Korean: 키키 야 근데 차는 진짜 최대한 나중에 사는 게 나아
English: Kiki, but it's really better to buy a car as late as possible
Really? Kiki

Korean: 근데 난 드라이브 좋아해서 당장 사고 싶어 ㅠㅠ
English: But I like driving so I want to buy it right now ㅠㅠ
Just use something like Socar
Your insurance premiums are no joke

Korean: 나 사실 쏘카랑 그린카 완전 vip야 하하
English: Actually, I'm a total VIP of Socar and Greencar haha

Korean: 키키 오 대박 니 이름으로 차 빌려도 돼?
English: Kiki Oh, can I rent a car in your name?

Korean: 내 아이디로 빌리고 동승자 등록해서 타고 다녀~
English: I rent it with my ID, register as a passenger, and ride around~
What qualifications do you have?
I have a lot of mechanical engineering certifications!

Korean: 오오 총 몇 개 가지고 있어?
English: Oh, how many in total do you have?

Korean: 한 7~8개 있는데 다 불러 줘야 해?!
English: There are about 7 or 8 of them, do I have to call them all?!
Wow, this is awesome. Sing them one by one~
Is it okay if I shorten it to something simpler?~
Hey, I won't know even if I hear it anyway~
Milling, lathe, mold, overhead crane, etc.
Even if you listen to everything, it'll be difficult Kiki
Yeah, Kiki, but what's the mold?

Korean: 금형은 쇠를 모양 내서 이쁘게 만든다 해야 하나? 키키
English: Should a mold be used to shape iron into something pretty? Kiki
Oh really?
Where can you use something like that?
I'll use it when I get a job...
It's almost like a certificate for show.
Is that so? Kiki
Still, it will come in handy later!

Korean: 응 키키 그래서 일단 따 놓기만 했어~
English: Yeah Kiki, so I just put it aside for now~
Kiki, you did well. When was the last time you got it?
One per year consistently since my second year of high school!
Where did you go to training camp?
Of course I'm from Nonsan Training Center~
Oh, isn't Nonsan so nice?

Korean: 에이 논산 너무 시설이 안 좋아...
English: Hey Nonsan, the facilities are really bad...

Korean: 왜!  논산 얼마나 살기 좋은 곳인데!
English: Why! Nonsan is such a great place to live!
no

Korean: 안에 시설이 안 좋아 키키 특히 화장실
English: The facilities inside are not good, especially the bathroom
Kiki, really?
I'm okay?
okay?

Korean: 근데 그것도 안에 연대마다 다르다고 들었어
English: But I heard that it varies from year to year
Kiki, really?
What regiment were you in?

Korean: 나 27연대인데 지금 완전 새로 리모델링 했다던데?!
English: I'm in the 27th Regiment and I heard they've completely remodeled it?!
Oh really?
I know someone in the 27th Regiment~
okay?

Korean: 27연대 간부 중에 아는 사람 있는 거야?
English: Do you know anyone among the officers of the 27th Regiment?

Korean: 키키 응 내가 아는 언니 남친 지금은 헤어짐 ^^
English: Kiki Yeah, the boyfriend of the sister I know is now broken up ^^
Oh... What year are you from?
Kiki, I'm a girl,

Korean: 나는 거기 알바 해서 들어간 거야,
English: I got in there by working part-time.
Of course it's a joke
Hey, don't fool me just this once~

Korean: 너는 최근에 시험 본 거 있으?
English: Have you taken a test recently?
I just started school and have midterms...

Korean: 헐 대박, 대학교 중간고사는 어떻게 치뤄?
English: Wow, how are college midterms?
It's just like high school, right?
Kiki study and solve problems

Korean: 키키 근데 너네는 점수가 다르게 나오잖아 에이 비 이런 식으로
English: Kiki but your scores are different, like A, B, etc.
Of course, I study with the goal of getting an A+!

Korean: 키키 오 지금까지 다 에이플 맞음?
English: Kiki Oh, so far everything is Apple?
I want to do that, but that's not reality...

Korean: 키키 그래 낙점만 안 맞으면 되지!
English: Kiki, that's fine as long as you don't get the lottery!
There's no such thing as a winning ticket Kiki

Korean: 다 그냥 평균 이상은 하는 중
English: Everyone is just doing above average

Korean: 에프 한 번 맞으면 다시 수업 들어야 한다던데 맞아?
English: I heard that if you get hit once you have to take the class again, is that true?

Korean: 그렇다고 들었긴 한데 난 자세히 잘 몰라
English: I heard that, but I don't know the details.
I see
As long as it doesn't match the F1, it's fine!

Korean: 그치 너는 학점 대학교 때 얼마나 받았어? 하하
English: Right, how many credits did you get in college? Haha

Korean: 키키 나는 대학교 안 나오고 바로 취업함 ^^
English: Kiki I got a job right away without graduating from college ^^

Korean: 와 그것도 나쁘지 않은 방법이다 그치?
English: Wow, that's not a bad idea, is it?
How old are your parents?

Korean: 나랑 거의 30살 넘게 차이 나셔 ㅠㅠ
English: There's almost a 30 year age gap between us ㅠㅠ
Oh my god, you're such a late bloomer.

Korean: 맞아 완전 늦둥이라 나이 차가 많이 나!
English: That's right, I'm really late bloomer, so there's a big age gap!

Korean: 그러게 키키 완전 애지 중지 키우시겠는데?
English: So you're really going to stop raising Kiki?

Korean: 나 완전 귀하게 자란 아들내미지~ 하하
English: I have a son who grew up so preciously~ haha
Kiki, I'm the second daughter in our family~

Korean: 그래? 너네 언니랑은 몇 살 차이 나는데?
English: Really? How old are you and your sister?
Kiki, I've been with my sister for exactly 3 years!

Korean: 3년이면 막 엄청 차이 나진 않아서 편하겠다!
English: 3 years won't make that much of a difference, so it'll be comfortable!
Yes, we are like friends!

Korean: 부럽다 나도 누나나 형 있었으면 좋겠는데 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm jealous. I wish I had an older sister or brother. ㅠㅠ
No, it's Kiki
I think it's good to be an only child~
For example?

Korean: 뭐가 좋아서 그렇게 생각 하는 거야
English: What do you like about it that makes you think that way?

Korean: 나는 둘째라 어렸을 때 맨날 물려 입음 ㅜ
English: I'm the second child, so I always wore hand-me-downs when I was little.

Korean: 아 키키 그건 단점일 수 있겠다...
English: Ah Kiki, that could be a drawback...
How did you meet your girlfriend?

Korean: 나는 해외여행 갔다가 우연히 만났어 하하
English: I met him by chance when I was traveling abroad haha
Oh really?
Where have you traveled abroad?

Korean: 나 혼자 동유럽 갔었잖아 기억 나?
English: I went to Eastern Europe alone, remember?
Oh right
You didn't go alone?

Korean: 응 가서 혼자였는데 우연히 여자친구랑 일정이 맞아서 같이 다녔었어
English: Yeah, I went alone, but coincidentally my girlfriend and I had the same schedule so we went together.

Korean: 키키 오 둘 다 엠비티아이 앞이 e인가 봐?
English: Kiki Oh, both of you, I think the MBI is preceded by an e?
that's right

Korean: e로 시작하고 j인가로 끝나 우리 둘 다
English: It starts with e and ends with j, both of us

Korean: 키키 오 너네 성격 죽이 아주 잘 맞았네!
English: Kiki Oh, your personalities really suit each other!
I guess so Kiki

Korean: 그래서 아직도 잘 사귀고 있는 거 같아
English: So I think we're still on good terms
Kiki said that her girlfriend is two years older than her?
Yeah, my girlfriend and I are 2 years older and younger than each other.

Korean: 너가 군대 갔다 와서 간 거였나?
English: Did you go there after you came back from the military?

Korean: 군대 가기 전에 마지막 여행이었어 ㅠㅠ
English: It was my last trip before I went into the military ㅠㅠ
Oh, I see
Then when did you start dating your girlfriend?

Korean: 나 해외여행 갔다 온 1년 뒤 하하
English: A year after I went abroad haha
Is your cat hospitalized now?

Korean: 응 키키 오늘 입원 시키고 지금 막 집 도착했어
English: Yeah Kiki, I just got home after admitting her to the hospital today.

Korean: 헉 ㅜㅜ 내 친구네 강아지도 오늘 퇴원한대
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ My friend's dog is getting discharged from the hospital today too

Korean: 헉 동물병원 입원비 진짜 비싸더라 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my, the cost of hospitalization at an animal hospital is really expensive ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 애들은 무조건 적금 같은 거 들어 놔야 해
English: That's right. Kids definitely need to save up something like a savings account.

Korean: 적금 들고 싶은데 지금 완전 돈이 없어...
English: I want to save money, but I have absolutely no money right now...

Korean: 돈은 벌면 생기는 거고 한 달에 5만 원씩이라도 넣어
English: Money comes when you earn it, so put in at least 50,000 won a month.
I guess so Kiki
It's not easy being a cat butler
Kiki is right ㅜㅜ
Our Obok is sick too, so he takes medicine.
Is Oh Bok-i taking her medicine well?
no
Mix it with churu and give it to me!

Korean: 아 우리 냥이는 너무 어려서 츄르는 아직이라...
English: Oh, my cat is too young to know Churu yet...
Ah, you can't eat it if you're young?
I'm afraid my taste will change ㅠㅠ
But I don't take my medicine well
You have to force yourself to take that pill.

Korean: 알약? 나 알약 받았는데 도전 해 봐야지 키키
English: Pills? I got the pills, I have to try them Kiki
I heard you go to the gym these days?
Yeah Kiki
Helen starts working out in a week~
Kiki Oh, wow, are you quitting PT?
Of course Kiki

Korean: 나 그거 없으면 시도조차 못 할 거 같더라
English: I don't think I could even try without it.
Kiki is right

Korean: 나 그냥 회원권만 끊었다가 돈 날림
English: I just canceled my membership and wasted my money.

Korean: 자세 교정이랑 운동 방법도 다 가르쳐 준다던데?
English: I heard they also teach posture correction and exercise methods?

Korean: 맞아 운동할 때 자세랑 호흡이 제일 중요해!
English: That's right, posture and breathing are the most important when exercising!

Korean: 근데 난 그냥 갯수 채우는 스타일로 한 거 같아...
English: But I think I just did it in a style that filled in the numbers...

Korean: 갯수만 채운다고 다 운동이 되진 않는대 ㅜ
English: Just filling out the number of steps doesn't mean it's exercise.

Korean: 그래? 그러면 그냥 pt 10회 더 추가 해야겠다
English: Really? Then I guess I'll just add 10 more pts
Kiki, if you do it 10 times, you get about 2 weeks?
Yes, I have to use it 10 times a month, so I use it 2-3 times a week as a basic.

Korean: 와오 피티 가격은 얼마 정도 해?
English: Wow, how much does a pity ball cost?
It costs 55,000 won, but people around me say it's more expensive than they thought.
Yeah? It's cheaper than you think.
It starts at 60 thousand won here?
Oh, it's more expensive there
Then I guess I'll just have to stay here...

Korean: 너 배그 말고 하는 게임 뭐 있어?
English: What games do you play besides PUBG?

Korean: 나 요즘 넥슨에서 카트라이더 하는데 알아?
English: Did you know that I'm playing Kart Rider on Nexon these days?

Korean: 키키 오 너 여친이랑 같이 하지?
English: Kiki Oh, are you doing it with your girlfriend?
Yeah, my girlfriend is good at Kart Rider too~
Oh really?
I am the god of item wars~
Item wars are all about luck, no skill required...

Korean: 키키 맞아 나 근데 타이밍 맞게 잘 던짐
English: Kiki, that's right, but I throw it with good timing

Korean: 그거 방어하면 아무 소용 없잖아 하하
English: Defending that is useless haha
Kiki, you have to keep flying before that~

Korean: 아이템 전보단 당연히 실력은 스피드 전이지~
English: Of course, the skill transfer is speed transfer rather than item transfer~
So you're good at drifting?

Korean: 드리프트계의 신이지 그냥 완전 잘 해 키키
English: He's a god in the drift world, he's just so good at it Kiki

Korean: 키키 오 니 여친도 잘 해?
English: Kiki, is your girlfriend doing well too?

Korean: 나보다 못 하는데 그래도 들어오긴 하더라
English: He's worse than me, but he still gets in.

Korean: 키키 너 아까는 완전 잘 한다고 하지 않았으?
English: Kiki, didn't you say you were doing really well earlier?

Korean: 난 훨씬 더 잘하니까 그렇게 말 한 거야~
English: I said that because I'm much better at it~

Korean: 너는 코로나 끝나면 어디로 가고 싶어?
English: Where do you want to go when Corona is over?

Korean: 국내랑 해외 중에 어디 말하는 거야?
English: Are you talking about domestic or overseas?
Just say both!

Korean: 국내는 제주도 또 가고 싶고 해외는 일본?~
English: Domestically, I want to go to Jeju Island again, and overseas, I want to go to Japan?~
Japan? Where do you want to go?
I've been to Osaka and Fukuoka, so Tokyo?!
I want to go to Tokyo!

Korean: 도쿄? 키키 넌 일본 어디 가 봤는데?
English: Tokyo? Kiki, have you been anywhere in Japan?
I've been to two places: Osaka and Fukuoka!

Korean: 오 나도 딱 거기만 가 봤어
English: Oh, I just went there too
I want to go to Tokyo Disneyland

Korean: 헐 나도 디즈니랜드 가 보고 싶어!
English: Wow, I want to go to Disneyland too!
Disneyland is only in Japan and China ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나는 오사카에 있는 유니버설 가 봄!
English: I'm going to Universal Studios in Osaka!

Korean: 헐 난 그 때 돈 없어서 못 가 봤는데...
English: Oh, I couldn't go at that time because I didn't have money...
Really? But people are awesome
I can only hold 3 all day,
Hey, what is this...

Korean: 그냥 돈 아끼고 안 갈래 하하
English: I'll just save money and not go haha
Wow the weather here is really nice!
Yeah? Why is it so cloudy here...
Oh really?
Did you just say Busan?

Korean: 응 지금은 부산인데 여기 날씨가 너무 안 좋아
English: Yeah, I'm in Busan right now, but the weather here is really bad.
Oh really?
Did you say it was going to rain today?
no

Korean: 그건 아닌데 흐려서 비 올까 걱정이네 키키
English: No, it's not, but it's cloudy so I'm worried it might rain Kiki
Isn't it nice when it rains?

Korean: 신발 다 젖고 좋은 게 있나...?
English: Is there anything good about getting your shoes wet...?
Kiki no

Korean: 그런 날은 집에 있어야지 어딜 나감?
English: On days like that, you should stay at home. Where should you go?

Korean: 저녁 먹으러 나가려는데 고민이야 지금 키키
English: I'm thinking about going out for dinner right now Kiki

Korean: 키키 야 그냥 배달 시켜 먹어 오늘 같은 날은!
English: Kiki, just order delivery on a day like today!
Is that so?

Korean: 근데 배달비도 비싸고 근데 또 우산 들고 가긴 귀찮고
English: But the delivery fee is expensive and it's also a hassle to carry an umbrella.
Kiki, order from a place with low delivery fees!

Korean: 그럴까? 너네 동네는 화창해서 좋겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: Is that so? I bet your neighborhood is nice and sunny ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나는 지금 산책하고 싶을 정도로 좋음!
English: I feel so good right now I want to go for a walk!

Korean: 부럽다... 우리 동네도 그랬으면 이미 나갔을 텐데 키키
English: I'm jealous... If my neighborhood was like that, I would have already left Kiki
Hey, do elementary school kids smoke these days?

Korean: 헐 요즘 초딩이 담배를 핀다고? 키키
English: Wow, these days elementary school kids smoke? Kiki

Korean: 어, 심지어 아파트 단지 내에서 대놓고,
English: Oh, even openly within the apartment complex,

Korean: 뭐야... 요즘 초딩은 겁도 없나 보네?
English: What the... Are elementary school kids these days fearless?
therefore,

Korean: 그래서 주의 좀 줬더니 얘네 엄마가 고소했대
English: So I paid attention to it and their mom sued them.
Wow, that mom is really...

Korean: 무슨 주의 주는 게 당연한 건데
English: What is the right thing to pay attention to?
therefore,

Korean: 이 글 쓴 사람이 애기 목을 잡았다고 하긴 하는데,
English: The person who wrote this article said that he grabbed the baby by the neck,

Korean: 아 신체적 접촉이 있으면 민감하긴 하겠네 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, I guess it would be sensitive if there was physical contact ㅠㅠ
therefore

Korean: 근데 이 초딩이 경찰서에서도 감시 대상이라나 뭐라나?
English: But this elementary school student is under surveillance at the police station or something?

Korean: 그래? 완전 그냥 초딩이 사고쟁이였나 봐 하하
English: Really? I guess he was just a kid who was a troublemaker haha

Korean: 걍 부모가 애를 잘못 키운 거지,
English: It's just that the parents raised the child wrong.
I think so Kiki
Where did you not submit the petition~
Dude, you should know how embarrassing it is,

Korean: 아파트 단지 내에서 대놓고 담배를 피고,
English: Smoking openly within the apartment complex,

Korean: 가정 교육을 아직 잘 못 받았나 봐 심하긴 하네
English: I guess he hasn't been properly educated at home yet. It's really bad.

Korean: 그러니까 다른 착한 애들한테도 해코지하고 그랬대 얘가
English: So, he said he was also harming other good kids.
That's crossing the line and deserves punishment~

Korean: 너는 커피 하루에 몇 잔 마셔?
English: How many cups of coffee do you drink a day?
Me? At least one glass a day is basic.
Oh really?
Do you like coffee?
Yeah I really like coffee
Especially Americano Kiki
Oh, you know what?
Are you saying the price of coffee beans will increase by 70%?
Wow, then the price of coffee will go up too...?
of course,
Now coffee is also becoming a luxury item.
A luxury item...
Coffee is not a luxury, Kiki

Korean: 이제 재배하기 어렵다고 하네 이거랑 카카오도!
English: They say it's hard to grow this now, and cacao too!

Korean: 하긴 재배량이 줄어들면 자연스럽게 가격이 오르겠다
English: Of course, if the amount of cultivation decreases, the price will naturally rise.

Korean: 그러니까 나 초콜릿 완전 좋아하는데  ㅜㅜ
English: So I really like chocolate ㅜㅜ

Korean: 초콜릿? 나는 그건 안 좋아해서 그나마 다행이다
English: Chocolate? I don't like that, so that's a good thing.

Korean: 키키 근데 그거 알지 커피 값 기본 5천 원인 거!?

okay?

English: Well, I got scolded at first, but the more I did it, the more Kiki fell asleep next to me.

I see

no

Kiki, you can't do much right now

The first button is the most important

English: Those are people who didn't have a position to begin with, but drivers apply to go, so Kiki

no

amazing!

Kiki is the type that just likes ganples

English: So, is this a place that has professional equipment?
No, there's no such thing as Kiki

Oh, is that right?

no

Thrilling and Kiki

Is this your first time hearing about it? Hmm

Korean: 남자들은 오락실 가면 철권밖에 안 함 키키

Korean: 나는 문구점 앞에 레슬링 게임기 있어서 그거밖에 안해 봤어  키키

Korean: 음 짱깽뽀? 우리 애들도 모를 거 같은데 그런게 있나
English: Um, Jjangkangpo? I don't think even our kids know, but is there such a thing?

Korean: 응 그거 나중에 한 번 봐 보면 되겠다
English: Yeah, I'll take a look at that later.
Do you know about the arcade game called Jjangkangpo?
What is that? It's the first time I've heard of it since I was born
Oh really?

Korean: 너네 가위바위보 게임 하는 오락기 없었어?
English: Don't you guys have an arcade game called rock-paper-scissors?

Korean: 뭐지 나는 처음 들어보는 걸? 키키
English: What is this? This is my first time hearing about it? Kiki
It's an amusement device

Korean: 키키 헐 너네 지역에는 이 유명한 게 없단 말이야?
English: Kiki, you're saying that this famous thing doesn't exist in your area?
I'm not sure what that is
Is it famous there?

Korean: 키키 이거 오락기 이기면 돈 줘
English: Kiki, if you win this arcade game, you get money
Wow, you're giving me money?
I have to go to your neighborhood right now haha

Korean: 키키 이거 군산에 있는 철길 마을이라고 알아?
English: Kiki, do you know this is a railroad town in Gunsan?
Oh I know Kiki
It's famous as a tourist destination there.

Korean: 어 거기에 이거 있는데 가서 해 봐!
English: Hey, there's this over there, go try it!

Korean: 그래 키키 이기면 돈은 얼마나 주는데?
English: So, if Kiki wins, how much money do you get?
I can earn up to 2700 won!

Korean: 한 번 이기면 얼마 주는 거야? 하하
English: How much do you give if you win once? Haha
Kiki That's random 200~2700 won
Oh, that's okay. 2700 won is totally max?!

Korean: 너는 최근에 여친이랑 어디 놀러 감?
English: Where have you been with your girlfriend recently?

Korean: 나 저번 주에 강릉 갔다 왔지~
English: I went to Gangneung last week~

Korean: 오 대박 양떼 목장 다녀 옴?
English: Oh, did you come back from the sheep ranch?
no

Korean: 비 오고 안개 껴서 그 쪽은 못 갔어 하하
English: It was raining and foggy so I couldn't go there haha
Oh really?
Then where did you go?

Korean: 강릉 해안가 따라서 놀고 하슬라아트 월드랑 서피비치?
English: How about playing along the Gangneung coast and going to Haslla Art World and Surf Beach?
Haslite World
Oh, is that the famous art museum?
Yeah, that's right
The admission fee was 12,000 won and it was worth seeing.
Oh really?
Art museum admission fees are more expensive than you thought?

Korean: 맞아 미술관인데 포토 존이 많아서 조금 비싸...
English: Yes, it's an art museum, but it's a bit expensive because there are a lot of photo zones...
Oh right
You're saying you're standing in line there to take pictures?

Korean: 응 거기 기본 30분인데 우리가 갔을 때도 그랬어 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, the basic time there is 30 minutes, and it was the same when we went there ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 헐 ㅜㅜ 그래서 사진 예쁘게 건짐?
English: Kiki Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ So that's why the photos are so pretty?

Korean: 날씨가 좌우하는데 어느 정도 기본으로 이뻐 하하
English: It depends on the weather, but it's pretty basic haha

Korean: 헐 키키 사진 나중에 보여줄 수 있어?
English: Hey Kiki, can you show me the pictures later?
Okay, I'll show you the picture.
I took this when it was completely clear
It's starting to rain here too...

Korean: 그래? 여긴 조금 전에 비 그쳤어 하하
English: Yeah? It stopped raining here a little while ago haha

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 여기로 올라왔나 보다 ㅜ
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ I guess I came up here ㅜ
I guess so Kiki

Korean: 얼른 비구름 너네 동네로 다 갔으면 좋겠다
English: I wish the rain clouds would go to your neighborhood soon.
Kiki, you're so funny

Korean: 진짜 서울에서 비 그만 좀 왔으면 ㅜ
English: I really wish it would stop raining in Seoul ㅜ
If it rains, just stay at home~

Korean: 키키 나도 지금 빗소리 들으면서 놀고 있음!
English: Kiki, I'm playing while listening to the sound of rain right now!
Doesn't the sound of rain sound nice?
Is it just me?

Korean: 맞아 이런 날씨에는 무조건 낮잠 필수
English: Yes, in this kind of weather, a nap is absolutely necessary.

Korean: 낮잠 잘 때 완전 수면 송이야 그치?
English: When you take a nap, you're a total sleeper, right?

Korean: 키키 인정 갑자기 그러니까 낮잠 자고 싶네
English: Kiki admits, all of a sudden I want to take a nap

Korean: 난 아까 빗소리 들으면서 잤어 하하
English: I fell asleep listening to the sound of rain earlier haha
I'm so jealous of Kiki

Korean: 나는 근데 자면 저녁에 잠을 못 자
English: But I can't sleep at night when I sleep

Korean: 그래도 비가 올 땐 자는 게 최고지~
English: But when it rains, sleeping is the best~

Korean: 인정 키키 커튼 다 쳐 놓고 어둡게 해서~
English: Okay, Kiki, close all the curtains and make it dark~

Korean: 다음에 비 오면 바로 시행한다 하하
English: Next time it rains I'll do it right away haha
Didn't you say your house is in Busan?
Yeah, that's right
But why is that?

Korean: 부산에 있는 갈비집 지금 난리 남 키키
English: The rib house in Busan is going crazy right now.
Rib house?
I really like ribs
Kiki, that's right

Korean: 근데 여기 재사용 음식 걸려서 난리 남!
English: But there's chaos here because of recycled food!
Wow, reuse?
Do not reuse any side dishes
That's too much

Korean: 혹시 너가 아는 갈비집 중에 구운 김치 나오는 곳 있어?
English: Do you know of any rib restaurants that serve grilled kimchi?
no

Korean: 아직 내가 간 곳은 다 생김치!
English: Everywhere I go, there's still fresh kimchi!
I see
This place serves grilled kimchi!

Korean: 휴 내가 간 곳은 아니라 다행이긴 하네~
English: Phew, thank goodness it wasn't where I went~
So, how do you know how it happened?
Huh? I don't know, Kiki, how did you get caught?

Korean: 생김치도 반찬에 나오는데 구운 김치랑 섞여 나왔대 ㅋ
English: Fresh kimchi is also served as a side dish, and it's served mixed with roasted kimchi.

Korean: 와 키키 그럼 당연히 들키지 이걸 이렇게~
English: Wow Kiki, of course I'll get caught like this~
Kiki, so

Korean: 근데 이 사장님이 봐 달라고 사정 했대...
English: But this boss asked me to look into it...
Oh, right, Kiki
Of course, an apology is mandatory
These days, house prices in Türkiye are no joke.

Korean: 터키는 또 우리나라랑 친숙한 나라잖아 하하
English: Turkey is also a country that is familiar to our country haha

Korean: 맞아 월세가 두 배 가량 가격이 인상됐대
English: That's right, the monthly rent has almost doubled.
Wow, isn't that too high?
It must be burdensome
So the original monthly rent was around 140,000 won...
So it must have gone up to close to 300,000 won now?!
It's 240,000 won now

Korean: 약간 서울 50만 원 월세가 100만 원이 된 거랑 비슷하지!
English: It's a bit like the monthly rent in Seoul going from 500,000 won to 1 million won!

Korean: 헐 너무 비싸 나였으면 방 빼야겠다...
English: Wow, it's so expensive. If I were you, I'd have to rent a room...

Korean: 그러니까 우리나라로 대입하니까 엄청 실감이 나더라...
English: So, when I applied to university in our country, it felt really real...

Korean: 대학생들은 그럼 집 다 잃은 거야?
English: So college students lost all their homes?
So I'm living on the streets ㅜㅜ I'm so sad
Wow, homeless...?
If I were you, I'd just go home.

Korean: 근데 집으로 돌아갈 수 없는 애들도 있잖아 ㅜ
English: But there are some kids who can't go home ㅜ

Korean: 엉 밖에서 돗자리 깔고 있더라 ㅜ
English: Oh, they were laying out a mat outside.

Korean: 와 너무 안타깝다 하필 터키라니 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, it's such a shame, it had to be Turkey ㅠㅠ
Do you have a tattoo or something?
no
My body is completely clean Kiki
Oh really?
Your parents don't like it?
Of course my parents are closed off

Korean: 키키 근데 문신 잘못했다가 지울 때 더 고생이잖아 ㅜ
English: Kiki But if you get a tattoo wrong, it'll be even harder to erase itㅜ

Korean: 헉 난 지울 생각조차 안 할 거 같아 엄청 아프다던데
English: Oh my gosh, I don't think I'll even think about erasing it, it hurts so much

Korean: 맞아 나 그거 동영상 봤는데 엄청 울더라...
English: Yeah, I saw that video and I cried so much...
I didn't even think about trying

Korean: 키키 여친은 문신 같은 거 있어?
English: Does Kiki's girlfriend have a tattoo or something?

Korean: 응 레터링? 같은 거 있긴 하더라!
English: Yeah, lettering? There is something like that!

Korean: 오오 요즘에 여자들 레터링 타투 많이 함!
English: Oh, these days a lot of women get lettering tattoos!

Korean: 그치 그런데 나중에 후회도 많이 한다고 들었어
English: Yeah, but I heard that you end up regretting it a lot later.
Oh really? Why?
The text isn't that great?
no

Korean: 나이 들면 피부가 탱탱 하지가 않으니까
English: As you get older, your skin becomes less elastic.
Oh, I see ㅜㅜ
Then, are you going to erase it?
I can't even erase it, it hurts so much...

Korean: 너 요즘에 건강식으로 뭐 챙겨 먹어?
English: What are you eating for health these days?

Korean: 따로 그런 건 없고 비타민 정도?~
English: Nothing special, maybe some vitamins?~
Where do you get your vitamins?

Korean: 오메가3 그냥 종합 비타민인가? 이거 먹어
English: Omega 3 is just a multivitamin? Take this.

Korean: 나도 종합 비타민이랑 다이어트 보조제 먹는 중
English: I'm also taking a multivitamin and diet supplement.
Diet supplements?

Korean: 그건 몸에 안 좋은 거 아니야?~
English: Isn't that bad for your health?~

Korean: 근데 나 장이 너무 안 좋아서 먹어야 해 ㅜ
English: But I have to eat it because my stomach is not feeling well.

Korean: 장 안 좋은 거랑 다이어트 보조제랑은 뭐가 연관이야 키키
English: What does a bad stomach have to do with diet supplements Kiki?

Korean: 배변 활동이 안 되니까 도움을 받는 거지
English: I need help because I can't have bowel movements.
Oh right Kiki
There's a subtle connection, huh?!

Korean: 응 근데 이것도 너무 많이 먹으면 안 좋아 ㅜ
English: Yeah but if you eat too much of this it's not good for you ㅜ

Korean: 나는 배변 활동은 괜찮으니 종합 비타민만 챙겨야겠다
English: I'm fine with my bowel movements, so I'll just take a multivitamin.
Kiki, that's a good idea.
Oh, and magnesium is good too!
magnesium?
There are a lot of good things
Then you should do it like that haha

Korean: 키키 엉 그리고 국산 영양제 이용하라구
English: Kiki, and use domestic nutritional supplements.
Domestic nutritional supplement? Kiki
Okay, I'll definitely go with domestic products.
What are you buying from Coupang this time?

Korean: 나 오늘 고양이 넥카라 샀었어 키키
English: I bought a cat neck collar today Kiki

Korean: 허 키키 고양이 넥카라도 팔아 거기서?
English: Hey Kiki Cat Neck Collar, do they sell those too?

Korean: 응 고양이 넥카라가 필요해서 로켓배송 시켰어
English: Yeah I needed a cat collar so I ordered rocket delivery
Why is the cat sick again?

Korean: 응 상처 난 곳을 핥으려 길래 필요해서!
English: Yeah, I need it so I can lick the wound!
Oh my, how much is one of those?

Korean: 만 원 언저리인데 내 꺼는 조금 더 싸서 8000원
English: It's around 10,000 won, but mine is a little cheaper at 8,000 won.
Oh really?
Is it because I bought it in a mini size?
In the most mini size!
Kiki is still a kitten
yes?

Korean: 우리 집에 넥카라 있는데 어차피 못 쓰네
English: I have a necktie at home, but I can't use it anyway.

Korean: 응 키키 나도 생각 했었는데 사이즈가 안 맞아
English: Yeah Kiki, I thought about that too, but the size doesn't fit
Kiki, I bought my house for 15,000 won!

Korean: 오 그러면 디자인이랑 퀄리티 좀 괜찮겠는 걸?
English: Oh, then the design and quality would be pretty good, right?
Did you buy the Kiki Neckarra after seeing the design?

Korean: 비싸면 디자인도 이쁠 거 아니야~ 하하
English: If it's expensive, the design won't be pretty either~ haha

Korean: 너는 요즘 아이돌 다 알고 있어?
English: Do you know all the idols these days?
no

Korean: 나는 아이돌 별로 관심 없어 키키
English: I'm not really interested in idols Kiki
So you're definitely a ballad person?

Korean: 응 나는 랩보단 발라드가 더 좋아
English: Yeah I like ballads more than rap
Then do you like Kono?

Korean: 응 나 코노에서 노래 부르는 거 좋아하지!
English: Yeah, I like singing in Kono!

Korean: 키키 코노 좋아하는 사람들이 발라드 많이 좋아하더라
English: People who like Kiki Kono like ballads a lot
The ballad is somewhat sad and emotional.

Korean: 키키 그치 너 감수성이 풍부한 아이구나?
English: Kiki, you're a very sensitive kid, aren't you?
Of course~
Do you want to go to Kono together next time?

Korean: 키키 나는 준꼬 같은 곳이 더 좋음
English: Kiki I like places like Junko better
Where is that?
This is my first time hearing about this?!

Korean: 키키 그 노래방인데 음식 나오는 곳
English: Kiki, that karaoke place where they serve food
Oh, it's okay there, Kiki
Want to go next time?
Kiki I'm good
But I play without stopping

Korean: 알았어 그러면 다음에 같이 가 보자
English: Okay, let's go together next time.
Do you know the cartoon called Black Rubber Shoes?

Korean: 당연히 알지 기영 기철이 나오잖아 키키
English: Of course I know, Kiyoung and Kicheol are in it

Korean: 키키 나 어제 라면 편 봤는데 왜 이렇게 맛있어 보이냐!!
English: Kiki, I watched the ramen episode yesterday and why does it look so delicious!!

Korean: 라면? 그 꼬불 꼬불 맛있는 라면 부르는 편?
English: Ramen? You mean that delicious, curly ramen?

Korean: 키키 어 맞아 그거 삼양 라면이잖아
English: Kiki, that's right, that's Samyang Ramen.
Oh, is that Samyang Ramen?
It's been like that since then!

Korean: 키키 처음 우리나라에 들어온 라면이 삼양 라면임!
English: Kiki: The first ramen to enter our country was Samyang Ramen!
I didn't know Kiki
Is Black Rubber Shoes a Korean comic book?
Kiki, of course

Korean: 그 삼양에서 일본 가서 배워온 기술로 삼양라면 만든 거!
English: Samyang Ramen was made with the technology learned from Samyang in Japan!
Somehow~
It's been a while since I've seen black rubber shoes, they're fun

Korean: 키키 검정고무신이 원래 만화가 원작이었던 거는 알고 있음?
English: Did you know that Kiki's Black Rubber Shoes was originally based on a manga?
Oh really?
Isn't this just the beginning of a comic?
Kiki No, it started out as a comic book
Oh, right, Kiki
Then I guess I'll have to read some comics next time

Korean: 키키 아니 그거는 단종 돼서 없을걸?
English: Kiki, no, that one's been discontinued, right?
Ah... I wanted to see it, but it's too bad ㅠㅠ
Sister, what did you eat for dinner tonight?

Korean: 나 오늘은 치킨 시켜 먹을라고 준비 중이야
English: I'm getting ready to order chicken today
Oh my, it's not even Friday night for chicken?

Korean: 금요일 아니여도 치킨은 먹을 수 있지!
English: You can eat chicken even if it's not Friday!
Hey, where are you eating chicken?
I ordered Kyochon chicken haha
Wow, you know it's definitely a honey combo, right?
I like honey combo the best
right?
Would you like some rice cakes too?
Yeah, how did you know?

Korean: 키키 헐 그거 설마 혼자 먹는 건 아니겠지?
English: Kiki, hey, you're not going to eat that alone, are you?
of course

Korean: 엄마랑 지금 같이 먹을라고 준비 중
English: I'm preparing to eat with my mom right now
Wow, this is awesome. Two servings of rice cakes?
I ordered a set of yeoptteok for two
You two are going to eat it all!?

Korean: 둘이서 다 먹고 아빠가 오면 다 드실 거야
English: We'll both eat it all and then Dad will eat it all when he comes.
Did your sister just come out of the house?

Korean: 아니 나 집에 살아 엄마 아빠랑
English: No, I live at home with my mom and dad
I see. So the three of you live together now?
Yeah, mom and dad and the dog

Korean: 키키 오 강아지는 지금 몇 살?
English: How old is Kiki O the puppy now?
No, the puppy is five years old
Kiki looks cute
Do you live in an apartment?
Yeah I live in an apartment
What floor of the apartment do you live on?
I live on the 15th floor
Wow, isn't the 15th floor the royal floor?
It's the royal floor but it's too noisy
Huh? It's the 15th floor, why is it so noisy?
The living room window side is the 4th floor road
Then the noise gets seriously louder?
When cars crash, the noise is loud.
Sister, do you have a car?
Yeah I have an Avante
Oh~ What year is this? A new model?
It's the 2019 model, not the new one

Korean: 키키 두 살밖에 안 됐네 애기네~
English: Kiki, you're only two years old, baby~
Yeah, your driving skills are also like a kid's

Korean: 키키 언니 차 산 지는 얼마나 됐어?
English: How long has it been since you bought your car, Kiki?

Korean: 차 산 지 이 년 됐어 초보야
English: It's been two years since I bought a car. I'm a beginner.

Korean: 그러면 완전 신형일 때 산 거네?
English: So you bought it when it was brand new?
Yeah, my mom gave me some money.
Kiki, how much was the total price back then?
It was about 24 million won

Korean: 와 붕붕이 차 색은 무슨 색이야?
English: Wow, what color is BbungBbung's car?
It's white, but it looks like a white rabbit
Kiki, the 2019 design is really pretty!
I like the design quite a bit

Korean: 언니는 최근에 알바 뭐 해 봤어?
English: Sister, what part-time job have you done recently?
I worked at a North Face clothing store.
Oh really?
Are there really a lot of customers there?
There are a lot of guests, students and adults.
I used to wear Latte Nope a lot~
I wore it a lot when I was in high school too
What color is Kiki wearing?
I wore green haha
Kiki I wore black just fine~
Black is the safest color haha
Yeah Kiki
Sister, how many years have you been wearing that?
I've been wearing it for 5 years now

Korean: 와 키키 그 정도면 소매 다 헤지는 거 아님?
English: Wow Kiki, wouldn't that be enough to tear up your sleeves?

Korean: 키키 그래서 엄마가 버리라 했는데 그냥 갖고 있어
English: Kiki, so my mom told me to throw it away, but I just kept it.

Korean: 키키 헐 지금 그걸 지금까지 갖고 있다고?
English: Kiki Huh? You still have that now?
Yeah, it's my precious thing.
Did your sister say she had a younger brother?
Why do I have an older brother?

Korean: 키키 그러면 오빠 군대 갔을 때 진짜 좋아했었겠네?
English: Kiki: Then, did you really like it when your brother went to the army?

Korean: 오빠 군대 갔을 때 나 울었어
English: I cried when my brother went to the army
Oh really?
How old are you and your brother?
My brother and I are 3 years apart

Korean: 그 정도 나이 남매면 엄청 티격태격하지 않아?
English: Don't siblings that old fight a lot?

Korean: 엄청 많이 싸웠었지 ㅠㅠ 피 터지게
English: We fought so much ㅠㅠ I was bleeding so much
But did you cry when you went to the army?
I cried so hard I was so sad
How old were you at that time?
Oh, I was a high school student back then
Oh, right, Kiki
I guess my sister is a very affectionate person!

Korean: 웅 나 정말 눈물도 많고 정도 많아 ㅠㅠ ㅎ헤
English: Yeah, I really cry a lot and have a lot of emotions ㅠㅠ hehe
Kiki: So the training center is in Nonsan?
Yeah, the training center went to Nonsan.
Did your sister graduate from college? Or did she graduate from high school?
I graduated from the Post Office Information Center
Is the Postal Information College a university in Daejeon?
Yeah, that's right, it's a school in Daejeon!
Wow, my sister was there too!
Oh really, what department did you go to?

Korean: 언니 혹시 거기에 애견미용과 있는 거 알아?
English: Sister, do you know if there's a dog grooming place there?
Oh, you know that famous dog grooming place!

Korean: 키키 맞아 우리 언니 지금 애견미용사야~
English: Kiki, that's right, my sister is a dog groomer now~
Wow, this is seriously no joke!

Korean: 키키 아니 그것도 자기 가게 차려야 생기는 거더라 ㅜ
English: Kiki, no, that's something you can only get if you open your own store.
That's right
You can make a lot of money if you have your own store.

Korean: 맞아 키키 근데 이제 곧 차릴 거야!
English: Yeah Kiki but I'm going to get ready soon!

Korean: 부럽다 나도 가게 하나 차리고 싶은데
English: I'm jealous. I want to open a store too.

Korean: 키키 언니는 어떤 가게 차리고 싶어?
English: What kind of store does Kiki want to open?
I go to a nail shop or a skin shop

Korean: 언니는 오빠 한 명 있다고 했었나?
English: Didn't your sister say she had an older brother?

Korean: 웅 나는 오빠 한 명 있어 하하
English: Yeah I have an older brother haha
Is your brother living with you now?
No, my brother is in Pyeongtaek
Oh really?
I know Pyeongtaek well~
I got married and moved to Pyeongtaek in May last year.
Wow! Why did you go to Pyeongtaek!?

Korean: 새언니가 평택 사람이여서 거기로 이사 갔어
English: My new sister is from Pyeongtaek, so I moved there.
Then you must have found a job there too?
Yeah, I went to work there as a production worker.
I see. So you're newlyweds now?
Wow, they're a totally sweet newlywed couple.
Do you have any plans for a baby, Hol Kiki?
Yeah, there's already a baby in my stomach
Oh my gosh Kiki
Is it a daughter or a son?
My daughter is a princess, my beautiful niece
Does your sister have a boyfriend now?
Yeah, I have a boyfriend!
Kiki, I see

Korean: 언니는 지금 남친이랑 몇 년 됐어?
English: How many years have you been with your boyfriend, sister?
I've been with my boyfriend for about 2 years.
Oh, it's been so long!
How did you meet?
I met you at the bar over there. Hunting
Kiki wow it's awesome
Is that the Daejeon bar I know?

Korean: 웅 대전 둔산동 프라하에서 만났어 하하
English: Yeah, we met in Praha, Dunsan-dong, Daejeon haha
Kiki, hunting is also in Dunsan-dong~
Still, I'm glad we're meeting well!

Korean: 핫플에서 만나가지고 남자친구가 다른 행동할까 바 불안하긴 해
English: I'm worried that my boyfriend will act differently if we meet at a hot place.
Kiki Ai, but I still have 2 years of experience~

Korean: 그럼 그 짬빱으로 오래 오래 예쁜 사랑해야지
English: Then, with that passion, we should love each other for a long time
Kiki: Yeah, that's a good idea!
Sister, have you ever fought with your boyfriend?

Korean: 맨날 싸우는 게 일이지 뭐 ㅠㅠ
English: Fighting all the time is my job ㅠㅠ
Hey, stop being so noisy~

Korean: 진짜 크게 한번 싸워본 적 있지 하하
English: I've actually had a big fight once haha
What did your sister say her dog's name was?

Korean: 우리 집 강아지 이름은 가을이야 하하
English: My dog's name is Autumn haha
Oh right
Is autumn brown?
No, our house's autumn is white
Oh, I see. What breed is Ga-eul?
Autumn is a Bichon Frise
Hibari is so cute
Wow, a Bichon? Kiki
Is that high bar really that fluffy?
The high bar is so soft and fluffy

Korean: 키키 오 그러면 아침에 일어나면 진짜 한 쪽이 꺼져 있어?
English: Kiki Oh, so when you wake up in the morning, one side is really off?

Korean: 그럼 자고 일어나면 푹 꺼져 있어
English: Then when I wake up I'm completely asleep
Kiki is really cute
Is Ga-eul a girl?
Our Autumn is a male

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 그러면 중성화는, 했겠네,?
English: Kiki Wow, awesome. Then you must have been neutered, right?

Korean: 우리 가을이 중성화 시켰지 애기 때 ㅠㅠ
English: Our autumn got neutered when she was a baby ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 그렇구나 몇 개월 때 시켰어?
English: Kiki, I see. How many months ago did you order it?

Korean: 우리 가을이 육 개월 때 시켰어 ㅠㅠ !
English: We ordered it when our fall was six months old ㅠㅠ!
Sister, are you doing any exercise right now?

Korean: 나는 배드민턴 치는 운동 좋아해 하하
English: I like playing badminton haha

Korean: 헐 요즘에 바람 많이 부는데 어떻게 해?
English: Wow, it's so windy these days. What should I do?

Korean: 나는 저기 건양대 짐나지움에서 배드민턴 쳐
English: I play badminton at the gymnasium at Konkuk University.

Korean: 키키 헐 나도 거기서 많이 했는데!
English: Kiki Wow, I did that a lot too!
There's a club there
I played badminton there.
Huh? There was a badminton club in Nonsan too?

Korean: 웅 그럼 나는 논산 클럽이였어 하하
English: Yeah then I was in the Nonsan club haha

Korean: 키키 헉 회원은 총 몇 명이었어?
English: Kiki Huck, how many members were there in total?
There are about 300 members in total.
Wow, there's more than I thought?
How much is the membership fee?

Korean: 웅 회원비는 한 달에 삼만 원씩 하하
English: Yeah, the membership fee is thirty thousand won per month haha
What's good about being like that?

Korean: 원래 회원이 아니면 한 달에 오만 원인데
English: If you're not an original member, it's 50,000 won per month.
Okay, then who are you playing with?

Korean: 나 동네 오빠랑 동생들이랑 하고 있어
English: I'm doing it with my neighborhood older brothers and younger brothers
Does your sister like playing games on her phone?
Yeah I like playing games on my phone
What games are you playing these days?
Please recommend me some!

Korean: 요즘에 나 메이플 하고 있어 하하
English: I'm playing MapleStory these days haha
Huh? You can play MapleStory on mobile?
Yeah, then it's possible on mobile haha

Korean: 키키 그러면 그거 피씨랑 연동될 수 있어?
English: Kiki: Then can that be linked to a PC?

Korean: 아니 메이플 피씨랑 연공 안 되는 걸로 알고 있어!
English: No, I know that Maple PC doesn't work with the older generation!

Korean: 언니 그거 하면 몇 시간 해?
English: Sister, how many hours does that take?
I play this game once for 3 hours

Korean: 와 키키 그거 앉은 자리에서 하는 거 맞지?
English: Wow Kiki, you do that while sitting, right?

Korean: 아니 돌아다니면서 할 수 있어 일할 때도!
English: No, you can do it while walking around or even while working!
I see. What level are you now?
I'm level 208 now, that's amazing lol
If Kiki and Mobile are 208, aren't they old?

Korean: 나 정도면 고인물이라고 할 수 있지!
English: I guess you could call me an old hand!

Korean: 언니는 올해 크리스마스 때 어디 놀러 안 가?
English: Sister, aren't you going somewhere to play for Christmas this year?

Korean: 남자친구랑 군산 놀러 가기로 했어! 하하
English: I decided to go to Gunsan with my boyfriend! Haha

Korean: 웅 맞아 나도 페이스북으로 보고 가려구
English: Yeah, that's right. I'm going to check it out on Facebook too.
Gunsan? It's famous for its railroad town!

Korean: 거기 사진관 유명한 곳 있는 거 알아?
English: Do you know that there's a famous photo studio there?
Ah, I know, the Grassland Photo Studio movie set
Oh right Kiki

Korean: 거기도 있고 복고풍으로 찍을 수 있는 곳도 있잖아!
English: There's also a place there where you can take retro photos!
Hey, where is that?
Please tell me
If you type that into Naver, it'll come up, right?
I should ask Naver Knowledge iN

Korean: 키키 거기 인기 있어서 빨리 예약해야 할걸?
English: Kiki, it's popular there, so you should make a reservation quickly, right?
Do I need to make a reservation too?
I need to make a reservation

Korean: 나도 그때 며칠 전에 예약하고 갔거든!
English: I also made a reservation a few days ago and went!
Oh really, who did you go with?
I went with my boyfriend! Hehe

Korean: 남자친구랑 같이 여행 가서 좋았겠네 하하
English: It would be nice to travel with your boyfriend haha
I heard it's really cold in Nonsan right now.
It's so cold I need to wear a padded coat.
Wow, is the weather like that?
Oh, it's really really cold. My hands are numb.
Kiki, really?
Has it been cold since this morning?

Korean: 웅 아침부터 날씨 장난 아니였어 대박
English: Wow, the weather was no joke since this morning.

Korean: 친구들이 바람도 장난 아니라고 하던데 ㅜ
English: My friends say the wind is no joke ㅜ
It wasn't even a fuss
I almost flew away this morning

Korean: 키키 헉 키키 패딩 그래서 꺼내서 입은 거야?
English: Kiki Heuk Kiki padding so you took it out and wore it?
Yeah, I took out my North Face padding and put it on.

Korean: 오우 키키 근데 노페 방한성이 좋아~
English: Oh Kiki but Nope has good cold resistance~
Yeah, that's good then
I worked at Nophe
Kiki, that's right, Kiki
No need to worry about padding!?
Then when the weather is cold, it's North Face
Kiki it's hot here
Still turning on the air conditioner,
Turn on the air conditioning there
I guess it's still hot
Sister, have you ever seen Ogame?
Wow awesome I know that

Korean: 키키 나 오늘 홍대 갔는데 달고나 만들고 계시더라 키키
English: Kiki I went to Hongdae today and they were making dalgona Kiki
Oh my, this is really amazing in Hongdae?

Korean: 어 근데 그 분이 진짜 오겜에서 달고나 만든 분이래!
English: Oh, but that person is the one who actually created Dalgona in Ogame!
Wow, wow, I want to see it too

Korean: 근데 사람이 엄청 모였는데 민감해 하시더라고,
English: But there were so many people gathered that he was sensitive.
Oh really?
I think I would do the same

Korean: 어떤 사람이 폰으로 영상을 찍고 있었나 봐!
English: Looks like someone was taking a video with their phone!

Korean: 근데 나 같아도 신기해서 찍을 거 같아
English: But I think I would take a picture because it's so interesting

Korean: 근데 문제는 그 사장님 얼굴까지 찍으니까 ㅜㅜ
English: But the problem is that I took a picture of the president's face too ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 사장님 얼굴 찍는 건 너무하다
English: Oh, it's too much to take a picture of the boss's face

Korean: 내가 그러고 우연히 오늘 기사를 봤는데 그거 때문에 골치라고 인터뷰를 하셨더라!
English: I happened to see an article today and they said they had a headache because of that interview!
Wow, you even did a great interview?
Yeah, that's right

Korean: 아프리카 비제이나 유튜버가 그렇게 많이 찍는다고 힘들다고 인터뷰 하셨더라 ㅜ
English: An African VJ or YouTuber said in an interview that it was hard filming so many videos.
That must have been really hard

Korean: 언니 요즘 집값이 장난 아니잖아 ㅜ
English: Sister, house prices are no joke these days.

Korean: 웅 맞아 집값이 장난 아니지 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right, house prices are no joke ㅠㅠ

Korean: 터키도 그렇고 미국도 집값 때문에 골치래!
English: Türkiye and the US are both struggling because of housing prices!
Türkiye and America are no joke either?

Korean: 응 터키는 심지어 노숙까지 한다더라 ㅜ
English: Yeah, I heard that Turkey even has people sleeping on the streets.

Korean: 우와 대박 나는 터키 가서 못살겠다
English: Wow, wow, I can't live in Türkiye
Me too Kiki

Korean: 그래도 우리 형제의 나라인데 그렇니까 마음이 좀 아파 ㅜ
English: But it's our brother's country, so my heart hurts a little.
It really breaks my heart, he's my brother
In the US, the average monthly rent has gone up by 13 percent!
The rent went up that much? Wow

Korean: 그래서 미국 정부에서 이걸 제재하는 법안을 냈는데 부동산 업자들이 반발이 심하대!
English: So the US government introduced a bill to sanction this, but real estate agents are strongly opposed to it!
Why are real estate agents so resistant?

Korean: 왜냐하면 자기네 밥벌인데 그걸 규제하는 법안을 낸다니까!
English: Because it's their way of making a living, and they're proposing a law to regulate it!
Oh, it's too much for me to earn a living

Korean: 키키 근데 또 시민 입장에서는 어느 정도 조율이 필요하잖아 ㅜ
English: Kiki But from the citizens' perspective, some level of coordination is necessary.
Yeah, that's right
Does your sister like wearing earrings?

Korean: 웅 나 귀걸이 하는 거 너무 좋아해
English: Yeah I really like wearing earrings
Sister, what design of earrings do you like?
I prefer a sophisticated design

Korean: 그런 디자인을 만드는 브랜드 어디 선호함~?
English: Which brand do you prefer that makes such designs?
I like Louis Vuitton
Was Louis Vuitton also a brand that made earrings?
Earrings are also pretty as accessories
Oh, that's amazing?

Korean: 샤넬은 향수 만드는 건 알고 있었는데!
English: Chanel knew how to make perfume!
So does Chanel make earrings too?
I don't know about Chanel?
I know how to make perfume

Korean: 키키 근데 루이비똥에서 만드는 거면 엄청 비싸지 않아?
English: Kiki, but if it's made by Louis Vuitton, isn't it really expensive?
Yeah, it's really expensive.
Still pretty

Korean: 키키 귀걸이 한 쌍에 얼마 정도 해?
English: How much for a pair of Kiki earrings?
I think it'll be around 400,000 won for a pair?

Korean: 와 대박 키키 내 한 달 월세값이네~
English: Wow, wow, Kiki, that's my monthly rent~
What I mean is
That's why it's so expensive
Has your sister ever been hospitalized?
I've been hospitalized before ㅠㅠ
Oh my! A traffic accident? What the heck!
I got into a car accident on my way to Daejeon Galleria.

Korean: 헐 대박 언니가 차 끌고 가다가 사고 난 거야?
English: Oh my god, did your sister get into an accident while driving?

Korean: 아니 친구가 차 끌고 가다가 사고 났어 ㅠㅠ
English: No, my friend was driving and got into an accident ㅠㅠ
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ You rode it with a friend?
No, I rode with four friends
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Who did something wrong!

Korean: 옆에 오던 택시 기사님이 잘못한 거야!
English: The taxi driver next to me was wrong!

Korean: 헐 택시기사 근데 위혐하게 운전하긴 해!
English: Wow, that taxi driver drives dangerously!
Yeah, that's right, it was so dangerous

Korean: 그래서 네 분 다 많이 다쳤어?
English: So, all four of you were hurt a lot?
No, not much, just a little hurt

Korean: 몇 주 진단이 나왔길래 입원했어 ㅜ
English: I was hospitalized after being diagnosed for a few weeks.
I was hospitalized for about two weeks.

Korean: 언니는 옷같은 거 주로 어디서 사?
English: Where do you usually buy things like clothes, sister?
I use online shopping
Does your sister often buy brand name clothes?
I often buy branded clothes and I like duty-free clothes too.
Where do you mainly buy the brand?

Korean: 나는 브랜드 중에 나이키를 좋아해 하하
English: I like Nike among brands haha

Korean: 나이키에서 옷이나 신발 같은 거 사는 거야?
English: Do you buy things like clothes or shoes from Nike?
Yeah, that's right

Korean: 옷이나 신발 같은 거 사는 거야
English: Buying things like clothes and shoes

Korean: 나이키 온라인에서 사면 할인 많이 돼?
English: Do you get a lot of discounts if you buy Nike online?

Korean: 그래도 가서 직접 사는 거보다 저렴해
English: Still, it's cheaper than going and buying it yourself.

Korean: 그렇구나 보통 몇 프로 할인 돼?
English: I see. How much discount do you usually get?
I think it's about a 20% discount

Korean: 헉 키키 그러면 무조건 온라인으로 사야지~
English: Oh my gosh, Kiki. Then I have to buy it online.
Yeah, online is the best
You should buy it too
Kiki, that's what I should do

Korean: 어떤 카드 쓰느냐에 따라 또 할인 있지 않아?
English: Aren't there other discounts depending on which card you use?
Right? It would be Hyundai Card, Shinhan Card, or Samsung Card, right?

Korean: 언니는 운전할 때 노래 자주 들어?
English: Sister, do you often listen to music when you drive?
Yeah, I listen to the song all the time

Korean: 키키 그러면 보통 무슨 노래 들어?
English: Kiki, what kind of songs do you usually listen to?
I like ballads and dance songs

Korean: 발라드는 주로 어떤 가수 노래 들어?
English: Which singer do you mainly listen to when it comes to ballads?
I like Jia's songs, of course~
Wow, I really like Gia too
What kind of songs do you like?

Korean: 내가 가장 좋아하는 노래는 소찬휘 티얼스~
English: My favorite song is So Chan-whee's Tears~

Korean: 키키 아니 지아 노래 중에 제일 좋아하는 곡 제목이 뭐냐규~
English: Kiki, what's your favorite song title among Gia's songs?

Korean: 아 하하 지아 노래 중에 술한잔해요
English: Ah haha let's have a drink while singing Jia
Kiki ha, that's a real masterpiece!
Then it's a masterpiece
Go to karaoke and sing every day

Korean: 키키 오 나중에 언니랑 노래방 같이 가서 노래하는 거 들어야지
English: Kiki Oh, I have to go to karaoke with my sister later and listen to her sing.

Korean: 웅 우리 꼭 같이 가자 하하
English: Yeah, let's definitely go together haha

Korean: 키키 오~ 거기는 6시 이후에 3명 먹는 거 가능해?

Yeah, this place can accommodate up to 4 people Kiki

okay?

okay?

no

I'm alone

okay?
