Are you working part-time now?
Oh, I'm working part-time right now!
Oh, I see. What kind of part-time job do you have?
I work part-time at a PC room haha

Korean: 어 요즘에 피씨방 얼굴 많이 본다던데~?
English: Oh, I hear you've been seeing a lot of PC room faces lately?
So I guess I got picked

Korean: 키키 진짜 부모님 걸고 자신 있냐!?
English: Kiki, are you really confident that your parents will take care of you!?
sorry
My parents won't let me
Kiki, how much is the hourly wage there?
Is it the lowest?
About ten thousand won including holiday pay?
Wow, but they still give me all the holiday pay?
That's why the boss is so kind!
Kiki, is that where they make food too?
Yeah, it was easy to make food!
But isn't it difficult because there are so many types?

Korean: 우리는 피시방이 작아서 괜찮은 거 같아
English: I think it's okay because our PC room is small.

Korean: 너는 친구 면회 가본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever visited a friend?
No, I've never been to an interview
I've been to Kiki once
Oh really?
What if I go for an interview?
There are just so many tough guys Kiki

Korean: 난 가면 누가 누군지 구분 안 갈 거 같아
English: I don't think I'll be able to tell who's who when I go.

Korean: 키키 아 그 정도는 아니고 그냥 뭔가 웃겨!
English: Kiki, not that much, just something funny!

Korean: 나도 나중에 기회 되면 면회 한 번 가봐야겠다.
English: I should also go and meet him sometime later when I get the chance.

Korean: 키키 너 친구 중에 아직 군대 안 간 친구 있어?
English: Kiki, do you have any friends who haven't gone to the military yet?

Korean: 생각해보니까 군대 다 갔다 온 거 같은데?
English: Come to think of it, I think I just finished my military service?

Korean: 키키 굳이 갈 필요 없어, 시간 낭비야,
English: Kiki, you don't have to go, it's a waste of time,
Right... I guess there are only tough guys anyway.

Korean: 키키 와 가는데 시간 진짜 많이 걸리더라 키키
English: It really took a long time to go to Kiki Kiki

Korean: 맞아 요즘 군부대는 너무 멀리 있어
English: Yeah, these days the military bases are too far away

Korean: 키키 전국 어디든 군부대는 다 멀리 있는 거 같아!
English: Kiki: It seems like military bases are far away everywhere in the country!

Korean: 맞아 나라 지키는 거 힘들겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: That's right, it must be hard to protect the country ㅠㅠ
What are you studying these days?
I'm studying English these days!

Korean: 오~ 너 외국 나가서 회화할 수 있음?
English: Oh~ Can you speak English when you go abroad?
No, I can't converse...
How much do you listen?

Korean: 키키 오 그 정도면 충분해 나의 통역사가 되어줘~
English: Kiki Oh, that's enough, be my interpreter~
Instead, I can't speak... ㅠㅠ
Kiki it's okay
Can you read it?
Of course!
I'll read it to your heart's content

Korean: 그러면 됐어 기차 여행은 너랑 같이 가야 되겠다!
English: Then that's fine. I have to go on the train trip with you!
But do you need English on a train trip?

Korean: 내리는 곳이 어디인지는 알아야 할 거 아니야!
English: You need to know where to get off!
I'm already so scared...
Kiki it's okay
You said you were studying now~
I'll study more from today
Kiki, do it for at least 3 hours a day!
Wow, that's a bit harsh... haha
Are your parents in good health these days?
Oh my, you're so healthy these days.

Korean: 키키 그래도 건강검진은 잘 받고 계시지?
English: Kiki, are you getting your health checkups regularly?

Korean: 근데 이상하게 건강검진은 잘 안 받으시더라
English: But strangely, he doesn't get health checkups very often.

Korean: 엥? 지금 받아야 할 연세 아니야?
English: Huh? Isn't this the age you should be receiving treatment at now?

Korean: 맞아 맞아 그런데 자꾸 귀찮다고 안 가셔 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right, but you keep saying it's annoying and don't go ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그러면 지금까지 한 번도 안 받으셨어?
English: So you've never received one until now?

Korean: 그건 아닌데 최근에 받은 적이 없어
English: No, I haven't received it recently

Korean: 그 전에 받았을 때는 어디 아픈 곳 있다고는 안 했고?
English: When you got it before, you didn't say anything hurt?

Korean: 응응 그래서 나도 지금 강요는 안 해!
English: Yeah, yeah, so I'm not forcing you right now!

Korean: 키키 지금 부모님 나이가 어떻게 되시지,?
English: Kiki, how old are your parents now?
You're both 60 years old!

Korean: 오우, 그러면 2년에 한 번은 꼭 받아야 하는데  ㅜㅜ
English: Oh, then I have to get it once every two years ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 너 말 들으니까 건강검진 받으러 가야겠다.
English: Yeah, listening to you, I think I should go get a health checkup.

Korean: 두 분 생년월일 뒷자리 짝수야 홀수야?
English: Are the last digits of your birth dates even or odd?
Both of you are odd numbers
Do you have a boyfriend now?
No I don't have a boyfriend

Korean: 그러면 너 전남친이랑 헤어진 지 얼마나 됐어?
English: So how long has it been since you broke up with your ex?
It's been a while, maybe a year?
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ How did we break up ㅜ
Are you full?
I was tea...
That guy kicked me...
What the heck is this ㅜㅜ
What don't you like!?
That guy cheated on me!
Oh, but you're saying he kicked you?
Even if you beg, you can still get a hat on sale!?
Oh, so the balance between the opposing sides is also the same

Korean: 그러니까 키키 걔 지금 뭐하고 사는 지 알아?
English: So, Kiki, do you know what she's doing now?

Korean: 아니 지금 다 차단해서 하나도 모르겠어
English: No, I don't know anything because they're all blocked now
Kiki, you did well
That Phil guy is at it again!
I really need to block all the recognition

Korean: 맞아 그 친구들도 걔가 바람둥이인 거 알았으면 좋겠다!
English: Yeah, I wish those guys knew he's a playboy!
I spread the word a little bit around!
Do you have any pets at home?
No, I don't have any pets at home

Korean: 본가랑 니 자취방 둘 다 키우는 애 없어?
English: Don't you have any children to raise both at home and in your studio?

Korean: 웅웅 그런데 주변에 키우는 사람 많더라
English: Yeah, but there are a lot of people raising them around me.

Korean: 그러니까 키키 너도 키우고 싶지 않아?
English: So, Kiki, don't you want to raise one too?

Korean: 맞아 키우고 싶은데 함부로 못 데려오겠어 ㅠㅠ
English: Yes, I want to raise it, but I can't just bring it in ㅠㅠ
So, you want to raise a puppy?
Oh my the puppy is so cute and nice ㅠㅠ
What kind of dog is it? Maltese Bichon?
If I raise one, I want to raise it as a large dog!

Korean: 오우 키키 너 대형견 진짜 사람 똥 싸는 거 모르지?
English: Oh Kiki, you don't know that big dogs really poop people?

Korean: 그럼 그냥 우리 집 동생 정도로 만족해야겠다.
English: Then I guess I'll just have to be satisfied with my younger sibling.

Korean: 키키 그래 말 알아들을 수 있는 반려인이 있잖아~
English: Kiki, you have a companion who can understand you~
Yeah, right~ Let's just go to a dog cafe later
Kiki oh good

Korean: 안 간 지 오래됐는지 너랑 가야겠다!
English: It's been a while since I've been there, so I should go with you!
Then let's meet up next week

Korean: 너는 등산 한 번이라도 해본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever been hiking?
Of course, hiking is good.
Wow, are you a hiking enthusiast?
It's not that hard!

Korean: 키키 와 나는 저번에 갔다가 토 했잖아 ㅜ
English: Kiki and I went there last time and threw upㅜ
Where did you go and you even threw up ㅠㅠ

Korean: 너 혹시 대둔산이라고 충남에 유명한 산 알아?
English: Do you know of Daedunsan, a famous mountain in South Chungcheong Province?

Korean: 아니 잘 모르는데 악명 높은 곳이야?
English: No, I don't know, but is it a notorious place?

Korean: 음 그렇게 높지는 않은데 약간 중급 코스?
English: Well, it's not that high, but it's a bit of an intermediate course?
Don't go there
It's too dangerous

Korean: 키키 아 진짜 뭣 모르고 갔다가 죽을 뻔!
English: Kiki, I went there without knowing anything and almost died!
Wow, I only went to beginner level!

Korean: 키키 근데 초급은 그냥 산책길 아니야?
English: Kiki But isn't the beginner's course just a walking path?
If you're not a beginner, it's too difficult.
Kiki, when was the last time you went?
Oh, I went last week.
What game do you like the most?
I like Overwatch the most
Kiki, Overwatch is popular these days, right?
Then then there's nothing like Overwatch!

Korean: 너 그러면 알바하면서 게임도 할 수 있어?
English: Then, can you play games while working part-time?
no...
I hope that happens ㅠ

Korean: 키키 그러면 카운터에 가만히 앉아만 있어?
English: Kiki: Then just sit at the counter?
No, don't use your phone secretly!

Korean: 키키 내 친구 보니까 카운터에 피씨 있어서 하던데?
English: Kiki, I saw my friend and he said there was a PC at the counter?

Korean: 헐 그 피시방 어디야 나도 할래...
English: Oh my, where is that PC room? I want to go there too...

Korean: 키키 너 논산까지 와서 알바할 자신 있니?
English: Kiki, are you confident that you can come all the way to Nonsan and work part-time?
Is there any military there?
How to Nonsan...
Kiki no Kiki
Are you ignoring Nonsan now?
It's not Kiki
I'll just go out and play next time
Kiki Oki
Come eat some Nonsan strawberries~
Nonsan is the best for PC rooms and strawberries!

Korean: 너는 어디 가보고 싶은 곳 없어?
English: Is there anywhere you want to go?

Korean: 나는 요즘 해외 너무 나가고 싶오!
English: I really want to go abroad these days!

Korean: 지금 해외 안 나간 지 몇 년 됐어?
English: How many years has it been since you last went abroad?
I think it's been about two years?

Korean: 와 그러면 코시국 직전에 간 거네?
English: Wow, so you went right before the coronavirus outbreak?

Korean: 어 맞아 코로나 나오고 한번도 못 갔어 ㅠ
English: Oh, that's right. I haven't been able to go since Corona came out.
Oh my gosh, where were you back then?
I went to Vladivostok then!

Korean: 와 대박 거기가 우리나라랑 제일 가까운 유럽 아니야!?
English: Wow, wow, isn't that the closest European country to our country!?
Oh, right!
Have you been there too?

Korean: 아니 나도 가고 싶었는데 코로나 터져서 못 감 ㅜ
English: No, I wanted to go too, but I couldn't go because of the coronavirus outbreak.

Korean: 아 너도 가봤어야 되는데 진짜 좋아!
English: Oh, you should go there too, it's really good!

Korean: 너 몇 박 몇 일로 갔었어 거기?
English: How many nights and days did you go there?
I went for 4 nights and 5 days!
It's small enough there!

Korean: 그렇구나 ㅜㅜ 총 경비는 얼마나 들었어?
English: I see ㅜㅜ How much did it cost in total?

Korean: 잘 기억은 안 나는데 100만 원 정도?
English: I don't remember exactly, but around 1 million won?
Wasn't it hotter than you thought today?

Korean: 헐 그래? 난 오늘 좀 춥던데
English: Oh really? I'm a little cold today.
Isn't the weather hot in October?
Oh that's right
I was wearing short sleeves
Kiki, what are you talking about short sleeves for in October, and it's mid-October!
I thought it was summer ㅠㅠ
Kiki is so funny lol
I got water in my armpit Kiki
Your birthday present this year is deodorant.
Oh honey Kiki is so good
I feel like I'm going to sweat even in winter!
What do you think the weather will be like tomorrow?
Tomorrow? It looks similar.

Korean: 내일도 우리 회사는 에어컨 틀 예정!
English: Tomorrow, our company plans to turn on the air conditioning!

Korean: 좋겠다 우리는 에어컨 잘 안 틀어주는데 ㅠ
English: That would be nice, we don't really turn on the air conditioner ㅠ
Kiki, really?
What should I do if I feel uneasy?

Korean: 그래서 나도 데오트란트 사용 중이야 하하
English: That's why I'm using deotrant too haha

Korean: 키키 오 대박 니 꺼 내가 뺏어야쥐~
English: Kiki Oh wow, I have to take what's yours~
There are already several
Take it lol
Wow, there is bullying even these days?
Oh really? This is too much!
Even the broadcasting station announcer was abusive!
How is that guy?

Korean: 키키 그러니까 아나운서인데 먹튀가 말이 되냐!?
English: Kiki, you're an announcer, so how can you run away with a dine-and-dash?
So this is really too much ㅠ

Korean: 메이크업 비용 150만 원이나 안 줬대 ㅜ
English: They didn't even give me 1.5 million won for makeup ㅜ
It's not even 10,000 won or 20,000 won, but 1.5 million won is too much ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 심지어 비행기 타고 오게 해서 출장메이크업 받은 거래!
English: That's right, I even got to fly here and get my makeup done!
That person must have had a really hard time ㅠ

Korean: 그러니까 ㅜㅜ 근데 이 사람 엄마도 문제야!
English: So ㅜㅜ But this person's mom is also a problem!
Why that guy's mom?

Korean: 이 아나운서한테 했던 화장이 마음에 안 든다고 돈을 안 준다고 한 거래 이 아나운서 엄마가!
English: This announcer's mother said she didn't want to pay for the makeup she did on her announcer!
Instead of drying it, you just add more oil...

Korean: 그러니까  ㅜㅜ 이제 곧 누구인지 그 아나운서 정체 밝혀질 듯!
English: So ㅜㅜ It looks like the announcer's identity will be revealed soon!
I'll be waiting for the article!
Now they say there's an edible coronavirus treatment?
Wow, this would be so great!

Korean: 계속 나온다 나온다 하다가 이제 몇 주 안에 결정이 난대!
English: It keeps coming up and coming up, and now they say a decision will be made in a few weeks!
I hope it comes out soon and comfortably

Korean: 그러니까 ㅜㅜ 니 지인 중에 코로나 걸린 사람 있어?
English: So ㅜㅜ Is there anyone among your acquaintances who has coronavirus?
No I don't have any yet
There were people around me ㅜㅜ
The aftereffects are no joke!
I really need to get vaccinated soon!

Korean: 근데 그때는 백신이 나올 때가 아니라서 ㅜ
English: But at that time, there was no vaccine available.

Korean: 그나저나 이 치료제로 치료를 하면 그 후유증이 생길 확률이 엄청 낮아진대!
English: By the way, if you are treated with this treatment, the probability of developing aftereffects is greatly reduced!

Korean: 그럼 약 나오면 빨리 먹으러 가야겠당!
English: Then I should go and take the medicine quickly once it comes out!
It's not Kiki~
I guess I'll get it once I get it?
Oh right... I guess I should just stay home...ㅠ

Korean: 맞아 키키 이거 근데 700달러면 비싼 건가 싼 건가?
English: Right Kiki, but is this expensive or cheap at $700?

Korean: 700달러? 휴유증 없애는 거면 싼 편이지 않을까?
English: $700? Isn't that cheap for getting rid of the hangover?

Korean: 이게 캡슐 4개를 하루에 두 번씩 복용하는 건데 총 40번을 먹어야 한대!
English: This is 4 capsules taken twice a day, for a total of 40 doses!
Wow, I have to eat a lot

Korean: 너 다이어트 한다더니 효과 좀 있어?
English: You said you were dieting, but is it working?
No, I think it's ruined now

Korean: 키키 헐 왜 열심히 하고 있었잖아!
English: Kiki, why were you working so hard!

Korean: 또 음식 보니까 참을 수가 없더라고 ㅠㅠ
English: I couldn't stand seeing the food again ㅠㅠ
Kiki ha, I admit that,
How many meals do you eat a day?

Korean: 하루에 한 끼에서 두 끼 정도?
English: One or two meals a day?

Korean: 근데 한 끼면 제대로 먹어줘야 해 ㅜ
English: But you have to eat properly at least once a day ㅜ

Korean: 맞아 그래서 먹다가 폭식하는 거 같기도 해
English: Yeah, that's why I think I binge eat

Korean: 너 중간에 간식 같은 거 안 먹어?
English: Don't you eat snacks in between?
Yeah, I don't eat snacks much
Eat healthy foods like almonds

Korean: 안 그러면 그렇게 폭식하게 되는 거야!
English: Otherwise you'll end up binge eating like that!
I really have to do that
I'll go buy almonds tomorrow ㅠㅠ
Kiki Oh, your momentum is amazing?

Korean: 그 하루 견과류 있잖아 그거 사!
English: You got some nuts that day, buy those!
I guess so, please recommend more

Korean: ㅋ 그냥 노브랜드에 있는 거 사
English: Haha just buy the one from No Brand
That's great value for money!
Okay, then I'll go to No Brand tomorrow.

Korean: 나 요즘에 발가락이 간지러운데 설마 이거 무좀임?
English: My toes have been itchy lately. Could it be athlete's foot?

Korean: 야 너 그거 무좀이야 빨리 병원 가
English: Hey, you, that's athlete's foot. Go to the hospital right away.

Korean: 헐 ㅜ 근데 발톱은 안 노란데?
English: Oh my gosh, but your toenails aren't yellow?
Oh, so it's not athlete's foot...?
But why do the soles of my feet itch?
So it's not just the soles of your feet that are caught?
Can athlete's foot only affect the soles of your feet?

Korean: 음 점점 퍼지고 있는 거지... 하하
English: Well, it's spreading... haha

Korean: 헉 ㅜㅜ 나 진짜 회사에서 계속 발만 비빔 ㅜ
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ I really just keep rubbing my feet at work ㅜ
What if I just rub my feet?
Let's go to the hospital quickly.

Korean: 아니면 내가 양말을 이번에 새로 사 신었거든?
English: Or maybe I just bought new socks?
Is this why?
Oh, that could be the case?

Korean: 일단 오늘까지만 참아 보고 내일 병원 가야지 ㅜ
English: I'll just endure it until today and go to the hospital tomorrow ㅜ
Go tomorrow and let me know what it's like haha
Kiki, I understand

Korean: 다행히도 우리 집 근처에 병원이 있음!
English: Luckily, there is a hospital near my house!
It's a good thing it's close ㅠ
Be sure to go tomorrow
What model phone do you have?
I have a galaxy s10
When did that come out?
Isn't the 20th series coming out now?
Maybe so?
It keeps coming out and I'm confused ㅠ

Korean: 키키 너 그러면 그거 언제 산 거야?
English: Kiki, when did you buy that?

Korean: 한 일 년 전쯤에 산 거 같은데?
English: I think I bought it about a year ago?
Did you go to the store and buy it yourself?
No, this time I bought it over the phone!
Can I buy a cell phone over the phone?

Korean: 어어 통신사랑 연락해서 할 수 있더라고 ㅎ
English: Oh, you can contact the telecommunications company and do it.
Wow, that's really amazing
What did you give as a gift?

Korean: 그런 거는 딱히 없었고 할인을 해줬오
English: There wasn't anything like that, they just gave me a discount
Oh really?
How much discount did you give?
Well, maybe 10 percent

Korean: 그러면 20만 원 정도 할인이 된 거네?
English: So, that's a discount of about 200,000 won?
Yeah, that's why I called.

Korean: 너 학생 때 어떤 아이돌 제일 좋아함?
English: Which idol did you like the most when you were a student?
I liked EXO the most

Korean: 와 엑소 시우민은 내 꺼다 건들지 마라!
English: Wow EXO Xiumin is mine, don't touch him!
Xiumin take it
I'm Chen...

Korean: 키키 첸,? 첸은 이미 누가 가져가지 않았어?
English: Kiki Chen,? Didn't Chen already get taken by someone?
That's right... he left first without anyone knowing...
no

Korean: 팬들 알고 있었는데 눈 감아주고 있었다고 했었어!
English: He said that the fans knew but turned a blind eye!
Why was I the only one who didn't know that?

Korean: 키키 와 그러면 첸은 완전 탈퇴한 거야?
English: Kiki: So Chen has completely withdrawn?
I think it was because I got married?
ㅜㅜ So now there are 12 members in EXO?

Korean: 그렇지 한 명씩 다 떠나는 거야
English: Yeah, they're all leaving one by one.

Korean: 아 생각해 보니까 중국인 멤버 싹 다 나가지 않았어?
English: Oh, come to think of it, didn't all the Chinese members leave?
So it seemed like there weren't many people?

Korean: ㅜㅜ 엑소 진짜 탑 아이돌 그룹이었는데!
English: ㅜㅜ EXO was really the top idol group!

Korean: 그러니까 지금 다른 아이돌이 너무 많다
English: So there are too many other idols now
Have you seen A Gift from Room 7?
Wow, I totally watched A Gift from Room 7!
Did you see that at the cinema?
Oh, I saw it at the cinema.
Do you remember what year it was?
Oh no, I don't remember

Korean: 이게 우리 학생 때 나왔던 영화였나?
English: Was this the movie that came out when I was a student?
I think that might have been the case?

Korean: 헐 시간이 이렇게 많이 흘렀구나?  ㅜ
English: Wow, so much time has passed? ㅜ

Korean: 그러게 이제 언제 봤는지도 기억이 안 나네 ㅠ
English: Now I can't even remember when I saw it ㅠ

Korean: 키키 최근에 TV 보니까 하더라고 또 보고 울었음 ㅜ
English: Kiki I saw that on TV recently and I cried when I saw it again ㅜ
Yeah, that's a sad movie ㅠㅠ
Did you see him getting dragged away at the end?
Oh, it was so sad there

Korean: 그러니까  ㅜㅜ 하, 또 감수성이 넘쳐 흐른댜,
English: So ㅜㅜ ha, my sensitivity is overflowing again,
I miss seeing you again after a long time
Where are you going out to eat tonight?

Korean: 아마 친구랑 돈까스 먹으러 갈 거 같은데?
English: I'm probably going to go eat tonkatsu with a friend.
Is there a good tonkatsu restaurant in Busan?

Korean: 당연하지 우리 동네에 맛집 있어! 키키
English: Of course there is a good restaurant in our neighborhood! Kiki
Kiki, is that the place that serves Western food?

Korean: 그건 아니고 돈까스에 그냥 우동 정식?
English: No, just udon with tonkatsu?
Ah, on a day like today, udon is the best!

Korean: 우동 안 먹은지 너무 오래 지나서 먹게 ㅠㅠ
English: It's been so long since I've had udon that I'm going to eat it ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 나도 우동 먹고싶다 ㅜ 우동 안 먹은지 오래 됨!
English: Kiki, I want to eat udon too ㅜ It's been a long time since I had udon!

Korean: 맞아 키키 오랜만에 따뜻한 국물에 우동 먹어
English: That's right Kiki, it's been a while since I had udon in warm soup

Korean: 키키 그러니까 나는 매운 국물파라 짬뽕을 자주 먹었거든
English: Kiki: Well, I like spicy soup, so I often eat Jjamppong.
Jjamppong? It's so spicy... My lips are freezing.

Korean: 키키 짬뽕 안 맵게 해달라고 하면 되지
English: Just ask Kiki Jjamppong to not be spicy

Korean: 그냥 그 고춧가루가 매워서 난 패스
English: I just pass because the chili powder is too spicy

Korean: 키키 그러면 너는 중국집 가면 짜장면 파구나?
English: Kiki: Then when you go to a Chinese restaurant, do you order Jajangmyeon?
Of course, tangsuyuk is the basic option for jajangmyeon.

Korean: 너는 지금 아파트에 살고 있어 주택에 살고 있어?
English: Are you living in an apartment or a house now?
I'm neither?~ It's a no-no!

Korean: 그러면 빌라겠지 뭐~ 거기서 거기 아니여?
English: Then it would be a villa, right? Isn't it there?

Korean: 에이 빌라는 또 다른 개념이잖아 키키
English: Hey villa is another concept Kiki

Korean: 키키 근데 나 빌라에서는 한 번도 안 살아봤어 어때?
English: Kiki But I've never lived in a villa before. What do you think?

Korean: 우리 빌라는 엘리베이터 없어서 완전 헬이야
English: Our villa doesn't have an elevator so it's total hell.

Korean: 아 진짜? 너 몇 층에서 살고 있는데?
English: Oh really? What floor do you live on?
I'm on the 4th floor, but there are only stairs...

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 4층 맨날 올라가면 허벅지는 튼튼하겠다
English: Wow ㅜㅜ If you go up to the 4th floor every day, your thighs will be strong

Korean: 허벅지가 너무 아파 4층 정도 올라오면 키키
English: My thighs hurt so much that I had to climb up to the 4th floor to get up.

Korean: 키키 야 그래도 남자는 허벅지가 튼튼해야혀!
English: Kiki, but still, a man needs to have strong thighs!

Korean: 난 그냥 편한 엘리베이터 있는 곳으로 갈래...
English: I just want to go somewhere with a convenient elevator...
Kiki, are your parents thinking of moving?

Korean: 아니 아직은 없으셔 근데 곧 생기지 않을까?~
English: No, not yet, but won't it be there soon?~

Korean: 키키 그렇구나 신축 아파트 요즘에 많이  생기던데!
English: Kiki, I see. There seem to be a lot of new apartments being built these days!

Korean: 신축 아파트로 가고 싶지만 돈이 비싸니까...
English: I want to move to a new apartment, but it's expensive...
What kind of car have you driven?

Korean: 나? 아반떼랑 suv등등 렌트 많이 해 봤지
English: Me? I've rented a lot of Avantes, SUVs, etc.
Oh, what did you try, SUV?

Korean: 나 셀토스랑 트레일블레이져랑 스토닉 등 많이 타 봤어~
English: I've driven a lot of cars like Seltos, Trailblazer, and Stonic.
Where did the Trailblazer come from?

Korean: 그 쉐보레에서 나온 차인데 완전 묵직해
English: That car from Chevrolet is so heavy.

Korean: 키키 그래? 그러면 기름 많이 잡아먹겠다!
English: Kiki Really? Then it will consume a lot of oil!

Korean: 맞아 키키 근데 그 만큼 승차감도 좋고 디자인 이뻐
English: Yes Kiki, but the ride is good and the design is pretty

Korean: 키키 헐 무슨 색상 타고 다녔어?
English: Kiki, what color were you riding?

Korean: 렌트카라서 거의 다 흰색이야! 키키 근데 저 차만 검은색
English: Since it's a rental car, most of them are white! Kiki, but that car is black.

Korean: 어디 여행 갔다왔을 때 탄 거야?
English: Where did you travel and come back from?

Korean: 나 혼자 밀양 드라이브 갔을 때 렌트했었어 하하
English: I rented a car when I went to Miryang alone haha
You went to Miryang alone?

Korean: 응 키키 그냥 차 궁금해서 렌트했었거든
English: Yeah Kiki, I just rented a car because I was curious about it.
How much did you pay for that ride per day?
Because it was carsharing, it was by the hour, not by the day.

Korean: 너는 상하차 말고 다른 알바 해본 거 있어?
English: Have you ever done any other part-time jobs besides getting on and off the truck?

Korean: 나는 진행요원 같은거 해 본 적 있어!
English: I've been a facilitator before!
A progress agent? A bodyguard or something?

Korean: 아니 그 면접이나 필기시험 칠 때 복도에서 도우미 느낌
English: No, I feel like I'm a helper in the hallway when I'm taking an interview or a written test.
Oh really? How much was that hourly wage?

Korean: 시급 만원인데 나름 할 만하더라 하하
English: The hourly wage is 10,000 won, but it's worth it haha
Wow, this is totally a sweet deal.

Korean: 아냐 그래도 약간 부담스러워 면접 같은 경우는
English: No, but it's still a bit burdensome in cases like interviews.

Korean: 키키 아니 너가 면접 보는 게 아니고 도와주는 사람 아니야?
English: Kiki, aren't you the one doing the interview, not the one helping?
Yeah, my role is to help the interviewers!

Korean: 그러니까 근데 너가 부담스러울 게 뭐가 있어
English: So what is there to be burdened by?

Korean: 내가 면접자들을 데리고 다니는거라 실수하면 큰일 나잖아 하하
English: I'm the one who brings the interviewers around so if I make a mistake it'll be a big problem haha

Korean: 키키 괜찮아 쉬운 거니까 그거는 몇 시간 했어?
English: Kiki, it's okay, it's easy, how many hours did you do that?
About 8 hours a day? Excluding 1 hour for meals~

Korean: 와 그러면 하루 일당 7만 원 받았겠네?
English: Wow, so you got paid 70,000 won a day?

Korean: 응 그럴 거 같아 물론 3.3프로 세금 떼야지...
English: Yeah, I guess so. Of course, you have to deduct 3.3% tax...
Didn't you have a hard time in the military?
I think training was the hardest though...?
Have you ever done that backpack training?

Korean: 행군? 당연하지 그건 언제나 필수코스더라 키키
English: Marching? Of course, that's always a must Kiki

Korean: 키키 군장 매고 그거 있잖아 20키로 걷는 거?
English: You know, the Kiki outfit where you walk 20 kilometers?
Yeah Kiki these days it's a 40kg backpack
Wow, 40 kilos? Wow, how can you carry that and walk?
I thought I was going to collapse while doing it~

Korean: 키키 진짜, 그거 신발이 진짜 불편하다며,
English: Kiki, seriously, those shoes are really uncomfortable,

Korean: 응 군화가 애초에 그냥 나랑은 안 맞아
English: Yeah, combat boots just don't fit me in the first place.

Korean: 키키 그거 내 남친은 진짜 엄청 까져서 병원 갔다고 했어
English: Kiki, my boyfriend said he got really annoyed and went to the hospital.

Korean: 맞아 그래서 그냥 나는 깔창 하나 더 깔아서 신어
English: Yeah, so I just put an extra insole on and wear them.

Korean: 깔창 하나 더 까는 게 훨씬 더 좋아?
English: Wouldn't it be much better to add one more insole?

Korean: 내 기준엔 그런데 사람마다 다를거야 하하
English: By my standards, it's different for everyone haha

Korean: 키키 아 그렇구나 너는 발에 물집 안 잡혔어?
English: Kiki Oh, I see. You don't have any blisters on your feet?
No matter what I do, I get blisters on my feet.
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Are you calloused now?

Korean: 아니 시간 좀 지나서 없어졌어 하하
English: No, it disappeared after some time haha

Korean: 너는 공부했던 과목 중에 뭐가 제일 어려웠어?
English: What was the most difficult subject you studied?
I find math the hardest?!

Korean: 너 때도 혹시 수학의 정석이라고 있었니?
English: Did you ever have a mathematical foundation?
I don't know when it started, but it was there...
Kiki, did you study with that?

Korean: 아니 키키 우린 그 전 과목까지만 배워서 안 써
English: No Kiki, we only learned up to that subject so we don't use it

Korean: 그렇구나 나는 이거 공부하느라 죽는 줄 ㅜ
English: Oh, I thought I was going to die studying this.
Just the title itself makes me feel like I don't want to do it

Korean: 키키 맞아 나 원래 수학 좋아하는데 싫어졌잖아 이거 때문에
English: Kiki, that's right, I originally liked math, but I started to hate it because of this.

Korean: 응 나도 수학 이제 완전 싫어 버릴거야 하하
English: Yeah I'm going to hate math now too haha

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 그렇다고 다른 과목도 좋은 건 아니야
English: Kiki is right, but that doesn't mean other subjects are good either.
I think society is better than ever

Korean: 아 키키 너 혹시 근현대사 배웠으?
English: Ah Kiki, have you ever studied modern and contemporary history?
Ah, I like things like geography, not that kind of society!
What did you learn in geography?

Korean: 기후랑 도시나 이런 나라들 공부하는거야 키키
English: Studying climate, cities, and countries like that Kiki
I heard your mother wasn't feeling well. How is she doing now?

Korean: 응 지금은 그래도 입원해서 나아지고 계셔 하하
English: Yeah, he's hospitalized now and getting better haha

Korean: 다행이다 ㅜㅜ 몇 개월 입원하셔야 해?
English: Thank goodness ㅜㅜ How many months will you have to be hospitalized?
They said they are looking at it for a month now, but we have to wait and see how it goes.

Korean: 오우 그렇구나 ㅜㅜ 빨리 낳으셔야하는데 지금 몇 일 계셨지?
English: Oh, I see. You have to give birth quickly. How many days have you been pregnant?

Korean: 3일차인데 그래도 조금 호전 된 거 같아 보여!
English: It's only the third day and it still looks like things have gotten a little better!

Korean: 그렇구나 나 그때 진짜 깜놀했잖아 어머니 아프시다고 하셔서
English: Oh, I was really surprised when you said your mother was sick.

Korean: 막 엄청 아프신건 아니여서 그 정돈 아니야
English: It's not like you're really sick, so it's not like that
But didn't you say your arm was broken?

Korean: 맞아 키키 골절이라 깁스 정도면 나을거래
English: That's right, Kiki, it's a fracture, so a cast would be better.

Korean: 그러니까  ㅜㅜ 골절이면 깁스는 한 2달은 해야 할 걸?
English: So ㅜㅜ if it's a fracture, you'll need to wear a cast for about 2 months?

Korean: 아마 1달 입원하고 1달 통원치료 할 거 같아
English: I think I'll probably be hospitalized for a month and receive outpatient treatment for a month.

Korean: 맞아 우리 고모도 이번에 팔꿈치 골절상 당하셔서 내가 잘 알지 ㅜㅜ
English: Yes, my aunt also broke her elbow this time, so I know her well ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그치? 안 부딪히고 사고 안나게 조심 해야지 뭐...
English: Right? You have to be careful not to bump into anything and cause an accident...

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 근데 이게 조심해도 다치게 되더라
English: Yeah ㅜㅜ But even if you're careful, you'll still get hurt

Korean: 알았어 하하 너도 조심해야해 방심은 금물이야
English: Okay haha you have to be careful too you can't let your guard down

Korean: 너네 여친이랑 각자 생일 어떻게 챙겼어?
English: How did you and your girlfriends celebrate their birthdays?

Korean: 우린 그냥 선물 하고 데이트하고 끝
English: We just give gifts, date and that's it
But that's not all, Kiki

Korean: 그래? 다른 사람들은 서프라이즈도 하고 다른 거 많이 하던데
English: Yeah? Other people do surprises and other things too.
Kiki, that's hardly a proposal
Yeah, I just like normal things

Korean: 키키 크게는 못 챙기더라도 의미만 가지면 되지
English: Even if you can't take care of Kiki in a big way, it's okay as long as it has meaning

Korean: 맞아 나도 의미만 챙기면 된다는 주의야
English: That's right, I'm just careful to keep the meaning in mind.

Korean: 키키 그러니까 근데 그것도 이제 오래되면 안 된다~
English: Kiki: Well, that's not good anymore, even if it's been a while~

Korean: 너네 지금 의미만 가지고 있구나? 키키
English: Are you just making sense now? Kiki

Korean: 키키 아니 이제 서로 날짜도 안 봐
English: Kiki, no, we don't even see each other anymore

Korean: 와 벌써 그 정도로 오래 사겼구나?!
English: Wow, you've been together for that long already?!
It's already our 7th anniversary this month ㅜ
You guys dated for a really long time, I'm jealous...
Now I live with friendship and loyalty~

Korean: 그치 키키 나도 곧 7주년 따라 갈게~
English: Right Kiki, I'll be following you for the 7th anniversary soon~
My friend's dog was hospitalized this time?
Oh my god, why was the puppy hospitalized...?

Korean: 강아지 몸 속에 있는 혈액이 약간 점성을 띄고 있대
English: The blood inside the dog's body is slightly viscous.

Korean: 헉 그러면 몸 많이 아픈 거 아니야?
English: Oh, then doesn't your body hurt a lot?

Korean: 그러니까 그래서 입원해서 링겔 맞고 있대
English: So, that's why he was hospitalized and was getting a Ringer's injection.

Korean: 와 동물병원비 장난 아니겠다 그치? ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, the vet bills are no joke, right? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그치 ㅜㅜ 지금 물어보니까 입원비만 50만 원 깨졌대
English: Right ㅜㅜ I just asked and they said the hospitalization fee alone was over 500,000 won
500,000 won? Since when were you hospitalized?
Starting Friday? I brought it now!

Korean: 아 비싸긴하네 키키 나는 부담스러울 거 같은데
English: Oh, it's expensive. Kiki, I think it would be burdensome for me.

Korean: 맞아 여기는 서울이라 더 그런 거 같아
English: Yeah, I think it's even more so here in Seoul.
The cost of animal hospitals varies greatly from region to region?

Korean: 아마 그럴 거야 그리고 치료비까지 한 100들었대
English: Probably, and the medical bills were around 100

Korean: 그래? 키키 나는 그럼 주인 되는걸 포기해야겠다
English: Really? Kiki, then I guess I'll have to give up being the owner.

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 지금 우리 오복이 때문에 등골이 휘어~
English: Kiki, that's right, my spine is also bent right now because of our Obok~
Oh Bok-i did cost a lot of money...
Have you ever been fishing?

Korean: 응  키키 바다에서 한 번 해 봤어
English: Yeah, I tried it once in the ocean, Kiki.
Oh, these days are the best season for squid fishing!

Korean: 쭈꾸미? 쭈꾸미도 낚시로 잡는 거였어? ㅋ키키ㅋㅋㅋ
English: Squid? You catch squid with fishing too? Hahahahahaha
Kiki, I didn't know you could catch them like that!

Korean: 헐 키키 나는 그냥 작은 생선 같은 거 잡아 봤어
English: Oh my gosh I just caught a small fish or something

Korean: 키키 생선 종류는 모르고?  걍 피라미 같은 거?
English: Kiki, you don't know what kind of fish it is? Is it just something like a pyramid?

Korean: 응 완전 생소한 물고기였어 근데 작아
English: Yeah, it was a completely new fish, but it was small.

Korean: 아 진짜? 너 배에서 낚시한 거야?
English: Oh really? You were fishing on a boat?

Korean: 아니 그 항구 방파제에서 앉아서 낚시!
English: No, sit on the harbor breakwater and fish!
Kiki, who did you go do that with?

Korean: 아빠랑 갔어 우리 아빠 낚시 매니아시거든 하하
English: I went with my dad. My dad is a fishing enthusiast haha

Korean: 그렇구나 아부지가 낚시 좋아하시면 장비도 상당할 텐데?
English: I see. If your dad likes fishing, he must have a lot of fishing equipment.

Korean: 그치 장비가 아주 맘에 들어서 따라갔었거든~
English: I followed along because I really liked the equipment~

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 낙시대도 몇 백하는 거 있는데 그거 아니야?
English: Kiki, really? Isn't that the one that costs a few hundred dollars?

Korean: 응 가격은 잘 모르겠는데 일단 비싼 장비야!
English: Yeah, I'm not sure about the price, but it's an expensive piece of equipment!
Have you ever tried everyone's Marvel?

Korean: 알지 그 게임 키키 유명하잖아 핸드폰게임으로
English: You know, that game Kiki is famous as a mobile game.

Korean: 키키 하 너 그거 언제까지 했었냐?
English: Kiki ha, how long have you been doing that?

Korean: 나 레벨100 넘어 고인물이거든~ 옛날부터 했지
English: I'm a veteran who's over level 100~ I've been doing it since long ago
Kiki, you're crazy. What's your character?

Korean: 나 그 여자캐릭턴데 이름은 기억이 안 나
English: I'm that female character, but I don't remember her name.

Korean: 여자 캐릭은 나는 하프 들고 다니는 애밖에 몰라
English: I only know of female characters who carry a harp

Korean: 어 걔 맞는 거 같은데? 요즘은 또 팀운도 중요하잖아
English: Oh, I think that's right. Team luck is also important these days.
Kiki, her name was probably Muse, right?

Korean: 맞아 키키 내 캐릭터 뮤즈 플러스야
English: Yes Kiki my character Muse Plus
There's also a character called Kiki Muse Plus?

Korean: 플러스가 그 등급 나타낸 거야 키키 나온건 아니고
English: The plus indicates the level, not Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 그렇구나 그러면 너 승률은 몇이었어?
English: Kiki Oh, I see. Then what were your winning percentages?
The odds of winning are 50%...? It's not that high ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그렇구나 그래도 승률 50이면 괜찮은 거 아니야?
English: I see. But isn't a 50% win rate okay?
Yeah? What were your odds of winning, Kiki?
Is there a travel destination you would like to visit?

Korean: 나는 이번에 제주도가 아직도 기억에 남아
English: I still remember Jeju Island from this time
Jeju Island this time? What month did you go?
I went last week and the weather was really nice.
Yeah? Who did you go with then?

Korean: 나 여친이랑 갔지 키키 갈 사람이 어딨겠어
English: I went with my girlfriend. Who would go to Kiki?

Korean: 키키 아니 친구랑 갔을 수도 있지
English: Kiki, maybe she went with a friend

Korean: 내 친구들 다 바빠서 혼자가거나 여친이랑 가 하하
English: My friends are all busy so I go alone or with my girlfriend haha

Korean: 키키 여친도 여행 진짜 좋아하나 봐
English: Kiki's girlfriend seems to really like traveling too
That's right, I met my girlfriend on a trip~

Korean: 키키 맞아 그것도  해외에서 만난 거면 완전 운명이지
English: Kiki, that's right. If you met overseas, it's completely fate.

Korean: 응 키키 그래서 항상 우린 여행 자주 다녀
English: Yeah Kiki, that's why we always travel a lot

Korean: 키키 그렇겠다 그래서 기념일에도 여행을 자주 갔구나?
English: Kiki: I see, so that's why you often go on trips for anniversaries?

Korean: 우린 기념일이나 생일을 다른 지역에서 보내는 편이야!
English: We tend to celebrate our anniversaries and birthdays in different places!

Korean: 둘 다 그게 좋다면 그렇게 하는 게 맞지~!
English: If you both like it, then that's right~!

Korean: 응 그래서 이번에도 또 다른 곳 가려고 계획중이야
English: Yeah, so I'm planning to go somewhere else this time too.
Oh, the rain has finally stopped!
Really? It would be normal if it stopped by now...

Korean: 키키  추적추적 내리더니, 내일 또 오려나,
English: Kiki, you keep coming down, will you come again tomorrow?

Korean: 일기예보 안 봤어? 키키 완전 폭우래
English: Didn't you see the weather forecast? Kiki, it's going to rain a ton.
Wow, that's on the news nationwide?

Korean: 응 키키 내일도 오니까 아무 걱정마~
English: Yeah Kiki, I'll be back tomorrow too, so don't worry~

Korean: 키키 아니 내일 오면 더 안 좋은 거 아니야?
English: Kiki: Isn't it going to be worse if you come tomorrow?

Korean: 난 내일 집에만 있어서 상관 없지
English: I don't mind because I'll just stay home tomorrow

Korean: 키키 나도 집에만 있을 예정인데 남친이 올 거 같아
English: Kiki I'm planning on staying home too, but I think my boyfriend will come

Korean: 아 그러면 어쩔 수 없이 나가야 하잖아!
English: Oh, then I have no choice but to go out!

Korean: 키키 맞아 콧바람 좀 쐬고 다녀야지
English: Kiki, you're right, you need to get some fresh air
It's raining, so where are you going?

Korean: 아니 그러니까 비가 안 왔으면 좋겠다고 ㅜ
English: No, I mean I hope it doesn't rain ㅜ
Let's just pray that the weather forecast is wrong.

Korean: 키키 맞아 일기예보 이럴 때만  정확하더라고 ㅜ
English: Kiki, that's right, the weather forecast is only accurate in times like this ㅜ

Korean: 하긴... 낼 비 오면 난 그냥 낮잠이나 자야지~
English: Well... if it rains tomorrow, I'll just take a nap~

Korean: 이번에 택시기사가 뻥소니 치고 자기 몰랐다고 했던 기사 봤어?
English: Did you see the article about the taxi driver who lied and said he didn't know?

Korean: 헐 너무 심한 거 아니야? 키키
English: Wow, isn't that too much? Kiki

Korean: 그러니까 근데 이거 뻥으로 판명났다 키키
English: So, but this turned out to be a lie, Kiki
Oh, that article is a lie?

Korean: 아니 택시기사가 몰랐다고 했던 게 뻥이라고!
English: No, the taxi driver was lying when he said he didn't know!
Then you did it without knowing, right?
So when I looked at the black box, everything was there
Black boxes can't lie...

Korean: 키키 덜커덩 하는 소리랑 아줌마 비명소리까지 들리더래
English: I could hear the sound of Kiki's thump and the sound of the woman screaming.

Korean: 그 정도면 무조건 알텐데 왜 도망 간거지 키키
English: If you knew that much, why did you run away? Kiki

Korean: 그러니까 내가 봤을 때 음주운전이 아니었을까,
English: So, when I saw it, it wasn't drunk driving, right?
Wow, a taxi driver is driving drunk? He should definitely be arrested.

Korean: 맞아 지금 징역 나올 거 같던데?
English: Right, I think I'm going to jail now?

Korean: 무조건 징역이지 뺑소니에 음주운전은 못 피해~
English: It's definitely a prison sentence, but you can't avoid drunk driving and hit-and-run accidents~

Korean: 키키 맞아 와 사람을 그렇게 하고 두고 가냐,
English: Kiki, you're right, you leave people like that,

Korean: 에이 너무 했다~ 이제 벌 좀 받아야 해!
English: Hey, you've gone too far~ Now you deserve to be punished!
What vaccine did you get?
I completed the second round with Moderna~
Fortunately, if it's Pfizer, you have to get a booster shot.
Huh? What is a booster shot? It's a buff? Kiki

Korean: 화이자면 나중에 예방확률 떨어져서 맞아야 하잖아
English: If it's Pfizer, the preventive effect will decrease later, so you have to get it.

Korean: 헐 다행이다 모더나라서 넌 뭐로 맞았는데?
English: Oh thank goodness it's Moderna. What did you get hit with?

Korean: 나도 모더나로 맞으라고 해서 그걸로 맞았어
English: I was told to get Moderna too, so I got that.

Korean: 다행이네 키키 난 화이자였으면 억울 했을 거같아
English: Thank goodness Kiki, if it was Pfizer I would have felt wronged
Kiki, my sister, first of all, is Pfizer, right?
Ah...? Then a booster shot is definitely required.

Korean: 맞아 근데 지금 당장은 안 맞아도 되고 한 4개월 뒤?
English: Yeah, but it doesn't have to be right now, but maybe in about 4 months?

Korean: 아 그게 기간도 정해져 있는 거야? 처음 알았네
English: Oh, that's a set period of time? I just found out.

Korean: 키키 그게 2달 뒤면 서서히 예방률이 떨어진대
English: Kiki, after two months, the prevention rate gradually decreases.
If that's the case, why did you even make a second one...

Korean: 키키 근데 전문가들이 그렇다고 예방률이 아예 없는 건 아니니까 걱정하지 말라고 하더라
English: Kiki But the experts said not to worry because it doesn't mean there is no prevention rate at all.

Korean: 에이 백신 다 소용없어~ 모더나가 그나마 낫지
English: Hey, all vaccines are useless~ Moderna is better
Have you ever been to a dermatologist?
I've been getting my beard shaved these days~

Korean: 와오 너 그거 엄청 아프지 않아?
English: Wow, doesn't that hurt like hell?

Korean: 완전 할 때 마다 오징어 타는 냄새 난다? 키키
English: Does it smell like squid every time you do it? Kiki

Korean: 키키 헐 아프지는 않고 그거 봤는데 엄청 아프다던데?
English: Kiki Oh my god, it doesn't hurt, but I saw that and it really hurt?

Korean: 맞아 엄청 아파 키키 따끔거리는 게 진짜 싫더라
English: Yeah it hurts so much Kiki I really hate that stinging feeling

Korean: 키키 헉 너 수염 얼마나 많길래?
English: Kiki, how much beard do you have?

Korean: 나 수염 많아서 레이저 제모 다니는거거든...
English: I have a lot of beard so I go for laser hair removal...

Korean: 키키 그래서 지금까지 몇 번 받았어
English: Kiki so how many times have you received it so far
I got it 7 times and it disappeared more than I thought.
Wow, I got it 7 times, so it must have decreased a lot!
But I heard that it takes more than 15 times to be effective.
Wow, if I get 15, what's the cost?
It costs about 50,000 won at a time, but it varies depending on the part.
Wow, then how much is it for 15 times?

Korean: 75만원...? 그래도 그 이상 값어치가 있다 생각해
English: 750,000 won...? I think it's worth more than that.

Korean: 나 요즘에 허리가 너무 아픈데 왜 그러지
English: My back hurts so much these days. Why is that?

Korean: 그래? 너 일 하느라 그런 거 아니야?
English: Really? Aren't you like that because you're working?

Korean: 그런 가 봐 이렇게 오래 앉아 있었을 때가 없었으니까
English: I guess so, I've never sat down for this long before.

Korean: 허리 아프면 보호대라도 한 번 사 봐
English: If your back hurts, buy a brace.

Korean: 그 요즘에 커블체어? 유행하잖아 그거 살까 생각중!
English: Curved chairs are trendy these days. I'm thinking about buying one!

Korean: 오 그거 우리집에 있어 지금도 쓰는중
English: Oh, I have that at home and I'm still using it.

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 그거 하나에 가격 얼마야?
English: Kiki Oh really? How much does one of those cost?

Korean: 3만원 정도 하던데 중고로 사면 더 싸
English: It costs about 30,000 won, but it's cheaper if you buy it used.
I see. It was more expensive than I thought.

Korean: 응 그거 사서 한 번 써 봐 나름 좋던데?~
English: Yeah, I bought that and tried it out. It was pretty good, wasn't it?~

Korean: 그래? 다른 사람들은 그거 허리가 더 아프다고 하더라고
English: Yeah? Other people say that it hurts their back more.
Ah, I guess it's different for everyone. I like it...?

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 한 개에 3만 원이라 고민 좀 해야겠어
English: Kiki, really? It's 30,000 won each, so I'll have to think about it.

Korean: 좋아 난 그만큼 효과가 있었거든 하하
English: Okay it worked for me haha

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 허리 지금 좋아?
English: Kiki, really? Is your waist feeling good now?

Korean: 지금은 괜찮은데 효과가 나름 있었던거 같아
English: It's okay now, but I think it had some effect.
Are you doing stocks or something?

Korean: 응 나 요즘 주린이로 입문했잖아 하하
English: Yeah I just started out as a kid haha

Korean: 키키 헐 어떤 종목 주식 샀어?
English: Kiki, what kind of stocks did you buy?

Korean: 나 우량주랑 삼성 이런 큰 기업들!
English: I like blue chip stocks and big companies like Samsung!

Korean: 키키 그래도 우량주 같은 경우는 배당금이라는 게 있잖아!
English: Kiki: But in the case of blue chip stocks, there is something called a dividend!
I just put it in to collect the dividends

Korean: 키키 그러니까 이번에 삼성 배당금 1. 3%라고 하더라고?
English: Kiki: So this time, Samsung said its dividend would be 1.3%?

Korean: 500원정도 요즘 나와 거기가다 가진 주 만큼 곱해서 주고!
English: These days, I'm going to give you about 500 won, multiply by the amount of money I have!
Kiki, is it true that it's 500 won!? How much did you put in?

Korean: 나 20주 가지고 있어 분기당 만원 받아 하하
English: I have 20 weeks and get paid ten thousand won per quarter haha

Korean: 오 그러면 만 원으로 피씨방 갔다오면 되것네!
English: Oh, then I can just go to the PC room for ten thousand won!

Korean: 에이 키키 그냥 다른 주식 투자 해 볼까 고민이기도 해
English: Hey Kiki, I'm thinking about investing in other stocks

Korean: 키키 어떤 거 설마 빗흐코인은 아니겠지!?
English: Kiki, what is that? It can't be Bithumb Coin, right!?

Korean: 아니야 그냥 주식 다른 거 사 보려고
English: No, I just wanted to buy some other stocks.

Korean: 그래 비트코인만 하지 말고 다른 거나 해~
English: Yeah, don't just do Bitcoin, do something else~

Korean: 알았어 한 번 검색 해 봐야지 하하
English: Okay, I'll have to look it up haha

Korean: 너는 노래방에서 잘 부르는 노래가 뭐니?
English: What song are you good at singing at karaoke?
Me? I only sing ballads these days
There are multiple singers for ballads too~
I'm a fan of SG Wannabe, especially Kim Jin-ho

Korean: 키키 와 김진호 이번에 에스지 워너비 확 떴잖아!
English: Kiki and Kim Jin-ho, this time SG Wannabe has really caught on!
Yeah, that's why I liked it better!

Korean: 맞아 노래 너무 좋지!? 나는 라라라 좋아해!
English: Yeah, the song is so good!? I like Lalala!

Korean: 라라라? 나 그 노래도 좋은데 혹시 내사람 알아?
English: Lalala? I like that song too. Do you know my person?

Korean: 키키 아 그거 아마 노래 들으면 알 걸?
English: Kiki, you'll probably know that if you listen to the song?

Korean: 에스지워너비는 내사람이 최고야 너무 잘 불러
English: SG Wannabe sings "My Person is the Best" so well

Korean: 아 맞아 나는 근데 개인적으로 먼데이키즈 좋아함!
English: Oh right, but I personally like Monday Kids!

Korean: 오 먼데이키즈? 그 그룹도 발라드계에선 유명하잖아
English: Oh Monday Kids? That group is also famous in the ballad world.

Korean: 맞아 나 먼데이키즈 콘서트도 갔다 옴 ㅜ
English: Yeah, I went to Monday Kiz concert too ㅜ

Korean: 헐 부럽다 어땠어? 나도 콘서트 가 보고싶다
English: Wow, I'm jealous. How was it? I want to go to the concert too.

Korean: 키키 헐, 진짜 완전 좋아 ㅜㅜ 또 가고 싶음
English: Kiki wow, really really good ㅜㅜ I want to go again

Korean: 다음에 나랑 그럼 같이 가 보자!
English: Next time, let's go together!

Korean: 너는 진격의 거인은 안 봤다고 했나?
English: You said you haven't seen Attack on Titan?

Korean: 응 나 본 적은 없어 키키
English: Yeah I've never seen Kiki
So, do you know the cartoon called One Punch Man?

Korean: 아 그것도 이름만 알고 잘 몰라 미안...
English: Oh, I'm sorry I don't know much about that, I only know the name...

Korean: 키키 어 이거 만화책으로 엄청 유명한 만화인데!?
English: Kiki, this is a really famous manga!?

Korean: 나는 잘 몰라 ㅠㅠ 너는 그거 봐?
English: I don't know ㅠㅠ Do you see that?
Kiki, this is hilarious, I recommend it
Is that it? I wonder what the content is.

Korean: 남주가 히어로인데 괴물들을 한방에 날려버리는 거야
English: The male protagonist is a hero who blows away monsters in one go.
It's totally cool if you're blowing up monsters!
Kiki, but the world view is really awesome!

Korean: 그러면 오늘은 원펀맨 입문 해 볼까~

English: Oh, that's right. Moderna's side effect is cerebrovascular disease, and I think they said that was the cause of death!
Wow, is this really a hit or miss thing?

cafe?

that's right?

I serve and make the guests laugh~

no

of course

yes.

Korean: 근데 원조 때문에 2기랑 3기 다 묻힘 키키

Kiki ah creepy kiki

Jo Seung-woo quietly disappeared after releasing Sampalgwangddaeng

I'm going on a diet now.
Eat eggs

Korean: 헐 저녁에 계란 한 개만 먹었어?

Korean: 아니 계란 세 개 먹었지 키키 너는?

Wow, that fills your stomach?

Korean: 키키 맞아 오빠 뱃살 좀 줄여야 해!
English: Kiki, that's right, oppa, you need to lose some belly fat!

Korean: 근데 독소가 빠져서 좋다 하더라 하고 후기 알려줌

Korean: 키키 오 좋아 좋아 언제까지 할 생각이야?
English: Kiki Oh, good, good. How long do you plan on doing this?

Korean: 일단 바지 사이즈 맞을 동안 키키
English: Kiki while your pants are getting the right size

English: I'm going this weekend. Do you want to go together?

Korean: 그렇구나 오빠 근데 혼자 살 생각이야?

Korean: 응 아직은 혼자 살고 나중에 여친이랑 투룸 가게

Korean: 키키 오 여친이랑 상의 된 내용이야~?

Korean: 키키 오빠 금액대는 얼마 정도 생각하고 있어?

Korean: 그렇구나 오빠 중소기업 대출 이미 받았구나?

Korean: 응 대출 이자만 내고 살다가 나와야지 ^^

English: Oh, oppa, what time did you finish yesterday?

Then isn't it time for the last train to leave?

Korean: 응 그래서 택시 타고 왔어 교통비 지원

It was close to my house because it was on the outskirts of Pyeongtaek.

Korean: 맞아 그래도 교통비 지원 해줘서 그냥 탔지 ㅜㅜ 넘힘듬
English: Yeah, but I just rode it because they supported the transportation fee ㅜㅜ It was too hard

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 맞아 아니 이 시국에 야간까지 시키다니!

Korean: 내 말이 그래도 택시 타니까 편하고 좋아

Kiki, thank goodness you caught a taxi right away?

Korean: 그렇구나 회사 안에 식당이 있는 거야?

Korean: 응 맞아 키키 우리 회사 식당 존맛탱

Korean: 아니 3천원 정도 내는데 괜찮은 것 같아 키키

Kiki, wow, it's 3 thousand won?
What's on today?
Today's black pork duruchigi kiki
I like my aunts' cooking

Korean: 그러게 짱 좋다 우리는 사 먹어야 하는데  ㅜ
English: That's really good, we have to buy it ㅜ
Oh, that's too bad. What about the food expenses?
Well, 100,000 won, haha
Oh but where does it come from!
Hahaha, is that so? I don't know,

Korean: 오빠는 피엑스에서 엄마 화장품 사 줬어?

Korean: 키키 오 오빠 때도 금 크림이 있었단 말이야?
English: Kiki Oh, you mean there was gold cream back in your day too?
That's a classic.
Better than snails

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 그거 완전 비싸잖아!
English: Kiki: Really? That's so expensive!
About 20 thousand won?
Kiki, not that expensive

Korean: 아니 근데 그거 시중에서는 몇 십만 원 하던데?

Korean: 그건 시중이고 키키 군대는 면세 개꿀~
English: That's the market and Kiki's Army is duty free so cool~

Korean: 키키 그니까 오빠 그거 몇 개 사 옴?
English: Kiki, how many of those did you buy, oppa?

Korean: 와 키키 맞다 오빠 이모 되게 많지?

Korean: 와 그걸 아직도 쓰고 있단 말이야!?

Korean: 양도 많고 유통기한도 길어서 근데 다 쓴 듯 아마

Korean: 키키 맞아 그런 거는 듬뿍 듬뿍 발라줘야 해!

Korean: 그래서 내 얼굴에 맨날 기름이 잔뜩 해

Korean: 내가 제일 잘하는 게 밤 식빵이야 키키

Korean: 아앗 키키 근데 밤 조림 캔이 훨씬 더 달고 맛있음!

Korean: 맞아 학교에서 밤캔 엄청 먹음 키키

Korean: 응 그러게 타일이 오래 되어서 마모 된 것 같아

Start construction!

Yeah ㅜㅜ It's a fracture ㅜㅜ

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 그래서 외할머니 댁을 못 갔다고 한 거였구나!

Korean: 맞아, 그땐 정말 심해서 누워만 계심

Korean: 그러게 키키 제사도 건너뛰고 나도 쉬었어

Marriage happens when your girlfriend asks you to!

English: Hey, oppa, aren't you going to have a plate of eggs right now?

Korean: 키키 근데 사람 일은 또 몰라!

Korean: 왜 몰라? 여친이랑 결혼 할 거야!

Korean: 키키 아니 오히려 빨리 결혼할 수도 있다구~

Korean: 글쎄 여친은 자기 30 넘어서 하고 싶대

Korean: 내 말이... 나 그러다 차이면 어떡하누

Korean: 키키 아니야 오빠는 차일 일이 없으~

Korean: 그런가? 혹시 모르지 다른 넘한테 혹할지 ㅜㅜ

Korean: 키키 오빠 여친 그렇게 못 믿어!?
English: Kiki, you can't trust your girlfriend like that!?

Korean: 아니 그래도 좋은 사람 나타날 수 있잖아

Oppa, Merong said you got scaling done this time!?
Yeah, that's right, I did it because it was so dirty~
Kiki Ha, Merong must have been anesthetized then?

Korean: 응 맞아 하도 발광을 해서 ㅠㅠ 어쩔 수 없지

Korean: 그렇지 ㅜㅜ 메롱이 델꾸 또 놀러 가야 하는데!
English: Oh no ㅜㅜ I have to go play at Merong Delku again!

Korean: 응 안 그래도 애견 카페 가볼려고!

Korean: 어디 지역 완전 크게 애견 카페 지었던데!?

Korean: 평택 근교인데 루프탑에 댕댕이 운동장 있음!
English: It's near Pyeongtaek, and there's a dog park on the rooftop!
Oh right, have you been there?

Korean: 아직 인스타로 봤는데 메롱이 데려 가려고
English: I saw it on Instagram, but Merong is taking it

Korean: 키키 헐 나랑 날짜 같이 맞춰서 가자! ;
English: Kiki, oh my gosh, let's go together! ;

Korean: 응 좋아 주말에 혹시 시간 나?
English: Okay, do you have time this weekend?

Korean: 이번 주말은 오빠가 집 보러 가자매!
English: This weekend, let's go look at houses!

Korean: 집을 하루 종일 보는 게 아니라 계약서만 넣고 오는 거라!
English: I'm not looking at the house all day, I'm just signing the contract and coming!

Korean: 키키 그러면 메롱이도 같이 데리고 가자!
English: Kiki: Then let's take Merongi too!

Korean: 메롱이도 이사 갈 집 적응하게 보여줘야지
English: I need to show Merongi how to adapt to the new house he's moving into.

Korean: 오빠는 운동 동호회 같은 데 안 가?
English: Don't you go to a sports club or something?
I joined the table tennis club!
Oh, table tennis? I'm a total prodigy~

Korean: 아 정말? 한번도 치는 거 못 봤어
English: Oh really? I've never seen it hit.

Korean: 키키 나 고딩 때 실기 점수 에이도 받았음!
English: Kiki, I also got an A in practical skills when I was in high school!
Oh, you had your performance evaluated through table tennis?

Korean: 어 맞아 우리 팀이 유일하게 에이 맞았음!
English: Oh yeah, our team was the only one that got this right!

Korean: 오 대박 랠리 잘했나 보다 키키
English: Oh wow, you must have had a great rally, Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 왔다 갔다 20번 이상 해야 에이야!
English: Kiki, you have to go back and forth more than 20 times to get this!
I also want to learn properly this time
Kiki Oh, that's a good idea!
Come join me later!

Korean: 좋지 나 많이 알려 줘야 돼 하하
English: Okay, I have to teach you more haha

Korean: 키키 그럼 그럼~ 탁구는 스텝이 중요해!
English: Kiki Then then~ Steps are important in table tennis!

Korean: 아, 난 몸치라 스텝 꼬일텐데 키키
English: Oh, I'm going to mess up my body step Kiki

Korean: 키키 오우 탁구는 그러면 안 돼!
English: Kiki Ou, table tennis shouldn't be like that!
Then what should I do?
What is your favorite game, oppa?

Korean: 나 요즘 테일즈 런너 다시 하는 중 키키
English: I'm playing Tales Runner again these days Kiki
Wow, Kiki oppa knows about Tales Runner?

Korean: 당연하지 키키 나 파란 부츠까지 키웠어
English: Of course Kiki, I even grew blue boots

Korean: 키키 파란 부츠라니 키키 누구랑 했어!
English: Kiki Blue Boots! Who did Kiki do it with!

Korean: 나 그때 게임 친구들이랑 자주 했어
English: I used to play games with my friends a lot back then

Korean: 키키 오빠 연금 풀 장착 했어?
English: Kiki, did you fully equip your pension?
Ah, the armor made me sick

Korean: 키키 오 갑옷 키키 라떼는 꿀벌이 제일 센 연금이었다고~
English: Kiki O Armor Kiki Latte said that the bee was the strongest alchemist~

Korean: 아니야 가재 갑옷이 진짜 좋았어 키키
English: No, the crayfish armor was really good Kiki
No, that was the 3rd one and the 4th one was a bee~
Oh, that's a different order

Korean: 키키 맞아!  아니면 가재는 속도 1 힘3 꿀벌은 4였나 봐!
English: Kiki is right! Or maybe the crayfish had speed 1 and strength 3 and the bee had 4!

Korean: 오 그럼 나는 가재까지 하고 안 한 듯 ㅜ
English: Oh, then I guess I didn't do it until I got the crayfish ㅜ

Korean: 키키 와 대박 나는 산양까지 만들고 그만 둠
English: Kiki and the jackpot even made a mountain goat and stopped
You're a real gamer, Kiki. I caught you.

Korean: 오빠 그래서 결국에 제주도 갈 거라고?
English: Oppa, so you're saying you're going to Jeju Island in the end?

Korean: 아 아니 그냥 그 돈 모아서 해외 가려고 !
English: Oh no, I'm just going to save up that money and go abroad!
But you can't travel now, right?

Korean: 아냐 트래블 버블로 사이판 괌 갈 수 있대!
English: No, you can go to Saipan and Guam with the travel bubble!

Korean: 오 사이판이랑 괌 되게 먼 곳 아니야?
English: Oh, aren't Saipan and Guam really far away?

Korean: 응 그래도 휴양지라 여친이 좋아할 듯
English: Yeah, but it's a vacation spot so I think my girlfriend will like it

Korean: 여친이랑 얘기해서 같이 가기로 한 거야?
English: Did you talk to your girlfriend and decide to go together?

Do you have a lot of money?
Are you going to buy me a new car? Kiki

Korean: 키키 그러면 오빠가 내 평생 기사해 줄 거임?
English: Kiki: So, you'll be my knight for the rest of my life?

Korean: 나 먹고 살기도 바빠 죽겠는데 그런 소리 하지 마라
English: I'm so busy trying to make a living that I'm dying. Don't say things like that.

Korean: 키키 나도 돈 없는데 왜 나보고 차 사 달래~?
English: Kiki, I don't have any money, so why are you asking me to buy a car?

Korean: 키키 원래 없는 것들끼리 이렇게 대화라도 하는 거지 키키
English: Kiki, these things that don't exist are having a conversation like this Kiki

Korean: 키키 그러면 오빠는 어떤 차 사고 싶음?
English: Kiki: Then what kind of car do you want to buy, oppa?

Korean: 나는 크게 바라지 않아 그냥 아우디 정도?
English: I don't expect much, just an Audi or something?

Korean: 그러면 오빠 아우디는 너무 비싸고 다마스라고 있음!
English: Then brother, Audi is too expensive and there is Damas!
Wasn't that your dream car?
Kiki, it's yours
Oppa, what do you mainly do on site?

Korean: 나 사람들 안전 관리도 하고 설계도 하고 키키
English: I manage people's safety and do design work.
Oh, then oppa, a safety helmet is required?

Korean: 당연하지 사고 나면 큰일 나서 사람들도 주의 많이 줘야 해
English: Of course, if an accident happens, it can be a big problem, so people have to be careful.

Korean: 오빠 현장에 있었을 때 큰 사건 난 적 있어?
English: Oppa, have you ever had a major incident while you were on set?

Korean: 아직까지는 없는데 있으면 안 되지 ㅠㅠ
English: There isn't one yet, but it shouldn't be there ㅠㅠ

Korean: 오우 ㅜㅜ 맞아 내가 아는 아저씨는 허리 다쳐서 입원해 있음!
English: Oh ㅜㅜ That's right. An old man I know is hospitalized with a back injury!

Korean: 헐 그래도 그만한 게 어디냐 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, but where is something like that? ㅠㅠ
That's okay

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 그러면 오빠는 현장에 몇 시간 정도 있음?
English: Right ㅜㅜ Then how many hours will you be at the site?

Korean: 나는 새벽에 나가서 저녁에 와 ㅠㅠ
English: I go out at dawn and come back in the evening ㅠㅠ
There is no time to rest

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 실화야? 언제까지 그렇게 일해야 돼?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Is this true? How long do I have to work like that?

Korean: 나 이게 직업이니까 확 벌어서 많이 벌어두고 쉬려고 키키
English: Since this is my job, I'm going to earn a lot of money and rest.

Korean: 키키 그렇구나 겨울에 추우니까 그 전까지만 열심히 일해 봐!
English: Kiki: I see. It's cold in the winter, so work hard until then!

Korean: 그래야지 겨울에 진짜 동상 걸리게 생김 키키
English: If you do that, you'll really get frostbite in the winter Kiki

Korean: 키키 지금 어디서 일하고 있다고 했지?
English: Kiki, where did you say you were working now?

Korean: 지금 대전에서 현장 맡아서 일하고 있어 키키
English: Kiki, I'm currently working in Daejeon

Korean: 오빠 지금 예비군 훈련 어떻게 받음?
English: Oppa, how is your reserve force training going now?
The reserves are just honey
Just go and play~
But are there cases where the reserve forces stay for 1 night and 2 days?
Yeah, of course there are cases like that.
Kiki, it's a little different every time

Korean: 내 남친이 예비군 때문에 외박하는데 의심 안 해도 되지?
English: My boyfriend is out all night because of his military service, so I don't have to be suspicious, right?
Oh, you don't have to do it
But just in case ^^ Break up
Kiki, the story of breaking up is true?
Isn't that too much?

Korean: 나 없어서 외로운데 다 헤어졌으면 좋겠어~
English: I'm lonely without you, I wish we could all just break up~
Kiki it's okay oppa
I like it alone ^^

Korean: 응 있는 애들은 꼭 그렇더라! 나는 아닌데 ^^
English: Yeah, that's definitely the case for those who have it! But not me ^^

Korean: 키키 그러면 랜선 여친이라도 좀 만들어,
English: Kiki, then get a LAN girlfriend or something.

Korean: 그건 아직 내 자존심이 허락 못 하지!
English: My pride still won't allow me to do that!
Kiki, you're still young~
Just date~
But I got old because I worked so much
Your face looks like you're in your 40s

Korean: 그러게 키키 그러면 40살 여자분 만나면 되겠다~
English: Okay, Kiki, then you should meet a 40-year-old woman~
Do you really want to die Kiki?
I'm so angry~

Korean: 오빠는 거기 회사 뭐 공부하고 들어간 거임?
English: Oppa, what did you study to get into that company?

Korean: 아 나는 외삼촌 네 회사로 들어와서 공부보단 배우면서 했어 키키
English: Ah, I joined my uncle's company and learned more than I studied. Kiki
Wow, it's a parachute. Is it a corruption?

Korean: 비리까지 말할 정도로 큰 회사는 아닌데 키키
English: Kiki, it's not a big company to the point where you can talk about corruption.

Korean: 거기 직원이 총 몇 분 계시는데?
English: How many employees are there in total?

Korean: 직원 총 5명 있고 일용을 많이 썼지 키키
English: There are 5 employees and they use a lot of daily labor.

Korean: 그러면 오빠 거기 회사 직책은 뭐야?
English: Then, oppa, what is your position at that company?

Korean: 나 과장이었는데 하는 건 뭐 인턴이야 키키
English: I was a manager, but what I'm doing is an intern Kiki
Kiki, it's a real parachute~
Is this the police station?
No, this is a fire station~

Korean: 아 까비~ 오빠는 그러면 뭐 공부하고 싶은 거 없구?
English: Ah, Kkabi~ Then is there anything you want to study, oppa?

Korean: 응 그냥 여기 한 우물 팔라고 키키
English: Yeah, just dig a well here Kiki

Korean: 오 오빠가 생각하기에 비전이 있는 회사임?
English: Oh, do you think this company has a vision?

Korean: 일단 요즘 파이족 마냥 팍 벌고 쉴 거야
English: For now, I'm going to work hard like a pie person and rest.
Kiki Pie Tribe? What is that?
First time hearing this!
Ah, it's not the pie tribe, it's the fire tribe, Kiki
Didn't your brother say he had a younger brother?
Who did you say was there then?
Little brother? Who are you confusing me with now?
I have a sister Kiki

Korean: 내가 아는 오빠가 너무 많아서 헷갈리네~
English: I know so many older brothers, it's confusing~
You guys, cut it off
My memory is not that good, Kiki

Korean: 키키 그러네 ㅜㅜ 너무 많아서 기억이 다 섞여 있음 ㅜ
English: Kiki, that's right ㅜㅜ There are so many that my memories are all mixed up ㅜ
Kiki, my sister got married this time.

Korean: 헐 맞아! 논산에서 했어 대전에서 했어?
English: Oh, right! Did you do it in Nonsan or Daejeon?

Korean: 누나는 서울 사람 만나서 서울에서 결혼했어 키키
English: My sister met a person from Seoul and got married in Seoul. Kiki
I see. When did you get married? May?
Sister, you said you were going to get married in May, and you did in May, Kiki

Korean: 와 키키 근데 이번에 코시국이라 정부에서 제재 엄청 하지 않았어?
English: Wow Kiki, but this time, didn't the government impose a lot of sanctions because of the coronavirus?

Korean: 맞아 그래서 그냥 가까운 분들만 불러서 소소하게 보냈어 키키
English: That's right, so I just invited only the people close to me and sent them a small message Kiki

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 결혼식은 진짜 성대하게 해야 하는데!
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ The wedding really needs to be grand!

Korean: 됐어 그냥 둘만 행복하면 되지 뭐 어때
English: Okay, as long as the two of you are happy, what's the big deal?

Korean: 키키 와 마음과 돈적으로 많이 여유가 있는 집안이구나?
English: Kiki, your family is very wealthy, both financially and emotionally.
My house is ruined...
So I just let go of my mind... Kiki

Korean: 오빠는 지금 결혼하고 싶은 여자 있음?
English: Oppa, is there a woman you want to marry right now?

Korean: 결혼할 여자가 아니라 연애 할 여자도 없다
English: There is no woman to marry, and no woman to date.

Korean: 아 아니 결혼하고 싶은 여자 이상형이라고 해야 하나?
English: Oh, no, should I say that the ideal type of woman is the one I want to marry?

Korean: 그냥 이제는 치마 입을 수 있는 사람이면 좋을 거 같아 키키
English: I think it would be nice if Kiki could just be someone who can wear skirts now
Kiki: So you like transgender people too?

Korean: 아 그건 아직 내가 마인드가 닫혀있네 키키
English: Ah, that's because my mind is still closed, Kiki

Korean: 키키 왜 요즘에 트랜스젠더 엄청 예쁘던데,?
English: Kiki, why are transgenders so pretty these days?

Korean: 아 근데 나보다 키 크면 좀 그렇잖아~
English: Oh but if you're taller than me it's a bit weird~
Kiki oppa is 168cm
what do you think about it?
Hmm... still no -_-
You hate it so much?
Kiki Oki I understand~
Then I'll go wearing a skirt~
You can't

Korean: 아는 형들이 너무 많아서 기억력이 별로잖아 키키
English: I have so many older brothers that my memory isn't that good Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 나 이렇게 얘기하고 또 까먹을걸~?
English: Kiki, that's right. I'm going to say this and then forget again~?

Korean: 너 그렇게 홀린 사람 몇 명이야 나쁜 기집애
English: How many people are you so obsessed with, you bad girl?
I don't even remember~
Have you fallen for my charm?

Korean: 와 구명조끼 하나 항상 착용하고 있어야겠네 키키
English: Wow, you should always wear a life jacket, Kiki.

Korean: 오빠네 집에 무슨 강아지 집 같은 거 있던데!?
English: My brother, there's something like a dog house at your house!?

Korean: 강아지? 우리 집 지금 고양이 데리고 올라고 하는데?
English: A puppy? I'm thinking of bringing a cat to my house right now.

Korean: 아 진짜? 고양이 어디서 데리고 옴?
English: Oh really? Where did you get the cat?
My friend gave me a cat for my birthday.

Korean: 홀 대박! 고양이는 묘종이 어떻게 댕!?
English: Wow! How can a cat be so cute!?

Korean: 아 근데 강아지는 보면 알겠는데 고양이는 봐도 모르겠더라고 키키
English: Oh, but I can tell when I see a dog, but I can't tell when I see a cat, Kiki
Hmm, what does it look like?
I'm a cat butler!

Korean: 내가 너한테 사진 보내줄 테니까 니가 한번 봐 볼래?
English: I'll send you a picture, would you like to take a look?
Oh, okay~ If I pretend, it'll pretend!
I sent you a picture Kiki
Have you checked?
Hey, isn't that an American Shorthair?
So cute!

Korean: 그래? 나는 이거 길고양인가 싶어 가지고 키키
English: Really? I think this is a stray cat.

Korean: 키키 아니야 길고양이면 진짜 야생에서 살아온 거처럼 생겼잖아!
English: Kiki, no, if you're a stray cat, you look like you've been living in the wild!
Yeah, it was cute

Korean: 고양이는 애기 때부터 손 타야 사람을 따른대 키키
English: Cats need to be touched from the time they are babies to follow people. Kiki

Korean: 키키 인정 키키 근데 우리 오복이는 왜 이렇게 앙칼짐?
English: Kiki, I admit it, Kiki, but why is our Ohbok so upset?

Korean: 그래서 전에 슈나우저한테 앙칼졌잖아 키키 놀램 키키
English: So you got teased by a schnauzer before, Kiki, surprise Kiki

Korean: 오빠는 현장에서 일하면 체력은 어떻게 길러?
English: How do you build up your stamina when you work in the field?

Korean: 그냥 일하는 게 체력 길러지는 거지 키키 뭐 있냐~
English: Just working builds stamina, so what else is there to do?

Korean: 키키 그렇지? 오빠도 무거운 거 날라!?
English: Kiki, right? Oppa, you carry heavy things too!?

Korean: 가끔 도와드리고 하긴 하지 키키 일찍 끝내야 되면!
English: I do help out sometimes, but Kiki, if you have to finish early!

Korean: 키키 할, 그 무거운 시멘트 나르는 거?
English: Kiki, what are you doing carrying that heavy cement?

Korean: 아니 그건 아니고 철 나르고 그래 키키
English: No, that's not it. It's iron and all. Kiki

Korean: 근데 그거나 그거나 무게 무거운 건 똑같은 거 아님?
English: But isn't it the same thing, being heavy?
Yeah, it's super hot in the summer~

Korean: 와 대박, 화상 입는 거 아니야?
English: Wow, wow, aren't you going to get burned?

Korean: 장갑은 끼고 있어서 화상까지는 안 나더라고 키키
English: Kiki, you weren't burned because you were wearing gloves.

Korean: 역시 현장에서 일하면 진짜 안전이 제일 우선인 듯 ㅜ
English: When working on site, it seems like safety really comes first.

Korean: 그래서 내가 안전화 좋은 거 맨날 사잖아 키키
English: That's why I always buy good safety shoes Kiki

Korean: 아 진짜? 오빠 안전화 어디 브랜드 거 사?
English: Oh really? Oppa, where do you buy your safety shoes from?

Korean: 나 K2 회사에서 맨날 안전화 쇼핑함 키키
English: I always shop for safety shoes at K2 company Kiki
Yeah, the safety shoes there are really good~
It's definitely different from the cheap ones, Kiki
What games do you play at home, oppa?

Korean: 나 아저씨들이랑 고스톱 화투 이런 거 하지 키키
English: I play Go-Stop and Hwa-tu with the old men.
Kiki, are you betting your money on this?

Korean: 아니 요즘 모바일로 만나서 하는데 키키 어른들이랑 일하니까 키키
English: No, these days we meet through mobile phones, but since we work with adults, Kiki
Oh, is that something you do with a new suit?

Korean: 아니 나는 뉴맞고 하고 있어 키키
English: No I'm doing new Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 그것도 엄청 찰지게 쳐주더라!
English: Kiki, that one was really hit hard!

Korean: 맞아 소리부터가 너무 찰져서 진짜 치는 거 같음
English: That's right, the sound is so crisp that it feels like it's really hitting you
Kiki, are you a master now?
The old men are much more skilled than me Kiki

Korean: 키키 거기 아저씨들 거기다 현질 하지?
English: Kiki, aren't those uncles there doing something crazy?

Korean: 하시는 분들도 종종 계시는 거 같더라고 키키
English: I think there are people who do that often Kiki

Korean: 근데 현질을 해야지 많이 이길 수 있음!
English: But you can win a lot if you practice hard!

Korean: 아니야 그냥 돈 잃으면 나무 키우면 됨
English: No, if you lose money, just grow a tree.

Korean: 아 그 옛날 빨간 앵두나무 같은 거? 키키
English: Oh, that old red cherry tree? Kiki

Korean: 맞아 그거 물 주면 잘 자라더라고 키키
English: Yeah, if you water it, it grows well, Kiki
Honey, where have you been recently?

Korean: 나 이번에 혼행이라고 한번 해봤지 키키
English: I tried it once this time, Kiki

Korean: 혼행? 설마 오빠 혼자 여행해 봄?
English: Solo travel? Have you ever traveled alone, oppa?

Korean: 친구들이랑 시간이 안 맞아서 그냥 혼자 여행 갔다 왔어 키키
English: Kiki, I didn't have time to travel with my friends so I just went on a trip alone.

Korean: 와 오빠 친구 없이도 혼행 할 수 있음?
English: Wow, you can travel alone without any friends?

Korean: 그럼 다 바빠서 시간 맞추기도 힘들고 혼자 하는 것도 좋던데?
English: Then, since everyone is busy, it's hard to find time, and it's better to do it alone?

Korean: 헐 맞아 ㅜㅜ 오빠 어디로 갔다 왔어?
English: Oh right ㅜㅜ Where did you go, oppa?

Korean: 나 담양으로 패러글라이딩 하고 왔어 키키
English: I went paragliding in Damyang Kiki

Korean: 와 대박 그거 날씨 좋아야 할 수 있는 거잖아!
English: Wow, that's something that can only be done when the weather is nice!

Korean: 지금 날씨가 진짜 타기 좋 은 거 같아 키키
English: The weather right now seems really good for riding Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 타 보고 싶었는데 안 무서웠음?
English: Kiki, that's right. I wanted to ride it too, but wasn't it scary?

Korean: 그거 처음에 뜰 때 막 달릴 때 빼고는 괜찮던데 키키
English: It was fine except when it first started running, Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 뒤에 아저씨도 같이 타는 거 맞지?
English: Kiki, really? The old man behind you is riding too, right?

Korean: 맞아 그분 없으면 나 절대 못 타지 키키
English: Yeah, without him I would never be able to ride Kiki

Korean: 흙흙 ㅜㅜ 근데 그거 체험비도 비싸드만!?
English: Hurry up ㅜㅜ But isn't the experience fee expensive!?

Korean: 아 그거 촬영까지 하면 10만 원 정도 하더라고 키키
English: Oh, if you film that, it would cost about 100,000 won, Kiki

Korean: 아니 이번 주 날씨 왜 이 모양?
English: Why is the weather like this this week?

Korean: 키키 춥다가 덥다가 비 오다가 그래서 나 이번에 쉬잖아~
English: Kiki It was cold, then hot, then rainy, so I'm taking a break this time~

Korean: 아 진짜? 현장은 비 오면 쉬나?
English: Oh really? Does the site close when it rains?

Korean: 응 우리는 그래서 날씨 항상 확인해 키키
English: Yeah, that's why we always check the weather Kiki

Korean: 근데 출근했는데 비 오는 경우는 어떻게 해?
English: But what if it rains when I go to work?
Then I have to go back home, Kiki.
Wow, this is so heartbreaking
But what if it stops?

Korean: 처음에 비가 오면 아예 출근을 안 해 키키
English: At first, when it rains, Kiki doesn't go to work at all.
Oh, I was shaking today,

Korean: 그러니까 평소에 날씨 확인 좀 하고 살어
English: So, I usually check the weather before I go to bed.

Korean: 아니 분명히 비만 오고 어제랑 기온은 똑같았거든?
English: No, it's definitely raining and the temperature is the same as yesterday, right?

Korean: 근데 해가 없으면 당연히 온도가 떨어지지
English: But if there is no sun, the temperature naturally drops.

Korean: 아 맞아 어제는 해가 쨍쨍했고 오늘은 흐렸음 ㅜ
English: Oh right, it was sunny yesterday and cloudy today ㅜ

Korean: 그러다가 비 후두두둑 떨어지더라 해야 할 일 많은데 후
English: Then it started to rain heavily. I have a lot of work to do.

Korean: 키키 맞아 키키 오빠는 비가 안 와야지 좋지?
English: Kiki, right? Kiki, it shouldn't rain, right?

Korean: 근데 비가 와도 사무실에서 일해야지 키키
English: But even if it rains, I have to work in the office, Kiki

Korean: 오빠 이번에 조재범 5년형 받은 거 봤어?
English: Oppa, did you see that Jo Jae-beom got sentenced to 5 years this time?

Korean: 조재범? 어디서 들어본 거 같은데 누구였지?
English: Jo Jae-beom? I think I've heard of him somewhere, but who was he?
He was Shim Seok-hee's coach!

Korean: 아 맞다 그거 엄청 이슈 됐었는데 넘 적은 거 아니야?
English: Oh right, that was a huge issue, but wasn't it too little?

Korean: 어, 근데 이것도 형량 늘은 거임 키키
English: Oh, but this also increased the sentence, Kiki
Wow, it was originally less?
This country is really rotten
Oh, it was 3 years, but it increased to 5 years!

Korean: 열 받네 진짜 그렇게 같은 남자 망신 좀 안 시켰으면
English: I'm so pissed off, I wish you wouldn't have embarrassed your fellow man like that.

Korean: 키키 하, 근데 지금 심석희도 논란이잖아!
English: Kiki ha, but Shim Seok-hee is also controversial right now!

Korean: 그분은 왜 같이 논란이 된 거야?

Korean: 최민정 선수 뒷담 깐 거 디스패치가 기사 냄!

Korean: 헐 근데 최민정 선수가 진짜 잘하긴 했잖아 키키
English: Wow, but Choi Min-jeong did really well, Kiki

Korean: 어, 근데 그때 둘이 넘어졌던 경기 기억나?
English: Oh, but do you remember that match where the two of you fell?

Korean: 엥 남자 경기 중에 그랬던 거 아니었나?
English: Huh, wasn't that during the men's game?
No, the two of them fell over!

Korean: 아 그래? 한번 내가 기사 찾고 볼게 키키
English: Oh really? I'll look for the article and see Kiki.
Oppa~ Let's go on a trip to Singapore~

Korean: 너 지금 이 오라방 꼬시는 거니~ 키키
English: Are you flirting with this guy right now~ Kiki
Of course~ Oppa said he rests in the winter~

Korean: 어휴 이번에는 또 얼마나 뜯어 먹으려고 키키
English: Oh my, how much are you going to eat this time, Kiki?

Korean: 키키 내가 언제 또 오빠 등골을 빼 먹었다고 그래~
English: Kiki, when did I say I ate your spine again?

Korean: 야 내가 너랑 놀러 가서 쓴 돈으로 집 샀을 거야 키키
English: Hey, I would have bought a house with the money I spent hanging out with you, Kiki.

Korean: 키키 아니 솔직히 나 혼자 놀았니!?

Korean: 키키 아니야~ 그러면 싱가포르 비행기 값은 내가 낼게 나머지는 오빠가 내
English: Kiki No~ Then I'll pay for the flight to Singapore. You pay for the rest.

Korean: 우와 이번엔 그래도 양심적으로 나오기는 하네 키키
English: Wow, this time you're coming out with a conscience, Kiki

Korean: 키키 그래 싱가포르 여행 상품 풀렸대!
English: Kiki, yeah, the Singapore travel package is out!
Take a look at that

Korean: 아 그럼 사람 몰려서 비행기 값 많이 나오겠네 키키 나이스
English: Oh, then the plane ticket will be expensive because there are so many people. Kiki, nice.
Kiki, is that so?
Then, will you pay for the plane ticket?

Korean: 그럼 나머지는 너가 다 부담하는 걸로 탕탕탕!
English: Then you'll have to pay for the rest, bang bang bang!
Hey! Oppa, is the guest house okay?!

Korean: 야 진짜 그 수영장 호텔은 데리고 가줘야지 키키

Korean: 오빠 저번에 무좀 걸린 곳은 괜찮아?

Korean: 무좀? 무우좀? 너 지금 나 놀릴라 그러지 키키
English: Athlete's foot? Athlete's foot? Are you kidding me right now? Kiki

Korean: 아니야~ 오빠 무좀 생겨서 엄청 고생했잖아!

Korean: 아 그거 진짜 맨날 약 바르고 짜증 났다 키키

Korean: 키키 오빠 엄지발가락 노란색 된 거 보고 깜놀함 키키
English: Kiki Oppa, I was surprised to see that your big toe turned yellow. Kiki

Korean: 너 왜 내 발에 관심 있냐 짜증 나게 키키
English: Why are you interested in my feet? It's annoying Kiki

English: Kiki, should I buy you some toe socks?
No, don't do that
If your pride won't allow it

Korean: 키키 오빠 그러면 겨울에도 샌들 신어야 해!
English: Kiki Oppa, then you have to wear sandals even in winter!
It needs to be ventilated!

Korean: 내가 안전화를 많이 신어서 그건 무리다 키키
English: I wear safety shoes a lot, so that's impossible Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 오빠가 무좀 걸리는 이유를 알겠다!

Korean: 응 나도 너무나도 잘 알지만 돈은 벌어야지 키키
English: Yeah I know that too but you have to make money Kiki
ㅜㅜ My heart hurts so much
Are there any well-ventilated safety shoes?

Korean: 그럼 안전성이 많이 떨어질 거 같은데 키키
English: Then I think the safety will be greatly reduced Kiki

Korean: 흠, 오빠가 한번 개발해 보는 건 어때?
English: Hmm, how about you try developing it?

Korean: 그거 개발할 수 있는 사람이면 키키 이미 했지
English: If anyone could develop that, Kiki already did it.
Honey, are there any nutritional supplements you're taking these days?

Korean: 나는 끼니를 많이 걸러서 철분제를 챙겨 먹어 키키

Korean: 아 밥을 거르면 빈혈이 생기니까 필수긴 하겠다 ㅜㅜ

I'm hungry so I'll eat lunch and some snacks.

Korean: 근데 집 가면 그냥 자 키키
English: But when I get home I just sleep Kiki

Korean: 가면서 뭐 대충 먹을 수는 없어?
English: Can't you just grab something to eat on the go?

Korean: 근데 운전하면서 먹기엔 좀... 위험하잖아 키키

Korean: 요즘에 죽도 팩으로 나오던데 그거 쭉 짜 먹어!

I heard that porridge comes in packs these days?

Korean: 어! 호박죽이나 이유식 같이 생긴 거 쭉 짜 먹게 나와!

Korean: 와 요즘 진짜 세상이 많이 좋아졌네 키키

Korean: 키키 어 그거 하나에 2천 원밖에 안 해!

Korean: 그거 양은 많기는 한 거야? 적당하려나...

Korean: 어 나는 한 번 사 먹어 봤는데 괜찮던데?
English: Oh, I tried it once and it was okay?

Korean: 그거 맛도 그럼 보장 너가 하는 거야?
English: Are you guaranteeing that it tastes good?
*** Oh, it was so sweet and delicious! Kangchu!

Korean: 오케이 그럼 나 지금 쇼핑하러 간다 키키

Korean: 그 너가 말했던 거 1+1 하고 있다는 거야?

Korean: 어 맞아 쭉 짜 먹고 휴지통에 버리면 끝이잖아!

Korean: 근데 양이 너무 적어서 10개는 먹어야 되는 거 아니냐?

Korean: 아니 나는 한 개면 괜찮던데 오빠는 그러면 두 개 먹어!

Korean: 그게 그냥 아침에 간단하게 끼니 챙기는 용이지?

Korean: 어 맞아! 호박죽이랑 다른 것도 있긴 해!

Korean: 아 나는 야채죽 전복죽 이런 거 좋아하거든 키키
English: Ah, I like vegetable porridge, abalone porridge, and things like that. Kiki

Korean: 어,? 그런 거는 아직 못 봤는데,?

English: Kimchi octopus porridge Isn't this out yet? Kiki
Wouldn't that cause the octopus to get caught in the tube?

Korean: 그래야겠다 내가 한번 건의해서 나오게 만들어볼게 키키

Korean: 나 걸스데이 좋아 했었지 키키 소진 누나

I don't know right now Kiki
Kiki, you're still pretty

Korean: 키키 근데 소진이라는 사람 진짜 동안이긴 하더라!

Korean: 거기서 나이가 제일 많은데 꿀리지 않어 키키
English: Kiki, you're the oldest there, but you don't get pushed around
That's right, you said you were in your 30s when you were active!

Korean: 다른 어린 아이돌 그룹이랑 있어도 제일 예뻐
English: Even if they're with other young idol groups, they're the prettiest

English: That's right, Kiki Sojin's long hair was the truth!
No, Kiki, you have a pretty little wave

Korean: 아 키키 거기다가 머리색은 약간 레드 계열로!
English: Ah Kiki, and your hair color is a bit red!

Korean: 아니지 갈색 그 계열이 더 이쁘셨지 키키
English: No, the brown color is prettier, Kiki

Korean: 아니야 레드 계열이 진짜 잘 어울렸음!
English: No, the red series really suits you!

Korean: 이게 바로 남눈 여눈 그거 말하는 건가 키키
English: Is this what you mean by male and female eyes? Kiki
Kiki, oppa, be honest
Is Yui chubby?

Korean: 유이는 당연히 통통이었는데 요즘은 아닌 거 같더라 키키
English: Yui used to be chubby, but she doesn't seem to be like that these days Kiki
Oppa, are you too busy to watch a movie?

Korean: 아니야 나 집에 누워서 넷플릭스 봐
English: No, I'm just lying at home watching Netflix

Korean: 이번에 마릴린 먼로를 모티브로 한 영화가 나온대!
English: I heard there's a movie coming out this time featuring Marilyn Monroe!
Then what should I do?

Korean: 나는 티비로 나와야 볼 수 있어 키키
English: I can only see you on TV Kiki
No, it's a Netflix exclusive release!

Korean: 오 그럼 내가 또 바로 봐줄 수 있겠네 키키
English: Oh then I can look at it again right away Kiki

Korean: 근데 그거 원래 몇 년 전부터 나왔어야 했던 거래!
English: But that deal should have come out years ago!
But why was the deadline delayed?
The water level was so high that they fought with Netflix!

Korean: 와우 그럼 내가 또 나오면 챙겨봐야겠네 키키
English: Wow then I'll have to check it out when I come out again Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 결국에 넷플이 두 손 다 들어서 내년에 개봉한대!
English: Kiki, that's right. Netflix is finally giving in and releasing it next year!

Korean: 아 그럼 제작사가 이긴 거네? 기대된다 키키
English: Oh, so the production company won? I'm looking forward to it Kiki

Korean: 키키 어 맞아~ 나도 본방사수 해야지~
English: Kiki, that's right~ I have to watch the original broadcast too~

Korean: 나왔다는 소식 들리면 바로 이 엉아한테 말해줘라 키키
English: When you hear news that it's out, tell this little girl right away Kiki

Korean: 그냥 오빠가 넷플 보다가 메인 화면에 나오는 거 누르면 될 거 같은데?
English: I think you can just press the button that appears on the main screen while watching Netflix?

Korean: 나는 제목을 모르잖아 그냥 지나친다고 키키
English: I don't know the title, I just passed by Kiki
Sister, have you tried Rosé Tteokbokki?
Yeah, I tried it
That's delicious

Korean: 언니 그러면 엽떡 로제 먹어 봤으?
English: Sister, have you tried the Yeopddeok Rose?
Yeah, I tried it
It's delicious for the price

Korean: 아 진짜? 가격 거의 2만 원 하지 않아?
English: Oh really? Isn't it almost 20 thousand won?

Korean: 그 정도 하는 걸로 알고 있어 짱이야
English: I know you can do that much, you're awesome

Korean: 키키 근데 2만 원이면 비싼 편 아니야?
English: Kiki, but isn't 20,000 won a bit expensive?

Korean: 떡볶이 치고는 비싼 편이지 근데 맛있잖아 하하
English: It's a bit pricey for tteokbokki, but it's delicious haha
I admit that Kiki
How many people ate?
I ate with four people at the hospital
I see. Is that enough for four Kikis?
I ate it with the female teachers and it was perfect.

Korean: 아 진짜? 거기 안에 뭐 뭐 들어가 있어?
English: Oh really? What's in there?

Korean: 떡이랑 라면 쫄면 사리 추가해서 먹었징
English: I ate it with rice cakes and ramen noodles
But isn't yeop-tteok spicy?

Korean: 순한 맛도 있어서 그걸로 시켜 먹었어
English: It also had a mild flavor, so I ordered that.

Korean: 언니 우리 집 냄새의 원인은 뭘까,?
English: Sister, what is the cause of the smell in our house?
Damp smell and mold on your clothes?

Korean: 헉, 나 세탁기 청소를 한 번도 안 했으!
English: Gosh, I've never cleaned my washing machine before!

Korean: 그거 세탁기 섬유제 넣고 그냥 돌려
English: Just put the washing machine fabric softener in it and run it.
Can I just put in some fabric and turn it on?

Korean: 웅 섬유제만 넣고 돌리면 향기 나
English: Yeah, if you just put in some fiber and turn it on, it will smell good.

Korean: 아 진짜? 세탁 방법은 어떻게 해야 해?
English: Oh really? How do I wash it?

Korean: 먼저 얼룩이 진 게 있으면 퐁퐁으로 지워
English: First, if there is a stain, wipe it off with a sponge.

Korean: 퐁퐁? 그냥 설거지 않을 때 쓰는 거?
English: Pong Pong? Just something you use when you're not washing dishes?

Korean: 웅 맞아 그다음에 세탁기에 넣고 돌리면 돼
English: Yeah, that's right. Then just put it in the washing machine and turn it on.

Korean: 그렇구나 세탁기 자체 청소는 어떻게 해?
English: Okay, so how do you clean the washing machine itself?

Korean: 그것도 세탁기 전용 청소하는 게 있던데
English: There's even a cleaner specifically for washing machines.
Do they sell that at Daiso?

Korean: 웅 친구가 다이소 가면 판다고 했어
English: Yeah, my friend said they sell it at Daiso.
Oh, I guess I should go there tomorrow!

Korean: 웅 한번 가서 다이소 쇼핑하고 와
English: Yeah, let's go and do some shopping at Daiso.
Sister, how is your work?
I'm driving around
Oh, I see. Do you have a car, sister?
Yeah, then I have my own car
I picked one
Oh, you just picked a new one?
I picked one last year haha

Korean: 오~ 새 차로 뽑았어 중고로 뽑았어?
English: Oh~ Did you get a new car or a used one?
I picked one for a new car haha

Korean: 오 대박 그 전에는 뚜벅이로 다녔던 거야?
English: Oh my goodness, you used to walk like a snail before?
Before that I was a walker
I took a bus or taxi
So how did you practice driving?
My father taught me how to drive.

Korean: 어엇, 운전은 가족한테 배우는 거 아니라고 했는데 허허

So I got scolded a lot by my dad

Korean: 키키 근데 나도 아빠한테 많이 혼남!

What does your sister do at work?

English: I go to the hospital and get treatment for injections
So, your sister's job is a nurse?

What is the difference between a nurse and a nursing assistant?

Korean: 간호사는 대학을 나와야 하고 조무사는 그냥 시험만 보는 거야
English: Nurses have to graduate from college, and assistants just have to take a test.
I see. Are you working in Nonsan now?
Yeah, I'm working in Nonsan haha
Are you working in a general hospital?
I work in an ENT clinic in a private hospital.

Korean: 그렇구나 그러면 감기 걸리면 언니네로 가야겠다~
English: I see. Then if I catch a cold, I should go to my sister's house.

Korean: 웅 당연하지 우리 병원으로 와 하하
English: Yeah of course come to our hospital haha

Korean: 키키 언니네도 코로나 백신 주사 놓고 있어?
English: Kiki, has your family also gotten their COVID-19 vaccine?
I'm getting the corona vaccine ㅠㅠ
Yeah, I'm so busy, it's hard ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헉 그러면 그거 맞으러 사람 엄청 많이 가겠다!
English: Oh my, then a lot of people will go to get that!
Sister, do you have a younger brother?
How old are you?
Yeah, I have a younger brother. He's 20 years old.
Oh, then where are you now?
Yeah, my brother is at the Yeonmu Training Center.

Korean: 아앗 키키 언제 거기 들어갔어? 키키
English: Oh, Kiki, when did you get in there? Kiki
I entered the month of March ㅠㅠ I feel bad

Korean: 어 근데 거기는 훈련소라 4주 뒤에 다른 곳으로 가지 않아?
English: Oh, but that's a training camp, so don't you have to go somewhere else after 4 weeks?

Korean: 훈련소라 4주 뒤에 다른 곳으로 갈 거야 아마
English: It's a training camp, so I'll probably go somewhere else in 4 weeks.

Korean: 3월 달에 들어갔으면 이미 다른 곳으로 가지 않았을까?
English: If it had been March, wouldn't it have already gone somewhere else?

Korean: 아아 키키 거기 지금 엄청 춥겠지?
English: Oh Kiki, it must be really cold there right now.

Korean: 앗, 강원도라니, 제일 먼 곳으로 가 버렸네,
English: Oh, Gangwon-do, I went to the farthest place.
Yeah, I feel bad for the guy ㅠㅠ He's in the military
So you don't know where in Gangwon-do he went?
My younger brother went to Cheorwon, Gangwon-do

Korean: 언니는 중학교 때 다니던 학원 있어?
English: Sister, did you go to an academy in middle school?

Korean: 좋은 학원? 어 들어본 거 같아!
English: Good academy? I think I've heard of it!

Korean: 웅 말 그대로 좋은 학원 내동에 있었어
English: Yeah, it was literally in a good school building

Korean: 키키 거기 일반 국영수 가르치던 곳인가?
English: Kiki, is that the place where they teach regular Korean, English, and math?
Yeah, that's right, that's where I taught Korean, English, and math.
Is this the place you've been going to since middle school?
Yeah, I've been hanging out with friends since I was in middle school.
I see. How long have you been going there?
I went until middle school 2nd year and then quit.
By the way, why did you quit then?
Because I like playing with my friends ㅠㅠ
Kiki, I admit that
When you play, you have to play!

Korean: 근데 후회돼 공부 안 해서 ㅠㅠ
English: But I regret not studying ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 그렇지 근데 또 그때 가면 안 혀~ 괜찮아~
English: Kiki, that's right, but if you go back then, it won't be okay~ It's okay~
