How many people are there in your sister's family?
There are four people in my family. How about you?
Oh, there are four of us! Mom, dad, me and my sister!
Me too, sister, mom and dad

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 언니랑 몇 살 차이나?
English: Kiki, really? How old are you and your sister?
Yeah 10 years difference haha
It doesn't come out much

Korean: 헐 키키 언니네 언니가 언니 키웠겠는 걸?
English: Wow, Kiki, your older sister must have raised you?
You almost raised me
Haha of course
Kiki and daebak
What are you doing now, sister?
Ah~ My sister got married now
By the way, does that mean you have a nephew too?
My sister is pregnant
My daughter haha

Korean: 홀 대박! 요즘에 딸이 제일 좋잖아!
English: Oh my goodness! My daughter is the best these days!
Oh my gosh, my daughter is the best haha

Korean: 그러면 그 조카가 언니 첫 번째 되는 조카야?
English: So that nephew is your sister's first nephew?
Yeah, my first nephew, I'm looking forward to it
Sister, are you thinking about getting married now?
I want to get married quickly quickly

Korean: 아 진짜? 지금 남자친구랑 하고 싶으?

Korean: 웅 나는 바로 하고 싶어 하하
English: Yeah I want to do that right now haha

Korean: 키키 오 남친이랑 결혼 얘기는 하고 있어?
English: Kiki Oh, are you talking about marriage with your boyfriend?

Korean: 남자친구가 근데 별로 맘에 안 들어 하는 거 같아

Huh? Why? Is it too early now?

Oh, I see. How old are you?

24 years old haha

Korean: 아 그러면 아직은 결혼 생각은 이르긴 하겠다!
English: Oh, then it's still too early to think about marriage!

When Kiki's older sister was 30, when her boyfriend was 30?
My boyfriend said he should get married when he is 30

Oh, I see. It's hard. It's hard to wait.

Korean: 언니네 귀여운 비숑 한 마리 키운다고 했지?
English: You said your sister was raising a cute Bichon, right?

So pretty I could die
How do you groom your baby?

English: Go to a pet shop to get your baby groomed ㅠㅠ

Yeah, I've been going there for 5 years.

Korean: 와 진짜? 거기가 진짜 마음에 드나 봐!?
English: Wow, really? You really like it there!?
Wow, you did a great job

Korean: 키키 아 매장 이름이 우아하개야? 졸귀탱
English: Kiki, the store name is elegant? It's so cute

So autumn is also elegant

Korean: 예전에 논산에 이쁘개라는 매장도 있었던 거 같은데?

Korean: 그렇지? 우아하게는 어디 쪽에 있는 매장이야?

Korean: 웅 동성 초등학교 쪽에 있는 걸로 알아

Oh, I think I know that!
How much does it cost?
Yeah, the price is 150,000 won for beauty.

Korean: 언니는 요새 하고 있는 운동 있어?
English: Sister, are you doing any exercise these days?
I go wakeboarding

Korean: 키키 헐 웨이크 보드가 어떻게 타는 거지?

Korean: 줄 잡고 보드처럼 타는 거 있어

Hold the rope and like a board?

Korean: 웅웅 물 위에서 타는 거야 너무 재밌어

Topjeongho is not allowed

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 나는 부여에만 있는 줄!

Oh wow this is so much fun
Go and see haha

Korean: 키키 오키 나중에 한 번 가 봐야겠다!

I'm growing up these days
Wow~? Are you doing it by yourself, unnie?
I know, I know, I do it with my friends

Korean: 키키 아 피시방 같이 가서 하는구나?

Korean: 웅웅 같이 가서 하면 더 재밌어

I like the badge character haha it's so cute

English: What's the name of that triangle kimbap head kid?

Korean: 걔였나? 그 물 풍선 두 개 뿌릴 수 있는 애!
English: Was that him? The one who can throw two water balloons!

There's a kid who contributes

English: Kiki, right? Isn't he better?

Korean: 유명해 내가 제주도 갈 때마다 먹는 곳

Oh, I don't know about that, but I heard it's famous

What does it taste like?

Korean: 진짜 맛있어 친구랑 가서 먹어 봐

Bracken Flavored Kiki

English: Kiki Aah, I like bracken fern, so I have to eat that!
Yeah, definitely go and try it
I want to eat it too

Black pork is the best, unconditionally meat

Korean: 언니 이번 여름에 어디로 놀러 감?

Korean: 2시간 정도 친구들이랑 신나게 노래 틀고 갔어 하하

Korean: 와오 키키 근데 이번 여름에 진짜 덥긴 더웠지?

Korean: 너무 더웠어 근데 놀러 가서 재밌었어

Did you have fun?

Korean: 서핑이랑 술 먹고 놀고 게임하고 하하

You can surf in Yangyang
Give me education too

Korean: 키키 교육 한 번만 들으면 그거 즐길 수 있어?
English: Can you enjoy it just by listening to Kiki's education once?
Yeah, just do it once
The handsome teacher tells me

Yeah, definitely go with your friends
Wow, do you know player Shim Seok-hee?
Yeah, I know, I know, but why?

Korean: 그 섬석희 선수 성폭행한 감독 알아?
English: Do you know the coach who sexually assaulted player Seom Seok-hee?
Oh my gosh, totally awesome. Who is this?

Korean: 조재범이라고 심석희 선수 괴롭힌 사람 있어!
English: There's a person named Jo Jae-beom who harassed Shim Seok-hee!

Korean: 와 무섭다 진짜 왜 그러는 거래;
English: Wow, that's scary, really. Why are you doing that?

Korean: 몰라, 이 사람 말로는 체벌이라고 하는데, 이거는 아니지,
English: I don't know, this guy says it's corporal punishment, but this isn't it.
Ah... still, he's a strange person;

Korean: 그러니까 얘 때문에 우리 조 씨 집안 욕먹잖아!
English: That's why our Jo family is getting cursed at because of him!

Korean: 에이 진짜 세상이 말세다 말세야 하하
English: Hey, this is seriously the end of the world, it's the end of the world haha

Korean: 키키 맞아 이 사람 결국에 5년 징역 받음!
English: Kiki, that's right, this guy ended up getting 5 years in prison!

Korean: 나도 체벌 안 하고 조심해야겠다 무섭다 하하
English: I also need to be careful and not use corporal punishment. It's scary haha.

Korean: 키키 그치 언니가 사람 혼내킬 일이 뭐가 있어!

Korean: 웅 난 맘이 착해서 그렇게는 못하지

Korean: 키키 그치 나도 그렇게 못 해~
English: Kiki, right? I can't do that either~

Korean: 웅 너도 그렇게 안 할 거 같아

Sister, have you ever traveled abroad?
Yeah, I went to Japan with my boyfriend.
Anywhere else besides Japan?

Korean: 움 나는 일본뿐이 안 가봤어 ㅠㅠ
English: Um, I haven't been to Japan yet ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그러면 언니 싱가포르는 안 가본 거지?
English: Then, you've never been to Singapore, right?
Yeah, I haven't been there
I really want to go
Sister, this is your chance
Singapore travel restrictions have been lifted!
Have you been there?
I'm jealous, that would be fun
Kiki No, I couldn't go.
So I'm going this time!

Korean: 코로나 때문에 못 갔는데 나도 가봐야겠다
English: I couldn't go because of Corona, but I should go too

Korean: 키키 아 근데 지금은 코로나 때문이 아니라도 못 갈 거 같아!

Korean: 와 정말 왜 못 갈 거 같아? 하하
English: Wow, really, why do you think you can't go? Haha

Korean: 키키 어 지금 여기만 풀려서 전 세계 사람들이 싱가포르로 여행 간다고 완전 난리 났어!
English: Kiki, right now it's been released here and people from all over the world are going on vacation to Singapore, it's total chaos!

Korean: 아 진짜 아쉽다 ㅠㅠ 가보고 싶은데...
English: Oh, it's really too bad ㅠㅠ I want to go...

Korean: 나도 키키 지금 우리 여행사 홈피도 마비됐대!
English: Me too Kiki, our travel agency's homepage is paralyzed right now!
Oh really, then let's go next time
Sister, have you ever bleached your hair?
I've bleached my hair a lot haha

Korean: 언니가 제일 특이하게 했던 색이 뭐야?
English: What is the most unique color your sister has ever used?

Korean: 나는 회색 머리 해본 적 있어
English: I've had gray hair

Korean: 회색은 탈색 최소 3번 이상 해야 하는 거 아니야?
English: Doesn't gray require at least bleaching three times?
I bleached my hair 4 times
Wow, is your hair okay, unnie?
My scalp was so itchy I almost died

Korean: 키키 그치 ㅜㅜ 어 근데 색은 잘 나왔어?
English: Kiki, right? ㅜㅜ Oh, but did the color come out well?

Korean: 아... 지금 생각해도 아프지만 잘 나왔어
English: Ah... It hurts even thinking about it now, but it turned out well
That's fortunate, that must be a considerable amount of money!?

Korean: 웅 다시 또 하라면 못하겠어 ㅠ
English: Yeah, if you ask me to do it again, I can't do it ㅠ

Korean: 키키 와오 맞아 나도 그럴 거 같아
English: Kiki Wow right I think so too
How much did it cost?
170,000 won? That's about it ㅠㅠ

Korean: 어 그거 밖에 안 나왔어? 싸네?
English: Oh, that's all you got? Is it cheap?
It was my friend's beauty salon haha DC
Sister, how is your health these days?

Korean: 나는 어지러움이 심해서 약 먹고 있어 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm taking medicine because I feel so dizzy ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 언니 저번부터 머리 아프다더니!
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Sister, you said you had a headache since last time!

Korean: 이석증이라 약 먹는 중이야 어지러워 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm taking medicine for kidney stones. I feel dizzy.
Stone disease? What kind of disease is that?
Because of the stone in my ear? I went to the ENT clinic.

Korean: 헐, 그러면 귀에 돌 빼야 하는 거 아니야?
English: Wow, then I have to have the stone pulled out of my ear?
I'm having a dizzy spell because my cochlea is damaged
How did a stone get in your ear?

Korean: 스트레스 받거나 하면 올 수가 있대
English: They say it can happen when you're stressed or something
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ I'm so sad
Why are you so stressed!?

Korean: 그래서 운전도 하지 말고 쉬래 ㅠㅠ
English: So don't drive and just rest ㅠㅠ
It's because of work
Oh, I see. Sister, go on vacation.
I'm so stressed out because of work
I don't have a vacation

Korean: ㅜㅜ 헐 그러니까 언니 몸이 안 좋아지지!
English: ㅜㅜ Oh my god, that's why your health isn't getting better!

Korean: 휴가 다 써서 하하 몸이 축난다
English: I used up all my vacation time haha I feel so tired
Sister, have you ever traded second-hand items?

Korean: 웅 해본 적 있어 하하 당근
English: Yeah I've tried it haha carrot

Korean: 당근당근? 지금 우리 언니도 당근 때문에 난리 났어!
English: Carrots, carrots? My sister is going crazy over carrots right now!

Korean: 웅 나는 당근에다가 신발 올렸어 키키
English: Yeah I put my shoes on the carrot Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 어떤 신발 올렸어?
English: Kiki, really? What kind of shoes did you put up?

Korean: 그러면 그거 피부염 같은 거 아니야?
English: Then isn't that something like dermatitis?

Korean: 근데 아무 상처 아니래 두 곳 다 ㅠㅠ
English: But there are no wounds in either place ㅠㅠ
So is that a good deal?

Korean: 따로 약 같은 거 안 먹어도 된대?
English: I don't need to take any medication or anything?

Korean: 응 그냥 연고 처방만 해주긴 했는데 나도 잘 모르겠다 키키
English: Yeah, they just prescribed ointment, but I don't know either Kiki
Kiki, how much did the hospital bill cost?

Korean: 이만 원? 뭔가 괜찮다고 하는데 안심은 되더라
English: This much? I feel relieved because they said it was okay.

Korean: 오 생각보다 많이 안 나와서 다행이다 ㅜ
English: Oh, I'm glad it didn't come out as much as I thought.

Korean: 응 맞아 근데 계속 귀를 긁긴 했어
English: Yeah, that's right, but I kept scratching my ear.
Change the feed

Korean: 어 그렇네 최근에 사료를 바꿔서 그런 거였나?
English: Oh, I see. Was it because you changed the feed recently?

Korean: 그런가 ㅜㅜ 요즘엔 잘 안 긁더라고
English: Is that so ㅜㅜ I haven't been scratching much lately

Korean: 다행이다 ㅜㅜ 아프면 안 돼 냥냥이덜~
English: Thank goodness ㅜㅜ Don't get sick, kitties~

Korean: 맞아 아프면 내 맘이 아프다구 ㅠ
English: That's right, when you're sick, my heart hurts ㅠ
Sister, who are you going to exercise with today?
I'm going to run alone hehehe

Korean: 아 진짜? 갑자기 런닝이 땡겨? 키키
English: Oh really? You suddenly want to run? Kiki

Korean: 응 바깥 바람 좀 쐬고 땀 좀 흘리고 싶어
English: Yeah, I want to get some fresh air and sweat a little.
So, are you going to run about 3 kilometers this time too?

Korean: 웅 바람막이 땀복 입고 하면 엄청 장난 아니야
English: Yeah, if you wear a windbreaker and sweatshirt, it's no joke.
Wow where is the windbreaker brand?

Korean: 아 그거 운동복으로 유명한 곳인데 ㅠㅠ 나이키 이런 곳은 아니야
English: Oh, that place is famous for its sportswear ㅠㅠ It's not like Nike
Oh, isn't that Sechkies by any chance?
Leggings are it!
But the windbreaker is a sweatshirt Kiki

Korean: 키키 그렇구나 언니는 운동할 때 뭐 챙겨 가지고 안 가?
English: Kiki: I see. Don't you bring anything with you when you exercise?

Korean: 응 나는 따로 뭐 안 챙기고 가볍게 나가
English: Yeah, I don't pack anything extra and just go out lightly
Do I not even need to bring water?

Korean: 애플워치 간지나게 하나 끼어주고! 물은 집 와서 벌컥
English: I'll give you an Apple Watch, it's so cool! I'll just go home and drink it

Korean: 와오 키키 애플워치~ 심박수 좀 체크해 줘요~
English: Wow Kiki Apple Watch~ Check my heart rate~
When you get angry, keep breathing Kiki Knock Knock

Korean: 언니 어렸을 때 했던 뽑기 게임 알아?
English: Sister, do you know that claw game we played when we were little?

Korean: 응 그거 백 원인가 얼마 주고 했던 거 종이
English: Yeah, that's a hundred won, how much did you pay for it?

Korean: 키키 맞아 언니 그거 1등 뽑혀본 적 있어?
English: Kiki, right, sis? Have you ever won first place?

Korean: 아니 한 번도 없이 맨날 2등만 됨
English: No, never once, always second place

Korean: 키키 헉 언니 때는 2등 뭐 줬어?
English: Kiki Hehe, what did you give for second place when you were a student?
What were you eating? Junk food
But I don't even remember
I'm in second place and they only give me junk food!?

Korean: 나는 1등 당첨 한 번 돼 봤쥐~
English: I won first prize once~
Wow what did you get
I'm so lucky
Latte was the number one hamster!
That's why I raised it hahaha

Korean: 헐 햄스터 키키 나도 햄스터 키워봤어 ㅠ 징그러움
English: Wow, hamster Kiki, I raised a hamster too ㅠ It's disgusting

Korean: 근데 제일 좋은 1등 상품은 역시 문화상품권이지!
English: But the best prize is definitely the cultural gift certificate!

Korean: 근데 진짜 그런 것도 잘 걸리는 애들이 있어 키키
English: But there are some kids who are really good at that kind of thing Kiki

Korean: 맞아 키키 근데 걔네는 기본적으로 천 원씩 쓰는 애들이여!
English: Yeah Kiki but they're basically the ones who spend a thousand won each!

Korean: 근데 천 원도 귀했잖아 그때는 알지 ㅜㅜ
English: But even a thousand won was precious back then, you know that ㅜㅜ
That's right Kiki, back then ice cream was 100 won!

Korean: 맞아 그 긴 거 알지 그것도 100원 키키 과일맛
English: Yeah, you know that long one, that one's 100 won Kiki fruit flavored

Korean: 언니는 가족 여행 가본 적 있어?
English: Sister, have you ever been on a family trip?

Korean: 응 나는 매년 한 번씩 갔어!
English: Yeah, I go once a year!
Oh really? You come here a lot?

Korean: 근데 요즘엔 코로나 땜에 2년 정도는 못 갔어…
English: But these days, I haven’t been able to go for about two years because of Corona…

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 작년에는 아예 못 갔겠다 ㅜ
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ I couldn't go at all last year ㅜ

Korean: 내가 성인 되고 주최 하에 돈 내고 갔는데 말이야 ㅜㅜ
English: I'm an adult and I paid to go and see the event ㅜㅜ

Korean: 할 ㅜㅜ 성인 되면 회비 얼마씩 걷음?
English: How much do you collect as membership fees when you become an adult?
So my mom is really depressed
Kiki, I paid for it all

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 언니네 식구 많지 않아?
English: Kiki, really? Your sister doesn't have many family members, right?

Korean: 응 거의 100만 원 이하로 내가 숙소 잡고 경비 냈어 키키
English: Yeah, I got a place to stay and paid the security for less than 1 million won. Kiki
Dad just makes rice

Korean: 와 그래도 100만 원이면 엄청 큰 돈이잖아!
English: Wow, but 1 million won is a lot of money!

Korean: 그래도 가족한테 투자하는 건 안 아까워 하하
English: But I don't mind investing in my family haha
Wow, it's really cool ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나 혹시 거기 둘째로 입양 가능!?
English: Can I adopt a second child there?
No, that won't work
If you're tall, you can do it Kiki
That would be completely impossible
It's a pity, ugh ㅜㅜ

Korean: 다음 생에 한번 도전하는 걸로 키키
English: Kiki, I'll try again in my next life

Korean: 오늘도 나는 겨드랑이에 워터파크가 개장 되었지,
English: Today, the water park opened in my armpit.
Why is Kiki so hot?
It was a bit hot this afternoon

Korean: 어 맞아 근데 점심 때 나갔다 왔는데 좀 춥네?
English: Oh right, but I went out for lunch and it's a bit cold.

Korean: 그래? 바람 불어서 그런가 왜 그런대 키키
English: Really? Is it because the wind is blowing? Why is that, Kiki?

Korean: 아니 여기 아침에는 해가 있었는데 점심 되니까 해가 사라짐!
English: No, the sun was out here in the morning, but it disappeared around lunchtime!
It's so sunny here right now

Korean: 헐 대박 키키 대전의 가을 햇살은 어떠신가,?
English: Wow, what do you think of the autumn sunshine in Kiki's War?

Korean: 완전 해 쨍쨍 구름 엄청 너무 많아 키키
English: It's so sunny and clear. There are so many clouds. Kiki
There are only clouds here Kiki

Korean: 나 긴팔인데 딱 입기 좋은 날씨여~
English: I'm wearing long sleeves, and the weather is perfect for wearing them~

Korean: 나도 오늘 후드티 입고 왔는데 좀 덥더라
English: I also wore a hoodie today, but it was a bit hot.
Sister, is Gyeotte Park open by any chance?

Korean: 아니야 나는 안에서 일하니까 가디건 입고 있어 키키
English: No, I work inside so I'm wearing a cardigan Kiki

Korean: 아 언니는 회사 유니폼 입고 있지!?
English: Oh, unnie, are you wearing your company uniform!?

Korean: 응 맞아 너는 개인 옷이야 설마?
English: Yeah, that's right. You're personal clothes, right?
Right! We're just regular office workers!

Korean: 아 그럼 옷 걱정도 엄청 많겠다 ㅜ
English: Oh, then you must be really worried about clothes ㅜ

Korean: 언니는 아침에 일어나면 몸이 붓는 편이야?
English: Sister, do you tend to feel swollen when you wake up in the morning?

Korean: 웅 엄청 눈이랑 얼굴 다리 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, the eyes, face, and legs are amazing ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 나도 언니 자기 전에 엘자다리 해?
English: Kiki, should I also do Elsa's legs before going to bed?

Korean: 응 맞아 그거 하다가 요즘엔 안 해 키키
English: Yeah, that's right, I used to do that, but I don't do it anymore Kiki

Korean: 키키 나는 안 하다가 요즘에 해 주고 있으 ㅜ
English: Kiki I didn't do it before, but I've been doing it recently.
Why do my legs hurt even when I sit down?

Korean: 아니 아침에 일어나니까 다리가 퉁퉁 불어있는 거야 ㅜ
English: No, when I woke up this morning my legs were swollen ㅜ

Korean: 엘자다리 하면 저릴 때까지 엄청 해야 돼
English: When you do Elsa's legs, you have to do it a lot until you go numb

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 왜 몸이 붓는지 알아?
English: Kiki, that's right, but do you know why your body is swollen?
Why is it swelling?
Is it a hormonal problem?

Korean: 음 호르몬 문제도 있을 거 같은데 일단 몸에서 수분이 빠져나와서 그런 거래!
English: Well, it might be a hormonal issue, but it's probably because your body is losing water!

Korean: 아 그럼 물을 자주 먹어야 되나?
English: Oh, so should I drink water often?

Korean: 어 이뇨 활동을 많이 해줘야 하고 원래는 다리가 자주 붓는데 눈은 왜 붓는 줄 알아?
English: Oh, I need to do a lot of urination activities, and my legs usually swell up a lot, but do you know why my eyes swell up too?
Why are your eyes like this again ㅠㅠ
I drink water a lot...

Korean: 눈은 우리가 자면 누워있으니까 수분이 눈으로 가게 돼서 그런 거래 키키
English: When we sleep, our eyes are lying down, so moisture goes to the eyes, so that's why it's like that.
Oh really? Is that so?
It's creepy, the cause is Kiki
Sister, do you happen to know someone named Li Keqiang?
Don't you know that Li Keqiang is a person?
So, you know that the number one person in China is Xi Jinping, right?
The number two guy is this guy
Xi Jinping doesn't even know
Tell me who it is...
Nobody knows

Korean: 그러면 지금 중국 전력난 때문에 골치인 거는 기사에서 봤어?
English: So, did you see in the article that China is currently suffering from a power shortage?

Korean: 아니 나는 중국에 관심이 일도 없엉 에휴 미안,.
English: No, I'm not interested in China at all, sorry.

Korean: 키키 아니야 나도 기사 보고 알았는데 지금 전력난 때문에 골치라고 하더라 ㅜ
English: Kiki No, I also found out from the article that they are having a hard time because of the power shortage.
Why is there a power shortage again?
Why does China have so many problems?

Korean: 키키 그래서 저 리커창이라는 사람이 몽골이랑 계약하고 다른 나라랑 계약하고 아주 동분서주하고 있나 봐!
English: Kiki: That's why this guy named Li Keqiang is making contracts with Mongolia and other countries and running around like crazy!
Were you on good terms with Mongolia?
I just found out
Yeah, I guess it's not that bad with Mongolia
The problem right now is between China and Australia!

Korean: 아 진짜? 호주랑 중국 키키 대박이네 그건 또
English: Oh really? Australian and Chinese Kiki are awesome. That's another one.

Korean: 어 원래 중국이 석탄을 호주에서 거의 수입을 해 오는데 외교 문제가 터져서 못 가져와서 전력난이 생긴 거래!
English: Originally, China had been importing most of its coal from Australia, but diplomatic issues arose and it was unable to do so, resulting in a power shortage!
Oh really? There are so many things going on.
I knew it first, Kiki

Korean: 그치? 키키 호주에서만 39억 톤을 수입해 오는데 그 공급이 완전 사라져버렸으니, 전력난이 생길 수밖에!
English: Right? Kiki, we import 3.9 billion tons from Australia alone, and now that supply has completely disappeared, there's bound to be a power shortage!
Wow, you've done so much
Kiki, you're my match

Korean: 언니는 일 년에 한 번씩 스케일링 꼭 해?
English: Sister, do you get your teeth scaled once a year?

Korean: 아니 나는 그냥 치석 쌓일 때마다 해 키키
English: No, I just do it every time tartar builds up

Korean: 진짜? 언니는 그쪽 계열이라 그냥 하면 되는구나!?
English: Really? Since you're from that lineage, you can just do it!?

Korean: 응 난 그냥 먼가 찝찝하면 해 키키
English: Yeah I just do it when I feel uneasy

Korean: 아 진짜? 키키 근데 그거 혼자서 어떻게 해?
English: Oh really? Kiki, but how can you do that by yourself?

Korean: 나는 수기구로 거울 보면서 해 하하
English: I do it while looking in the mirror with my hands haha

Korean: 근데 치석 쌓이는 게 진짜 눈에 보여?
English: But is tartar buildup really visible?
Yeah I can't see it
And something got stuck on my tongue

Korean: 아 나도 지금 혀로 만져보니까 꺼끌꺼끌한 느낌
English: Ah, I just touched it with my tongue and it feels rough
Could this be tartar!?

Korean: 응 맞아 그런 느낌 들면 치석이긴 한데 내가 느끼는 거랑 다를 수도 키키
English: Yeah, that's right. If you feel that way, it's tartar, but it might be different from what I feel.

Korean: 나 스케일링 받은 지 2달밖에 안 됐는데!?
English: It's only been 2 months since I got my teeth scaled!?

Korean: 그러면 뭔가 음식물이 낀 게 아닐까
English: Then maybe there's some food stuck in there
Well, does that feel overall right!?

Korean: 그럼 치석 제거해서 치아 느낌일 수도 있어 하하
English: Then maybe it's the feeling of teeth after removing tartar haha
Aha Kiki thank goodness
As expected, experts are different~

Korean: 키키 두 달 전이니까 걱정 마
English: Kiki, don't worry, it was two months ago
I guess it'll be okay
Does your sister get cavities easily?

Korean: 아니 나는 치실 해서 잘 안 생겨 키키
English: No, I don't floss well, Kiki

Korean: 치실 하면 충치가 잘 안 생겨?
English: If you floss, you won't get cavities?

Korean: 칫솔질 말고 치실이랑 치간칫솔도 해줘야징 하하
English: Besides brushing your teeth, you should also floss and brush your teeth haha

Korean: 근데 그렇게 했는데 충치가 생기는 이유는 뭐야!?
English: But if I do that, why do I get cavities!?

Korean: 침 성분에 따라 틀리고 사람마다 틀려 키키
English: It varies depending on the saliva composition and varies from person to person.

Korean: 역시 충치는 잘 걸리는 사람이 따로 있구나 바로 나초롬,
English: As expected, there are some people who get cavities easily, namely Na Cho-rom.

Korean: 응 맞아 양치 잘해도 충치 많이 생기는 사람은 자주 생기더라구
English: Yeah, that's right. Even if you brush your teeth well, there are many people who get cavities.

Korean: 흑 ㅜㅜ 나 이번에 검진 받으러 갔다가 100만 원 깨졌어
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ I went to get a checkup this time and lost 1 million won

Korean: 헐 자주 내원 해야겠다 키키 검진 필수로
English: Wow, I have to come here often. Kiki checkups are a must.

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 나 2년 만에 갔더니 충격과 공포였다구 ㅜ
English: That's right ㅜㅜ I went there after 2 years and it was shocking and scary ㅜ
Oh no, that won't do
If you really go to the dentist, it costs money...

Korean: 맞아, 진짜 어렸을 때는 아파서 울었는데 성인 돼서는 금액 때문에 운다 ㅜ
English: Yeah, when I was really young I cried because it hurt, but now that I'm an adult I cry because of the money.

Korean: 그러니까 다들 그렇지 똑같아 키키 웃기다
English: So everyone is the same Kiki it's funny

Korean: 키키 하 이제는 자주 가서 검진 받아야겠어!
English: Kiki ha, I should go and get checked more often from now on!
Yeah, I go for checkups often.
That's the best choice

Korean: 언니 진짜 웃긴 일 있는데 알려줄까!?
English: Sister, there's something really funny, should I tell you?

Korean: 뭔데 뭔데 안 욱기면 알지 ㅡㅡ? 키키
English: What is it? What is it? If you don't get angry, you'll know - -? Kiki
My brother went to buy a keyboard?

Korean: 아 나도 키보드 이쁜 걸로 사고 싶어 키키
English: Ah, I also want to buy a pretty keyboard Kiki

Korean: 근데 얘는 웃긴 게 당근마켓 거래하러 간다고 당당하게 말 하고 갔는데 잘못 거래하고 왔음 키키
English: But the funny thing is, he confidently said he was going to trade on Carrot Market, but he ended up trading wrong. Kiki

Korean: 왜 키키 물건을 잘못 알고 간 거야?
English: Why did you get the Kiki stuff wrong?

Korean: 어 맞아 타자 치는 키보드를 사와야 하는데 요즘에 애들한테 유명한 그 뽁뽁이 같은 거 알아? 그거 사 옴 키키
English: Oh, right, I need to buy a keyboard to type on. You know that bubble wrap thing that's popular with kids these days? I'll buy that.
Ah Kiki dust I know that
Why did you buy it with that

Korean: 키키 아니 그게 이름이 키보드 모양 뽁뽁이? 그건데 키보드만 보고 키보드인 줄 알고 사 왔음 키키
English: Kiki No, that's called a keyboard-shaped bubble wrap? But I bought it thinking it was a keyboard just by looking at it Kiki
Ah Kiki, now I understand
Did you get scammed?

Korean: 아니 키키 그냥 얘가 잘못 본 거야
English: No Kiki, he just saw it wrong

Korean: 갔는데 되게 가볍게 하고 왔대 상대방이 키키
English: I went and came back very lightly, the other person said Kiki

Korean: 아 키키 그러면 거기서 물건 보고 사지 않나
English: Ah Kiki, then you can see the items there and buy them
Kiki, but you already made a promise,
Kiki, I bought it for 2,000 won
Two thousand won is okay Kiki
Just donate, Kiki

Korean: 키키 어쩐지 키보드 값이 생각보다 싸더래 키키
English: Kiki, somehow the price of the keyboard is cheaper than I thought. Kiki
Why are you looking at it the wrong way?
Kiki is so funny
Sister, do you know what the Sakuranbo Dance is?
Yeah, that was popular for a while... you know
Do you know who made that popular?

Korean: 일본인이 해 가지고 유투버들이 유행 시킨 거 아니야?
English: Didn't the Japanese do it and have YouTubers make it popular?

Korean: 니 그거 우리나라에서 유명하게 된 계기가 시아준수 때문이야!

Wow, really? I just found out
Did Sia Junsu sing it?

Korean: 와우 그것 땜에 유행한 거라니 키키 유투버인 줄
English: Wow, that's why it became popular. I thought it was Kiki YouTuber.

Korean: 키키 그치? 근데 시아준수가 춘 거 내가 봤거든? 개잘춤 키키
English: Kiki, right? But I saw what Si-ah Junsu did? Kiki, you dance so well.

Korean: 나도 시아준수가 춘 거 한번 찾아봐야겠다 키키
English: I should also look for something Siajoonsu sang Kiki

Korean: 키키 오 봐 봐 유튜브에 시아준수 사쿠란보라고 치면 나와!
English: Kiki Oh look look, if you type in Shia Junsu Sakuranbo on YouTube, it will come up!

Korean: 동방신기는 뭐 워낙 춤 잘 추니까
English: TVXQ is so good at dancing
Sia Junsu's song is good ㅜ

Korean: 키키 맞아 천상계의 목소리잖아 시아준수 ㅜㅜ
English: Kiki is right, it's the voice of heaven, Sia Junsu ㅜㅜ

Korean: 근데 최강창민 결혼한 것도 소름이긴 했어...
English: But it was also creepy that Choi Kang Changmin got married...
Kiki Huh? When did Changmin get married!?
Wow, you didn't know you were married? Kiki
I did it with a normal person

Yeah right, I love Marvel so much~

Korean: 키키 그러면 이번에 베놈 2 나왔다는데 알아?

Korean: 응 최근에 광고하는 거 봤어 키키
English: Yeah I saw the advertisement recently Kiki
Right? When do you plan on seeing your sister?

Korean: 아 근데 베놈은 뭔가 징그러워 ㅜㅜ
English: Oh but venom is kind of creepy ㅜㅜ
I like action

Korean: 아 진짜? 베놈이 그렇게 징그러운 영화였나,?

Korean: 걔 생긴 거 엄청 징그럽잖아 ㅜㅜ 침 흘리고
English: His appearance is so disgusting ㅜㅜ I'm drooling
Sister, have you seen Venom 1?
Yeah, I've seen that before
It's so gross Kiki Weck

Korean: 키키 그러면 이번에 나온 거는 안 보겠네?

Yeah I don't want to watch it because it's disgusting ㅜㅜ
Do you see?
Oh, I thought it was fun so I'm going to watch it a second time!
Wow Kiki that's funny
But it's fun haha
Yeah~ It only takes 1 hour and 30 minutes~
Let's go see it together~
Okay, let's go and reserve a ticket to a nearby movie theater.
Is your sister a breakfast eater?

Korean: 아니 난 아침밥이랑 엄청 멀지 키키
English: No I'm really far from breakfast Kiki

Korean: 오우 키키 나도 그랬는데 요즘엔 챙겨 먹는 편!
English: Oh Kiki, I used to be like that too, but I eat it more often these days!

Korean: 오 이제 좀 일찍 일어나는 거야? 키키
English: Oh, are you waking up early now? Kiki

Korean: 키키 아니 회사 가서 챙겨 먹고 있음!
English: Kiki, no, I'm going to work and eating!
What? Do you have company breakfast too?
Is it really that good?

Korean: 키키 웅,? 우리 회사 점심 나가서 사 먹는데,?
English: Kiki Woong,? Our company goes out to eat lunch,?

Korean: 아 그럼 회사에 아침 들고 가는 거야? 키키
English: Oh, so you're taking breakfast to work? Kiki

Korean: 키키 옹옹 뭐 들고 가는지 알아?
English: Kiki Ong Ong, do you know what you're taking?
Hey, what are you taking with you? Kiki

Korean: 나 오토밀이랑 아몬드 브리즈 같이 섞어 먹음~
English: I eat it mixed with Otomeel and Almond Breeze~

Korean: 뭐야 그거 다이어트 식단 아니야? 키키

Korean: 키키 강제 다이어트 중이여! 원래는 아닌데!
English: Kiki's on a forced diet! It wasn't like that before!

Korean: 그래도 아침 먹으니까 더 살찔 수도 키키
English: But I might gain more weight because I ate breakfast
Oh man, I'm just turning into a pig

Korean: 역시 먹기 위해 산다는 말이 사실이었어 키키
English: The saying that we live to eat is true, Kiki
Please fix the curtains in my house.
Sorry, I haven't tried that either...

Korean: 후, 아니 집주인 아저씨는 어떻게 해서 고치던데,
English: Oh, no, how did the landlord fix it?
Is that what you used to do before?

Korean: 저번에 한번 또 고장 나서 고쳐줬었거든 ㅜ
English: I fixed it last time because it broke down againㅜ

Korean: 근데 또 고장 나서 부리긴 뭔가 미안하네 ㅠㅠ
English: But I feel bad about using it again because it broke down ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그러니까 근데 이거 내가 봤을 때 원래 고정 장치가 좀 풀렸던 거 같음!
English: So when I looked at this, it seemed like the original fastener was a bit loose!

Korean: 아아 그럼 고정 장치만 고정하면 될 거 같아?
English: Oh, so I guess I just need to fix the fixture?

Korean: 음, 근데 3개가 있는데 한 개가 좀 벌려져 있으!
English: Well, there are three, but one of them is a bit spread out!

Korean: 한번 주인 아저씨한테 다시 말씀드려봐 ㅠㅠ
English: Please tell the owner again ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그래야겠어, 근데 저번에도 나 눈치 주든데 ㅜ
English: I guess so, but you noticed me last time too ㅜ

Korean: 헐 그런 걸로 뭔 눈치여 ㅡㅡ 돈 내고 사는 건데
English: Wow, what do you mean by that? - I paid for it.
Kiki No, it was an original option.

Korean: 그것도 옵션에 포함이 되어있는지 첨 알았넹 하하
English: I just found out that that's included in the options haha

Korean: 엉엉 이것저것 다 옵션이라고 하더라고 키키 식기도 허허
English: Oh my, they said everything was optional, even Kiki's cutlery haha
Kiki, huh, even the dishes?

Korean: 근데 남이 쓰던 건 못 쓰겠어 ㅠㅠ
English: But I can't use something that someone else has used ㅠㅠ
My sister does a lot of deliveries.
When did you check your tires?

Korean: 웅 타다가 좀 이상하면 점검 받고 그래
English: Yeah, if something seems strange while riding, get it checked out and such
Kiki looks like she's two months old!

Korean: 키키 근데 나 4년 타면서 타이어 8개 바꿨는데 어떻게 생각해?
English: Kiki, but I've been riding for 4 years and changed 8 tires. What do you think?

Korean: 헐 2년에 한 번씩 바꾼 거야? 키키

Korean: 거의 1년에 한 번꼴로 바꾼 거 같음 ㅡ
English: I think it changed about once a year.

Korean: 아아 앞뒤 앞뒤 그런 식으로 바꾼 거야?
English: Oh, did you change it like that?

Korean: 엉엉 맞아, 근데 뭔가 사기 맞은 거 같기도 하고,
English: Oh, right, but I also feel like I've been scammed.

Korean: 근데 왜 그렇게 자주 바꾸게 된 거야? ㅠㅠ
English: But why do you change it so often? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아니 뭐 빵꾸 났다고 그러고 찢어졌다 그러고 그래서,
English: No, it said it was punctured and torn and so on,
Ah, that can't be helped...
It's true that it needs to be changed ㅠㅠ

Korean: 하, 근데 안 바꿔도 됐을 만한 것들이었어,
English: Ha, but there were things that didn't need to be changed.
No, if you do that you'll be in big trouble ㅠㅠ
It's safe to change tires!

Korean: 휴, ㅜㅜ 우리 집 시골이라 자갈밭이잖아
English: Phew, ㅜㅜ My house is in the countryside so it's a gravel field
So it could be more like that

Korean: 아 그래서 타이어 더 쉽게 나가나 봐 ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그냥 싼 걸로 자주 바꿔 ㅠㅠ
English: Just change to cheap ones often ㅠㅠ
Okay, how about 500,000 won for 4 wheels?

Korean: 헐 너무 비싼 거 같은데 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, it seems so expensive ㅠㅠ
Are you looking for a part-time job right now?

Korean: 웅 우리는 항상 구하고 있어 키키
English: Yeah we're always saving Kiki

Korean: 아 진짜? 많이 힘들어서 자주 사람들이 그만둬?
English: Oh really? It's so hard that people quit often?

Korean: 아니 여기 시골이라 사람이 안 구해져 ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 그렇겠다 ㅜㅜ 거기 젊은 사람이 거의 없쥐 ㅜ

Korean: 웅 거의 어르신이고 ㅠㅠ 여기까지 와서 일하는 사람도 없고 ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 거기 가야곡에 아는 오빠 있는데 물어봐 줄까?

Korean: 오 그분 지금 놀고 계시는 거야?

Korean: 응응 내가 알기론 친구들이랑 맨날 놀아!
English: Yeah, as far as I know, you hang out with your friends all the time!

Korean: 키키 오 그럼 한번 물어봐 줘!
English: Kiki Oh, then ask me!
Can you do this for a long time? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 흠, 그래도 취직 준비생이라서 잘 모르겠넹 ㅜ
English: Hmm, but I'm still a job seeker so I don't really know ㅜ

Korean: 아 그럼 취업 되면 사라져서 안 돼 안 돼 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, then I can't disappear once I get a job, no, no ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아앗 ㅜㅜ 흠 그쪽은 진짜 사람 구하기 어렵겠어 ㅜㅜ
English: Aah ㅜㅜ Hmm, it's really hard to find people there ㅜㅜ

Korean: 웅 그래서 내가 맨날 상주하고 있잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's why I'm always here ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아앗 키키 그래도 언니가 있어서 다행이여!
English: Ahh Kiki, I'm glad I have a sister!

Korean: 키키 그래서 내가 휴가 이런 걸 못 가 ㅠㅠ 슬퍼
English: Kiki That's why I can't go on vacations like this ㅠㅠ I'm sad

Korean: 언니는 남친 면회 가본 적 있어?
English: Sister, have you ever been to see your boyfriend?

Korean: 내 남친들은 다 전역자들 키키 음화하하하!
English: My boyfriends are all veterans Kiki yumhwahahaha!
Ah, so you're just like me, sister?

Korean: 그럼 곰신이 되어본 적이 없더라고 키키
English: Then Kiki, you've never been a bear before
Kiki, my sister is a forced bear goddess~
Why are you forcing me Kiki?
Didn't you meet a soldier?
Yes, my boyfriend is a soldier.
Same age as me haha
Wow, unnie, you're really meeting a baby?

Korean: 키키 응 맞아 그래서 내가 맨날 형부 새끼라고 놀려~
English: Kiki Yeah, that's right, that's why they always tease me by calling me your brother-in-law's brat~

Korean: 키키 너랑도 잘 아는 사이인 거야?
English: Kiki, are you two close friends?

Korean: 키키 웅 나랑 동갑이라 빠르게 친해짐!
English: Kiki Ung is the same age as me, so we became close quickly!
Yeah, I guess so, Kiki

Korean: 나중에 언니 흉도 같이 보겠는 걸 키키
English: I think I'll see your scars later too Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 거기까지는 걔 그러면 죽지 ㅋ
English: Kiki, if you do that, she'll die lol
He's working in Anmyeondo right now!
I guess your job is a soldier ㅠㅠ
It'll be hard to meet you ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 심지어 지금 초입이라 엄청 바빠,
English: Yes, it's really busy right now because it's the beginning.
I guess I should meet my boyfriend while being considerate of him ㅠㅠ
Sister, do you have any qualifications you want to get?

Korean: 나는 지금 공부까진 신경 쓸 여력이 없어 ㅠㅠ
English: I don't have the energy to study right now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 그러면 나중에 배우고 싶은 거 있어?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Then is there anything you want to learn later?

Korean: 나중에는 그냥 자격증보단 취미 생활처럼 하는 자격증?
English: Later on, is it more like a hobby rather than just a certificate?

Korean: 어떤 거? 우리 언니는 바리스타 시작함 키키
English: What is it? My sister started as a barista Kiki
Oh barista, are you okay Kiki?
I want to do crafts!

Korean: 오 그 오거리에 있는 고등학교 맞은편에 그거 하는 곳 있음!
English: Oh, there's a place that does that across from the high school on that street!

Korean: 오 진짜? 거기에선 뭐 만드는 거 있어?
English: Oh really? What do they make there?

Korean: 엉엉 나 거기서 화장대랑 휴지곽 같은 거 만들었음!
English: Oh my god, I made a vanity table and a tissue box there!

Korean: 키키 그거 그냥 만들기 하는 거 아니야? 귀여워 키키
English: Kiki, isn't that just something you made? Kiki, so cute.
That's Hanji craft, just stick it on and you're done!

Korean: 아아 한지공예는 해볼 만한 거 같다 키키 재밌어?
English: Ah, Korean paper crafts seem like something worth trying. Kiki, is it fun?
Oh my gosh!
I still have it at home!

Korean: 나중에 너네 집으로 한번 구경 가봐야겠다 키키
English: I'll have to go check out your house later, Kiki.

Korean: 키키 지금은 광에 잡동사니들과 같이 있긴 해,
English: Kiki is with the odds and ends of the world right now,

Korean: 키키 가는 김에 오복이도 보고 겸사겸사 하하 가는 거지!
English: While I'm going to Kiki, I'll also go see Obok-i, haha!

Korean: 언니네 어무니도 같이 일하고 계시는 거야?
English: Is your sister's mother working with you too?

Korean: 웅 엄마도 같이 하셨는데 지금은 좀 쉬고 계셔 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, my mom did it too, but she's resting now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 많이 힘드셔서 그렇구나? ㅜㅜ
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ You must be really tired? ㅜㅜ

Korean: 웅 엄마 몸에 무리 와서 지금은 쉬시는 중 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, Mom, your body is tired so you are resting right now ㅠㅠ
Oh ㅜㅜ That's right
So that's why your sister is running around so busily?

Korean: 웅... 원래 배달 전문이었는데 키키 서빙도 같이 하려니까 힘드네 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah... I used to specialize in delivery, but now that I'm trying to do Kiki serving as well, it's hard ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아앗 ㅜㅜ 그러면 아부지랑 언니랑 둘이서만 하는 거야?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ So, just you and your dad and your sister are doing it?

Korean: 웅 그리고 주말에 동생이 좀 도와주고 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah and my younger sibling helped me out a bit on the weekends ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그렇구나 ㅜㅜ 주말이 제일 바쁘긴 하지?
English: I see ㅜㅜ Weekends are the busiest, right?

Korean: 맞아... 그리고 평일 점심에 너무 정신 없어 ㅠㅠ
English: Right... and I'm so busy during weekday lunches ㅠㅠ

Korean: 평일 점심에 주로 어떤 분이 오시는데?
English: What kind of people usually come for lunch on weekdays?

Korean: 여기 농사 하시는 어르신들이 많이 오셔!
English: Many elderly people who farm here come here!
I see. You know that fall is the season of harvest, right?

Korean: 웅 벼농사 키키 그렇지 않아도 요즘 손님이 부쩍 많아짐 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, rice farming Kiki. Even without that, there have been a lot of customers lately ㅠㅠ
Kiki Ka, so just hold on for a bit
It'll be okay in winter ㅜㅜ

Korean: 웅 그래야지 ㅠㅠ 그래도 바빠야 돈 되니까 하하
English: Yeah, that's right ㅠㅠ But you have to be busy to make money haha
I'm worried even when I'm not busy haha

Korean: 언니는 지금 남편 분이랑 결혼할 생각 언제부터 가지고 있었어?
English: Since when have you been thinking about marrying your current husband?

Korean: 결혼 생각은 딱히 없었는데 어느 순간 결혼 얘기가 나와서 자연스럽게 하게 된 거 같아!
English: I didn't really have any thoughts of marriage, but at some point the topic of marriage came up and I think it just happened naturally!

Korean: 오오 그래서 지금 몇 개월 차 신혼부부쥐?
English: Oh, so how many months have you been newlyweds now?
We are now 5 months old! Kiki
Oh wow, you're a totally newlywed couple~

Korean: 웅 아직 꼬꼬마 신혼 부부야 키키
English: Yeah, we're still a little newlyweds, Kiki
Not really haha

Korean: 그러니까 키키 언니네는 둘이서만 신혼집 차린 거야?

... So now he's gone abroad...

14 years old, what do you think? Confucian girl?

English: Kiki, even after applying anesthetic cream, tears kept flowing down your face.

Korean: 아 헐... 그럼 얼른 가서 해 ㅠㅠ

That's scary Kiki

English: Oh, there you are, drawing and such... Kiki

My sister is truly an iron woman. Amazing!

Korean: 웅 맞아... 우리 정신없이 몰아치지 ㅠㅠ

English: Oh, you should do that more often!
Otherwise my legs will be numb ㅜ
It's so swollen, so it's essential, essential!

Korean: 맞아 나도 앉아있는 직업이라 자주 부어서 그거 자주 함!
English: Yeah, I also have a sedentary job so I get swollen often and do that often!

Korean: 그냥 로또 돼서 편하게 누워만 있고 싶다...
English: I just want to win the lottery and lie down comfortably...
Is your place also on the delivery app?

Korean: 아니 우리는 전화 주문만 받고 있어 키키
English: No we only take phone orders Kiki

Korean: 그렇구나 거기는 진짜 단골 위주로 돌아가는구나?
English: I see. So that place is mostly filled with regulars?

Korean: 웅 어르신들이라 어플 그거 해도 소용없어 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, since you're elderly, using the app won't help ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 맞아 키키 그러면 언니는 배달 어떻게 시켜 먹어?
English: Kiki, that's right Kiki. Then how do you order delivery, Unnie?

Korean: 우리는 나가서 포장해서 사오고 그러지 ㅠㅠ
English: We go out and buy it to-go and stuff ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그렇구나 근데 나도 서울 사는데 웬만하면 포장해 와!
English: Oh, I see. I live in Seoul too, so I usually get it to-go!
Yeah, don't you think the delivery fee is a waste?
It's too expensive ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 키키 엎어지면 코 닿을 거리인데!
English: That's right, if Kiki falls, her nose will touch it!

Korean: 맞아 그런 데는 그렇게 해야 되는데 난 배달비 주는 편 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's what you have to do in those places, but I prefer to pay for delivery ㅠㅠ
I guess that's because my sister has a hard time ㅜ

Korean: 웅 누워서 그냥 시켜두고 뒹굴거려 키키
English: Yeah, just lay down and let it roll around Kiki

Korean: 키키 논산은 보통 배달비 얼마 정도 들어?
English: How much does Kiki Nonsan usually charge for delivery?

Korean: 우리는 2천 원 3천 원 이렇게 기본인 거 같아!
English: I think 2,000 won or 3,000 won is the basics!

Korean: 여기는 4~5천 원도 하는 곳 있음, 아까워,
English: There are places that cost 4-5 thousand won. It's a waste.

Korean: 아 가끔 그런 데 있어 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, sometimes it happens like that ㅠㅠ

Korean: 난 그럼 안 시켜 먹음 키키
English: Then I won't order it Kiki

Korean: 언니는 요즘 자주 듣는 음악 있어?
English: Sister, is there any music you listen to often these days?

Korean: 나 경서예지? 이분들 노래 많이 듣고 있어 키키
English: I'm Kyeongseo Yeji. I listen to these guys' songs a lot. Kiki

Korean: 헐 어제 내가 아는 오빠도 그분 노래 듣는다는데 신곡 나옴?
English: Wow, a guy I know said he listens to her songs yesterday. Is there a new song coming out?

Korean: 아니 신곡은 아니고 맨날 듣고 있어 키키 너무 좋아서
English: No, it's not a new song, but I listen to it all the time because I like Kiki so much

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 요즘 신곡은 뭐 듣고 있는 거 없어?
English: Kiki, really? Are you listening to any new songs these days?

Korean: 요즘 신곡은 뭐 나오는지도 잘 몰라...
English: I don't even know what new songs are coming out these days...

Korean: 언니 그러면 에스파라고 에스엠 걸그룹 몰라?
English: Sister, then don't you know about the SM girl group called Espa?

Korean: 아 넥스트레벨? 그 노래 부른 애들 맞지? 키키
English: Ah, Next Level? Are they the ones who sang that song? Kiki

Korean: 어 맞아 이번에 신곡 나왔는데 진짜 개쩔어!
English: Oh yeah, a new song came out this time and it's really awesome!

Korean: 오 그래? 그럼 한번 또 들어줘야겠네 키키
English: Oh really? Then I guess I'll have to listen to it again, Kiki.
Wow, people's reactions were good too!

Korean: 한번 떠 가지고 신곡 나오면 찾아 들어서 더 그런가 봐 키키
English: I think it's even more so when a new song comes out after a while Kiki

Korean: 키키 아니 그냥 소녀시대 넘는 그룹인 거 같음 개인적인 생각으로!
English: Kiki, no, I personally think that they are a group that surpasses Girls' Generation!

Korean: 오 진짜? 그래도 우리나라에선 소녀시대 아직 넘는 애들은 못 봤는데 키키
English: Oh really? But I haven't seen any girls who surpass Girls' Generation in our country yet. Kiki

Korean: 아니여 진짜 얼굴도 예쁘고 노래도 잘하고 다 잘혀!
English: No, she's really pretty, sings well, and is good at everything!

Korean: 요즘 아이돌은 못하는 거 없더라 ㅠㅠ
English: There's nothing idols can't do these days ㅠㅠ
Aren't you going on a movie theater date with your husband?

Korean: 우리는 데이트 잘 하는 편이야 키키
English: We're pretty good at dating, Kiki
Oh, what have you seen recently?
Xiangqi is popular these days, isn't it?
Hey hey when are you going to write~
I saw the voice now Kiki
Kiki A Voice is coming out as a movie?
That voice I know?
No, the drama is different
This is voice phishing!
Oh, I see. Who is the lead actor?

Korean: 거기에 변요한이랑 김무열 나오는데 김무열 연기 진짜 잘하더라 키키
English: Byun Yo-han and Kim Moo-yeol appear in it, and Kim Moo-yeol's acting is really good. Kiki
Oh my gosh, Kim Moo-yeol! When did this come out?
I have to go see it right now!
Go see Kiki Eorung
This is really fun, I highly recommend it!

Korean: 키키 오오 여자 주연 배우는 없어?
English: Kiki Oho, there's no female lead actress?

Korean: 어... 음 있는데 거즘 안 나와 키키
English: Uh...um, there is one, but it's not coming out these days Kiki

Korean: 그래? 키키 그냥 김무열이랑 변요한이 주력 배우인 거네?
English: Really? Kiki, are Kim Moo-yeol and Byun Yo-han just the main actors?

Korean: 웅 맞아 근데 변요한 진짜 멋있게 나옴 키키
English: Yeah right but Byun Yo Han looks really cool Kiki
The role is cool
What role did Hal Byun Yo-han play?

Korean: 걔 사기 당했는데 전직 경찰인 거야 키키
English: He got scammed and he's an ex-cop Kiki

Korean: 그래서 중국 쫓아가서 범인 잡고 그래 키키
English: So I went to China and caught the culprit and that's it Kiki
Oppa, I'm so hungry~

Korean: 나는 너 같은 동생을 둔 적이 없다 하하
English: I've never had a younger sibling like you haha
Dad~ I want to eat some big chicken feet~

Korean: 지금 거기 여기보다 문 연 데 많지 않아?
English: Aren't there more open places than there are here right now?

Korean: 맞아 그런데 혼자서 다 못 먹쥐 ㅜ
English: Yeah, but I can't eat it all by myself ㅜ
No, I can eat it all
Give it a try Kiki
Why are you trying to make me strong!

Korean: 키키 너 솔직히 다 먹을 수 있잖아
English: Kiki, you can honestly eat everything
No!? I can't eat it all!?

Korean: 너 전에 먹는 거 보니까 어마어마하던데?
English: I saw you eat something like that before, it was amazing.

Korean: 키키 그때는 점심부터 저녁까지 나눠 먹은 거야~
English: Kiki, back then we shared lunch and dinner~

Korean: 확실해? 왠지 시키면 30분도 안 돼서 다 먹을 듯 키키
English: Are you sure? I feel like I can eat it all in less than 30 minutes if I order it.

Korean: 키키 노우노우~ 아 근데 무뼈는 가능할 듯!
English: Kiki Nouno~ Ah, but boneless seems possible!
Yes, chicken feet are boneless, that's the truth Kiki

Korean: 키키 나는 뼈파였는데 자취하고 무뼈파로 바뀜 키키
English: Kiki I used to be a bone person but I moved out and became a boneless person Kiki

Korean: 그럼 먹기 편한 게 진짜 짱이야 키키
English: Then it's really the best if it's easy to eat Kiki

Korean: 오빠 오빠는 집 청소 오빠가 해?
English: Oppa, oppa, do you clean the house?
Should I do it?
I have a mommy!

Korean: 키키 부럽다, 어무님이 청소 자주 하셔?
English: I envy Kiki, does your mom clean often?

Korean: 음 집에 들어오시면 하는 거 같아 키키
English: Well, I think you should come home, Kiki
You're so neat
Oppa, help me out too~

Korean: 아냐 나는 도우면 그게 더 일 만드는 거야 키키
English: No, I don't, helping just makes things worse Kiki

Korean: 키키 그러면 오빠 방도 엄마가 청소해 줌?
English: Kiki: Then, Mom will clean your room too?

Korean: 웅 나는 내 손으로 치우는 게 별로 없어 키키
English: Yeah I don't really clean up much with my own hands Kiki

Korean: 실은 나도 본가 내 방 우리 엄마가 치워줌~
English: Actually, my mom cleans my room too~

Korean: 키키 근데 너 지금 나가 살아서 너가 해야 되잖아
English: Kiki but you're out now so you have to do it

Korean: 어 맞아 자취방은 머리카락 한 올도 용납 못함 키키
English: Oh right, the studio apartment doesn't tolerate even a single hair, Kiki

Korean: 그럼 그 돌돌이는 비치해 뒀어? 키키
English: So did you put that rock on the beach? Kiki
Dol Dol has now changed the charging material 4 times

Korean: 대박이네 너도 어지간히 머리카락 떨어지나 보다 키키
English: Wow, you must be losing a lot of hair too, Kiki

Korean: 어 키키 그리고 여기 되게 잘 보임
English: Oh Kiki and here it looks really good

Korean: 키키 거기 장판이 좀 밝은 색인가 보네 키키
English: Kiki, the flooring there seems to be a bit brighter Kiki

Korean: 오빠는 버스 탄 지 몇 년 됐어?
English: How many years has it been since you took the bus, oppa?

Korean: 버스? 일반 버스? 아니면 고속 버스?
English: Bus? Regular bus? Or express bus?

Korean: 둘 다! 일반 버스 요금 얼마게?
English: Both! How much is the regular bus fare?

Korean: 그거 지금 1300원 그 정도 하지 않아?
English: Isn't that around 1300 won now?
It's really creepy
1300 won This is from two years ago Kiki

Korean: 아 그래? 일반 버스는 안 탄 지 8년 넘은 거 같아 키키
English: Oh really? I think it's been over 8 years since I've taken a regular bus. Kiki
The regular bus fare is 1,500 won now, but they're raising it to 1,600 won!

Korean: 근데 지금 물가 생각하면 그럴 수도 있지 키키
English: But considering the current prices, it could be possible Kiki

Korean: 맞아 근데 지금 타는 사람 엄청 줄었대!
English: That's right, but I heard there are a lot fewer people riding it now!

Korean: 나는 기름 값이나 좀 내렸으면 좋겠어 ㅠㅠ
English: I wish the price of oil would go down a bit ㅠㅠ
Kiki, how much is gasoline right now?
I think it's 1700 won now!
Wow, a latte was 1,400 won! Awesome!
Don't lie
There can't be that kind of amount, right?
Seriously! It was around 1400 won until last year!
I remember it was 1500 won last year. Kiki
Oppa, is that your lifelong job right now?

Korean: 웅 평생 직장일 거 같은데 다른 것도 좀 해보고 싶네 키키
English: Yeah, I guess it's just going to be a job for life, but I want to try other things too Kiki
Then, oppa, you should learn the skills!

Korean: 아니 나보단 일하는 동생이 더 잘해 키키
English: No, my younger sibling who works is better than me Kiki

Korean: 키키 그러면 오빠는 그냥 사장 직책만 가지고 있는 거!?
English: Kiki: So, you just have the title of president?

Korean: 아니 그냥 나는 병풍인 거지 뭐 키키
English: No, I'm just a screen, Kiki

Korean: 키키 아니 그래도 부모님이 이제 퇴직하시면 오빠가 다해야 하잖아!
English: Kiki: But even so, now that my parents are retired, my brother has to do everything!

Korean: 근데 지금 아직 정정하셔서 그러진 않아 키키
English: But it hasn't been fixed yet, Kiki
Sure, you'll probably do it for another 20 years, right?
Won't it be harder for me then?

Korean: 키키 그러면 오빠는 이거 말고 뭐 하고 싶어?
English: Kiki: Then what else do you want to do besides this?

Korean: 음 글쎄 나도 월급 받으면서 한번 지내보고 싶어 ㅠㅠ
English: Well, I want to try living while receiving a salary ㅠㅠ

Korean: 지금도 월급 받으면서 지내는 거 아니야?
English: Aren't you still receiving a salary?

Korean: 아니 그냥 다같이 카드로 써서 그런 기준이 없어 키키
English: No, we all just use cards so there's no standard for that Kiki

Korean: 헐 키키 그러면 오빠가 가지고 있는 비상금이 없어?
English: Oh my god, Kiki, so you don't have any emergency funds?

Korean: 웅 그냥 거기에 남는 거 걍 써 키키
English: Yeah, just use whatever's left over

Korean: 오빠가 군대 다녔을 때 운전병이라고 했나?
English: Did your brother say he was a driver when he was in the military?
Yeah, I'm a former driver, Kiki.

Korean: 키키 오빠가 있던 생활관에 있던 사람들도 다 운전병이야?
English: Are all the people in the dormitory where Kiki Oppa was also drivers?

Korean: 아니 아니 다 운전병은 아니었어 키키
English: No no, not all of them were drivers Kiki
Just a regular military police Kiki
If you're a military policeman, are you like a police officer in the military?

Korean: 아니 그냥 육군들 말하는 거야 키키
English: No, I'm just talking about the army, Kiki

Korean: 그러면 오빠는 운전병이니까 훈련 안 했겠네?
English: Then, since you are a driver, you didn't have any training?

Korean: 아니야 그래도 훈련은 다 받아 키키
English: No, but I still received all the training.

Korean: 아 진짜? 내가 아는 운전병은 개꿀 빨던디?
English: Oh really? The drivers I know suck up to so much honey?

Korean: 그게 일이 있으면 안 하는데 일 없으면 다 훈련 받지 키키
English: If there's work, you don't have to do it, but if there's no work, you don't get trained.
Is he a two-star driver who gets a free ride?

Korean: 근데 그런 애들은 사모님들도 모시고 다녀야 된다던데 키키
English: But those kids have to be accompanied by their wives too, Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 진짜 운전병처럼 부리더라 키키
English: Kiki, you're right, you really drive like a driver Kiki

Korean: 자식들 학원도 다 데려다 주고 해야 된대 키키 비서야 비서
English: Secretary Kiki, you have to take your children to school too. Secretary Kiki, you have to take your children to school too.
Kiki and the kids to school?
That's creepy!

Korean: 응 나 아는 애도 그랬다고 하더라고 키키
English: Yeah, I heard that a friend of mine said the same thing, Kiki
Oppa, is there anything you want to learn?

Korean: 음 나는 경호 이쪽에 관심이 좀 있었어
English: Well, I was a bit interested in security.
Bodyguard? Then I guess I'll have to learn judo?

Korean: 경호한다고 해서 무조건 유도를 하는 건 아니야 키키
English: Just because you're guarding doesn't mean you have to do judo unconditionally, Kiki

Korean: 어쨌든 운동 분야로 해야 하는 거 아닌가?
English: Anyway, shouldn't it be in the sports field?

Korean: 웅 맞아 근데 배운다면 권투 한번 배우고 싶더라 키키
English: Yeah, that's right, but if I were to learn, I'd like to learn boxing once Kiki

Korean: 오 권투!? 처음에는 무조건 줄넘기부터 하는 거 알지?
English: Oh boxing!? You know that you always start with jumping rope first?

Korean: 맞아 나 아는 애 한 달 동안 줄넘기만 해서 그만뒀대 키키
English: Yeah, I know a guy who just jumped rope for a month and quit. Kiki

Korean: 맞아 ㅋ 내 친구도 그거만 시켜서 도망갔대 키키
English: Yeah lol my friend ran away after ordering that too Kiki

Korean: 근데 줄넘기만 한 달 동안 시키는 건 좀 너무 한 거 아니야?
English: But isn't it a bit too much to make them only jump rope for a month?

Korean: 아니야 권투의 기본이 체력이라 줄넘기 쉬지 않고 1시간은 해야 한대!
English: No, the basis of boxing is physical strength, so you have to jump rope for an hour without stopping!

Korean: 스텝이나 그런 거 때문에 줄넘기를 시키는 건가?
English: Are you making me jump rope because of steps or something?
Yeah, I think so
You have to do it 3,000 times without stopping!

Korean: 아 그럼 나도 도중에 도망갈 거 같은데 키키
English: Oh, then I guess I'll run away too, Kiki

Korean: 키키 나 고딩 때 3분 컷이었음 키키
English: Kiki, when I was in high school, it was a 3 minute cut Kiki

Korean: 그 정도면 나름 많이 했던 거 아니야? 키키
English: Isn't that a lot of work? Kiki
Oppa, when is your father's birthday?
My dad was born in May, Kiki
So what did you do for your birthday this year?

Korean: 이번에 그냥 딱히 원하는 거 없으셔서 용돈 드렸어 키키
English: This time, I gave you some pocket money since you didn't really want anything Kiki.
Oh, how much allowance did you give?

Korean: 그냥 소소하게 30만 원 넣어 드렸지 키키
English: I just gave you 300,000 won, Kiki.
I have a problem right now!
Why is it your father's birthday too?
No, my dad retires in December!
Why worry when you retire and just rest?
I have to have a retirement party.
What should I give as a gift?

Korean: 아항 퇴직 파티 중요하지 키키 이제 쉬어야 되니까!
English: Ah, the retirement party isn't important, Kiki, you have to rest now!
Um, the gift is a blanket?

Korean: 이, 불,? 우리 아빠 이불 많아,
English: Hey, what? My dad has a lot of blankets.

Korean: 응 키키 그냥 이제 푹 쉬라는 의미로 이불 어때?
English: Yeah Kiki, how about a blanket so you can just get some rest?

Korean: 우리 아빠가 그거 보면 관짝에서 오래 쉴 거라고 필요 없다고 하겠다!
English: If my dad saw that, he'd say there's no need to spend a long time in a coffin!

Korean: 키키 아니야 그래도 뭐든 다 좋아하실 거 같아!
English: Kiki: No, but I think you'll like everything!

Korean: 내일 내 남친 우리 집 온다!
English: My boyfriend is coming to my house tomorrow!

Korean: 와 너네 이번에 얼마 만에 만나는 거야?
English: Wow, how long has it been since you guys last met?
Huh? You came and went yesterday too? Kiki

Korean: 엥? 너네 요즘 연락도 못하고 못 만난다고 하지 않았어?
English: Huh? Didn't you say that you guys haven't been able to contact each other or meet up these days?

Korean: 아니 어제 야간 작업하고 우리 집 왔음!
English: No, I worked overnight and came home to my house!

Korean: 그래도 시골에 있을 때보다 자주 보고 그런가 보네?
English: I guess that's because I see you more often than when I was in the countryside?

Korean: 응 맞아 근데 코 고는 소리 자주 듣게 돼서 싫음!
English: Yeah, that's right, but I hate hearing snoring so often!

Korean: 아 전에 같이 놀러 갔을 때 기억난다 키키
English: Oh, I remember when we went out to play together before, Kiki
I don't think it was a problem back then?

Korean: 키키 어 맞아 그때는 안 골 때였고 나이가 드니까 점점 곯더라,
English: Kiki, that's right, I wasn't a picky eater back then, but as I got older, I got more and more picky.

Korean: 요즘 형이 일이 많아서 많이 피곤한가 보네 키키
English: I guess my brother is very tired these days because he has a lot of work to do. Kiki

Korean: 맞아, 근데 내 이상형은 코 안 고는 남자인데!
English: Yeah, but my ideal type is a man who doesn't snore!

Korean: 야 그러기엔 너도 코 골고 있는 거 아니야? 키키
English: Hey, aren't you snoring too? Kiki

Korean: 아니 나는 잠꼬대로 웃으면서 자 키키
English: No, I'm sleeping while laughing
That's scarier Kiki
I think you'll appear in my dreams Kiki

Korean: 맞아 오빠가 나 깨우더니 무슨 일 있냐고 하더라고,
English: That's right, my brother woke me up and asked what was wrong.
That was when I was laughing and talking in my sleep!

Korean: 웃으면 좋은 일 있는 거 아닌감
English: Don't you think that if you laugh, something good will happen?
Kiki is so funny

Korean: 이번에 메롱이 오랜만에 산책 시켰더니 좋아해!
English: This time, I took Merong for a walk for the first time in a while and he loved it!

Korean: 오 어제 형이 오면서 메롱이도 데리고 왔어?
English: Oh, did you bring Merong with you yesterday when you came?
Oh right, Merong is still so bubbly!

Korean: 키키 메롱이 해피 밥이었는데... 기억이 새록새록 하네
English: Kiki Merong was Happy Bob... I remember it clearly

Korean: 키키 맞아 해피랑 콩이는 잘 지내고 있지,?
English: Kiki, are Happy and Kongi doing well?

Korean: 응 사진으로 보면 그런 거 같긴 하더라~ 우울...
English: Yeah, it looks like that in the picture~ Depressing...

Korean: 흘구 ㅜㅜ 우리가 같이 간 지 한 3년 됐나,?
English: Hehe ㅜㅜ Has it been about 3 years since we went together?
Wouldn't it be two years?

Korean: 원래 일 년에 한 번씩 가기로 했었잖아 키키
English: We were supposed to go once a year, Kiki
Yes, that's right, it was a holiday last year!

Korean: 우리가 마지막으로 갔을 때가 공주 거기였나?
English: Was the princess there the last time we went?

Korean: 공주? 기억이 잘 안 나네 ㅜㅜ
English: Princess? I don't remember very well ㅜㅜ

Korean: 대둔산인가 ㅠㅠ 할튼 근방으로 갔었던 거 같은데 ㅠㅠ
English: Is it Daedunsan? ㅠㅠ Anyway, I think I went somewhere nearby ㅠㅠ

Korean: 흙흙 ㅜㅜ 메롱이는 펜션으로 놀러 간 거 거기가 마지막이야 ㅜ
English: Hurry up ㅜㅜ Merong went to the pension to play and that was the last time ㅜ

Korean: 키키 메롱이 데리고 바다 냄새도 맡게 해줘!
English: Kiki Merong, take me out and let me smell the ocean!

Korean: 하 그래야 하는데 시간이 안 되네 ㅜ
English: Oh, I should do that, but I don't have time ㅜ

Korean: 에구 너도 거기서 고생 많이 하나 보네 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my, you must have had a hard time there too ㅠㅠ
Does your brother know how to play badminton?

Korean: 나 그거 완전 선수급으로 치지 키키
English: I think that's totally professional level

Korean: 아 진짜? 키키 안 봐서 모르겠음~
English: Oh really? I don't know because I haven't seen Kiki~

Korean: 너 나랑 하면 절대 이길 수가 없을 거야~
English: You'll never win against me~

Korean: 키키 오빠도 논산 배드민턴 동호회에 들어가 있어?
English: Kiki, are you also in the Nonsan Badminton Club?

Korean: 그건 아닌데 그분들 만큼 내가 치지!
English: No, I don't hit as hard as they do!

Korean: 키키 나는 거기 동호회 출신이야 까불지 마!
English: Kiki, I'm from that club, don't mess with me!

Korean: 오오 그럼 너 나랑 한 판 붙어야겠구나?
English: Oh, so you have to fight me?
Then~ I think men win too~

Korean: 흠 그건 내가 한번 검증을 해봐야겠구먼 키키
English: Hmm, I guess I'll have to check that out Kiki

Korean: 나 두 발목에 모래 주머니 차고 해도 오빠 쌉가능으로 이김!
English: Even if I wear sandbags on both my ankles, my brother can still win!

Korean: 그 대단한 자신감 하나는 칭찬해주지 키키
English: I praise you for that great confidence Kiki

Korean: 키키 저녁 내기 한 판 콜?
English: Kiki, would you like to call in a round of dinner bets?

Korean: 그럼 내가 이겨도 그 저녁 한 끼 충분히 쌉가능~
English: Then, even if I win, I can still afford that one dinner~

Korean: 키키 오 그러면 저녁은 참치로 가즈앗~
English: Kiki Oh, then let's have tuna for dinner~

Korean: 아항 그럼 그냥 내기로 해서 먹어야겠다 키키
English: Ah, then I guess I'll just bet and eat it Kiki
Honey, do you know how to play baduk?

Korean: 바둑은 우리 아버지랑 어릴 때 조큼 둬봤지
English: I played a little bit of baduk with my father when I was young.

Korean: 키키 나는 그거 룰 알아도 모르겠던데?
English: Kiki, I don't know what the rule is, even though I know it.
Yeah, I don't know either
Just leave it Kiki
How do you put Kiki?
I tried it on my phone and I don't understand a thing!

Korean: 그냥 나는 내 거 뭉쳐있는데 타다닥 놔 키키
English: Just put mine together Kiki

Korean: 근데 오빠 살던 집 근처에 바둑 학원 있지 않았어?
English: But wasn't there a baduk academy near the house where my brother lived?

Korean: 아 예전에 하나 있긴 했던 거 같아 키키
English: Oh, I think there was one before, Kiki

Korean: 맞지? 거기 봤던 거 같은데 지금은 망했나?
English: Right? I think I saw it there, but is it gone now?

Korean: 나 아는 동생도 거기 다녔던 거 같은데 키키
English: I think my friend went there too, Kiki
It's not there right now
Right, I heard they teach abacus there too?
I don't know because I haven't been in, but Kiki

Korean: 바둑 말고 신기한 거 많이 했네?
English: Have you done many interesting things besides baduk?

Korean: 키키 맞아 바둑은 근데 진짜 똑똑한 애들만 하는 거 같음!
English: Kiki: That's right, but it seems like only really smart kids play Baduk!

Korean: 어? 그럼 내가 하면 엄청 잘할 거 같은데 키키
English: Huh? Then I think I'll do really well Kiki

Korean: 나도 그때 학원 엄마가 다니게 해 줬으면 나 지금 멘사 회원임!
English: If only my mom had let me go to that academy back then, I'd be a member of Mensa now!
Oh, that's over ㅠㅠ
Moderation is key ^^

Korean: 오빠 우리 사이판이랑 괌은 지금 여행 갈 수 있대!
English: Oppa, we can travel to Saipan and Guam now!
Oh, is it solved there too?
I heard Singapore is now possible too Kiki
Oh, I see. The travel agency has released the product!

Korean: 와 그럼 나도 제주도 말고 괌 다녀 올걸 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, then I should have gone to Guam instead of Jeju Island ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 괌 여기서 되게 멀지 않아?
English: But isn't Guam really far from here?

Korean: 응 그런데 제주도 비용 생각하면 그냥 그런 데 가는 게 더 좋지 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, but considering the cost of Jeju Island, it's better to just go to a place like that ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 또 괌은 언제 갈지 모르잖아!
English: Right, I don't know when I'll be able to go to Guam again!

Korean: 맞아 코로나 땜에 느낀 건데 갈 수 있을 때 많이 다녀야 해 키키
English: Yeah, I felt it because of Corona, but I have to go out a lot when I can Kiki

Korean: 맞아 근데 싱가폴도 가보고 싶긴 해!
English: Yeah, but I also want to go to Singapore!
They say that country is so clean.

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 싱가폴은 어디 쪽에 있는 곳이지?
English: Kiki, really? Where is Singapore?
It should be relatively close!
What was Singapore famous for? Waffles?

Korean: 거기 예전에 수영장 하나 히트했었는데 키키
English: There used to be a swimming pool there that was a hit. Kiki

Korean: 수영장? 거기 호텔 안에 있는 수영장 말하는 건가
English: Swimming pool? Are you talking about the pool inside the hotel?

Korean: 웅 맞아 옥상에 있는데 사진이 이쁘게 나온다고 하더라 키키
English: Yeah, that's right, I'm on the rooftop, and they said the pictures came out pretty Kiki
The weather there was no joke, was it?

Korean: 오늘 아침에 추웠는데 낮엔 또 덥더라 ㅠㅠ
English: It was cold this morning, but it was hot again during the day ㅠㅠ
It was the opposite here!
It was hot in the morning and cold during the day!

Korean: 차라리 출근할 때 따뜻한 게 더 좋은 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: I think it's better to be warm when going to work ㅠㅠ
No, I was drenched in sweat on the subway!

Korean: 근데 나 지금 쌀쌀할 때 먹는 오뎅 먹고 싶다 ㅠㅠ
English: But I really want to eat oden, which is eaten when it's chilly ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 와 우리 회사 근처 분식집 있거든?
English: Kiki, is there a snack shop near our company?

Korean: 거기 오뎅 국물 냄새 오짐 ㅜ
English: The smell of oden soup there is overwhelming ㅜ

Korean: 아 거기 지나다닐 때마다 엄청 먹고 싶었겠는 걸?
English: Ah, you must have really wanted to eat it every time you passed by there.

Korean: 맞아 근데 길가에 있어서 창피해서 못 먹음 ㅜ
English: Yeah, but I'm embarrassed to eat it because it's on the street.

Korean: 뭐 어때 먹고 살자고 일하는데 그런 거 신경 쓰지 마!
English: What do you care? I work to make a living, so don't worry about that!
I was afraid I would meet the company staff,

Korean: 만나면 반갑게 인사하고 하나 드시고 가라 그래~
English: When you meet, say hello and have some before you go~

Korean: 키키 계산은 본인이 알아서 하고? 키키
English: Kiki, do you do the math yourself? Kiki
Of course it is
While talking, shout out, "Each person has money!"
There are also thousand won tteokbokki there!

Korean: 헐 대박 천 원이면 컵 떡볶이겠다 키키
English: Wow, wow, for a thousand won I could get a cup of tteokbokki Kiki
So how much did you pay for Samsung stock?
I currently have an average purchase price of 78,000 won Kiki
Did you see the news this time? 60,000 electrons,
Yeah I saw it... It's so annoying

Korean: 그거 백만 원 넘게 샀거든 키키
English: I bought that for over a million won, Kiki
Wow, is this true? When did you buy it?

Korean: 나 그거 막 올랐을 때 81000원 이때 샀다가 떨어질 때 추가 매입해서 그만큼 평균 단가 떨어트린 거야 ㅠㅠ
English: I bought it when it first went up at 81,000 won, and then bought more when it dropped, lowering the average price by that much.

Korean: 근데 지금 계속 떨어질 추세라고 하던데,?
English: But I heard that the trend is continuing to fall, right?

Korean: 맞아 그래서 지금 안 들어가고 있어
English: Yeah, that's why I'm not going in now
If you're crying tears of blood, Kiki

Korean: 피눈물 나는 사람 오빠 말고 또 한 사람 있어,
English: There is another person besides my brother who is shedding tears of blood,

Korean: 그 사람은 너의 그이 말하는 거니?
English: Is that the guy you're talking about?
There are many more besides Samsung...
Yeah, that Kiki guy

Korean: 아니 오빠는 몇 개가 물린 거야!?
English: Hey, how many did you get bitten by, oppa!?

Korean: 지금 주식시장 자체가 다 하한가인 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: It seems like the stock market itself is at its lower limit right now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 으앙 ㅜㅜ 지금 다 파랭이 밭이겠네,?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ It must be a field of blueberries now, right?

Korean: 웅 맞아 빨간색 좀 구경하고 싶다 진짜 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right. I really want to see some red ones ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 요즘에 빨간 밭에 뒹구르는 사람이 있을까?
English: But is there anyone rolling around in a red field these days?

Korean: 혹시 모르지 우는 사람 있으면 웃는 자가 있는 거니까 키키
English: If you don't know, there's someone crying, there's someone laughing, Kiki
There are bushfires in Australia again!

Korean: 거기는 왜 뭐만 하면 산불이 나는 거래? ㅠㅠ
English: Why do forest fires start there whenever you do something? ㅠㅠ
I guess it's because the climate is so dry!

Korean: 그래도 호주 살기 좋다고 많이 그러는데 ㅠㅠ
English: But still, many people say that living in Australia is nice ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 재작년에도 큰 불 났었잖아!
English: That's right ㅜㅜ There was a big fire the year before last too!

Korean: 난 산불 나도 좋으니 호주 가고 싶다
English: I want to go to Australia even if there is a forest fire

Korean: 호주 산불 나서 코알라 거의 전멸했대 ㅜ
English: Koalas are almost completely wiped out by the Australian wildfires.

Korean: 헐 대박 그건 안 되는데 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my god, that won't work ㅠㅠ
Koala, so is it a rare species?
I think so too

Korean: 원래도 내가 알기론 멸종 위기종이었을 걸,?
English: As far as I know, it was originally an endangered species, right?

Korean: 헐 그럼 지금 코알라 보존을 잘 해야겠네 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, then we really need to do a good job of preserving koalas now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아, 저번에 산불로 전 세계 코알라의 90%나 없어졌다고 그랬어,
English: Yes, last time I said that 90% of the world's koalas were wiped out by wildfires.

Korean: 나 코알라 한 번도 본 적 없는데 ㅠㅠ 이러면 안 돼~
English: I've never seen a koala before ㅠㅠ This is not right~

Korean: 어 나는 동물원에서 봤던 거 같은데 허허
English: Oh, I think I saw it at the zoo haha

Korean: 국내 동물원에 코알라가 있다는 얘기는 또 처음이네~
English: This is the first time I've heard that there's a koala in a domestic zoo~

Korean: 어 나는 어렸을 때 봤던 거 같은데!?
English: Oh, I think I saw it when I was little!?

Korean: 그거 다 너의 꿈이었을 수도 있어 키키
English: It could have all been your dream, Kiki
Are you grooming your eyebrows, oppa?

Korean: 아 그거 애인이 맨날 해주고 있어 키키
English: Oh, my lover does that all the time, Kiki

Korean: 키키 나도 내 애인 눈썹 내가 맨날 뽑아
English: Kiki I also pluck my lover's eyebrows every day
He rips it off...
Kiki's a waxing lover...

Korean: 키키 헉 그 왁싱기도 가지고 계셔,?
English: Kiki Hey, you have that waxing machine too?

Korean: 맞아 너 걔랑 블로그 이웃 아니야?
English: Right, aren't you his blog neighbors?
Oh right, that beard was your brother, huh?
Yeah, that's me...
I cried that day ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 그 정도면 피는 안 났어?
English: Kiki, at that level, you didn't bleed?

Korean: 피도 조금 난 거 같은데 모르는 척하더라고 키키
English: Kiki, I think there was a little bit of blood, but you pretended not to notice.

Korean: 키키 헐 ㅜㅜ 그 정도면 진짜 피 나고도 남았을 텐데 키키
English: Kiki, wow ㅜㅜ If it was to that extent, you would have really bled Kiki

Korean: 이렇게 나의 신상은 다 팔려 버렸더라고 키키
English: So all my personal information was sold, Kiki

Korean: 키키 오빠 그러면 다리털도 사악 밀었어?
English: Kiki Oppa, did you shave your leg hair too?

Korean: 아니 그건 내가 지키고 있지 키키
English: No, I'm guarding that Kiki

Korean: 우리 오빠는 털 숱도 침 키키
English: My brother has thick hair too

Korean: 다음에 내 애인한테 데리고 와 해줄 거야 키키
English: Next time I'll bring you to my lover Kiki
Has your brother ever been hospitalized?

Korean: 웅 나 예전에 한번 사고 나서 한 적 있지 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I did it once before after an accident ㅠㅠ
Oh my, are you talking about a car accident?

Korean: 응 맞아 빗길에서 달리다가 몇 번 돌았어 ㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right. I spun around a few times while running on a rainy road.
Wow, is that an accident that even involved a barricade?

Korean: 웅 친구 하나는 내려서 바로 눕더라
English: Yeah, one of my friends got off and lay down right away.
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ You must have been hospitalized with a friend, right?

Korean: 그래서 왜 내려서 누웠냐고 물어보니까 뭐라는 줄 알아?
English: So when I asked him why he got down and lay down, do you know what he said?
You said it was because you were dizzy?

Korean: 2차 사고 날까 봐 무서워서 나가서 누웠대 키키
English: Kiki said he went out and lay down because he was scared that there would be a second accident.

Korean: 키키 아니 그러다가 다른 차가 치고 가면 어쩌려고 키키
English: Kiki, what if another car hits you? Kiki

Korean: 몰라 나도 듣는데 너무 웃기더라고 키키
English: I don't know, I listened to it too, it was so funny Kiki

Korean: 키키 개웃기 그때 몇 키로로 달렸었는데?
English: Kiki, how many kilometers did you run back then?

Korean: 아 그거까지는 내가 잘 기억이 안 나 키키
English: Ah, I don't remember that well, Kiki

Korean: 빗길에 그렇게 빨리 달리는 사람이 어디 있어!
English: Who runs that fast in the rain?

Korean: 그래서 요즘은 비 오면 운전하기가 무섭더라 키키
English: So these days, when it rains, I'm scared to drive Kiki

Korean: 내 사촌 동생 중고거래 하러 갔거든?
English: My cousin went to a second-hand goods trade?

Korean: 어? 설마 키보드 사러 간 그 동생?
English: Huh? Are you sure it's not that little brother who went to buy a keyboard?

Korean: 어 맞아 키키 근데 키보드 잘못 삼 키키
English: Oh right Kiki but you're using the wrong keyboard Kiki

Korean: 아 맞아 나도 연락 왔어 키키
English: Oh right, I got a call too, Kiki
I'm in touch with him Kiki
What the heck, you two are contacting each other without me!?
Kiki bragged to me about buying me a keyboard

Korean: 전에 내가 보여줬었거든 내 거 하하
English: I showed you mine before haha

Korean: 키키 맞아 나한테도 2천 원에 거래하러 간다고 개꿀이라고 했거든
English: Kiki, that's right, she said it was so sweet that she was going to trade with me for 2,000 won.

Korean: 근데 그거 사고선 다시 다이소 가서 사왔던데? 키키
English: But after buying that, I went back to Daiso and bought it again? Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 유에스비 키보드 샀어야 했는데 다른 키보드를 사 왔음 키키
English: Kiki, you're right, I should have bought a USB keyboard, but I bought a different keyboard Kiki

Korean: 중고거래는 그래서 잘 보고 사야 되는데 키키 불운하구먼
English: That's why you have to be careful when buying used goods, but Kiki is unlucky

Korean: 키키 그래서 다이소 가서 5천 원 주고 사왔대 키키
English: Kiki So I went to Daiso and bought it for 5,000 won Kiki

Korean: 근데 그거 은근 쓰기 괜찮더라고 키키
English: But I think it's actually pretty good to use, Kiki

Korean: 어,? 지금 몇 번 쳤더니 고장 났다고 하던데,?
English: Uh,? You said it broke after hitting it a few times?

Korean: 개는 진짜 불운한가 봐 ㅠㅠ 왜 그러냐... 키키
English: The dog must be really unlucky ㅠㅠ Why is it like that... Kiki

Korean: 나랑 아까 그걸로 채팅하다가 사라짐 키키
English: Kiki, you disappeared while chatting with me about that earlier

Korean: 나랑 종류는 다른 거 사긴 했더라 키키
English: Kiki, you bought a different kind of thing than me

Korean: 내 거가 더 좋은 건가 보네
English: I guess mine is better

Korean: 어제 내가 보라고 했던 풍자 유튜브 봤어!?
English: Did you watch the satirical YouTube video I told you to watch yesterday!?

Korean: 야 나 무서운 영화 못 보잖아
English: Hey I can't watch scary movies
I could suffocate to death

Korean: 아니 풍자 유튜브 어제 내가 보라고 했던 거!
English: No, the satire YouTube is what I told you to watch yesterday!

Korean: 아 그거 무서운 거 말하는 건 줄 키키
English: Oh, I thought you were talking about something scary
I haven't seen Kiki yet
Kiki, look at that quickly~
It's really funny~

Korean: 그거 얼마나 재밌길래 이렇게 나를 재촉하는 거야 키키
English: How funny is that that you keep urging me like this, Kiki?

Korean: 오빠가 신기루 영상을 재밌게 봤다면 그건 분명히 더 재미있을 거야!
English: If oppa enjoyed the mirage video, this one will definitely be more fun!
Yes, Shingiru is really funny Kiki
It's still funny no matter how many times I watch it Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 나 어제 목욕하면서 그거 또 봄!
English: Kiki, that's right, I saw it again while taking a bath yesterday!

Korean: 너가 생각나서 한 번 더 본 거 같은데? 키키
English: I think I saw it again because I thought of you? Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 키키 근데 오빠 트렌스젠더 유튜버들 영상 봤어?
English: Kiki, that's right Kiki, but oppa, have you seen the videos of transgender YouTubers?

Korean: 아니 나는 보지는 않았어 키키 재미있어?
English: No I haven't seen Kiki. Is it funny?
It's so funny what you say Kiki

Korean: 요즘 사람들 다 말 센스 있게 잘 하더라 키키 부러워
English: These days, everyone speaks with such a good sense of humor. I envy Kiki.

Korean: 맞아 키키 요즘엔 게이 유튜버들도 잘 나와서 얘기 잘 하더라!
English: That's right Kiki, these days there are a lot of gay YouTubers and they talk a lot!
You should try it too, Kiki
You're pretty good at speaking~
Oppa, did you see Venom Two!?
Who did you see it with!

Korean: 누구랑 보긴 누구랑 보겠어~ 그분이랑 봤지~
English: Who would you watch it with? Who would you watch it with? I watched it with that person.
Oppa, does your lover like Marvel movies too?

Korean: 응 걔 맨날 그거 챙겨보더라 마덕 마덕
English: Yeah, he always checks that out, Madok Madok

Korean: 오 키키 베놈 2에는 누구 누구 나와?
English: Who's in Oh Kiki Venom 2?
There's a venom child appearing and Kiki
Oh, Venom's kid is the main character?

Korean: 응 개가 악랄하게 나와서 베놈이랑 싸워
English: Yeah the dog came out and fought Venom
Oh, did you enjoy the Kiki movie?

Korean: 시간이 길진 않아서 그냥 지루하지 않게 봤어 키키
English: It wasn't that long so I just watched it without getting bored Kiki
Why did it take several hours?

Korean: 한 시간 반? 두 시간도 안 한 거 같더라고 키키
English: An hour and a half? It didn't even feel like two hours Kiki

Korean: 엥? 영화라면서 왜 이렇게 짧게 나왔지?
English: Huh? If it's a movie, why is it so short?
Was the production cost insufficient?

Korean: 급하게 만든 거 같기도 하구... 흠
English: It looks like it was made in a hurry... hmm

Korean: 키키 거기 자동차 또 많이 때려 부심?
English: Kiki, are you hitting the car a lot there?
Kiki, you've been hitting walls a lot too
Kiki, jumping around the rooftops and breaking everything
What are you eating for dinner tonight?
I ate chicken today
Oh my gosh, I'm so jealous
Where can I eat chicken?
I ate Jikoba chicken
It was really delicious

Korean: 와 대박 거기다 밥 당연히 비벼 먹었겠지?
English: Wow, wow, of course you mixed rice in there and ate it, right?
Of course, Jikoba has to mix rice to be true

Korean: 맞아 너 매운맛 좋아해 순한 맛 좋아해?
English: Right, do you like spicy food or mild food?
Oh, of course I like spicy food
Kiki, that's right, Jikoba is spicy
But do you like your in-laws too?

Korean: 당연하지 처갓집 치킨은 밥에 얹어 먹어야지
English: Of course, you have to eat your in-laws' chicken with rice.

Korean: 키키 처갓집 치킨 되게 달지 않아?
English: Isn't Kiki's in-laws' chicken really sweet?
The original food is sweet and salty

Korean: 키키 아 인정 처갓집 슈프림 너무 먹고 싶다!
English: Kiki, I really want to eat the Supreme from my in-laws' house!
After a long time, I also crave for Supreme from my in-laws

Korean: 키키 나도 ㅜㅜ 아 생각해 보니까 교촌 허니콤보도 맛있겠다!
English: Kiki Me too ㅜㅜ Ah, now that I think about it, Kyochon's Honey Combo looks delicious too!
Kyochon Honey Combo is also really delicious
Are you living alone now?
I live with my parents now
Do you have a dog at home?

Korean: 우리 집에 강아지 두 마리 키워
English: We have two dogs in our house.

Korean: 키키 그래서 너랑 전화하면 항상 강아지 소리가 들리는구나?
English: Kiki: So that's why I always hear puppy sounds when I talk to you on the phone?
Yes, keep barking to be touched

Korean: 키키 아 짖는 이유가 만져 달라는 거야?
English: Kiki, are you barking because you want me to touch you?
Yeah, if you look at me, I won't bark.

Korean: 키키 지금 집에 부모님 안 계셔?
English: Kiki, aren't your parents at home right now?
I don't really care about you

Korean: 키키 근데 너네 집 아파트 아니야?
English: Kiki, but isn't your house an apartment?

Korean: 아니 나는 상가 주택에 살고 있어
English: No I live in a commercial building

Korean: 그렇구나 강아지 저렇게 짖는데 사람들이 뭐라고 안 함? 키키
English: I see. What do people say when a dog barks like that? Kiki
It's okay because there are no apartments around

Korean: 키키 오 너네 집 강아지들은 아주 운이 좋구만!
English: Kiki Oh, your dogs are so lucky!

Korean: 맘껏 짖어도 아무도 뭐라고 안 해
English: No one will say anything even if you bark all you want

Korean: 너는 학생 때 학교 어떻게 갔어?
English: How did you go to school when you were a student?

Korean: 기차도 타고 버스 타고 자차도 몰고 그랬어
English: I took the train, I took the bus, I drove my own car, etc.

Korean: 너 고딩 때 기차 타고 학교 다녔어?
English: Did you take the train to school when you were in high school?
When I was in high school, I took the bus.

Korean: 아 진짜? 너네 버스비 그때 얼마였어?
English: Oh really? How much was your bus fare back then?
When I was a student, it was 1200 won.
I see. How old are you now?
I'm 22 now, I'm old
Wow, you're old,
A latte costs a thousand won for a bus ticket!
It's 1500 won these days, but it's too expensive.

Korean: 맞아, 너 지금 논산에서 살고 있어?
English: Right, are you living in Nonsan now?

Korean: 아니 나는 지금 전주에 살고 있어
English: No, I live in Jeonju now
Are the bus fares similar in Jeonju and Nonsan?

Korean: 아 그래? 지역마다 다 다른 줄 알았어
English: Oh really? I thought it was different in each region.

Korean: 키키 아니야 다른데 논산이랑 전주랑은 버스비가 똑같음!
English: Kiki, no, it's different. The bus fare between Nonsan and Jeonju is the same!
Oh really I didn't know
I thought it was different
Do you have a part-time job right now?
I'm helping out at my dad's store.
Oh really? What does your dad do for a living?
My dad runs a restaurant
Do you know Codari?

Korean: 키키 헐 코다리? 나 코다리조림 킬러여!
English: Kiki, huh? I'm a killer of braised codfish!
The truth is that adding shiitake mushrooms to braised codfish is the best

Korean: 키키 아 대박 오랜만에 코다리 조림 먹고 싶다!
English: Kiki, wow, I want to eat braised codfish for the first time in a long time!
Have you tried codfish ribs and seafood?

Korean: 어? 아니? 그거 뭔가 신흥삼합 같은 느낌인데?
English: Huh? No? That feels like some kind of new trio?
It's really delicious, try it

Korean: 오 너네 집 가면 그거 먹을 수 있어?
English: Oh, can I eat that if I go to your house?
Of course our house's codfish is delicious

Korean: 헐 너네 집 코다리 하고 있었다니 나 무조건 달려갈 거임!
English: Wow, you guys were talking about your house, I'm definitely going to run there!
You are always welcome
I'll make it delicious for you when you come

Korean: 키키 나 거기다가 국수사리도 넣어줄 거지?
English: Kiki, you're going to put some noodles in there too, right?

Korean: 당연하지 소스에 비벼 먹으면 진짜 맛있어
English: Of course, it's really delicious when mixed with sauce
How are your brothers?
Do you have a younger brother?
I have an older brother and a younger brother at home.

Korean: 어 그러면 오빠 분은 지금 몇 살이셔,?
English: Oh, then how old are you now?
My brother is 25 years old now.
Then, you must have been discharged from the military? Pil-tung~

Korean: 아니 우리 오빠는 캐나다에 살아서 군대 안 가
English: No, my brother lives in Canada and doesn't have to go to the military.

Korean: 아 진짜? 왜 지금 캐나다에 계셔?
English: Oh really? Why are you in Canada now?

Korean: 대학교를 그쪽으로 가서 계속 사는 중이야
English: I went to college there and am still living there.

Korean: 아 진짜? 오빠 공부 진짜 잘하나 봐!
English: Oh really? Oppa, you must be really good at studying!
I want to deny it, but it's true...

Korean: 키키 그러면 캐나다에서 돌아오면 군대 가야 하는 거 아니야
English: Kiki, then when you come back from Canada, you have to go to the military, right?

Korean: 아니 영주권을 따서 안 가도 돼
English: No, you don't have to go there after getting a green card

Korean: 헐 키키 그러면 오빠 본 지는 얼마나 됐어?
English: Oh my gosh, Kiki, how long has it been since you last saw me?

Korean: 한 이년 정도는 안 본 거 같아
English: I don't think I've seen you in about two years

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 그러면 영상 통화만 지금까지 쭉 했겠네?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ So we've only been doing video calls up until now?

Korean: 아니 영상 통화도 잘 안 해
English: No, I don't do video calls that often either
Are you studying now?

Korean: 지금 다른 대학 편입 준비 중이야
English: I'm currently preparing to transfer to another university.

Korean: 아 진짜 어디 대학교 갈 예정이야?
English: Oh, really, where do you plan on going to college?
My parents want me to go to Jeonbuk National University, but not me.
So what is your major now?
My parents worked in the restaurant business, so I went to Sikyeong.

Korean: 식영과? 내 친구도 식영과 나왔는데 공부 엄청 하더라!
English: Food and beverage? My friend also graduated from food and beverage and he studied a lot!
Yeah, there's so much to study

Korean: ㅜㅜ 그렇겠다 그러면 전북대도 식영과로 들어가는 거야?
English: ㅜㅜ I see. Then, does that mean I can go to Jeonbuk National University’s food science department?
I think so
I want to go to another department

Korean: 근데 같은 과면 왜 굳이 편입해?
English: But why do you insist on transferring the same fruit?
My parents want me to get a four-year degree

Korean: 키키 4년제 학위 따서 너는 어디 가고 싶은데?
English: Kiki, where do you want to go after getting your four-year degree?

Korean: 나는 식영으로 취업은 하고 싶지 않아
English: I don't want to get a job as a chef.

Korean: 키키 아니 4년제 식영과 나와서 취업을 안 한다니!
English: Kiki, you're not going to get a job after graduating from a 4-year food and beverage program?
I want to try something different

Korean: 부모님이 코다리조림 음식점을 같이 하고 계시는 거야?
English: Are your parents running a braised codfish restaurant together?

Korean: 맞아 아빠가 코다리조림 음식점을 크게 하셔
English: Yes, my dad runs a big restaurant that serves braised codfish.
Kiki, I see. Are you doing it in Jeonju?
Not only in Jeonju but all over the country

Korean: 키키 와 대박 엄청 크게 하시는 구나?
English: Kiki, you're doing it so big, huh?
Yes, I'm busy building a factory this time.

Korean: 헐 대박 그러면 마트에서 너네 집 코다리조림 식품 먹을 수 있어?
English: Wow, awesome. Then you can eat your home-made braised pig's trotters at the mart?

Korean: 마트 쪽으로 유통은 하지 않고 음식점으로 해
English: We do not distribute to marts, but to restaurants.

Korean: 그렇구나 그러면 사업을 하시는 거 아니야?
English: I see. So you're running a business?

Korean: 맞아 코다리조림 음식점 사업을 크게 하시고 있지
English: Yes, you are running a big restaurant business.

Korean: 키키 그래서 아부지는 지금 식당을 운영하고 계셔 아니면 공장을 돌아보고 계셔
English: Kiki So, your father is either running a restaurant or looking after a factory now.
You run a restaurant now and also visit factories.
What is your mother doing?
Well, my mom is a housewife.

Korean: 아 그렇구나 식당 운영은 같이 안 하시고?
English: Oh, I see. So you don't run the restaurant together?
Don't do it separately
Only dad does it
Do you have a boyfriend now?
No, there isn't...
I'm so depressed

Korean: 왜? 니가 안 사귀는 거야 아니면 좋아하는 애 있어?
English: Why? Are you not dating or do you have someone you like?

Korean: 아직 사귈 마음이 없는 거 같아
English: I don't think you have any intention of dating yet

Korean: 뭐 남자 쪽에서 사귈 마음이 없다는 거야?
English: What do you mean the guy has no interest in dating?

Korean: 아니 내가 아직 연애하고 싶지 않아
English: No, I don't want to date yet

Korean: 왜? 지금 공부하는 거 때문에 그래
English: Why? Because I'm studying right now.
Yeah, I don't have any free time

Korean: 그렇구나 ㅜㅜ 그래도 어렸을 때 한 번이라도 사귀어!
English: Oh, I see. ㅜㅜ But at least date once when you're young!
Everyone around me said the same thing
So I decided to give it a try
Kiki: So are you single now?
Well, of course not Mosul
So when was your last relationship?
It seems like a very long time ago

Korean: 너 강아지 두 마리 데리고 있다고 했지?
English: You said you have two dogs?

Korean: 웅 한 마리는 말티즈고 다른 한 마리는 닥스훈트야
English: Yeah, one is a Maltese and the other is a Dachshund.
Wow, what color is the dachshund's fur?
Our dog's fur is black
Kiki looks so cute

Kiki dog funny kiki

Korean: 근데 현장이면 못 같은 거 많이 뿌려져 있지 않아?

don't worry!

Korean: 오빠 37년 전에 과로사로 죽은 군인이 결국에는 집단 내 구타로 죽은 걸로 나왔대!

that's right,

no

cat?

really?

Kiki dog laugh

that's right

of course

Kiki okki okki~

Oh, right,

I don't know Kiki

Pour- this is it, pour-

That's luck

Daecheon?
These days, grilled clams are delicious!
I want to go to Daecheon!

Korean: 나도 그래서 바다 가고 싶어 ㅠㅠ
English: That's why I want to go to the beach too ㅠㅠ

Is the Hal Kiki Corn story true?

What are you doing?

Korean: 낮에 나 없을 때 와서 청소하고 친구들 불러서 놀아 키키

Korean: 헐 나도 그런 거 알지 ㅠㅠ 배 찜질해줘 온으로 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my, I know that too ㅠㅠ Give me a steaming hot bath ㅠㅠ

Korean: 흙 ㅜㅜ 어쩐지 어제 식욕이 대박이더라고!
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ I had a really big appetite yesterday!
Women are really accurate, Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 나 그래서 어제 야식 먹었잖아!
English: Kiki: That's right, that's why I ate a late-night snack yesterday!

Korean: 난 저번 주에 끝났는데 야식으로는 뭐?
English: I finished last week, what should I have for a midnight snack?

Korean: 나 크레미랑 핫바 편의점 가서 사와서 먹었어 키키
English: I went to the convenience store with Cremi and Hot Bar and bought some and ate them Kiki

Korean: 우와 우와 맛있겠다 나도 어제 핫도그 시켜 먹음 키키
English: Wow wow it looks delicious I ordered a hotdog yesterday too Kiki

Korean: 키키 오 설마 명량핫도그 시켜 먹은 거!?
English: Kiki Oh, did you really order a Myeongryang hotdog!?

Korean: 맞앙 오늘 남은 거 운동 다녀와서 먹어야지
English: Yeah, I have to eat what's left after I go to the gym today.

Korean: 키키 그래 그래 나는 오늘 뜨쥬갈 예정!
English: Kiki Yeah yeah I'm planning on going today!

Korean: 설탕 뿌려야 되는 거 알지 치즈 쭈욱 감자
English: You know you have to sprinkle sugar on the potatoes with cheese
Does your sister have a microwave at home?

Korean: 응 전자레인지 남자친구가 사줘서 있어 하하
English: Yeah, I have a microwave because my boyfriend bought it for me haha
I see. You said there was a TV originally, right?

Korean: 응 거기 두개 있었는데 한개 빼달라 그랬어!
English: Yeah, there were two there, but I asked them to take one away!
Wow, there were two TVs!?

Korean: 웅 방에 큰 거 하나 거실에 벽걸이 키키
