English: Yeah, one big one in the room and a wall-mounted Kiki in the living room.

Korean: 와 쩐다 키키 언니 그러면 풀옵션으로 들어간 거네?
English: Wow, that's awesome. So, Kiki, you went with the full option?

Korean: 맞아 풀옵 이긴 한데 약간 애매 키키 가전제품 꾸졌어
English: Yes, it's a full option, but it's a bit ambiguous. Kiki's home appliances are decorated

Korean: 아 진짜? 어떤 게 기본 옵션으로 들어가 있었어?
English: Oh really? What was included as a default option?
Just a refrigerator, a washing machine, and a TV.

Korean: 어엇, 나는 냉장고 세탁기 전자레인지, TV 왜 안 줘,
English: Hey, why don't you give me a refrigerator, washing machine, microwave, and TV?
Oh, so you're buying a MacBook? Kiki

Korean: 키키 엉 나 넷플 맥북으로 볼 거다!
English: Kiki, I'm going to watch Netflix on my MacBook!

Korean: 개꿀이네 넷플릭스 나도 맥북 사고 싶다
English: Netflix is so great. I want to buy a MacBook too.
This is all debt, debt~
Yeah? But you still have to invest in yourself.

Korean: 언니 근데 차 사면 유지비는 예상하고 사는 거야?
English: Sister, when you buy a car, do you anticipate the maintenance costs?

Korean: 응 엄마한테 물어봤지ㅜㅜ 좀 목돈이긴 한데
English: Yeah, I asked my momㅜㅜ It's a bit expensive though
Oh, your mom drives a car too?

Korean: 응 엄마 아빠 두분 다 끌고 다니셔!
English: Yeah, Mom and Dad, take them both!

Korean: 와 그러면 언니네 차 두 개 이상 있겠네?
English: Wow, then your sister must have more than two cars?

Korean: 맞아 그래서 가끔 아빠 술 드실 때 나 대리 시킴
English: Yeah, that's why sometimes I make my dad drink instead.
Hey Kiki, your dad is awesome!

Korean: 그러면 부모님이 타고 계시는 차종은 뭐야?
English: So what kind of car do your parents drive?
Both of them are SUVs so they look good

Korean: 와 역시 차는 커 봐야 한다니까~?
English: Wow, I guess the car has to be big, right?

Korean: 맞아 맞아 모닝같은 거 타면 무섭더라고...
English: Yeah, yeah, it was scary when I rode something like the Morning...

Korean: 와, 언니 모닝 대형버스 안에 깔려서 짜부된 거 봤어?
English: Wow, did you see that big bus crushed inside the morning bus?
Yeah, it's really scary when I see things like thatㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 그래서 언니는 케이빠이브 보고 있다규~?
English: Right ㅜㅜ So you're watching K-Pop?

Korean: 응 맞아 나라도 싼 차 타야지 에혀 하하
English: Yeah that's right I should drive a cheap car too haha

Korean: 키키 아니 그게 싼 차라니 역시 언니는 브루주아였어!
English: Kiki: No, that's a cheap car. As expected, you're a bourgeois!

Korean: 빨리 차 사고 싶어 그만 얘기해 차 얘기!
English: Stop talking about cars, I want to buy a car soon!

Korean: 언니는 지금 회사 그만 둘 생각이야?
English: Are you thinking of quitting your job now, sister?
Yeah, after the Youth Tomorrow Filling is over, I'll quit my job.
Okay, so it's going to be an 8 month countdown?

Korean: 응 맞아 디데이도 해놨어 카톡에 캬 하하
English: Yeah that's right I even made a D-Day post on KakaoTalk haha

Korean: 와 키키 언니네 직장 상사분들도 그 디데이 뜻 알고 있어?
English: Wow, Kiki's bosses at work also know what D-Day means?

Korean: 아니 모르지 키키 상사라 해봤자 부장님은 눈치 챘을 듯
English: No, I don't know, even if you say Kiki, the manager probably noticed

Korean: 아앗 키키 근데 왜 그만두려고 하는 거야 일이 힘들어?
English: Aaah Kiki, but why are you quitting? Is work hard?

Korean: 아니 그건 아니고 사람 관계에서 지쳤으 너무 ㅜ
English: No, that's not it. I'm just so tired of human relationships.

Korean: 거기 진상 고객이 많아서 그래? ㅜㅜ
English: Is that because there are a lot of regular customers there? ㅜㅜ

Korean: 에이 그러면 벌써 그만뒀지 직원들끼리 지친겨ㅠ
English: Hey, then I quit already. The employees are tired.
What happened with the staff?

Korean: 응 한 명이랑 계속 부딪히네 힘들다ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, I keep bumping into one person, it's hardㅜㅜ

Korean: 하, 근데 어떤 직종이든 같이 일하는 사람이랑 안 맞으면 진짜 힘든 거 같아,
English: Ha, but I think it's really hard in any job if you don't get along with the people you work with.

Korean: 맞아 일이 힘들면 머하냐고 ㅠㅠ그거라도 좋아야지
English: That's right, if things are hard, what can I do? ㅠㅠ Even that should be good

Korean: 맞아,,나도 그랬던 적 있어서 잘 알아,
English: Yeah, I know because I've been there too.
How did you solve it? I'm jealousㅜㅜ I'm going to give up

Korean: 언니 혹시 피엑스 상품 써본 적 있어?
English: Sister, have you ever used PX products?

Korean: 응 그거 초록색 화장품 이름 뭐지
English: Yeah, what's the name of that green cosmetic?

Korean: 아 알지알지 닥터지 제품 말하는 거지?
English: Oh, I know, you're talking about Dr. G products, right?
I tried Dr. G and Dr. G snail cream

Korean: 맞아 키키 그거 진짜 인기잖아 올영에서도 팔던데?
English: Yeah Kiki, that's really popular. They sell it at All Young too, right?

Korean: 그거 진짜 싸고 촉촉 하더라 개좋아 ~ 맞아
English: That's really cheap and moist, I love it~ Yeah

Korean: 맞아 내가 아는 분들도 다 그거 쓰더라 수분크림!
English: Yeah, everyone I know uses that moisturizing cream!

Korean: 근데 올영에서 사는 것보다 피엑스에서 사는 게 훨 쌈
English: But it's much cheaper to live in PX than in Olyeong.

Korean: 맞아 내가 보니까 올영에서 2만 원이 넘는데 피엑스는 만 원도 안 함!
English: That's right, I saw that it's over 20,000 won at Ollyong, but PX is less than 10,000 won!

Korean: 그래서 나는 연무대가 본집이라 가끔 군인 마트 가면 사지 !
English: So, since Yeonmu-dae is my hometown, I sometimes go to the military mart and buy things!

Korean: 키키 오 대박 언니도 군인마트 갈 수 있어?
English: Kiki Oh, Daebak, can you go to the Military Mart too?

Korean: 할아버지가 군인이셨어서 증 있으면 갈 수 있어ㅜㅜ
English: My grandfather was a soldier, so if you have a certificate, you can goㅜㅜ

Korean: 와 대박 언니 나는 그러면 에이에이치씨 아이크림 부탁해도 돼!?
English: Wow, awesome, sis. Then can I ask for AHC eye cream?

Korean: 좋지 거기 가면 라면이랑 음식 엄청 싸게 살 수 있어 키키
English: Great, if you go there you can buy ramen and food really cheaply Kiki

Korean: 키키 와 대박 부럽다 나중에 언니 따라가야겠다!
English: Kiki, I'm so jealous. I have to go with you later!

Korean: 아이스크림도 싸고 팩도 엄청 싸 특히 팩 강츄!
English: The ice cream is cheap and the pack is super cheap too. I especially recommend the pack!
Sister, you have three siblings, right?

Korean: 응 난 삼 남매야ㅠㅠ 내가 첫째야 흑
English: Yeah I'm one of three siblingsㅠㅠ I'm the oldest

Korean: 누가 공부를 제일 잘하고 있는 거 같아?
English: Who do you think is studying the best?

Korean: 아마 남동생이 제일 잘하지 않을까 키키
English: Kiki, I think my younger brother is the best

Korean: 진짜? 여동생도 물치과면 공부 꽤 했을 텐데!?
English: Really? My little sister must have studied quite a bit for dental school too!?

Korean: 아냐 키키 남동생만 유일하게 인문계 나왔거든 키키
English: No, Kiki's younger brother is the only one who majored in humanities. Kiki

Korean: 와오 키키 그렇구나 남동생 그러면 야자시간 가졌겠다 ㅜ
English: Wow Kiki, I see. Then your little brother must have had a free time. ㅜ

Korean: 응 맞아 그리고 개는 그래서 아래로 대학 내려갔잖아ㅠ 등급 맞춰서
English: Yeah, that's right, and that's why the dog went down to college. It matched the grades.

Korean: ㅜㅜ헐 ㅜㅜ 수능 이번에 안 본대?
English: ㅜㅜOh my gosh ㅜㅜ I guess I’m not taking the CSAT this time?

Korean: 보겠지 근데 요즘엔 공부 안하고 몸 만드느라 정신없음
English: I see, but these days I'm too busy working out to study.

Korean: 아고 키키 그래 공부보다 건강한 게 최고지!
English: Oh Kiki, that's right, being healthy is better than studying!

Korean: 근데 진짜 집에서만 운동했는데 몸 짱 좋아졌어
English: But I really only worked out at home and my body got in great shape.

Korean: 와 부럽다 ㅜㅜ 그것도 근데 정신력이 있어야 하는데!
English: Wow, I'm jealous ㅜㅜ But that also requires mental strength!

Korean: 맞아ㅜㅜ 거의 마동석은 아닌데 얼추 비슷해졌어 키키
English: That's rightㅜㅜ It's not quite Ma Dong-seok, but it's similar to Kiki
Kiki, is that it?
Shouldn't that be something you're born with?
I really had a ton of belly fat, it was the best ever

Korean: 언니네 가족여행 일 년에 한 번씩은 간다고 했잖아!
English: You said you go on a family trip with your sister once a year!
Yeah, I was planning to go to Ulleungdo this time ㅠㅜ

Korean: 아 진짜? 올해도 못 가는 거야?
English: Oh really? You can't go this year either?

Korean: 웅 왕복만 해도 거의 100만원 넘고 잘 못 간대 날씨 때문에…
English: Yeah, a round trip costs almost 1 million won and it’s not easy because of the weather…

Korean: 헐, 지금 날씨가 추워져서 그런 가,?
English: Oh, is it because the weather is cold now?

Korean: 몰라 울릉도는 날씨 진짜 중요해서 배 잘 안 뜬대 ㅠㅜ
English: I don't know, the weather on Ulleungdo is really important so boats don't sail often ㅠㅜ

Korean: 내가 아는 오빠 울릉도 사람인데 배가 하루에 두 개밖에 없대
English: I know a guy from Ulleungdo, and he said there are only two boats a day.

Korean: 아 진짜? 그래서 더 그런가 봐 넌 가족여행 안 가?
English: Oh really? That's why I guess you don't go on family trips?

Korean: 어 우리는 다 여행 취향이 다 달라서 같이  안 가 키키
English: Oh, we all have different travel tastes, so we don't go together.

Korean: 아 진짜? 헐 대체 왜 가족인데!
English: Oh really? Why on earth are we family!

Korean: 키키 아니야 우리는 자기만의 시간을 더 중요하게 생각하는 집안이라 헤헤
English: Kiki no we are a family that values our own time more hehe

Korean: 우리는 다들 돌아다니는 거 좋아해서 맞나 봐 키키
English: I guess we all like to move around, Kiki

Korean: 키키 다행이다 우리는 펜션이 1순위 맛집이 1순위 이런 식으로 다 달라!
English: Kiki, thank goodness we are all different, with pensions being number one and restaurants being number one!

Korean: 구경하고 돌아다니는 거 다들 좋아해 호캉스보단 키키
English: Everyone likes to go sightseeing and wander around. Kiki is better than a vacation.

Korean: 키키 다행이다 최근에는 어디 갔다 왔다고 했지?
English: Kiki, thank goodness. Where did you say you've been recently?

Korean: 최근에 가족이랑 어디 갔다 왔더라 ㅜ 오래돼서 기억이
English: Where did you go with your family recently? It's been so long that I can't remember.

Korean: 언니는 동생이랑 연애상담 같은 거 자주 해?
English: Do you often give relationship advice to your younger sibling?

Korean: 아니 자주 안 해 그냥 싸우면 가끔 욕하더라
English: No, not often. When we fight, sometimes we swear.
Kiki, you recently got a call from your little sister?

Korean: 한참 남자친구가 큰 잘못 해서 카톡 왔었어 키키
English: My boyfriend made a big mistake and I got a KakaoTalk message from him Kiki
What the hell is going on?

Korean: 자기 친구랑 바람 나서 뭐 헤어졌다나 머라나 그러더니 다시 만남
English: He said he broke up with his friend because he cheated on him and then they met again

Korean: 헐! 키키 바람은 너무 큰 사건 아니야!?
English: Wow! Isn't Kiki's wind a huge deal!?

Korean: 그 친구랑은 아마 절교하고 남친이랑은 용서해줘서 그런 듯
English: I think she broke up with that friend and forgave her boyfriend.
Oh my goshㅜㅜ My friend was more at fault!

Korean: 몰라 둘 다 똑같아 보이던디 난 지들이 알아서 하겠지
English: I don't know, they both look the same, I guess they'll figure it out

Korean: 키키 그치 언니가 봤을 때는 애기들 연애지?
English: Kiki, when you saw it, it was like kids dating, right?

Korean: 맞아 남 연애는 아무리 머라 해도 안 들으니까 키키 알아서 하라구래 ~
English: That's right, no matter what I tell you, men won't listen to me when it comes to love, so Kiki, do what you want~

Korean: 키키 개웃기 우리 언니 남친은 나랑 동갑이라 나랑 싸움
English: Kiki is so funny My sister's boyfriend is the same age as me so we fight

Korean: 아 진짜? 왜 싸워 키키 진심으로 치고 박고?
English: Oh really? Why are you fighting Kiki and hitting him so hard?

Korean: 키키 아니 키키 그냥 말장난 하는 거지!
English: Kiki no Kiki I'm just playing with words!

Korean: 아니 언니가 걔 보고 형부라고 부르라고 하잖아!
English: No, my sister told me to call him brother-in-law!
I don't like it!

Korean: 아 결혼한 거 아닌데 형부라고 부르래? 키키
English: Oh, we're not married, but you call me brother-in-law? Kiki
Sister, did you say the cat was female?
No it's a male it's a man it's a man Kiki

Korean: 아앗 키키 너무 예뻐서 암컷인 줄!
English: Aah Kiki, you're so pretty I thought you were a female!

Korean: 빨리 마요 보러 퇴근 하고 싶다고~
English: I want to hurry up and get off work to see Mayo~

Korean: 키키 마요 나도 또 보고 싶다 마요 중성화 수술 했다고 했지?
English: Kiki Mayo I want to see you again too Mayo said you got neutered right?

Korean: 웅 키키 나의 비타민 같은 존재야 하하
English: Yeah Kiki, you're like my vitamin haha

Korean: 키키 마요 몇 살 때 수술 시켰어?
English: Kiki Mayo, at what age did you have the surgery?

Korean: 어릴 때, 갠 진짜 개냥이라 아침에 부비적 장난 아니야
English: When I was little, I was a real dog and I wouldn't play around in the morning.

Korean: 키키 와 개부럽다 우리 오복이는 그딴 거 없어!
English: Kiki, I'm so jealous of you, our Obok doesn't have anything like that!
How much did your sister's surgery cost?

Korean: 한 이십 정도 나온 거 같은데 검사랑 이것저것 해서
English: I think it came out to about 20, and they did tests and other things

Korean: 그렇구나 애기 수술 시간은 몇 시간 정도 걸렸어?
English: I see. How many hours did the baby's surgery take?

Korean: 근데 6.7개월도 안돼서 해가지구 기억도 안나 개도 모를 꺼야ㅠ
English: But it hasn't even been 6.7 months, so I don't remember the sun or the dog.

Korean: 나는 우리 오복이 빨리 시켰어 5개월 때 키키
English: I had our Obok quickly when he was 5 months old.
Yeah, that's what they said to do around that time.

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 우리 오복이는 대전가서 했어!
English: That's right ㅜㅜ Our Oh Bok-i went to Daejeon and did it!

Korean: 내가 더 긴장됐어 수술할 때 키키
English: I was more nervous during the surgery Kiki
Sister, what brand of sportswear do you like?
I think Adidas is cute these days Kiki

Korean: 아디다스~ 고딩 때 검은색 져지 필수인 거 알지 알지?
English: Adidas~ You know that black jerseys are a must in high school, right?
Right Kiki, you wore Adidas too

Korean: 키키 당연하지 교복 위에 져지 필수지~
English: Kiki Of course, a jersey is required over the uniform~
Ah, the school uniform is really ㅠㅠ so so memorable

Korean: 키키 그치 ㅜㅜ 근데 요즘에는 젝시믹스가 대세더라 거기랑 안다르!
English: Kiki, right ㅜㅜ But these days, Sechkies are the trend, so it's different from that!
Have you tried on the sexymix leggings? They're so good~

Korean: 나도 친구가 생일 선물로 거기 레깅스 사 달라고 하더라!
English: My friend asked me to buy her some leggings for her birthday too!

Korean: 그거 싸고 진짜 질 너무 좋아
English: It's cheap and the quality is really good

Korean: 그리고 초반에 모델 제시였던 거 알아?
English: And did you know that model Jessie was presented in the beginning?
I guess I can't not buy it?

Korean: 응 맞아 키키 제시가 모델일 때부터 알아 봤지
English: Yeah, that's right, I knew Kiki Jessie since she was a model.

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 하나 사야겠더라 언니는 레깅스 하나에 얼마 주고 샀어?
English: Kiki, that's right, I should buy one too. How much did you pay for a pair of leggings, sis?

Korean: 나 그거 백화점에서 이만원대 주고 산구 같은데 키키
English: I think I bought that for 20,000 won at a department store.

Korean: 키키 어 그거 백화점 입점 브랜드야?
English: Kiki, is that a department store brand?
Is this a hit?
Yeah, that was at the Hyundai outlet.

Korean: 언니 내가 저번에 뽑기 게임 얘기했잖아!
English: Sister, I told you about the lottery game last time!

Korean: 응 일등 했다고 한 뽑기 게임?
English: Yeah, that's the lottery game you said you won first place in?

Korean: 맞아 우리 어렸을 때 했던 게임 있잖아 요즘은 얼마인 줄 알아?
English: Yeah, there's that game we used to play when we were kids. Do you know how much it costs these days?

Korean: 얼만데ㅜㅜㅜ 설마 만원 넘는 건 아니겠지
English: How much is it?ㅜㅜㅜ Surely it can't be more than ten thousand won?
Huh? No, it was 100 won back then!?

Korean: 그럼 얼만데! 요즘에도 그걸 하는 사람이 있나 보니
English: How much is it? I guess there are still people who do that these days.

Korean: 키키 나야, 친구들이랑 문방구 가서 해 봤어 500으로 올랐더라,
English: Kiki, I went to the stationery store with my friends and tried it. It went up to 500.
Wow, it costs 500 won to pick one?

Korean: 어, 일등도 우리 때는 문상줬잖아 지금은 문상도 안 줘,
English: Oh, in our time, we used to give condolences to first place, but now we don't even get condolences.

Korean: 그럼 일등이 뭐야 그땐 뭐 나왔어 키키
English: Then what is first place? What came out then, Kiki?

Korean: 키키 아 일등 뭐 방탄 브로마이드!? 그런 거더라!?
English: Kiki, what is this, a bulletproof bromide!? Something like that!?

Korean: 거지 같네 그게 머야 키키 그런 거 좋아하나
English: That's so beggarly, what is that? Kiki, do you like that kind of thing?

Korean: 키키 근데 내가 문방구 아줌마한테 물어봤는데 그거 뽑을라고 성인도 온대,
English: Kiki But I asked the stationery store lady and she said that adults also come to pick those.
Oh my gosh, is it because of the squid game? Kiki

Korean: 키키 아니 내가 갔을 때는 재작년이었어 키키
English: Kiki No, it was the year before last when I went Kiki

Korean: 아 그러면 성인들은 그냥 재미로 하나 봄
English: Oh, then adults just do it for fun

Korean: 언니는 산이 좋아 계곡이 좋아 바다가 좋아?
English: Sister, do you like mountains, valleys, and the sea?

Korean: 나는 산도 좋고 바다도 좋아 하하 계곡은 별로
English: I like mountains and the sea haha I don't really like valleys

Korean: 키키  왜? 계곡이 제일 좋지 않아?
English: Kiki, why? Isn't the valley the best?

Korean: 계곡은 뭔가 덥기도 하고 ㅠ 나이 들면 가기 좋을 거 같아
English: The valley is kind of hot ㅠ I think it would be a good place to go when you get older
The valley is hot, huh?
Isn't this the coolest!?
I like the valley the best~

Korean: 그래? 난 바다는 그냥 물멍하기 좋고 산은 마음이 편해져
English: Really? I just like the ocean and the mountains make me feel at ease.

Korean: 키키 아 바다 인정 그러면 언니는 바다에서 노는 거 좋아해?
English: Kiki Ah, I admit it, so do you like playing in the ocean?

Korean: 근데 물은 안 좋아해 키키 안 들어가고 보기만 함
English: But I don't like water. Kiki doesn't go in and just looks.

Korean: 나도 바다는 놀기엔 너무 무섭지 않아?
English: Isn't the ocean too scary for me to play in?

Korean: 그래…바다 들어갔다 오면 찝찝해 그리고 계속은 더워 ㅜ
English: Yeah... I feel uncomfortable when I go into the ocean and it's still hot ㅜ

Korean: 키키 맞아 바다 그리고 소금물이라 짭짜름 하잖어!
English: Kiki, that's right, it's salty because it's the sea and salt water!

Korean: 맞아 그리고 바다에서 죽는 사람도 엄청 많잖아ㅜ...
English: That's right, and there are a lot of people who die in the sea...

Korean: 키키 헉, 언니 죽은 사람 봤어,?
English: Kiki Hey, sis, have you seen the dead person?

Korean: 아니 그건 아니고 ㅠㅠ 헤헤 뉴스에서만 봤지
English: No, that's not it ㅠㅠ Hehe I only saw it on the news

Korean: 키키 그렇지? 나도 그래서 튜브 없으면 절대 안 들어감!
English: Kiki Right? That's why I never go in without a tube!

Korean: 맞아 무조건 튜브 필수지 어디든 키키
English: Yes, tube is a must, no matter where you go Kiki
Sister, what's the weather like in Daejeon today?

Korean: 지금은 뭔가 비 올 거 같기도 하고~
English: It looks like it's going to rain now~
Really? It's so hot in Nonsan right now!
Is it hot in Nonsan? My boyfriend went on a business trip and came back...

Korean: 헉,  남친분 소방대원이라고 했지! 머선 일이야!
English: Oh my gosh, your boyfriend is a firefighter! What's going on?

Korean: 난 오늘 진짜 운동할꺼야ㅜㅜ 날씨 좋아야 해
English: I'm really going to exercise todayㅜㅜ The weather has to be nice

Korean: 키키 어 그러네 근데 지금 습해?
English: Kiki: Oh, right, but is it humid now?
Do you think it's going to rain?

Korean: 모르겠어 그냥 오늘 운동하고 떡볶이 먹으러 갈꺼야
English: I don't know, I'm just going to work out today and go eat tteokbokki

Korean: 키키 운동을 하는 이유가 거기에 있었구먼!?
English: So that's why Kiki exercises!?

Korean: 당연하지 먹기 위해서 한다 서울은 어때 날씨 키키
English: Of course I do it to eat. How is the weather in Seoul? Kiki

Korean: 키키 우리 회사 지금 에어컨 틀고 있어^^
English: Kiki, our company is turning on the air conditioner right now^^
It's going to be hot again today when I take the hell train home from work...

Korean: 키키 맞아, 나 심지어 얇은 긴팔 입었는데도 더워,
English: Kiki, that's right, I'm hot even though I'm wearing thin long sleeves,

Korean: 헐 에어컨 틀면 머리 안 아파?
English: Wow, doesn't your head hurt when you turn on the air conditioner?

Korean: 음,,, 차라리 더운 것보다 나은 거 같아!
English: Hmm,,, I guess it's better than being hot!
No, but it's scary if you get air conditioning sicknessㅜㅜ
Sister, Shin Min-a is so popular these days!
Is it because of the drama called Cha Cha Cha?

Korean: 키키 맞아 신민아가 하는 광고마다 다 대박이래!
English: Kiki, that's right, every commercial that Shin Min-a does is a huge hit!
Oh really? Shin Min-a has a good imageㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 ㅠㅠ 언니 쿠론이라는 브랜드 알아?
English: Right ㅠㅠ Unnie, do you know the brand called Kuron?

Korean: 아니 몰라 어디서 많이 들어본 거 같기도
English: No, I don't know, but I think I've heard it somewhere

Korean: 그 가방 브랜드 있는데 신민아가 들고 지금 2차 완판이래,
English: There's that bag brand, Shin Min-a is carrying it and it's currently sold out for the second time.

Korean: 아 진짜 왜 그러냐 키키 신민아 인기 대박이구만
English: Oh seriously, why is that? Kiki Shin Min-a is super popular.

Korean: 키키 그러니까 그러면 언니 퍼마일이라는 보험 알아?
English: Kiki: So, do you know about the insurance called Permile?

Korean: 아니 난 다 몰라 ㅜㅜ 아무것도 모르나 바
English: No, I don't know anything ㅜㅜ I don't know anything

Korean: 키키 나는 알거든 광고에 퍼마일~ 이렇게 하는 신민아 광고 못 봤어?
English: Kiki, I know, have you not seen Shin Min-a's commercial where she does this?

Korean: 응 못 봤어 광고 잘 안 봐서 그런가바...
English: Yeah, I didn't see it. Maybe it's because I don't watch advertisements often...

Korean: 키키 그렇구낭 ㅠㅠ 이것도 신민아 때문에 유명해졌대 키키 5개월만에 실적이 300프로나 올랐다고 그러더라 대박이지!?
English: Kiki, that's right ㅠㅠ This also became famous because of Shin Min-a. They said that Kiki's performance went up 300% in just 5 months. Isn't that a hit!?

Korean: 와 신민아 그 드라마 때문에 더 그런거 아니야? 키키
English: Wow, Shin Min-ah, isn't it because of that drama? Kiki
No, this was before the drama came out!
Now the ads are going to keep coming in!

Korean: 대박이다잉 나도 드라마 보고 가방도 사야지
English: Wow, I have to watch the drama and buy a bag too.

Korean: 언니 이번에 일본 지진 났던 거 알아?
English: Sister, did you know that there was an earthquake in Japan recently?

Korean: 응 그거 기사 봤어 일본 무너지는 거 아냐?
English: Yeah, I saw that article. Isn't it about Japan collapsing?

Korean: 일본은 하도 지진이 많이 일어나서 그 정도 가지고는 안 무너지지 키키 그래도 강도가 5. 0이었대!
English: Japan has so many earthquakes that it wouldn't have collapsed with that magnitude, but it was still only a magnitude 5.0!

Korean: 그래도 일본 여행 가고 싶어도 지진 날까 봐 무섭
English: Even though I want to travel to Japan, I'm scared of an earthquake.

Korean: 키키 이번에는 도쿄에서 났다더라, 만약에 코로나 없었으면 사람들 도쿄로 많이 갔었을 텐데,
English: Kiki, this time it happened in Tokyo. If there was no corona, many people would have gone to Tokyo.

Korean: 그러게... 코로나땜에 가지도 못하면서 간접 체험 하기
English: That's right... I can't go because of Corona, so I'm trying to experience it indirectly

Korean: 키키 근데 언니 일본 여행 해본 적 있어?
English: Kiki, have you ever been to Japan?

Korean: 아니 나는 국내밖에 안 돌아다녀 봄ㅠㅠ
English: No, I've only traveled within the country ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그렇구나 나는 오사카랑 후쿠오카 가 봤거든?
English: Oh, I see. I've been to Osaka and Fukuoka.
There are so many temples around here!

Korean: 오오 근데 일본은 초밥 먹으러 가보고 싶긴 해 키키
English: Oh, but I really want to go to Japan to eat sushi Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 초밥 진짜 맛있지 100엔스시 꼭 먹어 간다면!
English: Kiki Ah Sushi is really delicious! If you go, you must try the 100 yen sushi!
What do you recommend about Japan?
I'll try it too when the coronavirus is over

Korean: 근데 언니 무덤 같은 거 어떻게 생각해?
English: But what do you think about things like your sister's grave?

Korean: 일본은 그냥 길가에 무덤 있음 키키
English: Japan just has graves on the side of the road Kiki

Korean: 옴마 무덤 머야 키키 지진 날까 봐 무서워서 겁부터 난다야...
English: Mom, what is the grave? I'm scared that there will be an earthquake...

Korean: 키키 키키 일본은 길가에 무덤이 있거든 절 안에도 무덤 있고,
English: Kiki Kiki In Japan, there are graves on the roadside, and there are graves in temples too.

Korean: 난 한국에만 무덤 있는 줄 알았는데 일본에도 있나 보네
English: I thought there were only graves in Korea, but I guess there are some in Japan too.
Is your sister getting braces right now?

Korean: 아니 나는 교정 끝났지 키키 해방 된 지 몇 년 됨
English: No, I'm done with corrections. It's been a few years since Kiki was liberated.

Korean: 와 대박 그거 하는데 얼마나 걸렸어?
English: Wow, wow, how long did it take you to do that?
2 years and 6 months?

Korean: 교정 했을 때 진짜 두부도 못 먹을 정도로 아팠어 ㅜㅜ
English: When I got braces, it hurt so much I couldn't even eat tofu ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그러면 언니가 몇 살 때부터 한 거지?
English: Then, how old was your sister when you started doing it?
I first did it when I was 22 Kiki

Korean: 그렇구나 그게 조일 때 아픈 거 맞지?
English: I see. That's what hurts when you tighten it, right?

Korean: 응 맞아... 근데 왜 갑자기 교정 하고 싶어?
English: Yeah, that's right... but why do you suddenly want to get braces?

Korean: 어 나는 밑에는 괜찮은데 위에 때문에  ㅜ
English: Oh, I'm okay down there, but because of the up there ㅜ

Korean: 교정하면 이뻐지긴 하지 ㅜㅜ심미적으로 자신감 뿜뿜
English: If you get braces, you'll look pretty ㅜㅜ I'm full of aesthetic confidence

Korean: 키키 그러니까 근데 금액이 상당하잖아 ㅜ
English: Kiki: Well, that's a lot of money, isn't it?

Korean: 나도 밑에는 괜찮은데 위에 때문에 했어 ㅎ
English: I'm okay with the bottom, but I did it because of the top lol

Korean: 아 진짜? 근데 언니 위아래 다 했어?
English: Oh really? But did you do the top and bottom?

Korean: 응 나는 예전에 직원이라 엄청 싸게 했지롱~
English: Yeah, I used to be an employee so I got it really cheap~
I'm jealous, when I asked, they asked for 500.

Korean: 개비싸네 ㄷㄷ 뭐 이리 비싸냐 교정 비싸 원래
English: It's so expensive. Why is it so expensive? Braces are expensive to begin with.

Korean: 대자연 때는 참지 말고 약을 먹는 게 답인가?
English: When it comes to Mother Nature, is it better to take medicine rather than endure it?

Korean: 당연하지 아프기 전에 약 먹어야 되는데ㅜㅜ
English: Of course I should take medicine before I get sickㅜㅜ
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Do you have bad period cramps too, unnie?

Korean: 응 나 엄청 심해 붓고 허리랑 밑에 빠질 거 같아 키키
English: Yeah I'm really swollen and my waist and bottom feel like they're going to fall out Kiki

Korean: 와오, 나도 허리 진짜 아픈데, 왜 생리 하는데 허리가 아픈 걸까?
English: Wow, my back really hurts too. Why does my back hurt when I have my period?

Korean: 내 말이ㅡㅡ 잘 때 배 아파서 잠도 잘 못 자...
English: What I'm saying is-- I can't sleep well because my stomach hurts when I sleep...

Korean: 언니는 그러면 어떤 약 복용하고 있어?
English: Then what kind of medicine are you taking, sister?

Korean: 하루 종일 허리 두들기러 댕겨 그거 무슨 식스!
English: What the heck is that six, spending all day getting your back banged!
Sister, do you know what EZ-RN is?
I'm eating that!

Korean: 이지엔식스 나 그거 먹어! 기억났다 키키
English: Easy Six, eat that! I remembered Kiki

Korean: 키키 그치 나도 이거로 갈아탔어 타이레놀 먹다가!
English: Kiki Yeah, I switched to this too, after taking Tylenol!
Tylenol doesn't work, does it? Admit it?

Korean: 아니 아니 나는 있는데 이게 내성이 생긴대 ㅜ
English: No no I have it but it's said to be resistant to it ㅜ

Korean: 내성 생겨서 나는 안 드는 거 같아ㅡㅡ
English: I think I won't be able to do it because I've become resistant to itㅡㅡ

Korean: 그렇구나 ㅜㅜ 그래도 이지알엔 효과 장난 아니라 바꾸길 잘한 듯!
English: I see ㅜㅜ Still, it seems like it was a good decision to change it because the effect of EZ-LEN is no joke!

Korean: 무조건 약 먹어야 돼 참지 말고 그래야 일할 수 있어...
English: You absolutely have to take your medicine. Don't endure it. Only then can you work...
I bought some more clothes this time,

Korean: 오 가을 옷 장만 했나 봐?
English: Oh, I see you've prepared your fall clothes?

Korean: 하 최근에 내가 바지 하나 샀다고 얘기 해 줬나?
English: Hey, did I tell you that I bought a pair of pants recently?

Korean: 아니 뭔데! 나도 코트 사고 싶은데 돈이 모질라~
English: Hey, what is it! I want to buy a coat too, but I don't have enough money~

Korean: 키키 나 최근에 바지 샀더니 우수 고객이라고 또 할인쿠폰을 주지 뭐야~~
English: Kiki I recently bought some pants and they gave me a discount coupon for being a good customer~~

Korean: 난 이번에 온라인 쇼핑 한 거 다 망함 하하
English: I lost all my online shopping this time haha
Kiki, really? What did you buy?

Korean: 바지랑 가디건이랑 티랑 ㅡㅡ 넌 바지 어때 잘 맞고 이뻐?
English: Pants, a cardigan, and a T-shirt - How about your pants? They fit you well and are pretty?

Korean: 어 나는 편한 거 사서 득템했으!
English: Oh, I bought something comfortable and got a good deal!

Korean: 난 무슨 거적대기 옷 같이 생겨서 구려가지고 기분 망쳤어 ㅠ
English: I feel bad because I look like a giant piece of clothing and it makes me feel bad ㅠ

Korean: 키키 아 근데 진짜 사진이랑 실물이랑 다르면 따지고 싶음!
English: Kiki Ah, but if the real thing is different from the picture, I want to find out!

Korean: 응 후기도 괜찮더만 난 왜 그 모양인지
English: Yeah, the reviews are okay, but why do I look like that?

Korean: 키키 그 후기 그 회사에서 일부러 작성한 거 아니여!?
English: Kiki, wasn't that review written by that company on purpose!?
Sister, you took the bait!

Korean: 내 말이 바지는 나팔바진데 무슨 180이 입어야 될 판이야 키키
English: What I'm saying is that the pants are bell bottoms, but what size 180 should I wear? Kiki

Korean: 키키  실화? 남자 옷 산 거 아니지?
English: Kiki, is this true? You didn't buy men's clothes, did you?

Korean: 아냐ㅜ 티는 배 안에 넣어서 입을라 했더니만 들어가지도 않어
English: Noㅜ I tried putting the tea in my stomach and wearing it, but it didn't go in
Sister, do you know someone called Tasty Guy?

Korean: 아니 그건 뭐지 맛있는 녀석들 줄임말인가
English: No, what is that? Is that an abbreviation for delicious guys?
That's right! Kim Jun-hyun won't be coming out anymore!

Korean: 개그맨들 나와서 막 계속 먹으러 다니는 거?!
English: Comedians come out and just keep going around eating?!

Korean: 맞아 김준현 김민경 문세윤 또 한 명은 기억 안 나는데 그렇게 네 명이서!
English: That's right, Kim Jun-hyun, Kim Min-kyung, Moon Se-yoon, and another one I don't remember, but there were four of them!

Korean: 아 왜 왜 건강 때문에 그런가ㅜㅜ?
English: Ah, why, why is it because of health?ㅜㅜ?
You sweat a lot...

Korean: 키키 아니 약간 자기 발전을 위해서 나간 거래!
English: Kiki, no, I went out for a little self-development!

Korean: 개 귀여운데 김준현 키키 대박이네 돈 많이 벌었나 흠
English: The dog is cute, but Kim Jun-hyun and Kiki are the best. Did they make a lot of money? Hmm

Korean: 키키 아니 김준현한테 거기는 연금 같은 곳이었는데 자기가 발전하고 있지 않다는 느낌이 들어서 나간다고 하더라 ㅜ
English: Kiki, no, to Kim Jun-hyun, that place was like a pension, but he said he was leaving because he felt like he wasn't developing.

Korean: 헐랭... 왜 그런디야 김민경도 여자 혼자서 무지하게 잘 먹더라
English: Wow... why is that? Even Kim Min-kyung eats really well on her own.

Korean: 맞아 키키 김민경 운동 신경도 장난 아니잖아!
English: That's right, Kiki Kim Min-kyung's athletic ability is no joke!

Korean: 김준현 거기에 많이 나왔는데 키키 맞아 필테하는 거 봤어
English: Kim Jun-hyun appeared there a lot, and I saw Kiki doing a filter

Korean: 키키 김준현이 필테를 했다고 김민경이 아니라?
English: Kiki Kim Jun-hyun did the filtering, not Kim Min-kyung?

Korean: 아니 김만경이 필테하는 거 코어 힘 장난 아니던데
English: No, Kim Man-kyung's core strength is no joke.

Korean: 아 맞아 필테 쌤도 김민경 재능 있다고 했잖아 키키
English: Oh right, Teacher Pilte also said that Kim Min-kyung is talented. Kiki

Korean: 맞아 맞아 나도 필테 해야 되는데 ㅜ 엉엉
English: Yeah, yeah, I need to do a filter too ㅜ sob

Korean: 언니 혹시 아이유가 했던 드라마 다 봤어?
English: Sister, have you by any chance watched all the dramas that IU was in?

Korean: 아니 아이유가 뭐했었더라 잘 안 봤어ㅜㅜ
English: No, I didn't really watch what IU didㅜㅜ

Korean: 혹시 아이유랑 이준기랑 같이 나왔던 드라마 안 봤어?
English: Have you not seen the drama that IU and Lee Jun Ki appeared in together?

Korean: 응 나 그거 안 봤어 인기 많았잖아 또르르
English: Yeah I didn't see that one. It was popular.
Kiki, but you didn't see it!?
It was really fun ㅜㅜ

Korean: 웅 나는 그 제주도에서 아이유 먹는 거 그건 봤어 키키
English: Yeah I saw IU eating that in Jeju Island Kiki

Korean: 아아 키키 그거 이효리 나오고 민박집인가 그거?
English: Ah, Kiki, is that the one with Lee Hyo-ri and the guesthouse?

Korean: 엄청 오물오물 볼 안에 넣고 씹잖아 키키 먼지 알지
English: You put it in your mouth and chew it, Kiki, you know the dust?

Korean: 맞아 키키 졸귀지 근데 이번에 이준기가 나오는 영화에 아이유도 나온대!
English: That's right Kiki is cute, but IU is also appearing in the movie that Lee Jun Ki is starring in!

Korean: 아 진짜? 둘이 또 찍나 보네 이효리 부부 나오는 거 아이유 재밌게 봤어 키키
English: Oh really? Looks like they're filming again. IU had fun watching the Lee Hyo-ri couple. Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 효리네 민박집 재밌게 봤어 키키
English: Kiki, that's right, I also enjoyed watching Hyori's Inn Kiki

Korean: 맞아 그거 진짜 존잼 키키 효리네 민박집 또 했으면
English: Yeah, that's really fun. I wish Kiki and Hyori would do a guesthouse again.
Since Kiki 2 came out, wouldn't there be a 3rd one too?

Korean: 근데 그 이후로 민박집 엄청 시끄럽대잖아ㅜ 주변으로
English: But since then, the guesthouse has been really noisyㅜ in the surrounding area

Korean: 아 그러면 이제 더 이상 안 하겠다 ㅜ
English: Ah, then I won't do it anymore.

Korean: 그래서 아마 안 찍지 않을까 생각도 들어…
English: So I thought maybe I wouldn’t take a picture…
Isn't this your peak time now?

Korean: 맞아 이제 슬슬 바빠져서 나 사라질 수도 있어 키키
English: Yeah, I'm getting busy now so I might disappear Kiki

Korean: 키키 아앗 안 돼 ㅜ 날 떠나지마 ㅝ
English: Kiki ah no ㅜ don't leave me ㅝ

Korean: 키키 어쩔 수 없어... 나 먹고 살아야지 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki, I can't help it... I have to eat to live ㅠㅠ

Korean: 언니네는 점심 보통 몇 시에 먹어?
English: What time do you usually eat lunch?
We started eating around 2 o'clock ㅠㅠ
I see ㅜㅜ If I eat at 2 o'clock, what about dinner?

Korean: 저녁은 장사 끝나고 집 가서 먹지 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm going home to eat dinner after work ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 그러면 장사는 몇 시에 끝나는데?
English: Kiki: Then what time does business end?
It closes around 7 or 8! Haha

Korean: 그러면 집 가서 먹으면 한 9시 되겠네?
English: Then, if I go home and eat, it will be around 9 o'clock, right?

Korean: 웅 맞아 ㅠㅠ 그래도 같이 밥먹으려면 어쩔수 없어 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right ㅠㅠ But I have no choice but to eat together ㅠㅠ
Okay then I'll sleep late ㅜ

Korean: 근데 또 누워서 핸드폰 하고 그렇지 뭐 키키
English: But then again, I'm lying down and playing on my phone, Kiki

Korean: 키키 역시 밥 먹고 난 뒤에는 눕는 게 책오~
English: Kiki, after eating, it's a good idea to lie down~

Korean: 그럼 눕고 뒹굴거리다 자는 거지 뭐 하하
English: Then you just lie down and roll around and sleep haha
Did your sister move into a rented house?

Korean: 웅 우리 지금 아파트 짓고 잇는데 가려고 그전엔 전세야 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, we're building an apartment right now, but we have to rent it out before we move in. ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헉 논산에 새로 생긴다는 아파트에 언니 들어가?
English: Oh my, my sister is moving into that new apartment building in Nonsan?

Korean: 아니 아니 우리는 계룡으로 들어가요! 키키
English: No, no, we're going to Gyeryong! Kiki

Korean: 아하 혹시 계룡 리슈빌 말하는 거임?
English: Aha, are you talking about Gyeryong Rishuville?

Korean: 아니 아니 지역이 계룡을 말하는 거임! 키키
English: No, no, the area is Gyeryong! Kiki

Korean: 아항 키키 계룡이면 식당이랑 더 멀어지겠네?
English: Ah, if it's Kiki Gyeryong, it'll be further away from the restaurant?

Korean: 웅 그래서 지금 너무 걱정이긴 해 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's why I'm really worried right now ㅠㅠ
I see ㅜㅜ When are you planning on moving in?

Korean: 다 공사 완료되면 갈 거 같은데 1년 정도 걸릴 거 같아!
English: I think I'll go once construction is complete, but I think it'll take about a year!
Oh, so you're saying I can move in next year?
Yeah, I guess I'll have to move in next year haha
Then I guess I'll have to buy all the furniture too?

Korean: 웅 다 사야지 ㅠㅠ 돈 엄청 들어갈 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I have to buy them all ㅠㅠ I think it's going to cost a lot of money ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그래도 살 때 좋은 거 사야 해!
English: But when you buy, you have to buy good things!

Korean: 맞아 그래도 신축이라서 마음에 들어 하하
English: Yeah but I like it because it's stretchy haha

Korean: 언니네 남편분은 차 뭐 타고 다녀?
English: What kind of car does your sister's husband drive?
My husband drives a Grandeur Kiki

Korean: 오오 그랜져 이번에 신형 나온 거로 샀어?
English: Oh, did you buy the new Grandeur this time?

Korean: 아니아니 예전부터 타던 거야! 신형은 아니야 ㅠㅠ
English: No, no, I've been riding it for a long time! It's not a new model ㅠㅠ
But the Grandeur is still really good ㅜㅜ
Yeah, it's nice because it's spacious, Kiki

Korean: 맞아 키키 이번에 나온 신형 타봤는데 개좋더라 ㅜ
English: Yeah Kiki, I just rode the new model that came out and it's really good.
Everything new is good ㅠㅠ
Yes, I also rode the new Sorento and it was really good.
New Sorento?
I've never driven a Sorento before ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 진짜? 우리 집 쏘렌토 2010년씩 있음 키키
English: Oh really? We have a 2010 Sorento at home Kiki
Oh, so it's been 11 years now?

Korean: 응 맞아 아 2007년 식인가 보다 나 초딩 때부터 탔으니까!
English: Yeah, that's right. Oh, I guess it's the 2007 model, because I've been riding it since I was in elementary school!

Korean: 키키 이제 슬슬 바꿔야 될 때가 됐구나?
English: Kiki, is it time for a change now?

Korean: 키키 맞아, 그래서 시승식 많이  해봤지
English: Kiki, that's right, that's why I've done a lot of test drives.

Korean: 나중에 새로 뽑으면 구경 갈게 키키
English: I'll go and check it out later when I get a new one Kiki
Sister, have you ever worked at a company?
I used to go to a vet Kiki
Oh really? So, you were a nurse?

Korean: 음 간호사는 아니고 좀 비슷했던 거 같아! 키키
English: Well, not a nurse, but something similar! Kiki
I see. Did the doctor pay you a lot of money?

Korean: 그냥 저냥 최저에서 좀 더 주고 그랬나? ㅠㅠ
English: Should I just give a little more than the minimum? ㅠㅠ
Oh my goshㅜㅜ Is the work not that difficult?

Korean: 웅 근데 나름 힘들어 ㅠㅠ 동물 케어가 장난 아니야...
English: Yeah, but it's kind of hard ㅠㅠ Animal care is no joke...
But why are you giving so little?

Korean: 자본주의에선 어쩔 수 없어... 다 이렇게 받는 걸 ㅠㅠ
English: There's no way around it in capitalism... everyone gets what they deserve ㅠㅠ
Hahaㅜㅜ It's crying. How was it resting?

Korean: 쉬는 건 손님 없으면 쉬고 그랬던 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: I think they rested when there were no customers ㅠㅠ
When was your day off?

Korean: 주말에는 쉬었던 거 같아 키키 평일에만 일하고!
English: Kiki, you seem to rest on weekends, you only work on weekdays!

Korean: 오 다행이다 내가 아는 친구는 일요일 평일 하루에 이렇게 쉬었는데!
English: Oh thank goodness a friend of mine had a day off like this on Sunday!

Korean: 그래도 일욜날 쉬는 게 어디야 ㅠㅠ 나 지금 주말에 쉬고 싶어 ㅠㅠ
English: But where can I rest on Sundays ㅠㅠ I want to rest this weekend ㅠㅠ

Korean: 미얀, 허허 지금 더 바쁘게 사네 허허
English: Miyan, haha, I'm busier now haha

Korean: 응... 그래서 그때가 좀 그립고 그러기도 해 키키
English: Yeah... That's why I miss those days a little bit, Kiki

Korean: 언니는 해군 육군 공군 중에 어떤 군인이 제일 힘들 거 같아?
English: Sister, which military branch do you think has the hardest job among the Navy, Army, and Air Force?

Korean: 음 나는 해군이 가장 힘들 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Hmm I think the Navy would be the hardest ㅠㅠ
Wow, I thought the same thing!

Korean: 물이 있으니까 가장 힘들지 않을까 해서 키키
English: I thought it would be the hardest because there was water
Oh right, Kiki because of motion sickness

Korean: 웅 그리고 배는 나가면 핸드폰 안 터질 거 아니야 키키
English: Yeah and once the ship leaves, your phone won't explode Kiki

Korean: 키키 억 근데 어차피 군인은 핸드폰 못 쓰잖아!
English: Kiki Oh, but soldiers can't use cell phones anyway!

Korean: 아냐 요즘 군인들은 다 준다고 하던데?
English: No, I heard that these days all soldiers get it?

Korean: 아 진짜? 요즘에 핸드폰 다 준대?
English: Oh really? These days, they give away cell phones to everyone?

Korean: 웅 훈련소 끝나면 다 돌려준데 키키
English: Yeah, I gave it all back after the training camp ended, Kiki

Korean: 와 대박 키키 그러면 항상  소지하고 있어도 돼?
English: Wow, awesome Kiki. Then can I always carry it with me?

Korean: 웅 그래서 요즘은 연락도 잘된다고 그러잖아 키키
English: Yeah, so you said you've been keeping in touch with each other a lot lately, Kiki

Korean: 와오 키키 라떼는 공중전화 기다리면서 전화 받았는데 말이야~
English: Wow Kiki Latte got a call while waiting at a pay phone~

Korean: 키키 공중전화 맞아 우리는 그 전화기에 대기 하고 그랬다고 했지 키키
English: Kiki, the pay phone is right, we were waiting at that phone and that's what we said Kiki
Kiki, is that right? It started with 070, right?
Oh, did you get a call from 070?

Korean: 난 콜렉트콜 밖에 기억 안나 키키
English: I only remember the collect call Kiki
Sister, do you have any qualifications?

Korean: 아니 나는 자격증은 아직 없어 ㅠㅠ
English: No, I don't have a license yet ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 진짜? 그러면 고졸하고 바로 취업한 거야?
English: Oh really? So you got a job right after graduating from high school?

Korean: 웅 졸업 후에 이곳저곳 일하고 그랬지 키키
English: Yeah, after graduation, I worked here and there, Kiki.

Korean: 그렇구나 키키 지금은 누구보다 열심히 사시는 구먼유~
English: I see, Kiki, you're working harder than anyone else these days~

Korean: 그럼 ㅠㅠ 그때 열심히 놀았으니 지금 일해야지 ㅠㅠ
English: Well then ㅠㅠ I played hard back then so I have to work now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 그러면 언니는 따고 싶은 자격증은 없고?
English: Kiki: Then, there are no qualifications you want to get?

Korean: 웅 아직은 없어 그냥 이러고 지내고 싶어 너는?
English: Yeah, not yet. Do you just want to stay like this?

Korean: 나는 지금 배우고 싶은 건 있음!
English: There is something I want to learn now!

Korean: 오오 뭐 봐둔 거 있어? 말해봐바 키키
English: Oh, what have you seen? Tell me, Kiki.
I want to learn about dog treats these days~
Oh, making dog treats?
How about cake?

Korean: 오오 좋지 안산에 진짜 마음에 드는 학원 있는데 너무 멀어 ㅜ
English: Oh, great. There's an academy in Ansan that I really like, but it's too far away.
How long does it take from there to Ansan? ㅠㅠ
First of all, it takes 2 hours one way to get there from Seoul?

Korean: 헐 왕복도 아니고 편도? 포기해라 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my, it's not even a round trip, it's a one way trip? I give up ㅠㅠ

Korean: 언니네 아부지도 쉬지 않고 일 하시잖아ㅜ
English: My sister's father also works without restㅜ

Korean: 웅 맞아 ㅠㅠ 우리 아빠가 나보다 더 고생이긴 하지 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right ㅠㅠ My dad has it harder than me ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그치ㅜㅜ 아부지 그 더운 주방에서 맨날 일 하시고 ㅜ
English: Rightㅜㅜ Dad, you work in that hot kitchen all dayㅜ

Korean: 웅 그리고 기름도 튀고 하니까 화상도 입더라 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, and the oil splattered and stuff so I got burned ㅠㅠ

Korean: 오우 맞아 나도 중국집 알바 해 봤었잖아 ㅜ
English: Oh, that's right, I worked at a Chinese restaurant too.

Korean: 아 맞아 너도 했었지 ㅠㅠ 힘들지 않았어?
English: Oh right, you did it too ㅠㅠ Wasn't it hard?

Korean: 키키 나는 서빙이라 괜찮았는데 하 단체주문 하,
English: Kiki I was a server so it was okay but I ordered a group order.

Korean: 맞아ㅠㅠ 단체주문 들어오면 진짜 바쁘고 헬이야 ㅠㅠ
English: That's rightㅠㅠ When group orders come in, I get really busy and it's hellㅠㅠ

Korean: 우리는 군부대 근처라 군인들 엄청 시킴 ㅜ
English: We live near a military base so there are a lot of soldiers there.

Korean: 아 그러겠다 ㅠㅠ 거긴 피자랑 치킨도 장사 엄청 잘될 거 같아 키키
English: Oh, I see. I think pizza and chicken business will be really good there. Kiki

Korean: 오 맞아 키키 군부대 안에 식당 같은 거 있는 거 알지?
English: Oh right, did you know that there's something like a restaurant inside the Kiki military base?
Dad, how about coming in here?
Kiki, we're fine here too...

Korean: 키키 진짜 군부대 안에 아부지랑 둘이서 들어가면 뼈도 못 추릴 듯
English: Kiki, if you and your dad go into a military base together, you won't be able to even pick up a bone.

Korean: 키키 맞아 진짜 고생 엄청하고 ㅠㅠ 늙어 늙어 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki, you're right, you're really having a hard time ㅠㅠ You're getting old, you're getting old ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 아부지는 지금 식당 자리 좋으시다고 하셔?
English: Right, Dad said the restaurant seats are good right now?

Korean: 웅 그래도 여기선 우리가 독점이라 좋아 키키
English: Yeah but I like it because we have the monopoly here Kiki
When are you planning on having a baby, Sister?

Korean: 나는 내년에 집 되고 그 뒤에 생각 중이야!
English: I'm going to get a house next year and I'm thinking about that later!

Korean: 오오 신혼 집에서 애기까지 낳으면 진짜 좋겠당 ㅜㅝ
English: Oh, it would be really nice to have a baby in our new home ㅜㅝ

Korean: 웅 그래서 지금은 생각 없고 신혼 즐기는 중!
English: Yeah, so right now I'm just enjoying my honeymoon without thinking about it!

Korean: 키키 오오 굿굿 언니가 올해 결혼했었나?
English: Kiki Oh, good, good. Did your sister get married this year?
Yeah, I did it in May this year~ It's been 5 months haha

Korean: 아 맞다 키키 그러면 충분히 즐기다가
English: Oh right, Kiki, then enjoy it enough
Yeah, I guess I should enjoy the moment haha

Korean: 맞아 내 친구는 10월 결혼인데 이번에 애기 가졌대 허허
English: That's right, my friend is getting married in October and she's having a baby this time haha

Korean: 키키 그래도 결혼 준비 중에 그랬나보네 키키 행복하겠다
English: Kiki, I guess you were preparing for the wedding. Kiki, you must be happy.

Korean: 키키 엉 맞아 신경 안 쓰고 있었다가 이제 4주차 됐대!
English: Kiki, you're right, I didn't care and now it's the 4th week!

Korean: 와 드레스 사이즈 계속 재고 그래야겠네 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, I guess I'll have to keep checking dress sizes ㅠㅠ

Korean: 엉 다이어트 빡세게 하고 있었는데 지금 과일만 먹는 중이래
English: Oh, I was on a strict diet, but now I'm only eating fruit.

Korean: 안돼 ㅠㅠ 먹는 건 잘 먹어야 애기한테 좋지 ㅠㅠ
English: No ㅠㅠ You have to eat well, it's not good for the baby ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 키키 나도 이번에 황금사과 보내줌!
English: That's right Kiki, I'll send you a golden apple this time too!

Korean: 황금사과 키키 나도 그거 한번 찾아봐야지 키키
English: Golden Apple Kiki I should look for that too Kiki

Korean: 언니 내가 거북이 한 번 알아봤거든?
English: Sister, I recognized a turtle once.
Yeah, how about a turtle? Is it good to raise one?
Oh my, it's so good!

Korean: 그 전구?만 있으면 될 거 같은데?
English: That light bulb? I think that'll be enough.

Korean: 아 한마리 말고 두마리 키우라는 소리지?
English: Oh, so you're telling me to raise two instead of just one?

Korean: 키키 아니아니 준비물이 생각보다 별로 없어도 된다는 소리지!
English: Kiki No no, you're saying that you don't need as many supplies as you think!

Korean: 아 거북이 혼자서 잘 산다는 뜻이였어? 키키
English: Oh, so you mean turtles can live well alone? Kiki

Korean: 엉엉 맞아 약간 거북이가 하도 안 움직이니까 무슨 가구처럼 보인대 키키
English: Oh my, that's right. The turtle doesn't move at all, so it looks like some kind of furniture. Kiki

Korean: 키키 넘 웃기네 가구 키키 한마리는 안 외롭고 잘 사려나?
English: Kiki is so funny. I wonder if Kiki, the only one with furniture, is lonely and living well?

Korean: 키키 근데 거북이가 무리 지어 사는 동물이 아니라서 괜찮을 듯?
English: Kiki: But turtles don't live in groups, so I think it'll be okay?

Korean: 그래도 혼자는 내가 외로워 보일 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: But I think I'll look lonely if I'm alone ㅠㅠ
Then let's bring two guns!
Okay, I'll have to make two to make it look nice!

Korean: 근데 내가 말한 거북이는 좀 비싸 허허
English: But the turtle I mentioned is a bit expensive haha

Korean: ...안돼 비싸면 ㅠㅠ 적당한 게 좋단 말이야 ㅠㅠ
English: ...No, if it's expensive ㅠㅠ I'd rather have something moderate ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 언니 얼마 정도 생각하고 있으?
English: How much are you thinking, Kiki?

Korean: 나는 한 300 이 정도 생각 했는데 ㅠㅠ
English: I thought it was around 300 ㅠㅠ

Korean: 언니는 경기장에서 경기 보는 거 안 좋아해?
English: Sister, don't you like watching games at the stadium?
I'd like to see you at the stadium at least once!

Korean: 나 야구 경기 봤는데 진짜 존잼!
English: I watched the baseball game and it was really fun!

Korean: 아 부럽다 ㅠㅠ 실제로 보는 건 어때?
English: Ah, I'm jealous ㅠㅠ What's it like to see it in person?
First, I have to go and order some chicken and beer!

Korean: 키키 아 그건 너무 당연한 거잖아~ 또?
English: Kiki, that's so obvious~ Again?

Korean: 키키 그럼~ 내 친구는 원피스 맞춤 제작해서 입더라고!
English: Kiki: Then~ My friend got a custom-made one-piece dress and wore it!

Korean: 와 멋있다 그 친구는 야구 광팬인거야? 키키
English: Wow, that's cool. Is that guy a huge baseball fan? Kiki

Korean: 키키 엉 맞아 세트로 아예 다 맞췄더라고!
English: Kiki, you're right, you got the whole set!

Korean: 와 그렇게 열정적인 친구들 보면 멋있는 거 같아 키키
English: Wow, it's cool to see such passionate friends, Kiki

Korean: 키키 인정 키키 둘이 같이 가서 봤으 우리는 한화 팬 허허
English: Kiki admits Kiki we went together and watched it, we are Hanwha fans haha

Korean: 오 그럼 여긴 한화지 무조건! 키키
English: Oh, then this is definitely Hanwha! Kiki
Kiki, that's right, it doesn't matter if we lose!

Korean: 그냥 이 순간을 즐길 뿐이야~ 키키
English: Just enjoy this moment~ Kiki

Korean: 맞아 키키 이기면 그때는 눈물 흘리는 거지
English: That's right, if Kiki wins, then I'll cry

Korean: 오 이겼다니 ㅠㅠ 감격 이러면서 키키 그래도 한화 팬이 제일 많데 키키
English: Oh, you won ㅠㅠ I'm so touched Kiki But Hanwha fans are the biggest Kiki
Does your sister have a plus at home?

Korean: 아니 ㅠㅠ 그건 새로 이사 가면 장만할까 생각 중 키키
English: No ㅠㅠ I'm thinking about getting that when I move to a new place Kiki

Korean: 오오 키키 제발 사라 나 가서 놀게!
English: Oh Kiki please go and play with me!

Korean: 키키 왜그래 우리 신혼 즐기면서 할거야 키키
English: Kiki, what's wrong? We're going to enjoy our honeymoon. Kiki

Korean: 키키 안댕 나도 껴달라규~ 나도 하고 싶다규~
English: Kiki Andang, please hug me too~ I want to do it too~

Korean: 키키 그럼 우리 좀 즐기다가 내가 익숙해지면 부를게 키키
English: Kiki, let's have some fun and then I'll sing when I get used to it. Kiki

Korean: 키키 오키 근데 플스 게임 해본 적 있어?
English: Kiki Oki But have you ever played a Plus game?

Korean: 아니 ㅠㅠ 해본 적 없어... 그래도 집에서 하는 거라 좋을 거 같던데 키키
English: Noㅠㅠ I've never done it... But I think it'd be good to do it at home Kiki

Korean: 키키 나도 그 쓰리디? 게임 있잖아 그거 해 보고 싶음 ㅜ
English: Kiki, I also have that 3D game. I want to try it.
VR?
Are you talking about that game?

Korean: 키키 어 맞아 그거 플스로 할 수 있잖아!
English: Kiki, that's right, you can do that with plus!

Korean: 아 그래? 그럼 그것도 한번 알아봐야겠네 키키
English: Oh really? Then I should look into that too, Kiki.

Korean: 키키 엉 근데 플스 가격 얼마인 지 알아?
English: Kiki, but do you know how much the plus costs?

Korean: 웅 그거 100만원 그 정도 하는 걸로 알고 있는데!
English: Yeah, I think that costs around 1 million won!

Korean: 맞아 신제품은 이제 옵션에 따라 다르긴 하던데!
English: That's right, new products now differ depending on the options!

Korean: 맞아 ㅠㅠ 그래도 한번 사두면 좋을 거 같아 키키
English: Right ㅠㅠ But I think it would be good to buy it once Kiki

Korean: 언니는 남편분이랑 최근에 여행 간 적 있어?
English: Sister, have you been on a trip with your husband recently?
Our last honeymoon was in Jeju Island ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헐 지금 그러면 5개월 동안 어디를 못 간 거야?
English: Oh my god, then where haven't you been able to go for 5 months?

Korean: 웅 코로나때메 마땅치도 않고 가게 비울 수도 없고 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, it's not a good idea because of the coronavirus and I can't just close the store ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헐랭 ㅜㅜㅜ 그렇구나 ㅜㅜ 어디 가고 싶은 곳은 없고?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜㅜ I see ㅜㅜ Is there anywhere you want to go?

Korean: 웅 그냥 휴일만 맞춰서 같이 지내고 싶어 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I just want to spend the holidays together ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 어디 가고 싶은 곳은 딱히 없고?
English: Kiki, is there anywhere you want to go in particular?

Korean: 웅 갠 주말에 쉬고 난 월욜이라 ㅠㅠ 휴일만 맞아도 행복할 거 같아!
English: Yeah, I had a rest over the weekend and it's Monday now ㅠㅠ I think I'll be happy just by having a holiday!

Korean: 키키 헐랭ㅜㅜ 내년 봄에는 동학사 벚꽃구경이라도 한 번 가!
English: Kiki, wowㅜㅜ Next spring, let's go see the cherry blossoms at Donghaksa Temple!

Korean: 웅 그때 쯤이면 결혼도 1주년 됐으니까 기념으로 가야겠다 키키
English: Yeah, by then it will be our first wedding anniversary, so I should go to celebrate Kiki

Korean: 오오 너무 좋다 동학사 가서 파전도 먹어주고!
English: Oh, it's so good! Let's go to Donghaksa and eat some pajeon too!

Korean: 맞아 근데 파전 됐어 ㅠㅠ 데이트만 한다면 좋을 거 같아 키키
English: Yeah but it's a mess ㅠㅠ I think it would be nice if we just dated Kiki

Korean: 헐 거기 가서 계곡물 흐르는 거 들으면서 동동주에 파전이지!
English: Wow, let's go there and listen to the stream water flowing while eating dongdongju and pajeon!

Korean: 그냥 길에 파는 것만 먹어도 행복할 거 같아 하하
English: I think I'd be happy just eating whatever they sell on the street haha

Korean: 키키 오 맞아 거기 맛집 되게 많음!
English: Kiki Oh right, there are a lot of delicious restaurants there!

Korean: 은근 많더라고 키키 갈비집도 진짜 맛있었는데 ㅠㅠ
English: There were quite a lot of them, and Kiki's Galbi House was really delicious ㅠㅠ
What season do you like the most, sister?

Korean: 나는 봄을 가장 좋아하는 거 같아!
English: I think I like spring the best!
Late spring?

Korean: 아 진짜? 꽃 많이 볼 수 있어서 좋아?
English: Oh really? You like it because you can see a lot of flowers?

Korean: 아니 날씨가 나에게 적당해서 좋아 키키
English: No, I like it because the weather suits me Kiki

Korean: 언니 약간 따뜻한 날씨 좋아하는 구나?
English: Sister, do you like slightly warm weather?

Korean: 웅 난 추위 타서 따순게 좋더라고 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I'm cold so I like something warm ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 어우 언니는 살이 없으니까 추위 많이 타겠다
English: Kiki Au, you're skinny, so you'll catch a cold a lot

Korean: 그래서 겨울이 너무 싫은데 ㅠㅠ 지금 너무 추워져 ㅠㅠ
English: That's why I hate winter so much ㅠㅠ It's so cold now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 흙 ㅜㅜ 맞아 겨울 이불 밖은 엄청 위험해~
English: Dirt ㅜㅜ That's right, it's very dangerous outside the winter blanket~

Korean: 웅 그래서 그때 퇴사하고 싶어 키키 나가기 싫어서 키키
English: Yeah, so I wanted to quit then, Kiki, I didn't want to go out, Kiki

Korean: 키키 아빠한테 잠깐 꽃구경만 보고 오자고 해!
English: Tell Kiki's dad that we should just go and look at the flowers for a bit!

Korean: 키키 그래야겠어 아빠도 바람 좀 쐬고 스트레스 풀으시라고 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki, you should do that too. Dad, you should get some fresh air and relieve your stress. ㅠㅠ
That's right ㅜㅜ You have to take it easy!
Yeah, you're older now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 흙 ㅜㅜ 맞아 이제 노년에는 편하게 즐기셔야지!
English: Oh my gosh, you're right. Now is the time to enjoy your old age comfortably!

Korean: 키키 노년이라니 ㅠㅠ 울 아빠 아직 그 정도는 아니라궁 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki is old ㅠㅠ My dad isn't that old yet ㅠㅠ

Korean: 이번에 데이트 폭력으로 죽은 여성 분 있잖아 ㅜ
English: There was a woman who died from dating violence recently.
Dating violence?

Korean: 그건 폭력이 아니라 살인 아니야? ㅠㅠ
English: Isn't that murder, not violence? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 그 남자가 왜 폭력 쓴 줄 알아?
English: Right, do you know why that guy was violent?
Oh, really? Why did you hit me?

Korean: 여자가 자기 지인들한테 자기랑 사귄다고 자랑했다고,
English: The woman bragged to her friends that she was dating him.

Korean: 엥? 아니 사귀면 사귀는 거지 그게 왜 맞을 이유야?
English: Huh? No, if you date, you date. Why is that a valid reason?

Korean: 그러니까 막 의식 잃은 사람 머리채 질질 끌고 발로 밟더라,
English: So, they were dragging the unconscious person's hair and stomping on him.

Korean: 와 개 진짜 미쳤다 그래서 처벌은?
English: Wow, the dog is really crazy. So what's the punishment?

Korean: 지금 그래서 고소 진행 중인데 이 남자가 항소하면 몇 년 걸리겠지?
English: So the lawsuit is in progress now, but how many years will it take if this guy appeals?

Korean: 아니 갠 그냥 감옥에 살아야지ㅡㅡ 살인자잖아
English: No, he should just live in prison. He's a murderer.

Korean: 맞아 미친 거 아니냐, 데이트 폭력을 가장한 살인자
English: That's right, you're crazy, a murderer disguised as dating violence

Korean: 내말이... 그런 사람들은 걍 사회에서 매장 시켜야 된다고 ㅠㅠ
English: What I'm saying is... those kinds of people should just be buried in society ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아, 근데 더 빡 치는 건 뭔 줄 알아?
English: Yeah, but you know what's even more frustrating?

Korean: 이거 말고 더 화나는 게 있어?!
English: Is there anything more upsetting than this?!

Korean: 죽은 피해자 얼굴은 그대로 나왔는데 이 살인자 얼굴이랑 신상은 안 털림,
English: The dead victim's face was revealed as is, but the killer's face and identity were not revealed.
Wow, that's really ridiculous.

Korean: 장난하는 것도 아니고 왜 숨겨 ㅡㅡ 공개해야지
English: It's not like I'm joking, so why hide it? It has to be made public.

Korean: 다음 달 15일부터 싱가포르 격리 없이 여행 갈 수 있댕!
English: Starting from the 15th of next month, you can travel to Singapore without quarantine!

Korean: 오 대박! 그럼 거기는 왔다 갔다 가능한 거야? ㅠㅠ
English: Oh wow! So you can go back and forth there? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 엉엉 그렇대 원래는 2주 자가격리 했어야 했잖아!
English: Oh my god, that's right. I was supposed to self-quarantine for two weeks!

Korean: 웅 맞아 앞뒤로 해야 되는데 이제 할 필요 없대?
English: Yeah, that's right, you have to do it back and forth, but now you don't have to do it?
That's right! But that's only in Singapore!

Korean: 거기로 사람들 엄청 몰릴 거 같네 ㅠㅠ
English: I think a lot of people will flock there ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 싱가포르 가보고 싶었는데!
English: Kiki, that's right, I wanted to go to Singapore too!

Korean: 맞아 거긴 못 가본 나라라서 더 끌린다 오예
English: Yeah, I'm more attracted to that country because I've never been there. Oh yeah

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 싱가포르는 어디 쪽에 있는 나라지?
English: Kiki, that's right, but where is Singapore located?

Korean: 아 그거까진 모르겠다 ㅠㅠ 근데 멀지 않을 거야!
English: Ah, I don't know about that ㅠㅠ But it won't be far!

Korean: 맞아 내 친구들 싱가포르 여행 갔다고 했는데 진짜 갈만하다고 했으!
English: That's right, my friends said they went on a trip to Singapore and it was really worth it!
Yeah, I heard that 3 nights and 4 days is enough for a trip there!
Oh really? Isn't overseas basically 4 nights and 5 days!?

Korean: 웅 거긴 나라가 엄청 작데 키키 그래서 충분히 돈다고 그러던데?
English: Yeah, that's a really small country, but Kiki said there's enough money there?

Korean: 헐 키키 약간 대만이 생각이 나는 걸~?
English: Oh my, Kiki, you remind me a little of Taiwan~?

Korean: 키키 아 근데 대만은 일주일도 부족했음 키키
English: Kiki Ah but Taiwan wasn't even enough for a week Kiki
Sister, what kind of cosmetics do you use these days?
Basic cosmetics?
Or color cosmetics?
Um, color cosmetics!?
Something like lipstick?

Korean: 아 립스틱은 맥 이거 많이 써 키키 립밤이랑!
English: Ah, I use MAC a lot for lipstick and Kiki lip balm!

Korean: 역시 여자는 멕 립스틱 많이 쓰는 구나!
English: As expected, women use a lot of Mexican lipstick!

Korean: 립스틱보단 틴트를 쓰는 거 같아! 근데 난 립밤을 더 많이 써 ㅠㅠ
English: I think I use tint more than lipstick! But I use lip balm more ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아아 나도 ㅜㅜ 나는 베네피트 꺼 써!
English: Ahh me too ㅜㅜ I use Benefit's!
Oh, that thing that looks like nail polish?

Korean: 엉 맞아 근데 그거 이제 그렇게 안 나옴
English: Yeah, that's right, but it doesn't come out like that anymore
Huh? Then it comes out differently?
How does it come out?

Korean: 그냥 일단  틴트 바르는 것처럼 나오더라
English: It just looks like I applied tint
Ah, does lip balm just come in a stick form?
I use Lush lip balm!
Rush?
Is there lip balm there too?

Korean: 엉 맞아 거기 립스틱도 팔더라 키키
English: Oh yeah, they sell lipstick there too Kiki

Korean: 와 대박 신기해 키키 향은 확실히 좋겠다 키키
English: Wow, wow, amazing. Kiki's scent is definitely good. Kiki

Korean: 어무니 몸 안 좋으시다고 했는데 구체적으로 어떻게 아프셔?
English: Your mother said she wasn't feeling well, but what exactly is wrong with her?

Korean: 음 무리가 오셨나 많이 기운이 없으셔 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, you must be very tired because a lot of people came. ㅠㅠ
Oh my goshㅜㅜ Please make me some herbal medicine!

Korean: 웅 엄마 지금 쉬면서 여행도 다니고 힐링 중이라 괜찮아 키키
English: Yeah, Mom, I'm resting right now, traveling, and healing, so I'm okay Kiki

Korean: 아 진짜? 누구랑 여행 다니시고 계셔?
English: Oh really? Who are you traveling with?

Korean: 친구들이랑 요즘 여행 다니고 그렇더라고 키키
English: Kiki, I've been traveling with my friends lately

Korean: 오오 힐링하시는 구먼~ 이번에는 어디 다녀오셨대~
English: Oh, you're healing~ Where did you go this time~

Korean: 이번에는 단풍놀이 가시려고 그러는 거 같아 키키
English: I think you're going to see the fall foliage this time, Kiki
Okay, so you went hiking this time?

Korean: 웅웅 그럴 거 같아 어른들이라 등산도 다니고 꽃구경 가고 그러지 뭐 키키
English: Yeah, I think so. Since we are adults, we go hiking and see flowers and stuff. Kiki
Oh, hiking is the best exercise for adults!

Korean: 맞아 가서 다치지 않고 무사히 오기만 하면 좋겠어 ㅠㅠ
English: I hope you go there safely and don't get hurt ㅠㅠ

Korean: 할 이번에 높은 산 다녀오시는 거야?
English: Are you going to climb a high mountain this time?

Korean: 나는 산을 잘 몰라서 모르겠어 ㅠㅠ 그냥 어디든 안 다치고 와야지!
English: I don't know much about mountains so I don't know ㅠㅠ Just make sure you don't get hurt wherever you go!
Kiki, that's right!
Did you give me some pocket money?

Korean: 내 코가 석사라서 그런 건 못해줘~
English: My nose is a master's degree, so I can't do that~

Korean: 언니랑 남편분은 주식 같은 거 안 해?
English: Don't you and your husband invest in stocks or something?

Korean: 음 내가 하지 말라고 했는데 몰래 하고 있는 거 같아 키키
English: Um, I told you not to, but I think you're doing it secretly, Kiki.

Korean: 아앗 키키 역시 남자는 주식을 해 줘야 하는 가벼~
English: Ahh Kiki, after all, men are supposed to give stocks~

Korean: 요즘은 여자들도 엄청 많이 하더라 ㅠㅠ
English: These days, a lot of women do it too ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 내 친구들도 이제 막 시작했어 ㅜ
English: Yeah my friends are just starting out too ㅜ

Korean: 와 친구들 지금 그래서 돈 맛 좀 보셨으려남
English: Wow, guys, you must have tasted some money now.

Korean: 키키 아니 다 마이너스래 키키 다덜 그렇게 산다더라
English: Kiki, no, it's all minus. Kiki, they all live like that.

Korean: 키키 진짜 주식으로 누가 돈 버는겨 다 마이너슨데ㅡㅡ
English: Kiki, who really makes money with stocks? They're all minus signsㅡㅡ

Korean: 키키 그러게 그래도 비트코인 안 한 게 어디여~
English: Kiki, that's right, but why didn't you use Bitcoin?

Korean: 키키 비트코인은 아직도 사람들 잘 벌고 있나 모르겠네 키키
English: Kiki Bitcoin I don't know if people are still making a lot of money Kiki

Korean: 일단  내 남친 직장 상사 17억 벌어서 퇴사했대 키키
English: First of all, my boyfriend's boss quit his job because he earned 1.7 billion won. Kiki

Korean: 와 대박이다.. 그럼 그거 인생역전 노릴만 하네 키키
English: Wow, that's awesome.. Then that's worth trying to turn your life around Kiki

Korean: 맞아 집에 있는 빚 청산하고 2018년도에 전국 해외여행 떠났대
English: That's right, I paid off my debt at home and went on a trip around the country and abroad in 2018.

Korean: 와 대박... 얼마 투자하고 그렇게 벌었데?
English: Wow, wow... How much did you invest to earn that much?

Korean: 그거는 모르겠는데 그때 퇴직금 다 넣었다고 했던 거 같아
English: I don't know about that, but I think he said he put all his retirement money in at that time.

Korean: 천만원은 넘게 들어갔겠지 ㅠㅠ 와 대박이다 진짜 ㅠㅠ
English: It must have cost more than 10 million won ㅠㅠ Wow, this is really amazing ㅠㅠ
Sister, what do you think of Lee Byung-hun's acting?
Aren't you tired?

Korean: 맞아 개 연기 너무 잘해 ㅡㅡ
English: Yeah, your acting is really good ㅡㅡ

Korean: 하 나 이번에 남산의 부장들? 봤는데 개쩔더라
English: Hah, I saw the Namsan bosses this time, they were awesome

Korean: 엥 오징어 말고 또 나온 거 있어?
English: Hey, is there anything else besides squid?

Korean: 이거는 옛날에 나왔던 건데 넷플에 풀렸더라고!
English: This came out a long time ago, but it was released on Netflix!

Korean: 아아 그럼 한번 봐야겠다 키키 또 누구 나와?
English: Ah, then I should take a look. Kiki, who else will appear?

Korean: 키키 거기에 어 이희준이라고 배우 알아?
English: Kiki, do you know the actor named Lee Hee-jun?

Korean: 아니 ㅠㅠ 몰라 키키 잘 생겼어? 키키
English: Noㅠㅠ I don't know Kiki, is he handsome? Kiki

Korean: 어? 언니 쳐 보면 알 걸?
English: Huh? If you try hitting on me, you'll know?

Korean: 그래? 그럼 보기 전에 한번 쳐봐야겠다 키키 내용은 어때
English: Really? Then I'll have to try it out before I watch it. What's the content like?

Korean: 이게 진짜 실제 사건을 바탕으로 해서 만든 거라 내용이 탄탄혀!
English: This is based on a true story, so the content is solid!

Korean: 와 실화바탕인건 진짜 다 내용 쩌는데 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, it's based on a true story, the content is really great ㅠㅠ

Korean: 엉엉 이게 박정희 정권에 있었던 일 얘기하는 거야!
English: Oh my god, this is a story about what happened during the Park Chung-hee regime!

Korean: 아 그럼 눈물 좀 흘릴거 같은데 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, then I think I'm going to shed some tears ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 근데 이병헌이 가만히 분노하는 장면이 있거든?
English: Right ㅜㅜ But isn't there a scene where Lee Byung Hun is quietly angry?
I'm really fed up!

Korean: 키키 내가 오늘 자기 전에 정주행 한번 해볼게~
English: Kiki I'll try to drive around before I go to bed tonight~
It's been a long time since I've seen Dad's black rubber shoes.
Black rubber shoes cartoon? Kiki
Is that still on air?

Korean: 아니 그냥 재방송 하는 거 유튜브로 봄!
English: No, I just watched the rebroadcast on YouTube!

Korean: 옛날 거 다시보기 하고 있는 거야?
English: Are you rewatching old stuff?

Korean: 엉엉 맞아 키키 언니 검정고무신 예전에 봤었어?
English: Oh my, that's right. Have you seen Kiki's black rubber shoes before?

Korean: 웅 나 그거 엄청 재밌게 봤지 키키
English: Yeah I really enjoyed that, Kiki
Sister, did you see the steamed bun episode?

Korean: 그거 내용이 뭐였더라? ㅠㅠ 말해줘야 알 것 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: What was that about? ㅠㅠ I think I need to tell you so you can understand ㅠㅠ
That grandma who sells dumplings and steamed buns!

Korean: 너무 오래돼서 그렇게 말해도 기억이 안 난다 ㅠㅠ
English: It's been so long that I don't remember even if you say it like that ㅠㅠ

Korean: 할 ㅜㅜ 나 이거 보고 울었다 ㅜㅜ
English: I cried when I saw this ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아쒸 ㅠㅠ 눈물 흘리고 싶을 때 한번 찾아봐야겠네 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my gosh ㅠㅠ I should look it up sometime when I feel like crying ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 할머니가 돈 계산을 못 해서 애들이 그거 노리고 가는 편이거든 ㅜㅜ
English: That's right ㅜㅜ My grandmother can't count money, so the kids tend to go after that ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 헐 ㅠㅠ 애들이라 그럴 수 있지만 그러면 안돼 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my gosh ㅠㅠ They can do that because they're kids, but they shouldn't do that ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 근데 그 할머니 돌아가시고 돌아가실 때 기철이네 학교에 장학금으로 전재산 기부함 ㅜ
English: That's right, but when that grandmother passed away, she donated all her assets to Ki-cheol's school as a scholarship.

Korean: 헐 그 장사하고 버신 돈 기부하고 가신 거네 ㅠㅠ 맴찢이다...
English: Wow, he donated the money he earned from doing business and left... It's heartbreaking...
Oppa, I want to eat tteokbokki!

Korean: 야 내 옆에 있는 애인도 타령한다 키키
English: Hey, my lover next to me is also complaining Kiki
Kiki, I heard that the new Yeoptteok menu item is famous these days!?
Are you sure you're getting cream tteokbokki truffle?
Is this what you're talking about?

Korean: 어 맞아! 오빠 그거 먹어 봄?
English: Oh, right! Have you tried that, oppa?

Korean: 아니 지금 옆에서 노래 부르는 사람 한 명 있다고 키키
English: No, there's someone singing next to me right now, Kiki
Kikikiki, eat it tomorrow because it's Friday!

Korean: 안돼ㅡㅡ 나는 느끼한 거 싫어한단 말이야!
English: No - I hate feeling stuffy!
Wow! My girlfriend wants to eat it!
Don't eat that either!

Korean: 야 남친이 먹기 싫다는 데 좀 안 먹어줘야지
English: Hey, my boyfriend doesn't want to eat it, so I shouldn't eat it.

Korean: 키키 휴, 그러면 그 전에 나온 로제떡볶이는 어때?
English: Kiki Hugh, then how about the rose tteokbokki that came out before?

Korean: 음 그건 좀 먹을 만한 거 같기도 하고!
English: Hmm, that looks kind of edible!
Yeah, that's not spicy and it's delicious!

Korean: 아 근데 내가 또 맵찔이잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh but I'm also a spicy person ㅠㅠ
Kiki, I guess my girlfriend should just eat with her friends~

Korean: 응 그게 좋을 거 같아 입맛 맞는 좋은 친구들~
English: Yeah, that sounds good, good friends with good tastes~
Are you smoking right now, oppa?

Korean: 응 나 완전 많이 한다고 구박 받아
English: Yeah I get bullied a lot for doing that
Then how do you smoke it at home?

Korean: 우리 집 화장실 두 개라 하나에 들어가서 하지
English: There are two bathrooms in my house, so I go into one and do it.

Korean: 그러면 부모님이 오빠 담배 피는 거 알아?
English: So your parents know that your brother smokes?

Korean: 웅 알고 계셔서 되게 냄새난다고 싫어해 키키
English: Yeah, I know you hate it because it smells so bad Kiki

Korean: 키키 하루에 몇 갑을 피는 거야!?
English: Kiki, how many packs do you smoke a day!?

Korean: 나 한 갑 정도는 그냥 피는 거 같아 키키
English: I think I'll just smoke a pack or so Kiki
Wow, awesome, what are you talking about, oppa?
I don't know if you've heard of Moebius!
No I only know SL Life Kiki

Korean: 키키 너는 그거 어디서 듣고 온 거야 키키
English: Kiki, where did you hear that from Kiki?

Korean: 나 어렸을 때 우리 아빠 심부름 키키
English: When I was little, my dad would run errands for me
Everyone learns from their dad, right? Kiki

Korean: 키키 그럼~ 오빠 그러면 꽁초는 화장실 휴지통에 버려?
English: Kiki: Then oppa, do you throw away cigarette butts in the bathroom trash can?

Korean: 그냥 물 묻혀서 불 끄고 휴지통에 버려!
English: Just put it in water, put it out, and throw it in the trash!
Have you ever driven an electric car, oppa?

Korean: 아니 주변에 전기차는 없어서 안하고 전기 자전거는 타봤어!
English: No, I didn't ride an electric car because there were no electric vehicles around, but I rode an electric bicycle!
Electric bicycle,?
Oppa, did you buy one?

Korean: 아니 장만한 건 아니고 놀러 가면 전기 자전거 많자너~
English: No, it's not that I bought it, but there are a lot of electric bikes when I go out to play~

Korean: 아 키키 약간 제주도의 스쿠터와 같은 느낌인가?
English: Ah Kiki, does it feel a bit like a scooter in Jeju Island?

Korean: 맞아 요즘은 우도에 전기자전거도 꽤 많아 키키
English: Yes, these days there are quite a few electric bicycles in Udo.

Korean: 오 대박 키키 오빠 그거 타 봤어?
English: Oh my gosh, Kiki, have you tried that?

Korean: 웅 나 이번에 그거 타고 왔어 키키
English: Yeah I came riding that this time Kiki
Wow! How much is that for an hour?

Korean: 아니 이건 되게 좋은 게 시간이 무제한이고 15000원이야!
English: No, this is really great because it has unlimited time and costs 15,000 won!
Wow! Amazing! Why is it so cheap?

Korean: 대박이지 그거 진짜 좋아 난 또 가면 그거 탈거야
English: Wow, I really like it. I'll ride it again when I go there.
How fast is that?

Korean: 앞에 있는 차들 추월 가능할 정도로는 무조건 나오고 빨라
English: It's definitely fast enough to overtake the cars in front of you.

Korean: 키키 헐 그러면 거기에 스쿠터 다 사라지겠다!
English: Kiki Huh? Then all the scooters will disappear!

Korean: 맞아 키키 너 자전거 탈줄 알면 이거 빌려서 해 키키
English: Right Kiki, if you know how to ride a bike, borrow this and do it Kiki

Korean: 오빠 그때 뭐 배워보고 싶다고 그랬지?
English: Oppa, what did you say you wanted to learn back then?

Korean: 나 배우고 싶은 거 짱 많아서 기억도 안난다 키키
English: I have so many things I want to learn that I can't even remember Kiki

Korean: 키키 그러면 외국어 같은 거는 배울 생각 없어?
English: Kiki: Then, do you have any plans to learn a foreign language or something?

Korean: 나 예전에 야나두 해봤었는데 키키 개 망했으
English: I tried Yanado before, but Kiki was a total failure

Korean: 키키 앗 나도 그거 공구해서 해 봤거든? 소용없음~
English: Kiki Oh, I tried that too. It didn't work~

Korean: 키키 너 그거 얼마나 듣고선 포기 했냐?
English: Kiki, how many times did you hear that before you gave up?
How much have you heard?
I've never heard of it!
Real story? You've never really heard of it?
Oh, I don't even remember?

Korean: 난 그래도 일주일은 들었던 걸로 기억해 키키
English: I remember listening to it for a week, Kiki

Korean: 키키 그거 언제 정도 수강해야 연장되는데 아무도 듣지 않았어 키키
English: Kiki, how long should I take that class to extend it? No one listened to it Kiki

Korean: 키키 너네도 진짜 대박이네 나도 그랬거든 키키
English: Kiki, you guys are really great too, I was like that too Kiki

Korean: 키키 아니 안 듣는다고 해도 누군가는 대충 틀어야 하잖아 키키
English: Kiki, even if you don't listen, someone has to turn it on somehow Kiki
I did it because they said it would take 10 minutes a day?

Korean: 근데 10분 넘어가길래 배신감 들어서 안 했어 키키
English: But I didn't do it because I felt betrayed after more than 10 minutes, Kiki

Korean: 키키 나는 초보라면서 에이비씨부터 안 가르치더라고 키키
English: Kiki I'm a beginner so they didn't teach me ABC Kiki

Korean: 나 거기서 배운 거 엔조이 아니고 인조이라는 거 배웠어 키키
English: What I learned there was not enjoyment, but artificiality, Kiki

Korean: 오빠 친구들은 오빠 군대 면회 온 적 있어?
English: Have your friends ever come to visit you in the military?

Korean: 우리는 다 비슷한 시기에 들어가서 그런 건 없었어 ㅠㅠ
English: We all went in around the same time so there was no such thing ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그러면 배정 친구랑 된 적 있었어?
English: So have you ever been with a friend you were assigned to?

Korean: 아니 배정은 같이 안되고 다 찢어짐 ㅠㅠ
English: No, the assignments aren't the same and they're all torn apart ㅠㅠ
Yeah? Did you have a friend who enlisted at the same time?

Korean: 없지 당연히 키키 그래서 찢어진 거지 키키
English: No, of course Kiki, that's why it's torn Kiki

Korean: 아 그렇구나 비슷한 시기에만 갔다는 거구나?
English: Oh, I see. So you went around the same time?

Korean: 웅 그래도 거기서 동생들이랑 많이 친해졌어
English: Yeah, but I became really close with my younger siblings there.

Korean: 근데 진짜 디피에서 나오는 그런 괴롭힘도 있어?
English: But is there really such bullying as that in DP?

Korean: 응 그렇다고 하는데 나는 되게 재밌게 생활했어!
English: Yeah, that's true, but I had a really fun life!

Korean: 그거는 진짜 다행이다 사람을 잘 만나야 하나 봐!
English: That's really fortunate, I guess I just have to meet good people!

Korean: 일단 내 성격이 까불까불해서 키키 엄청 잘 놀고 그랬지
English: First of all, I have a mischievous personality, so I played with Kiki a lot.

Korean: 키키 다행이다 그때 오빠는 여친 있었어?
English: Kiki, thank goodness you had a girlfriend back then?

Korean: 웅 그때 친구 시켜서 꽃 배달 부탁하고 했던 기억이 나 키키
English: Yeah, I remember asking my friend to deliver flowers to me back then, Kiki.

Korean: 오 대박 키키 그 여친이랑 아직까지 진행 중이야!?
English: Oh my god Kiki, you're still going on dates with that girlfriend!?

Korean: 아니지 지금은 이별하고 새 사람을 만났지
English: No, we broke up and met someone new now.

Korean: 아 그래서 그 야나두 얼마 주고 배웠어?
English: Oh, so how much did you pay to learn Yanado?

Korean: 그때 기억이 좀 가물한데 40인가 50인가 그러지 않았나?
English: My memory is a bit hazy, but I think it was around 40 or 50?

Korean: 헐, 오빠 그 쌩돈 다 주고 한 거야,?
English: Wow, oppa, did you pay all that money for it?

Korean: 응 나 같이한 동료들이 있긴 있어... 키키
English: Yeah, I have colleagues that I worked with... Kiki
Kiki Hul, how many people did you do it with?

Korean: 나까지 총 세 명인데 키키 나중에 그냥 친구들한테 아이디 뿌리고 들으라고 해야 됐었나 봐 키키
English: There are three of us including me. Kiki, I guess I should have just told my friends to listen to the ID later. Kiki

Korean: 키키 괜찮아 내가 생각했을 때 그렇게 해도 안 들었음 키키
English: Kiki it's okay I thought it would be okay if you did that Kiki

Korean: 그래도 여러 명이면 작심삼일씩 하면 일 년은 늘어나지 않았을까?
English: But if there were several people, wouldn't it have been extended by a year if they had made a resolution for three days each?

Korean: 키키  기한만 늘고 나의 지식은 안 늘었겠지
English: Kiki, the deadline has just increased, but my knowledge hasn't increased.

Korean: 맞아 그리고 그것도 인원 제한이 있었던 거 같아 키키
English: Yeah and I think there was a limit on the number of people for that too Kiki

Korean: 키키 뭐 아이디 돌려가면서 썼으면 됐지 않았을까?
English: Kiki, wouldn't it have been better if you just rotated the IDs?

Korean: 근데 또 그때 어리니까 워낙 순수하잖니 키키
English: But then again, Kiki was so young and innocent

Korean: 키키 와 그때 몇 살 때였어?
English: Kiki, how old were you at that time?

Korean: 나 그때 아마도 24살? 이쯤 된 거 같아 키키
English: I think I was about 24 at that time, Kiki

Korean: 와 키키 그러면 진짜 어렸을 때다!
English: Wow Kiki, then you were really young!

Korean: 맞아 키키 매우 순수하고 아무것도 모를 때라고 하하
English: Yeah Kiki is very innocent and doesn't know anything haha

Korean: 부모님은 두 분 다 환갑 넘으셨어?
English: Are both of your parents over 60?

Korean: 아니 우리 부모님은 아직 안되셨고 곧 바라봐 하하
English: No my parents haven't come yet, look forward to it soon haha

Korean: 그러면 이제 환갑 잔치는 안 하더라도 같이 밥은 먹어야지!?
English: Then, even if we don't have a 60th birthday party, we should still eat together, right!?

Korean: 가족끼리 모여서 외식은 한번 하러 가야지 키키
English: Let's go out for a meal with the family Kiki
Yes, we are turning 60 soon, Dad.

Korean: 너네 환갑이랑 퇴직이랑 하면 파티가 많겠는 걸?
English: I bet you guys have a lot of parties for your 60th birthday and retirement.

Korean: 하, 용돈은 얼마 정도로  측정해야 할까,?
English: Ha, how much should I measure my allowance at?

Korean: 일단 환갑 때는 좀 많이 드려야 되는 거 아니야?
English: Shouldn't you give a lot when you're 60?

Korean: 나 전재산이 130만 원 있는데 내 영혼 털어야 하니,?
English: I have 1.3 million won in assets, so should I sell my soul?

Korean: 너 많다 나는 지금 사만원 있어 키키
English: You have a lot. I have 40,000 won right now. Kiki.

Korean: 키키 지금까지 벌던 돈 다 어디 갔어!
English: Kiki, where did all the money I earned go?

Korean: 나 오늘이 결제일... 그래서 순삭 당했어... 키키
English: Today is my payment day... so I got scammed... Kiki
Wow, is this true? How much did it cost? ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나 이번 달은 100만원 나오더라고 ㅠㅠ 할분데 ㅠㅠ
English: I got 1 million won this month ㅠㅠ I'm going to do it ㅠㅠ

Korean: 핫, 오빠 빨리 돈 모아야지 ㅜㅜ
English: Hot, oppa, I need to save money quickly ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나 대신 니가 좀 벌고 불우이웃 해줘라 하하
English: You earn some money for me and help the less fortunate haha
When are you getting married, oppa?
I don't have any thoughts yet, maybe around 34?
Are you getting married in Nonsan, oppa?
Or where are you going to do it?

Korean: 일단 집이 논산이니까 논산에서 하지 않을까?
English: First of all, since my house is in Nonsan, why not do it in Nonsan?
Is there a good wedding hall in Nonsan?

Korean: 여기는 항상 사람들이 하는 한 군데 있어 키키
English: There's always one place where people do this Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 거기 팔보채 맛집 아니야?
English: Kiki, isn't that a famous Palbochae restaurant there?
No, the water here is delicious, Kiki
Water? Oh, so you mean it tastes bad?

Korean: 응 맞아 나 그래서 가면 김밥이랑 김치 먹어 하하
English: Yeah that's right so when I go I eat kimbap and kimchi haha

Korean: 내가 아는 언니 내년에 결혼하는데 밥값만  6만 원이래,  나는 그러면 축의금을 얼마를,
English: A friend of mine is getting married next year and the cost of food alone is 60,000 won. So how much should I give as a wedding gift?
One meal ticket costs sixty thousand won?
Doesn't that sound nonsensical?

Korean: 어, 거기는 스테이크도 구워주고 랍스타도 나온대,
English: Oh, they grill steak there and serve lobster too.

Korean: 아 호텔 안에 있는 결혼식장 인가보네 키키 그런데는 진짜 좋더라
English: Oh, is that a wedding hall inside a hotel? Kiki, it was really nice.

Korean: 나 축의금 최소 10만 원은 줘야 겠지,?
English: I should give at least 100,000 won as a congratulatory gift, right?

Korean: 응 금액 말한 거 보면 5만원 내면 죽는다는 뜻이지 ^^
English: Yeah, judging from the amount you mentioned, it means you'll die if you pay 50,000 won ^^

Korean: 오빠는 밖에서 키우는 강아지 사료 뭐 줘?
English: What kind of food do you give your outdoor dog?

Korean: 우리는 그냥 철물점에서 파는 거 사와 키키
English: We just bought what we bought at the hardware store.
Kiki's hardware store, is this true? Kiki

Korean: 근데 나도 알 거 같아 키키
English: But I think I know too, Kiki
You know that thing the size of a rice sack?

Korean: 그거 20kg 짜리 사서 주고 있어 키키
English: I bought that 20kg and gave it to Kiki

Korean: 와 맞아 키키 그러면 그거 애기가 맛있게 먹어?
English: Wow, that's right Kiki. Then does the baby enjoy eating that?

Korean: 웅 항상 주던 거라 잘 먹는데 가끔 투정 해 키키
English: Yeah, I always give it to him so he eats it well, but he sometimes complains.

Korean: 밖에서 키우는 애들은 보통 먹다 남은 밥 주던데!
English: Kids raised outside are usually given leftover food!

Korean: 맞아 나도 가끔 주기는 해 키키
English: Yeah, I give it to you sometimes too Kiki

Korean: 키키 나도 어렸을 때 특식이라고 미역국에 밥 말아줌!
English: Kiki When I was little, I used to have rice wrapped in seaweed soup as a special meal!

Korean: 오 미역국이면 완전 특식이지 우린 탕수육 줬어 키키
English: Oh, if it's seaweed soup, it's a special dish. We gave them sweet and sour pork. Kiki

Korean: 키키 와 키키 애기 환장하겠는데 그러니까 사료를 안 먹지!
English: Kiki and Kiki the Baby are going crazy, so they won't eat their food!

Korean: 가끔 족발도 주는데 엄청 잘 먹더라 키키
English: Sometimes they give pig's feet too, and he eats them very well.

Korean: 그거 뼈 숨겨 놨다가 애들 까먹는 거 알아?
English: Do you know that they hide bones and then the kids forget about them?

Korean: 그렇게 멍청하단 말이야? 키키 귀엽네 하하
English: Are you that stupid? Kiki is cute haha

Korean: 키키 진짜야 찾아주면 그때 돼서 먹어 키키
English: Kiki, if you find it, then eat it Kiki

Korean: 근데 족발 뼈는 너무 커서 먹기 힘들 거 같아 하하
English: But the pig's feet bones are so big I think it'll be hard to eat haha
Honey, have you ever played table tennis?

Korean: 웅 나 초등학교 때 해봤던 거 같은데 키키
English: Yeah, I think I did it in elementary school. Kiki
When I was in elementary school?
Where have you tried it?

Korean: 여기 공설운동장 있는데 거기에 탁구장이 있었어 키키
English: There's a public sports field here, and there's a table tennis court there. Kiki
Oh right, they do a lot of that there!
Who did you do it with then, oppa?

Korean: 나 그때 가족들이랑 가서 많이 했어 키키
English: I went there with my family and did a lot of things Kiki
I guess your parents like table tennis!?

Korean: 아니 다른 친척들 놀러 오면 갈 데가 없으니까 거기 다녔거든 키키
English: No, when other relatives came to visit, I had nowhere to go, so I went there, Kiki.

Korean: 헐 키키 진짜 그때는 볼링장이 없었나?
English: Oh my gosh, Kiki, there really wasn't a bowling alley back then?

Korean: 일단 우리 집에 그때 볼링 치는 사람들이 없었어!
English: First of all, there was no one in my house who played bowling at that time!

Korean: 그러면 가족끼리 하면 대회 같은 거도 해?
English: Then, if you do it with your family, do you have competitions or something?

Korean: 그냥 그땐 점수로만 했었던 거 같아 키키
English: I think back then it was just about scores Kiki

Korean: 키키 그렇구나 우리는 볼링 치러 많이 갔었어!
English: Kiki: Oh, right. We went bowling a lot!

Korean: 너 그럼 지금도 볼링은 꽤나 치겠다 키키
English: You must be pretty good at bowling now, Kiki
I'm 40 now? Is that okay?
Wow, that's similar to me, I'm 30!
Oppa, did you have a Go board at home?

Korean: 웅 우리 집에 바둑판 당연히 있었지 키키
English: Yeah, of course we had a Go board at home Kiki

Korean: 그러면 오빠는 바둑 말고 알까기 했지?
English: Then, oppa, you played Alkkagi instead of Baduk?

Korean: 그건 바둑판 꺼내지도 않지 상에서 해야지 키키
English: You shouldn't even take out the Go board, you should do it on the table Kiki

Korean: 키키 왜? 바둑판에서 하는 게 더 재밌지 않아?
English: Kiki, why? Isn't it more fun to play on a Go board?

Korean: 아니야 멀리 보내기 이런 건 또 해줘야 한다구 하하
English: No, I have to do this again, sending it far away haha

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 그러면 오빠 알까기 잘 해?
English: Kiki, really? Then, oppa, are you good at telling me?

Korean: 알까기 생각보다는 좀 하는 거 같아 키키
English: I think it's a bit more than I thought Kiki

Korean: 키키  나 겁나 잘 함 나 알까기 신!
English: Kiki I'm so good I know you God!

Korean: 오 손가락 컨트롤이 아주 자유로운가 보군 하하
English: Oh, your finger control seems to be very free haha

Korean: 그럼 그럼~ 나 손가락은 작지만 컨트롤이 잘 됨!
English: Okay, okay~ My fingers are small, but I have good control!

Korean: 원래 손 작은 애들이 아기자기하게 그런 거 잘 하더라 키키
English: Kiki, kids with small hands are good at doing that kind of cute thing.
Kiki, that's right, that's me~

Korean: 다음에 너랑 붙어야 할 것들이 늘어나고 있구나!
English: There are more and more things I have to deal with next!

Korean: 키키 오빠가 선공해 그리고 내가 바둑알 하나 빼줄게~ 핸디캡~
English: Kiki oppa goes first and I'll take one of the stones away~ Handicap~

Korean: 키키 그정도로 내가 못하지는 않지만 봐준다는 건 거절 안 함~
English: Kiki I'm not that bad, but I won't refuse if you let me see it~
Honey, do you know Seongsu-dong in Seoul?

Korean: 아니 삼성동은 아는데 성수동은 몰라 키키
English: No, I know Samseong-dong, but I don't know Seongsu-dong Kiki

Korean: 키키 거기 여친이랑 가면 여친 진짜 좋아할 걸?
English: Kiki, if you go there with your girlfriend, she'll really like it, right?
Why do you like it when there's something there?

Korean: 응 거기 아모레 화장품 다 모여있는 곳 있어!
English: Yeah, there's a place that has all the Amore cosmetics!

Korean: 아 예전에 한창 인터넷에 떠돌던 그런 건가?
English: Oh, is that something that was floating around the internet a long time ago?
That's right, there's also a Sherlock Cafe on the second floor!
Looks like you spent a lot of money there, Kiki

Korean: 거기 입장만 해도 샘플 몇 개 줌!
English: Just by entering there, you'll be given a few samples!
There's also something like Sulwhasoo!

Korean: 아 그거 엄마들 가져다주면 되게 좋아하지 키키
English: Oh, if you bring that to moms, they'll really like it Kiki

Korean: 아이오페도 있고 헤라 샘플도 다 있음!
English: There are IOPE and Hera samples too!

Korean: 그거 골라서 가져올 수는 있는 거야?
English: Can you pick that out and bring it?

Korean: 어 샘플 바구니가 여러 개 있어!
English: Oh, there are several sample baskets!
Just get 5 from there!

Korean: 오 그럼 한번쯤 지나가면 방문은 해봐야겠다!
English: Oh, then I should visit there sometime when I pass by!

Korean: 그리고 나한테 맞는 파데랑 립스틱도 만들 수 있어!
English: And I can make my own foundation and lipstick!

Korean: 맨날 가서 5개씩 가져오는 거 괜찮으려나 키키
English: Kiki, is it okay to go and get 5 every day?

Korean: 오빠 대전은 지금 비 온다는 데 거기는 어때?
English: Oppa, I heard it's raining in Daejeon now. How is it there?

Korean: 대전? 여기는 대전 아니고 논산 입니다!
English: Daejeon? This is not Daejeon, it's Nonsan!
But still, Daejeon and Nonsan are in the same Chungnam region!

Korean: 그렇긴 하지만 차 타고 40분이나 가야 하는 걸?~
English: But it takes 40 minutes by car?~
Kiki: If it takes 40 minutes, the weather will be pretty similar!

Korean: 아니야 거기가 비 그치면 여기가 올 수도 있어!
English: No, if it stops raining there, we can come here!

Korean: 키키 그럴 수도 있지만 그래서 거기는 지금 안 온다는 거지?
English: Kiki: That might be true, but does that mean you're not coming there right now?

Korean: 웅 여기는 비는 아직 안 오고 있어
English: Yeah, it's not raining here yet.
So are you coming from Daejeon to Seoul?

Korean: 일단 사촌 동생 거기에 있나 체크부터 해봐~
English: First, check if your cousin is there~

Korean: 키키 사촌 동생 수원에 있어, 지금,
English: Kiki's cousin is in Suwon right now,
Oh, then it will rain there!

Korean: 키키 날씨 요정님 수원에서 계속 있을 예정이래 ㅜ
English: Kiki Weather Fairy is planning to stay in Suwon for a long time ㅜ

Korean: 내 애인이 날씨 진짜 요정이라 여기 비 안 올 거야~
English: My lover is a real weather fairy, so it won't rain here~

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 거기는 비를 몰고 오는 사람이 아니구나?
English: Kiki, really? Isn't that the guy who brings the rain?

Korean: 내 애인은 제주도 가서 비를 본 적이 없데
English: My lover has never seen rain since he went to Jeju Island.

Korean: 오빠 작년까지 유명했던 함소원이라는 사람 알아
English: Oppa, I know someone named Ham So-won who was famous until last year.

Korean: 응 알지 개 완전 사기꾼 아니야?
English: Yeah, I know, but he's not a total scammer, right?
That's right, it's gone to hell now.

Korean: 진화한테도 진짜 완전 많이 실망 함
English: I'm really, really disappointed in Jinhwa

Korean: 맞아, 진짜 그랬어 근데 또 지금 논란이야!
English: Yeah, that's true, but now there's controversy!

Korean: 거기는 항상 논란을 몰고 오네 이번에는 뭐라는 데?
English: There's always controversy there. What's it about this time?

Korean: 응, 꽃 원피스가 한 벌에 17만 원이야,
English: Yeah, the flower one-piece costs 170,000 won.

Korean: 근데 그게 왜 논란이 된 거야?
English: But why was that controversial?

Korean: 얘네가 운영하는 쇼핑몰에 올라온 건데 맞춤 제작이라고 하더니 대놓고 메이드인 차이나,
English: It was posted on a shopping mall they run, and they said it was custom-made, but it was blatantly made in China.

Korean: 근데 중국에서 살면 맞춤 제작도 중국산인 거 맞지 않아?
English: But if you live in China, isn't it true that even custom-made things are made in China?

Korean: 근데 지금 한국에 있잖아, 그러고 옷 사진도 엄청 어이없게 찍음!
English: But you're in Korea right now, and you take some really ridiculous pictures of your clothes!

Korean: 왜 옷 사진도 완전 엉망으로 찍고 올렸어?
