English: Why did you take such a mess of pictures of your clothes and post them?

Korean: 아니 원피스면 전체 샷을 찍어야 하는데 자기 셀카 밖에 없음,
English: No, if it's a one piece, you have to take a full body shot, but there's only a selfie.

Korean: 그게 뭐야 본인 sns 활동 하는 거야? 키키
English: What is that? Are you active on SNS? Kiki

Korean: 원피스 17만 원이라고 올렸는데 지분 70%가 본인 얼굴밖에 없음 키키
English: One Piece was listed at 170,000 won, but 70% of the shares are only Kiki's face

Korean: 키키 뭘 보라고 올리는 건지 하나도 모르겠네 하하
English: Kiki, I have no idea what you're posting for me to see haha

Korean: 오빠 이번에 아이폰 하나 장만하지 않았어?
English: Honey, didn't you buy an iPhone this time?

English: Yeah I bought one but it's not mine Kiki

Korean: 아 그거 애인님 꺼라고 하지 않았나?
English: Oh, didn't you say that was your lover's?

Korean: 맞아 개 선물로 내가 하나 구입했지 키키
English: Yes, I bought one as a gift for Kiki.

Korean: 키키 잘했어 만약에 내년에 샀으면 더 비싸졌을 걸?
English: Kiki, you did well. If you had bought it next year, it would have been more expensive, right?

Korean: 왜? 아이폰 내년에 금액 엄청 올라간데?

Korean: 맞아 그래서 반도체 주식 올라간다더니 삼성 왜 이래?

Korean: 키키 삼성은 지금 대장님이 부재중이시잖아 ㅜ
English: Kiki Samsung, the captain is out right now ㅜ

Korean: 대장님 나왔는데 왜 또 부재야 ㅠ 짜증난다...
English: The captain is here, but why are you absent again? It's annoying...

Korean: 대장님 이제 막 자리 잡고 계시잖아 좀만 버텨!
English: Sir, you're just settling in. Just hold on a bit!

Korean: 웅 맞아 ㅠㅠ 아이폰 근데 내년에 얼마로 올라간데?
English: Yeah, that's right ㅠㅠ iPhone, but how much will the price go up next year?

Korean: 얼마로 올라가는 것보다 생산을 줄인대 1000만 대나 줄인대!
English: Rather than going up by a certain amount, they are reducing production by 10 million units!

Korean: 아 그럼 한정 판매를 한다는 거네 키키 무슨 명품인 줄 아나
English: Oh, so you're saying it's a limited edition? Do you know what luxury brand Kiki is?

Korean: 그렇지 근데 엄청 또 살 거 아니야 사람들이!
English: Yeah but I guess a lot of people will buy it again!

Korean: 맞아 나 같은 앱등이 ㅠ 그냥 다시 삼성 가련다 ㅎ
English: Yeah, apps like mine are like that ㅠ I guess I'll just go back to Samsung hehe
Did you get your eyebrows tattooed, oppa?

English: No, my eyebrows are originally dark Kiki

Korean: 오 나는 내남친 눈썹은 어떻게 바꿔줘야 할지 모르겠어!
English: Oh I don't know how to change my boyfriend's eyebrows!
Brother, did you not originally have eyebrows?

Korean: 아니 눈썹이 있는데 약간 화나있는 눈썹이랄까?
English: No, there are eyebrows, but they're a bit angry eyebrows?

Korean: 아 근데 원래 눈썹을 다 없앨 수는 없잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh but you can't just remove all your eyebrows ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그렇지 너무 앵그리버드처럼 각도가 나 있어!
English: Yeah, it's so angled like an angry bird!

Korean: 근데 형님 얼굴이 순하셔서 눈썹정도는 화가 나도 돼!
English: But since your face is so innocent, it's okay to be angry about your eyebrows!
Kiki, is that so?

Korean: 근데 또 남자는 일자 눈썹은 별로겠지?
English: But then again, men wouldn't look good with straight eyebrows, right?

Korean: 아니면 디자인 왁싱하는 데를 가서 한번 뽑고 와봐
English: Or go to a design waxing place and get it plucked out.

Korean: 오 그럴까? 내가 주변만 깎아주고 있긴 하거든?
English: Oh, really? I'm just cutting down on the surroundings.

Korean: 또 전문가가 해주는 거랑은 다르니까 한번 가서 해봐
English: Also, it's different from what experts do, so go and try it once.

Korean: 오 그래야겠다 서울에도 그런 곳 있겠지?

Korean: 당연하지 여기도 있는데 거기는 엄청 많겠지!
English: Of course there are some here too, but there must be a lot there!
Oh, thank you for the good information!

Korean: 키키 나도 여자친구가 맨날 해서 주워 듣는 거야...
English: Kiki, I also listen to it because my girlfriend does it all the time...
Brother, Mother Nature happened to me,
Mother Nature? What's going on?
Really?

Korean: 아니, 여자들이 한 달에 한 번씩 하는 거,
English: No, it's something that women do once a month,
Oh, they said that was the worst. Does it hurt?
Yeah, I'm so sick right now,

Korean: 그거 안 아플 수 있는 방법은 없는 거야?
English: Is there any way for that not to hurt?

Korean: 어, 여친은 이런 얘기 잘 안 해?
English: Oh, doesn't your girlfriend talk about this kind of thing often?

Korean: 항상 오기 일주일 전에 싸우더라고 키키 엄청 예민

Korean: 키키 그럴 때는 진짜 오빠가 참아줘야 해,
English: Kiki, in times like that, you really have to put up with it,

Korean: 근데 나도 오는지 맨날 체크가 안되니까 막 싸우지 키키
English: But I can't check every day if I'm coming, so we keep fighting

Korean: 키키 오빠 핸드폰 앱에 좋은 거 깔아줄게 키키
English: Kiki Oppa, I'll install a good app on your phone Kiki
Isn't that always accurate?
But most of the time, they are all correct!

Korean: 그냥 개가 화 엄청 내면 곧 오는구나 하면 되더라고 키키
English: Just say that if a dog gets really angry, it will come soon. Kiki

Korean: 키키 그럴 때 그냥 맛있는 거 사주면 돼!

Korean: 그때 되면 또 속이 안 좋아서 밥을 안 먹어요 키키

Korean: 내가 아까 좋은  앱 알려준다고 했지,?

Korean: 그래도 여친을 위해서 한 번 깔아 봐!

Korean: 여자들이 좋아할 만한 그런 어플이야? 키키
English: Is this the kind of app that girls would like? Kiki

English: Oh, it's an app that tells you your menstrual cycle. I saw it and thought about buying it for my boyfriend.

Korean: 키키 그건 여친이 아니라 나를 위한 어플인거 같은데? 키키
English: Kiki, that's an app for me, not for my girlfriend. Kiki

Korean: 그렇지 안 돼지 핑크다이어리라고 있는 이거 깔아!

Korean: 아 그거 깔면 나 이제 싸움 안 날 수 있는 건가?

Korean: 어 오빠가 알아서 시작하는 날을 지정하면 알아서 얘가 예정 주기를 알려줘!
English: Oh, if you pick a starting day, she'll tell you the expected cycle!

Korean: 한동안 언제 하나 지켜보고 그래야겠네 키키

Korean: 키키 맞아 그리고 여기 보면 여자한테 좋은 물건 같은 거 같이 파니까 사 주면 더 좋고!

Korean: 그런 거 사줘도 쓰는 성격이 아닌 거 같아 키키

Korean: 아니야 여자들이 잘 쓰는 거 올리니까 한 번 봐봐 원플원도 잘 해!

Korean: 그냥 기분 좋게 좋아하는 거 사주는 게 좋을 거 같아!
English: I think it would be better to just buy something that makes you feel good!
Honey, have you ever seen Exercise Fat on YouTube?

Korean: 아 혹시 그거 김민경 말하는 건가?

Korean: 그 사람 총 쏘는 거 봤는데 진짜 멋있더라 키키
English: I saw that guy shoot a gun and it was really cool Kiki

Korean: 아 그거? 나도 그거 봤는데 진짜 못하는 게 뭐야!

Korean: 퐝 명중 퐝 명중 퐝 명중 남자보다 잘 하던데?
English: Phew hit, phew hit, phew hit. Are you better than a man?

Korean: 키키 맞아 그리고 뭔가 몸의 밸런스도 맞아서 안정적으로 보여!

Korean: 맞아 그래서 나도 보면서 감탄하면서 봤잖아 키키
English: That's right, so I watched it and admired it too, Kiki

Korean: 키키 김민경도 권투 하는 거 있는데  봤어?

Korean: 키키 어 맞아 키키 그거 찐으로 날라간 거래!
English: Kiki, that's right Kiki, that's a real deal!

Korean: 맞아 그분 엄청 놀라신 거 같긴 하더라 키키
English: Yeah, he seemed really surprised, Kiki

Korean: 그 납작하게 누워서 넘기는 그거 말하는 건가?
English: Are you talking about that thing where you lie flat and turn over?

Korean: 어 키키 정형돈이 자기 두 다리를 줬는데 생각보다 무거워서 레슬링 선수 넘어감 키키
English: Oh Kiki Jung Hyung Don gave his two legs, but they were heavier than expected, so the wrestler fell over Kiki

Korean: 헐 키키 넘 웃기네 둘 다 민망한 상황이였을거 같아 키키
English: Wow Kiki is so funny. I think it must have been an embarrassing situation for both of them. Kiki

Korean: 오빠는 그러면 만화 같은 거 안 좋아해?
English: Then, oppa, you don't like things like comics?

Korean: 아니 무슨 소리야 남자들에겐 원나블이라고 몰라?!
English: What are you talking about? Don't you know that men are one-of-a-kind?!
There's Wonable, but there's also Slam Dunk!

Korean: 와 대박 키키 하이큐는 피구 만화였던가?
English: Wow, wow, Kiki Haikyuu was a dodgeball manga?
No, that's a volleyball manga~ Bread Sister~

Korean: 아 맞아! 나도 김연경 선수 때문에 그 만화 보고 싶더라~

Korean: 나도 처음에만 보고 안 봤는데 그거 한번 보려고 넷플에 있어!
English: I saw it at first and then didn't watch it, but it's on Netflix so I'll watch it!

Korean: 맞아 키키 넷플이 어느  순간 사라지는 것도 있더라고 사라지기 전에 봐야지!
English: That's right, Kiki, there are times when Netflix disappears, so I have to watch it before it disappears!

Korean: 맞아 시간 지나면 없어지는 거 있어서 나올 때 무조건 봐야 해
English: Yes, there are some that disappear over time, so you have to watch them when they come out.

Korean: 키키 맞아 하이큐가 왼손은 거들 뿐이라는 명대사가 나온 만화였나?
English: Kiki, right? Was that the manga where the famous line "Haikyuu only uses his left hand?" came from?
Oh really? Is that the famous line there?
Isn't it a slam dunk?
Ahhhh that's right slam dunk!
It's from a basketball manga!

Korean: 키키 하두 이것저것 보니까 짬뽕되서 헷갈리나 보다 키키
English: Kiki, you're looking at so many different things, you must be confused because it's all mixed up Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 키키 이거 다음에는 테니스의 왕자 봐야지!
English: Kiki, that's right Kiki, next time I have to watch Prince of Tennis!

Korean: 아 그거 내 여자친구 분이 굉장히 좋아하는 만화야 키키
English: Oh, that's a cartoon my girlfriend really likes. Kiki
Does your grandmother like any kind of fruit?
Of course I like apples ~ What about you?
I like watermelon the best

Korean: 그래서 작은엄마네 가면 매일 사과를 깎아줬구나!
English: So that's why I peeled apples for my grandmother every day!

Korean: 응 맞아 우리집은 사과가 비어 있지 않아
English: Yeah, that's right, our house is not empty of apples.

Korean: 키키 그러면 사과 사러 가는 단골집 있어?
English: Kiki, do you have a favorite place to buy apples?
I ordered it separately from the internet
Do you like to shop at the post office when you have internet access?
Yeah, or you can order it at Homeplus Mall
How much do you pay for a box?
I bought about 5kg for 40,000 won. It was cheap.

Korean: 5키로에 4만 원이면 가격 꽤 쎈 거 아니야?
English: 40,000 won for 5 kilos is pretty expensive, isn't it?

Korean: 근데 품종 마다 달라서 좋은거 사려면 어쩔수 없어
English: But it varies by variety, so you can't help it if you want to buy a good one.
Then, does your grandmother like apples?
The adverb is the most delicious Kiki
Hongok is okay too!

Korean: 키키 요즘에 혹옥 파는 곳이 있어?
English: Kiki, is there a place that sells horok these days?
Then now is the season for Hongok~

Korean: 작은엄마는 집청소 몇일에 한 번씩 해?
English: How often does your grandmother clean the house?
Of course you should do it once every half day Kiki

Korean: 키키 그래서 집 가면 그렇게 깨끗했구나~
English: Kiki, that's why it was so clean when you got home~

Korean: 응 하도 털이 많이 빠져서 그래
English: Yeah, that's because I lose a lot of hair.

Korean: 키키 뭐 첫째도 그렇고 작은아빠도 그렇고 털 잘 안 빠지게 생겼던데?
English: Kiki: Well, both the first and second children don't seem to shed much hair, right?

Korean: 검은 머리 짐승들이 은근 많이 빠져
English: There are quite a few black haired beasts

Korean: 키키 오키 나도 자취방에서 머리카락 한 올만 보여도 다 치움!
English: Kiki Oki I also clean up even a single strand of hair in my studio apartment!
It's easy to clean with box tape.
Where can I buy Kiki box tape?
Go to a place like Daiso and buy a bunch~

no

Korean: 자기네들 죽을 때 되니까 말 안고 죽으면 천추의 한이 될 거 같아서 얘기했대,

I think it took about 3 hours

you?

no

you?

Monsta X?

I'm not that scared of Langzong

Korean: 키키 헐, 그러면 너가 봤던 공포영화 중에 뭐가 제일 무서웠어?

Eat mushrooms, tops, and cordyceps!
Huh? What kind of mushroom is Dongchunghwacho? Kiki

English: Kiki, there's that golden mushroom that looks like a oyster mushroom!

Korean: 아 갈색깔 좀 지저분해 보이는 그거 말하는건가

Korean: 키키 왜 그거 다른 버섯들이랑 뭐가 다른데?

Korean: 그럼 샤브샤브는 같이 먹으러 못 가겠다 키키

Korean: 맞아 저번에 아는 오빠네 집 갔는데 수컷 향기가 장난 아니더라,

Korean: 나는 잘 모르겠는데 사람들은 그렇다고 하더라고 키키
English: I don't know, but people say so Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 남자 혼자살면 그 특유의 냄새가 있어!
English: Kiki, that's right. When a man lives alone, he has that special smell!
Is it only men who can't feel that? Kiki

Korean: 그래서 그 오빠네 집들이 선물도 디퓨져 투척함

Korean: 근데 그렇게 주면 그 오빠도 좀 그래하지 않아? 키키
English: But if you give it to him like that, won't he be a little like that too? Kiki

Korean: 키키 아니 향 좋다고 좋아하던데? 키키
English: Kiki, you like the scent, don't you? Kiki
Oh, that guy is a bit open
I think I'll be depressed if I get it Kiki

Korean: 키키 왜 키키 호르몬 분비 때문에 어쩔 수 없는 거잖아
English: Kiki, why Kiki, you can't help it because of your hormone secretion
Well, that's true ㅠㅠ
What can I do? I have to clean well.

Korean: 맞아 키키 근데 오빠네는 안 나는 거 같음 다행으로 생각해!
English: Yeah Kiki but I don't think it's me oppa so that's a relief!

Korean: 나는 진짜 신경을 많이 쓰고 지내잖아 키키
English: I really care a lot, Kiki
Have you ever been on a boat, oppa?

Korean: 아니 나는 배 타본적은 없어 키키
English: No I've never been on a boat Kiki

Korean: 진짜? 제주도 갈 때 안 타 봤어?
English: Really? Didn't you ride it when you went to Jeju Island?

Korean: 아 순간 나는 낚시 배 말하는 줄 키키
English: Oh for a moment I thought you were talking about a fishing boat Kiki
And we used to ride on a chubby boat too
When did we last ride the tummy tummy?

Korean: 우리 회사에서 제주도 여행갔을 때 키키
English: When our company went on a trip to Jeju Island, Kiki
Oh, back then? Was that a chubby belly?
Wasn't that a yacht?
You rode a yacht and a boat too!
Didn't I get a chubby belly?
I don't remember at all

Korean: 오빠 옛날 사진첩 빨리 열어 봐 키키
English: Oppa, open your old photo album quickly, Kiki

Korean: 나 핸드폰 바꿔서 지금 사진이 없어 키키
English: I changed my phone so I don't have any pictures right now Kiki

Korean: 오케이 키키 나도 핸드폰 맛가서 다 사라짐 ㅜ
English: Okay Kiki, my phone went bad too and everything disappeared ㅜ
Oh my, that would be a shame

Korean: 나는 그래도 노트북에 다 옮겨 둠 키키
English: I still transferred everything to my laptop Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 그러면 빨리 우리 통통배 탔던 거 찾아 봐!
English: Kiki, really? Then let's quickly find the one we rode on!

Korean: 야 이거는 핸드폰이랑 달라서 찾기 힘들어 키키
English: Hey, this is different from the cell phone so it's hard to find Kiki

Korean: 오빠는 회사 퇴직하면 뭐 할 거야?
English: What are you going to do when you quit your job?

Korean: 나는 퇴직하면 일단 돈이 많을거 같아 키키
English: I think I'll have a lot of money once I retire Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 맞아 오빠 적금든 거 장난 아니지?
English: Kiki, that's right, oppa, your savings are no joke, right?
I'm gritting my teeth right now

Korean: 그래서 그때 되면 건물 하나 꼭 산다 내가
English: So when that happens, I will definitely buy a building.
Kiki, really?
So, oppa, your ultimate dream is to become a building owner?

Korean: 근데 요즘 건물도 별로라고해서 투자 할데 알아둬야겠지 키키
English: But these days, buildings are not that great either, so I need to know that before investing. Kiki

Korean: 요즘에는 어디에 투자하는 게 제일 좋대?
English: Where is the best place to invest these days?

Korean: 글쎄 사람들 보면 되게 다양하게 하던데 그중에 들어보고 해야겠어 키키
English: Well, when I look at people, they do it in so many different ways. I'll have to listen to some of them and try them out. Kiki
How's the solar business these days?
That's been dead for a long time, Kiki
It's too late now.

Korean: 키키 헐 거기다가 투자한 사람들 어떻게 해?
English: Kiki, what about the people who invested there?

Korean: 그전에 투자한 사람들은 괜찮아 계약을 20년 하니까
English: Those who invested before are okay because the contract is for 20 years.

Korean: 그렇구나 키키 그러면 오빠 퇴직은 언제 할 거야?
English: Oh, I see. Kiki. Then when are you going to retire, oppa?

Korean: 그래도 내가 일은 꾸준히 해야지 키키
English: But I have to keep working, Kiki
I guess I'll have to run until I'm 50, Kiki
Did you say you were going to bury your bones there? Kiki

Korean: 나는 크게 일 없으면 계속 다닐 예정이야
English: I plan to keep going unless something big comes up.

Korean: 오빠는 육군 해군 공군 중에 어디로 나왔음?
English: Brother, where did you go from the Army, Navy, and Air Force?
I'm from the army Kiki

Korean: 키키 육군 키키 내가 아는 분 공군 직업군인임!
English: Kiki Army Kiki I know someone who is a career soldier in the Air Force!
Oh, that's cool?
How about that?

Korean: 근데 공군이라고 다 비행하는 건 아니더라!
English: But not all air forces fly!

Korean: 왜? 공군이면 비행하고 낙하하고 그래야되는거 아니야?
English: Why? If you're in the Air Force, aren't you supposed to fly and parachute and stuff?
No, there are soldiers who fix fighter planes too!
Oh, so he's an engineer?

Korean: 어 맞아 오빠는 공군인데 엔지니어 같은 역할을 하고 있대!
English: Oh, that's right, my brother is in the Air Force and he's working in a role like an engineer!

Korean: 아 그럼 공군 아니여도 엔지니어로 들어갔겠네 키키
English: Oh, then you would have gone into engineering even if you weren't in the Air Force Kiki

Korean: 키키 어 맞아 거기 퇴직하면 공항으로 들어갈 거래!
English: Kiki, that's right, when you retire there, you'll go to the airport!

Korean: 오 그럼 공항 비행기 엔지니어 되는거야?
English: Oh, so you're going to be an airport flight engineer?

Korean: 어 맞아 직업군인일 때도 경력 인정이 된다더라!
English: Oh, that's right. I heard that your career is recognized even if you are a career soldier!

Korean: 오 그래도 잘 들어갔네 잘됬다 키키
English: Oh well, it went in well, good job Kiki

Korean: 어 맞아 공부 엄청 많이 해서 들어갔대!
English: Oh, that's right! I heard you studied really hard to get in!

Korean: 역시 노력은 배신을 하지 않는구나 키키
English: As expected, hard work never betrays Kiki
Oppa, don't you plan on learning drums?

Korean: 아 우리 이모 요즘 드럼 하는거 영상 보내더라 키키
English: Oh, my aunt sent me a video of her playing drums recently. Kiki
Does your aunt like playing drums? Kiki

Korean: 맞아 지금 취미생활 하고 계시는거 같더라고 키키
English: Yeah, it looks like you're having a hobby right now, Kiki

Korean: 와 진짜? 여자분이시면 드럼보다는 피아노같은 거 좋아하지 않으셔?
English: Wow, really? If you're a woman, don't you like things like the piano more than the drums?

Korean: 아니야 지금 새로 집 하시는데 거기에 드럼을 하나 놓으신데 키키
English: No, you're building a new house right now and you put a drum in there. Kiki
Wow, those drums must be really expensive!?

Korean: 그래서 지금 이모부 몰래 돈 빼돌리고 있더라
English: So now he's embezzling money without telling his uncle.

Korean: 키키 헐 키키 이모의 꿈이 과연 실천될 것인가!
English: Kiki Hull Will Aunt Kiki's dream come true?

Korean: 나한테 돈 보내고 있는데 전화해서 이사하면서 하나 사달라할테니 내가 사준걸로 하래 키키
English: He's sending me money, and he's going to call me and ask me to buy him one when he moves, so he's going to buy me one Kiki

Korean: 헐 키키 얼마씩 오빠한테 입금하고 계시는데?
English: Wow, Kiki, how much are you depositing to your brother?

Korean: 맨날 보내는 금액은 달라 키키 계속 모으는 중
English: The amount I send every day is different. I'm still collecting Kiki

Korean: 그러면 드럼 가격은 얼마 정도 해?
English: So how much does a drum cost?
I don't know about that either, Kiki
Wouldn't it be different for each type? Haha
But I guess it'll cost at least a few hundred?
I think so Kiki

Korean: 천 단위는 내가 선물줬다고 하기엔 무리가 있지
English: It's a stretch to say that I gave a thousand units as a gift.

Korean: 오빠는 할머니나 할아버지랑 같이 살고 있어?
English: Does your brother live with his grandparents?

Korean: 아니 나는 어릴 때 다 안계셨어 ㅠㅠ
English: No, they weren't there when I was little ㅠㅠ
I see. They all returned early?

Korean: 응 그래서 얼굴도 잘 기억이 안나
English: Yeah, so I don't remember the face very well either.
My grandfather passed away when I was 20 years old.

Korean: 아 부모님이 많이 힘들어 하셨겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, your parents must have had a hard time ㅠㅠ

Korean: 응 할아버지 병수발 부모님이 다 하셨거든 ㅜ
English: Yeah, my grandfather and my parents did it all.
Wow, your mom must have had a really hard time ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 대소변 우리가 다 번갈아가면서 받아냄 ㅜ
English: That's right, we take turns peeing and pooping together.
Did you help your mother too?

Korean: 당연하지 언니랑 나랑 집에 콕 박혀 있었어!
English: Of course, my sister and I were stuck at home!

Korean: 그래도 엄마한테 큰 힘이 됫겠다 키키 잘했네!
English: Still, I bet you got a lot of help from your mom. Kiki, you did a good job!

Korean: 응 ㅜㅜ 할아버지 정정하셨는데 갑자기 병이 생기시더라 ㅜ
English: Yeah ㅜㅜ My grandfather was doing well, but then he suddenly got sick ㅜ

Korean: 원래 모든 병은 갑자기 찾아오는거 같더라고 ㅠㅠ
English: Originally, it seemed like all illnesses came suddenly ㅠㅠ

Korean: 흙흙 ㅜㅜ 그러니까 우리 할아버지 담배도 안 피고 술도 안 마셔서 정정하셨는데!
English: Mud mud ㅜㅜ So my grandfather didn't smoke or drink, so he was healthy!

Korean: 오히려 그런거 하시는 분들이 더 건강하셔 키키
English: Rather, people who do that are healthier Kiki
Oppa, why did you break up with your ex-girlfriend?

Korean: 나 그때는 개의 소중함을 잘 몰랐지 키키
English: I didn't really know the value of dogs back then, Kiki
Really? Do you think you understand now?

Korean: 아니 지금 생각하면 내가 좀 너무했던거 같기도 해
English: No, now that I think about it, I think I may have been a bit too much.

Korean: 왜? 사랑 표현을 잘 안 해 줬구나?
English: Why? You didn't express your love to me well?

Korean: 아니 어디 도착하면 차에서 화장을 고치는데 그게 너무 짜증났어
English: No, I was so annoyed that I had to fix my makeup in the car when I got there.
Why does that bother you?
Are you trying to look pretty!?
I had to go in, but I had to wait, and it was delayed, and it was annoying.

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 오빠 성격이 급한 편이구나?
English: Wow ㅜㅜ Are you a bit impatient?

Korean: 급한건 아닌데 맨날 그러니까 짜증나더라고 키키
English: It's not urgent, but it's annoying because you do it all the time, Kiki

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 마스크 쓰면 당연히 화장이 무너져서 그럴 수밖에 없는데 ㅜ
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Of course, when you wear a mask, your makeup comes off, so it can't be helped ㅜ
Kiki said it wasn't corona at that time

Korean: 키키 아 그러면 오빠 전여친이랑 헤어진 지 진짜 거의 2년째네?
English: Kiki: Oh, so it's really been almost two years since you broke up with your ex-girlfriend?

Korean: 맞아 개랑 헤어진지도 엄청 오래됫네 키키
English: Yeah, it's been a long time since I broke up with the dog, Kiki.

Korean: 키키 지금은 만약에 사귄다면 그거 가지고 안 화낼 거지?
English: Kiki, if we were dating now, you wouldn't be upset about it, right?

Korean: 아 그럼 무조건 기다리지 사다줄거야 화장품 키키
English: Ah, then I will definitely wait and buy you cosmetics Kiki
Oppa said he was bringing a cat!

Korean: 어 맞아 이번에 고양이 데리고 오려고 준비 중
English: Oh right, I'm preparing to bring a cat this time
Are cats male or female? Do you know?
I don't know that either, Kiki
I'm receiving a child sent by a friend.
Then you're saying you'll send him after neutering?
There was no such thing
Shouldn't I do it while raising them?

Korean: 아마 암컷은 3~4개월 때 해야 할 거야!
English: Probably females should do it when they are 3-4 months old!
Oh, you can't do it when the kids grow up?
No, but more than that, the kids are suffering!

Korean: 아무것도 모르는 애기 때 해야된다는 소리구나
English: That's what you have to do when you're a baby who doesn't know anything.

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 밖에 길냥이들이 막 울잖아!
English: That's right ㅜㅜ The stray cats outside are crying!
That's why it's such a painful deal!

Korean: 헐 고통스러워서 그냥 울음으로 표현을 하는건가?
English: Oh my, are you crying because you're in so much pain?

Korean: 일단 분출을 못하니까, 이제 합체가 되면 괜찮은데
English: Since I can't erupt, it's okay once I combine them.

Korean: 밖에 길냥이들이 우는건 중성화 아니고 배고파서 그런거 아니야?
English: When stray cats cry outside, isn't it because they're hungry and not because they're being neutered?
If they're hungry, they'll hunt, right?
Ah, I'm going hunting, Kiki.
I thought you were crying because you were hungry
Honey, do you have any plans to learn golf?

Korean: 아직은 시간이 안나는데 친구들이 많이 해서 나도 나중엔 해보려고
English: I don't have time yet, but a lot of my friends are doing it, so I'm going to try it later.

Korean: 그치? 요즘에 젊은 사람들도 골프 많이 배우더라!
English: Right? These days, a lot of young people are learning golf!

Korean: 맞아 주변에 다 골프치고 다니더라 키키
English: Yeah, everyone around me was playing golf, Kiki.

Korean: 헐, 서민들 다 못산다더니 다 거짓말이야!
English: Wow, they said that the common people couldn't live, but that's all a lie!
But Kiki says you should definitely learn golf
Then it'll all be over

Korean: 근데 나는 그게 어떻게 운동이 되는지 모르겠어!
English: But I don't know how that works!

Korean: 골프 치면 한쪽만 발달을 한다는 소리도 있어 키키
English: There is also a rumor that when you play golf, only one side of your body develops.
So anyway, it only hits one side!

Korean: 라켓 들고 하는 모든 운동들이 그렇지 않을까?
English: Aren't all sports that involve holding a racket like this?

Korean: 아 그렇네 배드민턴도 한쪽만 승모근이 발달돼 있어!
English: Oh, that's right. In badminton, only one side of the trapezius muscle is developed!

Korean: 탁구도 그렇고 치는 쪽으로만 엄청 근육질듯 키키
English: Kiki looks like he's very muscular when it comes to table tennis and hitting.

Korean: 키키 아 맞아 테니스도 장난 아닐 듯!
English: Kiki, that's right, tennis is no joke!

Korean: 아 그건 진짜 라켓도 무겁고 공도 커 키키
English: Oh, that racket is really heavy and the ball is big.

Korean: 키키 맞아 그리고 그걸로 맞으면 개아픔
English: Kiki is right and it hurts a lot when you get hit with it

Korean: 난 그거 하게되면 양손잡이로 연습해서 할거야 키키
English: If I do that, I'll practice doing it with both hands Kiki
Have you ever been to a casino, oppa?
No, I've never been there
Don't you want to go?
I want to go!
When you say casino, you mean Kangwon Land, right?
Gangwon Land and Las Vegas casinos are famous too~

Korean: 근데 또 그런데 빠지면 못 나올까봐 키키 못가겠어
English: But then again, I can't go to Kiki because I'm afraid I won't be able to get out if I fall

Korean: 맞아 키키 나는 정신력으로 빠져나올 거임!
English: That's right Kiki, I'll get out of here with my mental strength!

Korean: 그리고 무슨일 일어날까봐 무섭기도 하고 키키
English: And I'm scared of what might happen Kiki

Korean: 키키 그건 그래 그래도 인생은 한방이지!
English: Kiki That's true, but life is one shot!

Korean: 갔다가 대박 났는데 사람들이 못나가게 막아봐 무서워 키키
English: I went and hit the jackpot, but people are blocking me from leaving. I'm scared. Kiki

Korean: 에이 그렇지는 않을 거야 그러면 거기 이미 다 망했지~
English: Hey, that won't be the case, then it's all ruined already~

Korean: 한번 쯤은 그래도 궁금해서 갈거긴한데 얼마 가져가야 적당한거야?
English: I'm going to go once in a while just out of curiosity, but how much is appropriate to bring?

Korean: 음, 일반 카지노는 재미만 보려면 20만 원 정도?
English: Well, a regular casino costs about 200,000 won just to have fun?

Korean: 나는 일단 다 잃고 온다고 생각하고 가는거라서 키키
English: I thought I would lose everything so I went to Kiki

Korean: 맞아 키키 그냥 게임 즐기기비용이라고 생각하고 가져가!
English: That's right Kiki, just think of it as the cost of enjoying the game and take it!

Korean: 이런게 바로 탕진잼이라는 그런거지 키키 재미는 있겠다
English: This is exactly what they call a fun time. Kiki, it'll be fun.
Have you ever stayed in a hotel, oppa?

Korean: 응 당연히 놀러갈 때 가본적 있지 키키
English: Yeah, of course I've been there when I went out to play, Kiki
But what's the difference between a hotel and a motel?

Korean: 작고 크고 깔끔하고 시설들이 많이 있지
English: It's small, big, clean, and has a lot of facilities.

Korean: 내가 알기론 호텔은 방에 음식이 들어올 수 있다는 점?
English: As far as I know, hotels allow food in the room?

Korean: 응? 모텔도 배달하면 음식 들어오잖아 키키
English: Yeah? If you deliver to a motel, food will come in. Kiki

Korean: 아니지~ 호텔 전용 음식점이 있잖아~ 룸서비스~
English: No~ There is a hotel-only restaurant~ Room service~

Korean: 응 그러니까 그런 시설들이 많다는 차이 인거같아 키키
English: Yeah, I think the difference is that there are a lot of those facilities, Kiki.

Korean: 아 생각해 보니까 호텔은 헬스장도 있고 수영장도 있네?
English: Oh, come to think of it, the hotel has a gym and a swimming pool?

Korean: 응 맞아 즐길거리들이 많이 모여있는거 같더라고 키키
English: Yeah, that's right, it looks like there are a lot of fun things to do, Kiki

Korean: 맞아 그리고 호텔이랑 모텔이랑 가격도 많이 차이나고!
English: That's right, and the prices of hotels and motels also differ a lot!

Korean: 그래서 사람들이 호텔로 가서 호캉스 호캉스 하잖아
English: So people go to hotels and have a staycation.

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 호캉스 좀 즐겨보고 싶다!
English: Kiki, that's right, I want to enjoy a staycation too!

Korean: 나도 호캉스는 아직 즐겨보진 못 했어 ㅠㅠ
English: I haven't been on a vacation yet either ㅠㅠ

Korean: 호캉스는 언제 가야 제일 잘 즐길 수 있을까?
English: When is the best time to go on a vacation to enjoy it the most?

Korean: 그래도 언제든 여름에 가는게 피크인거 같더라 키키
English: But I think it's always peak time to go in the summer Kiki
Isn't it really cold today?
I feel like I'm freezing to death

Korean: 맞아 오늘 너무 추워 집에도 바람이 들어온다
English: Yes, it's so cold today, the wind is blowing into the house too.
Did it rain there yesterday too?

Korean: 응 맞아 어제 비와서 오늘 추운듯
English: Yeah, that's right. It rained yesterday so it's cold today.

Korean: 키키 그러니까 비오고 나니까 기온이 뚝 떨어졌어!
English: Kiki: So, after it rained, the temperature dropped a lot!

Korean: 이제 진짜 가을 찾아와서 계속 추워질거 같아 키키
English: Now that fall is really here, it seems like it's going to get colder Kiki

Korean: 맞아 월요일부터는 회사 갈 때 겉옷 필수로 챙겨가야 겠어!
English: That's right. Starting Monday, I'll definitely have to bring a coat with me to work!

Korean: 나는 이미 사무실에 겉옷 하나 뒀어 키키
English: I already have a coat in the office Kiki

Korean: 키키 나도 스웨트 있긴 한데 출퇴근용 바람막이 하나 장만해야 겠어!
English: Kiki I have a sweatshirt too, but I need to get a windbreaker for commuting!

Korean: 차에는 항상 겉옷을 구비 해두긴 해야될거 같아 키키
English: Kiki, I think you should always keep an outer garment in the car.

Korean: 맞아, 이번에 남친 겉옷 좀 사 줘야 겠다!
English: Right, I need to buy my boyfriend some outerwear this time!

Korean: 지금 우리아빠도 들어와서 춥다고 난리다 키키
English: My dad came in just now and is making a fuss saying it's cold.

Korean: 키키 대박 키키 이런 날씨에 귤 까먹어야 하는데!
English: Kiki, daebak Kiki, I should peel a tangerine in this weather!

Korean: 한파라면서 지금 씻을 준비 하시는 중
English: You said it's a cold wave, so you're getting ready to wash up now

Korean: 키키 헐 키키 씻는 물은 당연히 따뜻한 물이겠지?
English: Kiki Hul Kiki Of course, the water you wash in is warm water, right?
Of course, you need to wash it warmly to feel refreshed~
This time, a man in his 20s ran away in handcuffs!

Korean: 헐 그 상태로 도주해봤자 아무것도 못하지 않아?
English: Wow, even if you run away like that, you won't be able to do anything?

Korean: 맞아 그리고 대담한 게 수갑을 절단기로 절단해서 도망쳤대!
English: That's right, and the bold one is that he cut the handcuffs with a cutter and escaped!
Wow, where did you get that cutter?

Korean: 이 남자 친구가 밖에서 대기하고 있었는데 그 친구가 절단기를 줬대!
English: This guy was waiting outside and he gave her a cutter!
Oh, there was an accomplice?
Wow, what did you do to get caught?

Korean: 어 맞아 음주운전해서 걸려서 경찰서에 갔대!
English: Oh, that's right. He got caught for drunk driving and went to the police station!

Korean: 근데 음주운전은 가서 조사받고 벌금 내면 되는데 그정도까지 해야되나?
English: But for drunk driving, you just have to go and get investigated and pay a fine, but do you really have to go that far?

Korean: 그러니까, 순간적으로 너무 무서워서 친구한테 얘기해서 도와달라고 했대!
English: So, at that moment, I was so scared that I told my friend and asked him for help!

Korean: 그거 도와준 친구도 똑같네 키키 끼리끼리 라더니...
English: The friend who helped me with that was the same, Kiki Kiri Kiri, as they say...

Korean: 키키 친구도 내가 봤을 때 처벌 받을거 같아!
English: I think Kiki's friend will be punished when I see him!

Korean: 그치 그런건 함부로 도와주면 안되는데 어려서 그랬나 보네
English: Yeah, you shouldn't help people like that so easily, but I guess you did that when you were young.

Korean: 근데 아침에 그렇게 도주하고 저녁에 자수했대
English: But he ran away like that in the morning and turned himself in in the evening.

Korean: 그치 도망갔는데 자기도 시간이 지나니까 아니다 싶었나보네 키키
English: Yeah, he ran away, but I guess he realized it wasn't right after time passed, Kiki

Korean: 키키 그러니까 화산이랑 안산을 계속 돌아다니다가 안 되겠어서 자수했대
English: Kiki: So you kept going around Hwasan and Ansan, but it didn't work out, so you turned yourself in.

Korean: 그래도 나름 술은 깨고선 들어 갔겠네 키키
English: Still, I guess he must have sobered up before he went in, Kiki

Korean: 저번에 스페인 산에서 화산폭발 일어났던 거 알아?
English: Did you know that volcanic eruption happened in Spain last time?
Oh, there was a volcano erupting on the mountain over there?

Korean: 응 스페인에 있는 라팔마 섬에서 화산폭발이 일어났었대!
English: Yeah, there was a volcanic eruption on the island of La Palma in Spain!

Korean: 라팔마 섬? 거기는 스페인에서 유명한 섬이양?
English: La Palma Island? Is that a famous island in Spain?
Yeah, I think so

Korean: 근데 이 섬에 고립되어있던 강아지들이 있대 ㅜ
English: But I heard there are dogs stranded on this island.

Korean: 헐 그럼 그 강아지들 구출은 했데?
English: Oh, so you rescued those puppies?

Korean: 구출을 못해서 대신에 드론으로 먹을 걸 하늘에서 떨어뜨려줬대!
English: They couldn't rescue them, so instead they dropped food from the sky using a drone!

Korean: 근데 화산폭발이 일어난거면 애들도 거기서 타 들어간거 아니야?
English: But if there was a volcanic eruption, didn't the kids get caught in it too?

Korean: 그치 어떤 애들은 타 죽고 이제 살아남은 강아지들이 있었겠지?
English: Right? Some puppies died and there were still some left, right?

Korean: 밥이 문제가 아니라 치료가 더 급할거 같은데 ㅠㅠ
English: I don't think food is the problem, but I think treatment is more urgent ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 지금 지상이 너무 뜨거워서 착지를 할 수가 없나 봐 ㅜ
English: But I guess the ground is too hot right now to land ㅜ

Korean: 아 그럼 물부터 뿌려서 식혀야 되는거 아니야?
English: Oh, then shouldn't I spray water on it first to cool it down?

Korean: 그렇겠지? 그 뒤에 사료를 뿌려준 게 아닐까?
English: I guess so? Maybe they sprinkled some feed after that?

Korean: 얼른 해결을 해서 구출해서 치료 받았으면 좋겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: I hope this is resolved quickly so that he can be rescued and treated ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그러니까 동영상 보니까 애들이 사료를 허겁지겁 먹고 있어 ㅜ
English: So, if you look at the video, the kids are eating the food voraciously.

Korean: 먹으면서 싸움만 안 일어 났으면 좋겠다
English: I hope we don't get into fights while eating

Korean: 오빠는 회사 출근할 때 가방 챙겨?
English: Oppa, do you pack your bag when you go to work?

Korean: 아니 나는 옷갈아 입을 가방만 챙겨 키키
English: No, I just packed a bag to change clothes in.
So you just pack your clothes and go to work?

Korean: 응 맞아 일 많이 하고 나면 땀에 젖을 때가 있어서 갈아 입어줘야 해 키키
English: Yeah, that's right. When you work hard, you get sweaty sometimes, so you have to change your clothes. Kiki
I see. So you're carrying a crossbody bag?

Korean: 아니 그냥 짐가방? 그거 들고 다녀 키키
English: No, just a suitcase? You carry that around Kiki

Korean: 요즘에 나이키나 아디다스 같은 곳 그런 옷 챙길 수 있는 가방 되게 편하게 나왔던데?
English: These days, there are really convenient bags that can hold clothes from places like Nike or Adidas.

Korean: 그런데 나는 그런건 일하러 다니는데 쓰기에 아까운거 같아
English: But I think it would be a waste to use something like that for work.

Korean: 왜? 그런 데 쓰려고 사는 거지!
English: Why? That's what you buy for!

Korean: 그냥 막 가방에 두고 쓰고 하는거지 키키
English: Kiki, I just keep it in my bag and use it.

Korean: 키키 그래그래 그러면 한 5천 원짜리 가방이겠네?
English: Kiki: Okay, okay. Then it would be a bag worth about 5,000 won?

Korean: 가격도 몰라 집에 굴러다니는거 가져온거거든 키키
English: I don't know the price, I just brought it from the house Kiki

Korean: 키키 그렇구나 옷은 보통 어떤 걸 챙겨?
English: Kiki: I see. What kind of clothes do you usually pack?

Korean: 입고갈땐 그냥 일복 입고 갈아입는건 편한 추리링!
English: When you go out, just wear your work clothes and change into comfortable sweatpants!
I see. You don't pack separate underwear?

Korean: 아 그건 따로 안챙겨 집에서 씻고 갈아입어 키키
English: Ah, don't pack that separately. Wash and change at home. Kiki
Has your brother ever been hospitalized?

Korean: 아니 나 어릴때 부터 최강 체력이었어 키키
English: No, I've had the best stamina since I was little, Kiki
Oh really? I was recently hospitalized~
You? When were you admitted and why?
I was hospitalized with enteritis~

Korean: 아 장염 걸리는 사람들 많긴 하더라
English: Oh, there are a lot of people who get enteritis
But does that mean you have to be hospitalized?

Korean: 응 맞아 빨리 나으려면 입원하는 게 좋대~
English: Yeah, that's right. They say it's better to be hospitalized to get better quickly.

Korean: 입원하면 장염은 금식 하고 있는거 아니야?
English: If you're hospitalized, aren't you fasting for enteritis?
Give me white porridge instead of fasting! It's tasteless.
Oh, but you still eat?
Fasting really sucks, Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 심하면 금식이라고 하는데 또 먹고 나면 뿌지지익~
English: Kiki, that's right. If it's severe, it's called fasting, but if you eat again, you'll feel like throwing up~

Korean: 근데 또 금식 지켜야 되는게 먹으면 난리난데 키키 아파서
English: But I have to fast again, and if I eat it, it's going to be a mess, and Kiki's going to get sick

Korean: 어 맞아 배가 계속 부글부글 거렸어!
English: Oh yeah, my stomach kept rumbling!

Korean: 그래도 넌 그정도는 아니어서 다행이네 키키
English: Still, it's a good thing you're not like that, Kiki
Yeah, so when you get a ringel, it works right away?

Korean: 아 그래도 효과를 잘 봐서 다행이네 키키
English: Ah, but I'm glad it worked, Kiki
Oppa, have you ever used Timon?

Korean: 나 예전에 20대 초반에는 많이 했엇어 키키
English: I used to do it a lot in my early 20s Kiki

Korean: 나도 티몬에서 워터파크 이용권 사 봄!
English: I also bought a water park ticket from Timon!

Korean: 아 거기서 사람들 티켓 많이 사긴 하더라 키키
English: Oh, there were a lot of people buying tickets there Kiki
Kiki is right but I got a refund,

Korean: 키키 왜 거기 못가게 되서 환불 받음?
English: Kiki, why can't I go there and get a refund?

Korean: 어 거기 워터파크에 아는 친구 있었는데 우리가 가는 날 초딩 애가 똥을 쌌다잖아!
English: Oh, I have a friend who works at a water park, and the day we went there, an elementary school kid pooped there!

Korean: 헐 그럼 또 놀기 싫지 키키 못가 찝찝해서 키키
English: Oh, then I don't want to play again. I feel bad because I can't go Kiki.

Korean: 맞아, 그리고 워터파크 그냥 그런 거 건져내기만 하는 거 알지?
English: Yeah, and you know what, the water park is just a place to salvage stuff?

Korean: 맞아 거기 그냥 소독약으로 약 친다고 그러잖아 키키
English: Right, they say they just disinfect it there, Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 나 피부 예민해서 그런 곳은 아예 못 가겠더라!
English: Kiki: That's right, I have sensitive skin so I can't go to places like that!

Korean: 그냥 워터파크 이런데 말고 계곡 가는게 더 좋은거 같아 키키
English: I think it would be better to go to a valley instead of just a water park or something Kiki

Korean: 맞아 키키 계곡은 대신에 기생충 냠냠~
English: That's right, Kiki Valley is a parasite yum yum~
Kiki: So in the end, you can't go anywhere?

Korean: 키키 아니야 기생충은 우리 몸에 좋은 단백질원이지
English: Kiki No, parasites are a good source of protein for our bodies.

Korean: 확실한거야? 기생충이 나중에 지배 하는거 아닌가 몰라 키키
English: Are you sure? I wonder if parasites will take over later. Kiki

Korean: 오빠는 연예인 콘서트 가서 놀아본 적 있어?
English: Oppa, have you ever been to a celebrity concert and had fun?

Korean: 아니 아직까지는 없는데 싸이콘서트는 가보고 싶더라 키키
English: No, not yet, but I want to go to the Psy concert Kiki

Korean: 헐 나 싸이 콘서트 가 봤는데!
English: Wow, I went to a Psy concert!

Korean: 오 너도 그럼 흠뻑쇼 거기 갔다온거야?
English: Oh, so you went to the Drenched Show too?

Korean: 아니 나는 올나잇 스탠드 콘서트 가 봤어!
English: No, I've been to an all night stand concert!
What is that?
I've only heard of the drenched show Kiki
This show goes on until morning!

Korean: 와 그럼 콘서트 시간이 얼마나 되는거야?
English: Wow, how long is the concert?
I think it took 5 hours if I remember correctly!
If it's until morning, does that mean the time to enter there is dawn?

Korean: 아니 11시부터 시작해서 첫차 탈 수 있을 때 보내주더라 키키
English: No, they start at 11 and send you when you can catch the first train Kiki

Korean: 와 대박 싸이 그 형님도 체력이 장난이 아니네 키키
English: Wow, that guy Psy has incredible stamina, Kiki

Korean: 나 진짜 마지막에 울 뻔 했어,
English: I almost cried at the end,
I wanted to go home,
Is it too hard?

Korean: 근데 차 없어서 가지도 못 했을듯
English: But I probably couldn't go because I didn't have a car.

Korean: 막판에 싸이가 물 뿌렸는데 진짜 단비뿌리는 줄!
English: At the end, Psy sprinkled water, but I thought it was really rain!

Korean: 와 대박 키키 그거 한입 하지 그랬어 키키
English: Wow, daebak Kiki, you should have taken a bite of that Kiki
Have you ever been to a drive-in theater with your girlfriend?
Yeah, I've been there once or twice Kiki

Korean: 일반 영화관보다 거기가 더 좋지 않음?
English: Isn't it better there than a regular movie theater?

Korean: 아니 나는 일반 영화관이 더 좋던데 키키
English: No, I like regular movie theaters better Kiki

Korean: 진짜? 나는 목이 안 좋아서 영화관은 불편하더라!
English: Really? I have a sore throat so movie theaters are uncomfortable for me!

Korean: 자동차 극장은 자리선점을 잘 못하면 주변도 신경쓰여 키키
English: If you don't reserve a seat at a drive-in theater, you'll be worried about the people around you.

Korean: 맞아 무조건 에스유브이 타고 가야 해!
English: That's right, you absolutely have to take the SUV!

Korean: 그래서 시야도 그렇고 그런거 생각하면 영화관이 더 좋은거 같아
English: So, considering the view and all that, I think the movie theater is better.

Korean: 그리고 앞에 붙 계속 켜 놓고 있으면 진짜 짜중나!
English: And if you keep it on in front, it's really annoying!
Don't people walk around telling you to turn it off?

Korean: 그 라이트 말고 차 안에 있는 불빛 있잖아!
English: Besides that light, there are lights inside the car!

Korean: 아 맞아 그거 끄는법 모르면 보면서 신경쓰여서 별로긴 해
English: Oh right, that's right. If you don't know how to turn it off, it's annoying to watch.

Korean: 맞아 그거 사이드 브레이크 땡기면 되는데!
English: That's right, just pull the side brake!

Korean: 응 그거 설명해주시는 분들도 있고 안해주는 분들도 있고 키키
English: Yeah, some people explain it to you, some don't. Kiki
Yeah Kiki, that's totally a testament to that!

Korean: 그래서 처음갈 때 되게 불편하게 봤었던거 같아 키키
English: So I think it was really uncomfortable when I first went there, Kiki
Sister, what did you eat for lunch?
I ate dakgalbi today

Korean: 아 진짜 나도 갈비 먹었는데~ 돼지갈비~
English: Oh really, I ate ribs too~ Pork ribs~
Ah, Chuncheon Dakgalbi is so delicious

Korean: 키키 아 춘천닭갈비 먹은지 엄청 오래됐는데!
English: Kiki, it's been so long since I ate Chuncheon Dakgalbi!
It's been a long time since I've had it, so it's really delicious

Korean: 거기에 고구마도 들어가 있는 거 맞이?
English: Are you sure there are sweet potatoes in there too?
Yeah, that's right, it's really delicious
Kiki, oh my gosh, I want to eat that too
Is there rice cake in it too?
Add rice cake and ramen noodles
Wow, this is crazy! Ramen noodles are the truth!
Ramen noodles topped with real cheese
Kiki, you eat fried rice there too?
Yeah, I'll make two fried rices and some cider

Korean: 개부럽다 키키 나랑도 다음에 같이 먹으러 가 줘!
English: I'm so jealous Kiki, come eat with me next time!
Then whenever you want, just say Kiki, let's go

Korean: 언니 이제 장판킬 때가 된 거 같음,
English: Sister, I think it's time to get rid of the long board now.
Yeah, the weather is so cold ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 나 잠깐 나갔다 왔는데 얼어죽는 줄,
English: Kiki, I went out for a bit and came back and I froze to death.
I'm thinking about what padding to buy

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 그래도 패딩은 이르지 않나?
English: Kiki Oh really? But isn't it too early to wear padding?
Is the padding oversized? Haha
I'm so cold

Korean: 키키 아 언니 추위 잘 타는 구나?
English: Kiki, do you feel cold easily?
Yeah, I was born in winter, but I'm fine

Korean: 키키 어 근데 그거는 상관 없는 거 같아
English: Kiki Oh but I don't think that matters
I was born in January too!
Yeah, that's right. I was born in February too, and it's so cold.

Korean: 키키 맞아 패딩 어디 브랜드 보고 있어?
English: Kiki, right? What brand of padding are you looking at?
I want a Moncler. Who wouldn't buy it for me?
Moncler? Isn't that an expensive brand?
Yeah, that's right. I can't afford it with my salary.

Korean: 키키 그거 한 벌에 얼마 정도하는데?
English: Kiki, how much does one of those cost?
It'll probably cost around 3 million won ㅠㅠ You beggar
Didn't you say you had a car?
Yeah, I'm here to play haha
Kiki, really? Where did you go to play?
I just came back from Iksan haha
Wow Kiki Iksan?
What are you doing there?
I'm eating with my boyfriend. Chicken galbi, yum yum
I'm jealous, you're eating in Iksan?
Yeah, I'm eating in Iksan, but where is the cafe?
Cafe? Is there a famous cafe in Iksan?
Dessert 369 is famous there.
Isn't that a brand?

Korean: 차라리 조금 더 내려가서 전주에 있는 카페가는 건 어때?
English: How about going down a little further and going to a cafe in Jeonju?

Korean: 전주 좋지 어디 가지 추천좀 해줘
English: Jeonju is nice. Can you recommend me a place to go?

Korean: 키키 전주 한옥마을 안에 있는 카페 유명하던데?
English: Kiki: Isn't that cafe inside Jeonju Hanok Village famous?

Korean: 움 어디지 나는 닭꼬치만 먹어봄 키키
English: Um where are you I only eat chicken skewers Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 거기 태극카페? 어 그거 유명하던데! ?
English: Kiki, really? That Taegeuk Cafe? Oh, that's famous! ?
I'll go with my boyfriend sometime and find it haha
Sister, what kind of part-time job have you ever had?
I worked at a bar haha

Korean: 술집이면 단골도 있지만 진상도 많지 않아?
English: If it's a bar, there are regulars, but aren't there also a lot of regulars?
There are regular customers, but there are too many real customers.

Korean: 그치? ㅜㅜ 나도 호프집 알바해서 알아!
English: Right? ㅜㅜ I know because I work at a bar too!
Oh seriously, that's so hard

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 나한테 막 욕하는 분도 있었어,
English: Yeah ㅜㅜ There was someone who just cursed at me,
You made me run an errand to buy cigarettes ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헐, 담배는 좀, 근데 나도 했던 거 같아!
English: Wow, smoking is a bit much, but I think I did it too!
And then he gave me 500 won. Kiki was so annoyed ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 헐 그래도 언니는 잔돈이라도 줬네, 나는 카드 줌,
English: Kiki, oh well, my sister at least gave me change, I gave her my card.

Korean: 키키 잔돈으로 택시비 했어 아 카드...
English: Kiki, I paid for the taxi with my change... Ah, card...

Korean: 키키 아 대박 키키 언니는 어떤 술집에서 일했어?
English: Kiki, wow, Kiki, what bar did you work at?
I worked at a beer house
I used to work part-time at a skewer restaurant!
Oh, you must have eaten a lot of skewers.
Sister, have you ever visited your friend?
Yeah, I've been there
Too far
Oh really? Where have you been?
Yeah, I went to Cheorwon, Gangwon-do.

Korean: 아, 철원 나도 가봤는데 진짜 욕나오더라,
English: Oh, I went to Cheorwon too, and it really made me want to swear.
Yeah, it was really hard, but it was still good.

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 친구랑 많이 친했어?
English: Kiki, really? Were you close with a lot of friends?

Korean: 웅 초딩때부터 친구지 하하 나랑 절친
English: Yeah, we've been friends since elementary school haha, my best friend

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 그러면 완전 좋았겠네
English: Kiki wow wow that would be awesome
What did you buy?
Bread, chicken, pizza, and cigarettes
Cigarettes? Kiki, can I bring that in?
Kiki said it was okay during the interview, so I bought it for her.

Korean: 그렇구나 키키 나는 치킨이랑 피자 사감 키키
English: Oh, Kiki, I bought chicken and pizza. Kiki.
Yeah, chicken is really the best haha

Korean: 키키 맞아 언니 몇 시간 있다 왔어?
English: Kiki, that's right, how many hours have you been here?
I'll have to buy it again in 2 hours haha

Korean: 언니 우리 어렸을 때 바둑학원 있었던 거 기억나?
English: Sister, do you remember that there was a baduk academy when we were young?

Korean: 나는 피아노 학원다녔는데 바둑 키키 모르겠다
English: I went to piano lessons but I don't know how to play baduk or kiki.

Korean: 키키 나도 피아노 학원 다녔는데 바둑학원도 있었잖아!
English: Kiki, I went to piano school too, but there was also a baduk school!

Korean: 아 진짜 웃기다 바둑 있었던거 같아
English: Oh, it's really funny, I think there was a game of baduk

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 요즘에는 바둑학원 있는 곳을 못 본 거 같아!
English: Kiki That's right, but I don't think I've seen any places with baduk academies these days!

Korean: 웅 나도 못봤어 요즘 애들은 안하나봐
English: Yeah, I haven't seen it either. I guess kids these days don't do it.

Korean: 그러니까 그거 머리 되게 좋은 애들만 하는 거잖아!
English: So, only kids with really good brains do that!

Korean: 아니야 너도 할 수 있어 화이팅
English: No, you can do it too. Fighting!

Korean: 키키 과연 나 지금 머리 다 굳어서 괜찮을까,?
English: Kiki, I wonder if it's okay for my head to be all stiff right now?
Kiki but I'm also frozen huh

Korean: 키키 언니 근데 바둑 둘 줄은 알아
English: Kiki, but I know how to play Go
I learned a little from my dad

Korean: 아 진짜? 나는 이웃집 아저씨한테 배웠는데 다 까먹음!
English: Oh really? I learned it from the old man next door, but I forgot it all!
Oh really, I still remember it

Korean: 키키 음, 그냥 집 만들 줄만 알아!
English: Kiki: Well, I just know how to build a house!
I don't even remember ㅠㅠ
Did you create a family group room on KakaoTalk?
Yeah, I have a group chat with my mom, dad, and brother.

Korean: 우리는 사촌까지 다 있는 방 만들었어!
English: We made a room for all of our cousins!
Oh really, I should make one too
Kiki, I think it's okay!
I like chatting with you too!

Korean: 수다 떨고 싶은데 우리 사촌들은 나이가 어려 ㅠㅠ
English: I want to chat, but my cousins are too young ㅠㅠ
Oh, how old are your cousins now?
Baby, babies, 7 year old Kiki

Korean: 와오 키키 엄청 어리긴 하네 키키
English: Wow Kiki, you're so young Kiki

Korean: 웅 너무 어려서 말도 잘 안들어
English: Yeah, he's too young to listen well.

Korean: 어,? 언니랑 나이차이도 많이 나는데 말 안 들어?
English: Huh? There's a big age difference between you and my sister, but you won't listen to me?
Yeah, come on, tease me more ㅠ

Korean: 키키 헐 그거 초장에 바로 잡아 줘야해!
English: Kiki, wow, you have to fix that right in the first place!
The real troublemakers are the ones who need to be caught

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 내 사촌동생들 내가 혼내키면서 버릇 고쳐줌!
English: Kiki That's right, I also scold my cousins and correct their bad habits!
Oh, that's really cool, Kiki
I can't do it

Korean: 언니는 남친이랑 기념일 어떤 식으로 챙겨?
English: How do you celebrate your anniversary with your boyfriend?
I like gifts and food dates haha
Hmm, did you celebrate your anniversary this year?
Yeah, I packed it up and went to cut the steak.
Oh I'm jealous Kiki

Korean: 나는 당장 다음 주에 기념일인데 뭐하지,?
English: My anniversary is next week, what should I do?
Oh really then I recommend Outback

Korean: 아 아웃백! 근데 남친이 회사에서 최근에 먹고왔음!
English: Ah Outback! But my boyfriend ate there recently at work!

Korean: 아 진짜 ㅜㅜ 그럼 삼겹살이 최곤데 키키
English: Oh really ㅜㅜ Then pork belly is the best Kiki
Kiki's pork belly! Pork belly is good!
Soju with pork belly!
Samgyeopsal Kiki or galbi would be delicious

Korean: 키키 갈비는 오늘 먹고 와서 패스!
English: I ate Kiki's ribs today so I'll pass!
Oh, so what's the date?
I want to go on a date to Namsan Tower, but I don't know how to do it!
Go to Namsan Tower and lock the padlock.

Korean: 거기에 자물쇠 사서 잠굴 수 있는 곳이 있어?
English: Is there a place there where I can buy a lock and lock it?
I tried it with my boyfriend a long time ago
What kind of personality does your sister have?
Innocent, lively, kind and generous
Does Gaeul bark often?

Korean: 아니 안짖어 절대로 초인종 울릴때 빼곤
English: No, I don't bark, never, except when the doorbell rings.
Wow, wow, what a gentle kid!
Very docile and follows people well

Korean: 오 진짜? 사람들을 많이 좋아하나 봐?
English: Oh really? You seem to like people a lot?
Yeah people like fall

Korean: 키키 가을이는 누구랑 노는 걸 제일 좋아해?
English: Who does Kiki Autumn like to play with the most?
I like you the most and your mom next
Wow, usually mom comes first!
Me first and dad last

Korean: 키키 언니가 잘 놀아주고 산책도 잘 시켜주나 봐! ?
English: I guess Kiki's older sister plays with her and takes her for walks often! ?
Yeah, I really go for a walk once a day.

Korean: 와 가을이는 진짜 가족 잘 만났다!
English: Wow, Gaeul really found a good family!
Yeah, it's really nice to meet you, Gaeul
Is your sister good at swimming?
No, I can't swim if I fall into the water.

Korean: 아 진짜? 그러면 나랑 수영 같이 배울래?
English: Oh really? Then do you want to learn swimming with me?

Korean: 배우고  싶다 우리집 앞에 배우는 곳 있는데
English: I want to learn. There is a place to learn in front of my house.

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 논산은 내가 알기론 보건소에서만 가능한 걸로 알고 있는데!
English: Kiki, really? As far as I know, Nonsan is only available at the health center!
Yeah, right, right, I know that well.

Korean: 키키 아 언니네 집 근처에 보건소가 있구나?
English: Kiki, is there a health center near your house?
Yeah, that's right, my house is in the east
But I heard it's really difficult to apply there?
Ah, it must be fierce because of the ladies

Korean: 맞아 키키 내 친구도 새벽에 일어나서 신청했대!
English: That's right Kiki, my friend also woke up at dawn and applied!
Ah, it's really hard, really ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 그러니까 논산은 거기 하나밖에 없으니까 더 그런 거 같아!
English: Kiki: I think it's because Nonsan is the only one there!
Well, there's only one so the competition is fierce.

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 또 아줌마들 등쌀에 밀려서 하고 싶지는 않다!
English: Kiki, that's right, but I don't want to do it because I'm being pushed around by the ladies!
Ah, seriously, these ladies are so tough ㅠㅠ

Korean: 언니는 혹시 강원랜드 가본 적 있어?
English: Sister, have you ever been to Kangwon Land?
No, I've never been there. I want to go.

Korean: 키키 나도 근데 나는 일본에서 이런 곳 가본 적 있어!
English: Kiki Me too, but I've been to a place like this in Japan!
Oh, I really want to go too

Korean: 키키 어 그 일본에 이런 곳을 뭐라고 하더라?
English: Kiki, what do they call this place in Japan?
How is it? I don't know if it's called a casino

Korean: 음? 그 이름말고 어 언니 혹시 TV에서 손잡이 땡겨서 게임하는 일본오락기 알아?
English: Hmm? Other than that name, do you know of a Japanese arcade game where you pull the handle on the TV?
Are you doing it by pulling the handle?

Korean: 그게 머야 나 아무것도 잘몰라 ㅠㅠ
English: What is that? I don't know anything ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 그거 TV에서 자주는 아닌데 그 게임 하는 거 나왔거든? 모 봤어?
English: Oh, that's not something you see often on TV, but they showed them playing that game. Did you see it?
Is it a joystick?
You said you were on Merge TV?

Korean: 카찡뽀인가? 이런 게임이었는데 이거 잘하면 몇백만 원 딸 수 있어!
English: Is it Kachinpo? It was a game like this, and if you were good at it, you could win millions of won!
I'll have to ask my boyfriend. This is awesome.

Korean: 키키 그치 나도 일본에서 모르고 들어갔다 나왔어!
English: Kiki, right? I went in and came out of Japan without knowing!
Oh, I really have to go there too

Korean: 키키 어 근데 일단 나는 천엔 정도 쓰고 나옴!
English: Kiki: Oh, but I'm going to spend about a thousand yen!
I'll go and try it too!

Korean: 언니는 최근에 펜션 예약잡아서 놀러간 적 있어?
English: Sister, have you ever made a reservation at a pension and gone out to play recently?
Instead of a pension, I went glamping
Glamping!? Who did you go with!? Who did you go with!?
I went out with my friends
Friends from middle school
Kiki and I envy Kiki
How many people went and came back?
It was really fun, 5 people

Korean: 5명? 근데 그런 곳은 정원 5명이 제일 좋은 듯!
English: 5 people? But I think a place like that would be best with 5 people in the garden!
Yeah, that's right. That's the number of people.
Kiki, did you go and have a barbecue?
Yeah, I had barbecue and roasted marshmallows.
Wow, awesome marshmallows!
Where did you buy that?
It was really delicious
I bought it at Homeplus
Do they sell those thick marshmallows at Homeplus?
There's a thick one on sale at Homeplus

Korean: 헐 나도 조만간 캠핑가는데 그거 사야겠다!
English: Wow, I'm going camping soon, so I need to buy that!
Yeah, try grilling with your friends.
Does your sister like making snowmen?
Yeah, I like it. I like snow too.

Korean: 키키 맞아 눈 오는 날 따뜻한 곳에서 귤까먹는 게 최고지!
English: Kiki, that's right, eating tangerines in a warm place on a snowy day is the best!
Yes, it seems like eating tangerines on a snowy day is the best

Korean: 키키 맞아 귤은 손이 노래질 때까지 먹어야 해!
English: Kiki, that's right. You have to eat tangerines until your hands turn yellow!
Yeah, my hands are really singing too

Korean: 키키 근데 진짜 귤 많이 먹으면 몸 전체가 노래지는 거 알아?
English: Kiki, did you know that if you eat a lot of tangerines, your whole body will turn yellow?

Korean: 아 그래? 몸이 전체가 노래져? 와
English: Oh really? Your whole body is getting tingly? Wow

Korean: 어 맞아 그게 과학적으로 일리가 있는 내용이래!
English: Oh yeah, that makes scientific sense!
Oh really? I just found out today, Kiki.
Kiki I just found out too
It's cold these days, so I want to eat tangerines!
I have to tell mom and dad, Kiki
I want to eat it too because it's so delicious
Kiki, let me tell you about Kiki

Korean: 나는 앉은자리에서 귤 한박스 다 먹을 수 있어!
English: I can eat a whole box of tangerines while sitting down!
I think I can eat it

Korean: 키키 나중에 우리 귤 한박스 사서 같이 먹자!
English: Kiki, let's buy a box of tangerines and eat them together later!
It's good to buy it later and share it.

Korean: 언니 이번에 어떤  남자가 자기 전처한테 성범죄 혐의로 고소당했다고 기사를 냈어!
English: Sister, this time there was an article about a man being accused of sexual assault by his ex-wife!
Oh my god, this is crazy, aren't you?

Korean: 근데 전처가 남자 고소한 이유 알려줄까?
English: But should I tell you why the ex-wife sued the man?
No, please tell me where it is

Korean: 둘 사이에 딸램이 있는데 이 남자가 자기 딸램 남자화장실 데려갔다고!
English: There's a daughter between them, and this man took his daughter to the men's bathroom!
Oh my god, this is so scary

Korean: 아니 무서운 것보다 약간 전처가 빌미 잡고 협박하는 거 같지 않아?
English: No, but rather than being scary, doesn't it seem a bit like your ex-wife is using excuses to threaten you?
That's why it's weird and funny too

Korean: 키키 맞아 그 전부터 전처가 계속 남자를 고소했대!
English: Kiki, that's right, his ex-wife had been suing him before that!
It's not the same reason!
Ah, I guess you wanted to say that your ex-wife is weird

Korean: 키키 그니까 근데 자기 딸램 데리고 협박하는 건 좀 아니지 않아?
English: Kiki: Well, don't you think it's a bit much to threaten your own daughter?

Korean: 딸 소변 보러 가는거 델고간거아니야? 협박은 좀
English: Didn't you take your daughter to go pee? That's a bit too much of a threat.

Korean: 어 맞아 이 남자가 자기 딸램은 자기랑 떨어져있는 걸 안 좋아해서 데려갔는데 그걸 본 전처가 바로 신고했대!
English: Oh, that's right. This man didn't like his daughter being away from him, so he took her away, but his ex-wife saw him and reported him right away!
What a strange woman. Is she really out of her mind?
Kiki right I think so too
I think you've lost your mind!
I shouldn't be that kind of person and neither should you haha

Korean: 언니 비티에스도 그렇고 오겜도 지금 전세계적으로 이슈인 거 알지?
English: Sister, did you know that BTS and Ogame are both hot topics worldwide right now?

Have you heard of things like car insurance and insurance for Sylvie?
Yeah, that's a given!

Korean: 키키 맞아 얘네는 진짜 필수인 거 같음!
English: Kiki, yeah these are really essential!

Korean: 너는 보험 잘 들어 놔져 있어?
English: Are you well insured?

Korean: 나는 지금 넘처 흘르는 중이야 정리해야 해,
English: I'm overflowing right now, I need to clean up,

Korean: 헐 얼마나 들었길래 넘쳐 흘러 키키
English: Wow, how much did you hear? It's overflowing Kiki

Korean: 키키 우리집 가족 지병이 있어서 많이 들었어,
English: Kiki, I've heard a lot about my family's chronic illness.

Korean: 아아 그럼 불안하니까 들고 있어야 하는 거 아니야?
English: Oh, then shouldn't I be holding it because I'm anxious?

Korean: 음 아니 넘치는 종류가 있어서 그거 정리하게!
English: Um, no, there are so many different types that I'll organize them!
Ah, then please organize it a bit ㅠㅠ
I don't want to waste money
Yeah Kiki

Korean: 이거 정리하면 한 150만 원 들어올 거 같아!
English: If I organize this, I think I'll get about 1.5 million won!
Wow, awesome...

Korean: 근데 낸 금액이 더 크잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: But the amount I paid was bigger ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그건 그런데 어쩔 수 없는 거지 그거는 ㅜ
English: But that can't be helped, that's it ㅜ

Korean: 웅 그래도 더 나가기 전에 한번 정리해 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, but let's organize this before we go any further ㅠㅠ
Sister, do you shop online often?

Korean: 나는 요즘은 쇼핑 잘 안해 키키
English: I don't shop much these days Kiki

Korean: 그러면 네이버쇼핑 같은 것도 잘 안 해?
English: Then you don't do things like Naver Shopping well?

Korean: 웅 지금은 아이쇼핑 많이 하는 중 키키
English: Yeah, I'm doing a lot of eye shopping right now Kiki

Korean: 오오 요즘에 보고 있는 거 뭐 있음?
English: Oh, what are you watching these days?

Korean: 요즘은 영양제 많이 보고 있어 키키
English: I've been seeing a lot of nutritional supplements lately Kiki
Oh, what kind of supplement are you looking at?
It's good for your eyes ㅠㅠ
My eyes are so tired these days ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키  아 그러면 마그네슘 보고 있구나?
English: Kiki: So you're looking at magnesium?
Yeah right Kiki

Korean: 루테인 그것도 같이 보고 있어 키키
English: Lutein I'm also watching that Kiki
Oh, so lutein is also a good nutrient for the eyes?

Korean: 웅 그게 눈 영양제로 많이 유명해!
English: Yeah, that's really famous as an eye nutrient!
I see

Korean: 나도 눈 떨려서 요즘 마그네슘 먹는 중!
English: My eyes are twitching too, so I'm taking magnesium these days!
Kiki, where are you eating?
If it works, please recommend it~
Oh, what I eat is shipped overseas!
Wow... I guess I'll have to wait a long time Kiki

Korean: 언니는 유튜브 요즘에 보는 애 없으?
English: Sister, aren't you watching YouTube these days?

Korean: 나는 요즘 보는 애들은 없고 슈주리턴즈 이건 봐 키키
English: I don't watch any of the kids these days, but I watch Super Junior's Kiki
Did that start recently?

Korean: 예전부터 했던 건데 친구가 팬이라 추천 받아서 봤는데 키키 이거 웃겨
English: I've been doing this for a long time, but my friend is a fan so he recommended it to me. Kiki, this is funny
Kiki, really?
Are all the Super Junior members coming out?

Korean: 웅 다 나오는것도 있고 스케줄에 따라서 다른 거 같던데? 키키
English: Yeah, some of them come out, but it seems to be different depending on the schedule? Kiki
Oh, I see
Who is the member who appears frequently?
Shindong and Teuk often come out and meet Kiki
You're an MC haha
Kiki Ah, and Leeteuk too
If Kiki and the two appear, it will be a guide comic

Korean: 웅 진짜 동해랑 은혁도 웃겨 키키
English: Yeah really Donghae and Eunhyuk are funny too Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 동해 은근 개그캐릭 인정이요!
English: Kiki, Donghae is secretly a gag character, I admit!

Korean: 응 허당끼 있어어 나도 입덕 할뻔했어 키키
English: Yeah, she's so cute, I almost got addicted to her too Kiki
Kiki is so funny, Donghae is so cute!
I should see that too~
Yeah subscribe to that Kiki
Time really flies Kiki
Kiki oki oki
Add one more subscriber~
Oh, so that's how I promoted it~

Korean: 언니는 지금까지 봤던 영화 중에 나한테 추천 할만 한 영화 있어?
English: Sister, is there any movie you've seen so far that you would recommend to me?
Do you like sad movies too?
Well, I personally like action haha,
If it's action... look at Liam Neeson's...

Korean: 오우 키키 그 분 잘 알지 키키
English: Oh Kiki, I know that guy well Kiki
Have you seen the whole movie Taken?

Korean: 헐 그거 안 봤는데 그거 시리즈 영화 아니야?
English: Oh, I haven't seen that, but isn't that a series of movies?
Yeah, that's right
It came out up to 3, but how is it in full swing?

Korean: 키키 오 그거 한 번 봐야겠다
English: Kiki Oh, I have to check that out
Is it on Netflix?
Ah... I don't know about that, Kiki
You may have to pay Kiki

Korean: 키키 아앗 괜찮 괜찮 네이버 영화로 보면  돼~
English: Kiki, ah, it's okay, it's okay. Just watch it on Naver Movies~
Is there a movie on Naver?
What is that?...
You buy movies from Naver and watch them!

Korean: 오 나 그건 처음 알았네 키키
English: Oh, I just found out about that, Kiki
I should search for it Kiki

Korean: 키키 아마 테이큰 1300원 주면 다 볼 수 있을 듯!
English: Kiki Maybe you could watch all of Taken for 1300 won!
Oh, this is awesome.
Kiki, that's so cheap
What is your favorite food, Grandma?
I like braised short ribs the most because they are so delicious~
Does your grandmother like cows the best?
Okay then
Is it because you have a sophisticated mouth? Haha
Kiki, but don't you feel sorry for the cow?
no
The beef is so juicy and delicious~
Kiki and daebak

Korean: 첫째 딸램이 작은엄마 생신 때는 소갈비찜 직접 해야겠네~
English: My first daughter should make braised short ribs for her mother's birthday~
Well, I guess we should go out and buy some food?
Kiki, then I'll buy you some braised short ribs~

Korean: 사 달라 해야지 아니며 스테이크나 썰러 갈까?
English: Should I ask you to buy it for me or should I go and cut up a steak?
Kiki, when was your little mom's birthday?
I remember~
I'm counting by the lunar calendar, so it's between January and February.
Oh really?
Then, it's January for me too. Do you want to go eat together?
Good
I heard there are a lot of delicious restaurants these days~

Korean: 키키 일단  논산에 맛집 하나 있으~
English: Kiki, there's a good restaurant in Nonsan~
Yeah, let's go on our birthdays.
It's really cold today,
You turned on the light in the room,
Oh, so that's why there's communal heating there?
that's right,
It was really cold earlier, but it's warm now!
I know
You have to pay well for that rent.

Korean: 키키 근데 이것도 진짜 겨울 되면 소용 없어!
English: Kiki But this really doesn't work in winter!
It's really colder in the metropolitan area, Kiki
Kiki and don't turn it on warmly!
right
It's lukewarm so I'm cold
Electric blanket is required
Kiki is right,

Korean: 이불을 계속 깔고 있으라고 하는데 소용 없다고요,
English: They tell me to keep the blanket on, but it doesn't work.
So you're there all winter?
Oh, I think that's what it's supposed to be!
I heard the contract is until January ㅜㅜ
Oh right
Here's a contract until January 1st!

Korean: 아 그러면 방 빼고 다시 내려가?
English: Oh, then you're going back down after leaving the room?
Kiki, that's right,
I'm out of money now,
I came to Seoul and had a hard time~
Mom, have you ever been on an airplane?

Korean: 응 예전에 제주도 갈 때만 타봤지~
English: Yeah, I only rode it when I went to Jeju Island before~
Did you go to Jeju Island for a family trip?

Korean: 응 애들 어릴 때 갔어~ 키키
English: Yeah, I went when the kids were little~ Kiki
So you haven't ridden one recently?
Yeah, that's the last time
Almost 10 years ago
Oh my~ It's been so long ㅜㅜ
Don't you want to ride an airplane?
You want to ride it, but it's too expensive?

Korean: 흙흙 ㅜㅜ 나는 이번에 아빠 퇴직기념으로 갈 예정이야!
English: Hurry up ㅜㅜ I'm planning to go this time to celebrate my dad's retirement!
Oh~ Are you riding from Cheongju?
Or Gunsan?

Korean: 키키 뭐 그때 시간 봐서 청주든 군산이든 가려고!
English: Kiki, depending on the time, I'm thinking of going to Cheongju or Gunsan!
When are you retiring, Dad?
Retire this December!
You should have a retirement party~

Korean: 어 근데 내가 백신을 아직 다 안 맞아서 백신 맞고 가기로 했어!
English: Oh, but I haven't been fully vaccinated yet, so I decided to get vaccinated and go!
You haven't gotten the vaccine yet?
Have you ever worked part-time, mama?
Side jobs were really popular back in the day~

Korean: 헐 키키 나도 부업 한 번 해봤어!
English: Wow Kiki, I also tried a side job once!
Do you know how to fold a mask pack?
Oh really?

Korean: 마스크팩이면 좀 깨끗한 환경에서 해야 하는 거 아니야?
English: If it's a sheet mask, shouldn't it be done in a clean environment?

Korean: 또 그건 아닌 것 같은데 집에서 말고 가서 했어
English: I don't think that's it either, I did it when I went out instead of at home
Oh, go?
I worked part-time at my friend's house!
You're so young, what kind of side job are you doing?

Korean: 키키 그냥 걔네 엄마 하는 거 일손 도와드렸어!
English: Kiki, I was just helping her mom with her chores!
So how much did you get paid per day?
I folded 100 sheets and got 2,000 won!
What the~
I just got paid for tteokbokki Kiki
Kiki, that's right

Korean: 딱 그 돈 모아서 친구랑 나가서 사 먹음!
English: I just saved up that amount of money and went out to eat with my friends!
cute
When did you do it? Kiki's side job
I did it when I was in middle school!

Korean: 지금도 다른 일 많이 하고 있지?
English: Are you doing a lot of other things now?
Cheer up haha

Korean: 둘째 아들램이 피엑스에서 뭐 안 사와?
English: My second son, Ram, didn't you buy anything from PX?

Korean: 저번에 달팽이 크림 사오라 했는데 이런
English: Last time I told you to buy snail cream, but this is what I got
He came on vacation, but he didn't buy it?
Draw.
If you don't give him money, he won't buy it.

Korean: 키키 그래도 돈은 주고 사오라고 해야지~
English: Kiki, you still have to give me money to buy it~

Korean: 엄마 선물 하나 사줄 수 없나
English: Can you buy me a present, Mom?
But that's true

Korean: 그거 만 원도 안 할 텐데!
English: That won't even cost ten thousand won!
I know
So my daughter's friend bought me a lot of things~

Korean: 키키 딸램 친구가 아들램보다 훨씬 낫네!
English: Kiki's daughter's friend is much better than her son's!
I know
Maybe it's because I'm old, Kiki
Kiki, is your friend 23 years old?
No, twenty-four, Kiki
I heard that my child went to the military late~
But whether they're 22 or 24, men are all the same~
I know
My son has a 30-year-old brother in the military.
Oh, right, Kiki

Korean: 이번에 전역할 때는 꼭 사올 거야
English: I'll definitely buy it when I get discharged this time
Let me tell you~
That's right

Korean: 안 그러면 집에 들어올 생각도 말라 그래
English: Otherwise, don't even think about coming home.

Korean: 작은엄마 첫째 딸램은 어렸을 때 뭐 가르쳤어?
English: Grandma, what did you teach your eldest daughter when she was little?
There's nothing I haven't done
But he's also stupid
Kiki, why aren't you better than the second one?
Draw

Korean: 근데 고등학교 때 놀아서 대학이 시원치 않아
English: But I played around in high school so college isn't fun.

Korean: 왜 대학교 세무학과 나오면 잘 하는 거 아니야?
English: Why don't you do well if you graduate from a university's taxation department?
It's a top-tier system, so everyone can go in there~

Korean: 상계열이라 다 들어간다고 하는 얘기는 머선 소리야?
English: What do you mean when you say that everyone in the upper class gets in?
Anyone can go in?
You don't necessarily have to study hard
Kiki, really?
But if I major in taxation, I'll have a good chance of getting a job, right?
I hope you get a job soon
Play all day~

Korean: 근데 지금 코시국이라 취업난 최고조라잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: But right now, it's the COVID-19 pandemic and the unemployment rate is at its peak ㅜㅜ
I know
It's going to get harder from now on

Korean: 첫째 딸램은 알아서 잘하니까 괜찮을 거야!
English: My eldest daughter is doing well on her own, so it'll be okay!

Korean: 응 지금은 사이버 대학 다니고 있어
English: Yeah, I'm attending a cyber university now.
Kiki, really?
Did you transfer?
no
Just say you're getting a diploma
Grandma, what happened to your brother?
I have 7 daughters and 1 son. How scary is that?
Kiki, is this true?
How many sons are you?
Ah, six daughters and one son
1st son, almost the youngest line
Our little house is also 5 girls and 1 boy Kiki
I know
So the daughter-in-law will have a hard time
that's right
Did the first son get married there too?
Yeah but we don't get along
Who are you not on good terms with?
With your daughter-in-law and sisters?
It's like that with my daughter-in-law~
It's hard to even see your face

Korean: 근데 며느리는 시누이 6명 얘기만 들어도 스트레스 받아할 거야 ㅜ
English: But my daughter-in-law will be stressed just hearing about her 6 sisters-in-law.
right
One word is six words, so Kiki
I can't help it
that's right,
Even small houses eventually fall apart,
right
It's no joke there either now
that's right,

Korean: 심지어 작은 할아버지랑 할머니 건강이 안 좋으시잖아,
English: Even my grandfather and grandmother are not in good health.

Korean: 두 분 다 지금 병원에 계시지 않아?
English: Aren't you both in the hospital right now?

Korean: 작은엄마 첫째 딸램 결혼한다고 하면 어떨 거 같아?
English: What do you think your eldest daughter will do if she gets married?
Welcome with open arms
Who will take it?
Kiki, really?

Korean: 우리 엄마는 나 보고 결혼하지 말래!
English: My mom told me not to get married!
Why don't you get married?
Don't get married, you're better off alone!
That's true

Korean: 너네 엄마도 시집와서 고생 많이 했을 거야
English: Your mother must have had a hard time after getting married.
Yeah Kiki

Korean: 그리고 우리 조 씨 집안 남자덜은 다 애덜이잖아~
English: And all the men in our Jo family are children~
I fully understand how much it rots your mind.
So Kiki

Korean: 근데 우리 언니는 결혼할 거 같던데?
English: But I think my sister is going to get married?
When are you getting married?
I'm getting older so I have to do it soon

Korean: 아마 남친 자리 잡고 하지 않을까?
English: Maybe she'll settle down with her boyfriend?
I heard you're meeting your parents too!
already?
When did you decide to meet?
As far as I know, we were supposed to meet in November!
Did you just say let's eat?
Or are you taking it seriously?
No!
He said let's just eat first~
Oh my... I'm already getting married
I hope it goes well

Korean: 작은엄마 첫째 딸램은 강아지 키운다는데 어떻게 생각해?
English: Grandma, your eldest daughter is raising a puppy. What do you think?
No furry animals

Korean: 근데 강아지랑 고양이랑 햄스터 다 키운대~
English: But I raised a dog, a cat, and a hamster~
You heard right Kiki
I'm getting married and living like that

Korean: 그래도 작은엄마네 놀러 가면 데리고 가지 않을까?
English: But if I go to my grandmother's house to play, won't I take her with me?
yes

Korean: 잠깐은 괜찮은데 같이 사는 건 힘들어
English: It's okay for a while, but living together is difficult

Korean: 키키 이제부터 작은엄마가 털 달린 동물을 만지는 법은 연습해야겠다~ 나중을 위해서
English: Kiki, from now on, Mommy has to practice how to touch furry animals~ For later.
Well ㅜㅜ
It's pretty to look at
Especially the Pomeranian is cute
But you don't like being touched?
no

Korean: 그냥 냄새 나거나 털 날리는 게 싫어서 그래
English: I just don't like the smell and the hair flying around.
Aren't our Obok totally cute?
that's right
But I think it's also fierce
Kiki is right,
But I don't get angry at my grandmother.

Korean: 응 작은 아빠한테 하악질 한거 봤어?
English: Yeah, did you see that little daddy yapping?
I almost died laughing
Yeah Kiki

Korean: 고양이가 하악질 하는 거는 진짜 극혐하는 거래!
English: It's really disgusting when a cat hisses!
That's because my little dad teased me
Do you know about Little Mom Climbing?
Have you tried it?
There's a climbing gym in the neighborhood. How is it?
I'm a flying orangutan~
I don't know~?
How much of that have you learned?

Korean: 나 년수는 3년 됐고 한 거는 많이 안 돼 키키
English: It's been 3 years since I've been here and I haven't done much Kiki
Are you self-taught?
Or did you take separate lessons?
No~
I went to a climbing academy~
How much is the tuition fee for this course?
It's 100,000 won a month there, so in 3 months it's 280,000 won!
It's a lot cheaper than I thought.
Here you get 30 a month
Wow, that's crazy expensive!
Come here!
It's expensive because it's a tuition fee, but the facilities are good

Korean: 그렇게 키키 여기도 근데 시설 나쁘지 않아!
English: Kiki, the facilities here aren't bad either!
Do they offer one-on-one lessons there too?

Korean: 거의 그런 식으로 하는 거 같아!
English: I think that's pretty much how it's done!
Oh, then it's definitely cheap and good

Korean: 작은엄마는 화투나 섯다 같은 건 안 좋아해?
English: Grandma, don't you like games like Hwatu or Seotda?
I played seotda once in my youth~

Korean: 그래서 애들이 그렇게 잘 치는 구나?
English: So that's why the kids play so well?
Yeah, that's right
Who do you resemble?
Now that I look at it, I know who it resembles~
right
I beat your dad too
Kiki, really?

Korean: 나 작은엄마가 하는 건 한 번도 못 봄!
English: I've never seen my grandmother do that!

Korean: 설날에 너가 친구들이랑 놀러 나가서 그렇지 뭐~
English: You went out to play with your friends on New Year's Day, right?
Kiki, is that so?
How much did you earn then?

Korean: 돈 내기는 안 하고 그냥 애들 치킨 사주려고 그랬지
English: I wasn't going to pay, I was just going to buy the kids chicken.
Kiki is right

Korean: 거기서 제일 많이 딴 사람이 치킨 쏘잖아!
English: The person who gets the most money there gets the chicken!

Korean: 응 그래서 다사랑 치킨 먹었는데 하하
English: Yeah so I ate dasarang chicken haha
Kiki, really?
I should have eaten Kyochon Chicken Honey Combo~

Korean: 그래도 작은 엄마는 논산에서 다사랑이 최고야
English: But my little mom says Dasarang is the best in Nonsan
Kiki, really?
But now all that love is gone,

Korean: 나는 큰 거 써도 다 삐져나오더라 ㅜ
English: Even if I use a big one, it all comes out crookedㅜ
Oh really
I guess your hair is long

Korean: 근데 내가 잘 사용하지 못하는 건가 봐...
English: But I guess I'm not good at using it...

Hey!

Korean: 아니 유튜브를 봐도 어떻게 해야 하는지 모르겠어!
English: No, even if I watch YouTube, I don't know what to do!
First, tie your hair and roll it up.

Korean: 돌돌 말라는 뜻이 한 방향으로 돌리라는 뜻?
English: Does the meaning of 'roll around' mean to turn in one direction?
Turn it in one direction
Hey!

Korean: 나 근데 그렇게 해 봤는데... 허허
English: I tried that though... Hehe
Have you tried it?
But it doesn't work well

Korean: 언니 지금 비타민 챙겨 먹고 있어?
English: Sister, are you taking your vitamins now?
Yeah, eat well
Because I'm old

Korean: 맞아 20대 때부터 먹어야 나중에 고생 안 한 대!
English: That's right, you should start eating it in your 20s so you don't suffer later on!
Okay, let's start eating from now on.

Korean: 키키 나는 지금 3개월 째 복용 중이야
English: Kiki I've been taking it for 3 months now
What about your sister?
I have been taking it for a month
Is this your first time eating it?
Yeah, I got it as a gift and I'm trying it for the first time.
I see

Korean: 나는 의사 선생님이 권유해서 먹기 시작했어!
English: I started taking it because my doctor recommended it!

Korean: 녹십자 꺼 젤리 같은 거 먹어
English: Eat something like the jelly from the Green Cross

Korean: 키키 나는 유재석 님이 선전하는 그 비타민~
English: Kiki I am the vitamin that Yoo Jae-seok is promoting~
Oh really
Mine is delicious and good

Korean: 키키 나는 그냥 물이랑 같이 먹는데!
English: Kiki I just drink it with water!
Oh really
Is that a pill?
Oh right
You should take two pills a day!

Korean: 그것도 챙겨 먹는 게 일이잖아 그치
English: It's your job to eat that too, right?
Sister, what did you buy from Coupang recently?
Yeah I bought slippers
slippers?
Did you buy shoes for the company?
Oh, I bought it for 32 thousand won
Wow... you bought something expensive?
Are these brand slippers?
Yeah, I bought a pair of Crocs.
Crocs?
Did Crocs sell slippers this expensive?

Korean: 웅 삼만 이천 원이면 싼 거 일 텐데
English: Yeah, if it's thirty-two thousand won, it's cheap.
Oh really?

Korean: 나는 크록스 한 번도 안 신어 봄! ?
English: I've never worn Crocs before! ?
Is it comfortable?
Try one on
Comfortable and nice
What color did you buy?
I have black and blue

Korean: 아 두 켤레를 사서 그렇게 비싼 거야?
English: Oh, I bought two pairs and they are that expensive?
I bought it on sale
that's right
Kiki, I see
Did you buy one for your boyfriend?

Korean: 웅 하나는 남자친구 꺼 하나는 내 것
English: Yeah, one is my boyfriend's and one is mine.

Korean: 언니는 뮤지컬 보러 가본 적 있어?
English: Sister, have you ever been to see a musical?
No, not even once ㅠㅠ
you

Korean: 나 딱 한 번 이벤트 당첨돼서 가 봤어!
English: I won an event once and went!
Oh really
With who
It would be fun
I went alone Kiki
Sister, do you know the musical Cats?
Is it fun to do it alone?
Yeah, I know

Korean: 어 나 처음으로 혼자 가 봤는데 혼자여도 재미는 있더라!
English: Oh, it was my first time going alone, and it was fun even alone!
Oh, that's really cool
I'll go alone too

Korean: 키키 근데 한 석밖에 당첨이 안 돼서 혼자 갈 수밖에 없었어...
English: Kiki, but I only won one seat, so I had to go alone...
Oh, so that's why you went alone, Kiki
Kiki yeah right
Sister, do you know Big Bang's Daesung?
Yeah I know Big Bang Kiki
why
Daesung appeared in Cats
What a really nice voice!
Oh, I really didn't know
I want to see it too
Kiki But I don't do that now...
It's already over~

Korean: 그치 끝나고 코로나 땜에 못 보겠지
English: Well, I guess I won't be able to see you because of Corona.
Sister, do you like CGV or Megabox?
Yeah I like Megabox
Why do you like Megabox?
I like it there too!
There's a Megabox in front of our hospital.

Korean: 키키 아 그러면 당연히 메가박스를 가야지~
English: Kiki: Then of course we have to go to Megabox~
Yeah, that's so good

Korean: 맞아 나는 거기에 오짱 팔아서 좋아해 키키
English: Yeah I like selling ochan there Kiki
Oh my gosh, it's delicious
me too
right?

Korean: 그리고 나는 sk라 거기 할인이 돼!
English: And I'm from SK so I get a discount there!
Oh, it's really on sale
I didn't know
Oh, it's 12,000 won right now, right?
If you use this, it's 8000 won!
Oh, I should go too, with my boyfriend.
Kiki's boyfriend's cell phone carrier is SK?
Yeah, that's right
Me too sk
Oh, then I should go and get a discount from the party~
I knew because of you
I have to go and do it
Is your mom cooking now?
Yeah I'm going to make dakgalbi today haha

Korean: 와 대박 ㅜㅜ 나도 오늘 점심 닭갈비 먹을 걸!
English: Wow, awesome ㅜㅜ I should have had dakgalbi for lunch today too!
I heard they even deliver dakgalbi these days?
that's right!

Korean: 근데 배달료가 장난이 아니라서 못 먹고 있어 ㅜ
English: But I can't eat it because the delivery fee is no joke ㅜ
Yeah. The delivery fee alone is 3-4 thousand won, right?
Haha that's right, I gave up because it was 5600 won somewhere!

Korean: 아휴 혼자 있으니 사먹으러 나가기도 뭐하겠어
English: Oh, I'm alone so I don't think I'll go out to eat.

Korean: 키키 맞아 ㅜㅜ 나 서울이라서 먹기도 좀 그렇고 ㅜㅜ
English: Kiki is right ㅜㅜ I'm in Seoul so it's a bit awkward to eat ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그럴 때 혼자 사는 게 서러운 거야~
English: It's sad to live alone at times like that~

Korean: 키키 맞아 엄마한테 전화하니까 열무김치 했다더라!
English: Kiki, that's right, I called my mom and she said she made pickled turnips!

Korean: 엄마 김치 맛있게 담그잖어~ 나중에 보내달라혀
English: Mom, you made some delicious kimchi. Send it to me later.

Korean: 키키 그니까 엄마 그거에다 밥 비벼먹고 있다는데 침 줄줄 나왔잖아
English: Kiki, so mom said you were mixing rice in it and eating it, and your drool was pouring out.

Korean: 집밥 많이 그립지? 나와서 살면 다 고생이여
English: Do you miss home cooking a lot? Living outside is hard.
Yeah ㅜㅜ

Korean: 다다음 주에 갈 예정인데!  그때 집밥 많이 먹어야지!
English: I'm planning to go next week! I have to eat a lot of home-cooked meals then!
Yeah, go gain some weight and come back.
Does your grandmother have an air fryer at home?
No, there isn't any~
Would you like to buy one?
Oh really?
Ask your first daughter!
Should I buy it?
Yeah, he asked me to buy him an oven, Kiki.
Kiki's oven? You're making bread?
Want to make cookies?
Kiki is making a fuss about grilling steak

Korean: 키키 오븐으로 스테이크를 왜 구워 후라이팬 있잖여!
English: Why cook steak in the Kiki oven when you have a frying pan!

Korean: 오븐으로 구워야 맛있대 온도가 균일 하다나 뭐라나
English: They say it tastes better when baked in the oven so the temperature is even and all.
Kiki, that's right
But how much steak do you eat?
Right Kiki
Where is an air fryer often used?
Don't you know about Kiki Air Fryer?
I can't live without this these days~
Isn't it similar to an oven? Everyone uses it.

Korean: 키키 음, 튀김기랑 비슷한 건데 대신에 기름 없이 쓰는 거야!

Korean: 기름을 안 두르고 쓰는 거구나 키키
English: Kiki, you use it without oiling it
I guess I'll have to do the dishes

Korean: 어 그거 종이호일만 있으면 만사 오케이야~
English: Oh, if you just have aluminum foil, everything will be okay~

When did you get your driver's license, grandma?
well...?
It was twenty years ago when I was working at Samsung...?

Korean: 키키 헉,  한 달에 운전 몇 번이나 해,?
English: Kiki Hey, how many times a month do you drive?
There is no time to say, "I won't do it now"

Korean: 키키 작은엄마 차 산다고 하지 않았어?!?
English: Kiki, didn't you say you were going to buy a little mom a car?!?

Korean: 응 그건 나중에 지금은 재택 근무라 필요없어
English: Yeah, that's not necessary now since I work from home.
Oh, right, Kiki

Korean: 근데 계속 연습은 해 줘야 하는 거 아니야?
English: But don't you have to keep practicing?

Korean: 응 나중에 도로 연수 받고 차사야지!
English: Yeah, I'll have to get some road training later and buy a car!

Korean: 키키 작은아빠한테 부탁해서 연습 시켜달라고 해!

Korean: 아우 작은아빠 운전 하는 꼬라지 봤어?
