Korean: 키키 어,  작은아빠 차 안에도 장난 아니더라 키키
English: Kiki Oh, it's no joke even in Daddy's car Kiki
Then~ where does the dog food smell like?

Korean: 키키 아 내가 탔을 때는 쉰내는 안 나는데 안에 흙 장난 아니던데?
English: Kiki, when I rode it, it didn't smell like shit, but wasn't there some dirt inside?

Korean: 응 그것도 그렇고 한달에 벌금만 얼마나 내는데
English: Yeah, that's right, and how much do you pay in fines every month?
Kiki Hul, how much do you have to pay in fines?
I've been consistently paying 40,000 won a month
What kind of part-time job have you had, Grandma?
Part time job?

Korean: 애들 어릴 때 설거지 하러 갔지~
English: I went to wash the dishes when the kids were little~

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 일반 식당 알바하러 간 거야?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ You went to work at a regular restaurant?

Korean: 아니 집 근처 공장인데 잠깐 한거야
English: No, it's a factory near my house, I just did it for a little while
I see
How many hours did you work there?

Korean: 4시간 정도 잠깐 했지~ 키키 애들 어려서
English: I did it briefly for about 4 hours~ Kiki and the kids were young

Korean: 4시간? 애들 학교 갈 때 했겠네 그러면?
English: 4 hours? You must have done it when the kids were going to school.

Korean: 유치원 다녀올때 잠깐 하고 데릴러 갔지
English: I went to pick her up for a bit when she came home from kindergarten.
Oh, I see ㅜㅜ
What was the hourly wage back then?
Well I think I got 5000 won haha

Korean: 설거지도 시급 센 건데 그때 당시에 5천원이었다니, 7
English: Even dishwashing was expensive, and at that time it was 5,000 won per hour.

Korean: 응 식기세척기 설거지인데 더 많이 주지
English: Yeah, it's dishwasher dishwashing so I'll give you more
Kiki, I see
Didn't your back hurt?
I should have done it when I was young~
It's hard now that I'm older
Yeah ㅜㅜ

Korean: 지금은 그래도 좋은 직장 다니고 있자녀~
English: I have a good job now though~
It'll be a good job once corona is over haha

Korean: 작은엄마 애들 병영캠프 같은 곳 보낼 생각 안 했어?
English: Have you ever thought about sending your little mom's kids to a military camp or something?

Korean: 응 당시에 사건사고가 많아서 안 보냈지
English: Yeah, there were a lot of accidents at the time so I didn't send it.

Korean: 키키 헐 근데 우리 학원은 왜 나 보낸 거냐!
English: Kiki Oh my gosh, but why did our academy send me there!

Korean: 그러게 성추행도 그렇고 익사 사건도 있었지
English: Yes, there was sexual harassment and drowning incidents.
Oh my gosh, sexual harassment?
Was there an incident like that?
The instructors said it was dangerous

Korean: 거기 교관들도 다 전문가 아니고 어디 뭣도 모르는 사람들이 와서 대충하는 거잖아
English: The instructors there aren't any experts, and they're just people who don't know anything and do things roughly.
I know.
Why would you pay money to get a fancy dress?

Korean: 맞아,,,  나는 진짜 가기 싫었는데 25만 원 이미 냈다고 가라잖아!
English: That's right,,, I really didn't want to go, but they told me to go since I already paid 250,000 won!
What is that you're going to pay 250,000 won for?
Kiki, that's right,

Korean: 근데 우리 가고 또 익사사건 있어서 거기 완전 망함
English: But when we left there was another drowning incident and it was a total mess.

Korean: 지금 하면 난리날걸? 키키 엄마들 절대 안보내지
English: If you do it now, there will be chaos. Kiki's moms will never let you go.

Korean: 키키 거기 지금 완전 망해서 지금 하는 곳 아예 없잖아
English: Kiki, it's totally ruined there right now, there's no place to do it right now.
Right~ They don't even have military programs these days.

Korean: 키키 맞아 이런 건 진짜 하면 안 된다고 지금도 생각하고 있어
English: Kiki, that's right. I still think that you really shouldn't do this.

Korean: 응 그러게. 뭣도 모르니깐 간거야 지금은 안가지
English: Yeah, that's right. I went because I didn't know anything. I'm not going now.

Korean: 작은엄마는 요즘에 요가 말고 배우고 싶은 거 없어?
English: Mom, is there anything you want to learn besides yoga these days?
Well, I wanted to learn nail art professionally.
Kiki, really?
Mom, do you like getting your nails done?
Of course~

Korean: 샵은 비싸고 집에서 직접 사다하면 어떨까?
English: The shops are expensive, so why not buy it at home?

Korean: 키키 오 좋지 첫째 딸램 마루타 고고!
English: Kiki Oh good, first daughter Maruta go go!

Korean: 걔는 손톱에 뭐 칠하는 거 싫어해서 너가 해라.
English: He doesn't like to paint his nails, so you do it.
Kiki, you don't know my nails?
I don't have fingernails,
Potato nails still like that?

Korean: 키키 당연하지 못 기르겠어, 나는 글렀어,
English: Kiki Of course I can't raise you, I'm done,

Korean: 왜 손톱 아직도 물어 뜯는 버릇 있어?
English: Why do you still bite your nails?

Korean: 어, 나도 모르게 불안하면 계속 뜯어
English: Oh, I keep tearing it off when I feel anxious without knowing it
What are you ~ anxious about?
If you keep biting your nails, your teeth will also become gapped.
Yeah ㅜㅜ

Korean: 내가 그래서 토끼 이빨이 됐나벼 ㅜ
English: That's why I have rabbit teeth ㅜ

Korean: 응 그거 나중에 교정 하려면 돈이잖어 얼른 고쳐
English: Yeah, it'll cost money to fix it later, so fix it quickly.

Korean: 헐랭 ㅜㅜ 근데 나는 이미 늦은 거 같아 하하
English: Wow ㅜㅜ But I think it's already too late haha
Try applying nail polish that won't break your nails
Did your grandmother say you were the youngest of your siblings?
Yes, I'm the youngest of 6 daughters and 1 son.
I see

Korean: 첫째 언니랑은 나이 차이가 많이 나?
English: Is there a big age difference between you and your eldest sister?
Yeah, I think there's about an 8 year age difference.
Oh really?
So all seven siblings were born in the same year?
Almost like that~
You kept having children to have a son

Korean: 키키 와 대박 근데 마지막에 또 작은엄마가 나왔넹~
English: Kiki, wow, daebak, but at the end, the little mom came out again~
I know

Korean: 아들 낳고 다음엔 아들이거니 했는데 내가 나왔지
English: After giving birth to a son, I thought it would be a boy next, but then I came out.

Korean: 키키 와오 키키 괜찮아 막내는 여자든 남자든 예쁨 많이 받어
English: Kiki wow kiki it's okay the youngest is pretty whether it's a girl or a boy
It's different now than it was back then Kiki
You only prefer sons
Oh, I see ㅜㅜ
So are you still close with your brothers?
We don't talk much, but we talk on the phone often.
Oh, right, Kiki

Korean: 다들 뿔뿔이 다른 지역으로 흩어져서 그런 거야?
English: Is it because everyone is scattered to different regions?

Korean: 응 반은 수도권 반은 고향 근처에 살아
English: Yes, half of them live in the metropolitan area and half live near their hometown.
I see

Korean: 수도권에 살고 있는 분들은 몇 째 언니들이셔?
English: How many sisters live in the metropolitan area?
There are about 4 people in Seoul and Gyeonggi.

Korean: 작은엄마는 첫째가 먼저 결혼할 거 같아 둘째 가 먼저 결혼할 거 같아?
English: Grandma, do you think the eldest will get married first or the second will get married first?
The first one will go first, right?
Kiki, really?

Korean: 나는 둘째가 먼저 갈 거 같음!
English: I think the second one will go first!
He's still young~ He's in his early twenties

Korean: 키키 근데 둘째 여자애들한테 인기 많은 거 같더라?
English: Kiki: But I think you're popular with the second girls?
Yeah. But we're all friends~
You're useless once you get married
Kiki, whether you get married or not, it's all the same~
You have to build your own home there~
You need to save up money to get married~

Korean: 키키 뭘 작은엄마가 모아~ 애들보고 알아서 하라고 혀~
English: Kiki, what is the little mom gathering~ Tell the kids to do it themselves~

Korean: 아니 걔가 돈을 벌어야 장가를 간다고 키키
English: No, he has to earn money to get married, Kiki
These days, if you don't have a house, you can't get married.
Kiki, that's right

Korean: 둘째 결혼 한 40대 때 하겠는 걸~?
English: What are you going to do when you get married for the second time in your 40s?
What if I don't grow old and die alone?

Korean: 키키 나는 혼자 늙어 죽을 거 같혀~
English: Kiki I think I'm going to grow old and die alone~
Why~ You have to marry your boyfriend

Korean: 키키 몰라~ 우리 둘 다 돈 없어~
English: Kiki I don't know~ Neither of us have money~

Korean: 얼른 열심히 벌어서 시집갈 밑천 해둬
English: Hurry up and work hard to earn money so that you can get married.
Little Mom, did I recognize the turtle?
It's the turtle song again... So?
Kiki the Turtle only costs 500,000 won!
Are you thinking of raising a turtle?

Korean: 키키 어 나는 거북이 키우고 싶음!
English: Kiki, I want to raise a turtle!
Land turtles other than pets?

Korean: 어 맞아 애완용 육지거북이야! 아프리카에서 사는 애!
English: Oh, that's right, a pet tortoise! One that lives in Africa!
Aha, you raise those in an aquarium?

Korean: 아니 걔는 적당한 햇빛이랑 물만 있으면 된대 계속 물에 있는 애가 아니야!
English: No, he's not the type of guy who's always in the water, he just needs some sunlight and water!
Then are you raising them outside? In a cage?

Korean: 사육장이 있고 이제 내가 있을 때는 풀어놔야쥐~
English: There's a kennel and now I have to let them out when I'm there~
What kind of food should I give to turtles?

Korean: 사료는 그 거북이 사료 따로 파는 거 있어 그거 주면 돼!
English: As for the feed, there is separate turtle feed for sale, so you can give that to him!
I see

Korean: 거북이 키우는데 돈 많이 들것 같은데
English: I think it would cost a lot of money to raise a turtle.

Korean: 아니야 거북이 자체 가격이 많이 비싸지 들어가는 건 얼마 안 들어!
English: No, the turtle itself is expensive, but it doesn't cost much to put it in!

Korean: 그래도 에버랜드 같은데 보면 등도 설치 해주더만
English: But if you look at places like Everland, they even install lights.
Have you ever played tennis, Grandma?
No~ I can't even play badminton properly.
Oh really?

Korean: 작은엄마는 공으로 할 수 있는 운동 잘 못 해?
English: Is your little mom not good at sports with a ball?
Ball games aren't my thing, are they?

Korean: 그러면 계곡 갈 때 사람들이랑 비치볼 가지고도 안 놀아 봤어?
English: Then, when you go to the valley, have you ever played with people and a beach ball?
Haha, don't go into the valley
What fun is there in getting older?

Korean: 키키 그러면 작은엄마는 요가 말고 할 수 있는 게 뭐야!?
English: Kiki: Then what can Little Mom do other than yoga!?

Korean: 글쎄... 등산... 산책 이 정도만 키키
English: Well... hiking... walking, just this much Kiki
I haven't tried any other exercise
Kiki, but hiking is the best with or without oxygen!

Korean: 그럼~ 산에 올라가면 얼마나 공기가 좋은데!
English: Well~ How good is the air when you climb the mountain!

Korean: 맞아 첫 째도 등산 가는 거 좋아하던데 같이 가!
English: That's right, my first child also likes to go hiking. Let's go together!

Korean: 걔랑 나랑은 스타일이 달라서 우린 따로가
English: He and I have different styles so we go our separate ways
Kiki, really?
How are the styles different?

Korean: 쉬지도 않고 앞만 보고 가 키키
English: Kiki, don't stop and just keep going forward
Kiki, who is your daughter?
Aren't you making it too tight?
That's really unacceptable

Korean: 작은엄마 카지노라고 알아?  그 돈 내고 하는 게임!
English: Do you know Little Mom Casino? It's a game you pay for!
I know~ I've been to Kangwon Land before.
Oh really?
When did you go?
When the kids were little haha
I went to High1 Resort and tried it~
Kiki and really?

Korean: 근데 우리도 지금 갈 수 있나?
English: But can we go now?
Then~ only adults can enter
Then can we go too?
Little Mom, have you ever played games there?
My little dad tried it before and lost.

Korean: 헐 키키 작은아빠 거기서 얼마 잃었는데?
English: Wow, Kiki Little Daddy, how much did you lose there?
I lost 100,000 won and left right away~

Korean: 헐 키키 한 번에 10만 원 잃고 나왔어?
English: Wow, Kiki, you lost 100,000 won in one go?

Korean: 응 맞아 하지도 못하는걸 왜 했대
English: Yeah, that's right. Why did you do something you couldn't even do?

Korean: 키키 그때 작은 아빠 포커 했어?
English: Kiki, did you play poker with your little dad back then?

Korean: 기억이 안나는데 포커는 아닌 것 같아
English: I don't remember, but I don't think it was poker.
I see

Korean: 그러면 우리한테 알려준 원카드 한 건가?
English: So, is that the one card you told us about?
That's another card game called hula.
Have you ever been on a boat, Mom?
Yeah, I've ridden it a lot~
I think I rode it recently too
Recently?
Where did you go to play with your uncle?

Korean: 가족여행으로 거제도 갔는데 섬 갈 때 탔지
English: I went to Geojedo Island for a family trip and rode it when I went to the island.
Geojedo?
What month did you go?
I'm jealous. I want to go too!
If you go in the middle of summer, you'll die of heat.

Korean: 키키 아 여름에는 펜션이나 잡고 수영이나 해야쥐~
English: Kiki, in the summer, you should stay at a pension and go swimming~
Yeah, that's right. It was really hot.

Korean: 키키 인정 나는 이번 여름에 아무 데도 안 갔잖아 그래서!
English: Kiki admit I didn't go anywhere this summer so!

Korean: 맞어~ 집에 있는 게 최고야 가서 고생만 하다 왔지
English: That's right~ Staying home is the best. I just went there and suffered.

Korean: 키키 맞아 나는 집에서 에어컨 바람 쐬면서 잘 지냈음!
English: Kiki, that's right, I had a great time at home enjoying the air conditioning!
Yeah, that's the best vacation~

Korean: ㅋ 인정 아이심도 하나 물어주고 말이야~
English: Haha, I admit, I have a question for you too~
In the summer, I should rest at home and eat patbingsu.
Kiki is right

Korean: 근데 너무 먹으면 배탈나니까 적당히 먹어줘야 함~
English: But if you eat too much, you'll get a stomachache, so you should eat in moderation~

Korean: 그렇지 가을이 되야 여행도 갈맛이 나~
English: Yeah, it's only when fall comes that I feel like traveling~
Grandma, do you like winter or summer?

Korean: 여름이 좋지 하하 해도 길고 따듯하고
English: Summer is nice haha but it's long and warm
Kiki, really?

Korean: 나는 여름에는 겨울이 좋고 겨울에는 여름이 좋음^^
English: I like winter in summer and summer in winter^^
Everyone is like that~
Still I like summer
Kiki, I see

Korean: 작은엄마는 그러면 더위를 잘 안 타는 편이네?
English: Then, does that mean your mother doesn't suffer from heat very well?

Korean: 더운 건 참을만 해 근데 추우면 이제 몸이 시려
English: I can bear the heat, but when it's cold, my body starts to feel cold

Korean: 키키 맞아 작은엄마는 살도 없어서 더 그렇겠어!
English: Kiki, that's right, it's even worse because the little mom is fat!

Korean: 아녀~ 나이 들어봐 다 공감 할걸?
English: Oh my~ When you get older, you'll all agree?

Korean: 키키 근데 우리 엄마는 나보다 더위를 더 잘 타는데?
English: Kiki: But my mom handles the heat better than I do?
Are you feeling feverish haha

Korean: 좋은 거지 여자는 몸이 차면 안돼
English: A good beggar woman should not be cold

Korean: 키키 아 그거는 그래 특히 생리할 때!
English: Kiki Oh, that's right, especially when you're on your period!

Korean: 응 너도 옷 따듯하게 입고 다녀 요즘 추워
English: Yeah, you should dress warmly too. It's cold these days.

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 내일 출근할 때 따숩게 입고 나가야지 ㅜ
English: Right ㅜㅜ I have to dress warmly when I go to work tomorrow ㅜ
Yeah, wear a scarf with your coat

Korean: 어 목도리 그래서 이번에 하나 장만하려고~
English: Oh, a scarf, so I'm thinking of buying one this time~

Korean: 목도 따숩게 해야 목감기 안 걸려~
English: You have to keep your neck warm so you don't catch a cold~
Does your grandmother sometimes buy lottery tickets?
It's been a long time since I bought a lottery ticket~
I used to buy a lot
Kiki, really?
This time, 10 people won!
Wow, really?
There really is a good place

Korean: 키키 그러니까 다 자동으로 선택해서 된 거래!
English: Kiki: So, everything was automatically selected and done!

Korean: 아 한 곳에서 그렇게 나온게 아니구나
English: Oh, it didn't come from one place.
Yeah Kiki
Should I give you my number?
The first one was 17
I heard there are places that tell you the lottery numbers these days.
Kiki, really?

Korean: 나 요즘에 스팸으로 오는 문자같은 거 말하는 건가?
English: Are you talking about the spam texts I get these days?
Yeah, there are a lot of people who do that.

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 가끔씩 그거 살까 고민 해
English: Kiki, that's right. I sometimes think about buying that too.
I'll do it because there's a chance it will happen~

Korean: 키키 나 근데 이번에 샀으면 5만 원 당첨됐었을 뻔!
English: Kiki, if I had bought it this time, I would have won 50,000 won!
What if I bought it with the number they gave me there?

Korean: 키키 아니 나 원래 계속 쓰던 번호 있음!
English: Kiki, no, I have a number I've been using!

Korean: 아 키키 그거 계속 밀고 나가는 거야?
English: Ah Kiki, are you going to keep pushing that?

Korean: 작은엄마 뉴스에서 중국 김치 만드는 과정 봤어?
English: Did you see the process of making Chinese kimchi on Little Mom News?
I know, I saw you make it naked
Wow, seriously, isn't this awesome?

Korean: 응 그래서 식당에서 중국산 쓰면 당연히 안 먹어
English: Yeah, so of course I won't eat it if a restaurant uses Chinese food.

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 원래부터 안 좋아했는데 그 아저씨가 헤엄치는 장면 보고 절대 안 먹음!
English: Kiki, that's right. I didn't like it to begin with, but after seeing the scene where that old man was swimming, I absolutely refused to eat it!
Yeah, I saw it on the news too
Be exposed

Korean: 키키 와 진짜, 그러다 우리나라 김치 만드는 과정 보니까 진짜 힐링이더라
English: Kiki, really, seeing the process of making kimchi in our country was really healing.
That's right, our country's factory hygiene is good.

Korean: 키키 맞아 진짜 깨끗하잖아 근데 수출률이 점점 준댕 ㅜ
English: Kiki is right, it's really clean, but the export rate is decreasing.
That's a shame.
Soon, even kimchi will be stolen by China.

Korean: 키키 휴, 전세계인들이 중국이 그렇게 만드는 거 봐야 하는데 말이야!
English: Kiki Phew, the whole world needs to see what China is doing!

Korean: 어우 김치도 직접 담가 먹지 사다 안먹어
English: Oh, I make kimchi myself and don't buy it.
Kiki is right

Korean: 휴, 전세계 우리나라 김치 수출률이 11%나 줄었대,
English: Phew, our country's kimchi export rate to the world has decreased by 11%.

Korean: 우리나라 고유 음식인데 ㅜ 한류 인기 많으면 뭐혀~
English: It's our country's unique food, but what if the Korean Wave is popular?

Korean: 키키 맞아 뭐가 문제일까 우리나라 꺼가 훨씬 더 맛있는데!
English: Kiki, that's right, what's the problem? Our country's stuff is much tastier!
That's right~ People don't know how to taste it~
How does your grandmother take care of her skin?
I bought a mask pack and put it on at home.
I see

Korean: 내가 아는 언니 마스크팩 50만 원짜리 준다는데 쓸래?
English: An older sister I know is giving me a 500,000 won mask pack. Do you want to use it?
Bring me one~

Korean: 집에 있는 건 싸구리라 쓰기 힘들어
English: What I have at home is cheap and hard to use

Korean: 키키 어 나는 왠지 그거 내 피부에 안 맞을 거 같아
English: Kiki, I don't think that will suit my skin.

Korean: 응 아들이 피엑스에서 사온 건데 별로야~
English: Yeah, my son bought it from PX, but it's not that good~
Kiki, really?
PX is also a good product in most cases, right?

Korean: 글쎄 시중에 파는 거라 비슷한 거 같은데
English: Well, it seems similar since it's sold commercially.

Korean: 키키 그니까 나는 피부에 좋은 걸 바르면 오히려 더 안 좋아지더라고!
English: Kiki That's why when I put something good on my skin, it actually gets worse!

Korean: 그렇군. 나이 들어서 발라도 바른 것 같지가 않어~
English: I see. Even though I'm older, it doesn't look like it's been applied properly~
Kiki, really?

Korean: 나는 지성이라 그런가 영양가 있는 성분 있는 게 더 안 좋아!
English: Maybe it's because I'm intellectual, but I don't like things that have nutritious ingredients!
Then I guess I should only use cosmetics with little oil content.

Korean: 맞아 그래서 모공 위주 화장품만 사서 쓰고 있어!
English: That's right, that's why I only buy and use cosmetics that are focused on pores!
Okay~
You should start taking care of your pores from a young age.

Korean: 키키 아, 이미 코는 딸기코가 되어 버렸쥬,
English: Kiki, your nose has already become a strawberry nose,
Strawberry Corani, do you want to be Little Daddy's nose?

Korean: 작은엄마 나 감기 걸린 거 같앙,
English: Grandma, I think I have a cold.

Korean: 으이그 맨날 창문 열어 놓고 자더니!
English: Oh my god, you always sleep with the window open!

Korean: 키키 아니 어제 잠깐 나갔다 왔는데 그때 걸린 거 같아,
English: Kiki, no, I went out for a bit yesterday and I think I got caught then.
You're going out wearing short sleeves

Korean: 키키 아니야 그냥 긴팔긴바지인데 얇게 입고 나가서 그런 거 같아!
English: Kiki No, it's just long sleeves and long pants, but I think it's because I went out wearing them thinly!

Korean: 응 그래서 약은 따로 챙겨 먹었니?
English: Yeah, so did you take your medicine separately?

Korean: 어 약국가기 귀찮아서 내일도 안 좋으면 가서 사 먹으려고
English: Oh, I don't feel like going to the pharmacy, so if I'm not feeling well tomorrow, I'll go buy some
Yeah, do you have Ssanghwatang at home?

Korean: 아니 그냥 따땃하게 하고 집에 방콕중이야!
English: No, I'm just staying home and keeping warm!

Korean: 응 이불 꼭 덮고 쌍화탕 한잔 마시면 짱인데
English: Yeah, it would be great if you covered yourself with a blanket and had a glass of Ssanghwatang.
Kiki is right
And I can't go to the hospital anymore

Korean: 그래~ 기침 잘못 했다가 몰매 맞아
English: Yeah~ I coughed wrong and got hit
Kiki right Kiki

Korean: 그리고 요즘에는 감기기운이어도 무조건 코로나 검사 받으라고 하잖아!
English: And these days, even if you have a cold, they tell you to get tested for coronavirus!

Korean: 너무 과잉 진료 아니여~ 이러니 다들 약국가지
English: Isn't that too much overtreatment? That's why everyone goes to the pharmacy.

Korean: 키키 아니야, 코로나 증상이 감기기운이랑 똑같아서 그래,
English: Kiki No, it's because the symptoms of Corona are the same as a cold.
What can I do? Take care of yourself.
Mom, what did you buy from home shopping this time?
I bought mackerel japchae and it was delicious

Korean: 키키 오 꿀 키키 몇 개 샀어?
English: Kiki Oh Honey How many Kiki's did you buy?

Korean: 40개 세트로 샀어 키키 추가로 갈치도 몇 마리 주더라
English: I bought a set of 40 and Kiki gave me some extra croaker
Oh really?

Korean: 고등어를 샀는데 갈치를 서비스로  줬다고 혜자 아니야?
English: I bought mackerel and they gave me some hairtail for free. Isn't that a bonus?
It's cheap because it's not domestic but Norwegian.

Korean: 키키 근데 갈치는 어디 나라 거였어?
English: Kiki, but where did the hairtail come from?
The hairtail wasn't domestic either Kiki
Easy to eat with bone broth

Korean: 키키 웃기 키키 그래도 맛있으면 장땡이여~
English: Kiki laugh Kiki but if it tastes good then it's a winner~

Korean: 응 비리지도 않고 버릴 것도 없어서 편해
English: Yeah, it's convenient because it doesn't get dirty and there's nothing to throw away.
I'm jealous
Where did you buy it from on a home shopping channel?
Hyundai Home Shopping!
This is my first time buying it
Kiki, really?

Korean: 현대면 현대카드로 사야 싼 거 아니여?
English: If it's Hyundai, isn't it cheaper to buy it with a Hyundai Card?

Korean: 아니야 처음 가입 했다고 할인쿠폰 주던데
English: No, they gave me a discount coupon because it was my first time signing up.
Oh really?
What kind of coupon did you give?
Sign up coupon 2,000 won discount and such
Does your grandmother watch TV well?
Yeah, these days I enjoy watching dramas~
Kiki, really?
What dramas are on these days?
Red shoes are funny, mom will see them too
Red shoes?
When is that drama coming out?
That's a drama that airs on weekdays at 8 o'clock. Kiki

Korean: 평일 8시면 엄마 그때는 드라마 안 보고  잠 키키
English: On weekdays at 8 o'clock, Mom, I don't watch dramas and I sleep.
You went to bed early haha
Little Mom saw that and went to work

Korean: 키키 맞아 아 맞다 그때쯤이면 일 할 시간이네?
English: Kiki Right, right? Oh, right. Is it time to work then?
Then are you looking at it as a re-run?

Korean: 티비로 보고 끝나면 바로 수업 하러 가지~
English: After watching TV, I go straight to class~
Kiki Oh, I see Kiki
Who is there?

Korean: 배우 이름은 잘 몰라~ 그냥 내용으로 보는 거지 키키
English: I don't really know the actor's name~ I just watched it for the content Kiki

Korean: 거기 그 기생충에 나오는 배우 나오지 않아?
English: Isn't that actor from Parasite there?
I don't know because I haven't seen Parasite ㅜㅜ
Please search it later

Korean: 키키 오키 알겠어 나도 나중에 tv 생기면 드라마나 챙겨봐야지
English: Kiki Oki Okay, I understand. When I get a TV later, I should watch the dramas too.
Yeah~ I heard that these days, everything is viewed on the cell phone.

Korean: 작은엄마는 영화관에서 영화 보는 거 좋아해?
English: Does your grandmother like watching movies at the cinema?
I like it, but it's too far to go
I see
How far is it from home?
It takes about 35 minutes by bus~ Kiki
It's not going well

Korean: 오우 키키 그러면 진짜 안 가지겠다
English: Oh Kiki then I really won't take it

Korean: 논산은 영화관 두 개 거의 동시에 생겼는데!
English: Nonsan has two movie theaters that opened almost at the same time!
Are you saying that a movie theater opened in Nonsan?

Korean: 어 메가박스랑 씨지브이 거의 동시에 생겼어!
English: Oh, Megabox and CGV opened almost at the same time!
Wow~ There's a new generation there, Kiki

Korean: 여긴 영화관 있어도 다 낡았지 뭐
English: There's a movie theater here, but it's all old.

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 거기는 브랜드 영화관이 아니야?
English: Kiki, really? Isn't that a branded movie theater?

Korean: 응 맞긴 한데 워낙 오래 되어서 스크린이 별로 안좋아
English: Yeah, that's true, but it's so old that the screen isn't that good.
Oh, right, Kiki

Korean: 내년 설에 오면 우리 다 같이 영화나 보러 가자!
English: When you come during the Lunar New Year next year, let's all go see a movie together!

Korean: 좋지~ 새로 생긴 영화관이나 한번 가보자 키키
English: Okay~ Let's go to the new movie theater Kiki
Kiki Oh good good
I'll shoot a movie~

Korean: 작은 엄마가 그러면 맛있는 저녁 사줄게~

that's right...

amazing

** I have to make her wear a pretty dress like that

Yes, a trickster has appeared in our neighborhood

English: Kiki, you grew up eating that kind of food, so you were healthy~ Your immune system was strengthened~
That's right, you can even chew on rocks and stuff

English: Kiki is funny, Kiki even eats sand~

English: Yeah, I ate grass and that was it~

Korean: 키키 아 추억에 아주 녹아내리는 중~

Vietnam is good

This is the first time I've heard of it

The puff pastry curry is also delicious~

Korean: 그때 처음으로 대선 먹어본 것 같은데
English: I think that was the first time I ever tasted the presidential election.
Yeah, it was our first time together.

Korean: 맛이 다르긴 하더라 충남지역에서 소주 마셔봤어?
English: The taste is different. Have you tried soju in the Chungnam region?

Korean: 아 이제 우린 인가라고 써 있는 거?
English: Oh, now it says we are authorized?

Korean: 응 맞아 그거 나 최근에 마셔오봤늰데 난 청하 마셨어
English: Yeah, that's right. I drank that recently. I drank Cheongha.
We have to go overseas again
Where do you want to go?
I'm going to Italy Italy

Korean: 천둥 칠 때 밖에 있어 봤어?
English: Have you ever been outside when it thunders?
Yeah, yeah, it was scary

Korean: 번개 칠 때도 밖에 있어 봤어?
English: Have you ever been outside when lightning strikes?
That's not there yet
Have you ever been affected by heavy rain?

Korean: 전에 다니던 센터에 물 차서 그거 빼는데 고생이였지
English: The center I used to go to had water in it, so it was hard to get it out.
Have you ever felt an earthquake?
No, not yet
What would it be like to feel an earthquake while abroad?
It would be scary if it was a foreign country
Do you like getting rained on?

Korean: 응 넌 그냥 나한테 맞는 거 좋아하나봐?
English: Yeah, you just like what suits me?
Haha, my dear sister, you are as scary as a flood

Korean: 홍수피해 받은 적 있어서 저렇게 얘기하는 거야?
English: Are you saying that because you were affected by a flood?
No, not even one?
What the hell are you talking about?

Korean: 그 블랙박스 영상 올라오는 거 본 적 있어?
English: Have you seen that black box video coming up?
I see it sometimes, why?

Korean: 거기 훈훈한 거 나온 것 중에 기억에 남는게 있어
English: Among the warm things that came out there, there is one that I remember
Is there anything warm there?

Korean: 신호등 거의 다 건너던 여성분께서 뒤에 도착 못하신 할아버지 모시러 다시 빠꾸해서 끝까지 같이 건너드렸어 천사셔...
English: A woman who was almost at the traffic light turned around again to pick up an old man who couldn't get there. She was an angel...

Korean: 와 멋지신분이다 누구도 쉽게 하지 못 했을 수 있는데
English: Wow, you are a great person. No one could have done it easily.

Korean: 그치 대단하셔 언니가 블박본건 뭐 있어?
English: That's amazing. What have you seen of Black Box?

Korean: 오토바이랑 차랑 사고났는데 오토바이가 욕하면서 사이드미러 양쪽  부수는...
English: I had an accident with a motorcycle and a car, and the motorcycle was swearing and breaking both side mirrors...
Oh, I tasted something spicy
I always see that...
There are a lot of secretly warm things!
I should read the articles more often too

Korean: 세상 돌아가는 거 신경 좀 써주세요
English: Please pay attention to what's going on in the world.
It's been so long since I've watched the news
So you can see it today!
Yes! It's TV angle
Want to read some foreign articles?
I saw a foreign black box or CCTV.
Oh, I saw that. What's in it?
The car skidded onto the 8-lane road and there was a reversal.

Korean: 반전? 사고 크게 난 거 아냐?
English: Reversal? Wasn't it a big accident?

Korean: 사고가 안 났어. 다 피해갔어 신기하지
English: There was no accident. It's amazing that everything was avoided.
Wow, all 8 lanes?

Korean: 응 왼쪽에서 오른쪽으로 미끄러졌는데 하나도 안쳤어
English: Yeah I slid from left to right but didn't hit a single one.
Wow, I'm so glad that happened
If I had slipped, I would have been seriously injured.
I really used up all my luck
Accidents always require caution

Korean: 맞아 방어운전을 해도 나만 잘한다고 사고가 안 나는게 아니니까
English: That's right, even if you drive defensively, accidents don't happen just because you're good at it.
Right, safety is paramount worldwide
Anything else?
Sorry, I'll come back later
What perfume do you use?
I'm using the lipstick you bought me
Do you use body mist?
I love body mist
Where do you use hand wash?
I think it's L'Occitane
Then where is the hand cream from?
It's like living in L'Occitane
Have you tried Aesop hand cream?
Are you talking about something big?
Yeah, it's awesome, it's huge
I tried that in pink and I liked it
Aesop hand cream is the right choice

Korean: 그거 향도 좋고 끈적이지 않아서 너무 좋아
English: I love it because it smells good and isn't sticky.

Korean: 아마자 나도 안 끈적여서 그거 사랑해
English: I like it too because it's not sticky

Korean: 내가 담에 가져다 줄게 나 여러 개있어
English: I'll bring it to you later. I have several.
Sister, have you had a health checkup?
No, I haven't even once
It's crazy, we're getting old now
What, have you received it?

Korean: 난 다닌 회사들이 현장직이여서 1년에 한번씩 받는게 의무였지
English: The companies I worked for were field positions, so it was mandatory to receive it once a year.

Korean: 그럼 현장직 아니면 안 받아도 돼?
English: Then, if it's not a field job, I don't have to accept it?
No, office work is once every two years!

Korean: 그거 4대보험 되어있어서그런가보네 안 하면 어케 돼?
English: I guess it's because you have the 4 major insurances. What happens if you don't?
Company fines
Does that also screen for cervical cancer?

Korean: 응 2년에 한번씩 근데 그거 너무 기본적인거라 추가해서 받아도됑
English: Yeah, once every two years, but it's so basic that you can add it
Did you try adding it?

Korean: 난아직 내년이 나 짝수 받는 년도라 내년에 추가해보려구
English: I'm going to try adding it next year since next year is an even year for me.
Is there such a thing? Then when am I?
My sister is also an even number so next year is the next year
Then come with me
Sister, have you ever traded stocks?
I'm still doing it
Did you put in a lot of all the adults?

Korean: 난 그냥 적금 대신 소소하게 넣어놨지
English: I just put a small amount aside instead of saving
It's amazing, he really looks like an adult
Don't you trade stocks?

Korean: 나 토스에서 계좌 만들면 무료로 준다고해서 한 번 받았는데...
English: I got it once because they said they would give it to me for free if I made an account at Toss...
Oh, where did you get it?

Korean: 인터파크 받았는데 내가 필요 없는 것 같아서 5000원대에 팔았는데...
English: I got it from Interpark, but I didn't think I needed it, so I sold it for 5,000 won...
Why... maybe
I sold it and the next day it was 9000 won^^
Hey you, don't ever invest in stocks

Korean: 어... 그 후로 쳐다도 안 봐
English: Uh... I haven't even looked at you since then

Korean: 진짜 속상하지 키키 너 돈 아니여도 장난아니지
English: It's really frustrating Kiki, even if you don't have money, you're not kidding

Korean: 긍까 내가 10주라도 샀으면 와우 난 울어요
English: Wow I'm crying if I bought it for 10 weeks
Give me your phone and I'm banned from stocks
There's a drama I'm into these days
What is it this time?
A drama called Gaetmaeul Chachacha!
Who is that when you first hear that?
*** Actor and *** Actor!
Wow, the lineup is good
Both of you have really pretty dimples
So, do you two look good together?

Korean: 완전 대박 너무 이쁘고 멋지고 일단 내용도 재미져
English: It's totally awesome, so pretty and cool, and the content is also fun
Is it a gentle style?
Is it a style that just unfolds quickly?
Calm~ It's surprisingly calm but fun
You originally liked the ending
But the fishing village caught me
Where is that broadcast?
It's TVN. I love TVN.
You watch a lot of TV, Kiki
Sister, have you been to a comic book cafe?
I go often, ramen is delicious

Korean: 아니 분식점 갔냐고 키키 만화책은 안 봐?
English: No, you went to a snack shop. Don't you read Kiki's manga?

Korean: 음 보긴 보는데 눈은 라면에 있는 시간이 더 많아
English: Well, I do see it, but my eyes spend more time on the ramen.
I was going to ask you to recommend a comic book, but you forgot?
So what do you want from me?
Do you read webtoons diligently?
Oh, I searched Naver and Daum
There is something I watch regularly
Heh, should I recommend it? Drew

Korean: 아니 미안 나 웹툰 안 봐
English: No sorry I don't read webtoons
You don't even read the book
Yeah, I don't see it, actually
What are you trying to say?

Korean: 난 질문을 한다. 넌 대답을 해라.
English: I ask questions. You answer.
Am I by any chance your younger sibling?
Do you eat breakfast often?
No, it's better to sleep than to wake up!

Korean: 으이그 엄마한테 혼나는 파구만 점심은 회사에서 사 먹어?
English: Hey, you're the guy who gets scolded by your mom. Do you eat lunch at the company?

Korean: 웅 예전엔 싸다니기도 했는데 요즘엔 귀찮더라
English: Yeah, I used to do it a lot, but these days it's annoying.
Do you have a restaurant you often go to?
I'm into kimbap these days!
Correct! Tuna kimbap! Is that right?
But that kimbap restaurant's Jinmichae kimbap is the real deal
What is the name of the kimbap restaurant?
Happy Kimbap? Just a neighborhood kimbap place Kiki

Korean: 김밥이랑 라면이 짝꿍인데 왜 라면은 두고ㅜㅜ
English: Kimbap and ramen are a perfect match, but why leave out the ramenㅜㅜ
They don't sell ramen there,
Wow, you only sell kimbap?
Yeah, so ramen is from the convenience store!
What kind of ramen do you like?
Guriguri raccoon! The soup is~ the best~!
What color did you use for the wallpaper?
Green! This is the best atmosphere ever.
Wasn't it hard to do it alone?

Korean: 힘들어 죽는줄 알았어...넌 절대 혼자 하지마
English: I thought I was going to die from the pain... You should never do this alone.
How long did it take?
Um... did it take about four hours then?

Korean: 난 혼자 할 일 없어! 아마 친구가 같이 해줄껄
English: I can't do it alone! Maybe a friend will do it with me.
Do you know who that guy is?
Well, you don't really want to know?
Do you have a mirror at home?
No I just broke it with my fist

Korean: 그 거울속의 주인공이 날 도와줄 사람이야~
English: The person in the mirror is the one who will help me~
Aha, so you're saying there's no one?
How many mirrors do you have in your house?
I told you there aren't any? I just broke them all.
How many clocks do you have at home?
There are so many watches, maybe 4?

Korean: 제주도 가서 차 뭐로 타고 다녔어?
English: What car did you drive when you went to Jeju Island?
This time it's Tivoli!
But the child was a little sick

Korean: 티볼리 오래된 차로 렌트된 건가 ㅜ
English: Is Tivoli an old car that was rented?
I guess so ㅠㅠ
I keep hearing strange noises
Did you choose the music well for the passenger seat?
Oh then then Kiki

Korean: 언제 한번은 상황이랑 노래 제목이 딱 맞아서 너무 웃겼어
English: There was a time when the situation and the song title fit so well that it was so funny

Korean: 어제 동서울 터미널에서 인천 터미널 올 때 차 안 막혔어?
English: Wasn't there a traffic jam when you came from Dong Seoul Terminal to Incheon Terminal yesterday?

Korean: 자느라 잘 몰랐는데 예상 시간 비슷하게 도착한 것 같아
English: I didn't notice because I was sleeping, but I think we arrived around the expected time.

Korean: 어제 인천 터미널에서 동서울 터미널 갈 때 차 안 막혔어?
English: Wasn't there a traffic jam when you went from Incheon Terminal to Dong Seoul Terminal yesterday?
I didn't know very well because I was sleeping at that time.
Do you use the app to make reservations?

Korean: 응 어플이 편하더라! 카드 등록해 놓으면
English: Yeah, the app is convenient! If you register your card
How long does it take to get from the terminal to your house by subway?
The bus from the terminal is more convenient!
How long does it take by bus?
About 20-30 minutes?
It won't take long!

Korean: 지금 회사 주말에도 출근할 때 있어?
English: Does your company have any weekend work hours these days?

Korean: 응 가끔? 건축주가 미팅을 주말로 잡으면 ㅠ
English: Yeah, sometimes? When the client schedules a meeting on the weekend.
When do you want to change jobs?
Me in about 2 years?

Korean: 이직하게 되면 집도 이사 할 거야?
English: If you change jobs, will you move house too?

Korean: 회사 위치를 봐야 할 것 같아
English: I think I need to look at the company location
Far away places aren't that great, are they?

Korean: 음 지금 집 위치가 좋아서 그렇긴 해!
English: Well, that's because the location of my house is good right now!
What is the most important condition?
Money... and people you work with?
Is it okay if there are less than 5 people in the company?
Oh, I don't think that will work
There are so many restrictions, right?

Korean: 미팅 할 때 3D로 막 만들어서 보여주는 건가?
English: Are you just going to make it in 3D and show it to us during the meeting?
Yeah, I do 3D and drawings too.

Korean: 방송국 미술팀도 그렇게 도안 만들던데 그쪽은 관심 없어?
English: The broadcasting station's art team also makes designs like that, so aren't you interested?
Oh, that sounds fun too!

Korean: 군대 나 이제 한 몇 살인지 알아?
English: Army, do you know how old I am now?
Is there an age limit? How old are you?
We're 27 years old, so we don't have much time left.
Oh, you're going to the army?
Will you come visit me when I go to the military?
What do you see?
Will I be able to endure it if I go to the military?

Korean: 음 뭔가 체대 나왔으니까 잘할 수 있을 듯
English: Well, I think I can do well since I graduated from a physical education school.

Korean: 군대 훈련 받을 때 자존심 긁고 해서 많이 나온다던데 나 들어갔다가 나오면 달래줄 거야?
English: I heard that a lot of people get hurt because their pride was damaged during military training, but will you comfort me when I go in and come out?
Just don't desert

Korean: 탈영해서 티비에서 친구 만나면 반갑지 않겠어?
English: Wouldn't it be nice to desert and meet your friends on TV?

Korean: 나 디피 분들 만나고 싶지 않아
English: I don't want to meet any DP people

Korean: 정모씨 탈영건으로 연락드렸습니다 이런 연락 받는 거 어때!
English: I'm contacting you about Mr. Jeongmo's desertion. How about receiving a call like this?
I'm going to say I don't know that kind of person ㅠㅠ
Are you going to tell me that you don't know anything?
Are you going to contact me if you desert?

Korean: 영어 다시 배우고 싶은 생각 있어?
English: Do you want to learn English again?
I want to be good at conversation ㅠㅠ
When do you plan on starting to attend driving school?

Korean: 앗차차, 근데 10월에 바빠서 아마 11월부터 가야 할 듯
English: Oh, but I'm busy in October so I guess I'll have to go starting in November

Korean: 요즘 전화로 영어 수업하는 거 있던데 그거 봤어?
English: I heard there's an English class being taught over the phone these days. Have you seen that?

Korean: 오 나 그거 해본 적 있어
English: Oh I've done that

Korean: 앗차차...11월에 물어보면 혹시 12월이라고 하는거 아니지 ㅜㅜ
English: Oh my... If you ask in November, you might say December, right? ㅜㅜ
^^ You know me so well
Oh wow, how much is that?

Korean: 난 토익이랑 패키지로 한 거여서 자세힌 몰라
English: I don't know the details because I took it as a package with TOEIC.
Do you do it once a week?
Yeah, yeah! But don't do it.
Is this a complete no-recommendation?

Korean: 내 돈 주고 하라면 나도 안 할듯
English: I wouldn't do it even if you asked me to do it with my own money.
Wow, does it really shine that much?

Korean: 응응 그 분들도 영어 발음이 찐이 아니라서
English: Yeah, those people's English pronunciation isn't that good either.
My mom and dad got their second dose yesterday!
Oh really? How are you feeling?

Korean: 아빠는 건강 그 자첸데 엄마가 넘 피곤해 하는중 ㅜㅜ
English: Dad is healthy, but Mom is so tired ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 정말 ㅠㅠ? 한동안 푹 쉬셔야겠다
English: Oh really ㅠㅠ? You should rest for a while.

Korean: 어제는 머리 아프다 하셔서 타이레놀 3번 드셨엉
English: You said you had a headache yesterday and took Tylenol three times.
Mom, Dad, did you get all the shots up to the second round?
Woohoo, my mom got the second dose recently.
Oh, Mom, are you okay?
Yeah, I just have muscle pain, but I'm fine.
Thank goodness you got Moderna?

Korean: 앗 그거까진 모르겠당! 아마 화이자라고 했던 거 같은데
English: Oh, I don't know about that! I think it was Pfizer.

Korean: 엇 우리 엄마아빠도 화이자이신데! 오빠는 맞으셨어?
English: Oh, my mom and dad got Pfizer too! Did your brother get it?
Yeah, I think you got all the way to the second round too, oppa?

Korean: 주위 분들 중에 코로나 검사 하신분들 계셔?
English: Is there anyone around you who has been tested for coronavirus?

Korean: 우리 엄마 최근에 했어 ㅠㅠ 키키
English: My mom did it recently ㅠㅠ Kiki
Oh ㅜㅜ Are you okay with your health?

Korean: 점심에 갔던 식당에서 확진자 나와서, 그래도 다행히 엄마는 음성!
English: A confirmed case occurred at the restaurant we went to for lunch, but luckily my mom tested negative!
When are you getting married?
Make a boyfriend first,
When are you getting a boyfriend?
Do you want to keep making me cry?
Is that a blur before your eyes? Are those tears?
Aren't there any good people around you?

Korean: 내가 왕따라 넌 주변에 좋은 사람 없니
English: I'm being bullied. Don't you have any good people around you?
We're both bullied

Korean: 우리 둘 다 이러다 아무도 결혼 못하면 우짜?
English: What if we both keep doing this and neither of us gets married?

Korean: 요즘 결혼 못하는 건 흠도 아니지 뭐
English: It's not a shame to not be able to get married these days.

Korean: 연애는 필수 결혼은 선택~ 노래도 있잖아하하
English: Dating is essential, marriage is optional~ There's even a song about it, haha
We can't even do the essentials?

Korean: 인생에 예외는 있지 뭐... 내 눈 앞에 있는 것도 눈물인가
English: There are exceptions in life... Are the things in front of my eyes tears?
I'll get a boyfriend someday, right?
Where were you born?

Korean: 아직도 안 태어났으면 그건 범죄야 우리
English: If you haven't been born yet, it's a crime for us
How old is your cat?
About 1.5 years old...? He's grown a lot

Korean: 와우 사람으로 하면 몇 살 인고지?
English: Wow, how old are you as a human?
Are you in the midst of your second year of middle school?
Wow do you have 2 cats
So that's why you keep asking questions these days
So you're tearing off the wallpaper?
Yeah, I'm seriously suffering from second-year middle school syndrome
Isn't that why you keep getting rejected?
No, I'm the one watching ^^
Are you eating well these days?
Oh right, I need to buy some feed.
Do you still like boxes?
Box love is still the same
Where do you buy your feed?
Just have it delivered online
Is there a sport you want to learn?
I want to learn paragliding
Do you want to watch the World Cup together next year?

Korean: 우리 둘 다 백신 안 맞아서 ㅠ
English: Because neither of us got vaccinated ㅠ

Korean: 패러글라이딩을 배운다는 거면 강사님이 되고 싶은 거야?
English: If you're learning paragliding, do you want to become an instructor?
no
I just wanted to do it...
I want to try it

Korean: 패러글라이딩은 단양이 유명한 걸로 알고 있는데 가 봤엉?
English: I know Danyang is famous for paragliding. Have you ever been there?

Korean: 나는 그 옆에 영월 가서 했던 거 같아!
English: I think I went to Yeongwol next to it and did it!

Korean: 월드컵 티비로 하루 날 잡아서 같이 보자
English: Let's set a day aside and watch it together on World Cup TV.
If it's a Korea-Japan match, I definitely watch it even at dawn
Oh, I'll give you my annual leave, unconditionally
Do you know the rules of soccer?

Korean: 잘은 모르고 그냥 볼 정도는 알아
English: I don't know much, but I know enough to know
Do you have a favorite soccer player?
I liked tea when I was young
Wow, you must have been very young
Kiki, yeah, really, baby
Let's play a round of Lumicube after a long time
Oh, it's been a while since I've done it
I think I'll go to a board cafe after a long time

Korean: 좋아좋아! 나 완전 재밌는 게임 알아왔어
English: Okay, okay! I found a really fun game.
Do you like Tekken games?
Isn't that just pressing it?
What game is it at the board cafe?

Korean: 응응 펭귄파티라는 건데 담에 가서 하자
English: Yeah, it's called a penguin party. Let's go next time.
Tekken is actually a finger strength game.

Korean: 그냥 연타 빨리하는 사람이 이기는 키키
English: Kiki, the one who just hits faster wins

Korean: 아 그거혹시 펭귄 얼음판에 올려놓고 하는 거아?
English: Oh, is that something you do by placing penguins on ice?

Korean: 아 그거 아니양! 카드 게임이야 키키
English: Oh, that's not it! It's a card game Kiki

Korean: 홍대에 방탈출 재밌는 곳 있다는데 홍대에서 해봤어?
English: I heard there's a fun escape room in Hongdae. Have you tried it in Hongdae?
Yeah! Do you want to go escape the room?

Korean: 야외 방탈출이있대 홍대에서 시작하구 끝나면 다른곳이래 어때?
English: There's an outdoor escape room. It starts in Hongdae and ends somewhere else. What do you think?
Outdoors? Wow, what is this? That's amazing.
Let's go on a trip to Hongdae
There are a lot of guesthouses in Hongdae

Korean: 우리집에서 한 시간 반이니까 그 정도면 여행 맞지?
English: It's an hour and a half from my house, so that's about enough for a trip, right?
It's so far away ㅠㅠ
Aren't you trying too hard?
There were a lot of foreigners in the guesthouse.
Have you ever slept in a guesthouse?
Yeah, yeah! When I was in school

Korean: 게하 파티도 있다던데 해본 적 있어?
English: I heard there are gay parties too, have you ever been to one?

Korean: 오 제주도 가서 게하 파티 하자
English: Oh, let's go to Jeju Island and have a Geha party.
Because of Corona, we're having a party for two people

Korean: 너무 좋네, 여행에서의 인연 만들기 실패
English: It's so good, I failed to make connections while traveling
Even if just two people get together, it's a party, right?
If you want to do it with someone else, then
I won't miss it

Korean: 제주도 갈 때 야간 비행 넘 기대된당
English: I'm really looking forward to the night flight to Jeju Island.

Korean: 둘 다 피곤에 절어있을 거 같은데? 키키
English: I think they're both exhausted? Kiki

Korean: 특가로 비해어기 2000원인 거 진심 오지는 거 같아
English: I really don't think it's worth the special price of 2,000 won.
So who found it really ㅠ
It was windy today. Did you go out?
Yeah, I went out for a bit earlier, but oh my
No but it feels a bit humidㅜㅜ

Korean: 비 와가지고 ㅠㅠ 나 오늘도 빨래했는데
English: It's raining ㅠㅠ I did laundry today too
It really feels like the wind is blowing at the beach...
There has been no rain all week.

Korean: 너 빨래할 때 미리 얘기해줘 항상 그때 비오더라
English: Tell me in advance when you do your laundry. It always rains then.
So to this extent, it is science

Korean: 신발 빨래 할 때 얘기해줘 그 정도면 태풍 올 것 같거든
English: Tell me when you wash your shoes. It looks like a typhoon is coming.

Korean: 키키 나 여행갈 때랑 빨래 할 때만 피하면 돼
English: Kiki, just avoid it when you travel and do laundry.

Korean: 태풍 부르고 싶을때 너한테 얘기할게 신발 빨래 좀 해줘
English: When I want to call a typhoon, I'll tell you. Please wash my shoes.
There is no need for a separate prayer service

Korean: 내가 날씨 운 좋으니까 한번 내가 더 쎄게 나가볼게
English: I'm lucky with the weather so I'll go out there and try harder
Let's go to the weather fairy showdown
What's the weather like in Jeju Island?
That's why ㅠㅠ I think it should be good, but I'm worried

Korean: 다음달 인가 부터는 백신 예약 없이 맞을 수 있대
English: They say that starting next month, you can get the vaccine without a reservation.
Oh, then you're right?

Korean: 난 아직 생각즁 백신패스에 대해 논란 많더라 봤어?
English: I still think there's a lot of controversy about the vaccine pass.
Hey, what is it? Tell me!

Korean: 백신 맞은 사람들만 식당 갈 수있게 하구
English: Only vaccinated people can go to restaurants.

Korean: 헐 치사해... 너무 강요하는 거 아닌가
English: Wow, that's fatal... Isn't that too much pressure?

Korean: 백신 안 맞은 사람들은 24시간~72시간 내에 음성확인서가 없으면 못 들어간대
English: People who haven't been vaccinated can't enter without a negative test result from 24 to 72 hours ago.

Korean: 아니 그럼 백신 부작용에 대해서 보상이라도 잘 해주던가 ㅠ
English: No, then at least compensate for the side effects of the vaccine.
Have you seen the talk about a second vaccine?
Oh no! What is that?

Korean: 2차 부작용 너무 떠서 1차만 맞고 2차는 포기하는 사람들이 2만명 넘는대
English: There are more than 20,000 people who only take the first dose and give up on the second dose because the secondary side effects are too severe.
Wow, there was news like that?

Korean: 독감 예방 주사도 부작용이 있는데 이렇게 급하게 맞는 주사가 부작용 없는게 이상해...
English: Flu shots also have side effects, so it's strange that a shot like this that's being administered so quickly doesn't have any side effects...
But doesn't it have to be done twice to be effective?

Korean: 그렇지 맞아 2차까지 맞아도 이번에 군대 집단 감염 걸렸어 ㅜ
English: That's right, even after getting the second dose, the military got infected this time.

Korean: 부스터샷인가 그것까지 맞아야 된다는 말도 있고 ㅠ
English: There are also some who say that you have to get a booster shot or something like that ㅠ

Korean: 외국에서 대통령님이 부스터샷 일부러 먼저 맞으셨다는 분도 계시던데 진짜 그렇게까지 해야하는 건가
English: There are some people who say that the president intentionally got the booster shot first in a foreign country. Is it really necessary to do that?

Korean: 우리도 대통령님 백신 안 맞았을때 논란 많았잖아 키키
English: We also had a lot of controversy when our president didn't get vaccinated.
In Russia, there are currently 900 deaths per day.
Wow, people are dying because of corona?

Korean: 캘리포니아에서 기름 유출됐대 예전에 태안 생각난다
English: The oil spill in California reminds me of Taean

Korean: 와 맞아 그때 자원봉사 많이 갔는데
English: Wow, that's right. I did a lot of volunteer work back then.
Have you been volunteering?
I couldn't go ㅠㅠ
I wish California would disappear like that soonㅜㅜ
A lot of my sea creatures are going to die ㅠㅠ
Russia is like that because of Corona...!

Korean: 헐 너무 무서워 ㅠㅠ 위드 코로나는 다 망한건가
English: Oh my gosh, it's so scary ㅠㅠ Is everything ruined with Corona?

Korean: 백신 개발국에서 그런 일이 생긴다는게 너무... 마음 아프다
English: It's so heartbreaking that something like that happens in a vaccine development country.
Oh, they developed a vaccine in Russia?
Yeah, probably haha
Oh you are so smart
I use the Shrek pack, have you tried it?
Oh, that green one?
Yeah, have you tried that?

Korean: 아니 나는 팩 잘 안해 ㅠㅠ
English: No, I'm not good at using packs ㅠㅠ

Korean: 요즘 스틱으로 된 화장품 많이 나오더라 써봤어?
English: There are a lot of stick cosmetics coming out these days. Have you tried them?
Oh, with a stick? What do you have?
There used to be a stick perfume out there, have you tried it?

Korean: 아 그건 별로 향이 안 세더라
English: Oh, that doesn't smell that good
I heard that wrinkle-removing cosmetics come in a stick form.
Are we now at an age where we can manage?
I fell in love with him when I was 27~28 years old... Soon
It's really coming soon... Do you manage it separately too?

Korean: 나도 아직... 선크림도 이제 꼭 발라야 하는 나이야... 선크림 발라?
English: Me too... I'm at an age where I have to wear sunscreen now... Wear sunscreen?

Korean: 아니... 진짜 나 훅 가겠다 곧
English: No... I'm really going to go crazy soon

Korean: 겨울에도 선크림은 꼭 발라야 한다고 하더라
English: They say you should definitely apply sunscreen even in winter.
It's so annoying though ㅠㅠ
I'm at an age where I should be taking vitamins.
Are you taking your vitamins?

Korean: 난 놉! 건강검진 올해 받을 거야?
English: Nope! Are you going to get a health checkup this year?
Yeah, I promised my mom that I would get it by October.

Korean: 너 자궁경부암 대상자인데 그것도 받는 거지?
English: You're a candidate for cervical cancer, so you get that too, right?
Am I the target? How do you know that?

Korean: 홀수년도엔 홀수 년도 생일이 대상자구 짝수때는 짝수년도래~
English: In odd years, the target is people whose birthdays are in odd years, and in even years, the target is people whose birthdays are in even years~
Oh, just in the year you get your health checkup?

Korean: 응응 종합검진이랑 자궁경부암 같이되는 병원이 잘없더라 잘 알아봐 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, yeah, there aren't many hospitals that do both comprehensive checkups and cervical cancer screenings. Look into it carefully. ㅜㅜ
Oh, thank you so much for the great information.

Korean: 기본적인 거 말구 돈 추가하면 자세한 검사 가능하대
English: Aside from the basics, if you pay more, you can get a more detailed inspection.
Our company is completely basicㅠ

Korean: 10월 검사면 10월에 술 좀 안 마실 예정인 건가?
English: If you have an examination in October, does that mean you won't be drinking alcohol in October?
Oh, that's a bit difficult?
Let's recycle and throw away the health checkup results as soon as they come out.

Korean: 키키 그냥 회사 벌금 안 내게 하려고 받는거지 뭐
English: Kiki, I'm just taking it to avoid paying the company a fine.

Korean: 고양이 사료 사는 사이트 따로 있어?
English: Is there a separate site to buy cat food?
Is there a pet-only shopping mall called Pet Friends?
Which site do you usually buy your shoes from?

Korean: 신발은 신어보고 사야되니까 인터넷으로는 잘 안 사
English: I don't usually buy shoes online because I have to try them on before buying them.
Do they sell all the pet supplies there?

Korean: 응 진짜 없는 거 빼고 다 있어
English: Yeah, everything is there except for the ones that aren't there.
Are you going to buy clothes before going to Jeju Island?

Korean: 아 사고 싶은데... 저번에 너가 보내준 사이트 어디였지
English: Oh, I want to buy it... Where was the site you sent me last time?
Are you talking about the Brandy Hoodie?
Ah, that seems right

Korean: 근데 생각보다 너무 더울날씨 같기도하구 옷 어디서 구경해?
English: But it seems like the weather is much hotter than I thought. Where can I see clothes?
I mainly go to a shopping mall called Yukyuk Girls

Korean: 아우터 바지 상의 다 파는 곳이야?
English: Is this a place that sells outerwear, pants, and tops?
Yeah, it even has accessories
It's cardigan weather these days, are you selling it at Yukyuk Girls?

Korean: 응 있을걸? 나도 옷 좀 사야겠다
English: Yeah, I guess so. I need to buy some clothes too.
Have you seen Yumi's cells?

Korean: 나 웹툰은 봤는데 드라마는 안 봤어
English: I read the webtoon, but I didn't watch the drama.

Korean: 나 지금 보고 있는데 너무 귀여운데 실환가
English: I'm watching it right now and it's so cute but it's a real deal

Korean: 근데 김고은이랑 유미랑 안 어울린다고 말 많았었는데
English: But there was a lot of talk that Kim Go-eun and Yumi didn't get along.

Korean: 근데 그 논란을 연기력으로 잠재운 게 진짜 멋진 것 같아...
English: But I think it's really cool that he put that controversy to rest with his acting skills...
That's a confession...
Are you doing that now?

Korean: 안보현 배우도 수염 방금 3회에서 깎았눈데 넘 멋지댜
English: Actor Ahn Bo-hyun also just shaved his beard in episode 3 and he looks so cool
Which broadcasting station does that?

Korean: 나 지금 티빙으로 재방 보고 있어
English: I'm watching the rebroadcast on Tving right now
Ah, are there any Yumi cells in Tiving?

Korean: 아마 티빙애사만 하는 걸로 알고 있어
English: I think it's probably only Tvingaesa
Oh, I see...
Who else is the actor?
SHINee Minho come out!
Your face is like this
Oh, Minho is acting too? That's amazing...
Minho appears in the first scene of episode 1 and Kiki
Why does it feel like something is smoking
What movies have you seen recently?
I watched one on Netflix today!
What's the title? Was it fun?

Korean: 조제, 호랑이 그리고 물고기들 이라는 영화
English: A movie called Josee, the Tiger and the Fish
What genre is that movie?
The genre just says drama
Who is the actor appearing?
I don't know the name because he's a Japanese actor.
How many hours long is the movie?

Korean: 한 시간 반 정도 한 것 같아
English: I think it took about an hour and a half
Was the content worth watching?
I watched it because it was recommended to me, but I thought it was just okay
Are the fish actually coming out...

Korean: 아 그건 아니야 키키 그냥 상징적인 거랄까
English: Oh, that's not it Kiki, it's just symbolic
I should watch it later too haha

Korean: 근데 너도 그냥 그럴 것 같아
English: But I think you'll be like that too
Did you eat breakfast this morning?
I ate at Yangpyeong house today
What did you eat at home this morning?
I ate soybean paste stew, scrambled eggs, and Korean food.
Home cooking is the best after all
What did you eat for lunch?
I ate cold noodles today
Wow I love naengmyeon
Did you make it?

Korean: 응응 육수 찢어서 바로 넣으면 됭
English: Yeah, just tear the broth and put it in right away.
Are there any good restaurants around your house?

Korean: 우리 집 상가에 치킨집 딱 하나 있지롱
English: There's only one chicken place in my neighborhood.
It's close. Is it good there?
I went and tried it and it was good!
What's the name of the chicken place?
Korean Charcoal BBQ Kiki
Wow, buy me that too
How long ago was the main house built?
I think it's been about 5 years now

Korean: 단독주택이랑 아파트 중에 뭐가 더 편해?
English: Which is more comfortable, a single-family home or an apartment?
I like apartments to live in Kiki
I don't go home often
Are single-family homes too hard to clean?

Korean: 2층까지 청소해야 하다 보니 청소하면 하루가 다 지나가
English: Since I have to clean up to the second floor, the whole day passes by.
I guess so
So how many bathrooms are there?
There is one on the first floor and one on the second floor.
So how many are there in the apartment?

Korean: 나랑 동생만 살아 아파트는 한 개지
English: My brother and I live in one apartment.

Korean: 그러겠넹 전세 계약 몇 년 했어?
English: Okay, how many years have you been renting for?
I've been doing it for 2 years, and if nothing bad happens, I'll keep living.
Well, there aren't any leases these days.
They say moving is all about money ㅜㅜ
Moving costs are not cheap either
It's physically difficult too
right
So are you going to keep extending it?
Yeah, that's still my plan
Is public transportation good in Wonju?
No, the interval between trains is too long

Korean: 아 그러겠다 그럼 주로 버스 잘 안 타?
English: Oh, I see. So you don't usually take the bus?
I don't take the bus often
I heard a train station was built. Do you take the train often?
I ride it often when I go to Gangneung
How about taking a taxi often?

Korean: 출퇴근 차 없을 땐 거의 맨날 타
English: When I don't have a car to commute to work, I ride it almost every day.
How much does it cost to ride one?
It costs about 5 thousand won
Oh, not quite close
It's just a moderate distance

Korean: 돈 벌려고 출근하는데 출근길에 이미 돈을 쓰고 출근하네
English: I go to work to earn money, but I already spend money on my way to work.
Yeah, Kiki, it's the same when you get off work too
Have you ever taken a model taxi?
I rode it once in Seoul
Sister, if you do one part-time job, will it last long?

Korean: 난 기숙사 있는 알바도 하고 한번 하면 오래 하지
English: I also work part-time at a dormitory, and once I start, I stay for a long time.
How about a part-time job with a dorm?
I like it because the commute is super fast
Aren't you doing it for a long time too?
I also did Pava for a year
I've been a dodgeball instructor for a year!
What does a dodgeball instructor do?
I teach after school classes for elementary school students.
Are you going to school?
Yeah, I go every Saturday and exercise.

Korean: 한 번 할 때 수업은 얼마나 해?
English: How many classes are there at a time?

Korean: 50분하고 10분 쉬고 이렇게 두 번 하루에 두 시간 하는데  애들이 거의 안 쉬어 키키
English: I do this twice a day for 50 minutes and then 10 minutes, but the kids barely rest.
Are you teaching under a contract with the school?
no

Korean: 인천미체육회랑 계약하구 그 체육회에서 학교 배정해 줘!
English: Sign a contract with Incheon Sports Association and have them assign schools to you!
It's random. Is your school far from your house?
It takes about 15 minutes by taxi.

Korean: 택시 기준인 거 보니 매일 택시 탔겠네 키키
English: I guess you take a taxi every day since it's based on taxi standards Kiki
Have you seen Steel Troops?
I saw that you're doing a season 2, right?
Yeah, they're recruiting now. Do you want to apply?

Korean: 군대 다녀온 사람만 가능한 거 아냐?
English: Isn't this only possible for people who have served in the military?

Korean: 그렇지 키키 그리고 남자만 돼 키키
English: Yes Kiki and only men Kiki

Korean: 우리 손 잡고 군대 먼저 갈까
English: Should we hold hands and go to the military first?
I bet your grandmother would love it

Korean: 손자가 없어서 군대 걱정 안 하고 계시는데 손녀 둘이 손잡고 간다 하면 너무 좋아하시겠다
English: He doesn't have any grandchildren, so he doesn't worry about military service, but he would be very happy if his two granddaughters went there holding hands.
Wouldn't you like it if there were two civil servants?
I'll try my best to support you
But, unnie, there's no age limit?
Oh right, I can't do it
Too bad~ What is the age limit?
Probably until I'm 27 years old
Are you okay?
Yes~ Sister~ My younger brother is 25 years old~ That's plenty~
Look at this, just like that

Korean: 언니 대학교 몇 학년 때 입사했지?
English: Sister, in what year of college did you join the company?
I started working in the job market in my third year.
Did you graduate and go?

Korean: 엉 난 졸업하고 학원 다니다가 입사했징
English: Yeah, I graduated, went to an academy, and then got a job.
What academy did you go to?

Korean: 입사 전에는 컴퓨터랑 회계 학원 다녔지
English: Before I joined the company, I went to a computer and accounting school.
Accounting? What level did you study?

Korean: 배운 건 1급 2급 배웠는데 자격증은 2급만 있어 키키
English: I learned level 1 and level 2, but I only have level 2 certification.
What did you learn about computers?
It was a beginner's course, so I learned a lot of different things.
Didn't you go to any other academies?

Was it a non-face-to-face class last year?

Korean: 응응 컴활은 비대면이었구 영상 편집은 학원 다녔엉
English: Yeah, I learned computer skills remotely and went to an academy for video editing.
Was the non-face-to-face class okay?

Korean: 컴활은 엑셀 말고는 사용할 거 없어서 할만하더라
English: I don't have anything to use for computers except Excel, so it's okay.
Thank goodness I learned a lot
Have you been in touch with your youngest aunt lately?
I haven't tried it, but what happened?

Korean: 아아 백신 2차까지 다 맞으셨다구 연락 왔어
English: Oh, I got a call saying you got your second dose of the vaccine.

Korean: 다행이다 막내 이모 딸도 다 맞았나?
English: Thank goodness, did your youngest aunt's daughter get it too?
He was in his third year of high school, so he got it much earlier than us.
Are you preparing well for the entrance exam?

Korean: 수시로 간다고 해서 아마 지금 원서 접수는 다 해놨을 거야
English: Since you said you go often, I think you've already submitted all the applications.
When will the announcement be made?
It will come out in November at the earliest, or mid-December at the latest.
There's not much time left, I'm nervous
Your aunt must be nervous too, right?

Korean: 표현은 안 하셔도 아마 제일 걱정하고 계실 듯...
English: Even if you don't say it, you're probably the most worried...

Korean: 이모는 또 혼자 앓는 스타일이라 혼자 그러고 계시겠구만
English: My aunt is the type to suffer alone, so she must be suffering alone.
Did your aunt and uncle get the second dose too?

Korean: 응응 엄마가 2차 맞고 너무 힘이 없어 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, yeah, my mom got hit twice and she's so weak ㅜㅜ
You should get better soon ㅜㅜ
Sister, do you fight often when you're dating?
Then then just breathe and fight
Akiki, if you keep fighting you'll get tired ㅜㅜ
yes
So you're tired...? You?

Korean: 난 사람에 따라 좀 많이 다른 편이얍
English: I'm a bit different depending on the person.

Korean: 넌 답답할 정도로 안 싸울 때도 있지?
English: Are there times when you don't fight to the point where it gets frustrating?
yes...
It's so hard to fight
That's why I'm a pacifist
Do you celebrate anniversaries often?

Korean: 응응 그리고 제일 중요하게 생각하는 날이 있어

Korean: 서로의 생일을 제일 중요하게 생각해 하하
English: We think of each other's birthdays as the most important haha
You're smart. Do you often give anniversary gifts?

Korean: 기념일 선물 챙기구 딱히 무슨 날 아니어도 선물은 자주 해
English: I often give gifts even if it is not a special day.

Korean: 하긴 무슨 날 아니어도 선물하고 싶으면 선물하는 게 좋긴 하지
English: Well, it's better to give a gift if you want to give one, even if it's not a special day.

Korean: 응 맞아 그래서 난 자주 해!
English: Yeah right, that's why I do it often!
Please give me one too~ ^^

Korean: 봄 여름 가을 겨울이 중에 누가 제일 이뻐?
English: Which is the prettiest among spring, summer, fall, and winter?
Gaeul is the most cute

Korean: 봄 여름 가을 겨울이 모두 다 같은 간식 먹어?
English: Do you eat the same snacks in spring, summer, fall, and winter?
We all eat the same snacks
Then there are four toys?
Yeah yeah if you don't then fight Kiki
I have to make them all pretty one by one

Yeah, that's right
Kiki, isn't it hard to wash yourself?

Korean: 응 그래서 엄마 아빠가 케어해 키키
English: Yeah, so mom and dad take care of Kiki
Oh, you're being honest, Kiki.
It must be hard
Yeah, it was hard to manage
So how do you manage the kids' tents?
That too from mom and dad~ ^^

Korean: 난 놀아주지 아주 내 체력을 다해서 키키
English: I'm going to play with all my might Kiki
Sister, do you know all the soccer rules?
no

Korean: 난 축구 잘 안 봐 너는?
English: I don't really watch soccer. What about you?

Korean: 주짓수 배우고 싶어서 각 보고 있어

Korean: 도복 운동 또 하고 싶은 거야?

Korean: 응 도복 운동하고 싶은데 태권도 다시 하긴 싫어서 키키
English: Yeah, I want to do a dobok workout, but I don't want to do taekwondo again.
Is it because Taekwondo is too intense?
Oh, I'm bored
I don't want to see you anymore

I did Taekwondo from the age of 7 until I majored in it in college.
Man, this is so boring

If you look at the reviews, it seems really fun
Try it and let me know what you think
Let me give it a try!

Sister, have you ever played Tales Runner?
I tried it, it really took a long time
It's so much fun
Are you good at that?

Korean: 나 허들 좀 잘 넘었지 넌?

Korean: 난 그 슈퍼 점프인가 그거 좋아했는뎅

Korean: 맞아 그래서 처음엔 몇 번 빠지긴 했었어 나도 키키
English: Yeah, so I missed out a few times at first, Kiki too
Speaking of missing things, I also think of carts.
The cart doesn't fall off easily either
It's a national rule to get out of a curve.
that's right

Korean: 키키 드리프트 잘 타면 꿀이긴 한데 빠지면 바이바이지
English: Kiki Drift is great if you're good at it, but if you get tired of it, it's goodbye
Do you like kart speed racing?
I like item wars better

Korean: 스피드전 할 때 집중 완전 해야 하지?
English: When you do a speed battle, you have to be completely focused, right?

Korean: 그치 아차 하면 바로 추월 당해
English: If you do that, you'll get overtaken right away.
That's right, I want to do it because you mentioned Kiki
Have you ever been to Tongyeong?
No, why? What's there?

Korean: 카트라이더 같은 루지 있는 데 가고 싶엉
English: I want to go to a place with a luge like Kart Rider
Let's go together
Is the traffic okay there?
Oh traffic is shit
It's definitely just a train

Korean: 인천터미널에서 있긴 한데 하루에 3개밖에 없어 ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 여행 갈 때 교통도 중요한데 ㅜㅜ
English: Ah, transportation is also important when traveling ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그러니까 그게 제일 걸려서 아직도 못 가봤어

Korean: 그렇겠네 ㅜㅜ 루지 다른 곳은 없어?
English: I see ㅜㅜ Is there no other place to go?

Korean: 있지 강화도는 이미 몇 번 타봤어
English: Yes, I've been to Ganghwa Island several times already.
Oh, how about there?
It's so much fun
Do you want to go with me?
Okay, let's go play in Ganghwado.
Ganghwado Pension is also great!

Korean: 난 더위 잘 안 타서 괜찮아
English: I don't feel the heat very well so I'm fine
Are you coping well with this cold weather?
Instead, I can handle the cold well
Oh, do you wear long padding in winter?
I wear both shorts and longs
So does that mean it's definitely a padding fine?
It's padding, no matter what
Are you a coat?

Korean: 난 추위 잘 안 타서 패딩 안 입오
English: I don't catch cold easily, so I don't wear padding.
Wow, you're not cold? Even without padding?
Yeah, it's so uncomfortable to wear padding
Don't you even make scarves and things like that?
Scarf Now I wear it occasionally
Aren't you wearing gloves?
Yeah, I never wear gloves
Wow you are young

Korean: 넷플릭스에서 하는 오징어 게임이라는 건데 거기에 명함에 나온 번호가 있대
English: There's a squid game on Netflix, and there's a number on the business card.

Korean: 응응 근데 그 번호가 일반인 번호였대
English: Yeah, but that number was a regular number.

Korean: 헐 그 사람한테 허락 받은 건가
English: Oh, did you get permission from that person?

So it was chaos

I got 4000 calls
My daily life is not going well
Wow, there are people calling?

I'm seriously calling you
Shouldn't you compensate me?

Korean: 응 처음에 100만 원 보상해 준다고 얘기했었는데
English: Yeah, at first I said I would give 1 million won in compensation.
You're going to handle it for just 1 million won?
I heard they raised it to 500 because of the chaos

Korean: 100도 500도 일상생활 뺏어간 회사에서 얘기할 금액은 아닌 듯싶다
English: It doesn't seem like an amount that can be discussed in a company that took away 100 or 500 degrees of daily life.
Squid game is super famous all over the world

Korean: 거기 나오는 배우들은 오징어 게임에서 나오는 이미지로 유명해지겠다

Korean: 그래서 이정재 배우를 외국에선 츄리닝 입는 배우로 기억이 참 남는대

Korean: 난 네이버 뉴스에서 세계 눌러서 보는 편이야

Should I click on the article directly and look at it carefully?

I'm into pumpkin nails these days

What did I buy you?
What Yoo Jae-seok is advertising is Kiki

Oh, do you have powder too? Other than drinks?

Korean: 난 그래서 시작도 안 했어 키키
English: That's why I didn't even start Kiki

I should try it too

Haven't seen it yet. Was it fun?

Korean: 응응 일요일에 감독판으로 마지막 회 했어 키키
English: Yeah yeah I saw the last episode of Director's Cut on Sunday Kiki

Korean: 아 스페셜로 지금까지 했던 에피소드들 정리하고 그거에 대해 얘기하는!
English: Ah, as a special, let's recap the episodes we've done so far and talk about them!
Oh, that would be more fun

Korean: 마자 난 NG 장면 이런 거 더 좋아하거든

Korean: 그래서 내가 좋아하는 드라마 메이킹은 다 보지

Is that fun?
I see a lot of people

Korean: 너 혹시 너한테 재미없는 드라마가 있긴 한 거야?

Korean: 아이구람 난 대신 재미없으면 1화에서 바로 멈춰

Korean: 아 시간 낭비 안 하는 스타일이구나 키키

Korean: 응 난 집에서 보는 게 더 좋지

Oh, that's amazing

Keep doing something else
Kiki, your concentration is waning

I ate aglio olio

Korean: 난 로제 뭐시기 먹었는데 거기 가격도 괜찮더라
English: I had a rose something and the price was okay.
The price is really reasonable
The pickles there are delicious
Kiki: So is this a good place for pickles?
That's right. It's delicious.
What are you going to have for dinner?
I have class so I'm a little late, so chicken breast...?
you?
I leave home cooking to my mom's choice.
Home cooking is still the best

Korean: 언니 인테리어 고를 때 어케 선택했어?

Korean: 볼 줄 몰라서 건축 일하는 친구한테 물어봐서 선택했엉

Korean: 그치 일단 있던거 바꿔도 되냐고 여쭤봤지

Korean: 전세는 원래 원상복구 하고 나가야 하지?
English: Shouldn't the whole world be restored to its original state before leaving?

Korean: 그렇지 근데 도배도 엉망이였어서 내가 셀프로 한다고 하니까 좋아하시더라구
English: Yeah, but the painting was a mess, so I told him I was going to do it myself and he was happy about it.

Korean: 다행이다 색도 언니 맘에 드는 걸로 택한거면 짱이지
English: Thank goodness you chose a color that you like, so it's awesome

Korean: 신축 아니고 월세 아니면 사실 혼자 해야지

Korean: 아니 화장실은 셀프로 절대 못하는 상태야 키키

Korean: 거기 변기랑 세면대랑 하나로 되어 있어?

Korean: 응 따로면 따로따로 사서 할 수 있는데 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, if they're separate, you can buy them separately and do them ㅜㅜ
Oh, that's a bit disappointing
But luckily the water pressure is fine
Wow water pressure is not important

Korean: 나도 우리 아파트 수압 약해서 샤워기 바꾸고 뭐 바꾸고 돈 오지게 들었어
English: My apartment's water pressure was weak, so I had to change the shower and other things, and it cost a lot of money.
So I'm satisfied with that alone

How many buses come to this place?

Korean: 종류... 두갠가 거의 없다 보면 돼
English: Type... There are two, almost none
you?
I'm at a bus stop everywhere...
Is there a bus that I can ride frequently?

Korean: 인천에서 버스 타본 기억이 잘 없어...
English: I don't really remember taking a bus in Incheon...
You're taking the subway
How far is the subway station from home?
Exit 3 is the name of our apartment. It's so cool.

Korean: 어쩐지 너네집 갔을 때 별로 걸은 기억이 없어
English: Somehow I don't remember walking much when I went to your house.

Korean: 내가 인천 터미널로 데리러 가서 같이 전철 타면 진짜 터미널에서도 역까지 5분 우리역에서 집까지 5분 키키
English: If I pick you up at Incheon Terminal and take the train together, it will take 5 minutes from the terminal to the station and 5 minutes from our station to the house.

Korean: 버스정류장 많은거 보다 전철역이 진짜 한몫해...

Korean: 수도권은 다 전철로 이어져서 더 그러겠다

Korean: 그래서 난 지리 잘 모르는데 전철역으로 얘기해주면 거리 바로 알지롱
English: So I don't know geography very well, but if you tell me the subway station, I'll know the distance.
Oh, I guess you really did ride that many
How is your work life?
What about fresh graduates... If you want to be rude, you have to be rude
If I keep doing this, I'll be a freshman my whole life.

Korean: 난 까라면 까야지 라는게 나쁜건줄 알았는데 아니였어

Korean: 사실 시키는 대로하고 시키는 만큼 해라 라는 말이기도 하지 뭐...하하
English: Actually, it's also saying, do as you're told and do as much as you're told...haha
Yes, thinking like that is good for your mental health.

I'm coming out on the 10th
you?
