Korean: 아 그러네 항상 국산차만 터지고 깨지고 빠지고 했네
English: Oh, that's right. It's always the domestic cars that break, explode, and fall off.

Korean: 근데 난 우리나라 영화 액션도 싸우고 하는건 재미있어 스릴 오져
English: But I find the fighting and action scenes in our country's movies fun and thrilling.

Korean: 보다 보면 와 저럴 때 저렇게 공격 나간다고? 하며 감탄할 때도 있지
English: When you look at it, there are times when you are amazed and say, “Wow, how can someone attack like that when they do something like that?”
That's right, that's amazing.

Korean: 그런건 다 가르쳐주시는 분이 따로 있는건가
English: Is there someone who teaches all that stuff?

Korean: 액션 감독님이 따로 계시는걸로 알고 있어
English: I know there is a separate action director

Korean: 그럼 그걸 다 배우는 배우들도 대단한거당
English: Then the actors who learn all that are also great

Korean: 그치 스턴트맨분들도 있지만 최대한 장면 따야 하니까
English: Of course, there are stuntmen, but we have to capture the scene as best as possible.
The stuntmen were also incredibly cool.
Did you have dinner at work?

Korean: 오늘 병원 다녀오느라고 간단히 빵 먹었어
English: I had a quick bite of bread today on my way back from the hospital.
Have you had anything to drink today?
Abara for lunch and dessert today!
What is Abara? What is Abara?
Iced Vanilla Latte~
Is there a good restaurant in Abara?

Korean: 인터넷 보니까 커피빈이 맛있다 했던 것 같아
English: I saw on the internet that Coffee Bean was delicious
What did you have for lunch?
I ate kimbap and tteokguk for lunch!
What are you going to have for lunch tomorrow?
I want to eat something healthy tomorrow ㅠㅠ
Are there a lot of restaurants around the company?
It's not that much ㅠㅠ
Is there a Korean buffet around the company?
Yeah, there is, but I've never been there!

Korean: 집 고를 때 제일 중요하게 생각 한 거 있어?
English: When choosing a house, what was the most important thing you considered?
First of all, the sink is clogged!
What do you mean blocked?

Korean: 싱크대 아래에 다리만 있는거 말구 아예 막힌거!
English: Not just the legs under the sink, but the sink is completely blocked!
Is there something under the sink that just has legs?
That's amazing...
Yeah, that's what the old house was like ㅠㅠ

Korean: 뭔가 아래로 뭐 지나다닐 거 같아서 무서워
English: I'm scared because I think something is going to pass by below.
Wasn't it hard to find a place to live?

Korean: ㅠㅠ 내가 원하는 가격대에서는 찾기 힘들었어
English: ㅠㅠ It was hard to find something in the price range I wanted
Are you paying the mortgage interest yourself?
Yeah, I'm paying for that!
How much per month
I borrowed 80 million won, so I pay about 80,000 won a month!
How much is the management fee?
The management fee is 50,000 won per month!
Oh, you're saying that you pay 130,000 won a month for a rental house?
Oh, is that so?!
It's totally cheap!

Korean: 집에서 전철역 제일 가까운게 무슨 역이야?
English: What is the closest subway station to my house?
Achasan Station! Have you been to Achasan Station?
I've been there about 3 times
How many minutes does it take to walk?
It takes about 7 minutes on foot
Is the road uphill?
No, rather it's going downhill lol
If it's Achasan, is it a real mountain?
Yeah, it's a real mountain!
There are a lot of hikers on weekends.
It'll be noisy in the morning

Korean: 맞아 ㅠㅠ 너희집은 어느 역이랑 가깝댔지?
English: Right ㅠㅠ Which station is your house close to?
I am Shin Yeon-su Station's Lee Ji-rong!
Was that Incheon Line 1?
Sky blue line?
Incheon Line 1 is in blue!
Are you purple?
Yeah, purple line 5!

Korean: 신길에서 5호선 갈아타러 갈 때 넘 멀지 않엉?
English: Isn't it too far to change to Line 5 at Singil?

Korean: 아 맞아 ㅠㅠ 한참 걸어가야 돼 진짜...
English: Oh right ㅠㅠ I really have to walk a long way...

Korean: 급여 받고 나면 몇분 안에 순삭 돼?
English: How many minutes does it take to get your paycheck back?
Me? It was a 10 minute cut...?
It really just passed by
What is your main job?
I design architecture!
Do you have meetings often?
Meetings once a week or so?
Do you guys have a meeting too?
We never
What do you guys talk about when you meet?
Just a weekly to-do briefing
Who's having a meeting like crazy?
Kiki, on the third floor, the boss! My shooter
What time does the meeting start?
9 o'clock in the morning!
Do you have a shooter in charge too?
I have someone in charge!
How long is the meeting?
It's different every week, but it's usually about 40 minutes.

Korean: 그거 할 때 의견 많이 내?
English: Do you get a lot of opinions when you do that?

Korean: 그냥 내 할 일만 얘기하는 거라 의견 낼 경우는 없엉!
English: I'm just talking about what I have to do, so I won't be giving my opinion!

Korean: 난 육군 공군 특전사 해군 뭐가 어울려?
English: What suits me: Army, Air Force, Special Forces, Navy?
You are a special agent!
It's so hard!
You just don't want to see me?
No, it's cool!
If you go to the special forces, you should brag about it.

Korean: 내친구~ 특전산데~ 못나와~ 못봐~  이거 맞아?
English: My friend~ It's a special offer~ I can't come out~ I can't see~ Is this right?
Oh no~ How many years do special forces soldiers serve?
Isn't being a career soldier a job for life...?
Haha, without knowing it, you look good in the air force
Me? Why doesn't the Air Force suit me?
How cool would it be to fly away like that
Are you trying to blow me away? ㅠㅠ
I can never be discharged
You said you wanted to go paragliding
If you go there, it's free for me

Korean: 키키 아 후배 곧 전역하는데 선물 뭐가 좋을까
English: Kiki Ah, my junior will be discharged soon. What would be a good gift?
Isn't alcohol the best when you're on vacation?

Korean: 그럼 입대 선물로는 뭐가 인기 있지
English: So what is popular as an enlistment gift?
I feel like sunscreen or a watch would be the best~
Thanks for the recommendation!
I have to go check out the alcohol.
Have you ever been to a study cafe?
Oh no, I've never been there
you?
I have nothing to do either haha
Have you ever studied at a cafe?
Yeah! I heard that these days, tutoring is also done in cafes.

Korean: 학교 시험 있을 때마다 긴장 많이 했어?
English: Are you always nervous before a school exam?

Korean: 음 가창 시험 때 말고는 그닥?
English: Well, not really, except for the singing test?

Korean: 과외 카페에서 하는건 카페가 입장료가 아닌 음료 시키는 기준이라 이득이라고 생각하는곤강
English: I think it is advantageous to do tutoring at a cafe because the cafe charges a drink order instead of an entrance fee.

Korean: 근데 학생이 집중 잘 될지 모르겠네
English: But I don't know if the student will be able to concentrate well.

Korean: 가창 시험 볼 때 무슨 노래 불렀어?
English: What song did you sing when you took the singing test?
I sing 10cm!
you?

Korean: 나는 윤하 기다리다 부른 기억이 있어!
English: I remember waiting for Yoon Ha and calling her!

Korean: 음악시간에 벌칙으로 노래방 게임 했었눈데 너희도 그런거 있었어?
English: We played karaoke as a punishment during music class. Have you ever done something like that?
Oh no, there was no such thing.
Is this your idea, teacher...?
Yeah, you played the song yourself, Kiki

Korean: 난 그때 벌칙으로는 케이윌 노래 부른 기억이 있어
English: I remember singing K.Will's song as a punishment back then
Have you ever studied the rest?
No one did it even though we asked them to...
Have you been there?

Korean: 난 어릴 때 구구단 못 외워서,
English: I couldn't memorize the multiplication table when I was young.
When are you going to the housewarming party, honey?
I think I'll go on Sunday the 24th
Were you the only one invited that day?
No, my whole family!
Wow, so your brother prepares the food?
My brother isn't good at cooking.

Korean: 집들이엔 배달 요리를 이쁘게 담는게 최고지
English: For housewarming, the best thing to do is to package the delivery food nicely.

Korean: 너도 사촌언니 집들이 간다고 하지 않았어?
English: Didn't you say you were going to your cousin's housewarming party?
I'm on Saturday the 23rd
What's on in October?
Does your cousin live alone?
I live with my cousin!
Does your brother live with his wife?

Korean: 응 그치! 덕분에 나도 가족이 늘었넹
English: Yeah, right! Thanks to you, my family has grown.

Korean: 오 그렇게 생각하니까 멋지다 가족이 늘었어
English: Oh, it's great that you think that way, your family has grown.
It's still awkward to call me new sister ㅠ

Korean: 근데 그 호칭 뭔가 왜케 멀어보이지...?
English: But why does that title seem so distant...?

Korean: 그치... 그냥 편하게 이름 부르고 싶다
English: Right... I just want to call you by your name

Korean: 연애 할 때 기념일 잘 챙겨?
English: Do you celebrate your anniversaries often when you're dating?
depending on?

Korean: 근데 점점 오래되면 굵직한 것만 챙기게 되더라
English: But as time goes by, I only take care of the big ones.
If you get a boyfriend, will you call him by a nickname?
No, I'm not good at staring ㅠ
you?

Korean: 나는 이름 불러! 아저씨라고 하던가 키키
English: I call your name! You say mister or Kiki
What do you like when your boyfriend calls you?
I also like it when people just call me by my name
Have you ever met your boyfriend's family?
Yeah, I've met Kiki before.
Have you ever been to your boyfriend's house?

Korean: 본가에 가본 적은 없는 것 같아
English: I don't think I've ever been to my parents' house
What is your ideal type?

Korean: 나는 내가 의지할 수 있는 사람!
English: I am someone I can rely on!
How much of an age difference is okay?
Plus or minus 5 or something?
you?
Um, me too, to that extent?

Korean: 마이너스는 만나본 적이 없어서 사실 모르게쒀
English: I've never met a minus before, so I don't really know.
Yeah, actually I don't like minuses either
Don't I look like an iguana?

Korean: 너 이구아나 실제로 본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever actually seen an iguana?
Actually no haha
You look like a fish
What kind of fish...?
I'm scared
Um, there's that one~
Don't tell me in advance, I'll get hurt~
How much does my cat weigh?
About 8 kilos?
Oh my god, you look so fat...?

Korean: 어...? 아 내가 무게 기준을 몰라서...
English: Huh...? Oh, I don't know the weight standard...
How many people?

Korean: 아냐 나름 다이어트 사료 먹는다구... ㅠㅠ
English: No, I eat diet food... ㅠㅠ
Then 3 kilos...?
What is the weight standard for babies?

Korean: 사실 나도 최근엔 안 재봐서 잘 몰라.
English: Actually, I don't know because I haven't watched it recently.
I think it'll be about 6 kilos
It's right in the middle
But how much do babies weigh?
Not moving?

Korean: 어어어엄청 큰 체중계에 올려두고 재야 돼
English: Oh my gosh, I have to put it on a huge scale and measure it.
Wow, it even calculates movement
Or you can also measure it with a human baby scale.

Korean: 나 다음 달에 캠핑 글램핑 간당
English: I'm going camping glamping next month
Oh really
Where are you going?

Korean: 강화도로 가는데 예약 꽉차가꼬 잡기 진짜 어려웠어
English: I was going to Ganghwado, but it was really hard to get a reservation because it was full.
Have you been there?
I've only been glamping
How was your day?
Was it okay?

Korean: 응 근데 차 있어야 편하겠더라 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah but it would be more convenient if I had a car ㅠㅠ
Have you ever played volleyball?
no!
Have you tried it?
I was in the volleyball club when I was in elementary school.
It's amazing
Oh, I had no idea.
What did you do again?
I still remember the hand movements
I guess the body doesn't forget
Yeah, I also used nunchaku in taekwondo.

Korean: 쌍절곤 하면 몸에 멍 드는 거 아냐?
English: If you use nunchaku, won't you get bruises on your body?

Korean: 멍이 있어 줘야 운동 좀 한 거 티 나지
English: You have to have bruises to show that you've been working out

Korean: 사실 그 알루미늄 쌍절곤 겁나 아파
English: Actually, those aluminum nunchucks really hurt
Then should I make you a fool?
Wouldn't that be easy for me?
Let me show off my workout too
It's been a while since we played Opchi?
Our computer is old so it won't work
Diva, can you carry some junklets?
A level is way above you
Levels are given only over time...
How many hours did you do it in a day?

Korean: 나 한창 할 때 피방 가서 세시간 기본이였지
English: When I was at my peak, I would go to a spa and spend three hours there.
Wow, if I do that, won't I get motion sickness?
I just need you to move with me
Be in pain with me
That's a little embarrassing

Korean: 부끄러운건 잠시야 할 수 있어 따라해볼래?
English: It's embarrassing, but you can do it for a moment. Do you want to follow along?

Korean: 카트 할 때도 몸 같이 움직이는 애들 있던데 혹시 너야?
English: There are some kids who move their bodies while going kart. Is that you?
I'm almost 4D
I went to the arcade today!
What game did you play!
What kind of ball throwing game is that?

Korean: 여행 가서 계획 짤 때 여유롭게 짜는 편이야?
English: When you go on a trip, do you tend to take your time and make plans?

Korean: 응 그래야 계획이 수틀려도 바꿀 수가 있더라구
English: Yeah, so if the plan goes wrong, you can change it.

Korean: 계획표는 동그랗게 방학 계획표처럼? 아니면 엑셀로 정리 똭?
English: Is the schedule like a round vacation schedule? Or is it organized in Excel?
Isn't it neater to do it in Excel?!
I like organizing things like that too, I love it
You're a planner too

Korean: 사실 여행 가서도 그렇지만 일상 생활도 다 계획파야 넌?
English: In fact, you're the type of person who plans everything, not just when you're traveling, but also in your daily life, right?

Korean: 나는 계획 짜는건 좋아하는데 실행은 잘 못해
English: I like making plans, but I'm not good at executing them.

Korean: 여행지 고를 때 제일 먼저 생각하는게 뭐야?
English: What's the first thing you think about when choosing a travel destination?
What is there to eat!

Korean: 놀러 가면 그 지역 유명한 음식은 다 먹고 오는 편이야?
English: When you go out to play, do you usually try all the famous local foods?
Yeah, I have to try it!
Do you like exploring restaurants too?
Yeah, yeah, but it's hard to stand in line ㅜㅜ
you?

Korean: 나도 30분 정도는 참겠는데 그 이상은 좀 ㅠㅠ
English: I can endure it for about 30 minutes, but more than that is a bit much ㅠㅠ

Korean: 기다렸다 먹으면 사실 내 음식도 맛있지 않아...?
English: If I wait and eat, won't my food actually taste bad...?
Do you also have a taste for good food?

Korean: 오늘 집 오는데 춥다가 전철에서 덥더라
English: It was cold on my way home today, but it got hot on the train.
you?

Korean: 맞아 바깥 공기 시원하긴 한데 뭔가... 더웠어
English: Yeah, the outside air is cool, but somehow... it's hot.
Don't you want to get struck by lightning?
Is it possible to live with that?

Korean: 눈 올 때 나랑 눈싸움 할래?
English: Do you want to have a snowball fight with me when it snows?
I absolutely love snowball fights.
Can I use a weapon?
Isn't that just a fight?
Do you like snowball fights?
Do you like making snowmen?
I don't really care about snow.
Do you hate snowy days?
Muddy, mushy, icy road, ugh

Korean: 나랑 안 맞는구나 ㅠㅠ 난 눈 오는 날 엄청 좋아하는데
English: It doesn't suit me ㅠㅠ I really like snowy days
I'd rather have rain ㅜㅜ
You don't like rain?

Korean: 아 비 보다는 차라리 눈이 낫지...
English: Ah, I'd rather have snow than rain...
Do you wear gloves when it snows?
No, you have to touch it with your bare hands to enjoy it

Korean: 요즘 학생들이 부족해서 대학교 인원부족 뜬거 봤어?
English: Have you seen the announcement that universities are short on students these days?

Korean: 헐 진짜? 그럼 지원하면 다 붙는거야?
English: Wow, really? So if I apply, I'll get accepted?

Korean: 그렇지 작년에 지방대 의대가 미달 떴어...
English: Yes, last year, local medical schools fell short...
Wow, things really change a lot in just a few years.

Korean: 그래서 우리 93부터 97까지인가 제일 힘들게 학교 다녔다고 키키
English: So Kiki said that from 93 to 97, school was the hardest for us.
There were the most repeat and third-time repeaters at this time.
I guess we've really become the latte generation

Korean: 라뗀말이야 실기시험을 몇개 조로 나눠서 봤어~
English: I mean, I took the practical exam in several groups.
Is this what a latte is now?

Korean: 그치 키키 나는 강당에 모여서 논술 보고 그랬는데ㅠ
English: Right, Kiki, we gathered in the auditorium and looked at the essays and stuffㅠ

Korean: 그리고 셋째까지 낳으면 셋째아이는 대학 등록금 전액 장학금 나온대
English: And if you have a third child, the third child will receive a full college tuition scholarship.
It's amazing
But I don't have enough money to send them to college...
Yeah... The first and second ones have to go too...
Wow, did you see the inflation rate this time?
Why haven't I seen it?

Korean: 물가는 계속해서 오르는데 왜 우리 월급은 안 오르지
English: Prices keep rising, but why don't our salaries increase?
Our salary is cute and small
I want to get a big and scary salary too
Have you seen any oil shortages abroad right now?
Oh my, why is there a shortage of oil?

Korean: 그건 몰랴! 차가 기름이 없어서 못굴러간대
English: I don't know! The car can't run because it has no gas.

Korean: 요즘 해외에서 완전 인기있는 영화 뭔지 알아?
English: Do you know what movie is really popular overseas these days?
No, I don't know. What is there?
What is it?
Squid games are so popular these days

Korean: 아 대박 그 외국인들은 *** 배우를 그렇게만 알듯 키키
English: Oh my goodness, those foreigners only know the *** actor Kiki
So, I heard that making dalgona is a trend all over the world.
Oh wow, are you good at that?
I've never done it before ㅠㅠ
These days, Korean culture is a huge topic of conversation all over the world.

Korean: 넷플이 제작할 때도 잘되면 제작자 덕 못돼도 제쟉자 덕 이라서 다 다른듯!
English: When Netflix produces, if it goes well, it's thanks to the producer, but if it doesn't, it's thanks to the publisher, so it all seems different!
This time, ** also released a song with *****...
Wow, he is a truly respectable Korean singer.
I think you also performed at the UN
Oh my gosh, this is really cool...
There's no way I can become more famous now
How do you take care of your skin?
You don't wear much makeup!
Oh, you're not doing that because you find it annoying?
I guess so too...
Are you in charge?
I pack when I have time

Korean: 팩 추천해 줄만 한 거 있어?
English: Do you have any pack recommendations?
They say it's good to take one pack a day
I recommend this mask pack
Which brand of mask pack do you buy?
My uncle brought it to me! Haha

Korean: 직접 팩 만들어서 해본 적도 있어?
English: Have you ever tried making your own pack?
Oh no, that's not there
Are you there?
What about cucumber packs or potato packs?
Wow I've never done that before
My mom often does that
Wow, the effect is good, right?

Korean: 웅 피부 탔을 때 감자팩 하면 효과 있대
English: Yeah, they say that if you use a potato pack when your skin gets tanned, it's effective.
Have you ever been hospitalized?
Yeah, I just did it once
Was that hospital room okay?
It was a 6-person room, but it wasn't that great ㅠㅠ
It's harder when it's noisy ㅜㅜ

English: My mom uses Naver and Coupang the most
Oh, Coupang is convenient too!

Korean: 쿠팡은 사실 내 아이디라 맨날 비번 물어보시더라
English: Coupang actually asks for my ID and password all the time.

Korean: 나 오랜만에 코빅 보는데 백아연씌 나온당
English: I'm watching Cobik for the first time in a while and Baek A-yeon is in it
Oh, is that person good at singing?

Korean: 엉엉 노래 나온 지 좀 됐는데 이제 나오셨넵!
English: Oh my, it's been a while since the song came out, but it's finally out!
Oh, it's been a long time

Korean: 내가 오랜만에 티비로 본방 보는데 되게... 피부가 다 보이는구나
English: I'm watching the live broadcast on TV for the first time in a long time, and wow... you can see all the skin

Korean: 키키 아 그래서 연예인들이 관리 빡세게 해도 잘 안 나온다는 건가 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki Ah, so that's why celebrities don't look good even if they take good care of themselves ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 피부가 너무 잘 보여서 신기해!
English: Oh my gosh, your skin looks so good!

Korean: 좋고 안 좋고 보다는 잘 보영
English: It's better to take good care of it than to take bad care of it

Korean: 아아 키키 나도 어제 오랜만에 티비 봤어
English: Ahh Kiki, I also watched TV yesterday for the first time in a long time
It's amazing, it's amazing

Korean: 우리 둘 다 티비 오랜만에 보지
English: It's been a while since we both watched TV

Korean: 엄마가 보는 신사와 아가씨? 드라마 같이 봤어
English: A gentleman and a lady that mom watches? We watched the drama together

Korean: 아까 채널 돌리다가 하는 거 봤어!
English: I saw you doing this while I was changing channels earlier!

Korean: 시작한 지 얼마 안 된 거 맞지?
English: It hasn't been that long since you started, right?

Korean: 어 그럴걸! 오케이 광자매 끝나고 시작한 거래
English: Oh, I guess so! Okay, the deal started after the Kwang Sisters finished.
Oh, that's right, that's right

Korean: 오케이 광자매도 시청률 되게 높았던 걸로 아는데!
English: Okay, I heard that Kwang Sisters also had high viewer ratings!
Oh really?
My mom also found it funny
So you saw it too?

Korean: 나도 본가 갈 때 몇 번 같이 봤어
English: I also saw it a few times when I went to my parents' house.
Are there any webtoons you're reading these days?

Korean: 나는 일요 웹툰 중에 별이삼샵이라는 거 즐겨봐
English: Among the Sunday webtoons, I enjoy the one called Byeol-isam-shop

Korean: 네이버랑 다음 중에 뭐가 더 나아?
English: Which is better, Naver or Daum?
I mainly use Naver!

Korean: 별이삼샵이 발신자 제한번호 뜨게 하는 그거 얘기하는 거야?
English: Are you talking about the Byeol-i-sam-shop thing that makes caller ID numbers appear?

Korean: 오 맞아맞아 약간 우리 어릴 때 감성 만화야 내용이 키키
English: Oh right, right, it's a bit of a sentimental cartoon from when we were young. The content is Kiki
Oh my gosh...

Korean: 영화 보고 싶은데 요즘 볼게 있나
English: I want to watch a movie, but is there anything to watch these days?
Have you seen that movie with Hwang Jung-min?

Korean: 아 황정민 배우가 황정민 배우를 연기하는 거?
English: Oh, actor Hwang Jung-min is playing actor Hwang Jung-min?
Oh, that was the hostage, the title

Korean: 나 그거 진짜 보고 싶었는데 아직도 상영하나?
English: I really wanted to see that, is it still showing?
I don't know ㅠㅠ
I think it's over

Korean: 그거 이후로는 보고 싶은 영화가 딱히 없었다 ㅜㅜ
English: After that, there wasn't really any movie I wanted to see ㅜㅜ
Have you been there?
Me too ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그냥 넷플로 옛날 영화나 계속 보는 것 같아
English: I feel like I'm just watching old movies on Netflix.
Are there any Korean movies on Netflix?
Among recent Korean movies, there's Squid Game...?

Korean: 엄마 어제 뭐 먹고 싶다고 했지?
English: Mom, what did you want to eat yesterday?
I told you about pig's feet yesterday

Korean: 앗 근데 엄마 족발 시키는 건 안 좋아하쟈나 ㅜㅜ
English: Oh but mom doesn't like it when I order pig's feet ㅜㅜ
It's delicious to have it delivered by courier
Where did Dad buy the Makguksu last time?
I bought it at the market along with pig's feet.
As expected, there are a lot of delicious restaurants in the market.
What's on the market?

Korean: 저번에 김피탕 시켰을 때 맛있게 먹었던 것 같은데!
English: I think it was delicious when I ordered Kimchi stew last time!
When did you order Kimchi stew?

Korean: 김치 피자 탕수육~ 저번에 맛있다고 한 거!
English: Kimchi Pizza Tangsuyuk~ You said it was delicious last time!
I remember it, let's order it again next time
How about the pasta I made!
What my daughter made was delicious

Korean: 사실 남이 해주는 음식은 다 맛있징?
English: Actually, isn't all food made by others delicious?
Cooking is the hardest part

Korean: 우리 집 이사 온 지 얼마나 됐지?
English: How long has it been since we moved into our house?

Korean: 부천에서 인천 온 지 벌써 6년 됐네
English: It's already been 6 years since I came to Incheon from Bucheon.
Was the Bucheon house for rent or for sale?

Korean: 인천 집 전세 주고 부천 집 전세 갔지
English: I rented a house in Incheon and then rented a house in Bucheon.
Is the house in Incheon for sale right now?
Yeah, that's a deal

Korean: 처음에 집 살 때 부동산 돌아다닌 거야?
English: Did you look around at real estate agencies when you first bought a house?

Korean: 그땐 다 부동산 직접 갔어야 했어
English: Back then, you had to go to the real estate agent yourself.

Korean: 와 직접 다 돌아다니면 넘 힘들었겠당 ㅜㅜ
English: Wow, it would have been so hard to go around everything myself ㅜㅜ

Korean: 지금처럼 어플로 방 볼 거라곤 생각 못했지
English: I never thought I'd be able to view rooms through an app like this

Korean: 전세 계약은 몇 년 하는 거야?
English: How many years is the lease contract?
The basic is 2 years, but there are some houses that only do it for 1 year.
Oh, it depends on the situation
Yes, you can extend it
If I leave, I will have to go to a rented house.
Yeah, it'll be better than rent.

Korean: 이모 집 갈 때 뭐 타고 갔어?
English: What did you ride when you went to your aunt's house?
I went to the terminal and took a bus.

Korean: 원주 터미널에서 이모 카페까지 얼마나 걸려?
English: How long does it take from Wonju Terminal to Imo Cafe?
It took about ten minutes by taxi.
If it's a taxi, there's no bus
I heard that taking the bus is inconvenient, so I took a taxi.

Korean: 가까워서 다행이네 인천 터미널은 뭐 타고 갔어?
English: It's fortunate that it's close. What did you take to get to Incheon Terminal?
I took the subway from home
Well, it's good because it only takes ten minutes

Korean: 이모네 집 들어갈 땐 이모부 차 타고 들어갔어
English: When I went into my aunt's house, I got in my uncle's car.
Is there no transportation to Yangpyeong House?
There is no subway station or bus around.

Korean: 와 무조건 차 타고 가야 하네
English: Wow, I have to go by car.

Korean: 맞아 그래서 이모부 차 타고 갔지
English: Yeah, that's why I went in my uncle's car.
What was your uncle's car?
That SUV must be Santa Fe

Korean: 엄마 이번 주 연차 썼다고 했나?
English: Mom, did you say you used up your vacation time this week?
Yeah, I'll use my vacation days and take a break.

Korean: 연차 쓸 때 눈치 보이는 분위기야?
English: Is it an atmosphere where you have to be mindful when using annual leave?
No, I'm free without that
Oh good, when is payday?
I will receive it in 10 days
If the 10th is a holiday, when will you give it to me?
Give it to me before that
Oh great, we do that too!
When will I get my paycheck?
I will receive it on the 30th
There's a lot left to get paid
Right... but it disappears as soon as you receive it anyway...
It was all like that back then
Right? I'm normal, right?
Yeah, mom was like that too

Korean: 나 군대 가면 육군 해군 공군 중에 뭐가 어울려?
English: If I join the military, which one would suit me best: the Army, Navy, or Air Force?

Korean: 딸은 일단 수영 못하니까 해군 빼고
English: My daughter can't swim, so she's excluded from the Navy.
Oh right, I'm scared of water

Korean: 그러면 번지 점프 이런 거 자신 있어?
English: So, are you confident in things like bungee jumping?
Uh... no... I haven't tried it
The answer is out Army

Korean: 오 현명해 키키 라섹 하고 군대 가면 훈련 못 하는 게 하나 있대
English: Oh, wise Kiki, if you get LASIK and go to the military, there's one thing you can't train for.
Is there something like that? What is it?

Korean: 내가 듣기론 화생방 훈련을 못한다고 들었어
English: I heard that they don't do chemical, biological, radiological and nuclear warfare training.
Isn't that the hardest part?
Yeah, that's the feeling of being stabbed with that hook.
This is really tough training

Korean: 그래서 얼굴 절대 만지지 말라고 한대
English: That's why I told you never to touch your face.
Are you hurt?

Korean: 그렇대 조심해야 하고 다들 힘들어 한대
English: They say you have to be careful and everyone is having a hard time
I'll be so exhausted after doing that
Mom, when did you file your taxes?
I think it's been about 4 years
Isn't it really difficult?
It was very difficult, but I worked hard.

Korean: 회계 없이 바로 세무로 딴 거야?
English: Did you get it straight from taxation without accounting?
Yeah, I got a level 2 tax accountant license in one go.
Didn't you say you have computer skills too?

Korean: 너무 예전에 딴 거라 기억이 잘 안 나지
English: It was so long ago that I don't remember it well
So is it 1st class? 2nd class?
It was single rank back then
Wow, there was something like that in computer skills too?
Is that what Word is like now?

Korean: 응 맞아 나 워드 땄는데 단일 등급이얍
English: Yeah, that's right, I got the word, but it's a single level.

Korean: 워드 시험 볼 때 영타 많이 나왔어?
English: Did you get a lot of English typing questions when you took the Word test?
Yeah, I was really embarrassed
Still, you passed. Good job.

Korean: 엄마 큰 이모 카페는 잘 되고 있어?
English: Mom, is your big aunt's cafe doing well?

Korean: 몇 주 전에 코로나 확진자가 다녀갔대
English: A person confirmed with coronavirus visited a few weeks ago.
Hey, are your aunt and uncle okay?

Korean: 다행히 테이크 아웃 손님이였구 검사 결과 다 음성이래
English: Luckily, they were takeout customers and the test results were all negative.
I'm so glad I did. I almost got into trouble.

Korean: 다행이지 이모는 혈압이 요즘 안 떨어진대
English: Fortunately, my aunt's blood pressure hasn't dropped these days.
Ah, is this the aftereffects of a car accident? ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그런 것 같아 죽다 살아 났지
English: I think so, I almost died and came back to life

Korean: 우리 가족 중에 곧 누구 결혼하시지 않아?
English: Isn't anyone in our family getting married soon?
My aunt who lives in Namhae is getting married.

Korean: 코로나 때문에 우리 가족 다 가도 되나 싶네
English: I wonder if my whole family can go because of Corona
They say that if you get hit twice, the number of people will be different

Korean: 난 안 맞아서 난 두고 가
English: I don't fit in so I'll leave it
Let's re-plan depending on the situation.
Okay, let me know when you go to Namhae.

Korean: 응 가족믈 볼 수 있으면 보러 가자
English: Yeah, if we can see the family, let's go see it.

Korean: 고모는 연애 얼마나 하고 결혼 하는 거래?
English: How long has your aunt been dating before getting married?

Korean: 서로 결혼 생각으로 시작한 거래 6개월 만나고 결혼식 해
English: We started a business with the intention of getting married, met for 6 months and got married.
Oh, so fast... Auntie, you're super fast...
I guess that's why we're middle school classmates
Oh, you're not a complete stranger.
So I guess it was a little faster
Um, how old is your aunt?
My aunt is in her late 30s now.
Oh, when do you want me to get married?

Korean: 딸 하고 싶을 때 하면 되지 상관없어
English: If you want to be my daughter, do it. It doesn't matter.
Is this my freedom?
What aren't you doing?
I have to have children and get married while I'm alive.
Oh I don't want to get married haha

Korean: 요즘은 안 하는 사람들도 않다곤 하던데
English: They say that these days, there are even people who don't do it.
That's right, single-person households are increasing these days.

Korean: 딸 하고 싶은 대로 해도 돼
English: Daughter, you can do whatever you want.
Did you used to have dogs in the countryside?
Yeah, but now he's gone to a different house
I remember there being a rabbit too
There were a lot of pigs in the yard.

Korean: 다 왜 다른 집으로 간 거야?
English: Why did you all go to different houses?

Korean: 할머니 할아버지 농사도 힘들어 하셔서 지인 분 집에 보냈대
English: My grandparents said that they had a hard time farming, so they sent them to an acquaintance's house.
Luckily, you sent it to someone you know!
The countryside is all neighbors
That's right, Mom, I've lived there since I was little.
I've always had a lot of animals since I was little
Wow, there was no chicken?
I had a daughter when she was little

Korean: 앗 내 기억에 없는 건가 부다
English: Oh, I don't remember that, Buddha
She was too young and my daughter was scared.
Haha that's right I don't approach
So you won't remember
Mom, do you want to try pilates?
I had back surgery. Will I be okay?

Korean: 허리 아픈 사람들이 운동 무조건 해야 한다잖아
English: People with back pain should definitely exercise.
Is Pilates something we all do together?
There are 1:1 and group classes.
Then it has to be 1 on 1

Korean: 그렇지 개인으로 받아야 내 몸 상태를 더 신경 써주시긴 하시지
English: If I take it as an individual, you will pay more attention to my physical condition.
Is it worth learning from a group?
Yeah, but the intensity is a bit low

Korean: 다들 난이도 맞춰야 해서 그런 건가
English: Is that because everyone has to adjust the difficulty level?

Korean: 그런 것 같아 센 기준으로 잡으면 다들 못 하니까 ㅜ
English: I think that's why everyone can't do it if you set a standard for them.
You teach exercise for beginners.

Korean: 맞앙 그래서 가끔 스트레칭도 많이 해
English: Yeah, that's why I do a lot of stretching sometimes.
It's also important to stretch your body

Korean: 준비 운동은 무조건 제일 신경 써야지
English: Warm-up exercises are absolutely the most important thing to pay attention to.

Korean: 준비 운동 제대로 안 하면 큰일 나지
English: If you don't warm up properly, you'll be in big trouble.

Korean: 내가 사온 펭귄 얼음 깨기 게임 오때?
English: When will the penguin ice breaker game I bought come?
The penguin was so cute
Kiki is funny, isn't he? He looks like Pengsoo.
Is it worth doing?
I liked it because it wasn't a game that required a lot of thinking.

Korean: 저번에 루미큐브 하던 게 어려줬지 키키
English: Last time you played Lumikub, it was hard, Kiki
That requires a lot of brain power

Korean: 맞아 키키 그래도 시간 금방 가고 재밌엉
English: Yeah Kiki but time goes by so fast and it's fun
Time really flies

Korean: 보드게임 카페 가서 하면 더 재밌어
English: It's more fun if you go to a board game cafe
Have you ever been to a cafe with friends?
We often go in groups too
How many hours do you play games when you go?

Korean: 나 루미큐브만 3시간 넘게 한 적 있어
English: I've only played Lumicube for over 3 hours
Playing just one game for 3 hours?

Korean: 다른 게임 해도 되는데 집중 너무해서 정신 차리니 3시간 지나있더라 키키
English: I could have played another game, but I was so focused that I came to my senses and 3 hours had passed. Kiki
I guess you concentrated very well.

Korean: 가족 여행 가면 어디로 가고 싶어?
English: Where do you want to go on a family trip?
I like places that are not too far away
Ganghwado, this much would be good!
Is there anything fun to do in Ganghwado?

Korean: 루지도 있구 공룡 박물관도 있어 키키
English: There's a luge and a dinosaur museum too Kiki
Have you been to the dinosaur museum?

Korean: 놀러 갔는데 비 많이 와 가지고 실내 찾다가 키키
English: I went out to play, but it rained so much that I was looking for an indoor space.
Was there a lot to see?

Korean: 응 유치할 줄 알았는데 되게 신기해
English: Yeah I thought it would be childish but it's really amazing
What is Luge doing?

Korean: 아 카트라이더 실사판이라고 생각 하먼 돼
English: Ah, I think it's a real-life version of Kart Rider.
Are you driving yourself?

Korean: 근데 발로 조종 하느 거 아니구 핸들로 운전해!
English: But you don't steer with your feet, you drive with the steering wheel!
Not only direction with the handle?
Yeah, you can brake and go straight
What a strange driving method.
How's the weather in Wonju?
It's autumn and the wind blows a lot.

Korean: 엇 여기도 어제 비 온 후에 계속 차가워
English: Oh, it's still cold here after the rain yesterday.
I guess it's really fall now
But when I checked the weather, fall was short
They say it's getting shorter and shorter
This time it'll be over in about two weeks...
Fall is that short?

Korean: 다시 돌아올 수 있지만 다음 주 일요일 짱 춥대
English: I can come back again but it's going to be super cold next Sunday

Korean: 이제 더운 건 좀 가셨나 보다
English: I guess the heat has gone away now
Now I have to put on short sleeves
It's the season when short sleeves become pajamas
Yeah, I'll be wearing padding soon

Korean: 조끼 패딩 입으신 분은 어제 봤어
English: I saw someone wearing a vest padding yesterday

Korean: 와우 벌써? 그분은 겨울에 뭐 입으시지...
English: Wow, already? What does he wear in winter...
I guess you feel cold easily

Korean: 애플 폰 써보고 싶은 적 있어?
English: Have you ever wanted to use an Apple phone?
No, Mom, LG phone is more convenient

Korean: 내가 산 폰 폴더폰 괜찮지 않아?
English: Isn't the flip phone I bought okay?
Isn't that Samsung?
That's right, Apple said it would make a foldable phone in 2023.
If there are 2 years left, it's still a long way to go

Korean: 근데 z플립3 판매량 보고 좀 당겨질 수 있대
English: But looking at the sales of the Z Flip 3, it seems like it could be pushed back a bit.
Apple is slower than Galaxy?
5G was also released a year late
Do a lot of your friends use iPhones?
The iPhone is actually a phone that users don't wait for.
Samsung and Apple are completely divided

Korean: 맞아 근데 이번에 z플립3으로 옮긴 아이폰 유저들이 좀 있어
English: Yes, but there are some iPhone users who have switched to the Z Flip 3 this time.

Korean: 주위에 그 폰 산 사람 많아?
English: Are there a lot of people around you who bought that phone?
Yeah, there are a lot of people who moved from iPhone!
Well, I guess it was a hit
These days, even teenagers get vaccinated.
What country did you start from?
Oh, that Canada is the first!
Did you get any teen approval recently?
Approved for ages 12 to 17 at the end of August
Is the vaccination interval the same as ours?
No, the interval between Pfizer and Moderna is different.
How are Pfizer and Moderna different?
Pfizer takes 3 weeks, Moderna takes 4 weeks.
It's very different from us

Korean: 막히긴 해도 사람들과 막 여름을 같이 즐기지 않아도 돼서 키키

Korean: 날씨에 따라가 아니라 전철에 따라 옷 입어야겠다
English: I should dress according to the train, not the weather.

Korean: 이제 예약 없이 백신 맞을 수 있대
English: Now you can get vaccinated without a reservation
Since when did it change like that?
I think it starts on October 11th!

Korean: 그럼 그냥 병원 가서 맞는다고 말하면 돼?
English: Then should I just go to the hospital and say that it's okay?

Korean: 아니 병원에 잔여백신 확인은 하고 가야 한대
English: No, I have to go to the hospital and check for remaining vaccines.
Can I just check by phone and then visit the hospital?
That's correct~
I guess I'll start getting hit soon too
I heard the cycle is getting shorter now

Korean: 맞아 원래 4주였는데 백신 수급 부족으로 6주였던 거잖아 ㅜ
English: That's right, it was originally 4 weeks, but it was reduced to 6 weeks due to a shortage of vaccines.
I guess it's okay now
But the period is too long
Self-quarantine for 2 weeks, and even after getting vaccinated, 2 weeks later ㅜㅜ
Why is it 2 weeks? It's long.
They also recommend booster shots from the same day.
What do you use for booster shots?
You probably know it as Pfizer
My mom's first and second shots were both Pfizer.

Korean: 이제 백신 다 맞으면 해외 나갈 수 있나 봐
English: Now that I've been vaccinated, I guess I can go abroad
They said it would be somewhere from November, but where is it?
Probably Thailand!
I think it was Thailand!
You saw the news, daughter!
It was Thailand
Do you know what the squid game is?
Isn't this a famous drama these days?
That's right
Did you see that?
I haven't seen it
Why is that?
You can see that in China too
Yeah, but why?
I guess they made goods because it was so famous
It seems to be popular
But they are selling counterfeit products in China
Are there counterfeit goods too?
Then how different is the feeling?
I didn't know
I just found out
Have you ever tried putting on eyelashes?
I used to wear it a lot when I was young
Did your mom have eyelash extensions too?
How many times have you tried it later?
Did that make your eyelashes look okay?
I was losing everything so I stopped
Are you taking one pack a day these days?
It wasn't as easy as I thought
Yeah, I tried it for 3 days too, but it was hard
It was a three-day resolution
Skin care is difficult
Is Sulwhasoo lotion good for you?
Sulwhasoo is the best

Korean: 피부가 비싼 화장품부터 써주면 그거에 적응한대
English: If you start using expensive cosmetics, your skin will adapt to them.
Isn't Mom old enough to adapt?
Um... right...
So I just write whatever~^^
Are you drawing the big picture?
Are you going to get a health checkup this year?
The end of the year is already approaching
Don't change the subject~
You should check it~
Did you decide to get a thorough checkup with your daughter this time?
Is that daughter me?
The mother has one daughter
Oh, it's a complete mess...
Uh... I'll go too

Korean: 보호자로 가는 거 말고 같이 검사하자
English: Let's get tested together instead of going as a guardian
Mom, you should get an endoscopy too!
My daughter can have an endoscopy too
Mom, is this your first time?
Yeah, this is my first endoscopy.
Then I'll do it for the first time in my 50s too
You only want to learn bad things

Korean: 에베베 메롱 12월 되기 전에 건강검진 받자
English: Ebebe Merong, let's get a health checkup before December
Okay then let's go
Where did you order soy milk this time?

Korean: 원래 지마켓에서 시키려 했는데 배송 늦는다고 연락 왔어
English: I originally tried to order from Gmarket, but they contacted me saying that delivery would be delayed.
Is it because it's a holiday?
Did you order it again?
I ordered it again from Timon
It was somehow super fast
I didn't know Timon had fast shipping either
I just found out now
These days, they even deliver clothes on the same day.

Korean: 브랜디! 근데 내 친구 그거 믿고 시켰다가 안 왔어 키키
English: Brandy! But my friend trusted me and ordered it and it never came Kiki
Where do you want to live?
Live far away?
Bucheon... Alive Kiki
early
Then I guess it was crowded because it was a holiday
Is that so ㅜㅜ
So I always order clothes that are loose

Korean: 해외배송 같은 경우는 더 일찍 시켜
English: In the case of overseas shipping, please order earlier
Overseas shipping really comes when you forget

Korean: 해외배송 사이트 옷 시키는 곳 있어?
English: Is there a website where I can order clothes overseas?
I watched TV for the first time in a long time and it was fun.
What did you see yesterday?
I saw the new Racket Boys
What kind of entertainment is that?
Celebrities are playing badminton!
Oh, I see. It's a sports show.

Korean: 응 맞앙 난 스포츠 예능이 재밌더랑
English: Yeah, that's right. I find sports entertainment fun.

Korean: 보는 걸 좋아해서 그럴 수도 있겠다
English: Maybe it's because I like watching

Korean: 맞아 그래서 나 어제 배드민턴 이용대 선수 찾아보고 우리 집 주위에 강습 있는지 찾아봤어 키키
English: Yeah, so I looked up badminton players yesterday and looked to see if there were any lessons around my house. Kiki
Who are the celebrities?
Yoon Doojoon is here! Highlight!
Isn't Yoon Doojoon from Beast?

Korean: 소속사 문제로 같은 멤버들끼리 나와서 회사 차려서 하이라이트로 바꼈어!
English: Due to issues with their agency, the same members left and started their own company, which became Highlight!
How many members are there now?
Maybe... only 4 left
I'll see you again next time
Who is your favorite movie star?
I like actress Jeon Ji-hyun
Mom is so consistent
Jeon Ji-hyun was pretty even when she was young

Korean: 마자 이제 곧 드라마도 시작하던데 영화도 많이 하셨지
English: The drama is starting soon, but you've also done a lot of movies
Have you been to your daughter's comic book cafe?
I've never been there!
Don't you read comics often?
Yeah, I don't like books.
I have friends who like comic books.
So these days, everyone reads webtoons.
Have you ever read a webtoon?
No I don't have that either Kiki
Don't your friends recommend it?
I recommended college life or something
I really have never seen it before
Mom, do you like rice noodles?
Yeah, I eat rice noodles often.
Oh, do you like coriander?
It was difficult at first, but now it's delicious
Do you like cheesy food?

Korean: 치즈 다 추가해서 먹는 게 맛있어
English: It's delicious when you add more cheese to it
So do you like tteokbokki?
Tteokbokki is so spicy it's hard
You don't like spicy food anymore?
I won't eat it anymore
So, do you like egg dishes?

Korean: 계란찜 계란말이 구운 계란 다 좋지
English: Steamed eggs, scrambled eggs, and baked eggs are all good.
What food do you dislike?
I don't eat fish very often
Oh, you don't like raw fish either?
I don't eat raw fish at all
Mom, do you have a savings account?
No, do you have a daughter?
I think success in life is about sharing

Korean: 다른 것보다 부동산으로 돈 관리하는 게 낫지
English: It is better to manage your money with real estate than anything else.

Korean: 분양은 어느 지역으로 하는 게 나을까
English: Which area would be better for distribution?

Korean: 딸이 제일 많이 활동하는 곳도 좋지
English: The place where my daughter is most active is also good
They say that rental housing is also okay.

Korean: 조건도 맞아야 하고 기간도 맞으면 좋지
English: It would be good if the conditions and period were right.

Korean: 청년 조건 있던데 그건 나랑 맞지 않을까?
English: There's a youth requirement, but wouldn't that fit me?

Korean: 그렇지 분양하는 곳마다 다 다르니까 잘 확인해봐
English: Yes, it is different for each distribution site, so check carefully.

Korean: 경기 인천 서울 중에 어디로 볼까
English: Where should I go between Gyeonggi, Incheon, and Seoul?
Since my home is in Incheon, try looking for Gyeonggi and Seoul.
I guess I'll have to go to Bucheon, Gyeonggi.
Friends, are you in Bucheon?
Correct answer. In fact, Bucheon is convenient.
There's also an app. Take a look.
It's been a while since I've driven so I feel awkward
What did you drive?
This time I drove a Kona
Is that an electric car?
I have an electric car, but I used gasoline.
Daughter, have you ever driven an electric car?

Korean: 아니 한 번도 없어서 휘발유로 했어
English: No, I never had it so I used gasoline
I haven't even tried charging it yet

Korean: 정답! 충전 안 해봐서 어려울 것 같아
English: Correct! I don't think it will be easy because I haven't tried charging it.
The instructions are all written down, so give it a try.
I guess so. Electric cars are really quiet.
They say that's dangerous

Korean: 그래서 이제 어느 정도의 소음은 나게 만들어진대
English: So now it's made to make some noise.

Korean: 필요하겠다 많이는 아니어도 소리가 나야 알 수 있으니까
English: I'll need it, not a lot, but I'll need to hear it so I can tell
Yeah, it seems dangerous
Be sure to drive next time
How long does it take to get to work?
It takes about 15 minutes by subway.
Close is best! Right?
How long will it take for your daughter?

Korean: 난 한 시간 반 조금 넘게 건령
English: I'm a little over an hour and a half away
Is work going well?
Yeah, are you okay, Mom?

Korean: 처음에 엑셀 너무 오랜만이라 공부 다시 했어
English: At first, I studied Excel again because it had been so long since I had used it.
Oh, are you feeling better now?
I remember it because I studied it again
Is there a meeting or something?
Once a week

Korean: 회의하면 주로 다 같이 모여서 하는 건 감?
English: When you have a meeting, do you usually get everyone together and do it?
We don't all get together these days
So are we going to have separate meetings?
Let's split up and have a meeting

Korean: 내 친구가 PX에서 보내준 달팽이 크림 어땠어?
English: How was the snail cream my friend sent me from PX?
It was moist, please do it again next time

Korean: 나어렸을 때 훈련 다녀온 거 뭔지 기억나?
English: Do you remember what it was like to go to training when you were young?
Was that military experience training?
It was Marine Corps experience training!

Korean: 언제 몇 살 때 다녀온 거야?
English: When and how old were you when you went there?
I went there when I was in elementary school
Is that something you learned at school?
I went to the Taekwondo demonstration team
Was that fun? How was it?

Korean: 다녀온 후로 빨간 모자만 보면 해병대 생각났어
English: Since I came back, every time I see a red hat, I think of the Marines.
I guess I'm afraid of the Marines.

Korean: 체험이었는데도 되게 힘들었던 게 아직도 생각나 ...
English: Even though it was an experience, I still remember how difficult it was...
Do you have any desire to go back again?
Yeah, not even 1 at all

Korean: 아쉽네 한 번 더 가라고 추천하려 했는데
English: It's a pity, I was going to recommend you go again
I filled out one line of my resume this time.
So what did you fill it with?
I'm writing this on my 3rd grade shorthand resume
Congratulations, really
Didn't you write one last time?

Korean: 그건 CPR 교육 받고 수료증 적었어
English: That's because I took CPR training and got a certificate.
Where did you get that kind of education?

Korean: 대한적십자에서 주최하는거라 집 앞 적십자에서 신청해서 교육 들었엉
English: Since it was hosted by the Korean Red Cross, I applied at the Red Cross in front of my house and received training.
How much do you pay for education?
Was it 40,000 won or 50,000 won?
It's not free!
How many people take that class?
It's a reservation system, but I was one of about 15 people.
How many hours is the training?
I think it took 5 hours
Can you keep that?
no
I have to retrain every two years!
I'll have to listen again in two years
My aunt sent me a package yesterday. What is it?
My aunt sent me a duck
Oh wow, this looks delicious
Did you see the package that grandma sent you?
Wow, what did grandma send you?
They sent me different types of kimchi

Korean: 오 ... 대박 할머니 백신 다 맞으셨나?
English: Oh... Grandma, did you get all your vaccines?

Korean: 친할아버지 친할머니 외할아버지 외할머니 모두 맞으시고 2주도 다 지나셨지
English: It's been two weeks since my paternal grandfather, paternal grandmother, and maternal grandfather all passed away.
Thank goodness there were no side effects?

Korean: 외할머니는 조금 있으셨는데 이제 모두 다 괜찮으시대
English: My grandmother was there for a while, but now everything is fine.
Thank goodness your youngest aunt got both shots?
Yeah, that's right, it's been two weeks
Mom and Dad, is next week the second week?
Yeah, it's almost the second week
It's going to get stronger now
That's right, thank goodness

Korean: 이제 남해 결혼식 얼마 안 남았네?
English: Is the Namhae wedding just around the corner?
Namhae Aunt Da-da ...

Korean: 결혼식 인원 제한 때문에 우리도 다 같이는 못 가지?
English: Because of the wedding crowd limit, we can't all go together?
Dad will go as a representative
What time is your aunt's wedding?
It's Saturday at 1pm
It's just lunch time food

Korean: 그래서 아빠 아마 전날 가실 거야
English: So Dad will probably go the day before
The wedding lasts about an hour?

Korean: 그럴 거야 요즘 결혼사진 찍을 때 마스크 쓰고 찍는다더라
English: That's right. I heard that these days, people wear masks when taking wedding photos.

Korean: 평생 남는 사진에 마스크가 같이 남는다고 하니 마음이 아프다
English: It breaks my heart to hear that the mask remains with the photo that will last a lifetime.
The groom sang the congratulatory song
Wow, that's awesome. What should I sing?
Let me ask Dad when he gets home
Who will look after society?
The groom's friend came to see me
Is your aunt in Namhae still raising a puppy?

Korean: 마당에서 키우다가 이제 집 안에서 키워
English: I used to grow it in the yard, now I grow it inside the house.
What was the dog's name?
They said he was named Sundung because he was innocent.
I remember it being so cute and small

Korean: 우리가 처음 봤을 때가 아가 때였대
English: The first time we met was when he was a baby.
Wow, it's been a while now
You have two puppies

Korean: 헐 순둥이 말고 그 친구 이름은 뭐야?
English: Oh my, other than Sundungi, what's that guy's name?
They say that guy is the youngest

Korean: 아 키키 너무 귀여우신 거 아닌가 키키
English: Ah Kiki, isn't she so cute? Kiki
The way you name it is so cute too

Korean: 엄마는 강아지 키우게 되면 이름 뭐라고 하고 싶어?
English: Mom, if you get a puppy, what do you want to name it?
Then let's say it's a hundred billion

Korean: 오 강아지 부를 때 백억 이리 와~ 하는 건가
English: Oh, when you call a puppy, it says, "Come here a hundred billion times"
Yeah, that's what I was aiming for
I have a new sport I want to learn
What kind of exercise is it this time?
Tennis! I'm looking into it.
Have you ever played tennis?
I learned it in college!
Did you have fun learning it?
I have such fun memories
Do you have a tennis racket at home?

Korean: 대학 졸업할 때 후배들 주고 와서 집에 없을걸 하하
English: When I graduated from college, I gave it to my juniors and they wouldn't be home haha
Then I guess I should buy one
I looked it up and it says if you sign up for 3 months they give you a tennis racket!
I guess I can register for 3 months~
Yeah, that's why I'm going to register!

Korean: 다른 테니스장도 다들 테니스 채 주는 거야?
English: Do all the other tennis courts provide tennis rackets?
No, there's an open event there!
Then I have to go there even more
Have you played with air a lot?
I did it more when I was a mom
Have you ever played Minesweeper on your computer?
Isn't it secretly nice to spend time there?
Have you heard of Nexon?
Wow, it's a company, right?

Korean: 헐 맞아 맞아 올 어떻게 알았대
English: Oh my, that's right, that's right, how did you know?

Korean: 딸 많이 해서 알지 넥슨 회사 왜?
English: You know a lot about Nexon, why do you have a daughter?
There is a Nexon Computer Museum in Jeju Island.
What kind of place is that?

Korean: 게임들 해볼 수 있고 공개되지 않은 게임 캐릭터도 볼 수 있어
English: You can try out games and see unreleased game characters.
Are you playing Nexon's games?

Korean: 응응 예전 것도 다 해볼 수 있어
English: Yeah, you can try all the old ones too
What did you buy there?

Korean: 사 오지는 않고 엽서랑 부채 받아왔어
English: I didn't buy it, but I received a postcard and a fan.
There are so many gifts
I went to Jeju Island and it was great
So how many nights did you stay there?
Haha I went for 3 nights and 4 days
Did it feel short? Did it feel long?
It was so fast, it felt like just one night
Did everything go as planned?

Korean: 아니 비가 와서 다시 다 바꿨어
English: No, it rained so I changed everything again
Is it okay to change your lifestyle?
Yes, I moved quickly to fit the time.
Did you find your way with Navi?
Yeah, it was comfortable because there weren't many cars.
Is there a place you would like to recommend in Jeju Island?

Korean: 휴애리라고 급하게 찾아간 곳인데 너무 좋았어
English: I went to Hyue-ri in a hurry and it was really great.
What kind of place is it?

Korean: 핑크 뮬리 포러 갔는데 꽃도 많더라
English: I went to the pink muhly field and there were a lot of flowers.
It would be nice to go on a family trip
Wow, it suddenly got this cold?
So autumn is gone

Korean: 맞아 ... 가을 없어져서 옷을 어찌 입어야 할지
English: Right... what should I wear when fall is gone?

Korean: 코트 입을 날씨가 사라진 것 같아
English: It seems like the weather is gone for wearing a coat.
So now I guess I'll have to get out the hot water mat...
It was hot but suddenly got cold

Korean: 출근할 때 이제 옷을 잘 입고 가야겠다
English: I need to dress well when I go to work now.
But it's hot on the train and cold outside
Yeah, that's the hardest part
Put the fan in and take out the electric blanket.
How cold will it be this winter?
It gets colder as time goes by

Korean: 올해는 그래도 지구가 덜 아파서 덜 춥지 않을까
English: This year, the Earth will be less sick and less cold, right?
Well then, let's look forward to it
First, let's take out our winter clothes.
Now let's put on short sleeves

Korean: 강남에 병원들 많잖아! 그중에 피부과 얘기 들었어?
English: There are a lot of hospitals in Gangnam! Have you heard about the dermatology department among them?
Why Gangnam Dermatology?

Korean: 피부과 같은 곳은 선불로 많이 결제하잖아
English: Places like dermatology often require payment in advance.

Korean: 그렇지 미리 선불로 하면 싸게도 해주니까
English: Yes, if you pay in advance, you can get it cheaper.

Korean: 근데 코로나 때문에 폐업하고 옆에 2호점 낸다고 문자가 왔대
English: But I got a text saying that they are closing down due to Corona and opening a second branch next door.
Hey, when did you say it was going to open?

Korean: 원래는 금방 오픈한다고 문자 보냈나 봐
English: I think they originally sent a text saying they would open soon

Korean: 기사가 뜬 거면 아직도 오픈을 안 한 거야?
English: If the article came out, it hasn't opened yet?

Korean: 한 달째 오픈 안 하고 있대
English: It hasn't been open for a month
What about the prepaid guests?
So now they're suing

Korean: 거의 한 사람당 얼마나 선불한 건데?
English: How much did you prepay for each person?

Korean: 한 사람당 최대 300만 원까지 피해본 거래
English: Transactions with damages of up to 3 million won per person

Korean: 그래서 예전에도 치과 피부과 이런 곳 그런 사건이 많았어
English: So, there have been many incidents like this in dental clinics and dermatology clinics in the past.
Oh, dental care too? Is there a prepayment for dental care?

Korean: 교정 같은 건 일시불 결제도 하긴 하지
English: For things like corrections, you can also pay in a lump sum

Korean: 두바이가 이제 외국인 출입제한을 많이 완화시켰대!
English: Dubai has now greatly relaxed its entry restrictions for foreigners!
They relieved it faster than us

Korean: 그래서 외국인들이 많이 와서 경기회복이 되고 있대
English: So, many foreigners are coming and the economy is recovering.
That's really fortunate

Korean: 두바이는 작년에 코로나 막기 위해 되게 신기한 방법을 사용했대 들어봤어?
English: Have you heard that Dubai used a really novel method to stop the coronavirus last year?
Was there any way?
They even flew drones to prevent residents from moving around.
Were you checking with a drone?

Korean: 그렇대 그래서 하루 확진자 100명으로 내리고 그랬대
English: That's why they lowered the number of confirmed cases per day to 100.
The vaccination rate must be high, right?
That's right, they said 92%!
The vaccination rate is also very high

Korean: 마스크 미착용 시에 벌금도 되게 쎄!
English: The fines for not wearing a mask are really high!
How high is it? How much is it?

Korean: 우리 돈으로 100만 원 정도 되는 벌금이래
English: The fine is about 1 million won in our currency.
Yeah, it's really strong
Are IOPE's base cosmetics any good?
I saw something I bought at a duty free shop, and it was collagen.
Are collagen products any good?
At what age do you need collagen?
Is there an area you would like plastic surgery on?
My eyes seem to be drooping these days

Korean: 이제 건조해질 텐데 촉촉하게 미스트 뿌려야 하지 않아?
English: It's going to get dry now, so shouldn't I spray some moisturizing mist on it?
So I ordered a mist

Korean: 피부는 요즘 잘 때 잘 챙겨 발라?
English: Are you taking good care of your skin when you sleep these days?
I'm also using moisturizing cream and packs well
Are you applying sunscreen properly?
I'm using Hera Sange well
Isn't that sticky and stuff?
I like it because it's waterproof and doesn't erase.
Oh, I want to try it too
Okay, I'll buy you the same thing.
Are you feeling okay after getting vaccinated?

Korean: 1차 맞고는 몇 주 계속 너무 피곤했어
English: I was so tired for several weeks after the first dose.
So were you okay after the second time?
I have chest pain after the second shot
Then I should go to the hospital right away.
Are you receiving proper acupuncture treatment?

Korean: 응응 1주에 한번 2주에 한 번은 꼭 가서 치료받지
English: Yeah, yeah, go and get treatment at least once a week or once every two weeks.
Where do you go to get treatment?
I have my fingers and wrists
Will it feel better if I receive it?
It definitely makes me feel more comfortable
Is your turtle neck feeling better?
No, I'm uncomfortable every day Kiki
They say posture is the most important thing

Korean: 최대한 허리 펴고 걸으려고는 하는데 ㅜㅜ
English: I try to walk with my back straight as much as possible ㅜㅜ
Pay a little more attention
Where did you order food yesterday?
I ordered it in a hurry from Market Kurly
They'll be there soon too
That's exactly what I needed, it was perfect

Korean: 여행 갔는데 친구가 잠옷 안 챙겨 와서 키키
English: I went on a trip and my friend didn't bring his pajamas. Kiki
So what did you do?
I tried to order from Coupang, but Kiki
Did you check if you're arriving at Jeju Island?

Korean: 응응 근데 생각해보니까 숙소에서 받기가 힘들더라고 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, but when I think about it, it's hard to receive it at the dorm ㅜㅜ
Did you also order fruit from Coupang?
The condition was better than I thought
Now they're really selling everything

Korean: 아이디어 시라는 어플에서 뭐 산 적 있어?
English: Have you ever bought anything from the app Idea City?
What app was that?

Korean: 작가님들이 파는 곳이라 상품들이 되게 많아
English: Since it is a place where writers sell, there are a lot of products.
Then I'll have to check it out
Do you know who CNBLUE is?
Aren't they the group that used to call themselves Loners?
Right, right, you know?

Korean: 예전에 FT아일랜드랑 같은 소속사라고 나온 거 봤어
English: I saw it mentioned before that they were from the same agency as FT Island

Korean: 지금 전참시에 나오는데 짱 오랜만이 양
English: It's been a long time since I've been on the show right now
Long time no see. Are you finished with your military service?

Korean: 응 세명 다 제대하고 이제 앨범 나올 거랑
English: Yeah, all three of us have been discharged and the album will be released now.
It's been a while since the band
Does your mom know Buzz well?
Isn't your daughter also from the Buzz generation?
Kiki That's right, two stars two stars
Is Knowing Brother still doing it?

Korean: 엉엉 게스트도 계속 바뀌고 아는 형님 계속하지
English: Oh my, the guests keep changing and Knowing Brothers keeps on going

Korean: 전참시 이번 주 게스트 누구 나왔어?
English: Who is the guest this week on Jeonju?
Yeah, CNBLUE and Junseo Yook!
That must have been fun. I should watch it sometime.
What did you say about the movie you saw last time?
I saw Mogadishu and it was fun
Who's coming out there?
Jo In-seong and Koo Kyo-hwan come out
Is that the guy from Ku Kyo-hwan that appeared in DP?
That's what I said, I didn't see DP
I heard you watch a lot of Venom, have you seen it?
Haven't you seen it yet? Is it fun?
But the rating is too low...
What is the rating on the internet?
I saw it yesterday and it was 6.4 points...
It's so low, I'm even more curious
It's a foreign film, so I shouldn't watch it.

Korean: 국내 영화 다음에 같이 보러 가자
English: Let's go see a domestic movie together next time
Right, let's go to the movie theater in front of the house.
Let's go in front of the house.
What did you have for lunch today?

Korean: 나는 회사에서 직원들이랑 샐러드 시켜 먹었어
English: I ordered a salad with my coworkers at work.
Oh, I see
What salad did you order?

Korean: 닭 가슴살 샐러드에 새우 추가해서 먹었어
English: I added shrimp to my chicken breast salad
Did you eat dessert after eating?

Korean: 아니 나는 안 먹고 다른 직원들은 커피 마셨어
English: No, I didn't eat, but the other employees drank coffee.
Which brand of coffee did you drink?
I drank at Mega Coffee today
Where do you usually drink?

Korean: 회사 바로 밑에 빽 다방 있어서 거기 자주 가
English: There is a cafe right below my company, so I go there often.
What are you planning to eat for dinner?
Tonight's menu is fish cake soup Kiki
Do you cook your own food?
No, my mom made dinner haha
Is your mother a good cook?

Korean: 응 나는 우리엄마 음식 다 좋아해
English: Yeah, I like all my mom's food.
When do you want to move?
Honestly, I want to go right now
Which area do you want to go to?
Well, anywhere in the metropolitan area is fine.
Do you want to go on a rental?
Yeah, it takes a while for the contract to be finalized, but...
When do you want to move out?

Korean: 자취는 내 밥벌이가 어느 정도 안정적일 때? 키키
English: When will my livelihood be somewhat stable? Kiki
Ah Kiki is smart

Korean: 자취는 회사 바로 앞에 하고 싶어?
English: Do you want to live right in front of the company?
I want to do it as close as possible!

Korean: 가까운데 비싼 곳과 싼데 멀지만 큰 곳 중에 어디를 월세 잡고 싶어?
English: Where would you rather rent, a place that's close but expensive or a place that's far but cheap but big?
Wow... difficult...

Korean: 그래도 전자가 더 나을 거 같아 ㅜ
English: But I think the former is better ㅜ
If you live alone, do you want to choose the interior yourself?

Korean: 응 나만의 집으로 잘 꾸미고 싶어 키키
English: Yeah, I want to decorate my own house well, Kiki

Korean: 집에 순이들의 침대 그거 본적 있어?
English: Have you ever seen Sooni's bed at home?
of course!
Kiki, it's totally my style

Korean: 전철 타면 주로 어딜 쪽으로 가?
English: Where do you usually go when you take the subway?
I go to Gangnam a lot
Do you ride Line 2 a lot?
Take line 7 and then transfer to line 2
Have you ever ridden the Line 1 Cheonan Express?
Yeah, I rode it sometimes when I was little.
There's no express train on Line 2, right?
Yeah, there wasn't any
I wish all subways had express trains.
The Line 9 express train is really amazing. Have you ever ridden it?

Korean: 응 근데 9호선은 자주 안 타게 되더라고 키키
English: Yeah, but I don't ride line 9 that often, Kiki
Have you ever ridden the Suin Line?
No, I've never been there

Korean: 전철 한 번에 쭉 가는데 2시간 3번 갈아타는데 1시간 중에 뭐가 좋아?
English: It takes 2 hours and 3 transfers to go all the way on the subway. What's better than spending an hour on it?
I prefer the latter

Korean: 갈아타기 위해 제일 가까운 길 찾는 편이야?
English: Are you looking for the closest route to transfer?

Korean: 응 시간 더 절약하는 걸 좋아해
English: Yeah I like saving more time
Does your company have any vaccine leave this year?

Korean: 나는 이차까지 다 맞아서 휴가 다 썼어
English: I got hit by both of them and used up all my vacation days.

Korean: 와 1차 2차 모두 백신 휴가 있는 거야?
English: Wow, both the first and second rounds have vaccine breaks?
Yeah, our company gives us one day each
Do you have monthly and annual leave?
We have 15 annual leave days in our first year.

Korean: 와 휴가 쓰는 건 다 자유로워?
English: Wow, you're free to use your vacation time?

Korean: 상반기에 좀 바빠서 하반기에 많이 쓰지
English: I was a bit busy in the first half of the year, so I won't be writing much in the second half.
Do you have meetings often?
Yeah, I do that sometimes
What are your commuting hours?
Going to work at 9 and leaving at 5 is so sweet Kiki
If we meet, will you give your opinion?

Korean: 그냥 내 할 말은 하는 스타일이야
English: I'm just the type to say what I want to say
Do you often work overtime?
I work overtime a lot in the first half of the year.
Do you still have any military friends?

Korean: 아니 내 나이대 애들은 다 전역했어
English: No, all the kids my age have been discharged
Do you have any friends who are career soldiers?
There are no professional soldiers around me.

Korean: 그럼 내가 너의 그 친구가 되어줄까
English: Then shall I be your friend?
Yeah but be my soldier friend
Recommend me among the Army, Air Force, and Navy
You are best suited for the army
Oh thank you
Are you coming for an interview?
Of course you have to go Kiki

Korean: 휴가 나오면 신나게 놀아줄 걸 얍?
English: When you get off vacation, you'll have fun, right?

Korean: 내가 그 누구보다 신나게 놀아 줄게
English: I'll have more fun than anyone else

Korean: 친구들 휴가 나오면 주로 같이 뭐 했어?
English: When your friends go on vacation, what do you usually do together?

Korean: 그냥 죽도록 술만 마셨던 거 같아 키키
English: I think I just drank until I died Kiki
Is that what you want?

Korean: 그거 나랑 같이 해줄 수 있지?
English: Can you do that with me?
It's obvious I'll die for you, but it's possible
Are you preparing for any certifications?

Korean: 아니 자격증 준비는 딱히 안 해
English: No, I'm not really preparing for a qualification
Are there any qualifications you would like to obtain?
I want to get a Korean history certificate
How often do you get a Korean history certificate?
I don't know because I haven't looked into it in detail...
Is there an academy you want to go to?

Korean: 요즘 영어 공부가 다시 하고 싶더라고
English: I feel like studying English again these days
How long have you been learning English?

Korean: 취업 준비할 때 까진 했던 거 같아
English: I think I did it until I was preparing for employment

Korean: 영어 할 때 제일 어려운 게 뭐야?
English: What is the most difficult thing about speaking English?

Korean: 모르는 단어 나오면 엄청 짜증 났어
English: I got really annoyed when I came across a word I didn't know.

Korean: 단어 외울 때 본인만의 팁 있어?
English: Do you have any tips for memorizing words?

Korean: 난 성격상 그냥 주야장천 외우는 편이었어
English: I'm the type of person who just memorizes things day and night.
How do you memorize words if you don't want to memorize them?
But I memorized it by writing it down no matter what

Korean: 집에 어머니 아버지 오빠 다 계셔?
English: Are your mother, father, and older brother at home?

Korean: 응 우리 가족 다 같이 살아
English: Yeah, my family all lives together
Is everyone going to work?
Yeah, I'm working right now
Do you keep in touch with your cousin often?
We only contact each other very occasionally
You and your cousin went on a trip together, right?
Yeah, I went there last November.
Don't you have a cousin?
Kiki has a lot more cousins

Korean: 어머 사촌 오빠분들이랑은 연락 안 해?
English: Mom, don't you keep in touch with your cousins?
My brothers don't do it
Do you do it very, very, very rarely?
Don't you have any cousins?

Korean: 외가 친가 합해서 사촌 동생 딱 1명 있어
English: I have exactly one cousin on both my maternal and paternal sides.
Wow how old is he?

Korean: 저스트 나보다 한 살 어려 키키
English: Just one year younger than me Kiki
Do you want to get married right now?

Korean: 아니 당장 할 남자도 없고 당장은 생각 없어 키키
English: No, I don't have a boyfriend right now and I don't have any thoughts right now Kiki
Do you want to date?

Korean: 요즘 들어 가끔 연애하고 싶단 생각해
English: Lately, I sometimes think about wanting to be in a relationship
Are you lonely and depressed these days?

Korean: 응 나 가을 타나 봐 키키
English: Yeah I think I'm going to fall Kiki

Korean: 결혼식 할 때 드레스 뭐 입고 싶어?
English: What dress do you want to wear for your wedding?

Korean: 나는 솔직히 머메이드 입고 싶은데 나랑 어울릴까 모르겠네
English: I honestly want to wear a mermaid dress, but I don't know if it will suit me.
Do you have a wedding atmosphere in mind?

Korean: 아니 그런 것 까지는 생각 안 해 봤어
English: No, I never thought about that
How about your husband wearing a dress?

Korean: 우와 그거 진짜 긴박한 생각이다 키키
English: Wow, that's a really urgent thought, Kiki

Korean: 난 결혼사진 꼭 한번 그렇게 찍고 싶은데 너는?
English: I really want to take wedding photos like that once. What about you?

Korean: 미안 나는 그런 생각 해본 적 한 번도 없어
English: Sorry, I never thought about that.
Oh, that's too bad
Then I'll try first
Yeah, I'll congratulate you a lot.

Korean: 여행 갈 때 나리는 어떻게 했어?
English: What did Nari do when she went on a trip?
Nari was taken care of by her cousin
Does your cousin also raise animals?

Korean: 응 사촌 언니는 고양이 세 마리 키워
English: Yeah, my cousin has three cats.
Wow, what are all the names?

Korean: 큰 나비 작은 나비 업둥이 이렇게 세 마리야
English: There are three of them, a big butterfly, a small butterfly, and a little butterfly.
Are those guys old?
Shouldn't they also do this at 9, 7, and 3 years old?
So how old is Nari?
Nari is nine years old

Korean: 그럼 언니네 큰 나비는 열 살이겠다
English: Then your big sister's butterfly would be ten years old

Korean: 우왕 다들 같이 모인 적 있어?
English: Wow, have you all ever been together before?

Korean: 아니 그런 적은 한 번도 없어
English: No, that's never happened
How much is Nari's feed?
About 15,000 to 20,000 won
How much food does Nari eat a day?
I'm not sure about that
Eats more than the average cat
I want to learn tennis
Oh, there are a lot of indoor tennis courts these days.
Have you ever played tennis?

Korean: 아니 난 해본 적 없는데 많이 힘들어 보이더라
English: No, I've never done it, but it looks really hard.
Have you ever played badminton?

Korean: 응 배드민턴은 해 본 적 있어
English: Yeah, I've played badminton before.
Do you like bowling?
I also go bowling sometimes
Do you like billiards or pocket ball?
I like pocket ball
I can't play billiards
What size bowling ball should I hit?

Korean: 손에 힘이 별로 없어서 제일 작은 거로 쳐
English: I don't have much strength in my hands, so I hit with the smallest one.
Are you good at striking?

Korean: 아니 공 무게가 없어서 그건 잘 안되더라
English: No, that didn't work well because the ball didn't have any weight.
Are you good at handling spares?
Kiki, you're not even good at spares
Have you ever eaten ramen while playing a game?
Yeah, I tried ordering it at a PC room.
Do you go to PC rooms often?

Korean: 남자 친구 있을 땐 자주 가는 편이야
English: I go there often when I have a boyfriend
How much does it cost to play one game?
About an hour?
What's the longest game you've played?

Korean: 메이플 레벨업 시키느라 가장 오래 해봤어
English: I spent the longest time leveling up MapleStory
Do you like Tekken games?

Korean: 응 그거 오락실 가서 많이 해
English: Yeah, I do that a lot at the arcade.
Do you play joystick games often?
Yeah I like those games better
Are you good at BB gun games?

Korean: 그거는 한 번도 안 해봐서 모르겠어
English: I don't know because I've never done it before.
Have you ever fired a live gun?
No, real bullets are too scary

Korean: 요즘 여행 가기 제일 좋은 날씨인데 어디 다녀온 곳 있어?
English: These days are the best weather for traveling. Where have you been?

Korean: 응 나 저번 주에 제주도 다녀왔어
English: Yeah, I went to Jeju Island last week.
Oh really?
Where have you been?
I traveled mainly to the east and Seogwipo.
How was the weather that day?
It was really summer there...
I almost died from the heat
What did you ride when you went to Jeju Island?
I rented a car in Jeju Island and traveled around here and there.
Is there a place that you remember the most?

Korean: 응 오조 포구라는 관광지 처음 가봤는데 사람도 별로 없고 좋더라
English: Yeah, it was my first time going to a tourist destination called Ojo Port, and there weren't many people, so it was nice.
Did you go and eat a lot of delicious food?

Korean: 회랑 딱새우랑 흑돼지 등등 많이 먹고 왔어
English: I ate a lot of crabs, shrimp, black pork, etc.
Wow, what was the most delicious?

Korean: 흑돼지집 유명한 곳 갔는데 진짜... 레전드...
English: I went to a famous black pig restaurant and it was really... legendary...
It was a hit
Oh, let me know later too
I want to go there sometime!

Korean: 구래 담에 제주도 갈 때 말해 내가 알려줄게
English: When you go to Jeju Island next time, I'll tell you.

Korean: 오늘 갑자기 비 오던데 우산 있었어?
English: It suddenly started raining today. Did you have an umbrella?

Korean: 아니 운동 끝나고 나왔는데 비 와서 당황했어
English: No, I came out after working out and it started raining so I was shocked
Autumn is gone
What did you wear today?
That's what I'm saying
I wore a fleece over a knit today

Korean: 나 오늘 일어나자마자 플리스 인터넷에 검색해봤어 ...
English: As soon as I woke up today, I searched the internet for fleece...
It's cold...
It was really cold even when I wore a fleece
Will it be cold tomorrow too?
I think so
I heard a typhoon was coming. Did you see it?
Hey, what kind of typhoon is this in the fall?

Korean: 태풍 올 때 밖에 있던 적 있어?
English: Have you ever been outside when a typhoon came?

Korean: 아니 항상 집에 있었던 거 같아
English: No, I feel like I've always been at home

Korean: 비 올 때 바람 많이 불면 우비 입어?
English: If it's windy and rainy, do you wear a raincoat?
No we've never worn it haha

Korean: 비 오는 날 나가는 거 좋아해?
English: Do you like going out on rainy days?

Korean: 나는 비 오는 날 정말 싫어해
English: I really hate rainy days
Building a snowman on a snowy day?

Korean: 성인 되고 만들어 본 적 없는 거 같아 키키
English: I don't think I've ever made one since I became an adult. Kiki
Have you ever tried Bitcoin?

Korean: 아니 해 본 적 없어 무서워
English: No, I've never done it before, I'm scared
Have you ever seen a moving center line road?
No, what is that
First time hearing this

Korean: 외국에서 먼저 시작한 건데 차가 막히는 구간 있잖아~
English: It started overseas first, but there are some areas where the traffic is blocked~

Korean: 아 그럼 차가 막히는 곳에서는 중앙선이 알아서 움직이나 보네
English: Oh, so I guess the center line moves automatically in places where there is traffic.

Korean: 항상 내 쪽 막히는데 저쪽 안 막히네라고 생각한 적 있지?
English: Have you ever thought, "My side is always blocked, but their side isn't blocked?"
Yeah, that's right
There are times like that

Korean: 중앙선을 움직이는 차로 차선을 옆으로 옮겨준대
English: The car that moves the center line moves to the side.

what?
