Korean: 다른 만화 본 거 뭐 있어?
English: What other cartoons have you read?

Korean: 학생 때 도라에몽도 가끔 봤지 키키
English: When I was a student, I watched Doraemon and Kiki sometimes.
To kill time
Doraemon Nobita is so cute
Which one do you like the best?

Korean: 마자 하하 난 도라에몽이 제일 좋아
English: Hahaha I like Doraemon the best
I want to live together

Korean: 투니버스랑 챔프 중에 뭘 더 자주 봤어?
English: Which do you watch more often, Tooniverse or Champ?
I was definitely a Tooniverse fan Kiki
I had Ashley's for dinner tonight
Oh, what are they selling there these days?
They sell a lot of different things
What did you eat most deliciously?

Korean: 난 초밥 좋아해서 초밥 많이 먹었어
English: I like sushi so I ate a lot of sushi.

Korean: 오 또 맛있는 거 뭐 있어?
English: Oh, what else is delicious?
These days, they make rice noodles and pizza is delicious.

Korean: 오 완전 양식 일식 다 있구나
English: Oh, there are all kinds of Japanese food.

Korean: 응응 그래서 골라 먹기 좋은 거 같아
English: Yeah, so I think it's good to choose

Korean: 넌 양식 일식 한식 중식 중에 뭘 제일 좋아해?
English: What do you like best among Western, Japanese, Korean, and Chinese food?

Korean: 난 해산물 엄청 좋아해서 일식이 제일 좋아
English: I really like seafood, so Japanese food is my favorite.

Korean: 오 나는 요즘 중식에 빠졌어 키키
English: Oh I'm into Chinese food these days Kiki
Oh, what food do you eat during lunch?

Korean: 요즘 마라탕에 빠져서 못 헤어 나오고 있어
English: I'm so into spicy stew these days that I can't get out of it
I've never had mala-tang before
Come eat with me
I know a good restaurant
Have you lived in an apartment since you were young?

Korean: 아니 주택에서 살다가 초등학생 때 아파트로 이사 갔어
English: No, I lived in a house and then moved to an apartment when I was in elementary school.
What did you find convenient about living in an apartment?

Korean: 그 당시엔 엘레베이터 있는 게 가장 신났어
English: At that time, the most exciting thing was that there was an elevator.
There wasn't an elevator in the old house?

Korean: 응응 높게 살진 않았지만 계단이 힘들었어
English: Yeah, I didn't live very high up, but the stairs were hard.
Can I ask which floor you live on?
I lived on the 4th floor of a 5-story building at that time.

Korean: 와 대박 나는 주택 살 때 전세였는데...
English: Wow, I hit the jackpot when I bought the house...
My house was also rented at that time.

Korean: 지금이랑 그때랑 전세 가격 차이 생각해보면 답도 없겠지
English: If you think about the difference in rent prices between then and now, there's no answer.

Korean: 그치... 요즘은 전세 알아보다가 그냥 조금 더 해서 매매하니까
English: Right... These days, I look into renting and then just buy it for a little more.
Yes, that is the reality

Korean: 그게 맞는 걸까 집은 언제 생기려나
English: Is that right? When will the house be built?

Korean: 그러니까 이 정도 가격이면 뭐 손가락만 빨아도 앙델듯
English: So, at this price, I can suck my thumb and get a lot for free
The difference is so big that I'm confused

Korean: 나 곧 외근 가는데 새로운 도전이 있어
English: I'm going on a business trip soon and I have a new challenge.
Oh, what is it? What kind of challenge is it?
I have to take Line 9 to work.
Have you never ridden Line 9 during rush hour?

Korean: 응... 출퇴는 안 타봤어... 너 타봤어?
English: Yeah... I haven't ridden it... Have you ridden it?

Korean: 응 그냥 너의 의지는 없다고 생각하면 돼
English: Yeah, just think of it as you having no will.
Ah, can I just go with the flow?

Korean: 그냥 앞 사람이 가는 길 같이 가
English: Just follow the path the person in front of you is taking

Korean: 와 내가 살 수 있는 방법이구나
English: Wow, this is how I can live.

Korean: 꿀팁이야 그리고 한번에 탈 욕심 가지면 안돼
English: This is a good tip and don't be greedy and try to get rid of everything at once.

Korean: 어? 아 한번에 못 타고 인원 막 짤려?
English: Huh? Oh, you can't ride it all at once and the number of people keeps getting cut?
So you have to go out with plenty of time to spare

Korean: 헐 그럼 첫날 완전 여유롭게 나가야겠다!
English: Wow, then I guess I'll just have to take it easy on the first day!
What subway station is this on Line 9?
I think it's probably the National Assembly Station!
Have you been to that subway station?
It's going to be really tough
This is my first time working outside the office!
You look happy. Is it because you're in a good mood?
It's amazing that it's the first time, everything is amazing
Yeah, enjoying it is the best

Korean: 마자 너무 사람은 적응하는 동물이니까 다 적응하겠지
English: People are animals that adapt, so they will all adapt.

Korean: 다른 직장 때는 근무지가 한 곳이였어?
English: When you worked at other jobs, was your workplace just in one place?

Korean: 아 경호 때는 전국이여서 사실 나의 자리가 없었어
English: Ah, during the security service, it was nationwide, so there was really no place for me.
Nationwide? You go all over the place? Anywhere?
Yeah, I was a specialist in nationwide business trips.
Wow, which one is the farthest?

Korean: 목포 부산 이 정도 다 다녀왔지
English: I've been to Mokpo and Busan.
What was the longest period of time you were away on business?

Korean: 내가 3개의 지역을 17일 동안 돌아다닌 적이 있어
English: I once traveled to 3 areas for 17 days.
Wow, wow, I can't even go home for 17 days?

Korean: 응 그때 한 달에 두 번 쉬었어...
English: Yeah, I took two days off a month back then...
There was nothing like this on weekends and weekdays
My friend is a career soldier, contact me!
Huh? What did you say?
Now the vacation is over
So the whole country is free of charge?

Korean: 대신 거주지만 돌아다닐 수 있다는 것 같아
English: Instead, it seems like you can only walk around your residence
It is possible to take a vacation with restrictions
He's in the army and he's in Suwon!
But if a soldier gets caught, it's an emergency
That's right, since we all live together
Either way, it's too dangerous
So I came out and asked him what he wanted to do.
What did you say?

Korean: 그냥 술 술 술 먹고 싶대
English: I just want to drink alcohol alcohol
Kiki, you're a friend who really likes alcohol.

Korean: 아니 그냥 술을 먹고 싶대 키키 고픈가 봐
English: No, I just want to drink. Kiki must be hungry.

Korean: 거기 계속 있으면 그럴 수 있어
English: If you stay there, it could happen
Do you remember your teachers when you were in school?
I remember my 4th grade teacher
Does it remind you of elementary school?
What kind of person was he?

Korean: 영어 선생님이셨는데 영어 발음이 너무 매력 있었어
English: He was an English teacher, and his English pronunciation was so charming.

Korean: 요즘 컴활1급 준비하는 건 잘 되고 있어?
English: Are you going well with your preparation for the Level 1 Computer Proficiency Exam these days?
I want to be satisfied with level 2...
Is level 1 really necessary?

Korean: 거의 1급은 다 있어야 한다고 하더라 ㅜㅜ
English: They said that almost all 1st graders should have it ㅜㅜ
Do I just need to look at the level 1 practical test?
Yeah, I passed the level 1 written test.

Korean: 와 그래도 필기 붙은 것도 대단하다
English: Wow, it's amazing that the handwriting is still there

Korean: 필기 몇 번 떨어져서 진짜 어려웠어
English: It was really hard because I failed the writing test several times.
Where did you take the test?
I saw it at the Bucheon Chamber of Commerce
Oh, I saw it at the Incheon Chamber of Commerce and Industry
There are two in Incheon, right?

Korean: 사촌언니 필테 강사인데 직접 배우고 싶다
English: My cousin is a Pilte instructor and I want to learn directly from her.
Oh, where do you work?
I'm doing it in Wonju, Gangwon-do

Korean: 원주 놀러 가 본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever been to Wonju?

Korean: 응응 자주 가 센터는 주차장까지만 가봤어
English: Yeah, I go there often. I've only been to the parking lot.
Why did you go to the Kiki parking lot?
I dropped my sister off at work.
Oh, I bet your sister would have liked it

Korean: 운전 하는 거 안 좋아하는데 맨날 하고 다니거든 키키
English: I don't like driving, but I do it all the time Kiki
Oh, then you would have liked it more
Yeah, yeah, so you had a good expression even though you were going to work
You must have been proud~ You did a great job
I'll have to bring it to you next time too
Is your cousin also an only child?
No, I have a younger sister who is 3 years younger than me!
It would be cute if my sister was 3 years older
You said you wanted to date these days!
Yeah right I'm hungry now

Korean: 내가 한번 내 주위에서 찾아볼게 이상형은?
English: Let me look around me. What is my ideal type?

Korean: 키 크고 후드티 잘 어울리는 사람
English: A tall person who looks good in a hoodie
Oh, I guess I'll have to put on the hoodie first.
Ah Kiki yeah I like hoodies
What kind of person do you like in terms of personality?

Korean: 난 재밌게 같이 놀 수 있는 사람
English: I'm someone who can have fun hanging out with others

Korean: 오 맞아 중요하지 같이 있는 시간
English: Oh right, the time we spend together is important

Korean: 같이 있을 때 즐거운 시간이면 좋겠어 서로
English: I hope we have a good time together
It's important, it's important, I'll look it up
What is your ideal type?
I'm a pretty talker!
Is that okay? What about anything else?
I wish you would just speak nicely
I'll look for it too
You said you raised an iguana last time, right?
Yeah, I raised it when I was really young.
Why don't you raise it again?
It was harder to manage than I thought

Korean: 아 그렇긴 하겠다 토끼 키우는 건 어때?
English: Oh, that's true. How about raising a rabbit?
Then raise yourself first!
Sorry, my mom has a hair allergy.
I think I'm starting today too

Korean: 어머 어머 너 지금 토끼 싫다고 하는 거야?
English: Oh my, oh my, are you saying you don't like rabbits right now?

Korean: 아니 토끼 좋지 이쁘지 근데 우리 집에 들어오는 게 상상 안돼
English: No, the rabbit is nice and pretty, but I can't imagine it coming into my house.

Korean: 아 키키 키우는 건 또 다르니까~
English: Ah, raising Kiki is different~
Yeah, you should see it at the zoo.
My grandmother used to raise rabbits!
That's amazing. Where did you grow it?
Kiki, you raised me in the yard

Korean: 그래서 난 마당 잘 못 갔어
English: So I didn't go to the yard properly
Are you scared of rabbits? Of those cute rabbits?
Is your Pilates pass over now?
I have one left and I'm going next week
What kind of exercise are you doing now?
I'm running alone at the gym.
Oh, you can do it by yourself?

Korean: 혼자서 간단한 건 할 수 있지
English: I can do simple things by myself
I told you too, I can't do it
Will you listen to me?

Korean: 넌 내가 아프다고 하면 말 들어줄 거야?
English: Will you listen to me if I tell you I'm sick?
No? That's all a lie.
Oh, Mr. Lee, I can't do it. I won't learn.

Korean: 내가 잘 가르쳐줄게 나 생체 있잖아
English: I'll teach you well. I have a body.
So, do you want to learn dodgeball from me?
Hey, why me to you?

Korean: 나도 피구 지도자 자격증 있어 드루와
English: I also have a dodgeball coaching license.
Oh sorry I hate ball games
Did you know there's a Nexon Computer Museum?
I think it was said to be in Jeju Island
Yeah, have you been there?
No, I only saw it in pictures
I went there recently!
Oh, what is it? Is it fun?
Yeah, I have all Nexon games
Are all those games free?

Korean: 입장료 내고 들어간 후에는 다 무료!
English: After paying the admission fee, everything is free!
So how much is the admission fee?
I think it was eight thousand won!
If I pay that and go in, everything is free?
Yeah, is that okay?
There's a lot to see
What game did you go and play?

Korean: 철권 오래하고 그 막 총 쏘는 거 하고 난 거의 다 하고 왔지롱
English: I've been playing Tekken for a long time and I've been shooting guns and I'm almost done with it.
I should go there next time too
Is there a place you want to go on a trip abroad?

Korean: 난 너가 추천해준 블라디보스톡 가보고 싶어
English: I want to go to Vladivostok, which you recommended

Korean: 내가 계획 짜놓은 거 엑셀로 있어 그거 줄게
English: I have a plan in Excel, so I'll give it to you.

Korean: 고마워 너는 또 안 가고 싶어?
English: Thank you. You don't want to go again?
I want to go on a family trip
I guess it was really good to that extent

Korean: 근데 두 분을 모시고 잘 설명 드릴 수 있을까 싶어 키키
English: But I wonder if I can explain it well to you two.

Korean: 그래서 가족끼리 갈 때는 다 여행사 끼고 가더라
English: So when we go with family, we always go with a travel agency.

Korean: 맞아 너 블라디보스톡 궁금한 거 없어?
English: Right, do you have any questions about Vladivostok?
Have you ever ridden the train there?
Yeah, it's really clean and the space is spacious.
How did you mainly get around?

Korean: 기차 전철 그리고 거의 다 걸어 다녔어
English: I took the train, subway and walked most of the way.
Is the place you're looking at within walking distance?

Korean: 다 그렇게 계획하고 숙소도 꼭 그렇게 골랐어
English: I planned it all like that and even chose my accommodation like that.
Please show me that Excel

Korean: 집에 전기장판이랑 온수매트 중에 뭐 써?
English: What do you use at home, an electric blanket or a hot water mat?
Our house has an electric blanket. What about you?
I'm hot, mom and dad are hot too!
Don't you need to fill the water mat with water?
That's true, but it takes longer than you think!
It's getting cold these days, so I have to take it out

Korean: 그 날씨를 표현하는 게 있대 봤어?
English: Have you seen something that expresses the weather?
Hey, what's that? Tell me.
Boohoooo ...

Korean: 찰떡이다 여름이 진짜 길게 느껴져 키키
English: It's perfect. Summer feels really long Kiki
Where did fall really go?

Korean: 누구야 좋은 말 할 때 가을 가지고 와라
English: Who is it that brings autumn when you say nice things?

Korean: 그러니까 ㅜㅜ 가을이 제일 좋은디 너는?
English: So ㅜㅜ do you like fall the best?
I actually like summer

Korean: 헐 왜 그런 생각을 가지고 있어?
English: Wow, why do you think that?
What's wrong with you?
I don't feel the heat very well

Korean: 속초 최근에 놀러 간 적 있어?
English: Have you been to Sokcho recently?
No, why not?
As of midnight on the 22nd, it has been lowered to level 2!
Wow, it's been a while since I've heard of a 2-step thing

Korean: 그러니까 그래도 비수도권은 다행히 점점 떨어지고 있나 봐
English: So, fortunately, it seems like the non-metropolitan areas are gradually falling.

Korean: 그래 다들 이제 좀 정상으로 돌아와야지...
English: Okay, everyone needs to get back to normal now...

Korean: 생각해보니 어제 수요일이였는데 얼마나 확진자 나왔지?
English: Come to think of it, yesterday was Wednesday. How many confirmed cases were there?
There are more today...
Wow, how much? Even though it's Thursday today?
As of 6 o'clock, 141 more people came out...
Oh, so how many people are there in total?
As of 6pm, 1216 people are in the lab
Still, it doesn't go up to 2,000 people.
Yeah where is that really
I was surprised when you said it was three digits before.
Now just four digits...

Korean: 중국에서 아이들이 사고 친 거 봤어?
English: Have you seen the accidents that kids have in China?
No, why China again?
I'm angry even without listening
My father's insurance money, who passed away in 2019, has just been paid out...

Korean: 응응 왜 이렇게 늦게 나오신 거지?
English: Yeah, why are you out so late?
That's about 40 million won in our money.
How do children manage that?
My aunt is raising me now
Oh, then your aunt will take care of it~

Korean: 근데 형제가 고모 폰으로 게임을 했나 봐
English: But I think my brother played a game on my aunt's phone
Wait a minute, cell phone...? Why are you anxious?

Korean: 근데 게임하고 뭐 성인인증까지 해서 게임으로 탕진...
English: But I squandered all my money on games, including the adult verification...
Wow, that much money for a game?
So, that's also father's death insurance money...
Oh, how many children are they?
Elementary school student, 10 or 11 years old
I'm so upset... I lost my father's insurance money...
I'm into eyelash perms these days

Korean: 오 나 한번도 안 해봤는데 우때?
English: Oh I've never done it before, when?

Korean: 화장할 때 완전 편하고 예쁘게 해주셔서 좋아
English: I like it because it makes me feel comfortable and pretty when I put on makeup

Korean: 속눈썹 펌 가격은 얼마 정도 해?
English: How much does eyelash perm cost?

Korean: 매장마다 거의 다른데 내가 가는 곳은 3만원이야
English: It varies from store to store, but the place I go to costs 30,000 won.
It's cheaper than you thought?
How long does it take to maintain?
I think it'll take 6 or 7 weeks

Korean: 와 유지력 최고네 나도 알려줘 해보고 싶어
English: Wow, the staying power is the best. Please let me know. I want to try it too.
Do you still do your nails often these days?

Korean: 아니 손톱이 망가져서 안하고 있어 너는?
English: No, you're not doing it because your nails are damaged.

Korean: 나는 꾸준히 받고 있어 손톱 강화제 알려줄까?
English: I'm receiving it regularly. Should I tell you about a nail strengthener?
Yeah, tell me, I'm really serious...
I'm using Innisfree products and they're good.
Thank you, I'll buy it tomorrow

Korean: 구래 회사 주변에 이니스프리 있으면 무조건 들어가
English: If there is an Innisfree around your company, you have to go there.
I have to look it up before I go to bed tonight, Kiki
I had an InBody test yesterday and my body fat increased...
Oh my gosh, I'm so upset ㅜ

Korean: 웅 그래서 운동 빡쎄게 할라고 다시
English: Yeah, so I'm going to work out hard again

Korean: 체지방 빼는 건 진짜 어려운 거 같아
English: I think losing body fat is really difficult.
Do you also do InBody sometimes?

Korean: 나도 한 달에 한번씩 헬스장에서 재 하하
English: I also go to the gym once a month haha
Oh, then do you see the change well?

Korean: 아니 키키 생각보다 확 보이진 않더라고
English: No, Kiki, it wasn't as visible as I thought.
What kind of exercise do you often do at the gym?

Korean: 나는 매일 유산소랑 근육 운동해 키키
English: I do cardio and muscle training every day Kiki
Oh please tell me too I'm curious about the routine

Korean: 등 운동 하는 날은 하체랑 같이하고 가슴이랑 어깨 같이 해
English: On days when you work your back, do it with your lower body, and on days when you work your chest and shoulders, do it with your lower body.
Wow, it's so systematic and cool

Korean: 키키 나도 주변 사람들한테 얻어 온 정보야
English: Kiki, I also got this information from people around me.
So, do you also study exercise on YouTube?

Korean: 응 유튜브로 다른 사람 운동하는 거 보는 거 좋아해
English: Yeah, I like watching other people exercise on YouTube.

Korean: 너희 어머니도 쇼핑몰에서 쇼핑 자주 하셔?
English: Does your mother often shop at the mall?

Korean: 어우 말도마... 매일 집 앞에 택배가 있어
English: Oh, don't be ridiculous... There's a package in front of my house every day.
Ah Kiki, you look just like my mom

Korean: 너희 어머닌 어디 쇼핑몰에서 자주 쇼핑하셔?

Korean: 타는 거는 3번 타면 십만 원 넘게 나와
English: If you ride it three times, it will cost over 100,000 won

Korean: 키키 와 그거 장비 자체가 비싸서 그렇게 비싸게 받는 거?
English: Kiki, is that why you charge so much for the equipment itself?

Korean: 그치 장비 빌리고 배 타고 나가서 하는 거니까
English: Yeah, because you rent equipment and go out on a boat.
Kiki and daebak oh that's right
It must cost a lot to launch a boat!

Korean: 웅 그래서 여름에 가따 와서 통장 잔고 비었어
English: Yeah, so I came here in the summer and my bank account is empty.

Korean: 너는 학생 때 친구들이랑 피시방 자주 갔지?
English: When you were a student, did you often go to PC rooms with your friends?
Yeah, I lived every day like that
Kiki, you had dinner there too, right?

Korean: 웅 요즘에 피시방에 맛있는 거 많아
English: Yeah, there are a lot of delicious things in PC rooms these days.

Korean: 키키 그니까 너 그때 친구들이랑 뭐 했어?
English: Kiki: So what did you do with your friends back then?

Korean: 나는 친구들이랑 스타 게임 하는 거 좋아했어
English: I liked playing star games with my friends

Korean: 너 때는 아마 롤이 제일 인기였지 않았어?
English: Wasn't LoL the most popular back in your day?

Korean: 지금은 롤이 인기고 나는 옛날 게임 좋아했어
English: LoL is popular now and I liked old games

Korean: 아 그렇구나 키키 스타는 내가 아는 건 홍구밖에 없음!
English: Oh, I see. The only Kiki Star I know is Honggu!

Korean: 아 정말 나는 애들이 하도 많이 해서 따라했어
English: Oh really, I did it because the kids did it so much

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 학교 끝나고 피시방 간 거지?
English: Kiki, really? You went to the PC room after school, right?

Korean: 아니 학교 땡땡이 치고 많이 갔어
English: No, I skipped school a lot and went

Korean: 와 키키 간댕이가 이거 많이 부었구만!?
English: Wow, Kiki's liver is really swollen!?

Korean: 키키 누나 무섭게 왜 그렇게 말을 해 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki, why do you talk so scary? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 너 그때 내가 부모님 알고 있었으면 일렀다 진짜!
English: Kiki, if I had known my parents back then I would have told you!

Korean: 아 정말 키키 누나 나 혼나게 하지마
English: Ah, seriously, Kiki, don't make me mad
Have you traveled recently?
Yeah, I went to Yeosu.
Yeosu? When did you go there and come back?

Korean: 나 한 달 전인가 그때 다녀왔어
English: I went there about a month ago

Korean: 아 그때 딱 여수 가기 좋은 날이였겠다!
English: Ah, that must have been a perfect day to go to Yeosu!
Yeah, that's right, it's not that hot

Korean: 키키 맞아 여수 가면 낭만 포차 가는 거 알지?
English: Kiki, you know that when you go to Yeosu, you go to a romantic pocha, right?
Yeah, that's right, I definitely went with my friends.

Korean: 키키 아 친구들이랑 여행 간 거였어?
English: Kiki, did you go on a trip with your friends?

Korean: 웅 친구들이랑 가서 신나게 놀다 왔지
English: Yeah, I went with my friends and had fun.

Korean: 키키 친구 몇 명이서 갔다 왔어?
English: How many of Kiki's friends went with you?
I went with 4 friends and it was so much fun
Oh, I see. How was Kiki's accommodation?

Korean: 숙소는 우리는 남자라 그냥 모텔에서 잤어
English: As for accommodation, we were men so we just slept in a motel.

Korean: 키키 모텔에서 두 명씩 짝 지어서 잤어?
English: Did you sleep in pairs at the Kiki Motel?
There were two beds in the motel, so we slept in twos.
Did you go out today?

Korean: 웅 나 밖에 갈비 먹고 들어왔어
English: Yeah, I just came in after eating ribs
Wow, I'm jealous, what was the weather like outside?
But it was so cold...
Home is the best

Korean: 아 진짜? 오늘 밖에 날씨 좋았다던데?
English: Oh really? You said the weather was nice outside today?

Korean: 아 진짜 나는 반팔 입고 나갔다 왔어
English: Oh seriously, I went out wearing short sleeves

Korean: 키키 그래서 그렇지 요즘 날씨에 무슨 반팔이야!
English: Kiki: That's why, why are you wearing short sleeves in this weather?

Korean: 아 오늘 날씨 좋다 하길래 그러고 나갔지
English: Oh, I went out because they said the weather was nice today

Korean: 키키 그렇구먼 키키 겉옷도 안 챙기고 나갔어?
English: Kiki, I see. Kiki, you went out without even bringing an outer garment?
Yeah, I didn't pack it
I'm a real man

Korean: 키키 상남자인데 그 추위 하나도 못 견디고 와!?
English: Kiki is a manly man, but you can't stand that cold!?

Korean: 아 미안... 추운 건 못 이기겠다
English: Oh, sorry... I can't stand the cold.

Korean: 키키 인정 키키 나는 집이 창문 안 열었음 키키
English: Kiki admit Kiki I didn't open the windows at home Kiki

Korean: 아 누나는 추위 많이 탈 거 같아
English: Oh, I think you'll catch a cold a lot, sister

Korean: 키키 나 당연하지 나는 감기도 쉽게 걸려!
English: Kiki Of course I catch a cold easily!
Oh, really be careful
Wear padding and go out

Korean: 이번에 우리나라에서 로켓 발사한 거 알았어?
English: Did you know that our country launched a rocket this time?
Huh? I really didn't know.

Korean: 웅 키키 누리호라고 며칠 전에 발사했었어!
English: Yeah, Kiki Nuriho was launched a few days ago!
Oh wow that's really cool, rocket launch

Korean: 키키 그니까 근데 결국에 달까지는 못 갔대!
English: Kiki: That's right, but in the end, they didn't make it to the moon!

Korean: 아 그럼 허무했겠다 달까지 못 가서
English: Oh, then it would have been a waste not to be able to go to the moon

Korean: 키키 그러니까 근데 이번에는 시범 발사여서 어느 정도 예상했었대!
English: Kiki: Well, this time it was a test launch, so I kind of expected it!
Ah, I really have to look forward to it later
That's right, they're launching again in May next year!
It won't be long until May next year.

Korean: 맞아 이번에 성공적으로 진입하면 9년 뒤에 진짜 보낸대!
English: That's right, if you successfully enter this time, you'll be sent for real in 9 years!
Oh, that's really cool
I want to see it too

Korean: 키키 나도 근데 이거 한 번 발사하는데 드는 비용이 얼마인 줄 알아?
English: Kiki Me too, but do you know how much it costs to launch one of these?
How much does it cost to fire one shot?
It's in units of 1 trillion?
Wow, right!?
It costs a lot of money!
Huh? The sunlight is crazy, really awesome
Ogames are totally popular in our country right now!
Oh, I know
It's really so much fun
China plagiarized our program again~
Oh really, China plagiarized it?

Korean: 키키 어 오겜을 이제 오징어의 승리라고 프로그램을 만들었대
English: Kiki Oh, now I made a program that says Ogem is the squid's victory
Oh, why is China like that?
You're a copycat

Korean: 키키 근데 여기는 런닝맨도 그렇고 다른 프로그램도 많이 표절했었잖아!
English: Kiki, but here, Running Man and other programs have plagiarized a lot too!
Ah, Running Man is fun
So it's worth plagiarizing

Korean: 근데 이번에는 중국 사람들이 챙피하지도 않냐고 맹비난을 했대!
English: But this time, the Chinese people fiercely criticized him, saying that he was ashamed!
Oh really Kiki, this must be embarrassing

Korean: 키키 맞아 그래서 결국에 이 프로그램 폐지했대 키키
English: Kiki That's right, so in the end they canceled the program Kiki
Ah, it's embarrassing enough to disappear

Korean: 키키 그니까 예고만 나오고 끝나버림 키키
English: Kiki, so it ends with just a preview Kiki

Korean: 아 우리나라는 그런 일이 없도록 해야겠다
English: Ah, we need to make sure that something like that doesn't happen in our country.

Korean: 근데 표절이 아닌 그 프로그램 상표를 사오는 건 괜찮지!
English: But it's okay to buy the trademark of that program as long as it's not plagiarized!
Oh really, the program doesn't matter

Korean: 너는 화장 같은 거 안 해?
English: Don't you wear makeup or anything?
Oh man, what kind of makeup is that?

Korean: 키키 왜 내 남자인 친구는 화장 해!
English: Kiki why is my boyfriend wearing makeup!
I just put on sunscreen and that's it
Kiki, but where is the sunscreen!
Yeah, you have to apply it for your skin.

Korean: 키키 맞아 내 남친도 내가 꼭 발라줌 키키
English: Kiki, that's right, my boyfriend also makes sure to apply it to me Kiki
Otherwise it'll be completely blackened
I envy your boyfriend

Korean: 키키 아니야 내가 발라줄 때만 바르고 자기 스스로 안 바름
English: Kiki no, she only applies it when I apply it, she doesn't apply it herself.
Oh really, men are annoying

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 내 남사친은 진짜 비비까지 바른다니까?
English: Kiki, that's right, but my boyfriend really uses BB cream too?
Oh my gosh, Vivi is really awesome.

Korean: 키키 대박이지 걔가 나보다 화장품 더 많을걸?
English: Kiki, you're awesome! You must have more cosmetics than me!

Korean: 웅 대박 진짜 왜 그런데... 키키
English: Wow, really, why is that... Kiki

Korean: 키키 뭐 요즘에는 남자도 화장하는 시대잖아~
English: Kiki, these days even men wear makeup~

Korean: 그치 이해해주자 남자인 나는 이해 못하겠지만 하하
English: Okay, please understand, I'm a man so I won't understand haha

Korean: 나 아까부터 머리가 왜 이렇게 아프지?
English: Why has my head been hurting so much since a while ago?
Oh, I'm dizzy too
Why is that so?

Korean: 어 진짜? 이거 찬바람 맞아서 그런가?
English: Oh really? Is this because I got hit by the cold wind?

Korean: 근데 계절 바뀌면 이석증도 많이 온대
English: But when the seasons change, kidney stones also come out a lot.

Korean: 이석증? 그거는 어떤 증상이 나오는 건데?
English: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo? What are the symptoms?

Korean: 웅 어지러움 병이라는데 가만히 있다가 옆으로 돌면 어지러운 거 있어
English: Yeah, I have a disease called dizziness. When I stay still and then turn to the side, I feel dizzy.

Korean: 그렇구나 그거 심해지면 토도 할 수 있는 건가?
English: I see. If it gets worse, you might vomit?

Korean: 아 진짜 토할 수도 있어 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, I might really throw up ㅠㅠ
Yeah, a lot
Wow, what would I do with that?
Oh really, that's not it
You must have a cold

Korean: ㅜㅜ 그니까 나는 지금 방 공기가 차서 그런 거일 수도 있어!
English: ㅜㅜ So it might be because the air in my room is cold right now!

Korean: 아 정말 키키 언능 보일러 틀어
English: Ah really Kiki, turn on the boiler

Korean: 키키 그래야겠다 너는 왜 아픈 거야?
English: Kiki, that must be it. Why are you sick?
I think I'm sick from stress

Korean: 헐 오늘 스트레스 받을 일이 있었어?
English: Oh, did something stress you out today?

Korean: 오늘 하루 종일 일하느라 스트레스 받았어
English: I was stressed out from working all day today.
Do you use your card a lot too?

Korean: 웅 나는 체크 카도 많이 쓰고 있어
English: Yeah, I use check cards a lot too

Korean: 근데 너 외제차는 돈 어떻게 주고 산 거야?
English: But how did you pay for that foreign car?
Oh, I'm paying it off in installments.

Korean: 대박 키키 설마 백 프로 할부인 거야!?
English: Wow Kiki, is this really a 100% installment plan!?

Korean: 웅 키키 백 프로야 돈이 어딨어 내가
English: Yeah Kiki Baek Pro, where is the money?

Korean: 와 대박 키키 너 그거 언제까지 갚아야 돼?
English: Wow, awesome Kiki. How long do you have to pay that back?

Korean: 나 이 년 정도 갚아야 할걸? ㅠㅠ 휴
English: I guess I'll have to pay it back in about two years? ㅠㅠ Sigh

Korean: 와오 키키 달에 얼마씩 내고 있어?
English: Wow Kiki, how much do you pay per month?
I'm paying about 800 thousand won

Korean: 와 근데 너 월급으로 생활이 가능해? 그렇게 갚고?
English: Wow, but can you live off your salary? Paying it off like that?
I'm okay living at home

Korean: 부럽다 키키 그러면 어디 대출 받아서 산 거야?
English: I'm jealous Kiki. Then where did you borrow money to buy it?
Oh, I got a loan from Nonghyup Bank.
How much does Kiki Wao pay?
It's okay because the interest rate isn't that high

Korean: 너 최근에 제일 재밌게 봤던 예능이 뭐야?
English: What's the most entertaining entertainment show you've seen recently?
I'm having fun watching Spau
Oh, you're talking about Supa?
Is that dancing?

Korean: 아 키키 스우파 맞아 맞아 그거
English: Ah Kiki Supa, that's right, that's right

Korean: 키키 맞아 나는 그거 유튜브로만 보는데!
English: Kiki, that's right, I only watch that on YouTube!

Korean: 나 그거 맨날 친구랑 춤 따라해
English: I dance to that with my friends all the time

Korean: 키키 헐 너 노제 춤 따라할 수 있으?
English: Kiki, can you follow Noje's dance?
Hey then I'm good at dancing
Why is it like this

Korean: 와 대박 키키 너 그러면 릴스 좀 올려라!
English: Wow, awesome Kiki, then turn up the reels!
I'm a dancer Kiki
Do you want to do reels together? Sister
Kiki, no, I'm skinny so take it out~
Oh really, I'll tell you
Kiki no i'm fine
I'll give you a heart for what you posted~
No, don't refuse
I'll tell you
Kiki no i'm really fine
I'll just watch from afar~
Oh, I see
Then I'll show you what I'm doing!

Korean: 너도 학생 대 웹툰 많이 봤지?
English: Have you seen a lot of student-to-student webtoons?
Yeah, I read a lot of webtoons every day.

Korean: 키키 너가 제일 재밌게 봤던 웹툰이 뭐야?
English: Kiki, what's the funniest webtoon you've ever read?
I've watched Fashion King a lot

Korean: 아 소름 키키 지금은 복학왕인가 그거 연재하고 있지?
English: Ah, creepy Kiki. Is that the Return of the King series being serialized now?
Have you seen your sister every day?
I'm watching the Return of Superman

Korean: 키키 나는 패션왕 그 늑대로 바뀌고 난 뒤로 하차함 키키
English: Kiki I am the fashion king. After turning into that wolf, I got off Kiki

Korean: 아 진짜 나 기안84 너무 좋아
English: Oh seriously I really like Kian84

Korean: 키키 나도 기안84 너무 좋아 ㅜㅜ
English: Kiki I also really like Kian84 ㅜㅜ
I hope you continue the series!

Korean: 너무 엉뚱하지만 그래도 너무 잘 그려
English: It's so weird, but still so well drawn

Korean: 키키 맞아 잘 그리는 것보다 되게 눈에 잘 들어오게 그리는 거 같아!
English: Kiki: Yes, I think it's better to draw in a way that catches the eye rather than drawing well!
The content is fresh and fun
I'm like this

Korean: 키키 맞아 진짜 딱 너 같은 느낌이야!
English: Kiki, that's right, it feels exactly like you!
Yeah, that's right, you think so too, sister.

Korean: 키키 응 딱 보자마자 너라고 생각했었어!
English: Kiki: Yeah, I thought it was you the moment I saw you!

Korean: 아 진짜 왜 그렇게 생각을 했대
English: Oh really, why did you think that?
That would be good

Korean: 엄마 오늘 친구 분들 만나서 뭐 먹으 꺼야?
English: Mom, what are we going to eat when we meet our friends today?
I haven't decided yet. Can you recommend something?
Where did you say you were going?
I'll meet you at Yeonsu Station
If it's Yeonsu Station, there's also gopchang and makchang!
What is the name of the restaurant?
It's a chain called Gwangmyeong Daechangjip, and the Yeonsu branch is famous.
Do you cook all the tripe and makchang?
Oh my, it's so good that you grilled it all over charcoal.
I can eat comfortably. I'll go.
Then the cafe is not available?
Then, can you recommend a cafe too?
Actually, the cafe is Starbucks Kiki
What menu do you eat often?
I'm into cold brew these days
Then I'll try it

Korean: 우리 집 공사 언제 할 거야?
English: When are you going to finish the construction on our house?
The weather is nice so we should do it soon
Have you decided on the interior design?
This time I'm going to do it in white
White is nice and clean

Korean: 블랙하니까 먼지 쌓인 게 다 보여
English: Because it's black, you can see all the dust that's accumulated

Korean: 아이고 그렇지 근데 먼지 쌓이기 전에 닦아줘도 되는데~ 그치?
English: Oh, that's right, but you could wipe it off before the dust accumulates, right?
But it all gets covered in dust

Korean: 그런 건강...하하 베란다 문 열어 놔서 그런가 부다
English: Such health...haha maybe because I left the veranda door open

Korean: 그래 베란다도 트면 더 그럴 거야
English: Yeah, it'll be even better if you open the veranda too.
If you open it, the house will be bigger
But I'm still thinking about it
Why? What are you worried about?
They say it's too cold in the winter
Is it too hot in the summer...?

Korean: 그럴 수 있다고 해서 고민 중이지
English: I'm worried because it might be possible
Have you been to Incheon Terminal recently?
No, why didn't you go?

Korean: 원래 원주 갈 때 큐알코드 이니였잖아!
English: When you originally went to Wonju, there was a QR code!
Did you submit it as a form?
Yeah, oh my goodness, but now it's a QR code!
So, has it changed now?

Korean: 응 그래서 나 어제 큐알로 찍고 탔어!
English: Yeah, that's why I took a QR code and rode yesterday!
Where can I get the QR code?

Korean: 시외버스 어플로 예약하면 받을 수 있지롱
English: You can get it if you reserve it through the intercity bus app.

Korean: 그 어플로 시간 보고 예약하는 거니?
English: Are you using that app to check the time and make a reservation?

Korean: 응 맞앙 바로 폰으로 할 수 있엉
English: Yeah, that's right, you can do it right on your phone.

Korean: 인천 터미널에서 원주 터미널은 얼마나 걸리니?
English: How long does it take from Incheon Terminal to Wonju Terminal?

Korean: 원래 2시간 넘는다고 써있는데 한 시간 사십 분 정도 걸린 것 같아!
English: It originally said it would take over 2 hours, but I think it took about an hour and 40 minutes!
Isn't the traffic congested?

English: How to avoid being scammed This would also be good

Wow, you became independent quickly, my friend.

English: If you live alone, you get sick alone and eat alone, so you get lonely.

Korean: 그건 겪어봐야 확 와 닿을 거 같다,

Are you going to invite me to your housewarming party?

Korean: 당연한 소리 양손 무겁게 와야 돼 키키
English: Of course, both hands should be heavy Kiki

Was my friend a cool guy all year?

Elevator is important, you want a high floor?

Korean: 완전 오랜만이라 설레 최근에 기차 타고 어디 가봤어?

Korean: 오 뭐야 너 생각보다 되게 자주 탔네

Korean: 정말 코로나가 세상을 다 바꿔 놨네...
English: Corona really changed the world...

Korean: 진짜... 그래서 친구랑 같이 못 가고 따로 갔어 ㅜ

Wow, I really empathize with this...
Of course I don't have much money, but Kiki

English: ㅜㅜ But don't feel too pressured. Just take a break and then change jobs again.

Korean: 나도 너 공부할 때 같이 공부해야겠어 키키

Wow, really? You're so cool.

Korean: 그치 ㅜ 무서울 거 같아 그런 일은...

Korean: 오... 대박이야... 그 당시에는 엄청 까이기도 했겠다 ㅜ

Korean: 그렇구나 거긴 진짜 다 대량이라 힘드셨을 가 같아...

Korean: 어릴 때 도전 정신 키워 놓으면 좋지

Korean: 오 처음 들어 봐 뭐가 좋은 거야?

English: I don't remember the details, but did you say that it helps you develop sociability? I think it was something like that.
Sociability is very important, you should know that Kiki

Korean: 그래 나중에 잘 키우라는 의미로 하나 사줄게

My aunt is opening a store soon

How about giving each other gifts right away?

Korean: 오 좋지 의미 있네 그거 참
English: Oh good, that makes sense
Kiki, did your aunt originally do that?

Korean: 아니 갑자기 관심 생기셔서 배우셨다가 오픈하셨어 키키
English: No, you suddenly became interested and learned about it and then opened it. Kiki

Korean: 와 역시 배움엔 나이가 없는 게 맞는 말이야... 멋있으셔 ㅜ

Ego Nari, you too are suffering...

I'm serious about Kiki Ski Resort.

Then, this time, go skiing with me too!

Korean: 옛날 노래도 추억이겠지만 요즘 노래가 신나긴 하지
English: Old songs are nostalgic, but new songs are exciting.
When it re-releases, do you want to do it with me?

Let's make a reservation in advance

Korean: 곧 겨울인데 어디로 여행 가고 싶어?

Korean: 오호 난 겨울에 가본 적은 없는 거 같아

Korean: 남쪽이라 그런지 날씨도 확실히 따뜻하고 좋더라구!
English: Maybe because it's in the south, the weather is definitely warm and nice!
If you go and take a picture, it will definitely be the picture of a lifetime, right?

Korean: 음... 생각보다 동해 바다 구경하러 가는 거도 좋더라

Wow, it must be really cold?

Korean: 마자 진짜 귀가 떨어질 거 같았지만 겨울에 바다 보니까 가슴이 뚫리더라 하하
English: I thought my ears would fall off right away, but when I saw the ocean in the winter, my heart thumped haha

English: Even if I'm tired and exhausted in the morning, I feel good when I see the sunrise. Kiki

English: Oh right, the article said to be careful about the extreme daily temperature range.

Korean: 이제 진짜 패딩 입어야 하나, 아직 10월인데,
English: Should I really wear padding now? It's still October.
The weather these days is really hopeless

It would be nice weather if the wind didn't blow.

Korean: 가을인데 단풍 구경도 못할 거 같아

Korean: 아니 자주는 못 가고 가끔 보러 강원도 가 하하
English: No, I can't go often, but I go to Gangwon-do to see it sometimes haha

I've been to Seoraksan and Odaesan.

Korean: 요즘 주식들 다 파란불이던데 넌 어때?

My stocks are all blue, so I'm depressed...
Oh my, you lost a lot?

Korean: 아니 다행히 많이 넣진 않아서 얼마 안 잃었지만...

Korean: 어이구 얼마 안 잃어도 아깝지 ㅜ

Korean: 마자 그래서 요즘 주식어플 안 들어가... 키키

Korean: 주식 한참 붐이였을 때 할까 했는데 안 하길 잘했다...

Korean: 주변 사람들이 해보라 해도 절대 하지마...

You have to be careful with coins these days too

Korean: 아휴... 나도 아는 지인의 친구 동생이 대출해서 엄청 넣었는데 다 잃어서 집안 난리 났다더라
English: Oh my... I know a friend's younger sibling borrowed a lot of money and lost it all, so the house was in chaos.
Oh my, if he's my younger sibling, he's still young...
So how did you get the loan...
Wow, the interest rate will be huge. This is a big deal.

Korean: 응 본인이 해결하려다가 도저히 안되겠어서 부모님께 말했다고 하더라구...
English: Yeah, he said he tried to solve it himself but couldn't, so he told his parents...
There's a lot of talk about Samsung phones in Russia...
Huh? What's the problem?
It's currently in danger of being banned from sale!
What? What did I do wrong?

Korean: 삼성전자 스마트폰이 스위스 모바일 결제 서비스 업체 기술을 무단으로 사용했다네...
English: Samsung Electronics smartphones have been found to have used Swiss mobile payment service provider technology without permission...
Wow, is that really true?
The local court accepted the lawsuit...

Korean: 이런... 현지에서 받아들인 거면 어쩔 수 없겠네
English: Well... if it was accepted locally, then there's nothing we can do about it.

Korean: 유럽 쪽에서 이틀 동안 허리케인급 폭풍이 몰아쳤대
English: A hurricane-force storm swept across Europe for two days.
Oh my, I hope there were no casualties.
The article said 4 people died in Poland.
Oh my... This kind of story is really sad...

Korean: 아 인도에선 상상치도 못한 일 있었더라
English: Oh, something unimaginable happened in India.

Korean: 아니 인도에선 뭔 일이 있었던 거야!
English: Hey, what happened in India!

Korean: 어느 30대 남성 분이 원숭이가 던진 벽돌에 맞아서 숨졌대
English: A man in his 30s died after being hit by a brick thrown by a monkey.

Korean: 와 살다 살다 원숭이가 던진 돌에 사람이 맞아 죽었다는 기사는 처음 보네...
English: Wow, this is the first time I've seen an article about a person dying from a rock thrown by a monkey...
It's been a while since I've been to the hair salon.
Is there a beauty salon you often go to?

Korean: 응 나 작년에 미용실 옮겨서 거기만 다녀 키키
English: Yeah, I moved to a new beauty salon last year, so I only go there.
Oh, that place must be doing well!

Korean: 머리도 잘 자르시고 잘 만져주시더라고 하하
English: He cut my hair well and stroked it well haha

Korean: 항상 너 마음에 들게 잘 해주시는구나?
English: Are you always doing things that please me?

Korean: 맞아 고객의 니즈를 굉장히 잘 아셔
English: Yes, you know your customers' needs very well.
I want to go later too! Let me know.

Korean: 그래 미용실 갈 때쯤 얘기해 알려줄겡
English: Okay, I'll tell you when I go to the hair salon.
How do you take care of your skin?

Korean: 요즘엔 그냥 일주일에 3번 정도 팩하려고 노력 중이야
English: These days, I'm just trying to use a pack about 3 times a week.
Oh, so you manage it with a mask pack?

Korean: 응응 마스크 팩 쓰면 다음날 피부가 진정되고 좋더라고
English: Yeah, yeah, when I use a mask pack, my skin calms down and feels good the next day.

Korean: 너가 알고 있는 좋은 제품 있어?
English: Do you know of any good products?

Korean: 음 제품이라기 보단 난 티트리 들어가 있는 거 위주로 써
English: Well, rather than a product, I mainly use products that contain tea tree.
Oh tea tree... I have to memorize it, Kiki. Thank you.
Wow, today I ran 10km along the Han River for the first time in a long time.
Wow, how did you run 10 kilometers?

Korean: 삘 받아서 뛰다 보니 10키로가 되었더라 키키
English: I got tired of running and ended up doing 10 kilometers. Kiki
You're really in good shape... How long did it take?

Korean: 난 그냥 여유롭게 한 시간 삼사십 분 걸린 거 같아
English: I think it took me an hour and thirty minutes at a leisurely pace.

Korean: 아 그냥 체력 키우려고 뛴 거구나
English: Oh, you just ran to build up your stamina.

Korean: 응응 근데 하다 보니까 재밌어서 내년이 마라톤 나가볼까 봐
English: Yeah, but it was fun so I think I'll run a marathon next year.

Korean: 와우 키키 마라톤 도전하기 쉽지 않을 텐데
English: Wow, it won't be easy to challenge the Kiki Marathon.
How about starting with 10km and working my way up to a half-full course?

Korean: 야 그럼 너 건강은 진짜 좋아지겠다 키키
English: Hey then your health will really get better Kiki

Korean: 그치 키키 이제 건강 챙겨야 할 나이가 다가오니까...
English: Right, Kiki, you're getting to the age where you need to take care of your health...

Korean: 마자... 나도 너 본받아서 건강 챙겨야지
English: Maja... I should follow your example and take care of my health too.
How do you take care of yourself these days?

Korean: 난 그냥 계단 걷기나 비타민 먹으면서 챙겨
English: I just take care of myself by walking up the stairs or taking vitamins.
Still, I'm taking good care of it

Korean: 이 마저도 안 하면 몸이 날 혼낼 거 같아 키키
English: If I don't do even this, my body will probably get mad at me Kiki
Where can I check the lowest price?
Aren't you typing it on Naver?

Korean: 거기도 아느긴 하는데 나는 따로 검색해
English: I know it's there too, but I searched for it separately
Then where do you search?
There's a site called enuri.com!
Does it come up if you search there?

Korean: 응응 상품 명이나 상품 번호 적으면 돼
English: Yes, just write the product name or product number.
This is really good. I'll take note.
Where do you usually order?

Korean: 아 자동 로그인 되어 있는 곳
English: Ah, it's automatically logged in
How many of those do you usually have?
There are about three
What sites are these?
Coupang 11st Gmarket
Oh, which one is the best?
I love Coupang
Have you ever seen those delicious guys?
I often see this when I eat alone
Oh, you watch it while eating?
Yeah I see you often
I often see it in pictures too
Are you watching a drama?
I saw Jirisan that started yesterday
Who's there?
Joo Ji-hoon, Jeon Ji-hyun, etc!
Oh, the lineup is already awesome?
Yeah, acting is no joke
So what about the content?
Okay, okay, this is so much fun.
Which broadcasting station's drama is this?
I'm holding it in my arms because it's TVN
Oh, is that the 15th anniversary drama this time?

Korean: 맞을 거야 나도 그거로 알고 있어
English: That's right, I know that too

Korean: 유미의 세포들 아직도 자주 보고 있어?
English: Do you still watch Yumi's Cells often?
I'm also reading webtoons again
Wow, isn't that paid?
Yes, I am investing
Wow, I want to see it too, show me
I'll tell you my ID, so take that as an example
Wow, you're rich
I don't pay for webtoons coolly

Korean: 대박 신기해 난 한번도 안 해봤어...
English: Wow, that's amazing. I've never done this before...
Once you do it, you get addicted and keep doing it Kiki
Oh, then I'll be in trouble if I miss it

Korean: 맞아 키키 난 네이버 자주 결제해
English: Yeah Kiki I often pay with Naver

Korean: 네이버랑 다른 곳 웹툰 또 뭐 있어?
English: Are there any other webtoons other than Naver?
There's also the next webtoon
Where is it easier to see?
I only see it on Naver
After all, cake is best when eaten whole!
Cake I like cheesecake

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 나는 초코케이크를 제일 좋아해!
English: Kiki Oh really? I like chocolate cake the best!
Where do you like to buy things, sister?

Korean: 나는 근데 음, 빵집마다 다른 거 같아!
English: I think it's different at each bakery though!
I like Starbucks cheesecake

Korean: 키키 와 스벅, 거기는 카스테라가 존맛인 듯!
English: Kiki and Starbucks, the Castella cake there seems to be really good!

Korean: 아 맞아 누나 먹을 줄 안다
English: Oh right, sister knows how to eat

Korean: 키키 당연하지 나는 근데 커피를 못 마심!
English: Kiki Of course I can't drink coffee!
Oh, that's exactly like me

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 진짜 나는 한 모금만 마셔도 그날 잠을 못 자 ㅜ
English: Kiki, really? Seriously, I won't be able to sleep that night even if I drink just one sip.

Korean: 나도 커피 잘 못 마셔 가슴이 두근거려
English: I can't drink coffee well either, so my heart pounds

Korean: 맞아 키키 나도 그래! 우리는 커피 마시면 안 돼!
English: Yeah Kiki, me too! We shouldn't drink coffee!

Korean: 아 진짜 카페인 안 맞는 거야
English: Oh, seriously, caffeine doesn't suit me

Korean: 맞아 그래서 나 스벅가서 디저트 시키고 항상 핫초코 시킴!
English: Yeah, that's why I always order dessert and hot chocolate at Starbucks!

Korean: 웅 맞아 나도 스벅가서 에이드만 마셔
English: Yeah, that's right. I also go to Starbucks and just drink ade.

Korean: 와 진짜 옆집 싸우는 소리 진짜 듣기 싫다!
English: Wow, I really hate hearing the sound of people fighting next door!
Oh, do you really fight every day?

Korean: 어 오늘도 아침에 소리 지르는 소리로 깼어
English: Oh, I woke up to screaming this morning too

Korean: 아 정말 진짜 소리 때문에 힘들겠다
English: Oh, really, really, it must be hard because of the sound

Korean: ㅜㅜ 맞아, 나의 알람 소용이 없게 됐쥬,
English: ㅜㅜ That's right, my alarm is now useless.
Oh, that would be great

Korean: 흙흙 ㅜㅜ 아니지 맨날 안 좋은 소리도 먼저  일어나잖아 ㅜ
English: Hurry up ㅜㅜ No, bad things always happen first ㅜ
Oh, I really hate this

Korean: 키키 그치, 이제 이것도 딱 두 달이면 끝나!
English: Kiki, right? This will be over in exactly two months!
Oh, so you decided to move now?

Korean: 어! 이제 다른 곳으로 떠날 예정이야!
English: Oh! I'm going to go somewhere else now!

Korean: 아 정말 다행이다 소리 안 듣고
English: Oh, thank goodness I didn't hear that

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 또 갔는데 여기보다 심한 곳이면 어떡하지?
English: Kiki, that's right, but what if I go again and it's worse than here?

Korean: 아 진짜 그럼 누나랑 안 맞는 거다
English: Oh really, then you and your sister don't get along

Korean: 키키 나는 그냥 서울이랑 안 맞나 봐~
English: Kiki I guess I just don't fit in with Seoul~

Korean: 아 그래도 난 서울에서 살고 싶다
English: Oh, but I still want to live in Seoul
You have a car now!
Yeah right I'm full
Oh, you bought that with full options?
Yeah, I bought it with full options.

Korean: 와 쩐다, 외제차에 풀옵이면 금액이 얼마야!?
English: Wow, that's crazy, how much would it cost to get full options on a foreign car!?

Korean: 웅 그래야 여자 꼬실 수 있지
English: Yeah, that's how you can seduce women.

Korean: 키키 오키 그래서 그 차로 여자 많이 꼬심?
English: Kiki Oki So you pick up a lot of girls with that car?

Korean: 웅 그래서 지금 여자친구가 나 좋아하잖아
English: Yeah, so my girlfriend likes me now.

Korean: 키키 와 대박 키키 외제차는 풀옵이라고 하면은 보통 뭐가 들어가는 거야?
English: Kiki, wow, daebak Kiki, when you say a foreign car is full option, what usually comes with it?
Um just the sheet and the light
Light? What was that called?
I don't remember

Korean: 웅 머지 나도 기억이 잘 안 난다
English: Yeah, I don't remember very well either

Korean: 그래서 너는 지금 차에 만족하고 있는 거지?
English: So are you satisfied with your car now?

Korean: 아니 다른 차로 바꾸고 싶어 돈 모아서
English: No, I want to change to another car and save up money
Kiki, wake up!
You should ride that for at least 10 years!

Korean: 키키 나 아직 철이 없나 봐
English: Kiki, I guess I'm still immature
Did you ever work part-time when you were in high school?

Korean: 웅 나 고딩 때 알바 많이 해봤지
English: Yeah, I did a lot of part-time jobs when I was in high school.

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 근데 논산에 할 곳이 많아?
English: Kiki Oh really? But are there a lot of places to do in Nonsan?
There are just cafes and bars

Korean: 아니 님아 고딩 때 술집을 어떻게 가나?
English: Hey, sir, how do you go to a bar when you're in high school?

Korean: 아 그건 성인 때 했지 대학다닐 때
English: Oh, I did that when I was an adult, when I was in college.

Korean: 키키 거기는 딱 20살 때 알바 했던 곳이지?
English: Kiki, that's the place you worked part-time when you were exactly 20 years old, right?
Yeah, of course I did it when I was 20.

Korean: 맞아 나 기억나 너 엄청 바빴잖아!
English: Yeah, I remember you being super busy!
Yeah, that's right, it was really hard

Korean: 키키 맞아 그때는 코시국도 아니어서 사람 진짜 많았잖아!
English: Kiki, that's right, it wasn't even Kosic back then, so there were a lot of people!
Yeah, it was really hard, you guys
Kiki, was there a truth there too?
How old were the guests there?
Yeah, they were the same age as me.

Korean: 키키 와 근데 너한테 진상을 부려!?
English: Kiki, but I'm going to use my power on you!?

Korean: 웅 술 취해가지고 진상 부려 ㅜㅜ 힘들었어
English: Yeah, I got drunk and acted like a fool. It was hard.
Did you buy Locati from PX too?
Yeah, I bought it too. You know that too, sis.

Korean: 키키 나도 알지 키키 그거 요즘 중딩 애들 필수 아이템인 거 알아?
English: Kiki, I know, Kiki. Do you know that that's a must-have item for middle school kids these days?
Oh seriously, I don't even want to look at it

Korean: 키키 맞아 군필들은 다 이런 생각인데 잼민이들은 그렇지 않더라 키키
English: Kiki, that's right, all military veterans think like this, but Jammins don't think like that Kiki
I want to forget about the military, sister

Korean: 키키 하지만 넌 이제 민방위가 남았지 않니,?
English: Kiki But you don't have any civil defense left now, do you?

Korean: 누나 나 너무 힘들었어 근데 그거까지 해야 하다니
English: Sister, I had such a hard time, but I had to do that too
Kiki, just hold on until you're 30~
After that, there is liberation~

Korean: 웅 참아야지 다른 사람들도 다 하는 거니까
English: Yeah, you have to endure it because everyone else is doing it too.
Yeah Kiki, just hold on for a bit~
But the unit won't go back~

Korean: 웅 누나 때문에 힘이 난다 키키 좋은 말 감사
English: Yeah, I feel strong because of you, Kiki. Thank you for the kind words.

Korean: 키키 오 내가 힘이 되었다니 이거 정말 영광인 걸~
English: Kiki Oh, it's such an honor to be of help to you~

Korean: 웅 진짜 누나 하는 말이 힘이나
English: Wow, really, what you said is encouraging

Korean: 키키 그래 이제 너는 꽃길만 걸으면 돼~
English: Kiki, now you just have to walk on a flower path~

Korean: 웅 누나 덕에 꽃길만 걷게 생겼다
English: Thanks to you, I'm walking on a flower path

Korean: 너는 학생 때 싫어했던 쌤 있었어?
English: Did you have a teacher you hated when you were a student?
Yeah, I hated my English teacher.

Korean: 아 진짜? 영어 과목 자체가 싫어서?
English: Oh really? Because you hate English itself?
Yeah, I'm really bad at English

Korean: 키키 영어 못하면 영어 쌤이 혼냈어?
English: Kiki, did your English teacher scold you for not being able to speak English?

Korean: 웅 영어 선생님이 밥을 못 먹게 했어
English: Yeah, my English teacher forbade me to eat.
Oh my gosh, that's not it!
You have to eat lunch!

Korean: 키키 영어 단어 다 외워야 보내줬어
English: Kiki, I had to memorize all the English words before I sent it to you.

Korean: 헐, 그러면 다 못 외우면 진짜 밥 못 먹어?
English: Wow, so if I can't memorize everything, I really can't eat?

Korean: 아니 먹을 순 있는데 늦게 보내줘
English: No, I can eat it, but please send it late.

Korean: 근데 늦게 가야지 맛있는 거 많이 남아서 많이 퍼오잖아 키키
English: But if you go late, there will be a lot of delicious food left so you can get a lot of it Kiki

Korean: 아니야 친구들이 다 퍼가서 남은 건 별로 없어
English: No, my friends all took it so there's not much left

Korean: 아앗 키키 우리 학교는 늦게 가야지 더 많이 줬었는데!
English: Aaaah Kiki, our school should have gone later, they gave us more!
It must have been different there!

Korean: 아 진짜 우리는 일찍 가야 훨씬 많이 줘
English: Oh really, if we go early, we get a lot more

Korean: 키키 그렇구나 ㅜㅜ 일주일에 몇 번 정도 그랬었어?
English: Kiki, I see. How many times a week did you do that?

Korean: 웅 거의 맨날? 말하니까 배가 고프다...
English: Yeah, almost every day? I'm hungry now that you mention it...

Korean: 너는 형이 두 명이고 여동생이 한 명이라고 그랬지?
English: You said you have two older brothers and one younger sister, right?
Yeah, that's right, I have a lot of brothers

Korean: 부모님이 다 계획하셔서 낳은 거야? 키키
English: Did your parents plan everything for you? Kiki

Korean: 아 그건 잘 모르겠다 물어보질 않아서
English: Oh, I don't know about that because I didn't ask.
Kiki: But raising 4 people is really hard!

Korean: 웅 그치 엄마 아빠 한테 너무 감사해
English: Yeah, I'm so grateful to Mom and Dad.

Korean: 키키 맞아 부모님 금술도 좋다고 하셨지?
English: Kiki, right? Your parents said that abstaining from alcohol is good, right?
Yeah, my parents are happy

Korean: 키키 오 대박 키키 애들도 많아서 더 행복하실 거야!
English: Kiki Oh, daebak Kiki, you'll be happier if you have lots of kids!
Yeah, right. We have to be filial every day.

Korean: 그러면 너네 형제들은 자주 안 싸워?
English: Then don't your brothers fight often?

Korean: 웅 우리는 자주 안 싸워 그냥 가끔
English: Yeah we don't fight often, just occasionally

Korean: 키키 여동생까지 지금 다 성인 된 거야?
English: Kiki's little sister is also an adult now?
Yeah, they're all adults haha

Korean: 키키 그렇구나 여동생이 지금 몇 살이야?
English: Kiki: I see. How old is your sister now?
My sister is a 23 year old kid
Did you say you have a girlfriend now?
Yeah I have a girlfriend now

Korean: 지금 여자친구는 몇살 때 만난 거야?
English: How old were you when you met your current girlfriend?
I found out about my girlfriend a year ago
I see. You must have just been discharged from the military when you met?
Yeah, I met you after I was discharged from the military. You're pretty.
Did you meet Kiki after she returned to college?
No, she's just a friend of my older sister's
Oh really? Then you're older?
Yeah, I'm older than you
I followed you because you were pretty

Korean: 키키 와 대박 키키 어쩌다가 알게 된 거야?
English: Kiki and Daebak Kiki, how did you meet?

Korean: 술 먹고 있는데 내 옆에 앉았어 반했지
English: I was drinking and he sat next to me and I fell in love with him.

Korean: 키키 와 대박 키키 근데 여친도 너가 처음부터 마음에 들었나 봐~
English: Kiki, wow, awesome Kiki. But I guess your girlfriend liked you from the start~

Korean: 웅 그랬나 바 내 볼을 꼬집더라고
English: Oh, that's right. He pinched my cheek.

Korean: 키키 헐 대박~ 거기서부터 스파크가 튄 거구먼~
English: Kiki, wow, awesome~ That's where the sparks flew~
Yeah, I think so
I miss you already
You have no intention of living alone right now, do you?
Yeah, I don't want to live alone, I'm a debtor.

Korean: 나중에 독립하게 된다면 키워보고 싶었던 동물 있었어?
English: If you ever become independent, is there an animal you would like to raise?
Yeah, I want to raise a puppy.

Korean: 그치? 너 강아지 진짜 좋아하는 거 같더라!
English: Right? You seem to really like puppies!
Yeah, I go to dog cafes often.

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 애견카페는 친구들이랑 가는 거야?
English: Kiki, really? Are you going to a dog cafe with your friends?
Yeah, go with your friends or go with your dad
Kiki, does your dad like you too?

Korean: 그러면 어머님이 싫어하셔서 강아지 못 키우는 거였구나?
English: So, your mother doesn't like it so you can't raise a dog?
Dad likes dog cafes too
I love puppies so much my mom hates them

Korean: 헐 키키 그랬구나 애견카페 최근에 갔었어?
English: Oh my, Kiki, did you go to a dog cafe recently?
Yeah, I went recently.
Does your sister like puppies?

Korean: 키키 나 진짜 동물 완전 사랑함!
English: Kiki I really love animals!
Oh, I think so
I think my sister is also sensitive

Korean: 키키 아니 여릴 거는 없고 그냥 애들이 너무 이뻐 ㅜㅜ
English: Kiki, no, it's not that they're young, they're just so cute ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 그래? 키키 맞아 진짜 귀엽지
English: Oh really? Kiki is right, she's really cute

Korean: 너는 운동 동호회 가입한 적 있어?
English: Have you ever joined a sports club?
I joined the bowling club.

Korean: 아 진짜? 볼링 동호회라는 것도 있어?
English: Oh really? Is there such a thing as a bowling club?
I joined because I like bowling.
Oh, how many bowling games do you have?
Yeah I got 200 points ㅠㅠ haha
Wow, 200 points?
Aren't you a player?
But I can't hit it
Other people hit better

Korean: 키키 그 사람들은 대회 나가본 적 있대?
English: Kiki, have those people ever competed?
Wow, he's really at the level of a professional.

Korean: 와 대박 키키 선수면 보통 몇 점 나와야 한대?
English: Wow, how many points does a great Kiki player usually get?
Everyone is a 360 point pro
I want to do that too
Wow, is that a score of 360 in bowling?

Korean: 웅 진짜 미쳤지 키키 잘 쳐
English: Wow, you're really crazy, Kiki, you're good at hitting

Korean: 키키 대박인데? 나 360점 처음 들어 봐!
English: Kiki, this is awesome! This is the first time I've heard of 360 points!

Korean: 나도 처음 봤어 대회 가서 봤어
English: I saw it for the first time too. I saw it at the competition.

Korean: 너는 친구들이랑 만나면 주로 뭐 해?
English: What do you usually do when you meet your friends?
I get all worked up when I meet the kids

Korean: 키키 할리갈리? 너네 남자애들 치곤 너무 귀여운 거 아니야?
English: Kiki Halli Galli? Aren't you guys too cute?
Yeah, we're missing our fortress.

Korean: 키키 근데 할리갈리도 피 터지는 거 알지?
English: Kiki, but did you know that Halli Galli also makes blood boil?

Korean: 할리갈리로 우리 돈 내기 해 키키 오만 원
English: Let's bet our money on Halli Galli Kiki 50,000 won

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 보통 게임하면 누가 내?
English: Kiki Wow, wow, who usually plays games?

Korean: 우리 다같이 한 명당 오만 원
English: Fifty thousand won per person for all of us

Korean: 키키 헐? 그러면 나도 껴줄 수 있니?
English: Kiki Huh? Then can I join you too?
Do you want to join us, sis? Let's make money.

Korean: 키키 그러니까 나 할리갈리 진짜 잘함
English: Kiki, so I'm really good at Halli Galli

Korean: 나 진짜 잘해 우리 둘이 편할래?
English: I'm really good. Can we be comfortable together?

Korean: 키키 오 팀전으로 할 수도 있어?
English: Kiki Oh, can we do it as a team battle?
Yeah, it's a one-on-one match, but it's a team match

Korean: 키키 아 우리는 뒷거래를 하는 건가?
English: Kiki, are we doing a backroom deal?
Yeah Kiki sounds fun
Let's meet up and do it together

Korean: 너 크리스마스 때 여행 안 가?
English: Aren't you going on a trip for Christmas?
I went skiing with my girlfriend on Christmas
Kiki wow I'm so jealous ㅜㅜ
Where are you going?
Have you been to Muju Nuna Ski Resort?

Korean: 아니 무주는 한 번도 가본 적이 없음!
English: No, I've never been to Muju!
Ah, it's really close to Muju
Is Muju close to Nonsan?
How many hours does it take?

Korean: 2시간 정도 걸리는 거 같아 멀긴 해
English: It's far, I think it takes about 2 hours
I've only been to Yongsan!
Oh, really, Yongsan is far, but Nonsan is too far.

Korean: 근데 용산보다 차라리 무주거 더 가까울 거 같다!
English: But I think it would be closer to Mujugo than Yongsan!
Yeah, so I'm going to go this time with my girlfriend.

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 ㅜㅜ 부럽다 ㅜㅜ
English: Kiki wow awesome ㅜㅜ I'm jealous ㅜㅜ
I also want to go skiing for the first time in a long time!
That would be fun
It would be nice if my sister went too
My boyfriend Delgo
Kiki, is that so?

Korean: 근데 남친이 추운 걸 안 좋아해!
English: But my boyfriend doesn't like it cold!

Korean: 우리 같이 더블 데이트 하면 좋은데
English: It would be nice if we went on a double date together

Korean: 이번 주에 제일 추웠던 날이 언제야?
English: What was the coldest day this week?

Korean: 이번 주에 이틀 전에 추웠어 비 온다고 하지 않았나
English: Didn't you say it was cold and rainy two days ago this week?
Oh, is that so?
It rained here on Monday, didn't it?

Korean: 아 여기는 비 오고 난 다음에 더 추워진 듯...
English: Ah, it seems like it got colder here after the rain...

Korean: 키키 맞아 여기도 월요일 저녁에 비 오고 화요일 날 겁나 추웠어!
English: Kiki, that's right. It rained here on Monday night and was freezing cold on Tuesday!

Korean: 아 진짜 추워지는 거 너무 싫은데 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, I really hate it when it gets cold ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 나도 진짜 가을이 어디 갔나 모르겠어!
English: Kiki I really don't know where fall went!
Oh, I really love fall
Right, but will it stay cold like this forever?
I think it's going to get colder
It's going to snow, big deal

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 눈 내린다고 하면 여기는 예쁘 쓰레기로 보이겠지?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ If it snows, this place will look like trash?

Korean: 진짜 눈 내리면 너무 추울 거 같아
English: I think it'll be really cold if it really snows
Don't throw trash

Korean: 맞아 키키 그리고 서울은 진짜 거짓말 안 하고 눈이 아니고 회색의 무언가로 바뀌어 있더라
English: Yes Kiki and Seoul really didn't lie, it wasn't snow but something gray

Korean: 아 진짜 누나는 눈사람 안 만들어봤어? 키키
English: Oh seriously, have you never made a snowman before, Kiki?

Korean: 키키 여기에서 눈사람 만들려면 아마 공원으로 가야 할 걸?
English: Kiki: If you want to build a snowman here, maybe you should go to the park?

Korean: 아 키키 나는 그래도 눈사람 많이 만들었었는데
English: Ah Kiki, I made a lot of snowmen though.
Do you have tens of millions of won in your bank account right now?

Korean: 나 천만 원 뿐이 없어요 ㅠㅠ
English: I only have 10 million won ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 야 그래도 그게 어디야 너 그때 농협 사건 기억나?
English: Kiki, where was that? Do you remember the Nonghyup incident back then?
Oh, really, how much do you have, sister?
What happened

Korean: 그때 농협에서 잘못 이체해서 어떤 사람 2억 날아간 사건!
English: At that time, there was an incident where someone lost 200 million won due to a mistake in transfer from Nonghyup!
Oh, this is really awesome
Tell me what it is about

Korean: 근데 그거 보상 못 해주겠다고 그래서 피해자가 방송에 나왔었거든?
English: But the victim appeared on TV because he said he couldn't compensate for that?
Oh, is it really two hundred million?

Korean: 와 어떻게 ㅠㅠ 나 같으면 진짜 열 받아
English: Wow how ㅠㅠ If I were you, I'd be really pissed

Korean: ㅜㅜ 그니까 근데 이번에 우연히 기사를 하나 본 게 있거든?
English: ㅜㅜ By the way, I happened to see an article this time?
Yeah but I wonder what that is

Korean: 너는 통장에 넣어둔 돈 얼마까지 보호 받을 수 있을 거 같아!?
English: How much of the money you put in your bank account do you think will be protected!?

Korean: 그래도 한 오백만 원 정도 아닐까?
English: Still, wouldn't it be around five million won?

Korean: 이게 금융 상품마다 다른데 한 2억 넣어 놓으면 8천만 원 정도?
English: This is different for each financial product, but if you put in about 200 million won, it's about 80 million won?

Korean: 아 그 정도 뿐이 안 해주는 거야?
English: Oh, so that's all you can do?
ㅜㅜ Everything will fly away

Korean: 근데 이게 금융 상품마다 정해 놓은 금액이 달라서 또 몰라!
English: But I don't know because the amount set for each financial product is different!
Oh, it's really amazing, I just found out about it

Korean: 와 올해 초반에 중국 김치로 논란이더니 이번에는 고춧가루네!
English: Wow, there was a controversy over Chinese kimchi earlier this year, and now it's red pepper powder!
Oh really Chinese kimchi? Kiki
What is that? Oh, red pepper powder

Korean: 키키 고춧가루를 맨발로 또 밟아서 판대!
English: Kiki, step on the pepper powder with your bare feet again and sell it!
Oh my god, this is so gross... Kiki yuck

Korean: 키키 그니까 이거 동영상까지 나와서 난리야!
English: Kiki, that's why this video came out and it's a mess!
Mom... I'm really curious about the video too

Korean: 근데 여자가 진짜 익숙한 듯이 막 밟음 키키
English: But the girl kept stepping on it as if she was really used to it

Korean: 아 그건 아니지 중국 왜 그런다니
English: Oh, that's not it. Why is China like that?

Korean: 키키 그니까, 여기는 계란도 가짜 계란 판다잖아!
English: Kiki: That's right, they even sell fake eggs here!

Korean: 아 대한민국 만세다 정말 중국은 못살겠다
English: Ah, long live the Republic of Korea! China really can't survive.
Kiki: Right, but that's part of it, right?
I wish it were so,
Well, it's really bad

Korean: 우리도 과자 과대 포장 엄청 심하다고 하잖아
English: We also say that excessive packaging of snacks is really bad.
Compared to China, it's a three-legged race!

Korean: 맞아 그건 인정 내가 맨날 먹는데...
English: Yeah, I admit that, I eat it all the time...

Korean: 맞아 키키 그냥 중국산은 안 쓰는 게 답인 듯!
English: That's right Kiki, I think the answer is to just not use Chinese products!

Korean: 그래 중국산 쓰는 식당도 잘 안 가 나는
English: Yeah, I don't really go to restaurants that serve Chinese food.
Do you have any tattoos on your body now?
Yeah, I have a tattoo on my back.

Korean: 와 대박 키키  맞아 그때 너 그렸다고 했던 거 같아!
English: Wow, awesome Kiki, that's right, I think you said you drew it back then!
I have a tattoo on my chest too haha
I did it with style

Korean: 와 대박 키키 가슴은 언제 또 한 거야!?
English: Wow, daebak Kiki, when did you get breasts again!?
I did it this time, men's romance

Korean: 키키 그거는 또 어디 가서 하고 온 건데~
English: Kiki, where did you go and do that~

Korean: 나 대전 가서 아는 형한테 받았어
English: I went to Daejeon and got it from a friend I know.

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 그거는 금액 얼마 줬어?
English: Kiki, really? How much did you pay for that?

Korean: 이거 가슴은 200만 원 줬어 하하 비싸
English: This chest cost 2 million won haha it's expensive

Korean: 와오 키키 금액도 그렇지만 할 때 아프지 않아?
English: Wow Kiki, the amount is great, but doesn't it hurt when you do it?
Yeah, it hurts, but I forgot about it now

Korean: 헐 키키 너 진짜 지울 생각은 없는 거지?
English: Hey Kiki, you really don't plan on deleting it, do you?
Yeah, I did it without thinking about erasing it.
Kiki and daebak,
How long did it take you to do that?
Time almost five hours? Slowly

Korean: 나 공복에 케이크 먹었더니 속이 안 좋아 ㅜ
English: I ate cake on an empty stomach and now I feel sick ㅜ

Korean: 아 배고파 나는 그냥 밥 먹고 싶다
English: Ah, I'm hungry. I just want to eat.

Korean: 지금 저녁 먹을 시간이긴 하지 ㅜ
English: It's time to eat dinner now ㅜ
Yeah, don't eat cake. I don't like it.

Korean: 키키 근데 케이크 아직  반이나 남았는걸,?
English: Kiki, but there's still half of the cake left, right?

Korean: 아 정말 그건 나주고 다른 거 먹어
English: Oh really, give that to me and eat something else
Good for your health

Korean: 키키 하, 이거 또 유통기한이 있잖아 아까워
English: Kiki ha, this has an expiration date too, it's a shame

Korean: 아까워 하지 말고 건강을 챙기란 말야!
English: Don't be stingy and take care of your health!
Kiki, I've already eaten half of it~
I'm already feeling unwell~

Korean: 아 진짜 누나는 나이 생각해서 비타민 챙겨 먹어
English: Ah, seriously, take your vitamins considering your age

Korean: 키키 아앗 나 당연히 비타민 챙겨 먹고 있지~
English: Kiki Ah, of course I'm taking vitamins~

Korean: 아 진짜 나 좀 추천해줘 바
English: Oh seriously, please recommend me something

Korean: 키키 나는 그냥 유재석님이 선전하는 거 먹고 있지~
English: Kiki I'm just eating what Yoo Jae-seok is promoting~

Korean: 아 진짜 그게 머지 나도 먹을래
English: Oh really, I want to eat that too
It's definitely a vitamin with great value for money!
Ah, I have to eat well too. I'm tired.

Korean: 너 차 말고 다른 대출은 안 받았지?
English: You didn't take out any other loans besides the car, did you?
Yeah, if I take out a loan I'm in big trouble.
ㅠㅠ I can't

Korean: 맞아 키키 절대 받으면 안 돼!
English: That's right, Kiki, you should never accept it!

Korean: 근데 대출 받으면 신용 떨어지지 않아?
English: But if I take out a loan, won't my credit drop?

Korean: 웅 여기서 멈춰야지 키키 아니 안 떨어져
English: Yeah, we should stop here Kiki, no, don't fall

Korean: 키키 아 그래? 내 친구는 대출 받자마자 6등급으로 떨어졌대!
English: Kiki Oh really? My friend said his rating dropped to 6th place as soon as he got the loan!

Korean: 아 정말 나는 안 그랬는데 확인해봐야겠다
English: Oh really I didn't do that, I should check
Yeah? What rank were you originally?
Am I second class?
I don't remember what happened
I'm also level 2 now?
How do you get a first grade?

Korean: 그니까 내 말이 나도 잘 모르겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: So I don't really understand what I'm saying ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 나도, 그냥 주택청약이나 계속 들어 놔야지~
English: Kiki Me too, I should just keep applying for housing subscriptions~

Korean: 나도 주택청약으로 아파트 분양 언능 받을라고
English: I also want to receive a contract for an apartment through a housing subscription.

Korean: 키키 오 대박 2년 뒤에 주택청약 당첨돼서 좋은 아파트로 가시길!
English: Kiki Oh, I hope you win the housing subscription in two years and move into a nice apartment!
I really dream of that too please
Kiki Me too, but I don't have money, do I?
Let's fight together
Do you like YouTube?
Are you watching?

Korean: 웅 나 맨날 보지 잘 봐!
English: Yeah, I see you all the time! Look at me carefully!

Korean: 나 진짜 오랜만에 무도 보고 겁나 웃었잖아!
English: It's been a long time since I've seen a dance and I laughed so hard!

Korean: 아 진짜 나 천뚱님 엄청 좋아해 키키
English: Ah seriously, I really like Cheon-ttung Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 천뚱은 그 전참시에 나오지 않아?
English: Kiki, didn't Cheon-tung appear in that prequel?
Yeah, that's right, the person who appears in the pre-show

Korean: 아 맞아 근데 그 분 유튜브 개설했잖아!
English: Oh right, but that person opened a YouTube channel!
Yeah right, it's really funny

Korean: 키키 맞아 이번에 업로드 한 거 봤어?
English: Kiki, did you see what I uploaded this time?
Yeah, I tried that
Did you see it too, sister?
Kiki, of course
The sora-muchim noodles must have been really tasty!
You really enjoyed it so much
Makes me want to eat...

Korean: 키키 맞아 ㅜㅜ 나 소라 안 좋아하는데 진짜
English: Kiki is right ㅜㅜ I really don't like Sora
Looking at that makes me want to eat some sora!

Korean: 진짜 나는 소라 엄청 좋아하는데 ㅠ
English: I really like Sora ㅠ

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 너는 더 먹고 싶었겠다!
English: Kiki, really? You must have wanted to eat more!
Yeah, let's eat together later

Korean: 너 최근에 제일 재밌게 봤던 영화나 만화 있어?
English: Is there a movie or cartoon you enjoyed the most recently?
I really enjoyed watching Parasite

Korean: 아 기생충 나 그거 한 세 번 본 듯!
English: Ah, Parasite, I think I've seen that three times!
Oh yeah Parasite was really fun
