Korean: 웅 재밌어 여자친구 맘을 잘 알더라구
English: Yeah, that's funny. He knows his girlfriend's feelings well.

Korean: 너는 지금 여친이랑 결혼할 마음 있음?
English: Are you willing to marry your girlfriend now?
Yeah, I'm definitely going to get married.

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 언제쯤 하려고 하는데?
English: Kiki, wow, when are you planning to do this?

Korean: 이런 여자 없을 거 같아 일년 뒤에?
English: I don't think there will be a woman like this in a year?
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Really?

Korean: 지금 여친 분이 몇 살이라고 그랬지?
English: How old did you say your current girlfriend is?
My girlfriend is 4 years older than me

Korean: 헐 대박 진짜 너 능력이 좋구나?
English: Wow, wow, you're really talented.
Yeah, I seduced you. I followed you around all the time.
Kiki is really awesome, awesome Kiki
Then where is your girlfriend's hometown?
It's nothing special
My girlfriend is also in Nonsan

Korean: 어 그러면 고민 없이 논산에서 결혼식 치르겠네?
English: Oh, so we can have the wedding in Nonsan without any worries?
Yeah, we should do it in Nonsan.

Korean: 논산은 딱 한 군데 괜찮은 곳 있지!
English: There is only one good place in Nonsan!

Korean: 노블레스인가 거기가 제일 나은 거 같아
English: I think Noblesse is the best

Korean: 키키 맞아 거기 팔보채 맛집임 키키
English: Kiki, that's right, that's a famous restaurant for Palbochae Kiki
Oh, you really like that, sis

Korean: 너는 나중에 결혼하면 아내랑 반려견 키울 거야?
English: When you get married, are you going to raise a dog with your wife?
I want to raise a turtle Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 거북이 내가 또 한참 알아봤었지~
English: Kiki, the turtle, I've been looking into it for a while now~
Yeah turtle kiki
Oh really, you too, sister?

Korean: 키키 어 거북이 성격이 나랑 좀 비슷한 거 같아서!
English: Kiki, the turtle's personality seems to be a bit similar to mine!
Why are you so slow? Kiki
It's probably similar

Korean: 키키 어 맞아 키키 아무 것도 안 하고 가만히 누워 있잖아 나 키키
English: Kiki, right Kiki, you're just lying there doing nothing, me Kiki

Korean: 아 키키 근데 그건 나도 그래
English: Ah Kiki but that's the same for me too

Korean: 키키 그치? 그리고 거북이가 습도랑 기온만 잘 맞춰 주면 건강하게 산대!
English: Kiki, right? And turtles can live healthily if you keep the humidity and temperature just right!
Ah, I really have to raise it sometime later

Korean: 키키 어 그리고 거북이 종에 따라 100년도 키울 수 있는 종도 있대!
English: Kiki Oh, and depending on the species of turtle, there are species that can live up to 100 years!

Korean: 아 진짜 나도 한번 100년 같이 살고 싶다
English: Ah, really, I want to live with you for 100 years too

Korean: 그래서 내가 키우다가 죽으면 내 자식들한테 넘겨주는 그런 사람도 있대!
English: So, there are people who raise children and then pass them on to their children when they die!
Oh, that's sad...

Korean: 자식들도 슬퍼할 거 같아 거북이 보면
English: I think the children will be sad when they see a turtle.
Kiki is right ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나는 근데 그 거북이 보면서 자식들도 추억 회상 할 거 같아서 좋을 거 같아!
English: I think it would be good if children could reminisce while looking at that turtle!

Korean: 아 진짜 그것도 맞는 말이긴 하다
English: Oh, that's true too
Are you exercising these days?
Yeah I'm exercising
really?

Korean: 너 헬스 다닌다더니 계속 다니는 거야?
English: You said you go to the gym, but are you still going?

Korean: 나 헬스장 가서 맨날 하고 있어 세달 끊었어 또
English: I go to the gym and do it every day. I quit for three months again.

Korean: 키키 와오 키키 피티도 같이 끊었어?
English: Did you cut off Kiki Wao Kiki Pete too?
No, I was 82 and now I'm 75
Wow Kiki awesome Kiki
You must have gained muscle too, right?
Yeah, that's awesome. You should exercise too, unnie.

Korean: 나,?  나는 주말에도 갈 시간이 없는 걸,?
English: Me,? I don't have time to go even on weekends,?
Don't just roll around at home
Hey that's an excuse
Kiki no, it's true,
I have a lot to do at home~
Eight, don't lie
Then do home training at home!

Korean: 키키 아 나 홈트 하고 있지! 하루에 30분!
English: Kiki, I'm doing homework! 30 minutes a day!
Oh really?
Should I try home training too?

Korean: 키키 아니 너는 그냥 계속 다니던 헬스장 다녀!
English: Kiki, no, you just keep going to the gym!
Oh, I see...
Health is the best

Korean: 너 학생 때 오락실도 많이 갔었지?
English: Did you go to the arcade a lot when you were a student?
Yeah I go there every day Kiki

Korean: 키키 너도 거기 싸커킥이라는 거 잘 찼음?
English: Kiki, are you good at kicking soccer kicks there too?
I've tried everything
I loved going and pumping
Kiki Pump? Is that dancing?

Korean: 발로 하는 거 있잖아 뛰는 거
English: There's something you can do with your feet, like running.

Korean: 맞아 키키 너 그거 고인물 동영상 봄?
English: Right Kiki, have you seen that old video?
No, I haven't seen that

Korean: 키키 와 유튜브 쳐서 그거 봐봐 진짜 대박임
English: Kiki, go to YouTube and watch it. It's really awesome.
Oh, I'm really curious. I'll have to check it out.

Korean: 키키 아니 나는 그 화살표가 어디 방향으로 가는지도 모르겠는데 그걸 다 맞추더라!
English: Kiki No, I don't even know which way the arrows are going, but you got them all right!
Oh my gosh, this is awesome Kiki
I can do it too

Korean: 아니 너 보면 못한다고 그럴  걸?
English: No, if I look at you, I would say I can't do it?

Korean: 아 진짜 멘붕 올라나 하고 싶다
English: Ah, I really want to have a mental breakdown

Korean: 키키 진짜 발이 아예 안 보일 정도야!
English: Kiki, you can't even see your feet!
Oh, I want to do that too

Korean: 아 조개구이 먹으러 바다 가고 싶다!
English: Ah, I want to go to the beach and eat grilled clams!
Ah, Daecheon is really the best
Oh really?
I also really like Daecheon grilled clams!

Korean: 웅 조개구이 가서 섬과 섬 사이 가봐
English: Yeah, go to the clam grill and go between the islands.

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 아 거기 매장 이름이 그거야?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Is that the name of the store?

Korean: 웅 맞아 조개구이 섬과 섬 사이 대박 맛있어
English: Yeah, that's right, the grilled clams between the islands are super delicious
Oh really?
I have to go in November! Take my mom with you!
Yeah, go with your boyfriend and mom.

Korean: 아 엄마랑 먼저 가고 남친은 나중에 엄마가 해산물을 진짜 좋아해!
English: Ah, I'll go with my mom first and my boyfriend will say later, "My mom really likes seafood!"

Korean: 아 진짜 우리 엄마 아빠도 좋아하는데
English: Oh really, my mom and dad like it too

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 우리 엄마 회 킬러임!
English: Kiki, really? My mom is a killer!
Oh, I really like raw fish too
Kiki me too Kiki
But I just eat it,

Korean: 아 진짜 조개구이 먹고 싶다 생각하니까 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, I really want to eat grilled clams ㅠㅠ
Kiki really ㅜㅜ

Korean: 이번 주말은 못 가고 11월에 대천이나 가야겠다!
English: I can't go this weekend, so I'll have to go to Daecheon in November!
I should take my girlfriend too

Korean: 근데 11월에 대천 가면 바람 장난 아니겠지?
English: But if you go to Daecheon in November, the wind will be no joke, right?
It must be seriously cold

Korean: 키키 그니까 나는 부산이 남쪽 지방이라 더울 줄 알았는데 바람 때문에 아니래!
English: Kiki: That's why I thought Busan would be hot because it's in the southern region, but it's not because of the wind!
Yeah, Busan is a bit warm, I said.

Korean: 키키 아니 나는 부산이 더울 줄 알았는데 바다가 있잖아 거기도! 그래서 바람이 많이 불어서 춥대!
English: Kiki: No, I thought Busan would be hot, but there's an ocean there too! That's why it's so windy and cold!

Korean: 아 그래? 나는 그때 갔을 때 바람은 그렇게 많이 안 불었던 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh really? I don't think it was that windy when I went there ㅠㅠ
Kiki, really?
But Daecheon is cold anyway, right?

Korean: 아 근데 대천은 진짜 추워 내가 장담
English: Oh but Daecheon is really cold, I guarantee it

Korean: 키키 아앗,  조개구이 먹고 싶은데 추운 건 또 못 참는,
English: Kiki Aah, I want to eat grilled clams, but I can't stand the cold,

Korean: 그치 조개구이만 먹고 바로 집 기기
English: Okay, I'll just eat grilled clams and go home right away.
Kiki ah good idea kiki
I'll see the sea from afar~
The sea is beautiful even from afar
Kiki right Kiki

Korean: 그리고 대천은 서해라서 멀리서만 봐도 돼~
English: And Daecheon is in the West Sea, so you can see it from far away~

Korean: 웅 맞아 인정 멀리서 보고 조개구이는 바로 앞에서 먹고
English: Yeah, that's right. I saw it from afar and ate the grilled clams right in front of me.

Korean: 키키 맞아 눈으로 즐기고 입으로만 즐기도 오면 되겠다~
English: Kiki, you're right, you can enjoy it with your eyes and mouth too~
Right, right, I should go there too
Did you know that the Coast Guard died this time?
Why did you die? What happened?

Korean: 이번에 18일 만에 발령 받은 해경이 자살했대 ㅜ
English: This time, a Coast Guard member who was assigned to the post after 18 days committed suicide.
Wow, wow, why did you do that?

Korean: 근데 이게 직장 내 괴롭힘 때문일 수도 있대!
English: But this could be due to workplace bullying!

Korean: 직장 내 괴롭힘? 진짜 그런 일 많더라
English: Workplace bullying? That happens a lot.

Korean: 어 ㅜㅜ 일이 너무 힘들다고 그랬는데 그 뒤로 좀 안 좋게 봤나 봐,
English: Oh, ㅜㅜ I said that work was too hard, but I guess I looked down on you after that.
It's hard enough, it's really a shame...

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 나이도 보니까 이제 34살이야 ㅜ
English: Wow ㅜㅜ Looking at your age, you're now 34 ㅜ
Oh my gosh, that's too bad
You're really young

Korean: 가정도 있는 사람인데 극단적인 선택을 할 정도면,
English: If you are a married person and would make an extreme choice,

Korean: 가정도 있는 사람인데 그랬데 와 남은 가족들은...
English: He's a married man, but what about the rest of his family...

Korean: 근데 괴롭힘을 한 사람들은 그냥 일반 징계만 내려졌대,
English: But the people who bullied were only given general disciplinary action.

Korean: 아 그런 게 어딨어 벌 받아야지 더!
English: Oh, how can that be? You deserve to be punished more!

Korean: 그러니까, 니 말처럼 남은 가족들만 피해 보는 거지!
English: So, just like you said, only the remaining family members are harmed!

Korean: 진짜 그 사람들은 평생 불행하길 바란다...
English: I really hope those people are miserable for the rest of their lives...

Korean: 와 홍콩 4~6평 아파트 가격이 얼마인지 알아?
English: Wow, do you know how much a 4-6 pyeong apartment in Hong Kong costs?
How much? Five hundred million? How much is eight hundred million?
Here too, it's no different from us!
First of all, we need to get 100 million per pyeong!

Korean: 아 진짜 대박이다 와 살고 싶다 가서
English: Oh, this is really great. I want to go and live there.

Korean: 키키 엥? 거기 가서 살고 싶다고 너무 비싸잖아!
English: Kiki Huh? I want to go there and live there, it's too expensive!

Korean: 아니 한 평 사서 또 땅값 오를 거잖아
English: No, if I buy one pyeong, the land price will go up again.

Korean: 키키 홍콩 땅값이 오를 거라, 난 잘 모르겠지만 6평에 6억으로 살고 싶지 않아!
English: Kiki Hong Kong land prices will go up, I don't know for sure, but I don't want to live in a 6-pyeong apartment for 600 million won!
I heard that the price of Sejong apartments has also risen significantly.
Kiki Sejong? It's worth going there,
So you came to the Blue House in Sejong?
So my friend's house was worth 400 million won, but now it's worth 800 million won.

Korean: 와 대박 키키 진짜 처음부터 세종에 살았으면 진짜 그 사람은 대박이겠다!
English: Wow, daebak Kiki, if he really lived in Sejong from the beginning, he would really be daebak!
That's why I'm jealous

Korean: 나도 세종에 집 좀 사 놀 걸 그랬어
English: I should have bought a house in Sejong and played around there too.
Kiki But you don't have money, right?

Korean: 근데 홍콩 여기 집 보니까 완전 닭장이더라!
English: But when I looked at the houses here in Hong Kong, they were like total chicken coops!

Korean: 홍콩 진짜 대박이다 닭장인데... 그 정도라니
English: Hong Kong is really a jackpot, it's a chicken coop... It's like that

Korean: 키키 맞아 제일 비싼 아파트는 17억까지 한대!
English: Kiki, that's right, the most expensive apartment costs up to 1.7 billion won!
Wow, this is really amazing

Korean: 너는 여친이 달라진 거 한 번에 캐치 할 수 있어?
English: Can you catch the difference in your girlfriend all at once?

Korean: 웅 알지 나 그런 거 잘 알아
English: Yeah, I know, I know that stuff
Kiki Oh really?
My boyfriend didn't recognize me at all!?

Korean: 아 진짜 나는 좀 섬세해서 잘 알아
English: Oh, really, I'm a bit sensitive so I know

Korean: 키키 오 그러면 바뀐 립스틱 색상도 알 수 있으?
English: Kiki Oh, then can you tell me the changed lipstick color too?

Korean: 알지 내 여자친구는 디올 샤넬 이런 거 좋아해서
English: You know, my girlfriend likes Dior and Chanel and stuff like that.

Korean: 키키 와 소름 너 브랜드 이름도 아는 구나,?
English: Kiki and Sorum, you know the brand name too, right?
Yeah, I know, my girlfriend kept asking me to buy it for her...

Korean: 키키 그래서 다 사줬어? 백화점 가서?
English: Kiki, so you bought everything? At the department store?
Yeah, I bought it at the Jeju Island duty free shop.
Wow, but even if it's a duty free shop, it'll be expensive!

Korean: 아냐 그래도 갖고 싶어 하니까 하하
English: No, but I still want it haha

Korean: 키키 와 진짜 멋있다 내 덩상~
English: Kiki, you're really cool, my dongsang~
How much did each one cost?

Korean: 사만 원인가 그 정도 했던 거 같아
English: I think it was about 40,000 won or so

Korean: 그거 아마 백화점 가면 6만 원 정도 할걸?
English: If you go to a department store, that'll probably cost around 60,000 won?

Korean: 아 정말 그 정도야? 그건 잘 몰랐어
English: Oh really? I didn't know that.

Korean: 나는 좀 안 좋은 버릇이 한 가지 있어!
English: I have one bad habit!

Korean: 아 진짜 무슨 버릇? 궁금하다 키키
English: Oh really, what kind of habit is it? I wonder, Kiki

Korean: 나 계속 손톱 물어 뜯는 거!
English: I keep biting my nails!

Korean: 아 진짜 키키 나는 입술 물어 뜯는 거
English: Oh seriously Kiki I'm biting my lip

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 입술은 피 자주 나지 않아?
English: Kiki, really? Don't your lips bleed often?

Korean: 웅 맞아 뜯으면 엄청 많이 나와 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right. If you tear it open, a lot comes out. ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 입술 거기 밥 먹는 곳이잖아,  아프잖아,
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Your lips are where you eat, it hurts.

Korean: 웅 그래서 립밤 많이 바르는 중 하하
English: Yeah, that's why I apply a lot of lip balm haha
Kiki, thank goodness,

Korean: 나는 그냥 물어 뜯고 있어, 안 뜯고 싶은데,
English: I'm just biting, I don't want to bite,

Korean: 아 진짜 손톱 물어 뜯지마 안 좋아
English: Oh seriously, don't bite your nails, it's not good

Korean: 키키 맞아, 근데 나도 모르게 이게 불안해지면 뜯게 되더라!
English: Kiki: That's right, but I also find myself tearing it off when I feel anxious without realizing it!

Korean: 키키 그거 애정 결핍인가 머라고 했었는데
English: Kiki, I said that was a lack of affection or something.

Korean: 헐 나 그런 거 같아 나에게 사랑을 다오!
English: Wow I think so Give me love!
Kiki I'll give you a lot, sis
Kiki Oh, this is so touching~
Let's eat later~

Korean: 그래 좋아 누나 맛있는 거 사줘
English: Okay, okay, buy me something delicious, sis.

Korean: 너는 요즘에 인터넷 쇼핑은 안 해?
English: Don't you do online shopping these days?

Korean: 웅 나는 요즘에 쿠팡으로 닭찌찌 시키는 중
English: Yeah, I'm ordering chicken jjiji from Coupang these days.

Korean: 헐 키키 역시 헬창인 답게 찌찌를 사는구먼?
English: Wow, Kiki, as expected from a Hell Hunter, is buying a dick?
If you want to work out, protein is essential.

Korean: 키키 근데 나는 찌찌 시켜봤는데 비리던데 괜찮아?
English: Kiki, but I tried the jjiji and it was spicy. Is that okay?
Oh really?
I'm a steak chicken slut

Korean: 키키 아 그거 스테이크는 안 먹어봤는데 그게 더 맛있어?
English: Kiki, I haven't tried that steak, but is it better?
Oh seriously, the steak is much tastier
Kiki, really?
I should try that later too
What about the price?

Korean: 가격은 하나에 천육백 원인가? 그 정도
English: The price is one thousand six hundred dollars each? That's about it.
Kiki Oh, it's cheaper than I thought?
I bought chicken tikka for around 1500!

Korean: 아 진짜 그거보단 훨씬 맛있어 사 먹어 봐
English: Oh really, it's much tastier than that. Buy it and try it.

Korean: 키키 오키 키키 혹시 첫 구매면 할인 같은 거 없니?
English: Kiki Oki Kiki Is there any discount for my first purchase?
If I sign up as a member, I'll get a 5,000 won discount?

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 키키 그러면 당장 가서 사야겠구먼~
English: Kiki Wow, awesome Kiki Then I have to go buy it right now~

Korean: 웅 당장 가서 우리 사서 몸짱 하자
English: Yeah, let's go buy it right now and get fit

Korean: 너 문세윤이랑 혜리랑 신동엽 나오는 프로그램 알아?
English: Do you know the program that Moon Se Yoon, Hye Ri, and Shin Dong Yup appear in?
Yeah, I know. What was its name?

Korean: 어 나도 이게 이름이 갑자기 기억이 안 나네?
English: Oh, I suddenly can't remember the name of this?
It's Amazing Saturday, isn't it?

Korean: 아 맞다 키키 너 거기에 키도 나오는 거 알아?
English: Oh right, Kiki, did you know that Key is in there too?

Korean: 알지 키 요즘에 나 혼자 산다에도 많이 나오자나
English: I know, Key has been appearing on I Live Alone a lot lately.

Korean: 맞아 키키 근데 그게 중요한 게 아니고 문세윤이랑 키랑 식성 정반대인 거 알아?
English: Right Kiki, but that's not important. Do you know that Moon Se Yoon and Key have completely opposite eating habits?
Oh really, I don't know what is this?

Korean: 키키 아니 키가 약간 육식보다 채식을 더 좋아한대!
English: Kiki, no, Kiki likes vegetarian food a little more than meat!

Korean: 아 채식만 먹게 생겼어 키는 그래서 말랐나?
English: Oh, you only eat vegetables. Is that why you're skinny?

Korean: 키키 그런 가봐 근데 안동 찜닭 부위 중에 어떤 부위를 제일 좋아하냐고 그 멤버들한테 다 물어봤었거든?
English: Kiki: I guess so, but I asked all the members which part of Andong Jjimdak they like the most.
Yeah, but what did you say? I wonder

Korean: 근데 보통 다 저는 다리가 좋아요 저는 가슴살이 좋아요 이러잖아
English: But usually, everyone says, "I like legs" and "I like chest fat"

Korean: 근데 키가 뭐고 했는 줄 알아?
English: But do you know what the height is?

Korean: 아 진짜 키키 목이 좋아요 이랬어? 설마
English: Oh really, did you say Kiki's neck is nice? No way

Korean: 키키 아니 거기 안에 있는 감자,
English: Kiki, no, the potatoes inside there,

Korean: 아 정말 ? 키키 아 감자; 머야 감자를 시켜 먹지
English: Oh really? Kiki, potatoes; what are you ordering potatoes for?

Korean: 너는 어렸을 때 어떤 만화를 제일 재밌게 봤어?
English: What cartoon did you enjoy the most when you were young?

Korean: 나 짱구 좋아했어 내가 짱구 닮았잖아
English: I liked Shinchan because I looked like him.
Kiki ah daebak kiki
Shinchan is still doing it!
Oh really?

Korean: 아직도 하나 티비를 잘 안 봐서
English: I still don't watch TV that much
Kiki, really?
But I also watched it on YouTube after a long time?
Hey, how was it, sis? Did you have fun?

Korean: 어 근데 슬픈 게 성우가 좀 바뀌었더라 ㅜ
English: Oh, but the sad thing is that the voice actor changed a bit.
Oh really, I should see it too, I'm curious
ㅜㅜ Shinchan's voice has changed a bit!
Shinchan's voice is cute, I want to hear it

Korean: ㅜㅜ 옛날 짱구가 더 좋긴 한데 아 그리고 신형만 목소리도 바뀜 ㅜ
English: ㅜㅜ I like the old Crayon Shin-chan better, but oh and only the new one has a different voice ㅜ
I need to watch it again Kiki

Korean: 어 유튜브로 볼 수 있으니까 한번 봐 봐!
English: Oh, you can watch it on YouTube, so take a look!

Korean: 알겠어 누나가 알려줬으니 한번 또 봐야지
English: Okay, I'll watch it again since my sister told me.

Korean: 키키 오 좋아 좀 있다가 여친이랑 같이  봐!
English: Kiki Oh, okay, watch it with your girlfriend later!

Korean: 웅 여자친구 오면 같이 보자고 해야겠다
English: Yeah, I should tell my girlfriend to come and see it with me.
Do you like ribs? Marinated ribs?

Korean: 응 좋아하지 나는 양념갈비 더 좋아해
English: Yeah I like it. I like marinated ribs better.
you ?
Kiki, really?

Korean: 나는 양념 중에서 간장 양념을 제일 좋아해!
English: Of all the seasonings, I like soy sauce seasoning the best!

Korean: 키키 나는 매운 양념 갈비 말고
English: Kiki I don't like spicy marinated ribs
What else do you like?

Korean: 키키 나는 일단 쳐먹파라서 웬만한 거 다 좋아함!
English: Kiki: I'm a foodie so I like just about anything!
Kiki's eating is good
Chicken is my favorite

Korean: 키키 아 인정 나 내일 치킨먹지롱~
English: Kiki, I admit I'm going to eat chicken tomorrow~

Korean: 헐 진짜 부럽다 무슨 치킨 먹어 ?
English: Wow, I'm really jealous. What kind of chicken do you eat?
I want to eat pudding
Ah, I like the sprinkles~
But I don't eat anything else!
Kiki, what did you eat today?

Korean: 나 오늘 한식 뷔페 갔다 옴!
English: I went to a Korean buffet today!

Korean: 키키 나 뷔페 안 간 지 엄청 됐는데 어땟어?
English: Kiki, it's been a long time since I've been to a buffet. How was it?

Korean: 너 가격 들으면 깜짝 놀랄 걸?
English: You'd be shocked if you heard the price.
Kiki, how much did you spend?
I guess you have a lot of money
Kiki, hey, it's 5 thousand won here! Isn't it awesome?
Wow, it's really cheap?
Let's go together next time

Korean: 아 오늘 대청소 했는데 진짜 죽는 줄!
English: Ah, I did some spring cleaning today and I thought I was going to die!
It's been a while since you did a spring cleaning?
How long did it take?
Yeah~ About 20 minutes?
It was so hard!
Kiki, it didn't take long, did it?
I want to change rooms

Korean: 엥 방? 너 여분 방이 있어?
English: Huh? You have a spare room?

Korean: 아니 그건 아닌데 구조를 바꾸고 싶어서
English: No, that's not it, I just want to change the structure

Korean: 아 진짜? 어떤 식으로 바꾸고 싶은데?
English: Oh really? How do you want to change it?
I want to change my bed into a bunk bed

Korean: 헐 이층 침대? 왜? 그게 더 좋아?
English: Oh, a bunk bed? Why? Is that better?

Korean: 아니 방이 좁아서 넓게 쓰고 싶어서
English: No, the room is small so I want to use it more spaciously.
Kiki Oh, I see
Then what are you going to put on the second floor?
I'm going to put a bed on the second floor and use the first floor.

Korean: 키키 어 보통 2층에 물건 갖다 놓지 않아?
English: Kiki, don't you usually put things on the second floor?

Korean: 키키 2층에는 얼마 못 둘 거 같아서 반대로 하려구
English: I don't think there will be much space on the second floor of Kiki, so I'm going to do it the other way around.
Kiki Oh, I see Kiki

Korean: 근데 이층은 조명 때문에 눈이 부시지 않아?
English: But isn't the lighting on the second floor blinding your eyes?

Korean: 키키 그래서 조명도 새로 바꿔볼려고 하고 있어
English: Kiki So I'm thinking about changing the lighting too
Do you have your driver's license now?

Korean: 응 나 얼마 전에 면허증 땄어
English: Yeah, I just got my driver's license a while ago.
Oh, how many did you get?
I was trying to get 1st class but ended up getting 2nd class
Kiki A If you're a man, you have to get one~
That was a long time ago
Do you have a driver's license?
I got it right away when I was 19, as a first class~

Korean: 키키 그럼 지금 운전하고 다니고 있어 ?
English: Kiki, are you driving now?

Korean: 그럼 그럼 내 차도 있는 걸~?
English: Then, then I have a car too~?
Wow, I'm jealous
I still take the bus

Korean: 키키 근데 지금은 버스 타고 다녀도 돼!
English: Kiki But now you can take the bus!
But isn't it more convenient to have your own car?
That's right Kiki
But the maintenance costs are no joke!
Kiki, that's right, parking is a problem too

Korean: 맞아 키키 주차 비용만 엄청 들 거야!
English: Yeah Kiki, parking costs are going to be huge!

Korean: 맞아 있으면 좋은데 돈도 너무 많이 들어 가는 거 같아
English: It would be nice if it were true, but I think it costs too much money.
What time did you finish today?
I finished at 10 today because the deadline was late.
Oh, I see. The customer left late?

Korean: 응 그렇기도 하고 마무리 할게 많았어
English: Yeah, that's true, and I had a lot to finish up.
Oh, I see. ㅜㅜ You had a lot of customers today!?
Seriously, we had the most customers today ever
Oh my god, it's Monday today?

Korean: 내 말이 오늘 주말인 줄 알았다니까?
English: I thought you said today was the weekend?

Korean: 키키 주말에는 오히려 안 바빴다고 했나?
English: Kiki, you said you weren't busy on the weekends?

Korean: 키키 아니 주말에도 바빠 근데 오늘 더 바빴어
English: Kiki No, I was busy even on the weekends, but I was busier today

Korean: 키키 대박 너네 집 되게 잘 살겠다~
English: Kiki, daebak, your house will be so nice~
Kiki, do you want to come and work too?

Korean: 키키 어 나 가면 알바비 많이 챙겨 주는 거임?
English: Kiki, if I go there, will they give me a lot of money for Alba?
I'll take care of you as much as you do Kiki
Oh my goodness, I'm an experienced worker so it's expensive?
If Kiki is a career person, it's better for us

Korean: 너 군대 자대 배치 어디로 받았다고 했지?
English: Where did you get your military unit assignment?
I served in the military in Gangneung.

Korean: 와 강릉?  거기 바다 진짜 예쁘잖아!
English: Wow Gangneung? The sea there is really pretty!

Korean: 키키 맞아 우리 부대에서 강릉 바다 다 보였어
English: Kiki, that's right, we could see the whole Gangneung sea from our unit.

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 ㅜㅜ 나 강릉 바다 한 번도 안 봤는데!
English: Kiki, wow, awesome ㅜㅜ I've never seen the Gangneung sea before!

Korean: 헐 진짜? 너도 군대 오면 볼 수 있어
English: Wow, really? You can see it when you join the army too.
Kiki, are you telling me to join the army?

Korean: 그럼 그럼 요즘 군대 많이 좋아졌잖아
English: Well then, the military has improved a lot these days.

Korean: 키키 그렇다고 나보고 지금 군대 들어가라는 거야?
English: Kiki: Are you telling me to join the military now?
Kiki, not bad, right?
I think I'll do well
Yeah I'll go
Instead, you go to the job group first
Kiki sorry
I think that would be a bit difficult
Kiki, why are you telling me to go away!
You should go too!
I've already been there once

Korean: 키키 괜찮아 다시 한 번 들어갈 수 있을 걸?
English: Kiki, are you okay? Can you come in again?

Korean: 아니야 두 번 하고 싶진 않아
English: No, I don't want to do it twice
Did you study well when you were a student?
Kiki, have you done it to some extent?
I'm jealous, I really couldn't do it Kiki
How good were your grades?

Korean: 키키 나는 그냥 잘했다 하는 정도 ?
English: Kiki I just did well?
Wow, really?

Korean: 너 반에서 몇 등까지 해 봤어?
English: What rank did you get in your class?

Korean: 나 반에서 3등까지 해 본 거 같아
English: I think I got 3rd place in my class

Korean: 헐 대박 그러면 전교에서는 몇 등이었어?
English: Wow, awesome. Then what rank were you in the whole school?
What place was it? I think it was 50th place?

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 그때 전교생이 몇 명이었는데?
English: Kiki Wow, wow, how many students were there in the school at that time?
I think there were about 350 people?

Korean: 와 대박 키키 너 선생님들이 좋아했겠다~
English: Wow, awesome Kiki, your teachers must have loved it~
Kiki, you liked me because I was a total model student ^^

Korean: 키키 그니까 나는 맨날 꿀밤만 맞고 다님 키키
English: Kiki That's why I get hit with honey all the time Kiki
Kiki, but you and your teacher were on good terms anyway

Korean: 키키 그건 그렇지 나 진짜 혼낸 쌤들은 없었어!
English: Kiki That's right, I've never had a teacher who really scolded me!

Korean: 키키 맞아 너도 이쁨 받고 다녔던 거 같아 보였어
English: Kiki, you're right, it looks like you were also getting some love
Are you just getting off work with your parents?

Korean: 키키 아니 오늘은 나 먼저 들어왔어
English: Kiki, no, I came in first today
Oh really? Where are your parents?
Oh, my parents just came in.
I see. Your parents said it wasn't hard for you?
Kiki, don't be hard on yourself
Still, I think it helped me a lot
Kiki, you're lucky~ You have a dependable daughter~
Are we all going to work together?
Kiki, okay, okay
No I go to work at 11

Korean: 키키 그러면 부모님은 몇 시에 출근하시는데?
English: Kiki: Then what time do your parents leave for work?
Well, my parents leave for work around 9 o'clock.

Korean: 와 대박 그러면 총 몇 시간 일하시는 거야,?
English: Wow, awesome. Then how many hours do you work in total?
More than 12 hours a day,? You work a lot ㅠㅠ
Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ You must be so tired
No break time?

Korean: 맞아 요즘 브레이크 타임 도입할까 생각 중이셔
English: Yes, I'm thinking about introducing break time these days.

Korean: 요즘에 브레이크 타임 없는 식당 없어 추진해!
English: These days, there are no restaurants that don't have break times, so let's do this!
Kiki: Well, I guess I'll have to talk about this later.
Are you seeing someone right now?

Korean: 어쩜 나한테 그런 말을 할 수가 있어 ?
English: How can you say that to me?

Korean: 미안 키키 왜 너 좋아하는 사람 있었잖아!
English: Sorry Kiki, why didn't you have someone you liked!
Kiki, that's also past tense, not now.

Korean: 키키 왜 그 사람이랑 잘 안 됐어?
English: Kiki, why didn't things work out with that guy?

Korean: 키키 응 어쩌다 보니까 잘 안됐네
English: Kiki Yeah, it didn't go well for me

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 너 고백은 해 봄?
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ Have you ever confessed?
No, it was over before I could confess
Wow, does that guy have a boyfriend?

Korean: 키키 응 ㅠㅠ 쎄 해서 찾아보니까 생겼더라구
English: Kiki Yeah ㅠㅠ I looked it up because it was strong and it was there

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 대박 고백이라도 하지 그랬어!
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ You should have at least confessed!
I've had a crush on you for several years! ?
Kiki, you've been in love with me for almost 3 years?
Wow, awesome ㅜㅜ
Is this true?
Are you okay?
Kiki, I had a hard time for a while, but now I'm calm
Dirt ㅜㅜ I'm sad
You don't keep in touch with that friend?

Korean: 키키 그치 그때 이후로 연락도 안하고 지내고 있어
English: Kiki, we haven't been in touch since then.
Do you have a dog at home right now?

Korean: 헐 아니 우리집은 동물 못 키우고 있어
English: Oh no, we can't raise animals in our house
Why do your parents hate you?
ㅜㅜ I'm sad,

Korean: 응 그것도 있긴 한데 돌봐줄 사람이 없어
English: Yeah, that's true, but there's no one to take care of it.

Korean: 그렇지 ㅜㅜ 너는 나중에라도 키우고 싶어?
English: Right ㅜㅜ Do you want to raise it later?

Korean: 응 나는 꼭 강아지나 고양이 키우고 싶어
English: Yeah, I really want to raise a dog or a cat.

Korean: 키키 너는 앵기는 애기 좋아해 아니면 니가 앵기는 걸 좋아해?
English: Kiki, do you like babies that cry or do you like being cried?

Korean: 나는 나한테 앵기는 애기가 더 좋아
English: I like babies who nag at me more

Korean: 그러면 무조건 너는 귀여운 갱얼쥐를 택해라!
English: Then you should definitely choose the cute gangster!
Gangerjwi is good
I came back today after petting the dog I was walking.
Kiki, really?
What kind of puppy was it?
It was a Pomeranian and it was super cute.

Korean: 헐 대박 ㅜㅜ 포메 물개같이 생긴 아이 아니야?
English: Oh my gosh, isn't that a Pomeranian that looks like a seal?
Kiki is right, it's completely round like a seal

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 걔 털 되게  부르덥잖아 ㅜ
English: Kiki, wow, that guy's hair is so fluffy ㅜ

Korean: 맞아 그래서 시간 가는 줄 모르고 쓰담 해주다 왔어
English: That's right, so I came here after writing without realizing how much time had passed.
What kind of exercise do you like?
Kiki I like basketball. Do you?

Korean: 나는 그냥 숨 쉬는 거 좋아해~
English: I just like breathing~

Korean: 키키 나도 그게 제일 좋긴 해
English: Kiki I like that the best too
Kiki, do you play basketball with your friends?

Korean: 키키 응 고등학교 때 했던 애들이랑 요즘도 농구 해
English: Kiki Yeah, I still play basketball with the kids I played with in high school.

Korean: 헐 대박 ㅋ 요즘에 추워서 할 수 있겠어
English: Wow, awesome lol It's cold these days so I guess I can do it

Korean: 키키 맞아 그래서 몸 안 풀고 하면 금방 다칠 꺼 같더라구
English: Kiki, that's right. If you don't stretch your body, you'll get hurt quickly.

Korean: 키키 너 농구 하다가 다친 적도 있어?
English: Kiki, have you ever gotten hurt playing basketball?
I've been hurt so much, I hurt my ankle too

Korean: 키키 헐 대박 ㅜㅜ 접질린 거야?
English: Kiki, wow, awesome ㅜㅜ Are you sick of it?

Korean: 키키 응 한번 접질르니까 자주 그러더라구
English: Kiki, yeah, once you do it once, it happens often.

Korean: 맞아 그거 너 인대에 문제 있는 거일 걸?
English: Yeah, that must be a problem with your ligaments, right?

Korean: 키키 맞아 인대 다쳐서 한번 고생했더니 그러더라
English: Kiki, you're right, you had a hard time once because you hurt your ligament, and that's what happened

Korean: 헐 ㅜㅜ 한의원 가서 침 한 번 맞아!
English: Oh my gosh ㅜㅜ I need to go to a Korean medicine clinic and get some acupuncture!

Korean: 키키 맞아 그거 맞으면 금방 좋아진다는데 한번 가보려고
English: Kiki, that's right. If you get that right, you'll get better quickly. I'm going to try it out.

Korean: 너 이제 일 끝나고 뭐 할 거야?
English: What are you going to do after work?

Korean: 키키 나 이제 씻고 게임 해야지
English: Kiki, I have to wash up and play games now.

Korean: 키키 너 요즘에 어떤 게임 해!?

Korean: 나 그런 거 못 해 ㅜㅜ
English: I can't do that ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그래? 피시방 안 간 지가 언제야?
English: Yeah? When was the last time you went to a PC room?

Korean: 일단 나는 최근에 갔던 이유가 이력서 뽑을려고 갔었지,
English: First of all, the reason I went recently was to get my resume picked.
Oh no! It's a game at the PC room~

Korean: 그런데 요즘에 코로나 때문에 못 가잖아~
English: But I can't go these days because of Corona~
No, there are curtains
Let's go together next time!
As a travel veteran, is there any travel destination you would recommend?
I recently went to Busan and it was nice.

Korean: 하 나 부산 한 번도 안 가봤잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: Hana, I've never been to Busan before ㅜㅜ
Oh really? Go with your boyfriend next time.

Korean: 니가 올리는 돼지 국밥이랑 밀면 너무 먹고 싶어 ㅜㅜ
English: I really want to eat the pork noodle soup and wheat noodles you posted ㅜㅜ
The noodles were really tasty
Kiki, the king of the land, is on the rise

Korean: 헐 육전도 나 한 번도 안 먹어봤어 ㅜㅜ
English: Wow, I've never even eaten meat before ㅜㅜ
The food is delicious, but there are also some nice tourist attractions nearby.

Korean: 그래 그런 곳 갔으면 관광지도 가야지
English: Yeah, if you go to a place like that, you should also go to the tourist map.
Recommend it!

Korean: 광안대교 야경에 맥주 한잔하면 그냥 끝나지 키키
English: Just having a beer while watching the night view of Gwangan Bridge is not enough

Korean: 헐 나도 그런 곳 가서 갬성 챙겨오고 싶다!
English: Wow, I want to go to a place like that and get my bearings!

Korean: 언니는 연차 언제 쓸 수 있어?
English: When can I use my annual leave, sister?

Korean: 연차는 상관없는데 나중에 아꼈다 쓸 거야!
English: The number of years doesn't matter, I'll save it for later!

Korean: 오호~ 잘 아껴둬 그거 내가 뺏을 거야 ^^
English: Oho~ Save it well, I'll take it away ^^
Huh? You're saying such scary things?
We should go on a trip with our family!

Korean: 어제 너네 동네도 비가 하루 종일 왔니?
English: Did it rain all day in your neighborhood yesterday?
No, I was just coming and going
How is it there now?

Korean: 일단 내가 밖을 안 나가봐서 모르겠어.
English: First of all, I don't know because I don't go outside.
Go outside, Jipsoon...
Kiki, I don't know what the weather is like

Korean: 주말인데 나갈 일이 뭐 있어 ㅜㅜ
English: It's the weekend, what should I do? ㅜㅜ
I went to a cafe and met my boyfriend!

Korean: 남친이 바빠서 나 안 만나준대 ㅜㅜ
English: My boyfriend is busy so he can't meet me ㅜㅜ
Oh, then I have no reason to go out!
It's windy and cool these days
So, that's why I'm going to go out later!
Where are you going?
Wear long sleeves when you go out
It's cold, Kiki

Korean: 그냥 집 앞에 있는 카페 허허
English: Just a cafe in front of my house haha

Korean: 고작 나간 곳이 앞에 있는 카페라니...
English: The only place I went to was a cafe in front of me...

Korean: 나는 큰 용기를 가지고 나가는 거야!
English: I'm going out with great courage!
Yeah, applause for your great courage...

Korean: 맞아 나 그리고 반 샷 들어간 카페 라떼도 먹을 예정이야!
English: Yes, I'm also planning on having a half-shot cafe latte!
Yeah, eat well
It's the changing of seasons these days, so be careful not to catch a cold~
Did you see the article this time?
Yeah I saw it
Motorcycle accidents are so bad these days.
Hey, did you see that video?

Korean: 응 맞아 차마 눈을 못 뜨겠더라
English: Yeah, that's right. I couldn't even open my eyes.
Yeah, that was so gross ㅜㅜ
I feel so bad for both drivers

Korean: 그러니까 오토바이 탔던 사람 가족들은 무슨 일이야 ㅜㅜ
English: So what happened to the family of the person who rode the motorcycle? ㅜㅜ
That's why motorcycles are really dangerous

Korean: 니 동생 혹시 오토바이 타는 거 아니지?
English: Your brother rides a motorcycle, doesn't he?

Korean: 그럼~ 운전 면허도 없는 걸 키키
English: Then~ Kiki doesn't even have a driver's license

Korean: 걔는 인생을 어떻게 산 거냐 키키
English: How did he live his life Kiki

Korean: 언니 걔는 필기 시험도 떨어지는 애야 키키
English: Sister, that kid is the one who fails the written test. Kiki

Korean: 그래, 착하기만 하면 됐지 그럼 됐어.
English: Yeah, as long as you're nice, that's fine.

Korean: 그치 나는 걔가 건강하기만 하면 됐어 ...
English: Yeah, I just want him to be healthy...
Yes, health is the best for everyone!
Yeah, take care of your health!

Korean: 이번에 아프간 애들 한국 들어온 거 봤어?
English: Have you seen the Afghan kids coming into Korea this time?
Yeah, I saw that you said you were going to Jincheon~
Oh, you said you were going there?
I haven't seen that~
Kiki, it can accommodate about 380 people
Great our country
Most of the kids said they came!
That's right, that's why I gave her a doll as a gift!

Korean: 애들이 그거 꼭 껴안고 있어 ㅠㅠ
English: The kids are hugging it tightly ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 나 그 사진 봤는데 뭔가 짠하면서 귀엽더라 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, I saw that picture and it was kind of sad and cute ㅜㅜ

Korean: 애들이 무섭겠지만 우리나라에 잘 적응 했으면 좋겠다...
English: I know the kids might be scared, but I hope they adapt well to our country...

Korean: 부모님이랑 떨어져서 외국에 있다는 게 얼마나 무서울까 ㅜㅜ
English: How scary would it be to be away from your parents and in a foreign country? ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그러게 우리가 도울 수 있으면 도와주고 싶네!
English: Well, we'd love to help if we can!

Korean: 근데 너 거기에 달린 댓글 봤어?
English: But did you see the comments there?
Yeah, that's so selfish
People are bad

Korean: 맞아 우리 어려울 때 미국에서 도와준 건 기억 못 해!
English: Right, don't you remember that America helped us when we were having a hard time!

Korean: 그러게 역사를 잊은 민족은 미래도 없다더니
English: They say that a nation that forgets its history has no future.

Korean: 어 너 명언을 얘기하니까 멋있어 보인다!
English: Hey, you look cool when you talk about famous quotes!

Korean: 우리도 남이 도와주면 똑같이 도와줘야 해!
English: If others help us, we should help them in return!

Korean: 너 저번에 보니까 헤어 스타일 예쁘더라~
English: The last time I saw you, your hairstyle was pretty~

Korean: 응~ 그냥 시원하게 머리 잘랐지 뭐야
English: Yeah, I just cut my hair cool
What is the name of that hairstyle?

Korean: 중단발 컷 이라는데 그냥 거지 존 같기도 하고?
English: They say it's a medium bob cut, but doesn't it just look like a beggar's bob?
No, it was really pretty
Is that a hush cut?
No, it's a layered cut.
I'm glad it suits you!

Korean: 요즘에 레이어드 컷을 사람들이 많이 하네~?
English: A lot of people are getting layered cuts these days, huh?
I guess that's the trend~
How's your hair these days, sister?

Korean: 나는 지금 조선 시대 사람처럼 됐어.
English: I feel like I'm from the Joseon Dynasty now.

Korean: 헐 뭐야~ 미용실 안 간 지가 언제야?
English: Oh my gosh~ How long has it been since I last went to the hair salon?

Korean: 나 그래도 올해 4월에 갔는데 머리가 빨리 자라더라.
English: I went there in April this year and my hair grew quickly.
I see! You don't dye or perm your hair?
I mastered that two years ago~

Korean: 맞지 그때 언니 머리 아주 볼 만했어 키키
English: Right, back then, your sister's hair was really nice to look at Kiki

Korean: 옛날 사진 보니까 나 완전 휘황찬란 했더라 키키
English: Looking at old photos, I was so dazzling Kiki
Yeah, I miss those days
Let's go to the hair salon next time!
Are you feeling sick these days?

Korean: 나 요즘 아침마다 똥을 못 싸
English: I can't poop in the morning these days

Korean: 야 너두? 야 나두! 나이가 드니까 그런 가 봐. ㅜㅜ
English: Hey you too? Hey me too! I guess it's because I'm getting older. ㅜㅜ

Korean: 이제 우리 유산균 챙겨 먹을 나이라구
English: Now is the age where we can start taking probiotics

Korean: 나는 심지어 유산균이랑 다른 것도 먹는데?
English: I even take probiotics and other things?
What else do you eat?
Let me know too!
I'm taking vitamins and magnesium!
Magnesium is said to be really good for eye twitching!
Did it work?

Korean: 맞아 나 회사 들어오고 눈 떨려서 샀잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: That's right, I bought it because I was so nervous when I came into the company ㅜㅜ

Korean: 어머 얼마나 일을 하면 눈이 다 떨린대 ㅜㅜ
English: Oh my, my eyes start to twitch when I work so much ㅜㅜ

Korean: 내 몸뚱아리 완전 저질로 변했어 ㅜㅜ
English: My body has completely changed into a low quality one ㅜㅜ
Really? Then supplements are essential.
Eat well

Korean: 맞아 그래서 내 책상 약 상자들로 가득해 키키
English: Yeah, that's why my desk is full of medicine boxes Kiki
Eat well too
They say food is medicine

Korean: 맞아 근데 나 하루에 한 끼 먹음.
English: Yeah, but I eat one meal a day.
I'll buy you food
Come out right now!

Korean: 나 당근 마켓에 화장품 올렸던 거 알아?
English: Did you know I put cosmetics on Carrot Market?
What is Carrot Market?
Is this the first time you've heard of that? Is it a mart?

Korean: 너 어린 애가 당근 마켓도 모르니?
English: You little kid, don't you know about Carrot Market?
I guess I'm fat Kiki
What are you doing?
I'm dealing with the locals!
Ah~ It's not a delivery transaction but a direct transaction?

Korean: 어 근데 택배 거래도 상대방이랑 얘기해서 가능해!
English: Oh, but you can also do a courier transaction by talking to the other party!
Oh it's okay Kiki
But isn't it scary?
What if he runs away with the money?
So, I tell them to bring cash if possible!

Korean: 오... 계좌 이체 하는 건 아니고?
English: Oh... You're not transferring money?

Korean: 응 그것도 해도 되고 나는 되도록 현금 추구함!
English: Yeah, that can be done too, but I prefer cash if possible!
Oh, I see. What cosmetics did you sell?

Korean: 나 몰래 내 꺼 판 거 아니지?
English: You didn't sell mine without me knowing, did you?

Korean: 그럴 리가~ 올영에서 샀는데 양이 많아서 하나 올렸지~
English: No way~ I bought it at Olyoung, but there was a lot so I uploaded one~

Korean: 그런 거 있으면 나나 주지 왜 팔아!
English: If you have something like that, why are you selling it to me?
No~ The place you live is far away~

Korean: 그건 인정 당근 마켓 유용하네 키키
English: That's right, Carrot Market is useful Kiki
I didn't know, but Park Bo-gum went to the military?

Korean: 어휴 간 지가 언젠데~ 우리 오빠 열일 하잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my, when was the last time you left~ My brother is working so hard ㅠㅠ
Yes, I heard he went to the Navyㅜㅜ
Yeah, did you see the picture?
The conquest suits you well, Bogum
Hey, people said Park Bogum is handsome.
Now you know, look at that Kiki

Korean: 나 무슨 군대 드라마 한편 본 줄 알았어 키키
English: I thought I was watching some military drama Kiki
He was really handsome

Korean: 나는 한 장밖에 못 봤는데 여러 장 있니?
English: I only saw one, but do you have more?
Share it!
It comes up a lot in Naver articles
Park Bo-gum is definitely the best!

Korean: 보통 연예인들 군대 사진 보면 일반 사람 같던데 박보검은 진짜 연예인이더라 키키
English: Usually, when you look at celebrities' military photos, they look like ordinary people, but Park Bo-gum is a real celebrity. Kiki

Korean: 어 맞아 군대 사진으로 옥택연도 유명한데 봤어?
English: Oh, right. Ok Taecyeon is also famous for his military photos. Have you seen them?

Korean: 옥택연은 못 봤는데 그 사람도 해군이야?
English: I haven't seen Ok Taecyeon, but is he in the Navy?
No, I think he went to the army
My physical has improved!
If you were in the army, you must have been wearing moss. Did you get discharged?

Korean: 전역한 것 같던데? 요즘 티비에 자주 봐
English: I think you've been discharged? I see you on TV a lot these days.

Korean: 아 진짜? 나는 요즘에 티비를 안 봐서 몰랐네~
English: Oh really? I didn't know because I don't watch TV these days~

Korean: 티비도 좀 보고 살아 언니 ㅠㅠ
English: Watch some TV and live, sis ㅠㅠ
What is your favorite movie?

Korean: 나 작년에 나오 테넷이 내 최애 영화야?
English: I saw Tenet last year and it's my favorite movie?
What about your sister?
Is there a movie called Tenet?

Korean: 앗 오타 ㅠㅠ 작년에 나온 영화야!
English: Oh, typo ㅠㅠ It's a movie that came out last year!
Ah, Tenet is the title of the movie.
What genre is it?
This is a science fiction movie
Sister, did you see this?
No, if it's SF, you should watch Victory Ho
Our lovely Jungki!
Oh, that's already taken over, Kiki
Yoo Hae-jin is so funny
Yeah, all the kids are cute
But who's in Tenet?

Korean: 잘 모르는 배우지만 감독이 인터스텔라 감독이래 키키
English: I don't know the actor very well, but the director is the director of Interstellar.

Korean: 그 감독은 공상 과학을 사랑하시는 분인가 보네~
English: I guess the director loves science fiction~

Korean: 응 그런 것 같아 비슷한 장르지만 다 달라 키키
English: Yeah, I think so. It's a similar genre, but they're all different. Kiki
I should take a look on my day off too!

Korean: 응 영화관에서 아이 맥스로 보는 거 추천해!
English: Yeah, I recommend watching it in IMAX at the theater!

Korean: 아이 맥스는 또 뭐야 문찐은 웁니다 흙 ㅜ
English: What is iMax? Moonjin is crying, dirt.

Korean: 영화관에서 비싼 거 발권 해 달라 해! 키키
English: Ask for expensive tickets at the movie theater! Kiki

Korean: 나 어제 닭볶음탕 먹었는데 넌 뭐 먹었어?
English: I ate spicy stir-fried chicken yesterday. What did you eat?
Ah~ I made and ate jjambbong
Wow, how do you make Jjamppong?

Korean: 아 나 어제 네이버로 레시피 보고 만들었어
English: Oh, I saw the recipe on Naver yesterday and made it.

Korean: 그 레시피 나도 공유해 줄 수 있어?
English: Can you share that recipe with me?
Oh, of course
Should I tell you now?
Yeah, what ingredients do I need to prepare?

Korean: 난 마트에서 오징어랑 새우 야채는 무조건 듬뿍!
English: I always buy a lot of squid, shrimp, and vegetables at the supermarket!
Isn't squid expensive these days?

Korean: 글쎄 엄마가 사서 나도 잘 몰라
English: Well, my mom bought it so I don't know either
Oh, did you eat with your mom?
Oh, I ate with my family.
It must have tasted even better because I ate it with my family!
Oh, then it was really delicious

Korean: 나도 다음에 놀러 가면 짬뽕 해 줘!
English: Next time I come over, make me some Jjamppong!
Okay, let's do that unconditionally

Korean: 너 저번에 살았던 집은 어떻게 됐어?
English: What happened to the house you lived in last time?
I came down home because my contract expired
Didn't you get off in the middle?
Oh, that's what happened, it worked out well

Korean: 그렇구나 니 집 저번에 사건 있었잖아!
English: Oh, there was an incident at your house last time!
Oh, that was absolutely horrible
Yeah, it wasn't a big deal back then!
I thought I was going crazy
How much was the monthly rent for the house you lived in?
The house I lived in was probably 50 years old
Is it 50 including management fee?
It turned out like that, including everything.

Korean: 그래도 서울 집 값 생각하면 저렴한 거네!
English: Still, it's cheap considering the price of houses in Seoul!
Yeah, yeah, if you think about it that way, then yes, that's true
Right, that's right. Did you say it was a one-room apartment?
Oh yeah that's right it's a studio
What do you ride home?
I take the bus home
What is the bus interval?

Korean: 배차 간격이 10분 정도 되는 거 같더라
English: I think the interval between trains is about 10 minutes.
You're getting home faster than I thought!
Yeah, that's right, the bus comes often.
Are there a lot of people on the bus?
Oh, even though it's corona, there were quite a lot of them
The interval between buses to our Nonsan house is 20 minutes!
Oh, it's really harder than I thought
Yes, all the people who ride are elderly.
It's no different here
Right? Is there a lot of elderly people in Mungyeong?
Yeah, there were quite a few more than I thought.
Yes, is the bus driver friendly?
Oh yeah, I think so
Do you have any part-time job these days?

Korean: 어 나 요새 재택 알바하고 있어
English: Oh, I'm working from home these days.

Korean: 역시 코로나 떄문에 다들 재택 알바 하는구나!
English: As expected, everyone is working from home because of Corona!
Oh yeah, that's good
So there are no commuting hours?
Then of course I really like it
How much is the daily wage?

Korean: 어 하루 일당으로 안 하고 시급으로 해
English: Oh, you don't do it by the day, you do it by the hour
If you get paid hourly, how many hours a day do you work?
I think I usually do it for 5 hours a day
So what do you do with the rest of your time?
Free time in the remaining time
I'm really jealous of you
I want to work from home too!
I'm totally jealous of your work from home job

Korean: 그러니까 자유 시간 때 주로 뭐 해?
English: So what do you usually do in your free time?
I usually watch variety shows or dramas
I also read books
Gorang? What book are you reading?

Korean: 어 시간에 대한 책 요즘 읽고 있어
English: I'm reading a book about time these days.
How old did you say your brother was?

Korean: 어 네 살 차이니까 스물 한 살이야
English: Oh, there's a four year age difference, so I'm twenty-one
There's a 4 year age difference!
You said you had a younger brother, right?
Oh right, my lovely little brother
Then you must have been discharged from the military by now!
No, I'm not in the military yet

Korean: 그나저나 진짜 사랑스러운 남동생 맞아? 키키
English: By the way, are you really a lovely little brother? Kiki
Oh, he's a really noisy little brother.
Kiki is also a love between siblings.
So where are you now?
I don't know where it is
Will you be alive?

Korean: 역시 그래도 가족이랑 배웅해 줬을 거 아니야?
English: But still, wouldn't you have seen him off with his family?
No, he said he saw his friend off and left.

Korean: 아 진짜 가족이랑 같이 안 갔어?
English: Oh, you really didn't go with your family?

Korean: 어 가족이랑은 만날 수가 없었고 친구가 우선이야 걔는
English: He couldn't meet his family and his friends came first.
But my younger cousin did the same thing.
How old did you say your brother was?
