Wow... my stomach is swollen...

Korean: 근데 엽떡에 쌀떡 있다는 말은 안 들어본 듯...!  신떡도 학생 때 진짜 맨날 먹었는데 오뎅 튀김 짱 좋아해서
English: But I don't think I've ever heard of rice cakes in yeop-tteok...! I ate shin-tteok every day when I was a student, and I really liked fried fish cakes.

Korean: 다들 지금 살고 있는 집은 아파트야?
English: Is the house you all live in now an apartment?
Is it a house?

Korean: 주택 난 그러고 보니 아파트는 한 번도 살아 본 적 없네
English: Housing Now that I think about it, I've never lived in an apartment.

Korean: 지금은 아파트 사는데 옛날에는 주택 살아봤었음!
English: I live in an apartment now, but I used to live in a house!

Korean: 근데 주택 약간 주차 공간이 애매해서 갠적으로는 아파트 선호...
English: But personally, I prefer apartments because the parking space is a bit ambiguous...

Korean: 아항 나는 주택을 안 살아봤는데 언니랑은 반대네!
English: Ah, I've never lived in a house before, but it's the opposite with my sister!

Korean: 뭔가 주택은 관리하기가 힘들 거 같아
English: I feel like housing would be difficult to manage
Yeah, in that respect, apartments are convenient...

Korean: 근데 가끔 오빠네 집 가보면 조금 답답하더라~
English: But sometimes when I go to my brother's house, I feel a little stuffy~

Korean: 어때 아파트 살면서 그런 느낌 받은 적 없어?
English: Have you ever felt that way while living in an apartment?

Korean: 음... 답답한 건 잘 모르겠는데 우리 집 바로 앞에 놀이터가 있어서 애기들 노는 소리 좀 나면 시끄러워서 그거는 조금 그렇더라고...
English: Um... I don't know what's so stuffy about it, but there's a playground right in front of my house, so it's a bit noisy when the kids are playing, so that's a bit of a problem...

Korean: 나두 계속 아파트 살았어서 그런지 답답한지는 모르겠어 하하
English: I don't know if it's because I've always lived in an apartment, but I feel suffocated haha
Then, do you also take care of your sister's yard?

Korean: 화분이랑 나무랑 있긴 한데 아빠가 주로 하시고 나는 그냥 감상만 키키
English: There are flower pots and trees, but my dad mostly does it and I just admire it.

Korean: 거기서 무화과랑 따먹고 그랬는데 올해는 농사 실패 ㅠㅠ
English: We used to eat figs there and stuff, but this year the harvest was a failure ㅠㅠ

Korean: 흐엉 ㅠㅠ 무화과 한번도 안 먹어봤는데 신기하다
English: Huh ㅠㅠ I've never had figs before, so that's interesting

Korean: 약간 마당에 대한 로망은 있는데 관리할 자신이 없음 키키
English: I have a bit of a romantic idea about the yard, but I don't have the confidence to manage it. Kiki

Korean: 그치 나두 키키 올해 너무 더웠어서 무화과가 잘 안 된 건가?
English: Oh, right, Kiki? Was it because it was so hot this year that the figs didn't grow well?
Figs are super delicious
Try it next time

Korean: 맞아 관리하려면 좀.. 가지도 쳐 줘야 하고 신경 쓸게 많지...
English: That's right. To manage it, you have to prune the branches and take care of a lot of things...
The taste is good, good~!

Korean: 막 고추나 쌈채소 이런 거나 허브 이런 거 키워서 쓰고 싶다는 생각은 많이 했는데!
English: I've always thought a lot about growing and using things like peppers, lettuce, and herbs!

Korean: 그런 거 키워서 먹으면 재밌을 거 같긴 해!
English: I think it would be fun to grow something like that and eat it!

Korean: 허브는 집에서도 키울 수 있는데 한번 키워봐 ~
English: Herbs can be grown at home, so give it a try~

Korean: 허브 중에서 나 애플민트 그거 좋아해~
English: Among herbs, I like apple mint~

Korean: 근데 집에서 키울 때 허브 조금 워험... 화분 바꿔 주다 보면 점점 커져서 허브 농장 된다구 집이 키키
English: But when growing herbs at home, it's a bit risky... If you change the pot, they will grow bigger and bigger, so your house will become an herb farm.
Herb Farm Kiki

Korean: 무화과 말고 뭐 키워본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever grown anything besides figs?
Or something I want to raise

Korean: 나는 없긴 한데... 키키 바질 키워서 음식에 넣어 먹어도 재밌을 거 같긴 해
English: I don't have any, but... I think it would be fun to grow Kiki basil and put it in food.

Korean: 아 그런 사람 있다. 우리 집에~
English: Oh, there's someone like that. In my house~

Korean: 우리 오빠 아파트 사는데 거기에 화단 크게 만들어서 키우더라구
English: My brother lives in an apartment and he makes a big flower bed there and grows plants there.

Korean: 오오오 사실 옛날에 자취했었을 때 따로 깻잎이나 상추 이런 거 화단 만들어서 키워볼까 했는데...귀차나서 안함 키키
English: Oh oh oh, actually, when I lived alone in the past, I thought about making a separate flower bed to grow things like perilla leaves and lettuce... but I didn't do it because I was lazy. Kiki

Korean: 키키 자주 물 주고 들여다봐야 해서 귀찮긴 할 듯...
English: Kiki, you have to water it often and look after it, so it might be annoying...

Korean: 나중에 무화과 잘 되면 우리도 좀 나눠줘~
English: If the figs do well later, please share some with us~

Korean: 당연하지~ 수확량 많을 때는 동네 사람들 하고도 나눠서 먹어~
English: Of course~ When the harvest is plentiful, we share it with the neighbors~
This year is a pity, a pity
Oh wow, that's amazing. So it's a single-family home?
I see you said there was a yard?

Korean: 웅웅 그렇겠징! 나눠 먹을 정도로 많이 나오는구나?
English: Yeah, I guess so! There's so much that we can share?

Korean: 짱이다 키키 무화과 말고 딴 것도 있어?
English: It's awesome Kiki. Do you have anything else besides figs?

Korean: 단독은 아닌데 거의 단독처럼 살아 키키
English: Kiki, who lives almost like she's alone, but not alone

Korean: 옥상에 포도랑 뭐 또 있다고 들었는데 옥상에 거의 안 올라가서 모르겠네~
English: I heard there are grapes and other things on the rooftop, but I don't know because I rarely go up there~

Korean: 근데 포도 가져오신 거 보니까 되게 작더라
English: But the grapes you brought were really small
I hope things go well next year....

Korean: ㅠㅠ 내년에는 풍작 해서 우리도 한 송이씩... 키키 기대해 봅니다앙!
English: ㅠㅠ Next year, let's hope for a bountiful harvest so that we can each get one flower... Kiki, I'm looking forward to it!

Korean: 회사 올 때 보통 대중교통 뭐 타고 와?
English: What type of public transportation do you usually take to get to work?
Bus and subway~ What about you?

Korean: 나는 지하철 정기권 끊어서 지하철만 타려고 노력 중!
English: I'm trying to buy a subway pass and only ride the subway!

Korean: 아아 정기권은 일정 금액 내고 지하철 무제한인 건가?..
English: Ah, is the subway pass something that allows you to ride the subway without limit by paying a certain amount of money?

Korean: 그런 거 같더라 얘기 들어보니까 버스로 환승은 안 되고 ~그럼 많이 절약 돼?
English: I think so. After hearing the story, you can't transfer to a bus. ~ So you save a lot?
I was thinking about whether to do it or not ~

Korean: 웅웅 이것도 구간별로 갈 수 있는 곳이 제한되어있어서 단계를 선택할 수 있는데 1단계만 해도 서울 앵간한 곳은 다 다닐 수 있음
English: Yeah, this also has a limit to the places you can go by section, so you can choose a level. Even with just level 1, you can go to all the places in Seoul.

Korean: 근데 버스 환승이 안돼서 좀 불편... 그래도 최소 만원은 절약하더라고!
English: But it's a bit inconvenient because you can't transfer buses... But I still saved at least 10,000 won!
The section is set, Kiki
I've never used it before...

Korean: 나는 버스 타고 오는데! 보통 그럼 오는 시간은 얼마나 걸려?
English: I'm coming by bus! How long does it usually take to get there?

Korean: 난 버스 지하철 합치면 걷는 거 포함 1시간쯤?
English: It takes me about an hour including walking by bus and subway?
Are you just coming by bus?
Then it won't be blocked?
Hmm... It seems like it'll take about 50 minutes!
Including walking for me!
Do you guys transfer a lot?
Yeah, it's okay since you're coming from the center lane!

Korean: 나는 바로 오는 버스도 있는데 그 버스가 좀 늦게 오면 다른 거 타고 한번 갈아탈 때도 있엉
English: I have a bus that comes right away, but if that bus is a little late, I sometimes take another bus and transfer.

Korean: 난 버스 타고 지하철 타고 갈아타고 와 키키
English: I took the bus, took the subway, and changed trains to Kiki
Transfer?

Korean: 아침에 일찍 오려고 경의중앙 타고 분당선 갈아타고 2호선 갈아탄당!
English: To get there early in the morning, I took the Gyeongui-Jungang Line, transferred to the Bundang Line, and then transferred to Line 2!
Wow.. it's a bit tough haha
Aren't there a lot of people on the subway in the morning?
Wow~ You really change a lot
If it's line 9, isn't it that hellish train?

Korean: 많긴 한데 그래도 나름 일찍 출발해서 (7시에 열차타니까..? ) 막 퇴근길 만큼 붐비지는 않는 듯...
English: There are a lot of people, but since we leave relatively early (because we catch the train at 7..?), it doesn't seem as crowded as the commute home...

Korean: 하 진짜 퇴근길이 너무 힘든 것 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh seriously, the commute home seems so hard ㅠㅠ
I guess that's true because I ride a little fast!

Korean: 나도 저번에 퇴근할 때 지하철 타봤는데.. 한 대 보내고 탔어 사람 너무 많아서
English: I also rode the subway last time I left work.. I had to let one pass because there were too many people.

Korean: 나 7호선 타는데 그건 퇴근 길에는 항상 그래~
English: I take line 7, and that's always the case on my way home from work~

Korean: 퇴근할 때는 대중교통은 다 사람이 많군...
English: When I leave work, public transportation is always crowded...

Korean: 저도 분당선 사람 많으면 차 하나 보내거나 완전 짜부돼서 타야 해서... 그래서 퇴근할 때 튀어나가요 키키
English: I also have to send a car or ride it when there are a lot of people on the Bundang Line... So I jump out when I leave work Kiki

Korean: 근데 다른 사람들도 다같이 튀어나가는 거 아냐? 키키
English: But aren't other people jumping out too? Kiki

Korean: 출퇴근 시간 자유롭게 하는 회사도 있더라
English: There are also companies that allow flexible working hours.

Korean: 막 10시에 출근하고 퇴근 7시에 하고? 오후에 출근하는 사람도 있으려나?
English: You go to work at 10 and leave at 7? Are there people who go to work in the afternoon?

Korean: 약간 대기업이나 이런 곳은 유연 근무제 해서 자기가 출근 시간 조정할 수도 있고 그렇던데... 부럽 하하
English: Some large companies and such have flexible work hours so you can adjust your own work hours... I'm jealous haha
But wouldn't it be impossible to go to work in the afternoon...!
No afternoon! It was from 10 to 2...

Korean: 기억이 안 나지만 뭐 저렇게 중간 타임은 꼭 근무를 해야 하는 걸로 알아 하하
English: I don't remember, but I think you have to work during those breaks haha
Ah, then it might be easier to just go to work at 9...

Korean: 만약에 유연 근무제이면 몇 시에 출근하고 싶어?
English: If you have a flexible work schedule, what time would you like to come to work?

Korean: 나는... 그냥 일찍 출근해서 일찍 퇴근하고 싶엉!
English: I... just want to go to work early and leave work early!
If it really works out, I'll start work at 8 and leave at 5...! Whoa!

Korean: 일 안 하고 놀 때는 직장 생활이 하고 싶었는데 또 일하니까 금방 놀고 먹고 싶다.. 그치 않음? 키키
English: When I was not working and playing, I wanted to work, but when I started working again, I wanted to play and eat right away.. Isn't that right? Kiki

Korean: 3일 정도 쉴 때 많았잖아 휴일에 연결돼서
English: There were many times when I had about 3 days off, because it was connected to a holiday.
Then I feel like going to work~

Korean: 근데 토요일 일요일은 너무 짧은 거 같아 키키
English: But I think Saturday and Sunday are too short Kiki
Are you talking about that alternate holiday!?

Korean: 토욜 일욜..너무 순식간 ㅠㅠ 그래도 9월에는 추석 있으니까!
English: Saturday and Sunday... It passed so quickly ㅠㅠ But still, there's Chuseok in September!

Korean: 난 3일 쉬어도 출근은 안 하고 싶던데 키키
English: I don't want to go to work even if I take 3 days off Kiki
Right, how many days is the Chuseok holiday?

Korean: 연속으로 따지면 5일 아냐? 토요일 일요일 포함
English: Isn't it 5 days in a row? Including Saturday and Sunday.

Korean: 웅웅 맞아 만약에 목욜 금욜까지 월차 쓰면 거의 9일 노는 거임!
English: Yeah, that's right. If you use your vacation days from Thursday to Friday, you'll have almost 9 days off!

Korean: 좋당... 연휴에 맞춰서 연차 쓸 거야?
English: Okay... Are you going to use your vacation days for the holidays?

Korean: 와~ 9일이면 옛날 같으면 진짜 해외여행 가도 되겠다
English: Wow~ If it were 9 days, I could really go on a trip abroad like in the old days.
Oh no, Corona!

Korean: 만약에 여행 갈 수 있었으면 이미 신청해 놨었을 듯 키키
English: If I could have gone on a trip, I would have already applied Kiki

Korean: 근데 진짜 코로나 때문에도 그렇고.. 그냥 10월에 와장창 써야징!
English: But really, because of Corona too.. I just have to write a lot in October!
How much of your monthly leave do you have left?
I have one day left ㅠㅠ

Korean: 이제 9월에 하나 더 생기면 두 개!
English: Now with one more coming in September, there will be two!

Korean: 난 2개~ 근데 추석 때 연결해서 쓰면 진짜 출근하기 싫어질 거 같은데~
English: I have 2~ But if I connect them and use them during Chuseok, I really won't want to go to work~

Korean: 키키 그르네 진짜 나오기 싫겠다 나는 정말 안 쓴 편이이서 아직 1번 썼고 한번은 시험 전날에 예약해둠!
English: Kiki, you're so ugly, I really don't want to come out. I really don't use it, so far I've used it once and reserved it once the day before the exam!

Korean: 회사 다니면서 공부하는 거 넘 힘들당...
English: It's so hard to study while working...

Korean: 오오 시험 전날~ 그것도 좋긴 하넹
English: Oh, the day before the exam~ That's good too

Korean: 뭔가 쓰고 싶은데 아직 계획이 없어서 못 쓰고 있는 중... 헛되게 쓸 수 없어 ㅠㅠ!
English: I want to write something, but I don't have a plan yet, so I can't write... I can't write in vain ㅠㅠ!

Korean: 아! 나 지금 생각났다! 나 휴가 0일 남았어
English: Ah! I just remembered! I have 0 days left on vacation.
It's gloomy...

Korean: 이제 8월말까지 일해야 하나 더 생기는 건가?
English: Does this mean I have to work until the end of August?

Korean: 근데 정말 피 같은 월차 아무렇게나 쓸 수 없어!
English: But I really can't just use my monthly salary however I want!
Be very careful

Korean: 그치 다른 회사들은 백신 맞으면 다음날 휴가도 주더라고 !
English: By the way, other companies even give employees a vacation the next day after getting vaccinated!

Korean: 우리는 안 그러니... 난 토요일에 예약 하하
English: We don't... I have a reservation for Saturday haha

Korean: 대학교도 백신 맞으면 3일 출석 인정 하하
English: Even universities allow 3-day attendance if you get vaccinated haha
It was amazing to see that

Korean: 소리자바... 아직 늦지 않았으니... 백신 휴가.. 기대합니다 찡긋!  키키
English: Sorijaba... It's not too late... Vaccine vacation... I'm looking forward to it Wink! Kiki

Korean: 나는 시험 다음 주 토요일 날 맞는데!
English: My exam is next Saturday!

Korean: 그러면 추석 연휴 시작할 때 맞는 거 아닌가?
English: Then wouldn't it be right at the start of the Chuseok holiday?

Korean: 그러네 추석 때~ 마음껏 못 노는 거 아니야?
English: Oh, so you can't have fun during Chuseok?

Korean: 전 지금 공부만 안 해도 행복할 것 같아요...
English: I think I'd be happy even if I didn't have to study right now...
I'll just lie down...!
are you okay!
How have you been using your monthly leave?

Korean: 나는 한 번에 이틀 몰아서 쓰고 여행 갔다 왔음!
English: I wrote it in two days and went on a trip!
How did you write it, sister?

Korean: 나 아파서 6월 1일에 하루 쓰고 아! 조카 공연 때문에 쓰고 이번에 시험 전에 예약해 뒀어
English: I'm sick so I'm using it for one day on June 1st. Oh! I'm using it for my nephew's performance and I reserved it before the exam this time.
I completely forgot~
Thanks for reminding me of this

Korean: 돈 열심히 벌어서 알차게 또 놀아봅시다!
English: Let's work hard to earn money and have fun!

Korean: 군대 갔던 친구나 가족 면회 가 본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever visited a friend or family member who served in the military?
My real older brother and my cousin's older brother~

Korean: 나두 친오빠랑 친구 면회 간 적 있어!
English: I've also been to visit my older brother and his friend!

Korean: 피엑스 구경하고 운동장? 연병장? 이런 거 구경함 키키
English: After watching PX, I saw a playground? A training ground? Kiki

Korean: 아 진짜? 나는 가도 그런데 구경은 안 해봤었는데 키키
English: Oh really? I went there but I never saw Kiki
I wonder what PX was like

Korean: 부대마다 조금 다를 수도 있는데 나 갔던 데는 그냥 마트처럼 생겼어
English: It might be a little different depending on the unit, but the one I went to just looked like a mart.

Korean: 근데 군대에서만 파는 가격과 물품이 있는 게 좀 다를까... 그 정도~
English: But I think the prices and items that are only sold in the military are a bit different... That's about it~

Korean: 내가 갔던 곳도 그냥 작은 동네 마트 느낌?
English: The place I went to also felt like a small neighborhood mart?

Korean: 훨씬 싸다고 엄마가 흥분해서 이것저것 사셨음 키키
English: My mom was so excited that she bought a bunch of things because they were so cheap. Kiki
Kiki is cute

Korean: 나 친척 할아버지 중에 예전에 공군 직업 군인이셨던 분이 계셔서 아직도 가끔씩 피엑스에서 화장품 같은 거 사서 쓰시고 나눠주시고 이래
English: One of my cousins, a grandfather, used to be a career soldier in the Air Force, so he still occasionally buys cosmetics from PX and uses them and shares them with others.

Korean: 맞아~ 민간인 사는 데보다 훨씬 싸 ㅠㅠ
English: That's right~ It's much cheaper than living as a civilian ㅠㅠ
The US military base PX is a real duty free shop...
Oh wow, the US military is so amazing.

Korean: 달팽이 크림 이런 거 인기 많았던 것 같은데!
English: I think things like snail cream were popular!

Korean: 맞아 맞아 달팽이 크림 가끔씩 사다 주셔 키키
English: Yes, yes, please buy me snail cream every now and then Kiki
I'm curious about the PX of the US military base

Korean: 난 거기까지는 못 들어가 봤는데 미군 부대 안은 옛날 영어 마을 이런 느낌~
English: I haven't been there yet, but the inside of the US military base feels like an old English village.

Korean: 피엑스에서 뭐 뭐 사오라고 시켜만 봤네
English: I just ordered people to buy this and that at PX
They say only one person can enter there at a time

Korean: 나도 달팽이 크림 몇 개 받았다 키키 친척 동생한테
English: I also got some snail cream from my cousin Kiki

Korean: 요즘에는 군대 들어가서 2주 동안 자가격리 하고 훈련소 들어간대!
English: These days, you go into the military, self-quarantine for two weeks, and then go to training camp!

Korean: 오.. 근데 말은 자가격리여도 다 같이 생활관에 있는 건가?
English: Oh.. but even if you're self-quarantining, does that mean you're all in the same dorm?

Korean: 각자 방은 없을 거 아냐 ㅠ
English: We won't each have our own room, right?

Korean: 그러게 한 명씩 자가격리이면 공간이 얼마나 있어야 되는 거야
English: If each person is self-quarantined, how much space do you need?

Korean: 왠지 군대가 그렇게까지 지원은 못해주니까 그냥 방마다 하는 거이지 않을까..!
English: I guess the military doesn't seem to be able to provide that much support, so they're just doing it in each room...!

Korean: 그렇겠지? 그래도 2주 동안 훈련 안 하고 복무 기간에 포함 시켜주는 거면 좋긴 하겠다
English: Sure, right? But it would be nice if they included the two weeks of training as part of the service period.
Oh right, but that would be included~
But the Air Force must be really cool.
Should I call it a position? What was it like?

Korean: 그르게 ㅠㅠ 약간 공군이면 파일럿 물론 물씬 나서 짱 멋있을 듯
English: Yeah, that's right ㅠㅠ If it's a bit of an air force pilot, of course it would be awesome

Korean: 키키 나도 정확한 보직 이름까지는 모르는데 막 헬기 정비하시고 그런 거 했다고 했어!
English: Kiki: I don't know the exact job title, but I heard that you did helicopter maintenance and stuff!

Korean: 아 기술 쪽이셨구나 ~ 그것도 완전 멋있지~
English: Oh, you're in the technical field~ That's totally cool too~

Korean: 옛날 우리 이모부도 직업은 아니고 군 복무할 때 그거 하셨는데
English: My uncle used to do that too, although it wasn't his job, when he served in the military.

Korean: 와 생각해보니까 지인 중에 공군 간 사람이 한 명도 없긴 하네 신기하다
English: Wow, come to think of it, none of my acquaintances went to the Air Force. That's strange.

Korean: 그치 공군 많이 가지는 않으니까.. 복무 기간도 더 길걸?
English: Well, since not many people go to the Air Force, the service period will be longer, right?

Korean: 맞아 그래서 조인성이 너무 늦게 돌아왔어 민간인의 세계로~
English: That's right, that's why Jo In-seong came back so late to the civilian world~

Korean: 키키 조인성 키키 약간 조인성이 유명 했던 것 같기도 하네요
English: Kiki Jo In-seong Kiki Jo In-seong seems to have been a bit famous
As a celebrity who seems to have come out late!

Korean: 학교 다닐 때 제일 좋아했던 과목이 뭐야?
English: What was your favorite subject in school?

Korean: 특별히 좋아했던 과목은 없고 싫어했던 과목이 있다 키키
English: Kiki, there is no subject that I particularly liked, but there are subjects that I disliked.
math

Korean: 나는 체육!  진짜 너무 좋아했엉 ㅠㅠ
English: I loved PE so much ㅠㅠ
I like moving haha
Oh me too, PE!

Korean: 자유 시간 줘서 피구하면 더 좋았었음
English: It would have been better if you had given me some free time to play dodgeball

Korean: 나 공 좀 던졌는데 근데 발야구는 잘 못했어~
English: I threw the ball a bit, but I wasn't very good at kicking.
How were you?

Korean: 오오 역시 여자들은 피구 좋아하는 듯 키키 맨날 쌤한테 피구하자고 조르고 키키
English: Oh, it seems like girls like dodgeball. Kiki always pesters the teacher to play dodgeball. Kiki

Korean: 나는 그냥 체육 다 좋아했었음!!  발야구도 좋아했었다 키키
English: I just liked all sports!! I liked kickball too Kiki
Yeah, kickball was fun too!

Korean: 고등학교 때 우리는 배구로 수행 평가도 하고 그랬는데 배구 해봤어?
English: In high school, we used to evaluate our performance with volleyball and stuff. Have you ever played volleyball?
No, I didn't play volleyball
We evaluated our performance with kickball

Korean: 발야구 재밌긴 한데 공격보다 수비가 재밌어 공을 잘 못 차서 키키
English: Kickball is fun, but defense is more fun than offense. I'm not good at kicking the ball, so I'm a Kiki.

Korean: 오 우리는 배구 남녀 혼성 팀 짜서 학년 별로 대회 열어서 나 2등했었음!
English: Oh, we made a mixed volleyball team and held a competition by grade level and I got second place!

Korean: 발야구는 중딩 때 몇번 했었다 웅웅
English: I played kickball a few times in middle school.
Oh 2nd place~ This is the best!

Korean: 그럼 학교 다니면서 선생님 좋아해본 경험은? 있오?
English: So, have you ever had an experience of liking a teacher while attending school?

Korean: 오 2등~ 선생님은 없고 교생 선생님 좋아했었다
English: Oh 2nd place~ There is no teacher, but the student teacher liked the teacher
I think it was just so amazing

Korean: 와 나도 선생님 좋아한 적은 없었음 키키 근데 여자 선생님들 이랑 웬만하면 정말 친하게 지냈었어서 응응
English: Wow, I never liked teachers either, Kiki, but I was really close with most of the female teachers, so yeah
Yeah? I don't have any either Kiki
Surprisingly, there isn't a single one of us
Sometimes there are kids who like their teacher.
There was no young teacher Kiki

Korean: 맞아요 키키 남자 쌤들은 다 세상 아저씨들에 배드민턴 채나 단소 들고 다니시고 수업 세상 재미없게 하시는데... 어휴 불가능
English: That's right, Kiki. All the male teachers are like old men in the world, and they walk around with badminton rackets and short shoes and make the class boring... Oh my, it's impossible.

Korean: 미쳐 키키 단소 들고 다니는 거 국룰.. 개량 한복 입고 다니는 선생님도 있었는데 ㅠㅠ
English: It's a national rule to carry a crazy Kiki danso around.. There was even a teacher who wore a modified hanbok ㅠㅠ

Korean: 어 우리도 있었는데 국어 선생님~ 같은 분 아녀? 키키
English: Oh, we had a Korean teacher too~ Isn't that the same person? Kiki

Korean: 키키 아니 다들 필수사항이신가 키키 저도 국어선생님이었어요 키키
English: Kiki, isn't this a prerequisite for everyone? Kiki, I was a Korean teacher too. Kiki

Korean: 시험 감독 하실 때 뒤에서 골프 스윙 하시는 것도 국룰
English: It is also a national rule to swing golf from behind while supervising a test.

Korean: 키키 너무 웃기네 그때는 선생님이라는 직업 세상 편해 보였는데 지금 생각해보면 그렇지도 않은 듯
English: Kiki is so funny. At that time, being a teacher seemed like an easy job, but now that I think about it, it doesn't seem like that.

Korean: 선생님은 쉬운 직업 아니지 ~ 진짜 바쁘고 정신 없고
English: Being a teacher is not an easy job ~ It's really busy and hectic

Korean: 제 친구가 지금 초등학교 교사인데 방학이 있는 거는 정말 너무 너무 부러운데 퇴근하고서도 다음날 수업 준비해야 해서 제대로 쉬는 날이 몇 없더라고요..
English: My friend is an elementary school teacher right now, and I'm really, really jealous that she has vacation days, but she doesn't really get a lot of days off because she has to prepare for the next day's classes after work.
They all seem to have strengths and weaknesses

Korean: 마자.. 애들보다도 학부모들 때문에 엄청 힘들다고 하던데 ㅠㅠ 극성인 사람들이 많아서
English: Maja.. I heard that it's harder for the parents than the kids ㅠㅠ There are a lot of extreme people

Korean: 교권이 땅에 떨어진 지 오래라 특히 여교사는 너무 힘들지~
English: It's been a long time since the authority to teach has fallen to the ground, so it's especially hard for female teachers~
There are training sessions even during vacation~

Korean: 요즘에는 원격 수업 하니까 학생들도 다 어떻게 하는지 알려줘야 하고 학부모님들도 못하시는 분들이 너무 많아서 하나하나 다 알려드리고 해야 해 가지고 그게 힘들대요 ㅠㅠ
English: These days, since we are doing remote classes, we have to tell the students how to do it, and there are so many parents who can't do it, so we have to tell them everything one by one, and it's hard.

Korean: 또 대면 수업 하면 그거대로 까다롭고...
English: Also, if you take face-to-face classes, that's difficult in its own way...
How are your family relationships?

Korean: 언니는 오빠 있는 건 알고 있긴 한뎅!
English: I know you have an older brother, though!

Korean: 응 난 오빠 한 명 너도 오빠 한 명이지?
English: Yeah, I have one older brother and you have one older brother too, right?
Oh, I have an older brother too!
They're all the same Kiki

Korean: 그러게 키키 우리 집은 친할머니도 모시고 살아 !
English: That's right, Kiki, my grandmother lives with me at home too!
Oh, wow, so three generations lived together?

Korean: 우리는 오빠도 나가 살아서 완전 핵가족
English: My brother also lives outside of the house, so we are a complete nuclear family.

Korean: 우와 할머니랑 살고 있는 거는 좀 부럽다
English: Wow, I'm a little jealous of you living with your grandmother.

Korean: 나는 할머니가 나 어릴 때 돌아가셔서 좀 아쉽 ㅠㅠ
English: I feel a little sad because my grandmother passed away when I was young ㅠㅠ
I'm jealous that you're living outside of your home....
I'm jealous of Kiki

Korean: 혼자 독립해서 살고 싶은 생각도 있어?
English: Have you ever thought about living independently on your own?
I don't have any right now
Are you thinking of becoming independent?

Korean: 나는 너무너무 독립하고 싶긴 한데 현실적으로 생각해봤을 때 돈 모으기에는... 그냥 부모님이랑 사는 게 맞는 거라... 흑
English: I really, really want to be independent, but realistically speaking, in order to save money... I think it's better to just live with my parents... sigh

Korean: 그치.. 월세 나가는 게 제일 아깝잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Right... Paying rent is the biggest waste ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 막상 혼자 살면 외로울 거 같긴 해
English: But I think I'd be lonely if I lived alone

Korean: 난 거기서 살아도 왠지 집에 매일 올 거 같은데~
English: Even if I lived there, I feel like I would come home every day~

Korean: 빨래랑 설거지 청소 등등 다 할 자신 있어?
English: Are you confident that you can do laundry, dishes, cleaning, etc.?
I've tried that trace!

Korean: 캐나다에서 유학한 적이 있었어서 한 2년 정도 혼자 살았어요!
English: I studied abroad in Canada, so I lived alone for about two years!
How was it!

Korean: 나는 어학 연수 가서도 한국인 언니랑 같이 살고 이랬어서 온전히 혼자 살아본 적이 없어 ㅠ
English: I've never lived completely alone because I lived with a Korean girl even when I went to study abroad.
I've never lived alone before~
What was it like living alone?

Korean: 음 그래도 거기 문화가 우리나라 월세 같은 느낌은 아니고 다 쉐어 하우스였어서 완전 혼자 사는 건 아니었지만 난 그래도 혼자 요리하고 장 보고 빨래하고 정리하고 이런 것들이 그렇게 힘들다고 생각 안 들고 그랬어서 디게 좋았엉!
English: Well, the culture there wasn't like our country's monthly rent culture, and since they were all share houses, I wasn't living completely alone, but I didn't think cooking, shopping, laundry, and organizing by myself were that hard, so I really liked it!

Korean: 오 다행이네 ~ 시간만 좀 여유 있으면 집안일도 나름 할만하긴 해 키키
English: Oh, thank goodness~ If I had some free time, I could do some housework Kiki

Korean: 회사 다니면서 하려고 하면 피곤하긴 하지만...
English: It's tiring to try to do it while going to work, but...

Korean: 난 청소랑 설거지는 괜찮은데 빨래가 너무 너무 귀찮더라~
English: I'm okay with cleaning and washing dishes, but I find laundry so annoying~

Korean: 근데 뭐랄까 떨어져서 살았다가 다시 같이 사니까 부모님의 잔소리가 간섭으로 너무 느껴져서 좀 떨어져서 사는 게 서로에게 좋겠다는..
English: But what can I say, after living apart and then living together again, my parents' nagging felt like too much interference, so I thought it would be better for both of us to live apart.

Korean: 감정이 많이 느껴져서 그냥.. 독립하고 싶어여 엉엉
English: I feel so emotional, I just want to be independent.. sob sob

Korean: 그럼 언니는 남편 분이랑 할머니랑 부모님이랑 이렇게 사시는 거에요?
English: So, does your sister live with her husband, grandmother, and parents like this?

Korean: 아니 아니! 우리 둘은 따로 나와서 살지~
English: No, no! The two of us should live separately~

Korean: 친정집에는 할머니랑 엄마랑 오빠! 아빠는 일 때문에 다른 지역에 나와서 살고 계셔 ㅠㅠ
English: At my parents' house, there's my grandmother, my mother, and my older brother! My father lives in a different area because of work ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 가끔은 조용한 나만의 공간이 있었으면 좋겠다고 생각할 때도 있긴 한데 아플 때 마다 그 생각이 쏙 들어가는 거 같아
English: I also sometimes think it would be nice to have my own quiet space, but I think that thought disappears whenever I'm sick.

Korean: 역시 아플 때는 엄마 죽 최고 최고!
English: When I'm sick, mom's porridge is the best!

Korean: 아 아플 때 혼자 있을 때는 좀... 슬프더라고요 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, when I'm sick and alone, I feel a little... sad ㅠㅠ
It was fortunate that I had friends ㅠㅠ
Yeah.. that's the saddest ㅠㅠ

Korean: 퇴근하고 저녁은 거의 가족들이랑 같이 먹어?
English: After work, do you usually eat dinner with your family?

Korean: 응 나는 거의~ 아침이랑 저녁은 같이 먹지 너는?
English: Yeah, I almost always eat breakfast and dinner together. Do you?

Korean: 나는 아침은 혼자 빨리 먹고 출근하고 저녁은 그래도 집에 있는 가족끼리는 같이 먹어!
English: I eat breakfast alone and go to work quickly, but I eat dinner with my family at home!

Korean: 남자친구랑 만날 때 기념일 같은 거 중요시하는 편이야?
English: When you meet your boyfriend, do you put importance on things like anniversaries?

Korean: 나는 별로 나도 그런 거 잘 못 챙겨서 챙겨주면 미안하더라 키키
English: I'm not really good at taking care of things like that, so I feel sorry if you take care of it for me Kiki
how about you?

Korean: 음.... 처음에는 에이 무슨 기념일이야 라고 생각했는데 안 챙기자니 좀... 찝찝하더라고요?
English: Um... At first I thought, "What kind of anniversary is this?" but then I felt a little... uneasy about not celebrating it.
But I'm a bit curious about the criteria for taking care of it.

Korean: 키키 사람마다 그 기준도 다르긴 하지...
English: Kiki: Everyone's standards are different...

Korean: 난 그냥 같이 맛있는 거 먹고 사진 찍고 그 정도?
English: I just want to eat something delicious together, take pictures, and that's it?

Korean: 이런 건 챙겨야 하는 거 같아
English: I think I need to take care of this

Korean: 각자 생일이랑 처음 만난 날 정도? 이거 챙기는 건가? 키키
English: Each person's birthday and the day they first met? Do you keep this in mind? Kiki

Korean: 아하아하 약간 어떤 사람들은 진짜 좀 호텔 같은 데 가서 놀거나 좀 비싼 곳 가서 분위기 내고 이런 걸 말하는 분들도 계셔서...!
English: Ahahaha, some people really go to places like hotels to hang out or go to expensive places to set the mood and talk about things like that...!

Korean: 나두 그냥 만나서 밥 먹고 그냥 한강 같은 곳 가서 놀고 하는 거면... 그 정도는 해야 한다고 생각해!
English: If we just meet up, have a meal, and go to a place like the Han River to hang out and stuff... I think we should do that much!

Korean: 우리 형님네 부부는 그런 거 아예 안 중요하게 생각해서 결혼기념일도 까먹고 있다가 뒤늦게 깨닫고 그러더라 키키
English: My brother and his wife didn't think that was important at all, so they forgot their wedding anniversary and realized it later. Kiki

Korean: 근데 둘 다 그러니까 안 챙겼다고 싸우지는 않더라고
English: But since they both did that, they didn't fight over not taking care of it.

Korean: 나도 약간 그런 편인 거 같아
English: I think I'm a bit like that too
How far have you taken care of it?

Korean: 달마다 있는 기념일이랑 처음 만난 날 무슨 날 무슨 날 해서 챙기는 친구도 있어 나는
English: I have a friend who celebrates our anniversaries every month and the day we first met.

Korean: 근데 사실 지금 남친이 첫 남친이라 이제 100일밖에 안 챙겨봐서 키키
English: But actually, my current boyfriend is my first boyfriend, so I've only been with him for 100 days, so Kiki
Um, I don't know...
Wow, you must be so cute Kiki
Is your boyfriend treating you well?
I can't even date properly because of Corona ㅠㅠ
Wow~ When are we meeting?
I'm more curious about that Kiki

Korean: 키키 남친이 일 시작하기 전에는 그래도 토요일마다 만났어!
English: Before Kiki's boyfriend started working, we still met every Saturday!

Korean: 뭐 영화 보거나 먹거나 카페 가고 그러는 키키
English: Kiki, who watches movies, eats, goes to cafes, and things like that
That's usually the case Kiki
How old are you? Are we the same age?

Korean: 언니는 몇 살 차이까지 만나 봤엉?
English: Sister, how old have you ever dated someone?
I've only met people my age~

Korean: 진짜 몇 살인지 궁금하다~ 우리 막내의 연애 초 관심!
English: I wonder how old he really is~ Our youngest's initial interest in love!
I'm jealous, I'm jealous, those days were great~
Same age... Kiki shy...

Korean: 근데 이제 서로 너무 바빠서 만나기가 쉽지 않다 ㅠㅠ
English: But now we're both so busy that it's not easy to meet up ㅠㅠ
Kiki shy... cute

Korean: 그리고 요새는 평일에 만나도 9시까지밖에 안 하니까 좀 그렇긴 하네 ㅠㅠ
English: And these days, even if we meet on weekdays, we only work until 9pm, so it's kind of weird ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞네~ 연애 하는 사람들한테는 진짜 문제가 있네~
English: That's right~ There's a real problem with people who are in relationships~

Korean: 해당 사항이 없어서 전혀 생각도 못했다 키키
English: I didn't even think about it because there was no such thing Kiki

Korean: 맞아아아아아 진짜 코로나 너무 싫어어어어어 엉엉엉엉엉 어디 가기도 그렇고...
English: Yeahh ...

Korean: 소개팅으로 만난 거라 처음에는 마스크 벗을 때 마다 아 저렇게 생겼었구나 하면서 놀랬었음 키키
English: We met on a blind date, so at first I was surprised every time he took off his mask and thought, "Oh, that's what he looked like." Kiki

Korean: 맨날 마스크 쓴 것밖에 못 봐서 키키
English: Kiki, I only see you wearing a mask all the time
Kiki, this is so funny ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 진짜 요새는 소개팅했는데 마스크 쓴 것만 보고 어 괜찮다! 이랬는데 벗고 나니까 마기꾼일 수도 있는 거잖아.. 키키
English: But seriously, these days, I've been on blind dates and people just saw me wearing a mask and thought, "Oh, it's okay!" But when I took it off, I realized I might be a magician... Kiki

Korean: 그러게~ 마스크 벗은 거 보고 어땠어? 궁금 궁금
English: Yeah~ How did you feel when you took off your mask? I'm curious.

Korean: 처음에 마스크 안 벗었을 때도 와 잘생겼다라고 생각해서 빨리 마스크 벗겨보고 싶었는데 마스크 벗으니까 은근 귀엽게 생겨서... 하하
English: At first, I thought he was handsome even when he didn't take his mask off, so I wanted to take his mask off quickly, but when he took his mask off, he looked secretly cute... haha
Yes... that's right... hehe

Korean: 허허 부럽네.. 얼굴을 보나 봐? 키키
English: Haha, I'm jealous.. Have you seen my face? Kiki

Korean: 나는 잘생긴 사람은 한 번도 안 만나봤어
English: I've never met a handsome man
sad...

Korean: 키키 뭐야~ 기준이 너무 높은 거 아니고?
English: Kiki, what the heck~ Aren't your standards too high?

Korean: 근데 나는 옛날부터 애들이 너 눈 하수구에 있다고 좀 눈 좀 높이라고 했는데 키키
English: But I've been saying since I was a kid that your eyes are in the sewer so raise your eyes a little higher. Kiki
Luckily a handsome guy came hehe
Isn't your sister picky?
Do you have any pets right now?

Korean: 아니 우리 엄마가 반려 동물 키우면 엄마 나간다고 해서 못 키우고 있지 그래서 아빠가 반려 식물이 많아 키키
English: No, my mom said she would leave if I raised a pet, so I couldn't raise one, so my dad has a lot of pet plants.

Korean: 반려식물 키키 귀욥 지금은 안 키우는데 강아지 2마리 키웠었엉!
English: I don't have a companion plant Kiki anymore, but I used to have two dogs!
What about your sister?
I'm not raising it right now either!

Korean: 지난 주말에 이모네 여행 가서 강아지 잠깐 맡아줬는데 넘 행복해쓰..
English: I went to my aunt's house last weekend and took care of her dog for a while. She was so happy.
The puppy was really so so cute

Korean: 나 작은 강아지 좋아하는데 얼마 전에 인터넷에서 보고 완전 반했어 ㅠㅠ
English: I like small dogs, and I saw this on the internet a while ago and I fell in love with it ㅠㅠ

Korean: 요즘에 유튜브에 강아지 영상 엄청 많고 다양해서 틀어 놓고 보는 맛이 있지 하앍
English: These days, there are so many and diverse puppy videos on YouTube that it's fun to just turn them on and watch them.
Yeah, there are so many cute kids...
Do you like cats too?

Korean: 고양이는 그 세일러문의 루나 알아? 그 고양이 좋아해
English: Cat, you know Luna from Sailor Moon? I like that cat.

Korean: 헐 루나 그 검정 고양이 그 친구인가..!
English: Oh my gosh Luna, is that the black cat guy..!
I've seen it a lot in pictures!

Korean: 근데 고양이는 많이 안 접해봐서 강아지보다는 좀 조심스러워 ㅠㅠ
English: But I don't have much experience with cats, so I'm a bit more cautious than with dogs ㅠㅠ

Korean: 냥냥 펀치 맞을 뻔 하기도 하고... 무셔
English: I almost got punched by a cat... It was scary

Korean: 그건 그래... 개냥이들은 귀엽긴 한데 고양이 잘못 만졌다가 할퀼까 봐 무섭 ㅠㅠ
English: That's true... cats and dogs are cute, but I'm scared that if I touch a cat wrong, it'll scratch me ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나 비 오는 날 고양이 털 세우면서 막 야옹 무섭게 하는 거 있잖아
English: There's this thing where on a rainy day, a cat's fur stands on end and it meows in a scary way.

Korean: 그거 봐서 엄청 무서웠던 적 있는데 집에 막 달려갔어 ㅠㅠ
English: I saw that and was so scared that I just ran home ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그 하앍질 한 거 말하는 건가..!
English: Are you talking about that damn thing..!

Korean: 근데 개냥이는 진짜 한 없이 개냥이 여서 신기해..!
English: But it's amazing that dogs and cats are really dogs and cats without end..!

Korean: 내 친구네 개냥이는 집사가 들어오면 막 다리로 슬라이딩해서 우잉? 하는 표정으로 막 애교 부리고 하는데 와우임 진짜
English: My friend's cat and dog slide their legs when the owner comes in and act cute with a "wooing?" expression. Wow, really.

Korean: ㅠㅠ 그런 고양이는 좋아 막 다리에 비비적대는 애들 키키
English: ㅠㅠ I like those cats. The ones that just rub against my legs. Kiki

Korean: 근데 난 강아지 고양이 말고 다른 동물은 그저 그래..
English: But I'm just okay with other animals besides dogs and cats.

Korean: 나도 근데 내 조카는 동물만 보면 그렇게 좋아하더라
English: Me too, but my nephew really likes animals

Korean: 양, 말, 여우 뭐는 안 가려 키키 아이라 그런가...
English: Sheep, horses, foxes, whatever. Kiki Aira doesn't care...
I have the mental age of a child, so Kiki

Korean: 나두 약간 포유류면 다 좋아하는..? 털 있으면 너무 좋은 것
English: I also like all mammals..? If they have fur, they're really good.
Doesn't touching relieve stress? Kiki
The world is amazing for people who like reptiles.
Who was it
I was around someone who raised an iguana.
Wow... reptiles...
Ugh, I'm not that good...
Hair... There has to be hair!
Yeah, I do too...

Korean: 그럼 강아지 종류 중에 제일 좋아하는 종은 뭐얌?
English: So what is your favorite breed of dog?
Maltese~ and a small puppy~
you?

Korean: 나는 강아지면 상관 없음! 강아지는 정말 다 좋아 ㅠㅠ
English: I don't care if it's a puppy! I really like all puppies ㅠㅠ
I like them all too ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 뭐 굳이 고르라면 나도 소형견이 좋긴 해~
English: But if I had to choose, I like small dogs too~
It feels cuter~
Right? It's so cute when you eat it.
Even puppies have their own kind of cuteness~

Korean: 강아지는 진짜 존재 자체가 행복 그 자체 하트하트 아악
English: The puppy itself is the very embodiment of happiness, heart heart aah
Do you usually exercise?

Korean: 원래 요가 했었는데 코로나 이후로 가는 것도 무섭고 마스크 쓰고 할  자신도 없어서 운동은 포기
English: I used to do yoga, but after Corona, I was scared to go and I didn't have the confidence to do it while wearing a mask, so I gave up exercising.

Korean: 나두 원래 여성 전용 뭐 운동 뭐 그런 거 있어서 했는데 시험 준비도 해야 하고 코로나 4차 유행 그때 그냥 일시 정지 해서 시험 끝나고 다시 할 예정!
English: I also originally did some kind of exercise for women, but I had to prepare for the exam and during the 4th wave of COVID-19, I just put it on hold and plan to do it again after the exam is over!
What about your sister?

Korean: 여성 전용 운동? 30분 동안 기구 돌아가면서 하는 그건가?
English: Women-only workout? That thing where you rotate the machines for 30 minutes?

Korean: 나는 코로나지만... 그냥 다니고 있어... 헬스랑 골프... 흐흐

I know what that is, Kiki.

Korean: 보라색 그거 맞지? 골프는 실내 골프?
English: Is that purple? Golf is indoor golf?

Korean: 헐헐 이거 아는 사람 처음 보는데 둘이나 되네;
English: Wow, this is the first time I've seen someone who knows this, but there are two of them;
How much does it cost to work out once?

Korean: 30분만 해도 된다고 해서 나도 전에 해볼까 했었거둔 키키
English: I was thinking of doing it before because they said it would only take 30 minutes. Kiki

Korean: 헬스장에 골프 연습장까지 같이 있는 거랑 골프 50분 치고 헬스 좀 하고 올 때도 있고 안 할 때도 있고 그래!
English: There's a golf practice range right next to the gym, and sometimes I play golf for 50 minutes and then work out a bit, and sometimes I don't!

Korean: 나 헬스 할 때는 20분 유산소 하고 30분 정도는 웨이트하고 그랬었어~
English: When I was working out, I did cardio for 20 minutes and weight training for about 30 minutes.
I was also fascinated by the 30-minute workout and looked into it.

Korean: 근데 진짜 30분 인데도 엄청 열심히 하면 땀 쭉쭉 나고 진짜 세상 힘들어서 나중에 한번 체험이라도 해보는 거 추천!
English: But seriously, even if it's only 30 minutes, if you work really hard, you'll sweat a lot and it's really hard, so I recommend trying it at least once later!
I lost a lot of weight with this Kiki
Oh.. I should try that next time!

Korean: 다른 운동은 뭐 좋아하는 거 없어?
English: Do you like any other sports?
I also like playing badminton.

Korean: 그거 한 번 무료 체험 있을걸?
English: Is there a free trial for that?

Korean: 근데 나는 항상 그런 거 가면 등록하고 오더라 키키
English: But I always register and come back when I go to something like that Kiki
I'm good at badminton! I like it.

Korean: 오오 나도 제일 좋아하는 운동이 배드민턴인데!
English: Oh, my favorite sport is badminton too!

Korean: 고딩 때 학교 배드민턴 대회에서 일등 함 키키
English: Kiki won first place in the school badminton competition when she was in high school.
Are you all hitting on something? Kiki

Korean: 아무래도 강습 같은 거 안 해도 치기 쉬워서 그런가.. 테니스는 생각보다 어렵다고 하더라
English: I guess it's because it's easy to play without taking lessons or anything... They say tennis is harder than you think.

Korean: 테니스는 좀 배우기도 해야 하고 체력도 좀 필요하지~
English: Tennis requires some learning and physical strength~

Korean: 우리 아빠 테니스 치는 거 보니까 가끔 다치시기도 하시구~
English: When I watch my dad play tennis, he gets hurt sometimes~

Korean: 그치 그치 아무래도 배드민턴이 접근하기 쉬우니까!
English: Yeah, yeah, because badminton is easy to approach!

Korean: 테니스는 진짜 힘들어 보이던데... 배드민턴도 저때는 어렸으니까 잘 했지
English: Tennis looks really hard... I was good at badminton when I was young too
I don't think I can do it right now because my physical strength is trash
Kiki, no, it's still difficult now...

Korean: 테니스는 공 자체도 좀 무거워서 잘 안 나갈 거 같아
English: I don't think tennis balls will go out well because they are heavy.

Korean: 라켓도 무겁고~ 여자가 테니스 치면 멋있긴 하던데 옷도 예쁘고 3키
English: The racket is heavy and it looks cool when a woman plays tennis, but the clothes are pretty and she is 3cm tall.
1 person more interested in ashes

Korean: 키키 와 테니스 옷 이쁘다는 거는 생각도 안 해봤음 근데 생각해보니까 이쁘긴 하네 (잿밥에 관심이 생긴 1인)
English: I never thought that Kiki and the tennis outfit were pretty, but now that I think about it, they are pretty (A person who became interested in ash rice)

Korean: 웅 맞아 키키 원래 그런 재미로 운동하는 거지~
English: Yeah, that's right Kiki, that's what exercise is for fun~
I'm not even a player ^^

Korean: 자세 배우는 거 봤는데 좀 웃겨 키키
English: I saw you learning posture and it was kind of funny Kiki

Korean: 자세부터 배우고 들어가니까 더 하기 힘든 거 같아
English: I think it's harder to do it because you have to learn the details first.
You have to make up your mind to do it

Korean: 나는 테니스보다 배울 수 있으면 수영 배우고 싶음!
English: I would rather learn swimming than tennis if I could!

Korean: 수영은 많이 써먹을 수가 있어서 좋은 거 같아!
English: I think swimming is good because it can be used in many ways!

Korean: 어릴 때 배우고 지금은 다 까먹었지만 ㅠㅠ
English: I learned it when I was young, but now I've forgotten it all ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나 좀 로망 있는데~ 남편한테 수영 배우고 싶음 키키
English: I'm a bit romantic~ I want to learn swimming from my husband Kiki

Korean: 맞오맞오 코로나만 끝나면 하고 싶은 것들 산더미 키키
English: Right, right, once Corona is over, there are a ton of things I want to do Kiki

Korean: 컴퓨터 게임이나 핸드폰 게임 하는 거 있어?
English: Do you play computer games or mobile games?
I don't have any~
Do you have a favorite game?

Korean: 나는 워낙에 게임에 소질이 없어서 어렸을 때 크아랑 카트라이더... 테일즈런너... 말고는 해본 게 없다 키키
English: I'm not very good at games, so when I was young, I played nothing but Kawai and Kart Rider... Tales Runner... Kiki
Cookie Run..? Something like that?
Kiki is similar to me
Me too, Kwarang Kart!
What is Tales Runner? This is my first time hearing about it.
Didn't your sister do that?

Korean: 아 그건 했었지 고등학교 때 키키
English: Oh, I did that in high school Kiki

Korean: 그때는 그거 학교 끝나면 버디버디 켜 놓고 했었다 키키
English: Back then, I used to turn on Buddy Buddy after school and do that Kiki

Korean: 나는 감정 이입 잘하는 편이어서 맨날 크아에서 물풍선에 갇혀서 죽어가는 내 캐릭터를 보면서 미안하다고 ㅠㅠ 소리침
English: I'm the type of person who empathizes well, so I always feel sorry when I see my character dying in a water balloon in Kwa.
Kiki is cute? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나는 근데 카트도 잘 못했었던 거 같아...
English: But I don't think I was good at carting either...

Korean: 내가 카트 탄 거처럼 몸이 따라서 움직여
English: My body moves as if I'm riding a cart

Korean: 키키 난 그거 좀 잘 하는 편이었는데~
English: Kiki, I was pretty good at that~

Korean: 근데 아이템 달기 시작하면 템빨 무시 못함...
English: But once you start attaching items, you can't ignore the tempo...

Korean: 오오오 혹시 현질 이런 거 해 본 적 있음?
English: Ohhh, have you ever tried something like this?
No, I haven't had it once or twice.
Have you tried it?
What is Hyunjil?
Am I the only one who doesn't know? Kiki

Korean: 게임 할 때 막 아이템 이런 거 돈 주고 사는!
English: When you play a game, you buy items and such with money!

Korean: 난 게임에 진심이 아닌 편이라 한번도 안 해봤는데 한번 돈 써본 친구들은 꽤 쓰더라고?
English: I'm not really into games so I've never played them, but my friends who have spent money on them say they spent quite a bit?

Korean: 그치 아무래도 한번 그 맛을 보면 키키
English: Of course, once you taste it, you'll be hooked

Korean: 나 얼마 전에 오락실 같은 데에 있는 운전하는 게임 해봤는데 진짜 차에 탄 거처럼 부릉부릉하고 막 어디 박으면 진동 오고 그러더라
English: I played a driving game at an arcade a while ago, and it was like riding in a real car, and it made a rumble and if you hit something, it would vibrate and stuff.

Korean: 아 나는 아이템은 안 샀어 그거 하기 시작하면 끝이 없을 거 같아서~
English: Ah, I didn't buy the item because I thought it would never end once I started doing it~

Korean: 나는 그 자동차 게임만 하면 맨날 전복돼서 끝나더라~
English: Whenever I play that car game, I always end up flipping over.

Korean: 그거 핸들이 이상해 키키 기계 탓하기
English: That handle is weird, blame the Kiki machine

Korean: 키키 우리 다들 운전하는 게임은 안 하는 걸로...
English: Kiki, let's not play driving games...

Korean: 예전에 화이트 데이라고 공포 게임 있었는데 알아?
English: Did you know there used to be a horror game called White Day?
I don't know, what game is it?
If you listen, you'll know...
Oh, this is my first time hearing about it...

Korean: 근데 나 공포 세상 무서워해서 ㅠㅠ
English: But I'm scared of the scary world ㅠㅠ
What kind of fear is it?

Korean: 나도 진짜 싫어하는데 예전에 사촌 오빠들이 하는 거 옆에서 구경했어..
English: I really hate it too, but I used to watch my cousins do it..

Korean: 막 화이트 데이에 사탕 놓고 오려고 밤에 학교에 혼자 들어가는데 ㅠㅠ 수위 아저씨도 피해야 하고 귀신도 나오나? 뭐 그런 엄청 무서운...
English: I'm going to school alone at night to leave candy for White Day...ㅠㅠ I have to avoid the security guard and do ghosts appear? It's so scary...

Korean: 오~ 재밌겠다 핸드폰 게임은 뭐 하는 거 없어?
English: Oh~ That sounds fun. Do you play any cell phone games?

Korean: 지하철 타고 오다 보면 하는 사람들 진짜 많던데~
English: There are so many people doing this when I ride the subway~
I don't do it ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 앞에 분이 게임 하시면 그거 좀 구경하기는 함 키키 신기해서
English: But when the person in front of me plays a game, I watch it because it's so interesting.
I don't have anything to do these days either..

Korean: 옛날에는 가끔 하긴 했는데 키키 캔디 크러쉬 같은 거
English: I used to do it sometimes, like Kiki Candy Crush
Oh, by the way, is it Anipang?
I did that, begging for a heart.

Korean: 키키 애니팡 진짜 한때 세상 핫했는데 추억이네
English: Kiki Anipang was really hot in the world at one time, but it's a memory

Korean: 코로나 끝나면 제일 먼저 가고 싶은 해외 여행지는 어디얌?
English: Where is the first overseas travel destination you want to go to once the coronavirus is over?

Korean: 나 우리 미국 이모한테 먼저 가려고 거기 있는 조카들도 너무 보고 싶어
English: I'm going to go to my American aunt first, and I miss my nephews there too

Korean: 나는... 갈 수 있다면 유럽 가고 싶어!
English: I... want to go to Europe if I can!
Which side of the US do you live on?
Really, anywhere is fine...

Korean: 나는 발리 가고 싶어! 가서 휴양하게
English: I want to go to Bali! Let's go and relax.
LA~ Bali is also good~
Have you been to Bali before?

Korean: 우와아아아 발리 ㅠㅠ 진짜 휴양 너무 너무 시급함...
English: Wow, Bali...ㅠㅠ I really need to go on vacation so badly...
I've never been to Bali, so I want to go!
There were so many pretty ones..

Korean: 유럽은 가게 되면 어느 나라 가고 싶어?
English: If you go to Europe, which country would you like to go to?
Spain is good~ Come on~ Kiki
Me too Spain!
I really want to go there the most ㅜㅜ

Korean: 근데 지금 발리에 좀 혹해서... 키키
English: But I'm a little crazy about Bali right now... Kiki
Kiki, don't you want to go to Bali too?
I want to go back to Switzerland...
It was so good ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 친척 동생 배낭 여행으로 1달 넘게 갔다 왔는데 원래 유럽 몇 개 나라 가는 코스였는데 스위스 갔다가 거기서 계속 있다 왔어 지상 낙원이라던데~
English: Oh, my cousin went backpacking for over a month. The original plan was to go to several European countries, but we ended up going to Switzerland and staying there the whole time. They say it's paradise~

Korean: 와 스위스... 한번도 안 가봤는데 진짜 가 보고 싶당 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, Switzerland... I've never been there, but I really want to go ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 사실 지금 국내 여행만 가도 정말 행복할 것 같아
English: But actually, I think I would be really happy if I just went on a domestic trip right now.
That's right~ I want to go to Jeju Island...

Korean: 국내에서는 그래도 제일 해외 분위기 나서 좋아
English: In Korea, I like it the most because it has an overseas feel.
Yeah, no, I'm fine with just going to the airport~

Korean: 가장 최근에 간 곳은 어디야 다들?
English: Where is the most recent place you've been?
I'm from Sokcho! Lang and Gosung haha
I went on a summer vacation
I went to my brother's house in Ulsan~
Where have you been?
Me too, most recently Jeju Island!
Ha.. I want to go again ㅠㅠ
Oh, I went to Jeju Island...

Korean: 요즘 사람들 진짜 많이 가는 듯
English: It seems like a lot of people go there these days

Korean: 이번 추석 때 거기 대박일 듯...
English: I think it'll be a big hit there this Chuseok...
Wow, but Jeju Island is currently at social distancing level 4...

Korean: 전 이번 추석에 그냥 집콕하려구요 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm just going to stay home this Chuseok ㅠㅠ
If Jeju Island is at level 4, is it the same as us?
After 6 o'clock, only 2 people are allowed..?

Korean: 그런 거 같은데~ 요즘 코로나 상황 너무 안 좋아서 그런가~
English: I think so~ Is it because the corona situation is so bad these days~

Korean: 웅 웅 그래서 해수욕장도 막아 놨다고 하더라고!
English: Yeah, yeah, that's why they closed the beach too!
Why is the weather like this these days...
How long will it be this cloudy?
Isn't it late rainy season?
The rainy season is over but again ㅠㅠ
They say it's the autumn rainy season now...

Korean: 오늘 아침에 우산 안 들고 와서 그냥 비 좀 맞고 옴 ㅠㅠ
English: I didn't bring an umbrella this morning so I just got rained on ㅠㅠ

Korean: 이런 ㅠㅠ 우산 계속 회사에 놔두던가 들고 다니던가 해야겠어 맨날 퇴근할 때쯤에 비 와 가지고
English: Oh my goshㅠㅠ I guess I should either keep my umbrella at the office or carry it with me. It always rains when I leave work.
But why does it rain from 6 o'clock?
It's been like this for several days now

Korean: 저도 그래서 항상 회사에 우산 하나 놓고 다니는데 아주 쏠쏠해요!
English: That's why I always carry an umbrella with me to work. It's really useful!
It's a must! It's a must!
Do you like short umbrellas or long umbrellas?

Korean: 나는 비 안 오면 가방에 넣을 수도 있어야 되니까 단우산!
English: I need a short umbrella so I can put it in my bag when it doesn't rain!
I like umbrellas

Korean: 얼마 전에 연보라색 장우산 봤는데 너무 예쁜 거야
English: I saw a lavender umbrella a while ago and it was so pretty.

Korean: 집에 우산 엄청 많은데 살 뻔 했어~
English: I almost bought it because I have so many umbrellas at home~

Korean: 나도 뭔가 효율면에서는 단우산이지! 하는데 장우산이 예쁜 게 많아서 하나쯤은 장만하고 싶달까!
English: I also think that a short umbrella is more efficient! But there are so many pretty long umbrellas that I want to get one!

Korean: 맨날 편의점에서 투명 우산 사서 우산이 집에 쌓여있음 키키
English: Kiki, I always buy transparent umbrellas at the convenience store and have a pile of umbrellas at home.

Korean: 근데 요즘에는 편의점 투명 우산도 비싸더라?
English: But these days, even convenience store transparent umbrellas are expensive?

Korean: 저번에 갑자기 비 와서 사려고 하다가 놀람...
English: Last time, it suddenly started raining and I was surprised when I was trying to buy something...
The transparent umbrella is also pretty
Regardless of quality~Kiki

Korean: 근데 편의점마다 가격이 다른 거 같더라 투명 우산
English: But it seems like the price of transparent umbrellas is different at each convenience store.

Korean: 맞오 맞오 투명 우산이 유독 자릿값 많이 쳐지는 듯!
English: That's right, that's right, it seems like the transparent umbrella is the one with the lowest seat value!

Korean: 명동에서도 그냥 입구 쪽에서는 막 삼천 원 이렇게 살 수 있는데 안쪽으로 들어가면 정말 몇 만 원하는 것도 있고 ;;당황했었어
English: In Myeongdong, you can buy things for about 3,000 won at the entrance, but if you go inside, there are things that cost tens of thousands of won; I was surprised.

Korean: 갑자기 비 오면 진짜 부르는 게 값이니까...
English: If it suddenly starts raining, it's really worth it...
The convenience store one was 8,000 won, I think haha

Korean: 그럼 다들 비 오는 날 보다는 맑은 날 좋아해?
English: So, do you all like sunny days more than rainy days?

Korean: 난 집에 있을 때는 비 오는 날 좋아해
English: I like rainy days when I'm at home
I like the sound of rain, so I'm watching it~

Korean: 전 비 오면 삭신이 쑤시고 기분도 좀 가라앉고 그래서 맑은 날을 좋아합니다 ㅠㅠ
English: When it rains, my body aches and I feel depressed, so I like sunny days ㅠㅠ
Kiki, your back is already aching

Korean: 나도 맑은 날이 더 좋아~ 하늘 예쁜 날!
English: I like clear days better too~ Days with a pretty sky!
It's a clear day when you're outside~

Korean: 나 구름 보는 것도 되게 좋아해 키키
English: I also really like looking at clouds Kiki
There are a thousand pictures of clouds~

Korean: 오오 맞아 구름 완전 좋아해 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh yeah I really like clouds ㅠㅠ

Korean: 어제였나 한번 맑은 적 있었을 때 정말 잠시나마 힐링이었다...
English: I think it was yesterday when the weather was clear, and it was a moment of healing...

Korean: 맞아 얼마 전에 엄청 뭉게구름 있던 날 있었어!
English: Yeah, there was a day a while ago when there were really thick clouds!
You know?
And then it rained a lot?

Korean: 난 먹구름도 그렇게 뭉게뭉게 있는 거 봤어 얼마 전에
English: I saw dark clouds like that a while ago

Korean: 맞는 듯!  그때도 집 가니까 비 오고 그랬어...
English: That seems right! It was raining when I went home that time too...
Haha, this weather has no middle ground...

Korean: 그래도 요즘에는 좀 덜 더워서 살 만해 ㅠㅠ
English: But these days it's a little less hot so it's livable ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아.. 근데 좀 급격하게 추워지는 거 같지 않아? 키키
English: Right... but don't you think it's getting colder suddenly? Kiki
Was it like this originally?
It's been really cold in the mornings for a few days.
But isn't it hot again today?

Korean: 그르네 어제 저녁은 좀 더웠어 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, it was a bit hot last night ㅠㅠ

Korean: 얼마 전에 데이트 폭력으로 20대 여자가 뇌사 상태에 있다가 사망했던 사건 알아? ㅠㅠ
English: Do you know about the case where a woman in her 20s was brain dead and then died due to dating violence? ㅠㅠ
Yeah, I saw that in an internet article~
Bad X...

Korean: 헐... 하... 아니 ** 건가... 왜 때리지...?
English: Oh my... Ha... No, it's **... Why are you hitting me...?

Korean: 데이트 폭력 사건 너무 많아서 뭐가 뭔지 모르겠는데 하하하 정말 무서운 세상...
English: There are so many dating violence cases that I don't know what's going on hahaha it's really a scary world...

Korean: 응 요즘 진짜 많은 거 같아...
English: Yeah, I think there are a lot these days...

Korean: 그동안은 기사화가 별로 안 됐던 건가?
English: Hasn't it been reported much in the news lately?

Korean: 아님 요새 이런 일이 많아진 건가?
English: Or has this kind of thing happened a lot recently?

Korean: 일단 맞는 걸 숨기지 않는 여자들이 많아진 거 같고...
English: First of all, it seems like there are a lot of women who don't hide what's right...

Korean: 진짜 문제는 요즘 사람들이 너무 폭력적으로 변하는 거 같아
English: The real problem is that I think people are becoming too violent these days.

Korean: 그치 그치 근데 그런 말 있다잖아요
English: Yeah, yeah, but there's a saying like that

Korean: 분노 조절 장애면 정말 그런 장애가 있는 사람이면 남녀노소 안 따지고 주변에 사람이 많든 적든 상관 없이 폭력 휘두를 텐데 꼭 저런 사건들 보면 약자한테 사람 없는 곳에서 범행 일어난다고 허허
English: If it's anger management disorder, then if someone really has that disorder, they will commit violence regardless of age, gender, or whether there are many people around them. When I see incidents like that, I think the crimes are committed against the weak in places where there are no people.

Korean: 맞아 강한 사람한테는 약하고 약한 사람한테만 저래...
English: That's right, he's weak to strong people and only does that to weak people...

Korean: 진짜 때린 이유도 너무 어이 없더라
English: The reason I hit him was really ridiculous

Korean: 다른 사람들한테 둘이 연인 사이인 거 알렸다고 때리는 게 가능한가 ㅠㅠ
English: Is it possible to hit someone for telling other people that you are a couple? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 원래 정신이 좀 이상한 사람 아니었을까?
English: Wasn't he originally a somewhat strange person?

Korean: 요즘 이상한 사람 진짜 많아 ㅠㅠ
English: There are so many weird people these days ㅠㅠ
I'm scared of bumping into someone on the street

Korean: 허얼 때린 이유 세상 얼탱이가 없네
English: There is no reason in the world to hit Huhul

Korean: 근데 저렇게 사람 죽여 놓고도 구속이 안 됐다고 하더라고...
English: But they say that even after killing a person like that, he wasn't arrested...
A person died and was not arrested?
Aaaah, why did someone get hit and die!
This is ridiculous, really

Korean: 그니까... 이러고 또 심신 미약이나 음주 상태였다고 감형되면 부들부들...
English: So... if the sentence is reduced because of mental weakness or drunkenness, I'm shaking...

Korean: 얼마 전에는 자기 딸이 남친한테 맞고 있는 걸 본 엄마가 뛰어들어서 막고 대신 맞았는데 엄마 분이 돌아가신 사건도 있더라
English: Not long ago, there was an incident where a mother saw her daughter being beaten by her boyfriend, jumped in to stop her, and got hit instead, but the mother died.

Korean: 아니 이런 거는 더 가중 처벌해야지 감형은 무슨 감형이야아!
English: No, this kind of thing should be punished more severely. What kind of reduction in sentence is this?
What...? Mom instead? ㅠㅠ
How is that daughter alive, really...

Korean: 여친을 때리는 거 자체가 잘못된 거지만 아무리 그래도 여친 때리다가 엄마가 왔는데 어떻게 엄마까지 때리는지...
English: Hitting your girlfriend is wrong in itself, but no matter what, how can you hit your mom when she comes home after hitting your girlfriend?

Korean: 진짜 눈에는 눈 하고 싶다 정말
English: I really want to do an eye for an eye

Korean: 언니들 주변에서는 뭐 저런 일 없었죠...?
English: Nothing like that has ever happened around you, has it...?
Just in case we were friends or something ㅠㅠ
They say that even stalking is punishable these days.
Yeah, I wasn't there...

Korean: 근데 진짜 지금보다 더 강하게 처벌할 필요는 있는 거 같음 ㅠㅠ
English: But I think there really needs to be a stronger punishment than now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 다시 생각해도 진짜 이해가 안 된다...
English: Even thinking about it again, I really don't understand...

Korean: 때린 걸로 끝났어도 문제인데 사망 사건인데 너무 말이 안 되는데...
English: It would be a problem even if it ended with a beating, but it's a death case, so it's just ridiculous...

Korean: 제 친구는 남친이랑 헤어졌는데 막 집 앞까지 몰래 숨어서 기다리고 있다가 친구 나오면 잠깐 얘기하자고 막 그랬는데 지금 생각해보면 완전 스토커 짓이여서 소름...
English: My friend broke up with her boyfriend, so I just hid in front of her house and waited for her, and when she came out, I told her to talk for a bit. Thinking about it now, it was totally stalker-like behavior, and it gave me the creeps...

Korean: 그래서 막 남친 사귈 때 집 주소 절대 알려주면 안된다고 막 그러던데 하... 세상이 참...
English: So when I first started dating a boyfriend, he kept telling me not to give him my home address... What a world...

Korean: ㅠㅠ 무섭다... 근데 초반에는 머 어느 정도까지만 알려주고 안 알려준다고 하지만...
English: ㅠㅠ It's scary... But in the beginning, they say they'll only tell you up to a certain extent and then not tell you anything...

Korean: 만나다 보면 집 앞까지 데려다 주기도 하고 그러는데 어케 안 알려줄 수 있겠어
English: When we meet, he takes me to his house and stuff, so how could I not tell him?

Korean: 근데 진짜 아이러니한 게 또 어떤 남친은 여친을 집 골목 앞까지 바래다 준거야~
English: But what's really ironic is that some boyfriends drop their girlfriends off in front of their house.

Korean: 근데 집 앞에 어떤 남자가 숨어있다가 대문 앞에서 그 여자를 죽인 사건도 있었어
English: But there was also an incident where a man hid in front of a house and killed a woman in front of the front door.

Korean: 허유... 진짜 무서워서 누구 만나겠나 ㅠㅠ
English: Heoyou... I'm really scared, who would I meet? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아프가니스탄 카불 공항에서 자살 폭탄 테러로 90명 정도나 사망했다고 하더라 ㅠㅠ
English: They say that around 90 people were killed in a suicide bombing at Kabul Airport in Afghanistan.
Oh really, the Taliban!

Korean: 사람들이 하도 공항으로 몰리니까 그런 거겠지?
English: I guess that's because so many people are flocking to the airport?

Korean: 헐... 와 진짜 너무 무섭다 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my gosh... this is seriously so scary ㅠㅠ

Korean: 전 사실 옛날에 그 수장 죽었다고 해서 탈레반 아예 없어진 줄 알았었어요...
English: I actually thought the Taliban disappeared once their leader died...
That's what IS is like...

Korean: 미군들도 꽤 죽어서 바이든 대통령이 용서 안 한다고 했대 ㅠㅠ
English: I heard that many American soldiers died and President Biden said he would not forgive them.
So scary

Korean: 아니 근데 처음에는 나가고 싶은 사람은 나가도 된다고 하지 않았었나?
English: But didn't you say at first that anyone who wanted to leave could leave?

Korean: 자국민은 안 되고 외국인만 의미했던 건가?
English: Did you mean only foreigners and not your own citizens?

Korean: 헐... 진짜 이러다가 핵전쟁 일어나는 거 아닌가 모르겠네요...
English: Wow... I really wonder if a nuclear war could break out if this continues...
scary...

Korean: 그니까... 자살 폭탄 테러 진짜 무섭지 않아?
English: So... isn't a suicide bombing really scary?

Korean: 어떤 생각을 갖고 있으면 자기가 죽으면서까지 테러를 할까
English: What kind of thoughts would make someone commit terrorism while dying?
They say that once you go in, they will brainwash you~
ㅠㅠ
Back in the old days, there was a lot of IS chaos...

Korean: 정말 세뇌 교육 들어가면 우리가 상상하는 이상의 모든 것을 다 시킬 수 있나 봐요...
English: If we really go into brainwashing education, it seems like we can do everything we can imagine...
I guess so... It's strange and scary at the same time ㅠㅠ
By the way, the Tokyo Paralympics have just started.

Korean: 도쿄 올림픽 시작한 지도 얼마 전인 거 같은데 벌써 끝났네~
English: It feels like it was only a short time ago that the Tokyo Olympics started, but it's already over~
There was a lot to say, really...

Korean: 나도 도쿄올림픽시작하기전에는 아니 이렇게 위험하고 말도 많은 데 왜 하지!? 했는데 막상 시작하니까 세상 열심히 보고 키키 패럼림픽도 중계 이런 거 좀 해주면 좋을 텐데 ㅠㅠ
English: Before the Tokyo Olympics started, I thought, "Why are we doing this when it's so dangerous and there's so much to say!?" But now that it's actually started, I'm watching the world diligently, and it would be nice if they broadcast the Kiki Paralympics too ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그치 키키 패럴림픽은 중계 따로 안 하나?
English: Right? The Kiki Paralympics won't be broadcast separately?

Korean: 휠체어 타고 농구 하는 장면 잠깐 뉴스로 봤는데 겁나 잘하더라
English: I saw a brief scene on the news of him playing basketball in a wheelchair. He was really good.

Korean: 그냥 하는 말이 아니라 정말 멋있어 거 같아 얼마나 노력했을까
English: I'm not just saying this, I think it's really cool. How much effort did it take?

Korean: 그니까 탁구 이런 거는 또 패럼림픽만의 기술도 따로 있다고 하고 그런 거 보면 또 재미있을 것 같은데!
English: So, I heard that table tennis and other things have their own Paralympic techniques, so it would be fun to see those too!

Korean: 맞아 양궁도 막 발로 잡고 턱으로 쏘고 그러더라 키키
English: That's right, archery is also done by holding it with your feet and shooting with your chin. Kiki
You must have practiced a lot
I didn't see it, ugh...

Korean: 말만 할게 아니라 좀 챙겨서 봐야겠다. 패럴림픽~
English: Let's not just talk about it, let's take a closer look. Paralympics~

Korean: 근데 아프간에 그 한국 협력자들?  구해 온 거는 진짜 대박인 것 같아!
English: But those Korean collaborators in Afghanistan? I think it's really a jackpot to have rescued them!

Korean: 약간 다른 나라들은 다 실패했다고 하고 그러던데
English: They say that other countries have all failed.

Korean: 아 다른 나라들은 다 실패한 거야?
English: Oh, so all the other countries failed?
I didn't know that...
Oh really? I didn't know
Are you an article writer?
Now that I look at it, they say Japan failed...?

Korean: 아 그래? ㅠㅠ 한국 협력자들은 대한민국 체류하면서 취업 활동도 할 수 있다고 그러넹
English: Oh really? ㅠㅠ They said that Korean collaborators can stay in Korea and work while doing job activities.
Oh, Japan really gave up.
I see you said you withdrew

Korean: 우리나라에도 막 IS멤버들 있네 아니네 뭐 그런 말 있었었는데 제발 아무일 없길 ㅠㅠ
English: There were rumors that there were IS members in our country too, but I hope nothing happens ㅠㅠ

Korean: 피부 관리나 그런 거 따로 받는 거 있어?
English: Do you get any skin care or anything like that?

Korean: 옛날엔 엄마 따라서 다녔는데 요즘엔 전혀 안 하고 있네
English: I used to follow my mom around, but I don't do that at all these days.

Korean: 그래서 엄마한테 혼나~ 관리 안 한다고
English: So I got scolded by my mom for not taking care of myself.

Korean: 옛날에 여드름 한창 너무 많이 나서 가본 적 있어!
English: I went there once when I had a lot of acne!

Korean: 하하 꾸준히 받아야 나중에 후회 안 할 거 같은데 가기 넘 귀찮아...
English: Haha, if I keep taking it, I don't think I'll regret it later, but it's too much of a hassle to go...

Korean: 그럼 관리 받고 여드름 안 나고 좋아졌어?
English: So, after you received treatment, did your acne get better and disappear?
I got better~ My acne and my skin~

Korean: 웅 웅 약간 침술로 여드름 치료하는 곳이었는데 진짜 비쌌는데 정말 바로 괜찮아치고 아직 뭐 재발도 된 적 없어!
English: Yeah, yeah, it was a place that treated acne with acupuncture. It was really expensive, but it really helped right away and I haven't had any relapses yet!

Korean: 그냥 한두 개 나는 거는 당연히 있지만
English: Of course, there are just one or two
With acupuncture? That's amazing...

Korean: 한 두 개씩 나는 거는 어쩔 수 없지 ㅠㅠ
English: There's nothing I can do about one or two of them coming out ㅠㅠ
Have you heard of a procedure called shrinking?
I don't know, shrink?
I don't know much about the procedure~

Korean: 그거 약간 피부 표면... 다시 재생하게 하는 그건가?
English: Is that the thing that regenerates the skin surface a bit?

Korean: 뭔가 유명하고 추천 많이 하던 거 같던데?
English: I think it was something famous and highly recommended?

Korean: 음 약간 리프팅 하는 그런 건데 아프지도 않고 가끔 하면 좋은 거 같더라고~
English: Well, it's a bit of a lifting thing, but it doesn't hurt and I think it's good to do it sometimes~

Korean: 요즘에 좋은 시술 많이 나왔다고 하더라~
English: I heard there are a lot of good treatments these days~

Korean: 근데 한 번 받기 시작하면 의존할 거 같아서 못하겠어
English: But I can't do it because I feel like I'll become dependent once I start receiving it.

Korean: 음 그래도 난 한번은 받아보고 싶어!
English: Well, I still want to receive it once!
My skin really improved a lot

Korean: 맞아 맞아 근데 시술 말고 그냥 피부 관리해 주는 데서 꾸준히 받고 싶은 데 그거만 하는 데는 별로 없더라...
English: That's right, that's right, but I want to consistently get my skin taken care of rather than getting procedures done, but there aren't many places that only do that...

Korean: 어 그래? 예전에 다닐 때는 꽤 있었는데~`
English: Oh really? There used to be quite a few when I went there~`

Korean: 흐음... 근데 요즘은 그냥 피부과 이런 데서도 많이 하지 않나?
English: Hmm... But these days, don't dermatologists do it a lot?

Korean: 웅 근데 막 시술이랑 같이 하니까~ 관리만 해주는 데가 잘 없어
English: Yeah, but since it's done at the same time as the procedure, there aren't many places that only do management.

Korean: 에스테틱은 경락 이런 거를 많이 하고...
English: Aesthetics does a lot of things like meridians...

Korean: 가서 말하면 그렇게 해 줄 텐데~
English: If you go and tell them, they will do it for you~
Tell me while you cancel your membership~

Korean: 아 그렇구나... 시술이랑 피부 관리랑 같은 범주인 줄...
English: Oh, I see... I thought that treatment and skin care were in the same category...
Hmm, that's difficult

Korean: 그럼 결혼식 올리기 전에도 그런 거 받았었어?
English: So you received something like that before your wedding too?
Yeah yeah I got it then!

Korean: 경락이랑 피부과에서 한 달? 네번 정도 뭐 해주는 거 받았었는데 경락은 내가 꾸준히 안 가서 효과도 별로 없었던 거 같음 ㅠㅠ
English: I got some kind of treatment from a meridian and dermatologist about four times a month, but I didn't go to the meridian regularly, so it didn't seem to be very effective.
Before the wedding, I received a lot of packages.
From vitamins to meridians~
The name is really funny~

Korean: 아 맞아 경락은 다들 하는데 꾸준히 하기 쉽지 않다고 다들 효과 잘 모르겠다고 했던 거 같아
English: Oh, that's right. Everyone does acupuncture, but I think everyone said that it's not easy to do consistently and that they don't know the effects.

Korean: 막 승모근 근육 풀어주고 그런 거 하라고 나중에 결혼하면 키키
English: I'll just loosen up my trapezius muscles and do things like that when I get married.

Korean: 맞아 하체는 드레스로 가려지니까 목이랑 팔 라인 정리가 제일 중요한 듯!
English: That's right, since the lower body is covered by the dress, it seems like organizing the neck and arm lines is the most important!

Korean: 그래서 나 그때 승모근 쪽이랑 위쪽 라인 관리 해 달라고 하니까 해 주시는 분이 나한테 결혼하냐고 물어보더라 키키
English: So when I asked to have my trapezius muscle and upper line managed, the person who did it asked me if I was getting married. Kiki

Korean: 아니라고 당당하게 얘기했지 나만의 만족을 위한 거라고 키키
English: I said no proudly, it was for my own satisfaction Kiki

Korean: 오 그럼 그런 거 좀 관리 받으면 효과가 있는 것 같아?
English: Oh, then do you think it would be effective if you managed that a bit?

Korean: 좀 아프면 바로 병원 가는 스타일이야 아니면 참는 스타일이야?
English: Are you the type that goes straight to the hospital when you're even a little sick, or are you the type that puts up with it?
I'm going to the hospital right away~

Korean: 나는... 한 하루나 이틀 경과 보고서 좀 가는 편이야!
English: I... tend to go after a day or two!

Korean: 약간 바로 갔더니 아무 이상 없는데요?
English: I went there a little earlier and there was nothing wrong?
Kiki, I've had this happen before
I'll try staying there for a day or so!

Korean: 근데 초반에 가야 빨리 낫는 거 같긴 해
English: But I think it'll get better quickly if you go early.

Korean: 근데 요즘은 코로나 때문에 병원 가기도 무서워서 그냥 버텨 보는 거 같아
English: But these days, I'm scared to go to the hospital because of the coronavirus, so I think I'm just going to hold out

Korean: 감기 같은 거는 가면 환자들 많이 있으니까 좀 무서워
English: I'm a little scared because there are a lot of patients with colds.

Korean: 아 그러네... 코로나도 눈치를 봐줘야지 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, I see... We need to keep an eye on Corona too ㅠㅠ
Are your wrists okay these days?

Korean: 속기 하니까 난 많이 안 좋아졌는데
English: I feel a lot worse because of the cheating

Korean: 그래? 너무 열심히 연습한 거 아니야? ㅠㅠ
English: Really? Aren't you practicing too hard? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나는 아직 무리가 갈 정도는 아닌 거 같아...
English: I don't think I'm ready to go to the herd yet...
Sometimes I feel sick~
Are you in a lot of pain?
Oh my, am I the only one who's sick?

Korean: 나 요번에 수업 할 때 왼쪽 팔이 진짜 안 움직여져서 지금 공부 정말 못하고 있어서 좀 불안해 가지고 ㅠㅠ
English: This time during class, my left arm really wouldn't move, so I'm really having trouble studying right now, so I'm a little anxious ㅠㅠ
Kiki on life support with a pass
Oh my gosh, it's so unmovable? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 며칠은 많이 안 쓰는 게 나을 텐데 시험이 곧이라 마음이 불편하지...
English: It would be better not to use it much for a few days, but I feel uneasy because the exam is coming up soon...

Korean: 연습 많이 해서 그런가 보다 근데 아프면 조금 쉬는 것밖에는... ㅠㅠ 에고
English: I guess it's because I practiced a lot, but when I'm sick, all I can do is rest for a bit... ㅠㅠ Ego
Hmm... I guess I'm the only one who's sick

Korean: 근데 이게 내가 워낙에 근육이 심하게 없어서 키키 그런 거 같기는 해
English: But I think it's because I don't have much muscle mass
Have you all taken an InBody test recently?

Korean: 좀 아프면 바로 병원 가는 스타일이야 아니면 참는 스타일이야?
English: Are you the type that goes straight to the hospital when you're even a little sick, or are you the type that puts up with it?

Korean: 응 응 나는 몇 달 전에 건강 검진하면서 찍어봤어!
English: Yeah yeah I took it a few months ago when I had a health checkup!

Korean: 난 근육 엄청 없는 편은 아니고 그래도 적당히 있움 하하
English: I'm not that muscular, but I have a decent amount haha
I don't have any~
Even if I lift weights, it doesn't seem to stick~

Korean: 타고 나는 게 있는 거 같아
English: I think it's something I'm born with

Korean: 맞아 맞아 진짜 근육 잘 붙은 사람들은 좀만 신경 써 줘도 근육 막 늘고 그런다더라
English: That's right, that's right. People with really good muscles say that if you just take care of them a little, their muscles will start to grow.

Korean: 웅 나는 근육 운동 따로 하는 거 없어도 어느 정도.. 유지되더라 !
English: Yeah, I can maintain my muscle tone to some extent even without doing any muscle training!

Korean: 그래도 근육 없는 몸이 볼 때는 예쁜 거 같아 여리여리
English: But when I look at a body without muscle, I think it's pretty and delicate
Oh, I guess I'm not that delicate~

Korean: 그리고 청순가련형 보다는 건강미 쪽이 훨씬 예쁘더라~
English: And the healthy type is much prettier than the innocent and pitiful type~

Korean: 난 막 구릿빛 피부 이런 거 좋아
English: I like that kind of coppery skin

Korean: 그럼 다들 비타민이나 이런 거 챙겨 먹어?
English: So, does everyone take vitamins and things like that?

Korean: 원래는 안 먹었었는데 얼마 전부터 꾸준히 먹고 있어!
English: I didn't eat it before, but I've been eating it consistently recently!
What about your sister?

Korean: 난 비타민은 건강 식품으로 챙겨 먹어~
English: I take vitamins as health food~
Something like tart cherries~

Korean: 오호 나도 그냥 종합 비타민? 정도랑 소화제 정도만 챙겨 먹는 중!
English: Oh, I also just take a multivitamin and some digestive aids!
What kind of digestive medicine?

Korean: 카베진 같은 거 꾸준히 먹는 거야?
English: Are you taking something like Cabezin regularly?
I'm curious too~
What kind of digestive aid do you take?

Korean: 웅 웅 카베진이랑 S정이라고 장에 좋은? 그런 거 먹었는데 요즘에는 한약 먹는 중!
English: Yeah, yeah. I ate some Kabejin and S-jeong, which are good for the intestines, but these days I'm taking herbal medicine!

Korean: 최근에 인터넷 쇼핑으로 뭐 산 거 있는 사람~
English: Anyone bought something online recently?

Korean: 코로나 이후로 대부분 다 인터넷으로 사고 있어~
English: Since Corona, I've been buying most things online~
Everything from groceries to digital products~

Korean: 음 나도 그냥 로션 이런 거 쿠팡으로 시켜서 쓴 것 같아!
English: Yeah, I think I just ordered lotion and stuff from Coupang and used that!
Oh, what digital product did you buy?
Cell phones, tablets, PCs~ things like that~
Oh, what kind of cell phone did you buy?
You bought all of that recently?
It's going well
I bought a Galaxy phone in November last year.

Korean: 그거 말고는 저번 달에 산 거 같은데~
English: Other than that, I think I bought it last month~

Korean: 아하 나도 같은 생각함 키키 이 언니 잘 나가네~
English: Aha, I thought the same thing. Kiki, this unnie is doing well~

Korean: 아 근데 디지털 제품은 그냥 가서 사지 시켜본 적은 없는 듯 하다
English: Oh, but I don't think I've ever just gone and bought a digital product.

Korean: 그래? 인터넷으로 사는 게 싸긴 하더라고!
English: Yeah? It's cheaper to buy it online!
Last time, I bought a laptop online too!

Korean: 인터넷 사면 편해 요즘은 퀵으로도 주고~ 진짜 빨라~
English: It's convenient to buy online. These days, they even deliver by courier. It's really fast.
Perfect if you don't feel like going out

Korean: 그러네 그냥 요즘에 디지털 제품을 안 샀어서 그런가 봄;

you?

I'm shy now

Korean: 키키 아니야 언니 할 수 있어
English: Kiki no, you can do it, sister
Let's go to karaoke next time~

Korean: 와 근데 너네들은 가족끼리 노래방 가?
English: Wow, but do you guys go to karaoke with your family?

Korean: 나는 한 번 가 본 듯? 사촌들이랑은 자주 갔어!
English: I think I've been there once? I went there often with my cousins!
What about you?

Korean: 나도 어릴 때는 자주 갔는데 최근에는 간 적 없어 키키
English: I used to go there often when I was young, but I haven't been there recently. Kiki

Korean: 나두 키키 난 그리고 애초에 사촌들은 나이가 너무 많아...
English: Me too Kiki, and my cousins are too old to begin with...
The youngest of the youngest families

Korean: 키키 나는 그래서 노래방에서 노래 부르는 모습 보고 엄마가 놀라던데 키키
English: Kiki, my mom was surprised when she saw me singing at the karaoke. Kiki

Korean: 키키 언니 노래 부르는 거 보고 왜 놀라셔?
English: Why are you surprised to see Kiki sing?

Korean: 궁금하다 키키 그냥 노래 부르는 거 자체가 신기하셨던 건가
English: I wonder if Kiki was just curious about singing
Kiki I'm a singer ~

Korean: 일단 당분간 같이 안 가니까 막 뱉을게 하하
English: Since we won't be together for a while, I'll just spit it out haha

Korean: 다들 결혼 몇 살 쯤 할 거야?
English: At what age do you all plan on getting married?
Marriage... when

Korean: 근데 나 결혼하면 좀 걱정이야 키키
English: But I'm a little worried about getting married, Kiki

Korean: 남자도 남자고... 내가 바람 피지 않는다는 보장이 있을까
English: Men are men... Is there any guarantee that I won't cheat?
But I thought about that too

Korean: 바람까지는 아니더라도 어떻게 한 사람이랑 평생 살지 이 느낌? 상상이 안 가
English: Even if it's not the wind, how can you live with one person for the rest of your life? I can't imagine this feeling.

Korean: 아니 여러분 바람 필 수도 있다고 생각하지 말고 바람 필 거면 헤어지고 만나세여...
English: No, guys, don't think that you can cheat, if you're going to cheat, break up and meet again...
Just get a divorce!

Korean: 아 키키 나 좀 전에 옆에 쪼꼬미한테 혼났어!
English: Ah Kiki, I got scolded by the little girl next to me a little while ago!

Korean: 그냥 그런다는 게 아니구~ 그저 작은 걱정이야 하하
English: I'm not saying it's just like that~ It's just a small worry haha

Korean: 하 근데 난 또 보수라 이혼 약간 안 돼
English: Oh but I'm conservative so divorce is a bit much

Korean: 일단 안 해봐서 몰라 근데 키키
English: I don't know because I haven't tried it yet, but Kiki

Korean: 키키 근데 나도 보수라 최대한 이혼 안 하고 싶은데 남편이 이혼 사유 만들면 이혼해야지 뭐 참고 살긴 싫어
English: Kiki But I'm also a conservative, so I want to avoid divorce as much as possible, but if my husband makes up a reason for divorce, I have to get divorced. I don't want to put up with it.
What's wrong with that? Kiki!
Me too, same as you guys... Kiki

Korean: 그래도 참고 사는 것보다야 이혼이 낫다!
English: Still, divorce is better than living with it!
What if you have a baby?! ㅠㅠ The baby is sad

Korean: 어쩔 수 없지 만약에 남편이 바람 폈으면 이혼해야지 어떻게 같이 살아!
English: There's nothing we can do. If your husband cheated on you, you should divorce him. How can we live together?
No, that's extreme, Kiki
But these days there are a lot of DINK couples

Korean: 애기 안 낳고 결혼만 하는... 난 그거 찬성이야
English: Getting married without having children... I'm all for that.

Korean: 키키 나는 뭔가 마음이 왔다 갔다 해
English: Kiki I have been having second thoughts

Korean: 키우는 거 생각하면 힘들 것 같은데 또 낳으면 넘 이쁠 것 같고
English: I think it would be hard to raise them, but if I had another one, they would be so pretty

Korean: 맞아 근데 난 그래도 한번 사는 인생 내 아기 한번 정도는 낳아 보고 싶어
English: Yeah, but I still want to have a baby at least once in my life.

Korean: 나 닮아서 귀엽고 얼마나 예쁠까^^ 키키
English: How cute and pretty she is because she looks like me^^ Kiki

Korean: 할많하않...? 이럴 때 쓰는 말인가봐 하하
English: Don't you have a lot to say...? I guess that's what you say in this situation haha

Korean: 암튼 애기 안 낳으면 이혼할 때 편하다 뭐 이런 소리였어...
English: Anyway, it was something like, if you don't have children, it'll be easier to get a divorce...

Korean: 왜 우리 이혼 생각부터 하는지 모르겠다 근데?
English: I don't know why we're even thinking about divorce.

Korean: 키키 극단적이긴 하네 아직  하지도 않았는데 키키
English: Kiki, that's extreme. I haven't even done it yet. Kiki

Korean: 결혼 누가 먼저 할 것 같아?
English: Who do you think will get married first?
Kiki, I'm not thinking about divorce X!

Korean: 나는 송송 언니가 젤 먼저 할 거 같아!
English: I think Song Song unnie will do it first!

Korean: 흠 나는 백빽이 너가 젤 일찍할 것 같은데?
English: Hmm, I think you'll be the first to do it.

Korean: 와 근데 생각해 보면 약간 다 늦게 할 것 같은 느낌이긴 하다 키키
English: Wow, but if you think about it, it feels like it's all going to be a little late Kiki

Korean: 근데 왜 내가 먼저 갈 것 같아?
English: But why do you think I'll go first?

Korean: 키키 나? 아니야~그냥 송송 언니 결혼하자 하면 그랭! 하고 할 거 같애 키키
English: Kiki Me? No~ If you just say let's get married, Song Song, I think she'll say yes! Kiki

Korean: 아니 너무 쉬운 거 아니야 그건? 키키
English: No, isn't that too easy? Kiki

Korean: 키키 그 전에 너네들이 봐줘야지 서로 봐주자 하하
English: Kiki, you guys should look after each other before that haha

Korean: 키키 결혼 전에 우리한테 검사 받아!
English: Kiki, get tested with us before you get married!

Korean: 키키 좋아 별로면 내가 끌고 나올 거야
English: Kiki, if you don't like it, I'll drag you out.
Kiki, I'll be watching you with eagle eyes
Go hard
Anyone who has ever raised a pet at home~
Me~ I raised a puppy haha

Korean: 우왕 나는 엄마가 알러지 있어서 키워본 적 없다 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, I've never raised one because my mom has allergies ㅠㅠ
What was your name?
Wow, I'm jealous. That's right. What was your name?

Korean: 근데 우리집 촌이라서 마당에서 키우던 시골 잡종이었어 하하
English: But since it was in the countryside where my house was, it was a country mongrel that we raised in the yard haha
Bangul was cute!

Korean: 홀랭 그 유명한 시고르자브종을 키웠단 말이야? 보여줘
English: Hollang, you raised that famous Sigorjabjong? Show me.

Korean: 시고르잡브종 키키 내가 모르는 종 이름인가 한참 봤다
English: Sigorjabjong Kiki I looked at it for a long time because it was a name I didn't know

Korean: 아쉽게도 그 아이 사진이 없어... 하하
English: Unfortunately, there is no picture of that kid... haha

Korean: 키키 나는 엄마가 알러지 있어서 키워본 적 한 번도 없어 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki I've never raised one because my mom has allergies ㅠㅠ
I want to raise a Pomeranian

Korean: 나두 나두 키우고 싶은데 돈이 너무 많이 들어 키키
English: I want to raise one too, but it costs too much money.

Korean: 돈도 그렇고 놀아줄 시간이 없어 댕댕이를 키키
English: I don't have money and I don't have time to play with my dog.
Because I don't stay at home often

Korean: 강아지 말고 다른 동물 키워본 사람?
English: Has anyone ever raised an animal other than a dog?

Korean: 나는 어릴 때 금붕어 키워봤어 키키
English: I raised goldfish when I was little Kiki

Korean: 너 닮은 거 키웠네 바보! 하하
English: You raised a child who resembles you, idiot! Haha

Korean: 키키 나는 그리고 어릴 때 햄스터도 너무 키우고 싶었는데 그것조차 키워보지 못했다...하...
English: Kiki I also really wanted to raise a hamster when I was little, but I never got to raise one...sigh...

Korean: 맞아 나는 고슴도치... 친구가 키워서 나도 키우고 싶었어
English: Yes, I have a hedgehog... My friend raised one so I wanted to raise one too.
Wow, your friend raised a hedgehog?
It's really cute...
But I can't hug you^^

Korean: 내 남친은 기니피그였나 그런 거 키웠대 키키
English: My boyfriend raised a guinea pig or something Kiki

Korean: 맞아 근데 친해질라면 핸들링 해야 돼
English: Yeah but if you want to get close you have to handle it
If we become friends later, we won't have to put up thorns
Guinea pigs really do make pig sounds...
Wow, that's amazing Kiki
No guinea pigs right now?

Korean: 없지 옛날에 어릴 때 키운 것 같던데 듣는데 웃겼어 뭔가 키키
English: No, I think I raised it when I was young, it was funny to hear, something like Kiki

Korean: 글고 유트브 보면 오리 키우는 사람도 있는데 본 사람? 완전 노랑이
English: Also, if you look on YouTube, there are people who raise ducks. Has anyone seen them? They are all yellow.

Korean: 나 중3 때 신도시라 우리 학년에 첨에 5명이었는데 과학 쌤이랑 병아리랑 오리랑 부화 시켜서 키웠었어 키키
English: When I was in 3rd grade of middle school, there were 5 people in my grade in a new city. My science teacher and I hatched chicks and ducks and raised them. Kiki
Oh, I think I told you this
I raised him until he became a chicken!
Kiki, that's right, I heard it last time

Korean: 수달 키우는 사람도 봤는데 수달 진짜 넘 귀엽더라 ㅠㅠ
English: I saw someone raising an otter and the otters were really cute ㅠㅠ
After our exams, we go climbing, right?

Korean: 당근이지 ~근데 4인 이상으로 풀려야 할 텐데 ㅠㅠ
English: Of course ~ but it has to be done with 4 or more people ㅠㅠ
What time do you close there?
Ending time? Are you talking?
It's 9 or 10 o'clock now...

Korean: 근데 원래는 11시 정도까지 했던 것 같아
English: But I think it was originally done until around 11 o'clock

Korean: 아 진짜? 9월에 바로 가고 싶었는데 진짜 계속 이러면 바로 못 갈 수도 있겠는데...? ㅠㅠ
English: Oh really? I wanted to go right away in September, but if this keeps up, I might not be able to go right away...? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 백신 접종자 둘 있으면 4인으로 갈 수 있으니까 만약 형형 언니 안 가면 우리 둘에 송송 언니 백신 완료해서 되지 않아?
English: But if there are two people who have been vaccinated, we can go as a group of four, so if Hyung-hyung and Unnie don't go, can't we go after Song-Song and Unnie have completed their vaccinations?
Oh Song Songi got her second dose, haha, that's right!

Korean: 그래도 규제 풀렸으면 형형이 뒷목 잡고 끌고 가자
English: But if the regulations are relaxed, let's grab Hyung by the scruff of the neck and drag him away.
Kiki Gran! Should I bring my gym clothes?

Korean: 무슨 옷 입고 해야 되는 거야?
English: What should I wear?
What about shoes?

Korean: 난 만약 가면 운동할 때 입는 레깅스 입을래!
English: If I go, I'll wear the leggings I wear when I exercise!

Korean: 신발은 거기서 빌리는 거 같던데 맞아?
English: I think you can rent shoes there, right?

Korean: 얘두랑 무조건  맨발로 가야 해 아니면 입장 안 시켜줘 하하
English: You and I have to go barefoot or we won't let you in haha
You're not wearing socks, you're barefoot?

Korean: 신발 따로 안 가져가니까 좋네 키키
English: It's nice not having to bring separate shoes, Kiki

Korean: 진짜? 그럼 맨발로 암벽 올라가는 거야?
English: Really? So you're climbing the rock wall barefoot?

Korean: 아니 장난 칠려 했는데 너네 너무 진지하네.. 하하
English: No, I was trying to joke, but you guys are too serious.. haha
If you have climbing shoes, they'll rent them out to you!
Kiki, what are you kidding me?

Korean: 아무것도 몰라서 진짜로 믿는다고 키키 아나
