English: Kiki Ana, I really believe it because I don't know anything

Korean: 키키 어쩐지 아니 나 그거 하는 영상이랑 사진 봤는데 다 전용 신발 신고 있었다구!
English: Kiki, somehow I saw videos and pictures of them doing that, and they were all wearing special shoes!

Korean: 그래서  당연히 빌리는 줄 알았는데 당황 키키
English: So of course I thought I would borrow it but I was surprised Kiki

Korean: 바보들 ~우리 근데 가면 그 수업 해주는 걸로 하자!
English: Idiots~ Let's just teach that class when we get there!
I think it was 30,000 won!
Climbing shoes are included too!

Korean: 웅웅 진짜 착지하는 법? 잘 배워야지
English: Whew, how to really land? I have to learn it well.

Korean: 무섭네 허리 아작 날까 봐 키키
English: It's scary, I'm afraid my back will break. Kiki

Korean: 당연 처음이라 아무것도 몰라서 수업 받아야 해!
English: Of course, since it's my first time and I don't know anything, I have to take a class!

Korean: 웅웅 근데 별 거 없어 키키
English: Yeah but it's nothing special Kiki
And I've been sick for two days now...

Korean: 다음날 너무 몸이 괜찮길래 뭐야 나 쌉강하잖아? 생각했다가 키키
English: The next day I felt so good that I thought, "What? I'm so strong?" and then Kiki

Korean: 전혀 안 쓰던 근육들이 뭉쳤어서 좀 힘들었다
English: It was a bit difficult because muscles I hadn't used at all were stiff.

Korean: 키키 나 하고 오면 앓아 눕는 거 아닌가 몰라 키키
English: Kiki, if you come with me, I don't know if you'll be sick in bed Kiki
Let's go on Friday, no matter what!

Korean: 키키 언니 근육 왜 이렇게 늦게 아파
English: Kiki Sister, why do my muscles hurt so late?

Korean: 반응 되게 느리네 맞아 무조건 금욜 가야 돼!
English: The response is really slow. You have to go on Friday no matter what!

Korean: 이게 속근육을 쓰는 거라... 엄청 조금 뭉쳤다가 신기한 곳들이 아파 괴로워 키키
English: This uses the deep muscles... I got really sore and started feeling pain in strange places.

Korean: 근데  나랑 가면 너네 엄청 타야 해
English: But if you go with me, you'll have to ride a lot

Korean: 나 진짜 조금 쉬고 계속 타
English: I'll just take a break and keep riding
This will be really fun
If it's fun, go often!
Do you all have a favorite game?

Korean: 나 요즘은 게임 안 하는데 ~가끔 언니 애니팡 뺏어서 하면 하트 다 쓰고 줌...
English: I don't play games these days ~ but sometimes I steal Anipang from my sister and play, and I use up all my hearts and give them to her...
I'll even empty your mailbox haha
Kiki loves board games!

Korean: 우리 보드 게임도 하러 가자 개꿀잼일 듯
English: Let's go play board games too. It'll be so much fun.
I like board games too!

Korean: 우리 하러 가면 대환장 파티일 듯 형형 언니 게임 룰 설명해주다 끝날 듯 키키
English: If we go there, it'll be a total mess. It'll probably end with Hyung and Unnie explaining the game rules. Kiki
No, I'm already stressed out Kiki

Korean: 빽빽이 입 꾹... 하고 있을 거 생각하니까 너무 웃기다 근데
English: It's so funny to think that you'll be keeping your mouth shut...

Korean: 키키 벌써 스트레스 받았대 짱 웃기네 키키
English: Kiki is already stressed out. That's hilarious. Kiki

Korean: 근데 뭔가 그럴 것 같긴 하다 키키
English: But I think it might be like that, Kiki

Korean: 아 우리 시끄러울 게 벌써 보인다 보여
English: Ah, I can already see that we're going to be noisy
Looks like we're going to take over there...

Korean: 키키 그니까 스트레스 받는데 웃겨 키키
English: Kiki, that's why you're stressed, but it's funny Kiki

Korean: 우리 리얼 엄청 시끄러울 듯 키키
English: Our real one is going to be really noisy Kiki

Korean: 어... 애들아 내 말도 잘 들어줘야 해 키키 알겠지?!
English: Uh... Kids, you have to listen to what I say, Kiki, okay?!

Korean: 키키 언니 거기 가면 이제 마이크 가지고 와라
English: Kiki, when you get there, bring the mic now.
It looks like my voice will be buried~

Korean: 키키 맞아 언니 이겨도 우리가 목소리 크게 우기면 걍 묻힐 듯
English: Kiki, right, even if you win, if we raise our voices, it'll probably just get buried
I guess I'll have to look for a microphone starting today...

Korean: 벌써 내 목 쉬는 거 상상 돼 키키
English: I can already imagine my throat getting sore Kiki
Kiki, that's funny

Korean: 상상만 해도 우리 할 거 넘치네 ^^
English: Just imagining it makes me think there's so much we can do ^^

Korean: 보드 게임 중에 좋아하는 거 있어?
English: Do you have a favorite board game?
We have to get together first

Korean: 그리고 재밌는 거 많은데 이름을 기억 못 해 ㅜㅜ
English: And there are a lot of fun ones, but I can't remember their names ㅜㅜ

Korean: 클루가 뭐냐고 물어보면 또 놀릴 거니? 키키
English: If I ask what Clue is, will you tease me again? Kiki
Sister, don't you know that?
Actually, I don't know either! Haha, what is it?
Kiki is cute^^

Korean: 근데 이건 몰라도 놀릴 만하진 않아
English: But even if you don't know this, it's not something to be teased about

Korean: 유명하긴 한데 보드 게임 잘 안 하면 모를 수도 있지
English: It's famous, but if you don't play board games well, you might not know about it.
It's a game to find the culprit and the murder weapon.
What is this, a brain game Kiki?
It must be very crowded and difficult
You have to teach us all!
Don't be angry!

Korean: 키키 빽빽아 나는 괜찮으니까 우리가 한 명씩 케어하자! 헤헤
English: Kiki, I'm okay, let's take care of each of us one by one! Hehe
Kiki, you're so confident, I like it

Korean: 그리고 요즘엔 거기 알바생한테 설명해 달라 하면 해주니까 한번은 다른 사람 설명 찬스 써먹을 수 있어
English: And these days, if you ask a part-timer there to explain it to you, they will do it for you, so you can use the opportunity to have someone else explain it to you.

Korean: 송송아 어이없네 정말 하하 우리는 하나라며 ^^
English: Song Song, this is ridiculous haha, we are one ^^

Korean: 키키 하나니까 알려주지 하나 아니었으면 바로 안 알려주고 게임 했지~
English: Since it's Kiki, I'll tell you. If it wasn't for Kiki, I wouldn't have told you and just played the game~

Korean: 아 근데 우리 게임 하나 익히는데 한 시간 쓸 것 같은 느낌이다 뭔가 키키
English: Oh but I feel like it would take an hour to learn one game. Kiki

Korean: 키키 근데 다들 보드 게임 카페 가봤어?
English: Kiki, have you ever been to a board game cafe?
Me once? I think I've been there!

Korean: 나는 가끔 갔던 것 같아 키키
English: I think I went there sometimes Kiki
Do you go as a group or as a couple?
Is there a place you want to travel to?

Korean: 나 요즘 해외 여행 너무 너무 가고 싶다 ㅠㅠ
English: I really really want to travel abroad these days ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나 미국... 진짜... 티켓까지 끊고 코로나 때문에... 좌절된 나의 미국행... 또륵... 미국 가 본 사람
English: Me, America... Seriously... I bought a ticket, but because of Corona... My trip to America was thwarted... Hehe... Anyone who has been to America?
I haven't been to America ㅜㅜ
I want to travel abroad too

Korean: 나는 코로나 풀리면 체코 프라하 젤 가보고 싶어
English: I want to go to Prague, Czech Republic when the coronavirus is over
I haven't been to the US either ㅠㅠ
The Grand Canyon is crazy... I definitely want to go!
My trip to Europe was also canceled...

Korean: 그랜드캐년 하니까 생각났는데 어떤 한국인 거기서 사진 찍다가 떨어졌다는 거 기사 본 사람...짱 무섭
English: I thought of the Grand Canyon, but I read an article about a Korean who fell while taking pictures there... It was really scary.
Oh, I saw that too...

Korean: 무서워 언니 가게 되면 조심해야 돼
English: I'm scared. You have to be careful when you go to my sister's house.
No, really? This is my first time hearing about it...
This is really crazy ㅠㅠ
I just imagined Kiki and my legs started shaking
Why do you want to go to Prague?
The night view there is really pretty
I've wanted to go there for a while ㅜㅜ

Korean: 거기 나 고등학교 레슨 샘이 체코로 유학 갔었다고 들은 후로 사진 봤는데 진짜 넘 예뻐서 나도 유럽 1순위였어 ㅠㅠ
English: After I heard that my high school teacher Sam went to study abroad in the Czech Republic, I saw the picture and it was so pretty that I also ranked Europe first ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 우리 언제쯤 다시 떠날 수 있을까
English: Kiki, really? When can we go again?
I wonder if I can go next year ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그치 진짜 체코 필수 코스로 넣어서 유럽 여행 갈 거야...
English: Yeah, I'm really going to include Czech Republic as a must-visit destination when I travel Europe...

Korean: 우리 근데 코로나 아니어도 계속 이어서 일하면 바빠서 갈 수 있을까
English: But even if we don't have corona, will we be able to go if we keep working?
It has to be released next year, no matter what...

Korean: 안 풀리면 나 울 거야... 일 있어도 간다!
English: If it doesn't work out, I'll cry... I'll go no matter what!

Korean: 언니는 일단  호주부터 가야 되는 거 아니야?
English: Sister, shouldn't you go to Australia first?
Let's go to Delco together!
Take me~ We are one
We have to go together~

Korean: 구니까 내년에는 무조건 풀려야 해 ㅠㅠ
English: Because it has to be released next year unconditionally ㅠㅠ
You guys are a little tired
Follow me quietly haha

Korean: 그러면 그분이 호주 투어 시켜주는 거양? 꺄
English: So he's giving you a tour of Australia? Wow

Korean: 키키 그분이 투어 키키 아주 좋아
English: Kiki he really likes tour kiki
Let's welcome the real thing!
Oh Kiki, but you know what?
He can't go anywhere either

Korean: 거의 우리가 시켜줘야 할 수도 있어 키키
English: Kiki we may have to do it
Kiki-chan is funny
Then why don't we go on tour together?

Korean: 키키 그래? 그럼 같이 다니면서 통역하라 하자
English: Kiki Really? Then let's go together and interpret.

Korean: 왜 내가 공부 열심히 해서 내가 해줄게~ 하하
English: Why don't I study hard so I can do it~ haha

Korean: 키키 언니 이번 년도에 호주 갈 거야?
English: Kiki, are you going to Australia this year?

Korean: 오늘 아침에 비 오던데 다들 우산 가져왔지?
English: It was supposed to rain this morning. Did you all bring umbrellas?
Of course ~ I brought an umbrella!

Korean: 그래도 오늘은 날씨가 안 습하고 시원했어 그치!
English: But the weather was cool and not humid today, right?

Korean: 그랬던 거 같기도 하고 기억이 안 난다 키키
English: I think so, but I don't remember, Kiki

Korean: 오 난 아침에 힘들어서 날씨를 느낄 겨를이 없었어 키키
English: Oh I was so tired this morning I didn't have time to feel the weather Kiki

Korean: 키키 나는 지하철 오늘 이어서 와서 나름 여유 있게 왔어
English: Kiki I came by subway today and I came with plenty of time to spare.

Korean: 근데 너무 졸려서 진짜 눈감고 쭉 온 듯
English: But I was so sleepy that I felt like I had my eyes closed the whole time
Yeah, but they said the rain would stop in the afternoon
Yeah, I'm so sleepy
It stopped after 6 o'clock!

Korean: 나도 오늘 엄청 졸려 오랜만에 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm also really sleepy today for the first time in a long time ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나중에 비 그치면 사진 찍어줘~ 빽빽아!
English: Take a picture later when it stops raining~ Bbaekbaek!

Korean: 키키 맞네 오늘 사진도 찍어야 되지?
English: Kiki, you're right. Do I have to take a picture today too?
Yeah yeah I'll take a picture when it stops raining~
Or after it's over!

Korean: 좋아! 딱 마치고 어둡기 전에 찍으면 되겠당 하하
English: Okay! I'll just finish it and take a picture before it gets dark haha

Korean: 이제 여름 옷도 곳 끝나갈 것 같아 키키
English: I think summer clothes are almost over now Kiki
I think I'll be able to wear long sleeves soon!
Yeah, it's starting to get cold
It's cold even at night

Korean: 웅웅 지금도 얇은 겉옷 가지고 다녀야 될 것 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I think I still need to carry a thin outer layer ㅠㅠ
It's cold now when I turn on the air conditioner

Korean: 뭔가 이번 비 오는 거 끝나면 점점 쌀쌀해질 것 같아 그치?
English: I have a feeling it's going to get colder after this rain stops, don't you?
Yeah, I think so too

Korean: 또 낮이랑 밤이랑 기온 차 심할 듯 ㅜㅜ
English: Also, the temperature difference between day and night seems to be severe ㅜㅜ

Korean: 웅웅 비 오면 날씨 확 바뀌니까...
English: Yeah, when it rains, the weather changes a lot...

Korean: 우리 시험 전까지 몸 관리 잘하자... ㅠㅠ
English: Let's take care of ourselves before our exam... ㅠㅠ
Don't catch a cold!

Korean: 키키 맞아 아침에 나올 때는 추운데 지하철은 또 덥고 온도 맞추기 힘들어서 감기 걸리기 딱 좋아
English: Kiki, that's right. It's cold when you go out in the morning, but the subway is hot and it's hard to adjust the temperature, so it's perfect for catching a cold.
Really be careful

Korean: 맞아 감기 걸리기 딱 좋은 날씨 다들 따뜻하게 입고 다니자
English: That's right, it's the perfect weather for catching a cold. Let's all dress warmly.
But I'm still cold
My hands are so cold...

Korean: 진짜? 난 옷 입으니까 딱 괜찮아졌어!
English: Really? I feel just fine when I put on my clothes!
Does the air conditioner keep blowing in that direction?

Korean: 근데 지금은 에어컨 끈 것 같은데 아직도 추워?
English: But I think the air conditioner is turned off now, but is it still cold?

Korean: 이제 공기는 괜찮아졌는데 손이 시려 운 게 안 없어져
English: The air is better now, but my hands still feel numb
Because it was already too cold
touch my arm
It's warm now! Kiki

Korean: 키키 넘 추우면 내 옷 줄게!
English: Kiki, if it's too cold, I'll give you my clothes!

Korean: 어젠가 선릉에서 오토바이 사고 난 거 봤어?
English: Did you see the motorcycle accident in Seolleung the other day?
I was surprised when I saw it this morning...
In Seolleung?! I didn't know ㅠㅠ
Did you see it on your way to work?
What's going on?
Explain the situation

Korean: 아니 직접 본 건 아닌데 아침에 페북 보는데 난리 났더라고
English: No, I didn't see it myself, but I saw it on Facebook this morning and it was a mess.

Korean: 신호 대기하는 화물차 앞에 오토바이가 끼어들었는데 화물차는 차체가 높아서 못 봐서 초록불 되면서 걍 출발함...
English: A motorcycle cut in front of a truck waiting at a traffic light, but the truck couldn't see it because it was tall, so it just drove off when the light turned green...

Korean: 헐... 뭐야 그럼 완전 깔린 거야?
English: Wow... What? So it's completely installed?

Korean: 오토바이 운전자 죽은 거 아니야? ㅠㅠ
English: The motorcyclist is dead, right? ㅠㅠ
So...what happened?
curious
Yeah, I got crushed and died...

Korean: 선릉만 쳐도 바로 나와 언니랑 블랙박스 영상 봤다
English: As soon as I hit Seolleung, my sister and I watched the black box footage.
If you're scared, don't watch Song Song...
No, seriously, it's too bad...

Korean: 트럭 운전자도 트라우마 엄청 심할 것 같은데?
English: I bet truck drivers are also very traumatized?
Wow... so vain
Seriously how can that be so scary

Korean: 그니까 맞은 편에서 사고 직접 본 운전자들도 정신적으로 힘들듯...
English: So, the drivers who saw the accident directly from the opposite side must have had a hard time mentally...

Korean: 근데 영상 보니까 너무 있을 법한 일이라서 더 무서워
English: But when I watched the video, it was even scarier because it seemed so possible

Korean: 그니까 아침부터 무슨 일이야 우리도 근데 조심해야 돼 ㅠㅠ
English: So what happened in the morning? We have to be careful too ㅠㅠ

Korean: 여기 오토바이도 너무 막 다녀 차랑
English: Here, motorcycles are also going around like crazy

Korean: 맞아 오토바이들이 너무 신호도 안 지키고 막 피해 다니고 너무 위험하게 다녀...
English: That's right, the motorcyclists don't obey traffic signals and just dodge around, driving around so dangerously...
I watched the video for nothing
My impression still hasn't cleared up...

Korean: 진짜 다들 교통 법규 정직하게 지키고 살면 안 될까요... ㅠㅠ
English: Can't we all just honestly follow the traffic laws and live like this... ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그니까 특히 이런 비 오는 날에는 더 조심해야 되는데 ㅠㅠ
English: So, you have to be especially careful on rainy days like this ㅠㅠ

Korean: 진짜 본 사람들도 충격과 공포일 듯 으으
English: Even people who actually saw it would probably be shocked and scared

Korean: 맞아 다들 신호랑 법 좀 잘 지켜 주세여...
English: That's right, everyone, please follow the traffic lights and laws...

Korean: 저 사고도 영상 보니까 오토바이 운전자만의 잘못은 아니었어 ㅠㅠ
English: Looking at the video, it seems like that accident wasn't just the motorcycle driver's fault ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아니 그리고 일단 오토바이는 진짜 없애야 해
English: No and first of all, we really need to get rid of the motorcycle

Korean: 항상 느끼지만 너무 죽으려고 타는 교통 수단이야
English: I always feel like I'm on a vehicle that's too dangerous to ride

Korean: 키키 아니 안전하게 타면 좋은데 스릴을 즐기니 근데 남에게까지 피해를 주는 게 제일 문제지
English: Kiki, no, it's good to ride safely, but if you enjoy the thrill, the biggest problem is that it causes harm to others.
Let's enjoy the thrill alone...

Korean: 맞아 근데 또 오토바이 다 없애서 늦게 배달 오면 음식 배달 늦게 온다고 난리 칠 듯
English: Yeah, but if they get rid of all the motorcycles and the food delivery is late, there's going to be a fuss about it being late
That's the problem with Korea!

Korean: 빨리 빨리! 근데 빨리 빨리가 좋긴 해 키키 토종 한국인...
English: Hurry up, hurry up! But I like it when it's hurry up Kiki, a native Korean...
But motorcycles are too dangerous

Korean: 진짜 조금 금리 가려다가 진짜 평생 빨리 간다고... ㅠㅠ
English: I was really trying to lower the interest rate a little bit, but it really went by so quickly... ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 오토바이 타 본 사람 있어?
English: Has anyone ever ridden a Kiki motorcycle?
I have never

Korean: 나도 없어 뒤에도 타본 적 없어
English: I don't have one either. I've never ridden in the back.

Korean: 아 난 경주 여행 갔을 때 대여해서 뒤에 탔었는데... 다시는 안 타고 싶었어 키키
English: Ah, I rented one when I went on a trip to Gyeongju and rode in the back... I never wanted to ride it again Kiki
Kiki, let's all be careful!
You know, there's chaos in Afghanistan these days, right?

Korean: 어어 미군 철수해서 완전 난리 났잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my, the withdrawal of US troops caused a total mess ㅠㅠ

Korean: 뭐야 나 제대로 안 봐서 잘 모르는데 무슨 일이니?!
English: What? I don't know because I didn't look properly, but what's going on?!

Korean: 거기 탈레반이 장악해서 완전 난리 났어 ㅜㅜ
English: The Taliban took over there and it was total chaos ㅜㅜ

Korean: 거기 남은 사람들 다 빨리 떠나려고 난리 난리야
English: There's chaos as everyone left there tries to leave quickly.

Korean: 웅웅 ㅠㅠ 근데 우리나라에도 몇 백 명 데리고 왔는데 사람들이 난민 데리고 오지 말라고 청원 올리고 그러던데
English: Yeah, yeah ㅠㅠ But they brought a few hundred people to our country too, and people started petitions asking people not to bring refugees.

Korean: 헐 진짜? 근데 우리나라에 지금 데리고 올 수 있는 거야?
English: Oh really? But can I bring it to our country right now?
I guess opinions will be completely divided for and against?

Korean: 불쌍한데 또 우리나라 온다 그러면 좀 그러고... 사람들이 난민 데려올 거면 노숙자나 도와주라고 난리던데 키키
English: It's pitiful, but if they come to our country again, then we should do something about it... People are making a fuss about if we're going to bring in refugees, we should at least help the homeless. Kiki

Korean: 웅 그 우리나라랑 같이 뭐 일했던 사람들이랑 뭐 가족이랑? 이런 식으로 해서 데리고 오는 무슨 작전명도 있던데!
English: Yeah, there was even an operation called "bringing in people who worked with our country and their families" like that!
Thank goodness everyone arrived safely

Korean: 헐 근데 진짜 요즘 같은 시대에도 저런다는 게 약간 상상이 안 가
English: Wow, but I can't even imagine that something like that would happen in this day and age.

Korean: 뭔가 옛날 시대에서나 볼 법한 이야기인데 오바야 ...
English: It's a story that you would only see in olden times, but...

Korean: 나도 그거 보자마자 그 생각 했어
English: I thought the same thing when I saw it

Korean: 그리고 애기들 부모들이 애기라도 살리려고 대사관 철장 안에 애기 던지고 그랬대...
English: And the parents of the babies threw the babies into the iron cage of the embassy to try to save them...

Korean: 근데 잘못 던져서 죽은 애기들도 있고 ㅜㅜ
English: But there are also babies that died because they were thrown wrong ㅜㅜ

Korean: 어떤 군인이 애기 받아주는 것도 봤어 ㅠㅠ
English: I even saw a soldier holding a baby ㅠㅠ
You could be in danger too...
This is exactly what we see in the movies...

Korean: 만약 우리가 그런 상황에 놓였다고 생각하면 진짜 끔찍하다
English: It's really scary if we think about it.
Yeah, it's terrible

Korean: 그리고 특히나 걔네는 여자를 물건 취급하던데 너무 싫어...
English: And I especially hate how they treat women like objects...

Korean: 어어 ㅠㅠ 그래서 총 들고 있는 군인들 앞에서 여자들 시위하고 있음
English: Oh my gosh ㅠㅠ So women are protesting in front of soldiers holding guns
That's really great too

Korean: 와 총 맞을 각오하고 그러는 거잖아 와우...
English: Wow, you're doing that with the intention of getting shot, wow...
Wow, this is really amazing

Korean: 나였음 그냥 숨어 살았을 듯 ㅜㅜ
English: If it were me, I would have just lived in hiding ㅜㅜ

Korean: 웅웅 근데 그렇게 안 하면 바뀌는 게 없으니까 무릎 쓰고 하는 거지 뭐... ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, but if I don't do that, nothing will change, so I'll just do it on my knees... ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 진짜 남 일은 아닌 느낌이야
English: But I really feel like it's not someone else's business

Korean: 우리나라도 미군 철수 어쩌고 얘기 나오면 솔직히 좀 무섭긴 해
English: To be honest, I'm a little scared when we hear talk about the withdrawal of US troops from our country.

Korean: 이제는 근데 전쟁나면 다같이 죽자 이거 아니야? 키키
English: Now, if war breaks out, we'll all die together, right? Kiki

Korean: 맞아 특히 핵폭탄 왔다 갔다 하면 그냥 끝나는 거야 키키
English: Yeah, especially if you go back and forth with a nuclear bomb, it's just over Kiki

Korean: 우리도 북한 때문에 진짜 남일 같지 않더라
English: We also don't really feel like we are in a different situation because of North Korea.

Korean: 인정...그냥 죽을 거면 고통스럽지 않게 죽고 싶다^^ 휴...
English: Admit it... If I'm going to die, I want to die without pain^^ Sigh...

Korean: 북한 하니까 생각났는데 그 김정은 형 죽은 거 봤어? 공항에서?
English: Speaking of North Korea, I thought of this. Did you see Kim Jong-un die? At the airport?

Korean: 유튜브에 다시 떴길래 봤는데 소름 돋았잖아
English: I saw it on YouTube again and it gave me goosebumps

Korean: 맞아 죽은 건 봤는데 그거 유튜브에서 떴길래 볼라 했는데 까먹었어 봐야겠다!
English: Yes, I saw that he died, but I saw it on YouTube and wanted to watch it, but I forgot. I guess I'll have to watch it!

Korean: 오 아니? 나중에  밥 먹을 때 보여줘!
English: Oh no? Show me later when we eat!

Korean: 웅웅 좀 이따 까먹을 수도 있으니까 말해!
English: Yeah, tell me, I might forget later!

Korean: 혹시 네일 아트 해 본 사람~
English: Has anyone ever tried nail art?
I tried it once! Kiki

Korean: 근데 진짜 답답해서 1주일 만에 내가 다 뜯어버림
English: But it was so frustrating that I tore it all apart in a week.

Korean: 키키 나는 친구가 네일 아트 갓 배웠을 때 받아봤어
English: Kiki I got it when my friend just started learning nail art.
It was really pretty and I liked it, but what about you?
I haven't tried it

Korean: 너무 예뻐서 한번쯤은 해보고 싶은데 매니큐어만 발라도 답답해서 다 떼어버리는 스타일이라 백 퍼 답답해 죽음
English: It's so pretty that I want to try it at least once, but I'm the type that just puts on nail polish and takes it all off, so it's 100% frustrating to death

Korean: 아니 난 초등학교 때 이후로 거의 처음 발라본 거거든?
English: No, this is the first time I've applied it since elementary school?

Korean: 근데 진짜 그거 어떻게 하고 다니냐
English: But really, how do you do that?
It's so frustrating, really

Korean: 키키 나는 하라면 잘할 수 있을 것 같아
English: Kiki I think I can do it well if I'm told to do it

Korean: 근데 손톱 길어야 예쁜데 우리는 손톱 못 길어서 좀 슬프지...?
English: But it's a bit sad that we can't have long nails, even though they are pretty if they are long...?

Korean: 다니라고 하면 다닐 수 있을 듯! 예뻐
English: If you tell me to go, I think I can go! It's pretty

Korean: 진짜? 나는 그냥 딱 한번만 해볼래... 불편해~
English: Really? I just want to try it once... It's uncomfortable~

Korean: 하게 되면 완전 화려하게 할 거야 키키
English: If we do it, we'll do it in a flashy way, Kiki

Korean: 윽 키키 근데 내 친구 맨날 네일 받았었는데 손톱 무좀 걸려서 이제 아무것도 못해 키키
English: Ugh Kiki but my friend used to get her nails done every day but now she got nail fungus and can't do anything Kiki
Is that because your hands can't breathe?

Korean: 헐 손톱 무좀 미쳤네 처음 들어 키키
English: Wow, nail fungus is crazy. I've never heard of it before. Kiki
Why is the texture like that Kiki

Korean: 아니 네일 받는 건 좋은데 이제 지우는 것도 우리가 잘 못하니까 그런 게 좀 귀찮지?
English: Well, getting your nails done is good, but now we're not good at removing them either, so isn't that a bit annoying?

Korean: 헐 손톱 무좀 나도 처음 들어봐
English: Wow, this is the first time I've heard of nail fungus.

Korean: 맞아 지우는 거 때문에 나같이 게으른 애들은 못해...
English: That's right, lazy people like me can't do it because of the deletion...

Korean: 젤 네일 떼러 또 가야 되잖아
English: I have to go back to get my gel nails removed again.

Korean: 맞아 하하 나 이번 여름에 패디 처음 받아봤는데 지금 많이 길었는데도 떼러 가기 귀찮아서 참는 중이야...
English: Yeah haha I got my hair done for the first time this summer and it's already long so I'm holding back because I'm too lazy to go get it taken off...

Korean: 근데 나는 샵 가서는 한 번도 안 받아봤어 어때?
English: But I've never received it at a shop. What do you think?

Korean: 헐 많이 긴 패디한 발톱 보여줘! 키키
English: Wow, show me your long, pedicured toenails! Kiki

Korean: 키키 내 발 못 생겨서 좀 부끄러웠어 ^^
English: Kiki I was a little embarrassed because my feet were ugly ^^

Korean: 난 새끼 발톱 거의  없는 수준이라 내가 가끔 바르면 살에다가 발톱인 척하고 발랐었어 키키
English: I have almost no baby nails, so when I apply it, I pretend it's a nail and apply it to my skin Kiki
But they created it for me this time when I went

Korean: 키키 너무 웃기다 살에다가 그걸 왜 바르냐고 어이 없어 키키
English: Kiki is so funny. Why are you putting that on your body? Kiki is ridiculous.

Korean: 키키 나도 새끼 발톱 몇 번 빠진 뒤로 거의 없어졌어...
English: Kiki, my little toenails have almost disappeared after falling off a few times...

Korean: 빽빽아 넌 엄청 많은 거야 키키
English: You are so thick, Kiki
I just don't have any...

Korean: 아니 새끼만 없으면 웃기니까 그냥 있는 척 좀 해봤어!
English: No, it's funny if there's no kid, so I just pretended there was one!
Are you dissatisfied?!

Korean: 좀 이따 둘 다 봐야겠다 아니 발톱은 또 왜 빠진 건데?!
English: I'll have to see you both later. Why did your toenail fall off again?!

Korean: 아니 언니 내 거 본 적 없으면서 왜 많은 거래 키키
English: No, sis, you've never seen mine, so why are you trading so much?

Korean: 나 구두 한번 잘못 신었다가 빠졌는데 한 번 그러고 나니까 자꾸 빠져...
English: I wore my shoes wrong once and they fell off, but after that, they kept falling off...

Korean: 그래? 너 샌들 신었을 때 발톱 본 것 같은데 키키 잘못봤나...
English: Really? I thought I saw toenails when you were wearing sandals, but did I see Kiki?

Korean: 송송아 그리고 오늘 안 보여줄 거야 양말 신었졍!
English: Song Song Ah, and I won't show you today, I'm wearing socks!

Korean: 아 뭐해! 헐 근데 나는 빠져본 적은 없고 멍들어서 남색깔로 칠하고 다녔다 키키
English: Oh, what are you doing! Oh my, but I've never fallen for it and I just went around with it painted in blue because I was dazed. Kiki

Korean: 아니 멍들었는데 남색으로 칠한 거 진짜 어이없네 키키
English: No, it's ridiculous that you painted it blue when you were drunk, Kiki
Kiki, you're so sisterly
Seriously, what are you doing?

Korean: 다들 왜 이렇게 코미디야 진짜 키키
English: Why is everyone so comedic, really Kiki

Korean: 키키 아니 멍들면 잘 안 빠져 창피하다구!
English: Kiki, no, it's embarrassing because it doesn't come out easily when you get bruised!

Korean: 우리 젊어도 건강 검진 열심히 하자...
English: Let's get health checkups even though we're young...

Korean: 너 이번 주에 내시경 하러 가잖아!
English: You're going for an endoscopy this week!
I need to tell you a review

Korean: 키키 그니까 나 내시경 안 해봐서 궁금하다
English: Kiki, I'm curious because I've never had an endoscopy before.
If I wake up under anesthesia, won't it hurt?
That's why I'm scared because it's my first time too
What should I do if something goes wrong with me?

Korean: 아 근데 수면 내시경 아프다는 후기는 못 들어본 듯?
English: Oh, but I don't think I've ever heard a review saying that sleep endoscopy is painful?

Korean: 헛소리 그런 거 후기만 많고 키키
English: There are a lot of reviews that are just nonsense like that Kiki
I wonder what Kiki's nonsense will be called
Are you going with your parents?
Yeah, my mom said she'd go with me haha
I want to sleep quietly~
Kiki, will it be done by your will?!

Korean: 그거 보호자 없으면 안 해주나 근데?
English: But you can't do that without a guardian?

Korean: 근데 아예 갈 사람 없으면 어케 ㅠㅠ 되지 않을까
English: But what if there is no one to go? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 우리 엄마는 건강 검진할 때 수면으로 위 내시경 했는데 혼자 갔대
English: But my mom had an upper gastrointestinal endoscopy while sleeping during a health checkup, and she went alone.

Korean: 아 진짜? 나도 하게 되면 거의  혼자 가야 할 삘이라 물어 봤졍 하하
English: Oh really? I asked because if I did it, I'd probably have to go alone haha

Korean: 키키 근데 얘들아 아메리카노 찐하게 매일 2잔씩 마시기랑 단 음료 매일 마시기랑 뭐가 더 건강에 안 좋다고 생각해?
English: Kiki But guys, which do you think is worse for your health, drinking two cups of strong Americano every day or drinking a sugary drink every day?
Kiki, is it too difficult...? Isn't it similar...?

Korean: 키키 내가 둘 다 별로라고 했어 안 했어!
English: Kiki I said neither of them were good!
Both need to be reduced

Korean: 근데 내가 봤을 때는 단 거가 더 안 좋아
English: But when I saw it, I didn't like the sweet one much
Sugar is really bad for you!

Korean: 키키 아니 나는 아메리카노가 더 걱정된다고 했는데 아까 언니한테 혼났어 키키
English: Kiki No, I said I was more worried about Americano, but I got scolded by my sister earlier Kiki
Kiki and I are both worried about each other

Korean: 아메리카노는 위에 안 좋고 단 거는 딱 어디 안 좋다는 건 몰라
English: I don't know if Americano is bad for your stomach or if something sweet is bad for you

Korean: 반응 빠르게 안 좋은 건 아메리카노 선택!
English: If you don't like quick reactions, choose Americano!

Korean: 키키 아니 근데  단 거는 그냥 다 흡수야...
English: Kiki: No, but the sweet stuff just absorbs everything...

Korean: 특히 쟤는 액체류를 많이 먹잖아 걍 혈액에 바로 흡수
English: Especially since he drinks a lot of liquids, they just absorb them straight into his bloodstream.

Korean: 역시 빽빽이 나랑 비슷한 생각이었어 키키
English: Kiki, you had similar thoughts to me

Korean: 맞아 요새 특히 더 많이 마시는 듯 ㅠㅠ 단 거 못 끊어
English: Yeah, I think I drink a lot more these days ㅠㅠ I can't stop eating sweets

Korean: 나도 단 거 좋아하나 봐 몰랐는데 키키
English: I didn't know you like sweets either, Kiki

Korean: 근데 진짜 단맛 다르게 느끼는 거 너무 신기해 키키
English: But it's so amazing how you can taste sweetness differently Kiki

Korean: 내가 먹으면 혀가 얼얼할 정돈데 너넨 맛있어! 혹은 부족해야
English: If I eat it, my tongue will be numb, but you guys are delicious! Or maybe it's not enough

Korean: 키키 아마 우리 둘이는 커피 많이 안 마시니까 단 거에 적응해서 더 그럴 수도?
English: Kiki Maybe because the two of us don't drink much coffee, we're used to sweets and that might be why it's so bad?

Korean: 맞아 근데 내가 궁금해서 쳐봤는데 저장할 수 있는 당을 넘어서면 중성 지방이 된대
English: That's right, but I was curious so I looked it up and it says that if you exceed the amount of sugar you can store, it becomes neutral fat.
I guess I'm just gaining weight
Coffee is worse~

Korean: 아니야! 당뇨병 걸려 진짜 키키 조심해 얘들아 알겠지?
English: No! I have diabetes. Be careful, Kiki. Okay?

Korean: 난 요즘 커피 엄청 줄이는 중!
English: I'm trying to cut down on coffee a lot these days!

Korean: 키키 그건 그래! 요새 안 마시는 거 인정
English: Kiki That's right! I admit I don't drink these days.
Flip is pretty these days
People around me keep switching from iPhone...

Korean: 야 진짜... 오늘 아침에 테크 유튜버 리뷰 보면서 왔어 하하
English: Hey seriously... I came here this morning after watching tech youtuber reviews haha

Korean: 그거 진심 방수 기능 장난 아니야
English: That thing is seriously waterproof, no joke
Samsung is crazy

Korean: 키키 어 나 본 것 같아
English: Kiki, I think I saw you

Korean: 그 얼음컵에 아예 집어 담구는 거 맞지 분홍색이랑 초록색 리뷰 키키 색깔 이쁘더라
English: It's okay to just put it in the ice cup. The pink and green review Kiki colors are pretty.
Oh, I can't see it

Korean: 근데 애플 워치 있는 사람들 팔면서까지 사는 거 대단해 난 귀찮아서 안 할 듯...
English: But it's amazing that people who have Apple Watches are selling them to buy them. I don't think I'll do it because it's too much of a hassle...
Oh Song Song, that wasn't it haha

Korean: 그리고 놀리려는 건 아닌데 분홍색은 없어... ^^
English: And I don't mean to be joking, but there's no pink... ^^

Korean: 뭐야! 나랑 같은 거 본 줄 키키
English: What! Kiki, you saw the same thing as me

Korean: 나도 얼마 전에 유튜브로 플립 봤거든
English: I also watched Flip on YouTube a while ago

Korean: 키키 뭐야 그럼 송송 언니가 본 분홍색은 뭐야
English: Kiki, what is it? Then what is the pink color that Song Song saw?

Korean: 라벤더를 분홍으로 착각한 것 같긴 한데... 좀 다르긴 하네 많이 키키
English: I think I mistook lavender for pink... but it's a bit different, Kiki
Or maybe you confused it with the hologram in version 2?

Korean: 키키 라벤더 그래 그거 키키 아니 아무튼 예쁘다고!
English: Kiki Lavender Yeah that's Kiki No anyway it's pretty!
Kiki aha kiki you look pretty

Korean: 난 근데 갤럭시는 다 가로로 너무 짧고 세로로 길어서 디자인이 내 스타일 아님 ㅜㅜ
English: But I think the Galaxy is too short horizontally and too long vertically, so the design isn't my style ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 그건 맞아 오늘 리뷰 보니까 가로로 영상 볼 때 유튜브 자막이 좀 잘리긴 하더랑 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, that's right. When I looked at the review today, I saw that the YouTube subtitles are cut off a bit when watching the video horizontally.
But the camera is really good...

Korean: 갤럭시 근데 후면은 괜찮은데 전면은 별로지 않아?
English: Galaxy, but the back is okay, but the front is not so great, right?

Korean: 아 진짜? 난 그런 건 모르고 그냥 그런 디자인 때문에 옛날부터 안 좋아했는데 자막 잘리는 거 오바네
English: Oh really? I don't know about that, but I didn't like it since long ago because of the design, but the subtitles being cut off is too much.

Korean: 맞아 갤럭시 오이 되기로 유명한데 괜찮나?
English: Yeah, it's famous for being a Galaxy cucumber, is that okay?

Korean: 갤럭시? 아이폰이 오이 진짜 심하지 않아?
English: Galaxy? Isn't iPhone really that bad?

Korean: 어제 우리 사진 찍을 때도 그랬잖아
English: It was the same when we took our picture yesterday
No, it's cucumber galaxy Kiki

Korean: 나도 갤럭시 추종자로 노트를 고집해왔다가 아이폰 쓰고 나서는 쭉 아이폰!
English: I too was a Galaxy fan and stuck with the Note, but after using the iPhone, I've always used the iPhone!

Korean: 어제 그건 난 그렇게 오이인진 모르겠는데 언니가 그렇대서 그렇구나 했어 키키
English: Yesterday, I didn't know if it was that cucumber, but my sister said it was, so I thought it was Kiki

Korean: 갤럭시로 셀카 특히 가운데 말고 가장자리로 갈수록 얼굴 짱 길어짐
English: When taking selfies with Galaxy, your face becomes really long, especially towards the edges rather than the center.

Korean: 헐 진짜? 난 삼성 전자기기 자체를 별로 안 좋아해서 써 본 적이 없어서 몰랐어 키키
English: Wow, really? I don't really like Samsung electronic devices, so I've never used them, so I didn't know. Kiki

Korean: 근데 이번에 디자인이 진짜 너무 예뻐
English: But this time the design is really pretty

Korean: 근데 삼성 요새 하도 그런 소리 많이 들어서 이제는 오이 아니지 않을까?
English: But Samsung has been hearing that a lot lately, so isn't it no longer a cucumber?
I want to see the real flip too
I haven't seen it yet

Korean: 근데 나도 삼성 한 번도 안 써봄 키키
English: But I've never used Samsung either Kiki

Korean: 내가 아빠 거로 셀카 찍어볼게 오이 되나 키키
English: I'll take a selfie with dad, okay? Kiki

Korean: 근데 예쁘긴 한데 아빠건 검은색이라 그렇게까지 예쁜 건 모르겠어
English: It's pretty, but I don't know if it's that pretty because my dad's is black.
Oh great! Is the flip black?

Korean: 플립 검정색 짱 예쁜데...실물 진짜 더 이뿌던데 어제 보니까
English: The black flip is really pretty...but it's even prettier in person, I saw it yesterday

Korean: 아아 맞다 어제 검은색 봤네 키키
English: Oh right, I saw the black one yesterday Kiki

Korean: 어 맞아 글고 내가 알기로 검은색만 무광이야!
English: Oh right, and as far as I know, only the black one is matte!

Korean: 그래? 난 폰 검정 안 좋아해서 키키
English: Really? I don't like black phones. Kiki

Korean: 그럼 누구 한명 플립 하나 사~
English: Then whoever buys a flip~

Korean: 키키 난 주변에서 쓰는 거 실험해보고 살래...
English: Kiki I want to experiment with what people around me use...

Korean: 삼성은 화면 노래지는 거 싫어서 좀 더 고민해야 해
English: Samsung needs to think more about it because they don't want the screen to be distorted
Oh, are you thinking of changing it?

Korean: 나는 바꾼 지 얼마 안 됨 키키
English: I haven't changed for long Kiki
Sisters, do you have a favorite celebrity?
But I always change Kiki

Korean: 이 드라마 보면 얘가 좋고 저 드라마 보면 쟤가 좋아...
English: If I watch this drama, I like him, and if I watch that drama, I like him...

Korean: 근데 말했던 것 같은데 요즘은 김성철 좀 꾸준히 좋아
English: But I think I said it before, but I like Kim Sung-cheol consistently these days

Korean: 인스타도 얘만 팔로우 해 놨어 연예인 중에서
English: I only follow this person on Instagram among celebrities.

Korean: 키키 나는 요새 일박이일 김선호 멋있는 것 같아!
English: Kiki I think Kim Seon-ho from Il-Nam-Il-Il is cool these days!
you?
But why do you like Kim Seong-cheol?
Because you sing well?

Korean: 나도 드라마 볼 때마다 좋아하는 사람 바뀜 키키
English: Every time I watch a drama, my favorite person changes Kiki

Korean: 키키 사실 진짜 내 스타일 아니거든?
English: Kiki, actually, that's not really my style?
But it appeared in my dream and I felt better
Do you remember what I told you, Kiki?
Kiki, what was that? Tell me again.

Korean: 키키 아 전에 얘기했던 거 같아
English: Kiki, I think we talked about this before

Korean: 내가 아마 빽빽이랑만 얘기했었을 거야 키키
English: I probably only talked to Bakbak Kiki

Korean: 전에 꿈에 김성철 나왔었는데 계속 생각나서 그 뒤로 좋아졌어
English: I had a dream about Kim Seong-cheol before, and I kept thinking about him, so I started liking him after that.

Korean: 키키 김성철 근데 언니 남친 닮음!
English: Kiki Kim Sung-chul but he looks like my sister's boyfriend!

Korean: 키키 그래? 내가 보기엔 안 닮았는데
English: Kiki, really? They don't look alike to me.
No, they don't look alike
Why are you teasing our Seongcheol?!

Korean: 키키 왜! 좋은 거지 이상형 만난 거잖아
English: Kiki, why! It's good, you met your ideal type.

Korean: 키키 이상형이라곤 안 했어 그냥 좋아한다고 언니 스타일은 아니라 함!~
English: Kiki didn't say she was my ideal type, she just said she liked me but she wasn't my type!~

Korean: 휴! 정말 키키 그래서 너넨 누가 좋아?
English: Phew! Seriously Kiki. So who do you guys like?
I originally really liked Song Joong-ki
You're so cool Kiki

Korean: 나는 없어~ 계속 바뀌는데 요즘엔 준호가 섹시하고 괜찮더라
English: I don't have one~ It keeps changing, but these days Junho is sexy and okay
Very foxy Kiki

Korean: 아니 키키 아줌마냐고 키키 여우래 키키
English: No, you're not Kiki Auntie, you're Kiki the Fox Kiki
This is the real Fox Song Kang...
Seriously, everything from his physique to his face is crazy ㅠㅠ
Now all I have to do is act well!

Korean: 키키 오 처음 보는데 잘생겼다 연기하니까 생각났는데 나혼자산다 성훈도 멋있지 않아?
English: I'm seeing Kiki Oh for the first time and he's handsome. His acting reminds me of him. But isn't Sung Hoon from I Live Alone also cool?

Korean: 송강은 좋아하면 울리는 때 잠깐 좋아했지...
English: Song Kang liked it for a little while when he cried...
It passed by quickly^^
Seonghoon is totally not my style...
I really don't like it that much

Korean: 와... 성훈 난 너무 부담스러워 키키
English: Wow... Sunghoon, I feel so burdened Kiki

Korean: 너 내 친구랑 취향 비슷하다 송송아
English: You have similar tastes to my friend Song Song-ah

Korean: 키키 나는 약간 진한 사람 좋아하는 건가?
English: Kiki, do I like slightly dark people?

Korean: 그런가 봐 나는 진한 사람 안 좋아해 키키
English: I guess so, I don't like strong people Kiki
It's burdensome
I like slightly slanted eyes
My friend also likes strong people

Korean: 그 친구는 차은우랑 최강창민 잘생겼다 하더라
English: That friend said that Cha Eunwoo and Choi Kang Changmin are handsome

Korean: 오... 근데 그 둘은 진짜 잘생기긴 했어 키키
English: Oh... but those two are really handsome, Kiki

Korean: 근데  내 이상형이랑은 좀 많이 멀어 키키
English: But Kiki is a bit far from my ideal type

Korean: 너 얘기 들어보면 빽빽이랑 나랑 좀 이상형 이미지가 비슷한 듯
English: Listening to you, it seems like Backback and I have similar ideal types

Korean: 키키 차은우는 진짜 얼굴 천재라는 말이 납득 가는 얼굴이야
English: Kiki Cha Eunwoo has a face that makes you believe he's a real face genius
He's so handsome I'm actually curious
What is your favorite movie genre, ladies?
There's nothing special about it!

Korean: 근데 느와르나 공포 영화는 잘 안 봐...
English: But I don't really watch noir or horror movies...

Korean: 키키 나는 로코 좋아 달달하고 웃긴 거 키키
English: Kiki I like Roco. It's sweet and funny. Kiki
Someone recommend me a romantic comedy movie~
When I actually asked, I couldn't think of any romantic comedy.

Korean: 나 사실 영화 제목 잘 기억 못 해 ㅜㅜ
English: I actually don't remember the movie title very well ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나도 키키 아 키싱 부스 봤어 송송아?
English: Have you seen Kiki A Kissing Booth too? Song Song, right?

Korean: 키키 오 대박 나 그거 본지 얼마 안됨!
English: Kiki Oh wow I just saw that!
It was fun

Korean: 어 맞아 그런 느낌 좋아해 키키
English: Oh yeah I like that feeling Kiki
I saw that too Kiki
I've watched up to part 2, but part 3 came out so I'm going to watch it soon!
Yeah Kiki that's funny

Korean: 근데 거기 주인공 두 명 사겼다가 헤어지고 시즌 2 찍은 거 알아?
English: But did you know that the two main characters dated and then broke up and filmed season 2?

Korean: 키키 헐 진짜로? 돈이 이렇게 무섭습니다 여러분
English: Kiki, really? Money is this scary, you guys.
Are you going to film season 2 and then buy it again?
How is it?

Korean: 아 맞아 사겼다 헤어졌다곤 들음 키키
English: Oh right, I heard you broke up Kiki

Korean: 근데 외국은 전 애인이랑 친구하고 되게 자유롭더라
English: But in foreign countries, you can be friends with your ex-lover and be very free.

Korean: 전 남편이랑 현 남편이랑도 같이 만나고 그러던데
English: I heard you were meeting your ex-husband and current husband together.

Korean: 별로 뭐 그런 거 없을 걸?
English: There's not really anything like that, right?

Korean: 인터뷰 본 것 같은데 기억이 안 나 키키
English: I think I saw the interview but I don't remember Kiki
I just thought, "Oh, I cheated..." and moved on.

Korean: 시즌 2 근데 남자 주인공 바뀌지 않았어? 흑인으로
English: Season 2, but didn't the male protagonist change? He became black.
I couldn't watch till the end of 2

Korean: 결국은 그 원래 남친이랑 다시 화해한 거로 알아
English: In the end, I found out that she reconciled with her original boyfriend

Korean: 흠... 주인공 안 바꼈었던 것 같은데?!
English: Hmm... I don't think the main character changed?!
But that setting is funny Kiki

Korean: 하버드 대학 1학년은 무조건 기숙사 사는데 걔네 같이 살려고 집 알아보더라
English: First-year students at Harvard University are required to live in a dormitory, so I was looking for a house to live with them.

Korean: 근까 나는 어디까지 봤냐면 둘이 롱디 돼서 점점 멀어지는데 흑인 전학생이 놀러 와서 약간 좀 친해지는 부분까지?
English: As far as I could see, the two of them were becoming long-distance friends and growing apart, but then a black transfer student came to visit and they started to become a little closer?

Korean: 아하 완전 초반인데 키키 다시 이어서 봐봐
English: Aha, this is really early days, but watch Kiki again
After seeing that, watch part 3 too
What, I barely saw it haha
See you again!

Korean: 키키 1편 보고 바로 2편 연속으로 보니까 지루해서 보다 껐어
English: I watched Kiki 1 and then watched the second one right after, and it got boring so I turned it off
Recommend again
Yes, sister, recommend me
I just like romance too
It's burdensome^^ Kiki

Korean: 넷플릭스를 좀 들여다봐야지 기억이 날 것 같아 키키
English: I'll have to check out Netflix a bit, I think I'll remember Kiki

Korean: 근데 옛날 영화 감성 좋아하면 노트북도 재밌어
English: But if you like old movie vibes, The Notebook is also fun

Korean: 아 진짜 노트북도 엄청 유명하다는데 나 아직도 안 봄 실화야...?
English: Oh, really? I heard that the notebook is really famous, but I still haven't seen it. Is this true...?

Korean: 아 노트북 보려고 했던 거 같은데 앞에 좀 지루해서 껐던 거 같아
English: Ah, I think I was trying to look at my laptop, but I think I turned it off because it was a bit boring.

Korean: 클레멘타인인가 그거 재밌게 봤던 거 같은데
English: Clementine, I think I enjoyed that one

Korean: 노트북 그냥 옛날 감성 안 좋아하면 보면 안 돼 키키
English: If you don't like the old fashioned feel of the notebook, don't watch Kiki
It might be boring...
Clementine I didn't see that!
See you later ~haha

Korean: 키키 나 옛날 감성 영화 좋아해
English: Kiki I like old school sentimental movies
Have you seen Notting Hill?
What's for lunch today?
I'm still undecided...
Give me some recommendations Kiki

Korean: 니가 아까 마라탕 얘기하니까 먹고 싶어서 나는 마라탕 시킬 예정!
English: Since you mentioned mala-tang earlier, I want to eat it, so I'm going to order mala-tang!

Korean: 헐 진짜 거기 마라탕 맛집 있어?
English: Wow, is there really a good spicy hotpot restaurant there?

Korean: 우리 집 5분 거리에 줄 서서 먹는 맛집 있지~
English: There's a restaurant 5 minutes away from my house where people have to wait in line to eat~

Korean: 와 나도 거기 한번 가보고 싶다!
English: Wow, I want to go there too!
I'm serious about Mala Tang Kiki
You know there's a good restaurant in Suwon~

Korean: 아 거기! 요즘 점심에 문을 안 열어 ㅠㅠ 코로나 때문에
English: Oh, there! They don't open for lunch these days ㅠㅠ Because of Corona

Korean: 헐 코로나 때문에 못 연다고? 실화야?
English: Oh my god, you can't open it because of Corona? Is that true?

Korean: 그러게 요즘 배달만 하더라 거긴 가서 먹어야 하는데
English: Yeah, they only do delivery these days, so I have to go there and eat there.

Korean: 그러니까 원래 마라탕은 그 자리에서 먹어야 제 맛인데 ㅜㅜ
English: So, originally, mala-tang should be eaten on the spot to enjoy it properly ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 금방 튀긴 꿔바로우가 너무 맛있어 키키
English: Yes, the freshly fried kuay bao rou is so delicious Kiki

Korean: 헐 저번에 같이 먹었던 그 꿔바로우 말하는 거지?
English: Oh, are you talking about the kuabaorou we ate together last time?

Korean: 응 맞아 나 그거 너무 좋아해 키키
English: Yeah right I love that so much Kiki

Korean: 나도 완전 사랑이지 하 또 먹고 싶다 ㅜㅜ
English: I also totally love it. I want to eat it again. ㅜㅜ

Korean: 다음에 먹으러 가야지 얼른 와 키키
English: Let's go eat next time, come quickly Kiki

Korean: 너 이번에 취업하면 자취할 생각 있어?
English: Are you thinking of living alone when you get a job this time?

Korean: 응 맞아 나 얼른 자취하고 싶어
English: Yeah, that's right. I want to live alone soon.
If you go, which area do you want to go to?

Korean: 아마 대전으로 가지 않을까? 거기 좋더라
English: Maybe I should go to Daejeon? It's nice there.
Send me to Daejeon too ㅜㅜ
Daejeon is really a great place to live!
Is living in Seoul really hard? ㅠㅠ
Let's go down together!

Korean: 일단 혼자 사는 게 너무 외롭더라 ㅜㅜ
English: First of all, living alone is so lonely ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 진짜? 우리 같이 투룸 구해서 가볼까 키키
English: Oh really? Let's find a two-room apartment together and go, Kiki
It'll probably be cheaper there than in Seoul, right?
Yeah, that's right, half. Kiki, this is it!
Is the real price real?
Send me to Daejeon ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그러게 같이 부동산 알아보자 키키 내려가~
English: Okay, let's look into real estate together. Kiki, come down~
Okay, I'll cut the refund fee down a lot!
I'll look for you with my eagle eyes Kiki
We're going to be a fantastic duo!
Yeah, that's right, jump south!

Korean: 너 저번에 셔틀버스 타고 간 곳이 어디야?
English: Where did you go on the shuttle bus last time?
Oh, that's Everland Safari Kiki

Korean: 아 그거는 어디서 탈 수 있어?
English: Oh, where can I get that?

Korean: 사파리 월드라는 놀이기구인데 거기서 버스를 탑승했어
English: There's an amusement park called Safari World, and I took a bus there.

Korean: 그 버스 디자인 되게 귀엽던데 ㅜㅜ
English: That bus design was really cute ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 통창으로 동물들 가까이서 봤어 키키
English: Yes, I saw the animals up close through the window Kiki
Wow, wow, weren't you scared?
Yeah, it's really sturdy and safe, Kiki
Was there a bar on that window?

Korean: 웅 맞아 다 철창이 안전하게 되어 있어서 괜찮아
English: Yeah, that's right, it's okay because the bars are all safe.

Korean: 그렇구나 25년 살면서 그런 곳은 안 가봤네 ㅜㅜ
English: I see. I've never been to a place like that in 25 years of living. ㅜㅜ

Korean: 안 가본 곳이 정말 많구나 언니 ㅠㅠ
English: There are so many places you haven't been to, sis ㅠㅠ
So, give me a shuttle bus ride too~!

Korean: 셔틀버스 타고 같이 동물 구경 하지 않을래?
English: Would you like to take a shuttle bus and go see the animals together?
Do I have to pay for the shuttle bus?
No, it's included in the admission ticket. Kiki

Korean: 너 저번에 면접 본 곳은 결과 언제 나와?
English: When will the results come out for the place you interviewed at last time?

Korean: 결과 아직이래 키키 똥줄 탄다 정말 키키
English: The result is still like this Kiki is really riding the shit rope Kiki

Korean: 역시 공기업이라 그런지 여유가 넘치네 키키
English: As expected from a public corporation, Kiki is very relaxed

Korean: 그러게 나 거기 말고도 다른 곳도 지원했어!
English: Yeah, I applied to other places too!
Oh really? You applied for an office job?
Yeah, that's right, the general affairs and finance and accounting teams.

Korean: 근데 너는 자격증이 취업 잘 되는 자격증을 가지고 있어서 될 수 있을 거야!
English: But you can do it because you have a qualification that will help you get a good job!
Thank you Kiki

Korean: 하지만 요즘 오버 스펙을 원하다 보니 ㅠ 떨어지네
English: But these days, I want over specs so it falls short ㅠ

Korean: 맞아 요즘에 사람들 스펙 보면 장난 아니더라
English: Yeah, these days, if you look at people's specs, they're no joke.
Are you building up your specs well?

Korean: 그럼 나 곧 포토샵 배우는 학원도 다닐려구 키키 취업 성공!
English: Then I'm going to go to a Photoshop academy soon and Kiki, I hope you get a job!

Korean: 헐 대박 그 학원 비용은 어떻게 돼?
English: Wow, wow, how much does that academy cost?

Korean: 학원에서 아르바이트 하면서 배울 수 있대!
English: You can learn while working part-time at a school!
Huh? Is that even possible?
They're looking for an information desk worker

Korean: 그거 하면서 수강 하면 할인 해준대 키키
English: If you take the class while doing that, you'll get a discount Kiki
Then it's a total win-win situation. Apply now!
Okay, I get it! Let's give it a try~

Korean: 니 동생 자대 배치 어디로 받았었어?
English: Where did your brother get his sleeping arrangements?

Korean: 아 거기 파주라고 경기 북부야 키키
English: Ah, there's Paju, northern Gyeonggi Province. Kiki

Korean: 어? 처음에 다른 곳으로 갔다고 하지 않았어?
English: Huh? Didn't you say you went somewhere else at first?

Korean: 거기는 훈련소이고 다른 곳으로 옮겼어 키키
English: That's a training camp and they moved to another place Kiki
Oh, that's the training camp.
How long was your time at the training camp?

Korean: 아마 4주 정도 될걸? 나도 그건 잘 ㅠㅠ
English: Maybe about 4 weeks? I'm not sure about that either ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 논산도 4주라던데 훈련병은 다 똑같나 봐!
English: That's right, Nonsan is also 4 weeks, but I guess all trainees are the same!

Korean: 그러게 키키 어쨌든 지금은 파주에 있어
English: Okay, Kiki, anyway, I'm in Paju now.
Then, would it be easy to come to Suwon in Gyeonggi-do?

Korean: 맞아 키키 근데 못 나온 지 오래야 키키
English: Yeah Kiki but it's been a long time since I've been out Kiki

Korean: 그럼 휴가 나왔을 때 작은 아빠가 데리러 갔어?
English: So when you came back on vacation, did your little dad come pick you up?

Korean: 아니 대중교통 타고 잘 오더라구 키키
English: No, I heard you can get there by public transportation Kiki
You're an adult, you're an adult
But you're getting discharged early~

Korean: 맞아 곧 얼굴 볼 것 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I think I'll see your face soon ㅠㅠ
I want to see that fat pig's face~

Korean: 곧 보게 될 거야 아주 많이...
English: You'll see a lot soon...
What are you studying these days?

Korean: 나 요즘 영상 편집 공부 중이야 키키
English: I'm studying video editing these days Kiki
Right, you're working with that, right?

Korean: 요즘 인스타 릴스가 유행이라 나도 배우는 중 키키
English: Insta reels are trending these days, so I'm learning them too Kiki
I understand Instagram, but what are Reels?
It's a short video of less than 30 seconds.
Is that popular these days?
Is that like TikTok?

Korean: 응 맞아 틱톡 같더라 키키 그거 배워
English: Yeah right, it's like TikTok. Kiki, learn that.

Korean: 아 나 근데 왜 한국 애들이 릴스로 갈아탄 지 알겠어!
English: Oh, but now I know why Korean kids switched to reels!
Yeah? Why are you changing?

Korean: 틱톡이 중국 앱이라서 개인정보 빼낼 수 있다고 들었어!
English: I heard that TikTok is a Chinese app and that they can steal personal information!
Oh, that's too much ㅜㅜ
I'll have to do it in reels from now on

Korean: 릴스 우리도 할 수 있는 거야?
English: Reels, can we do that too?

Korean: 좀 어렵지만 금방 배우더라 키키 한번 해봐
English: It's a little difficult, but you'll learn it quickly. Try Kiki.

Korean: 아니 우리 같이 해야지 릴스 선생 알려주세요~
English: No, we should do it together. Teacher Rils, please tell me~

Korean: 아 내가 제대로 배워와서 다 알려줄게 키키
English: Ah, I'll learn it properly and tell you everything, Kiki

Korean: 작은 아빠랑 작은 엄마 다들 주사 맞았어?
English: Did Little Daddy and Little Mommy both get their shots?
Oh, are you talking about the vaccine?
Yeah, everyone got the first one right?

Korean: 응 맞았지 화이자 키키 별로 안 아프대
English: Yeah, that's right. Pfizer Kiki doesn't hurt that much.
You got Pfizer. Are you having any symptoms?

Korean: 팔이 붓고 조금 머리가 아프시대 ㅠㅠ
English: My arm is swollen and my head hurts a little bit ㅠㅠ
Was Grandma right?
Yeah, my mom got the first one too!
Oh, so you don't have any symptoms?

Korean: 어 없었는데 일주일 지나니까 맞은 부위가 부었어!
English: Oh, it wasn't there, but after a week, the area I was hit swelled up!

Korean: 그거 타이레놀 잘 챙겨 먹으면 낫는다고 하네
English: They say that if you take Tylenol regularly, you'll get better.

Korean: 그래서 언니가 그 약 사다 놨었어!
English: That's why my sister bought that medicine!
Oh, good job! When will you meet me?

Korean: 나는 마스크나 잘 쓰고 다니려고 헤헤
English: I'm going to wear a mask and go out hehe

Korean: 그치 아직은 좀 무섭긴 하더라 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, it's still a little scary ㅠㅠ
That's right! This time, it came out that someone in their 20s died!

Korean: 맞아 우리도 백신 맞을 때 고민해야 해
English: Yes, we also have to think about getting vaccinated.
You went to Busan this time since it's your 400th day?
Yeah, that's right, I went on a date~
I'm jealous. Wasn't your boyfriend two years younger than you?
Yeah, that's right, Kiki, born in 2000
Are there people born in 00 in this world?
Hey, these days, everything is 00s ㅠㅠ

Korean: 하 대박이다 몇 일 동안 있다 온 거야?
English: Wow, that's awesome. How many days have you been here?
2 nights and 3 days! It's 400 days so I went to eat steak Kiki
Oh, you went to cut the meat~

Korean: 그래 기념일인데 그 정도는 해 줘야지~
English: Yeah, it's our anniversary, so we should do that much~
I just sent it simply because it was our first anniversary last month
Oh, it's already been a year
I don't even remember haha
How long has it been since you and your boyfriend met?
I recently checked and it was 2500 days.
Wow... That's great. When are you getting married?

Korean: 나 아직 25살이라 생각 안 해 봤어
English: I haven't thought about it yet, I'm only 25

Korean: 근데 내 주변 다 결혼한다고 톡 오더라 젠장.
English: But damn, everyone around me keeps texting me saying they're getting married.
Hey, it's coming soon Kiki
I need to eat quickly~ ^^

Korean: 너는 자취하면 반려동물 키울 생각 있어?
English: If you live alone, do you plan on raising a pet?
I have a dog, a cat, and a hamster!
Are you talking about growing three types at the same time?
No, I'm going to keep increasing it!
What breed of dog do you want to raise?

Korean: 강아지 비숑 키우고 싶어 너무 예뻐
English: I want to raise a Bichon puppy, it's so cute

Korean: 아 그 친구 자다 일어나면 머리 짜뿌되는 거 졸귀지 ㅜㅜ
English: Ah, that guy wakes up with his head in a mess, he's so cute ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 구름이 뛰어 다니는 것 같아 키키 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, it looks like the clouds are jumping around Kiki ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 그러면 미용은 언니한테 부탁하면 되겠다~
English: Okay, then I can ask my older sister for beauty care~
That's a good idea Kiki. Kiki.
Does your sister have a pet?

Korean: 우리 오복이가 내 최애 반려동물이지 뭐~
English: Our Obok is my favorite pet~
Oh Bok-i, is there anything that hurts?

Korean: 지금 이틀에 한 번씩 약 먹고 있잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: I'm taking medicine every two days now ㅜㅜ
Oh my gosh ㅠㅠ My heart hurts so much

Korean: 지금은 언니랑 엄마가 번갈아가면서 먹이고 있어!
English: Now my sister and mom are taking turns feeding it!

Korean: 약을 안 먹는 날이 왔으면 좋겠네! 우리 오복이
English: I wish there would come a day when we don't have to take medicine! Our Obok

Korean: 너는 요즘에 하고 싶은 운동 있어?
English: Is there any exercise you want to do these days?
I want to learn climbing~
If you climb, you'll get it right away~
Oh, did you learn climbing, sis?
Yeah, I'm in the intermediate class.

Korean: 너 그것도 급수 나누는 거 알아?
English: Do you know that you can also divide that by a series?
Wow, that's great
What do you need to climb?
That's also an exercise that requires skill~
What skills do you need?

Korean: 일단 코어 힘이 기본적으로 있어야 하고 하다 보면 알아~
English: First of all, you need to have basic core strength, and you'll know it as you keep doing it~

Korean: 응 언니 코어가 되게 좋구나~ 부럽다!
English: Yeah, unnie, your core is really good~ I'm jealous!

Korean: 응~ 나는 없는데 전체적으로 힘 분산을 잘 시켜서 칭찬을 많이 받았지~
English: Yeah~ I don't have any, but I got a lot of compliments for distributing my strength well overall~
Wow, how much does it cost?

Korean: 내가 했을 때는 한 달에 10만 원이었고 3달에 24만 원이었어!
English: When I did it, it was 100,000 won per month and 240,000 won in 3 months!
And I need to buy shoes too!
It's so cheap
The instructor taught me?
Yes, there is a teacher who teaches you!
Oh, I should learn it too!
You said you play Overwatch, right?

Korean: 응 맞아 근데 요즘 다른 거 해
English: Yeah that's right but I'm doing something different these days

Korean: 헐 역시 세상은 빠르게 돌아가는구나 뭐 하는데?
English: Wow, the world really does turn fast. What are you doing?
So, do you know Kiki Battle Ground?

Korean: 배그 알지 알지 나도 그거 해 봤어~
English: Bag, you know, you know, I've done that too~

Korean: 아 진짜? 그거 좀 어렵던데 어땠어?
English: Oh really? That was a bit difficult. How was it?

Korean: 맞아 그래서 맨날 헤드샷 당했지 뭐~
English: Yeah, that's why I got headshots all the time~

Korean: 그러게 키키 다음에 같이 한번 해볼래?
English: Okay, Kiki, do you want to do it together next time?

Korean: 우리 같이 하면 그냥 전멸이지 뭐 물론 우리가.
English: If we do it together, we'll all be wiped out. Of course, that includes us.
I just want to give you the items Kiki

Korean: 맞아 키키 나도 너 따라다니면서 줍줍이나 해야지~
English: Right Kiki, I should follow you around and pick up things too~

Korean: 그러면 10등 안에 들더라고 키키 나름 전략~
English: Then, Kiki's strategy is to get into the top 10~

Korean: 키키 맞아 너 치킨 먹어 봤어?
English: Kiki, have you ever tried chicken?

Korean: 와 치킨 먹어 보고 싶지 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, I want to try chicken ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 처음에 진짜 치킨 주는 줄 알았잖아~
English: At first, I thought they were giving me real chicken too~
That's not it Kiki
I want to eat chicken!

Korean: 너 최근에 갔던 해외 여행지가 어디야?
English: Where was your last overseas trip?

Korean: 해외 여행을 안 간 지 언제야 ㅠ 마지막은 일본!
English: When was the last time I went on a trip abroad? The last time was Japan!

Korean: 너 설마 그때 라면 먹고 싶어서 갔던 그때니?
English: Did you go there because you wanted to eat ramen back then?

Korean: 맞아 라멘 먹을라고 당일치기 한 것 같은데 키키
English: Yes, I think I went on a day trip to eat ramen. Kiki

Korean: 일본을 당일치기로 가다니 내 주변에 너 같은 사람은 없어!
English: There's no one like you around me who can go to Japan for a day trip!

Korean: 이치란 라멘이 생각 나는 걸 어떡해 ㅠㅠ
English: What should I do when I miss Ichiran Ramen? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 근데 그 라멘집 존맛탱이기는 해!
English: Oh, but that ramen place is really delicious!

Korean: 언니도 일본 갔다 왔었구나! 어디 갔어?
English: Sister, you went to Japan too! Where did you go?
I've been to Osaka and Fukuoka!
Oh, I went to Fukuoka too!
How many days did you travel to Fukuoka?

Korean: 나 되게 자주 가서 기억이 안 나네 ㅠㅠ
English: I go there so often that I don't remember ㅠㅠ

Korean: 와 진짜 너는 코로나만 아니었으면 지금 날아다녔을 텐데!
English: Wow, seriously, if it weren't for Corona, you would be flying right now!
That's right, my body is aching ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그나마 제일 먼 부산을 간 거야 그러면?
English: So you went to Busan, which is the farthest place?

Korean: 맞아 키키 거기라도 갈 수 있어서 좋아!
English: Yeah Kiki, I'm glad I can go there!
What is your favorite season?
I like summer because it's warm

Korean: 헐 내 주변에 여름 좋다는 사람은 못 봤는데!
English: Wow, I haven't seen anyone around me who likes summer!
Isn't that rare?
I hate the cold ㅠㅠ
Then you don't turn on the air conditioner?
Turn on the air conditioner, but don't cover yourself with a blanket!
But that's the happiest national rule!

Korean: 맞아 근데 이제 여름이 끝나가서 아쉬워 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, but I'm sad that summer is ending now ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 이제 가을비 내리고 이거 끝나면 추워진대 ㅜㅜ
English: That's right, it's raining autumn now and it's going to get cold when this is over ㅜㅜ

Korean: 정말? 이제 가을 옷 살 때가 되었네~
English: Really? It's time to buy fall clothes now~

Korean: 나도 가을 옷 사야 하는데 쇼핑하러 같이 갈까?
English: I also need to buy some fall clothes. Do you want to go shopping together?
Yeah, okay

Korean: 요즘 가을 옷 많이 나오더라 키키
English: There are a lot of fall clothes coming out these days, Kiki

Korean: 맞아 나도 광고로 많이 봤어 자기네 옷들 좀 사라고 키키
English: Yeah, I've seen it in a lot of commercials too. Kiki tells you to buy some of their clothes.
Kiki, yeah, good
Let's go sometime~

Korean: 좋아 다른 언니들도 우리가 데리고 가주자~
English: Okay, let's take the other sisters too~

Korean: 그래 얼른 추워지기 전에 옷 사야지~
English: Yeah, I need to buy some clothes before it gets cold~

Korean: 너 이번에 젊은 엄마가 신생아 쓰레기통에 버린 기사 봤어?
English: Did you see the article about the young mother who threw her newborn baby in the trash can?

Korean: 아 진짜? 나 요즘 뉴스를 못 봤어 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh really? I haven't watched the news lately ㅠㅠ

Korean: 애기를 낳자마자 음식물 쓰레기 통에 버렸대!
English: As soon as the baby was born, she threw it in the food waste bin!

Korean: 헐 그게 사람인가? 악마인가 싶네 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, is that a person? I wonder if it's a devil ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그러니까 근데 그 애기를 사람들이 3일 만에 찾았대!
English: So, they said that people found that baby after 3 days!
That's a relief ㅠㅠ
Is that woman in custody?
I haven't gotten that far, but won't I be arrested?

Korean: 그런 사람은 구속 해야지 진짜 못됐네
English: That person should be arrested. He's really bad.
I know that girl is a teenager!
Huh? Really? You're young...

Korean: 응 그렇지? 그렇다고 해서 생명을 버리는 일은 하면 안 되지!
English: Yeah, right? But that doesn't mean you should throw away your life!

Korean: 촉법 소년으로 벌을 제대로 받을라나 싶어
English: I wonder if I'll be properly punished as a juvenile delinquent

Korean: 그렇겠지? 근데 대단한 건 그 신생아가 3일 동안 거기서 버텼다는 거야!
English: Sure, right? But the amazing thing is that the newborn survived there for three days!

Korean: 그러게 그 애는 꼭 좋은 곳으로 입양 갔으면 싶어 ㅠㅠ
English: I really hope that kid gets adopted to a good place ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 진짜 좋은 부모 만나서 행복하게 살았으면 좋겠다!
English: Yes, I really hope you meet good parents and live happily!
Yeah, I really hope so too~

Korean: 너 한국 사진 작가가 미국에 가서 공짜로 사진 찍어주는 거 알아?
English: Did you know that there is a Korean photographer who goes to America and takes photos for free?

Korean: 아 그거 한국 전쟁에 참여하신 분 찍어주는 거 그건가?
English: Oh, is that the one that takes pictures of people who participated in the Korean War?
Wow, you know

Korean: 나 그거 보고 완전 감동이었잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: I was so touched when I saw that ㅜㅜ

Korean: 응 맞아 요즘 인스타에서 본 것 같아~
English: Yeah, that's right. I think I saw it on Instagram recently~

Korean: 나는 유튜브에서 봤는데 그분 인스타 계정도 있어?
English: I saw it on YouTube, does he have an Instagram account?

Korean: 응 있더라고 들어가 봤는데 풍경 사진도 잘 찍으셔!
English: Yeah, I went in and saw that it was there, and the scenery photos were really nice!

Korean: 맞아 사람들이 액자 값 물어보는데 그 사진 작가가 하는 얘기 완전 소름 돋지 않아?
English: Yeah, when people ask how much a frame costs, isn't it absolutely creepy what the photographer says?

Korean: 진짜 멋있더라 배우고 싶어 나도 키키
English: It was really cool, I want to learn it too Kiki

Korean: 맞아 그런데 어떤 한 분을 찍고 그 얘기를 하는데  그분이 더 감동적인 말을 했었어
English: Yeah, but when I was talking to someone about it, he said something even more touching.
Didn't you see that video?

Korean: 그 말이 뭔데? 나도 알려줘 키키
English: What does that mean? Tell me too, Kiki

Korean: 사진 작가가 돈을 낼 필요 없다고 이미 지불했다고 했잖아?
English: Didn't you say the photographer already paid you so you don't have to pay?

Korean: 아 그 의미가 예전에 우리나라를 도와줘서 그런 거구나
English: Oh, so that means it was because you helped our country in the past.

Korean: 근데 그분이 우리가 지불한 건 원래 없었다고 자유인은 자유를 만끽할 권리가 있다고 우리도 자유를 갈망하는 나라에 똑같이 도와주라고 했어!
English: But he said that what we paid was not originally there, that free people have the right to enjoy freedom, and that we should do the same for countries that long for freedom!

Korean: 그분 정말 참된 분이시네 키키 멋지다!
English: He is truly a true person Kiki is awesome!

Korean: 그러니까 그런 분이 되도록 우리도 본받자!
English: So let's follow in his footsteps and become like that person!

Korean: 응 나도 그거 한번 보고 와야겠어
English: Yeah, I should go see that too.

Korean: 너 주근깨 없앤다고 하더니 시술 했어?
English: You said you were getting rid of your freckles. Did you get the procedure done?

Korean: 아니 아직 돈 모으는 중 ㅠㅠ 생각보다 견적이 나오네
English: No, I'm still saving up money ㅠㅠ The estimate is better than I expected
How much does that cost?
It probably costs about 1 million won.
That's a lot of money, isn't it?

Korean: 와 한 군데만 가서 견적 낸 거야?
English: Wow, you only went to one place and got a quote?

Korean: 아니 몇 군데 가봤는데 다 비슷하더라구 ㅠㅠ
English: No, I went to a few places but they were all similar ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그러면 확실하게 다 사라지게 할 수 있대?
English: Then you can definitely make them all disappear?
Um, it's like 6 sessions for 1 million won?
If you do it 6 times, it will all disappear!
Well, I'm worried because my freckles are deep ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그렇구나 그래도 예전부터 하고 싶었으니까 돈 빨리 모으자!
English: I see. But I've always wanted to do it, so let's save up money quickly!
Yeah, I've collected about half of it now.
Didn't your sister say she was getting her nose done?
Yeah I'm so nervous I could die!
When did you say you were going to get your nose done?
I'm planning to do it in the winter!

Korean: 오 그렇구나 나도 겨울에 할 거야
English: Oh right, I'll do that in the winter too

Korean: 너 그러면 요즘에 먹는 영양제 없어?
English: Then, aren't there any nutritional supplements you're taking these days?

Korean: 나 요즘 영양제 사보려고 하는데 추천 좀 키키
English: I'm thinking about buying some nutritional supplements these days. Can you give me some recommendations?

Korean: 내가 요즘에 병원 다니는데 비타민은 꼭 챙겨 먹으래!
English: I've been going to the hospital lately, and they told me to make sure to take my vitamins!
Really? What vitamins? Multivitamins?
Just a multivitamin!

Korean: 쌤이 앞 자리가 바뀌니까 몸 자체가 너무 힘들대!
English: The teacher said that because the front seat changed, his body itself was very tired!

Korean: 키키 난 아직 앞자리 바뀔라면 멀었지 헤헤
English: Kiki I still have a long way to go before I can change seats hehe

Korean: 하 나는 이제 만 나이로 따져도 중반이야 흙흙
English: Hey, I'm in my mid-teens now, even by Korean standards.

Korean: 하긴 요즘 너무 피곤해서 먹긴 할 거야...
English: Well, I'm so tired these days, I'll just eat...

Korean: 맞아 근데 확실히 먹으니까 오후에 졸린 게 줄었어!
English: Yeah, but I definitely feel less sleepy in the afternoon after eating it!
Oh, it worked, Kiki.
Where can I buy nutritional supplements?

Korean: 나는 그냥 인터넷 쇼핑으로 샀는데 요즘은 쿠팡 많이 쓰더라!
English: I used to just buy things online, but I use Coupang a lot these days!
Is the price okay?
If it's too expensive, it's a burden
The food I eat is very cheap
Should I tell you the price?

Korean: 응 나도 공유 좀 해줘 키키
English: Yeah, share it with me too, Kiki
Let me try it this time~

Korean: 아앗 나 사려면 아직 한참 멀었는데 그러면 내 꺼 나눠줄게~
English: Ah, I still have a long way to go before I can buy it, so I'll give mine away~

Korean: 응 일단 먹어보고 키키 다음에 공동구매 각
English: Yeah, I'll try it first and then buy it together

Korean: 너 이번에 가을 옷 어디서 살 거야?
English: Where are you going to buy your fall clothes this time?

Korean: 나 인터넷 쇼핑몰 생각 중이야 키키
English: I'm thinking about an internet shopping mall Kiki
Hey, which shopping mall do you use?
I mostly like Ableena Zigzag
Of course, it's the shopping mall that people in their 20s love the most. It's Kiki.

Korean: 아 언니도 거기 알구나~ 괜찮지 않아?
English: Oh, you know that too, sis~ Isn't it okay?

Korean: 맞아 많은 쇼핑몰들을 하나로 모아서 자주 애용하고 있지~
English: Yes, I often use it because it gathers many shopping malls into one place~

Korean: 오 맞아 거긴 예쁜 옷들도 싸게 팔더라 ~
English: Oh right, they sell pretty clothes cheap there too~

Korean: 맞아 근데 애들이 너무 말라깽이라 사이즈 선택이 힘들어 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah but the kids are so skinny it's hard to choose a size ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그래서 나는 꼭 상세 정보를 확인 하고 사는 편이야
English: So I always check the details before buying.

Korean: 어 나도 그거 보긴 하는데 옷들마다 사이즈가 틀려서 사기 힘들어
English: Oh, I see that too, but it's hard to buy because the sizes are different for each piece of clothing.

Korean: 그러면 상의만 사고 하의는 오프라인에서 사는 게 낫겠다~
English: Then it would be better to just buy the top and buy the bottom offline.

Korean: 그렇긴 한데 그냥 복불복으로 사는 중이야~
English: That's true, but I'm just living a hit or miss life~

Korean: 그래 싼 맛에 건지는 거지 키키 굿굿
English: Yeah, it's cheap, so Kiki is good.

Korean: 맞아 길면 긴 대로 입고 작은 것보다 낫잖아 키키
English: Yeah, if it's long, it's better to wear it long than short. Kiki

Korean: 말 나온 김에 나도 한번 쇼핑 해야지~
English: Now that we're on the subject, I should go shopping too~
Are you watching You Quiz these days?

Korean: 그거 유재석 나오는 건데 자주 못 봐 ㅠㅠ
English: That's Yoo Jae-suk's thing, but I don't get to see it often ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 유튜브로 보는데 이번에 유재석이 앵커로 나왔대!
English: I'm watching it on YouTube too, and I heard Yoo Jae-suk appeared as an anchor this time!
Oh, are you interviewing Yoo Jae-suk?

Korean: 아니 유재석이 MBC 앵커로 생방송 진행을 했대!
English: No, Yoo Jae-seok hosted a live broadcast as an MBC anchor!
Wow, really? Kiki is amazing
Did Yoo Jae-suk get along well with the announcer?

Korean: 아니 그거 기사만 보고 좀 있다가 동영상으로 보려고!
English: No, I just read the article and then I'll watch the video later!
Wow, I should see it too~
I'm a huge fan of Yoo Jae-seok ㅠㅠ
Is there really anyone who hates Yoo Jae-suk?
Yeah, that's right too, Kiki
The nation's favorite MC~

Korean: 맞아 근데 나이가 벌써 50이 넘었어 실화냐!
English: That's right, but is it true that I'm already over 50 years old?

Korean: 아 진짜? 역시 연예인은 다른가 봐
English: Oh really? I guess celebrities are different.
My dad is like my grandfather Kiki

Korean: 그거 알아? 유재석느님이랑 나랑 띠띠동갑이야 키키
English: Do you know that? God Yoo Jae-seok and I are the same age. Kiki

Korean: 와우, 근데 되게 동안이네 40대 중반인 줄,
English: Wow, but you look so young, I thought you were in your mid-40s.
Right? You're the ultimate self-management expert!
Wow, that's cool.
I've been wanting to see you for a long time, Yoo Jae Suk!
What movie did you see last?
I saw Mogadishu at the drive-in theater~
Oh, where did the drive-in theater go?
It was nice that it was at the Sejong Intercity Bus Terminal.
Is Sejong a new place?

Korean: 거기 있잖아 공주 대전 사이에 세종특별시~
English: There it is, Sejong Special City between the princess and the war~
Oh, there's a new drive-in theater
I know that much, right?

Korean: 아 난 또~ 거기 생긴 지 오래지 키키
English: Ah, I've been there for a long time, Kiki

Korean: 그렇구나 나도 자동차 극장 자주 다니는데 세종은 안 가봤어!
English: Oh, I also go to drive-in theaters often, but I've never been to Sejong!
Where have you been?
Recommend me Kiki

Korean: 나는 평택 용산 대전 천안 네 군데 갔는데 그 중에서 대전 추천!
English: I've been to Pyeongtaek, Yongsan, Daejeon, and Cheonan, and among them, I recommend Daejeon!
Wow, Daejeon isn't that far away?

Korean: 나 말고 내 남친이 멀었지 뭐~
English: My boyfriend is far away, except for me~

Korean: 아~ 키키 대전 가서 뭐 봤는데?
English: Ah~ What did you see at Kiki's War?
I think I saw that speech!
Malmoido is also fun Kiki
I like that too
Sisters~ What did you eat for lunch today?

Korean: 나는 오늘 순두부랑 비빔밥 먹었졍 하하!
English: I ate soft tofu and bibimbap today haha!

Korean: 키키 나는 뼈 해장국! 거기 테라스 열려 있어서 날씨도 좋고 맛있었당 너는?
English: Kiki I had bone soup! The terrace was open there so the weather was nice and it was delicious. How about you?

Korean: 나는 편의점 잔치국수 먹었다 맛있는데 배고프더라 ㅜㅜ
English: I ate convenience store noodles. They were delicious, but I was hungry. ㅜㅜ

Korean: ㅠㅠ 거기 비빔밥 양도 많고 푸짐했어
English: ㅠㅠ The bibimbap there was a lot and it was plentiful
Next time, you come with me!

Korean: 키키 맞아 진짜 내 거랑 1000원 차이였는데 양이 짱 많았어 나중에 나도 먹어볼라공
English: Kiki, that's right, it was 1000 won different from mine, but the quantity was huge, I'll try it later too

Korean: 나도 먹어보고 싶어~ 순두부 찌개 나도 좋아하는데!
English: I want to try it too~ I like soft tofu stew too!

Korean: 아 근데 그거 먹고 배탈나긴 했어 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh but I got a stomachache after eating that ㅠㅠ

Korean: 이제 나 빨간 음식 먹으면 안 되나 봐 ㅠ
English: I guess I shouldn't eat red food anymore ㅠ

Korean: 헐 진짜? 아까 겁나 맛있게 먹더니 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh really? You were eating so deliciously earlier ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 언니가 라면 스프맛 난다고 하긴 했어 자극적이었나
English: But my sister said it tasted like ramen soup. Was it spicy?
I guess it was provocative ㅜㅜ

Korean: 근데 언니 아침부터 배 아프다고 했어서 상태 별로라서 더 그랬나 봐...
English: But my sister said her stomach hurt since this morning, so I guess it was because she wasn't feeling well...

Korean: 구니까 ㅠㅠ 너도 조심하면서 먹어 나중에 배 자주 아팠잖아
English: Because I'm a punk ㅠㅠ You should eat carefully too, because you'll often have stomach aches later on

Korean: 그니까 오늘 배고파서 좀따 저녁에 햄버거 먹는 거 아니야?
English: So you're hungry today, so you're going to eat a hamburger for dinner?
Kiki Woong, that's right ㅜㅜ

Korean: 진짜 이따 배고파서 햄버거 먹는 거 아냐? 안 되는데
English: Are you really going to eat a hamburger because you're hungry? You can't.

Korean: 그래도 빵은 먹어도 된다고 하지 않았어?
English: But didn't you say it was okay to eat bread?

Korean: 햄버거 말고 좀 부드러운 걸로 먹장! 하하
English: I'd rather eat something soft than a hamburger! Haha
No, let's just eat dead!
I have to go get an endoscopy ㅠㅠ

Korean: 죽은 제발 그만 먹고 싶어... 죽 그만!
English: I really want to stop eating dead... Stop eating dead!
Kiki, I can really feel your sincerity

Korean: 근데 나도 뭔가 죽 먹어야 할 것 같아
English: But I think I need to eat something too

Korean: 언니도 오늘 화장실 계속 가게 생겼네 ㅠㅠ
English: My sister also had to keep going to the bathroom today ㅠㅠ

Korean: 진짜 둘 다 왜 맨날 아파
English: Seriously, why are you both always sick?
I'm jealous of your healthy ** sister~

Korean: 우리 중에서 젤 건강해 진짜 키키
English: The healthiest of us all, really Kiki

Korean: 배 아프가 괜히 맛있는 거 먹고 싶어!
English: My stomach hurts, but I want to eat something delicious!

Korean: 시험 때까지는 매운 것도 먹지 말구 커피도 마시지 말자!
English: Until the exam, don't eat spicy food or drink coffee!
Be healthy like me!

Korean: 맞아 시험 전까지 먹는 거 조심하자~
English: That's right, be careful what you eat before the test~

Korean: 웅웅 그래야지 요즘 커피도 열심히 안 먹는 중!
English: Yeah, that's right. I don't even drink coffee much these days!
After exams, let's go eat chicken feet!
Does anyone have any interior design ideas they'd like to try?

Korean: 난 원래 넓어 보이는 화이트 선호하는데 요즘엔 좀 포근한 느낌이 좋은 것 같아 하하
English: I originally preferred white to make it look spacious, but these days I like a warmer feel haha

Korean: 키키 나는 원래 우드 계열이었는데 이사 오면서 화이트로 바꿨어!
English: Kiki I originally had a wood family, but I changed it to white when I moved!

Korean: 나도 지금은 화이튼데 꾸미게 된다면 원목이랑 라탄 느낌으로 꾸미고 싶어!
English: I'm also white now, but if I were to decorate it, I'd like to decorate it with a wood and rattan feel!
Oh, I know what you mean Kiki

Korean: 난 좀 빈티지 느낌으로 꾸미고 싶어! 안락한 너저분함... 키키키
English: I want to decorate with a bit of a vintage feel! Cozy messy... Kikki
You know what it is ^^?

Korean: 키키 웅웅 둘 다 비슷한 느낌으로 꾸미고 싶네
English: Kiki Woong Woong I want to decorate them both with a similar feel
It must be pretty
Kiki, you know what comfortable messiness is?
If you dress up like that later, invite me~
I don't know when that will be... haha!
Have you guys ever used blackout curtains?

Korean: 웅웅 암막 커튼 진짜 커 언니
English: Wow, the blackout curtains are really big, sis

Korean: 지금 집에 없으면 무조건 사 추천!
English: If you don't have it at home right now, I definitely recommend buying it!

Korean: 웅 근데 난 완전 암막은 아닌 거 같아
English: Yeah but I don't think it's completely dark

Korean: 아침 되면 조금은 밝아지더라 완전 깜깜한 정도는 아냐!
English: It gets a little brighter in the morning, but it's not completely dark!

Korean: 그거 색깔이 약간 밝은 거 아니야?
English: Isn't that a bit bright in color?

Korean: 난 전에 진짜 검정색으로 달았었는데 아예 차단이야 키키
English: I used to wear it in real black, but it's completely blocked Kiki

Korean: 지금은 커튼 없이 살고 있는데 달지 말지 고민 중이얌!
English: I'm currently living without curtains and I'm debating whether or not to put them up!

Korean: 암막 없으니까 일찍 깨징 가뜩이나 잠도 별로 못 잔다며
English: Since there is no blind, I wake up early and I can't sleep much anyway.

Korean: 필수야 요새 암막 커튼 이쁜 것도 짱 많앙 무조건 추천
English: It's a must-have. There are so many pretty blackout curtains these days. I definitely recommend them.

Korean: 아아 웅 나는 검정색은 아니라서 그런가 봐 ㅜㅜ
English: Ah, I guess it's because I'm not black ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아하 근데 암막 하니까 진짜 끝도 모르고 자게 되던데? 키키
English: Aha, but if you block out the light, you'll end up sleeping without even realizing it? Kiki

Korean: 키키 계속 닫아 놓고 있으면 그렇지
English: If you keep Kiki closed, it won't be like that

Korean: 키키 아침에 못 일어나서 지각하는 거 아니야?
English: Kiki, aren't you going to be late because you can't wake up in the morning?

Korean: 근데 잘 때는 닫아 놓게 되잖아... 키키
English: But when you sleep, you close it... Kiki
I guess I'll just have to live without it...

Korean: 키키 하긴 근데 진짜 암막하면 몇 시인지도 모르고 잘 수도 있긴 해
English: Kiki Well, if you really block out the light, you can sleep without even knowing what time it is.

Korean: 키키 그럼 나처럼 적당한 암막 느낌 고고
English: Kiki then let's go to a place with a moderate amount of darkness like me
Okay, I'll think about it!
There are a lot of pretty curtains these days.
There are a lot of pretty things right now

Korean: 내 방 커튼은 금색이야 키키 그거랑 흰색 반투명? 그거랑
English: My room curtains are gold Kiki and white translucent?

Korean: 오 내 방도 금색이랑 흰색의 조합이야 키키
English: Oh my room is also a combination of gold and white Kiki

Korean: 아니 금색 실화야? 나중에 사진 보여줘 키키 궁금하네
English: No, is this a real gold story? Show me the picture later Kiki, I'm curious

Korean: 키키 좀 따 밥 먹을 때 보여줄게!
English: Kiki, I'll show you when we eat!

Korean: 비 오니까 지하철에 사람 더 많더라~
English: Because it rained, there were more people on the subway~

Korean: 맞아 비 오면 진짜 사람 많아져 ㅠㅠ
English: That's right, when it rains there really are a lot of people ㅠㅠ
Aren't you guys taking the bus?

Korean: 웅웅 나는 버스가 한 번에 와서 좋긴 한데 강남 출퇴근 버스는 절대 불가야 흑흑
English: Yeah, I'm glad the bus comes all at once, but the Gangnam commuter bus is absolutely impossible. Sob sob
Do you all like buses or subways?

Korean: 난 버스! 지하철은 냄새나서 싫어 ㅠㅠ
English: I hate buses! I hate subways because they smell ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나는 버스! 바깥에 풍경 볼 수 있어서 좋앙
English: I'm on a bus! I like being able to see the scenery outside.
I think the subway is better

Korean: 버스는 너무 흔들려서 서 있기 힘들어~
English: The bus was shaking so much that it was hard to stand~
That's right ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그래도 버스가 앉을 수 있는 확률도 높고 전용 도로로 다니니까 좀 더 빠른 느낌? 하하
English: But the bus has a higher chance of finding a seat and it runs on a dedicated road, so it feels a bit faster, haha.

Korean: 그래도 빠른 건 확실히 지하철이긴 해 시간이 정확하잖아
English: But the subway is definitely faster and the timing is accurate.

Korean: 버스는 어디 놀러 갈 때 좋아!
English: The bus is great for going out and having fun!

Korean: 맞아 지하철은 시간 딱 맞춰 가서 약속 시간 맞추기에는 좋아!
English: That's right, the subway is perfect for getting to appointments on time!

Korean: 버스는 여유로울 때 좋은 거 같아
English: I think the bus is good when you have free time

Korean: 오 사실 버스는 짧게만 타본 것 같아 하하
English: Oh actually I think I only rode the bus for a short time haha
Kiki stupid stupid nana

Korean: 근데  너 버스 좌석 버스 타고 다녀?
English: But do you ride the bus with a bus seat?

Korean: 응 출근할 때는 너무 밀려서 못 타고 집 갈 때는 밀려서 늦게 도착해도 상관 없으니까 그냥 타고 다녀!
English: Yeah, I can't ride it on the way to work because it's too crowded, and I don't mind arriving late on the way home because it's crowded, so I just ride it!
Oh, but aren't seat buses expensive?

Korean: 근데 집 갈 때 지하철 못 앉아서 가?
English: But can't you sit on the subway when you go home?

Korean: 웅 좌석 버스 너무 비싸 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, the seat bus is so expensive ㅜㅜ

Korean: 웅 지하철 잠실까지만 타서 잠깐 타긴 하는데 거의 못 앉아가지~
English: Yeah, I ride the subway to Jamsil for a bit, but I can hardly sit down~

Korean: 우리도 키키 **이랑 사당까지 맨날 같이 가는데 언제 타든 사람 많아
English: We also go to Sadang with Kiki ** every day, and there are always lots of people no matter when we ride.

Korean: 그니까 우리 처음에 늦게 갔을 때 사람 없을 거라고 기대하고 갔는데 똑같더라구 ^^
English: So when we first went there late, we expected there wouldn't be anyone there, but it was the same ^^

Korean: 그래도 9시 규제 이전에는 사람 훨씬 없다고 좋아하지 않았어?
English: But don't you like that there aren't a lot of people before the 9 o'clock curfew?

Korean: 어어 맞아 8시 30쯤 가면 사람 별로 없었는데 휴가 기간 끝나고부터 계속 많아 ㅠㅠ!
English: Oh yeah, that's right. If you go around 8:30, there won't be many people, but since the holiday period is over, there have been a lot of people ㅠㅠ!
Yes, it was a hit or miss
