English: You don't want me to come during Chuseok because of Corona? Really?

Korean: 우리는 주말 점심 때 항상 하는 편 키키
English: We always do this for lunch on weekends
It's a shame I can't do it these days because of Corona...

Korean: 웅웅 코로나 때문에... 버스 타지 말래!
English: Yeah, because of Corona... Don't ride the bus!

Korean: 근데 우리 집도 외식하는 것보다 집에서 먹는 거 더 좋아해 키키
English: But in my house, we like eating at home more than eating out, Kiki
It seems like you tend to bring it home to eat?

Korean: 키키 울 집은 엄마 아빠 다 바뿌니까 주말에는 쇼파에서 꼼짝도 안 해 붙박이야 붙박이
English: Kiki, my mom and dad are both busy at home, so I don't move from the sofa on the weekends. I'm stuck.
Kiki, you both work on weekdays, right?
Kiki, that's my story...

Korean: 나도 붙박이야 집에서 나가기 너무 싫어
English: I'm stuck too. I hate leaving the house.

Korean: 키키 웅웅 글고 우리 집은 다 가까이 살아서 애초에 이모들이 걍 울 집에 놀러와 서 놀아 키키
English: Kiki, ugh, and my house is close to my house, so my aunts used to just come over to my house and play.

Korean: 키키 신기하다 나도 침대 붙박이 젤 좋아...
English: Kiki, that's amazing. I like the bed fixed the best too...
It's also fun to eat together every week!

Korean: 진주에서는 약속 있다고 나가기 바빴던 듯 주말에는
English: In Jinju, it seems like they were busy going out because they had plans on the weekend.

Korean: 키키 맞아 나도 글고 주말에 놀러 많이 나가긴 하니까 오히려 너네를 더 많이 보는 듯 진짜
English: Kiki, that's right. I also go out a lot on weekends, so I think I see you guys more.

Korean: 근데 우리도 약속 있으면 한 명씩 빠지긴 해 키키
English: But when we have plans, one of us has to drop out. Kiki

Korean: 맞아 요즘 제일 많이 보는 사람 언니들이야
English: That's right, the people I see the most these days are my sisters

Korean: 진짴 키키 같이 사는 우리 언니보다 자주 본다!
English: I see Jinjjang Kiki more often than my older sister who lives with me!

Korean: 키키 진심 밥 같이 먹는 횟수도 제일 많다고
English: Kiki, you really are the one who eats with me the most

Korean: 키키 그니까 맞아 밥 언니들이랑 젤 많이 먹어
English: Kiki That's right, I eat the most with my sisters
Still, I'm glad you guys are here ^^ Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 여기서 얻은 거 너네!
English: Kiki, that's what you got here!
Does everyone have an ideal type? What is your ideal type?

Korean: 난 이제는 외적인 거는 잘 안 보는 듯?!
English: I guess I don't really care about external things anymore?!

Korean: 좀 열심히 사는 사람이었으면 좋겠어 키키 게으른 사람 싫어
English: I wish I was someone who worked a little harder Kiki I hate lazy people

Korean: 키키 맞아 성격 잘 맞아야 해
English: Kiki, right, your personalities have to match well

Korean: 나는 외적으로 따지면 옷핏 잘 받는 사람!
English: Externally, I am a person who likes clothes to fit well!

Korean: 나는 개그 코드 잘 맞고 완전 남자다운 사람!
English: I'm a very manly person with a good sense of humor!
I like good physique haha

Korean: 근데 외향 안 본대도 솔직히 아예 안 봐지지는 않는 것 같아 키키
English: But even if you don't look at the outside, honestly, I don't think you can completely ignore it Kiki

Korean: 나도 외적인 거 따지면 좀 남자다운 게 좋아!
English: I also like things that are a bit more manly when it comes to appearances!

Korean: 키키 그래도 외적 떠나서 성격 안 맞으면 빠이야
English: Kiki But even if you leave out the external factors, if your personality doesn't match, then bye

Korean: 진짜 착한 남자가 최고야 착한 남자 만나자
English: A truly good man is the best. Let's meet a good man.

Korean: 맞아 착한데 재밌는 사람 없나 키키
English: Yeah, he's nice, but isn't there anyone fun to be had? Kiki
Your ideal type is just your ideal type Kiki

Korean: 외적 이상형 만나면 또 성격 안 맞고 어렵네 ^^
English: If you meet your ideal type, your personality won't match and it's difficult ^^

Korean: 키키 왜 지금 남친한테 만족하자! 그냥 받아들여
English: Kiki, why are you satisfied with your boyfriend now? Just accept it.
Kiki, of course you're satisfied with your boyfriend now~

Korean: 아니 난 만족스럽지 않다고 한적 없어!
English: No, I never said I was dissatisfied!
I like it now Kiki

Korean: 둘 다 사귄 지 얼마나 됐어?
English: How long have you two been dating?
That's right, that's right, I'm 493 today!

Korean: 기억 안 나서 보고 왔어 키키 난 489일!
English: I came to see you because I couldn't remember Kiki, I'm 489 days old!

Korean: 키키 오 둘 다 근데 더 오래된 것 같은 느낌이야 뭔가
English: Kiki Oh both but it feels like it's older
Kiki I saw it too Kiki
It's hard to remember at this point

Korean: 맞아 나도 더 오래된 거 같은데 생각보다 아니야
English: Yeah, I think I'm older too, but not as much as I thought

Korean: 난 그냥 안 만나니까 그런 느낌이 없어... 키키
English: I don't feel that way because I just don't meet her... Kiki

Korean: 언니는 그러면 사귄지 얼마 안 되고 한국 온 거야?
English: Sister, you came to Korea not long after you started dating?

Korean: 두 달 사겼다 하지 않았어? 아닌가 키키
English: Didn't you say you dated for two months? Isn't that right Kiki?

Korean: 두 달?은 아니야 키키 한 반 년 정도?
English: Two months? No, Kiki. About half a year?
**How long has it been!
Kiki, it's been 400 days since I applied for the exam!

Korean: 언니 겨울에 다같이 호주로 떠나자 우리 델꼬가 헤헤
English: Sister, let's all go to Australia together in the winter, our Delko hehe
Oh, it hasn't been two months Kiki

Korean: 맞다 언니 그때 400일이었지 호주로 가자 가자!
English: That's right, sis, it was 400 days back then. Let's go to Australia, let's go!
Kiki, I like you! Let's go when the border is released!

Korean: 찐풍경 사진으로 말고 이제 눈으로 담으러 간다!
English: Instead of just taking pictures of the scenery, let's go take it in with our eyes!
Do you know Kang Hyung-wook?

Korean: 강형욱 나오는 프로 여러 개 봐봤는데 정말 강아지들 행동 교정 되는 거 보면 신기하더라!
English: I've watched several programs featuring Kang Hyung-wook, and it's really amazing to see how the dogs' behavior is corrected!
I know Kang Hyung-wook!

Korean: 그 사람 진짜 강아지인 것 같아 키키
English: I think that guy is a real puppy Kiki
How do you know so well?

Korean: 맞아 개들도 교육이 필요할 때가 있어
English: Yes, dogs need training sometimes too.

Korean: 어떤 짱 큰 강아지 주인 막 엄청 무는 거 교정하는 거 봤어
English: I saw a really big dog owner correct a really big biting dog.

Korean: 키키 그 사람 강아지래 짱 웃겨 키키
English: Kiki that guy is a dog so funny Kiki

Korean: 맞아 나도 그거 프로 재밌어서 가끔 보는데 개들 그러는 거 다 주인 잘못이더라 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, I also find that pro funny and watch it sometimes, but when dogs do that, it's always the owner's fault ㅜㅜ
We need to educate them well

Korean: 웅웅 근데 주인들도 다 알 수가 없으니까 진짜 어려운 듯 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, but it seems really difficult because even the owners can't know everything ㅠㅠ

Korean: 저번에 어떤 프로에서 강아지가 너무 잠을 안 잔다고 불면증 그런 건 줄 알고 엄청 돈 많이 들여서 병원 다니고 했는데 강아지가 자기가 안 자면 주인이 와서 놀아주니까 잠 못 자는 척 연기하는 거 봤어 키키
English: Last time, I saw a program where a dog didn't sleep well, so they thought it was insomnia and spent a lot of money to take it to the hospital, but when the dog didn't sleep, the owner came and played with it, so they pretended not to be able to sleep. Kiki

Korean: 키키 헐 진짜? 놀아달라구? 너무 귀엽다 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki, really? You want me to play with you? You're so cute ㅠㅠ
Kiki is so cute
I told you that puppies are really smart

Korean: 그니까 강형욱 나오는 프로그램 중에 기억나는 에피소드 있어? 키키
English: So, is there an episode you remember from the program that Kang Hyung-wook appears in? Kiki

Korean: 나는 강형욱 거 잘 안 봐서 몰라
English: I don't know because I don't watch Kang Hyung-wook's stuff much

Korean: 저 위의 얘기 말고는 본 적이 없는 듯?
English: I guess you've never seen anything like the story above?

Korean: 난 많이 봤는데 기억나는 게 없네
English: I've seen a lot, but I don't remember anything.

Korean: 무는 강아지 사연만 많이 본 듯!
English: It seems like I've only seen stories about dogs that bark!

Korean: 키키 근데 파충류 기르는 건 어떻게 생각해?
English: Kiki, what do you think about raising reptiles?

Korean: 키키 나는 파충류 내 스타일 아니야
English: Kiki I'm a reptile not my style

Korean: 나에게는 너무 먼 존재 언니 키우고 싶은 거 있어?
English: My older sister is so far away from me, do you want to raise her?

Korean: 나도 파충류 싫어... 대부분 좀 징그럽잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: I hate reptiles too... most of them are kind of gross ㅜㅜ
I can't raise Kiki either because she's annoying

Korean: 근데 파충류 좋아하는 사람들 은근 많더라고
English: But there are actually quite a few people who like reptiles.

Korean: 맞아 옛날에 어릴 때 아쿠아리움 가면 무조건 뱀 목에 걸잖아 으으 지금도 싫다
English: Yeah, when I was little, whenever I went to the aquarium, they always put a snake around my neck. Ugh, I still hate it.

Korean: 키키 언니한텐 말 했는데 나 태국 갔을 때 뱀 목에 걸었어!
English: I told Kiki, when I went to Thailand, I had a snake around my neck!
Kiki, I'm also in Japan...
But if you go to the aquarium, are there snakes too?
Was it a Molang zoo?

Korean: 꼭 그 동굴 같은 데서 한 명씩 거는 거 국룰이잖아 키키
English: It's a national rule that each person must hang out in a cave or something like that. Kiki

Korean: 키키 동물원 맞을 걸 아쿠아리움 뜻 모른대요~ 키키
English: Kiki zoo is right, I don't know what aquarium means~ Kiki
No, Kiki, I will never miss it!
**Oh, I was just genuinely curious ^^
Kiki-chan is funny no
But you're all used to it now, right?
Kiki is right, it's just funny and entertaining

Korean: 근데 놀리는 건 못 참지~ 키키
English: But I can't stand teasing~ Kiki

Korean: 너무 키키 이제 척하면 척이지 진짜!
English: Too much Kiki Now if you pretend, it's pretend, really!

Korean: 키키 같이 뱀 보러 가자! 뱀뱀 뱀
English: Kiki, let's go see snakes together! Bam Bam Bam
Anyone who has ever been there~
I don't have any ㅠㅠ
Have you been there all?
In summer it's a paradise, in winter it's a ski resort!

Korean: 언니 놀이기구 이런 거 잘 못 타?
English: Sister, aren't you good at riding these rides?

Korean: 언니 근데 궁금한 게 지방에는 그런 거 하는 데 없어?
English: Sister, but I'm curious. Are there any places in the provinces that do something like that?

Korean: 지방에 빠지 모르겠다? 나중에 찾아보자 하하
English: Don't know if you're in the province? Let's look it up later haha
I'm really good at rides!

Korean: 지방에는 빠지 말고 수영장?이 많았던 것 같아 오션월드 이런 거
English: Don't forget to go to the local area. There were a lot of swimming pools, like Ocean World.

Korean: 오호 ** 언니는 그런 거 잘 타? 놀이기구든 수상레저든 그런 거
English: Oh, ** Sister, are you good at that kind of thing? Like amusement rides or water sports?
Yeah, there are a lot of those!
**How do you not know this well haha

Korean: 어디 갈까 하고 알아볼 때 그랬던 것 같아서 키키
English: I think it was like that when I was looking into where to go, Kiki

Korean: 나 짱 잘 탄다고 말하고 싶지만 최근에 기구 타다 날라가서 그냥 탈 수 있다고 말할게 ^^
English: I want to say I'm really good at riding, but I recently got blown away on a hot air balloon ride, so I'll just say I can ride it ^^

Korean: 키키 나도 안 날아가려고 손에 힘 꽉 주고 탔었어...
English: Kiki, I also rode with my hands tightly clenched so that I wouldn't fly away...

Korean: 안 되겠다 담에 우리 같이 빠지 가자 언니 경험 시켜줘야지 ^^
English: It won't work. Let's go together next time. I have to let you experience it ^^

Korean: 앗 키키 근데 나 그런 거 잘 버텨
English: Oh Kiki but I can handle that well
Kiki, you have to choose the place well

Korean: 재밌는 데 가면 오래 태워주고 막 우리 날려버려 키키
English: If you go somewhere fun, give us a long ride and then just blow us away, Kiki

Korean: 키키 좋아 가기 전에 열심히 찾아봐야지~
English: I like Kiki so I have to search hard before I go~

Korean: 말하니까 오랜만에 진짜 가고 싶다 ㅜㅜ
English: Now that I mention it, I really want to go after a long time ㅜㅜ
Did you all go to Gapyeong?

Korean: 웅웅 나는 다 가평! 근데 한강에도 있다던데?
English: Yeah, I'm all Gapyeong! But I heard there's one in the Han River too?

Korean: 나도 가평! 다른 데는 어딨는지 못 들어봤는데 한강에도 있대?
English: Me too, Gapyeong! I haven't heard of any other places, but I heard there's one in the Han River too?

Korean: 오 진짜? 처음 듣는다 나도! **이 알아오도록 키키
English: Oh really? I'm hearing this for the first time too! **Kiki, let me know
I'll go later

Korean: 웅웅 있는데 거기 별로라고 했었엉 친구들이
English: Yeah, but my friends said it wasn't that great
Let's go to Gapyeong

Korean: 오호 근데 원래 유명한 데로 가야 돼
English: Oh, but you have to go to a famous place
The original is the best, let's go to Gapyeong
Gapyeong is the original? Okay haha that sounds fun
I have to go to the amusement park later.

Korean: 키키 우리 할 거 짱 많네 차고 넘쳐 스케줄 빽빽
English: Kiki, we have so much to do, our schedule is jam-packed with cars

Korean: 키키 맞아 우리 다 해야 돼
English: Kiki, that's right, we all have to do it
I can't do it because of corona ㅜㅜ

Korean: 키키 나중에 뭐하고 놀지 고민할 일 없겠다
English: Kiki, you won't have to worry about what to do later.

Korean: 키키 벌써부터 너무 설레 가자 가자
English: Kiki, I'm already so excited, let's go, let's go
Have you ever played online games when you were young?

Korean: 나 테일즈런너 되게 좋아했는데 해 본 사람 있어?
English: I really liked Tales Runner, has anyone tried it?

Korean: 테일즈런너 들어봤는데 무슨 게임이더라? 그건 안 해봤오
English: I've heard of Tales Runner, but what game is it? I haven't played it.

Korean: 키키 헐 테런 왜 몰라 짱잼이었는데 키키
English: Kiki Hul Terran why don't you know it was so fun Kiki

Korean: 너 그거 알아? 그 블록 어려운 거 못 깨면 강종 겁나한 맵
English: You know what? If you can't break that hard block, you'll be in a terrible map.

Korean: 키키 테런 모른대요~ 세대 차이 난다!
English: Kiki Terran doesn't know~ There's a generation gap!
It's a game where you run as a character~

Korean: 맞아 그거 블록 어려운 거 알 거 같애 키키
English: Yeah I think that block is hard Kiki
Kiki, this is so ridiculous, really Kiki

Korean: 빨리 내가 아는 게임 얘기 해봐
English: Tell me a game you know quickly.

Korean: 키키 엘렐레 엘렐레~ 언니 그러면 무슨 게임했어 어릴 때?
English: Kiki ellele ellele~ Unnie, what games did you play when you were young?

Korean: 키키 언니 모르니까 계속 모르는 게임 얘기만 하자~
English: Since you don't know Kiki, let's just keep talking about games you don't know~

Korean: 너네 진짜 초딩이네 초딩이야~ 못 놀아주겠다 아주! 키키
English: You guys are really elementary school kids, elementary school kids~ I can't play with you, really! Kiki

Korean: 아니 달리는 게임 나 알투비투 했었는데... 혹시 이것도 세대 차이냐...
English: No, I played the running game R2V2... Is this also a generation gap...

Korean: 키키 알투비투는 들어만 봤지 해본 적은 없어 오투잼은 했다!
English: I've only heard of Kiki R2B2 but never actually done it. I did O2Jam!

Korean: 다 들어는 봤는데 안 해봤어 솔직히
English: I've heard of it all, but honestly I've never done it
Have you tried all the crazy arcades? Haha
Of course, of course, unconditionally~

Korean: 그건 대학교 가서도 좀 했었어 키키
English: I did that a bit even after I went to college, Kiki
Kiki, have you all played Maple Story?
I did it when I was in college too Kiki
It's still fun to do that with friends

Korean: 메이플 스토리는 유명해서 해봤는데 재미없어서 안 했어 키키
English: Maple Story is famous so I tried it but it wasn't fun so I didn't try it Kiki
I liked maple story

Korean: 근데 한동안 안 할 때 해킹 당해서 내 아이템 다 훔쳐갔더라 ^^... 열받네 다시 생각하니까
English: But when I wasn't playing for a while, I got hacked and all my items were stolen ^^... I'm getting mad when I think about it again.

Korean: 헐 진짜로? 알고 보니 친오빠가 한 거 아니야
English: Oh really? Turns out it wasn't my older brother who did it.
It's so funny how you got caught

Korean: 키키 그니까 진짜 어떻게 해킹 당해?

Korean: 진짜 저번이랑 다른 게 없이 똑같을 듯
English: It really seems to be the same as last time

Korean: 맞아 가스라이팅... 맞아도 계속 사귀는 거 이해 불가야 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, it's gaslighting... I don't understand why you keep dating even after getting hit ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 나도 그 동영상 봤던 거 같아
English: Yeah, I think I saw that video too

Korean: 데이트 폭력 요즘에 되게 빈번한데 제대로 법을 세워야 돼
English: Dating violence is very common these days, so we need to establish proper laws.

Korean: ㅠㅠ 맞아 이런 문제들 생길 때면 젠더 갈등도 엄청 생기잖아...
English: ㅠㅠ That's right, when these kinds of problems arise, gender conflict also arises a lot...

Korean: 사회적으로 이슈 되고 해도 계속 똑같은 문제들 생기는 거 보면 진짜 솜방망이 처벌 너무 많아서 그래
English: Even though it has become a social issue, the same problems keep occurring, and it's because there are too many slapped-on punishments.
But if he's your boyfriend, you love him...

Korean: 진짜 슬픈 현실이다 어케 남친한테 맞아 죽어 미친 듯
English: It's a really sad reality. How can you be beaten to death by your boyfriend and go crazy?
Yes, they should be punished properly.
They don't even punish me properly ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그니까 내가 사랑하는 사람한테 죽는 다는 게 얼마나 비참할까...
English: So how miserable would it be for someone I love to die...

Korean: 사귀는 동안에는 또 잘해줬던 적이 많으니까 몰랐을 것 같기도 해...
English: I think you might not have noticed because I treated you so well while we were dating...

Korean: 내 남자친구가 저런 사람일지 어떻게 미리 알겠어... ㅠㅠ
English: How could I know in advance that my boyfriend would be that kind of person... ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그것도 맞지만 그래도 징조가 분명 보였을 거야 상 진짜 ㅠㅠ
English: That's true, but I'm sure there were clear signs, seriously ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 보통 처음에는 툭 한 대 때리다가 점점 심해지더라 벗어나야 돼
English: Yeah, usually it starts with a quick hit, but it gets worse and worse. You have to get out of it.

Korean: 남자가 전여친 가족 다 살해한 것도 있었잖아
English: There was also a case where a man killed his ex-girlfriend's entire family.

Korean: 그런 거 보고 엄마 아빠가 남자 잘 만나라고 걱정하셨어 ㅜㅜ
English: Seeing that, my mom and dad were worried and told me to find a good man ㅜㅜ
There are so many crazy people...

Korean: 저런 거 보면 아무도 못 만나 진짜 ㅠㅠ
English: If I see something like that, I really can't meet anyone ㅠㅠ
I have to watch the video. It's scary but I'm curious.

Korean: 일본 모더나 백신에서 이물질 나왔다는 거 봤어?
English: Did you see that foreign substances were found in the Japanese Moderna vaccine?

Korean: 헐헐 아니 그건 못 봤어 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my god, I didn't see that ㅠㅠ

Korean: 백신에 무슨 검은 물질? 나왔다는데 아직 확인 중인 것 같던데?
English: What's that black stuff in the vaccine? I heard it came out, but it looks like they're still checking?

Korean: 근데 다행히 우리나라랑은 상관 없다는 거 같던데?
English: But fortunately, it seems like it has nothing to do with our country?
Huh, how does it matter?
Still, that's a good thing...

Korean: 일본도 우리나라처럼 백신 교차 접종 한다고 하던데!
English: They say that Japan is also doing cross-vaccination like our country!

Korean: 1차 아스트라 맞고 2차로 모더나나 화이자로 불안하겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm worried that I'll get the first AstraZeneca vaccine and then the second one will be Moderna or Pfizer ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그니까 심지어 랜덤이라 그거 모르고 맞을 수도 있는 거잖아 ㅠㅠ 불안해
English: So even if it's random, you might not know it and get it right ㅠㅠ I'm anxious
Which country made that?

Korean: 암튼 기억 안 나는데 거기서만 이물질이 나왔는데 우리나라 들어온 건 미국에서 만든 거라 상관 없을 거라던데!
English: Anyway, I don't remember, but they said that the foreign substance was found only there, but the ones that came into our country were made in the US, so it shouldn't be a problem!

Korean: 흠 그래? ㅠㅠ 우리도 이제 곧 백신 맞는데 저런 뉴스 하나만 나와도 좀 무섭긴 하더라
English: Hmm really? ㅠㅠ We're about to get the vaccine too, but even just one news like that makes me a little scared
When are you all getting vaccinated?
I'm coming in September!

Korean: 여러분 화이자 맞고 백혈병 걸린 얘기 봤어...? 그거 때문에 무서워 나는
English: Did you guys see the story about someone getting leukemia after getting Pfizer? That's what scared me.

Korean: 나도 9월! 추석 전 주말에 맞는다 ㅠㅠ
English: Me too, September! It's the weekend before Chuseok ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아니 근데 백혈병 넘 무서운데? 그것도 우리나라야...?
English: But isn't leukemia really scary? And in our country too...?

Korean: 헐 어케 그래 무슨 변수가 많긴 하네 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow, how is that? There are so many variables ㅠㅠ

Korean: 20대 여자는 심근염 부작용 많이 생긴다고 하던데
English: They say that women in their 20s often experience side effects from myocarditis.

Korean: 웅 우리나라 ㅜㅜ 백혈병 걸린 게 예비 신랑인데 그 예비 신부가 글 올린 거야
English: Yeah, our country ㅜㅜ The groom-to-be has leukemia, and the bride-to-be posted this

Korean: 맞아 심근염 그런 거 때문에 백신 맞고 운동하지 말라더라
English: Yes, they said not to exercise after getting the vaccine because of myocarditis and stuff.

Korean: 남친도 맞고 왔는데 그런 심장 관련 부작용 알려줬대
English: My boyfriend also got hit and told me about the side effects related to his heart.

Korean: 아니... 그건 어떻게 보상 받냐 진짜 ㅠㅠ
English: No... how do you get compensated for that, seriously ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 원래 질병이 있던 사람도 아닌 건가?
English: But isn't this person someone who originally had an illness?

Korean: 너무 무섭다 건강하던 사람이 갑자기 백혈병이라니... 예비 신부 진짜 너무 슬플 것 같아
English: It's so scary. A healthy person suddenly gets leukemia... I think the bride-to-be will be really sad.

Korean: 그래도 나는 내 주변에는 아직까지는 무슨 부작용은 못 봐서 잘 맞고 오자...!
English: But I haven't seen any side effects around me yet, so I'm hoping it works out well...!

Korean: 웅 원래 운동도 하고 술 담배도 안 하고 건강했다고 봤어 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, I thought he was originally healthy, working out and not drinking or smoking ㅜㅜ
I think it's acute leukemia.

Korean: 나도 아직 주변에 부작용 심하게 온 사람은 없어
English: I haven't seen anyone around me suffer from severe side effects yet.

Korean: 확률이 적긴 한데 그래도 그게 내가 될까 봐 무서워
English: The odds are slim, but I'm still scared that it might be me.

Korean: 구니까! ㅠㅠ 내 주변에는 두 명이나 응급실 갔었었다 엄청 실하게 열나고 아파서
English: It's true! ㅠㅠ Two people around me went to the emergency room because they had a really high fever and were in a lot of pain.

Korean: 헐 둘 다 가뜩이나 몸도 잘 아픈데 걱정되긴 하네
English: Wow, both of them are already sick, so I'm worried.

Korean: 맞아 아스트라 때는 주변에서 열 엄청 나고 응급실 가는 거 봤어!
English: That's right, during Astra, I saw people around me with high fevers and going to the emergency room!

Korean: 근데 화이자랑 모더나는 못 본 거 같아
English: But I don't think I've seen Pfizer or Moderna

Korean: 그니까 우리 백신 맞고 멀쩡하길 빌자...
English: So let's get vaccinated and hope we're all fine...

Korean: 구래... ㅠㅠ 근데 일본에서 이물질 나왔던 거는 이상 반응 나온 사람 없었대?
English: Oh my...ㅠㅠ But I heard that no one had a strange reaction to the foreign substance that came out in Japan?

Korean: 웅웅 이물질 나온 거 맞은 사람 없었나 봐 다행히!
English: Whew Whew, luckily no one was hit by the foreign substance!

Korean: 우리 엄마도 아스트라제네카 맞았는데 막 끙끙 앓긴 했어 ㅠㅠ
English: My mom also got AstraZeneca, but she was really sick ㅠㅠ

Korean: 오 다행이네 맞기 전에 이물질이 보였나 보네~
English: Oh thank goodness I guess I saw the foreign object before I got hit~
That AstraZeneca made a lot of people suffer ㅜㅜ

Korean: 우리 엄마 아빠는 그래도 괜찮게 넘어갔는데 그나마 다행이었구나,
English: My mom and dad got through it okay, so that was a relief.

Korean: 웅웅 아빠는 모더나 맞았는데 아무렇지도 않고 엄마는 1차 때 그랬엉
English: Yeah, my dad got Moderna and it was fine, but my mom got it the first time

Korean: 그래도 우리는 화이자 아니면 모더나니까 ㅠㅠ!
English: But we have Pfizer or Moderna ㅠㅠ!

Korean: 해보고 싶은 머리 있어? 염색이나 파마나 여러 가지로!
English: Is there a hairstyle you want to try? Whether it's dyeing, perming, or something else!
I want to try ombre haha

Korean: 나는 레이어드 컷! 옴브레하면 군데군데 색 브릿지같이 하는 머리 맞아?
English: I have a layered cut! When you say ombre, you mean hair that has colored bridges here and there?
Yeah, that's right, right?
My friend used to be pretty~
Yeah, that's right!

Korean: 그거랑 진짜 백금발 해보고 싶어 키키
English: I really want to try platinum blonde hair Kiki

Korean: 근데 전에 탈색 해봤는데 난 얼굴이 노래서 일단 밝은 색하면 별로긴 하더라
English: But I bleached my hair before, and since my face is pale, bright colors don't really look good.

Korean: 키키 나도 옴브레 하고 싶은데 탈색 무조건 해야 된다고 해서 안 했어
English: Kiki I also wanted to do ombre, but I didn't do it because they said I had to bleach my hair.

Korean: 탈색 한 번도 안 해봤어 나
English: I've never bleached my hair

Korean: 나도 탈색해서 백금발이랑 애쉬색 하고 싶은데 미용실에서 안 해줘...ㅜㅜ 머리카락 너무 얇아서 ㅜㅜ
English: I also want to bleach my hair and make it platinum blonde and ash-colored, but the hair salon won't do it...ㅜㅜ My hair is too thin ㅜㅜ

Korean: 흠 ㅠㅠ 난 그냥 맨날 내가 미용실에서 쓰는 약 사가지고 했었는데 키키
English: Hmm ㅠㅠ I just used the medicine I always used at the beauty salon. Kiki
Let's try a layered cut!

Korean: 근데 내 친구 나랑 똑같은 얇은 머리인데 걘 진짜 겁나 망한거 봐서 내 머리도 괜찮을까...?
English: But my friend has the same thin hair as me, and her hair looks really messed up, so I wonder if mine will be okay...?

Korean: 언니 우리 같은 얇은 머리는 가뜩이나 숱 없어 보이는데 레이어드 컷하면 머리 더 없어 보여서 망해 키키
English: Sister, our thin hair already looks thinner, and if you get a layered cut, it will look even thinner, so it's a disaster Kiki
Oh, I see ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 근데 오늘 선크림 새 거 썼는데 톤업이라더니 마스크에 다 묻어 무슨 파운데이션처럼 키키
English: Oh, but I used a new sunscreen today, and it said it was for tone-up, but it got all over my mask and it looks like foundation.
I feel so annoyed and itchy

Korean: 언니 선크림 뭐 샀어? 추천 받아염
English: Sister, what sunscreen did you buy? Please recommend one.

Korean: 난 선크림 무조건 무색에 뽀송한 거... 하얗게 되는 거 절대 안 써!
English: I always use sunscreen that is colorless and fluffy... I never use sunscreen that leaves a white residue!
Sister, I need to buy a new one ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나 달바꺼! 여기께 촉촉해서 그런 듯 키키
English: I'm going to sleep! It's so moist here, Kiki

Korean: 답답하거나 안 맞는 건 아닌데 마스크에 묻은 거 보고 오잉? 싶었어
English: It's not stuffy or uncomfortable, but I was like, "Oh?" when I saw it on the mask.

Korean: 헐 근데 선크림 마스크에 묻는 거 신기해
English: Wow, but it's weird that sunscreen gets on the mask
Is it a powder formulation?

Korean: 나는 원래 그냥 흰색 썼는데 어느 순간부터 볼에 자꾸 가루?처럼 묻는 거야
English: I originally just used white, but at some point, it started to get on my cheeks like powder.
So I changed it to Sunfact!

Korean: 선크림 색이 그런 색이어서 그런 듯 ㅜㅜ
English: I think it's because the sunscreen color is like that ㅜㅜ

Korean: 가루처럼 되는 거 건조해서 그런 거 아니야?
English: Isn't it because it's dry that it becomes like powder?
Is it okay if I change it to Sunfact?
I guess that's why haha
But it's still moist so it's good...
** How about the sun pack you recommended back then?
If it's okay, keep using it haha

Korean: 어 맞아 나 그때 그 싸이닉 선팩트 계속 쓰고 있는데 솔직히 보송해지긴 하는데 선보호의 역할은 잘 모르겠는 느낌?
English: Oh, that's right. I'm still using that Psynic sun pack, and honestly, it does make my skin softer, but I don't really know what it does for sun protection.
It's definitely nice that there are no quirks!
Kiki Oh, if you like it, that's good

Korean: 팩트처럼 같이 들어있는 스펀지로 두드리는 거야?
English: Are you tapping it with the sponge that comes with it like a fact?
It's exactly the same as the fact, but the contents are sunscreen Kiki!

Korean: 근데 피부 타입이 다르니까 추천하기가 애매하구만?
English: But since everyone's skin type is different, it's hard to recommend?

Korean: 웅웅 근데 확실히 이거 쓰고 나서는 기름 안 끼고 여름에는 괜츈한데 겨울에 건조할까 봐 걱정
English: Yeah, but I definitely don't get oily after using this, and it's fine in the summer, but I'm worried it might dry out in the winter.

Korean: 그렇구만 나는 어차피 쓰는 선크림만 몇 년째 계속 써서 키키
English: By the way, I've been using the same sunscreen for years now.
Kiki, you are so like that

Korean: 맞아 나도 겨울 대비해서 선크림 바꿨졍 촉촉한 걸루 하하
English: Yeah, I also changed my sunscreen to a moist one for winter haha

Korean: 키키 어제 근데 올영 갔는데 셀퓨전씨 파데 같은 선크림도 나왔더라
English: Kiki I went to Olleung yesterday and they had a sunscreen like Selfusion C Pa-de.

Korean: 그거 보고 좀 신기했어 완전 파데 색깔
English: I was a bit surprised to see that, it's a completely faded color

Korean: 여러분 건강 검진 꼭 한번 해봅시다 ㅜㅜ
English: Everyone, please make sure to get a health checkup ㅜㅜ

Korean: 야 너 보니까 진짜 해봐야 할 것 같아 키키
English: Hey, looking at you makes me feel like I really have to try it Kiki

Korean: 키키 그니까 나는 근데 여러분 때문에 그 2년 마다 나오는 것도 알았어
English: Kiki, that's why I also knew that it comes out every two years because of you guys
I honestly didn't know

Korean: 키키 그거 우편 날라온 적 없댔나?
English: Kiki, you said you never got that mail?

Korean: 아니 근데 생각해보니까 **아 어머니 간호사신데 너 잔소리 안 듣니?
English: But come to think of it, **ah, your mother is a nurse. Don't you listen to her nagging?
Yeah, no!

Korean: 글고 옛날에 채용 검사서 한 번 받았을 때 엑스레이 정도 찍고 피 검사는 엄마가 봐서 더 그런 듯?
English: And when I took the employment physical a long time ago, my mom took an X-ray and a blood test, so I think that's why?

Korean: 아 엄마가 피 검사 해주신 적 있어?
English: Oh, has your mom ever done a blood test?
Oh good haha

Korean: 이번에 시험 끝나고 할 일이 많아
English: I have a lot to do after the exams are over
First of all, you have to go to the dentist.
Yeah, go to the hospital and do it

Korean: 나 코로나 주사도 엄마가 놔줬어 키키
English: My mom gave me the corona shot too Kiki

Korean: 아 진짜? 키키 엄마가 간호사시니까 좋네!
English: Oh really? It's great that Kiki's mom is a nurse!

Korean: 엥 너무 좋은데 진짜? 키키 믿음직스러워
English: Wow, that's so good, really? Kiki is trustworthy
Right, sister, you really need to see a dentist urgently.
Are you still sick?
Are you still sick these days?
I really have to go as soon as the exam is over!

Korean: 웅웅 아파 ㅠㅠ 양치할 때 아파...
English: Oww it hurts... It hurts when I brush my teeth...

Korean: 빨리 가고 싶은데 괜히 시험 전에 갔다가 아픈 치료 해야 할까 봐 못 가겠어
English: I want to go quickly, but I can't go because I'm afraid I'll have to go before the exam and get treatment for my illness.
That's right ㅠㅠ Just hold on for 2 weeks...

Korean: 아니면 진료만 받고 그 이후에 치료 예약을 잡아도 되지 않을까?
English: Or would it be okay to just get the examination and then schedule a treatment appointment afterwards?

Korean: ㅜㅜ 한 달 남았으면 가라 할 텐데 2주 남아서 좀 그렇긴 하다...
English: ㅜㅜ If there was a month left I would tell them to go, but since there are only two weeks left, I feel a bit hesitant...

It wasn't as expensive as I thought. About 100,000 won?

Korean: 원목인데 그 가격이면 사람들이 엄청 사겠는데?
English: It's raw wood, so wouldn't a lot of people buy it at that price?

Korean: 응 맞아 셀프 시공이라 저렴한 것 같아
English: Yeah, that's right. I think it's cheap because it's self-construction.

Korean: 평소에 여행 갈 때 어떤 거 타고 다녀?
English: What do you usually ride when you travel?

Korean: 나는 주로 비행기를 타고 다녀 키키 남친이 부산 살거든 ㅠ
English: I mostly travel by plane, and Kiki's boyfriend lives in Busan.
Wow, isn't the plane ticket expensive?
It's twice as cheap as KTX!
Kiki is close to the airport too

Korean: 헐 대박이네 집에서 공항까지 몇 시간 걸려?
English: Wow, that's amazing. How many hours does it take from my house to the airport?
It takes about an hour and a half

Korean: 생각보다 안 걸리네 뭐 타고 가는데?
English: It doesn't take as long as you think. What are you riding?
I took the airport limousine bus~ It was okay
Does the airport bus go to your house too?

Korean: 응 맞아 인천공항 김포공항 둘 다 가
English: Yes, that's right, go to both Incheon Airport and Gimpo Airport.
Your house is totally a honeymoon house!

Korean: 우리 동네 역세권에 광역 버스 잘 다녀 키키
English: The metropolitan bus runs frequently in the area around our neighborhood station.

Korean: 부럽다 우리 집은 20분에 한 대씩 시내 나가는 거밖에 안 다니는데
English: I'm jealous. My house only has one bus going into town every 20 minutes.

Korean: 아 그래? 거기도 얼른 버스가 개편 되어야겠네 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh really? The buses there need to be reorganized soon too.
No, I mean the Nonsan house hahaha.

Korean: 아... 거긴 좀 힘들긴 하겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah... It'll be a bit difficult there ㅠㅠ
Tea is a must Kiki

Korean: 지금 편의점 말고 다른 알바는 안 해?
English: Aren't you working any other part-time jobs besides at the convenience store?
I recently worked at Coupang

Korean: 헐 쿠팡 최근에 불 났다고 기사 봤는데 거기니 혹시?
English: Oh my, I saw an article saying Coupang was on fire recently. Is that you?
Not there, it's in a different area
Good thing, how many times have you been there?

Korean: 주 3회 정도 간 것 같아 너무 힘들어서 ㅠㅠ
English: I think I went about 3 times a week, it was so hard ㅠㅠ
Do you still plan on going?
No, I don't want to go there again
Yeah, they say convenience stores are the sweetest part-time jobs.

Korean: 맞아 편의점도 같이 하는데 그게 훨씬 나아
English: Yes, it's much better if you also have a convenience store.

Korean: 그렇지? 그러면 쿠팡에서는 무슨 일 했어?
English: Right? Then what did you do at Coupang?

Korean: 사람들이 주문한 거 포장해서 보내는 일~
English: Packing and sending out what people ordered~
How many hours a day did you do this?
Um, about 8 hours a day?
8 hours? That must be tough.
Did you give them a break?
Of course I'll give you a break~
Did your boyfriend go to the military and come back?
Oh, so you were discharged from the military this year?
So you started dating and then enlisted right away?

Korean: 아니야 전역 몇 달 남기고 만났어 키키
English: No, I met Kiki a few months before my discharge.

Korean: 너가 유럽 여행을 언제 갔다고 했지?
English: When did you say you went on a trip to Europe?

Korean: 2년 전에 갔는데 그땐 안 사귀었어 키키
English: I went there 2 years ago, but we weren't dating then Kiki
So when did your boyfriend enlist?

Korean: 유럽 여행 다녀오고 2주 후에 입대 했어
English: I enlisted two weeks after returning from my trip to Europe.
At that time I was a student~
Oh, time really flies
Is it 1 year and 6 months in the military?
Yeah, that's what it's like these days.
Then how long have you been waiting for your boyfriend?

Korean: 나 6개월 정도 기다린 것 같아 키키
English: I think I waited about 6 months Kiki
Hey, I waited longer than you thought?
Kiki I don't know for sure~
Wow, time flies?
Is this the power of love?
Yeah right... I'm embarrassed hehe
What major did you study in college?
I majored in tax accounting, Kiki

Korean: 나는 대학을 안 나와서 뭐 하는 과인지 모르는데 알려줄래?
English: I didn't go to college so I don't know what major to take. Can you tell me?

Korean: 아 세금이랑 장부 관리에 대해 배우는 거야
English: Oh, I'm learning about taxes and bookkeeping.
So, have you tried the internship?
I haven't tried the practice yet Kiki
A quick part-time job at the tax office?
Is that not an internship or a part-time job?
Yeah, I got some money there too ~ Yahoo

Korean: 헐 대박 세무서에서 아르바이트를 하다니 신기한 걸?
English: Wow, that's amazing. Working part-time at the tax office.

Korean: 5월에 종소세 기간에 신고 도우미 했었어 키키
English: I helped you file your return during the tax season in May Kiki

Korean: 그때 신고하러 사업자들 엄청 많이 왔지?
English: Did a lot of business owners come to report at that time?

Korean: 응 맞아 하루에 천 명 왔었어...
English: Yeah, that's right, a thousand people came in one day...

Korean: 헉 니가 그 사람들을 다 신고해 준 거야?
English: Oh my god, you reported all those people?

Korean: 다른 사람들이랑 같이 도와서 신고 했지~
English: I reported it with the help of other people~

Korean: 진짜 대박이다 내 동생이 이런  멋진 일을 하다니!
English: This is seriously awesome! My little brother is doing such an awesome job!
I'll help you file your taxes later too~
What did your brother do after he was discharged from the military?

Korean: 음 글쎄 아직 나이 어려서 아르바이트 할걸
English: Well, I guess I'll work part-time since I'm still young.
At least I'm glad I can earn my own living!

Korean: 대학을 안 가서 너무 걱정이야 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm so worried about not going to college ㅠㅠ

Korean: 걔 가지고 있는 자격증은 뭐 있어?
English: What certifications does he have?
Well, maybe there aren't any? Kiki
Did he graduate from a humanities high school?
Oh right, I graduated from the humanities department Kiki
Then you might not have a license
We came from the commercial world!

Korean: 그렇긴 한데 얘가 아무것도 관심이 없어 ㅠㅠ
English: That's true, but he's not interested in anything ㅠㅠ
Really? You don't even have a driver's license?

Korean: 응 맞아 그 시험 마저도 하기 싫어해...
English: Yeah, that's right. I don't even want to take that test...

Korean: 그래도 아직 어리니까 나와서 뭐라도 하겠지!
English: But he's still young, so he'll come out and do something!
Well, I hope so, Kiki
If you do that after I come out, I'll scold you severely!
I have to chase after them with a club
What's your boyfriend doing these days?
I'm into working out these days Kiki Health

Korean: 헐 내 남친도 최근에 피티 받았는데
English: Wow my boyfriend also got PT recently

Korean: 아 진짜? 그 피티는 얼마 정도 해?
English: Oh really? How much does that PT cost?

Korean: 한 번에 5만 원이라고 했던 거 같아!
English: I think it was 50 thousand won at once!

Korean: 헐 진짜? 비싸다 계속 피티 받는 중이야?
English: Wow, really? It's expensive. Are you still getting PT?

Korean: 아니 끝났어 근데 헬스 이용권 1달치 있는데 안 가
English: No, it's over, but I have a one month gym membership, but I'm not going

Korean: 아 진짜? 키키 피티 하고 나서  변화가 좀 있었어?
English: Oh really? Has anything changed since you did Kiki Piti?

Korean: 음 배가 조금 들어갔는데 최근에 보니까 원상복구 됐어 허허
English: Um, my stomach went in a little bit, but I recently checked and it's back to normal haha

Korean: 엇 저번에 바프 찍는다고 하지 않았어?
English: Hey, didn't you say you were going to take a shower last time?
Yeah, it's a story from a far away country.
Well, a happy pig is the best, Kiki

Korean: 그럼 건강한 사람은 지방이 어느 정도 있다며 나를 설득 시키더라.
English: Then he convinced me that healthy people have some fat.
A boyfriend with a big belly is cute too~

Korean: 뭐든지 정도가 있어야 하는데 지금 위험해.
English: There has to be a limit to everything, but it's dangerous right now.

Korean: 언니가 옆에서 같이 운동 해주면 딱이겠네 키키
English: It would be perfect if my sister could exercise with me, Kiki

Korean: 너 아까 비숑 키우고 싶다고 했잖아.
English: You said earlier that you wanted to raise a Bichon.

Korean: 어 맞아~ 비숑이 너무 좋지 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh right~ I really like Bichon ㅠㅠ

Korean: 비숑 크기가 어떻게 되는 지 알아?
English: Do you know how big a Bichon is?
It doesn't seem to be a small dog, but a medium-sized dog?

Korean: 음 크기에 따라 다른데 중소형견 이라고 생각하면 돼!
English: Well, it depends on the size, but you can think of it as a small to medium-sized dog!

Korean: 아 진짜? 생각보다 작구나 나는 큰 줄 알았어
English: Oh really? It's smaller than I thought. I thought it was big.
Think of it as about 5kg on average!
Oh really? Is it about the same size as Obok?

Korean: 응 크기는 털 때문에 좀 더 클 수도 있어!
English: Yes, the size may be a bit bigger because of the fur!
Yes, it was cute because the fur was fluffy ㅠ

Korean: 맞아 니가 비숑 얘기하니까 나도 비숑이랑 놀아보고 싶다!
English: Right, since you're talking about Bichon, I want to play with a Bichon too!

Korean: 애견 카페 가면 비숑 많이 있더라구 한번 가봐
English: If you go to a dog cafe, there are a lot of Bichons. Go there sometime.

Korean: 헐 애견 카페 한 번도 안 가봤어 어때?
English: Wow, I've never been to a dog cafe before. What do you think?
He's so active that he gets tired of playing with puppies...

Korean: 헐 나도 기회 되면 조만간 가서 놀아야지!
English: Wow, I should go and play sometime soon when I get the chance!

Korean: 그래 꼭 강아지 없어도 된다 하더라~
English: Yeah, he said you don't have to have a dog~
Did you wear hiking clothes when you went hiking?

Korean: 아니 요즘 레깅스 입고 많이 간다더라구
English: No, I heard that a lot of people wear leggings these days.
So you went hiking wearing leggings?
Yeah, that's right, the leggings are stretchy.
I can't wear leggings.
Why? Are the leggings uncomfortable?

Korean: 불편한 것보다 엉덩이가 쳐져서 입으면 안 예뻐
English: It's not pretty to wear it because it makes your butt sag rather than being uncomfortable.

Korean: 아 그럼 힙업 운동을 하면 되겠다!
English: Oh, then I guess I should do hip-up exercises!

Korean: 나 매일 스쿼트 운동 하는 걸?
English: I do squats every day?

Korean: 그러면 힙 브릿지 운동도 같이 해봐
English: Then try the hip bridge exercise too.

Korean: 브릿지 운동도 매일 같이 하는 걸?
English: Do you also do bridge exercises every day?
Your ass is really cursed
Have you seen your big mommy butt?
Superior genes.

Korean: 유전은 무시 못하는 건가 아니야 할 수 있어!
English: Genetics can't be ignored, can it?
No, this also needs the hand of God.
No, let's work together

Korean: 너는 어리니까 애들이랑 술 게임 자주 하지?
English: Since you're young, do you often play drinking games with kids?

Korean: 에이 술 게임 언제 적 얘기야~
English: Hey, when are we going to have a drinking game?

Korean: 그러면 요즘 애들은 술자리에서 뭐 해?
English: So what do kids these days do when they drink?
Let's talk about Dorandoran instead of drinking games

Korean: 라떼는 말이지 술자리에 술 게임이 빠지면 어깨도 같이 빠진다구~
English: Latte, as they say, if you don't have a drinking game at a drinking party, your shoulders will fall off too~

Korean: 이야 ~ 술 게임 뭐 있었지? 기억도 안 나네
English: Hey~ What was the drinking game? I don't even remember.

Korean: 그냥 너 그거 알잖아 너너 게임
English: You know what, you game
Oh~ Hey, but the classic is 369 Kiki
Ah, 369 is creepy. Does it remind you of Baskin Robbins 31 degrees?

Korean: 그럼 나 근데 처음에 그거 아이스크림 맛 대결인 줄 알았잖아 키키
English: Well, at first I thought it was an ice cream flavor contest, Kiki.
Everyone can think that way
I played the game with caution!

Korean: 그래? 나는 술 게임 할 때 눈치가 너무 없어서 항상 취했어 키키
English: Yeah? I'm always drunk because I'm so oblivious when I play drinking games. Kiki
You can't do giggles?

Korean: 엇 그런가, 그냥 술이 고팠지 뭐야~
English: Oh really, I was just thirsty for alcohol~

Korean: 너 일부러 게임에 져서 술 왕창 먹은 거니?
English: Did you purposely lose the game and drink a lot?

Korean: 들켰다 사실 나 게임 고수야 키키
English: I got caught, I'm actually a game expert Kiki

Korean: 부산 말고 다른 여행지 추천 좀!
English: Please recommend other travel destinations besides Busan!
Well, I recommend Jeju Island~

Korean: 제주도 가려고 했는데 코로나 때문에 못 갈 것 같아 ㅜㅜ
English: I was planning to go to Jeju Island, but I don't think I can go because of Corona ㅜㅜ
That's right, Jeju Island is currently at Corona level 4 ㅠㅠ

Korean: 논산은 아직 3단계인데 결국 제주도도 그렇게 됐구나.
English: Nonsan is still at stage 3, but Jeju Island ended up like that too.

Korean: 응 맞아 한 2주 된 것 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right, I think it's been about two weeks ㅠㅠ
I want to go to Jeju Island
I was planning to go in October too, but I cancelled ㅜㅜ
Oh really? Who are you going with?
I was planning to go for my 7th anniversary with my boyfriend!
Oh my, that's too bad ㅠㅠ
Still went and came back

Korean: 가면 뭐 해 다 포장해서 먹어야 할 텐데!
English: What are you going to do if you go? You'll have to pack everything and eat it!
It's okay because vacations are going well these days
Right, the price has gone down a lot, right?
The package is better than I thought, so it's worth going at least once.

Korean: 나 호캉스 한 번도 안 해 봤는데 예약하러 가야겠다!
English: I've never been on a vacation before, but I need to go make a reservation!

Korean: 나도 곧 제주도 갈 것 같아서 예약해야지~
English: I think I'll go to Jeju Island soon, so I should make a reservation~

Korean: 너 이번 주에 부산에 있었던 거야?
English: Were you in Busan this week?

Korean: 응 맞아 근데 비가 내내 왔어 ㅠ
English: Yeah that's right but it rained the whole time ㅠ
Right, I heard a typhoon came there?
Yeah, Typhoon Omais hit us directly.
The typhoon's name is Oh My! What an interesting name!

Korean: 비가 정말 앞이 안보일 정도로 왔어
English: The rain was so heavy that I couldn't see ahead.
Wow, but how was your trip?
Weren't you scared?

Korean: 남친이 렌트해서 다녔는데 시야가 안보여서 무섭더라
English: My boyfriend rented a car and drove around, but it was scary because there was no visibility.
How did you drive so well?
Look how good your boyfriend drives!

Korean: 다행히 현지 사람이라 그런가 봐 키키
English: Luckily, I guess it's because he's a local person. Kiki

Korean: 부산은 심지어 교통 편도 안 좋다고 하던데!
English: They say that Busan's transportation isn't even that good!

Korean: 응, 그래서 엄청 막히고 그랬어 ㅠㅜ
English: Yeah, that's why it was so congested ㅠㅜ

Korean: 부산 차들이 엄청 난폭하다 그러는데 사실이야?
English: They say Busan cars are incredibly violent. Is that true?

Korean: 아 그건 아닌데 차선이 복잡하더라구 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, that's not it, but the lanes are complicated ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 도로가 울퉁불퉁한 곳이 많다고 들었어!
English: Yeah, I heard the roads are bumpy in a lot of places!

Korean: 응응 나도 그거 느꼈어 비오니깐 더 위험하더라
English: Yeah, yeah, I felt that too. It's more dangerous when it rains.
I really need to be careful about food poisoning these days!

Korean: 그래 최근에 살모넬라균 때문에 식중독 많이 걸렸잖아
English: Yeah, we've had a lot of food poisoning recently because of salmonella.
They say they caught it in a group, but one person died!

Korean: 헐 무섭다 정말 특히 김밥 집이 더 많이 그러더라
English: Wow, it's scary. Especially the kimbap places are like that a lot.

Korean: 안에 야채가 많이 들어가서 그런가 봐
English: I guess it's because there are a lot of vegetables inside
Where is the kimbap place?

Korean: 고양에 있는 김밥 집이던데 야채도 그렇고 계란이 되게 문제가 많대
English: It's a kimbap restaurant in Goyang, and they say there are a lot of problems with the vegetables and eggs.

Korean: 맞아 그 계란이 세척 계란이 아니라서 그렇다고 해!
English: That's right, that's because those eggs aren't washed eggs!
You really have to be careful with what you eat in the summer.
That's right, salmonella starts in eggs!
Do you eat eggs often?

Korean: 어 맞아 그래서 더 조심하고 있어 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh right, that's why I'm being more careful ㅠㅠ
They told me to eat eggs that are antibiotic-free, even if they are expensive!
Oh really? I didn't know that ㅠㅠ
But if you're careful, it'll be okay~

Korean: 맞아 딱 먹을 것만 사다 놓고 쟁여 놓으면 안 돼!
English: That's right. You shouldn't buy only what you'll eat and hoard it!

Korean: 그리고 식당들도 위생관리 잘 했으면 좋겠다
English: And I hope restaurants also manage hygiene well.

Korean: 맞아 그 김밥 집 이제 곧 망하겠어 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah, that kimbap place is going to go out of business soon ㅜㅜ
Don't play with your food~
Have you seen the Fukushima nuclear disaster?
So how much damage was that?

Korean: 어떻게 그렇게 은근슬쩍 방출할 수 있지?
English: How can you release it so subtly?

Korean: 이번에 후쿠시마 원전 오염수 방출 했다던데 어떡하냐 정말
English: I heard that the Fukushima nuclear power plant released contaminated water this time. What should we do? Really?
Do you know how much contaminated water there is?

Korean: 나도 간접적으로 기사 봤는데 아마 수산물 피해가 있지 않나 싶어
English: I also saw the article indirectly and I think there may have been damage to seafood.

Korean: 아 나 회 엄청 좋아하는데  양식으로만 먹어야 하나?
English: Oh, I really like raw fish, but do I have to eat it only in Western form?

Korean: 양식도 위험할 수도 있어 ㅠㅠ 방사능에 노출 되면...
English: The form can also be dangerous ㅠㅠ If exposed to radiation...
But why do they release it so freely?
Japan is really selfish
Don't even think about the surrounding countries that are affected

Korean: 진짜 너무한 거 같아 지금 코로나로 정신없는데!
English: I think it's really too much. We're going crazy because of Corona right now!

Korean: 그러게 이건 우리나라도 잘 대처 해야 할 텐데 ㅠㅠ
English: Well, I think our country needs to deal with this well too ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 그걸 어떻게 막을 대안이 없을까?
English: Right, isn't there an alternative to stop that?

Korean: 두 나라 외교가 잘 돼야 할 텐데
English: Diplomacy between the two countries needs to go well.
I don't think that's the case

Korean: 조율할 부분이 있으면 지혜롭게 조율했으면 좋겠다!
English: If there are parts that need to be adjusted, I hope you do so wisely!
Yeah, I think so too

Korean: 너 요즘에 다이어트는 잘 하고 있어?
English: Are you doing well with your diet these days?

Korean: 아니 나 다이어트 때려 쳤어 키키
English: No I gave up on dieting Kiki
Why, why were you doing so well!

Korean: 그냥 요즘 먹는 게 너무 행복해~
English: I'm just so happy eating these days~

Korean: 그건 그런데 운동도 안 하고 있어?
English: By the way, aren't you exercising?

Korean: 응 그냥 심심할 때 밖에 나가서 산책 정도?
English: Yeah, just go outside and take a walk when you're bored?

Korean: 그래도 움직이니까 괜찮네 나는 다이어트 약 먹고 있어!
English: It's okay though because I'm moving. I'm taking diet pills!
Oh, what kind of medicine are you taking?

Korean: 그냥 연예인이 홍보하는 다이어트 약 먹는 중이야!
English: I'm just taking diet pills that celebrities are promoting!
Oh, is that something like a supplement?

Korean: 응 맞아 그거 먹으니까 응가는 잘 나오더라!
English: Yeah, that's right. If you eat that, your appetite will improve!

Korean: 그러면 운동 안 해도 살 빠져?
English: So you can lose weight without exercising?

Korean: 아니 그거는 아닌 거 같고 그냥 유지?
English: No, I don't think that's it. Just maintain it?
Oh, I want to keep it!
How much weight have you gained?

Korean: 나 요즘 한 3KG 정도 찐것 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: I think I gained about 3kg recently ㅠㅠ
Hey, do you know that your sister is hurt?
Hey, where did you get hurt, unnie?
Sister, both of my legs are broken.
What were you doing that made you shiver? What happened? ㅠㅠ
He sprained his leg while going to buy ice cream.

Korean: 근데 두 다리나 접질린 거야? 헐...
English: But both your legs are broken? Wow...

Korean: 아니 한 쪽 다리 반 깁스 하고 나와서 또 넘어져서 다른 한 쪽 다리도 다쳤대.
English: No, he came out with half a cast on one leg, then fell and hurt his other leg too.

Korean: 아 진짜? 양쪽 다 그러면 불편하겠다...
English: Oh really? That would be uncomfortable for both of us...
He said it was because he had no strength in his legs.
My sister needs to take care of me
Mom will take care of it
It's all because of lack of exercise!

Korean: 그러게 평소에 언니가 운동을 안 하지?
English: So, doesn't your sister usually exercise?

Korean: 그럼 안 하지 우리라도 열심히 해서 건강 챙기자!
English: Then let's not do it. Let's work hard and take care of our health!

Korean: 그러게 운동 신경이 조금 있어야 안 다치지 ㅠㅠ
English: If you have some motor skills, you won't get hurt ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 그러니까 우리 다시 운동 시작하자!
English: Okay, so let's start exercising again!
Okay, good! Let's start with light squats.
I told you I posted on Carrot Market!
Yeah, I told you that.
Did I even tell you the story of the sale?

Korean: 아 아니 ~ 당근 마켓에 올리려 던 거 팔았어?
English: Oh no~ Did you sell the thing you were going to put up on Carrot Market?

Korean: 그걸 내가 8월에 올렸는데 아무도 관심을 안 주는 거야.
English: I posted it in August, but no one paid attention.
Yeah, that's what I said

Korean: 그래서 신경 안 쓰고 있었는데 두 명이나 연락이 왔었어!
English: So I wasn't paying attention, but then two people contacted me!
Oh, that's good. So who are you going to sell it to?

Korean: 먼저 연락 준 사람한테 팔 수 있다고 했더니 그 사람은 샀다고 했고 다른 연락 온 사람한테 팔았지!
English: I told the person who contacted me first that I could sell it, but he said he bought it and sold it to someone else who contacted him!

Korean: 아 그래? 은근 인기가 있나 보다 키키
English: Oh really? I guess you're secretly popular, Kiki.
No, I put it up really cheap!

Korean: 헐 값에 줬구나 나라도 산다고 했을 거야 키키
English: Wow, you gave it to me for such a low price. I would have bought it too. Kiki

Korean: 맞아 원가가 만 원이 넘는 건데 내가 4000원에 올렸거든!
English: That's right, the original price was over ten thousand won, but I listed it for 4,000 won!
Wow it's really cheap Kiki
It's almost like giving away for free, Kiki

Korean: 그치? 나 너무 천사 같아 음하하하!
English: Right? I'm such an angel hahaha!
Then, put it up for cheap next time too, Kiki
Do you have a favorite celebrity?
I'm into Song Kang these days, Kiki

Korean: 너도 송강이랑 한소희 나오는 드라마 봤니?
English: Have you seen the drama with Song Kang and Han So-hee?
I know, but is that right?
I saw Kiki once

Korean: 그거 언니가 나한테 보라고 보라고 했는데 안 봤더니 완결 났더라
English: My sister told me to watch it, but I didn't watch it and it was already finished

Korean: 그거 넷플릭스에 다 올라왔대 한번 봐봐
English: It's all on Netflix. Check it out.

Korean: 근데 그거 시청률 낮던데 재미있는 거 맞아?
English: But that one has low viewer ratings, is it really that fun?
Kiki, I think the development is a bit frustrating
Still, Song Kang is handsome

Korean: 송강 나쁜 남자로 나오는데 역시 얼굴이 다인가!
English: Song Kang appears as a bad guy, but his face is everything!

Korean: 그러게 나쁜 남자인데도 끌리는 건, 휴
English: Even though he's a bad guy, I'm attracted to him.
After all, a person's face is everything!
Han So-hee who appears there is also very pretty
Since the main characters are handsome men and beautiful women, I have to watch it when I get the chance~
Yeah, there was a short highlight on YouTube.
Yeah, I saw that a little bit!

Korean: 응 나는 시간 날 때 한번에 몰아서 볼려구
English: Yeah, I'm going to watch it all at once when I have time.
Do you watch cartoons?

Korean: 나 만화는 짱구는 못말려 완전 좋아해
English: I really like the cartoon Crayon Shin-chan

Korean: 아 그건 국민 만화지 지금 몇 기지?
English: Oh, that's a national cartoon. What base is it now?
I think it's over 16?
But these days it's not that great

Korean: 완전 최장수 프로그램이네 성우가 바뀌어서 별로 인가?
English: This is the longest-running program. Is it not so good because the voice actors have changed?

Korean: 응 맞아 특유의 짱구 아빠 목소리가 아니야 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right, it's not Shinchan's dad's signature voice ㅠㅠ
Right, didn't Shin-chan change either?

Korean: 아 그래? 어쩐지 좀 다르더라 옛날 짱구가 더 재밌는데
English: Oh really? It's a bit different. The old Shinchan was more fun.

Korean: 맞아 더 익살스럽잖아 봉미선 씨는 그대로니?
English: Yeah, it's more humorous, isn't it? Is Bong Mi-seon still the same?

Korean: 응 맞아 그래도 옛날 감성이 참 좋았어
English: Yeah, that's right, but I still really liked the old feeling

Korean: 맞아 근데 요즘에는 제재 하는 부분이 많아져서 재미가 없어진 거 같아.
English: That's right, but I think it's become less fun these days because there are so many sanctions in place.
That could be it Kiki

Korean: 가끔 유튜브로 찾아봐 짱구 옛날 거
English: Sometimes I search YouTube for old videos of Shinchan.
Should I watch a movie after a long time?
Which Shinchan movie do you like?

Korean: 그거 있잖아 옛날 시대로 돌아가는 편!
English: There's that thing called going back to the old days!

Korean: 아 그거 나도 알아 재밌게 봤었지
English: Oh, I know that too. I enjoyed watching it.
Did you all have coffee this morning?

Korean: 나 오늘은 커피 스킵~ 대신 아이스티 마셨지~
English: I skipped coffee today~ I drank iced tea instead~
Did you drink your morning coffee?

Korean: 다들 굿모닝!  난 지금 마시는 중...
English: Good morning everyone! I'm drinking now...

Korean: 아침에 잠 깨려고 아아 마셨다가 너무 추워서 뜨거운 물 부어서 마시고 있다 키키
English: I drank it to wake up in the morning, but it was too cold, so I poured hot water and drank it Kiki

Korean: 나도 아침에 걸었더니 덥길래 아이스로 탔는데 지금은 추워...
English: I also walked in the morning and it was hot so I rode on ice, but now it's cold...

Korean: 난 아직 뜨아는 잘 못 마시겠어 키키
English: I still can't drink hot water well Kiki

Korean: 아메리카노 잘 마셔 평소에? 시럽 없이?
English: Do you usually drink Americano? Without syrup?

Korean: 나는 잘 마셔! 뭐 옛날에는 좀 단 거 땡길 때 시럽 넣어서도 마시고 했는데 시럽 안 먹으려고 노력하는 편이라 요즘에는 그냥 마심
English: I drink well! Well, in the past, when I wanted something sweet, I would put syrup in it and drink it, but I try not to drink syrup, so these days, I just drink it.
Me too, without syrup!

Korean: 단 거 땡기면 그냥 아예 바닐라 라떼 이런 거 먹고~ 그 외에는 아메리카노가 좋아 키키
English: If I want something sweet, I just drink something like vanilla latte~ Other than that, I like Americano Kiki
Didn't your sister just say she doesn't eat it?

Korean: 아메리카노는 아아로 마시는데 거의 시럽 넣어서 마셔 키키 난 아직 덜 컸네 입맛이~
English: I drink Americano as an aa, but I usually drink it with syrup. Kiki, my taste buds are still young~
Have you tried almond syrup?

Korean: 아 아몬드 시럽 맛있다고 얘기는 들었는데 마셔보지는 못했어!
English: Oh, I've heard that almond syrup is delicious, but I've never tried it!
If you ask for it at any store, will they put it in for you...?
Are there other stores too?

Korean: 헤이즐넛 시럽이랑 맛은 비슷한 거 같았는데...
English: I think it tastes similar to hazelnut syrup...

Korean: 다른 데서는 많이 못 본 거 같아
English: I don't think I've seen it much anywhere else

Korean: 보통 바닐라 시럽이나 헤이즐넛, 카라멜 시럽 정도는 다 가지고 있는데말야 요 앞에 맘모스에서는 봤는데~
English: Usually they have vanilla syrup, hazelnut syrup, and caramel syrup, but I saw it at Mammoth before~

Korean: 아 내가 들은 게 헤이즐넛이었구나 키키 나는
English: Oh, what I heard was hazelnut Kiki I

Korean: 위가 약해서 엄청 연하게 마시는데 다들 어떻게 마셔?
English: I have a weak stomach so I drink very weak drinks. How do you all drink it?

Korean: 나도 위는 안 좋은데... 진한 거 좋아하는 편 ㅠㅠ
English: My stomach isn't that good either... but I like strong flavors ㅠㅠ

Korean: 보통 말 안 하면 투 샷 주더라~
English: If you don't say anything, they usually give you two shots~

Korean: 그냥 그 정도에 아몬드 시럽~! 으미~ 땡긴다
English: Just almond syrup~! Oh my~ I want some

Korean: 맞아 맞아 난 그래서 한 샷만 넣어 달라고 해 키키
English: Yeah yeah that's why I asked for just one shot Kiki

Korean: 산미 있는 커피 잘 마셔? 난 산미 싫어해서;
English: Do you like acidic coffee? I don't like acidic coffee;

Korean: 오.. 나두 산미 있는 거 싫어해...  대체로 다들 안 좋아하드라 언니는 어때?
English: Oh.. I don't like sour things either... Most people don't like them. What about you?

Korean: 나두 저번에 개인 커피 집인데 원두가 종류대로 있는 거야 커피콩 원산지 별로~ 추천해서 예가체프 먹어 봤는데 신 맛이었어 별로 별로 ㅠㅠ
English: I also went to a personal coffee shop last time, and they had coffee beans by type, but the coffee bean origins weren't that great~ I tried Yirgacheffe because it was recommended, but it was sour, not so great ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 그냥 고소하거나 그런 게 더 좋기는 하더라
English: I think it would be better to just sue or something like that
You like things like affogato, right?

Korean: 좋아하지~ 아이스크림 들어가니까 안 써서 키키
English: I like it~ I don't like it because it has ice cream in it, so I don't use it

Korean: 근데 커피 진해서 너한테는 별로이겠다~ 이건 어때?
English: But the coffee is strong so it might not suit you~ How about this?

Korean: 아포카토 완전 좋아함 키키 그래도  아이스크림이랑 섞여서 왕 맛있던디
English: I really like avocado Kiki, but it was really delicious mixed with ice cream.

Korean: 그치그치 맛있오 흐흐 그린티 같은 건 어때?
English: Yeah, yeah, it's delicious. Hehe, how about something like green tea?
Green tea latte and stuff like that

Korean: 나 녹차 맛 별로라 거의 안 먹어~
English: I don't like the taste of green tea, so I hardly ever drink it~

Korean: 아이스크림은 먹긴 하지만 키키 말하고 보니 나 진짜 어린이 입맛이다
English: I do eat ice cream, but now that I think about it, Kiki, I really have a childish palate.
So what if it's for children's taste!

Korean: 나는 녹차 말차 이런 거 다 좋아해! 근데 그린티 라떼 안 마신지 엄청 오래 됐다
English: I like green tea, matcha, and all that! But it's been a long time since I've had a green tea latte.
Do you like decorating your house or room?

Korean: 엄청 좋아하지~ 나 내 방 가구 혼자서 이리저리 막 옮기고 꾸미고 해 키키
English: I love it so much~ I move the furniture around in my room and decorate it by myself Kiki
Do you like it?

Korean: 난... 별로 관심이 없는 것 같아 키키
English: I don't think... I'm really interested Kiki

Korean: 그냥 놓은 대로 사는... 느낌?  불편하지 않으면?
English: Just living as is... what does it feel like? If it's not uncomfortable?

Korean: 키키 난 관심은 많은데 자주 옮기고 하지는 않는 듯 !
English: Kiki I'm very interested, but I don't seem to move often!

Korean: 예쁘게 해 놓은 거 구경하는 거 좋아해 이케아 가는 것도 재밌고~
English: I like looking at things that are nicely done. Going to IKEA is also fun~

Korean: 이케아 광명이었나 처음 생긴 데 못 가봤어~ ㅠㅠ 집에서 멀어 ㅠㅠ
English: I haven't been to the first IKEA in Gwangmyeong. It's far from my house.

Korean: 대신 집 주변에 꾸며 놓은 데 있으면 들어가서 구경해 그러다 보면 자꾸 방에 뭐가 늘어 ㅠㅠ
English: Instead, if you have something decorated around the house, go in and take a look, and you'll end up with more stuff piling up in your room ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 이케아 광명 진짜 가보고 싶은데 ㅠㅠ 진짜 이쁘게 잘 꾸며 놔서 구경하는 재미 있다고 하더라
English: Ah, I really want to go to IKEA Gwangmyeong ㅠㅠ I heard it's really nicely decorated and fun to look around.

Korean: 그럼 다들 뭐 방 색깔? 톤?도 맞춘 편이야?
English: So, everyone, what color and tone do you have for your rooms? Are they all the same?

Korean: 우리 집은 거의 화이트고 식탁이나 침대 같은 건 우드!
English: My house is almost entirely white, and things like the dining table and bed are made of wood!

Korean: 우리 집도 거의 화이트 우드 좀 섞여 있어~
English: My house also has a bit of white wood mixed in~

Korean: 내 방은 내가 좋아하는 하늘색으로 포인트 벽지 키키 예전에 포인트 벽지 유행할 때 한 거라~
English: My room has a sky blue point wallpaper that I like. I did it back when point wallpaper was popular.

Korean: 오오 신기하다 화이트랑 우드가 제일 꾸미기도 무난하고 약간 배신을 덜 하는 느낌인 것 같아
English: Oh wow, that's amazing. I think white and wood are the easiest to decorate with and they feel a little less betraying.

Korean: 맞아 제일 유행도 많이 안 타고~
English: That's right, it doesn't follow the trend very much~

Korean: 근데 진짜 첨에는 짐 많이 안 만들려고 최소한으로 해 놨는데 계속 하나 하나 늘어나는 거 같음
English: But at first, I tried to keep it to a minimum so as not to create too much luggage, but it seems like it keeps increasing one by one.

Korean: 맞아~예쁘다고 다 사면 안 돼ㅠㅠ 다 쓰레기 되더라~~
English: That's right~ You shouldn't buy everything just because it's prettyㅠㅠ They all become trash~~

Korean: 집에 스탠드나 이런 거 있어? 무드등이나?
English: Do you have a stand or something like that at home? Or a mood light?

Korean: 웅웅! 거실 불 그 하얀색 등? 별로 안 좋아해서 키키 대부분 스탠드 켜 놓고 있어~
English: Woof woof! The living room lights are white? I don't like them that much, so Kiki usually has the stand on~
I bought it at IKEA!

Korean: 작은 거 하나 있어~ 밤에 불 다 끄면 켜 놓는 거~ 밝은 거 좋아해서 나는 거의 불 켜 놓는 편!
English: There's a small thing~ I turn it on when I turn off all the lights at night~ I like bright things, so I usually leave the lights on!

Korean: 어둡게 해 놓고 스탠드 켜 놓는 거 좋아해?
English: Do you like it dark and the stand on?

Korean: 음 나는 어두운 거 좋아하기도 하고 잘 때 완전 캄캄해야 해서 무드등 안 써 키키
English: Well, I like the dark and I need it to be completely dark when I sleep, so I don't use mood lighting.
But the atmosphere was good ㅠㅠ

Korean: 응 나는 좋아해! 그래서 방에 있는 거는 타이머 되는 거 해놔 키키
English: Yeah I like it! So put something on a timer in your room Kiki

Korean: 누워서 좀 놀다가 잘 때쯤에 자동으로 꺼지게
English: It turns off automatically when you lie down and play for a while and then go to sleep.

Korean: 나도 잘 때는 내 방은 완전 깜깜~ 거실에만 켜 놓음 키키
English: When I sleep, my room is completely dark~ I only turn on the light in the living room Kiki

Korean: 요즘엔 무드등에 사진도 들어가고 습기도 되고 그런 아이템 되게 많더라
English: These days, there are a lot of mood lights that have photos and humidifiers and such items.

Korean: 오호 맞아 요즘에 진짜 이쁜 거 엄청 많더라 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, that's right, there are so many pretty things these days ㅠㅠ

Korean: 사진 들어가는 건 처음 들어보네 신기하다
English: This is the first time I've heard of photos being included. It's amazing.
Yeah, that's right, I'm hearing it for the first time too!
Do you have any plants growing inside your home?

Korean: 있었는데 요즘 기온도 괜찮고 벌레도 많이 생기는 때라 다 밖에 내놨어~
English: I had them, but the temperature is nice these days and there are a lot of bugs, so I put them all outside~

Korean: 그래서 집 대문 딱 열고 들어가면 꽃 향기가~ 스트레스 풀리는 느낌~
English: So, as soon as I open the front door and go in, the scent of flowers comes out~ It feels like my stress is relieved~

Korean: 거실에서 키우는 식물 있는데 아빠가 관리 하셔서 별 관심이 딱히 없음 키키
English: I have a plant growing in the living room, but my dad takes care of it so I don't really care about it. Kiki

Korean: 그냥 좀 새 싹이 나거나 하면 오오오! 하는 정도
English: Just when a new sprout comes out, I go, "Ohhh!"

Korean: 키키 우리 엄마는 베란다에다가 다육이 키우는데 엄청 많음...
English: Kiki, my mom grows a lot of succulents on the veranda...

Korean: 막 나눠주고 그러는 데도 계속 늘어나더라
English: Even though I kept handing it out, it kept increasing

Korean: 우와~ 다육이가 뭐야? 번식성이 엄청 좋은가 보네
English: Wow~ What is a succulent? It seems to have a very good reproductive capacity.

Korean: 그 다육 식물 해서 막 쪼꼬만한 식물들 집에서 작게 키우기 좋다고 하던데 잘 안 죽어서 인기가 좋은 거였나?
English: I heard that succulents are good for growing small plants at home, but is it popular because they don't die easily?

Korean: 자동차 중에 그냥 세단을 더 좋아해 아님 SUV를 더 좋아해?
English: When it comes to cars, do you prefer sedans or SUVs?

Korean: 예전엔 SUV 좋아했는데 요즘은 승차감이 좋은 승용차가 더 낫더라고~
English: I used to like SUVs, but these days I prefer passenger cars with a good ride quality~
Have your tastes changed, Kiki? What about you?

Korean: 음... SUV 가 조금 더 좋은 것 같아!
English: Hmm... I think SUV is a little better!
I like SUV better too!
Do you usually drive?

Korean: 놀러 다닐 때는 SUV가 더 좋구~
English: When going out to play, an SUV is better~

Korean: 나 평소에 운전 안 해 너는?
English: I don't usually drive. What about you?

Korean: 나는 어디 갈데 있으면 종종 끌고 다녀! 언니는?
English: I often drag you wherever I go! What about your sister?

Korean: 나도 뭐 평일에는 별로 쓸 일 없는데 주말에는 어디 갈 때 끌고 다녀~
English: I don't really have anything to do with it on weekdays, but I take it with me when I go out on weekends~
SUVs are more comfortable to drive~

Korean: SUV 운전하다가 갑자기 승용차 운전하면 진짜 당황스러워 앞이 안 보여 키키
English: If you are driving an SUV and then suddenly start driving a passenger car, you will be really confused and not be able to see ahead.

Korean: 오호 나는 suv만 몰아보고 승용차는 안 끌어봐서 모르겠어!
English: Oh, I don't know because I only drive SUVs and never cars!
Do you have a dream car?
The view is a bit different!

Korean: 나는 뭐 딱 하나 정해진 건 없는데... 레인지로버나 포르쉐 마칸? ^^ 하하 드림이니까...
English: I don't have anything in particular in mind... Range Rover or Porsche Macan? ^^ Haha, because it's a dream...
Because it's a dream, I'm going to Lincoln Kiki
Have you ever driven an open car?
I heard a lot of people ride it in Jeju Island and other places.

Korean: 웅! 작년에 제주도 가서 BMW Z4 렌트 해서 탔는데 날씨 좋아서 엄청 좋았어 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah! Last year I went to Jeju Island and rented a BMW Z4 and the weather was nice so it was really nice ㅠㅠ
It seems a bit like a servitude...

Korean: 난 뜨거운 햇빛이랑 바람 때문에 오픈카는 노노~
English: I don't like open cars because of the hot sun and wind.
Do you like it?

Korean: 아니 아니 안 타봤는데 우리 부모님도 제주도에서 한번 타보셨다는데 그냥 한번으로 족한 것 같다고 하셔서 키키
English: No, no, I haven't ridden it, but my parents said they rode it once in Jeju Island and that once was enough, so Kiki
They said it was a bit noisy even with the lid closed

Korean: 키키 그치 제주도니까 뚜껑 열었지 이런데서는 열지도 못 할 듯
English: Kiki, right? It's Jeju Island, so I opened the lid. I don't think I can open it here.

Korean: 밤에 영동대교 같은 데 지나가다 보면 있어~
English: If you pass by Yeongdong Bridge at night, you'll see it~

Korean: 주말에 건대만 가도 한 대씩은 보는 거 같음~
English: I think I see at least one if I go to Konkuk University on the weekend~

Korean: 근데 햇빛 때문에 얼굴이 빨갛던데 키키
English: But Kiki, your face is red because of the sunlight

Korean: 키키 어후 대단한 용기다 근데 서울에서 열고 다니면 매연 가스 다 마실 것 같은데
English: Kiki, wow, that's really brave, but if you open it and drive around in Seoul, you'll probably inhale all the exhaust fumes.

Korean: 그니까... 신호도 계속 걸릴 텐데 여는 의미가 있나 키키
English: So... is there any point in opening it when the signal will keep going on? Kiki
So~ it's self-satisfaction~

Korean: 근데 진짜 자차가 있으면 편할 것 같긴 한데 유지비가 많이 든다고 해서 걱정이에요 ㅠㅠ 살 계획은 없지만...
English: But I think it would be convenient to have my own car, but I'm worried because I heard it costs a lot to maintain it. I don't plan on buying one though...

Korean: 맞아... 차 사고 끝이 아니니까 ㅠㅠ
English: Right... It's not the end of a car accident ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그래도 나중에는 다들 드림카 탈 수 있으면 좋겠당
English: Still, I hope that everyone can drive their dream car later.
Right! What's your dream car?

Korean: 차를 많이 아는 편이 아니어서 드림카는 따로 없엉 ㅠㅠ
English: I don't know much about cars, so I don't have a dream car ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그냥 지금 있는 코나가 내 차였으면 좋겠음 키키
English: I just wish the Kona I have now was my car Kiki

Korean: 이 일 하기 전에는 어떤 업무로 일 했거나 하고 싶었어?
English: Before doing this job, what did you do or what did you want to do?

Korean: 아 나는 하고 싶은 일 찾느라 방황을 많이 한 거 같아~키키
English: Ah, I think I wandered around a lot trying to find what I wanted to do~Kiki

Korean: 근데 지금 일 마음에 들어 적성에도 맞는 거 같구 막연히 뭔지 딱 짚지는 못해도 이런 일이 하고 싶었던 거 같아
English: But I like my current job and it seems to fit my aptitude, and although I can't pinpoint exactly what it is, I think this is something I wanted to do.

Korean: 전 여기 들어오기 전까지 재택에서 정제 알바 했었어요 키키 그래서 뽑힌 것 같기도...
English: I worked part-time at a refining shop from home before I came here. Kiki, so I think I got picked...
Well, I'd like to try working in subtitled broadcasting too!
Would it be better if I worked from home?

Korean: 출퇴근 시간이 절약돼서 좋을 거 같애
English: I think it would be good because it would save commuting time.
Kiki, I'm curious too. How was working from home?
Yeah, it was good!

Korean: 그때도 공부했을 때니까 일 빨리 다 해 놓고 공부하고 그랬어서 병행하기에는 좋았는데 아무래도 계약직도 아니고 그냥 알바라는 점이 좀 차이가 큰 듯!
English: At that time, I was studying, so I was able to finish my work quickly and then study, so it was good to do both, but I think the fact that it wasn't a contract job and just a part-time job was a big difference!

Korean: 그거는 급여를 그러면 작업한 양대로 책정해서 주는건가?
English: So, is that salary determined based on the amount of work done?
It won't be a fixed salary like ours, right?

Korean: 재택은 그렇다더라고~ 작업한 시간당으로 계산! 맞지?
English: That's what they say about working from home~ They calculate it by the number of hours you work! Right?
It was per hour of work!

Korean: 그래서 그때 세상 빨리 해서 돈 많이 벌었죠... 하핫
English: So back then I made a lot of money by moving quickly in the world... haha

Korean: 키키 뭔가 좋을 거 같기도 하고 안 좋을 거 같기도 하다 뭐가 더 나은 거 같아? 재택이랑 출퇴근 중에
English: Kiki It seems like it would be good and it seems like it would be bad. What do you think is better? Working from home or commuting.

Korean: 그러게~ 나도 궁금하다 어떤 게 더 나았어?
English: Yeah~ I'm curious too. Which one was better?

Korean: 음 공부 병행 시작하면 재택이 좋긴 한데 그래도 경력 쌓을 수 있는 출퇴근이 더 좋은 것 같아!
English: Well, working from home is good if you start studying at the same time, but I think commuting to work is better because it allows you to build up your career!

Korean: 근데 지금은 재택 하고 싶음 키키 집 가고 싶... 흠흠
English: But now I want to work from home. I want to go to Kiki's house... ahem

Korean: 키키 나중에 재택도 기회 되면 해봐야겠다
English: Kiki I'll have to try working from home later when I get the chance.
Sister, are you thinking of doing it too?
If you have the chance, try it~
Are you thinking of doing it again?

Korean: 음... 하는 거 없으면 당연히 하겠... 죠...? 키키
English: Um... If there's nothing else to do, then of course I'll do it... right...? Kiki
What kind of part-time jobs have you had before?
I've only ever done tutoring part-time work~
Have you ever worked part-time?

Korean: 나는 보통 음식점에서 알바 했었어! 음료나 포장 이런 거!
English: I used to work part-time at restaurants! Drinks, packaging, things like that!

Korean: 오~ 나는 학원 알바랑 카페에서 해봤어!
English: Oh~ I worked part-time at a school and a cafe!
What subject did you take private tutoring?

Korean: 고1 문과 전체~ 외국에서 살다 온 애라서 그냥 전체적으로 봐줬어 학교 내신 때문에~
English: All of the liberal arts in the first year of high school~ Since she came from a foreign country, I just looked at her overall because of her school grades~

Korean: 과외도 많이 해 본 건 아니고 학교 선생님이 연결해 주셔서 그 아이 하나만~
English: I haven't done much tutoring, but my school teacher put me in touch with just that one kid~

Korean: 우와... 대박이당 난 능력이 된다고 해도 누구 가르치는 거 무서워서 못하겠어 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow... This is awesome. Even if I had the ability, I'd be scared of someone teaching me, so I couldn't do it. ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 내가 모르는 거 물어볼까봐 키키
English: Kiki, I'm going to ask you something I don't know
I've never had a tutor before

Korean: 맞아 나도 처음에는 걱정했는데 부탁받고 거절 못해서 하다보니까 그냥 저냥 괜찮았어 키키
English: Yeah, I was worried at first, but I couldn't refuse after being asked to do it, so it was just okay Kiki

Korean: 재미는 있었는데 나도 내 공부 때문에 오래 못했지~
English: It was fun, but I couldn't do it for long because of my studies~

Korean: 우선 지금 하는 일이라도 열심히 해야겠어요 ㅠㅠ 키키
English: First of all, I have to work hard at what I'm doing now ㅠㅠ Kiki

Korean: 주변에 카투사나 좀 특이한 데로 군대 갔다 온 사람 있어?
English: Is there anyone around you who served in the military as a KATUSA or in some other unusual place?
There are Marines and Air Force, but no KATUSAs~
Are you around?

Korean: 와 난 주변에 다 육군이랑 해군이어서 뭔가 특별한 게 없네;
English: Wow, there's nothing special about me since everyone around me is in the army and navy;

Korean: 우리 오빠는 자주포 정비병으로 신청해서 들어갔는데 그 부대에 자주포가 없었대 키키
English: My brother applied to be a self-propelled artillery mechanic and got in, but the unit didn't have any self-propelled artillery Kiki
Kiki, what was your position then?

Korean: 난 학교 다닐 때 몇 명 있었어 카투사!
English: I had a few KATUSA's when I was in school!

Korean: 진짜 뭐야 신청까지 해서 가셨는데 없는 데로 배치 받으신 거야? ㅠㅠ
English: Seriously, what the heck? You applied and went, but you got assigned to a place that didn't exist? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 카투사는 근무할 때 뭐가 어떻게 달라?
English: What is different about working as a KATUSA?

Korean: 웅웅 그래서 자기 말로는 완전 꿀빨았다고 하더라고;
English: Yeah, so that's why he said he got a total honey-suck;

Korean: 맘에 안 들어 고생 좀 하길 바랬는데 현실 남매
English: I didn't like it and wanted to have a hard time, but it's a real sibling relationship

Korean: 키키 원래 고생 좀 해야 돼라고 생각한 애들은 다 좋은데루 가더라...
English: Kiki: All the kids who I thought would have a hard time ended up going to good places...

Korean: 카투사 뭐 훈련까지는 나도 잘 모르는데 걍 미군들이랑 생활하고 그러니까 그래도 좀 자유로운 분위기 같던데?
English: I don't know much about KATUSA training, but it seems like they live with American soldiers and have a relatively free atmosphere.

Korean: 키키 오빠 군대 갈 때 안 울었어?
English: Kiki, didn't you cry when you went into the army?

Korean: 아 근데 논산 훈련소 들어갈 때는 살짝 울었어요!
English: Oh, but I cried a little when I entered Nonsan Training Center!

Korean: 약간 이렇게 많은 사람들이 매주 마다 군대에 간다는 거에 좀 놀래서...!
English: I'm a little surprised that so many people go to the military every week...!

Korean: 오... 난 그 누구도 보내면서 안 울어봤어 하하 언니는?
English: Oh... I've never cried while sending anyone off haha What about you, sis?

Korean: 난 통곡했는데 키키 나중에 신발이랑 옷 오잖아~ 그때도 그거 붙잡고 울고 키키
English: I cried, but Kiki later came with shoes and clothes~ Even then, I held on to them and cried Kiki
Was it your older brother or younger brother?

Korean: 남동생 군대 가면 누나들은 좀 울던데... 오빠... 음...
English: When my younger brother goes to the military, my older sisters cry a little... Oppa... um...
My sister is my brother too! To the point of crying...

Korean: 키키 사실 훈련소 따라 갈 때까지는 별 느낌 없었는데 마지막에 들어갈 때 다들 거수경례 하고 들어가잖아~ 그때부터 계속 울었어
English: Kiki Actually, I didn't feel anything until I followed them to the training camp, but when they finally went in, everyone saluted and went in~ I cried from then on.

Korean: 엄마도 울고 하니까 더 운 거 같아 키키
English: I think Kiki cried more because his mom was crying too

Korean: 오우... 신기 하당... 나는 그냥 오빠 머리 짧아 깎았는데 촉감이 좋더라고 그래서 그냥 계속 쓰담 쓰담 하면서 갔어 키키
English: Oh... That's amazing... I just cut my brother's hair short and it felt good so I just kept patting it Kiki

Korean: 키키 촉감 근데 무슨 느낌인지 알아... 은근 중독됨 키키
English: Kiki touch but I know what it feels like... I'm secretly addicted to Kiki
Are there any female soldiers around you?

Korean: 응 여군은 내가 가고 싶었지  키키
English: Yeah, I wanted to go, Kiki

Korean: 오 나도 정말 잠깐 가고 싶었는데 내가 윗몸 일으키기를 하나도 못해서 바로 포기했었어...
English: Oh, I really wanted to go for a bit too, but I gave up right away because I can't do a single sit-up...

Korean: 와 진짜? 나는 전혀... 생각도 안 해봄 키키
English: Wow, really? I never even thought about it Kiki

Korean: 언니 근데 뭔가 이미지가 잘 어울린다
English: Sister, but somehow the image suits you well

Korean: 키키 고래~? 내 학번에서 알티 지원을 받았으면 바로 갔지~
English: Kiki Whale~? If I had received support from my class, I would have gone right away~

Korean: 그니까 언니 이미지랑 뭔가 잘 어울려 키키
English: So, it matches well with my sister's image, Kiki

Korean: 여군 했어도 엄청 잘 했을 것 같아
English: I think she would have done really well even if she had been a female soldier
Yeah, it suits you well!

Korean: 근데 다들 체력이 약할 거 같긴 해
English: But I think everyone's stamina is weak

Korean: 키키 민간인으로는 괜찮은데 군인 하기에는 충분하지 않지 키키
English: Kiki is okay as a civilian, but not good enough to be a soldier. Kiki
Have you had any female soldiers around you?

Korean: 아니 주변에도 멀리 에도 하나도 없네 ㅠㅠ
English: No, there isn't one around or far away ㅠㅠ

Korean: 속기 자격증 말고 다른 자격증 딴 거 있어? 컴퓨터나 그런 거
English: Do you have any other certifications besides a shorthand certificate? Computer or something like that?

Korean: 컴퓨터 쪽으로는 모스랑 정보처리산업기사 있어~ 너는?
English: For computers, there's MOS and information processing industry engineer. What about you?

Korean: 우와 난 속기도 없고 아무것도 없엉 허허허
English: Wow I have no shame and nothing hahaha

Korean: 속기자격증 딴다고 해도  더 따야 하는 게 너무 많다 ㅠㅠ
English: Even if I get a shorthand license, there are still so many things I need to get ㅠㅠ

Korean: 다른 것도 따야 하는 거 많은가?
English: Are there many other things that need to be followed?

Korean: 나도 모스랑 정보처리! 컴활도 있긴 한데 1급은 못 땄어... 어렵...
English: I also have Morse and information processing skills! I have computer skills, but I didn't get a level 1... It's hard...
First of all, the most important thing is the shorthand~ ㅠㅠ

Korean: 음 약간 컴활도 따야 하고 비서 자격증도 있으면 좋을 것 같고 워드도 따야 하고...
English: Well, I need to get some computer skills, and it would be good to get a secretarial license, and I also need to get Word...

Korean: 이거 3개는 좀 기본으로 다들 따는 것 같더라고...?
English: I think everyone follows these three as basics...?
Ah, there is no word...

Korean: 아직 여유 있는 나이니까 차근차근 하면 되지~
English: Since you're still at an age where you can take your time, just take it one step at a time~

Korean: 맞아~ 너무 조급하게 생각 안 해도 될 듯~
English: Right~ I don't think you need to think about it so hastily~
Do you have a secretarial license?

Korean: ㅠㅠ 뭔가 자꾸 조급하네요... 빨리 빨리 해야 한다는 생각이 자꾸 들어서 끄악
English: ㅠㅠ I keep feeling impatient... I keep thinking that I have to hurry up and do it quickly.

Korean: 비서 자격증은 속기 자격증은 있으면 실기 면제라고 하더라고요!
English: They say that if you have a secretary's license and a shorthand license, you are exempt from the practical test!

Korean: 아 속기 자격증도 해당되는 거야? 글쿠낭!
English: Oh, does that apply to shorthand certification too? Gulkunang!

Korean: 나는 컴활 있어서 그것도 실기 면제 해주더라 키키
English: I have computer skills, so they exempted me from the practical test. Kiki

Korean: 키키 비서 자격증이라는 게 있는 건 알지~ 키키 가지고 있냐는 뜻이었어 키키
English: Kiki, you know there's something called a secretary license~ Kiki, I meant, do you have one? Kiki

Korean: 아아아 없어유 키키 비서 자격증 면제 되는 거 많으니까 나중에 따려구요!
English: Aaaah, no, there are many things that Kiki's secretary license is exempt from, so I'll get it later!

Korean: 난 있어! 그래서 컴활 있어서 실기를 면제 해줬다구~~
English: I have it! That's why I was exempted from the practical test because I have computer skills~~
Oh~ cool cool~
Are there any other qualifications you would like to obtain?

Korean: 오오오 흠 개인적으로 따고 싶은 거는 한국사 자격증!
English: Ohhhh, personally, what I want to get is a Korean history certificate!

Korean: 나는 자격증은... 딱히 없고 그냥 외국어나 꾸준히 배워보고 싶은데 맘처럼 안 돼 키키
English: I don't have any qualifications... I just want to study a foreign language steadily, but it doesn't work out the way I want.

Korean: 나도 국사 좋아하는데~ 외국어 배우고 싶다~
English: I like Korean history too~ I want to learn a foreign language~

Korean: 난 요즘 일드 보니까 일어 다시 하고 싶다~ 피아노도 다시 배우고 싶고~
English: These days, when I watch Japanese dramas, I want to learn Japanese again~ I also want to learn piano again~

Korean: 헐 나도 피아노도 배우고 싶고 영어 회화도 하고 싶고 배드민턴도 동호회 이런 거 하고 싶고 수영도 배우고 싶고... 욕망 덩어리네
English: Wow, I also want to learn piano, English conversation, badminton, and swimming... I'm full of desires.

Korean: 키키 다들 하고 싶은 거 많네 열정 부자~
English: Kiki, you all have a lot of things you want to do, you're so passionate~

Korean: 나도 이것저것 배우고 싶은 건 많은데 시간도 없고 귀찮기도 하고 키키 시험 끝나고 하나씩 해보자
English: There are a lot of things I want to learn, but I don't have time and it's annoying. I'll try to do them one by one after the Kiki exam.

Korean: 좋지~ 일단 시험 끝나면 추석 있으니까 행복 행복~
English: Alright~ Once the exams are over, there's Chuseok so I'm happy, happy~

Korean: 꺄아아 두 분은 시험 보시나요? 어디서 보세요?
English: Wow, are you two taking the test? Where?

Korean: 나는 경복! 상공회의소 한 번도 안 가봐서 그냥 가본데루 ㅠㅠ
English: I'm Kyungbok! I've never been to a chamber of commerce before, so I just went there ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나는 상공~ 나도 거기서만 해 봤네~
English: I'm in the sky~ I've only done it there~

Korean: 오오 언니는 상공에서 볼 수도 있겠당! 키키
English: Oh, I can see you from above, Sister! Kiki

Korean: 부모님이랑 최근에 여행 간 적 있어~?
English: Have you been on a trip with your parents recently?

Korean: 최근이라고 해도 1년 전이야 ㅠㅠ 코로나 때문에~
English: Even though it's recent, it was a year ago ㅠㅠ Because of Corona~
Kiki Hot Springs in Daejeon

Korean: 헉 나는 그래도 엄마랑 속초 놀러 왔었다!
English: Oh my, I came to Sokcho to play with my mom!
Even though I was almost stuck at the resort...!

Korean: 나도 속초가 마지막! 그것도 꽤 됐어 ㅠㅠ
English: Sokcho is my last too! It's been quite a while ㅠㅠ
Do you and your mom often go out to play together?
I often go out with my mom~

Korean: 코로나 전에는 여기저기 많이 갔었는데~ 아쉽다 진짜 ㅠㅠ
English: Before Corona, I went to many places~ It's really a shame ㅠㅠ
I used to go there often with my mom too!

Korean: 엄마 아빠 두 분다 여행을 즐겨 하셔서! 요즘에는 좀 힘들지만 ㅠㅠ
English: Mom and Dad both enjoy traveling! It's a bit difficult these days though ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그래도 두 분은 호캉스라도 하시기는 하더라!
English: But the two of you did go on a vacation though!

Korean: 그치 나도 딱 엄마랑 작년 초에 둘이 싱가포르 여행 가려고 알아보던 참에 코로나 터짐... 부들부들
English: Right, I was looking into going on a trip to Singapore with my mom early last year when the coronavirus broke out... I was shaking.

Korean: 나도 난 곧 이모 보러 가려고 했는데 ㅠㅠ
English: I was planning to go see my aunt soon too ㅠㅠ

Korean: 코로나 때문에 가려다가 못 간 곳 있어?
English: Is there a place you couldn't go because of Corona?

Korean: 원래 저 저번 주에 친구들이랑 선재도 놀러 가려고 했는데 갑자기 코로나 확진자 막 2천명 되고 그래서 당연하지만 취소 했습니다 ㅠㅠ
English: Originally, I was going to go to Seonjae Island with my friends last week, but suddenly the number of confirmed cases of COVID-19 reached 2,000, so of course, we canceled ㅠㅠ

Korean: 선재도? 그건 어딨는 거지 첨 들어 본당!
English: Seonjaedo? Where is that? This is the first time I've heard of it!

Korean: 그러게 선재도... 우리나라에는 참 섬이 많아 키키
English: That's right, Seonjae... There are so many islands in our country, Kiki
Where are you? Introduce me~

Korean: 선재도 그 인천이라고는 하는데 경기도 쪽인가 봐요!
English: Seonjae-do is said to be in Incheon, but I think it's in Gyeonggi-do!

Korean: 근데 보통 가족들이랑은 속초나 뭐 제주도...이런 가던 곳을 가지 새로운 곳은 잘 안 가게 되는 듯...!
English: But I usually go to places I've always been to, like Sokcho or Jeju Island with my family... and I don't really go to new places...!

Korean: 맞아 또 너무 먼데 까지 가기에는 일정을 길게 잡아야 되고 가족들 시간 맞추기도 어렵고 하니까~
English: Yes, it's too far, so I have to make a long schedule and it's hard to coordinate with my family's schedule~

Korean: 맞아 맞아~그리고 가족이랑은 모험하기가 그래서 나도 예약할 때 항상 묵던 데 예약하게 돼~
English: Yeah, that's right~ And it's fun to go on adventures with family, so when I make a reservation, I always make a reservation at the place I stay at~

Korean: 그리고 뭐랄까 또 부모님이랑 하는 여행이니까 새로운 곳 도전하기가 걱정이랄까
English: And what should I say, since it's a trip with my parents, I'm worried about trying a new place.

Korean: 괜히 갔다가 별로 안 좋아하실 수도 있고 해서 그냥 무난하게 쉬다가 오는 듯
English: I think I'll just go there and rest and come back, because I don't think I'll like it if I go there for no reason.

Korean: 그치 가족 여행 가면 보통 계획 짜는 편이야?
English: When you go on a family trip, do you usually make plans?
Your parents will just follow you?

Korean: 응 나는 그래 그것도 주로 오빠가 짜곤 했는데 요즘은 내 차지 된 듯...
English: Yeah, I do that too. My brother used to do it mostly, but it seems like it's mine these days...

Korean: 음 나는 해외여행이면 거의 무조건 내가 짰었고 국내 여행이면... 사실 엄마나 아빠가 많이 아셔서 나는 그냥 이쁜 카페 정도만 알아보는?
English: Well, when it comes to overseas travel, I almost always plan it myself, and when it comes to domestic travel... Actually, my mom and dad know a lot, so I just look for pretty cafes?

Korean: 오 글쿠나 우리는 아빠가 포함되면 아빠가 막 가고 싶은 데가 있고 그 외에는 내가 가자고 하는 듯!
English: Oh my goodness, when Dad is involved, there are places he wants to go and other times it's like I'm the one who wants to go!

Korean: 근데 계획 짜면 보통 엄마는 좋아하시는데 아빠는 덜 만족하시는 듯~ 너희 집은 어때?
English: But when you make plans, mom usually likes it, but dad seems less satisfied. How is your house?

Korean: 음... 대체적으로 우리는 항상 가던 곳만 가서 아빠는 그냥 여행 와서 힐링 하는 거 자체에 만족스러워 하시고 엄마도 그냥 그거 자체에 만족스러워 하시는?
English: Um... Generally, we just go to the same places we always go, and my dad is satisfied with just traveling and healing, and my mom is satisfied with that itself?

Korean: 쓰읍 너무 같은 곳만 가나 키키
English: Kiki, you only go to the same places

Korean: 키키 그러면 그래도 계획 짜느라 힘들진 않으니까 좋은 거지~
English: Kiki: Well then, it's good because it doesn't have to be hard to plan~

Korean: 우리 아빠는 맛있는 거랑 술만 있으면 만족 키키
English: My dad is satisfied with just delicious food and alcohol.

Korean: 우리 아빠는 여기저기 보는 거 좋아하셔~ 힐링 보다 체험 키키
English: My dad likes to look around~ He likes to experience things more than healing

Korean: 우리 아빠는 등산... 있으면 좋아하시는 듯 키키
