English: My dad seems to like hiking... Kiki
Do you have any romantic ideas about weddings?

Korean: 야외 결혼식이나 소규모 웨딩이나 그런 거
English: An outdoor wedding or a small wedding or something like that.
Ah, I wanted a small outdoor wedding~
I saw that place when I was in high school ㅠㅠ
It disappeared a while ago there ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 야외 결혼식 로망 있었는데 조명 없다고 사람들이 별로라고 막 그러는데 키키
English: I also had a romantic idea for an outdoor wedding, but people kept saying it wasn't very good because there were no lights. Kiki

Korean: 그래도 로망이니까 난 아직도 야외 결혼식 로망이야
English: But it's still romantic, so I still romanticize an outdoor wedding.

Korean: 맞아 조명 ㅠㅠ 내 친구 그래서 야외에서 한 애 있는데 볼터치를 엄청 빡! 이렇게 하드라 키키
English: Right, the lighting ㅠㅠ My friend is like that, so he has one outside and the bolt touch is really strong! It's like this, Kiki

Korean: 날씨만 좋으면 야외가 진짜 예쁜 거 같애... 비 오면... 문제지만
English: I think the outdoors is really pretty when the weather is nice... but if it rains... that's a problem

Korean: 내 친구는 이번에 제주도에서 했는데 혹시 날씨 안 좋을 수도 있어서 야외랑 실내랑 같이 준비하더라~
English: My friend went to Jeju Island this time, and he prepared both indoor and outdoor activities in case the weather was bad.

Korean: 아 맞아 맞아 그 유튜브에 소근커플도 결혼식 야외에서 했는데 그 계약할 때 보니까 혹시나 비 오면 실내에서 하는 걸로 계약하더라고
English: Oh, that's right, that's right. The Sogun couple on YouTube had their wedding outside, but when I looked at the contract, they had a contract to have it indoors in case it rained.
That's right, you need to have a plan B...

Korean: 요즘은 강제 소규모지만 좀 작게 아기자기하게 하는 거 예쁜 거 같음
English: These days, it's forced small-scale, but I think it's pretty to make it a little smaller and more cute.

Korean: 난 꽃 좋아해서 소규모로 디귿 모양으로 테이블 배치해 놓고 꽃으로 주변 다 꾸미고 싶었어 행진 이런 거 안 하고~
English: I like flowers, so I wanted to arrange tables in a small square shape and decorate the surrounding area with flowers, without doing anything like a parade~

Korean: 아 맞아 ㅠㅠ 결혼식장에 꽃이 많고 이쁠수록 진짜 이쁘더라고...
English: Oh right ㅠㅠ The more flowers there are at the wedding hall, the prettier it is...

Korean: 나는 결혼식에서 드레스 잡아주는 알바 했었는데 그때 약간 좀 신랑 신부 찍어내는 느낌 받았어서 나는 결혼식 안하고 그 돈으로 여행 할 거야!  했는데 좀 어린 생각이었음 키키 지금은 하고 싶어
English: I worked part-time at a wedding, holding dresses, and at that time, I felt like I was taking a picture of the bride and groom, so I thought I would not get married and travel with that money! I was a little young, but now I want to do it.

Korean: 우와 그런 알바도 했어? 신기하다 키키
English: Wow, you did that kind of part-time job too? That's amazing Kiki

Korean: 그냥 드레스샵 이모님이 해주시는 건 줄!
English: I thought the dress shop lady would just do it for me!

Korean: 나도 예식장에서 막 3,40분 간격으로 찍어내듯이 하는 거는 넘 싫어 ㅠㅠ
English: I also really hate it when they take pictures at wedding halls every 30 or 40 minutes ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 그거 싫어 웨딩 사진도 마찬가지고~ 근데 또 안 하는 건 너무 서운할 것 같고 좀 색다른 방법 없을까?
English: I hate that too, and so do wedding photos~ But I think it would be too sad not to do it again, so isn't there a different way?

Korean: 그래서 이제 스몰웨딩이 인기였던 거 아닐까
English: So maybe that's why small weddings are popular now?

Korean: 그냥 부모님 수금의 목적이 아니라 정말 나와 내 지인들이랑 온전하게 축하 받고 싶으니까!
English: It's not just for the purpose of collecting money from my parents, but I really want to celebrate with my friends and I!

Korean: 맞아 그래서 야외 결혼식도 많이들 하고 싶어하는 거 같애!
English: That's right, I think that's why many people want to have outdoor weddings!

Korean: 근데 은근히 그동안 뿌린 돈 다시 받고 싶어하시는 부모님들도 많으시더라고...
English: But there are many parents who secretly want to get back the money they have spent...

Korean: 키키 맞아 너무 많이 다니셔가지고 키키
English: Kiki, you're right, you've been going around too much Kiki

Korean: 난 그래서 처음부터 얘기했어 나 때문에는 그러시지 말라고 키키 나 축의금 안 받는다고~
English: That's why I told you from the beginning, Kiki, don't do that because of me. I don't accept condolence money~

Korean: 저는 그냥 물어봤었는데 아빠는 막 에이 자기는 막 상관 없다고 하셨는데 엄마는 받아야겠다고 키키
English: I just asked and my dad said he didn't care but my mom said she had to take it

Korean: 키키 그럴 수 있지 그래도 결국에는 하고 싶은 대로 하라고 하시겠지만~
English: Kiki: That may be true, but in the end, you'll be told to do whatever you want~
What about the dress? Is there a style you want to wear?

Korean: 예전에는 드레스도 별로 입고 싶지 않았는데 점점 입고 싶어지더라~ 튜브탑으로~
English: I used to not really want to wear dresses, but I started to want to wear them more and more~ with tube tops~

Korean: 흠... 난 그냥 제일 기본적인 거 입고 싶어!
English: Hmm... I just want to wear the most basic things!
Mermaid is a bit shy... Kiki

Korean: 키키 머메이드는 키 큰 사람들이 확실히 잘 어울리더라~
English: Kiki Mermaid definitely looks good on tall people~
And it has to be dry... Kiki

Korean: 결혼 전에 다이어트 괜히 하는 게 아닌 것 같음...
English: I don't think dieting before marriage is a waste of time...
Did your sister have a wedding ceremony?

Korean: 아니 난 없었어! 그냥 혼인서약서 읽고 양가 아버지가 편지랑 성혼 선언문 읽어주고 그렇게 했음
English: No, I wasn't there! I just read the marriage contract and the fathers of both families read the letter and the marriage declaration and that's it.

Korean: 어디서 했어? 어떤 웨딩 드레스 입었어?
English: Where did you get it done? What wedding dress did you wear?
I have so many questions~ What about the congratulatory song?
Oh, a lot of people do that these days.

Korean: 나도 나중에 하면 그냥 그렇게 하고 싶긴 한데 양가 아버님 편지가 참 걱정 키키
English: I also want to do it like that later, but I'm worried about the letters from my father-in-law.

Korean: 어렸을 때 햄스터 키워본 적 있어?
English: Did you ever raise a hamster when you were young?

Korean: 없음~ 강아지 말고는 키워 본 적  없어~ 너는?
English: None~ I've never raised anything other than a puppy~ What about you?

Korean: 나도 햄스터는 없어 근데 친구는 한 3마리 키웠었어
English: I don't have a hamster either, but my friend had about 3.

Korean: 약간 주변에서는 키우는 사람 한 명씩은 있지 않았어?
English: Wasn't there at least one person raising one around you?

Korean: 웅웅 있었지~ 나도 한 마리 키워보긴 했어!
English: Yeah, there was one~ I tried raising one too!

Korean: 골든햄스터였나... 무튼 보통 햄스터보다는 되게 빠른 애였어
English: It was a golden hamster... Anyway, it was much faster than the average hamster.
There are different types of hamsters~

Korean: 종 이름 되게 귀엽다 골든 햄스터~
English: The name of the species is so cute, Golden Hamster~

Korean: 오오 그러네 햄스터에도 종류가 있을 거라는 생각은 안 해봤네 귀여워 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, I see. I never thought there would be different types of hamsters. They're so cute.

Korean: 그 햄스터 볼 이런 거에 다가 넣어 놓고 돌아다니게 한 적도 있어?
English: Have you ever put your hamster in a ball or something and let it wander around?
What is a hamster ball? I've never heard of it before...
Oh, is there something like that? What is it?

Korean: 햄스터들 케이지 밖에 그냥 나가면 실수로 밟거나 막 그럴 수 있으니까 동그란 투명 플라스틱 공 같은 거에다가 넣어서 막 자기 혼자 돌아다닐 수 있는?
English: If hamsters go outside their cages, they might accidentally step on something or something, so you can put them in something like a round, clear plastic ball so they can run around on their own?

Korean: 그런 거 있더라고? 웹툰에서 봤어 키키
English: There was something like that? I saw it in a webtoon Kiki

Korean: 우와 키키 귀엽다 키키 얼핏 보면 그냥 공 굴러다니는 거네? 키키 넘 귀여워 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow Kiki is cute. At first glance, Kiki is just a ball rolling around? Kiki is so cute.
They say they protect hamsters, but will hamsters like it?
Kiki, I think you'll be frustrated

Korean: 아 근데 약간 자기 맘대로 달릴 수 있는 거라 산책하듯이! 다들 좋아하던디
English: Oh, but since you can run as you please, it's like taking a walk! Everyone likes it.

Korean: 그 케이지 안에만 있다가 나오면 좋아할 거 같애!
English: I think you'd like it if you just stayed in that cage and came out!
What else does a hamster like?

Korean: 아 진짜 해바라기씨 이런 거 좋아해?
English: Oh, do you really like sunflower seeds and things like that?

Korean: 응 해바라기씨를 밥으로 먹었던 거 같은데?
English: Yeah, I think I ate sunflower seeds with rice?

Korean: 다른 거는 뭐 줬는지 기억은 안나... 초딩 때라
English: I don't remember what else I gave him... I was in elementary school.
Have you ever raised a chick?
In the past, they used to sell a lot of it in front of elementary schools~

Korean: 파는 거는 많이 봤는데 약간 당연히 살 생각을 안하고 그냥 지나침 키키
English: I saw a lot of them for sale, but I didn't really think about buying them and just passed by Kiki

Korean: 키키 나두... 나는 새 안 좋아해서 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki, me too... I don't like birds ㅠㅠ
Have you ever raised your sister?

Korean: 아니~ 난 금방 죽는다고 해서 못 키웠어~
English: No~ I couldn't raise it because I thought I'd die soon~
I think my heart will hurt too much

Korean: 아 맞아 맞아 ㅠㅠ 근데 약간 전설처럼 닭까지 키웠다 이런 얘기 많던데
English: Oh, that's right, that's right ㅠㅠ But there were a lot of stories about how they even raised chickens, like a legend.
Never been around Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 그런 얘기도 자주 듣기는 들었어
English: Kiki, that's right, I've heard that kind of story often.

Korean: 앵무새 같이 예쁜 애들이어도 새는 너무 징그러워...
English: Even though they are cute like parrots, birds are so disgusting...

Korean: 나도 비둘기 등등 조류 별로 ㅠㅠ
English: I don't really like birds like pigeons and such ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 푸드덕거리는 거 너무 싫어 ㅠㅠ
English: I hate fussing too ㅠㅠ

Korean: 캠핑 가거나 이런 야외 활동 좋아해~?
English: Do you like camping or other outdoor activities?

Korean: 자고 오는 건 별로 안 좋아하고 그냥 당일치기로 가는 건 언제든지 오케이~
English: I don't really like to sleep over, so just going for a day trip is always okay~

Korean: 오우 나는 시러... 실내가 좋아 키키
English: Oh I love it... indoors Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 그래? 왜 벌레 있고 그래서?
English: Kiki Oh really? Why are there bugs and such?
Indoors... Where do you like to play?

Korean: 음... 아 여기 캠핑 좋아하는 사람이 있나 모르겠는데 난 그냥 굳이 밖에서 요리하고 자는 이러는 게 불편하고 쉬는 느낌이 안 들어서... 싫어...
English: Um... I don't know if there's anyone here who likes camping, but I just don't like cooking and sleeping outside because it's uncomfortable and doesn't feel like I'm resting...

Korean: 약간 노동 하는 느낌... 일 것 같아 키키
English: I feel like I'm working a little bit... Kiki

Korean: 해보지는 않았지만! 벌레도 큰 이유 중에 하나고!  실내 보통 리조트나 호텔이라...
English: I haven't tried it yet! Bugs are one of the big reasons! Indoors, usually in resorts or hotels...

Korean: 확실히 잠자고 씻기에는 리조트나 호텔이 편하긴 한데...
English: Of course, resorts and hotels are more convenient for sleeping and washing...
That camping experience has its own unique flavor!

Korean: 야외에서 맛있는 거 먹고 불멍도 때리고 ~
English: Eat something delicious outside and have a fire pit~

Korean: 불멍 물멍이 확실히 스트레스 풀리긴 하지~
English: Bullmong and watermong definitely relieve stress~

Korean: 나도 씻는 거 불편해서 자고 오는 건 싫어해~ 근데 자연 속에 있는 느낌이 너무 좋아!
English: I also hate sleeping in because it's inconvenient to wash up. But I love the feeling of being in nature!

Korean: 오호 내가 불멍은 안 해봐서 그 맛을 모르나 보네!
English: Oh, I guess I don't know what it tastes like because I've never tried it!
So do you usually use glamping?
No I'll just go!
Sleeping in the car, sleeping in the tent ~

Korean: 나도 그냥 있는 거 가져가서 있다가 오는데~
English: I'll just take what I have and come back later~

Korean: 음식은 끓여 먹기 편하게 포장된 거 있어서 그거 사 가지고 가고~
English: The food is packaged in a way that makes it easy to boil and eat, so buy that and take it with you~

Korean: 요즘에는 음식 자체가 끓여 먹을 수 있는 알루미늄 그릇에 팔더라 하하
English: These days, they sell food in aluminum containers that you can boil and eat haha

Korean: 오오오 뭐야 다들 캠핑 많이 했었구나아
English: Oh wow, what is this? You all have been camping a lot.

Korean: 차에서 자는 거면 그 차 뒷좌석 눕혀서 이불 깔고 자는 거야?
English: If you sleep in the car, do you just lie down in the back seat of the car and sleep under a blanket?

Korean: 응응 다 눕히고 이불이나 침낭 이런 거 깔고 자!
English: Yeah, lie down and spread out a blanket or sleeping bag or something and go to sleep!

Korean: 근데 확실히 불편하긴 해... 자고 일어나면 누구한테 씨게 얻어 맞은 거 같은 느낌 ^^
English: But it's definitely uncomfortable... When I wake up, I feel like I got beaten up by someone ^^

Korean: 키키 그게 여름에는 여름대로 덥다고 새벽에는 서늘하고 겨울에는 춥고 으~
English: Kiki, it's hot in the summer, cool in the morning, and cold in the winter. Ugh~

Korean: 오호... 신기해... 뭔가 미지의 세계야 키키
English: Oh... how amazing... this is an unknown world, Kiki

Korean: 그러면 불 피우는 것도 다 스스로 해야 하는 거지?  잘 피우는 편이야?
English: So you have to start the fire yourself? Are you good at it?

Korean: 응 다 스스로 ! 키키 근데 난 내가 해본 적은 없어... 다 남편이...하하
English: Yeah, all by myself! Kiki, but I've never done it myself... My husband did it all... haha

Korean: 요즘에는 불에다가 넣는 건데 불이 알록달록하게 변하게 하는 그런 것도 있어!
English: These days, you put them in fire, and there are even things that make the fire change into colorful colors!

Korean: 요즘은 진짜 좋은 거 많이 나왔던데~
English: There are so many really good ones coming out these days~

Korean: 근데 나는 안 가지고 있어 키키 그냥 기본적인 것만 있지~
English: But I don't have Kiki, I just have the basics~
My dad likes that kind of thing
Wow, that's crazy. The lights are so colorful...

Korean: 그럼 설거지는 어떻게 해야 해? 따로 씻을 수 있는 곳이 있나?
English: Then how do I wash the dishes? Is there a separate place to wash them?

Korean: 개수대가 있어서 거기서 설거지하고 좀 괜찮은 캠핑장은 설거지하고 이럴 수 있는 데가 따로 있어!
English: There is a sink where you can wash your dishes. There are some nice campsites where you can wash your dishes and other things!
Warm water also comes out

Korean: 나는 그것도 귀찮아서 대부분 일회용품 쓰거나 아니면 그냥 가져올 때도 있고~
English: I find that annoying too, so I mostly just use disposable ones, or sometimes I just bring my own~

Korean: 오홍 내가 간다고 하면 나도 언니처럼 그냥 일회용품 쓸 것 같아
English: Oh, if I go, I think I'll just use disposable products like my sister

Korean: 그럼 산이랑 바다 중에 어디를 더 선호해?
English: So, which do you prefer, the mountains or the sea?

Korean: 나는 둘 다 좋긴 한데... 흠 그래도 바다가 약간 더 좋긴 하다
English: I like them both... Hmm, but I like the ocean a little better

Korean: 나는 캠핑이랑 상관없이 산 더 좋아해~
English: I like mountains more, regardless of camping~

Korean: 아아악 난 아무리 그래도 실내가 더... 좋은 듯 하하
English: Aaaah, no matter what, I think I like indoors better... haha
Did you go to the arcade often when you were young?
I went to high school often, Kiki

Korean: 영화관 가면 꼭 먼저 오락실 들렀다가 영화 봤어~
English: When I go to the movie theater, I always stop by the arcade first and then watch the movie~

Korean: 오락실은 딱히 없었는데 그냥 분식점에 딸려 있는? 그런 거는 있었는데 나는 간 적이 없네 키키
English: There wasn't really an arcade, but there was one attached to a snack shop? I've never been there. Kiki

Korean: 분식점에 오락실이 있어? 가게 앞에 기계 한 두대 있는 그거 말하는 건가...?
English: Is there an arcade in the snack shop? You mean the one with one or two machines in front of the store...?
What did you usually do when you went to the mask?

Korean: 총 쏴서 죽이는 거랑 펌프랑 그 탁구대 같이  생겼는데 손으로 볼 못 들어가게 막는...이름을 모르겠네 그런 거~
English: Something that kills by shooting a gun, and something that looks like a pump and a ping-pong table, but you can block it with your hand... I don't know the name of it~

Korean: 아아아 그 오락실! 그거는 학교 주변에 없어서 거의 안 갔어 ㅠㅠ
English: Ahhh, that arcade! There's no one around the school, so I rarely go there ㅠㅠ

Korean: 한 두 번 가본 적 있긴 한데 그냥 친구들 음악에 맞춰서 북 치는 그런 거 구경하거나 했다 키키
English: I've been there once or twice, but I just watched friends beating drums to the beat of music.

Korean: 아 그 탁구대 같은 거는 납작한 플라스틱? 키키
English: Oh, that ping-pong table thing is a flat plastic thing? Kiki

Korean: 그거 밀어서 넣는 거 말하는 거지...? 나도 이름을 모르겠네
English: Are you talking about the push-in thing...? I don't know the name.

Korean: 어 그거 키키 그거 하다가 영화 시간 늦은 적도 있었지~
English: Oh, I was doing that Kiki, and I was late for the movie once~

Korean: 버디버디 같은 것도 있고 오토바이 타는 것도 있고 재밌는 거 많았는데~
English: There were things like buddy buddy and riding a motorcycle, and there were a lot of fun things~

Korean: 아 맞아 그거는 몇 번 해 봤다 키키
English: Oh right, I've done that a few times Kiki

Korean: 진짜 별거 아닌 건데 세상 승부욕 생겨서 어떻게든 넣고 어떻게든 막겠다고  키키
English: It's really nothing special, but I got competitive and tried to block it somehow.

Korean: 키키 그치 그거 재밌음 버디버디 같은 게 뭐야?
English: Kiki, right? That's fun. What's something like buddy buddy?

Korean: 고전 게임 중에 버디버디 안 해 봤어?
English: Have you ever played the classic game Buddy Buddy?

Korean: 풍선 터뜨리는 거~ 테트리스 있던 시절에 있던 거기는 한데...
English: Popping balloons~ It was there back in the days when Tetris existed...

Korean: 혹시 버블 버블 얘기 하는 건가...?
English: Are you talking about Bubble Bubble...?

Korean: 그 공룡 두 마리 나와서 뻐끔 뻐끔 거리는 거?
English: Those two dinosaurs come out and pout?

Korean: 뭐지... 보글보글 아니고...? 키키 구슬 붙여 가지고 터트리는 거... 온갖 이름 다 나오네
English: What is it... It's not bubble bubble...? It's something where you stick Kiki marbles on and pop them... All sorts of names are coming out.

Korean: 맞아 그거 키키 내가 볼 때는 애니팡의 시조새~
English: Yes, that's Kiki. In my opinion, it's the ancestor of Anipang~
What's the exact name Kiki?

Korean: 아아 보글보글 키키 이거랑 그 스노우브라더스 그것도 했는데
English: Ah, Bubble Bubble Kiki, I did this and that Snow Brothers too
What is the progenitor of Anipang?
I haven't played Anipang...

Korean: 아 보글보글인지 그게 애니팡의 시조새라고 키키
English: Ah, Bubble Bubble, that's the ancestor of Anipang, Kiki

Korean: 보글보글 엔딩이 그 첫 번째 보스 죽이면 자기네들 저주가 풀려서 인간으로 변하고 두 번째 보스 죽이면 여자친구도 풀려나고 마지막 보스 죽으면 부모님도 저주에서 풀려나는 그런 거래 감동쓰...
English: The ending of Bubble Bubble is so touching... if you kill the first boss, your curse will be lifted and you'll turn into a human, if you kill the second boss, your girlfriend will be released, and if you kill the last boss, your parents will be released from the curse...

Korean: 오와... 그런 스토리가 있는 건 줄 몰랐네 키키
English: Wow... I didn't know there was a story like that Kiki
Is your name Bubble Bubble?
Oh, so there's a story to that too?

Korean: 끝까지 못 갔나 보다~ 본 적이 없네
English: I guess you didn't make it to the end~ I've never seen it before
Yeah, I looked it up and it's Bubble Bubble, Kiki

Korean: 나도 당연히 끝까지 간 적이 없었는데 한때 보글보글 결말 해 가지고 돌아다니더라고 키키
English: Of course, I never went all the way to the end, but I once went around with a bubble bubble ending.

Korean: 총 게임 이런 거는 보통 좀비 나오는 그런 건가?
English: Do these games usually have zombies in them?

Korean: 총으로 직접 화면에 쏘는 그런 게임?
English: A game where you shoot directly at the screen with a gun?

Korean: 그런 거는 좀비나 괴물 나오지 않을까... 안 해봤어 ㅠ
English: I'm worried that zombies or monsters might appear... I haven't tried that ㅠ

Korean: 사람이었던 거 같은데~ 내가 경찰이면 적이지 않았을까?
English: I think I was a human~ If I were a police officer, wouldn't I have been an enemy?

Korean: 오홍 신기하구만 약간 스토리들이 다양한가 보네
English: Oh wow, that's amazing. The stories seem to be quite diverse.

Korean: 국내 여행지 중에 어디를 제일 자주 가?
English: Where do you travel most often in Korea?
It's not a tourist destination, but I go to Daejeon often~

Korean: 오빠 네가 울산이라 중간에서 만난다고 키키 너는?
English: Oppa, you're from Ulsan, so we'll meet in the middle. Kiki, what about you?

Korean: 우리 집은 속초 많이 놀러 가!
English: My family goes to Sokcho a lot to play!
Is it easy to go to rest?

Korean: 나도 속초나 다른 강원도 지역 키키
English: I also go to Sokcho or other areas in Gangwon-do

Korean: 대전은 제대로 가 본 적이 없다 구경할 데 많아?
English: I've never been to Daejeon properly. Is there a lot to see?
There's not much to see~

Korean: 조카가 있어서 놀이 공원이나 동물원 가고~ 우린 카페에 앉아서 놀고 키키 어른들은 온천이나 빵집 가고~
English: I have a nephew, so we go to an amusement park or a zoo~ We sit at a cafe and play, and Kiki and the adults go to a hot spring or a bakery~
There's a bread road in Daejeon~

Korean: 약간 조카 있으면 그런 뽀짝뽀짝한 곳 많이 가게 되나 봐 키키 귀여웡 ㅜㅜ
English: If you have a little niece, you'll probably go to a lot of cute places like that. Kiki is so cute. ㅜㅜ
I really want to go to a hot spring...
Recommend a good place

Korean: 맞아 나는 일본에서 료칸만 가보고 한국 온천을 안 가봐서... 가보고 싶어 ㅠㅠ 추천해줘!
English: That's right. I've only been to ryokans in Japan and I've never been to a Korean hot spring... I want to go. Please recommend one!

Korean: 예전에 유명했던 곳들이 있었는데 대전이랑 충주~
English: There used to be famous places like Daejeon and Chungju~

Korean: 요즘은 온천 물이 말라서 지금은 이름만 있는 곳들이 많아~
English: These days, the hot spring water has dried up, so there are many places that only have a name.

Korean: 나 가는 대전도 유성 온천이라고 예전에는 유명했었는데 지금은 좀 시들해졌지...
English: The Daejeon I'm going to was also famous for its Yuseong hot springs in the past, but it's become a bit less popular now...

Korean: 그래도 하고 나오면 나름 괜찮더라 거기는 거리가 가까워서 가는 곳이고 덕구랑 풍기 온천 좋다고 하더라~
English: But it was okay after doing it. It was close so I went there and I heard that Deokgu and Punggi hot springs were good~

Korean: 하 진짜로  시험 끝나고 한번 저런데만 가서 몸이라도 풀고 오고 싶은데... 코로나가 좀 잠잠해 져야 어디를 마음 놓고 갈 텐데 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, really, after my exams are over, I want to go somewhere like that and relax... But I think the coronavirus situation needs to calm down a bit before I can go somewhere with peace of mind ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 온천이나 수영장은 특히 좀 그렇지... 호캉스도 수영을 해야 완성인데 참 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, hot springs and swimming pools are especially a bit like that... A vacation isn't complete without swimming, though...
Are you all good at swimming?

Korean: 코로나 이전에 여행 가면 수영 즐겨 하는 편이야?
English: Before Corona, did you enjoy swimming when you traveled?

Korean: 엇 나는 초등학교 때 배웠는데 다 까먹었더라고 키키
English: Oh, I learned it in elementary school, but I forgot it all. Kiki

Korean: 그때의 체력이 아니어서 그런가 키키 그래서 좀 다시 배우고 싶어 ㅠㅠ
English: Is it because I don't have the stamina I had back then? Kiki, that's why I want to learn again ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 초딩 때 배우고 키키 지금은 그냥 허우적~ 그래도 막 레일에서 하는 수영이 아니고 그냥 물놀이 하는 거니까 자주 하는 편이야!
English: I learned it when I was in elementary school, and now I just flounder around. But since it's not like swimming on a rail, but just playing in the water, I do it often!

Korean: 나도 수영 멋지게 딱 하고 싶은데 수준은 우리 조카랑 같아 키키 같이 놀면 딱~
English: I also want to be a great swimmer, but my skill level is the same as my niece's, so playing with Kiki is perfect~

Korean: 그럼 약간 레일 있는 수영장 좋아해 아니면 그냥 풀장 같은 수영장 좋아해?
English: So do you like a pool with a bit of a rail or do you like a pool that's just like a pool?
It depends on who you go out with
I'm just like a pool!
Do you know about the resort called Parkrosi in Jeongseon? Have you been there?

Korean: 아니 안 가봤어~ 강원도는 울산에서 오기가 멀어서 잘 안 가게 되네~
English: No, I haven't been there. Gangwon-do is far from Ulsan, so I don't go there often.

Korean: 우리 아빠는 무조건 식구가 다 같이 놀러 가야 돼 키키
English: My dad always says that the whole family has to go out and play together. Kiki

Korean: 정선 자체를 거의 안 가본 듯!
English: It seems like you've hardly ever been to Jeongseon!

Korean: 가봐야 하는 리스트에 넣어 놔야 겠구먼 키키
English: I guess I'll have to put that on my to-do list, Kiki.
What do you usually eat when you go?

Korean: 저기는 주변에 진짜 아무것도 없어서 저 안에서 해결 해야 하는데 힐링하기 최고야 진짜...
English: There's really nothing around there, so you have to deal with it inside, but it's really the best for healing...

Korean: 막 요가랑 체육 프로그램도 포함돼있고 수영장이랑 자쿠지도 있고!
English: It even includes yoga and exercise programs, and there's a swimming pool and jacuzzi!

Korean: 추가 금액 내면 쿠킹클래스 같은 것도 있고 그래 한번 가봐 키키
English: If you pay extra, there are things like cooking classes. Go and try it out, Kiki.

Korean: 주변에 아무것도 없으면 진짜 거기 안에서 놀아야겠다~
English: If there's nothing around, I'll really have to play inside~

Korean: 주변에 놀 거 많으면 오히려 그 안에 있는 거 하나도 사용 못하고 나올 때가 많아서 아쉬워~
English: When there are a lot of things to do around, it's a shame that you often end up not being able to use anything inside.

Korean: 헐 너무 좋은데...?  개인적으로 그냥 짱 박혀서 쉬는 거 좋아하는 나로서는 완벽한 곳이네 키키
English: Wow, it's so good...? Personally, for me who just likes to sit down and rest, this is the perfect place Kiki

Korean: 그치 딱 좋아할 거 같아서 말해봄!
English: I'm telling you because I think you'll like it!

Korean: 나는 강원도 가면... 매번 다르긴 한데 거의 회나 감자전 막국수 그런거 먹어 하하 가끔 닭강정도 먹고
English: When I go to Gangwon-do... it's different every time, but I usually eat things like raw fish, potato pancakes, and makguksu haha. Sometimes I eat fried chicken too.
Just hearing Gangwon-do is healing~

Korean: 그니까 ㅠㅠ 회랑 감자전이랑 닭강정이랑 다 좋아하는 것들 뿐... 배고프당
English: That's why ㅠㅠ I only like hoerang potato pancake and fried chicken... I'm hungry

Korean: 사계절 중에 제일 좋아하는 계절이 뭐얌?
English: What is your favorite season of the four seasons?

Korean: 나 여름~ 키키 여름 좋아하는 사람은 별로 없더라
English: Me, summer~ Kiki, there aren't many people who like summer
What season do you like?
Hmm...I'm fall!

Korean: 여름도 좋긴 한데 요즘 여름이 너무 습해지고 힘들어져서 점점 여름 좋다고 하는 사람이 줄어드는 듯 ㅠㅠ
English: Summer is nice, but these days, summer is getting too humid and difficult, so it seems like there are fewer and fewer people who say they like summer.

Korean: 맞아 좀만 덜 습하면 그래도 괜찮을 텐데...
English: Yeah, but if it were just a little less humid it would be okay...
I like spring the best hehe
Is there a reason why fall is better than spring?

Korean: 그러게 봄이랑 가을이랑 뭐가 달라 키키
English: What's the difference between spring and fall? Kiki

Korean: 아 내가 꽃가루 알러지가 좀 있어서... 봄도 좋고 꽃도 너무 너무 좋아했는데...
English: Oh, I have a bit of a pollen allergy... I love spring and I really, really like flowers...
Now it has become a scary thing ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아하... 나도 비염이 있어서 환절기에 재채기하고 좀 그렇긴 한데 ㅠㅠ
English: Aha... I also have rhinitis, so I sneeze a lot during the changing of seasons ㅠㅠ

Korean: 꽃가루 알러지는 힘들겠다 제일 예쁜 때에 알러지라니...
English: Pollen allergies must be tough, having allergies at the most beautiful time of the year...

Korean: 꽃가루 알레르기 있으면 심한 사람은 진짜 계속 재채기 하던데~ ㅠㅠ
English: People with severe pollen allergies sneeze constantly~ ㅠㅠ
Is it worse even if I take medicine?

Korean: 음 아무래도 안과는 가서 안약 넣는 거 처방 받고 호흡기 쪽은 약도 먹고 꽃가루 시즌에는 거의 주마다 가서 처치? 받아요 ㅠㅠ
English: Well, I guess I go to the ophthalmologist and get a prescription for eye drops and take medicine for the respiratory system, and during pollen season, I go almost every week to get treatment? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그래도 봄... 좋아요... 하하 뭔가 핑크핑크한 느낌이잖아
English: Still spring... I like it... haha it's kind of pink

Korean: 에고 엄청 고생이네 ㅠㅠ 매주 병원 가야 될 정도면...
English: Oh my, this is so hard ㅠㅠ If I have to go to the hospital every week...

Korean: 맞아 뭔가 가을은 썰렁?한 느낌이고 봄은 따뜻! 그래서 난 봄이 더 좋은 거 같애
English: Yeah, somehow fall feels cold? And spring is warm! That's why I think spring is better.

Korean: 아 반대네~ 나는 봄이 좀 서늘한 느낌이고 가을이  좀 푸근하게 느껴지더라~
English: Oh, it's the opposite~ I feel like spring is a bit cool and fall is a bit warm~

Korean: 근데 곧 겨울이 와서 가을도 미워 키키
English: But winter is coming soon and I hate fall too Kiki

Korean: 하 근데 사실 우리나라 여름이랑 겨울이 좀 하드 해진? 너무 중간이 없고 보통이 없는 날씨가 돼서...
English: Ah, but actually, in our country, summers and winters have become a bit hard? The weather has become so in-between and normal...
Because it's too hot or too cold; it's painful

Korean: 맞아 예전에는 여름도 선풍기 켜고 어느 정도 견딜만 했는데... 요 근래는 진짜 죽음의 더위인 듯 ㅠㅠ
English: Yes, in the past, I could turn on the fan and endure the summer to some extent... but these days, it feels like it's really killing me ㅠㅠ
Sister, are you okay with this heat?

Korean: 에어컨 있으니까 크게 상관없는 듯 키키 그렇지 않으면 죽음이지~
English: It doesn't seem to matter much since there's air conditioning Kiki, otherwise I'd die~

Korean: 근데 여름의 이 파릇파릇한 느낌을 못 버리겠어 너무 예쁘지 않아?
English: But I can't shake off this fresh, green feeling of summer. Isn't it so pretty?

Korean: 하늘은 내가 좋아하는 하늘색에 나무는 싱그러운 초록색 꽃들도 풀들도 다 싱싱~ 너무 예뻐
English: The sky is my favorite color, the trees are a fresh green, the flowers and grass are all fresh~ So pretty

Korean: 맞아 맞아 ㅠㅠ 진짜 날씨 시원했을 때는 그래 이게 여름이지 ㅠㅠ 하는 느낌이 있더라 세상 푸릇푸릇하고 하늘은 푸르고 쨍한 햇살에... 너무 좋았어 ㅠㅠ
English: That's right, that's right ㅠㅠ When the weather was really cool, I felt like, "Yes, this is summer ㅠㅠ" The world was so green, the sky was blue, and the sunlight was bright... It was so nice ㅠㅠ

Korean: 정말 좀 덜 덥고 습하지만 않아도 훨씬 좋던데 ㅠㅠ
English: It would be much better if it were a little less hot and humid though ㅠㅠ

Korean: 진짜 습기랑 모기만 아니면 그나마 여름 좀 좋을 거 같긴 해 키키
English: If it weren't for the humidity and mosquitoes, I think summer would be a little better Kiki

Korean: 겨울은 너무 추워서 괴롭고... 중간이 없는 날씨
English: Winter is so cold it's miserable... weather with no middle ground

Korean: 지구 온난화 때문이지 뭐 ㅠㅠ 날씨가 좀 극단적이기는 하지 점점 더한 거 같고
English: It's because of global warming ㅠㅠ The weather is a bit extreme, but it seems to be getting worse

Korean: 아니 근데 가을 모기들이 너무 많아서... 여름에 너무 더워서 걔네 활동 안 하다가 이제 서야 나온 거 라던데 키키
English: No, but there are so many mosquitoes in the fall... I heard that they stopped being active in the summer because it was too hot, and they're only coming out now, Kiki

Korean: 한번 물렸는데 진짜 팔 퉁퉁 부어서 깜짝 놀람...
English: I got bitten once and my arm swelled up so much I was really surprised...

Korean: 그렇게 더웠는데 죽지도 않고... 끈질긴 놈들 ㅠㅠ
English: It was so hot, but they didn't die... Those guys are so persistent ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그렇게 부은 거면 산모기 같은 거였나
English: If it was that swollen, was it something like a mosquito bite?
Do you get bitten by a lot of mosquitoes in the summer?

Korean: 나는 옛날에는 정말 세상 모기 나만 무는 느낌이었는데 요즘은 좀... 다 같이 물리는 추세... 이더라고? 키키 덜 억울
English: I used to feel like I was the only one bitten by mosquitoes in the world, but these days... everyone is getting bitten... Is that it? Kiki, it's less unfair

Korean: 나는 많이 물리는 편이야... 다른 사람이랑 같이 있으면 내가 물려주는 키키
English: I tend to get bitten a lot... When I'm with other people, I get bitten by them.

Korean: 혈액형 때문인가 모기가 O형을 좋아한다는 말이 있더라고
English: I heard that mosquitoes like type O blood because of their blood type.

Korean: 아 그래? ㅠㅠ 나 올해 모기는 한 번도 안 물린 거 같은데~
English: Oh really? ㅠㅠ I don't think I've been bitten by a mosquito once this year~

Korean: 잘 물리는 사람이 따로 있나 보다 ㅠㅠ
English: I guess there are people who are good at biting ㅠㅠ

Korean: 오오 나도 오형인데 키키 혈액형 이것도 과학인건가!
English: Oh, I'm also type O. Is Kiki's blood type also a science?

Korean: 코로나 국민지원금 신청 이제 곧 시작된대!
English: Applications for the Corona National Support Fund will begin soon!
Did you know?

Korean: 응 그거 얘기는 들었는데 우리도 받을 수 있는 건가?
English: Yeah, I heard about that, but can we get it too?
What are the conditions?

Korean: 음... 뭐 중위 소득80%... 이런 얘기밖에 기억이 안 나네... 알고 있는 거는 빨리 신청하면 빨리 받는다고 미리 열리는 시간 예약도 해놓을 수 있다고 하더라고?
English: Um... I only remember something like the median income of 80%... From what I know, they say that if you apply quickly, you can get it quickly and even make a reservation for an opening time in advance?

Korean: 아 그래? 키키 별게 다 예약이 되네 뭐 국민의 88%가 받는 거니까 우리도 받을 수 있지 않을까?
English: Oh really? Kiki, everything is fully booked. Since 88% of the population receives it, shouldn't we be able to receive it too?

Korean: 근데 어차피 돈 아니고 상품권이라면서~ 쓸 데 많나?
English: But since it's a gift certificate and not money, what can you use it for?

Korean: 아 진짜요?  그거 막 여러 가지로 받을 수 있다고 들었는데?
English: Oh really? I heard you can get that in a variety of ways?

Korean: 지역 상품권으로도 받을 수 있고 은행으로도 그냥 받을 수도 있고 현금으로도 받을 수 있고...
English: You can receive it as a local gift certificate, or you can receive it through a bank, or you can receive it in cash...
I'm not sure if that's true or not...

Korean: 그래도 식당 미용실 편의점 이런 게 거의 되니까 쓸 데는 많을 거 같은데!
English: Still, since it's available at restaurants, beauty salons, convenience stores, and things like that, I think it'll be useful in a lot of places!
It's not a large amount, but...
Then shall we find out? Kiki
When do you apply~

Korean: 아 찾아보니까 국민 비서 홈페이지에 가서 알림 서비스를 요청할 수 있다고 하네여
English: Oh, I looked it up and it says you can go to the National Secretary's website and request a notification service.

Korean: 네이버앱이나 카톡이나 토스도는 안내 간다고 하고...
English: They said they would guide you through Naver app, KakaoTalk, and Toss...
Yeah, I heard you can apply for Part 5 Zero starting September 6th!
According to the last digit of the year of birth

Korean: 아~그렇구나 출생 연도 끝 자리로 신청 받는 건 진짜 기발한 아이디어인 거 같아
English: Ah, I see. I think it's a really unique idea to accept applications based on the last digit of the year of birth.

Korean: 오호 이것도 5부 제로 하는 구나 몰랐네 하긴 또 서버 몰릴게 뻔하니까 좋은 선택이긴 하네
English: Oh, I didn't know this was a 5-part zero. Well, it's a good choice since it's obvious that the server will be overloaded again.

Korean: 그치 얼마 전에 선릉역에서 오토바이 사고 났던 거 봤어?
English: Did you see that motorcycle accident at Seolleung Station a while ago?

Korean: 아 ㅠㅠ 눈 뜨고 못 보겠던데 ㅠㅠ 그분 어머니가 보낸  문자 보고 코 끝 찡 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah ㅠㅠ I can't open my eyes and look ㅠㅠ My nose is tingling after seeing the text that his mother sent ㅠㅠ

Korean: 어우 나는 그거 기사 제목만 보고 차마 들어가 보지는 못했어...
English: Oh, I just saw the title of the article and couldn't bring myself to go in and look...

Korean: 보니까 마음이 안 좋긴 하드라... 근데 트럭 운전하신 분도 트라우마 클 거 같애 ㅠㅠ
English: It's hard to see... but I think the truck driver must have been traumatized too ㅠㅠ
I guess it's his fault, though...

Korean: 그러니까 ㅠㅠ 누구 탓도 할 수 없는 그 사실이 더 안타까운 같아
English: So ㅠㅠ I think it's even more regrettable that there's no one to blame

Korean: 그분 어머니는 항상 사고 소식만 들리면 아들한테 문자 했었대 ㅠㅠ
English: His mother would always text her son whenever she heard news of an accident ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 음주운전 이런 거는 아니었나 보네...? ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, so it wasn't drunk driving or anything like that...? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 웅웅 신호 바뀌고 출발하기 직전에 그 오토바이가 맨 하위 차선에서 트럭 앞으로 슥 와...
English: The signal changed and just before we started moving, that motorcycle came zooming in front of the truck in the lowest lane...

Korean: 그러고 트럭은 높아서 당연히 앞에 오토바이가 안보이니까 그냥 출발해버림 ㅠㅠ
English: And the truck was tall so of course I couldn't see the motorcycle in front of me, so I just drove off ㅠㅠ
Countermeasures are urgent...
Isn't there a good way? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 흠... 그냥 운전할 때 절대 그런 큰 화물  트럭 근처에 안 있으라고 해서 그렇게 하는... 방어 운전밖에는 뭔가 없지 않을까
English: Hmm... I guess there's nothing else to do but drive defensively, since they tell you to never drive near those big trucks.

Korean: 아니면 대형차들 사이드미러나 그런 사각지대를 좀 없애야 하는 필요도 있을 듯
English: Or maybe there is a need to eliminate blind spots such as side mirrors on large vehicles.

Korean: 맞아 그런 큰 트럭 바로 코앞에 서있으면 안 되는데 빨리 배달해야 된다는 생각 때문에 그런 생각을 못 한 듯...
English: Yeah, you shouldn't be standing right in front of such a big truck, but I guess you didn't think about it because you thought you had to deliver it quickly...

Korean: 속도도 중요한데 본인들이 좀 조심해야 될 필요가 있는 거 같애  ㅠㅠ
English: Speed is important, but I think they need to be a little more careful.
First of all, I think we should start with education. Then~

Korean: 요즘 배달 알바가 많아지고 점점 연령대도 다양해지고 하다 보니 교육이 제대로 안 되고 있는 게 우선 큰 문제인 거 같아
English: These days, there are more delivery workers and the age range is becoming more diverse, so I think the biggest problem is that they are not receiving proper education.

Korean: 이런 사고 날 때마다 제발 다음 사고는 안 나기를 바라는데... 쉽지가 않네 ㅠㅠ
English: Every time an accident like this happens, I hope that another one won't happen again... but it's not easy ㅠㅠ

Korean: 베트남이 코로나 19로 봉쇄 조치 돼서 전세계 커피 공급에 차질이 생길 수도 있대 ㅠㅠ
English: Vietnam's lockdown due to COVID-19 may disrupt global coffee supply ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헐... 브라질도 한파로 커피 생산량이 22% 줄어든다고 하는데...
English: Wow... They say Brazil's coffee production has decreased by 22% due to the cold wave...

Korean: 헐... 커피는 생각도 못했는데 생각해보니 당연한 거긴 하네... 안되는데...
English: Wow... I never thought about coffee, but now that I think about it, it's obvious... It can't be...

Korean: 그니까 맞아 브라질은 갑자기 최악의 서리가 내려서 그렇다고 하더라?
English: So that's right, Brazil suddenly got the worst frost ever?

Korean: 근데 웃긴 게 스타벅스는 커피 매입가를 고정으로 해 놓아서 괜찮대
English: But the funny thing is that Starbucks fixed the coffee purchase price so it's okay.

Korean: 커피 매입가를 고정으로 해 놓은 게 왜 괜찮은 거야?
English: Why is it okay to keep the coffee purchase price fixed?

Korean: 이미 그 만큼의 커피 물량이 있다는 건가?
English: Do you already have that much coffee?

Korean: 물량이 있을 수도 있고 추가 구매할 때 원래 같으면 가격이 엄청 오를 텐데 기존 가격대로 매입할 수 있으니까 스타벅스는 타격이 없다는 거 아닐까?
English: There may be a shortage, and when purchasing additional items, the original price would have gone up significantly, but since they can purchase them at the original price, isn't that saying Starbucks won't be affected?

Korean: 그렇지~ 이미 계약할 때 가격을 정해 놓아서 스타벅스는 운영하는데 문제가 없는데, 문제는 스타벅스에 커피 대는 업체겠지? 슬프다...
English: Yes~ Starbucks has no problem operating because the price was already set when the contract was signed, but the problem is the company that supplies coffee to Starbucks, right? It's sad...
Ah, that's what you meant...

Korean: 흠 그럼 진짜 다른 브랜드들은 타격이 좀 심하겠네; 근데 댓글 보니까 걍 다른 나라 꺼 먹으면 된다면서 베트남 커피 막 쓰레기라고 그러는데... 진짠가;
English: Hmm, then other brands will be hit hard; but looking at the comments, some people are saying that you can just drink coffee from other countries, and that Vietnamese coffee is trash... Is that true?
I knew it was delicious;

Korean: 아 그래?  나도 맛있다고 알고 있었어...
English: Oh really? I knew it was delicious too...

Korean: 생산량도 세계 2위인가 그래서 우리도 많이 먹었을 건뎅
English: I guess we also eat a lot of it since it is the second largest in the world in terms of production.

Korean: 베트남은 원래 자국 커피 사랑이 대단하지 않나?
English: Doesn't Vietnam originally love its own coffee very much?
The coffee looks delicious~

Korean: 스타벅스가 유일하게 안 되는 곳이 베트남이라며?
English: You say Vietnam is the only place where Starbucks doesn't work?

Korean: 맞아 맞아 나도 그 얘기 들은 것 같아 키키
English: Yeah yeah I think I heard that too Kiki

Korean: 말레이시아도 커피 맛있다고 하던데... 진짜 저 정도로 공급이 어려워지면 다른 나라에서 받으려나?
English: They say that Malaysia has delicious coffee too... If the supply becomes that difficult, will they really start getting it from other countries?
Sure, right? But it'll be expensive...

Korean: 커피 값 막 오르는 거 아니겠지 ㅠㅠ
English: The price of coffee isn't going to go up anymore, is it? ㅠㅠ
I'm worried... It's really hard to quit coffee...

Korean: 미국에는 지금 초강력 허리케인 왔다고 하네; 무서버라
English: They say there's a super strong hurricane in the US right now; it's scary.

Korean: 아 그래? 미국은 땅이 커서 그런가 되게 자주 오는 거 같애
English: Oh really? I guess it's because America is so big that I come here quite often.
It's like a hurricane ㅠㅠ

Korean: 미국은 넓어서 기후가 다양데다 요즘 진짜 지구 온난화 때문에 엉망이야 진짜...
English: America is so big that the climate is so varied, and these days, global warming is really messing things up...

Korean: 한번 토네이도 멀리서 본 적 있는데 소름 돋더라
English: I once saw a tornado from afar and it was scary.

Korean: 헐 허리케인 본 적이 있다니 대박일세
English: Wow, you've seen a hurricane before? That's awesome.

Korean: 그 미국에 사시는 가족분 보러 갔다가 본 건가!
English: Did you see it when you went to see your family who lives in America?

Korean: 그러게 어디서 봤어? 엄청 무서웠을 거 같애
English: Where did you see that? It must have been really scary.

Korean: 나 천문대 좋아해서 거기 갔다가 저 멀리 있는 거 봤어~
English: I like observatories, so I went there and saw that thing far away~
Because the observatory is so high~

Korean: 와 신기하다... 나 아는 분은 미국에서 허리케인인가 토네이도였나 그런 거 막 주의보? 경보? 그런 거 떴는데 그냥 괜찮겠지 하고 차에 딱 탔는데 차가 몇 초 살짝 떴다가 떨어져서 바로 집 들어갔대
English: Wow, that's amazing... I know someone who was in the US and got a warning or alert for a hurricane or a tornado or something, but he just thought it would be okay and got in the car, but the car floated for a few seconds and then fell and he went straight home.

Korean: 헐 미쳐... 그래도 몇 초 살짝 떴다가 떨어져서 다행이지 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my gosh... Still, it's fortunate that it only rose for a few seconds and then fell ㅠㅠ

Korean: 더 심하면 막 차도 날아가는 거 아니야?
English: If it gets worse, wouldn't the car just fly away?

Korean: 영화처럼 ㅠㅠ 나 한국에서도 그런 거 본 적  있는데~
English: Just like in the movies ㅠㅠ I've seen something like that in Korea too~

Korean: 앞 집 옥상에서 평상 날아가는 거 난 순간 해리포터 보는 줄 알았어~
English: I thought I was watching Harry Potter when I saw the plane flying over the roof of the house in front of me~
The plane was flown as is without even flipping over~

Korean: 그니까 진짜 우리나라에는 저런 거는 없어서 다행임
English: So, it's a good thing that there's nothing like that in our country.

Korean: 머리 하러 안 간지 오래 돼서 미용실 좀 가고 싶다...
English: It's been a while since I've had my hair done, so I want to go to the hair salon...
Have you had your hair done recently?
I dyed my hair and cut it a bit too~

Korean: 최근에는 나도 염색하고 볼륨 매직 했어! 뿌리 염색하러 가야 하는데...
English: Recently, I dyed my hair and got a volume magic! I have to go get my roots dyed...
Oh Hong, you dyed your hair too?
It's not black, it's dark brown?
It's dark brown but it just looks black Kiki

Korean: 우리 새 언니가 나 보더니 고등학교 때 생각난대 키키
English: My new sister looked at me and said she reminded me of high school Kiki
Since when did you have short hair, sister?
Have you ever had short hair?

Korean: 그르게 나는 완전 똑단발은 초딩 때 이후로 안 해봄...
English: That's right, I haven't had my hair cut completely bob-shaped since elementary school...

Korean: 거의 계속 긴 머리거나 해봤자 중 단발
English: Almost always long hair or medium-length hair
I also had short hair late~

Korean: 자르기 시작 한지 3년 됐나~ 이거보다 더 짧은 머리도 해 봤지롱~
English: It's been 3 years since I started cutting it~ I've had hair shorter than this before~

Korean: 나도 성인 되고서는 중단발 한번 해 놓고 그냥 계속 머리 기르는 중
English: I also got a bob cut once after becoming an adult and just kept growing my hair out.

Korean: 단발머리 한번 빠지면 헤어 나올 수 없다고 하던데 키키
English: They say that once you lose your short hair, you can't get rid of it, Kiki

Korean: 맞아 못 참고 계속 자르더라 단발인 사람들은
English: That's right, people with short hair can't stand it anymore and keep cutting it.

Korean: 내가 그래 지금~ 머리 기르려고 참다가 참다가 또 자르고 2년 째 반복 중~ 흑
English: That's me right now~ I've been holding back on growing my hair out, holding back on it, and cutting it again, and it's been going on for two years now~ Sigh
Do your sisters have a lot of hair?

Korean: 응 나 많아... 그래서 좀 싫음 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I have a lot... That's why I don't like it ㅠㅠ

Korean: 길이도 있고 숱도 많아서 정리가 안 돼
English: It's long and thick, so it's hard to organize.

Korean: 나도~ 그래서 머리 기르기가 더 힘들어
English: Me too~ That's why it's harder to grow hair

Korean: 오오오 나는 머리숱 진짜 없고 머리카락도 가늘어서... 진짜 층 내 달라고 한번 해보고 싶어 키키
English: Ohhh I have really thin hair and my hair is really thin... I really want to try layering it Kiki
Kiki, everyone seems to be jealous of each other...

Korean: 머리숱 많은 사람이랑 별로 안 많은 사람이랑
English: People with a lot of hair and people with not much hair
Wouldn't it be easier to grow hair if you have thin hair?

Korean: 하 뭐랄까 머리 기르기도 그렇고 관리하거나 머리 말릴 때도 숱 없는 게 편한 거 같기는 한데 그래도 머리숱 많은 게 이쁘긴 해서 부러워 ㅠ
English: Well, I guess it's easier to grow hair out and manage it or dry it, but I'm still jealous of those with thick hair because they're pretty.

Korean: 파마 잘못하면 바로 헤그리드 돼... 앞머리도 잘 어울리면 머리를 좀 다양하게 바꿔볼 텐데 난 앞머리도 안 어울려 ㅠㅠ
English: If I do a perm wrong, I'll immediately become Hagrid... If my bangs suit me well, I'll try to change my hair a bit more, but bangs don't suit me either ㅠㅠ
Have you ever let your bangs down?

Korean: 응~ 뱅 했었지~ 지금은 관리하기 귀찮아서 안 해~
English: Yeah~ I used to do it~ Now I don't do it because it's a hassle to manage~

Korean: 헤그리드... 익숙한 단어 나도 내 머리 설명할 때 그걸로 설명하는데~
English: Hagrid... I'm familiar with that word. I use that word to describe my hair too~

Korean: 헤그리드 키키 아 진짜 웃기네 난 앞머리 안 어울려서... 안 해... ㅠㅠ
English: Hagrid Kiki Ah, that's really funny. I don't like bangs... I won't do it... ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 이마가 좁아서 뭔가 답답해 보이더라고...
English: I also have a narrow forehead, so it looked a bit stuffy...
Management isn't easy either~
It's hot again in summer Kiki

Korean: 아 그러네 앞머리 있으면 또 계속 잘라줘야 하고 그러니까
English: Oh, I see. If you have bangs, you have to keep cutting them.

Korean: 어디 부러져서 깁스하거나 그래본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever broken something and had a cast or something?
No~ I don't have any. Do you have any?
Oh, I don't have any either...

Korean: 근데 우리 오빠는 세상 여기저기 많이  부러지고 다쳤어서 키키 깁스 한 거 많이 봤었어
English: But my brother has been broken and hurt so many times all over the world that I've seen him in Kiki casts a lot.

Korean: 나도 없어 키키 근데 깁스하고 나면 그 부분이 엄청 얇아지지 않아?
English: Me neither Kiki but after putting on the cast doesn't that part become very thin?

Korean: 맞아 나도 본 적  있는데~ 움직이지 않아서 근육이 없어서 그런 거래~
English: Yeah, I've seen it too~ It's because you don't move, so you don't have any muscles~

Korean: 아하... 얇아지는 구나 신기하다 난 왜 본 적 없지 키키
English: Aha... It's getting thinner. That's amazing. Why have I never seen it before? Kiki

Korean: 혹시 맹장 수술 한 사람 있어?
English: Has anyone ever had an appendectomy?

Korean: 아니! 뭔가 흔한 거 같은데 주변에서는 한 번도 본 적 없네
English: No! It seems like something common, but I've never seen it around here.

Korean: 어 나도 없네~ 그거 순간적으로 엄청 아파서 데굴데굴 구르던데
English: Oh, I don't have any~ That hurt so much for a moment that I rolled around

Korean: 오 뭔가 흔한 거라 한 명은 있을 줄 알았는데 없네?!
English: Oh, I thought there would be at least one since it's so common, but there isn't one?!
Everyone is healthy, Kiki

Korean: 그것도 급성으로 터지면 데굴데굴 구르는 걸 껄?
English: If that bursts suddenly, it'll roll around, right?
If it doesn't burst, it won't roll haha

Korean: 되게 흔한 수술이어도 시기 놓치면 되게 위험하다더라~
English: Even though it is a very common surgery, it is said to be very dangerous if you miss the timing.
Are the scars from the surgery still big these days?

Korean: 우리 오빠 옛날에 맹장수술했었는데 그때도 흥터 거의 안 남았다고 했어!
English: My older brother had an appendectomy a long time ago, and he said that even then, there was hardly any scar left!

Korean: 오호 맞아 요즘은 웬만한 거는 흉터 많이 안 남는 듯!
English: Oh, that's right. These days, it seems like most things don't leave scars!
Surgical techniques have really improved~

Korean: 혹시 최근에 건강 검진 받은 사람 있오?
English: Has anyone had a health checkup recently?

Korean: 응 나 몇 달 전에 받았었어! 6월엔가?
English: Yeah I got it a few months ago! In June?
I didn't get it~ Did you get it?

Korean: 나는 요번에 엄청 장염 계속 걸렸어서 한번 대대적으로 받았었어 키키
English: I had a lot of enteritis this time, so I had a big one Kiki

Korean: 대대적으로는 다른 것도 다 받았다는 거지? 키키
English: So you got everything else in a big way? Kiki

Korean: 언니는 그럼 언제 마지막으로 받은 거야?
English: When was the last time you received it, sister?

Korean: 나 피 검사만 해 본 거 같은데~
English: I think I only had a blood test~

Korean: 웅웅 대장 내시경이랑 위 내시경까지 다 했었어 ㅠ
English: Yeah, I had a colonoscopy and an upper gastrointestinal endoscopy.

Korean: 근데 별 이상이 없대서... 그냥 지금처럼 살으래 키키
English: But there's nothing wrong... so just live like you are now, Kiki

Korean: 키키 그치 나도 위 안 좋아서 해보면 맨날 모든 사람이 있는 정도의 위염만 있고 별거 없더라...
English: Kiki, right? My stomach is not in good condition either, so when I try it, I only get the same level of gastritis that everyone else has, and nothing else...

Korean: 오 대장도 했구나? 준비하기가 엄청 빡시던데 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, you're the captain too? It must have been really hard to prepare ㅠㅠ
You drank a lot, was it okay?

Korean: 어우 진짜 힘들었어 ㅠㅠ 관장약 진짜 노맛임...
English: Oh man, that was really hard ㅠㅠ The enema really didn't taste good...

Korean: 근데 요즘에는 막 좋은 곳은 좀 몇 만원 비싸긴 하지만 물에 타서 먹는 가루약 말고 그냥 알약 형태로도 나오더라!
English: But these days, the really good places, although a bit more expensive by tens of thousands of won, come in pill form instead of powder that you mix with water!

Korean: 둘 다 물 많이 마셔야 하는 거는 똑같지만... 알약이 훨씬 편할 듯 ㅠㅠ
English: Both require you to drink a lot of water, but... pills seem much more convenient ㅠㅠ

Korean: 쿠팡 로켓 프레쉬? 그거 써 본 적 있어?
English: Coupang Rocket Fresh? Have you tried it?

Korean: 나 매주 써 키키 요즘 마트 안 가고 다 그걸로 사~ 거의 다
English: I use Kiki every week. I don't go to the mart these days. I buy almost everything from there.

Korean: 우리 엄마도 진짜 일주에 한번은 쓰시는 듯!
English: My mom seems to use it once a week too!

Korean: 솔직히 너무 좋은 것 같아! 질도 좋고 편하고 비싼 것도 아니고!
English: Honestly, it seems so good! It's good quality, comfortable, and not expensive!

Korean: 그것도 오늘 주문하면 내일 바로 와? 아침에?
English: If I order it today, will it arrive tomorrow? In the morning?

Korean: 요즘은 시간이 좀 빨라져서 밤 11시쯤 까지 시키면 다음 날 새벽 배송으로 오고 그 이후에 주문하면 다음 날 6시 이전까지 배송~
English: These days, the time is a bit earlier, so if you order by 11 PM, it will be delivered the next morning, and if you order after that, it will be delivered by 6 PM the next day~

Korean: 맞아 맞아 새벽 배송도 하더라 쿠팡 가끔씩 보면 떨이처럼 밤에 들어가 보면 막 남은 재고 싸게 팔고 그러더라고!
English: That's right, that's right, they also do early morning delivery. If you look at Coupang sometimes, you'll see that they sell their remaining inventory cheaply if you go in at night!
Oh, you do that too? Sounds good!

Korean: 나머지는 마켓컬리랑 비슷한데 거기는 떨이처럼 하는 거는 없거든
English: The rest is similar to Market Kurly, but they don't have anything like a shaker.
I think it's because of the freshness

Korean: 난 마켓컬리는 한 번도 사용해 본 적 없는데 어때?
English: I've never used Market Kurly before. What do you think?
Oh, right, that must be the reason.

Korean: 마켓컬리는 유튜브 먹방 하시는 분들이 많이 애용하시던데 약간 밀키트 이런 거 잘 되어있는 거 같더라고?
English: Market Kurly is used by many people who do mukbang videos on YouTube. It seems like they have some good meal kits.

Korean: 웅웅 그런 것도 많고 마트에 안 파는 치즈나 음료 이런 것도 많아서 사는 재미가 있어!
English: Yeah, there are a lot of things like that, and there are also a lot of cheeses and drinks that aren't sold at the supermarket, so shopping is fun!
Something they don't sell at the mart?
What is an example?

Korean: 아아 맞아 맞아 막... 희귀한 제품들 있다던데...
English: Oh, that's right, that's right... I heard there are some rare products...

Korean: 아니면 막 마카롱이나 떡이나 이런 유명한 제품들도 팔고 그런 거 같아!
English: Or maybe they sell famous products like macarons or rice cakes!

Korean: 응응 막 노티드 식빵 이런 것도 팔고!
English: Yeah, they even sell things like Notted Bread!
It's too extensive to list, but Kiki

Korean: 마켓 컬리나 쿠팡에서 주로 어떤 거 사?
English: What do you usually buy from Market Kurly or Coupang?

Korean: 난 안 쓰지만 엄마는 보통 뭐 우유나... 우유밖에 모르겠네 키키 음
English: I don't use it, but my mom usually uses milk or something... I only know milk Kiki um

Korean: 나도 우유도 사고 계란도 사고... 그냥 머 크림치즈 같은 것도 사고 이것저것 다 사 키키
English: I also bought milk and eggs... I also bought things like cream cheese and all sorts of things.

Korean: 나도 밑반찬 들이나 생 야채도 그냥 거기서 사~
English: I also just buy side dishes and raw vegetables there~

Korean: 코로나 때문에 마트 가기도 좀 그래서 이게 편하네
English: Because of Corona, I don't feel like going to the supermarket, so this is convenient.
Does Market Kurly also have a separate shipping fee?

Korean: 사실 쿠팡이랑 둘 다 사용을 안 한지 오래 돼서 잘 모르겠네
English: Actually, I don't know because it's been a long time since I used Coupang.
No shipping fee for purchases over a certain amount!
Wouldn't Coupang be like that too?

Korean: 로켓프레시는 15,000원 이상 사야 배송 자체가 가능해~
English: Rocket Fresh can only be delivered if you purchase over 15,000 won~

Korean: 아아아 맞아 맞아 그러네 그 쿠팡은 또 멤버십...? 그런 거 있지 않나
English: Ahhh, right, right, that's right. Coupang also has membership...? Doesn't it have something like that?

Korean: 우리 엄마는 그거여서 막 다 무료로 배송 받고 빨리 받고 그러던데
English: My mom said that because of that, she got everything shipped for free and got it quickly.

Korean: 아 와우? 로켓와우 회원? 그런 건가...
English: Oh wow? Rocket Wow member? Is that so...

Korean: 맞아~ 한 달에 2900원인가 내면 회원 되고 그러면 로켓 배송을 무료로 받을 수 있지 키키
English: That's right~ If you pay 2900 won a month, you can become a member and get free rocket delivery Kiki
I feel like a public relations ambassador~
Kiki, are you a Coupang employee?
But it's all correct information Kiki

Korean: 드라마 나의 아저씨 봤어? 아이유 나오는 거!
English: Have you seen the drama My Mister? The one with IU in it!
I don't know because I only watch it sporadically~

Korean: 허어어억 나 진짜 완전 각 잡고 정주행으로 쫙 봤어 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my god, I really got hooked and watched it straight through ㅠㅠ

Korean: 요즘에도 클립으로 보는 중 ㅠㅠ 진짜 명작이야아아
English: I'm still watching it in clips these days ㅠㅠ It's really a masterpiece

Korean: 그치 ㅠㅠ 진짜 이건 꼭 봐야 돼 언니... 인생 드라마야 ㅠㅠ
English: Right ㅠㅠ Seriously, you have to watch this, sis... It's the drama of your life ㅠㅠ
I have to see you again soon

Korean: 요즘에 tvn에서 짤막하게 잠깐 잠깐 나오더라~
English: It's been appearing briefly on tvN these days~
I think it's a collection of only touching scenes

Korean: 아니 그 드라마도 처음에 약간 원조 교제? 나이 많은 사람이랑 어린애랑 러브라인인거냐고 막 엄청 욕하고 그랬다면서
English: No, that drama also had a lot of swearing at first, saying it was a love line between an older person and a younger person.

Korean: 응응 맞아... 모든 걸 다 러브 라인으로 보는 사람덜 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right... People who see everything as a love line ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나는 진짜 보면서 장기용 너무 싫었는데 마지막까지 보니까 그래도 괜찮더라
English: I really hated Jang Ki-yong when I watched it, but it was okay when I watched it till the end.

Korean: 장기용 처음부터 무섭게 나와서 뭐지? 그랬는데~ 사연이 있더라~
English: Jang Ki-yong was scary from the beginning, so what? I thought~ but there was a story~

Korean: 나는 장기용이라는 배우를 그 드라마에서 처음 봐서 이후에 로맨스 드라마에서 나올 때 친구들은 막 멋있다고 그러는데 난 좀 무서웠어 키키
English: I first saw the actor Jang Ki-yong in that drama, and when he appeared in a romance drama later, my friends kept saying he was cool, but I was a little scared.
I guess my uncle had a big impact

Korean: 키키 그런가 보네 다른데서는 멋있게 나오는뎅...
English: Kiki, I guess so. You look cool in other places...
Is there another drama you enjoyed watching?
www was also fun because it had Jang Ki-yong in it~

Korean: 요즘에 갯바위 차차차라고 김선호 나오는 것도 재밌어~
English: These days, it's fun to see Kim Seon-ho appear in the show "Geatbawi Chachacha"~

Korean: 아 맞아 WWW가 유명했다 난 저거 안 봤는데 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh right, WWW was famous, I didn't see it though ㅠㅠ
Did you see your sister?
I haven't seen it either! I heard it was fun, but...
Were you talking about Naver?

Korean: 꼭 네이버랑 다음 얘기 같기는 했는데~
English: It was exactly like the story about Naver and Daum~
Is the motif really Naver and Daum?

Korean: 오호 그런 내용이었구나 거기에서 그 이다희도 엄청 이쁘게 나온다고 하던데 약간 여자들이 심쿵 했다고 키키
English: Oh, that's the kind of content it was. They said that Da-hee Lee was also really pretty in it. Some women said their hearts fluttered.

Korean: 그렇다고 들었는데 나도 확실하지는 않아 키키
English: I heard that, but I'm not sure either Kiki

Korean: 맞아 이다희랑 임수정! 다 예쁜 애들이야
English: That's right, Dahee Lee and Soojung Lim! They're all pretty.

Korean: 근데 확실히 길이 차이는 있더라 둘 다 예쁘지만~
English: But there is definitely a difference in length, they are both pretty though~

Korean: 오홍 이다희가 키가 엄청 크지 않나?  임수정이 아담하신 편인가
English: Oh Hong, isn't Dahee Lee really tall? Is Soojung Lim on the petite side?

Korean: 임수정은 아담하고... 이다희 생각보다 되게 클걸?
English: Im Soo-jung is petite... but I think Lee Da-hee is a lot taller than I thought?
Since she was a model, she must be really tall~
But it's so skinny wow
Have you seen Mr. Sunshine? It's the drama of my life...

Korean: 그런 사람들 많더라! 나 그거 앞에 쪼끔 보다가 중단했어...
English: There were a lot of people like that! I stopped watching it after watching it for a bit...
Should I take note of it?

Korean: 나도 안 봤어~ 난 이병헌 별로라
English: I haven't seen it either~ I don't like Lee Byung-hun
I'm curious about what it's about~

Korean: 아아아 안돼 안돼 나도 이병헌 때문에 안 봤었는데 진짜 이건 봐야 해
English: Aaaah no no I didn't watch it because of Lee Byung Hun but I really have to watch this
This is seriously a work of art ㅠㅠ
Do you often read webtoons or comics?

Korean: 나 웹툰은 안 보고 만화는 코난이랑 짱구 슬램덩크 이런 거 좋아해~ 넌?
English: I don't read webtoons, but I like comics like Conan and Crayon Shin-chan Slam Dunk. What about you?

Korean: 난 반대로 만화 안보고 웹툰만 엄청 봐 키키
English: On the contrary, I don't read comics and I read a lot of webtoons. Kiki

Korean: 요즘에는 시험 때문에 못 보기는 하는데 끝나면 다 몰아볼 예정이야 후욱후욱
English: I can't watch it these days because of exams, but I plan to watch it all once I'm done.

Korean: 키키 나는 둘 다 안 봄~
English: Kiki I don't see either of them~

Korean: 중학교 때는 가끔 만화책 빌려서 봐보긴 했는데 그것도 몇 개 안돼...
English: When I was in middle school, I occasionally borrowed comic books to read, but there weren't that many...
Are webtoons fun?
Which author do you like?
Do you have a favorite webtoon?

Korean: 이동건이라고 유미의 세포들 그린 작가인데 진짜 캐릭처도 귀엽고 감정선이 정말 여자인 건가 싶을 정도로 세심해요!
English: The artist who drew Yumi's cells is Lee Dong-gun. His character is really cute and his emotional lines are so detailed that you might think he's really a woman!

Korean: 재미도 있고 지금도 뭐 신작 나왔더라고!
English: It's fun and there are new releases out now!
Ah, Yumi's cells! I've heard of them~

Korean: 유명하더라 영화인지 드라마로도 나오는 거 같던데? 김고은이 주인공으로
English: It's so famous that I think it's going to be made into a movie or drama? Kim Go-eun is the main character.

Korean: 맞아 드라마 야나? 예고편 같은 거 떴던데~
English: Is that right, drama Yana? There was a trailer for it~

Korean: 웅웅 맞아 맞아 그거 웹툰이 엄청 흥행 해서 드라마화 한다고 하더라...
English: Yeah, that's right, that's right. I heard that the webtoon was so popular that they're making it into a drama...

Korean: 근데 개인적으로 웹툰 기반 드라마화 한 거 그렇게 재미는 없을 것 같아서 딱히 기대는 안 하는 중
English: But personally, I don't think a drama based on a webtoon would be that interesting, so I'm not really looking forward to it.

Korean: 맞아 전에 치즈인더트랩도... 별로 였다고 했던 거 같애
English: Yeah, I think I said before that Cheese in the Trap wasn't that good either.

Korean: 그건 드라마 영화 둘 다 이상해 ㅠㅠ 내용은 괜찮은데~
English: Both the drama and the movie are weird ㅠㅠ The content is okay though~

Korean: 맞아 드라마로 했다가 평 안 좋았어서 영화로도 나왔는데 더 망했던 걸로 기억해 키키
English: Yes, I remember it was made into a drama but it didn't get good reviews so it was made into a movie too, which was even worse. Kiki

Korean: 그나마 요번에 한 간 떨어지는 동거 그거는 잘 된 것 같더라고?
English: I think this little bit of cohabitation went well this time?

Korean: 아아 장기용이랑 혜리 나온 거? 뭐 구미호 얘기인 거야...?
English: Oh, that thing with Jang Ki-yong and Hye-ri? Is that a gumiho story...?

Korean: 아 진짜? 그것도 앞에만 보다 말았는데~
English: Oh really? I only saw it from the front~

Korean: 웅웅 맞아 맞아 장기용 여기도 나왔네 맞다 키키
English: Yeah, that's right, that's right, Jang Ki-yong is here too, that's right, Kiki
Do you like Marvel movies?

Korean: 보면 재밌는데 나는 막 챙겨보는 편은 아니야! 좋아해?
English: It's fun to watch, but I'm not the type to watch it all the time! Do you like it?

Korean: 안 좋아해~ 다들 재밌다고 해서 맘 잡고 보려고 하는데 눈에 잘 안 들어오더라~ ㅠㅠ
English: I don't like it~ Everyone says it's fun so I'm trying to pull myself together and watch it, but I can't really see it~ ㅠㅠ

Korean: 약간 나랑 언니랑 취향 좀 다른 듯 키키
English: Kiki, my sister and I seem to have slightly different tastes

Korean: 나는 마블 영화 엄청 챙겨 보는데 ㅠ
English: I watch a lot of Marvel movies ㅠ
It's fun to watch!

Korean: 나는 아예 싹 보고 싶은데 너무 많아서 엄두가 안 나서 못 챙겨보는 중...
English: I want to see everything, but there are so many that I can't even think about it, so I can't keep up...

Korean: 마블 중에서 특히 어떤 게 재밌어?
English: What do you find particularly interesting about Marvel?
I definitely go with Iron Man and the Avengers!

Korean: 아항 이번에 무슨... 마블 영화긴한데 중국인들? 아시아계? 히어로물 나오던데 마블 로고 보기 전까지는 그냥 중국 삼류 영화인 줄 알았어 하하
English: Ah, what's going on this time... It's a Marvel movie, but there's a Chinese? Asian? hero movie. I thought it was just a third-rate Chinese movie until I saw the Marvel logo haha
What was the title?

Korean: 난 그 발신 제한 그거 보고 싶었는데 아직 못 봤네
English: I wanted to see that call restriction thing, but I haven't seen it yet

Korean: 아하 발신 제한 그것도 뭔가 잘된 것 같던데
English: Aha, I think that sending restriction is also a good thing.

Korean: 수원 토박아 수원 맛집 좀 추천해 줄래?
English: Can you recommend some delicious restaurants in Suwon?
Then I've been here for 24 years Kiki
What do you like?
I like everything except mushroom food!
Oh really? Do you like mala-tang by any chance?
Of course I love Mala Tang
You were the one who initiated me!

Korean: 수원 아주대에 괜찮은 마라탕 집이 있어
English: There is a good mala-tang restaurant near Ajou University in Suwon.

Korean: 우리가 갔던 곳 말고 다른 곳이야?
English: Anywhere else than where we went?
Yeah, that's right, it's new, Kiki

Korean: 기억나니 우리 먹고 배 아파서 약 먹은 거 키키
English: Do you remember when we ate and had a stomachache so we took medicine?
We ordered it too spicy back then
The spicy soup place there is a bit spicy
Even when we were hungry
Wow, we were really crazy
They were crazy about Mara
What's delicious at the new place?
I ordered egg fried rice and it was delicious and chewy.

Korean: 헐 계란볶음밥 웍으로 볶은 밥이 제일 맛있는 거 알지?
English: Wow, did you know that egg fried rice is the best when it's fried in a wok?
You know, it's really delicious Kiki

Korean: 너 가구는 원목으로 하고 싶다고 했잖아!
English: You said you wanted your furniture made of wood!
Yeah, that's right, wooden furniture is pretty~

Korean: 그러면 가전제품은 어떤 제품으로 사고 싶어?
English: So, what kind of home appliance do you want to buy?
When it comes to home appliances, it's Samsung Kiki
When it comes to home appliances, isn't it LG?

Korean: 아니야 요즘 삼성 세탁기가 너무 좋아 보여
English: No, Samsung washing machines look really good these days.
As expected, big companies are different!

Korean: 그러게 전자레인지도 하나 사고 싶어 ㅠ
English: I also want to buy a microwave oven ㅠ

Korean: 그런데 뭐니 뭐니 해도 요즘에는 건조기가 핫하지 않아?
English: But anyway, aren't dryers hot these days?
Oh yeah, the dryer was awesome
But that will ruin the fabric

Korean: 헐? 나 코인 빨래방 가서 매주 건조기 돌리는데?
English: Oh my? I go to a coin laundromat and turn on the dryer every week?

Korean: 자주 돌리면 보풀도 빨리 나고 안 좋대 ㅠ
English: If you turn it often, it will get fluffy quickly and it's not good.

Korean: 그래서 겨울 니트들이 다 상해버린 거구나 ㅜㅜ
English: So that's why all my winter knits are damaged ㅜㅜ

Korean: 응 되도록이면 건조기 사용을 자제해야 해
English: Yes, if possible, you should avoid using the dryer.

Korean: 그런데 건조기로 수건 돌리면 뽀송뽀송해서 안 돌릴 수가 없어 ㅜㅜ
English: But when I put towels in the dryer, they become so fluffy that I can't help but do it ㅜㅜ
I think a towel would be okay
Have you tried KTX?

Korean: 응 이번에 부산 갈 때 타 봤지~
English: Yeah, I rode it when I went to Busan this time~

Korean: 수원에서 부산으로 가는 거 탄 거야?
English: Did you take the train from Suwon to Busan?

Korean: 응 맞아 수원에서 한 방에 가더라
English: Yeah, that's right, I went to a room in Suwon.

Korean: 그러면 가는 데 몇 시간 걸려?
English: Then how many hours does it take to get there?

Korean: 수원에서 두 시간 반 정도 걸렸던 것 같아
English: I think it took about two and a half hours from Suwon

Korean: 와 진짜 빠르긴 하네 비용은 얼마야?
English: Wow, that's really fast. How much does it cost?

Korean: 왕복 8만 원 정도 하는데 나는 할인 받았어~
English: It costs about 80,000 won round trip, but I got a discount~

Korean: 와 진짜 비싸네 어떻게 할인 받았어?
English: Wow, that's really expensive. How did you get a discount?
I bought a pass called Tomorrow on Korail Talk

Korean: 그 패스권 나도 끊는 법 좀 알려주라!
English: Please tell me how to cancel that pass too!
You can choose to buy a 3-day or 7-day pass for tomorrow.
I see. How much does that cost?
A 3-day pass is 50,000 won and a 7-day pass is 70,000 won. Kiki, that's okay.
Then you must have bought a 50,000 won note?
Yeah, that's right. It was good because it was cheap.

Korean: 나 요즘 직장 생활이 너무 힘들다.
English: My work life is so hard these days.

Korean: 언니 취업한 지 벌써 얼마나 된 거야
English: How long has it been since you got a job, sister?
How old do you think I am?
Hasn't it been half a year?
6 months? Well, I've been going for 8 months now~
What? It hasn't even been a year yet and it's hard?
That's how all office workers are~
What did you say you were doing?
I'm working on my contract!
What is the shorthand doing?
First time hearing this

Korean: 음 네이버에 쳐 봐 말하기 귀찮다~
English: Um, I'll try searching on Naver. It's too much of a hassle to talk~
Okay, I see, I see.
Your back will hurt a lot.
Yes, this is also an occupational disease.
Everyone is just like me~
Sister, are you a full-time employee or a contract employee?

Korean: 아니 나는 우리 회사 계약직 병아리지~
English: No, I'm a contract worker at our company~
I wish I could be converted to a full-time employee Kiki
Did your boyfriend get discharged from the army?
Yeah, that's right, I was discharged from the army when my term was up. Kiki

Korean: 와 멋있다 진짜 고생했겠다 니 남친!
English: Wow, that's cool. Your boyfriend must have had a hard time!
Where did your sister's boyfriend come from?
My boyfriend is in the special forces~
Wow, that's cool.
Don't you have to be good at martial arts to do that?

Korean: 응 그냥 배정 받은 거지 뭐
English: Yeah, I just got assigned to it.
He's just an old man now.

Korean: 아 그래? 키키 근데 특공대는 어디 소속이야?
English: Oh really? Kiki, but what special forces unit are you affiliated with?
I don't know, I'm not really curious Kiki

Korean: 남자들은 군대 얘기 엄청 좋아하던데 키키 언니 남친도 그래?
English: Guys really like to talk about the military. Does Kiki's boyfriend do that too?

Korean: 오빠도 20대 중반까지는 신명나게 얘기했는데 지금은 노땅이라 잔소리만 해.
English: My brother used to talk excitedly until he was in his mid-20s, but now he's a no-nonsense person and all he does is nag.

Korean: 그래? 내 남자친구는 20대 초반이라 그런지 군대 얘기 필수야
English: Yeah? My boyfriend is in his early 20s, so talking about the military is a must.

Korean: 아 진짜 남자들은 왜 그런지 모르겠어!
English: Oh, I really don't know why men are like that!
Every time I hear that, I get goosebumps

Korean: 너도 그런 얘기 다 들어 주지 말고 다른 얘기로 돌려!
English: Don't listen to all that and change the subject to something else!

Korean: 그래서 그 얘기 나올 때마다 입을 잡아버려
English: So every time that story comes up, I hold my mouth shut
Are you studying a foreign language?

Korean: 아 나는 전에 스페인어 잠깐 배웠어
English: Oh, I learned Spanish a little bit before.
Real? When did you learn Spanish?

Korean: 겨울방학 때 심심해서~ 넷플릭스 보면서 익혔어
English: I was bored during winter break, so I learned it while watching Netflix.

Korean: 헐 스페인어로 인삿말 해 줄 수 있어?
English: Hey, can you say hello in Spanish?

Korean: 올라 부에노 디아스 어때? 영어랑 느낌 많이 다르지
English: How about Ola Bueno Diaz? It feels a lot different from English.

Korean: 어 나 다음에 너 만나면 저렇게 인사해야겠다!
English: Oh, I should greet you like that next time I see you!
Kiki, no, I'm sold out,

Korean: 언니도 넷플릭스 종이의 집 본 적 있어?
English: Sister, have you ever seen Money Heist on Netflix?
Was Paper House a Spanish drama?

Korean: 어 맞아 그거 스페인 드라마라 회화 배우기가 좋더라구
English: Oh right, that's a Spanish drama, so it's good for learning conversation.

Korean: 솔직히 나는 외국어로 말하는 애들 다 영어하는 건 줄 알았어 키키
English: Honestly, I thought all the kids who spoke a foreign language spoke English Kiki

Korean: 영어 말고도 독일어랑 일본어랑 중국어랑 많드라 ^^
English: Besides English, there are also many in German, Japanese, and Chinese ^^
Yeah, I'm just stupid~

Korean: 아 좀 배워~ 요즘은 3개 국어가 기본이래
English: Ah, learn a little~ These days, it seems like learning three languages is the basics.

Korean: 나는 한국어도 못해서 0개 국어 될 판이야 ㅜㅜ
English: I can't even speak Korean so I'm going to be a zero-language person ㅜㅜ
Really? I guess I'll have to start learning Korean again.

Korean: 요즘에도 작은 아빠 산 타러 다녀?
English: Do you still go hiking with your little dad these days?

Korean: 안 그래도 지금 산에서 내려오는 중이야
English: I'm coming down from the mountain right now anyway

Korean: 실화니 이번엔 어디 산 다녀 오시는 거야?
English: Is this true? Where are you going to go this time?

Korean: 강원도에 있는 거 같던데 나도 잘 몰라
English: I think it's in Gangwon-do, but I don't know much about it.
How many times a week do you come?

Korean: 평일에는 회사 가고 주말 이틀 정도?
English: Go to work on weekdays and two days on the weekend?
What did you bring when you got the mask?

Korean: 산삼 캐서 오거나 버섯 따오지 키키 지겨워 죽겠어
English: I'm dying from boredom without digging up ginseng or picking mushrooms.

Korean: 그것도 허가 받아야 따 올 수 있는 거지?
English: Do I need permission to get that too?

Korean: 우리 아빠 농장이 따로 있어 키키 허가 받은 거야
English: My dad has a separate farm so he got Kiki's permission.

Korean: 그렇구나 신기하다 산삼도 비싸면 몇 백만 원하잖아!
English: I see. That's strange. Even ginseng is expensive, costing millions of won!
Yeah, that's true, right?
But Kiki is not doing well these days

Korean: 그러면 요즘에 뭐 파시는 거 있어?
English: So what are you selling these days?

Korean: 요즘은 개복숭아 따다가 주변 지인들에게 나눠줘 키키
English: These days, I pick peaches and share them with people around me.
Oh, really? It's peaches season these days!

Korean: 응 맞아 비 많이 와서 많더라고 키키
English: Yeah, that's right, it rained a lot so there was a lot Kiki

Korean: 나 10월에 7주년인데 선물을 뭘 해야 할지 고민이야
English: It's my 7th anniversary in October and I'm having trouble deciding what to give as a gift.

Korean: 음 오빠 나이가 있으니깐 벨트 어때?
English: Um, oppa, since you're older, how about a belt?

Korean: 벨트 예전에 아가타 벨트 사 줬어.
English: Belt I bought an Agatha belt a while ago.

Korean: 아 그래? 더 비싼 거 하나 해 주자!
English: Oh really? Let's get you something more expensive!
Agatha belt not so good?
Somehow it never got cold.

Korean: 헐 그래도 선물 해준 건데? ㅜㅜ 너무하네
English: Wow, but you still gave me a gift? ㅜㅜ That's too much

Korean: 그러니까 어울리는 옷이 없다면서 안 차더라고!
English: So he said he didn't wear it because he didn't have any clothes that matched it!

Korean: 아 너무하네~ 그럼 명품 벨트 사줘야 차려나?
English: Oh, that's too much~ Then should I buy you a luxury belt to look good?
How much does a Gucci belt cost?
Well, maybe around 70?
I'm not sure about the belt Kiki

Korean: 나는 지금 마지노선 50 정도 생각하고 있는데!
English: I'm thinking about Maginot Line 50 right now!

Korean: 50이면 그럼 넥타이도 괜찮을 것 같네 키키
English: If you're 50, then a tie would probably be okay Kiki

Korean: 오빠 파견직이라서 런닝복을 많이 입어 ㅜㅜ
English: My brother works on a temporary contract so he wears running clothes a lot ㅜㅜ
Well, what about your wallet?

Korean: 지갑도 작년에 내가 바꿔 줬지 ㅜㅜ
English: I changed your wallet last year too ㅜㅜ
Wow, you're really amazing, sis~

Korean: 너 그러면 고양이는 어떤 종 키우고 싶어?
English: So what kind of cat do you want to raise?
I'm thinking of taking in a stray cat and adopting it.

Korean: 스트릿 출신 애들이 예쁘긴 하지 우리 오복이처럼~
English: The kids from the streets are pretty, like our Ohbok~

Korean: 품종묘 보단 유기묘 데려다 기르고 싶어서 ㅠㅠ 불쌍하기도 하고
English: I want to raise an abandoned cat rather than a purebred cat ㅠㅠ I feel bad for it too

Korean: 사촌 오빠네 고양이 애기 낳으면 데려다 키울 생각은 없어?
English: If your cousin's cat has kittens, don't you plan on taking them in to raise them?
Wow, this is totally great~
Mongsil is pretty too haha
What is the name of the breed Mongsil?
Maine Coon grows up to 1m tall.
That's right, I always forget

Korean: 나는 걔 보면 구구콘 생각이 나 키키
English: When I see him, I think of Gugucon Kiki
Why do I think of Gugucon?
The baby's fur is the color of a googocon!

Korean: 아 무늬가 좀 그렇긴 하다 키키
English: Ah, the pattern is a bit like that, Kiki
Yeah, it's totally cute
I recently had a baby, what happened?
The babies went to heaven because of vinegar ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헉 그랬구나 마음이 너무 아프다 ㅜㅜ
English: Oh my gosh, that's what happened. My heart hurts so much ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그러게 다음에는 건강하게 출산했으면 좋겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: I hope you give birth healthily next time ㅠㅠ
You don't like camping?
I like camping, but isn't it too much of a hassle?
You are my subject too
i think so too!

Korean: 차라리 모든 게 다 갖춰진 카라반 어때?
English: How about a fully equipped caravan?
Have you ever been caravan camping?

Korean: 응 봄에 가 봤는데 생각보다 괜찮던데?
English: Yeah, I went in the spring and it was better than I expected.

Korean: 헐 나는 태안으로 가 봤는데 너는 어디로 가 봤어?
English: Wow, I've been to Taean, where have you been?
I went to Ganghwa Island Kiki
Where is Ganghwa Island located?

Korean: 인천 옆이였어 거의 섬인 것 같아 키키
English: It was next to Incheon, it almost felt like an island Kiki
Then the view would have been an ocean view?
It was close to the ocean but had a mountain view.
That's a shame
Then there must have been a lot of mosquitoes and flies?

Korean: 아무래도 산 밑이라 그런데 모기장도 있더라!
English: I guess it's because it's at the bottom of a mountain, but there's also a mosquito net!
That should be a given~
What about the amount?
It's the off-season so it's cheap at 100,000 won

Korean: 너는 오버워치 캐릭터 중에 어떤 애가 제일 좋아?
English: Which Overwatch character is your favorite?
I'm a diva and a bombshell

Korean: 걔가 여자 캐릭이었지? 남자 캐릭은 안 써?
English: Wasn't she a female character? You don't use male characters?

Korean: 응 맞아 여자 캐릭 남자 캐릭은 맥크리 써
English: Yeah that's right, female character uses McCree, male character uses McCree

Korean: 그러면 니가 봤을 때 나랑 어울리는 추천할 만한 캐릭 있어?
English: Then, when you see it, is there a character you would recommend that suits me?

Korean: 언니는 에임이 좋아서 저격하는 위도우가 좋을 것 같아
English: My sister likes aiming, so I think a sniper widow would be good
What's the aim? Is Widow a female character?

Korean: 목표물을 한번에 정확히 맞추는 거 위도우는 여자 캐릭!
English: A female character who can accurately hit the target in one shot!

Korean: 그렇구나 한 판에 몇 분 정도 걸려?
English: I see. How many minutes does one game take?

Korean: 점령 게임이라 20분 정도 소요 되는 것 같아
English: It's a capture game so I think it takes about 20 minutes
That takes as long as the bag!

Korean: 응 롤이랑 비슷한 것 같아 키키 좀 오래 걸려
English: Yeah, it's similar to LoL, Kiki takes a while
I see. Was there a change of heart for that too?

Korean: 개인전 보다는 팀플레이가 우선인 것 같아 키키
English: I think team play is more important than individual play, Kiki
Isn't that just a land grab game in the end?

Korean: 맞아 그런 것 같더라구 키키 재밌어
English: Yeah, I think so too, Kiki, it's fun

Korean: 너 유럽 여행 갔을 때 얼마 들고 갔어?
English: How much did you take with you when you traveled to Europe?
I think it was around 500
So the total travel expenses are 5 million won?

Korean: 응 맞아 하지만 중간에 절도 당해서 추가로 100정도 더 든 것 같아
English: Yeah that's right but I think it got stolen in the middle so I think it cost an extra 100 or so
How did it get stolen ㅜㅜ

Korean: 내가 잠든 사이에 강도가 내 가방 가져갔어
English: A robber stole my bag while I was sleeping.
But you're not hurt, right?
Yeah, I'm glad your limbs are fine.

Korean: 니 여행 가방을 다 들고 튄 거야?
English: Did you run away with all your luggage?

Korean: 그건 아니구 중요한 배낭 가방만 들고 튀었어
English: No, I just ran away with my important backpack.
What was in there?

Korean: 여권이랑 돈이랑 카메라 에어팟 등등 ㅠㅠ
English: Passport, money, camera, AirPods, etc. ㅠㅠ

Korean: 제일 비싼 것만 가지고 튀었구나 핸드폰은?
English: You ran off with only the most expensive thing. What about the cell phone?

Korean: 핸드폰은 손에 꼭 쥐고 있었어 키키
English: Kiki was holding the phone tightly in her hand

Korean: 핸드폰도 없었으면 진짜 어떡할 거야 ㅜㅜ
English: What would I do if I didn't even have a cell phone? ㅜㅜ
Am I really an international missing person?
You said you don't like the cold?

Korean: 응 맞아 추운 게 싫어 요즘 날씨가 점점 추워져
English: Yeah, that's right. I hate the cold. The weather is getting colder these days.

Korean: 맞아 나 이제 에어컨도 잘 안 틀잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: That's right, I don't even turn on the air conditioner much anymore ㅜㅜ

Korean: 우리 집 에어컨은 이미 커버 씌웠어 키키
English: Our house air conditioner already has a cover on it Kiki
Really? You put it on that quickly?

Korean: 밤만 되면 바람이 엄청 불어 와 거긴 어때?
English: How is it there, the wind blows so hard at night?

Korean: 여기는 알잖아 창문 밖에 바로 창문 있는 거.
English: You know, here, there's a window right outside the window.
Oh, then it will be warm when it's cold~

Korean: 그건 아닌 거 같고 햇빛이 안 들어오잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: I don't think so, the sunlight isn't coming in ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그건 좀 불편하겠다 ㅠㅠ 햇빛이 있어야 되는데
English: That would be a bit uncomfortable ㅠㅠ There needs to be sunlight

Korean: 그래도 좋은 점은 어두우니까 늦잠을 잘 수 있다는 거야!
English: The good thing though is that it's dark so you can sleep in!

Korean: 그러게 나는 햇빛이 너무 잘 들어서 일찍 일어나 키키
English: That's why I wake up early because the sunlight is so good
Are you thinking of buying blackout curtains?

Korean: 암막 커텐 해도 뚫고 들어와... 이런
English: Even with the blackout curtains, it comes in through... like this

Korean: 너네 집은 곰팡이 쓸 시간이 없겠다 키키
English: Your house doesn't have time for mold Kiki
That's right, Kiki's house is very fluffy

Korean: 너 이번에 강호순이 편지 보낸 거 봤어?
English: Did you see the letter Kang Ho-sun sent this time?
Huh? What letter? This is the first time I've heard of it.

Korean: 자기네 교도관이 자기를 못살게 군다고 신변 보호 요청을 했대!
English: He said he requested personal protection because his prison guards were making his life miserable!

Korean: 엥 범죄자 주제에 신변 보호? 기가 차다 정말
English: Hey, you want personal protection for a criminal? That's really ridiculous.

Korean: 안 그래도 댓글에도 그런 얘기가 나오더라
English: There was already something like that in the comments

Korean: 목숨 붙어 있는 게 다행인 줄 알아야지
English: You should be thankful that you are still alive.
We think so

Korean: 근데 본인은 그렇게 생각을 안 하나 봐.
English: But I guess he doesn't think that way.
By the way, when is Kang Ho-soon going to be released? He's scary.

Korean: 내가 알기로 사형 선고 받고 복역 중인 걸로 알고 있어!
English: As far as I know, he is serving a death sentence!
It may not be the death penalty, but it would be life imprisonment.
Of course, since we have abolished the death penalty!

Korean: 평생 감옥에서 나오지 않았으면 좋겠어 무서워
English: I hope I never get out of prison, I'm scared
He also said that he killed a total of 10 people!
This is really creepy. How did he get caught?
Well? I'm not sure about that!

Korean: 아 진짜? 그래도 저 악마를 잡아서 다행이다
English: Oh really? Still, I'm glad I caught that demon.
Do you know the famous prophet in India?

Korean: 어 들어 본 것 같은데 왜?
English: I think I've heard of it before, but why?
Right! He predicted Corona.
Yeah, that's right. But why?

Korean: 근데 이번에 또 예언을 하나 했대!
English: But this time he made another prophecy!
Oh really? What kind of prophecy is this?

Korean: 코로나는 3년 정도 계속 지속될 거라고 하더라!
English: They say that Corona will last for about 3 years!

Korean: 너무 끔찍하다 얼른 끝내고 싶은데 코로나
English: It's so horrible, I want it to end quickly, but Corona

Korean: 근데 내년부터는 마스크 없이 살 수 있을 거라고 예언했대!
English: But he predicted that starting next year, we will be able to live without masks!

Korean: 그건 아마 공존 선언한 거 아닐까?
English: Isn't that perhaps a declaration of coexistence?
It's still a while before Corona disappears...

Korean: 그건 그래 그리고 23년에 경제 대호황이 올 거래!
English: That's right, and there's going to be a boom in the '23s!

Korean: 아 그래...? 대호황? 좋은 거 아니야??
English: Oh really...? A boom? Isn't that a good thing??

Korean: 그러니까 우리 주식을 끌어모아야 하나 봐!
English: So I guess we need to gather our stocks!

Korean: 아 주식! 주식 살 돈도 없는데 ㅠㅠ
English: Ah, stocks! I don't have money to buy stocks ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그래도 예언가가 얘기한 거니까 투자할 가치가 있지 않을까?
English: But since it's what the prophet said, isn't it worth investing in?
Sister, isn't that a scam? Be careful...

Korean: 너는 피부과 다녀 본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever been to a dermatologist?
Yeah, I went to get my mole removed recently.

Korean: 아 진짜? 점 몇 개 뺐어?
English: Oh really? How many dots did you take off?
I took out about 3 deep ones
Shouldn't the deep ones be cut out?
Yeah, it was really strong and it was hit hard with a laser.
Did that smell like burning meat?

Korean: 응 나 무슨 오징어 굽는 줄 알았잖아 키키
English: Yeah I thought you were grilling squid Kiki
I know that too
I'm also a dot-headed person Kiki

Korean: 언니는 점 있는 거 다 뺐어?
English: Sister, did you remove all the spots?

Korean: 아니 나도 깊은 거는 다시 나오더라고 그래서 그낭 달고 살아.
English: No, I also got a deep one and it came out again, so I just lived with it.
Wow, that would be stressful too ㅠㅠ

Korean: 괜찮아 어렸을 때는 얼굴에 점밖에 없었는데 지금은 포인트처럼 있어!
English: It's okay. When I was little, I only had dots on my face, but now I have them like dots!
Hmm, I guess I achieved a mental victory?
Could you please stop talking like that?
Am I really okay?
Yeah, good luck to you, unnie!

Korean: 너는 헬스장 가서 피티 받아 본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever been to a gym and gotten a personal trainer?

Korean: 응 작년에 잠깐 받아 봤어 키키
English: Yeah I got it for a bit last year Kiki
Wow, how many months have you been going?
I did it for about 4 months and then I gave up Kiki
4 months is still a long time
But why did you quit?

Korean: 응 근데 흥미가 떨어져서 이제 안 가
English: Yeah but I'm losing interest so I won't go anymore

Korean: 근데 살 빼는 게 제일 힘들어 인정?
English: But do you admit that losing weight is the hardest?

Korean: 맞아 맛있는 건 못 참지 키키
English: Yeah, I can't resist something so delicious, Kiki
How much did the PT cost there?
I was hesitant because 450,000 won for 10 times was too expensive.

Korean: 거기도 한 시간만 해 주는 건가?
English: Are you only going to do it for an hour there?
It takes about an hour, but it feels like 50 minutes.

Korean: 보통 힘들어서 1시간이 10시간 같다고 하는데 너는 반대네
English: People usually say that one hour feels like ten because it's hard, but you're the opposite.

Korean: 아니야 중간 중간 쉬는 시간도 있다구~
English: No, there are breaks in between~

Korean: 하긴 쉬지 않고 1시간 하면 나 같으면 죽었을 거야.
English: Well, if I had done it for an hour without stopping, I would have died.

Korean: 키키 그러게 피티 쌤이 살살 달래 가면서 했어
English: Kiki, that's what Teacher Piti did while gently coaxing you.
Do you trade stocks?

Korean: 주식 하다가 손절했어 너무 짜증 나서
English: I lost money while trading stocks because I was so annoyed
Wow, where did you invest and quit?

Korean: 나는 단타 치려고 여름 테마주에 넣었어
English: I put it in the summer theme stocks to make a short-term investment.

Korean: 너 은근 주식 용어 잘 쓰는구나?
English: You're actually good at using stock terminology, aren't you?

Korean: 유튜브로 조금 배웠는데 아직 난 주린이~
English: I learned a little bit on YouTube, but I'm still a beginner~
Have you thought about investing again?

Korean: 응 근데 돈이 있어야 할 것 같아 지금은 노노 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah but I think I need money so no no right now ㅠㅠ
How much did you invest when you invested in stocks?

Korean: 진짜 용돈 넣어서 10만원 넣고 5천 원 얻었어 키키
English: I put in 100,000 won of my real allowance and got 5,000 won Kiki

Korean: 그래도 마이너스는 아니었네? 좋은 거 아니야?
English: But it wasn't a minus, was it? Isn't it a good thing?
I also experienced some minuses in the middle. It was really dizzying.
How much did it drop into the red?

Korean: 2천 원 정도 내려갈 때 눈물이 나더라
English: I started crying when it went down to about 2,000 won.

Korean: 근데 금액이 적어서 그렇지 공을 몇 개 넣어 보면 진짜 눈물 날 거 같긴 해.
English: But the amount is small, so if you put in a few balls, you'll probably cry.

Korean: 그러면 나는 이 세상에 없었을 것 같아 정말...
English: Then I really feel like I wouldn't be in this world...
What songs are you listening to these days?

Korean: 나 요즘에 피식대학에 나오는 피치스 들어 키키
English: I'm listening to Peaches from Pishik University these days
Are you still listening to it?

Korean: 피식대학이 커버한 게 너무 중독성 있어 키키 들어봤어?
English: Have you heard of Kiki? The cover of Pishik University is so addictive.

Korean: 나도 그거 듣고 이거 뭐야 했는데 아침마다 듣게 되더라 키키
English: I also heard that and was like, what is this? I started listening to it every morning Kiki
Aren't the old men's pronunciations so cute?

Korean: 맞아 저스틴 비버 노래 커버 중에 최고야!
English: Yeah this is the best Justin Bieber song cover ever!

Korean: 아마 유튜브 조회수도 엄청 찍었을 거야 키키
English: Kiki, you probably got a lot of views on YouTube too
Really? How many times was it filmed?

Korean: 몇 백만 되는 것 같더라구 키키
English: I think it was a few million, Kiki
