Comments are still coming in
I know I played a part in that too!

Korean: 그러게 우리 오빠들 스트리밍 많이 해줘~ ^^
English: That's right, our brothers, please stream a lot~ ^^

Korean: 당연하지 피치스 말고 다른 곡은 안 냈어?
English: Of course you didn't release any other songs besides Peaches?
There's also Havana, listen up.
I feel like I'm in Cuba Kiki

Korean: 키키 하바나가 설마 내가 아는 카밀라의 노래는 아니겠지?
English: Kiki Havana isn't that Camila song I know, is it?
That's right, Havana is warming up~

Korean: 너 밥 먹을 때 자주 보는 동영상 있잖아.
English: There's a video you often watch while eating, right?

Korean: 나 넷플릭스로 요즘 반도 보고 있어
English: I'm watching Peninsula on Netflix these days
Is Peninsula the sequel to Train to Busan?

Korean: 아 그래? 잘 모르지만 좀비 영화라 비슷한 것 같아
English: Oh really? I don't know for sure, but it seems similar because it's a zombie movie.

Korean: 나의 사랑 강동원 씨가 나온 거잖아 키키
English: My love Kang Dong-won is in Kiki
Wow, Kang Dong-won is really handsome.

Korean: 맞아 나의 사랑 강동원 씨 역할이 뭐야?
English: That's right, what is my love Kang Dong Won's role?
Kiki, it was cool that you saved people from zombies

Korean: 역시 나의 사랑 강동원 씨 다른 배우는 누구 나와?
English: As expected, my love Kang Dong-won. Who else is the actor?

Korean: 김선아 씨 나왔던 것 같은데 여전히 아름다워
English: I think Kim Sun-ah was in it, she's still beautiful

Korean: 내가 아는 김삼순의 김선아 씨 얘기하는 건가?
English: Are you talking about Kim Sun-ah from Kim Sam-soon that I know?

Korean: 응 맞아 키키 언니도 그 드라마 알아?
English: Yeah, that's right. Does Kiki know that drama too?
Of course, it's probably a 20 year old drama?

Korean: 헐 진짜 오래되었네 키키 김선아도 안 늙더라,
English: Wow, it's really been a long time. Even Kiki and Kim Sun-ah don't age.
As expected, celebrities are different. Who is the director?

Korean: 감독 기억이 잘 안 나네 신입이었던 것 같아
English: I don't remember the director very well. I think he was a newbie.
Pasta Story is cheap and good, right?
Seriously! It's worth going if you're sick of buffets haha
Kiki, ugh, it was delicious, there were a lot of people

Korean: 맞아 근데 가게가 작아서 생각보단 없는 거 같은데 아마 비 와서 그런 듯 비 안 오면 더 많을 각!
English: Yeah, but the store is small so I don't think there's as much as I thought, but maybe it's because it rained. If it didn't rain, there would be more!

Korean: 맞아 가게가 근데 생각보다 많이 작더라 키키
English: Yes, the store is smaller than I thought, Kiki

Korean: 오늘 근데 크림 소스 맛있었어 계속 먹고 싶던댕 소스만

Korean: 키키 그니까 스프 먹는 줄 알았어
English: Kiki, I thought you were eating soup
Let's eat pizza later!

Korean: 맞아 나중에 밥 종류도 같이 놓고 먹자!

Korean: 뭔가 밥으로 배를 안 채우니까 헛배 찬 느낌이야 키키
English: I feel like I'm full because I didn't eat enough food Kiki

Korean: 웅웅 맞아 양식 먹으면 좀 그렇긴 해 키키
English: Yeah, that's right. If you eat Western food, it's a bit like that Kiki

Korean: 다음에 가면 그럼 피자랑 밥도 시켜서 먹장
English: Next time I go, I'll order pizza and rice and eat there too

Korean: 키키 웅웅 좋아 양 추가 하길 잘했어
English: Kiki woong woong good job adding sheep
If I hadn't done it, I would have been really hungry by 3 o'clock?

Korean: 좋아 좋아 맞아 지금 벌써 뭔가 출출한 느낌 들어
English: Okay okay right now I already feel like something is off

Korean: 나도 아까 진짜 배불렀는데 양치하고 오니까 좀 많이 꺼져 있어 키키
English: I was really full earlier, but when I came back after brushing my teeth, I felt a bit fuller. Kiki
Kiki, what do you want to eat for dinner? ^^

Korean: 키키 난 집 가서 잡채랑 불고기 먹을 거지롱~ 히히
English: Kiki I'm going home to eat japchae and bulgogi~ Hehe

Korean: 우왕! 불고기 자주 먹어서 안 부럽다~ ^^
English: Wow! I'm not jealous because you eat bulgogi often~ ^^
**Ah, let's go to the convenience store...
**Hey, are you really going to eat alone?

Korean: 언니 우리 뭐 먹을래...아스크림 사 먹으까
English: Sister, what do we want to eat... Should we buy ice cream?

Korean: 키키 아니 저녁 먹을 거 물어본 거 아니었어?
English: Kiki, weren't you asking what to eat for dinner?
Ice cream is a snack~
Eat seaweed and ice cream!
I don't want to eat ice cream, Merong~
Actually I want to eat it now Kiki

Korean: 아까 고민하다 안 먹어는데 좀따도 먹고 싶으면 먹을랭!
English: I was thinking about it earlier and decided not to eat it, but if you still want to eat it, then eat it!

Korean: 그니까 먹고 싶다더니 지금 먹고 싶은 거 얘기하네 키키 좀따 나가서 먹어!
English: So you said you wanted to eat, and now you're talking about what you want to eat. Kiki, go out and eat!
Yeah, I'll go with you, Kiki

Korean: 난 근데 밥 먹고 오니까 오랜만에 졸리다
English: But I'm sleepy for the first time in a while after eating

Korean: 키키 언니도? 나도 뭔가 그런 느낌이야 안 시원해서 그런가
English: Kiki-sister too? I also have that same feeling. Is it because I feel uneasy?

Korean: 난 어제 10시에 일찍 잤는데도 아침에 일어날 때 힘들었는데 그 대신 졸지는 않는다!
English: I went to bed early at 10 last night, but I had a hard time waking up in the morning, but I didn't fall asleep!

Korean: 웅웅 그런가? 급 엄청 졸리다 키키
English: Yeah, really? I'm so sleepy Kiki
If you're really sleepy, you should drink some coffee for the first time in a while~
Kiki, I should take some out and drink it too.

Korean: 언니 침대 산다 그랬지? 갑자기 왜 사?
English: Sister, you said you were going to buy a bed, right? Why are you buying it all of a sudden?
I'm running out of storage space! Kiki

Korean: 그래서 밑에 공간 넓은 걸로 사서 수납하려고
English: So I bought one with a lot of space underneath to store things.

Korean: 웅웅 나도 침대 밑에 수납 공간 있는데 그거 진짜 좋아! 추천 추천
English: Yeah, I have storage space under my bed too, and I really like it! Recommended Recommended

Korean: 오 그럼 원래 지금 침대 있긴 해?
English: Oh, so there's a bed right now?
Did you bring it from your home?

Korean: 아니 지금은 그냥 매트리스만 놓고 써!
English: No, for now, just put down a mattress and use it!

Korean: 본가에서 아무 것도 안 가져왔당 하하
English: I didn't bring anything from home haha

Korean: 요새 근데 거의 보면 수납 공간은 다 기본적으로 돼 있긴 하더라
English: But these days, if you look at most things, they all have basic storage space.

Korean: 그럼 매트리스는 그대로 침대에 놓고 쓰려구?
English: So you're going to just put the mattress on the bed and use it?

Korean: 웅웅 당근! 그냥 프레임만 사는 거야!
English: Woof woof carrot! I'm just buying the frame!

Korean: 나중에 짐 많아 지는 거 싫어서 철제로 간단한 거 산당
English: I don't want to have too much luggage later, so I bought something simple made of iron.

Korean: 이미 산 거야? 아니면 이제 주문하는 거?
English: Have you already bought it? Or are you ordering it now?
I feel alive now!
What color do you want to buy?

Korean: 흰색 사고 싶은데 튼튼한 거 찾다 보니까 후기 괜찮은 건 검정색밖에 없더라고 ㅠㅠ 그래서 검정
English: I wanted to buy white, but when I looked for something sturdy, the only one with good reviews was black. So I bought black.

Korean: 근데 생각해 보니까 언니 평일에 집 비어서 그거 어떻게 받아?
English: But come to think of it, how do you receive that when your house is empty on a weekday?

Korean: 헐 검정 침대는 처음 들어 봐
English: Wow, this is the first time I've heard of a black bed

Korean: 언니 또 검정 키보드처럼 후회하는 거 아니지...?
English: Sister, aren't you going to regret it again like the black keyboard...?

Korean: 키키 철제 프레임 한 번도 못 봤어?
English: Kiki, have you never seen a steel frame?
The steel frame is mostly black!

Korean: 나도 뭐 말하는지 잘 모르겠다 궁금해!
English: I don't know what you're talking about either, I'm curious!

Korean: 아 나중에 무겁게 옮겨 다니기 싫어서 그 철제 프레임으로 사는 거야?
English: Oh, so you're buying the iron frame because you don't want to move it around too heavily later?

Korean: 웅웅 그냥 접고 펴는 거 아마존에서 판매 1위던데?
English: Yeah, that folding and unfolding thing is the number one seller on Amazon, right?
I live by faith Kiki

Korean: 키키 나중에 후기 알려죠 월급 플렉스하넹
English: Kiki, I'll let you know later, I'll flex my salary

Korean: 오 간편하긴 하네 조립도 아니고 걍 접고 펴기만 하면 돼?
English: Oh, it's easy. You don't even have to assemble it. Just fold and unfold it?
Yeah, I see. Is that so?

Korean: 근데 튼튼하다는 후기 많아서 좀 놀랬어 키키 별로 안 비싸!
English: But I was a bit surprised because there were so many reviews saying it was sturdy. Kiki isn't that expensive!
How much are you thinking about?

Korean: 그냥 철제라서 그렇게 비싼 거 같지는 않아 3만 후반에서 4만 원 정도 하는 거 같은데
English: It doesn't seem that expensive because it's just made of iron. I think it costs around 30,000 to 40,000 won.
It was much less than I thought Kiki
I think I can buy it for around 100,000 won?

Korean: 키키 프레임만 사서 괜찮은 건가? 좋넹
English: Is it okay to just buy the Kiki frame? It's good.

Korean: 근데 지하철 되게 시끄럽지 않아? 달리는 소음 좀 심한 거 같아
English: But isn't the subway really noisy? I think the noise from the subway running is a bit loud.

Korean: 아 나도 느꼈어 특정 구간에서 더 심해지던데... 그래서 지하철에서 전화도 잘 안 해
English: Oh, I felt it too. It gets worse in certain areas... That's why I don't talk on the phone on the subway.

Korean: 키키 맞아 방배에서 사당역 갈 때 짱 심해
English: Kiki, that's right, it's really bad when you go from Bangbae to Sadang Station
I can't even hear what my sister is saying

Korean: 그치 한번식 그럼 구간 있어 너무 시끄러
English: Yeah, once in a while, there's a section so it's too noisy
In that case, the bus is better...

Korean: 진짜 키키 우리 맨날 거기서는 귀에 가까이 말해...
English: Seriously Kiki, we always talk right up to your ear there...
It was really noisy

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 오늘 비 많이 와서 버스 엄청 막히겠다
English: Kiki, that's right, but it's raining a lot today so the buses will be really congested
Study and go ^^
Kiki, but I'm really stuck...

Korean: 비 오니까 공부하고 늦게 가도 막힐 듯~ 키키
English: It's raining so I'm studying and I'm going to be late so I'll probably get stuck~ Kiki
I can see your will to go ^^

Korean: 아 ** 나 저번에 4호선 타 봤어 키키
English: Ah ** I rode line 4 last time Kiki

Korean: 4호선 언제 타 봤어? 후기 들려 줘 키키
English: When did you ride Line 4? Tell me your review Kiki

Korean: 여러분 우리 집 앞에 4호선 역 만들고 있습니다! 짱이죠
English: Guys, they're building a Line 4 station in front of my house! It's awesome.

Korean: 원래 종점인 당고개 가서 탔었는데 이어진대!
English: I originally got on at Danggogae, the final stop, but it continues!
Line 4 is rotten... haha... wow Kiki is awesome!
When will it be completed

Korean: 키키 욜 그러면 그거 쭉 타고 울 동네까지 오면 되겠당 하하
English: Kiki Yool Then I can just ride it all the way to my neighborhood haha
Kiki is too far away~

Korean: 이번 년도 말에 완공 된다는데 그거 말 나온 지 5년은 된 거 같은데 드디어...
English: It's supposed to be completed by the end of this year, but it's been five years since that was mentioned, and finally...

Korean: 오 축하해 키키 난 4호선 타고 거기 가 봤어 이수역!
English: Oh congratulations Kiki I went there on Line 4, Isu Station!

Korean: 키키 오 나 이수 자주 갔어 앞으로 이수에서 모이자! 키키
English: Kiki Oh, I often go to Isu Let's meet at Isu from now on! Kiki
Where is Kiki Isu...

Korean: 나한테 멀 거 같은 느낌인데? 키키
English: Do you feel like you're too far away from me? Kiki
Oing **isn't this good for you Kiki
But it's not far from my house

Korean: 키키 맞아 사실 우리 집이랑 가까워
English: Kiki, that's right, it's close to my house
How long does it take you two to get there?
I looked it up and it seems like it's not that far, with Line 7 taking 1 hour and 8 minutes and Line 4 taking 1 hour and 14 minutes!
Uh... How far? Kiki, I'll be around 30 minutes?

Korean: 키키 우리는 나중에도 모이려면 강남이 제일 적당하긴 하겠당 그치
English: Kiki, if we're going to meet up later, Gangnam would be the best place, right?
It takes about the same time as Gangnam, Kiki

Korean: 그거 알지 경기도민들은 한 시간이면 괜찮네 하고 한 시간 반이면 좀 걸리네 이러는 거 키키
English: You know, Gyeonggi-do residents say an hour is fine, and an hour and a half is a bit long.

Korean: 서울 사람들은 한 시간이면 와 멀다 이러고 키키
English: People in Seoul say it's far away in an hour.

Korean: 아키키 짱 웃겨 나 서울 사람으로 쳐주는 거야? 하하
English: Akiki-chan, you're funny. Are you saying I'm from Seoul? Haha

Korean: 키키 욜 프로 서울러~ 우리 서울 투어 시켜 줘라
English: Kiki Yole Pro Seouler~ Take us on a Seoul tour

Korean: 회사 다닐 때 같이 일하는 사람들이 진짜 중요한 거 같아!
English: I think the people you work with are really important when you're working at a company!

Korean: 나나 우리 생각하고 말하는 거지? 하하 재밌지?!
English: Nana, you're thinking and talking about us, right? Haha, isn't it funny?!

Korean: 키키 그래서 지금 회사 생활이 어떤 것 같은데?
English: Kiki: So what is company life like now?

Korean: 맞아 언니들이랑 너무 재밌게 회사 생활 중 ^^
English: Yes, I'm having so much fun at work with my sisters ^^

Korean: 요즘 초딩화 되어가고 있어 키키 그렇지 않아?
English: Kiki, aren't you becoming more and more childish these days?

Korean: 키키 맞아 솔직히 고딩도 아니고 중딩 친구들 같아 너네 좋아 ^^
English: Kiki, that's right, honestly, you guys are like middle school friends, not even high school students. I like you guys ^^

Korean: 나 원래 안 그런데 언니들이랑 있으면 초딩처럼 하게 돼
English: I'm not like that normally, but when I'm with my sisters, I act like an elementary school kid.
That's why the group atmosphere is important~ Kiki

Korean: 진짜 키키 얘들아 내가 진짜 그래... 근데 너네는 손목 안 아파?
English: Seriously Kiki guys I really do... but don't your wrists hurt?
When you move your mouse!

Korean: 아파 ㅠㅠ 진짜 하루 종일 계속 클릭해서 그런 가 봐 손도 자주 스트레징해야 돼 진짜
English: It hurts ㅠㅠ I guess it's because I keep clicking all day. I really need to stretch my hands often.
Really? I'm not in any pain!

Korean: 근데 마우스가 달라서 그럴 수도 있어
English: But it could be because the mouse is different

Korean: ** 언니 거는 마우스 클릭 소리 진짜 크더라...
English: ** My sister's mouse click sound is really loud...

Korean: 키키 맞아 여기서도 들려 좀 조용하면
English: Kiki, you're right, I can hear you here too, if you're a little quiet

Korean: 난 마우스 클릭하다가 손목 돌리면 우두둑 소리 엄청 나던데
English: When I click the mouse and turn my wrist, it makes a really loud clicking sound.

Korean: 키키 아 맞아 내 꺼 크더라고 몰랐는데
English: Kiki, oh right, I didn't know mine was that big

Korean: 옆에 언니 꺼 쓸 때 아예 무소음인 거 보고 그때 알았어
English: I knew it when I saw that it was completely silent when my sister next to me used it.

Korean: 웅 내 거도 아예 소리 안 나 키키
English: Yeah, mine doesn't make any noise either

Korean: 저번 주 금요일에 우리 셋이서만 공부할 때 너무 조용하니까 ** 언니 마우스 클릭 소리 신경 쓰이더라고 키키
English: Last Friday, when the three of us were studying alone, it was so quiet that ** sister was bothered by the sound of the mouse clicking. Kiki

Korean: 키키 내 것도 좀 크다고 생각했는데 **이 마우스 조금 크긴 해!
English: Kiki I thought mine was a bit big too, **this mouse is a bit big!
Are you guys up to speed now?

Korean: 웅웅 지금 드라마 작업 정제하는데 내용 이어지고 재밌어서 좋아!
English: Yeah, I'm currently refining the drama, and the content is continuous and fun, so I like it!
I can work now too~

Korean: 내용이 너무 막장이긴 한데 이어지니까 재밌긴 해 키키
English: The content is so ridiculous, but it's still fun because it continues. Kiki

Korean: 난 지금 내용 하나도 모르겠어 키키
English: I don't understand a single thing right now Kiki

Korean: 지금 900개 가까이 했는데 그냥 하는 중...
English: I've done close to 900 so far and I'm just doing it...

Korean: 나는 내 마음이 들리니 하는데 이거 제목으로는 몰랐는데 그 황정음이랑 김재원 목소리 나오는 거 보고 무슨 드라마인지 알 것 같아 키키
English: I can hear my heart. I didn't know this from the title, but I think I know what drama it is because I hear Hwang Jung-eum and Kim Jae-won's voices. Kiki

Korean: 키키 내가 꼰대 인턴 할 때 그랬어 내용 모르고 끝남 키키
English: Kiki I did that when I was an intern at Kkondae. I didn't know the content and it ended. Kiki

Korean: 내 마음이 들리니 들어 본 거 같은데 황정음 드라마 단골이네 키키
English: I think I've heard it before, but Hwang Jung-eum is a regular in Kiki's dramas

Korean: 나도 황정음 나오는 드라마 했었는데 키키
English: I also did a drama with Hwang Jung-eum, Kiki
There really are a lot of dramas out there...

Korean: 작업할 때 목소리도 튀어서 바로 알 수 있어
English: When you work, your voice will pop out and you can tell right away

Korean: 맞아 키키 그리고 이거 본 적은 없는데 옛날에 유명했던 것 같아서 바로 알았어 그 남궁민 나오고! 알아?
English: Yeah Kiki and I've never seen this before but I thought it was famous a long time ago so I knew right away that Nam Goong Min is in it! You know?

Korean: 맞아 목소리 짱 튀어 키키 아니 잘 몰라 키키
English: Yeah your voice is really great Kiki no I don't know Kiki
Hmm, I don't know either ㅠㅠ

Korean: 내가 중간 중간 내용 알게 되면 알려줄게 하하
English: I'll let you know when I find out more info haha

Korean: 육군 해군 공군도 그렇고 제복 되게 멋있는 거 같아!
English: I think the Army, Navy, and Air Force uniforms are all really cool!

Korean: 아 맞아 키키! 제복 진짜 멋있어 주변에 해병대 간 사람 있어? 키키
English: Oh right Kiki! Your uniform is really cool. Do you know anyone who was in the Marines? Kiki

Korean: 나는 친한 사람 중에 해병대는 없는 것 같아! 키키
English: I don't think any of my close friends are Marines! Kiki
Do you have a lot of friends in the Marine Corps?
I've never seen a Marine either!

Korean: 오 진짜? 내 주변엔 은근히 많았어 키키
English: Oh really? There were quite a few Kiki around me.

Korean: 술 마실 때 짜증 났다 휴!
English: I get annoyed when I drink. Phew!

Korean: 키키 해병대 썰 풀어? 기억나는 얘기 들려줘
English: Kiki, tell me the Marine Corps story? Tell me a story you remember.

Korean: 진짜? 그러고 보니 신기하네 어떻게 주변에 한 명도 없지
English: Really? Now that I think about it, it's strange. How is there not a single person around?

Korean: 맨날 취하면 같은 얘기 했는데 이제 기억도 안 나 키키
English: I used to say the same thing every time I got drunk, but now I can't even remember it Kiki

Korean: 심지어 동기들끼리 같이 갔다 오고 그래서 더 시끄러웠던 것 같당
English: I think it was even noisier because we went and came back together with our classmates.

Korean: 나는 주변 군대 얘기 나오면 생각보다 또라이가 엄청 많다는 얘기 들었던 것 같아 키키
English: I think I heard that there are a lot more thugs than you think when it comes to talking about the military around here. Kiki

Korean: 진짜 이상한 사람들도 다 모아 놨는데 또라이가 많을 수밖에 없는... ㅜㅜ
English: I gathered all the really weird people together, so there's bound to be a lot of weirdos... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 생각해 보니까 내 남자친구도 해병대라고 했던 것 같은데 키키 아닌가...
English: Oh, come to think of it, I think my boyfriend said he was a Marine too, right? Isn't it Kiki?

Korean: 키키 지금 남자친구? 남자친구한테 관심 좀!
English: Kiki, do you have a boyfriend now? Pay attention to your boyfriend!

Korean: 키키 아 지금 남친 해병대래? 기억 못 했다고 일러야지~
English: Kiki, your boyfriend is in the Marines now? I should tell him that I don't remember~

Korean: 아니야 방금 물어보고 왔어 키키 맞대 키키 너무 웃기다
English: No I just asked Kiki Kiki is so funny

Korean: 키키 제일 측근이 있었네 갔다 온 소감 좀 물어봐 키키
English: Kiki's closest aide was there. Ask him what he thought of her visit. Kiki

Korean: 오 멋있네 언니 상남자 만나고 있네~
English: Oh, cool, you're seeing a cool guy~

Korean: 전에 거기서 엄청 먹고문 했다고 들은 것 같아... 억지로 뭘 엄청 먹였대
English: I heard that you ate a lot there before... You forced yourself to eat a lot of something

Korean: 헐 진짜? 미친 거 아니냐 먹고문이 뭐야 진짜...
English: Wow, really? Are you crazy? What the heck is this? Seriously...

Korean: 그 예전에 군대에서 괴롭혀서 죽은 사건에서도 냉동 억지로 먹여서 죽었잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: In that incident where someone died from being bullied in the military before, they forced him to eat frozen food and he died. ㅜㅜ

Korean: 진짜 인성 덜 된 애들 많아...
English: There are so many kids with really bad character...

Korean: 웅웅  ㅠㅠ 엄청 마른 애들 있으면 일부러 팔굽혀펴기도 엄청 시키고 키키
English: Yeah, yeah ㅠㅠ If there are really skinny kids, I make them do a lot of push-ups on purpose.

Korean: 근데 이건 좀 웃기기도 했어 몸 만들어 주는 거 아니야?
English: But this was kind of funny. Isn't it supposed to help you build your body?

Korean: 진짜 죽은 사람들도 많으니까 요새는 좀만 그러면 바로 신고잖아 ㅠㅠ 다행이야
English: There are a lot of people who actually died, so these days, if you do something like that, you get reported right away. That's fortunate.

Korean: 키키 몸 만들어 주는 거긴 하네
English: Kiki, you're giving me a body

Korean: 근데 난 누가 억지로 시키면 더 하기 싫을 듯~
English: But I think I would hate it even more if someone forced me to do it~
Yeah, that's just something I heard...

Korean: 암튼 사람 같지 않은 것들이 넘 많긴 해  ㅠㅠ
English: Anyway, there are so many things that don't seem human ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 해병대 갔다 온 언니 남친에게 박수 쳐 주자!
English: That's right, let's give a round of applause to my sister's boyfriend who went to the Marines!

Korean: 예전에 학교 다닐 때 예체능 시간 되게 좋아했는데 언니들도 인정?
English: When I was in school, I really liked arts and physical education classes. Do your older sisters agree?

Korean: 하하 맞아 이동 수업이라서 더 좋아
English: Haha, that's right, it's better because it's a mobile class

Korean: 키키 웅웅 나는 체육 시간되면 나가자 파였어 너네는?
English: Kiki woong woong I was like let's go out during gym class what about you guys?

Korean: 나는 당연히 나가기 싫어했지 키키 엠비티아이 맨 앞에 아이잖아
English: Of course I didn't want to go out. Kiki MBTI was the kid in front.

Korean: 나도 나가지 말자파... 체육 시간에 비 오는 거 젤 좋았다
English: I don't want to go out either... I liked it the most when it rained during gym class.
Kiki, is it really true that MBTI is like this?

Korean: 어케 그래 ㅠㅠ 밖에 나가야 재밌잖아! 아니야?
English: How is that? It's more fun if you go outside! Right?
Yeah, but it's annoying Kiki

Korean: 그리고 체육 시간에 옷 갈아 입는 거 너무 귀찮았어
English: And I hated having to change clothes during gym class

Korean: 인정? 귀한 쉬는 시간 옷 갈아입다가 다 날림
English: Admit it? I wasted all my precious free time changing clothes.

Korean: 키키 맞아 체육복은 근데 맨날 입고 있었어 편해서 그래도 나가는 건 싫어...
English: Kiki, that's right, I wear gym clothes all the time, they're comfortable, but I still don't like going out...

Korean: 키키 근데 나도 체육복 자주 입고 있어서
English: Kiki But I also wear gym clothes often

Korean: 글고 여고여서 안 입고 있어도 훌렁훌렁
English: And since it's a girls' school, I can still wear it without it getting wet
Oh my ** You said you were going to an all-girls high school!? You went to an engineering middle school?

Korean: 여고 부러워! 난 공학이긴 했는데 거의 여고 수준이긴 했어 키키
English: I envy you at girls' high school! I majored in engineering, but I was almost at the level of girls' high school Kiki

Korean: 키키 웅웅 여고! 근데 옆에 외고랑 운동장 같이 썼는데 생각해 보니까 지금 만나는 남자친구 거기 다녔다 키키
English: Kiki, woong woong girls' high school! But the playground was shared with the foreign language high school next door, and come to think of it, my current boyfriend went there Kiki
Wow, that's amazing. It must be fate!

Korean: 그래 진짜! 신기해 하하 그땐 몰랐징 서로?
English: Yeah, really! That's amazing haha. We didn't know each other back then?

Korean: 키키 웅웅 그때는 몰랐어 다행이야 참 ^^
English: Kiki Woong Woong I didn't know that back then, thank goodness ^^
But were you two good at art?

Korean: 키키 나름 잘했지 내 생각만일 수도 있지만 ^^
English: Kiki did a good job, it could just be my opinion though ^^

Korean: 키키 초딩 때는 나름 잘했었던 것 같은데...
English: Kiki, I think I did pretty well in elementary school...

Korean: 키키 나는 미술 학원도 다녔는데 미술 샘이 공포 얘기 해 주는 거 들으러 다닌 듯
English: Kiki I also went to art school, but I think I went there to listen to the art teacher tell horror stories.

Korean: 키키 나도 미술 학원 다녔었어 거기서 잘한다고 엄마 보고 나 미술 쪽으로 보내랬다구...
English: Kiki, I also went to an art school. My mom told me that I was good at it, so she sent me to art school...

Korean: 난 색칠하면 망했었어 뭔지 알지 키키
English: I was ruined when I colored you know what Kiki

Korean: 오 다들 미술 학원 다녔었네 난 안 다녔오 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, everyone went to art school. I didn't go. ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 친구 따라 갔다가 그 쌤이랑 친해져서 맨날 놀러 감...
English: But I went there with a friend and became close with that teacher, so we went there to hang out every day...

Korean: 키키 나는 차라리 그런 따라 그리는 거 보다 무슨 한지 같은 거로 뭐 만드는 거 있었거든? 그런 거 더 좋아했던 것 같아
English: Kiki I think I'd rather make something with something like Hanji than draw like that.

Korean: 맞아 색칠하면 망함 키키 만드는 것도 재밌었지~
English: Yes, it's ruined if you color it. It was fun making Kiki too~

Korean: 난 초딩 때가 딱 끝이야 하하
English: I finished elementary school right away haha

Korean: 그 후로는 별로 관심 없었던 것 같아
English: I don't think I was very interested after that

Korean: 키키 이참에 미술이나 다시 배워 봐야겠당
English: Kiki, I guess I should learn art again while I'm at it.
Sisters, do you have a group chat with your family?

Korean: 단톡방 내가 만들면 사라지고 만들면 사라져 키키
English: When I create a group chat, it disappears, and when I create it, it disappears Kiki

Korean: 우리는 단톡 안 써 하하 내가 뭐 공지할 때만 생김!
English: We don't use group chats haha it only happens when I make an announcement!

Korean: 키키 뭔지 알겠다 나도 있는데 필요한 말 말고 아예 활동 없어 키키
English: Kiki I know what it is I have it too but other than the words I need to say there is no activity at all Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 뭔지 알아 키키 우리도 있긴 있는데 가끔 필요할 때 말고는 활동 안 함
English: Kiki, you know what it is Kiki, we have them too, but we don't do anything except when necessary.

Korean: 근데 가족 단톡 활발한 집 은근히 많도랑!
English: But there are quite a few houses that secretly have active family group chats!

Korean: 키키 맞아 그런 집들 많아 일단 우리 집은 아니야 우리 집은 주로 전화해
English: Kiki, that's right. There are a lot of houses like that. First of all, not my house. My house is mostly called.

Korean: 맞아 우리도 주로 전화 키키 심지어 별 중요한 말 아니면 읽씹 당함키키
English: Yes, we also usually talk on the phone and even if it's not something important, we get ignored.
Kiki, that's right, I used to do that too...

Korean: 그리고 우리 엄마 아빠는 내가 단톡 파서 말하면 자꾸 갠톡으로 답장 와 키키
English: And my mom and dad keep replying to my private messages when I talk in the group chat.
So cute, really

Korean: 키키 우리 아빠 톡으로 나한테 제일 많이 하는 말 아빠에게 전화해. 딱 이렇게 와
English: Kiki My dad says the most to me on text: Call dad. It's just like this.
Kiki, why are you all so cute...

Korean: 아니 언니는 왜 갠톡으로 답장 오는 거고 언니는 왜 먼저 전화하시면 되는데 전화하라고 카톡해 키키
English: No, why are you replying to my texts through Gantalk? Why are you sending me a KakaoTalk message telling me to call you when you could have just called me first? Kiki

Korean: 키키 몰라 나도 그게 훨씬 불편할 것 같은데 맨날 말해도 거기에 답 안 하고 갠톡으로 옴 키키
English: Kiki I don't know, I think that would be much more uncomfortable, but even if I tell you every day, you don't respond and come to the chatroom Kiki

Korean: 키키 각자 자기 언니 오빠 장점들을 말해 보자! ^^
English: Kiki, let's each tell each other about your sister and brother's strengths! ^^

Korean: 아니 갑자기 언니 오빠 장점을 왜 말해 남사시럽게 키키
English: Why are you suddenly talking about your brother's good points like that? Kiki

Korean: 진짜 키키 장점이 있는지 정말 의문이다...
English: I really question whether Kiki has any real merits...
It takes too much thought

Korean: 키키 이럴 때 말하는 거지 빨리 강제로 한 개는 말해 봐
English: Kiki, this is what you say in such a situation. Tell me one thing quickly and forcefully.
They celebrate anniversaries well...

Korean: 아니 근데 나 언니가 퍼스널 컬러 비싸서 돈 아깝다고 안 가 준다 해서 좀 칭찬할 기분 아닌데 키키
English: No, but my sister said she didn't want to buy personal color because it was expensive and it was a waste of money, so I don't feel like praising her. Kiki

Korean: 우리 엄마 아들 딸들은 장점이 없는 게 장점이야!
English: Our mother's sons and daughters have no strengths, that's their strength!

Korean: 키키 둘 다 짱 웃기네 키키
English: Kiki, you're both so funny Kiki

Korean: 그러면 아 이럴 때 진짜 때리고 싶다 순간 말해 줘
English: Then tell me when you really want to hit me

Korean: 우리 인터뷰 하냐고 자기 외동이라고 아주 어이가 없네!
English: He's so absurd, he's asking for an interview and he's his only child!
I want to hit you when you act selfishly.

Korean: 진짜 키키 우리 언니 머리카락 병적으로 싫어해서 맨날 치우고 있어
English: Seriously, Kiki, my sister hates hair so much that she always brushes it off.

Korean: 귀찮아 죽겠는데 자꾸 이리저리 나와 보라 해 넘 싫어...
English: I'm dying from annoyance, but you keep telling me to come out here and there. I hate it...
Isn't it totally great? Kiki

Korean: 머리카락은 근데 진짜 어떻게 그렇게 많이 빠지는지 진짜
English: But seriously, how come so much hair falls out?

Korean: 아니 하라고 시키는 것도 아니고 하면서 나오라고 하는 건 괜찮다 그나마 키키
English: No, it's okay to tell someone to come out even though I'm not telling them to. At least Kiki

Korean: 아니야 시키기도 해 그냥 방금 치우고 치우고 또 치워 키키 한 가닥도 용납 못 해...
English: No, I even order you to do it. Just clean it up and clean it up and clean it up again. I can't tolerate even a single bit of Kiki...

Korean: 휴 이건 겪어 봐야 알아 키키
English: Hey, you have to experience it to know Kiki

Korean: 키키 언니 근데 머리카락 두꺼워서 더 잘 보일 것 같긴 하당
English: Kiki Unnie, but I think it would look better because your hair is thick

Korean: 나중에 애 낳게 되면 딸 낳고 싶어 아들 낳고 싶어?
English: If you have a child later, do you want to have a daughter or a son?

Korean: 무조건 딸이지! 아들은 우리 오빠만 봐도 흠...
English: Definitely a daughter! As for a son, just looking at my brother...

Korean: 나는 아들! 키키 듬직한 아들이 나 도와줬으면 좋겠어
English: I am a son! I wish Kiki, a good son, would help me.

Korean: 키키 언니 아들 부려먹으려고! 나도 딸 낳고 싶어 하하
English: Kiki, you want to use your son! I want to have a daughter too haha
**This dream is big! Haha

Korean: 근데 요즘 같은 세상에 딸 놓기도 싫어... ^^ 불안해
English: But in this day and age, I don't want to let go of my daughter... ^^ I'm anxious

Korean: 키키 사실 아들 하나 딸 하나가 베스트인데 둘 중 누가 먼저인 게 나을 것 같아?
English: Kiki Actually, either a son or a daughter is best, but which one do you think should come first?
Yeah, I'm anxious... The world is so scary

Korean: 맞아 나도 아들 하나 딸 하나 낳고 싶긴 한데 첫째는 딸이 낫지
English: Yes, I also want to have a son and a daughter, but I think it's better to have a daughter as the first child.
If the first child is a son, they beat him a lot...
If I had to choose, it would be my son!

Korean: 아들 교육 잘 시켜서 동생 보호하라고 해야지 하하
English: I have to tell my son to raise himself well so he can protect his younger sibling haha
Kiki, the two of you are completely different

Korean: 맞아 근데 나도 약간 오빠 로망 있었어 뭔가 보호해 줄 것 같은...?
English: Yeah, but I also had a bit of a romantic idea about my older brother. He seemed like he would protect me somehow...?

Korean: 다들 꿈이 크구만 그게 교육으로 됐으면... 키키
English: Everyone has big dreams. I wish they could be realized through education... Kiki

Korean: 근데 어차피 복불복이니까 난 아들 둘은 절대 절대 싫다
English: But since it's a hit or miss anyway, I absolutely absolutely don't want two sons.

Korean: 키키 근데 애초에 난 아들에 대한 기대가 없어...
English: Kiki But I didn't have any expectations for my son in the first place...

Korean: 주변 친구들이나 우리 집 아들만 봐도... 그리고 이런 팍팍한 세상에 안 태어났으면 좋겠어 내 자식들이
English: Just looking at my friends around me or my son... I wish my children were not born into this harsh world.

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 진짜 요새는 둘이 사는 집도 많긴 하더라 여행도 다니면서
English: Kiki, that's right, but these days, there are a lot of houses where two people live together and travel together.

Korean: 그거 뭐라 부르는 말 있잖 뭐더라 무슨 족인데
English: There's a name for that, what is it? What kind of tribe is it?

Korean: 저번에 내가 말했는데 기억 안 나서 찾아봤다 키키 딩크족이래
English: I said it last time, but I didn't remember, so I looked it up and it's Kiki DINK.

Korean: 키키 맞아 딩크족 나 아는 언니도 결혼했는데 둘이서 맨날 여행 다니고 캠핑 다니더라 알콩달콩
English: Kiki, that's right, I know a DINK, and my older sister is married. The two of them always travel and go camping together. They're so sweet.
That's right, that's right, DINKs! That's the correct answer.

Korean: 나도 그래서 신혼 3년에서 5년은 즐기고 애 낳고 싶다 ㅜㅜ
English: That's why I want to enjoy the first 3 to 5 years of marriage and then have a baby. ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나도 내 로망이당! 그러다가 애기 낳고 싶으면 또 낳는 거고 하하
English: I also have my own dream! Then, if I want to have a baby, I can have another baby haha

Korean: 키키 맞아 나 혼자 사는 것도 힘든데 애기 어케 케어하고 살아 새삼 대단해 진짜
English: Kiki, it's hard for me to live alone, but I'm really amazed at how you take care of a baby and live like that.
Yes, parents are really great! Let's do our best!

Korean: 키키 맞아 근데 난 맨날 결혼 일찍 할 것 같다 애기 잘 키울 것 같다는 소리 많이 들었어...
English: Kiki, that's right, but I've always heard people say that I'll get married early and raise my children well...

Korean: 근데 그 말 했던 애들이 먼저 결혼하는 중... ^^
English: But the kids who said that are getting married first... ^^

Korean: 키키 악 키키 언니 근데 애기 잘 키울 것 같긴 해
English: Kiki, oh no, Kiki, unnie, but I think she'll raise the baby well

Korean: 키키 언니 애 낳으면 언니를 화나게 하는 사람 2명에서 3명으로 늘어나겠구만
English: If Kiki has a child, the number of people who make her angry will increase from two to three.

Korean: 키키 휴... 어쩌겠어! 낳았으면 책임져야지 뭐~
English: Kiki, phew... what can I do! If you gave birth to a child, you have to take responsibility for it~

Korean: 키키 그래! 결혼부터 하고 생각하지 뭐
English: Kiki Yeah! I'll think about it after I get married.

Korean: 전에 동네에서 알파카 목줄 달고 돌아다니는 사람 봤어
English: I saw someone walking around the neighborhood with an alpaca leash the other day.
But I looked a little strange...
Why why? Alpacas are really cute ㅠㅠ
Kiki Really? An alpaca on a leash?

Korean: 거의 동물원에서도 못 볼 일 아니야?
English: Isn't this something you wouldn't see even in a zoo?

Korean: 키키 그니까 키우는 게 흔한 게 아니니까 그 사람이 알파카만 데리고 나오면 사람들이 몰려들어서 사진 찍고 난리 나는데
English: Kiki, so it's not common to raise an alpaca, so when that person brings one out, people flock to take pictures and it's chaos.

Korean: 그걸 즐기는 거 같아서 좀 그랬어 ㅜㅜ
English: I felt like I was enjoying it so I was a bit like that ㅜㅜ
I raised it because I wanted to get attention...

Korean: 아아 진짜 그럴 수도 있겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, that could really be true ㅠㅠ

Korean: 근데 알파카도 그렇게 목줄하고 다녀도 되나?
English: But is it okay for an alpaca to walk around with a leash like that?

Korean: 아예 정보를 모르겠네 전에 TV에서 알파카 키우는 형제 나온 거 봤었는데... 하하
English: I don't know anything at all. I saw a couple raising alpacas on TV before... haha

Korean: 그니까 나는 일단 너무 놀랄 것 같아
English: So I think I'd be really surprised

Korean: 글고 마당 있는 집 아니면 키우기 힘들지 않을까? ㅠㅠ
English: And wouldn't it be difficult to raise them if you don't live in a house with a yard? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그니까 나도 모르겠다 그렇게 다녀도 되는지는!
English: So I don't know if it's okay to go like that!

Korean: 맞아 되게 커서 마당 없는 집에서는 힘들 거 같더라
English: Yeah, it's really big, so I think it would be difficult to live in a house without a yard.

Korean: 근데 그 TV에 나왔던 사람들도 내 기억에 아파트에서 키웠던 것 같당
English: But I think the people who appeared on TV were also raised in apartments.

Korean: 키키 아니 글고 냄새 날 것 같아 ㅠㅠ 관리 어떻게 해
English: Kiki, no, I think it smells ㅠㅠ How do you manage it?

Korean: 헐 아파트에서는 알파카가 너무 불쌍해 ㅜㅜ
English: Wow, I feel so bad for the alpaca in the apartment ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 냄새 크기 클수록 많이 나잖아
English: That's right, the bigger the smell, the more it comes out.

Korean: 근데 너네 갓 태어난 알파카 봤어? 키키
English: By the way, have you seen the newborn alpaca? Kiki
They're really hairy guys...
It's so thin it's disgusting... Thin and long

Korean: 글고 그거 똥 처리 어떻게 해...?
English: And how do you dispose of that poop...?
Kiki, no, I haven't seen it
Are you born hairless?
The poop guy has to clean it up... Kiki
Yeah, no fur Kiki

Korean: 그런 거 감수할 수 있는 사람이 키우는 거지!
English: It's raised by someone who can handle that kind of thing!

Korean: 저번에 어디 나온 거 봤는데 강아지 기르는 것처럼 방법이 다 있더라구~
English: I saw it somewhere last time, and it seems like there are various methods for raising a puppy~

Korean: 어릴 때부터 주인이랑 교감하고 하면 뭐 큰 문제 없지 않을까?
English: If they communicate with their owners from a young age, there won't be any big problems, right?

Korean: 키키 나는 근데 강아지도 키우고 싶긴 한데 한편으로는 걔 죽는 거 생각했을 때 너무 슬플 것 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Kiki I want to raise a dog, but on the other hand, I think it would be too sad to think about it dying ㅠㅠ
Yeah, that's why I can't raise him either

Korean: 나보다 수명이 짧은 걸 아는데 나보다 먼저 죽을 걸 알면서 키우는 거잖아
English: I know that he has a shorter lifespan than me, but I raise him knowing that he will die before me.

Korean: 너무 힘들 거 뻔하니까 처음부터 키우질 말아야지...
English: It's obvious that it'll be too hard, so you shouldn't raise it from the beginning...

Korean: 맞아 ㅠㅠ 그리고 반려동물 키우는 것도 신중하기도 하고 키우기 전에 공부도 많이 하고 키워야 하니까 쉽게 생각 못 할 일이긴 해
English: That's right ㅠㅠ And raising a pet is something that you have to be careful about and study a lot before raising it, so it's not something you can easily think about.
Yeah, I feel like crying all the time

Korean: 진짜 나중에 결혼하고 자리 잡으면 그때 생각해 봐야 할 듯 나는
English: I think I should really think about it later when I get married and settle down.

Korean: 맞아 신중하게 공부 많이 하면서 키워야 돼 ㅜㅜ
English: That's right, you have to raise them carefully and study hard ㅜㅜ

Korean: 난 중학교 때 병아리 부화시켰다고 했잖아
English: I told you that I hatched a chick in middle school.

Korean: 첨에 우리 집 데려갔다가 죽었는데 만난 지 이틀인가밖에 안 됐는데도 진심 하루 종일 펑펑 울었어
English: The first time I brought him to my house, he died. Even though it had only been two days since I met him, I cried all day long.

Korean: 학교 가는 길에도 울고 학교에서도 내내 울고...
English: I cried on the way to school and I cried all the time at school...
I think it was more like that when I was young ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 강아지 분양 받고 2주 만에 파보장염으로 죽었었는데 진짜 한참 울었어 ㅠㅠ
English: I also received a puppy and it died of parvovirus two weeks later. I cried for a long time.

Korean: 그 뒤로 애견샵 절대 안 가
English: I've never been to a pet shop since then

Korean: 헐 진짜?... 봐바 그렇게 짧은 기간이었는데도 엄청 슬프잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh really?... Look, it was such a short period of time, but it's so sad ㅠㅠ
I don't want to be heartbroken, sob, sob
Yeah, I can't because I'm sad ㅜㅜ

Korean: 내 주변 사람들도 다 평생 건강해라!
English: May everyone around me be healthy for the rest of their lives!

Korean: 좋아 진짜 우리 다 건강하게 오래 살장! 하하
English: Okay, let's all live long and healthy! Haha

Korean: 키키 구랭 나중에 강아지도 이쁘게 키워 보자!
English: Kiki Guren, let's raise a pretty puppy later!
Has anyone tried paragliding!?

Korean: 오 난 놉! 해 보고 싶어 하하
English: Oh no! I want to try haha

Korean: 패러글라이딩 나도 해 보고 싶어! 키키
English: I want to try paragliding too! Kiki
It's scary but I think it'll be fun

Korean: 나도 진짜 살면서 꼭 해 보고 싶은 버킷리스트야!
English: It's something on my bucket list that I really want to do in my lifetime!

Korean: 오 그럼 우리 같이해 보러 가면 되겠다!
English: Oh, then let's go and try it together!

Korean: 내 버킷리스트에도 매년 들어가 있는데 못 가 봄... 하하
English: It's on my bucket list every year, but I haven't been able to go... haha

Korean: 키키 가 보고 싶은 곳 있어?
English: Is there a place Kiki wants to see?
People usually go to Danyang to go paragliding.
Yes, yes, I go to Danyang a lot.

Korean: 많이 하는 곳에서 해야지 그리고 좀 안전한 데로 ㅜㅜ
English: You have to do it in a place where there are a lot of people and somewhere safe ㅜㅜ
But I'm still afraid of what might happen...
I only know Danyang! Haha

Korean: 한국에서 하고 나중에 호주 가서 꼭 해 보려고 저번에 코로나 때문에 못 했거둔!
English: I did it in Korea and was planning to do it later when I go to Australia, but I couldn't do it last time because of Corona!

Korean: 키키 맞아 단양 거기 픽업도 해 준대
English: Kiki, that's right, they even pick you up in Danyang

Korean: 근데 거기 산비탈에 자동차 타고 올라가는데 그게 더 무섭대 내 친구 말로는 키키
English: But my friend says that driving up the hillside in a car is scarier than Kiki.

Korean: 헐 진짜 그거 하려면 높은 곳 올라가야 되니까 그렇긴 하겠다
English: Wow, I guess that's true because you have to climb up high to do that.
What did friends who tried it say?

Korean: 지금 마음으로는 엄청 잘할 것 같은데  키키 막상 가면 무서울 듯
English: I feel like I can do really well right now, but I think it'll be scary when I actually go to Kiki.

Korean: 후기 잘 기억 안 나는데 비싸고 무슨 버전이 2개가 있었어
English: I don't remember the review very well, but it was expensive and there were two versions

Korean: 나 그거 들어 봄 일반적인 거랑 막 공중에서 도는 거 있다더라
English: I've heard that there's a regular one and one that just spins in the air.

Korean: 근데 해 보고 싶은데 남친은 그런 거 싫다고 절대 안 한대 같이 가주기만 한대...
English: But I want to try it, but my boyfriend says he doesn't like that kind of thing and will never do it, he just goes with me...
If that's the case, then I won't go! ㅜㅜ
Kiki, then come with us!

Korean: 내 남친도 위험한 거 하기 싫다고 안 간다고 했었어
English: My boyfriend also said he didn't want to go because he didn't want to do anything dangerous.

Korean: 아 진짜? 그거 사고 많이 나?
English: Oh really? Do you buy that a lot?
Yeah! Let's go together!

Korean: 사고 많이 나는지는 모르겠는데 만약에 바람이나 그 기구 문제로 혹시 모르니까 하늘에서 떨어질까 봐 키키
English: I don't know if there are many accidents, but just in case there's a problem with the wind or the machine, I'm afraid it might fall from the sky.

Korean: 웅웅 일단 딱 보기에 안전한 느낌은 아니라서 그러는 듯?!
English: Yeah, I guess it's because it doesn't look safe at first glance?!

Korean: 키키 신기한 게 우리 그래도 하고 싶은 거 다 맞아 키키
English: Kiki The funny thing is, we still do what we want to do Kiki
It would be nice if we went to experience it together

Korean: 키키 아니... 우리 셋은 같은데 또 ** 언니는 절대 안 한다고 할 듯 끌고 가자...
English: Kiki No... The three of us are the same, but ** Unnie will definitely not do it, so let's drag her along...

Korean: 근데 의외로 **이 저런 건 좋아할 수도 있어!
English: But surprisingly, ** might like that kind of thing!

Korean: 저번에 여수에서도 뭐 그런 거 한다고 했었던 것 같은데  하하
English: I think they said they were doing something like that in Yeosu last time haha

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? **이는 그냥 힘든 게 싫어서 올라가는 거 차로 간다고 하면 갈 듯 하하
English: Kiki, really? **She just hates hard things so if you tell her to go up by car, she'll probably go haha

Korean: 키키 이거랑 빠지랑 어떻게 생각하는지 물어보자 난 그냥 활동적인 건 다 싫어하는 줄
English: Kiki, let's ask what you think about this and that. I just hate anything active.

Korean: 클라이밍은 운동하는 거잖아... 그래서 싫다고 했었어 키키
English: Climbing is exercise... That's why I said no, Kiki.

Korean: 키키 맞아 아니 근데 느낌이 빠지도 싫어할 것 같아
English: Kiki, right? No, but I think you'll hate it if the feeling disappears
Do you like any mobile games?

Korean: 난 핸드폰 게임 안 깔아서 가끔 카톡에서만 미설치 미니게임 한당 하하
English: I don't install games on my phone, so I sometimes play minigames that I don't install on KakaoTalk haha
That's also secretly fun
What is that? I've never heard of it before.
So I don't know, what is that?

Korean: 그 카카오톡 어플 들어가면 안 깔고 할 수 있는 게임 있어
English: If you go into that KakaoTalk app, there are games you can play without installing them.
There are quite a few people who don't know this...
I'll tell you later where to do it!

Korean: 웅웅 진짜 몰랐어 무슨 게임 있는데?
English: Wow, I really didn't know. What games are there?
Really? I didn't know that either.
How did you find out, sister?

Korean: 키키 게임 종류 엄청 많은데 테트리스 젤 많이 해 난 하하
English: There are so many Kiki games, but I play Tetris the most haha

Korean: 난 그냥 친구가 하길래 경쟁한다고 따라 했오
English: I just did it because my friend told me to.

Korean: 키키 그거 점수 친구 기록 깨는 거야?
English: Kiki, is that a score that breaks your friend's record?

Korean: 오 친구 것도 같이 떠서 경쟁할 수 있어?
English: Oh, my friend, can we compete by floating the same thing?
Is it perfect for us? ^^

Korean: 웅웅 카톡에 있는 친구가 이거 하면 점수 알 수 있었던 것 같은데 요즘에는 하는 친구가 없어서 모르겠다 ^^...
English: Yeah, I think you could find out your score if you did this with a friend on KakaoTalk, but I don't have any friends who do this these days, so I don't know ^^...

Korean: 키키 아 진짜? 그러면 언니 기록 깨러 간다 기다려
English: Kiki, really? Then I'll go break your sister's record. Wait.

Korean: 맞아 아 또 우리 경쟁심 자극하네 안 되겠다! 싸우자!
English: That's right, you're stimulating our competitive spirit again. This can't be happening! Let's fight!

Korean: 허 참! 덤벼~ 카톡 전체 설정 메뉴 들어가서 게임 들어가면 설치 없이 스낵 게임이라고 있오
English: Oh, right! Jump in! Go into the KakaoTalk settings menu and go into games. There's a snack game that doesn't require installation.
Is this Kiki's Snack Game? The name is cute.

Korean: 말 듣자마자 들어왔다 한판 해 봐야지 히히
English: I came in as soon as I heard about it. I should give it a try hehe

Korean: 어쩐지 바로 폰 집어 들더라 키키 귀엽네
English: Somehow he picked up his phone right away. Kiki is cute.
Try it later on your commute!
I eat Kiki first
Be prepared, be prepared

Korean: 키키 재밌네 나중에 제대로 해 본다!
English: Kiki, this is fun. I'll do it properly later!

Korean: 키키 내가 또 재밌는 거 알려줬네~ 고마워해라
English: Kiki, I told you something fun again~ Thank you

Korean: 이번 건 좀 좋았다 언니 키키
English: This one was pretty good, Sister Kiki
Something to do when you're bored
Kiki, that's why it's a great game to play on your way to and from work.

Korean: 이번 건?! 키키 난 항상 좋은 것만 알려줘 **아!
English: What's this?! Kiki, I always tell you only good things **Ah!
Hmm? You don't remember very well?

Korean: 어느 계절에 가는 여행이 젤 좋아?
English: What season do you like to travel the most?

Korean: 난 지금! 하하 배낭 여행 가고 싶당!
English: Me right now! Haha I want to go backpacking!
Kiki I want to go in the fall
Kiki, it seems like you've never been there

Korean: 둘 다 배낭 여행 해 봤어?
English: Have you both ever been backpacking?

Korean: 아니 배낭 여행 일반 여행이랑 뭐가 다른 거지?
English: What's the difference between backpacking and regular travel?

Korean: 배낭 메고 가는 거지 뭐 키키
English: Kiki, you're carrying a backpack

Korean: 유럽 여행 내놔! 사실 유럽은 지금도 여행 비자 풀려 있긴 한데 하하
English: Give me a trip to Europe! Actually, Europe is still open for tourist visas haha

Korean: 배낭 여행은 진짜 말 그대로 짐 보따리 엄청 들고 다니는 거!
English: Backpacking is literally carrying a ton of luggage!

Korean: 키키 그럼 다들 혼자 여행은 어떻게 생각해?
English: Kiki: So what do you all think about traveling alone?

Korean: 난 요즘 혼자 여행 너무 하고 싶어! 키키
English: I really want to travel alone these days! Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 언니 혼자 여행 가 보고 싶어했댔잖아!
English: Kiki, that's right, you said you wanted to go on a trip alone!

Korean: 나도 근데 혼자 해 보고 싶긴 한데 좀 무서워 키키
English: I want to try it myself too, but I'm a little scared Kiki
I'm scared of traveling alone too ㅜㅜ

Korean: 숙소에 마스터키로 들어와서 범죄 저지르는 일들도 있잖아
English: There are also cases of people entering a residence with a master key and committing crimes.

Korean: 그거 보고 혼자 못 자겠어 ㅜㅜ
English: I can't sleep alone after seeing that ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나 전에 내일로 찾아봤을 때 혼자 여행 오는 여자 노리는 사람들 많다고 들었었어...
English: I heard that there are a lot of people who target women who travel alone when I searched for tomorrow before...

Korean: 그런 거 때문에 무섭긴 한데 그래도 혼자 여행 넘 좋을 것 같아!
English: That's what makes me scared, but I still think traveling alone would be great!

Korean: 헐 나는 그런 것보다 친구가 혼자 여행 갔는데
English: Wow, I think my friend went on a trip alone rather than something like that.

Korean: 카페에 들어가면 자기만 혼자고 죄다 커플이라 자기 다 쳐다봤다고 하더래
English: He said that when he went into the cafe, he was alone and everyone was looking at him because there were couples.
Kiki was so funny
Kiki that's funny

Korean: 나도 저런 위험성 때문에 절대 안 할 듯
English: I would never do that either because of the risk.

Korean: 어렸을 때 부모님이 혼자 여행 반대할 때는 왜 그러지 했는데 이제는 알겠어
English: When I was young, my parents were against me traveling alone, but now I understand why.

Korean: 키키 우쒸 그건 좀 외롭긴 하겠다...
English: Kiki Uchiyama: That would be a bit lonely...

Korean: 삼각대 들고 사진 찍고 키키 내가 다음에 가면 브이로그 찍어서 올게!
English: I'll take a tripod, take some pictures, and Kiki. Next time I go, I'll film a vlog and come back!
Kiki looks like it'll be fun

Korean: 언니 혼자 여행 가면 어디로 가고 싶은데?
English: If you were to travel alone, where would you like to go?

Korean: 맞아 내 친구도 혼자 여행 즐겨하는데 또 부산 갔어 자주 가
English: Yes, my friend also enjoys traveling alone and went to Busan again. He goes there often.
I went to Jeju Island too, Kiki
Oh really? That's cool!

Korean: 난 어릴 때는 밥 혼자 먹기 싫어서 혼자 못 가봤어 키키
English: When I was young, I hated eating alone, so I never went alone. Kiki

Korean: 이제 혼밥 가능이니까 코로나 좀 잠잠하면 가 볼랭~
English: Now that I can eat alone, I'll go when the coronavirus calms down a bit~
Where do you want to go most?

Korean: 키키 나도 어릴 때는 혼밥 못 했었는데 이제 완전 잘해!
English: Kiki: When I was little, I couldn't eat alone either, but now I'm really good at it!

Korean: 나 젤 가고 싶은 곳은 없구 원래는 유럽 여행 가려고 했었는데 이제 한동안은 못 가니까 국내에서 여행지 찾아봐야 하지 않을까?!
English: I don't have a place I particularly want to go. I originally planned to travel to Europe, but I won't be able to go for a while, so shouldn't I look for travel destinations within Korea?!
How about you go with us first?

Korean: 키키 ** 언니 무조건 같이 가려 하네 같이 가자!
English: Kiki ** Sister, you definitely want to go with me. Let's go together!
Kiki, decide when to go!
Then right after the exam, Lulu

Korean: 어제 집 갈 때 엄청 춥더라...
English: It was really cold when I went home yesterday...

Korean: 맞아 좀 놀랬어 키키 그래서 오늘 긴 팔 입구 옴!
English: Yeah I was a little surprised Kiki so today I came with long sleeves!
That's right, fall has come now
It was so hot, but it changed in the meantime

Korean: 그니까 나 어제 버스 내려서 진심 덜덜 떨면서 갔어...
English: So I got off the bus yesterday and I was really shaking...

Korean: 그래서 나도 오늘 겉옷 챙겨 옴!
English: So I brought an outerwear today too!
It was hot on the bus and subway ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 아침에  환기 시키고 샤워하고 나왔는데 겨울인 줄... ㅠㅠ
English: That's right, I ventilated the room in the morning and took a shower, but it felt like winter... ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 맞아 이제 선풍기 넣어도 될 것 같아
English: Kiki, right, I think it's time to put in a fan now

Korean: 원래 아침에 머리 말릴 때 선풍기 같이 틀어 놨는데 오늘은 안 틀었엉
English: I usually turn on the fan when I dry my hair in the morning, but I didn't turn it on today.

Korean: 맞아 선풍기 이제 넣고 전기장판 꺼내야 돼 키키
English: Right, now I have to put the fan in and take out the electric blanket Kiki

Korean: 야 틀면 감기야 진짜 키키 전기장판 없어 난... ㅠㅠ
English: Hey, if you turn it on, you'll catch a cold. Seriously, I don't have an electric blanket... ㅠㅠ
I have to steal it from Jinju!
Electric blanket is really a must-have, a must-have Kiki

Korean: 나도 이번에 추석 가서 할무니네 집 가서 갖고 올라고
English: I'm also planning to go to my grandmother's house for Chuseok this year and bring it up.
My grandmother bought it for me Kiki
Kiki is right, it's a must in winter

Korean: ** 언니 원래 쓰던 전기장판은? 새로 바꾸는 거야?
English: ** Sister, what about the electric blanket you were using before? Are you replacing it with a new one?
Oh grandma, you're the best haha
**Did you throw this away when you moved?

Korean: 욜 맞았어 키키 그거 오래돼서 저번까지만 쓰고 쿨하게 버렸당~!
English: Yol, you're right Kiki. That's old, so I only used it until last time and then just threw it away~!

Korean: 오 잘했네 그런 건 쿨하게 버리는 게 맞지 키키
English: Oh, good job. It's better to just throw that away, Kiki.
Grandma is really the best!

Korean: 내 거는 안 사 놓으셨대? 하하
English: You didn't buy mine? Haha

Korean: 키키 미안 언니 전기장판는 생각 좀 한다고 하시넹 하하
English: Kiki, sorry, unnie, I think you should think about the electric blanket haha
What comes to mind first when you think of fall?

Korean: 가을 하면 낙엽? 또 갑자기 인터뷰 모드 키키
English: Fall leaves? Suddenly interview mode again Kiki
Kiki, let's do an interview!

Korean: 난 단풍 생각납니당! 단풍 보러 어디 가 너네!
English: I miss the fall foliage! Where are you guys going to see the fall foliage!

Korean: 키키 착한 친구들 ㅠㅠ 단풍 보러 간 적은 없는 것 같아
English: Kiki, good friends ㅠㅠ I don't think you've ever been to see autumn leaves
Where did you go to see the fall foliage?

Korean: 키키 나도 단풍을 그렇게 좋아하지는 않아서... 걍 동네에서 봅니당 키키
English: Kiki I don't really like autumn leaves either... I just look at them in the neighborhood Kiki
I asked because I was reminded of Kiki Gunyang...

Korean: 나도 단풍 찾아서 간 적은 없는 듯?
English: I don't think I've ever gone to see fall foliage?
But now that you mention it, I want to go to the mountains~

Korean: 키키 하긴 근데 이런 날씨에 산타기 딱 좋긴 하다
English: Kiki Well, it's perfect for this kind of weather
It's not that hot and it's cool

Korean: 맞아 근데 난 산을 별로 안 좋아해서...
English: Yeah, but I don't really like mountains...

Korean: 그래? 그럼 어쩔 수 없이 등산 데리고 가야겠당 하하
English: Really? Then I guess I have no choice but to take her hiking haha

Korean: 키키 우리 진짜 해야 될 거 짱 많아
English: Kiki we really have a lot to do
I should put that on the list soon

Korean: 이번에 20개월 영아 강간하고 살해한 사건 봤어...?
English: Have you seen the case of the rape and murder of a 20-month-old baby?

Korean: 잘못 보고 있는 거니 나? 키키
English: Am I seeing things wrong? Kiki
20 months? Isn't that crazy?
20 months...? Is this true...?
He is a real bug

Korean: 저 문장 자체가 이해가 안 되는데 키키
English: I don't understand that sentence itself, Kiki

Korean: 그래서 지금 난리야 화학적 거세 얘기도 나오고 얘 때매 사형 부활해야 된다고 완전 난리 났어
English: So now there's chaos. There's talk of chemical castration and people are saying that the death penalty should be revived because of this.
No, is that really a death sentence...?

Korean: 진짜 충격이다 방금 찾아봤는데 진짜네 와...
English: This is really shocking. I just looked it up and it's real. Wow...

Korean: 근데 이 와중에도 정치질하고 있는 거 너무 꼴보기 싫다
English: But I really hate seeing people doing politics in the midst of all this

Korean: 뭐라고 정치질을 해? 진짜 아침부터 토 나오네 뭐야 진짜 개드러워
English: What are you talking about? I'm vomiting since morning. What the hell is this? It's really annoying.

Korean: 저거 심지어 저 가해자 남자 친딸 아니라던데
English: They even said that she wasn't the biological daughter of the man who committed the crime.

Korean: 자기 친딸인 줄 알고 저런 짓 한 건데 이번에 사건 조사하면서 친딸 아닌 거로 나와서 저 가해자한테 알려주니까 놀랐다더라
English: He said he did that because he thought she was his own daughter, but when the investigation into the case revealed that she was not his own daughter, he was surprised when he told the perpetrator about it.

Korean: 아니 자기가 대통령이었으면 사형 시켰을 거래
English: No, if he were president, he would have executed him.

Korean: 이거 틈타서 그냥 지지율 신경 쓰고 뱉는 말로밖에 안 들려...
English: This just sounds like something he's saying to take advantage of his popularity...

Korean: 그냥 다 더럽다 진짜 ㅠㅠ 와... 충격 그 자체
English: It's all just so dirty, really ㅠㅠ Wow... It's shocking in itself

Korean: 아니 근데 소름 돋아서 나도 방금 봤는데 애기 죽이고 나서 장모한테 한 번 하고 싶다고 문자 보냈대
English: No, but it was creepy, I just saw it too, and after killing the baby, he texted his mother-in-law saying he wanted to do it again.

Korean: 한 번 해 주면 지금 어떤 상황인지 알려준다고 와 진짜 사형 시급함
English: If you do it once, I'll tell you what the current situation is. It's really urgent to get the death penalty.
Yeah ** I really hate Kiki

Korean: 맞아 장모한테도 한 번 하자고 했대 걍 그거에 놈임
English: Yeah, he said he asked his mother-in-law to do it once too. He's just a jerk

Korean: 아니... 진짜 친자식이 아니라고 나왔지만 어쨌든 자기 딸한테 그런 생각이 드는 거 자체가 말이 안 되는 거야 진심,
English: No... It's true that she's not your biological child, but it's really absurd to think that way about your own daughter.

Korean: 엄마가 지적으로 안 모지라고 정상이었어도 저랬을 놈이야
English: Even if his mother said he was intellectually normal, he would have been like that
But doesn't he show his face?

Korean: 와 근데 확실히 실검 없어지니까 직접 찾아보지 않으면 잘 모르는 것 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Wow but it's definitely not a real-time search, so I don't think you'll know unless you look it up yourself ㅠㅠ

Korean: 사람들도 옛날보다 더 모를 것 같아!
English: I think people don't know as much as they used to!

Korean: 그래서 뉴스나 기사 봐야 돼 ㅜㅜ
English: So I have to watch the news or read articles ㅜㅜ

Korean: 저런 애들은 사회로 내보내면 안 돼 곧 얼굴 공개되지 않을까...
English: We shouldn't let those kids out into society. Won't their faces be revealed soon?

Korean: 진짜 솔직히 여성들 살아 가기 너무 무서운 사회다...
English: Honestly, it's a really scary society for women to live in...
Even 20-month-olds are exposed to sexual crimes...

Korean: 집에 갈 때 집 주변에 좀 수상해 보이는 사람 보이면 괜히 바로 집에 안 들어가고 빙빙 돌다가 들어가고 그럴 때 진짜 현타 와
English: When I go home and see someone suspicious around my house, I don't go in right away but instead go around in circles before going in. That really makes me feel dizzy.

Korean: ㅠㅠ 잘했어 힘들더라도 진짜 그렇게라도 해야 돼
English: ㅠㅠ You did well, even if it's hard, you really have to do it like that
I wish he would kill the real example too
Yeah, it's so scary ㅜㅜ

Korean: 저런 애들은 자기보다 약한 존재한테만 강한 애들임 그 어리고 약한 애기한테 그런다는 거 자체가
English: Those kids are only strong towards those weaker than them. The fact that they are like that to that young and weak kid

Korean: 맞아 세상이 진짜 어떻게 돌아가고 있냐
English: That's right, how does the world really turn?

Korean: 저런 놈들이 너무 많아, 이번에 친할머니 살해한 10대 형제도 있던데...
English: There are too many of those guys, like the teenage brothers who murdered their grandmother...

Korean: 진짜 뉴스 보면 이런 일이 매일 발생하고 있다는 게 너무 신기하고 무서울 따름이야
English: When I watch the real news, it's so amazing and scary to see that this kind of thing happens every day.

Korean: 어케 맨날 이러지 하루라도 조용한 적이 없어
English: How can it be like this all the time? There's never been a single quiet day.

Korean: 그니까 무서워 그 부검하는 사람인가 그 분은 여러 죽음을 하도 많이 보니까
English: So, is that person who does autopsies scary? He has seen so many deaths.

Korean: 지금 이 순간도 내가 살아 있는 게 기적이라고 생각하고 살아야 된다고 그랬어
English: He said that I should live my life thinking that even at this moment, it is a miracle that I am alive.
That's true ㅠㅠ
Those 10 brothers killed their grandmother because she kept nagging them...
Oh my... It's really going out, it's going out

Korean: 부검하는 사람들도 죽는 이유들 들으면 어이없을 것 같아
English: Even people who do autopsies would be dumbfounded if they heard the reasons why people die.

Korean: 맞아... 잔소리한다고 친 누나 살해한 사건도 얼마 전에 있었잖아
English: Right... There was a case not long ago where someone killed his older sister because she nagged him.

Korean: 우리 다른 사람 잔소리하지 말고 나 자신이나 잘 살자...
English: Let's stop nagging at others and just live well ourselves...
**Hey... I won't nag you so much anymore...
**Ah, you apologize too, quickly ㅠㅠ

Korean: 키키 하 근데 잔소리 못 끊어... 얘들아 버텨... 화이팅!
English: Kiki ha but I can't stop nagging... Hang in there guys... Fighting!

Korean: 페루에서 고속도로 달리던 버스가 절벽에서 추락했대...
English: A bus crashed off a cliff while driving on a highway in Peru...
Wasn't there a guardrail next to it? ㅠㅠ

Korean: 졸음 운전 했나 ㅠㅠ 왜 떨어졌대?
English: Were you driving while drowsy? Why did you fall?
I don't know, it seems like there is no guardrail ㅜㅜ

Korean: 거기 안데스 산맥에서 불과 며칠 전에도 절벽에서 버스 떨어져서 16명 사망하고 사고 있었는데 또 사고 나서 교통사고의 저주라고 그런대
English: There was an accident in the Andes Mountains just a few days ago where a bus fell off a cliff and killed 16 people, and now they're saying it's a curse of traffic accidents.

Korean: 아니 거기 길을 정비해야 할 것 같은데... 무슨 일이야 진짜 ㅠㅠ
English: No, I think the road needs to be cleared... What the heck, seriously ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헐 뭔가 계속 그러면 진짜 무섭긴 하다 저기 어커 다녀 무서워서
English: Oh my, if you keep doing that, it's really scary. I'm scared of where you're going.

Korean: 맞아 진짜 길 자체가 문제 아니냐고 ㅜㅜ 29명 사망했대 이번에는...
English: That's right, isn't the road itself the problem? ㅜㅜ 29 people died this time...

Korean: 또 며칠 전에 페루 아마존 강에서 해상 선박 충돌 사고로 14명 사망했었고 몇 달 전에도 산악 도로에서 버스 떨어져서를 27명 사망했었대
English: A few days ago, 14 people died in a shipwreck in the Peruvian Amazon River, and a few months ago, 27 people died when a bus fell off a mountain road.

Korean: 진짜 이 정도면 페루의 저주 아니냐...
English: Seriously, isn't this the curse of Peru...

Korean: 엥 그게 최근 몇 달 사이에 일어난 일이야?
English: Huh? That's what happened in the last few months?
This is crazy, this is really the curse of Peru...

Korean: 페루 진짜 무슨 공사를 대충하나 어떻게 저래
English: Peru, what kind of construction are they doing so carelessly? How can they do that?

Korean: 그니까 이게 다 얼마 안 된 일... 무섭겠다 페루 사람들은
English: So this is all just a short while... Peruvians must be scared

Korean: 그니까 버스 기사들도 운전할 때 무서울 듯 ㅠㅠ...
English: So bus drivers must be scared when they drive too ㅠㅠ...

Korean: 아니면 날씨가 별로 안 좋아서 미끄러져서 그런가 뭐지 ㅠㅠ
English: Or maybe it's because the weather is not so good and I slipped or something ㅠㅠ

Korean: 기사에선 승객들 말로는 과속하다가 바위 박았다는데
English: The article said that the passengers said they hit a rock while speeding.

Korean: 언니 그때 집 갈 때 버스 엄청 달려서 무섭다 했잖아 키키
English: Sister, you said you were scared because the bus was running so fast when you went home, Kiki
I really think speeding is dangerous

Korean: 아 그날 근데 진짜 무서웠어 키키
English: Oh, but that day was really scary, Kiki

Korean: 경상도 버스 아저씨들 진짜 난폭 운전 장난 없거든?
English: Gyeongsang Province bus drivers really drive recklessly, don't they?
Even though I was used to it, I was scared that day

Korean: 뭔데? 나 못 들은 것 같아 알려죠
English: What? I don't think I heard it. Let me know.

Korean: 맞아 경상도 난폭 운전 심하다고 들었었어 키키
English: Yes, I heard that Gyeongsang Province has a lot of reckless driving Kiki
** I said it in the idiot group chat!

Korean: 진짜 **아 나한테 관심을 좀 가져 줄래...? ^^
English: Seriously **Ah, could you please pay some attention to me...? ^^

Korean: 금요일에 집 갈 때 버스 아저씨 진짜 역대급 빨리 달렸어
English: When I went home on Friday, the bus driver drove really fast.

Korean: 앞에 전용도로로 가는 버스들 다 제치고 1빠로 감...
English: I passed all the buses going to the dedicated road in front and went first...
It usually takes 8-10 minutes? But I got there in 5 that day.
Wow, you said this in the group chat? Wow, wow?

Korean: 아니 근데 버스 아저씨 달리는 아저씨들은 진짜 겁나 밟긴 해 위험천만
English: No, but the bus driver and the running driver really step on each other so it's very dangerous

Korean: 근데 나는 성격 급해서 달리는 아저씨들 좋아해 키키
English: But I have a hasty personality so I like running men Kiki

Korean: 시간 아끼는 기분 근데 저런 거 보면 위험하겠다 ㅜㅜ
English: I feel like I'm saving time, but seeing things like that makes me feel dangerous ㅜㅜ

Korean: 너무 늦게 달리면 답답하긴 한데 키키 적당해야 해...
English: It's frustrating to run too slow, but Kiki has to be moderate...

Korean: 서울에서 난폭 운전은 처음 겪어 봤졍
English: This is my first time experiencing reckless driving in Seoul.

Korean: 키키 나도 가끔 버스 타다가 좀 불안 불안한 버스 느낀 적 많은 것 같아
English: Kiki I also feel a bit uneasy when I ride the bus sometimes.

Korean: 에휴 그 버스 안에 있는 사람들은 무슨 죄야 진짜 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my gosh, what crime did the people on that bus commit? Seriously ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그니까 도심에서 느끼는 질주 본능인가 봐 키키
English: So I guess it's the instinct to run in the city, Kiki

Korean: 구니까 키키 그래도 다른 승객들 태우고 다니는 건데 좀 안전 운전 하셨음 해...
English: Kiki, you're driving safely though, you're carrying other passengers...

Korean: 키키 맞아 너무 심해서 가끔 말하고 싶을 때도 있었어 나는
English: Kiki, that's right, it's so bad that sometimes I want to say it.

Korean: 속눈썹 펌 진짜 너무 좋아 삶의 질 올라가~
English: I really love eyelash perms. It improves my quality of life~

Korean: 난 요즘에 안 하고 있어 키키
English: I'm not doing it these days Kiki
I have to do it again right after the test is over~

Korean: 키키 맞아 처음 했을 때 완전 신세계였어
English: Kiki, that's right, when I first did it, it was a whole new world
Has anyone ever gone to a shop and gotten it?
I have to do it after my exam too

Korean: 새로 많이 났어 키키 샵에서는 안 해 봤어 ㅜㅜ
English: There are so many new ones, I haven't tried them at Kiki's shop ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나도 샵에서는 안 해 봤는데 나도 속눈썹 연장은 옛날에 많이 해 봤당 하하
English: I haven't tried it at a salon either, but I've had eyelash extensions done a lot in the past haha

Korean: 아 진짜? 언니 연장 안 해도 짱 길잖아 키키
English: Oh really? It's really long even without extensions, sis. Kiki
Tell me about the extension review

Korean: 그니까 언니 연장 안 해도 긴데 왜 했어?
English: So, unnie, it's long even if you didn't extend it, so why did you do it?
Kiki, I was obsessed with eyelashes... ^^...

Korean: 그냥 다른 화장 안 해도 되고 엄청 편하던데?
English: It's so comfortable and you don't have to wear any other makeup, right?

Korean: 막 심하게는 안 하고 젤 자연스러운 걸로 키키
English: Kiki, don't do it too harshly, just do it in the most natural way

Korean: 근데  샵 언니가 맨날 왜 하냐고 하긴 했어
English: But the shop owner always asked me why I did that

Korean: 키키 아니 나는 셀프로 하는데 너무 시간 오래 걸려서 샵에서 한번 해 볼까 생각 중!
English: Kiki No, I do it myself but it takes too long so I'm thinking of doing it at a shop!

Korean: 언니 속눈썹 집착녀인 건 많이 들어서 아는데 그래도 펌만 하지 그러면~
English: I've heard a lot that my sister is obsessed with eyelashes, but she still gets perms~

Korean: 오 샵 가서 하는 게 빠르고 편하긴 하지 돈이 좋아 역시!
English: Oh, it's faster and more convenient to go to the shop, but I like money!
I couldn't even think about getting a perm back then!

Korean: 근데 그냥 눈 진해 보이고 좋던데? 키키
English: But isn't it nice that the eyes just look dark? Kiki

Korean: 확실히 달라 그냥 길어도 연장 해 볼만 했는데 이제 답답해서 못 하겠어
English: It's definitely different. I was thinking of extending it even though it was long, but now I'm frustrated and can't do it.

Korean: 키키 거기 가면 아래만 연장도 가능해?
English: Kiki, if you go there, can you extend just the bottom?

Korean: 연장하면 확실히 안 했을 때랑 다르게 답답해?
English: If you extend it, will it definitely be more frustrating than if you didn't extend it?

Korean: 웅웅 난 맨날 내가 한 가닥씩 뽑았던 듯 키키 세수하면서...
English: Yeah, I feel like I've been pulling out one strand at a time while washing my hair...

Korean: 아래만 되지 않을까 아래는 안 해봐서 모르겠오
English: I don't know because I haven't tried the lower part.
Oh, how much did you pay for it? I wonder

Korean: 키키 맞아 그거 매일 엄청 빠진다고 하더라
English: Kiki, that's right, I heard that you miss that a lot every day

Korean: 나는 답답한 거 싫어해서 못 하겠다
English: I can't do it because I hate being stuffy.
I think it was around 30-40 thousand won?
I did it because it was the most natural!

Korean: 키키 오 괜찮네 나도 시험 끝나고 샵 가 본당!
English: Kiki Oh, it's okay. I'll go to the shop after my exams are over!
Oh but I'm scared that it might fail

Korean: 왜 망해 맨날 그 일하는 사람들인데~ 잘하고 와 하하
English: Why are they always doing this? They're doing a good job haha

Korean: 나도 내가 하기 귀찮은데 추석 연휴 때 해야겠다
English: I don't feel like doing it myself, but I'll do it during the Chuseok holidays.

Korean: 모야 너네 다 샵 가서 하는 거야? 하하 좋아 좋아~
English: Hey, you guys all go to the shop and do it? Haha, I like it, I like it~
I want to go see it after Chuseok

Korean: 키키 웅웅 해보고 거기가 훨 나으면 그냥 샵 다니고 아니면 혼자 셀프로...
English: Kiki, try Woong Woong and if it's better there, just go to the shop, otherwise do it yourself...

Korean: 귀찮은데 그냥 추석 연휴 때 내가 한다는 소리였어 키키
English: It's annoying, but I just said I'll do it during the Chuseok holiday Kiki

Korean: 오래 유지 되는 게 아니라서 돈 아까워 ㅜㅜ
English: It's a waste of money because it doesn't last long ㅜㅜ
That's right Kiki

Korean: 그래도 친구들 보면 샵 가서 한 게 훨씬 잘 올라가고 유지력도 좋긴 하더랑
English: But when I look at my friends, they seem to go to the shop and do it much better and last longer.

Korean: 아 그래? 갔다 와서 후기 알려주께 키키
English: Oh really? I'll go and come back and tell you a review Kiki

Korean: 건강을 위해서 뭐 하고 있는 나만의 습관이나 먹는 거 있어?
English: Do you have any habits or things you eat to stay healthy?

Korean: 흠 요즘에 아침 공복에 사과식초 알약 먹는당! 하하
English: Hmm, these days I take apple cider vinegar pills on an empty stomach in the morning! Haha
What are apple cider vinegar pills?

Korean: 처음 들어 키키 신기한 거 많이 알아 언니
English: When I first heard about Kiki, I knew a lot of interesting things

Korean: 나도 키키 언니 뭐 몸을 위해 먹는 게 많네 신기해
English: I also find it interesting that Kiki-sister eats a lot for her health.
Kiki I'm serious about my health Kiki

Korean: 그냥 비타민처럼 먹는 거야 아침에 물도도 챙겨 먹게 되고 좋아
English: I just eat it like a vitamin and I like it because I also drink water in the morning.
What are apple cider vinegar pills good for?

Korean: 사과식초 자체를 먹는 거는 봤는데 알약은 처음 봐 키키
English: I've seen people eat apple cider vinegar itself, but this is the first time I've seen it in pill form.

Korean: 진짜 언니 그런 거 먹어서 몸이 버티나 키키
English: Seriously, can your body survive by eating that kind of food? Kiki

Korean: 그거랑 똑같은 건데 식초 그대로 먹기 역해서 비타민처럼 만들어서 나오는 거 먹는당!
English: It's the same thing, but I hate eating vinegar as is, so I eat it made into a vitamin-like substance!
What do you guys have?

Korean: 나는 유산균이랑 비타민 비 먹어 키키
English: I eat probiotics and vitamin B

Korean: 나는 좀만 피곤하면 혓바늘 나는데 비타민 비가 좋다더라고?
English: I get a sore tongue whenever I'm a little tired, so I heard that vitamin B is good for me?

Korean: 나는 오메가 쓰리 키키 비타민 씨도 요즘에 나 자주 아프다고 먹으래서 먹기 시작했어
English: I started taking Omega Three Kiki Vitamin C because I was sick a lot these days.

Korean: 오 임팩타민 먹어 ** 그거 진짜 좋아 하하
English: Oh eat impactamine ** I really like that haha
When the tongue bumps, it almost disappears immediately

Korean: 키키 오 진짜? 지금 먹고 있는 거 다 먹으면 사 봐야겠당
English: Kiki Oh really? If I eat everything I'm eating now, I'll have to buy some.

Korean: 나 요새는 좀 괜찮나 봐 키키 안 나네
English: I think I'm doing okay these days. Kiki isn't here.

Korean: 그러고 보니까 나도 입병 엄청 자주 나는데 요즘에 좀 괜찮아!
English: Come to think of it, I also get colds a lot, but I'm feeling a bit better these days!

Korean: 그니까 규칙적인 생활이 진짜 중요해 키키
English: That's why regular life is really important Kiki
When I go to work, it's automatic!

Korean: 키키 맞아 진짜 좀만 늦게 자도 다음날 바로 힘들어서 어떻게든지 12시 안에 누워
English: Kiki, that's right. If I sleep in even a little late, I'll be tired the next day, so I have to go to bed before midnight somehow.

Korean: 맞아 몇 시에 자는지가 되게 중요하더라
English: Yes, it is very important what time you go to bed.
If I sleep late, I'll be very sleepy the next day.

Korean: 맞아 일찍 자면 확실히 개운해 다음날!
English: That's right, if you go to bed early you'll definitely feel refreshed the next day!

Korean: 난 그래도 뭔가 내 시간 없어지는 거 같아서 괜히 일찍 자면 아깝더라 ㅠㅠ
English: But I still feel like I'm wasting some of my time, so I feel like it's a waste to go to bed early ㅠㅠ
