English: I saw that, but the only thing I remember is Joo Won, Kiki!

Korean: 키키 어맞아 주원이 나쁜 놈이었지 키키
English: Kiki, that's right, Joo-won was a bad guy Kiki
But I haven't seen that drama

Korean: 키키 헷갈렸어 김래원은 식객이야 둘 다 음식 만드는 거라 헷갈림~
English: Kiki, I'm confused. Kim Rae-won is a gourmet. They both cook, so I'm confused~

Korean: 웅 다음 바보~ 키키 어쩐지 매칭이 잘 안 되더라
English: Yeah, next idiot~ Kiki, somehow the matching doesn't work out well

Korean: 키키 바보들 바보들 가장 보통의 연애 오랜만에 봐야징
English: Kiki idiots idiots the most ordinary love affair it's been a while since I've seen you
Do you eat late-night snacks often?

Korean: 일주일에 한 번씩 먹는 것 같아
English: I think I eat it once a week
What about your sister?

Korean: 나는 혼자 사니까 야식 먹고 싶은데 못 먹어 ㅜㅜ
English: I live alone so I want to eat late night snacks but I can't ㅜㅜ
Yes, I guess the quantity was large, so delivery

Korean: 맞아 그리고 최저 금액 맞춰야 하잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah and you have to meet the minimum amount ㅜㅜ

Korean: 최소 주문 금액이 만원이 넘으면 부담스러워
English: It's burdensome if the minimum order amount exceeds ten thousand won
right?

Korean: 맞아 심지어 우리 주변은 최소 주문 금액 12000원이야.
English: That's right, even around us the minimum order amount is 12,000 won.
Wow, that's really expensive
If that's the case, it would be better to pack it Kiki

Korean: 맞아 그래서 포장을 해야 하는데 알지? 나 집순이인 거!
English: Yeah, so I have to pack it, you know? I'm a homebody!

Korean: 키키 그러면 집에서 야식 잘 안 먹겠네?
English: Kiki: Then you don't eat much late-night snacks at home?
I don't eat well
I have natto and almond breeze at home.

Korean: 아 그거 정말 다이어트 식단 같네
English: Oh, that really sounds like a diet menu.
It's creepy

Korean: 심지어 아몬드 브리즈는 언 스위트 맛이야.
English: Even the Almond Breeze tastes unsweet.

Korean: 도대체 당이 없으면 어떻게 살라는 건지 언스위트 맛없어 ...
English: How on earth are we supposed to live without sugar? It's so unsweet and tasteless...

Korean: 나는 안 단 게 더 맛있더라고!
English: I think it tastes better without it!
Oh really? Then admit it Kiki
If you live alone, do you want to live in an apartment?

Korean: 나 아파트 나중에 살고 싶어서 청약 저축 하고 있어!
English: I want to live in an apartment later, so I'm saving up for a subscription!
Wow, when did you sign up for the subscription savings plan?

Korean: 올해 처음 넣었는데 언제쯤 갈진 모르겠네 ,
English: I just put it in for the first time this year, but I don't know when it will go away.

Korean: 나도 올해부터 넣고 있는데 너 얼마씩 넣고 있어?
English: I've been putting it in since this year, but how much are you putting in?
I put in about 50 thousand won a month
What about your sister?

Korean: 니가 나보다 청약 될 확률이 높겠다
English: You have a higher chance of being accepted than me.
I have 20,000 won hehe.
Aha, where is the bank?

Korean: 나는 기본 5만원 넣는 게 좋다 하더라고 ㅠㅠ
English: I heard it's better to put in the basic 50,000 won ㅠㅠ
I'm putting it in Kookmin Bank

Korean: 아니야 내가 알기로는 10만 원이 제일 좋다고 했어!
English: No, as far as I know, 100,000 won is the best!

Korean: 응 맞아 10만원이 좋긴 한데 은행원이 내 사정으로는 5만원이 베스트래
English: Yeah, that's right. 100,000 won would be good, but the banker said 50,000 won would be best for my situation.
You even look at that
I just applied through the app.

Korean: 아 나는 청약에 대해 아무것도 몰라서 은행가서 직접 상담했어
English: Oh, I didn't know anything about subscriptions, so I went to the bank and consulted directly.

Korean: 잘했네 나는 나가기 귀찮아서 앱으로 했어~
English: Good job, I didn't feel like going out so I used the app~

Korean: 나중에 언니도 아파트 갈려고 하는 거지?
English: Are you planning to move to an apartment later too?

Korean: 음 아직까지는 생각이 없는데 아파트로 가지 않을까?
English: Well, I haven't thought about it yet, but maybe we should move to an apartment?

Korean: 그러게 요즘 아파트 많이 짓긴 하고 있어
English: That's right, they're building a lot of apartments these days.
Have you ever been on a boat?
I've been on a cruise ship, but it wasn't that great.
How can a cruise ship be so bad?

Korean: 응 파도 때문에 배 멀미가 너무 심하더라고
English: Yeah, I got really seasick because of the waves.

Korean: 아이구 날씨가 안 좋은 날 갔나 보네!
English: Oh my, I guess you went on a day with bad weather!

Korean: 응 맞아 그때 토할 뻔 했어
English: Yeah, that's right, I almost threw up then
And I'm scared of falling into the sea
Where did the cruise ship go?

Korean: 거제도에서 장사도 섬 갈 때 탔었어
English: I rode it when I went from Geojedo to Jangsa Island.
Who did you go with that time?

Korean: 여름 휴가 때 가족이랑 갔었지 키키
English: I went with my family during summer vacation, Kiki
That must have been really fun
If only the weather was nice and the waves didn't crash!
Yeah, but I hate my stomach so much
Sister, have you ever been on a boat?

Korean: 나는 회사에서 제주도 여행 가서 유람선 타 봤어!
English: I went on a trip to Jeju Island with my company and rode a cruise ship!
Oh, how was it?
They say that Jeju Island has clear water and you can even see dolphins.

Korean: 우리는 안에서 와인이랑 안주 먹으면서 놀았어.
English: We played inside, drinking wine and eating snacks.
Wow, that must have been a huge ship.
That would have been nice.

Korean: 너는 알바 말고 취업해 본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever had a job other than a part-time job?
No, not yet, just getting ready~

Korean: 그렇구나 알바는 제일 오래했던 곳이 어디야?
English: Oh, where did you work the longest?

Korean: 지금 있는 곳 롯데몰 버터 키키
English: Where I am now Lotte Mall Butter Kiki
Oh, how many months has it been there?

Korean: 아마 2년 반 넘게 다니고 있지 키키
English: I've been going there for probably over two and a half years now Kiki

Korean: 그 정도면 너는 이미 직원이 아닐까?
English: At that point, aren't you already an employee?

Korean: 원래 직원이었지만 퇴사하고 재 입사해서 알바생 키키
English: Originally an employee, but quit and re-joined to become a part-time worker Kiki
But what kind of place is that?
Kiki, a place that sells daily necessities
It's like a modern house~
If it's daily necessities, do you also sell home appliances?

Korean: 응 이번 여름에 선풍기가 아주 대박 쳤어 키키
English: Yeah, this summer the fan was a huge hit Kiki
How much did the fan cost?
It was cheap and good at 50-60 thousand won Kiki
These days, they call it a circulator. Is that it?
Yeah that's right Kiki
It was good

Korean: 요즘에 여성 징병제 얘기가 많던데 들어봤어?
English: There's been a lot of talk about female conscription these days. Have you heard of it?

Korean: 응 맞아 군대 가라고 난리들이야 키키
English: Yeah, that's right, they're making a fuss about going to the military, Kiki

Korean: 너는 가는 거에 대해서 어떻게 생각해?
English: What do you think about going?

Korean: 애 안 낳고 싶은데 가면 가산점도 주고 애도 안 낳아도 되려나?
English: I don't want to have children, but if I go, will I get extra points and not have to have children?

Korean: 애 낳는 문제는 지금도 안 낳고 싶으면 상관 없지~
English: As for the issue of having children, it doesn't matter if you don't want to have children now~

Korean: 응 근데 만약에 가라고 하면 난 그럴 것 같아
English: Yeah but if you tell me to go I think I would
I honestly don't mind going.

Korean: 그치 우리나라는 분단 국가라 국방력이 아주 중요해
English: Right, our country is a divided country, so national defense is very important.

Korean: 근데 이렇게 하는 것보다 지금 직업 군인들 처우를 개선 시키는 게 더 낫지 않을까?
English: But wouldn't it be better to improve the treatment of professional soldiers now rather than doing it like this?

Korean: 그치 군인들 대우가 너무 안 좋긴 해
English: Yeah, the soldiers are treated really badly.

Korean: 그 다음에 여성 징병제를 고려 해봐도 좋을 것 같아!
English: Then I think it might be a good idea to consider a female conscription system!

Korean: 어차피 군대 안에 여자 화장실 만들려면 시간 오래 걸려~
English: Anyway, it takes a long time to build a women's bathroom in the military~

Korean: 그러게 키키 아직은 먼 나라 얘기 같다
English: That's right, Kiki. It still seems like a story from a far away country.
But I heard the national petition has over 50,000 signatures Kiki
Who pressed all those buttons ~ Really ^^
First of all, it's not me, don't worry~
Not me either,

Korean: 그렇지만 아직까진 여성 징병제는 힘든 것 같아
English: But it still seems difficult to conscript women
You said you were studying editing now, right?

Korean: 응 맞아 자기 계발에 도움이 좀 되더라고
English: Yeah, that's right. It helped me a bit with my self-development.
Where specifically did it help?

Korean: 다양한 미디어를 접할 수 있어서 좋았지 ~
English: It was nice to be able to access various media ~
Is there a qualification exam for that too?

Korean: 자격증은 따로 없는 것 같고 교육 수료 정도 있더라
English: I don't think there is a separate certificate, but there is some kind of training required.

Korean: 그렇구나 지금 그 교육을 받는 중이야?
English: I see. Are you receiving that training now?

Korean: 아니 나는 집에서 독학으로 배우고 있어!
English: No, I'm learning on my own at home!
Are you learning by buying a book?
No, I made it by following along on YouTube

Korean: 그렇게 공부해서 지금 유튜브 편집 알바 하는 거야?
English: So you studied so hard and now you work part-time as an editor for YouTube?

Korean: 응 맞아! 아르바이트는 아니고 부업 정도 키키
English: Yeah, that's right! It's not a part-time job, it's a side job.
Still great though

Korean: 나중에 나도 유튜브 생성하면 니가 편집 좀 해 줘!
English: Later, when I create a YouTube channel, you help me edit it!

Korean: 그래 좋아요와 구독 부탁 드릴게요 만들어 줄게 ^^
English: Okay, please like and subscribe, I'll make it ^^
Wow, this is so good
I'm already looking forward to it!
The profit is 6:4, okay? ^^
I am 6

Korean: 작은 엄마는 요즘 일 어떻게 하셔?
English: How is your little mom doing these days?

Korean: 코로나 때문에 화상 수업으로 하는 중이야
English: I'm taking online classes because of Corona.

Korean: 그때 한참 줌으로 뭐 하시더니 그거야?
English: What were you doing at that time? What was that?

Korean: 응 괜찮아 질 때 몇 번 대면 수업 했는데 다 바뀌었어
English: Yeah, I had a few face-to-face lessons when things got better, and everything changed.
So you're not going to do it on Zoom anymore?
No, it's completely changed to zoom, it's level 4
Right? Are there a lot of students?

Korean: 음 한 10명 정도 있는 것 같아 고정으로
English: Well, I think there are about 10 people, so it's fixed.

Korean: 그렇게 수강 하면 몇 시간 정도 하는데?
English: How many hours does it take to take a class like that?

Korean: 하루에 아침 저녁 두 시간 있어
English: I have two hours a day, morning and evening.
3 days a week
So what do you do with the rest of your time?

Korean: 엄마 개인 운동 하시거나 등산 잘 다니셔
English: Mom, do some personal exercise or go hiking often.

Korean: 역시 자기 관리를 잘 하시는 구나
English: As expected, you take good care of yourself.

Korean: 우리 중에서도 제일 몸매가 좋잖아 키키
English: Kiki, you have the best body among us all

Korean: 맞아 근데 엄마 직업상 어쩔 수 없지...
English: Yeah, but I can't help it because of my mom's job...

Korean: 그건 그래 그래도 코로나 때문에 피해가 많으시겠어!
English: That's true, but I guess there's a lot of damage because of Corona!

Korean: 응 작년 대비 소득이 너무 줄어서 걱정이래 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I'm worried because my income has decreased so much compared to last year.

Korean: 너는 남친이랑 기념일 어떤 식으로 챙기는 편이야?
English: How do you and your boyfriend celebrate anniversaries?

Korean: 나는 주로 선물 해주는 거 좋아하는데 남친은 그냥 하루 맛있는 거 먹재
English: I like giving gifts, but my boyfriend just likes to eat delicious food all day long.
How did you celebrate this first anniversary?

Korean: 그냥 서로 갖고 싶은 거 선물 해줬어
English: We just gave each other gifts that we wanted.
What gifts did you give each other?

Korean: 나는 해외 직구로 신발 사주고 남친은 목걸이 사줬어 티파니앤코 ^^
English: I bought shoes through overseas direct purchase and my boyfriend bought a necklace from Tiffany & Co. ^^

Korean: 헐 거기 진짜 비싼 쥬얼리 브랜드 아니야?
English: Wow, isn't that a really expensive jewelry brand?

Korean: 응 근데 그 중 제일 저렴한 거,
English: Yeah, but the cheapest one among them,
Everything else was too expensive
But that was only the first anniversary!

Korean: 그러게~ 근데 요즘 다 비싼 선물 많이 하더라고 키키
English: Yeah~ But these days, everyone gives a lot of expensive gifts, Kiki

Korean: 나는 절대 그렇게 못 해 ㅜㅜ
English: I could never do that ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 진짜? 그치 ㅠㅠ 근데 또 선물 막상 받고 기분은 좋아 ~
English: Oh really? Right ㅠㅠ But I feel good when I actually receive the gift~

Korean: 그건 모든 사람들이 다 그렇게 생각하지
English: That's what everyone thinks
What brand are your shoes?
I guess New Balance 993 is really popular

Korean: 뉴발란스도 그 번호에 따라 가격이 천차만별이더라!
English: New Balance also has a wide range of prices depending on the number!

Korean: 응 맞아 내가 고른 건 좀 비쌌어
English: Yeah, that's right, the one I chose was a bit expensive

Korean: 요즘 부동산 가격이 너무 올라서 걱정이에요.
English: I'm worried because real estate prices are rising so much these days.

Korean: 네 부동산이 개판이라 쳐다 보기도 싫네요
English: Your real estate is a mess, I don't even want to look at it.

Korean: 집에 가족들이랑 같이 사세요 아니면 혼자 사세요?
English: Do you live at home with your family or do you live alone?

Korean: 얼마 전까지 혼자 나와서 자취하다 다시 부모님이랑 같이 살고 있습니다.
English: Until recently, I was living alone, but now I live with my parents again.

Korean: 다시 본가로 들어오니 장단점이 있는 거 같아요.
English: I think moving back home has its pros and cons.
Does your brother live alone?
Yes I live alone

Korean: 혼자 자취한 지도 오래된 거 같아요
English: I think it's been a long time since I've lived alone

Korean: 혼자 살 때랑 가족들이랑 살 때랑 무슨 점이 제일 좋나요?
English: What do you like best about living alone and living with family?

Korean: 음... 일단 제일 큰 장점은 집안일을 제가 하지 않아도 된다는 점인 거 같아요.
English: Well... I think the biggest advantage is that I don't have to do any housework.

Korean: 자취하면서 제일 힘든 점이 어떤 거예요?
English: What is the most difficult thing about living alone?

Korean: 자취하면서 힘든 점은 음 이제 힘든 점은 딱히 없는 거 같고요
English: What's difficult about living alone? Well, I don't think there's anything particularly difficult now.

Korean: 돈이 나간다는 게 제일 힘든 거 같네요
English: I think the hardest thing is spending money.
Do you have any plans to go out again?

Korean: 그렇죠. 아무래도 자취를 하면 고정 지출이 어쩔 수 없이 생겨서 힘든 거 같아요.
English: Yes. I think it's hard because you inevitably have fixed expenses when you live alone.

Korean: 저는 당분간은 계획이 없고 나중에 자리 좀 잡으면 다시 독립할 거 같아요.
English: I don't have any plans for the time being, but I think I'll become independent again later on when I've settled down a bit.

Korean: 그럼 자취하시면서 좋은 점은 어떤 건가요?
English: So what are the good things about living alone?

Korean: 자취하면서 좋은 점은 아무래도 눈치 안 보고 하고 싶은 거 할 수 있고 친구들도 눈치 안 보고 올 수 있고 그런 게 좋은 거 같아요
English: The good thing about living alone is that I can do what I want without worrying about what other people think, and my friends can come and go without worrying about what other people think. I think that's good.
Where were you when you lived alone?
I have lived alone in many places.

Korean: 생각해 보니 저도 자취 경력이 좀 오래됐네요.
English: Come to think of it, I've been living alone for quite some time now.
So, do you cook and eat your own meals?

Korean: 아 보통 요리는 한 번씩 하고 거의 밖에서 사 먹는 거 같아요
English: Ah, I usually cook once in a while and eat out most of the time.

Korean: 요리하는 거는 좋은데 정리할 때가 너무 귀찮아서... 혹시 방을 볼 때 가장 중요하게 생각하는 게 있나요 뷰나 크기나 화장실 등등
English: Cooking is good, but cleaning up is too much of a hassle... Is there anything you consider most important when looking for a room? The view, the size, the bathroom, etc.

Korean: 저는 방을 볼 때 특별한 기준점이 없는 거 같아요.
English: I don't think I have any particular criteria when looking at a room.

Korean: 딱 봤을 때 깔끔하다는 느낌이 들면 되는 거 같네요!
English: I think it's okay if it feels neat at first glance!

Korean: 저는 인테리어 하는 걸 좋아하는데 혹시 인테리어에 관심이 있으세요?
English: I like interior design. Are you interested in interior design?

Korean: 인테리어에 딱히 관심은 많이 없는 거 같긴 한데 보고 있으면 좋아해요
English: I don't seem to be particularly interested in interior design, but I like looking at it.

Korean: 혹시 셀프 인테리어 집에서 해보신 거 있으신가요?
English: Have you ever tried self-interior design at home?

Korean: 저는 자취할 때마다 새로 인테리어를 했어요.
English: Every time I moved into a new place, I redecorated the interior.

Korean: 나중에 결혼하면 아파트나 주택 중 어디서 살고 싶으세요?
English: When you get married, where would you like to live, an apartment or a house?
I want to live in an apartment

Korean: 저는 깔끔하고 벌레 없는 곳에 살고 싶어서
English: I want to live in a clean and bug-free place.

Korean: 그리고 높은 층에서 밖을 보는 거를 좋아해서 이왕이면 아파트에서 살고 싶네요
English: And I like looking out from a high floor, so if possible, I'd like to live in an apartment.
Where do you want to live?

Korean: 저도 벌레가 없는 곳을 생각하면 아파트가 정답이긴 한데 마당이 있는 주택에서 살고 싶기도 해요...
English: If I were to think of a place without bugs, an apartment would be the answer, but I also want to live in a house with a yard...
Do you have a preferred region?
I want to live in Busan or Seoul

Korean: 부산에는 친구들이 많이 있고 서울에는 갈 곳이 많아서 고민이 되네요 하하
English: I have a lot of friends in Busan and a lot of places to go in Seoul, so I'm having a hard time deciding haha
How did you get here today?
I came by subway
What did you ride?
Will there be a lot of people when you come?
Even though it's the holiday season, there are so many people.
It's so hot every time I come here that it's hard.
Do you like tea?
I like tea!

Korean: 차 바꿀 때가 돼서 보고 있는데 요즘 디자인들이 너무 다 이쁘네요.
English: I'm looking at new cars because it's time to change them, and the designs these days are all so pretty.
Do you like sedans or SUVs?
I personally like sedans!
What kind do you like?

Korean: 저도 세단을 좋아하는데 요즘에 차박 이런 게 잘 돼 있어서 에스유브이도 눈이 가네요
English: I like sedans too, but these days, car camping is becoming more popular, so I'm also interested in SUVs.
If you change it, what will you change it to?

Korean: 음... 이번에 비엠더블유 보고 있는데 너무 현실적이지가 않아서 보고만 있습니다.
English: Um... I'm watching BMW this time, but it's so unrealistic that I'm just watching it.
Do you like things like car camping?
Yes, I like sleeping in my car.

Korean: 캠핑카 이런 것도 사고 싶지만 아직은 안 되겠네요
English: I want to buy a camper van or something, but I can't do it yet.
Do you like car camping?

Korean: 차박 한번 해보고 싶긴 한데 기회가 없네요.
English: I'd like to try car camping sometime, but I haven't had the chance.

Korean: 아 그런데 출근하실 때 혹시 거리가 얼마나 되나요?
English: Oh, by the way, how far is it from you to work?
I think it takes about 3 hours round trip.
How long does it take you to commute to work?

Korean: 저는 뛰어 가면 왕복 한 시간 정도인 거 같고 천천히 걸으면 한 시간 반 정도 걸리는 거 같아요
English: I think it takes about an hour round trip if I run, and about an hour and a half if I walk slowly.

Korean: 집에 가실 때는 뭐 타고 가세요?
English: What do you take when you go home?
Take the subway and then transfer to the bus.
How are you doing?

Korean: 저는 똑같이 지하철 타고 가는데 갈 때는 여자 친구 만나서 가서 버스 타고 갈 거 같아요.
English: I'm going to take the subway the same way, but I think I'll meet my girlfriend and take the bus there.
Have you done a lot of part-time jobs?

Korean: 네 아르바이트 아르바이트로 할 수 있는 거는 거의 다 해본 거 같아요
English: Yes, I think I've done almost everything that can be done as a part-time job.
Have you tried it a lot?

Korean: 저는 생각보다 이렇게 많이 해본 거 같지는 않아요.
English: I don't think I've done this much, actually.
Do you have any memorable part-time jobs?
I remember when it was first delivered

Korean: 그때는 어려서 오토바이 타는 게 재밌어서 즐겁게 일했던 기억이 있네요
English: I remember having fun working because I was young and riding a motorcycle was fun.
What kind of part-time job have you done?

Korean: 저는 영화관에서 아르바이트할 때가 기억이 남네요.
English: I remember when I was working part-time at a movie theater.
I saw a lot of celebrities back then.

Korean: 영화관에서 아르바이트를 하면 힘든 점은 없나요?
English: Are there any difficulties in working part-time at a movie theater?

Korean: 하루 종일 서 있어야 해서 다리가 너무 아파서 힘들었어요.
English: I had a hard time because my legs hurt so much from having to stand all day.

Korean: 첫 월급 받았을 때 기분이 어떠셨어요?
English: How did you feel when you received your first paycheck?

Korean: 월급 받았을 때 너무 기분이 좋았어요
English: I felt so good when I got my paycheck

Korean: 첫 월급 받으셨을 때 뭐 사셨나요?
English: What did you buy when you received your first paycheck?

Korean: 첫 월급 받고 오토바이를 샀는데 기분이 너무 좋았어요.
English: I got my first paycheck and bought a motorcycle, and I felt so good.

Korean: 오 저는 아르바이트를 중학교 때 했는데 그때는 시급이 이천 원이어서 하루 다섯 시간하고 하루에 만 원정도 받았던 거 같아요
English: Oh, I did a part-time job when I was in middle school. At that time, the hourly wage was 2,000 won, so I worked five hours a day and got paid about 10,000 won a day.
I bought shoes with that

Korean: 맞아요 그때는 진짜 지급이 너무 낮았어요.
English: Yes, the pay was really low back then.
I hear that wages have gone up a lot these days.

Korean: 네 시급이 너무 낮아서 어떻게 일을 했는지 모르겠네요
English: I don't know how you worked because your hourly wage was so low.
Isn't it hard to work these days?

Korean: 저는 원하던 일이라 재미있게 일하고 있어서 좋네요.
English: I'm happy because I'm having fun doing the job I wanted to do.
How is your work these days?
It's fun because it's something I want to do too

Korean: 날씨가 더워서 조금 더운 거만 빼고는
English: The weather is hot so it's just a little hot
Does time pass quickly when you work?

Korean: 하루가 너무 빨리 가는 거 같아요.
English: The days seem to go by so quickly.

Korean: 요즘 일할 때 너무 덥지 않아요?
English: Isn't it too hot to work these days?

Korean: 네 출근할 때랑 밥 먹고 오면은 너무 더운 거 같아요
English: Yes, I think it's too hot when I go to work and when I come back after eating.
Please turn up the air conditioning!
Where did you serve in the military?

Korean: 저는 강원도 화천에서 군 생활을 했습니다
English: I served in the military in Hwacheon, Gangwon-do.
Where did you serve in the military?
Oh, I did it in Inje, Gangwon-do.
Wasn't it too cold in Gangwon-do?
Yes, it was very cold.

Korean: 여름에는 너무 뜨겁고 군대에서 추억이 있나요?
English: It's so hot in the summer. Do you have any memories from the military?

Korean: 음... 훈련했던 게 기억에 많이 남네요.
English: Um... I remember a lot of the training I did.
Do you have any memorable memories?

Korean: 추억보다는 군대에서 힘든 기억이 많은 거 같네요
English: I think I have more difficult memories from the military than good memories.
The training was so hard
Were you in the army?

Korean: 네네 저는 케이 나인 자주포 조종수였습니다.
English: Yes, yes, I was a K-9 self-propelled howitzer driver.
What was your position?
You're an artilleryman like me.
I envy K9
I was a KACH 179 artilleryman in the shit-poor army.
Have you served in the military?

Korean: 네 병사였는데 운이 좋게 꿀 보직을 맡았네요.
English: Yes, I was a soldier, but I was lucky enough to get a sweet job.
Thanks to this, I was able to train comfortably.

Korean: 저는 견인포라 포 들고 삽질하고 땅 파고 너무 힘들었네요
English: I was a tow truck driver, so it was really hard to carry the truck, dig, and dig the ground.
How did you feel when you were discharged?

Korean: 아 저희 부대로 와서 훈련하시는 거 본 거 같아요.
English: Oh, I think I saw you come to our unit and train.

Korean: 전역하기 전에는 마냥 기분 좋을 줄만 알았는데 감정이 좀 복잡해지더라고요.
English: Before I was discharged from the military, I thought I would just feel good, but my emotions became a bit complicated.
How did you feel?

Korean: 저는 너무 좋았어요 거기서 탈출하는 기분이 다시 입대하라면 하실 수 있나요?
English: I had such a great time escaping from there. If you were asked to re-enlist, would you do it?

Korean: 오!  한 10억 정도 준다고 하면 갈 수 있겠네요.
English: Oh! I guess I could go if they gave me about 1 billion won.

Korean: 만약 2억을 준다고 하면 재 입대 가능하세요?
English: If I were given 200 million won, would you be able to re-enlist?
Yes, I definitely do it haha

Korean: 혹시 군 생활 중에 기억에 남는 음식이 있나요?
English: Is there any food that you remember from your military service?

Korean: 음 군대리아가 가장 기억이 남고 지금도 다시 먹어보고 싶네.
English: Well, I remember Gungunria the most and I still want to eat it again.
Do you have any memorable foods?

Korean: 저는 그 탄약고에서 먹는 라면이 너무 맛있었어요
English: I loved the ramen I ate at that ammunition depot
I suddenly feel like eating ramen.
Did you like studying during your school days?
I think I only liked it until elementary school
Studying was fun back then
Did you study well?

Korean: 저는 중학교 2학년 때까지 열심히 하다가 친구를 잘못 만나서 공부와 벽을 쌓았어요.
English: I studied hard until my second year of middle school, but then I made the wrong friends and built a wall between myself and my studies.
It's similar to me haha
I think so too
Have you gone to a place like an academy?

Korean: 학원비 받아서 열심히 놀러 다녔죠 크크
English: I received tuition fees and went out to play hard haha

Korean: 이번 자격증 시험 공부는 잘 돼가세요?
English: How are you studying for this certification exam?
I didn't get to study much for the qualification this time.
** Are you confident?

Korean: 처음에는 자신 있었는데 계속 실력이 줄어들어서 자신이 없어지네요.
English: I was confident at first, but my skills kept declining and I lost confidence.

Korean: 아직 한 달 넘게 남아서 충분히 잘하실 수 있을 거예요
English: There's still over a month left, so I'm sure you'll be able to do well.
Do you have any memorable teachers?

Korean: 기억에 남는 선생님은 *** 선생님이 기억에 남네요.
English: The teacher I remember the most is Mr. ***.
Do you have any memorable teachers?
I remember that teacher too
What a great teacher you are.

Korean: 그리고 중학교 때 선생님이 기억에 남아요
English: And I remember my teacher from middle school
I got hit a lot
Do you remember being hit by your teacher?

Korean: 중학교 때 사립이었는데 정말 수도 없이 맞은 거 같아요.
English: I went to a private school in middle school and I think I got hit countless times.
At that time, I really thought corporal punishment was natural...
These days, students are king.

Korean: 자격증 공부는 하루에 몇 시간 씩 하나요?
English: How many hours a day do you study for the qualification?

Korean: 하루에 보통 4-5시간 정도 하는 거 같아요.
English: I think I usually do it for about 4-5 hours a day.

Korean: 시험 공부 노하우 같은 게 있나요?
English: Do you have any tips for studying for exams?

Korean: 노하우는 그냥 계속 많이 하는 게 답인 거 같아요
English: I think the answer to know-how is to just keep doing it a lot.
I have to study too...

Korean: 하루에 보통 몇 시간 정도 하세요?
English: How many hours do you usually work a day?

Korean: 저는 할 때는 하루 5시간 정도 한 거 같은데 요즘에는 아직 시작도 못했어요.
English: I think I used to do it for about 5 hours a day, but I haven't even started yet.
How are your family relationships?
There are five of us, including my father, mother, younger sister, and younger brother.
How are your family relationships?

Korean: 저는 아버지 어머니 형 이렇게 있습니다!
English: I have a father, mother, and older brother!
Are you coming up to Seoul alone?

Korean: 네 혼자 서울에 있고 다른 가족들은 부산에서 살고 있습니다
English: Yes, I am alone in Seoul and the rest of my family lives in Busan.
How old are you and your brother?

Korean: 2살 차이 나는데 형은 결혼까지 해서 조카가 벌써 2명입니다.
English: There is a two year age difference between us, but my older brother is married and already has two nephews.
What are your plans for children in the future?
I want to have a daughter
Do you have any plans for children?

Korean: 저는 딸 하나 아들 하나 낳고 싶습니다.
English: I want to have one daughter and one son.
But the world is so dangerous, it's scary.

Korean: 친구들 애 키우고 있는 모습 보면 부럽기도 하고 빨리 저도 키우고 싶네요
English: When I see my friends raising children, I feel envious and want to raise one too soon.
Are you thinking about getting married?

Korean: 결혼을 빨리 하고 싶었는데 최근에 좀 생각이 바뀌었어요.
English: I wanted to get married quickly, but I've recently changed my mind.
Do you have any plans to get married?

Korean: 저도 결혼 빨리 하고 싶은데 아직 준비가 안 됐네요
English: I want to get married soon, but I'm not ready yet.
Will you help me a lot if I raise a child?
of course

Korean: 저는 정말 좋은 아빠가 될 자신이 있습니다.
English: I am confident that I will be a really good father.
What kind of father do you want to be to your children?
I want to raise it myself too

Korean: 시간만 된다면 친구 같은 아버지가 되고 싶습니다.
English: If I have time, I want to be a father who is like a friend to me.
Same as me!

Korean: 캠핑 좋아하시니 같이 캠핑도 가면 좋을 거 같아요.
English: Since you like camping, I think it would be nice if we went camping together.

Korean: 네 같이 가서 좋은 추억 많이 만들고 재밌게 보내고 싶어요
English: Yes, I want to go together and make lots of good memories and have fun.
Have your nephews grown up a lot?

Korean: 첫째는 이번에 초등학교 2학년이고 둘째는 4살 정도 됐습니다.
English: My first child is now in the second grade of elementary school and my second child is about four years old.
Wow, you got married early.
I'm jealous!
How long have you been dating?
I'm now 997 days old.
How long have you been dating?
I think it's been about 680 days.

Korean: 데이트할 때 보통 어떤 거 하시나요?
English: What do you usually do when you go on dates?

Korean: 저희는 요즘 자전거 타고 맛있는 거 먹고 그런 거 같아요
English: I think we ride bikes and eat delicious food these days
** What do you do a lot?

Korean: 요즘 코로나도 위험하고 날씨도 덥고 해서 그냥 맛집 찾아가고 카페 가고 하는 거 같아요.
English: These days, because of the danger of Corona and the hot weather, I think I just go to good restaurants and cafes.

Korean: 여자친구 만나러 갈 때 거리는 어느 정도 되나요?
English: How far is it to go to meet your girlfriend?

Korean: 거리는 좀 되는데 고속도로를 이용해서 가서 20분에서  30분 정도 걸리는 거 같아요.
English: It's a bit far, but I think it takes about 20 to 30 minutes if you take the highway.
How far is the distance between you and your girlfriend?

Korean: 저는 차 타고 가면 15분 20분 정도 걸리는 거 같아요
English: I think it takes about 15 to 20 minutes by car.
Do you see it every day?
No, we only see them on Saturdays.
Do you always celebrate anniversaries?
Yeah, I think I'm almost done
Do you have a memorable gift for your anniversary?

Korean: 저희는 생일만 챙겨서 작년 생일 때 받았던 선물이 기억에 남네요.
English: We only celebrate birthdays, so I remember the gift I received for my birthday last year.
Do you have a memorable gift?

Korean: 네 저는 100일 때 사진이랑 편지랑 꾸며서 받은 선물이 기억에 남네요
English: Yes, I remember the gift I received when I turned 100, including a photo and a letter.
Is there a gift you would like to receive from your girlfriend?

Korean: 가능하다면 아파트 한 채를 선물 받고 싶네요.
English: If possible, I would like to receive an apartment as a gift.
How do you usually decide on a date course?

Korean: 보통 티비나 SNS를 보다가 괜찮은 곳 있으면 가는 거 같아요
English: I think I usually go to a good place after watching TV or SNS.
Are there any good courses?

Korean: 요즘은 아무래도 코로나 때문에 어디 가기가 좀 그런 거 같아요.
English: These days, it seems like it's a bit difficult to go anywhere because of the coronavirus.

Korean: 팔당댐 쪽 가시면 분위기 좋은 카페들 많이 있으니 기회 되시면 한번 가보세요!
English: There are many cafes with nice atmospheres near Paldang Dam, so if you have the chance, go visit them!
thank you
I'll go there once
Be happy with your girlfriend always haha
Do you have any pets?
no
Do you have a pet?

Korean: 네, 저는 고양이랑 강아지를 키우고 있습니다.
English: Yes, I have a cat and a dog.
Have you ever raised a pet?

Korean: 아니요 저는 한 번도 반려동물을 키워본 적이 없어요
English: No, I've never had a pet.
Which of the two do you like better?

Korean: 서로 매력이 달라서 딱히 누구라고 하기 어렵네요.
English: They all have different charms, so it's hard to say who they are.

Korean: 아무래도 편한 건 고양이가 더 편한 거 같아요.
English: I think cats are more comfortable.

Korean: 아 저도 강아지나 고양이를 키우고 싶은데 혹시 어떤 동물이 괜찮을까요?
English: Oh, I also want to raise a dog or cat. What kind of animal would be good?

Korean: 음 편하신 걸 추구하시면 고양이가 좋습니다.
English: Well, if you're looking for something comfortable, a cat would be a good choice.
Are cats good at hiding their poop and pee?

Korean: 고양이는 따로 가르치지 않아도 알아서 가려요!
English: Cats know how to navigate without being taught!

Korean: 요즘 길을 가다 보면 입마개를 안 한 대형견들이 종종 있는데 어떻게 생각하시나요?
English: These days, when you walk down the street, you often see large dogs without muzzles. What do you think?

Korean: 대형견들이 불쌍하다고 생각하지만 그래도 안 하고 가는 걸 보면 신고하고 싶어요
English: I feel bad for the big dogs, but I still want to report them when I see them not doing it.
There are a lot of physical accidents and things like that

Korean: 물어보고 싶은 게 있는데 고양이 씻기기는 힘들지 않나요?
English: I have a question. Isn't it difficult to wash a cat?

Korean: 고양이가 물을 너무 싫어해서 저는 업체에 따로 맡기고 있어요.
English: My cat hates water so much that I leave it to a company to get it for me.
In that respect, puppies are better.

Korean: 아 고양이 용품 강아지 용품 사료 이런 거 비용이 뭐가 더 비싸나요?
English: Ah, cat supplies, dog supplies, food, what costs more?

Korean: 음 가격은 비슷 비슷한 거 같아요.
English: Well, I think the prices are similar.

Korean: 고양이 털 알레르기 있으신 분들이 종종 있던데 알레르기는 없으신가요?
English: There are many people who are allergic to cat hair. Do you not have any allergies?
Yes, I don't have a fur allergy.
I'm curious about the names of the cats and dogs!
Cats are steamed buns and dogs are dumplings!
Oh, the name is so cute
I want to get one too haha
Do you have a favorite sport?
I like watching soccer.
Do you have a favorite sport?
I've also recently become interested in soccer.
Are there any good players?

Korean: 네 저는 옛날 선수 호나우두를 좋아합니다
English: Yes, I like the old player Ronaldo
Do you have a favorite player?
I like Son Heung-min.
Have you watched any games recently?
I recently watched the Olympics

Korean: 대한민국이랑 멕시코랑 경기를 했는데 완전 크게 졌어요
English: We played against South Korea and Mexico and lost big time.
Do you play soccer yourself?

Korean: 아 직접 하는 건 좋아하지 않습니다.
English: Oh, I don't like doing it myself.
Do you play soccer yourself?

Korean: 저도 직접 하는 건 별로 좋아하지 않아요
English: I don't really like doing it myself either
Are you also interested in women's soccer?

Korean: 여자 축구는 본 적이 없는 거 같아요.
English: I don't think I've ever seen women's soccer.

Korean: 저는 축구 말고 예전부터 야구를 좋아했어요.
English: I've always liked baseball, not soccer.
I like baseball too

Korean: 야구는 가서 보면서 응원하고 노는 게 재밌어요
English: Baseball is fun to watch, cheer for, and play.
Do you go to the baseball stadium often?

Korean: 예전에 만났던 여자친구가 야구를 좋아해서 자주 야구장에 가고는 했습니다.
English: A girlfriend I met before liked baseball, so we often went to the baseball stadium.
Do you have a favorite baseball team?

Korean: 저는 예전에는 삼성을 좋아했는데 지금은 야구를 잘 안 봐서 좋아하는 팀은 없는 거 같아요
English: I used to like Samsung, but now I don't watch baseball much, so I don't think I have a favorite team.
Do you have a favorite baseball team?
I am a Doosan fan.

Korean: 특히 김현수 선수를 좋아했는데 다른 팀으로 이적해서 너무 아쉽네요
English: I especially liked Kim Hyun-soo, but it's too bad he transferred to another team.

Korean: 이번에 김현수 잘한 거 같은데 올림픽 야구는 보셨나요?
English: I think Kim Hyun-soo did well this time. Did you watch the Olympic baseball?

Korean: 이번에는 시간이 없어 경기를 보지 못했습니다.
English: This time I didn't have time to watch the game.
Did you watch the game?

Korean: 네 저도 기사만 봤는데 김현수 선수가 잘했다고 기사 본 기억이 있네요.
English: Yes, I only read the article, but I remember seeing an article saying that Hyun-soo Kim did well.
Do you have a favorite game?
I like soccer games
Do you have a favorite game?

Korean: 최근에는 저도 축구 게임을 하고 있습니다.
English: Lately, I've been playing soccer games too.
Have you heard of FIFA Online?

Korean: 네 저도 그 게임을 하고 있습니다
English: Yes I play that game too
Do you still play games these days?
Yes yes, I did it last weekend too.

Korean: 이번에 구단을 리빌딩 했는데 아주 만족스럽습니다.
English: I am very satisfied with the team's recent rebuild.

Korean: 저도 저번에 리빌딩을 했는데 아주 좋아요
English: I did a rebuild last time and it was really good
Do you have a favorite team in the game?
I love the Brazilian team!
What team did you rebuild with?
I rebuilt in Munich

Korean: 원래는 맨시티 유벤투스에서 뮌헨으로 바꾸니 선수들이 밸런스가 좋아졌어요
English: Originally, when I changed from Manchester City to Juventus, the balance of players improved.
What team are you playing on?
I'm playing for the Brazilian national team.
Where is the tier?
I am a Super Challenger Tier

Korean: 이번에 챔피언스를 찍으려고 노력 중입니다 크크
English: I'm trying to get the Champions this time haha
Wow... you're really good at it...
It won't be fun if you do it with me..

Korean: 아 피파3은 잘했었는데 피파4는 아직 잘 못해요
English: Ah, I was good at FIFA 3, but I'm still not good at FIFA 4.
I get so angry while playing games
Have you ever gotten angry while playing a game?

Korean: 정말 피파3은 재미있게 했었는데 이번 피파4는 업데이트를 할 때마다 이상해지는 거 같아요.
English: I really enjoyed playing FIFA 3, but FIFA 4 seems to get weirder with every update.

Korean: 실제 축구를 반영한다고 하는데 게임이 점점 산으로 가는 거 같네요.
English: They say it reflects real soccer, but the game seems to be going downhill more and more.

Korean: 네 게임이 지금은 달리기 게임으로 바꼈어요
English: Your game has now turned into a running game.
Are you playing games today too?

Korean: 아니요, 평일에는 안 하고 주말에 조금씩 하고 있습니다.
English: No, I don't do it on weekdays, but I do it a little bit on the weekends.

Korean: 다음에 기회 되면 같이 게임 하면 좋을 거 같아요!
English: I think it would be great if we could play a game together next time!
Yes, let's definitely play together next time!
Do you have any vacation plans?
I don't have any vacation plans yet.

Korean: 원래 여름이면 워터파크 가는 거 좋아해서 갔었는데 코로나 때문에 갈 수가 없네요
English: I used to like going to water parks in the summer, but I can't go because of the coronavirus.
Do you have any vacation plans?
I don't have any plans yet.

Korean: 너무 더워서 계곡이라도 한번 갔다 오려고 합니다.
English: It's so hot that I'm thinking of going to the valley.

Korean: 서울 근교에 계곡 괜찮은 곳 있나요?
English: Are there any good valleys near Seoul?

Korean: 파주 쪽이나 청평 쪽에 괜찮은 곳이 좀 있는 거 같아요.
English: I think there are some good places in Paju or Cheongpyeong.
Do you have any memorable travel destinations?
I remember going to Japan

Korean: 코로나 터지기 전에 갔었는데 처음으로 해외여행 가봐서 기억에 남네요
English: I went there before the coronavirus outbreak, and it was my first time traveling abroad, so it was memorable.
Do you have any memorable travel destinations?

Korean: 저는 예전에 말레이시아에서 잠깐 살았었는데 그때 기억이 많이 남네요.
English: I lived in Malaysia for a while before and I have a lot of memories from that time.
Where did you travel abroad?
I can't remember the name in Japanese

Korean: 가까운 쪽에 갔는데 일본도 나름 볼 게 많아서 괜찮았던 거 같아요
English: I went to the nearby one, but I think it was okay because there was a lot to see in Japan.
What did you do in Malaysia?

Korean: 말레이시아에서 잠깐 대학 다니다가 군대 때문에 돌아왔네요..
English: I went to college in Malaysia for a while and then came back because of the military.
Oh, that would be nice
What language is spoken in Malaysia?

Korean: 말레이시아는 공통 언어로 영어를 쓰고 있어요!
English: Malaysia uses English as its common language!
Since there are a lot of Chinese people, Chinese is also used a lot.
Oh, you speak English well.

Korean: 저도 다른 곳도 가고 싶은데 코로나 때문에 이제 해외는 못 가겠어요 유유
English: I also want to go to other places, but I can't go abroad anymore because of Corona.

Korean: 영어를 하도 안 쓰다 보니 기억이 가물가물하네요.
English: Since I don't use English much, my memories are vague.

Korean: 필리핀에 팔라완이라는 섬이 있는데 정말 너무 아름다웠어요.
English: There's an island in the Philippines called Palawan, and it's really beautiful.
If you get a chance later, go there!

Korean: 네 필리핀 그런 곳은 무섭지 않나요
English: Yeah, isn't that place like the Philippines scary?

Korean: 너무 안 좋은 사건들을 많이 본 거 같아서
English: I feel like I've seen so many bad things

Korean: 제가 갔을 때는 케이팝 열풍이라 한국인에 대한 사랑이 엄청났어요.
English: When I went there, there was a K-pop craze and there was a huge love for Koreans.
Is there a travel destination you would like to visit?

Korean: 저는 유럽을 한 번 가보고 싶어요!
English: I want to go to Europe sometime!

Korean: 요즘 날씨가 너무 더운 거 같아요.
English: The weather seems too hot these days.
Yes it's so hot
Do you have a favorite season?
I like spring and fall.
Do you have a favorite season?

Korean: 저도 날씨는 그 날씨를 좋아하는데 계절은 놀기 좋은 여름이 좋은 거 같아요
English: I like the weather too, but I think summer is the best season for playing.
As for the weather, I hate summer the most. Kiki
I hate summer too.

Korean: 차라리 겨울이 더 나은 거 같아요.
English: I think winter is better.

Korean: 혹시 천재지변으로 피해를 보신 적이 있나요?
English: Have you ever suffered damage from a natural disaster?
No, I don't have any.
Have you ever had that happen?

Korean: 저는 없는데 주변에 천재지변으로 피해를 본 사람들을 봤어요
English: I haven't, but I've seen people around me who have suffered damage from natural disasters.
Do you like rainy days?
I hate rain so much.

Korean: 근데 집에 누워서 빗소리 듣는 건 좋아해요.
English: But I like lying at home and listening to the sound of rain.
Do you like rainy days?

Korean: 저도 비 오는 날 밖에 있는 거는 싫어하는데 자동차나 집이나 안에서 비 보는 거는 좋아합니다
English: I also hate being outside on rainy days, but I like watching the rain from inside my car or house.
Do you like snow?
I liked the snow.

Korean: 근데 군대에 다녀온 이후로부터 눈이 너무 싫어졌네요.
English: But ever since I came back from the military, I really hate my eyes.
Do you like snow?

Korean: 저도 부산에 살아서 눈 오면 신기하고 좋아하고 그랬는데 군대를 다녀온 이후부터 눈이 너무 싫어졌어요
English: I also live in Busan, so I used to love it when it snowed, but after I finished my military service, I started to hate snow.
Are there any ways to enjoy summer?
What a fun way to spend summer...
Does such a thing even exist?

Korean: 여름에는 에어컨 바람 쐬면서 아이스크림 먹는 게 최고이죠.
English: In the summer, there's nothing better than eating ice cream while feeling the air conditioning.

Korean: 평소에는 아이스크림 먹지도 않는데 이번 여름에는 하루에 아이스크림 한 개는 먹는 거 같네요 키키
English: I don't usually eat ice cream, but this summer I think I'm eating one ice cream a day Kiki
Yeah, that's right
They say it's going to get hotter and hotter...
Be careful of the heat!
Yes, be careful of the heat.
Be careful when you go to the valley!

Korean: 요즘 사회적으로 이슈가 많은데 관심 있게 보고 있는 이슈가 있으세요?
English: There are a lot of social issues these days. Is there an issue that you are interested in?

Korean: 요즘은 아니고 그 어린이 보호 구역에서 자동차로 30km 그거 때문에 어떻게 생각하세요?
English: What do you think about that 30km drive from that children's protection zone, not these days?

Korean: 어린이 보호구역에서 서행하는 건 당연한 것이지만 그걸 악용하는 사람들이 있다고 하네요...
English: It's natural to drive slowly in children's safety zones, but I hear there are people who abuse that...
What do you think?

Korean: 네 무서워서 어린이 보호구역을 가지를 못하겠어요
English: Yes, I'm scared to go to the children's safety zone.
Are there any issues that interest you these days?

Korean: 요즘은 코로나가 제일 핫한 이슈가 아닐까 생각합니다.
English: I think Corona is the hottest issue these days.

Korean: 빨리 백신 접종을 해야 하는데 큰일이네요.
English: This is a big problem, we need to get vaccinated quickly.
yes that's right

Korean: 처음에는 무서워서 접종하다가 잘못된 사람들도 많고 해서 안 할까 했는데 친구들이 거의 다 맞아서 빨리 저도 접종하고 치우고 싶네요.
English: At first, I was scared and thought that many people get vaccinated but fail because of it, so I was thinking of not getting vaccinated. But since almost all of my friends got vaccinated, I want to get vaccinated soon too.

Korean: 근데 이번에 백신을 접종해도 돌파 감염된 사람이 계속해서 증가하고 있다고 하는데 정말 너무 무섭네요.
English: But this time, even after getting vaccinated, the number of people infected with breakthrough infections continues to increase, and it's really scary.

Korean: 아 맞아요 10시 이후 영업 못하게 하는 거는 어떻게 생각하세요?
English: Oh, right. What do you think about not allowing businesses to operate after 10pm?

Korean: 음 저는 딱히 효과가 없다고 생각합니다.
English: Well, I don't think it really works.
It feels like only the self-employed are suffering.
What do you think about that part?
I think so too

Korean: 직장을 늦게 마치는 분들은 마치고 밥도 못 먹는 분들도 있더라고요
English: There are people who finish work late and don't even eat after work.
Do you think that 2 people and 5 people have meaning?

Korean: 인원수 제한을 한다고 해서 사람들이 안 모일까요,
English: If we limit the number of people, will people not gather?
I don't think so.

Korean: 어차피 맛집 같은 데나 대형 마트에만 가도 사람들이 바글바글한데 그게 무슨 의미가 있을까요?
English: Anyway, even if you go to a restaurant or a large mart, it's always crowded with people, so what's the point?
Yes, that's right.

Korean: 좀 다른 방법으로 했으면 좋겠는데 아쉽네요
English: It's a shame, I wish it had been done a little differently
Are there any good ways to deal with this?

Korean: 아주 확실한 방법은 외국처럼 저희도 락다운을 걸어서 빠르고 확실하게 잡아내는 것도 하나의 방법이 되지 않을까 싶습니다.
English: I think a very certain way would be to implement a lockdown like foreign countries and quickly and definitely catch the virus.

Korean: 아니면 이스라엘처럼 코로나와의 공존 방안을 새롭게 찾아내야 한다고 생각합니다.
English: Otherwise, I think we need to find a new way to coexist with Corona like Israel.
Is there any good way?

Korean: 저는 그냥 모든 업종에 그렇게 적용하기보다는 술집이나 그런 곳에 그렇게 하는 것이 좋다고 생각합니다
English: I think it would be better to do that in bars and places like that rather than just applying it to all industries.

Korean: 술을 먹으면 판단력이 흐려져서 사람들이 실수를 많이 할 거 같아서요.
English: I think people make a lot of mistakes because their judgment is clouded when they drink alcohol.
Yes, that sounds like a good point!

Korean: 코로나가 종식되면 해보고 싶은 게 있으세요?
English: Is there anything you want to do once the coronavirus is over?
Yes, I want to travel abroad.

Korean: 이번 일본 도쿄 올림픽 개최에 대해서 어떻게 생각하시나요?
English: What do you think about Japan hosting the Tokyo Olympics this year?

Korean: 아 저는 무리하게 일본에서 왜 올림픽을 개최하는지 모르겠어요
English: Ah, I don't understand why they are forcibly holding the Olympics in Japan.
**What do you think?

Korean: 저도 굳이 이 시국에 개최를 하는 게 맞나 하는 생각이 있습니다.
English: I also wonder if it is right to hold the event in these times.

Korean: 심지어 올림픽 준비도 제대로 안 한 느낌을 많이 받았습니다.
English: I even got the feeling that they hadn't prepared properly for the Olympics.

Korean: 해리포터 출판사 회장이 자신의 내연녀에게 1조 재산을 몽땅 넘긴 사건이 있었는데 혹시 알고 계신가요?
English: Did you know that there was an incident where the chairman of the Harry Potter publishing company gave his entire fortune of 1 trillion won to his mistress?

Korean: 네 뭔가 기사만 보면 사기 사건 같은 느낌인데 아닌가요?
English: Yeah, if you just read the article, it feels like a fraud case, doesn't it?

Korean: 저도 뭔가 수상한 느낌이 드는 거 같긴 하네요.
English: I also have a feeling that something is fishy.

Korean: 유서가 발견이 됐다고 하는데... 이게 가능한 일인가요?
English: They say a will was discovered... Is this possible?
I envy that woman.

Korean: 댓글에 보니 이 시대의 최고의 직업은 내연녀라고 하네요 키키
English: I saw in the comments that the best job in this era is being a housewife. Kiki

Korean: 너무 쉽게 벌면 또 너무 쉽게 탕진하지 않을까요 하하
English: If you earn too easily, won't you also squander it too easily? Haha

Korean: 그래도 탕진을 하더라도 한 번 쓰고 싶은 만큼 써 보고 싶네요 키키
English: Even if I end up blowing it, I want to use it as much as I want to use it Kiki
It won't be easy to use all 1 trillion Kiki

Korean: 이번에 빌 게이츠 부부 이혼한 사실 아시나요?
English: Did you know that Bill Gates and his wife recently divorced?

Korean: 이혼 중이라고는 얘기를 들었는데 결론이 났나요?
English: I heard you're going through a divorce. Has it been finalized?

Korean: 재산 분할을 한 거 같은데 돈이 어마어마하네요 175조...
English: It looks like they've divided up the property, but the amount is enormous: 175 trillion...
Wow... That's 175 times the amount from before.

Korean: 그런 금액을 가지게 되면 무슨 기분일까요.
English: How would it feel to have that amount of money?

Korean: 그냥 돈이 무엇인지 까먹을 거 같아요.
English: I think I'm just forgetting what money is.

Korean: 이혼한 거 보니까 바람을 피워서 이혼했다고 하는데 나쁜 놈이네요.
English: Looking at the divorce, it looks like he divorced because of an affair. He's a bad guy.

Korean: 대부분 부자들은 바람피우는 게 기본 옵션인가 보네요.
English: For most rich people, cheating seems to be a default option.

Korean: 키키 이혼 잘 하고 부디 지금부터는 잘 살기를...
English: Kiki, I hope your divorce goes well and you live well from now on...
Are you interested in beauty?

Korean: 어릴 때는 관심이 많았었는데 요즘에는 관심이 많이 떨어진 거 같아요

Korean: 인구가 너무 많아서 더 사건 사고도 많은가보다 그만큼 키키
English: There must be more accidents because there are so many people. That's why Kiki

Korean: 우리나라도 하루가 다르게 매일 사건 사고 올라오는데 중국은 진짜 엄청나겠다 생각해보니까 그치
English: In our country, accidents and incidents occur every day, so I think China is really going to be a huge deal.

Korean: 우리가 모르는 안 알려진 사건 사고들도 포함해서...
English: Including unknown incidents and accidents that we don't know about...
That's what I'm saying

Korean: 피부가 나이가 들 수록 안 좋아지는 게 느껴져...
English: I feel like my skin is getting worse as I get older...

Korean: 엥 언니 피부 좋아 보이는데 피부 관리 어떻게 해?
English: Hey, your skin looks nice, how do you take care of it?

Korean: 아니야 ㅠ 근데 요즘 관리실 안 가는 사람이 없더라 맞제
English: No, but these days, there's no one who doesn't go to the management office.
Are you going, sister?

Korean: 나는 재작년인가 피부 뒤집어져서 한번 갔는데 진짜 좋긴 하더라
English: I went there once a year ago because my skin was bad, and it was really good.
Oh really?
I've never been there
So I want to go ㅠ
Oh my, why did it flip over?

Korean: 아니 무슨 좁쌀이 겁나 올라오는 거야
English: Hey, what the hell is that little grain of rice coming up?
It was truly legendary, honestly

Korean: 헐 그래도 피부과 가서 괜찮아 져서 다행이네!
English: Wow, I'm glad you went to the dermatologist and got better!
I guess it works well
Sister, have you ever had a vaginal discharge?
What is extrusion?

Korean: 피부과 가면 내 눈에 안 보이는 피지라 하나 그런 거 짜주는데 진짜 핵아파 키키
English: When I go to the dermatologist, they squeeze out sebum that I can't see with my eyes, but it really hurts Kiki

Korean: 근데 피부과도 한번 가면 한 5 6만 원 깨진다 흑흑
English: But if you go to a dermatologist once, it costs about 50,000 to 60,000 won.
Oh really?
Shedding tears Kiki

Korean: 그래 친구들도 보면은 한번에 결제하고 쫌 할인 받아서 다니더라
English: Yeah, when I see my friends, they pay all at once and get a small discount.

Korean: 효과는 근데 눈에 보여서 나도 혹 한다 키키
English: The effect is visible though, so I'm also trying it Kiki

Korean: 나도 근데 10회권 끊고 일주일에 한번씩 갔어
English: I also bought a 10-day pass and went once a week.

Korean: 근데 진짜 갈 때마다 고통인데 관리 받는 느낌이어서 좋긴해!
English: It's really painful every time I go, but it's nice because it feels like I'm being taken care of!

Korean: 말 들으니까 더 가고 싶다 키키
English: Hearing you say that makes me want to go even more Kiki

Korean: 근데 너무 자주 받으면 피부 약해 진다던데 아닌가
English: But I heard that if you do it too often, your skin will become weak.

Korean: 레이저 치료 이런 거는 그렇다고 하더라!
English: That's what laser treatment is like!

Korean: 나중에 이벤트로 1회권 이렇게 한번 가봐 좋긴해!
English: It would be nice to go to an event later and get a one-time ticket!
I guess so
Recommend me a hospital haha
Come to our neighborhood haha
Exercise: Did you say you liked hiking back then?

Korean: 좋아하는 건 아니고 가끔 해 본 정도?
English: I don't like it, but I just do it occasionally?
Be careful not to get hurt while hiking ㅜㅜ

Korean: 언니는 최고로 크게 난 사고 이런 거 있어?
English: Sister, what's the biggest accident you've ever had?

Korean: 아 나 중학교 때 구급차 실려간 적 있었어 키키
English: Oh, I was taken away in an ambulance when I was in middle school, Kiki.

Korean: 헐 뭐 때문에 구급차 탄 거야
English: Oh my god, why did you take an ambulance?

Korean: 학교에서 중간고사 끝나고 놀다가 깨진 유리에 무릎 베여서 키키
English: After finishing the midterm exam at school, Kiki cut his knee on broken glass while playing.
It wasn't a riot

Korean: 니는 뭐 사고 큰 거 난 거 있었어?
English: Did you buy anything big?

Korean: 나는 그래도 엄청 큰 사고는 아니고 깁스한 적?
English: I've never had a cast on, but it wasn't a huge accident.
I think this is the end Kiki
You were quiet, Kiki?

Korean: 아닌데 사건 사고 있을 거 같은 느낌인데 기억 못 하는 거 아니고?
English: It's not like that, but I have a feeling something happened, but it's not like you don't remember?
Sharp Kiki

Korean: 말 안 할랬는데 머리통 한번 꼬맨 적 있다 하하
English: I wasn't going to say anything, but I screwed up my head once haha
Look look Kiki
Tell me by chance

Korean: 키키 그리고 나 어릴 때 엄청 잘 넘어졌어 언니는?
English: Kiki and I fell down a lot when we were little. What about you, sister?
Kiki, why don't you tell me?
How did you get hurt?
It's my heart!
Tell me about your sister
^^ I didn't fall down much Kiki

Korean: 한 번 더 물어 봐도 대?
English: Can I ask you one more time?
Sir secret secret meron
Let's go buy summer clothes
Did you know there's a sale going on these days??
Where are you talking about online?
Just some information, online or whatever

Korean: 요즘 세일 하는 데가 하도 많아서 맞제 키키
English: There are so many places having sales these days, so I'm going to buy it

Korean: 니 어디 아는데 있나 알려줘 키키
English: Tell me where you are Kiki

Korean: 나 요새 진짜 옷 안 사서 모르겠는데 미소페 이번에 세일한다고 아까 네이버에서 봤어 키키
English: I don't really buy clothes these days, so I don't know, but I saw on Naver earlier that Misope is having a sale this time. Kiki
What is Misope doing?
I don't know, please tell me

Korean: 미소페 구두 브랜드인데 가격도 무난하고 발이 편하다고 하더라고?
English: It's a Misope shoe brand, and they say the price is reasonable and it's comfortable.
I don't know because I haven't worn it either Kiki

Korean: 언니 구두 편한 브랜드 알고 있는 데 있어?
English: Sister, do you know a brand of comfortable shoes?
I don't know either ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그냥 지그재그 쇼핑몰에서 거의 사는 거 같다 키키
English: It's almost like I'm just buying from the ZigZag shopping mall Kiki
But zigzag is good

Korean: 뭔가 근데 나이 들어서 그런가 초반에 내가 본 것보다 가격 오른듯
English: I think it's because I'm getting older, but the price seems to have gone up compared to what I saw at the beginning.

Korean: 아니야 요즘 가격이 전체적으로 오르긴 했어 ㅠㅠ 키키
English: No, prices have gone up across the board these days ㅠㅠ Kiki

Korean: 근데 구두 브랜드는 잘 모르겠다 ㅠ
English: But I don't know the shoe brand well ㅠ

Korean: 근데 나 구두 잘 안 신어서 키키
English: But I don't wear shoes often, so Kiki

Korean: 글고 옷도 딱히 안 사는 것 같아
English: And I don't think I'll buy any clothes either
Sister, do you buy clothes often?
I like shopping
But I only have a full cart

Korean: 키키 나는 장바구니 안 담고 꽂히면 걍 사는 스타일
English: Kiki I'm the type that doesn't put anything in the cart and just buys it when I like it

Korean: 언니 서울 와서 어디서 쇼핑 해봤어?

Offline!
I haven't tried it Kiki
What if I get lost?
Kiki I'm here haha
Just follow me

Korean: 연기자 좋아하는 사람 말해줘 봐 키키
English: Tell me who your favorite actor is Kiki

Korean: 나 지금은 그렇게 까지는 아닌데 원래 송중기 엄청 좋아했어! 언니는?
English: I'm not like that now, but I used to really like Song Joong-ki! What about you, Unnie?
Ah, I like Song Joong-ki!
I used to like sharing... Kiki
You must have seen the real Goblin, right?
Oh, I didn't take care of it properly?

Korean: 근데 키키 하도 많이 떠서 내용 다 알아 키키
English: But Kiki has appeared so many times that I know all the content Kiki

Korean: 키키 언니 그거 이동욱이랑 둘이 대박이야
English: Kiki unnie, that's awesome with you and Lee Dong Wook

Korean: 근데 나도 송중기 작품은 태양의 후예가 끝임
English: But for me, Descendants of the Sun is the last Song Joong-ki work

Korean: 키키 맞제 새로운 사람들 나올때 마다 다 멋있어...
English: Kiki, every time new people come out, they're all cool...
Fall in love every day

Korean: 키키 요새는 근데 티비 잘 안 봐서 누구 나오는지도 모르겠어
English: Kiki I don't watch TV much these days, so I don't even know who's on TV
I know that too, The Great Escape?

Korean: 아 그거 들어만 봤고 제대로 본 적은 없어 그거 재밌어?

The full season 4 just came out this time, right?
Please watch it from the beginning ㅜㅜ
Empathize with me
Oh really? What's that about?

Korean: 말 그대로 방에서 탈출 하는 건데 우리가 상상 하는 거랑 차원이 달라
English: It's literally escaping from the room, but it's on a different level than what we imagined.

Korean: 제작진들 머리 비상 그 자체 근데 푸는 애들도 너무 똑똑해...
English: The production staff are really crazy, but the people who solve it are also really smart...

Korean: 키키 그거 강호동 나오는 거밖에 몰랐어
English: Kiki, I only knew that Kang Ho-dong was in it

Korean: 근데 전체적으로 어두워 보이던데 그거 무서운 거야?
English: But it looks dark overall. Is that scary?
There were a lot of scary episodes Kiki

Korean: 유병재랑 신동이 브레인 이걸 맞춘다고? 이 정도로 키키
English: Yoo Byung-jae and Shin Dong-i's brains matched this? Kiki to this extent
Oh really? I have to go home and look.
Do you like Japanese animation?
Something like My Neighbor Totoro?

Korean: 응 키키 포뇨랑 하울의 움직이는 성 미쳤어 ㅜㅜ
English: Yeah Kiki Ponyo and Howl's Moving Castle are crazy ㅜㅜ
I don't know how many times I've seen it

Korean: 나 하울의 움직이는 성 꽤 최근에 보긴 했어

Korean: 근데 확실히 그 그림인데 진짜 같은 그 느낌이 너무 좋긴해! 색감도 그렇고
English: But it's definitely that picture, and I really like the feeling of it being real! The colors are like that too.

Korean: 맞아 키키 애니메이션은 일본 못 따라가는 듯 그럼 센과 치히로는? 봤어?
English: Right. It seems like Kiki's animation can't keep up with Japan. Then what about Sen and Chihiro? Have you seen it?

Korean: 웅웅웅 그것도 하쿠 나오는 거 심지어 나 어릴 때는 누가 나보고 하쿠 닮았대 키키
English: Yeah, yeah, yeah, that's Haku too. When I was little, someone said I looked like Haku. Kiki

Korean: 야 키키 진짜 키키 헐 대박 닮았어 느낌이 얄쌍한 것이 키키
English: Hey Kiki, really Kiki, wow, it looks great. It feels like a pity. Kiki
That guy is sharp

Korean: 키키 언니는 만화 캐릭터 뭐 닮았대?
English: What cartoon character does Kiki resemble?

Korean: 나는 사람 닮았단 소리 안 들어보고 다 캐릭터야

Korean: 공실이 포뇨... 무민이 인형... 뭐 이런

Kiki I've heard of Princess Jasmine too

Korean: 야 인정하기 싫은데 왜 닮았냐 키키
English: Hey I hate to admit it, but why do we look alike Kiki?
What is this? Who is this? A thousand faces

Korean: 키키 쟈스민 하니까 생각났는데 알라딘 봤어?
English: Kiki Jasmine reminds me of Aladdin. Have you seen it?
This is totally awesome
Aladdin Kiki is crazy ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나 첨에 기대 하나도 안하고 봤다가 반했잖아 오에스티 맨날 듣고

Oh really speechless kiki

Korean: 한때 많이 들었는데 지금은 기억도 안 난다
