Korean: 키키 아니 여자 주인공도 진짜 이뻤다고 기억나제
English: Kiki, I remember the female protagonist as really pretty
Kiki, that's right, let's meet again!
What did you eat for breakfast this morning?

Korean: 나 오늘 아침에 콩나물국이랑 계란 키키
English: I had bean sprout soup and egg kiki this morning
Have you eaten breakfast?

Korean: 나 오늘 완전 늦게 일어나서 못 먹었어 ㅜㅜ 편의점 삼김... ㅜㅜ
English: I woke up really late today and couldn't eat ㅜㅜ I just ate convenience store pork... ㅜㅜ
I'm hungry
Did you eat at the convenience store?
No, I bought it and ate it at Starbucks!
Ah, sam kim at Starbucks... How unique~
Still glad I ate it
I can't stand being hungry

Korean: 난 오늘 커피 사올까 말까 하다가 그냥 왔는데 지금 후회 중...
English: I was debating whether or not to buy coffee today, but I ended up just coming, and now I regret it...
I'm craving hazelnut coffee

Korean: 그래 원래 살까 말까 하면 사야 해
English: Yeah, if you're thinking about whether to buy it or not, you should buy it.

Korean: 근데 나도 오늘 카누 먹을라고 텀블러 챙겨왔는데 유혹에  못이기고 샀어...
English: But I also brought a tumbler to drink canoeing today, but I couldn't resist the temptation and bought it...

Korean: 맨날 아메리카노만 먹던데~ 우유 들어간 거 안 좋아해? 라떼 같은 거~
English: You only drink Americano all the time~ Don't you like something with milk in it? Like a latte~

Korean: 나는 우유 별로... 나는 라떼가 아무 맛이  안 나.
English: I don't really like milk... I don't like the taste of lattes.

Korean: 샷 추가 해서 먹으면 맛있다고 하던데 언니는 라떼 좋아해?
English: They say it tastes good if you add a shot. Do you like lattes, sister?

Korean: 난 아메리카노 보다는... 카라멜 마끼아또만 먹었었어 어릴 때는~
English: When I was young, I only drank caramel macchiato rather than Americano~

Korean: 요즘은 아메리카노에 아몬드 시럽 추가해서 먹는 게 그렇게 맛있더라
English: These days, it's so delicious to add almond syrup to Americano.
Oh, almonds?

Korean: 나 아몬드는 이디야꺼 좋아하는데 그 토미넛 라떼!
English: I like Ediya's almond and that tomato nut latte!

Korean: 카라멜 마끼야또 한때 유행해서 먹었는데 이건 단것도 아니고 안 단것도 아니고...키키
English: Caramel macchiato was popular at one time, but it was neither sweet nor not sweet... Kiki

Korean: 카라멜 마끼아또는 좀 커피가 진한 편인데다가 달아서 좋아했었던 거 같아
English: I liked the caramel macchiato because it was a bit strong and sweet.

Korean: 이디야에서도 아몬드 시럽 넣은 거 팔아?
English: Does Ediya sell almond syrup?

Korean: 토피넛 라떼가 아몬드 아니야? 키키 달라?
English: Isn't toffee nut latte almond? Kiki Dalla?
Is that almond chewy?

Korean: 시럽이 아니라 그 토핑 같은 거에 들어가 있는 거 아닌가?
English: Isn't that what's in the topping, not the syrup?
Oh, I think so

Korean: 이디야 안 간 지 하도 오래돼서 모르겠네.
English: It's been so long since I've been there, I don't remember.

Korean: 나 학생 때는 이디야 킬러였는데 키키
English: When I was a student, I was an Ediya killer. Kiki

Korean: 난 떡볶이 킬러였는데 지금도 그렇고 키키
English: I was a tteokbokki killer and I still am Kiki
Sister, do you live in an apartment?
No I am a house

Korean: 아파트 한 번도 살아본 적이 없네~
English: I've never lived in an apartment before~
Do you live in an apartment?
I'm going to buy an apartment!
Do you like houses?

Korean: 예전엔 좋은지 몰랐었는데 지금은 주택이 더 좋은 거 같아
English: I didn't know it was good before, but now I think the house is better

Korean: 오빠가 계속 아파트 살아서 놀러 가보면 하루 지나면 답답해서 못 있겠더라고
English: My brother lives in an apartment, so if I go over and visit him, I get so frustrated after a day that I can't stay.
Oh really?

Korean: 나는 주택 살았을 때 안 좋은 기억밖에  없어. ㅜㅜ
English: I only have bad memories of living in a house. ㅜㅜ
Why was it like that?

Korean: 나 벌레 진짜 싫어하는데 내가 시골에 살았어서 그런가 벌레가 진심 너무 많았어.
English: I really hate bugs, but maybe because I live in the countryside, there were just so many bugs.

Korean: 세상 모든 벌레 거기서 다 본 듯
English: I think I saw all the bugs in the world there
Ah, I guess it's because it's in the countryside ㅠㅠ
Where was the countryside?
Me, Paju! Kiki's field...

Korean: 그래서 나 초등학교 때 인원 몇 명이었게 키키
English: So how many people were there in elementary school? Kiki
Oh~ Paju I'll try to guess! 5 people
Wow, awesome Kiki
Yes, there were 5 of me and 7 of my sister's class. Kiki

Korean: 그리고 주택이어서 그런지 뭐 슈퍼 한번 가려면 너무 힘들던데?
English: And since it's a house, it's really hard to go to the supermarket.
Was it because it was in the countryside?
Oh, I got it right! Awesome!
Transportation in the provinces is still very inconvenient these days~

Korean: 대전에서 버스 한 번 타려고 걸어본 적이 있었는데 횡단보도가 끊어져서 진짜 황당했어
English: I once walked to catch a bus in Daejeon and the crosswalk was cut off, so it was really absurd.
In the end, I found the subway and barely managed to get across.
The crosswalk is broken?
So the road just fell away? Like a sinkhole?

Korean: 아니~ 키키 도로가 횡단보도 횡단보도도 연결이 돼야 건널 수가 있잖아
English: No~ Kiki, the road has to be connected to the crosswalk to be able to cross.

Korean: 보통 2차선 3차선 이러니까~ 근데 도로 체계가 잘못돼서 횡단보도로는 길을 건널 수가 없는 거야 버스 타야 되는데 ㅠㅠ
English: It's usually two or three lanes, but the road system is wrong, so I can't cross the street at the crosswalk. I have to take the bus.

Korean: 그래서 땡볕에서 검색해보니까 지하도로 가라고 해서 그렇게 건넜다고~ 키키
English: So I searched in the blazing sun and it told me to go to the underpass, so I crossed that way~ Kiki
Wow, awesome Kiki

Korean: 근데 나도 저번에 그런 적 있어
English: But I've had that happen to me before too

Korean: 저번에 뭐 길 찾기 했는데 최단거리로 검색했더니 한강 건너서 가래... 장난하냐고 키키
English: Last time I was looking for directions, I searched for the shortest route and it said to go across the Han River... Are you kidding me?
Are water taxis also considered a means of transportation? Kiki

Korean: 나 수상 택시 본 적  있어
English: I've seen a water taxi

Korean: 그니까 근데 난 타본 적은 없어
English: Well, but I've never ridden one
Sister, have you tried it?

Korean: 타는 사람 보기만 했어 뒤에서~ 옷 다 젖을 거 같아서 무섭던데~
English: I just watched the person riding from behind~ I was scared because I thought my clothes would get all wet~
Oh really?

Korean: 나는 타는 사람도 못 봤어 키키
English: I didn't see anyone riding Kiki
Isn't that expensive?

Korean: 나 여의도에서 봤는데 출퇴근 하는 건 5천 원인 거 같아
English: I saw it in Yeouido, and I think the commute is 5,000 won.
Wow, 5 thousand won?
It's so cheap?
Huh? Is it good? Kiki
what's the matter
But only in Seoul

Korean: 나도 확실히는 몰라서 지금 찾아보니까 잠실 뚝섬 도선장 여의도 이렇게만 운영하네 출퇴근코스는
English: I don't know for sure either, so I looked it up and it seems that Jamsil Ttukseom ferry terminal and Yeouido are the only ones operating like this for commuting courses.

Korean: 아니 근데 생각해보니까 그럼 비싼 거네.
English: No, but if you think about it, it's expensive.

Korean: 왜냐면 뚝섬에서 여의도 가는데 5천 원이면 어차피 환승해서  갈 텐데 사람들... 맞지
English: Because if it costs 5,000 won to go from Ttukseom to Yeouido, people will transfer anyway... right?
yes

Korean: 아무래도 배니까~ 근데 그 다리에서 한 번 막히면 택시도 소용이 없거든
English: Well, it's a boat, but once you get stuck on that bridge, even a taxi won't be of any use.

Korean: 진짜 수영해서 가고 싶을 때 있어
English: There are times when I really want to go swimming

Korean: 그럴 때는 진짜 유용할 거 같아
English: I think it would be really useful in that case
What's going on, sister?
Swim there and die.
Wake up Kiki

Korean: 그치~ 근데 다른 데서는 막히면 급할 때 택시도 타고 뛰기도 하고 그렇잖아
English: Right~ But in other places, when you're stuck in traffic and in a hurry, you take a taxi and run, right?

Korean: 근데 다리 위에서 사고 나서 교통 막히기 시작하니까 진짜 답답하더라
English: But after the accident on the bridge, traffic started to be congested, so it was really frustrating.

Korean: 그럴 때 수상 택시 대박 유용할 듯
English: In such cases, a water taxi would be very useful.
Oh right, awesome

Korean: 나 저번에 6시 15분인가? 그때 버스 타고 가는데 비 오던 날이긴 했는데 8시까지 아직도 한강 위였음...
English: I think it was 6:15 last time? I took the bus at that time, and it was raining, but it was still on the Han River at 8 o'clock...
I really thought you'd be disappointed... Wow...
It took me 2 hours to go a distance that was supposed to be 1 hour~
If it rains, there's no way.
You have to run Kiki

Korean: 어? 뛰어? 뛰어가라고? 그 먼 거리를?
English: Huh? Run? Run? That far?

Korean: 너무 막히니까 그게 더 빠르겠더라고~ 아 요즘에 그 이름이 뭐지?
English: It's so clogged up, I thought that would be faster~ Oh, what's the name these days?

Korean: 퀵보드 같은 거 그거 되게 좋아 보이더라 자전거도 많고
English: I really like the kickboard and there are a lot of bikes too.
Oh, that's it? Right
I like that too

Korean: 근데 그거 타다가 나 역주행 해서 다신 안 탐... 키키
English: But I rode it and it drove against the road so I won't ride it again... Kiki
I've never ridden one before

Korean: 오르막 올라갈 때 되게 편해 보이더라 한 번 해봐야지
English: It looks really comfortable when going uphill. I should try it.

Korean: 언니 이거 일하면서 다른 데서도 해봤어?
English: Sister, have you tried this at other places while working?
Working from home and stuff like that!
I worked from home sometimes while I was a warrior last time.
Working from home was harder than going to work every day

Korean: 집에서 일한다는 게 쉽지 않은 듯
English: Working from home doesn't seem easy

Korean: 아 그래? 난 재택이 더 좋아보였는데
English: Oh really? I thought working from home was better.

Korean: 사실 나는 재택 근무가 가능하다고 해서  선택한 것도  큼 키키
English: Actually, I chose Kiki because I could work from home.

Korean: 재택으로 일하니까 좀 경계가 불분명해서 힘들더라고 나는 일하고 있는데 가족들 눈에는 그렇게 안 보이니까
English: Working from home is hard because the boundaries are a bit unclear. I'm working, but my family doesn't see it that way.
Wow, even though you said you were working?
What's going on? What's going on?

Korean: 놀고 있는 줄 아시는 건가 마치 게임하는 것처럼? 키키
English: Do you think I'm playing like I'm playing a game? Kiki

Korean: 그런 건 아닌데 아무래도 딸이 집에 있으니까 편하게 생각하셨겠지? 키키
English: That's not true, but I guess you felt comfortable because your daughter was at home, right? Kiki

Korean: 너는 재택에 더 관심이 있는 거야?
English: Are you more interested in working from home?
Oh, I think I know what it is

Korean: 그 딸 집에 있으면 일하고 있던 공부하고 있던 밥 차리라 그러고 설거지 하라 그러고! 동생 새끼 놀고 있는데!  나 일하는데!
English: If that daughter is at home, she'll be working, studying, preparing meals, and doing the dishes! My little brother's kid is playing! I'm working!
Kiki, what kind of part-time jobs have you had?

Korean: 나 영화관 카페 식당 등등? 일단 돈 되는 거면 웬만한 건 다 한 듯?  하하
English: I've done movie theaters, cafes, restaurants, etc.? I guess I've done pretty much anything that makes money? Haha
What about your sister?

Korean: 이거 말고 또 다른 일 뭐했었어?
English: What else have you done besides this?
I worked part-time as a tutor

Korean: 대학생 때 커피 꼭꼭 해보고 싶었는데~
English: I really wanted to try coffee when I was a college student~
Wow, this is awesome!
Isn't tutoring totally awesome?

Korean: 선생님 소개로 했었는데 캐나다에서 유학하고 들어와서 국어가 딸린다고 해서 맡았던 애였지
English: I was introduced to him by my teacher, but he was a kid who came back from studying abroad in Canada and said he was good at Korean.

Korean: 지금 뭐 하려나 그때 밴드 보컬 한다고 난리였는데
English: What are you doing now? At that time, there was a fuss about you being a band vocalist.
Wow, wow, wow, wow, wow, wow

Korean: 나는 절대 과외 못할 거 같아
English: I don't think I'll ever be able to tutor

Korean: 나 설명 진짜 못하거든. 근데 언니는 완전 잘할 거 같아
English: I'm really bad at explaining things. But I think you'll be really good at it.
Something suits Kiki

Korean: 나는 몸으로 때웠는데 언니는 머리를 썼네... 휴...
English: I used my body, but my sister used her head... phew...

Korean: 근데 알바는 많이 하면 할수록 좋은 거 같아
English: But I think the more part-time jobs you do, the better it gets

Korean: 배우는 것도 많고 경험도 늘고 커피 알바는 안 해봤어?
English: You learn a lot and gain experience. Have you ever worked part-time at a coffee shop?

Korean: 그거 너무 해보고 싶었는데 이제 못해보겠다.
English: I really wanted to do that, but now I can't.
Of course I did it~

Korean: 집 앞에 있었어서 했는데 하 다른 건 다 둘째치고 손님 대접 진짜 커피가 제일 힘들었던 거 같아 손님 땜에... ㅜㅜ
English: I did it because it was in front of my house, but I think the hardest part was serving the customers, putting aside everything else. Because of the customers... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 나는 커피 너무 좋아해서 그것만 생각했는데...
English: Oh, I love coffee so much that I just thought about that...

Korean: 맞아 커피 알바도 서비스직이라 내 친구 카페 하는데 손님 때문에 맨날 전화와
English: Yes, coffee part-time job is also a service job. My friend runs a cafe and gets calls all the time because of customers.

Korean: 나한테 거의 하소연하거나 화내거나 그러는 거 같아 스트레스 받아서
English: I feel stressed because it seems like people are complaining to me or getting angry or something.
That's what I'm saying

Korean: 완전 나 저번에는 자기가 뜨거운 거 달라 그래서 뜨거운 커피 줬는데 이렇게 뜨거운 거 어떻게 먹냐고 나한테 던짐... 무슨 일이야 진짜
English: Last time, he asked for something hot so I gave him some hot coffee, but he threw it at me like, "How can I eat something so hot?" What the heck is going on?
That's true ㅠㅠ
What do you think military life would be like?

Korean: 그 요즘 군대 생활 예능 프로그램 많이 있잖아 키키
English: There are a lot of entertainment programs about military life these days, Kiki

Korean: 진짜 사나이 같은 거? 그거 되게 해보고 싶었어
English: Something like a real man? I really wanted to try that.
Cool~
Yeah right, Kiki

Korean: 나는 그냥 힘들겠다라고만 생각했는데 해보고 싶었다고? 해보고 싶었다는 사람은 내 주변에 처음이야 진심 키키
English: I just thought it would be hard, but you wanted to try it? You're the first person around me who wanted to try it, seriously Kiki
It's cool

Korean: 나는 그 운동 잘하는 사람이 그렇게 멋있더라고 그 결정체가 군인인 거 같아
English: I think that guy who is good at sports is so cool, and I think he is the epitome of a soldier.

Korean: 특히 여자 군인들 진짜 멋있지 않아?
English: Aren't female soldiers especially cool?
Oh, that's right

Korean: 그렇긴 한데 나는 보는 것만 좋아.
English: That's true, but I like just looking at it.

Korean: 그냥 우상으로 삼고 나는 딩가딩가 놀래. 키키
English: Just idolize me and I'll play Ding-Ding-Ding. Kiki

Korean: 그래서  규칙적인 생활하니까 좋아 보이긴 하더라
English: So, it looks good because I have a regular life.

Korean: 나 생활 패턴 완전 뒤죽박죽이라 ㅜㅜ
English: My lifestyle is totally messed up ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 군인은 진짜 그런 면에서는 칼 같지
English: Yes, soldiers are really like swords in that respect.

Korean: 나도 잘 못하니까 그런 모습을 동경하는 거 같아
English: I think I admire that kind of appearance because I'm not good at it either.

Korean: 오 태권도 몇 단 막 이런 거는 진짜 다음 생에는 해봐야지
English: Oh, I really have to try something like getting a few degrees in Taekwondo in my next life.

Korean: 와 태권도 나 진짜 어렸을 때 엄청 다녀보고 싶었는데 ㅜㅜ 근데 요즘 군대 문제 많잖아. 특히 여자
English: Wow, I really wanted to try Taekwondo when I was young ㅜㅜ But these days, there are a lot of military issues. Especially for women.
What's the problem?
That female soldier sexual assault problem ㅜㅜ

Korean: 계속 화두 되고 그러더라 자살하고 그랬잖아. ㅜㅜ 속상
English: It kept coming up and he committed suicide. ㅜㅜ I'm so upset.

Korean: 맞아 나쁜 사람들... ㅠㅠ 군이 아무래도 민간인이랑 떨어져서 고립되어 있는 곳이 많다 보니까 그런 거 같아
English: Yeah, bad people...ㅠㅠ I think it's because the military is often isolated and separated from civilians.

Korean: 그니까 거기다가 거기는 재판도 따로 하잖아
English: So, on top of that, they have separate trials there.

Korean: 군 사법 기관 따로 있고 의료관도 따로 있고  완전 독립 체계야  ㅜㅜ
English: There is a separate military judicial agency and medical office, it's a completely independent system ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그래서 더 그런 거 같다고 하더라고
English: So he said it seemed more like that

Korean: 근데 요즘엔 군대 규율이 많이 없어지고 있잖아
English: But these days, military discipline is disappearing a lot.

Korean: 휴대폰도 반입되고 휴가도 그렇고 그거는 좋은 걸까 나쁜 걸까?
English: Bringing in a cell phone and going on vacation, is that a good thing or a bad thing?

Korean: 그렇게 자꾸 풀어주다 보면 오히려 군 기강이 해이해져서 이런저런 사고가 더 많아지는 건 아닐까?
English: If we keep letting them off like that, won't military discipline become lax and more accidents happen?

Korean: 그런가? 나는 그 위계질서에  문제라고 생각했는데 그게 너무 심하잖아
English: Is that so? I thought the problem was with the hierarchy, but it's just too much.

Korean: 약간 우리 대학 때 체육과 애들 같은 그런 군기가 있지 않을까
English: Isn't there a military discipline similar to that of the PE department in our college?

Korean: 그런 거면 휴대폰 반입이나 휴가 문제로는 해결이  절대 불가할듯...
English: If that's the case, it seems like it can never be solved by bringing in a cell phone or taking a vacation...

Korean: 휴대폰 반입돼서 게임이나 도박 문제도 생기나 보더라고 그러면 옆에 있는 동기한테도 영향을 줄 거고 그런 식으로 풀어주면 상관 말을 들을까?
English: If you bring in a cell phone and start having problems with games or gambling, it will affect your classmates next to you. If you let it go like that, will they listen to what their superiors say?
Oh, that's what it was?

Korean: 나는 연락 문제로 그런 줄 알았는데 미친 도박은 진짜 생각도 못했다 무슨 일이야.
English: I thought it was a communication issue, but I never thought of crazy gambling. What the heck.

Korean: 그러니까 역시 휴대폰의 세상은 끝이 없어
English: So, the world of cell phones is endless.

Korean: 언니는 요즘에 뭐 따로 배우고 싶은 거 없어?
English: Sister, is there anything you want to learn these days?

Korean: 커피 내리는 거 배우고 싶고 춤 배우고 싶어~
English: I want to learn how to make coffee and I want to learn how to dance~
Huh? Dance? Dance? Kiki

Korean: 아 근데 나도 폴댄스는 배워보고 싶긴 하다
English: Oh, but I also want to learn pole dancing.
Pole dancing makes your legs hurt so much~
I'm so tired and worn out~

Korean: 아 진짜? 나 저번에  박나래가 폴댄스 배우는 거 보고  배우고 싶더라고 키키
English: Oh really? I saw Park Na-rae learning pole dancing last time and I wanted to learn it.

Korean: 커피 내리는 거 국비 지원으로 배울 수 있던데!
English: I heard you can learn how to make coffee with government funding!

Korean: 맞아 근데 시간도 따로 내야 하고 자격증 따도 딱히 지금은 쓸 데가 없어서 고민 중
English: Yes, but I have to set aside time and I'm worried because I don't have a place to use the certificate right now.

Korean: 그냥 집에서 내려 먹게 배울까? 키키 고급 취미 생활
English: Should I just learn how to eat at home? Kiki Advanced Hobby Life

Korean: 아니 취미 생활 너무 고급 진 거 아니야? 키키
English: No, isn't your hobby life too advanced? Kiki

Korean: 근데 커피 그거 한번 시작하면 장비빨 필요하잖아
English: But once you start making coffee, you need to get the equipment.

Korean: 나는 뭐 시작하기 전에 무조건 장비부터 사는 편이라 키키 내 주변 그 국비 그걸로 커피 배우더라고
English: I tend to buy equipment before I start anything, so Kiki learned coffee with the national budget around me.
I see~

Korean: 너는 뭐 배우고 싶은 거 없어 요즘?
English: Is there anything you want to learn these days?
I have so many!

Korean: 나는 라탄도 배우고 싶고 막 손으로 하는 거 뜨개질도 배우고 싶고 ㅜㅜ
English: I want to learn rattan and also knitting by hand ㅜㅜ

Korean: 라탄이면 그 라탄 가방 같은 거 만드는 건가?
English: If it's rattan, do you make things like rattan bags?
Oh my, oh my, oh my, that's right
I have a cat
Kiki, the cat loves rattan so much
And I want to learn that too
That computer thing! I gave up.

Korean: 어디까지 했었어? 필기 내용 보니까 말이 너무 어렵더라
English: How far have you come? Looking at the notes, the words are too difficult.

Korean: 그니까 나 필기 배우다가 기간 끝나서 흐지부지 됐어
English: That's why I was learning handwriting, but the period ended and it just fizzled out.
Even the movers came... ㅜㅜ
That was also done with government funding haha
Oh, that's also supported by government funding~

Korean: 나 다음 달에 엄마 생일인데 뭐해주지?
English: My mom's birthday is next month. What should I do for her?

Korean: 절대 주방 기구나 그런 건 안 돼!
English: Absolutely no kitchen utensils or anything like that!
Oh my gosh! Isn't it good?
What should I do? There's nothing I can do for you.

Korean: 왜냐면 몇 달 전에 어버이날이었잖아 이미 한 번 했다고... ㅜㅜ
English: Because it was Parents' Day a few months ago, we already did it once... ㅜㅜ
What did you give me back then?

Korean: 그때는 돈 박스 했어! 뭔지 알지 키키
English: I had a money box back then! Do you know what it is Kiki

Korean: 그리고 여수로 가족 여행 갔다 왔지~ 언니는?
English: And I went on a family trip to Yeosu. Where's your sister?

Korean: 우와~ 난 핸드폰 그때 망가지셔서 그거 사드렸다!
English: Wow~ My phone broke back then so I bought that for you!
Wow, the scale is completely different?

Korean: 와 우리 아빠도 핸드폰 바꿔줘야 하긴 하는데 ㅜㅜ 자꾸 안 된다고 의미심장하게 똑같은 말 계속함 알지 키키
English: Wow, my dad also needs to change his phone ㅜㅜ He keeps saying the same thing over and over again, saying it can't be done, you know Kiki

Korean: 키키 딸이 사주면 의미도 있고 자랑도 할 수 있고 좋아서 그러신 거 같아~
English: I think Kiki's daughter likes it because it's meaningful and something she can show off.

Korean: 주방 기구는 어머니만을 위한 선물은 아니니까 생신 때는 어머니만을 위한 선물이 좋을  거 같아
English: Kitchen utensils aren't just gifts for moms, so I think it would be nice to give a gift just for her on her birthday.

Korean: 엄마만을 위한 선물? 엄마는 빨리 나가라고 하는데? 키키
English: A gift just for mom? Mom tells me to hurry up and go? Kiki

Korean: 뭐 맨날 엄청 비싼 거 해달래 ㅜㅜ
English: Why do you always ask me to do something so expensive? ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그 돈 쏘는 총 할까. 돈은 없고 총만... 키키
English: Should I get that gun to shoot money? No money, just a gun... Kiki

Korean: 그런 것도 있어? 요즘 진짜 특이한 것들 많아~
English: Is there something like that? There are so many unique things these days~

Korean: 같이 나가서 옷 해드려도 좋고 아깝다고 하시겠지만 꽃도 한가득 좋을 거 같아
English: I could go out with you and give you clothes, but you might think it's a waste, but I think a bunch of flowers would be nice too.

Korean: 아 꽃 저번에  했는데 돈 꽃 아니면 갖고 오지 말래
English: Ah, I gave you flowers last time, but if it's not money or flowers, don't bring them.

Korean: 우리 엄마 좀 물질 만능 주의 같다. 이렇게 얘기하니까 키키
English: My mom seems to be a bit materialistic. When I say this, Kiki
No, all parents are like that
My mom is like that too
But I just stay strong

Korean: 그럴 때 아니면 꽃 선물 언제 해보고 받아보시겠어
English: If not now, then when will you give and receive flowers as a gift?

Korean: 그니까 ㅜㅜ 그냥 꽃으로 때우고 싶다 나도... 키키
English: That's why ㅜㅜ I just want to fill it with flowers... Me too... Kiki

Korean: 아니 돈 나갈 일이 너무 많아
English: No, there are too many things to spend money on
Seriously, what about me? Even on my birthday?
Birthday? Your birthday?

Korean: 어 키키 나는 돈 받을 때가 생일밖에 없는데 엄빠는 여러 가지 날이  있잖아...ㅜㅜ
English: Oh Kiki, I only get paid on my birthday, but Dad gets paid on many other days...ㅜㅜ
Ah~ That's right Kiki

Korean: 난 생일 때 돈 받아 본 적이 너무 오래 전인데 키키
English: It's been so long since I've received money for my birthday, Kiki

Korean: 언니는 연애 할 때 중요하게 생각하는 부분이라든지 따로 있어?
English: Sister, is there anything you consider important when dating?
First of all, let's talk Kiki
I guess it has to be something like a gag code too?
Yeah, I admit it Kiki

Korean: 나도 개그 코드 무조건 맞아야 해
English: I also have to have a gag code

Korean: 근데 나는 나이 차이도 좀 보는 편이야
English: But I also pay attention to the age difference
And absolutely no younger people
How much of an age difference is okay?
Up to four years old!
Below is something I've never really thought about
Isn't she just a kid? Kiki
I don't like dating either~

Korean: 나이 들면 들수록 연하가 좋아진대 누구의 말에 의하면
English: Someone said that the older you get, the more you like younger women.
Who is that Kiki

Korean: 웃겨 키키 근데 그렇다고 하긴 하더라 근데 동갑은 진짜 안되겠더라 나는...
English: Funny Kiki, but that's what they say, but I really can't be the same age...
Ah~ Why?
Do you fight a lot?
Oh. Totally Kiki
It's almost war

Korean: 나 완전 다 집어던지는 스타일이라 키키
English: I'm the type that just throws everything away, Kiki

Korean: 동갑이면 말이 일단 편하잖아 답도 없음.
English: If we're the same age, it's easier to talk. There's no answer.
Oh, that's true too~
If we were the same age, we would fight often.

Korean: 연하 좋아하는 건 내가 아는 언니 키키
English: The one I like the most is my older sister Kiki

Korean: 아~ 근데 내 친구들은 이제 다들 연하 좋아하긴 하더라 키키
English: Ah~ But now all my friends like younger guys Kiki
Meet up with younger people.

Korean: 옛날에는 위에 사람만 만나더니 진짜 웃겨
English: In the past, I only met people above me, it was really funny
I guess I'm getting old now Kiki

Korean: 맞아 그렇더라고 너는 연애할 때 제일 중요하게 생각하는 거 뭐야?
English: Right, that's right. What do you think is most important when dating?
When I first met my boyfriend

Korean: 나는 말씨!  말씨가 고운지! 말투 제일 중요해
English: I am a speaker! Is the speech beautiful? The tone of speech is the most important.

Korean: 맞아 말 예쁘게 하는 남자 흔치 않아~
English: That's right, it's rare to find a man who speaks nicely~
Has there ever been someone like that?
No, why would you look for someone like that?
Seriously, tears are welling up in my eyes.

Korean: 맞아 그래서 사람들이 반려동물을 많이 키우는 거 같아 싱글로 살면서
English: That's right, so I think a lot of people keep pets while living single.
that's right

Korean: 근데 나는 동물 키울 때 펫샵에서 사오는 사람 진짜 극혐함.
English: But when I raise animals, I really hate people who buy them from pet shops.
Oh, why?
Then where do you bring it from?

Korean: 그 품종묘나 품종개 때문에 버려지는 유기견 유기묘가 더 많아지고 있잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: There are more abandoned cats and dogs because of those purebred cats and dogs. ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나는 지금 길고양이 데려왔고 포인핸드라고 유기견 유기묘 입양하는 사이트가 따로 있어!
English: I just adopted a stray cat, and there's a separate site for adopting abandoned dogs and cats called Pointhand!
Oh, I see

Korean: 난 어릴 때만 키워봐서 그런 정보를 몰랐네
English: I didn't know that information because I only raised it when I was young.
Is the stray cat okay?

Korean: 원래 고양이가 좀 어려운 동물이지 않아?
English: Aren't cats originally a bit of a difficult animal?

Korean: 근데 길고양이는 사람 손 안 타서 더 어려울 거 같아
English: But I think it would be more difficult for stray cats because they don't get touched by people.

Korean: 움... 나는 그 길고양이가 새끼를 낳았는데 사람손을 타버렸는지 애만 안 데려갔더라고... ㅜㅜ
English: Um... I think that stray cat gave birth to kittens, but they didn't take the kittens because they got bitten by a human hand... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 그래서 며칠 지켜봤는데도 어미 냥이가 안 나타나서 그냥 내가 키우기로 하고 데려왔어!
English: So I watched for a few days but the mother cat didn't show up, so I decided to raise it myself and brought it home!
It would have been okay if it was a young cat
It must have been really cute~
Good, good, good, good job

Korean: 맞아 ㅜㅜ 근데 지금 너무 커서 뚱뚱해졌어
English: Yeah ㅜㅜ But now I'm so big and fat
This is so fat Kiki

Korean: 언니도 어렸을 때부터 데려와서 키웠던 거지?
English: Did you bring your older sister in and raise her since she was little?

Korean: 나? 아 난 내가 어릴 때만 키워봐서 아빠가 어디서 데려왔는지 모르겠어~
English: Me? Ah, I only raised it when I was little, so I don't know where my dad got it from~

Korean: 아~ 개 키우는 거 하니까 생각난다
English: Ah~ I think of you when I think of raising a dog

Korean: 우리도 시골 살았을 때 아빠가 멧돼지 잡고 하느라 개 키웠는데 기 개 사료가 맛있어 보이잖아 소리도 그렇고... 그래서 먹어본 적 있다 나 키키
English: When we lived in the countryside, my dad raised a dog to catch wild boars. The dog food looked delicious and sounded good too... So I tried it.

Korean: 먹는 사람 본 적은 있어 나도 키키
English: I've seen people eat it too Kiki
You said it wasn't tasty?
Has anyone tried it?
You're not eating that as stock, are you?

Korean: 먹는 사람이라 그러니까 살짝 걱정되네. 키키
English: I'm a little worried because you're an eater. Kiki

Korean: 맛이  있고 없고를 떠나서 겁나 비려.
English: Regardless of whether it tastes good or not, it's really expensive.
It's the worst

Korean: 으~ 비리기까지 하면 너무 하잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Ugh~ It's too much to even call it a scandal ㅠㅠ
Animals eat it because it tastes good, right?
Wouldn't that be so?

Korean: 나 고양이 사료도 엄청 냄새 비려
English: My cat food smells really bad too

Korean: 으메 그게 맛있다고 먹는데 너무 웃기고 귀여움
English: Oh my that's so delicious I'm eating it, it's so funny and cute

Korean: 반려용품이라고 더 비싸게 파는 그런 것만 없었으면 좋겠어 ㅜㅜ
English: I just wish there weren't things like pet supplies that are sold at higher prices ㅜㅜ
Do cats really like milk?
No, if you eat that you'll die.
Why? They eat it a lot in cartoons and on TV.

Korean: 근데 개 키우면서 요즘 같이 런닝 하는 사람 많더라
English: But these days, there are a lot of people who run with their dogs.
Does your sister like running too?
I like it sometimes. Definitely Kiki

Korean: 근데 뛰면 기분 좋아질 때 있어
English: But there are times when running makes me feel better
Wow, I'm having a hard time, Kiki

Korean: 근데 요즘 올림픽 해서 그런가 양궁 배워보고 싶지 않아?
English: But maybe because of the Olympics these days, don't you want to learn archery?

Korean: 양궁도 좋은데 나는 그 국궁 배워보고 싶어
English: Archery is good, but I want to learn archery.
Oh, that's right, that's right

Korean: 국궁은 나 그 킹덤 보면서 배워보고 싶었는데 키키
English: I wanted to learn archery while watching Kingdom, but Kiki

Korean: 근데 나 수영 배워본 적 있다!
English: But I have learned how to swim!
Oh, are you good at swimming?

Korean: 나 물에 빠지면 구해주는 거야? 키키
English: If I fall into water, will you save me? Kiki
No, I'm not very good at it~

Korean: 나 파주 살 때 맨날 언니랑 같이 가서  배우고 그랬어
English: When I lived in Paju, I always went with my sister to learn and stuff.
It was fun when I was little, Kiki
I like water!
I really like water too~
But I can't swim
I want to learn

Korean: 아! 아까 남친 볼 때 어떤 거 보냐고 물었었는데 조건 하나 있다!
English: Ah! I asked you earlier what you look for when you meet your boyfriend, but there's one condition!
Oh my, what is it? What is it?
Do you like people who exercise?
Oh right

Korean: 운동 잘하는 사람 그리고 좋아하는 사람 그래서 나랑 같이 운동도 가고 특히! 수영 가르쳐 줄 사람~
English: Someone who is good at sports and likes it, so I can go to the gym with them and especially! Someone who can teach me how to swim~
Ohhhhhh~ Are you serious about swimming? Kiki

Korean: 근데 수영하면 체력 소모 너무 심해
English: But swimming consumes too much energy
I just hate exercising.

Korean: 물에서 노는 것만 좋아하는 듯... 키키
English: Kiki seems to only like playing in the water...
I want to try the butterfly stroke
Ah, the butterfly stroke is awesome
I got scolded for not being able to do that, Kiki

Korean: 접영까지 배웠으면 진짜 거의 끝까지 배운 거 아냐? 대단대단
English: If you've learned the butterfly stroke, aren't you almost done learning it? That's amazing.
Well, I learned everything until the end~

Korean: 근데 나는 그 수영 끝나고 딱 씻고 셔틀버스 기다리면서 마시던 핫초코가 너무 좋았어 키키
English: But I loved the hot chocolate I had after swimming and while waiting for the shuttle bus Kiki
So it seems like it kept going...

Korean: 운동 후 핫초코 난 딸기 우유!
English: Hot chocolate after a workout or strawberry milk!

Korean: 근데 컴터 게임 중에 그 총으로 하는 게임 있잖아
English: But among the computer games, there's a game that uses that gun.
Sister, have you tried Sudden Attack?

Korean: 컴퓨터 게임은 잘 안 해서 모르겠고 그 오락실 가면 있는 거 그건 진짜 많이 있지
English: I don't know much about computer games, but if you go to the arcade, there are a lot of them.

Korean: 그치 나도 오락실 가면 있는 총 쏘는 게임은 많이 하는데 그 컴터로 하는 거는 하다가 멀미 날뻔함 키키
English: Yeah, I also play a lot of shooting games at the arcade, but I almost got motion sickness when I played them on the computer. Kiki
It's so dizzy...?

Korean: 아 그러고 보니까 오빠 하는 거 본 적 있다
English: Oh, come to think of it, I've seen you do that before

Korean: 그거 화면이 크면 클수록 그 화면이 확확 바뀌어 가지고 눈을 아프더라
English: The bigger the screen, the more it changes and it hurts my eyes.
That's why it's so difficult

Korean: 나 친구 따라서 피씨방에서 했는데 화면 너무 커가지고 키케
English: I followed my friend to a PC room and the screen was too big
By the way, have you ever played MapleStory at a PC room?
What is Maple?
Maple Story Kiki
I only saw the commercials Kiki
Is that fun?

Korean: 아니 나는 유일하게 좀 오래 했던 게임이 그거인 거 같아 키키
English: No, I think that's the only game I've played for a while, Kiki

Korean: 재밌긴 한데 갈수록 돈 써야 돼서  힘들어 ㅜㅜ
English: It's fun, but it's getting harder and harder because I have to spend more money ㅜㅜ
Money? To buy items and stuff like that?

Korean: 엉 키키 내가 또 한번 시작하면  끝장을 봐야 해 아니면 아예 하질 말던가...
English: Hey Kiki, if I start again I have to finish it or else I shouldn't do it at all...

Korean: 그리고 그게 돈 있다고 살 수 있는 게 아니라 복불복이니까 완전 짜증나 ㅜㅜ
English: And it's not something you can buy with money, it's a hit or miss thing so it really sucks ㅜㅜ
Lucky or not?
Are you saying that you can't buy it even if you give money?
That's unusual

Korean: 엉엉 돈 주고 그 뽑기권을 사야 해
English: Ugh, I have to pay money to buy that lottery ticket.

Korean: 그러고 이제 그걸로 뽑는 건데 좋은 아이템이 잘 안 나와!
English: And now I'm trying to pull it out, but good items don't come out easily!

Korean: 그럼 또 그 뽑기권을 사서 또 뽑아야 해...
English: Then I have to buy that lottery ticket again and draw again...
What the heck, this is almost like gambling~

Korean: 하고 싶은 사람은 거의 될 때까지 하겠다
English: Anyone who wants to do something will do it until it almost happens.

Korean: 그니까 키키 그래서 막 유튜브 이런 거 찾아봤어든?
English: So Kiki, did you search for things like YouTube?
They spent hundreds of dollars...

Korean: 근데 이상하게 핸폰 게임에서는 안 쓰고 싶은 데 컴터 게임은 꼭 쓰고 싶더라...
English: But strangely, I don't want to use it for mobile games, but I really want to use it for computer games...
Oh really? It looks really fun~

Korean: 언니는 국내 여행 어디 어디 가봤어?
English: Sister, where have you been on domestic trips?

Korean: 난 특이하게 고속도로 휴게소 투어 해봤다 경부선 쪽 라인
English: I did a unique highway rest stop tour on the Gyeongbu Line.

Korean: 헐 키키 대박 무슨 일이야 완전 특이하다 헐 뭐?
English: Wow Kiki, what the heck is going on? This is so weird. Wow, what?
How do you do it?

Korean: 친오빠가 울산 살거든 근데 KTX타고 그냥 내려가면 재미없으니까
English: My older brother lives in Ulsan, but it wouldn't be fun to just take the KTX and go down.

Korean: 차 타고 어떨 때는 고속도로 타고 어떨 때는 국도 타면서 휴게소 안 가본 데 없이 다 들러보기 했었어
English: Sometimes I drove on the highway, sometimes on the national road, and I stopped at every rest stop I could find.

Korean: 엄마가 그런 거 좋아하셔서 그래도 못 가본 데도 있지만 휴게소 진짜 진짜 많아 우리나라
English: My mom likes that kind of thing, so I haven't been to any rest areas, but there are a lot of them in our country.
Wow, this is totally amazing.

Korean: 오 완전 색달라 원래 무조건 최단 거리로 가잖아 대박이다
English: Oh, it's totally different. It's awesome because it always takes the shortest route.

Korean: 나는 순천 가보고 싶더라 그럼 언니한테 휴게소 맛집 알아내야 겠다 ㅋ
English: I want to go to Suncheon. Then I have to ask my sister about a good restaurant at a rest stop.

Korean: 순천은 나도 못 가봤어 전라도지 순천이?
English: I haven't been to Suncheon either. Is Suncheon in Jeolla-do?
Should I give you my mom's number?
I just followed along so I don't remember~

Korean: 키키 저번에  무슨  휴게소에서 통감자 먹고 싶다고 한번 돌아갔더니 아빠가 엄청 뭐라 했거든 키키 엉엉엉
English: Kiki, last time I went back to a rest stop because I wanted to eat sweet potatoes, and my dad said something really crazy. Kiki, sob, sob

Korean: 나 나무 진짜 진짜 좋아하는데 가면 재밌겠다.

Oh, that's right, you liked hiking too, sis~

Korean: 나도 식물원 가는 거 좋아하긴 하는데 벌레... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나 제주도 여행했을 때도 그 꽃 사이에서 사진 찍는데 벌 너무 많아서 한 장 찍었나?

English: I want to go to Jeju Island again. My friend lives there.

Korean: 지금 딱 가면 더워도 날씨 좋아서 이쁠텐데

Korean: 맞아 제주도만 가도 여행 가는 느낌 확 들어서 좋더라

Korean: 사람들 요즘에 많이 취소해서 제주도 한가해졌다는데 진짜인가?

Korean: 그렇다고 하긴 하더라 친구 말로는 괜찮아졌대

English: Yes, I've been to Jeju Island, but I've never been to Udo Island.

English: Jeju Island is like that too, and I've been there a lot when I've been to Busan, so this heat dome phenomenon? That needs to be broken.

This is totally awesome

English: That's right. Last time I saw it, there was an old couple who died from heatstroke because they couldn't pay their air conditioner bill.

Wow, there's a business like that?
Wow, this is awesome.

English: But if you install an air conditioner in a house that didn't have one, the electricity bill will increase, so it's a money issue, regardless of the progressive tax rate.

Korean: 그 사람들 입장에서는 에어컨이 선풍기의 몇 배는 전기가 더 드니까 그만큼 나올 거고
English: From their perspective, air conditioners consume several times more electricity than electric fans, so they will pay that amount.

Korean: 아~ 그런 느낌으로~ 근데 그래도 선풍기로 나기 힘들어졌어

Until two years ago, we only had to use electric fans to survive.

Korean: 근데 또 기후변화가 가속화되는 거니까 북금곰 생각하면 또 따흐흑...
English: But then again, climate change is accelerating, so when I think of polar bears, I feel so sad...

Korean: 북극곰 후원하지만 에어컨은 포기 못하는 나 너무 비열해... 키키

Are you joining us in supporting polar bears now?

Korean: 그래서 맨날 환경 다큐 보다 보니까 키키 동물 키우니까 또 그런 게 생기더라 참나 하하
English: So I was watching environmental documentaries all the time and I realized that raising animals like Kiki made me do the same thing. Haha

Korean: 수영하다가 발 디딜 곳이 없어서 죽는다는 말 들었을 때는 정말 눈물 났어

Korean: 근데 오늘도 플라스틱 쓰는 나란 사람 너무 모순적이야... 키키

English: That's right. When you go to a cafe, they say you can't use personal cups. But because of Corona, plastic is plastic, and some people say that eating seafood could be more serious for the environment!

Korean: 계속 그런 식으로 대량으로 잡고 그러면 질서가 사라지니까 바다를 정화 시켜주는 게 다 해양 생물이잖아 ㅜㅜ

Korean: 의견이 분분하네 정치적으로 악용하려는 것도 보이고

Korean: 헐 대박 나는 저번 호주 산불처럼 기후변화 그런 거 때문에 건조해져서 나는 그런 건줄 알았는데 정치적 악용은 좀 심하다

Korean: 아침 9시 경기였대 끝나자마자 봤다 버스에서 키키

Korean: 그니까 근데 그거 폭로했다고 그 지금 나온 시몬 바일스 빼고 전부 퇴출 당했대...

But I want to do that

Korean: 그치 키키 나 하고 싶은 데 지금 단발이라 하면  정재형 될 거 같아서 못하겠어...

Kiki Jung Jae-hyung

But I want to do that

English: Ah, crazy Hagrid Kiki, no, but it would be nice to have a lot of hair

Korean: 볼 때는 괜찮은데~ 여자는 머리 엄청 중요해

Korean: 그래서 나 그 헤어 라인 정리도 하고 싶더라

Korean: 머리 묶을 때 너무 비어 보여 키키
English: Kiki looks so empty when you tie your hair

But I don't know the name either, Kiki

English: But you're not talking about black tea, are you? Kiki

Korean: 헤어라인 쉐도우 헤어라인 쿠션 이렇게 부르나봐
English: Hairline Shadow Hairline Cushion I guess that's what it's called
I bought this when it first came out?
At a famous beauty salon~ But it wasn't that great
Are you okay now?

Korean: 눈썹 타투 해주는 그 그리는 눈썹 타투!
English: The eyebrow tattoo that gives you an eyebrow tattoo!
I even got my eyebrows tattooed lol

Korean: 요즘 건강을 위해 챙겨 먹는 비타민 같은 거 있어?
English: Are there any vitamins that you take for your health these days?

Korean: 나 비타민은 음식으로 섭취하려고 건강식품으로 먹어

Korean: 비타민 채우는 거면 야채 말하는 건가?

Tart cherry? What's that?

Korean: 와 진짜 생전 처음 들어봐 키키
English: Wow, this is the first time I've heard Kiki

Korean: 음 체리 종류의 하나인데 그게 잘 물르는 성질이 있어서 생으로 먹기는 힘들다는
English: Well, it's a type of cherry, but it's hard to eat raw because it's prone to getting chewed.

Korean: 근데 비타민도 그렇고 영양소가 되게 많아서 그냥 그거 하나 먹고 있어 비타민 쪽으로는
English: But vitamins and other nutrients are very rich, so I just eat one. As for vitamins,
Wow, this is amazing

Korean: 나는 야채도 싫어하고 과일도 싫어해서 비타민이라도 챙겨 먹으려고 했는데 사다 놓기만 하고 안 먹고 있어 키키
English: I hate vegetables and fruits, so I tried to take vitamins, but I just bought them and didn't eat them. Kiki

Korean: 어떤 비타민? 비타민 씨? 종합 비타민? 알약?
English: What vitamins? Vitamin C? Multivitamins? Pills?

Korean: 나 처음에는 오메가 먹었는데 2알 먹고 안 먹었고 지금은 그 종합 비타민으로 얼라이브 유명하다고 해서 그거 사다 놓았는데 안 먹고 있어 키키
English: At first, I took Omega, but I stopped eating after taking 2 pills. Now, I heard that Alive is famous for its multivitamins, so I bought that, but I'm not taking it. Kiki

Korean: 아 그 얼라이브~ 광고도 상큼한 그거~
English: Ah, that Alive~ Even the advertisement is refreshing~

Korean: 나도 건강식품 집에 되게 많은데 꾸준히 챙겨 먹는 건 몇 개 안 되는 거 같아
English: I have a lot of health food products at home, but I think I only eat a few of them regularly.

Korean: 내 말이 그거 챙겨 먹는 시간에  잠을 10초라도 더 자야함 키키

That's good for my health..

I feel like I'm going to die soon

Korean: 건강에 안 좋아 1초씩 수명 줄어드는 느낌

Korean: 나 대학 때 배운 건데 잠 안 자면 몸 속에 유전자에 영향을 미쳐서 수명이 단축된다고 했어
English: I learned in college that if you don't sleep, your genes will be affected and your lifespan will be shortened.
I got a good deal from Carrot Market a while ago~

Korean: 요즘 당근마켓 진짜 많이 하던데 어떤 거 샀어?
English: I've been using Carrot Market a lot these days. What did you buy?

Korean: 나 산 건 아니고 또 고양이 용품이긴 한대
English: I didn't buy it, but it's a cat product.

Korean: 어떤 사람이 이거 자기 고양이 안 쓴다고 무료 나눔 한대서
English: Someone said they were giving this away for free because their cat didn't use it.
Kiki bought a hiding place for the cat
Yes, I heard there are free giveaways too
Is that really free?
Oh my gosh it's really free
Sister, have you never done it before?

Korean: 응 앱은 깔아 놨는데 이용은 안 해봤어
English: Yeah, I installed the app, but I haven't used it.

Korean: 근데 그거 좀 불편한 게 있던데
English: But there's something a little inconvenient about that
Yeah? What kind of point?
I wrote it so comfortably!

Korean: 물건을 검색하기 전에 거래 지역을 선택해야 돼서 그게 좀 불편해 보였어
English: I found it a bit inconvenient that I had to select a trading area before searching for items.

Korean: 내 지역에는 없는데 다른 지역에 내가 원하는 물건이 있을 수도 있잖아
English: It's not in my area, but there may be something I want in another area.
Ah~ right, right
That was really uncomfortable

Korean: 다른 지역도 됐으면 좋겠던데 그래서 그거로 무슨 네고왕? 같은 거에서 개발자 찾아갔더라
English: I wish it was in other areas too, so I went to find a developer in something like Nego King.

Korean: 오~ 요즘 광고도 늘고 사람들 진짜 많이 이용해서~
English: Oh~ These days, there are more advertisements and people are using them a lot~

Korean: 틈새시장 제대로 찾은 거 같아 그 사람이
English: I think that person has found the right niche.

Korean: 내 말이 내 지역이 아니면 거래 제한 되는 것만 아니면 진짜 좋은 데 소소하게 용돈 벌이 정도는 괜찮은 듯!
English: I think it would be really good if it weren't for the fact that trading is restricted outside of my area, but it seems okay to make a little extra money!

Korean: 맞아 집에 안 쓰는 건데 새 거 인 거 진짜 많잖아~
English: That's right, I don't use them at home, but there are a lot of new ones~

Korean: 나 이사 올 때 냉장고 사면서 공기청정기 사은품으로 받았는데 그것도 팔아서 쏠쏠해짐 키키
English: When I moved, I got an air purifier as a gift when I bought a refrigerator, and I sold that too and got a lot of money.
I got something good~
I need to change my air purifier~

Korean: 그런 건 항상 살 때 고민 돼
English: That's something I always worry about when I'm living.
Buy online or buy at a store

Korean: 그래? 나는 공기청정기를 살 생각이 아예 없었어서 키키 오로지 고양이 용품...
English: Yeah? I had no intention of buying an air purifier, so Kiki only bought cat products...
The cat is having a good time~

Korean: 난 기계에 관심이 많아  좋아하고 그럼 고양이 관련 용품 살 때는 주로 인터넷으로 사?
English: I'm very interested in machines, so I usually buy cat-related items online.
I guess so?

Korean: 방송에서 좋다고 하는 건 다 사는 듯 키키
English: Kiki seems to buy everything that is said to be good on TV

Korean: 요즘 연예인들이 거의 모든 제품을 광고하는 거 같아
English: It seems like celebrities these days are advertising almost every product.

Korean: 살 때 연예인들이 광고하는 제품을 사는 편이야?
English: Do you tend to buy products that celebrities advertise?
Well, I guess it's more like YouTube than a celebrity?

Korean: 나는  요즘 티비 방송 이런 거 보다 유튜브가 훨씬 재밌더라고
English: I find YouTube much more interesting than TV these days.

Korean: 그렇네 요즘은 유튜브에서 광고하는 사람도 많고 소개하는 사람도 많고~
English: That's right. These days, there are a lot of people advertising and introducing things on YouTube.

Korean: 근데 나는 유튜브 방송에서 광고하는 건 안 사본 거 같아
English: But I don't think I bought anything advertised on YouTube.
Have you bought it?
No, Kiki

Korean: 나는 그 요즘 1인 방송 많이 하잖아
English: I do a lot of one-person broadcasts these days.

Korean: 유튜브에서 거기서 유명한 사람들이 추천하는 건 좀 사봤어
English: I bought some of the stuff that famous people on YouTube recommended.
Cat Hancheong!

Korean: 방송은 요즘에 금쪽같은 내새끼 본다 키키
English: The show is about my precious baby these days Kiki

Korean: 주로 뭘 키우는 거에 관심이 있구나?
English: What are you mainly interested in growing?
I guess you have a warm heart
? That's not it...
Am I just disillusioned with people?

Korean: 그리고 금쪽같은 내새끼는 알고리즘에 선택을 받아서 보게 됐는데 계속 보게 되네? 키키
English: And my precious baby was chosen by the algorithm and I keep watching it? Kiki
That's what interests me~

Korean: 나도 그런 거 보는 거 좋아해
English: I like seeing that kind of stuff too

Korean: 특히 애들은 예상이 안 됐었는데 그 방송 진짜 좋더라
English: Especially the kids, I didn't expect that, but that show was really good
There's a lot to learn
Right Kiki
If you look at it, the kids didn't do anything wrong...

Korean: 우리 고양이가 그렇게 된 것도 내 잘못인가? 키키
English: Is it my fault that my cat ended up like that? Kiki

Korean: 나 고양이를 부탁해라고 동물 관련도 보거든 키키
English: I also watch animal related stuff like Please Take Care of My Cat Kiki
Oh, there's a program like that too

Korean: 근데 동물 키우는 것도 진짜 관심과 애정 그리고 스킬이 필요해
English: But raising animals also requires real interest, affection, and skill.
Seriously, not just anyone can raise it~
I think it would be good to learn it

Korean: 그니까 신기한 프로그램 되게 많아 키키
English: So there are so many interesting programs Kiki

Korean: 이상한 프로도 많고  제일 짜증나는 프로는 뭐였어? 키키
English: There are a lot of weird pros, what was the most annoying pro? Kiki

Korean: 제목은 모르겠고 일반 남녀든 연예인이든 그 데이트 같은 거 하는 프로그램
English: I don't know the title, but it's a program where ordinary men and women, as well as celebrities, go on dates.

Korean: 아 맞아 그 짝? 짝 아니야? 키키
English: Oh right, that's the pair? Or is it not the pair? Kiki

Korean: 근데 또 그 옛날 연애편지나 엑스맨은 재밌다?
English: But aren't those old love letters and X-Men fun?
Isn't it weird Kiki?
I think I've seen it that far

Korean: 근데 그 후에는 남녀 연애는 그냥 그들끼리 알아서 하도록 놔뒀으면 하는 바람이 있어
English: But after that, I hope that men and women will just be left to figure out their own relationships.

Korean: 다 연기 같아서 진실성이 없는 거 같아
English: It all seems like acting and I feel like it lacks sincerity.
Isn't that too liberating?
Oh, I remembered
We're married, right? Haha

Korean: 맞아 장미산장, 짝, 우결, 요즘에 제이티비씨나 티브이엔에서도 그런 프로그램 되게 많이 했어~
English: That's right, Jangmisanjang, Jjak, Woogyul, these days JTBC and TVN have been doing a lot of programs like that~

Korean: 언니는 영화가 더 좋아 만화가 더 좋아?
English: Sister, do you like movies better or comics better?
Cartoon~ Kiki

Korean: 사실 영화보다는 드라마를 좋아하는 편이고 둘 중에는 만화가 더 좋네 지금은
English: Actually, I like dramas more than movies, and between the two, I like comics better now.

Korean: 오~ 막 투니버스에서 하던 그런  만화?
English: Oh~ Is that the kind of cartoon they used to do on Tooniverse?

Korean: 응~ 좋아하는 만화가 따로 있기는 함 키키
English: Yeah~ I do have a favorite cartoon, Kiki

Korean: 짱구 명탐정 코난 비룡 요런 옛날 것들~
English: Crayon Shin-chan, Detective Conan, Hiryu, old stuff like that~
What do you like?
Oh, I think I know what it is

Korean: 음 나도  지금은  만화가 더 좋은 거 같아
English: Yeah, I think I like comics better now too
Comics from back then!

Korean: 알지 디지몬 부르고 하던 거 있잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: You know, there was this thing where they used to call Digimon ㅜㅜ
I miss you
I'm from the Pokemon generation Kiki

Korean: 아 키키 근데 나도  포켓몬 세대긴 해
English: Ah Kiki but I'm also from the Pokemon generation
There probably won't be a generation without Pokemon.
I've been playing Pokemon for so long, Kiki
My favorite character was a turtle...
My sister is Kiki

Korean: 나 지금 생각하려고 그 주제가 노래 속으로 부르고 있어~
English: I'm thinking about it now and I'm singing that theme song~

Korean: 아 주제가 그 피카츄 라이츄 꼬부기 그거?
English: Oh, the theme song is that Pikachu, Raichu, and Squirtle?
Does that song sound sad when you listen to it now?

Korean: 맞아 그 노래 근데 왜 슬퍼?
English: Yeah that song but why is it sad?
Aren't you sad?

Korean: 아 그건 디지몬인가 안녕 디지몬... 네 꿈을 꾸면서 잠이 들래.. 막 이랬던 거 같은데
English: Oh, is that Digimon? Hello Digimon... I'm going to sleep while dreaming of you... I think it was something like that

Korean: 슬픈가... 아 그때는 어렸는데 생각하니까 슬프긴 하다
English: Are you sad?... Oh, I was young back then, but when I think about it, it's sad
I also like Cardcaptor Sakura's theme song~

Korean: 근데 지금 생각하니까 카드 캡처 체리 주제곡이 슬프네~
English: But now that I think about it, the Card Capture Cherry theme song is sad~

Korean: 만날 수 없어 만나고 싶은데 그런 슬픈 기분인 걸~ 이렇게 시작하는 그 노래
English: I can't meet you, I want to meet you, but it's such a sad feeling~ That song starts like this
Oh my goodness, I admit it Kiki

Korean: 카드 캡터 체리는 못 참지 키키
English: Cardcaptor Sakura can't stand it Kiki

Korean: 나 진짜 그 오빠에  진심이었다 사랑한다
English: I really really loved that guy

Korean: 누구 설마 내가 생각하는 오빠는 아니지?
English: Who are you? You're not the brother I'm thinking of, are you?

Korean: 그 오빠는 내 거야~ 체리 오빠
English: That guy is mine~ Cherry guy
Cherry oppa, right? Cheonmyeong oppa?
No, Cheonmyeong Oppa is too much of a fantasy
It has to be somewhat realistic

Korean: 근데 아침밥 해주는 오빠라니 오빠 있는 입장에서 어때 말이 돼?  키키
English: But what do you think about having an older brother who makes breakfast for you? Kiki

Korean: 천명 오빠는 그 체리가 좋아하는 오빠고 나중에 마법 쓰는 인물..
English: Cheonmyeong Oppa is the oppa that Cherry likes and later becomes a magician..

Korean: 체리 친오빠 도근 오빠인가? 맞나? 그 사람이 좋다구~
English: Cherry's real older brother, is that Dogun's older brother? Is that right? I like that guy~

Korean: 우리 오빠 해달라고 하면 아침밥 해준다
English: My brother will make breakfast if I ask him to.
What did you eat for lunch today?

Korean: 음식 딱히 생각이 안 나서 김밥 집 갔어요.
English: I couldn't think of anything to eat, so I went to a kimbap restaurant.
What did you eat, sister?
I ate the sandwich I bought this morning.
The menu selection is okay Kiki
I suddenly want a sandwich too

Korean: 지하철 역에 있는 빵집이 맛있더라고요 키키
English: The bakery in the subway station was delicious, Kiki

Korean: 아아 아침에 빵 냄새 진동 하잖아요 키키
English: Ah, the smell of bread in the morning vibrates Kiki

Korean: 오늘은 샌드위치가 다양해서 고민 많이 했어요 키키
English: Today, I had a hard time deciding because there were so many sandwiches. Kiki

Korean: 거기 맛집인 거 같아요 지하철 맛집 키키
English: I think it's a good restaurant there. Subway restaurant Kiki

Korean: 퇴근할 때 세일 하는 거 사고 싶은 마음
English: I want to buy something on sale when I get off work
Yes, they are having a sale after work hours.

Korean: 오늘 갈 때 한번 봐야지 키키
English: I have to see Kiki when I go today
What did you have for dessert?

Korean: 후식은 커피 마시려고 했는데 산책하다 보니 시간이 다가서 못 마셨어요...
English: I was planning to have coffee for dessert, but as I was walking around, I ran out of time and couldn't drink it...

Korean: 키키 커피는 늘 함께 하는 거 같아요.
English: Kiki Coffee seems to always be with me.
I'll continue drinking what I used to drink in the morning.

Korean: 아침에 사온 커피를 너무 빨리 마셨나 봐요 키키
English: I think I drank the coffee I bought this morning too quickly, Kiki.
Ah, you finished eating, Kiki
I'm still here Kiki
Ah, I envy Kiki

Korean: 저는 카누를 타야 되나 말아야 하나.
English: I'm debating whether I should go canoeing or not.

Korean: 카누 타서 또 충전 해야죠 오후에!
English: I need to recharge again by canoeing in the afternoon!

Korean: 요즘 집꾸미기 블로그 나 정보들이 많은 거 같아요!
English: It seems like there are a lot of blogs and information about home decorating these days!

Korean: 네 저도 인테리어 관심 생겨서 SNS로 보는데 다들 잘 꾸며 놓더라고요 키키
English: Yes, I also became interested in interior design, so I looked at SNS and everyone decorated it well. Kiki

Korean: 태그까지 걸어서 해주니까 구경하기도 편하고 키키
English: It's easy to look around because you can even hang tags.
Aren't the prices all listed?

Korean: 맞아요! 요즘 침대를 계속 보고 있는 거 같아요.
English: Yeah! I feel like I've been looking at the bed a lot lately.

Korean: 오 매트리스랑 요즘 프레임도 다양하던데 둘 다 보고 있어요?
English: Oh, there are a lot of mattresses and frames these days. Are you looking at both?

Korean: 집이 원룸이어서 벙커 침대를 찾아보고 있어요 키키
English: I'm looking for a bunk bed because my house is a studio apartment. Kiki

Korean: 아 벙커 침대! 뭔가 괜찮을 거 같아요 공간 활용되고
English: Ah, the bunk bed! I think it would be nice to utilize the space.

Korean: 성인이 쓰는 거는 좀 튼튼해야 할 거 찾아보고 있는데 해외 배송이...
English: I'm looking for something that's a bit more sturdy for adults to use, but overseas shipping...

Korean: 해외 배송 키키 오래 걸리기도 하고 ㅠㅠ
English: Overseas shipping takes a long time ㅠㅠ
Is the house a monthly rent or a deposit?
It's a monthly rental now, but it's Kiki's apartment.
Oh apartment!

Korean: 저도 월세 ㅠㅠ 요즘 집값 장난 아니라 정말 서울은
English: I also pay rent ㅠㅠ These days, the price of houses in Seoul is no joke

Korean: 그나마 외곽이라 평수에 비해 월세가 저렴한 거 같아요.
English: Since it's on the outskirts, I think the monthly rent is cheaper compared to the area.
Ah, I think it would be good to get a little bit into it like that.

Korean: 저도 다음에 집 구할 때는 좀 더 부동산을 알아봐야겠어요.
English: Next time I'm looking for a house, I'll have to look into real estate more.

Korean: 요즘 어플 잘 되어 있어서 많이 알아볼 수 있어서 좋더라고요.
English: These days, the app is so good that I can find out a lot of information.

Korean: 네네 근데 허위에 속음 안 돼요.
English: Yes, yes, but don't be fooled by lies.

Korean: 요즘 주말에 차 너무 막히지 않아요?
English: Aren't the cars really congested on the weekends these days?
Oh, is there a lot of traffic?
I only use the subway...

Korean: 관광지랑 연결되어 있는 도로에 들어서면 거의 주차장이에요...
English: When you enter the road connected to the tourist site, it is almost like a parking lot...

Korean: 헐 그 정도는 운전대 잡기 힘들잖아요.
English: Wow, it's hard to hold the steering wheel like that.
Do you have a car?
Yes yes I bought it used last year Kiki
I left Kiki at home
Hey Kiki

Korean: 그러면 다른 가족 분이 타시는 건가요?
English: Then, are other family members riding it?

Korean: 네 사촌 동생한테 잠시 맡겨두고 키키
English: I'll leave Kiki with your cousin for a while.
I think public transportation is the best here.

Korean: 맞아요... 저도 있기만 있지 집에 세워두고 지하철로 출퇴근 키키
English: That's right... I also have it at home, so I leave it at home and commute to work by subway.

Korean: 키키 지하철이 진짜 어디든 다 가니까 버스도 더워서 기다리는 거 싫어요.
English: Kiki The subway really goes everywhere, so I hate waiting for the bus because it's hot.

Korean: 버스는 시간적 여유가 있을 때와 날씨가 좋을 때 키키
English: The bus runs whenever you have time and when the weather is good.

Korean: 아 진짜 그 선선할 때 이용하면 되겠는데요.
English: Oh, really, it would be good to use it when it's cool.

Korean: 창 밖 보면서 좀 멀리 돌아가도 좋은 거 같아요.
English: I think it would be a good idea to go a little further and look out the window.

Korean: 키키 창 밖을 괜히 많이 보게 돼요.
English: Kiki, you end up looking out the window a lot for no reason.

Korean: 버스 타면 직장까지는 거리가 멀어서 힘들겠어요
English: It would be difficult to take the bus to work because it's far away.

Korean: 버스는 진짜 엄두를 못 내겠어요. 정류장도 멀고 해서
English: I really can't think of a way to take the bus. The stop is far away.

Korean: 그렇죠 자차면 더 편하긴 한데 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, it's more convenient if you have your own car ㅠㅠ

Korean: 요즘에 코로나 때문에 회식은 아예 안 하는 거 같죠?
English: These days, it seems like people aren't having company dinners at all because of the coronavirus, right?
Yeah, yeah, that's just how the situation is these days.

Korean: 그리고 회식은 좀 안 해도 될 거 같은데 말이에요.
English: And I think we might not have to have company dinners.

Korean: 네네 저는 대부분 그런 거 같아요?

Korean: 먹는 것도 요즘 다 온라인으로 잘 되어 있잖아요.
English: Even eating is done online these days.
Isn't there a difference in price?

Korean: 맞아요!  폰으로 많이 보다보니까 앱으로 구매하면 더 싼 가격에 살 수 있고 쿠폰도 많고
English: That's right! I've been looking at it a lot on my phone, so I think you can buy it at a cheaper price if you buy it through the app, and there are a lot of coupons.
That's right, those coupons are secretly quite useful!

Korean: 온라인으로 구매하면 훨씬 혜택이 많은 곳도 있어서 정보 줍줍 하는 게 아주 중요 키키
English: There are places where you can get a lot more benefits if you buy online, so it's very important to gather information.

Korean: SNS에도 링크 공유되어서 저렴하게 살 수 있고 이득이 많은 거 같아요.
English: It seems like you can buy it cheaply and get a lot of benefits because the link is shared on SNS.

Korean: 맞아요  신선하게 다음날 바로 받을 수 있는 새벽 배송... 최고 키키
English: Yes, fresh, next day delivery... the best Kiki
They arrived at dawn.

Korean: 아 그 12시 전에만 주문하면 아침 7시 전에 보내주는 그거죠?
English: Oh, so if I order before 12 o'clock, it will be delivered before 7 in the morning?

Korean: 네네! 저 11시 전에 주문했는데 새벽 2시에 도착했다고 카톡 왔어요... 대박
English: Yes yes! I ordered before 11am and got a KakaoTalk message saying it arrived at 2am... Awesome

Korean: 와 진짜 쇼핑에 있어서 배송이 빠른 건 소비자 입장에서는 진짜 좋은 거 같아요!
English: Wow, when it comes to shopping, fast delivery is a really good thing for consumers!

Korean: 진짜 그 정도 서비스면 만족 할만 하죠 키키
English: If you get that level of service, you'll be satisfied, Kiki
The price is also satisfactory!
Don't you also choose by looking at the trading volume?

Korean: 맞아요! 후기도 보는데 제일 먼저 보는 건 거래량이나 판매량!
English: That's right! I look at reviews, but the first thing I look at is the transaction volume or sales volume!

Korean: 저도요! 음식 배달 시킬 때도 요즘은 리뷰보다는 주문 많은 순으로 보게 돼요.
English: Me too! These days, when I order food delivery, I look at the order of the number of orders rather than the reviews.

Korean: 리뷰를 저도 안 적을 때가 많아서 분명 맛있었는데 귀찮거나 까먹어서 키키
English: I don't write reviews often, so it was definitely delicious, but I was lazy and forgot, so I wrote Kiki.
Oh me too...

Korean: 진짜 기분 좋을 때는 남기는 편이에요 키키
English: When I'm really feeling good, I tend to leave it Kiki

Korean: 쇼핑몰에서 늘 고민하다가 끌 때도 많고
English: I often hesitate at the shopping mall and end up choosing

Korean: 그거 사려고 고민하다 지쳐서 안 사는 된다는... 안 샀지만 산 거 같은 기분 키키
English: I got tired of thinking about buying it so I didn't buy it... I didn't buy it but it felt like I bought it Kiki

Korean: 키키  저도 그럴 때 많은데 공감돼요
English: Kiki, I feel that way a lot too, I can relate

English: I think I also often repeat one song these days.

Korean: 그 만화 중에 101마리 강아지 그거 영화로 나오지 않았어요?
English: Among those cartoons, wasn't that 101 Puppies that was made into a movie?
Oh, that's Cruella, right?
I really wanted to see that

Korean: 저는 처음에 뭔가 싶다가 헤어 스타일보고 알았어요 키키
English: At first I was like what is this, but then I saw the hairstyle and I knew it was Kiki
Kiki, you're really a perfect match

Korean: 포스터 보니까 너무 보고 싶은 비주얼 배우만 봐도
English: Looking at the poster, I really want to see the visuals of the actors

Korean: 그 여자 배우 스파이더맨에도 나왔던 배우죠?
English: That female actress was also in Spiderman, right?
Ah, I think that's right...
I'm not sure, but Kiki
Do you like musical movies?

Korean: 오! 음악 영화 중에 드림걸즈 좋아해요 키키
English: Oh! Among the music movies, I like Dreamgirls. Kiki

Korean: 오오 재밌었는데 OST가 진짜 좋은 게 많은 거 같아요 영화들은
English: Oh, it was fun, I think there are a lot of movies with really good OSTs
That's right~
That Begin Again?
That sounds good too!

Korean: 네 ㅠㅠ 플레이리스트에 아직도 있어서 매일 들어요.
English: Yesㅠㅠ It's still on my playlist so I listen to it every day.
So good!

Korean: OST 명곡이 더 오래 기억에 남는 거 같아요.
English: I think OST songs are more memorable.
It reminds me of a scene from the movie, but Kiki
that's right!

Korean: 라라랜드처럼 그 장면이 확실히 임팩트 있게
English: That scene definitely had an impact, like in La La Land.

Korean: 그 저녁에 키로 자동차 찾다가 추는 거!
English: That evening I was looking for a car with keys!
Ah, I want to see you again
How many times have I seen this! Kiki

Korean: 봐도 봐도 질리지가 않는 거 같아요.
English: I don't think I'll ever get tired of watching it.
I want to see it again in the theater!
I wish they would re-release those movies!
What are you going to eat for lunch today?
Kiki, I'm going to eat bibimbap today
Have you decided?

Korean: 나는 오늘 도시락 먹을 거야 김밥!
English: I'm going to eat kimbap for lunch today!
Oh, Kimbap! What kind of Kimbap is it?
I'm having tuna kimbap today!
Are you near a bibimbap restaurant?
Oh tuna kimbap!

Korean: 음 멀지 않아 여기서 한 7~8분 걸릴걸 키키
English: Um, it's not far, maybe 7 or 8 minutes from here Kiki

Korean: 오늘은 김밥 먹고 휴게실에서 쉬는 거야?
English: Are you going to eat kimbap and rest in the break room today?

Korean: 응! 오늘은 너무 더워서 나가기가 싫어 키키
English: Yeah! It's too hot today, I don't want to go out Kiki
Are you going to drink coffee too?
Yeah, it's been so hot since this morning!
I'm thinking about coffee Kiki

Korean: 너는 오후에 음료 뭐 마실 거야?
English: What are you going to drink this afternoon?
Yeah, I'm going to drink iced americano!

Korean: 그래야 오후에 안 졸 거 같아 키키
English: I think I won't fall asleep in the afternoon Kiki
Do you like coffee?
I don't feel sleepy if I eat in the afternoon ㅠ

Korean: 나는 카페인이 안 맞아서 커피 못 먹어 ㅠ
English: I can't drink coffee because caffeine doesn't suit me ㅠ

Korean: 커피 향은 좋은데 먹으면 심장이 두근두근해
English: The coffee smells good, but my heart starts pounding when I drink it.
Oh, coffee doesn't suit you!

Korean: 카페인 안 맞는 사람 은근히 있더라고
English: There are quite a few people who don't tolerate caffeine.

Korean: 맞아 커피 향은 좋은데 못 먹어서 아쉬워 ㅠ
English: Yes, the coffee smells good, but it's a shame I can't drink it ㅠ

Korean: 커피 어떻게 내리는지에 따라 맛이 다르다며?
English: They say that coffee tastes different depending on how you make it?

Korean: 응 맞아 커피마다 향도 다르고 맛도 달라서 신기해!
English: Yeah, that's right. It's amazing how each coffee has a different scent and taste!

Korean: 그럼 커피 말고 좋아하는 음료 있어?
English: Then, do you have a favorite drink other than coffee?

Korean: 오 나는 초코 음료나 말차 과일 음료도 좋고 키키
English: Oh I like chocolate drinks and matcha fruit drinks too Kiki

Korean: 커피는 어디 거 제일 자주 먹어?
English: Where do you drink coffee most often?

Korean: 요즘은 회사 근처에 텐퍼센트 자주 가! 맛있고 저렴해서!
English: These days, I often go to Ten Percent near my company! It's delicious and cheap!
I recommend you go there next time too!
Oh, right there, I got it!

Korean: 너는 집 구할 때 어떤 점을 제일 많이 고려해?
English: What do you consider most when looking for a house?

Korean: 음 역세권인지, 층수가 높은지, 화장실이 깨끗한지 봐 키키
English: Well, check if it's near a subway station, if it's on a high floor, and if the bathroom is clean.
What do you see?

Korean: 응 나는 화장실을 제일 먼저 봐!
English: Yeah, I'll check the bathroom first!

Korean: 아무래도 화장실이 깨끗하면 전체적으로 깨끗한 집이라는 느낌이 들더라고 키키
English: Kiki: I think that if the bathroom is clean, the house as a whole feels clean.
What type of house do you live in?
Yeah I totally agree Kiki

Korean: 음 나중에는 주택 살고 싶어 조용하게 살고 싶어 키키
English: Well, later on I want to live in a house and live quietly Kiki
What kind of house do you want to live in?

Korean: 나는 조용한 동네에서 아파트 살고 싶어 키키
English: I want to live in an apartment in a quiet neighborhood Kiki

Korean: 우리 본가가 주택인데 관리하기 너무 힘들더라
English: My main home is a house, but it's too hard to manage.
Oh, right.
They say you have to be diligent to buy a house...Kiki

Korean: 조용한 아파트가 좋은 선택일 수 있겠다 키키
English: A quiet apartment might be a good choice Kiki
Did you always live in a house when you were young?

Korean: 응 어릴 때부터 자취하기 전까지는 계속 주택 살았었어!
English: Yeah, I lived in a house ever since I was little and before I started living on my own!
And the house was full of bugs.
Oh, a bug...ㅠ

Korean: 근데 주택가가 조용한 건 좋지? 키키
English: But is it good that the residential area is quiet? Kiki
Yeah, that's right!
I like it when the house is quiet!

Korean: 부지런하기만 하면 살기 좋을 거 같아!
English: I think life will be good if I just work hard!
Have you ever lived in a house?

Korean: 응 나 어릴 때 할머니네에서 살았던 적 있어서 그때 주택 살아봤어 키키
English: Yeah, I lived at my grandmother's house when I was little, so I lived in a house at that time Kiki

Korean: 주택 살면 엘베 안 기다리고 바로 나가면 되니까 좋은 거 같아 지금 생각해 보면 키키
English: If you live in a house, it's good because you don't have to wait for the elevator and you can go out right away. Thinking about it now, Kiki

Korean: 맞아 그거는 진짜 좋은 거 같아 키키
English: Yeah, that sounds really good, Kiki

Korean: 너는 주택 살게 되면 해보고 싶은 거 있어?
English: Is there anything you want to try when you buy a house?

Korean: 나는 테라스나 마당 있는 주택에 살게 되면 바람 쐬고 싶을 때 나가서 바람도 쐬고 가만히 앉아서 날씨 구경도 하고 싶어 키키
English: If I live in a house with a terrace or yard, I want to go out and get some fresh air and sit still and watch the weather.

Korean: 실제 주택 살면 어때? 날씨 구경 이런 거
English: What's it like to live in a real house? Check the weather and stuff

Korean: 해도 잘 들어오고 특히 비 오는 날 분위기가 좋아!
English: It comes in well and the atmosphere is especially good on rainy days!

Korean: 오 좋다! 생각만 해도 여유롭다 키키
English: Oh good! Just thinking about it makes me feel relaxed Kiki

Korean: 맞아 다음에 주택에서 살게 되면 초대해줘!
English: Yes, invite me next time you live in a house!
Yeah, okay, good!
Do you use public transportation a lot?

Korean: 응응 차가 없어서 대중교통을 많이 타 키키
English: Yeah, I don't have a car, so I use public transportation a lot.
you?
Yeah me too!
Do you usually take the subway or the bus?

Korean: 버스 타는 걸 더 좋아하는데 출퇴근 때만 지하철 타 키키
English: I prefer taking the bus, but I only take the subway when I'm commuting to and from work.

Korean: 너는 버스 같은 거 탔을 때 멀미는 없어?
English: Don't you get motion sickness when you ride a bus or something?
Yeah! I don't get motion sickness!

Korean: 너는 배나 비행기 이런 것도 잘 타는 편이야?
English: Are you good at riding boats or planes?
It's really nice not to have motion sickness...

Korean: 비행기는 잘 타는데 배는 쉽지 않아.
English: I'm good at flying, but it's not easy to ride a boat.
how about you?

Korean: 응 나는 오히려 배 타는 거 좋아해!
English: Yeah, I rather like riding a boat!

Korean: 뭔가 엄청 시원한 기분이 들어서 키키
English: I feel so cool, Kiki

Korean: 너는 나중에 사고 싶은 차 있어?
English: Do you have a car you want to buy later?
It's cool outside! Kiki
I want to buy a Volvo later!
you?
Oh Volvo is great!
I'm a matte Benz!
I saw the commercial and it was so cool and pretty!

Korean: 오 벤츠 요즘 새로 나온 거야?
English: Oh, is that Benz new?
Yeah, I guess so
It looks better because it's matte Kiki

Korean: 너 혹시 자전거 탈 줄 알아?
English: Do you know how to ride a bike?
Yeah ride a bike Kiki
Are you good at riding?

Korean: 응 나도 잘 타지는 않는데 그래도 타는 거 좋아해!
English: Yeah, I'm not very good at riding either, but I still like riding!
Want to go to the Han River and ride a bike next time?
Oh yeah good! Kiki
How about going around October?
Okay, let's go in October!
Yeah, yeah, good!
Was there a part-time job you wanted to try?
I am Cafe Alba Kiki
What do you have?

Korean: 나는 겨울에 스키장 알바 해보고 싶었어 키키
English: I wanted to try working at a ski resort in the winter Kiki
Why did you want to try opening a cafe?

Korean: 카페 알바 뭔가 분위기도 그렇고 여유롭고 만드는 것도 재미있을 것 같았어 키키
English: Cafe Alba, the atmosphere was good and it seemed like it would be fun to make it. Kiki
Why did you want to work at a ski resort?

Korean: 그냥 겨울에만 할 수 있고 보통 대학생 때 많이 해본다고 해서 해보고 싶었어요!
English: I just wanted to try it because I heard that it can only be done in the winter and that it's something that college students usually do a lot!
And doesn't that sound fun?
Yeah right Kiki

Korean: 방학 때 딱 하기 좋은 거 같아 알바 끝나고 스키도 타고! 아르바이트 많이 해봤어?
English: I think it's a good thing to do during the vacation. After work, go skiing! Have you done a lot of part-time jobs?

Korean: 응 대학 다닐 때는 많이 해봤었어!
English: Yeah, I did it a lot when I was in college!
you?
I haven't tried many.

Korean: 그래서 지금 생각해보면  조금 아쉬워. 키키
English: So now that I think about it, I feel a little sorry. Kiki

Korean: 요즘은  아르바이트 구하기 어렵겠다 코로나 때문에
English: It's hard to find a part-time job these days because of Corona.

Korean: 맞아 요즘은 코로나 때문에 아르바이트 구하기 힘들다고 하더라고
English: That's right. I heard that it's hard to find a part-time job these days because of the coronavirus.
How is going to work these days?
I'm used to the company, it's routine Kiki
Is there anything difficult about working at the company?

Korean: 응 아직도 아침에 일어나는 게 제일 힘든 거 같아 키키
English: Yeah, I still think waking up in the morning is the hardest part, Kiki.
you?

Korean: 아 그거는 나도 아직 힘들다 키키
English: Ah, that's still hard for me too Kiki

Korean: 적응이 안 돼 그거는 회사 사람들은 몇 명 정도 돼?
English: I can't adapt. How many people are there in that company?

Korean: 한 30명 정도 되는 거 같아 키키
English: I think there are about 30 people Kiki
How is your company?
I think we're similar too Kiki

Korean: 너무 많지도 않고 적지도 않고 딱 좋아
English: Not too much, not too little, just right
thank god!
Even if we're tired, let's fight!
Yeah, you too, fighting!

Korean: 코로나 때문에 군대 휴가 통제 한대!
English: Military leave restrictions due to Corona!
what do you think about it?

Korean: 아무래도 집단 생활 하는 곳이니까 어쩔 수 없는 조치인 것 같으면서도 좀 안타까워. ㅠ
English: I guess it's an inevitable measure since it's a place where people live in groups, but it's also a bit disappointing. ㅠ

Korean: 입대하고 한번도 못 나온 군인도 있대
English: They say there are soldiers who enlisted and never came out.
I'm really upset ㅠㅠ
I bet you're really looking forward to your vacation!
Have you ever tried military food?
Something like a military base!
Yeah, no
I haven't tried it.
Have you tried it?

Korean: 군대 PX에서 파는 전투 식량 같은 거 먹어본 적 있어!
English: Have you ever eaten something like the combat rations sold at the military PX?
It was amazing

Korean: 요즘은 군대 프로그램이 인기가 많아서 그런 것도 쉽게 구할 수 있는 거 같아!
English: These days, military programs are so popular that it seems like they're easy to find!
Oh, how did it taste?

Korean: 응 생각보다 괜찮기는 했는데 맛 보다 뭔가 신기했어!
English: Yeah, it was better than I thought, but the taste was a bit strange!

Korean: 요즘 강철부대라는 예능 인기 많던데 본 적 있어?
English: There's a popular variety show called Steel Troops these days. Have you seen it?
I've only heard of it!
Are you training like a real man?

Korean: 여러 부대원 대표들이 나와서 경쟁하는 프로그램이래!
English: It's a program where representatives from various units come out and compete!

Korean: 진짜사나이 이후로 군대 프로그램이 많아 지는 거 같아서 신기해!
English: It's interesting that there seem to be a lot of military programs after Real Man!

Korean: 아 맞아 유튜브에도 군인 컨셉으로 하는 그런 것도  있던 것 같은데 키키
English: Oh right, I think there was something with a military concept on YouTube too, Kiki

Korean: 맞아 요즘 되게 다양하게 많이 나오는 거 같아!
English: Yeah, I think there are a lot of different ones coming out these days!

Korean: 이렇게 인기 많아졌으니까 군인 처우도 좋아져야 할 텐데!
English: Now that it's become so popular, the treatment of soldiers should also improve!
At least give me some food.

Korean: 그나마 복무 기간 줄어서 부담은 덜하겠지?
English: The burden will be less since the service period has been shortened, right?
Maybe so?

Korean: 그래도 요즘은 핸드폰도 쓸 수 있다고 하고 점점 좋아지는 거 같아서 다행이야
English: But these days, I'm glad that it's getting better and better because they say you can use your cell phone too.
right?
Yeah, that's right

Korean: 그나마 휴대폰 쓸 수 있으니까 휴가 못 나가는 아쉬움을 좀 덜 수 있을 것 같아.
English: I think I can somewhat lessen my regret about not being able to go on vacation since I can at least use my cell phone.

Korean: 맞아 앞으로 점점 더 군인에 대한 대우가 좋아졌으면 좋겠다!
English: Yes, I hope that the treatment of soldiers will get better and better in the future!
Yeah, I hope so.

Korean: 너는 어렸을 때 학원 다녀본 적 있어?
English: Did you ever go to an academy when you were young?
Yeah, yeah, I went to a comprehensive academy. Kiki
Where have you been?
I've only ever played the piano! Kiki
Is there an academy you wanted to go to?

Korean: 어릴 때는 발레 학원 다녀보고 싶었는데 못 다녔어. 키키
English: When I was young, I wanted to go to ballet school, but I couldn't. Kiki
Is there an academy you wanted to go to?
Yeah, I want to learn Aikido!

Korean: 동네에 합기도 학원이 있었는데 지나갈 때 마다 부러웠어 키키
English: There was a Hapkido school in my neighborhood, and I was envious every time I passed by Kiki

Korean: 오 합기도 우리 어릴 때 합기도랑 태권도 많이 다니던데 보면  키키
English: Oh, Hapkido. When I was young, I did Hapkido and Taekwondo a lot. If you look at it, Kiki
Is Hapkido like Kendo?

Korean: 약간 태권도랑 비슷한 거 같았는데 합기도복이 검은색이라서 멋있어 보였어! 키키
English: It looked a bit similar to Taekwondo, but the Hapkido uniform was black, so it looked cool! Kiki

Korean: 혹시 드라마 중에 스카이 캐슬 본 적 있어? 사교육 얘기인데 엄청나더라
English: Have you ever seen the drama Sky Castle? It's about private education and it's amazing.

Korean: 아 아니 스카이 캐슬 안 봤어
English: Oh no, I haven't seen Sky Castle

Korean: 근데 워낙 유명해서 여기저기 나와서 내용은 대충 알아!
English: But it's so famous that it appears everywhere, so I know the general content!

Korean: 근데 그런 얘기 실제로 있을 것 같아
English: But I think that kind of story actually happens
That's right!
They say that Gangnam area in particular is amazing.

Korean: 내가 아는 분도 학원 강사인데 학구열이 엄청 나다고 하더라
English: I know someone who is a private academy instructor and he said he has a great passion for learning.

Korean: 강남에 8학군이라고 그러나 그거 있지 않았나? 학구열 엄청난 곳
English: There is a school district called 8 in Gangnam, but isn't that there? It's a place with a lot of enthusiasm for school.
Yes! It will be in Gangnam.

Korean: 우리나라 사교육 문제 심각한 거 같아
English: I think our country's private education problem is serious.

Korean: 요즘은 코로나 때문에 온라인 강의라서 교육 격차가 더 심해지고 있대!
English: These days, because of the coronavirus, classes are being held online, so the educational gap is getting worse!
Yeah, I heard that too.

Korean: 학교 못 가니까  다 사교육으로 몰린다던데
English: They say that since they can't go to school, they're all being forced into private education.
That's what I'm saying

Korean: 우리나라 교육 문제 빨리 해결책이 나와야 할 텐데
English: We need to find a solution to our country's education problem quickly.

Korean: 맞아 근데 당분간은 아마 사교육이 줄어들기는 힘들지 않을까 싶네
English: That's right, but I don't think private education will decrease for the time being.
That's what I'm saying
I hope this gets resolved quickly and in a good way!
Yeah, that would be great.
Since I live alone, I miss my family a lot!
Do you see each other often?

Korean: 아니 자주는 못 받고 그래도  2주에 한 번 정도는 봤어 키키
English: No, I don't get it often, but I still see Kiki once every two weeks.
how about you?

Korean: 나는 집이 멀어서 거의 명절에만 보는 편이야!
English: I live far away, so I only see him on holidays!

Korean: 그래서 대신에 전화를 자주 해! 키키
English: So instead, call often! Kiki
Do you video call often? Kiki

Korean: 아니 영상 통화는 가끔 강아지 보여 달라고 할 때만 해 키키
English: No, I only do video calls occasionally when I want to see my dog Kiki

Korean: 그래도 떨어져 사니까 사이가 좋아지는 거 같지 않아?
English: But don't you think our relationship is getting better because we live apart?

Korean: 맞아 약간 그런 것도 있어 키키
English: Yeah, that's a bit like that Kiki

Korean: 애틋한 것도 있고  너도 그래? 키키
English: It's also sad, you too? Kiki

Korean: 응 나도 같이 지낼 때는 사소한 걸로도 싸웠는데 떨어져 있으니까 사이가 좋아지는 거 같아 키키
English: Yeah, when we were together, we fought over trivial things, but now that we're apart, I think we're getting along better, Kiki.

Korean: 너는 다시 가족들이랑 같이 살 생각 있어?
English: Do you plan on living with your family again?

Korean: 집 근처에서 일하게 되면 다시 같이 살 것 같아
English: If I work near my house, I think we'll live together again

Korean: 근데 한 번 혼자 살아보니까 혼자 있는 게 편하다 키키
English: But once I lived alone, I felt comfortable being alone Kiki
you?
Yeah me too Kiki

Korean: 가족들이 보고 싶지만 혼자 사는 게 너무 편하고 좋아 키키
English: I miss my family but I like living alone so much and it's comfortable Kiki

Korean: 나중에는 같은 집 말고 근처에서 살고 싶어 키키
English: Later on, I want to live nearby, not in the same house.
Kiki that's okay too

Korean: 근데 엄마가 서운해 하시지 않아 그러면?
English: But what if your mom isn't upset?

Korean: 가끔 서운해하시기는 하는데 엄마도 이제 익숙하신가 봐
English: Mom gets upset sometimes, but I think she's used to it now.

Korean: 내가 전화하면 약간 귀찮아하시면서 바쁘다고 끊으라고 하시더라 키키
English: When I call, Kiki, you seem a little annoyed and tell me to hang up because you're busy.
Kiki, it was like that at first, but it's getting better.

Korean: 나도 엄마랑 전화하면 거의 안부만 묻고 금방 끊게 되더라
English: When I talk to my mom on the phone, I just ask how she's doing and then hang up right away.

Korean: 시간 지나면 다 그렇게 되나 봐! 키키
English: I guess time passes and everything becomes like that! Kiki

Korean: 근데 시간이 지날수록 가족이 건강한 게 최고인 거 같아
English: But as time goes by, I think it's best for the family to be healthy

Korean: 맞아 밖에 나와 있으니까 건강이 제일 걱정 돼!
English: That's right, since I'm outside, I'm most worried about my health!
I feel at ease when my parents are healthy.
Yeah, I think that's true

Korean: 우리도 건강 잘 챙기고 부모님 잘 살펴 드리자!
English: Let's take care of our health and take good care of our parents!
Yeah, let's do that!

Korean: 너는 결혼 몇 살에 하고 싶어?
English: At what age do you want to get married?

Korean: 나는 직장만 안정적이라면 35살 전에 하고 싶어 키키
English: I want to do it before I turn 35, as long as I have a stable job.
you?
I wanted to do it when I was over 35, around 37!
Is there any special reason?

Korean: 지금 혼자 사는 게 편해서 친구들이랑도 더 놀고 되도록 늦게 하고 싶기는 한데 40살 전에는 하고 싶어서 키키
English: I'm comfortable living alone now, so I want to hang out with my friends more and do it later if possible, but I want to do it before I turn 40.

Korean: 너도 요즘 친구들 결혼식 많이 하지?
English: Do you have a lot of friends getting married these days?

Korean: 아 그치 결혼하면 이 생활은 또 할 수가 없으니까!
English: Oh, right, I can't live like this once I get married!

Korean: 응 친구들 결혼도 많이  하고 주변에서 하여튼 다들 가네 키키
English: Yeah, a lot of my friends are getting married and everyone around me is getting married.
Aren't you like that too?
Yeah right Kiki

Korean: 나도 이제 결혼한 친구들 많아서 결혼식 자주 가는데 요즘 코로나 때문에 결혼식도 힘들다고 하더라고
English: I have a lot of friends who are married now, so I often go to weddings, but I heard that these days, it's difficult to get married because of the coronavirus.

Korean: 맞아 요즘 결혼식은 진짜 예전에는 상상할 수 없던 풍경이야
English: That's right, weddings these days are a sight that was unimaginable in the past.

Korean: 마스크 쓰고 사진 찍고 연회장도 그렇고
English: Wearing a mask and taking pictures, and even at the banquet hall
Yes, that's right!

Korean: 그래서 요즘은 더 간소하게 하는 추세인가 봐!
English: So I guess the trend these days is to simplify things!
Is anyone in your family married?

Korean: 응 사촌 동생들도 결혼하고 거의 반은 했어 키키
English: Yeah my cousins are married too and almost half of them are Kiki
you?

Korean: 나도 이제 절반은 거의 결혼한 거 같아 키키
English: I feel like I'm almost half married now Kiki
Don't your parents pressure you to get married?

Korean: 응응 오히려 20대 후반에 잠깐 하셨다가 지금은 안 하셔 키키
English: Yeah, yeah, you did it for a while in your late 20s, but you don't do it anymore.
What did your parents say?

Korean: 응 나는 지금까지는 별 말씀 안 하셨는데 언니 결혼하고 나니까 갑자기 얘기하시기 시작하시더라고 키키
English: Yeah, I didn't say anything until now, but after my sister got married, she suddenly started talking. Kiki

Korean: 벌써 결혼 재촉 받을  나이가 된 거 같아서 슬퍼...
English: I'm sad because I feel like I'm already at an age where I should be getting married...

Korean: 맞아 결혼 되게 먼 얘기 같았는데 벌써 그 나이야... ㅠ
English: Right, marriage seemed like a distant dream, but I'm already that age... ㅠ

Korean: 갈 때 되면 다 가겠지 뭐 키키
English: When it's time to go, we'll all go, Kiki
don't cry
Okay Kiki

Korean: 우리 좋은 사람 만나서 진짜 가고 싶을 때 행복하게 가자!
English: Let's meet good people and go happily whenever we really want to!
Yeah, definitely do that!

Korean: 너는 동물 농장 본 적 있어?
English: Have you ever seen Animal Farm?
Yeah, I saw that in elementary school!

Korean: 그거는 보면  진짜 너무 불쌍한 동물 너무 많아 ㅠㅠ
English: When I look at it, there are so many animals that are so pitiful ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 ㅠㅠ 나는 요즘도 자주 보는 편인데 요즘에도 불쌍한 동물 많이 나와!
English: That's right ㅠㅠ I still see it often these days, and there are still a lot of pitiful animals!

Korean: 특히 반려견이었는데 버려져서 길거리에 떠도는 강아지들 많이  나오더라 ㅠㅠ
English: In particular, there are many dogs that were abandoned as companion dogs and end up wandering the streets ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 맞아 그거는 보면 유기견이나 떠돌이견 구조하는 거 많이 나오던데 ㅠ 상태가 너무 아파 보여 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh right, if you look at that, there are a lot of stories about rescuing abandoned or stray dogs ㅠ They look so sick ㅠㅠ
Have you ever seen a rescue?

Korean: 응 최근에 본 건 고속도로 졸음 쉼터에 버리고 가서 강아지가 주인 차랑 비슷한 차만 보면 달려가는 내용이었는데 너무 슬프더라
English: Yeah, the last thing I saw was a story about a dog that was abandoned at a highway rest stop and ran to a car that looked like its owner's car. It was so sad.

Korean: ㅠㅠ 주인은 그거 보면  어떤 생각할지 진짜 ㅠㅠ
English: ㅠㅠ I really wonder what the owner will think when he sees that ㅠㅠ

Korean: 유기견은 입양돼도 한동안은 후유증 때문에 적응하는 데 시간 좀 걸린다던데
English: They say that even if an abandoned dog is adopted, it takes some time for them to adjust because of the aftereffects.
That's right, that's right!

Korean: 우리나라도 외국처럼 키우기 전에 의무적으로 교육 받고 보험도 들고 하면 지금보다는 나아지지 않을까?
English: Wouldn't things be better in our country if we made it mandatory for children to receive education and insurance before they are raised like other countries?

Korean: 맞아 진짜 그런 교육을 좀 받아야 책임감을 갖고 가족으로 키울 것 같아.
English: Yeah, I think they really need to receive that kind of education so they can raise their children as responsible family members.
When I see people throwing things away, I think they think of them as possessions!
That's what I'm saying!

Korean: 어제 기사에서 봤는데 코로나 백신 접종 이후로 버려지는 동물들이 또 많아지고 있대
English: I saw an article yesterday that said that the number of abandoned animals is increasing after the COVID vaccination.
What does this have to do with vaccination?

Korean: 집에만 있을 때는 심심하니까 입양했다가 백신 접종하고 나서 외부 활동 할 수 있게 되니까 집에 있을 시간이 줄어들어서 그렇다고 하더라고!
English: He said that he adopted the dog because he was bored when he was just at home, and after he got vaccinated and was able to go outside, he spent less time at home!
Is it really that bad?
How could you think like that!
bad!

Korean: 그런 거 보면  유기견 봉사 활동도 한 번 가보고 싶다
English: When I see something like that, I want to try volunteering for abandoned dogs.
Do you want to go sometime when you have time?

Korean: 그래 가까운 곳에 있는지 혹시 알아?
English: Do you happen to know if there's one nearby?
No, I'll look it up and let you know!
When is a good time for you?
Anytime is fine with me on weekends!

Korean: 응응 그럼 주말에 되는 곳으로 찾아볼게!
English: Yeah, then I'll look for a place that's open this weekend!
Did you happen to watch the volleyball quarterfinals yesterday?
Yeah yeah, I was really touched ㅠㅠ
Did you see it too?
Yeah, I was really nervous!

Korean: 레드 카드 받을 때는 진짜 화나더라!
English: I was really upset when I got a red card!
Have you ever received a red card?
I didn't see that scene!
For what reason?

Korean: 심판한테 계속 강하게 항의했다고 레드 카드 받았어!
English: I got a red card for protesting strongly to the referee!
Isn't this really ridiculous?
Oh really?
What the red card!

Korean: 레드 카드 받으면 명수 불리하게 해야 경기 해야 해?
English: If you get a red card, do you have to play at a disadvantage?
No, strangely enough, there are no ejections in volleyball!

Korean: 대신에 상대 팀에 1점이랑 리시브권 주는 거래!
English: Instead, a deal is made where the opposing team gets 1 point and the right to receive!
I just found out yesterday too
Isn't it amazing?
Oh really, I just found out about this!

Korean: 경기할 때 진짜 심판 잘 만나는 것도 운 같아!
English: I think it's also lucky to meet a really good referee during a match!
Yeah, I was really upset yesterday
Still, I'm so glad we won
Do you know when the semi-finals are?
No I don't know the date Kiki

Korean: 할 때쯤 되면 기사 보고  확인했는데 키키
English: When it was time to do it, I checked the article and Kiki
Do you know when?
Yeah I know Kiki
One on Friday night at 7pm!
If it's Friday, is it tomorrow evening?

Korean: 응 맞아 내일 퇴근하고 치킨 시켜서 보면 딱 좋을 거 같아?
English: Yeah, that's right. I think it would be perfect if I order some chicken after work tomorrow?

Korean: 그러게 진짜 퇴근하고 보기 딱 좋다 키키
English: That's really nice to see after work Kiki
There's going to be a chicken riot tomorrow Kiki
Where are you going to see it?

English: Many students who are bullied at school are unable to tell their parents and endure it alone for fear of being retaliated against.
That's what I mean

Korean: 그런 기사 보면 너무 화나고 안타까운데 그런 기사가 너무 자주 나오는 거 같아!

These days, even elementary school students are suffering
