Why aren't you doing a club now?

Korean: 그 동호회는 울산에 있기도 하고... 배구가 재밌긴 한데 진짜 빡세요... 진짜 피멍 들고 난리도 그런 난리가...
English: That club is in Ulsan... Volleyball is fun, but it's really tough... It's really bruising and chaos...

Korean: 저는 그때 남자가 치는 공으로 연습했었는데 진짜... 생각하면 울고 싶다... 키키
English: I used to practice with the ball that the guy hit, and seriously... when I think about it, I want to cry... Kiki

Korean: 그리고 공 받으려면 깡도 있어야 해요. 키키
English: And you have to have guts to get the ball. Kiki
Is that different for men and women? That's interesting.
Is the ball a bit soft or hard?
It's a difference in power...

Korean: 이게 그냥 경기로 보면 공이 그렇게 빠른지 모르는데 코트 안에서 받아보면... 키키 무슨 미사일이 날아옵니다... 진심...
English: If you just watch the game, you wouldn't know that the ball is that fast, but if you receive it on the court... Kiki, some kind of missile flies... Seriously...

Korean: 아~ 공의 재질이 아니었구나 하하 아 저 진짜 스알못이거든요...
English: Ah~ It wasn't the ball material haha. I really suck at drawing...

Korean: 근데 듣다 보니 안경 쓴 사람은 위험할 거 같은데요?
English: But when I hear it, it seems like people wearing glasses might be dangerous?

Korean: 네...맞아요. 그래서 진짜 잘 피해야 해요 키키
English: Yeah... that's right. So you really have to avoid it Kiki

Korean: 이게 공 받을 때 몸을 최대한으로 낮춰야 하는데 그 상태에서 자기 어깨선보다 위로 오면 아웃이라서 피해야 하고 반대로 어깨선보다 아래로 오면 인이라서 받아야 해요.
English: When receiving the ball, you have to lower your body as much as possible, but if it comes above your shoulder line, it is out so you have to avoid it, and conversely, if it comes below your shoulder line, it is in so you have to receive it.

Korean: 그걸로 파악하고 잘 피하든 받든 해야 해요. 키키
English: You have to figure it out and either avoid it or accept it. Kiki

Korean: 들어서는 정말 무슨 뜻인지 모르겠어요 키키
English: I really don't know what it means Kiki

Korean: 예전에 수행평가도 겨우 겨우 하면서 사회 나가면 이런 거 할 일 없다고 속으로 생각했는데 스스로 그걸 하는 사람이 여기 있네... 키키
English: In the past, I barely managed to get a performance evaluation, so I thought I wouldn't have to do this kind of thing when I went out into society, but here's someone who does it on their own... Kiki

Korean: 자의가 아닌 게 포인트입니다... 저는 끌려갔어요... 키키  근데 이게 하다 보면 재밌어요.
English: The point is that it wasn't voluntary... I was dragged in... Kiki But it's fun if you do it.

Korean: 하지만 저는 그렇게 되기까지 엄청난 시련과 고통을 겪어야 했죠. 키키
English: But I had to go through a lot of trials and tribulations to get there. Kiki
Teacher, you don't play LoL?

Korean: 네. 롤은 하다가 욕 정말 많이 먹는다고 해서 안 해요. 키키
English: Yes. I don't play LoL because I get cursed at a lot. Kiki
Teacher, do you play LoL?

Korean: 아뇨 저는 해 보긴 했는데 별로 취향이 아니라서 튜토리얼만 하고 껐어요 키키
English: No, I tried it, but I didn't really like it, so I just did the tutorial and turned it off. Kiki

Korean: 저는 처음에 롤이 블리자드에서 나온 게임인 줄 알았어요. 키키
English: At first I thought LoL was a game from Blizzard. Kiki

Korean: 저는 어릴 때 오락실 진짜 많이 갔었는데 쌤도 혹시 오락실 많이 가셨었나요?
English: I went to arcades a lot when I was young. Did you go to arcades a lot, too?

Korean: 오락실에서는 테트리스랑 무슨 막 두드리는 거 있잖아요 그거 많이 했는데...
English: In the arcade, there's Tetris and other things where you have to tap on things, right? I used to do that a lot...
What about the teacher?

Korean: 저는 1945라고 비행기 게임 진짜 많이 했네요. 하하
English: I played a lot of airplane games like 1945 haha

Korean: 그리고 오락실 가면 야구공 칠 수 있는 거 있는데 그거는 무조건 했던 거 같아요. 하하
English: And when I went to the arcade, there was a place where I could hit a baseball, and I think I did that without fail. Haha
Are you talking about the one where the ball actually pops out?

Korean: 네. 그것도 자의적으로 한 게 아니라 저 배구 끌고 갔던 친구 때문에 하기 시작한 건데 스트레스 많이 받았을 때 가서 몇 번 치고 오면 스트레스 풀려요 키키
English: Yes. I didn't do it on purpose. I started doing it because of a friend who took me to play volleyball. When I'm stressed out, I go and play a few times and it relieves my stress. Kiki

Korean: 와 쌤 진짜 용감하시네요... 저는 그거 무서워서 가까이서 구경하는 것도 못...
English: Wow, teacher, you're really brave... I'm scared of it so I can't even look at it up close...

Korean: 저 친구 덕분에 그런 종류의 깡이 많이 생긴 것 같아요... 키키
English: I think I got a lot of that kind of energy thanks to that guy... Kiki

Korean: 저도 처음에는 무서워서 막 피하고 그랬는데 그럴 때마다 야! 피하지 말라고! 뒤에서 더 무섭게 해... 키키  공만 보면 된다고 하면서 키키
English: At first, I was scared and just avoided it, but every time I did that, I said, "Hey! Don't avoid it! It'll make you scarier from behind... Just look at Kiki's ball and Kiki will do it."
Teacher, then shooting? Do you do that too?

Korean: 네 저 사격도 하고 양궁도 해요.
English: Yes, I do shooting and archery.

Korean: 쏘는 건 실탄 쏘는 거 빼고 거진 다 하는 것 같은데...
English: It seems like they shoot almost everything except for live ammunition...
What about the teacher?

Korean: 저는 그 총 쏘는 게임만... 그건 실제로 뭐 하는 게 아니잖아요 키키
English: I just play that shooting game... that's not really what you're doing Kiki

Korean: 아 근데 그것도 좀비 나오는 건 안 해요 좀비 짱 싫음
English: Oh but I don't like zombies either. I really hate zombies.

Korean: 혹시 하우스 오브 더 데드? 키키  저 그거 진짜 많이 했었는데...
English: By any chance, House of the Dead? Kiki, I used to do that a lot...

Korean: 좀비 무서워서라도 정말 열심히 했던 게임이네요. 키키
English: This is a game that I really worked hard at, even though I was scared of zombies. Kiki

Korean: 그거 맞는 거 같아요! 요즘은 그 탈것 같은 데 타고서 총 쏘는 것도 있던데 그건 또 멀미 날까 봐 못 해 봤어요.
English: That sounds right! These days, there are things like riding on a vehicle and shooting guns, but I haven't tried that because I'm afraid of getting carsick.
Teacher, have you tried it? Kiki

Korean: 아니요. 그거는 못해봤는데 탈 것 같은 거 하니까 생각나는데 요새는 레이싱 게임이 그런 형식으로 나오더라고요. 키키
English: No. I haven't tried that, but it reminds me of something that looks like something I'd ride. These days, racing games come out in that format. Kiki

Korean: 한번 해봤는데 아우... 근육통이 덤으로 왔어요. 빡세요 게임이 키키
English: I tried it once and ugh... I got muscle pain as a bonus. The game is tough.
Teacher, you don't play LoL?

Korean: 어제도 본보야지를 봤는데 뉴질랜드 편에서 연어 낚시가 그렇게 재밌어 보이더라고요?
English: I watched Bon Voyage yesterday too, and the salmon fishing in New Zealand looked so much fun.
Have you been to New Zealand?

Korean: 아니요. 저 뉴질랜드 가보고 싶었는데 못 가봤어요.
English: No. I wanted to go to New Zealand, but I haven't been able to.

Korean: 저는 항상 일본 아니면 유럽으로만 갔네요.
English: I always went to Japan or Europe.
Kiki the picky traveler

Korean: ** 씨는 뉴질랜드 가서 연어 낚시 해보고 싶으신 거죠? 하하
English: ** So you want to go to New Zealand and go salmon fishing? Haha
Yes, but New Zealand is very nature-oriented...

Korean: 저는 좀 도시 타입인데 쌤은 어때요?
English: I'm more of a city type, what about you, teacher?

Korean: 음... 저는 자연 타입인 거 같기도 한데...
English: Um... I think I'm the natural type...

Korean: 사실 자연 위주로 가 보질 않아서 잘 모르겠어요.
English: Actually, I don't know because I haven't been to many places that are close to nature.

Korean: 근데 대도시보다는 소도시 타입은 확실한 것 같아요!
English: But I think it's definitely more of a small city type than a big city type!
I love the hustle and bustle of a big city!

Korean: 다들 바쁜데 여행자 느낌으로 돌아다니면 은근한 쾌감... 키키
English: Everyone is busy, but it's a secret pleasure to wander around like a traveler... Kiki

Korean: 아 진짜요? 근데 그럼 휴양지랑은 좀 안 맞는 거 아니에요? 하하
English: Oh really? But then doesn't that not fit with the vacation spot? Haha

Korean: 네 그래서 휴양도 대형 리조트에서만 하는... 키키
English: Yes, that's why vacations are only available at large resorts... Kiki

Korean: 저는 걸어 다니는 걸 엄청 좋아하다 보니까 대도시보다는 소도시더라고요. 하하
English: I really like walking around, so I prefer small cities over big cities. Haha
I heard that the trip is so popular. Have you ever been there?

Korean: 네 근데 저는 진짜 오사카? 이런 유명한 관광지밖에 못 가봤는데 독일이 정말 다니기 좋은 소도시를 가봤었죠.
English: Yes, but I've only been to famous tourist destinations like Osaka, but I've been to small cities in Germany that are really nice to travel to.

Korean: 그때는 제가 여행 계획을 짠 게 아니라 거기에 사는 친구가 플랜을 짜서 거기에 맞춰서 다녔었는데 정말 저를 위한 계획이었어요 하하
English: At that time, I didn't plan the trip, but a friend who lived there made the plan and I went along with it. It was really a plan for me haha.

Korean: 역시 현지에 사는 사람이 계획을 해야 한다는 걸 그때 느꼈어요!
English: That's when I realized that it's the local people who need to make the plans!

Korean: 저 일본은 오사카 고베 교토 요 라인 갔었어요! 8뭘 말에 최고 더울 때 키키
English: I went to Osaka, Kobe, Kyoto, and Yo Line in Japan! 8 What is the hottest time to go to Kiki?

Korean: 다시 그때처럼 그렇게 가라고 하면 돈 받고도 못 가겠어요. 진짜 땀 구멍이 자동 오픈...
English: If you tell me to go back like that again, I can't go even if I get paid. My pores are really opening automatically...

Korean: 근데 어디든 현지에 지인 있는 여행 한번 해 보고 싶다... 너무 좋을 거 같아요.
English: But I'd like to try traveling somewhere with local acquaintances... I think it would be great.
I went that line too! Kiki

Korean: 근데 그거는 진짜 누구나 다 가는 플랜이라서 좀 식상하죠.
English: But that's a plan that everyone does, so it's a bit boring.

Korean: 현지어가 능숙한 사람이랑 같이 다니면 진짜 편해요. 키키
English: It's really convenient to travel with someone who is fluent in the local language. Kiki

Korean: 그리고 잘 아니까 더욱더 잘 즐기다가 올 수도 있고요. 하하
English: And since you know it well, you can enjoy it even more. Haha

Korean: 저는 현지인이 주로 가는 맛집이 궁금해서 키키
English: I was curious about the restaurants that locals usually go to, so I went to Kiki.

Korean: 아! 저 독일 여행에서 그런 식당 갔었어요. 현지인들이 가는 맛집! 진짜 맛있더라고요.
English: Ah! I went to a restaurant like that when I traveled to Germany. It's a popular restaurant for locals! It was really delicious.

Korean: 여행 책자에서 나오는 맛집이랑 확실히 틀려. 먹물 파스타였는데 다시 가서 먹고 싶어요... 그 맛이 생각나요.
English: It's definitely different from the restaurants in travel brochures. It was squid ink pasta, and I want to go back and eat it again... I remember the taste.

Korean: 현지인 집에 가서 사는 거 구경도 하고 싶어요!
English: I also want to go to a local person's house and see how they live!

Korean: 저 일본에 친구 있어서 집에 가본 적 있는데 진짜 집 알차다고 해야 하나...?
English: I have a friend in Japan, so I've been to his house before, and I would say his house is really full...?

Korean: 진짜 신기한 게 욕조가 하나씩 다 있어요!
English: What's really amazing is that they each have their own bathtub!

Korean: 일본인들 목욕하는 거 진짜 좋아한다고 하더라고요.
English: They say Japanese people really like taking baths.

Korean: 일본은 여름에 너무 습해서 힘들었는데 이제 한국도 거의 비슷한 기분이에요...
English: Japan was so humid in the summer that it was hard, but now Korea feels almost the same...

Korean: 그러니까요. 진짜 일본 여름에 갔을 때 두 번 다시 여름에는 가지 않겠다고 다짐했었는데 우리나라가 이제 날씨가 그렇다니...
English: That's right. When I went to Japan in the summer, I swore I would never go back in the summer again, but now the weather in our country is like that...

Korean: 요새 모기도 별로 없어요. 날이 너무 더워서 그런가
English: There aren't many mosquitoes these days. Maybe it's because the weather is so hot.

Korean: 매미도 아침저녁 선선할 때만 울어요 키키
English: Cicadas only sing when it's cool in the morning and evening Kiki
They're hot too...

Korean: 진짜 얼마나 더웠으면 매미도 울기를 포기하나...
English: How hot must it be for even cicadas to give up singing?

Korean: 매미 진짜 아침 거의 새벽부터 울던데요. 키키
English: Cicadas really start crying from early in the morning. Kiki

Korean: 김해 갔을 때 대낮에 산책하는데 참새들이 그늘에 옹기종기 모여 있더라고요?
English: When I went to Gimhae and was taking a walk in broad daylight, I saw sparrows huddled together in the shade.

Korean: 뭐 주워 먹는 줄 알았는데 아무것도 없는 거예요 키키
English: I thought you were going to pick up something to eat, but there was nothing Kiki
It was just hot

Korean: 아... 뭔가 상상하니까 왜 이렇게 귀엽죠...? 키키
English: Ah... why is it so cute when I imagine it...? Kiki

Korean: 근데 정말 날이 더우니까 괜히 길에서 사는 동물들이 걱정되고 그렇네요.
English: But it's really hot these days, so I'm worried about the animals living on the streets.
There will be no water

Korean: 맞아요 동네 고양이 급식소에 물이 더럽고 말랐더라고요!
English: That's right, the water at the neighborhood cat feeding station was dirty and dry!

Korean: 그리고 왠지 낮에는 그 물이 끓을 것도 같은...
English: And somehow, it feels like the water will boil during the day...

Korean: 그러니까요... 날이 더우니까 진짜 동물이나 사람이나 너무 힘든 것 같아요.
English: That's why... I think it's really hard for both animals and people because the weather is so hot.

Korean: 차라리 겨울이 더 좋나 이런 생각도 들고... 태어나서 처음 이런 생각 해봤어요. 키키
English: I even thought that maybe winter was better... It's the first time in my life that I've thought like this. Kiki

Korean: 그래도 올해는 장마가 거의 없었죠? 서울에서는...
English: But there was almost no rainy season this year, right? In Seoul...

Korean: 작년에 비가 너무 길게 와서 지쳤잖아요 하하
English: It rained so long last year that I was exhausted haha

Korean: 네... 작년에 진짜 비 징그럽게도 많이 왔었는데 올해는 징그럽게도 덥네요 정말...
English: Yeah... It rained so much last year and it was really disgusting, but this year it's really disgustingly hot...
There is no middle ground Kiki

Korean: 작년에 비 많이 올 때는 날씨가 여름답지 않다고 해가 좀 쨍쨍했으면 좋겠다 생각도 해 봤는데 미쳤었죠 정말 키키
English: Last year, when it rained a lot, I thought it was not summer-like weather and wished it was a little sunny, but I was crazy. Kiki

Korean: 그러니까요. 키키  아 근데 가만히 생각해보면 비 그렇게까지 오는 것도 너무 싫어요...
English: That's right. Kiki, but if you think about it carefully, I really hate it when it rains that much...

Korean: 둘 중에 뭐가 더 싫은 것 같아요? 저는 그래도 비요.
English: Which of the two do you hate more? I like the rain, though.

Korean: 저도 비 싫어해요! 매일 새벽 1시부터 5시까지 딱 와 줬으면 좋겠어요 키키
English: I hate rain too! I wish it would come every morning from 1am to 5am Kiki

Korean: 저도요. 키키  저도 비 싫어해서 내가 잘 때 비 와줬으면 좋겠어.
English: Me too. Kiki, I hate rain too, so I wish it would rain while I sleep.

Korean: 비가 아예 안 오면 안 되니까 키키
English: Kiki, it can't be helped if it doesn't rain at all

Korean: 그쵸 비가 너무 안 오면 나중에 과일이 맛이 없어서 안 돼요!
English: Right, if it doesn't rain for a long time, the fruit won't taste good later on!

Korean: 맞아요. 농사하시는 분들 생각해서 비는 적당히 와야 해요.
English: That's right. We need to get enough rain for the farmers.

Korean: 근데 올해 비가 너무 안 와서 농사가 제대로 될지...?
English: But since there hasn't been much rain this year, will the crops turn out well?

Korean: 코로나 때문에 농사짓는 분들도 타격이 크다잖아요.
English: Farmers are also taking a big hit because of the coronavirus.

Korean: 학교를 안 가니까 급식소에 공급을 못 하는 것도 크대요.
English: Since they don't go to school, they can't supply food to the cafeteria.

Korean: 아 진짜요? 그 부분은 생각을 못했네요.
English: Oh really? I didn't think about that part.

Korean: 코로나가 생각보다 사회적으로 피해를 입히는 부분이 상당하네요.
English: The social damage caused by Corona is considerably greater than expected.

Korean: 생각보다 야채나 과일이 급식으로 들어가는 게 많대요.
English: It seems that more vegetables and fruits are included in school meals than you might think.

Korean: 그전에 이미 밭에서 작물은 다 자랐고 하니까 그걸 수확하는 인건비며 그런 게 수지 타산이 안 맞아서 다 자란 걸 막 갈아엎는 거 봤어요.
English: Before that, the crops in the field had already grown, so I saw them just plowing them over because the labor costs to harvest them and other things didn't make sense.

Korean: 아 그러고 보니까 빵집 하시는 분들도 공장에 납품해서 생계유지하시는 분들이 많은데 코로나 때문에 타격이 크다고 들었어요.
English: Oh, by the way, I heard that many bakery owners make a living by supplying to factories, and that they've been hit hard by the coronavirus.

Korean: 공장에서 간식 부분의 비용을 줄여서 그렇다고 하더라고요.
English: They said that it was because they reduced the cost of snacks at the factory.

Korean: 외식을 자제하니까 1차 산업부터 시작해서 줄줄이 어렵죠
English: Since we are refraining from eating out, everything is going to be difficult, starting with the primary industry.

Korean: 뭐... 근데 전자상거래는 또 덕분에 호황이잖아요?
English: Well... but e-commerce is booming thanks to that, right?
Yeah, that's really ironic.
** Are you planning to get vaccinated?

Korean: 해야죠! 너무 하고 싶은데 이번에 10부제 때 예약 성공할지 모르겠어요...
English: I have to! I really want to do it, but I don't know if I'll be able to make a reservation for the 10th episode this time...
I'm still thinking about it.

Korean: 요새 백신 접종 예약이 거의 인기 아이돌 가수 티켓팅보다 더 어렵다면서 그러더라고요.
English: They say that these days, getting a vaccine appointment is almost more difficult than getting tickets for popular idol singers.

Korean: 지난번 50대 예약 때는 그랬는데 이번에 10부제는 처음 시도하는 거니까 또 어떨지 모르겠네요.
English: It was like that last time I made a reservation for 50s, but this is my first time trying the 10-part system, so I don't know how it will be.

Korean: 잔여 백신 예약이 서울은 거의 없어서 콘서트 티켓 취소표 줍는 거랑 비슷하긴 해요.
English: There are almost no remaining vaccine reservations in Seoul, so it's like collecting concert ticket cancellations.

Korean: 10부제 도입된 거는 혼선 없이 잘 진행이 돼야 될 텐데요.
English: The introduction of the 10-part system should proceed smoothly without confusion.

Korean: 델타 변이에 이어서 이번에는 또 델타 플러스 사례까지 나온다고 하는데 이거 정말 끝나긴 할까? 키키
English: Following the Delta mutation, there is now a Delta Plus case. Will this really end? Kiki

Korean: 안 그래도 우리나라도 이제 방향을 좀 달리해서 감기처럼 계속 같이 가는 걸로 해야 한다 이런 의견도 있더라고요.
English: There are even opinions that say that our country should change direction and continue to go together like a cold.

Korean: 네. 너무 금지만 하니까 자영업자들이 살아남기가 정말 어렵겠다 싶더라고요.
English: Yes. I thought it would be really difficult for self-employed people to survive because there were so many prohibitions.

Korean: 배달 시켜서 먹는 것도 한계가 있을 건데 앞으로 계속 이런 식으로 가다간 어떻게 될지 모르니까요.
English: There are limits to what you can do with delivery, and I don't know what will happen if we continue like this.

Korean: 지금도 꾸준히 중증 환자가 나오는 거 보면 또 건강한 사람 입장만 생각하는 거 아닌가 싶기도 하고...
English: Looking at the fact that there are still serious patients coming out, I wonder if they are only thinking about the position of healthy people...

Korean: 음... 이건 정말 어려운 문제인 것 같아요. 누구 한쪽으로만 치우치면 안 되는 문제이니까요.
English: Well... I think this is a really difficult problem. It's one that can't be taken lightly by one side.

Korean: 현장에서 일하시는 관계자들이 진짜 힘들겠다는 생각이 들더라고요.
English: I thought that the people working on site must be having a really hard time.

Korean: 이번에는 연령대 특성상 인구 수도 많고 하니까 제발 별 탈 없이 예약 잘 끝나고 접종까지 잘 됐으면 좋겠네요!
English: This time, since the population is also large due to the age characteristics, I hope that the reservations are made and the vaccinations are administered without any problems!

Korean: 그러니까요. 이 바이러스는 진짜 자연적으로 생긴 바이러스가 절대 아닌 것 같아요. 이렇게 변이가 빠르게 되는 걸 보면...
English: So, this virus is definitely not a natural virus. Seeing how it mutates so quickly...

Korean: 하필 코로나도 발원지가 중국이고 그래서 의심스러운 구석이 많긴 해요 하하
English: The origin of the coronavirus is China, so there are many suspicious aspects haha

Korean: 네 여러 가지 설이 있는데 그 중국과 관련된 설에도 빌 게이츠가 얽혀있어서 미국 내에서 이슈라고 하더라고요. 하하
English: Yes, there are various theories, but the one related to China also has Bill Gates involved, so it's said to be an issue in the US. Haha

Korean: 미중 갈등이 수그러들 기미가 안 보이는데 제발 고래 싸움에 새우 등 터지는 일 없었으면 좋겠어요.
English: The US-China conflict shows no signs of abating, so I hope we don't end up with a shrimp getting hurt in a fight between whales.

Korean: 아무래도 지리학적으로 우리나라가 중요한 지역이다 보니까 그런 것 같아요.
English: I think it's because our country is geographically an important region.

Korean: 패권 국가들의 싸움에서 진짜 생각을 잘해야 하는데 그게 정말 쉽지 않은 일인 것 같아요.
English: In a fight between hegemonic powers, you really have to think carefully, and I think that's not an easy task.

Korean: 지도자 하나가 처신 잘 한다고 해서 해결될 일이 아닌데 그냥 절대악 같은 존재가 필요하니까 지금 한국 내에서는 그게 중국이냐 일본이냐로 당파 싸움이나 하고 있으니 국민들도 정신 못 차리고 아주 대놓고 타 국가 혐오 발언을 너무 많이 해요.
English: This isn't something that can be solved just by one leader behaving well. We need an absolute evil being, so right now in Korea, there's a partisan fight over whether it's China or Japan, and the people haven't come to their senses and are openly making too many hateful remarks about other countries.

Korean: 네. 근데 그게 우리나라만의 문제가 아니라는 게 더 문제죠.
English: Yes. But the bigger problem is that it's not just our country's problem.

Korean: 타 국가 예를 들어 중국이나 일본 안에서도 각자의 나라를 혐오하고 싫어하는 게 큰 이슈인 것 같더라고요.
English: Even within other countries, such as China and Japan, it seems like hatred and dislike for one's own country is a big issue.

Korean: 지리적으로 가까우면서 친한 국가들이 있던가요 하하
English: Are there any countries that are geographically close and friendly? Haha
Um... no... Kiki absolutely does not.

Korean: 사실 유럽도 지금의 관계들을 보면... 진짜 기적의 관계죠.
English: In fact, if you look at the current relationships in Europe... they are truly miraculous relationships.

Korean: 그런데도 지금 보면 관계가 완전히 좋지 않은 걸 보면 진짜 쉽지 않은 문제인 것 같아요!
English: But looking at it now, it seems like it really isn't an easy problem, seeing as the relationship isn't all that good!

Korean: 그래도 지금 같은 전 지구적 재난 상황에는 도울 건 돕고 했으면 좋겠어요.
English: Still, in a global disaster like this, I hope we can help where we can.

Korean: 코로나도 그렇지만 기후 재앙이 심각한 나라들도 많은데 관심이 좀 필요할 거 같아요.
English: Not only Corona, but there are many countries that are suffering from serious climate disasters, so I think they need some attention.

Korean: 맞아요. 다같이 탄소 중립으로 간다고 하는데 개발도상국들은 또 나라 발전을 위해서는 그렇게 할 수도 없고
English: That's right. Everyone says they're going carbon neutral, but developing countries can't do that for their own development.

Korean: 근데 또 기후를 위해서는 그렇게 가는 게 맞고 어떤 게 옳은 건지 솔직히 잘 모르겠다는 생각도 해요.
English: But I also honestly don't know if that's the right way to go for the climate and what's right.

Korean: 이미 탄소 배출 실컷 해 놓은 선진국들이 좀 탄소세를 많이 많이 냈으면 좋겠는데요.
English: I wish developed countries, which have already emitted a lot of carbon, would pay a lot of carbon taxes.

Korean: 우리나라를 포함해서요. 우리나라도 기후 악당 국가잖아요.
English: Including our country. Our country is also a climate villain country.

Korean: 맞아요. 이때까지 자기들 누릴 거 다 누려서 망쳐놓고 지금의 개발도상국들 보고 뭐라 하는 것도 너무 이기적이라고 생각해요.
English: That's right. I think it's very selfish to say anything to developing countries now, when they've enjoyed everything they could and ruined it.

Korean: 우리나라도 기후 위기에 많은 일조를 했죠.
English: Our country has also contributed greatly to the climate crisis.

Korean: 국토가 물에 잠기고 작물이 자랄 수 없는 황폐한 땅이 돼서 빈곤 문제가 심각한 건 결국에 저개발 국가들인데 이 정도 발전했으면 책임을 져야 한다고 생각합니다.
English: The country is underwater and has become a wasteland where crops cannot grow, so the poverty problem is serious. Ultimately, it is the underdeveloped countries that have developed to this extent, so I think they should take responsibility.

Korean: 근데 그런 거 하라고 있는 국제기구들도 결국엔 돈 많이 내는 선진국 편이잖아요.
English: But the international organizations that are supposed to do such things are ultimately on the side of the advanced countries that pay a lot of money.

Korean: 지구 멸망하기 전에 좀 다 같이 정신 차렸으면 키키
English: Kiki, I hope we all come to our senses before the Earth is destroyed.

Korean: 근데 이미 망해가고 있는 것 같아요... 키키
English: But I think it's already going to fall apart... Kiki

Korean: 기후 변화의 위기를 뭔가 온몸으로 겪고 있는 듯한 기분이랄까...
English: It feels like I'm experiencing the climate change crisis with my whole body...

Korean: 맞아요 근데 시원한 에어컨 바람 맞으면서 이런 말하는 저도 참 양심 없긴 하네요 하하
English: That's right, but I feel a bit unscrupulous saying this while feeling the cool air conditioning breeze haha
So... Kiki

Korean: 출근길에 잠시 더운 건데 그걸로 기후 위기를 겪고 있다고 하니까 뭔가 되게 웃기네요. 키키
English: It's funny how you say that you're experiencing a climate crisis because of the hot weather on your way to work. Kiki

Korean: 더우니까 요즘은 뭐 찍어 바르기도 쉽지 않아요 그쵸 하하
English: It's hot these days so it's not easy to even apply anything, right haha

Korean: 저 어제 친한 언니랑 수부지 피부 타입에 대해서 얘기했었는데 화장품 얘기도 했었거든요.
English: Yesterday, I was talking to my close friend about oily skin types and we also talked about cosmetics.
** What is your skin type?
I think it's that guy!

Korean: 원래는 완전 지성이라고 생각했는데 요새 늙어서 그런가...
English: I originally thought he was completely intelligent, but maybe it's because he's getting older...
I'm a water buff too. Kiki

Korean: 그래서 저 피부 화장 끊은 지 몇 년 됐다고 하니까 놀래더라고요.
English: So when I told her it had been a few years since I last used makeup on my skin, she was surprised.
I just apply sunscreen and go out.
My skin is getting worse because I put on makeup

Korean: 저는 신기하게도 화장을 하면 더 좋아지더라구요?
English: Strangely enough, I look better when I put on makeup.

Korean: 근데 당장은 그렇게 보이는데 모르죠 뭐.
English: But right now it looks like that, you know?

Korean: 저는 화장 씻어낼 때 화이트헤드가 같이 사라지는 기분?
English: I feel like when I wash off my makeup, my whiteheads disappear with it?

Korean: 저는 세안을 하면 더 피부에 자극이 가서 더더욱 망하더라고요. 크크
English: When I wash my face, my skin gets more irritated and it gets even worse. Hehe
So I use cleansing water.

Korean: 그게 끝이고 아침에 일어나서 이제 세안을 하죠.
English: That's it, wake up in the morning and wash your face.

Korean: 그러니까 피부가 정말 좋아졌어요. 화장을 안 해도 될 정도로
English: So my skin has really improved. I don't need to wear makeup.

Korean: 클렌징 워터를 화장 지우는 용도 이외에 그냥 세안 시에도 쓰신다고요?
English: Do you use cleansing water not only to remove makeup but also to simply wash your face?
That's it for the cleansing water.

Korean: 클렌징 워터 화장솜으로 두 번 사용하고 끝이에요.
English: I just use it twice with a cleansing water cotton pad and that's it.

Korean: 화장 지운다고 세안을 해버리니까 피부가 더 망가져서...
English: I washed my face to remove my makeup, so my skin got even worse...

Korean: 에... 저도 클렌징 워터로 1차 클렌징만 하고 그거 물로 씻고 끝이에요 하하
English: Uh... I also just do the first cleansing with cleansing water and then wash it off with water and that's it haha
Ah, the eye remover is separate...

Korean: 저는 눈 화장을 안 하니까 피부 노화가 좀 느리게 온다는 느낌을 받았어요. 키키
English: I feel like my skin ages a little slower because I don't wear eye makeup. Kiki

Korean: 저 어릴 때부터 눈가에 주름이 있어서 고민이에요
English: I've had wrinkles around my eyes since I was little, and that's been a concern.

Korean: 근데 엄마도 똑같은 모양 있는 거 봐서는 노화로 인한 주름이 아니라서 관리가 안 듣는 거 같아요 키키
English: But since my mom has the same shape, I don't think it's wrinkles caused by aging, so it's not responding to care. Kiki

Korean: 아 피부는 유전의 영향도 무시할 수 없죠. 하하
English: Ah, you can't ignore the influence of genetics on skin. Haha

Korean: 저희 친가 쪽이 피부 탄력이 좀 있는 편이라서 그게 영향인가 싶기도 해요.
English: My maternal side of the family has relatively elastic skin, so I wonder if that has an effect.

Korean: 어릴 때 끈적끈적한 거 싫어서 선크림 안 발랐는데 요즘도 솔직히 따로 잘 안 바르거든요?
English: When I was young, I didn't wear sunscreen because I didn't like sticky things, and to be honest, I don't really apply sunscreen these days either.

Korean: 그래서 선크림 바르기 싫어서 여름에 밖에 안 나가기도 키키
English: That's why I don't like to apply sunscreen, so I don't go outside in the summer.

Korean: 쌤도 지성이면 끈적거리는 거 싫지 않아요?
English: Teacher, don't you hate sticky things when you're smart?
Yeah, I really hate that sticky stuff...

Korean: 저는 선크림 진짜 목숨 걸고 발라요. 키키
English: I put on sunscreen with all my might. Kiki
It is true that ultraviolet rays are the main culprit of aging.

Korean: 원래 지성이 잘 안 늙으니까 그냥 이대로 살다가 순리대로 가죠 뭐... 크크크
English: Since Ji-seong doesn't age well, I guess I'll just live like this and let things take their course... Hehe

Korean: 키키  저도 그냥 이제 생긴 대로 살려구요.
English: Kiki: I'm just going to live the way I am now.

Korean: 피부가 켈로이드 체질이라 보톡스 같은 거 아예 꿈도 못 꿔서 이 정도 생긴 것도 감사하게 생각하고 살아야 하나라고 애써 생각하고 살고 있는 중입니다. 키키
English: My skin is prone to keloids, so I can't even dream of getting something like botox. I'm trying to live my life thinking that I should be thankful for the fact that I have this much skin. Kiki
Do you have keloid scars?
Yes, I have something similar on the bottom of my neck.

Korean: 그래서 좀 슬프긴 한데 이게 가슴 위쪽으로 생기는 거라고 하더라고요.
English: So it's a little sad, but they say that this happens above the chest.

Korean: 제 친구가 등에 켈로이드 흉터가 있는데 병원에 가서 물어보니까 쉽게 제거가 안 되더라고요.
English: My friend has a keloid scar on his back, and when he went to the hospital, he was told that it wasn't easy to remove.

Korean: 맞아요. 켈로이드 상처를 쉽게 제거할 수가 없어서 진짜 조심 조심 또 조심해야 해요.
English: That's right. Keloid scars are not easy to remove, so you really have to be very, very careful.

Korean: 그래서 저도 피부과 가서 시술받는 거 잘 안 해요.
English: That's why I don't often go to dermatologists and get treatments.

Korean: 귀도 못 뚫고 타투도 못 하고 진짜 불편하겠다 싶긴 한데...
English: I think it would be really uncomfortable not being able to pierce your ears or get a tattoo...

Korean: 아 귀는 뚫었어요. 중학생 때 키키
English: Oh, I got my ears pierced. Kiki when I was in middle school.
But fortunately, that didn't happen.

Korean: 그거 들켜서 엄마한테 정말 혼 많이 났었어요.
English: I got caught for that and got really scolded by my mom.
Teacher, have you ever had major surgery?

Korean: 아니요. 큰 수술은 없어요. 앞으로도 가급적이면 큰 수술할 일은 없었으면 좋겠는데...
English: No, I don't have any major surgery. I hope I don't have any major surgery in the future...
Is the teacher there by any chance?

Korean: 아뇨 저도 수술이나 입원을 한 번도 안 해 봤어요.
English: No, I've never had surgery or been hospitalized.

Korean: 그냥 몇 시간 링거 맞는 거 말고는 하하
English: haha just a few hours of ringer

Korean: 다행인데 또 병원 생활 궁금해 가지고...
English: Fortunately, I'm curious about hospital life again...

Korean: 아 저 안구 사실 수술한다고 입원하고 수술 진행한 적은 있어요!
English: Oh, I actually had eye surgery and was hospitalized!

Korean: 그때 전신 마취했었는데 전신 마취하고 나서 못 깨어나는 사람들 왜 그런지 알 것 같더라고요.
English: I was under general anesthesia at the time, and I think I know why people can't wake up after being under general anesthesia.
How many days were you hospitalized for?

Korean: 전신 마취면 쌤... 큰 수술해 봤다고 하는 거예요 키키
English: If you're under general anesthesia, teacher... you're saying you've had major surgery Kiki
Oh really...? Kiki
Wow, general anesthesia is really scary.

Korean: 저 수술 전날에 하루 입원하고 수술하고 하루 더 입원했죠.
English: I was hospitalized for one day the day before the surgery, had the surgery, and was hospitalized for another day.

Korean: 부분 마취나 하루 만에 나올 수 있는 시술 정도 말고는 큰 수술이라고 해요 보통은! 키키
English: It's usually considered a major surgery, except for local anesthesia or procedures that can be done in one day! Kiki
Oh really? Kiki

Korean: 저는 그냥 사시 수술이라고 생각해서 큰 수술이라고 생각은 안 했어요.
English: I just thought it was a surgery, so I didn't think it was a big deal.

Korean: 암튼 앞으로도 큰 수술 받는 일 없게 건강하세요!
English: Anyway, I hope you stay healthy and don't need any major surgery in the future!

Korean: 네 우리 앞으로 큰 수술할 일 없게 건강 관리 잘해요! 하하
English: Yes, we will take care of our health so that we don't have to have any major surgery in the future! Haha

Korean: 쌤 인터넷에서 옷 안 산다고 했잖아요 그러면 어디서 사요?
English: Teacher, you said you don't buy clothes on the Internet, so where do you buy them?

Korean: 저는 주로 밖에서 사요. 사이즈가 안 맞는 경우를 너무 많이 겪었어서...
English: I mostly buy outside. I've had so many instances where the size doesn't fit...

Korean: 특히 치마 같은 경우는 꼭 입어보고 사는 편이에요.
English: Especially in the case of skirts, I always try them on before buying them.
** Do you buy a lot on the Internet?

Korean: 저는 옷도 인터넷에서 잘 샀었는데 저도 거의 실패 반 성공 반?
English: I used to buy clothes online a lot, but I was almost always half successful and half failed?

Korean: 저는 실패가 거의 90%라서 꼭 오프라인으로 입어 보고 사요.
English: I always try things on offline before buying them because my failure rate is almost 90%.

Korean: 식품 사는 거는 주로 어디에서 사세요?
English: Where do you usually buy groceries?
I think we had this conversation last time

Korean: 저는 쿠팡 프레시 이용하고 있고요. 아니면 쓱 배달도 써요.
English: I use Coupang Fresh. Or I use Ssuk Delivery.

Korean: 저는 집 주변에 살펴보니까 식재료 마트가 있더라고요.
English: I looked around my house and found a grocery store.

Korean: 그래서 거기서 직접 사서 해 먹을까 생각 중인데... 어디가 더 쌀까요...? 키키
English: So I'm thinking about buying it there and eating it myself... Which place would be cheaper...? Kiki

Korean: 혼자 살면 직접 재료 사다가 해 드시면 더 비쌀 수도 있어요.
English: If you live alone, it may be more expensive to buy the ingredients and cook it yourself.

Korean: 특히 처음에 장류 같은 게 집에 아무것도 없는 상태라면...
English: Especially if you don't have anything like seasoning at home at first...
I guess so?

Korean: 식재료비 아끼려다가 배로 나갈 수도 있겠다는 생각이 들더라고요.
English: I was thinking that I might have to go all the way to save on groceries.

Korean: 진짜 참기름부터 시작해서 된장도 없고 김치도 없고 아무것도 없어서
English: Starting with real sesame oil, there is no soybean paste, no kimchi, no nothing.

Korean: 그런 건 확실히 인터넷으로 사면 싸요.
English: Those things are definitely cheaper if you buy them online.

Korean: 그리고 물건 종류도 오프라인보다 많아서 좋던데요 저는!
English: And I like it because there are more types of products than offline!

Korean: 역시 사람들이 많이 이용하는 데는 이유가 있어요.
English: There is a reason why so many people use it.

Korean: 요새 쿠팡 프레시 시키면 같이 배달 오는 용기 수거해 가지 않는다고 말이 많더라고요.
English: These days, there's a lot of talk about how when you order Coupang Fresh, they don't collect the containers that come with the delivery.

Korean: 아 그 박스... 맞아요 그게 뭔가 때가 안 맞으면 귀찮아져요.
English: Oh, that box... that's right. That thing gets annoying when the timing isn't right.

Korean: 그래도 계속 계속 시키는 사람은 그런 걱정 잘 안 해도 돼요 키키
English: But people who keep doing it don't have to worry about that Kiki
Oh really? Why?

Korean: 계속 계속 시키면 더 많이 늘어나는 거 아니에요?
English: If you keep doing it, won't it increase more?
You don't even collect it properly?

Korean: 그게 문 앞에 놓으면 다음번에 뭐 갖다 줄 때 회수하는 시스템이에요.
English: It's a system where if you leave it in front of the door, it will be retrieved the next time you bring something.

Korean: 그니까 끊이지 않으면 곤란할 일이 없더라고요?
English: So, if it doesn't stop, there won't be any problems?

Korean: 아아 그럼 완전 계속 시켜야겠네요. 키키
English: Ah, then I guess I'll have to keep doing it. Kiki

Korean: 저 도시락 시켜야 하는데 귀차니즘 때문에 안 시키고 있어요.
English: I need to order a lunch box, but I'm not doing it because I'm lazy.

Korean: 도시락 요즘 다양한 거 엄청 많이 나오던데!
English: There are so many different types of lunch boxes coming out these days!

Korean: 아예 도시락만 모아 놓은 사이트도 있더라고요!
English: There's even a site that only collects lunch boxes!

Korean: 아 진짜요? 저 나중에 사이트 좀 공유할 수 있을까요? 하하
English: Oh really? Can I share the site with you later? Haha
Teacher, I bought those 2020 Memories yesterday!

Korean: 아 진짜요? 키키 저는 요번에 멤버십 갱신해야 하는데
English: Oh really? Kiki, I have to renew my membership this time.

Korean: 혹시... ** 씨 아미 가입하실 건가요...? 키키
English: By any chance... **Could you join the army...? Kiki

Korean: 저 안 할 거예요! 저 아미 아니에요!
English: I won't do it! I'm not ARMY!

Korean: 키키  ** 씨 이미 거의 아미인 것 같은데...
English: Kiki **, it seems like you're almost an ARMY already...

Korean: 저 덕메 친구한테 얘기하니까 지진정까지 다 아는 것 보면 끝난 거 아니냐고 그랬다고요.
English: When I told my friend Deokmae about it, he said that since he knew everything about the earthquake, it must be over.

Korean: 아니 어쩌다 보니 알게 된 거지 뭐 제가 막 입덕을 마음 먹은 건 아니니까 아직 ** 쌤 같은 진짜 아미하고는 차원이 다르죠! 키키
English: No, I just happened to find out about it. It's not like I just decided to become a fan, so I'm still on a different level from real ARMYs like **! Kiki

Korean: 키키  근데 궁금했는데 토니 오빠를 좋아하는 게 특별한 계기가 있어요?
English: Kiki: But I was curious. Is there a special reason why you like Tony?

Korean: 옛날부터 좋아했어서 딱히 이유는 생각나지 않는데 이제...
English: I've liked it since a long time ago, so I can't really remember why, but now...

Korean: 너무 어릴 때부터 좋아한 거라서 그런가...
English: Is it because I liked it since I was very young?

Korean: 그냥 토니는 제 삶에 공기처럼 존재한다...?
English: Tony just exists in my life like air...?
Wow... that's cool. Kiki

Korean: 저는 방탄은 음... 나의 활력소? 비타민? 키키
English: I think BTS is... my source of energy? Vitamins? Kiki

Korean: 근데 사람들이 잘 몰라서 그렇지 토니 씨는 노래할 때 목소리가 되게 말할 때랑 다르고 매력적이에요!
English: But people don't know that, but when Tony sings, his voice is different from when he speaks, and it's very attractive!
You don't need to know, but Kiki

Korean: 근데 예전 모습 보면 왜 인기 많았는지 알 것 같긴 했어요! 키키

It was popular...

Korean: 생일 파티가 전국에서 열리는 토니 없는 토니 생파 이런 거 원조 키키
English: The original Kiki's birthday party, Tony's birthday party, which is held all over the country without Tony
Kiki, do you remember that?

Korean: 응칠에 보면 포카리 떴다! 하면서 막 그러더라고요. 그때 당시의 사생들이...
English: If you look at the response, Pocari appeared! and they were like that. The sasaengs at that time...
Pocari!

Korean: 그거 토니 파란색 데칼 붙어있는 차 이름 키키

Korean: 아 근데 저 그렇게 옛날에 극성 아니었어요!

Korean: 키키  그럼 ** 씨는 라이트팬에 가까워요 아니면 반대 쪽에 가까워요?
English: Kiki So, is ** closer to a light fan or is he closer to the opposite?
Teacher, what movie genre do you like?
I love romantic comedy!
Teacher, what genre do you like?
Oh me too, Loco! And SF!

Korean: 근데 좀비 나오는 거랑 막 추격전 같은 거 말고는 대충 다 보긴 해요.
English: But I watch pretty much everything except for the ones with zombies and chases.

Korean: 저는 공포는 보기 힘들어요. 근데 장화홍련은 보고 싶다는 생각은 했어요.

Have you seen it?

Oh really? Why?
Is the content very violent?

Haven't you seen that at all?
No, I didn't see it at all.

English: If the sound is scary, ah... covering your eyes won't help, then... Kiki

Korean: 그거는 음악이랑 배경 같은 게 무섭지 막 깜짝 놀라는 타입의 공포는 아니거든요.
English: It's not the type of horror that makes you jump in surprise, it's the music and background that's scary.

Korean: 방송에서 배경음 같은 걸로 쓰이는 거 들어보신 적 있으실 거예요 아마 키키
English: You may have heard it used as background music on a broadcast, probably Kiki

Korean: 근데 저는 그건 어떻게 보긴 했지만 다른 공포 영화는 거의 본 적 없어요.
English: But I've seen that one, but I've hardly seen any other horror movies.

Korean: 아 그렇군요. 저는 공포 영화 매니아인 친구가 있어서 알 포인트가 무섭다고 추천했었는데... 나는 볼 수가 없으니...
English: Oh, I see. I have a friend who is a horror movie fanatic and he recommended it to me because it's scary... But I can't watch it...
** Do you like romantic comedies?

Korean: 네 저 근데 영화 제목을 잘 기억을 못 해서...
English: Yeah, but I don't remember the movie title very well...

Korean: 요즘은 넷플릭스에서 만든 로코 많이 봤어요
English: I've been watching a lot of romantic comedies on Netflix lately.

Korean: 아 넷플릭스에 요새 영화 재밌는 거 많이 올라왔는데 혹시 킹덤 보셨나요?
English: Oh, there are a lot of interesting movies on Netflix these days. Have you seen Kingdom?

Korean: 쌤... 킹덤 그거 좀비 나오잖아요... 못 본다니깐... 하하
English: Teacher... There are zombies in Kingdom... I can't see it... Haha
Ah... Kiki

Korean: 저 공포 못 보는데 정확히는 서양 좀비를 못 보는데 이상하게 이건 볼 수 있더라고요. 키키
English: I can't see that horror, to be exact, I can't see western zombies, but strangely I can see this. Kiki

Korean: 혹시나 해서 한번 봐봐요. 재밌어요. 키키
English: Just in case, check it out. It's fun. Kiki
Ah... but zombies are a bit...

Korean: 근데 넷플릭스는 집에서 보니까 보다가 싫으면 끌 수 있으니까 한번 시도는 해 볼게요!
English: But since I can watch Netflix at home and turn it off if I don't like it, I'll give it a try!

Korean: 네네! 한번 시도해 봐요. 스토리도 나름 탄탄하고 재밌어요. 꼭 추천! 키키
English: Yes, yes! Give it a try. The story is solid and fun. I highly recommend it! Kiki
Sister, do you like cake among desserts?
Yeah I like cake!
Then what kind of cake do you like?
I like cheesecake
Do you like cake?
I like yogurt cake and sweet potato cake~
So do you like macarons?
Do you have yogurt cake?
Hear it for the first time.
I like macarons

Korean: 근데 너무 달아서 많이는 못 먹겠어
English: But it's too sweet so I can't eat much

Korean: 응 내가 요거트 아이스크림도 좋아해서 맛있더라
English: Yeah, I like yogurt ice cream too, it was delicious.
I like it because it's not too sweet
My friend recommended it to me and said it was delicious!

Korean: 맞아 마카롱 너무 달아서 2개 정도가 적당해
English: Yes, the macarons are so sweet that 2 is enough.

Korean: 오 나도 요거트 좋아하는데 케이크로는 맛이 상상이 안 가는데?
English: Oh, I like yogurt too, but I can't imagine how it would taste in cake.
I'm curious~
It's really delicious
Sell it to Tous Les Jours
Be sure to try it next time
Oh okay!
I'll try it
You really like yogurt!

Korean: 나도 좋아해서 집에 요거트 메이커도 있어
English: I like it too, so I have a yogurt maker at home.

Korean: 우리 집에도 있었는데 얼마 전에 망가졌어
English: We had one at home too, but it broke a while ago.

Korean: 근데 나는 달달한 요거트 좋아해 키키
English: But I like sweet yogurt Kiki

Korean: 우리 엄마는 안 단 요거트만 사 오고 먹어서 집에서는 잘 안 먹어
English: My mom only buys and eats plain yogurt, so I don't eat it much at home.
Oh really?

Korean: 난 단 거보다 그릭 요거트 진짜 좋아해
English: I really like Greek yogurt more than sweet.

Korean: 진짜? 언니는 단 거 별로 안 좋아하는 거 같더라!
English: Really? I don't think my sister likes sweets that much!
There are different types of sweets

Korean: 뭔가 완전 설탕 단맛 나는 건 별로 안 좋아하는 것 같아!
English: I don't think I like anything that's too sugary!
I see

Korean: 나는 그냥 내가 좋아하는 단맛이면 좋아
English: I just like whatever sweet I like
I don't like bitter sweetness.
I see!
Let's go eat together next time~
What floor do you think would be appropriate for an apartment?

Korean: 아파트는 전망은 높은 층이 좋은데 엘베가 좀 무서워서 중간층이 좋은 것 같아
English: The apartments on the higher floors have a good view, but the elevators are a bit scary, so I think a middle floor would be better.
About 5-6 floors?

Korean: 진짜? 나는 지금 15층인데 딱 좋은 거 같아
English: Really? I'm on the 15th floor right now and it seems perfect.

Korean: 근데 엘리베이터 하나밖에 없으면 빨리 나갈 때 힘들 거 같아서 그때는 좀 낮은 층이 나을 거 같아!
English: But if there's only one elevator, it might be hard to get out quickly, so I think a lower floor would be better!

Korean: 지금은 사는 집에 엘리베이터 여러 대야?
English: Are there multiple elevators in the house you live in now?
There are two now

Korean: 그래도 답답한데 다시 1대 있는 데 살면 엄청 답답할 거 같아 ㅜㅜ
English: It's still frustrating, but I think it'd be incredibly frustrating if I lived in a place with only one unit again ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 나는 세대가 안 많은데도 엘리베이터 1대라서 출근 시간에는 좀 답답할 때가 가끔 있더라
English: Yes, I don't live in a large building, but there's only one elevator, so it can sometimes be a bit stuffy during rush hour.

Korean: 그치 나는 한 층에 3세대인데 엘리베이터 1대가 나한테 오고 있으면 다른 하나는 안 움직이는 시스템이라 누가 오래 잡고 있으면 한참 기다려.
English: Right, I'm on the third floor, and the system is such that when one elevator is coming to me, the other one doesn't move, so if someone holds it for too long, I have to wait a long time.
Oh, I know what that is

Korean: 저번에 출근 시간에 위층에서 엘리베이터 계속 잡고 있어서 화났었어
English: I was upset last time when I was commuting to work because the elevator upstairs kept getting held up.

Korean: 그니까 화나 진짜 그리고 바쁠 때 꼭 타는 사람 많아서 계속 멈춘다고 ㅜㅜ
English: That's why I'm really mad and it keeps stopping because there are a lot of people who always get on when they're busy ㅜㅜ
Yeah, I really don't know what you're doing.

Korean: 난 그냥 오피스텔이라 자주는 아니긴 한데 넌 진짜 답답하겠다
English: I don't do it often because I just live in an officetel, but you must be really frustrated.

Korean: 응 ㅜㅜ 학교 다닐 때가 그런 경우 많았는데 요즘은 출근길 피해서 일찍 출근해서 그런지 거의 항상 나 혼자 타고 엘리베이터도 빨리 와서 좋아 하하
English: Yeah ㅜㅜ I used to have a lot of those when I was in school, but these days I avoid going to work and go to work early, so I'm almost always the only one riding the elevator and it comes quickly, so I like it haha
That's lucky~

Korean: 근데 너네 집은 층간 소음 스트레스 같은 거 없어?
English: But don't you have any stress from noise between floors in your house?

Korean: 한 번씩 시끄럽게 했었는데 그렇게 심하진 않아 언니는?
English: You were noisy once in a while, but it wasn't that bad, was it?

Korean: 나는 처음에 이사 왔을 때 새벽에 계속 가구 끌고 시끄럽게 해서 한 번 찾아갔었는데 이제 좀 괜찮아졌어 ㅜㅜ
English: When I first moved in, I went to visit them once because they kept dragging furniture and making noise in the early morning, but now it's a little better ㅜㅜ
Was it noisy because you moved from the floor above?
Yeah, I guess so
I'm glad you're okay now!
Sister, do you have a driver's license now?
Yeah, I have a license!
When did you get your driver's license?
I'm 16 years old?
I got it when I was on leave
Do you have a license?
No I don't have a license

Korean: 나도 따고 싶긴 한데 시간이 없기도 하고 어차피 차가 없어서 그런지 별로 급하지가 않아서 안 따게 돼 ㅜㅜ
English: I want to get it too, but I don't have time and I don't have a car anyway, so I'm not in a hurry, so I don't get it ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 맞아 나도 지금 거의 장롱 면허야.
English: Yeah, yeah, I'm almost a closet license holder now.

Korean: 1종 땄는데 기어 넣는 것도 다 까먹었어 키키
English: I got a type 1 but I forgot to put it in gear Kiki
Kiki, are you going to buy a car later?

Korean: 차 사고 싶을 때도 있는데 서울에 계속 있으면 필요 없을 것 같아
English: Sometimes I want to buy a car, but I don't think I'll need it if I stay in Seoul.

Korean: 맞아 서울은 차 너무 많아서 너무 막혀서 갖고 다니기 힘들 거 같아.
English: Yeah, Seoul has so many cars and the traffic is so congested that it would be difficult to get around.

Korean: 맞아 그리고 길도 복잡해서 자신도 없어 하하
English: Yeah and the road is complicated so I'm not confident haha

Korean: 초보 운전은 그냥 시골 길만 다닐래.
English: As a beginner driver, I just want to drive on country roads.

Korean: 키키 근데 나 지금 사는 데는 차 있으면 편한 동네야
English: Kiki But where I live now, it's a convenient neighborhood if you have a car.

Korean: 그래? 넌 근데 운전하는 거 안 무서울 것 같아?
English: Really? But you don't think driving is scary?
I think it's scary

Korean: 그리고 운전자들이 상대 보고 여자면 더 뭐라 잘 한다 그래서 안에 잘 안 보이게 하고 다닐 거 같아.
English: And drivers tend to criticize women more if they see them, so I think they drive around trying not to be seen.
Yeah, be careful when you do it later!
What do you think about working standing up?

Korean: 서서 하는 거 하지 정맥류 때문에 난 이제 너무 힘들어서 못하겠어 ㅠㅠ
English: I can't do it standing up anymore because of my varicose veins. It's too hard for me. ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 나도 서서 하는 거 싫어 너무 힘들어.
English: Yeah, I hate doing it standing up too. It's too hard.

Korean: 근데 이때까지는 거의 서서 일했던 것 같아 키키
English: But until now, I think I've been working mostly standing up, Kiki

Korean: 아르바이트는 보통 서서 하는 거긴 하지 ㅜㅜ
English: Part-time jobs usually involve standing up ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나도 앉아서 한 적 한 번도 없어.
English: I've never done it while sitting down either.

Korean: 맞아 그냥 학원에서 일할 때 한 번 앉아서 일했다!
English: Yeah, I just sat down and worked once when I was working at the academy!
What kind of part-time job have you done?
I've mainly focused on restaurants

Korean: 그래서 지금 앉아서 일하는 거 너무 좋아!
English: So I love sitting down and working now!
That's fortunate
Are you satisfied with your work? Isn't it difficult?
I don't think it's difficult yet
What about your sister?

Korean: 나도 힘든 일은 아직 크게 없는 것 같아
English: I don't think I've had any major difficulties yet.

Korean: 업무를 짧은 기간이지만 이것저것 많이 하게 되니까 재밌기도 해
English: It's fun because I get to do a lot of different things in a short period of time.

Korean: 맞아 근데 나는 업무를 처음 시작할 때 적응하는 게 조금 힘든데 적응하고 나면 재밌는 거 같아
English: Yeah, but I find it a little hard to adjust when I first start working, but once I get used to it, it's fun.
Yeah, everyone is like that haha

Korean: 그래도 계약 동안에 여러 가지 배워갈 수 있어서 좋을 것 같지 않아?
English: But don't you think it would be good to be able to learn a lot of things during the contract?

Korean: 맞아 경력도 쌓고 여러 가지 많이 배우고 좋아!
English: Yes, I like it because I'm building my career and learning a lot of different things!

Korean: 맞아 있는 동안 열심히 해서 많이 배워나가자!
English: Let's work hard and learn a lot while we're here!
Okay, let's study hard!
Yeah, let's continue to work hard in the future!

Korean: 예전에 진짜 사나이 티비 프로 했던 거 있는데 본 적 있어?
English: Have you seen the Real Man TV show that was on before?

Korean: 응응 진짜 사나이 본 적 있어!
English: Yeah, have you ever seen Real Man?
Looking at that, it must have been really hard ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 그것도 그런데 거기 근데 진짜 웃긴 거 많이 나왔었는데 키키
English: Yeah, that's true, but there were a lot of really funny things there, Kiki
Did you see the episode with Henry and Sam Hammington?
I think I've seen it before, Kiki
I think it was funnier because I was a foreigner
Right, is that Taekwondo?

Korean: 뭐 그런 거 하는 장면이었는데 진짜 웃겼어
English: It was a scene where they did something like that, and it was really funny

Korean: 지금도 한 번씩 유튜브 보면 올라오더라
English: Even now, if you look at YouTube, it comes up every now and then

Korean: 키키 진짜? 오래돼서 다 까먹었는데 유튜브 올라온 거 한번 봐야겠네
English: Kiki Really? It's been so long that I forgot everything, but I should watch the one that's on YouTube.

Korean: 그래! 그리고 무한도전에서 진짜 사나이 찍은 게 진짜 웃겼는데 그런 군대 체험 프로그램이 많았었네 그러고 보니 키키
English: Yeah! And the Real Man episode on Infinite Challenge was really funny, but there were a lot of military experience programs like that. Now that I think about it, Kiki

Korean: 나는 무한도전에서 한 거는 못 봤다 ㅜㅜ
English: I didn't see what happened on Infinite Challenge ㅜㅜ
I'll show you later

Korean: 지금도 웃긴 거 보고 싶으면 가끔 찾아봐. 하하
English: If you still want to see something funny, look it up sometimes. Haha

Korean: 키키 좋아 최근에도 유튜브에서 가짜 사나이 유행한 뒤로 군대 그런 프로그램 여러 개 했었잖아
English: Kiki, I like you. Recently, after Fake Man became popular on YouTube, there were a lot of military-related programs.

Korean: 아 맞아 가짜 사나이는 근데 한 번도 본 적 없어 넌?
English: Oh right, but have you never seen a fake man?

Korean: 응 나는 답답하고 화나는 거 안 좋아해서 일부러 안 봤어 언니는?
English: Yeah, I don't like feeling frustrated and angry, so I didn't watch it on purpose. What about you, Unnie?
Is that frustrating and upsetting?

Korean: 나도 그런 거 별로 안 좋아해. 키키
English: I don't like that kind of thing either, Kiki.

Korean: 나도 자세히는 모르는데 그런가 봐 ㅜㅜ
English: I don't know the details, but I think so ㅜㅜ
Yeah, that's what it says!
Do you tend to get nervous when taking tests?

Korean: 어 나 긴장 진짜 많이 하는 편이야 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh, I get really nervous ㅠㅠ
Me too ㅜㅜ

Korean: 평소에 잘 하다가도 시험만 되면 실력보다 안 나와.
English: Even if you usually do well, when it comes to tests, your performance doesn't match your abilities.

Korean: 맞아 진짜 그래서 진짜 연습할 때 최대한 120%는 만들어놔야 조금은 나오는 것 같아
English: That's right, that's why I think you have to practice at least 120% to get a little bit out of it.

Korean: 맞아 긴장해서 실수하는 것까지 생각해야 돼 ㅜㅜ
English: That's right, I have to think about making mistakes because I'm nervous ㅜㅜ
Yeah yeah

Korean: 난 심지어 저번 시험 때 약 먹고 시험 봤었어 키키
English: I even took medicine during the last exam Kiki
But my hands were shaking so much
Kiki, even if I take medicine, it doesn't work?

Korean: 심장박동 줄여주는 약이라서 손 떨림은 효과가 별로 없더라고
English: It's a medicine that reduces heart rate, so it doesn't really help with hand tremors.
Are your hands shaking too?

Korean: 그럼 이번 시험에는 안 먹을 거야?
English: So you're not going to eat it for this test?
Yeah my hands are shaking too ㅜㅜ
This time I'm going to eat it too!
I have to go get a prescription so
Oh, are you taking your prescribed medication?

Korean: 웅웅! 마지막 시험이면 좋겠다 이번이... 하하
English: Yeah! I hope this is the last exam... haha

Korean: 나도 그랬으면 좋겠는데 나중에 다른 자격증도 딸 거 같아서 마지막은 아닐 거 같아 키키
English: I wish I could do that too, but I think I'll get other qualifications later, so I don't think it'll be the last time Kiki
Ah, me too... Let's work hard!

Korean: 이 속기 시험 말이었어 얼마 안 남았는데
English: This shorthand test is almost here.
Okay, let's work hard for the remaining period!
Yeah, let's all do our best together!
Are you close with your brothers, sister?

Korean: 나 언니랑은 같이 살아서 좀 친하게 지내는데 오빠랑은... 그냥...
English: I live with my sister and we're pretty close, but with my brother... I just...
Just like that Kiki
Don't you usually keep in touch with your brother?
Only when you really need to contact me?

Korean: 근데 그럴 일이 잘 없어 하하
English: But that doesn't happen very often haha
What about you?

Korean: 나도 언니랑 같이 살아서 친한 편이야~
English: I also live with my older sister, so we're close~

Korean: 역시 성별이 같으면 좀 서로 의지하게 되는 것 같아
English: I think that if you are the same gender, you tend to rely on each other more.
right?

Korean: 맞아 말도 더 잘 통하니까 그런 거 같아
English: Yeah, I think it's because it makes more sense

Korean: 언니랑 나이 차이 얼마 안 나지?
English: There's not much of an age difference between you and your sister, right?
Did you go to school together?
Two years difference

Korean: 근데 같이 학교 다닌 기억은 딱히 없는 것 같아

Did your sister go with you?
When I was in first grade, my sister was in sixth grade.

Korean: 그래서 괴롭히는 애들 있으면 장난으로 가서 이르고 그랬던 기억 나 키키
English: So I remember when there were kids who were bullying me, I would go and tell them as a joke.
It was sturdy
i envy you

Korean: 언니는 나이 차이 진짜 많이 난다 키키

Korean: 키키 나도 그런 줄 알았는데 생각보다 나이 차이 더 많이 나는 사람들도 많더라!
English: Kiki, I thought so too, but there are a lot of people with a bigger age gap than I thought!

Korean: 나이 차이 많이 나는 형제 은근 많아
English: There are quite a few brothers with a big age gap.

Korean: 맞아 그리고 클수록 외동보다는 훨씬 덜 외로워서 형제 있는 게 좋은 것 같아
English: Yeah, and I think it's better to have siblings because you're less lonely as an only child.
Yeah, I think so too
Yeah, you think so too!

Korean: 아기 보는 건 정말 힘들 거 같아

Korean: 진짜 아무리 내 애기라도 내 삶이 없어지니까 행복하다가도 진짜 우울해질 것 같아
English: Seriously, even if it's my baby, I think I'll be really depressed if my life disappears even though I'm happy

Korean: 그치 행복도 큰 만큼 힘든 것도 크대
English: That's right, the greater the happiness, the greater the hardship.

Korean: 육아가 진짜 육체 노동이라 그러잖아 ㅜㅜ
English: They say that raising children is real physical labor ㅜㅜ

Korean: 맞아 친구 애기 사진으로 볼 때는 진짜 예뻤거든?
English: Yeah, when I looked at your friend's baby pictures, she was really pretty, right?

Korean: 근데 진짜 말 안 듣더라... 하하

Korean: 친구 너무 힘들어 보여서 마음 아팠어
English: My friend, it hurts my heart to see you having such a hard time.

Korean: 맞아. 근데 난 육아 프로그램 좋아해서 슈퍼맨이 돌아왔다 좋아했어
English: Yeah, but I like parenting shows, so I liked The Return of Superman.

Korean: 내가 육아 하는 거 아니라서 귀엽고 재밌더라 키키

Oh right Kiki

Korean: 난 그런 거 다 좋아했어 키키

What program did Jeong Woong-in appear on?
Ah, daddy where are you kiki

Korean: 그거 진짜 레전드 짤들 너무 웃겨
English: Those are really legendary memes, they're so funny
It's really funny and the youngest is so cute
I liked him the most Kiki
Ah, is that Da-yoon, the cute baby? Kiki

Korean: 어어 맞다 걔 진짜 아직도 찾아본다고

It was the cutest thing in the real world

Korean: 쪼꼬만 애가 먹을 것도 엄청 좋아하고

Korean: 맞아 나는 그 첫째 먹고 있는데 이 흔들리는 영상 알아?
English: Yeah I'm eating that first one and you know this shaking video?
Total chaos Kiki
That's really so funny ㅜㅜ
Oh I know that Kiki
It's so funny, I'm laughing so hard.

Hey, that's Kiki

Korean: 앞에 스태프한테 해주라고 하니까 예? 이러잖아 진짜 젤 웃겼어

Kiki is right, she's so cute
Yeah, yeah
That's so cute Kiki

Korean: 요즘엔 여러 종류의 동물들 많이 키우더라
English: These days, people raise many different kinds of animals.
Right, have you heard of water tech? Kiki
Water Tech, what is that?

Korean: 물고기 키워서 새끼 생기면 파는 거라는데
English: They say that they raise fish and sell the babies when they hatch.
A lot of people do that?
Oh my gosh

Korean: 그거 나 어릴 때도 많이 했었는데!

Oh really?
I just heard it for the first time recently
Oh really?

Korean: 근데 새끼 엄청 많이 낳아서 조금 키우던 사람들도 나중에 엄청 많아지더라
English: But since they had so many children, the number of people who raised them also increased later on.
Oh yeah right
It's more substantial than I thought, Kiki

Korean: 근데 내가 보던 유튜버는 그 목적으로 물테크 했다가 잘못 키웠는지 많이 죽어서 손해가 더 많다고 했어 키키
English: But the YouTuber I was watching said that he lost more money because he raised them wrong and many of them died for that purpose. Kiki

Korean: 걔네 살던 환경도 맞춰줘야 하고 까다로워.

Yeah, yeah, have you ever raised one?

Korean: 난 옛날에 금붕어 집에 키웠었던 것 같아

I've only raised goldfish~

I want to try raising one too!

Korean: 나는 물고기는 이제 안 키우고 싶어
English: I don't want to raise fish anymore

Korean: 막 만질 수 있는 동물 키우고 싶어
English: I want to raise an animal that I can touch

Korean: 난 마음의 안정도 되고 좀 좋을 것 같아 물고기도! 하하

I see

Korean: 나는 교감 할 수 있는 동물 키우고 싶어!

Sister, have you ever gone fishing?
Oh, once
I tried it in Jeju Island!

Oh, I think I heard that

Korean: 너무 열심히 팔로 들어 올리고 해서 그런가?

Korean: 어어 그때 처음이니까 어떻게 하는지 몰라서 그냥 손목을 너무 많이 썼나 봐...

Korean: 나 졸업 연주 준비하고 있었는데 당황했잖아. ㅠㅠ

Korean: 헉 그래서 졸업 연주 어떻게 됐어?

Korean: 그때 연주까지는 기한이 좀 남았어서 치료 받으면서 손목에 보호대하고 연습했었어
English: At that time, I had some time left until the performance, so I practiced while receiving treatment and wearing a wrist guard.

Korean: 다행히 연주 때는 심하지는 않더라. 하하

Korean: 나는 어릴 때 해본 거 같은데 기억도 안나
English: I think I did it when I was young, but I don't remember
I want to try again
Right Kiki
I was really surprised...

Korean: 제주도 가서 기회 되면 한번 해봐!

Korean: 고등어 잡아서 바로 먹었는데 진짜 맛있었어

Okay, okay
So have you been to the fishing cafe?
No, I haven't been there~
Have you been there, sister?

English: Yeah, I went there but I couldn't touch the fish so the owner kept taking them out... Kiki
I can't touch it either.

Korean: 특히 걸린 거 빼는 거는 더 못할 거 같아 ㅜㅜ

Yeah, it's so gross!

Korean: 어렸을 때 좋아했던 컴퓨터 게임 있어?

Korean: 나 바람의 나라랑 메이플 스토리 많이 했던 것 같아!

you?
Oh, I know it all
I really liked Tales Runner.
I haven't done that!
That Alt-Beat? You know that game?
Oh, I've heard of it, but what was it?

Korean: 그 카트라이더 같은 건데 사람이 하는 거 스케이트 신고!
English: It's like Kart Rider, but with people wearing skates!
I don't remember very well, Kiki
I loved that so much

Kiki, maybe it was

You know... you know that ramen shop?
Ahh Shu's Ramen Shop Kiki
I know, I know, it was fun

Korean: 솔직히 성인 되고 나서도 좀 생각났어

I wanted to do that sometimes
Kiki, is that game gone now?
Yeah, I think it disappeared ㅠㅠ
I'm really sorry Kiki
Animal Farm? I've done that a lot.
There are a lot of fun games on Naver

Korean: 아 대박 동물농장 나 엄청 좋아했어.
English: Oh my goodness, I loved Animal Farm so much.
Yeah, I played a lot of games on Naver

Korean: 맞아 다들 그랬던 것 같아! 하하
English: Yeah, I think everyone did that! Haha

Korean: 여행할 때 맛집 미리 찾아보고 가는 편이야?

Korean: 응응 미리 찾아보긴 하는데 그 지역에서 택시 기사 아저씨들한테 물어봐.
English: Yeah, I do look it up in advance, but I ask the taxi drivers in the area.
Please tell me a really good restaurant

Korean: 나 속초 갔다가 맛집이라 해서 갔는데 맛없었어.

Korean: 진짜? 난 블로그는 일단 안 믿어. 키키
English: Really? I don't trust blogs. Kiki
There were too many ads, what is this?

Korean: 난 그래서 칠 때 무조건 내가 치는 맛집 이름 뒤에 내돈내산 붙여
English: That's why I always add "my money, my country" after the name of the restaurant I'm going to.
Then it's not an advertisement Kiki
This is a great tip, keep that in mind ^^
Kiki, who I bought with my own money, is cute

Korean: 역시 먹을 거에 진심이야 진짜 키키

Korean: 난 택시 기사님이나 주변에서 물어보면 맛있는 곳 잘 알려주더라고 그런 식으로 많이 성공했었어!
English: I've had a lot of success that way, by asking taxi drivers or people around me, they'll tell me about good places!
Daebak, you're lucky

Korean: 나도 물어보는 방법 다시 한번 시도해 볼게.
English: I'll try asking again.
Have you been to Gwangju?
Gwangju, Jeollanam-do!
No, you haven't been there?

Korean: 왜? 시장수호대라고 시장 살리기 그런 프로젝트 참여하면서 견학 겸 갔었는데 진짜 좋더라고 맛집도 많고.
English: Why? I went there on a field trip while participating in a project called Market Protection Corps to revitalize the market, and it was really nice. There were a lot of good restaurants.
Oh, I should go and play later!

Korean: 응 진짜 코로나 때문에 지금은 야시장 이런 거 운영 못하겠지만 괜찮아지면 다음에 가봐
English: Yeah, really, because of Corona, we can't operate a night market right now, but if it gets better, go next time.
I'll tell you about a good beer place haha
Oh good good
Traveling is always great!

Korean: 맞아 자유롭게 여행 좀 다니자 코로나야~
English: That's right, let's travel freely, Corona~

Korean: 코로나 끝나면 우리도 넷이 놀러 가자!
English: When Corona is over, the four of us should go out and play!
Yeah, that's so good!
What season were you born, sister?
I was born in the dead of winter
you?
Oh, what month was it?
Me too, it's totally winter!
I'm in January!
You want me to guess?
It's December, right? Or not?

Korean: 맞아 맞아 우리 한 달 차이네 ^^
English: Yeah, yeah, we're one month apart ^^
Do I have a good memory?
Watch and learn!
I remembered it as soon as you asked!
People should be honest! Kiki

Korean: 근데 자기가 태어난 계절 보통 좋아한다던데 난 추위를 너무 많이 타서 솔직히 좋은 지는 모르겠어
English: But they say people usually like the season they were born in, but I get cold so much that I honestly don't know if I like it
Kiki this is real
I also think spring and fall are the best
Do you know the song Winter Child?

Korean: 아 알지 알지 생일 때 친구도 불러주고 나도 부르는 노래잖아 키키
English: Oh, I know, I know, it's the song that my friends sing and I sing on my birthday, Kiki
What season were you born, sister?

Korean: 맞아 맞아 괜히 겨울에 태어나서 그 노래 좋아했었어
English: That's right, that's right, I was born in winter for nothing and liked that song

Korean: 어릴 때 노래방 가서 많이 불렀었는데 키키
English: When I was young, I used to go to karaoke and sing a lot, Kiki

Korean: 키키 맞아 역시 겨울에 태어난 사람들 특징이구만
English: Kiki, that's right. That's a characteristic of people born in winter.
What season were you born, sister?
That's why everyone is cute, Kiki
Yeah haha it's really cute!
Yeah, we're so cute!
Do you know that Park Soo-hong is all the rage these days?

Korean: 아니 제대로 못 본 것 같은데
English: No, I don't think I saw it properly
what's the matter?

Korean: 나이 차이 엄청 많이 차이 나는 여자랑 결혼했잖아
English: I married a woman who was a lot older than me.

Korean: 아 완전 어린 사람이랑 결혼한 거지?
English: Oh, you married a really young person?
Yeah, I think I was in my 20s...
Oh my... isn't that too much?

Korean: 근데 나이가 중요하지 않다고 하지만 난 개인적으로 진짜 이해할 수가 없어. 서로 관심이 가는 것부터가...
English: But they say that age doesn't matter, but I personally really can't understand it. The fact that they're interested in each other...

Korean: 나도 아빠뻘인데... 너무 싫을 거 같아
English: I'm the same age as my dad... I think I'd hate it so much
Oh, so that's it!
Don't you feel the generation gap?

Korean: 맞아 연예인들은 나이 차이 엄청 많이 나는데 사귀는 사람 꽤 많은 거 같아
English: That's right, I think there are quite a few celebrities who date people with a huge age gap.

Korean: 이게 연예인들은 나이가 가늠이 사실 잘 안 되는 것 같아.
English: I think it's hard to guess the age of celebrities.

Korean: 매일 TV로 접하고 또 나이에 비해서 젊어 보이는 사람들이 너무 많아서
English: We see so many people on TV every day who look younger than their age.

Korean: 맞아 그리고 특히 돈도 많으니까 돈 보고 하는 경우도 많은 거 같아
English: Yes, and especially since they have a lot of money, I think they often do it for money.

Korean: 맞아 그런 경우도 없지는 않을 것 같다 뭔가 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I guess that's not the case. Something like that ㅠㅠ

Korean: 안 좋게 보면 안 되지만 일반인들한테도 영향이 많이 끼쳐지는 것 같아서... 연예인들이 어떤 이슈가 되면
English: I don't want to look at it negatively, but I think it has a big impact on ordinary people as well... When celebrities become an issue,
Yeah, yeah

Korean: 이번에 그 하정우 아버지도 39살 차인가 여자 임신시켜서 논란됐잖아 이름 뭐더라
English: This time, Ha Jung-woo's father was also involved in controversy because he got a 39-year-old woman pregnant. What was his name?
Ah, Kim Yong-geon!
Are you crazy?
Ah, right, right
That's even more shocking.
So it's really shocking.

Korean: 그 인도 소년이 예언한 거 봤어?
English: Did you see what that Indian boy predicted?
Yeah, I saw it
It'll be okay starting in November!

Korean: 그치 그리고 내년 5월인가에 아예 마스크 벗는다는 거 봤는데 진짜 그랬으면 좋겠다...
English: Yeah, and I saw that they're going to take off their masks completely in May next year, I really hope that happens...

Korean: 그러니까 솔직히 지금은 마스크 벗는 세상이 상상이 안 가는데 그때는 이때 어떻게 마스크 쓰고 다녔지 이 생각 들겠지? 키키
English: So honestly, I can't imagine a world where we can take off our masks now, but back then, I wonder how we could have worn masks? Kiki

English: Yeah, I guess it's become a habit to take off your mask when eating.

Korean: 근데 나는 마스크 못 벗을 거 같아
English: But I don't think I can take off my mask

Korean: 바이러스는 계속 변이하는데 그게 내년이라고 괜찮아질 것 같지가 않아...
English: The virus keeps mutating, so I don't think things will get any better next year...
I think so too

Korean: 그리고 코로나가 괜찮아지면 또 다른 바이러스가 생긴다고 하잖아 ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 그리고 빙하가 녹으면 얼어있던 고대 바이러스도 퍼질 거라는 얘기도 있어.
English: That's right, and there's also talk that as the glaciers melt, frozen ancient viruses will spread.
It's really scary...

Korean: 맞아 그거 듣고 좀 소름 돋았어
English: Yeah, that gave me goosebumps when I heard that

Korean: 인간이 이렇게 다 만든 거잖아 ㅠㅠ
English: Humans made everything like this ㅠㅠ

Korean: 지금부터 다 노력하면 괜찮아질 수 있을까
English: If I try my best from now on, will things be okay?
I don't know

Korean: 나는 지구 멸망을 겪고 싶지 않아... 키키
English: I don't want to experience the destruction of the Earth... Kiki
Right ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아무튼 저 인도 소년 예언 진짜 많이 적중했던데 이번에도 맞았으면 좋겠다
English: Anyway, that Indian boy's prophecy really came true a lot, so I hope it comes true this time too.
right
Yeah I hope this is true

Korean: 응 맞으면 바로 해외로 도망갈 거야!

I want to go out and play as much as I want ㅜㅜ
Good idea Kiki
Let's wait until November ㅠㅠ
Okay, let's wait until November!
Yeah, let's wait hard together!
Do you go to a beauty salon near your house?

Korean: 미용실 아직 집 근처에서는 한 번도 안 가봤어
English: I haven't been to a beauty salon near my house yet.

Korean: 그럼 미용실 계속 다른 데 가?

Korean: 흠 원래 진주랑 울산에서는 가던 선생님한테만 받았었는데...

Korean: 서울에서는 아직 한 번밖에 안 가봤어

But it wasn't that great

Korean: 맞아 별로인데 많아서 괜찮은데 골라서 거기로만 가야 돼
English: Yeah, it's not that great, but there are a lot of them so it's okay, but you have to pick and go there.
What about you?
Do you have anywhere to go?
I always have a place to go!
Oh, that would be great!
Do you like it there?

Korean: 응 맘에 들어서 항상 거기로 가!
English: Yeah, I like it so I always go there!
thank god

Korean: 근데 서울 미용실 진짜 비싸 키키

Korean: 난 다니는 곳이 가격이 싸서 다니는 것도 있는데 키키
English: I go to places that are cheap, but I also go to Kiki

Korean: 오 난 조금은 비싸도 되니까 제발 잘 해줬으면 좋겠어 키키
English: Oh I don't mind paying a little bit more, but please do it well Kiki

Korean: 울산에 살 때 선생님이 진짜 좋았어 엄청 꼼꼼하고
English: When I lived in Ulsan, I really liked my teacher. He was very thorough.

Korean: 그치 그럼 이제 다시 괜찮은 곳 찾아야겠네
English: Okay, then I guess I'll have to find a better place now.
Yeah, I'm a beauty salon nomad right now

Korean: 그나마 지금은 머리 기르고 있어서 다행인 것 같아!
English: I guess I'm lucky that I'm growing my hair out now!

Korean: 그러네 난 무조건 파마를 해야 돼서 미용실 중요해!
English: Yes, I absolutely have to get a perm, so a hair salon is important!
I see. Beauty salons are important!

Korean: 건강하게 살기 위해 어떤 노력을 할 수 있을까?
English: What can we do to live a healthy life?

Korean: 너처럼 살면 건강할 수 있을 것 같아... 하하 운동 열심히 하고 잘 챙겨 먹고
English: I think I can be healthy if I live like you... haha, exercise hard and eat well

Korean: 키키 근데 난 몸에 안 좋은 것도 많이 먹어서 ㅜㅜ
English: Kiki but I eat a lot of things that are not good for my health ㅜㅜ

Korean: 아 맞아 근데 식도염 때문에 강제로 건강식만 먹어봤는데 행복하지가 않아...
English: Oh right, but I forced myself to eat only healthy foods because of esophagitis, and I'm not happy...

Korean: 맞아 건강만을 위해서 살면 행복하지가 않아.
English: That's right. If you live only for health, you won't be happy.

Korean: 맞아 근데 운동 꾸준히 다니는 건 진짜 좋은 것 같아!
English: Yeah, but I think it's really good to exercise regularly!
Yes, I will continue to exercise in the future!

Korean: 응응 우리 집 바로 앞에도 크로스핏 생겼던데 너 생각났어
English: Yeah, yeah, I thought of you because there was a CrossFit right in front of my house.

Korean: 아 진짜? 근데 가짜 크로스핏도 많대

Korean: 진짜 크로스핏은 외국에서 승인 받아야 된다더라
English: They say real CrossFit has to be approved abroad.
Really? There's something like that?
That's new
Yeah, I'll have to look into it carefully.

Korean: 나도 크로스핏 아예 모르다가 여기 다니고서 알게 됐어!
English: I didn't know anything about CrossFit until I started coming here!
I see
I'm going to go climbing too!
Please cheer me on so I can have a great body
Okay, show me your fit body!

Korean: 응응 너도 운동도 하면서 먹을 것도 한 끼 정도는 꼭 건강식으로 챙겨 먹어
English: Yeah, you should exercise too and eat healthy food at least once a day.
Okay, I will do that from now on!
Yeah, try that!
Where to buy used cars?

Korean: 인터넷으로 가격 비교하는 사이트가 많던데 보통 그런 데서 비교해보고 사지 않을까?
English: There are many price comparison sites on the Internet, so don't you usually compare prices there before buying?
There are a lot of scams with used cars too.

Korean: 맞아 근데 중고 거래 자체가 진짜 조심해야 하는 것 같아 ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 물에 빠졌던 차나 불 났던 차 같은 것도 깨끗하게 수리해서 정상 가격으로 팔고 그러더라고
English: That's right, they repair cars that have been in water or caught on fire and sell them at a regular price.

Korean: 앗 맞아 침수차 진짜 조심해야 한다고 하더라!
English: Oh right, they said you really have to be careful with the water truck!

Korean: 전에 중고차 거래 해본 적 있는데 아무것도 모르던 때라서 그냥 샀더니 나중에 잔고장이 진짜 많았었어
English: I've traded used cars before, but I didn't know anything so I just bought it and it ended up having a lot of minor issues later on.
Oh really?

Korean: 그 호주에서는 차 없으면 다니기가 힘들었었거든 그래서 거기서 처음 거래도 해보고 운전도 해봤어
English: In Australia, it was hard to get around without a car, so I did my first transaction there and also drove.

Korean: 헉 심지어 외국에서 차 거래를 했다니 대단하네
English: Wow, you even traded cars overseas. That's amazing.
Did you buy it by talking directly in English?
No, I was dealing with a Korean.

Korean: 인터넷 사이트로 찾아보고 만나서 확인하고 했었는데 무서웠어 ㅠㅠ
English: I searched on the internet and met them to check, but I was scared ㅠㅠ
scared...
I have to take the man
It's dangerous to go alone...

Korean: 맞아 근데 혼자 사는 거 아니고 친구랑 같이 샀었어!
English: That's right, but I didn't live alone, I lived with a friend!

Korean: 알고 보니까 이것저것 손댈 게 많아서 차 가격보다 수리비가 더 많이 나가더라 ^^
English: When I looked into it, there were so many things to fix that the repair cost was more than the price of the car ^^
That's fortunate

Korean: 진짜 중고차도 제대로 알아보고 사야 돼
English: You really have to do your research before buying a used car.

Korean: 예전에 생활의 달인 같은 데에 차 잘 보는 법 나왔었는데 나중에 살 때 참고하자
English: There was a show about how to look at cars well on a show like Life Master before, so I'll refer to it when I buy one later.

Korean: 그래? 그럼 이제 너가 보고 나서 알려주면 되겠다 하하!

Korean: 맞아 요즘에 폰으로 전부다 다시 보기 하기가 쉬워져서 나도 항상 폰으로 봐!
English: Yeah, these days it's easy to rewatch everything on your phone, so I always watch it on my phone too!

Korean: 폰으로 보면 방에서 편하게 할 수 있어!

Korean: 맞아 넷플릭스 같은 걸로 드라마도 완결 나면 몰아서 봐!

I hate waiting

English: I don't watch dramas often because they're so long that I end up watching them all night long, so I haven't seen any dramas recently...

Korean: 나도 최근에는 바빠서 본 적 없어 ㅠㅠ

Korean: 슬기로운 시리즈는 다 본 것 같다.

Really? I didn't see it.

Korean: 여름에는 항상 공포 영화가 많이 나오는 거 같아

Korean: 맞아 난 공포 영화 무서워서 잘 안 봐. 하하

Korean: 나는 무서워서 아니고 공포 영화는 놀래키기만 하고 내용이 없어서 재미 없어서 안 봐
English: I don't watch horror movies because they're scary, but they're just scary and don't have any content, so they're not fun.
Watch a movie that scares people

Korean: 근데 사람 무서운 게 사실 더 무서워 키키

It's something that is displayed in each apartment building
Oh, is that hide and seek?

Korean: 헉 나는 너무 오래돼서 잊고 지냈어

Korean: 그치 그때 너무 인상 깊었었나 봐 나한테 습관적으로 확인하게 되더라고
English: I guess it must have been so impressive at the time that he started checking with me out of habit.

Korean: 근데 그거 실제로 그런 방법으로 사람 수랑 성별 확인한다는 얘기 있었어
English: But there was talk of actually checking the number of people and their gender in that way.

Korean: 응응 여자 혼자 사는 집마다 표시하고 그런다고 하더라고

Korean: 그런 영화 보면 진짜 범죄 수법 사람들이 따라할 것 같아서 좀 무서워
English: When I watch movies like that, I get a little scared because I think real criminals would follow those methods.

Korean: 근데 범죄 하는 애들은 어차피 할 애들이라...

Korean: 아무튼 난 공포 영화나 느와르 영화나 다 잘 못 봐
English: Anyway, I'm not good at watching horror movies or noir movies.

Korean: 그럼 데리고 가서 강제로 보게 해야겠다

Korean: 여름에는 항상 공포 영화가 많이 나오는 거 같아
English: It seems like there are always a lot of horror movies coming out in the summer.

Korean: 나 진짜 반은 눈 감고 있을 걸?

That's okay though

Korean: 여름에는 항상 공포 영화가 많이 나오는 거 같아
English: It seems like there are always a lot of horror movies coming out in the summer.
It'll stick to you like gum haha!
Do you like desserts?

Korean: 응 나 완전 좋아해 내가 어제 빨미까레 먹고 싶다 그랬잖아!
English: Yeah, I really like it. I told you yesterday that I wanted to eat red curry!

Korean: 나 그거 오늘도 역시 먹고 싶어!

Korean: 나도 ㅠㅠ 나는 어제 노티드 도넛 먹었는데 앉은 자리에서 3개는 먹을 수 있을 거 같은데 1개 반밖에 못 먹어서
English: Me too ㅠㅠ I ate a notched donut yesterday and I think I could eat 3 while sitting down but I could only eat one and a half
I feel like I've just taken a shit...

Korean: 그래서 먹을 때 내 생각은 안 했고?
English: So you didn't think about me when you ate?

Korean: 나도 디저트 좋아하니까 종종 생각해줘 그럼 키키
English: I like desserts too, so think of me often. Then Kiki

Korean: 아~ 무슨 소리~ 당연히 못 했지! ^^ 미안 미안.

I want to eat butter right now

Korean: 그 노티드 앙버터 도넛 먹고 싶다구? 노티드에는 민트초코는 없어? 궁금해...
English: You want that Noted Amber Butter Donut? Noted doesn't have mint chocolate? I wonder...

Korean: 노티드에 민트초코 있는데 배달 가능 메뉴는 한정적이더라구 ㅠㅠ
English: There's mint chocolate in Noted, but the delivery menu is limited ㅠㅠ

Korean: 민트초코 특이한 거 뭐 먹어본 거 있어?

Korean: 내가 오늘 아침에 민트초코 단백질 쿠키란 걸 먹었는데 나 태어나서 그렇게 화한 쿠키 처음 먹어봤잖아...
English: I had a mint chocolate protein cookie this morning and it's the best cookie I've ever had in my life...

Korean: 오, 뭔가 말만 들으면 맛있을 거 같은데!
English: Oh, just hearing it makes it sound delicious!
Mint chocolate soju? Honestly, it's crossing the line;

Korean: 먹어봤어? 그거 보기만 했는데 후기가 어때?

Korean: 아니 안 먹어봤어. 그냥 내 추측이었어 하하

Korean: 아 뭐여 먹어봐서 선 넘었다는 줄! 나중에 어떤가 먹어보러 가 보자구
English: Oh, what the heck? I thought I crossed the line by eating it! Let's go eat it later and see what it's like.

Korean: 키키 아 혼란 줘서 미안 미안 ^^! 좋아.
English: Kiki, sorry for the confusion ^^! Okay.

Korean: 그럼 그럼 혹시 감자전을 추가해도 되니?
English: Then, then, can I add potato pancakes?

Korean: 나 지금 감자가 몸에 부족해서 힘들어 나 감자 엄청 좋아해서 키키
English: I'm having a hard time right now because I don't have enough potatoes. I really like potatoes. Kiki
Kiki, that's very possible!

Korean: 언니 옥수수도 좋아하고 감자도 하네? 그러면 고구마도 좋아하겠네? 맞지?
English: Sister, you like corn and potatoes too? Then you like sweet potatoes too, right? Right?

Korean: 아휴 그걸 또 틀렸네 고구마는 별로 안 좋아해...
English: Oh man, I got that wrong again. I don't really like sweet potatoes...

Korean: 언니는 집을 언니 취향대로 꾸미는 편이야?
English: Does your sister decorate her house according to her taste?

Korean: 내 자리를 보면 정신이 하나도 없잖아... 그럴 리 없지! 너는 방 잘 꾸며놨어?
English: If you look at my room, I'm completely out of my mind... No way! Did you decorate your room well?

Korean: 언니는 집을 언니 취향대로 꾸미는 편이야?
English: Does your sister decorate her house according to her taste?

Korean: 언니, 내 자리도 봐 줘. 어떨 거 같아? 하하
English: Sister, please take a look at my seat too. What do you think? Haha
There's just a place to put your feet and lie down~

Korean: 우리 자리만 복작복작 난리도 아닌 거 이미 알고 있었어...
English: I already knew that our place wasn't the only one in chaos...

Korean: 그럼 소품 하나 살 수 있으면 어떤 걸로 꾸며볼 테야?
English: So, if you could buy one prop, what would you decorate it with?

Korean: 나는 우선 예쁜 조명을 하나 장만할 테야! 조명만 있어도 분위기가 좀 살더라고~
English: First of all, I'm going to get a pretty light! Just having a light makes the atmosphere come alive~

Korean: 맞아! 나는 그래서 무드등가습기로 분위기 좀 살렸었지 예전에 키키
English: That's right! That's why I used a mood light humidifier to liven up the atmosphere. Kiki

Korean: 근데 뜬금없지만 나 정말 독립하고 싶다.
English: But out of the blue, I really want to be independent.
Very strict, solemn and serious.

Korean: 그래 진지하게 언제쯤 나와 살아볼 거야?
English: Seriously, when are you going to live with me?

Korean: 독립 선배로서 어서 나오길 내가 지금 예전부터 기다리고 있는데!
English: As an independent senior, I've been waiting for you to come out for a long time!

Korean: 그러면 조금만 더 기다려 줘. >< 독립하게 되면 바로 초대할게!
English: Then please wait a little longer. >< I'll invite you as soon as I become independent!

Korean: 어서 나오라구~ 내가 휴지랑 이것 저것 들고 놀러 갈랭!
English: Come out! I'm going to go play with some tissues and stuff!

Korean: 벌써 설레는군^^ 언니 몸만 와. 내가 맛있는 거 해 줄게.
English: I'm already excited^^ Just come here, unnie. I'll make you something delicious.

Korean: 오 거기에 이제 선물을 곁들여볼 건데 그럼 어떤 게 갖고 싶어?
English: Oh, I'm going to add a gift to that now. What do you want?
I have so many, can you handle them?
I'll extract the list into Excel and send it to you haha >
I can't afford it~
Just say one thing, just one thing...
You don't have to put in that much effort!
Then I'll wear cute pajamas >

Korean: 그렇다면 내가 언니 집 놀러 가도 되는 부분?
English: Then, can I go to my sister's house to play?
You can come to our house!

Korean: 산 넘고 물 건너서 놀러 오세요~
English: Come play across mountains and rivers~
Welcome!
Sister, do you like cars?
I think the Mini Cooper is pretty.

Korean: 이쁘긴 하더라 그게 맘에 들어! 너는?
English: It's pretty, I like it! What about you?

Korean: 맞아 미니 예쁜데 가성비 별로라던데 일단 차가 있는 게 어디야~ 그쵸잉?
English: Yeah, the Mini is pretty, but I heard it's not very cost-effective. Where can I get a car? Right?
I like SUVs.

Korean: 오 나도 SUV 괜찮은 거 같아!
English: Oh, I think SUV is fine too!

Korean: 쌍용에 티볼리가 괜찮다고 하던데 나 그거 사고 싶었었어!
English: I heard that Ssangyong's Tivoli is good, so I wanted to buy that!

Korean: 그래서 우리는 장롱면허지만 차를 살 생각은 있어?
English: So we have a car license but are you thinking of buying a car?
My friend Tivoli is okay!

Korean: 차 있으면 편하고 좋을 거 같지만
English: It would be convenient and nice to have a car, but

Korean: 차 사면 이제 정말 원래도 그렇지만 빈털털이가 될 거 같아. 언니는?
English: If I buy a car, I feel like I'll end up broke, just like I was before. What about you, sister?

Korean: 맞아! 그래서 나는 리스를 생각해보고 있긴 한데
English: Right! So I'm thinking about resigning.
How can I overcome my fear of driving?

Korean: 오오, 그럼 그럼! 내 친구 정말 겁쟁이인데 살살 매일 연습하더니 이제는 베스트 드라이버가 돼가고 있어!
English: Oh, then that's right! My friend is such a coward, but he practices little by little every day and now he's becoming the best driver!
Really? I want to practice too!

Korean: 근데 운전도 운전인데 주차가 너무 어렵지 않아?
English: But isn't parking too difficult, let alone driving?

Korean: 맞아. 예전에 폰으로 주차 게임은 아주 잘해서 자신만만 했는데 실전은 너무 다르더라. 역시 인생은 실전이야?
English: That's right. I used to be really good at parking games on my phone, so I was confident, but real life is so different. After all, life is real life, right?

Korean: 그럼 그럼! 나 아빠가 주차 가르쳐줬는데 사실 그거 아빠가 주차한 거야.
English: Okay, okay! My dad taught me how to park, but it was actually my dad who parked the car.
I guess it's too stuffy I'm Kiki

Korean: 키키 아 아빠가 운전 잘 가르쳐 주셔?
English: Kiki, did your dad teach you how to drive well?

Korean: 나는 엄마한테 한 번 배웠다가 다시는 엄마랑은 안 타 하하 이유는 알겠지?
English: I learned it from my mom once and I'll never ride with her again haha you know why?

Korean: 우리 엄마는 내가 운전하면 그 차를 안 타. 그 이유 역시 알겠지?
English: My mom won't let me drive her car. You know why, right?
I'm good at braking though...
After all, family is family~ ^^!

Korean: 브레이크 잘 잡으면 솔직히 반 이상은 한 거라고 생각해.
English: If you hold the brakes well, I honestly think you're more than halfway there.

Korean: 그러니까 진짜 부드럽게 잘 밟았는데도 엄마가 얼마나 뭐라 그러던지...
English: So, even though I stepped on it really gently, my mom kept saying things like...

Korean: 사실 운전도 그 정도면 아빠가 한 거 같기도 하고!?
English: Actually, it seems like my dad did the driving too!?

Korean: 운전 빨리 먼저 배워서 나를 가르쳐주는 건 어때...?
English: How about you learn to drive quickly first and then teach me...?

Korean: 키키 오, 그게 얼마나 빨리 될지 모르겠는데 각오가 됐다면 한번 시도해 보자! 한 5년 뒤 만나!
English: Kiki Oh, I don't know how fast it will be, but if you're ready, give it a try! See you in about five years!

Korean: 안 되겠다... 내가 먼저 베스트 드라이버 되는 게 빠르겠당 하하
English: No way... I guess it'd be faster if I became the best driver first haha

Korean: 요즘 시국엔 회식을 못 하잖아. 어떻게 생각해?
English: These days, we can't have company dinners. What do you think?

Korean: 나는 회식 못 하는 건 좋은데 친구나 동기들 여러 명이서 같이 뭐 못하는 건 좀 많이 별로야!
English: I don't mind not being able to have company dinners, but I really don't like not being able to do things with my friends or colleagues!

Korean: 나도 ㅠㅠ 퇴근하고 동료들이랑 시원하게 소맥 한잔 못한다니 정말 슬퍼.
English: Me too ㅠㅠ I'm really sad that I can't have a cold drink of soju with my colleagues after work.

Korean: 맞아! 약간 그럴려고 회사 나오는 맛도 있는 건데
English: Yeah! It's a bit fun to come out to work for that reason.

Korean: 여러 동료랑 얘기도 나누고 싶은데 이게 이렇게 힘들다고 진짜!? 않
English: I want to talk to my colleagues, but is it really this hard?

Korean: 그러니까 동기 사랑 나라 사랑 동료 사랑인데 말이야. 그치?
English: So, it's love for one's motives, love for one's country, and love for one's colleagues. Right?
That's why lunch time is so precious.

Korean: 그럼 점심시간 즐겁게 보내려고 회사 나오는 것도 있지!
English: Then, there are also times when I leave the company to have fun during lunch time!

Korean: 그래서 점심시간에 동료들이랑 잘 얘기하면서 지내고 있어?
English: So, are you having a nice time chatting with your colleagues during lunch?

Korean: 응응. 나는 수다쟁이이기 때문에 사실 점심시간도 너무 부족하고 아쉬워. 언니도지? 다 알아.
English: Yeah, yeah. I'm a chatterbox, so I actually feel like lunch time is too short and I regret it. Do you know, Unnie? I know everything.

Korean: 같은 부류 사람인 거 알고 있었어 나도 키키
English: I knew we were the same type of people, me too Kiki
I'm really chatty...

Korean: 나 얘기를 하도 많이 해서 목이 쉬는 스타일인데 일하면서는 얘기 잘 못해서 지금 많이 힘들어.
English: I'm the type of person who gets hoarse from talking so much, but I can't talk much while I'm working, so I'm having a hard time right now.

Korean: 대신 목이 싱싱하겠다 요즘은! 그러면 출근할 때는 집에서 몇 시쯤 출발해?
English: Instead, your throat must be fresh these days! Then, what time do you leave home for work?
I catch the bus around 7:15!

Korean: 그래서 일찍 내려서 천천히 여유를 조금 즐겨...
English: So, get off early and enjoy some leisure time...
Do you tend to leave work early?
What a great guy who enjoys his free time!

Korean: 나는 7시 반쯤 나오면 딱 알맞게 회사에 도착해.
English: If I leave around 7:30, I arrive at the office just in time.
Any earlier than that... it's hard hehe...
It takes forever to get to work ㅜㅜ

Korean: 나는 그래도 가까운 편이라서... 그러면 아침에 주로 지하철로 서서 오겠네?
English: But I'm still close by... So I guess I'll mostly take the subway in the morning?

Korean: 맞아 ㅠㅠ 그래서 다리가 너무 아파.
English: Yeah ㅠㅠ That's why my legs hurt so much.

Korean: 그리고 지하철은 계속 실내라서 너무 답답해 힝~ ㅠㅠ
English: And the subway is always indoors so it's so stuffy, ugh~ ㅠㅠ
I like looking outside...

Korean: 맞다! 근데 버스는 없고 오래 걸린다고 했지?
English: Right! But you said there's no bus and it takes a long time?

Korean: 응 ㅠㅠ 버스는 한 시간에 1대도 안 다녀서 승객을 태우겠다는 건지 말겠다는 건지 모르겠더라고 하하
English: Yeah ㅠㅠ The bus doesn't even run once an hour so I don't know if they're going to pick up passengers or not haha

Korean: 언니는 그럼 버스 안 막히면 금방 도착하겠다!?
English: Sister, if the bus doesn't get stuck, we'll get there soon!?

Korean: 응 나는 기사 아저씨가 막 질주하면 30분이면 강남역에 도착해!
English: Yeah, I can get to Gangnam Station in 30 minutes if the driver keeps driving!

Korean: 최근에 군대에서 의료 사고? 난 거 들었어? ㅠ
English: Medical accidents in the military recently? I heard about that? ㅠ
No? What the heck, a medical accident?
I hope it works out well...

Korean: 나는 최근에 본 뮤지컬이 군 뮤지컬인데 혹시 너도 봤니?
English: The most recent musical I saw was a military musical. Have you seen it too?

Korean: 오, 나도 군 뮤지컬 하나 봤는데 언니는 뭘 봤어?
English: Oh, I saw a military musical too. What did you see, Sister?

Korean: 나는 귀환이라고 작년까지 했었던 군 뮤지컬을 봤는데 너도 그거 본 거야?
English: I saw the military musical called Return that was on until last year. Did you see that too?

Korean: 엇 아니! 나는 신흥무관학교라는 뮤지컬을 봤어.
English: Oh no! I saw a musical called Shinheung Military Academy.
