I saw Kang Ha-neul and Onew. What about you, Unnie?

Korean: 나는 시우민이랑 성규랑 배우 김민석을 봤어! 노래를 다들 잘하더라고~
English: I saw Xiumin, Sunggyu, and actor Kim Minseok! They all sang well~

Korean: 신흥무관학교는 근데 군복을 입지는 않았겠다 그치?
English: But I guess Shinheung Military Academy doesn't have military uniforms, right?

Korean: 아니 입는데? 아 군복은 아니고 무관학교 교복이라고 해야 하나...?
English: No, I'm wearing it? Oh, it's not a military uniform, but should I say a military academy uniform...?
I think so haha

Korean: 아 귀환은 완전 지금 현재 군복 입은 채로 나와서 베레모 쓰고!
English: Ah, the return is completely current, I'm out in my military uniform and wearing a beret!
Oh, that would make it more realistic!

Korean: 강하늘이 연기 너무 잘해서 나도 줄줄 울었지 뭐야~
English: Kang Ha-neul's acting was so good that I cried a lot too~

Korean: 아니 강하늘 노래도 잘 하지 않아? 궁금하다.
English: No, Kang Ha-neul is good at singing too. I wonder.

Korean: 근데 온유는 귀환에도 나왔었는데 신흥무관학교에도 나왔다니 되게 오래 있었던 느낌이네... 키키
English: But On-yu appeared in Return and Shinheung Military Academy too, so it feels like he's been around for a long time... Kiki
You're practically a military musical craftsman, aren't you?

Korean: 응응 강하늘 노래도 잘하고 연기도 잘해서 감동이었어!
English: Yeah, yeah Kang Ha-neul is good at singing and acting, I was touched!
It's fiction, but it's so touching...

Korean: 맞아 귀환은 그 중년 배우 분이 연기를 진짜 잘하셔서 나도 2층에서 눈물 좀 흘렸지... ㅜㅜ
English: That's right, the middle-aged actor's acting was really good, so I shed some tears on the second floor too... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 군 뮤지컬하면 또 보러 갈 생각은 있어?
English: Do you plan on going to see the military musical again?

Korean: 응 완전 있지! 뮤지컬도 좋아해서 완전 있어. 언니는?
English: Yeah, I totally do! I like musicals too, so I totally do. What about you, sister?
I totally have that too!

Korean: 나도 뮤지컬 좋아해서 상관하지 않고 볼 수 있으면 다 보는 편이야!
English: I also like musicals, so I watch them all if I can, regardless of the genre!

Korean: 내 친구는 총소리 때문에 보기 싫다 하더라구... ㅜㅜ
English: My friend said he didn't want to see it because of the gunshots... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 헐 ㅠㅠ 맞아 아무래도 군대다 보니까 ㅠㅠ
English: Oh my gosh ㅠㅠ That's right, I guess it's because it's the military ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그런데 총 들고 군무하는 거 너무 멋있지 않아?
English: But isn't it cool to carry a gun and serve in the military?

Korean: 맞아 맞아! 나 완전 총 들고 군무할 때 진짜 멋있어서 소름 돋았는데 역시!
English: Yeah, that's right! I was really scared when I saw him wielding a gun and doing military service, but it was really cool!
Sister, do you have any memorable teachers?

Korean: 어! 나는 중학교 때 학원 선생님이랑 아직도 연락하고 지내!
English: Oh! I still keep in touch with my academy teacher from middle school!

Korean: 집에도 가서 자고 막 그래 신기하지?
English: Isn't it amazing that you can go home and sleep and stuff?
Wow, this is awesome!

Korean: 나는 고2 때 담임 선생님이랑 얼마 전에도 뵀었는데!
English: I met my homeroom teacher from my second year of high school a while ago!

Korean: 오! 나는 학원 선생님이랑만 친해서 그리고 내가 유일하게 100점을 맞아봤던 과목 선생님이라
English: Oh! I'm only close with my academy teacher, and he's the only subject teacher I ever got a perfect score on.
The teacher said I was pretty Kiki
Wow, 100 points! Cool! I'll try to guess.
Sister, is that subject math?

Korean: 아니 고구마도 틀리더니 이것도 틀렸어... 사회야 사회!
English: Oh, sweet potatoes were wrong, and this is wrong too... Society, society!

Korean: 데헷 ^^ 나 헛다리 잘 짚는 편~
English: Ta-da ^^ I'm good at making mistakes~
You and your teacher have such a deep connection!

Korean: 응! 너는 그러면 고2 때 담임 선생님이 제일 기억에 남는 선생님이야?
English: Yeah! So, is your homeroom teacher from your second year of high school the teacher you remember the most?

Korean: 응응! 영어 선생님인데 고2 때 반 전체적으로 친하고 단합이 잘 돼서 스무 살 땐 다 같이 여행도 갔었어~!
English: Yeah! I'm an English teacher. When I was in the second year of high school, we were all close and united in the class, so when we were twenty, we all went on a trip together~!
Oh, with the teacher? Awesome!
It's my first time hearing about a trip with my homeroom teacher!
He must have been a really good teacher...
I didn't like any of my high school teachers...

Korean: 맞아 ㅠㅠ 잘 맞고 좋은 선생님 만나기 정말 힘든 일인데,
English: That's right ㅠㅠ It's really hard to meet a good teacher who fits well.

Korean: 스승의 은혜 노래가 절로 나오는 선생님이셨어 하하 물론 마음속으로만 불렀어
English: He was a teacher who would sing the song of the teacher's grace without realizing it haha. Of course, I only sang it in my mind.
No, why did you only call me in your mind?

Korean: 노래하니까 나는 고3 담임 쌤 우리 담임 맡았을 때 결혼하셔서 축가 불렀던 기억이 나네 나는 진짜 불렀어
English: When I sing, I remember my high school senior homeroom teacher singing a congratulatory song when he got married. I really sang it.

Korean: 쌤은 기억 별로 안 나는데 그 축가 불렀던 건 기억이 너무 난다 키키
English: I don't remember the teacher very well, but I remember singing that congratulatory song very well, Kiki
Wow, awesome! So cute and heartwarming. >
Half of us are singing the congratulatory song together ㅠㅠ
Oh, was that your solo song?

Korean: 당연히 애들이 모두 다 불렀지! 키키
English: Of course the kids all sang! Kiki

Korean: 그때 담임 쌤이 28살 막 이랬는데 지금 생각해보면 어리다 쌤들도... ㅜㅜ
English: At that time, my homeroom teacher was about 28 years old, but now that I think about it, even the teachers were young... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 헐 ㅠㅠ 맞아... 지금 내 나이 비슷할 때 결혼이라니...
English: Wow ㅠㅠ That's right... Getting married at a similar age to me...

Korean: 내 나이보다 어린 선생님들 정말 힘들겠어, 지금 생각해 보면...
English: I guess it must have been really hard for teachers younger than me, now that I think about it...

Korean: 그니까 그때 말을 잘 들었어야 했는데
English: That's why I should have listened to you back then.

Korean: 지금 생각해보면 조금 사춘기랍시고 말 안 들어서 죄송하당...
English: Thinking about it now, I feel a bit adolescent and I'm sorry for not listening to you...
How many people are in your family, sister?
I have 4! You?

Korean: 오 나도! 아빠, 엄마, 오빠, 나. 언니는?
English: Oh me too! Dad, Mom, Brother, Me. What about Sister?
Me too, exactly the same!

Korean: 그럼 오빠랑 나이 차이는 많이 나?
English: Then is there a big age difference between you and your brother?
I'm 4 years older than you! What about your sister?
I'm exactly the same.

Korean: 4살 차이 조금 많지도 적지도 않은 느낌인데 나는 오빠가 남동생이었으면 좋겠어.
English: The 4 year age gap isn't that big or small, but I wish my older brother was my younger brother.

Korean: 그래? 나는 이미 오빠가 남동생 같아서 조금 오빠 노릇을 해 줬으면 좋겠던데 하하
English: Really? I already feel like my brother is my brother, so I wish he would act like my brother a little bit haha
Oh really?

Korean: 근데 말하고 보니까 오빠가 용돈 종종 잘 줘서 약간 그냥 오빠여도 될 거 같아...
English: But now that I think about it, my brother often gives me a lot of allowance, so I think it's okay for him to just be my brother...

Korean: 오, 그럼 그럼. 돈 주는 사람 최고 최고!
English: Oh, then yes. The person who gives money is the best!
The best the best!

Korean: 갑자기 궁금한 건데 엄마가 환갑이라면 어떤 선물이 좋을 거 같아?
English: I'm suddenly curious, what kind of gift do you think would be good for my mom's 60th birthday?

Korean: 음... 누가 됐든 선물은 참 어려운데,
English: Well... It's really hard to give a gift to anyone.
How about cash? Wrap it up nicely and make it look like an event!

Korean: 역시 현금만큼 좋은 게 없긴 하겠지?
English: After all, there's nothing better than cash, right?

Korean: 조만간 엄마 생신이 다가와서 물어봤어 하하
English: I asked because my mom's birthday is coming up soon haha

Korean: 맞아. 나이 성별 불문하고 현찰이 최고인 거 같아!
English: Yes, I think cash is the best, regardless of age or gender!

Korean: 어머님께 생신 아직 조금 남았지만 축하 드린다고 전해 줘! 하하 ><
English: Tell your mom that she's still a little bit away from her birthday, but she's happy! Haha >
Kiki, there's a little left, but I'll tell you!

Korean: 그럼 너도 다음 어머니 생신 때 현금을 드릴 생각이야?
English: So, are you planning to give your mother some cash for her next birthday?

Korean: 응! 계획은 그런데 일단 엄마 생신 내년이라,
English: Yeah! That's the plan, but first of all, my mom's birthday is next year.
Mom, wait~ ^^

Korean: 우리 엄마도 조금 기다려야 되긴 하는데 여하튼 고마웡!
English: My mom will have to wait a bit too, but thank you anyway!
Sister, have you ever been on a blind date?

Korean: 아니 나는 자연스런 만남 추구하는 스타일이야! 너는 해봤어?
English: No, I'm the type that seeks natural encounters! Have you tried it?
Oh, I'm also proud! ^^

Korean: 몇 번 받을 뻔했는데 아무래도 부담스러워서 거절했어...
English: I almost accepted it a few times, but I declined because I felt burdened...

Korean: 근데 주위에 보니까 이제 애들이 자연스런 만남 힘들다고 다 소개팅하던데 나는 모르는 사람이랑 그렇게 만나는 거 너무 어색하고 생각만 해도 힘들어
English: But when I look around, I see that these days, kids are having a hard time meeting people naturally, so they all go on blind dates. But for me, meeting people I don't know like that is so awkward and hard to even think about.
Then what is your ideal type?
Yes, that's exactly why.

Korean: 나는 안경이 잘 어울리고 마르지 않고 예의가 바르고 나랑 개그 코드가 맞는 사람 >< 언니는?
English: I want someone who looks good in glasses, isn't thin, is polite, and has a similar sense of humor to me >< What about you, Unnie?
It's very specific. It's very specific.

Korean: 나는 뭔가 아 이 사람은 배울 게 진짜 많은 거 같다라고 느껴지는 사람을 좋아하는 거 같아!
English: I think I like someone who makes me feel like, "Oh, this person has a lot to learn!"
Oh, right, that point is important too!

Korean: 그러면 외적인 것도 말해 줘! 궁금하니까 ><
English: Then tell me about the external things too! I'm curious >

Korean: 나는 동글동글하게 생긴 사람을 좋아하는 거 같아 도경수 같은? 도경수 괜찮지 않아?
English: I think I like someone with a round face. Like Do Kyungsoo? Isn't Do Kyungsoo okay?
It's completely fine.

Korean: 나 고3 때 도경수 엄청 좋아했었어 하하
English: I really liked Do Kyungsoo when I was in 3rd year of high school haha

Korean: 나는 이장원 같은 사람이 좋아. 이장원 알아?
English: I like people like Lee Jang-won. Do you know Lee Jang-won?

Korean: 나는 지금 도경수가 좋은 거 같아 좀 키키
English: I think Do Kyungsoo is good right now. Kiki

Korean: 그 기타 치시는 분 아닌가...? 그 똑똑하신 분 아닌가?
English: Isn't that the guy who plays the guitar? Isn't that the smart guy?

Korean: 응 맞아! 외적인 것도 내 스탈이고 개그 취향이 나랑 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, that's right! The exterior is also my style and we have similar tastes in comedy ㅠㅠ

Korean: 언뜻 보면 흔한 타입 같지만 주변에서 절대 볼 수 없어.
English: At first glance, it seems like a common type, but you never see it around you.

Korean: 그 방탈출에 하석진이랑 김지석이랑 같이 나왔던 분 맞지? 안경 쓰시고?
English: Are you the guy who came out of the escape room with Ha Seok-jin and Kim Ji-seok? Are you wearing glasses?

Korean: 아 맞다 이상형 안경 잘 어울리는 사람! 딱 맞네!
English: Oh right, my ideal type is someone who looks good with glasses! They fit me perfectly!
So you found your ideal type, Kiki
That's right! That's him!

Korean: 똑똑한 것도 매력인데 넘 재밌고 귀여워 >,<
English: Being smart is attractive, but it's also so funny and cute >,

Korean: 언니는 그럼 어떤 부분에서 매력을 느껴?!
English: Then what part of your sister do you find attractive?!

Korean: 내가 말한 걸 이 사람이 온전히 다 잘 들어주고 있구나라고 느낄 때? 맞나 그런 거 같아!
English: When I feel like this person is listening to everything I said? I think so!

Korean: 뭔가 그 통하는 느낌이 들 때... 이거 매력 맞니?
English: When you feel that connection... is that charm?

Korean: 그럼 매력이지! 남의 이야기 안 듣고 자기 말만 지껄이는 사람이 얼마나 많은데! 하하
English: Then that's charm! How many people are there who don't listen to others and only talk about themselves! Haha

Korean: 그렇지? 맞아 그럼 거기서 매력을 느끼는 게 맞아!
English: Right? That's right, then it's right to feel attracted to that!

Korean: 내 프로필 사진 귀엽지? 내 동물 친구들이야 ><
English: Isn't my profile picture cute? These are my animal friends >

Korean: 응 프사 매일 매일 바꿔줬으면 좋겠어
English: Yeah, I wish you could change your profile picture every day.
I want to see new photos every day!
Kiki I'll show you a new picture every day!

Korean: 언니 프로필 사진에 귀여운 멍멍이는 누구야?
English: Who is the cute puppy in your sister's profile picture?

Korean: 아 얘는 누룽지야! 친구 강아지인데 누런 색이어서 누룽지래 키키
English: Oh, this is Nurungji! My friend's dog is yellow, so he's called Nurungji Kiki
The name is perfect, isn't it?
It's so cute and suits you so well ㅠㅠ
So is Nurungji a Pomeranian?
that's right!

Korean: 근데 다른 포메에 비해서 다리가 진짜 길어 키키
English: But compared to other Pomeranians, Kiki's legs are really long.
Running around, running around!

Korean: 보리도 그럼 색깔 보고 이름 보리라고 지은 거야?
English: So, barley is named barley because of its color?

Korean: 맞아! 보리 애기 때 우리 집 왔을 때 꼬리 보니까 보리가 생각나서 보리라고 내가 지었어! 잘 지었지!? >,<
English: That's right! When Bori came to our house as a baby, I saw his tail and it reminded me of Bori, so I named him Bori! Did I name him well!? >,
It's a perfect match! It's a perfect match!

Korean: 포미는 하얀색이어서 백설기 찹쌀떡 이렇게 불러주고 싶당...하하 찹쌀떡!
English: Since Pomi is white, I want to call it Baekseolgi Chapssaltteok...haha Chapssaltteok!

Korean: 맞아 우리 포미는 하얗고 핑크 핑크해 >,<
English: Yes, our Pomi is white and pink >,

Korean: 포미는 포미, 뽀미, 돼지, 애기 등등 불리는 이름이 많아.
English: Pomi has many names such as Pomi, Pomi, Pig, Baby, etc.

Korean: 반려동물들은 애기라고 부르게 되더라고... 진짜 애기 같아 가지고!
English: They call their pets babies... They really are like babies!

Korean: 포미는 손이랑 앉아 엎드려 이거 훈련했어?
English: Did Pomi practice this by sitting on his hands and knees?
That's right. Even when you grow up, you're still a baby... >

Korean: 응응 우리 포미 앉아, 엎드려, 손, 돌아, 브이, 기다려를 할 줄 알아.
English: Yeah yeah our Pomi knows how to do sit, lie down, hands, turn around, V, and wait.
Barley doesn't do anything. Haha

Korean: 헉 브이라니... ㅜㅜ 어떻게 동영상 좀 찍어서 나중에 보여줘!
English: Oh my gosh, V... ㅜㅜ Can you please record a video and show me later!
I'll show you!

Korean: 엄지 검지로 브이 하면 거기에 턱을 갖다 대서 넘 귀여워 >,<
English: When you make a V with your thumb and index finger, it's so cute when you put your chin there >,
That would be really cute!
I really want to see it, it's my first time hearing about V-Rain!

Korean: 근데 고양이는 원래 훈련이 힘든 동물 아니야?
English: But aren't cats originally animals that are difficult to train?
Yeah, I guess so!

Korean: 가족들 생각에는 다 알아 듣는데 어쩌라고~ 이런 마음으로 안 해주는 거 같아 고양이는 하하
English: The cat seems to think that he understands everything but what can I do? Haha

Korean: 역시 고양이는 도도한 게 맞는 거 같아 아무리 개냥이래도! 하하
English: I think cats are really proud, even if they are dogs! Haha
Sister, do you like fishing?

Korean: 낚시 옛날에 낚시 카페? 가서 한 번 해본 게 끝인데...
English: Fishing I went to a fishing cafe a long time ago and tried it once...
Do you like fishing? Do you do it often?

Korean: 아니, 나는 참을성이 없는 건지 가만히 기다리는 게 너무 고문이더라고... ㅠ
English: No, I'm just impatient, waiting around was just too much torture... ㅠ

Korean: 아 근데 해보긴 해봤는데 안 맞는 거야?
English: Oh, but I tried it and it didn't work?

Korean: 응응! 우리 할머니가 낚시를 좋아하셔서 어릴 때는 가족끼리 종종 했었어!
English: Yeah! My grandmother loved fishing, so we used to do it with our family often when I was little!

Korean: 어릴 땐 그래도 조금 재밌게 했던 거 같긴 한데...
English: I think I had some fun with it when I was younger...
Wow, a fishing grandma. How romantic!

Korean: 나는 그때 처음 해봤는데 손맛이라는 걸 처음 느껴봤어 키키
English: I tried it for the first time then and it was the first time I felt the taste of the hand Kiki
Have you caught a lot of meat?
Oh, the taste~ Kiki

Korean: 응응. 할머니 덕에 바다 낚시, 민물 낚시, 빙어 낚시 골고루 해본 것 같긴 해.
English: Yeah, yeah. Thanks to my grandmother, I think I've tried saltwater fishing, freshwater fishing, and ice fishing.
Do you like any other sports?

Korean: 아니 운동은 그렇게 좋아하지 않는데 수영은 또 좋아해!
English: No, I don't really like exercising, but I like swimming!
Do you know how to freestyle?

Korean: 우와! 나는 물을 좋아하지만 개헤엄도 겨우 치는 수준이야...
English: Wow! I love water, but I can barely paddle...
Do you like hiking?

Korean: 아니 등산 너무 예전에 가고 안 갔는데 집 앞 언덕도 잘 안 올라가는걸...
English: No, it's been a while since I went hiking, and I don't even go up the hill in front of my house...
So have you been hiking recently?
I'm having a hard time too, not really... hehe

Korean: 4년 전에 한라산 갔었는데 너무 힘들어서 다시는 가고 싶지 않아!
English: I went to Hallasan four years ago, but it was so hard that I never want to go again!
So, personally, I think mountain climbing is too difficult...

Korean: 그냥 동네 뒷산 이 정도서부터 시작해야 되는데...
English: I guess we should just start from the mountain behind the neighborhood...
But why is it Mt. Halla so suddenly?

Korean: 그러니까. 집 뒤에 동산 정도밖에 안 가는데 아주 하룻강아지 범 무서운 줄 몰랐지!
English: That's why. I didn't know that a tiger could be so scary when it was only a little hill behind the house!
So, do you like camping?

Korean: 키키 캠핑은 하면 좋아할 거 같긴 한데... 따로 막 해 본 적은 없어.
English: Kiki seems like she'd enjoy camping, but... I've never actually tried it.
Does camping include car camping?
I want to try a little bit of car camping!
Then let's include car camping too!

Korean: 차박 나도 궁금한데 좁은 곳에서 약간 불편하게 자는 게 걱정이긴 한데 재밌을 거 같아!
English: I'm also curious about car camping. I'm worried about sleeping in a small space and feeling a little uncomfortable, but it sounds like fun!

Korean: 티비에서 차박하는 거 보는데 거기 이쁘게 꾸며 놓으면 진짜 이쁘고 그래서 한번 해보고 싶어!
English: I saw people on TV doing car camping, and it looks really pretty when they decorate it, so I want to try it someday!
Does your sister like games?
I don't hate it, I don't like it!

Korean: 리듬 게임이라고 해야 되나 그거만 좋아해 키키
English: I guess you could call it a rhythm game, but I only like that Kiki
Oh, I like rhythm games too!

Korean: 알투비트, 오디션 등등. 또 뭐가 있지?
English: R2Beat, audition, etc. What else is there?

Korean: 근데 탭소닉 같은 것도 리듬 게임 맞지?
English: But isn't something like Tapsonic also a rhythm game?

Korean: 어, 맞지 맞지! 그거 되게 옛날 게임 맞나?
English: Oh, right, right! Is that a really old game?

Korean: 맞아 그걸 하는 건 아니고 그거와 같은 슈스엠이라고 그걸 하는데 모르겠지?
English: Right, that's not what they're doing, but they're doing something similar to that, so you don't know?
Yeah. I don't know much about the game called Shusm...
Is that a phone game? A computer game?

Korean: 폰 게임인데! 나도 친구가 시작해서 한 건데 노래에 맞춰서 탭소닉처럼 하는 그런 거야~
English: It's a phone game! I started playing it because my friend started it. It's like tapsonic, with the rhythm of the song~

Korean: 꽤 오래 해서 나름 상위 레벨인 편이야 키키
English: I've been doing this for quite some time, so I'm pretty high level Kiki

Korean: 오~ 멋쟁이 ^^ 그러면 보드 게임도 좋아해?
English: Oh~ Cool ^^ Then do you like board games too?
Yeah! I like Lumikub. What about you?

Korean: 나는 루미큐브 할 줄 몰라... 할리갈리는 좋아해!
English: I don't know how to play Lumikub... I like Halli Galli!
Halli Galli is so much fun!

Korean: 나도 루미큐브 배우는데 좀 걸렸어 이게 어렵더라...
English: It took me a while to learn Lumikub too, it was hard...
Should I teach you something?
Yeah! Teach me! Promise, promise!

Korean: 배워서 스승을 이기는 제자가 돼 보겠어!
English: I will learn and become a disciple who can overcome his master!

Korean: 내가 물론 스승 소리까지 그 정도는 아닌데 최선을 다해보겠어...
English: Of course, I'm not that good of a teacher, but I'll try my best...

Korean: 우선 근데 루미큐브 어디서 구해? 보드 게임 카페 가야 되나...
English: First of all, where can I get a Lumikub? Do I have to go to a board game cafe?
Um... maybe?

Korean: 그럼 거리 두기 풀리면 보드 게임 카페도 가자~ 약속 약속!
English: Then, when social distancing is lifted, let's go to a board game cafe too~ Promise, promise!

Korean: 우리 갈 데가 너무 많아졌다 잊지 않도록 해 키키
English: We have so many places to go, don't forget Kiki

Korean: 여행 갈 때 꼭 챙겨 가는 것이 있어?
English: Is there something you always take with you when you travel?

Korean: 약을 꼭 챙겨가고... 묵주? 같은 거를 하고 가.
English: Make sure to bring your medicine... and a rosary or something.
Are you a bit of a coward?
Not a coward, but a man of sense~ ^^

Korean: 나도 약이나 밴드 같은 거 챙겨 가고!
English: I'm also taking some medicine and bandages!

Korean: 사실 평소에 짐이 많아서 특별한 건 없는 거 같아 하하
English: Actually, I don't think there's anything special because I usually have a lot of luggage haha

Korean: 너 짐 한 보따리지 맞아 알고 있어 키키
English: You're carrying a lot of luggage, Kiki, you know that

Korean: 모든 걸 가지고 있을 거 같아.
English: I feel like I have everything.
Have you ever traveled alone?

Korean: 아니. 평소에 혼자 잘 돌아다니고 타지는 반나절 정도는 혼자 돌아다녀 본 적 있는데 아예 박을 해 보진 않은 거 같아.
English: No. I usually walk around alone, and I've walked around alone for about half a day, but I don't think I've ever done it alone.
What about your sister?

Korean: 나도 돌아다니는 건 혼자 잘하는데 어디 가서 자고 그런 건 안 해봤어!
English: I'm good at walking around by myself, but I've never gone out and slept!
Oh, just like me!

Korean: 그러면 아예 자고 오는 여행으로 혼자 가 볼 의향은 있어?
English: Then, are you willing to go on a trip alone and just sleep over?

Korean: 응! 나 계획은 많이 세워봤는데 이게 실행이 안 되더라고?...
English: Yeah! I made a lot of plans, but they didn't work out?...
As expected, a coward...

Korean: 너는 혼자 가면 역시 제주도로 여행을 가고 싶어?
English: If you go alone, do you want to travel to Jeju Island?

Korean: 음, 꼭 제주도 아니어도 일단은 국내로 가 보고 싶어!
English: Well, I want to go to Korea at least, even if it's not necessarily Jeju Island!

Korean: 해외는 혼자 가 보기엔 약간 무섭고 심심할 거 같아서! 언니는?
English: I think it would be a bit scary and boring to go abroad alone! What about you, sister?
As expected, cowards travel domestically too...

Korean: 해외 여행은 근데 친구랑 가야 재밌어 해외 여행은 혼자 안 가고 싶어!
English: Traveling abroad is more fun when you go with friends. I don't want to travel abroad alone!
Exactly! That's exactly what I thought ^^

Korean: 그러면 여행 가면 꼭 사오는 게 있어?
English: So, is there something you always buy when you travel?

Korean: 초코렛이랑 마그네틱을 꼭 사왔던 거 같아!
English: I think I bought some chocolate and a magnet!

Korean: 먹보는 역시 먹을 걸 빠뜨리지 않는 법...
English: A gourmet never misses out on anything to eat...
You probably bought some chocolate too, right?

Korean: 그럼 그럼! 그리고 제주도는 오메기떡 필수야!
English: Then, then! And in Jeju Island, you must try Omegi Tteok!
It's so delicious >,
I haven't tried omegi tteok! Is omegi tteok good?
Do you have any red beans?

Korean: 맞아! 안에 팥이 있고 겉에는 통팥으로 감싸져 있어!
English: That's right! There's red bean inside and it's wrapped in whole red beans on the outside!
I like red beans. What about you, sister?

Korean: 난 팥은 안 좋아하는데 또 시루떡은 좋아해 비슷한 건가?
English: I don't like red beans, but I like sirutteok. Is it similar?

Korean: 계속 비 소식 있던데 막상 비는 안 오네?
English: There's been rumors of rain, but it's not actually raining?

Korean: 아 오늘 비가 온다 그랬어? 몰랐어!
English: Oh, you said it was going to rain today? I didn't know!
Do you usually check the weather forecast?

Korean: 응! 나는 별명이 *시리라서 그날그날 기상예보를 잘 챙겨 봐!
English: Yeah! My nickname is *Siri, so I check the weather forecast every day!
You take good care of it!

Korean: 근데 저번에 비 온다고 내가 알려줬던 거 같은데
English: But I think I told you last time that it was going to rain

Korean: 그래서 잘 안보는 줄 알았어... 하하
English: So I thought you weren't watching... haha
Oh, because I take good care of it

Korean: 우산 챙기는 여부는 내 마음대로거든 하하 언닌 잘 챙겨 봐?
English: It's up to me whether I bring an umbrella or not haha. Unnie, take good care of it?

Korean: 나는 혼자 살아서 비 오는 건 정말 잘 챙겨보지!
English: I live alone so I really don't pay attention to the rain!

Korean: 그래서 항상 우산이 내 자리에 있잖아!
English: That's why I always have an umbrella by my side!
Are you an umbrella fairy?

Korean: 그러면 언니는 천둥 번개 치면 무서워하는 편이야?
English: So, are you afraid of thunder and lightning?
No! I'm not scared.

Korean: 나는 근데 바람이 그렇게 무섭던데 넌 바람 괜찮아?
English: But I'm so scared of the wind. Are you okay with the wind?
Oh, strong man.

Korean: 그런데 나도야 비바람도 나를 막을 수 없어.
English: But even I, the wind and rain can't stop me.
How are your eyes?

Korean: 눈은 이제 오면 차가 너무 막히니까 무서워...
English: It's scary when it snows now because the traffic is so congested...
I used to like snow, but not anymore.

Korean: 맞아. 비바람도 나를 막을 수 없지만 눈은 나를 막을 수 있어.
English: That's right. Neither rain nor wind can stop me, but snow can stop me.
Do you like snowball fights?

Korean: 눈싸움 안 한 지 너무 오래 됐는데?
English: Has it been so long since we had a snowball fight?
Are you still having a snowball fight?
No, actually, it's been a really long time for me too...
But I liked it.
How about making a snowball fight?
Now it's cold so I don't want to go out... Kiki

Korean: 눈은 올 때 베란다에서 구경하는 게 최고!
English: The best way to enjoy snow is from the veranda!

Korean: 맞아! 눈이랑 비는 실내에서 바라만 보는 게 좋아.
English: That's right! I like just looking at the snow and rain from inside.

Korean: 맞아 이제 실내에서 애기들 노는 거 보면 돼~
English: That's right, now you can watch the babies playing indoors~

Korean: 드디어 다음 주부터 20, 30대 백신 신청 기간이야?
English: Is next week finally the vaccine application period for people in their 20s and 30s?

Korean: 응 드디어 우리 주사 맞는 거야!
English: Yeah, we're finally getting our shots!
But if I apply this time, will it be in September?

Korean: 응 확실하진 않은데 아마 그랬던 거 같아!
English: Yeah, I'm not sure, but I think it might have been like that!
Sister, what day is your application due?
I think it's August 12th? You?
I'm 9 days old!

Korean: 신청 기간 첫날이라서 너무 떨려... 어떡하지...?
English: It's the first day of the application period, so I'm so nervous... What should I do...?

Korean: 그거 그냥 백신 맞는 날짜랑 병원만 신청하면 되는 건가...
English: Is it okay to just apply for the date of vaccination and the hospital?

Korean: 아마 이제는 서버 다운 안 되지 않을까라고 조금 희망을 걸어보려고
English: I'm trying to have some hope that the server won't go down anymore.
I'll have to look into the exact procedure again.

Korean: 백신 맞으면 다음 날까지 쉬고 싶다. ㅠㅠ 그치?
English: After getting vaccinated, I want to rest until the next day. Right?

Korean: 응! 그거 맞았는데 그 다음날 아프고 출근해야 되는 거면 너무 힘들 거 같아...
English: Yeah! That's right, but if I'm sick the next day and have to go to work, it's going to be so hard...
What day do you plan to apply?

Korean: 금토가 좋을 텐데 엄청 몰릴 거 같아서 걱정이네... 언니는?
English: Friday and Saturday would be nice, but I'm worried it'll be really crowded... What about you, Unnie?

Korean: 나도 금요일 저녁에 맞고 싶은데 할 수 있을지 모르겠다 ㅜㅜ
English: I want to meet you on Friday night too, but I don't know if I can ㅜㅜ

Korean: 안 아파야 할 텐데 우리 화이자 맞는 거지?
English: It shouldn't hurt, but we're getting Pfizer, right?
Yeah! This time, it's Pfizer and Moderna!
Is there anyone around you who has been vaccinated?

Korean: 내 친구 병원 근무해서 아스트라 맞았어
English: My friend works at a hospital and got AstraZeneca.

Korean: 친구는 열 조금 나는 거 말고는 부작용 없었다던데
English: My friend said there were no side effects other than a slight fever.

Korean: 나도 아무 이상 없었으면 좋겠어 부작용 무서워... ㅜㅜ
English: I hope there's nothing wrong with me, I'm scared of side effects... ㅜㅜ
My mom also got AstraZeneca!

Korean: 하루 이틀 약간 감기 기운 있으셨대 ㅠㅠ
English: I heard you had a bit of a cold for a day or two ㅠㅠ

Korean: 아 우리 엄마는 피곤한 거 말고는 없었는데...
English: Oh, my mom was nothing but tired...

Korean: 우리는 그냥 조용히 넘어갔으면 좋겠다... 그치?
English: We'd like it to just go quietly... right?

Korean: 그러니까! ㅠㅠ 우리 둘 다 괜찮길 바래 보자!
English: So! ㅠㅠ Let's hope we're both okay!

Korean: 그럼 그럼 백신 신청 성공하고 팁 알려주길 바래!
English: Well then, I hope you succeed in applying for the vaccine and give me some tips!
The number of confirmed coronavirus cases in Tokyo has exceeded 5,000...

Korean: 정말? 올림픽 기간인데 그거 괜찮은 건가...
English: Really? It's the Olympics, is that okay...?

Korean: 응 올림픽 때문에 더 늘었나 봐...
English: Yeah, I guess it increased because of the Olympics...
I'm also really worried about our country's athletes...

Korean: 그니까 그거 올림픽 선수들 안에서도 조금 집단 감염 있는 거 같던데
English: So, it seems like there is some group infection among the Olympic athletes.
Can I continue, please...?
Oh my gosh... What should I do...
Everyone needs to come back safely ㅠㅠ
That's why I'm worried.

Korean: 나는 올림픽 배구 보는데 결승 갈 수도 있을 거 같으니까 제발 문제 없이 끝까지 했으면 좋겠다...
English: I'm watching the Olympic volleyball, and I think they might make it to the finals, so I hope they make it to the end without any problems...
I know.
Health comes before grades!

Korean: 방역에 조금 더 신경 썼으면 좋았을걸...
English: I wish they had paid a little more attention to quarantine...

Korean: 그니까 정말 어딜 가나 코로나가 말썽이네.
English: So, really, wherever you go, Corona is causing trouble.

Korean: 그래서 아까 배구 얘기해서 말인데 어제 배구한 거 터키전 봤어?
English: So, since we were talking about volleyball earlier, did you watch the volleyball game against Turkey yesterday?
No, I didn't see it, I just saw the highlights!
It was really so dramatic!?

Korean: 나도 하이라이트만 봤는데 또 마지막 세트에서 역전해서 또 이겼잖아!
English: I only watched the highlights, but they came back from behind in the last set and won again!

Korean: 진짜 그거 생방송으로 봤으면 심장 아팠을 거 같아...
English: I think my heart would have hurt if I had seen that live...
Yeah, it's so cool! ㅠㅠ

Korean: 세계적인 대회에서는 정말 떨릴 텐데... 그치?
English: You must be really nervous at a world-class competition... right?
I absolutely can't... ㅜㅜ

Korean: 터키에서 이번에 큰불이 나서 터키 선수들이 더 잘하고 싶었다고 한 뉴스까지 보긴 했는데
English: I even saw a news report that said that the Turkish athletes wanted to do better after the recent fire in Türkiye.

Korean: 조금 마음이 아팠지만 잘 이겨서 기뻤어!
English: It was a little heartbreaking, but I'm glad we won!

Korean: 맞아 나도 그 소식 들었어... ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I heard that news too... ㅠㅠ
It hasn't evolved yet...
This is really a big deal
Still? Oh, I didn't know that...

Korean: 불이 며칠째 나고 있는 거 아니야 그러면?
English: Hasn't the fire been burning for several days?
Yeah, that's right ㅠㅠ

Korean: 빨리 진화하고 인명 피해가 적었으면 좋겠다!
English: I hope it evolves quickly and causes fewer casualties!

Korean: 아 터키 뉴스 제대로 안 봐서 몰랐는데 더 심각한 것 같네...
English: Ah, I didn't know because I didn't watch Turkish news properly, but it seems more serious...

Korean: 언니는 미용적으로 신경 쓰는 부분이 있어?
English: Sister, is there anything you care about aesthetically?
I always spray perfume!

Korean: 향수를 제일 신경 쓰는 거 같아 너는?
English: I think you care the most about perfume.

Korean: 나는 원래 화장이었는데 지금은 화장을 거의 안 해.
English: I used to wear makeup, but now I hardly ever wear makeup.

Korean: 나는 원래 화장을 잘 안 하는 편이었는데 지금 더 안 하는 거 같아.
English: I originally didn't wear much makeup, but I think I don't wear it even more now.

Korean: 너는 화장하면 어디를 제일 공들여서 했어?
English: When you put on makeup, where do you put the most effort?
I'm into lip these days!

Korean: 요즘은 마스크 때문에 다양하게 구매는 안 하는 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: I don't think people are buying a lot of different things these days because of the masks ㅠㅠ
What about your sister?

Korean: 아 나는 화장하면 아이쉐도우를 제일 공들여서 했어!
English: Ah, when I put on makeup, I put the most effort into eyeshadow!
I think I used about 5 colors?
Oh, you use it a lot!
Do you like shiny pearls?

Korean: 응 나는 반짝이는 걸 써야 이제 눈이 더 커 보이고 그래서 입자가 작은 반짝이를 잘 썼지!
English: Yeah I use glitter so my eyes look bigger now so I use glitter with small particles!
What brand do you mainly use?

Korean: 오~ 딱히 제일 좋아하는 브랜드는 없는데 립 제품은 맥이 제일 무난하면서 색깔도 많아서 좋은 거 같아.
English: Oh~ I don't really have a favorite brand, but I think MAC lip products are the best because they are versatile and come in a variety of colors.
What about your sister?

Korean: 응 나는 립은 페리페라를 주로 써.
English: Yeah, I mainly use Peripera for my lips.
I like the color there
I use a type of lip product called Airy Velvet.
Have you tried it?

Korean: 나 엄청 예전에 한 번 써 봤어!
English: I used it once a long time ago!

Korean: 그럼 언니는 틴트 종류를 좋아해 립스틱 종류를 좋아해?
English: So, do you like tints or lipsticks?

Korean: 나는 그 건조한 걸 진짜 싫어해서 립스틱 종류는 잘 안 발라!
English: I really hate that dry feeling so I don't really wear lipstick!
you?

Korean: 오, 나는 반대로 매트 립을 좋아하고 틴트보다는 립스틱을 좋아해!
English: Oh, I on the contrary like matte lips and I like lipstick more than tint!
Oh, that's totally the opposite of me!
That's why I always apply Nivea.
Have you seen me apply it often?
Oh really?
I got it now! ^^

Korean: 나는 입술이 별로 안 건조해서 사실 립밤도 잘 안 발라 하하
English: My lips aren't that dry, so I don't really use lip balm haha

Korean: 나는 학생 때부터 건조했어서 아직까지도 계속 바르는 중이야!
English: I've had dry skin since I was a student, so I still keep applying it!

Korean: 건강을 위해서 하는 작은 습관 같은 게 있어?
English: Are there any little habits you do for your health?
I tend to go to bed early...
Do you know what time I sleep?
Yeah, I know!
I think sleep is really important.

Korean: 나는 늦게 자서 체력이 이 모양인가...
English: I slept late so my stamina is like this...

Korean: 너는 늦게 자고 일찍 일어나는 거 같아
English: You seem to go to bed late and wake up early.

Korean: 그래서 더 피곤한 걸 수 있다고
English: So you might be more tired

Korean: 하루에 7시간은 자야 좀 건강해지는 느낌이 들어...
English: I feel healthier if I sleep 7 hours a day...
Do you have a habit?
I drink a lot of water.

Korean: 근데 습관이라기보다는 원래 좀 많이 마시는 편이야!
English: But rather than saying it's a habit, I'm just someone who drinks a lot!
Oh, that's a really good habit.

Korean: 나는 물을 너무 안 마셔서 걱정인데!
English: I'm worried because I don't drink enough water!
So how much do you drink a day?

Korean: 정확하진 않은데 그래도 항상 1리터 이상은 마시는 거 같아!
English: I'm not sure, but I think I always drink more than a liter!
Sister, try increasing it little by little!

Korean: 나는 진짜 일하면서는 500미리도 안 마시는 거 같아.
English: I don't think I drink even 500 ml while I'm working.
Is it okay to drink carbonated water?
Carbonated water is also good.

Korean: 하지만 탄산을 또 너무 과다 섭취하면 이빨에 안 좋은가?
English: But is it bad for your teeth if you consume too much carbonated beverages?
I'm not sure... haha
I can't drink plain water.

Korean: 뭐라도 티백이라도 넣어야 좀 들어가 물이...
English: You need to put in something, even a tea bag, so that some water can go in...

Korean: 내 친구도 그래서 차를 마시거나 탄산수를 마시더라!
English: My friend also drinks tea or soda because of that!

Korean: 그러면 우리 스트레칭을 수시로 해 보자!
English: Then let's do some stretching often!
I really need to stretch

Korean: 그럼 스트레칭을 할 때 나 좀 데려가서 같이 해줘.
English: Then, when you do stretching, take me with you.
Yeah yeah I'll tell you!
It's good to just turn your neck often!

Korean: 그래? 나는 손목이랑 허리가 안 좋은 편인데
English: Really? My wrists and back are not in good shape.
Tell me some stretching related to this!
Yeah! I'll teach you some wrist stretches too.
Let's do it together and take care of our health ^^
okay!
Then stretching only trusts you!
Sister, do you use Market Kurly well?
I used it once last month and it was good
Great for people who live alone!
Yeah. Early morning delivery is really convenient.
What about Coupang?

Korean: 쿠팡은 이제는 잘 사용 안 해!
English: I don't use Coupang much anymore!
Dawn delivery is okay too~
Oh, thanks for the recommendation!
I'll try using SSG next time!
What do you usually order?
Just order something to eat!
Frozen dumplings or meal kit?
Have you tried a meal kit?
no!
Is it that comfortable?
What kind of food is there?

Korean: 나는 감바스랑 파스타 먹었는데 진짜 맛있고 가격도 저렴해!
English: I had gambas and pasta and it was really delicious and cheap!

Korean: 프레시지 거니까 꼭 이용해 줘 한번!
English: It's a presage, so please use it at least once!
Oh, I love gambas.
thank you!
Have you ever ordered something like a frozen lunch box?

Korean: 냉동 도시락은 맛이 없어서 잘 안 시켜 먹어!
English: I don't order frozen lunch boxes very often because they don't taste good!
Are frozen lunch boxes okay?

Korean: 나 한 번 시켜보고 다시는 안 시켜... 하하
English: I tried it once and never tried it again... haha
First of all, the quantity is too small!
Ah, if the amount is too small, you are eliminated.
The meal kit is basically for two people, so be sure to order it!
Okay, okay!

Korean: 냉동 도시락은 양도 적고 너무 건강한 맛이야...
English: Frozen lunch boxes are small in size and taste so healthy...
Yeah, that's why I stopped eating it
Bibigo is delicious too, so order that too...

Korean: 알았어! 다음에 꼭 비비고를 시켜 먹어볼게.
English: Okay! Next time I'll definitely order Bibigo.

Korean: 응 내가 비비고 맛은 장담할 수 있어!
English: Yeah, I can guarantee the taste!
Sister, do you have a favorite celebrity?
Oh I really like EXO!
Oh, who do you like the most?

Korean: 나는 도경수를 제일 좋아하는데 사실 다 좋아하긴 해!
English: I like Do Kyungsoo the most, but I actually like them all!

Korean: 그럼 엑소 노래 뭐 제일 좋아해?
English: So what’s your favorite EXO song?
You know the winter song called Universe?
I absolutely love that song!

Korean: 그럼 도경수 영화 뭐 제일 좋아해?
English: Then what is your favorite Do Kyung Soo movie?

Korean: 형이라고 그 조정석이랑 나오는 거 그거!
English: That thing that comes out with Jo Jeong-seok, hyung!
Oh, I know, I know!
You're really good at acting.

Korean: 도경수 목소리 너무 좋은 거 같아. 그치?
English: I think Do Kyungsoo's voice is really nice. Don't you think so?
Okay then

Korean: 내가 그 목소리 들었다가 엑소 다 좋아하게 된 거잖아...
English: I started liking EXO after hearing that voice...

Korean: 도경수 영어 발음하는 거 혹시 들어봤니?
English: Have you ever heard Do Kyungsoo pronounce English?
Oh, I heard.
It was really great ^^
Do Kyungsoo's face is nice too, right?
Then your face is the best
Round face is the best the best!
He's handsome but small, so he looks like a fairy, right?

Korean: 나보다 조금 작을 수 있는데 그건 아무것도 아니지 키키
English: You may be a little smaller than me, but that's nothing Kiki
Please keep loving me hard!

Korean: 그럼 나는 해바라기 같이 계속 좋아할 예정이야!
English: Then I will continue to like you like a sunflower!
Sister, do you like Marvel movies?
I love it so much I've seen it all!
you?
I saw it all too!
Do you like Captain America?

Korean: 응 좋아하는데 나는 아이언맨이 최고라고 생각해!
English: Yeah I like it, but I think Iron Man is the best!
Yeah but I like Thor too
Ah, I don't really like Thor!
I like Spiderman too.
Yeah, me too.
What about Doctor Strange?

Korean: 닥터 스트레인지는 약간 잊고 있던 영웅인데...
English: Doctor Strange is a somewhat forgotten hero...
I think I forgot a little bit.
Don't forget!
I actually like Rocky.
Ah, Rocky, the movie is coming out soon!
So I hope it comes out quickly!
I'm waiting too
The Marvel universe is absolutely the best!

Korean: 맞아 맞아! 이번에 블랙위도우도 봐 줘!
English: That's right, that's right! This time, let's look at Black Widow too!
Oh right, I have to see that.
Was it fun?
Yeah, it's totally fun!
I hope you see it before you go down!
Yeah! I'll definitely watch Black Widow!
Do you want to go for a beer this evening?
Beer is totally good!
What kind of beer do you like?
I like lagers~

Korean: 어떤 음식이랑 맥주 먹는 게 좋아?
English: What kind of food do you like to eat with beer?

Korean: 음 나는 사실 맥주랑은 뭐든 다 좋아해서 과자랑 먹는 것도 좋고 떡볶이나 피자 등등 있지
English: Well, I actually like everything with beer, so I like eating it with snacks, tteokbokki, pizza, etc.

Korean: 배달 시켜 먹을 때 맥주도 같이 시킨 적 있어?
English: Have you ever ordered beer along with your food delivery?

Korean: 응 치킨 시킬 때 생맥주 같이 시킨 적 있는데 아무래도 매장에서 먹는 거보다는 별루더라 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I ordered draft beer with my chicken once, but it wasn't as good as eating it in the restaurant ㅠㅠ
Have you ever ordered it?
No I don't have any

Korean: 그렇게 오면 확실히 맛이 별로일 거라고 생각해서 맥주 좋아하는 나는 내키지 않더라고
English: I didn't feel like drinking it because I thought it would definitely taste bad if I came that way. I like beer so I didn't feel like drinking it.
What do you usually drink beer with?

Korean: 나도 피자나 치킨이랑 먹는 것도 좋아하고 그냥 티비 보면서 맥주만 마실 때도 있지!
English: I also like eating pizza or chicken, and sometimes I just drink beer while watching TV!
Do you usually eat late-night snacks?
I love late night snacks

Korean: 생각만 해도 좋은데 잘 못 먹어 소화가 안 되는 편이라...
English: It's good to just think about it, but I don't eat well so I have trouble digesting it...
What would be good for a late night snack?
I like chicken feet!

Korean: 라면도 밤에 먹으면 맛있는데 아침에 얼굴 퉁퉁 붓긴 하지
English: Ramen tastes good when you eat it at night, but your face will be puffy in the morning.
Chicken feet, my mouth is watering haha
I like it a lot too
And I highly recommend the gopchang too
Don't you like that either?
Oh, I like tripe too...
Let's go eat gopchang next time!
There is a good restaurant in Seolleung Station
Do you want to go right now?

Korean: 곱창은 그럼 소곱창 좋아해 돼지곱창 좋아해?
English: Then do you like beef tripe or pork tripe?
I like beef tripe!
Pigs smell so I don't like them...
you?
You have a weak stomach

Korean: 나는 가리지 않고 둘 다 좋아해
English: I like both without any distinction
What are you planning to eat for dinner tonight?

Korean: 그럼 오늘 저녁은 피자에 맥주 먹을까?
English: So, shall we have pizza and beer for dinner tonight?
Totally good
Definitely call!

Korean: 우리 집 전세 계약이 이제 끝나가서 이사 갈 집 알아봐야 돼 ㅠㅠ
English: My house lease is about to end, so I have to find a new house to move into ㅠㅠ
Oh really?

Korean: 다음 집은 어떤 집으로 갈 거야?
English: What house are you going to go to next?

Korean: 다음에는 주택도 살아보고 싶어서 고민 중이야!
English: I'm thinking about buying a house next time!
I thought it would be nice to have a yard
A house with a yard is nice!

Korean: 근데 그런 집은 너무 비싸서 좋은데 구하기가 쉽지 않더라
English: But those houses are so expensive that it's hard to find them
I need to look into it carefully and buy it.
Are you interested in real estate?

Korean: 잘 알지는 못하는데 요즘에는 좀 관심을 가져보려고 하고 있어!
English: I don't know much about it, but I've been trying to take an interest in it lately!
how about you?
You can say that I don't know much
I'm not even that interested Kiki
It's still too difficult...

Korean: 내 집 마련의 꿈 같은 건 없어
English: There is no such thing as a dream of owning a home
I have that dream too...

Korean: 집값이 계속 오르니까 지금이라도 매매를 해야 되나 싶고~
English: Since house prices keep rising, I'm wondering if I should buy or sell now~

Korean: 너는 언젠가는 집을 사야겠다고는 생각하지 않아?
English: Don't you think you'll buy a house someday?
Should I buy a house?
I want it too much

Korean: 근데 현실적으로 어려움도 너무 크다 보니까 애초에 체념하는 기분이랄까?
English: But realistically, the difficulties are so great that I feel like I've given up from the start?

Korean: 아무래도 수도권보다는 지방이면 집값이 더 싼데 그리로 가는 생각은 안 해 봤어?
English: Since housing prices are cheaper in the provinces than in the metropolitan area, have you ever thought about moving there?

Korean: 그치 지방이었으면 더 빨리 샀을 거 같은데
English: If it was the province, I would have bought it sooner.

Korean: 원래부터 서울에 살았고 모든 게 다 서울에 있으니까 지방에서 사는 건 상상을 안 해봤어 ㅠㅠ
English: I've always lived in Seoul and everything is in Seoul, so I never imagined living in the countryside ㅠㅠ

Korean: 너는 다른 지역에서 살 생각도 있어?
English: Are you thinking of living in another area?

Korean: 음 부동산에 관심이 많아서 제대로 알아본 건 아니지만 비교해보고 훨씬 싼데 집도 크고 마음에 든다 하면 갈 수도 있을 것 같아
English: Well, I'm interested in real estate, so I haven't looked into it properly, but I compared it and it's much cheaper, and the house is big, so if you like it, you might want to go.

Korean: 다음 집은 그럼 전세로 알아보는 거야?
English: So are you looking for a rental for your next house?
I need to find out about both rent and sale~

Korean: 집을 사면 내가 원하는 대로 인테리어할 수 있으니까 좋을 거 같긴 해
English: I think it would be nice to buy a house because I can decorate it the way I want.

Korean: 그치 내 집 인테리어 하는 게 진짜 행복할 것 같아
English: Yeah, I think I'd be really happy decorating my house.

Korean: 그럼 어떤 스타일로 인테리어 하고 싶어?
English: So what style of interior do you want to do?

Korean: 나는 그냥 환하고 깔끔하게만 하면 좋을 거 같아!
English: I think I'd be fine with just making it bright and clean!

Korean: 좀 시간 지나도 유행 안 타게 하하
English: Even if some time passes, it won't become a trend haha

Korean: 방 꾸미거나 그런 거 좋아하는 편이야?
English: Do you like decorating your room or something like that?

Korean: 좋아하긴 하는데 아무래도 난 혼자 사는 게 아니라서 그동안도 내 마음대로 못 꾸미긴 했어
English: I like it, but since I don't live alone, I haven't been able to decorate it the way I want.

Korean: 내 집 마련을 하고 싶은 이유이기도 하지
English: That's also why I want to buy my own house.
Are you good at dressing up?

Korean: 아니 나도 마음은 잘 꾸미고 싶은데 생각보다 그런 센스는 없는 거 같아 키키
English: No, I also want to dress up my heart well, but I don't think I have the sense to do that, Kiki

Korean: 나중에 하게 되면 인테리어 업체에 맡겨야지~
English: If you do it later, you should leave it to an interior design company~

Korean: 집도 잘 장만해서 꼭 원하는 인테리어로 하길 바랄게!
English: I hope you decorate your house well and have the interior you want!

Korean: 요즘 너무 더워서 대중교통으로 출퇴근하기 힘들다 그치?
English: It's so hot these days that it's hard to commute to work by public transportation, right?

Korean: 아 맞아 너무 공감해 출근만 해도 지치더라.
English: Oh right, I totally agree. I get tired just going to work.
Don't you plan on going by car?

Korean: 이 주변이 차가 너무 막히고 주차도 힘들 거 같아서 못 갖고 다니지 않을까?
English: I wonder if I won't be able to take it around here because the traffic is so congested and parking will be difficult?

Korean: 넌 거리도 있는데 차로 다니면 더 편했긴 하겠다
English: You have a long way to go, so it would be more convenient to go by car.

Korean: 거리가 멀긴 한데 그래서 그만큼 오는 동안의 정체가 더 심할 거야
English: It's a long distance, so traffic congestion will be worse on the way there.

Korean: 찾아본 적도 있는데 똑같이 두 시간 걸린다더라.
English: I looked it up and it said it takes the same two hours.

Korean: 너라면 그래도 차로 다닐 것 같아?
English: Do you think you'd still go by car?

Korean: 시간이 똑같으면 그냥 오는 동안 핸드폰 보고 쉬는 게 더 낫긴 하겠다 ㅠㅠ
English: If the time is the same, it would be better to just rest and look at my phone on the way there ㅠㅠ
If only I could just sit down and come!

Korean: 맞아 그래서 자면서 그냥 오고 있어 하하
English: Yeah that's why I just came while sleeping haha

Korean: 할 수만 있다면 비행기 하나 장만해서 그걸로 출퇴근하고 싶다...
English: If I could, I would like to buy a plane and commute to work on it...
Even if you make Kiki, where are you going to put it?

Korean: 하나 있으면 여기 저기 돌아다닐 수 있는 데가 많긴 하겠다
English: If you have one, there are a lot of places you can go around.
That's why I can't prepare... haha

Korean: 요즘 전기차들 많이 생겼던데 갖고 싶은 마음 없어?
English: There are so many electric cars these days. Don't you want to have one?

Korean: 좀 궁금하긴 해! 자율 주행도 되고 그러니까~
English: I'm a bit curious! It can drive autonomously too~

Korean: 나중에 차 바꿀 때 되면 전기차도 한 번 생각해봐야지 하하
English: When I change my car later, I should consider an electric car too haha
How about an electric car?
I'm not sure yet

Korean: 길 다니면서도 보면 소리가 너무 안 나서 깜짝 놀랄 때가 많거든 그런 거 보면 위험한 것 같기도 하고.
English: When I walk down the street and see it, I'm often startled because the sound is so quiet. When I see something like that, it seems dangerous.
Did you know that the country supports you?

Korean: 응! 근데 그것도 다 지원 해 주는 게 아니더라...
English: Yeah! But they don't support all of that either...

Korean: 좀 가격대 있는 차는 지원 안 해주더라고 ㅠㅠ
English: They don't support cars that are a bit more expensive ㅠㅠ

Korean: 물론 그거 살 돈도 없지만 키키
English: Of course I don't have the money to buy that, but Kiki
Oh right, that's what I heard

Korean: 그래서 난 아직 첫 차도 없으니까 그냥 중고차로 나중에 살까 해
English: So I don't have my first car yet, so I'm thinking of just buying a used car later.
If it's your first time, a compact car would be better, right?

Korean: 운전하기 편하긴 할 텐데 고속도로 같은데 다닐 일 있으면 좀 위험하긴 하지!
English: It might be easy to drive, but it's a bit dangerous if you have to drive on highways or something!

Korean: 너무 작은 건 말고 중형 세단 정도로 알아봐봐
English: Don't look for something too small, something like a mid-sized sedan.
Oh, is that so?

Korean: 차가 작으면 고속도로 다니기가 오히려 무섭긴 하겠다
English: If your car is small, it might be scary to drive on the highway.

Korean: 큰 차면 다니는데 제한되는 것도 없고 무시도 안 당할 것 같아 하하
English: If you drive a big car, there are no restrictions and you won't be ignored haha

Korean: 그치 오히려 큰 차는 시야가 높아서 운전하기는 편하더라고~ 주차가 힘들긴 하지만.
English: Well, actually, it's easier to drive a big car because the field of vision is higher. Parking is difficult though.
If you pick a car, give me a ride~!

Korean: 언제가 될 지는 모르지만 차 생기면 놀러 가자!
English: I don't know when that will be, but when I get a car, let's go play!

Korean: 예전 회사 다닐 때 회식 많이 했어?
English: Did you have a lot of company dinners when you were working at your previous company?

Korean: 사무실에서 시켜 먹고 논 적은 많아도 따로 회식은 많이 안 했어
English: I've ordered food and had drinks at the office a lot, but I haven't had many separate company dinners.

Korean: 근데 오히려 그게 더 좋더라고 너무 술 먹게 되지 않아서!
English: But I actually like it better because I don't end up drinking too much!
Have you done a lot?
Wow, that's great!

Korean: 응 나는 자주 하기도 하고 하게 되면 술도 많이 먹이고 이래서 좀 힘들었어 ㅠㅠ 업무의 연장선.
English: Yeah, I do it often, and when I do, they make me drink a lot, so it's a bit difficult ㅠㅠ It's an extension of work.

Korean: 그럼 너무 싫지 그냥 회사는 정해진 근무 시간만 있었으면 좋겠어.
English: Well then, I don't hate it so much. I just wish companies had set working hours.
Wasn't the work very tough?
Yeah, work was tough.

Korean: 급여를 좀 많이 줬으면 좀 참았을지 모르겠는데 그것도 아니고 하하
English: If they had paid me a bit more, I might have tolerated it, but that wasn't the case, haha

Korean: 일은 안 힘들고 돈은 많이 주는 회사가 있으면 좋겠다~
English: I wish there was a company that didn't have hard work and paid a lot of money~
Hey buddy, it's about time you knew, right?

Korean: 그런 회사는 이 세상에 존재하지 않아 ^^
English: A company like that doesn't exist in this world ^^

Korean: 직장에서 사람 때문에 힘든 적은 없어?
English: Have you ever had a hard time because of people at work?
^^ Haha I know...
There were some not so good people too

Korean: 진짜 일보다도 사람 때문에 힘들면 답 없는 거 같음 ㅠㅠ
English: If you're having a hard time because of people rather than your actual work, it seems like there's no answer ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그치 거의 대부분이 사람 때문에 힘들걸.
English: Yeah, most of it is hard because of people.

Korean: 나도 그랬고 그렇게 안 맞는 사람들하고 회의하기도 너무 싫어.
English: I used to be like that too, and I hate meeting people who don't fit in so well.
Yeah, I don't even want to look at your face.
But I'm glad I don't see it anymore!
Have you ever negotiated your salary at work?

Korean: 아니 나는 급여가 고정적으로 책정돼있는 데를 다녔어서.
English: No, I worked at a place where the salary was fixed.
Have you tried it?

Korean: 응 맞아 나는 했었는데 진짜 어렵더라.
English: Yeah, that's right. I did it, but it was really hard.

Korean: 그냥 고정적으로 돼 있는 곳이 세상 편한 것 같아
English: I think the world is more comfortable when things are just fixed

Korean: 그치 말이 협상이지 협상이 아니고 회사에서 정한 대로 따르는 거 아냐? 키키
English: Isn't that a negotiation? It's not a negotiation. It's just following the company's rules? Kiki

Korean: 그렇지 그냥 회사에서 시키는 대로 거의 했지
English: Yeah, I pretty much just did whatever the company told me to do.

Korean: 의견은 반영이 안 됐던 것 같아 키키
English: Kiki, I don't think your opinion was reflected

Korean: 그치 그래도 협상이라고 해서 계속 조금씩 올려주면 기분은 좋을 거 같긴 해 !
English: Yeah, but I think it would feel good if they kept raising it little by little under the pretext of negotiation!

Korean: 그러면 그나마 회사 다닐 맛이 나지
English: Then I'll have some fun going to work
It's really hard being a salaried worker... ^^
Have you ever seen a program called Steel Troops?

Korean: 아 그거 보지는 않았는데 꽤 얘기가 있었던 걸로 알아
English: Oh, I didn't see that, but I heard there was quite a bit of talk about it
Do you know a real man similar to that?

Korean: 응응 그거는 연예인들이 가서 체험하는 거잖아!
English: Yeah, that's something celebrities go and experience!

Korean: 이건 일반인 예비역들이 같은 부대끼리 팀을 짜서 대결하는 거야 특전사는 특전사끼리 뭐 이렇게
English: This is a competition between ordinary reservists who form teams within the same unit. Special forces compete against each other.

Korean: 오 그러면 더 실감나고 몰입이 잘 되겠다 완전 간접 체험이네!
English: Oh, then it will be more realistic and immersive. It will be a completely vicarious experience!
Yeah, it's survival so it's really fun Kiki
Did you like the program Real Men?

Korean: 매번 보지는 않았는데 한때 유명했어서 몇 번 보기는 했어!
English: I didn't watch it every time, but it was famous at one time, so I watched it a few times!
But it was still fun

Korean: 화생방 훈련은 한번 해 보고 싶다고 생각했는데 어떨 것 같아?
English: I've been thinking about trying chemical, biological, radiological and nuclear warfare training. What do you think?

Korean: 오. 궁금하긴 한데 안 하고 싶어 나는 하하
English: Oh. I'm curious but I don't want to do it haha
Are you all in so much pain?

Korean: 맞아 괴로워서 해 보고 싶어 키키
English: Yeah, it's painful, I want to try it Kiki

Korean: 뭔가 극한 체험 같은 그런 거 하면 세상이 달리 보이고 그럴 것 같아
English: I think if you do something extreme, you'll see the world differently.

Korean: 주변에서 해 본 사람들 얘기 안 들어봤어?
English: Haven't you heard from people around you who have tried it?

Korean: 응 생각해보니까 따로 화생방 얘기를 들어본 적은 없네?
English: Yeah, come to think of it, I've never heard of chemical, biological, radiological warfare talk before?
I want to try it because I'm in pain

Korean: 아냐 그냥 체험 한번 하고 싶다 이거지
English: No, I just want to experience this once.
When you overcome pain, you grow as a person ^^
Military life will probably become a little easier.

Korean: 그건 그래 엄청 힘든 거 이겨내고 나면 다른 건 아무것도 아니게 느껴지겠지!
English: That's right, after you overcome something incredibly difficult, nothing else will feel like that!

Korean: 친구 중에 공군 갔다 온 애가 있는데 휴가가 많아서 좋다고 하더라
English: I have a friend who served in the Air Force and he said it was good because he got a lot of vacation time.
Oh really? That's the first time I found out about that.

Korean: 군대 간 친구들 휴가 나왔을 때 만난 적 있어?
English: Have you ever met your friends from the military when you were on leave?
What did you play?

Korean: 응 그냥 술 먹고 맛있는 거 먹고 그랬지~
English: Yeah, I just drank alcohol and ate delicious food~

Korean: 안에서 먹고 싶었던 게 많잖아 군인들은 키키
English: There were a lot of things I wanted to eat inside, the soldiers Kiki

Korean: 그치 오래간만에 휴가 나오면 장난 신세계지 그들한테는 하하
English: Well, when you go on vacation after a long time, it's a whole new world for them haha

Korean: 군대 만약 간다면 어떤 보직이 잘 맞을 것 같아?
English: If I were to join the military, what position do you think would suit me best?

Korean: 음. 나는 행정병 키키 꿀 보직일 거 같아
English: Hmm. I think administrative soldier Kiki would be a good fit.
you?

Korean: 나는 취사병 가보고 싶더라 그 많은 사람들이 먹을 거 만들면 뭔가 뿌듯할 것 같아!
English: I'd like to try cooking for all those people. I think it would be satisfying to cook for that many people!

Korean: 시험 보고 자격증 따는 건 학생 때가 끝일 줄 알았는데 왜 아직도 하고 있는 걸까?
English: I thought taking exams and getting certifications was the end of my student years, so why am I still doing it?

Korean: 그건 우리가 이 길을 선택했기 때문이지. 하하
English: That's because we chose this path. Haha.

Korean: 힘내길 바라고 어려서는 어떤 과목 잘 했어?
English: I hope you do well. What subjects were you good at when you were young?

Korean: 나는 과학을 잘 했고 좋아하기도 했는데 수학을 못해서 그냥 문과를 택했어.
English: I was good at science and liked it, but I was bad at math, so I just chose liberal arts.

Korean: 이제 와서 생각해보면 잘못 선택한 듯 키키
English: Now that I think about it, I think I made a wrong choice Kiki
you?

Korean: 나는 과학도 수학도 둘 다 못해서. 확실히 문과 체질이야 국어는 좀 했거든
English: I'm bad at neither science nor math. I'm definitely more of a liberal arts major. I did a bit of Korean.
So you think I should have gone into science?

Korean: 수학만 좀 더 열심히 했으면 그냥 이과를 갔을 거 같아!
English: If only I had studied math a little harder, I think I would have just gone to science!

Korean: 확연하게 문과라고 생각한 적은 없거든 ㅠ
English: I never really thought of myself as a liberal arts major ㅠ

Korean: 그럼 국어 말고 영어나 다른 외국어도 잘 했어?
English: Then, were you good at English or other foreign languages besides Korean?

Korean: 그럴 리가? 나는 토종 한국인이라 타국 언어는 별로 관심이 없네. 그래도 배우면 진짜 쓸모 많을 것 같긴 해
English: How could that be? I'm a native Korean, so I'm not really interested in foreign languages. But I think it would be really useful if I learned it.
Don't you study foreign languages?

Korean: 응 지금은 안 하고 있는데 미드나 이런 거 보면 영어를 좀 더 공부해서 자막 없이 보고 싶긴 해!
English: Yeah, I'm not doing it now, but when I watch Midna or something like that, I want to study English a bit more and watch it without subtitles!

Korean: 그치 영어가 진짜 초등학생 때부터 배웠는데도 평생의 난제야..
English: Yeah, I've been learning English since elementary school, but it's still a lifelong challenge.

Korean: 간단한 회화 정도는 할 수 있는 실력이야?
English: Are you capable of having a simple conversation?

Korean: 응 여행 가거나 뭐 이런 때는 문제없지!
English: Yeah, it's no problem when you go on a trip or something like that!

Korean: 아무래도 듣는 건 잘하는데 말하는 게 많이 어렵긴 한 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: I think I'm good at listening, but speaking is really difficult ㅠㅠ
how about you?
Oh, then you're not good at it?

Korean: 나는 문제 있지만 문제 없어 키키
English: I have a problem but it's not a problem Kiki

Korean: 말이 안 나오지만 손과 발과 얼굴을 쓰지 그리고 무엇보다 영어 말하는 거는 자신감인 것 같아
English: I can't speak, but I use my hands, feet, and face, and most of all, I think speaking English is a confidence thing.

Korean: 어 그건 맞아! 잘 못해도 그냥 되는 대로 말하면 다 알아듣기는 하더라 키키
English: Oh, that's right! Even if you're not good at it, if you just say it the way it is, they'll understand everything Kiki

Korean: 나중에 시간이 좀 나면 회화 학원이라도 다닐 까봐
English: Later, when I have some time, I think I'll go to a conversation school

Korean: 근데 요즘엔 워낙 유튜브나 인강 같은 것들이 잘 돼 있어서 시간 내서 학원 가는 게 더 안 될 수도 있어.
English: But these days, things like YouTube and online lectures are so well-established that it may be difficult to make time to go to an academy.

Korean: 학교 다닐 때 영어 성적은 어느 정도였어?
English: How was your English grade when you were in school?

Korean: 영어 성적은 나쁘진 않았던 거 같은데 계속 공부해도 성적이 크게 오르진 않더라 ㅠㅠ
English: My English grades weren't bad, but even though I kept studying, they didn't really go up much ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 요즘엔 유튜브도 뭔가 올라와 있는 게 많더라
English: Yeah, there's a lot of stuff on YouTube these days.

Korean: 영어 성적 올리기가 쉽지 않지 모국어도 아니라.
English: It's not easy to improve your English grades, and it's not even your native language.

Korean: 유튜브 같은 걸로 보면서 맘 맞는 사람들하고 스터디 해도 괜찮지 않을까?
English: Wouldn't it be okay to study with like-minded people by watching something like YouTube?

Korean: 그래도 좋을 거 같은데 요즘은 사람 만나기가 또 그래서 코로나 풀리면 그것도 생각 해봐야겠당
English: I think that would be good, but it's hard to meet people these days, so I'll have to think about that when the coronavirus situation is over.

Korean: 코로나가 많이 걸리긴 하네 맘 놓고 영어 공부 할 수 있길 바라야지!
English: There are a lot of people with Corona. I hope you can study English with peace of mind!

Korean: 저번에 부산가서 동생이랑 잘 놀고 왔어?
English: Did you have fun with your little brother when you went to Busan last time?
I had a great time

Korean: 잊지 못할 추억들이 엄청 많았어 하하
English: There were so many unforgettable memories haha
When was the last time you went on a trip with your family?

Korean: 나는 얼마 전에 가족들이랑 제주도 갔다 왔어~
English: I went to Jeju Island with my family a while ago~

Korean: 아 그러네 하필 시국이 안 좋아서 다니는 게 편하지 않았을 텐데 여행하면서 싸우진 않았어?
English: Oh, I see. It must have been difficult to travel around during these difficult times. Didn't you get into any fights while traveling?

Korean: 응응 날이 더워서 조금 짜증 날 뻔한 적은 있는데 싸우진 않았어!
English: Yeah, it was so hot that I almost got a little annoyed, but we didn't fight!

Korean: 여동생이 있으면 옷 같은 것도 같이 공유하고 그래?
English: If you have a younger sister, you share things like clothes, right?

Korean: 그치 하필 쌍둥이라 나이도 같고 체격도 비슷하고 해서 옷 사이즈나 이런 것도 같다 보니 서로의 옷을 입기도 해
English: Of course, since they are twins, they are the same age and have similar builds, so they even wear each other's clothes.

Korean: 근데 둘 다 서로 싫어해 엄청 키키 그래도 좋은 점이 더 많아?
English: But they both hate each other so much Kiki. But are there more good points?

Korean: 그치 아무래도 내가 입고 싶은데 그 옷이 없을 수도 있고 키키
English: Yeah, I guess I might want to wear something, but they might not have it. Kiki

Korean: 그래도 옷장을 공유하면 옷 종류가 더 많아지니까 좋을 거 같아 !
English: Still, I think it would be good to share a closet because you'd have more clothes to choose from!

Korean: 나는 여자 형제가 없어서 그게 부럽다
English: I don't have a sister so I'm jealous of that.

Korean: 근데 뭐 오빠여도 다들 오빠 옷 한 번씩 입고 그러지 않아?
English: But even if you're an older brother, don't you all wear older brother's clothes at least once?

Korean: 사이즈 크고 해도 그 나름대로 입는 옷들이 있을 것 같은데?
English: Even if the size is big, there must be clothes that can be worn in their own way, right?

Korean: 응 뭐 반팔 티 같은 경우는 박시하게 입을 수 있긴 하지!
English: Yeah, you can wear something like a short-sleeved T-shirt in a boxy way!

Korean: 그렇지만 신발 가방 이런 거는 없으니까...
English: But there are no shoes or bags or anything like that...
Are you wearing your brother's too?

Korean: 지금은 오빠랑 같이 안 살아서 입을 수는 없는데 학생 때 아무래도 많이 입은 것 같아
English: I can't wear it now because I don't live with my brother, but I think I wore it a lot when I was a student.

Korean: 그냥 뭐 두툼한 옷들 그런 거?
English: Just some thick clothes or something?

Korean: 그치 맨투맨이나 후드티는 입을 수 있지!
English: Yeah, you can wear a man-to-man or a hoodie!

Korean: 얼마 전에 어머니 생신이셨다며 선물 뭐 해드렸어?
English: It was your mother's birthday recently. What did you give her as a present?

Korean: 음 나 이번에 특별히 현금 드렸어
English: Um, I gave you cash this time
My parents said that's what they like the most
I gave you a big 500,000 won haha
Is this kind of gift okay?

Korean: 응 마음에 안 드는 선물보다는 현금이 최고지~
English: Yeah, cash is better than a gift you don't like~

Korean: 별로 실용적이진 않지만 꽃도 가끔 드리면 좋아하시더라고!
English: It's not very practical, but he likes it when I give him flowers sometimes!

Korean: 어버이날에 드렸는데 생각보다 너무 좋아하셔서 놀랐어 종종 드려야겠더라고
English: I gave it to her on Parents' Day, and she liked it more than I expected, so I was surprised. I thought I should give it to her often.

Korean: 부모님한테 해 드린 선물 중에 기억에 남는 거 있어?
English: Is there a memorable gift you gave to your parents?

Korean: 나는 아빠가 술을 좋아하셔서 양주 비싼 걸로 사드렸더니 좋아하시더라고 키키 건강에는 안 좋지만~
English: My dad likes alcohol, so I bought him some expensive liquor and he liked it. It's not good for Kiki's health, but~

Korean: 더 돈 모아서 다른 좋은 선물도 사드리려고! 너는 현금 말고 어떤 거 있어?
English: I'm going to save up more money to buy you another nice gift! What do you have besides cash?

Korean: 선물보다는 주로 외식으로 많이 때웠는데 이제 현금으로 드려야겠어
English: I used to spend more on eating out than on gifts, but now I have to give cash.
Have you been to a wedding recently?

Korean: 나 아니 요즘 시국도 이렇고 그래서 그런가 주변에 결혼한 사람이 없어서 가질 않았어
English: No, I don't have one because there's no one around me who's married these days.

Korean: 이번 달에도 있는데 안 갈 예정. 가면 결혼하고 싶어질 것 같아!
English: There's one this month too, but I don't plan on going. If I go, I think I'll want to get married!

Korean: 그래? 나는 시국이 이런데도 은근히 결혼하는 친구들이 많아 !
English: Really? Even in these times, I have a lot of friends who secretly get married!

Korean: 다들 작년에 좀 참다가 이제 코로나 끝날 기미가 안 보이니까 그냥 해버리는 것 같아
English: I think everyone endured it for a while last year, but now that there is no sign of the coronavirus ending, they are just giving up.
Oh really?
How many people did it?

Korean: 이번 달에도 한 명 있고 다음 달에도 한 명 있어!
English: There's one this month and one next month!

Korean: 내년 초에도 있고 은근 많아~ 결혼식을 다 갈 수 있을지는 모르겠지만
English: There are still a lot of weddings early next year, but I don't know if I'll be able to attend them all.

Korean: 그 친구들은 다 오래 연애하고 결혼하는 거야?
English: Do all those friends date for a long time and get married?

Korean: 보통 1년 정도 연애하고 하는 거 같아!
English: I think it usually takes about a year to date!

Korean: 너는 보통 연애 하면 오래 만나는 편이야?
English: When you date, do you usually stay in relationships for a long time?

Korean: 오래 만나고 싶은데 그게 잘 안 되는 것 같아.
English: I've been wanting to meet you for a long time, but it doesn't seem to be going well.

Korean: 잘 맞는 사람 만나는 게 너무 어렵다.
English: It's so hard to meet the right person.
How many times have you dated and been married?
I've been seeing him for about two and a half years~
Are you interested in going on a blind date?

Korean: 옛날에는 없었는데 이제 그런 거라도 해야 할 것 같아 키키
English: It didn't exist in the past, but I think it's time to do something like that now Kiki
Want to introduce me?

Korean: 응 생각 있으면 한 번 찾아봐야지~!
English: Yeah, if you have any thoughts, you should look it up~!
What age difference is okay?

Korean: 나는 연하만 아니면 상관 없는데 5살 정도까지가 좋은 것 같아
English: I don't mind as long as they're not younger, but I think up to 5 years old would be good.

Korean: 저번에 그 잘생겼다던 친구는 잘 지내? ^^
English: How is that handsome guy you mentioned last time? ^^
Kiki, are you interested in him?
He has a pretty face but his personality is not that great~
Oh really?

Korean: 잘생겼다길래 혹했는데 성격 안 좋으면 만날 수가 없지
English: I was tempted because they said he was handsome, but if his personality is bad, I won't be able to meet him.
Oh, that's too bad

Korean: 너는 성격 잘 맞는 사람들 많이 만났어?
English: Have you met many people whose personalities match yours?

Korean: 응 대부분 외모 보다는 성격 보고 만났던 거 같아~
English: Yeah, I think most people meet based on personality rather than appearance.

Korean: 그리고 얼굴보다는 키가 중요한 듯 나는!
English: And I think height is more important than face!
Stop looking at my face
I don't see your face much.
A man is a character!

Korean: 나 요즘 너무 강아지 키우고 싶어.
English: I really want to raise a puppy these days.

Korean: 어 나도! 애기 강아지 품에 완전 안고 싶다.
English: Oh me too! I really want to hold that puppy in my arms.
Is this a situation where you can't raise it?

Korean: 키우려면 너무 신경 써야 될 게 많잖아.
English: There are so many things to take care of when raising a child.

Korean: 그리고 나중에 아프고 이런 것도 마음 아프고 ㅠㅠ
English: And later on, I got sick and this also hurt my heart ㅠㅠ

Korean: 그건 그렇지만 키우면서 행복이 훨씬 클 텐데?
English: But wouldn't the happiness be much greater while raising them?

Korean: 나는 집에 사람도 많이 없고 애가 혼자 있을 게 뻔해서 못 키우고 있어.
English: I can't raise the child because there aren't many people at home and it's obvious the child will be left alone.
Yeah, that's something I'm also concerned about.

Korean: 강아지 혼자 하루 종일 집에 있게 하는 것도 좀 아닌 거 같아서 ㅠㅠ
English: I don't think it's right to leave the dog home alone all day ㅠㅠ
Have you ever raised fish?

Korean: 물고기 키우는 친구들 보기만 했고 내가 키운 적은 없어
English: I've only seen friends raise fish, but I've never raised one myself.

Korean: 아쿠아리움 갔을 때 키워보고 싶다는 생각은 했어 하하
English: I thought about raising one when I went to the aquarium haha
But don't you think about it when you go?
That's true!

Korean: 요즘에는 카페에서 수족관 설치해서 물고기도 구경할 수 있고 판매도 하는 데가 있더라?
English: These days, there are cafes that have aquariums installed so you can see the fish and even buy them.

Korean: 물고기 카페! 몇 군데 있는 것 같더라고
English: Fish cafe! I think there are a few.

Korean: 어릴 때 특이한 동물 키우던 친구들 없었어?
English: Didn't you have any friends who raised unusual animals when you were young?

Korean: 앵무새 키우던 친구가 있었는데 막 새장에서 나와서 집안에도 돌아다녀서 좀 무서웠어.
English: I had a friend who had a parrot, and it would come out of its cage and run around the house, so I was a little scared.
Were you among your friends?
I was there too

Korean: 페릿이라고 족제비과 동물 키우는 애였는데 애 자체가 특이해서 아직도 기억난다 키키
English: I still remember the ferret that I raised because it was a mustelid. Kiki
Do you know that animal?

Korean: 들어는 봤는데 실제로는 한 번도 못 본 거 같아
English: I've heard of it, but I don't think I've ever actually seen it.
I think it would be cute? Haha

Korean: 사진 보여주고 막 그랬는데 반려 동물로 삼을 만하더라
English: I showed him the picture and he said it was good enough to be my pet.

Korean: 생긴 게 진짜 귀엽긴 했어 키키
English: Kiki, you look really cute
So I also wanted to raise one at one time
I see

Korean: 강아지 말고 다른 동물 키워보고 싶은 거 있어?
English: Besides a dog, is there any other animal you would like to raise?
Well, there are many things I want to try growing

Korean: 나 혼자 산다 보고 고슴도치도 키워보고 싶어졌어 귀엽더라 하하
English: After watching I Live Alone, I wanted to raise a hedgehog too. It was so cute haha

Korean: 햄스터도 흔한데 안 키워봐서 키워보고 싶고 너는?
English: Hamsters are common, but I've never raised one before and would like to try raising one. What about you?
I raised a hamster when I was little!

Korean: 근데 강아지만큼 애교를 부리고 하는 게 아니라서 키우게 되면 난 무조건 강아지!
English: But it doesn't act as cute as a puppy, so if I were to raise it, I'd definitely choose a puppy!
After all, dogs are our nation's pets!

Korean: 나 요즘에 캠핑 다니는데 재미 들렸어
English: I've been going camping lately and it's been fun.

Korean: 아 하긴 요즘 날씨도 좋아서 캠핑 하기 딱이지
English: Oh well, the weather is nice these days so it's perfect for camping
I'm into fishing
Really? Don't you get seasick?

Korean: 아 근데 바다 낚시 말고 그냥 땅에서 낚싯대 던져 놓고 하는 거! 그게 은근 생각 정리할 수 있고 좋더라고
English: Oh, but instead of fishing in the ocean, I just throw my fishing rod on the land and do it! That's good because it helps me organize my thoughts.
Oh, freshwater fishing?

Korean: 그건 멀미 안 해서 좋을 거 같아!
English: I think that would be good because it wouldn't make you motion sick!
Do you have a favorite fishing spot?

Korean: 정확한 이름은 모르겠는데 강원도에 무슨. 생각이 안 난다 하하
English: I don't know the exact name, but it's in Gangwon-do. I can't remember it haha

Korean: 또 좋아하는 야외 활동 뭐가 있어?
English: What other outdoor activities do you like?
These days, I go hiking sometimes!

Korean: 등산 좋지 운동도 많이 되고 그건 진짜 하고 나면 개운한 것 같아서 좋아
English: I like hiking because it gives me a lot of exercise and I feel really refreshed after doing it.
How many hours does it take?

Korean: 두세 시간 정도씩은 가는 거 같아!
English: I think it takes about two or three hours!
It's the best if you get off and drink makgeolli
That's why I climb mountains.
Is there a mountain you often go to?

Korean: 나는 청계산도 가고 아차산도 자주 가~
English: I often go to Cheonggyesan and Achasan~
Do you want to go to the mountain with the kids next time?
Okay, I really want to go

Korean: 우리 주말에 날 좀 선선해지면 가면 되겠다
English: We can go when the weather gets a little cooler this weekend.

Korean: 그때까지 산 타는 실력 좀 키우고 하하
English: Until then, I'll work on my mountain climbing skills haha
Yeah yeah, build up some stamina~!
It's too hot now, so let's go around September.

Korean: 9월 되면 적당히 선선해져서 이것저것 많이 하고 싶을 것 같은데 또 좋아하는 운동 있어?
English: It's going to get a bit cooler in September, so I think you'll want to do a lot of different things. Do you have any favorite sports?

Korean: 내가 하는 거 말고 야구 보는 거 좋아해!
English: I like watching baseball more than playing it!

Korean: 어제 한일전 하는 거 봤는데 져서 너무 슬프더라 ㅠㅠ
English: I watched the Korea-Japan match yesterday and I was so sad because they lost ㅠㅠ
Did you see it too?

Korean: 아니 야구는 잘 몰라서 봐도 모르겠더라고 나중에 봐볼게!
English: No, I don't know much about baseball, so I didn't know even after watching it. I'll watch it later!

Korean: 너 동생이 게임 하는 거 좋아한다고 했지?
English: You said your brother likes playing games, right?

Korean: 오 맞아 동생도 유독 좋아하긴 하는데 나도 사실 좋아해
English: Oh right, my younger sibling likes it too, but I actually like it too
I did this a lot when I was young
What games did you play mostly?

Korean: 나는 한 때 메이플 했었는데 이제는 안 해~
English: I used to play MapleStory, but I don't anymore~
What did you do?
I played Starcraft!

Korean: 우리 어릴 때 그 게임 진짜 유명했잖아 방송도 막 찾아보고 그랬는데 기억나?
English: When we were kids, that game was really popular. Do you remember looking up broadcasts and stuff?
Yeah, I think that's what happened!

Korean: 내 친구 중에는 프로게이머 되고 싶다고 한 애도 있었어
English: Among my friends, there was one who said he wanted to become a pro gamer.
Oh me too me too
Actually, there was someone who was preparing for that

Korean: 어릴 때는 한 번 하면 몇 시간 정도 했어?
English: When you were young, how many hours did you play at a time?

Korean: 두 시간 정도 했던 거 같아!
English: I think it took about two hours!

Korean: 나 대학 다닐 때 애들이랑 한 번 위닝이라는 게임도 해봤는데 이거 알아?
English: When I was in college, I played a game called Winning with my friends. Do you know this?

Korean: 아니 그건 처음 들어본다 컴퓨터 게임이야?
English: Oh, I've never heard of that before. Is it a computer game?

Korean: 그 게임을 할 수 있는 피시방? 오락실? 같은 데가 있었는데 키키
English: There was a PC room or arcade where you could play that game. Kiki
It was a soccer game, and that was fun too.
Ah, soccer games are really fun

Korean: 나도 오락실에 가면 맨날 하던 축구 게임 있었는데 혹시 그 게임이 그거인가?
English: There was a soccer game I always played when I went to the arcade. Is that the one?

Korean: 한 번 하면 오래 하게 되는 게임이야?
English: Is this a game that you play for a long time once you start?
I think I did quite a bit!

Korean: 예전에는 그래도 게임을 하긴 했는데 요새는 거의 안 한다
English: I used to play games, but I hardly ever do these days.
You too?

Korean: 그치 아무래도 회사 다니고 하면 시간이 없으니까 집에서 시간 날 때는 쉬기 바쁘지.
English: Of course, since I don't have much time after going to work, I'm busy resting when I have time at home.

Korean: 그치 그래도 나중에는 플레이스테이션 같은 거 사서 집에서도 해보고 싶긴 해!
English: Yeah, but I still want to buy something like a PlayStation later and play it at home!

Korean: 아 나도 어릴 때 그거 진짜 갖고 싶어서 부모님한테 사 달라고 엄청 졸랐지
English: Oh, when I was little, I really wanted that too, so I begged my parents to buy it for me.
Do you have a favorite game character?
I like the character Adele!
Are you there?

Korean: 아니 나는 딱히 좋아하는 애는 없어!
English: No, I don't really have a favorite!
Where have you traveled abroad?
I've been to Kota Kinabalu and Vietnam.
you?
Oh, I want to go to Kota Kinabalu~

Korean: 나는 유럽 배낭 여행 한 달 동안 해서 여러 군데 가봤는데 동남아를 안 가봤어
English: I've been backpacking around Europe for a month and have been to many places, but I've never been to Southeast Asia.

Korean: 동남아는 친근한 느낌이면서도 물가도 저렴하고 부담 없이 놀러 가기 진짜 좋은 것 같아 추천 !
English: I recommend Southeast Asia because it has a friendly feel, is cheap, and is a great place to go and have fun without feeling burdened!

Korean: 그치 동남아는 가까워서 자주 갈 수 있을 거라고 생각해서 그런지 아직까지 가 보질 않았네 하하
English: Yeah, I thought Southeast Asia was close enough that I could go there often, but I haven't been there yet haha
The food looks delicious too

Korean: 음식은 워낙 취향이다 보니까 난 맛있는 것도 있고 정말 안 맞았던 것도 있어 하하
English: Since food is a matter of taste, there are some things that are delicious and some that really don't suit me haha

Korean: 그럼 여행 갈 때 그곳의 유명 음식 이런 거 보고 선정하는 편이야?
English: So when you travel, do you tend to choose based on the famous local food?

Korean: 그런 걸 보고 여행지를 정하는 건 아닌데 여행 가려고 하면 우선 뭐가 맛있나 찾아보긴 하지 키키
English: I don't decide my travel destination by looking at things like that, but when I'm planning a trip, I first look for something delicious.

Korean: 가서 맛있는 거 먹는 게 제일 재밌잖아
English: The most fun is going and eating delicious food.

Korean: 그치 여행은 먹는 재미지 그럼 또 어떤 거 중요시 여겨? 관광지별 역사라든가 교통 편이라든가 !
English: Right, the fun of traveling is eating, so what else do you consider important? Like the history of each tourist attraction or the convenience of transportation!

Korean: 역사는 크게 중요하지는 않고 교통이 편리하면 다니기 수월하니까 중요한 거 같긴 해!
English: History isn't that important, but it's important because it's easy to get around if transportation is convenient!

Korean: 넌 여행 갈 때 계획을 세세하게 세우는 편이야?
English: Do you tend to plan your trips in detail?

Korean: 전혀 아냐 나는 좀 즉흥적인 편이라 내키는 대로 다니는 걸 좋아해서 그 즉시 찾고 이렇게 다녀
English: Not at all. I'm a bit spontaneous and like to go wherever I want, so I find it right away and go like this.

Korean: 너는 계획을 좀 세워서 다니는 편 이랬나?
English: Are you the type of person who plans things out a bit?

Korean: 나는 큰 계획 정도만 세우고 여행 가서는 상황에 맞게 조율하는 편이야!
English: I tend to make big plans and then adjust them to the situation when I go on a trip!
Do you prefer independent travel rather than package travel?

Korean: 맞아 패키지는 내 맘대로 할 수 없는 게 너무 싫어
English: Yeah, I hate that I can't do whatever I want with packages.

Korean: 자유롭게 다니는 걸 좋아하는 나한테는 전혀 매력이 없어
English: It has no appeal to me at all, as I like to move around freely.
Have you tried the package?
Yeah, I went there but it wasn't that great.

Korean: 코로나 풀리고 해외 여행 갈 수 있게 되면 어디를 제일 먼저 가고 싶어?
English: When the coronavirus situation is over and we can travel abroad, where do you want to go first?
I want to go to America!

Korean: 어려서부터 가고 싶단 생각은 있었는데 경비가 너무 들고 워낙 넓다 보니 무서워서 못 갔어
English: I've wanted to go there since I was little, but I couldn't go because it was too expensive and it was so big that I was scared.
Have you been to America?
Yeah, I've been to America!
It's good, so definitely go~!

Korean: 서부 쪽 가고 싶어 동부 쪽 가고 싶어?
English: Do you want to go west or east?
Let's definitely go later!

Korean: 요즘에 너무 심하게 더운 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: It feels so hot these days ㅠㅠ

Korean: 맞아 열대야 좀 이제 가셨으면 싶네
English: Yes, I wish the tropics would go away now.

Korean: 에어컨도 너무 많이 세서 머리도 자주 아픈 것 같아.
English: I think I often get headaches because I turn on the air conditioner too much.

Korean: 그치 비 오면 그래도 좀 덜 더운 거 같긴 한데...
English: Yeah, but it seems like it'd be a little less hot if it rained...
Do you like rainy days?

Korean: 응 나는 비 오는 날 엄청 좋아해
English: Yeah I really like rainy days

Korean: 내가 밖에 있어도 비 오면 가끔 맞기도 하고 그래
English: Even when I'm outside, sometimes I get rained on and stuff like that
Don't you get a little excited when it rains?

Korean: 응 맞아~ 비 오는 날만의 분위기가 있어!
English: Yeah, that's right~ There's a special atmosphere that only rainy days have!

Korean: 근데 태풍 오는 건 좀 별로야 그치 키키
English: But it's not a good idea for a typhoon to come, right, Kiki

Korean: 태풍은 좀이 아니라 많이 별로지 하하
English: The typhoon is not bad, it's really bad haha

Korean: 우리 대학교 때인가 한 번 태풍 진짜 심하게 와서 나무 뽑히고 이랬던 거 기억나?
English: Do you remember when I was in college, there was a really bad typhoon that uprooted trees and stuff?

Korean: 어 맞아 강남역 물바다 되고 난리였는데. 산도 무너지고 그랬어
English: Oh, that's right. Gangnam Station was a sea of water and it was chaos. Even the mountains collapsed.
Oh, that one wasn't a joke either
Was there any damage to the house?
Yeah, thankfully nothing happened!

Korean: 요새 비 오던 때쯤에 하늘 완전 이뻤는데 봤어? 핑크색 하늘
English: Have you seen the sky that was so pretty when it rained recently? The pink sky

Korean: 봤지 그럼! 핑크색 하늘도 있었고 무지개 예쁘게 뜬 날도 있었잖아
English: You see, there was a pink sky and a day with a pretty rainbow.

Korean: 난 하늘 예쁠 때가 그렇게 기분이 좋더라
English: I feel so good when the sky is pretty

Korean: 맞아 핑크색 하늘이던 날 사람들 다 사진 찍고 그러더라!
English: That's right, it was a pink sky day and everyone was taking pictures!

Korean: 요즘 너무 더우니까 빨리 가을 오면 좋겠다고 생각하고 있어
English: It's so hot these days, I wish fall would come quickly.

Korean: 하도 더위에 찌들어서 가을 바람 맞고 싶단 생각 들어
English: I'm so sick of the heat that I want to feel the autumn breeze

Korean: 가을 되면 생각나는 게 뭐가 있어?
English: What comes to mind when you think of fall?
Trench coat? Kiki

Korean: 근데 늘 가을이 너무 짧아서 한 두 번 입으면 다시 옷장에 넣어야 되는 게 넘 아쉬워
English: But it's always a shame that fall is so short that I have to put things back in the closet after wearing them once or twice.

Korean: 오호 트렌치 코트 빼놓을 수 없지
English: Oh, I can't forget the trench coat.

Korean: 나는 낙엽 밟은 그 바스락 소리가 생각나 그거 기분 좋은 거 알지?
English: I remember the rustling sound of fallen leaves underfoot. You know how nice that feels?
Oh right! I like that too

Korean: 근데 은행 떨어지는 건 너무 싫어
English: But I hate it when banks fail
Yeah, I really hated it because it smelled so bad

Korean: 우리 지금 거리 두기 단계를 6일에 다시 조정한다고 하더라 어떻게 될 거 같애?
English: They said we're going to adjust the social distancing level again on the 6th. What do you think will happen?
I think stage 4 will be extended
But I think it should be like that
you?

Korean: 그치. 지금 4단계를 해도 계속 확진자가 나오고 있으니까 3단계로 낮추거나 하면 더 심해질 거 같아
English: Right. Even if we do level 4 now, confirmed cases are still coming out, so if we lower it to level 3, I think it will get worse.

Korean: 맞아 백신 맞은 사람이 그렇게 많은 것도 아닌데 낮추면 방역 강국 따위는 사라지는 거지
English: That's right. The number of people who have been vaccinated is not that high. If we lower the rate, our quarantine powerhouse will disappear.
Are you planning to get vaccinated?
Yeah, I'm thinking about doing that
you?

Korean: 나는 부작용이 걱정돼서 아직은 안 맞으려고 멀쩡한 사람도 죽었다는 사례가 있는데 그럼 어떡해.
English: I'm worried about the side effects, so I'm not going to get it yet. There have been cases where healthy people died. What should I do?

Korean: 그치 검증된 게 없으니까 막상 맞기는 무섭긴 해.
English: Well, since there is nothing verified, it is scary to actually try it.

Korean: 근데 분당에 있는 어떤 김밥 전문점에서 집단 식중독 환자가 발생했다는 거 들었어?
English: By the way, did you hear that there was a mass food poisoning incident at a kimbap restaurant in Bundang?
Yeah I heard that too
That was a bit harsh

Korean: 몇십 명이 단체로 걸렸는데 어떻게 그럴 수 있지?
English: How could that be possible when dozens of people were involved in a group?
The owner probably knew about it, right?
You didn't know, did you?

Korean: 우리도 맨날 김밥 먹는데 조심해서 먹어야겠어
English: We eat kimbap every day, but we have to be careful when we eat it.
Yeah, I was eating it today and it reminded me of that
It's hot so you really have to be careful
Have you watched the Olympics this time?
Yeah, I watched a few games!

Korean: 어제 야구 보는데 지고 있다가 동점 만들어서 이길 줄 알았거든.
English: I was watching baseball yesterday and I thought we were going to win after tying the game.

Korean: 근데 실수한 거 때문에 5대 2로 졌어 ㅠㅠ
English: But because of a mistake, we lost 5 to 2 ㅠㅠ
It's such a pity

Korean: 나는 야구는 볼 줄을 몰라서 아예 안 봤고 배구 봤는데 감동적인 장면들이 있었어
English: I don't know how to watch baseball, so I didn't watch it at all. I watched volleyball, but there were some touching scenes.
Did you see that?
Oh, I haven't seen it, I've only heard about it!

Korean: 선수들 진짜 대단한 거 같아 그치
English: I think the players are really great, right?

Korean: 응응 이번 올림픽을 계기로 우리나라 좀 더 유명해졌을 것 같기도 해!
English: Yeah, I think our country might have become a bit more famous thanks to these Olympics!

Korean: 맞아 이제 얼마 안 남았는데 다들 무사하게 돌아오면 좋겠다!
English: Yes, there isn't much time left, I hope everyone returns safely!
Let's cheer hard for the rest too
Yeah yeah let's definitely cheer!

Korean: 미국에서는 백신 맞으면 돈 주는 회사도 있대
English: In the US, there are even companies that pay you if you get vaccinated.
Oh really?

Korean: 우리는 왜 그런 거 안 하지?
English: Why don't we do that?
Is it because there are many people who feel aversion to it?
I guess so
Because America is so wrong

Korean: 접종률 높이려고 돈을 주는 거 같아
English: I think they're giving money to increase vaccination rates

Korean: 그전에 접종 후 관리나 좀 더 철저히 해 줬으면 좋겠다?
English: I wish they had been more thorough with post-vaccination management beforehand.

Korean: 그러게 애플이 아이폰 13에 중국산 부품을 늘리기로 했대.
English: That's why Apple decided to increase the number of Chinese components in the iPhone 13.
Why did you do that?
I'm a little disappointed with Apple.

Korean: 나도 폰 바꿀 때 됐는데 삼성으로 갈아타야 하나?
English: It's time for me to change my phone. Should I switch to Samsung?

Korean: 그니까 근데 나는 삼성 폰 보다는 아이폰을 더 좋아하긴 하거든
English: Well, I do like iPhones more than Samsung phones.

Korean: 나도 이제 익숙해져서 아이폰이 더 나은 것 같은데.
English: I'm used to it now, so I think the iPhone is better.

Korean: 아 그 빌 게이츠 부부 이혼한 거 봤어?
English: Oh, did you see that Bill Gates and his wife got divorced?
Yeah, the assets are worth over 170 trillion won.
It's an unimaginable amount of money.

Korean: 재산 분할 어떻게 되려나 몰라 그 재산 나 조금만 떼어줬으면 좋겠다 하하
English: I don't know how the property will be divided. I wish they would give me a little bit of the property. Haha.

Korean: 그치 진짜 어느 정도 떼줘도 티도 안 날듯
English: Yeah, really, even if you take it off to some extent, it won't be noticeable

Korean: 그래도 코로나 때문에 우리나라 위상 좀 올라간 것 같지 않아?
