English: But don't you think our country's status has risen somewhat because of Corona?

Korean: 응 맞아 다른 나라들에 비하면 초기에 엄청 잘 대처했어!
English: Yeah, that's right. Compared to other countries, we handled it really well in the beginning!
It's just like that now, Kiki

Korean: 해외 입국자 안 막은 게 가장 큰 잘못이라고 생각하지만 그래도 이번에 올림픽도 한 몫을 한 것 같아
English: I think the biggest mistake was not blocking overseas arrivals, but I think the Olympics also played a part this time.

Korean: 그치 해외 입국자 막았으면 또 그거 때문에 난리 치는 사람들도 있었을 거야.
English: If we had blocked overseas arrivals, there would have been people who would have made a fuss about it.
I hope it all ends soon
I hope it gets finished quickly in other countries too

Korean: 나 이번 주말에 미용실 가서 머리 하려고!
English: I'm going to the hair salon this weekend to get my hair done!
Oh really?
What are you going to do?
It's hot these days, so should I just cut my hair short?
Oh good good

Korean: 너 엄청 잘 어울릴 것 같아
English: I think you'll look great together
Have you heard that a lot?

Korean: 응 단발이 더 잘 어울린다고 몇 번 듣기는 했어~
English: Yeah, I've heard a few times that short hair suits you better~

Korean: 얼마 전에 내 친구 턱 보톡스 맞았다는데 나도 맞을까?
English: My friend recently got botox in his jaw. Should I get it too?
Have you seen what happened to your friend?

Korean: 요즘 웬만해선 잘하는 것 같은데 혹시나 부작용 생길까 봐 선뜻 못 맞겠다
English: I think I'm doing pretty well these days, but I can't get it right away because I'm worried that there might be side effects.

Korean: 응 봤는데 살 빠진 거 같고 되게 얄쌍해졌더라고!
English: Yeah, I saw it and it looks like he lost weight and became really thin!

Korean: 그래도 큰 수술 아닌데 괜찮지 않을까?
English: It's not a major surgery, so I think it'll be okay?

Korean: 보톡스 한 번 맞기 시작하면 이것저것 다 하고 싶을 것 같은데?
English: Once you start getting botox, you'll want to do everything else, right?
I want to put on aegyo sal
Oh... what if I become like a caterpillar?
Thanks for the advice...^^

Korean: 그럼 다른 미용 목적으로 한 시술 해 보고 싶은 거 있어?
English: So, is there any other cosmetic procedure you would like to try?

Korean: 슈링크 해봤었는데 효과가 좀 있었던 거 같아서 그거 또 해보려고!
English: I tried shrinking and it seemed to be effective, so I'm going to try that again!

Korean: 오와 나중에 하고 나면 꼭 만나자 궁금하네
English: Oh, I wonder if we can meet up later
Have you had any skin care?

Korean: 예전에 가끔 받았는데 요즘엔 안 받았지~
English: I used to get it sometimes, but not these days~

Korean: 이제 조금씩 관리하긴 해야 될 거 같아
English: I think I need to start managing it little by little now

Korean: 성형수술 하고 싶단 생각은 안 해?
English: Have you ever thought about getting plastic surgery?

Korean: 응 그건 좀 무서워서 싫어 ㅠㅠ
English: Yeah, I don't like that because it's a bit scary ㅠㅠ

Korean: 나도 무섭긴 한데 예뻐진다면 할 마음은 있긴 하다 키키
English: I'm scared too, but I'd do it if it made me pretty Kiki

Korean: 이번에 건강 검진 했는데 그거 했다고 너무 피곤하더라.
English: I had a health checkup recently, and I was so tired after doing it.

Korean: 그래도 크게 아픈 데는 없어서 다행이야
English: But I'm glad it doesn't hurt too much

Korean: 그게 진짜 다행이지 나는 아픈 곳이 많아서 문제인데 ㅠㅠ
English: That's really fortunate, I have a lot of sore spots so that's the problem ㅠㅠ
I guess I'm really old
Really? What don't you like?

Korean: 속이 갈수록 안 좋아지는 것 같아
English: I feel like it's getting worse and worse

Korean: 소화도 안 되고 쓰리기도 하고. 너도 속 안 좋은 편이라며?
English: It's indigestible and makes me nauseous. I heard you have a weak stomach too?

Korean: 응응 예전에는 안 그랬는데 점점 소화력이 떨어지더라고.
English: Yeah, it wasn't like this before, but my digestive power has been getting worse.

Korean: 운동도 좀 열심히 하고 먹는 것도 가려서 먹어야겠어~
English: I need to work out harder and be careful about what I eat~

Korean: 먹는 걸 잘 먹어야 하는데 그거 챙기는 게 힘드네.
English: I need to eat well, but it's hard to take care of it.

Korean: 건강 생각해서 관리하는 건 뭐 있어?
English: What do you do to manage your health?

Korean: 그냥 운동하고 영양제도 챙겨 먹지 식습관 개선은 못 하겠어
English: I can't improve my eating habits by just exercising and taking supplements.

Korean: 근데 정기적으로 치과도 가야 하는데 계속 미루고 안 가고 있네
English: But I need to go to the dentist regularly, but I keep putting it off and not going.

Korean: 치아 관리 소홀히 하면 나중에 진짜 고생한다 돈도 많이 깨져
English: If you neglect dental care, you will suffer later and lose a lot of money.

Korean: 나는 어릴 때 부모님이 그래서 어려서부터 양치 엄청 열심히 했어 !
English: When I was young, my parents made me brush my teeth very diligently!

Korean: 아 그래? 난 잘 썩는 편인 거 같아
English: Oh really? I think I'm the type that rots easily.

Korean: 그리고 예전에 교정했어서 이가 약해진 거 같아 ㅠㅠ
English: And I think my teeth got weaker because I had braces before ㅠㅠ
Then I should go to the dentist even more diligently.
Are you not going because it hurts?

Korean: 그런 건 아닌데 시간 내서 가기가 귀찮아.
English: It's not like that, but I don't want to take the time to go.
Do you go regularly?
I don't go to the dentist at all

Korean: 물론 썩은 이가 있겠지만 아직까지는 아픈 데가 없어서 꼼꼼한 양치로 버티는 중이야 하하
English: Of course I have rotten teeth, but I'm holding on by brushing my teeth thoroughly since there's no pain yet haha

Korean: 그래 불편한데 없으면 관리 잘 하고 있나 보네~!
English: Yeah, it's uncomfortable, but if it's not there, I guess you're managing it well~!

Korean: 나중에 치료하려고 하면 돈도 많이 드니까 열심히 양치해
English: If you try to treat it later, it will cost a lot of money, so brush your teeth diligently.
Yeah, that's right
You should go to the dentist right now, Kiki.
Yeah, I guess I'll have to make a reservation for next week!

Korean: 너도 시간 날 때 미리미리 가봐~
English: You should go there early when you have time~
Definitely go before it gets any worse!

Korean: 어제 쇼핑몰에서 원피스 사려고 했는데 너무 비싸서 그냥 안 샀어
English: I tried to buy a one-piece dress at the mall yesterday, but it was too expensive, so I just didn't buy it.

Korean: 요즘 여름철이라 원피스 할인하는 곳도 많더라고
English: These days, since it's summer, there are a lot of places that are offering discounts on one-piece dresses.
What style of clothes were you wearing?

Korean: 약간 하늘하늘한 건데 무릎 살짝 위까지 오는 거였어!
English: It was a little loose, but it came just above the knees!
It's clothes from a shopping mall, and they cost over 100,000 won.
Wow, really? It's so expensive.

Korean: 가격 보니 쿠팡은 아닌 것 같고 브랜드 옷인가?
English: Looking at the price, it doesn't seem to be Coupang. Is it a brand name clothing?

Korean: 아니 그건 모르겠고 그냥 막 누르다 보니까 나왔는데 예쁘더라고!
English: No, I don't know about that, I just kept pressing it and it came out, and it's pretty!

Korean: 최근에 쇼핑몰에서 뭐 산 거 있어?
English: Have you bought anything at the mall recently?
I bought sandals

Korean: 여름에 데일리로 신으려고 샀는데 이만 원 치고 괜찮아서 마음에 들어 하하
English: I bought it to wear daily in the summer, and I like it because it's good for this price haha
Oh, it's cheap and good? And is it comfortable on your feet?

Korean: 응 굽도 딱 적당하고 사람들 후기 보고 샀거든
English: Yeah, the heel is just right and I bought it after reading people's reviews.

Korean: 아직 하루밖에 안 신었지만 괜찮은 것 같아
English: I've only worn them for a day but they seem fine
What have you bought recently?

Korean: 나는 여름에 막 입을 반팔 티 3개 샀었어!
English: I just bought 3 short sleeve t-shirts to wear this summer!
Oh, three each?

Korean: 하긴 여름에는 가볍게 입을 수 있는 반팔 티만 한 게 없지
English: Well, there's nothing better than a light short-sleeved T-shirt for summer.
Is this just a shopping mall that came up through a search?

Korean: 응응 지그재그에 있는 쇼핑몰들! 배송도 하루만에 와서 좋더라고
English: Yeah, shopping malls in ZigZag! It was nice that the delivery came in one day.

Korean: 오 나도 지그재그 평소에 많이 이용해
English: Oh, I also use zigzag a lot

Korean: 예쁜 거 모아져 있어서 그게 너무 편하더라고 !
English: It was so convenient because there were so many pretty things gathered together!

Korean: 그치 쇼핑몰 하나씩 검색 안 해도 되고 다 모아져 있으니까 편하지?
English: Isn't it convenient because you don't have to search each shopping mall individually and they're all gathered together?

Korean: 응 그게 너무 편리해서 자꾸 거기만 찾게 되는 것 같아
English: Yeah, I think it's so convenient that I keep coming back to it.
Which shopping mall do you frequent often?

Korean: 옷은 주로 지그재그에서 사고 그 외에는 쿠팡에서 거의 사는 거 같아!
English: I think I mostly buy clothes from ZigZag and everything else from Coupang!
you?
I'm just going to use zigzag~
Have you ever thought you couldn't be number one?
That's so funny Kiki

Korean: 근데 제대로 챙겨보지는 않고 가끔 재방 발견하면 보곤 해
English: But I don't watch it properly, but I watch it occasionally when I find it again.
You like that?
It's fun to watch sometimes
It's so funny because they're comedians

Korean: 응 나도 한참 웃었던 기억이 있는데 동생도 좋아하더라
English: Yeah, I remember laughing a lot too, and my younger sibling liked it too.

Korean: 그치? 강재준네가 제일 웃긴 거 같아
English: Right? I think Kang Jae-jun's is the funniest.
Do you have a favorite comedian?
I like Jang Do-yeon

Korean: 개그 스타일이 너무 내 코드야 하하하
English: Your gag style is so my style hahaha
They were fun too, they're a couple of friends
Yeah, that's right

Korean: 나도 여자 개그우먼 중에서는 장도연이 제일 웃기고 선도 지켜가면서 개그 하는 거 같아!
English: I also think that among female comedians, Jang Do-yeon is the funniest and the one who keeps the lead while telling gags!
What other entertainment programs do you watch?

Korean: 나 혼자 산다만 한 예능은 없다고 생각해
English: I don't think there is any entertainment show like I Live Alone

Korean: 되게 오랫동안 한 프로그램인데도 꿋꿋이 1위 자리를 지키고 있잖아
English: It's a program that's been around for a long time, but it's still holding on to the top spot.
Oh, right, tomorrow is the day?

Korean: 온 앤 오프도 나 혼자 산다랑 비슷하고 재밌던데 그건 이제 안 하더라고
English: On and Off was similar to I Live Alone and was fun, but they don't do that anymore.
Oh, you know that?
I liked on and off too

Korean: 맞아 진짜 비슷한데 분위기가 좀 다르지
English: Yeah, it's really similar, but the atmosphere is a bit different
Whose side did you enjoy watching?

Korean: 나는 윤아랑 이지아 편이 재밌었던 거 같아!
English: I think Yuna and Lee Ji Ah's side was fun!
you?

Korean: 음 내가 다 못 본 편이네
English: Well, I haven't seen it all.

Korean: 나는 아이유랑 지연 나온 편이 재밌었고 김동완 편도 좋았어 봤어?
English: I enjoyed the one with IU and Jiyeon and the one with Kim Dongwan was also good. Did you watch it?

Korean: 아 맞아 아이유랑 지연 편 봤지!
English: Oh right, I watched the IU and Jiyeon episode!
I haven't seen Kim Dong-wan's episode, but is it fun?

Korean: 김동완은 여러 번 나왔는데 내가 그냥 좋아해서 재밌었던 것 같아
English: Kim Dong-wan appeared several times, but I just liked him and found it fun.
I liked mythology when I was young haha

Korean: 오 나도 신화 좋아했었는데 나는 전진 좋아했었어 하하
English: Oh I liked Shinhwa too, I liked Jeon Jin haha
Mythology is good for everyone
They were all incredibly popular!
Do you have a favorite film director?

Korean: 그냥 유명한 감독들만 몇 알지 그중에 딱히 좋아하는 사람은 없다 하하
English: I just know a few famous directors, but I don't really like any of them haha
I'm more interested in the actors than the director.
Which director do you like?
I like director Bong Joon-ho~
So who do you like to learn from?

Korean: 하정우도 좋아했고 현빈도 좋아하고 좀 많긴 한데 너는 좋아하는 배우 있어?
English: I like Ha Jung-woo and Hyun Bin, and there are quite a few, but do you have a favorite actor?
I like Ha Jung-woo too!

Korean: 나는 한국 영화 말고 외국 영화도 좋아하는데 넌 어때?
English: I like foreign films as well as Korean films. What do you think?

Korean: 외국 영화 좋지 명작들이 확실히 많아
English: Foreign movies are good, there are definitely a lot of masterpieces.
What foreign movie have you seen recently?
I saw Cruella and it was fun
Have you seen this movie?

Korean: 아 나도 그거 봤어 진짜 재밌더라
English: Oh I saw that too. It was really funny.

Korean: 그래서 또 한 번 봐도 좋을 것 같아!
English: So I think it would be good to watch it again!

Korean: 그치 좀비 나오는 영화는 어때? 잘 보는 편이야?
English: By the way, how about zombie movies? Do you like them?

Korean: 오 나 좀비물 되게 좋아해 일부러 찾아서 보는 편이야 하하
English: Oh, I really like zombie stuff. I go out of my way to look for it and watch it. Haha
Have you seen the movie Dawn of the Dead?
No, I've heard of it.

Korean: 나는 무서운 종류 영화는 안 좋아해서 ㅠㅠ
English: I don't like scary movies ㅠㅠ

Korean: 음 그럼 그거는 좀 안 맞겠다
English: Well, that doesn't seem right.

Korean: 나도 추천 받은 영화라 주말에 보려고 했는데 좀비물은 그럼 안 좋아해?
English: I was planning to watch the movie this weekend since it was recommended to me, but then you don't like zombie movies?

Korean: 응 너무 깜짝 놀래서 심장이 아파.
English: Yeah, I'm so surprised my heart hurts.
I just like bright and cheerful movies!

Korean: 로코 이런 거 그럼 좋아하나 보다 맞지?
English: I guess you like things like Roco, right?
Yeah, that's right, I like that kind of thing!

Korean: 미스터리한 것도 좋아하긴 해 너무 놀래키거나 무섭지 않으면!
English: I like mystery too, as long as it's not too surprising or scary!
Do you like mystery stories?
Yeah, I really like it too
Recommend me some good movies later!
What are you having for lunch today?
I think I'll eat at the convenience store today too

Korean: 요즘에 너무 더워서 식당에서 밥 먹고 나오면 죽을 맛이에요 ㅠㅠ
English: It's so hot these days that I feel like I'm going to die after eating at a restaurant ㅠㅠ
What would you like to eat today?

Korean: 저도 날이 너무 더워서 오늘은 편의점에서 먹어야겠어요.
English: It's so hot today that I think I'll have to eat at the convenience store.

Korean: 편의점 음식 중에서 어떤 거 드실 건가요?
English: What kind of convenience store food would you like to eat?

Korean: 간단하게 빵이나 아니면 컵라면 생각 중입니다
English: I'm thinking of something simple like bread or cup ramen.

Korean: 빵 먹을 때 주로 마시는 거는 뭐를 드시나요?
English: What do you usually drink when you eat bread?

Korean: 편의점에서 먹을 때는 항상 바나나 우유를 마시는 거 같아요.
English: I always seem to drink banana milk when I eat at convenience stores.
Do you usually eat ramen often?

Korean: 라면은 원래 잘 안 먹었는데 요즘 많이 먹는 거 같아요
English: I didn't really eat ramen, but I think I've been eating it a lot lately.
Do you like ramen?

Korean: 저는 반대로 라면을 정말 좋아했는데 요즘 많이 못 먹고 있는 거 같네요.
English: On the other hand, I really liked ramen, but I don't think I've been eating it much lately.
Do you have a favorite convenience store food?
I like triangle kimbap
It looks easy to eat and delicious
Do you have a favorite convenience store food?
I like simple things like sandwiches or burgers.
What is your favorite food?

Korean: 저는 좋아하는 음식은 돼지 껍데기를 좋아해요
English: My favorite food is pork rinds
It tastes so good when eaten with alcohol.
Do you have a favorite snack to go with your drinks?

Korean: 좋아하는 술 안주는 따로 없는 거 같아요.
English: I don't think I have a favorite snack to go with my drinks.

Korean: 제가 술을 잘 안 먹어서요 하하
English: I don't drink much haha
How much can you drink?
I don't know the exact amount

Korean: 술을 안 마시는 거예요 아니면 몸에서 안 받아 주나요?
English: Do you not drink alcohol or does your body not accept it?

Korean: 아니요, 딱히 건강 상에 문제가 있는 건 아닌데 안 먹다 보니 별로 생각도 마시고 싶다는 생각도 잘 안 드네요 하하
English: No, it's not that I have any health problems, but since I don't eat it, I don't really think about it or feel like drinking it haha
I'm like that these days too

Korean: 요즘 그냥 자기 전에 맥주 먹으면 잠도 잘 오고 괜찮은 거 같아요
English: These days, I just drink beer before going to bed and I feel better because I can sleep well.

Korean: 소주를 좋아하세요 맥주를 좋아하세요 아니면 다른 술을 좋아하세요?
English: Do you like soju, beer, or other alcohol?

Korean: 저는 과일 향이 나는 맥주를 좋아합니다.
English: I like fruity beers.
What kind of alcohol do you like?

Korean: 예전에는 소주를 좋아하는데 요즘은 과일 향이 나는 맥주를 좋아하는 거 같아요 키키
English: I used to like soju, but these days I think I like fruity beers Kiki
What do you think about real estate policy?

Korean: 부동산 정책이 잘못된 방향으로 가고 있다고 생각합니다
English: I think real estate policy is going in the wrong direction.
What do you think about real estate policy?

Korean: 잘못된 정책으로 이렇게까지 피해를 입을 수 있구나 하는 생각이 들었습니다.
English: It made me realize that a wrong policy can cause this much damage.

Korean: 이제 정말 내 집 마련의 꿈이 사라진 거 같아 무섭네요.
English: Now I'm really scared that my dream of owning a home is gone.
Yes, me too

Korean: 너무 복잡하고 매일 매일 정책이 바뀌고 일반 사람들은 세금 이런 문제도 많아지고 머리가 아프네요 ㅠ
English: It's so complicated, policies change every day, and ordinary people have a lot of problems with taxes and things like that, it's giving me a headache ㅠ

Korean: 지금이라도 영끌을 해서 미리 집을 사 놔야 하나 하는 생각이 드네요.
English: I'm thinking that I should go ahead and buy a house right now.
Are you planning to buy a home?
I have no idea yet

Korean: 뭔가 그런 부분에 대해서 아직 생각할 엄두가 안 난다고 해야 하나 생각하면 머리가 아파요
English: I have a headache just thinking about it, I guess I just can't bring myself to think about that part yet
If you buy a home, where do you plan to do it?

Korean: 서울은 너무 많이 올라서 경기 쪽으로 해야 되나 싶네요.
English: Seoul has gone up so much that I think we should go to Gyeonggi.

Korean: 일부 전문가들이 부동산 가격에 거품이 많이 껴 있다고 하고 있어 망설여지기도 하고 어떻게 해야 할지 정말 모르겠네요.
English: Some experts are saying that there is a huge bubble in real estate prices, so I am hesitant and really don't know what to do.

Korean: 네 원래 내가 사면 떨어지고 남이 사면 오르고 근데 이제 떨어지지는 않을 거 같은데 나중에 저희 나이 들면 인구 수가 많이 줄어서. 그때는 집이 남아돌지 않을까 생각됩니다.
English: Yes, originally, when I buy, it goes down, and when others buy, it goes up, but I don't think it will go down anymore. Later, when we get older, the population will decrease a lot. I think there will be a surplus of houses at that time.
This is a really big problem.

Korean: 나중에 결혼을 하게 되면 주택은 전세, 월세, 매매 중에 어떤 걸로 하실 계획이세요?
English: When you get married later, what do you plan to do with your house: rent, lease, or buy?
I'm thinking about renting it out for now

Korean: 전세로 살다가 형편 좀 괜찮아지면 집을 사는 걸로 생각 중입니다
English: I'm thinking about living in a rented house and buying a house when my circumstances improve.
** What are you going to do?

Korean: 요즘 전세 가격도 만만치 않다고 하더라고요.
English: I heard that the price of rent is not cheap these days.

Korean: 저는 무리를 해서라도 매매로 하려고 하지만 그때 상황에 맞게 해야겠죠.
English: I'm going to try to trade even if it means pushing myself, but I have to do it according to the situation.

Korean: 매매로 하시면 주택을 선호하시나요 아파트를 선호하시나요?
English: If you were to buy, would you prefer a house or an apartment?

Korean: 처음에는 아파트로 시작하는 게 좋을 거 같아요.
English: I think it would be a good idea to start with an apartment.

Korean: 주택 청약을 노리고 있긴 한데 요즘에는 로또 청약이라고 해서 당첨되기가 하늘의 별 따기라고 하더라고요.
English: I'm trying to apply for a housing subscription, but these days, they say winning the lottery subscription is like trying to catch a star in the sky.

Korean: 저도 그런 거에 관심을 좀 가져봐야겠어요 ㅠ
English: I should also take an interest in that kind of thing ㅠ

Korean: 나중에 결혼하실 때 어디 쪽으로 주택을 마련할 계획이세요?
English: Where do you plan to buy a house when you get married?

Korean: 저는 웬만하면 서울에서 살고 싶은데 직장 근처로 가지 않을까 생각됩니다.
English: I would like to live in Seoul if possible, but I am thinking of moving closer to my workplace.
